Reviews.Title: “First time in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: NeedsNEscape
Reviews.Content: This was a nice place to locate for a first trip to Las Vegas. It looks amazingly faux-authentic and was very Disney-like. Yes, the hotel was big and noisy and packed over Spring break. It was full of 20-somethings, traveling in packs, so that was fun to watch it the 'faux' outdoor cafe next to rows and rows of slot machines. We're not used to 'smoke' and the casino had its share of smokers. It was fun to learn how to use the slot machines and the dealers (especially around the empty lunch time) had no problems introducing us to the games. We played for about 4-5 hours for about $85.00 The location of the Paris was right in the middle of the strip and had a great view of the Bellagio fountains. We ate at most all the restaurants and enjoyed something at each meal. One day we ate lunch outside at Mon Ami Gabi and it was HOT! The table was right in the sun and it warmed up the plates so much that the cheese on the $15.99 cheese platter melted! We ate breakfast there later in the week and it was so nice outside. We had a room on the 17th (no smoking) floor and it was nice enough. The bathroom including shower were nice, water was warm really fast. TV lacked some useful channels, but we didn't watch much TV anyway. It was very quiet in the room and when the elevators deposit you on the casino floor the noise immediately hits. We went to the pool, but the water was really cold, although it was 75-80 deg outside. So we sat in the sun and read our books. We couldn't decide whether to take the Eiffel Tower Ride one evening and the ticket person, seeing that we were undecided, offered us half price tickets. So who could turn that down. The night view of the strip and the fountains were excellent. So glad we went. Which is how we sum up our trip to Las Vegas -- so glad we went.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room!”
Reviews.Author: cyberta88
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paris for St. Patty's day, and I loved it! We were in walking distance to all of the cool bars and shops. The room was big but cozy...We even had pizza delivered to our room at midnight!

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the strip”
Reviews.Author: StarryEyed14
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located roughly Mid-strip opposite the Bellagio. It has a restaurant with a terrace, Mon Ami Gabi, which does good food and where you can watch the Bellagio Fountains as you eat, however the outdoor terraces area cannot be prebooked to sit. The room was very spacious and very nicely decorated. The bathroom had a separate shower cubicle to the bath, which was lovely and it was a very hot and spacious shower. We got a taxi from the airport to the hotel and there was no problem arranging this, in fact it seemed to be very well organised and cost no more than $15USD. I felt that this is one of the better themed hotels on the strip, with a painted sky and facades on a cobbled street, it had a nice feel to it. There is also a cafe on the ground floor, 'Madeline', which has free wifi. We did not have a problem with any of the staff and the concierge staff were very helpful and informative.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Rooms....Super location!”
Reviews.Author: Minocoop
Reviews.Content: I have been to Las Vegas several times. Hubby and I love to just walk around and see the beauty that each of the new hotel/casinos has to offer. Paris is right in the middle of everything! The price was very low compared to others in its class and location, and the buffet dinner is AMAZING! If you want to be in the middle of it all, PARIS is your best, most reasonably priced choice.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location”
Reviews.Author: acds24
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paris hotel for my 25th birthday on 11/11/11 with a bunch of friends. The experience was phenomenal. I've always wanted to stay at this hotel and I would recommend it to anyone who is even a little bit francophilic. We stayed in the Red Rooms, a slight upgrade from the regular rooms, and it was pretty standard. I liked the decor, but the rooms weren't all that special. The airport shuttle was satisfactory, although they drop you off at a weird side entrance, so if you don't know your way around this hotel, you'll get lost like I did. The service was great, and I liked the location of the hotel as well as the different amenities within the hotel: Buffet -- delicious, five stars, although pricey, but it's Vegas. If you like buffets and can eat enough to where the near $30 price tag is worth it, then DO it, because this was yummy. Spa -- minimal, three stars. I enjoyed a massage and that was nice and relaxing, but overpriced and the sauna/spa/hot tub area, was pretty disappointing. It wasn't at all the kind of ritz you'd expect at a premium Las Vegas hotel and reminded me of the saunas at YMCA gyms. Food -- We also ate at Mon Ami Gabi (delicious, but super busy, but had a great outdoor view of the Bellagio fountains) and had crepes and pizza downstairs. Again, pricey, but there are a lot of options for food at this hotel depending on how much you want to spend. Chateau Nightclub -- Beautiful gorgeous view of the Bellagio from the base of the Eiffel Tower. Girls got free drinks thanks to a promotion and it was just lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Paris!”
Reviews.Author: susanbpr
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed 3 nights at Paris, first time at this hotel, but have visited Vegas many times and stayed at many other hotels. Paris was great! Every employee - from the doorman who greeted us upon arrival, to the front desk clerk, cashiers, waitresses, etc., to the doorman who called me a taxi when I left - was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is beautiful. Rooms are nice and clean; bathrooms spacious and towels generous. As others have noted, the TVs are not flat screen; are built in to the wardrobe furniture in the room. Who cares? I don't go to Vegas to watch TV. Casino was fun - great slots. Location is perfect - very convenient for visiting other casino resorts. Join Total Rewards! Take advantage of the "all you can eat in 24 hours" buffet offer for 44.95 - it's the best deal in Vegas! Paris buffet is awesome! Also received a follow-up email from the hotel manager. Will definitely stay here again. Only 2 minor complaints - better quality sheets and real butter at the buffet would be nice.

Reviews.Title: “Getting Long in the Tooth”
Reviews.Author: Tim B
Reviews.Content: Paris Las Vegas, like at lot of Las Vegas Hotels, is getting worn out fast because of the massive amount of traffic that goes through it. One of the last of the City Theme hotels in Las vegas, it is eclipsed by newer properties like Wynn and Aria that don't try to mimic a particular city. Paris has excellent restaurants, one of the few hotels in Las Vegas with a good selection of not-too-epensive wines, and an atmosphere that is less typical of other hotel casinos. The room decor is unique for the city. The rooms are still in pretty good shape, but the lobby and casino is starting to show wear and tear. Room prices are very good these days, reflecting the decline of the property. It is still a maddening check-in process, requiring a long wait at the front desk instead of the quick check in process most hotels use these days. The pool is very good, not the best in Vegas but good enough. The problem is that the pool is frequently booked for private events, so always check its availability in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Hotel Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Drstock55
Reviews.Content: Casino was beautiful, rooms clean but just average,have stayed in much nicer rooms for less. Big problem was the cost for internet service in the room ($14.95) day,per computer. Would stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK!”
Reviews.Author: Janethq16
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in the Paris hotel. A lost stop on our way home to Ca. My daughter loves Paris and thought it would be nice and fun for her. She loved the decor of lobby, shops and obviously the tower. I wasn't a big fan of the rooms and halls leading you to them. Its outdated and although clean but needs a touch up may be a lil paint. Our was eh, the tv was missing a button and furniture again outdated. Get the Frenchy decour kept that but get new sheets and furniture. Bathrooms are nice in size. Beds were ok comfortable. Our view was the best but I did pay extra for it. The location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Paris a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: westcoast74
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas for a night on a roadtrip. We decided to try the Paris as it was on the lower price end of the newer hotels. The staff was friendly and helpful. We were pleased they let us take our mountain bikes inside (we didn't want to leave them on the vehicle). The room was clean, and quiet. Nice bathrooms. We were on the 24th floor. Check in took 30 minutes due to a line up, check out was a simple slip of paper into a box for that purpose which was very convienient. The location on the strip is nice and central. The bell services and valet were very organized and wait times were not too bad. However booking we had to 100% prepay by credit card upon booking. As we were travelling, we all were dissapointed to find that wifi was not free at this hotel. even the best Westerns in the middle of nowhere have free wifi!! We thought it was a cheap cash grab. We did not eat there, the buffet at the Bellagio was recommended and was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, great food and service”
Reviews.Author: katie e
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris for 3 nights in March for a wedding. We had great service and they atmosphere at Paris was romantic and wonderful! The breakfast buffett and French cafes in the lobby were wonderful and quick! Love staying so close to the Eiffel Tower. The pool was cool and the weather was hot, we loved Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Oui!”
Reviews.Author: WestofSomewhere
Reviews.Content: Had a delightful 2nd stay at the Paris Hotel and hope to return again! Very friendly staff at the front desk (both arrival and departure) and we think this is one of the best locations on the Strip for accessibility to restaurants and other hotel/casinos. Our room was large, clean, quiet, and a little careworn, but we were not in it long enough to mind too much. We like the ambiance in the casino and really enjoyed the indoor "avenue" of restaurants and shops between the Paris and Bally's. Pretty good resort experience for a hotel in the center of the Vegas action!

Reviews.Title: “Jam packed smoky hotel”
Reviews.Author: AZGlass
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Paris. I had a conference to attend. Our room was fine except for the intermittent smokiness in our "non-smoking" room. The room was clean and well-kept, no complaints. Check-in was relatively fast. The entire casino floor and public areas were overwhelmed with hoardes of people the entire visit. Just getting from our room to the the convention area was like dodging drunks in times square. The convention area was a bit quieter with mediocre snacks and breakfasts. Needless to say, it is virtually impossible to find a quick and reasonable meal at this hotel. The Total Rewards thing was a joke for us. I had only 48 hours to use my $10 reward and not with slots. My husband signed up when we checked in our Thursday evening. By midday on Sunday, his "reward" still was not active. The premises of the hotel itself were quite cute, but the excessive smoke and crowding, made this an unpleasant trip for us.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: LordKelvin
Reviews.Content: Stayed over St Pattys weekend for a business meeting. After reading the TA reviews I was prepared for features including: noise, filth, bugs, long lines, rudeness... And Voila! None of these things were evident. Our room on floor 25 (red room) was super quiet, very clean, no bedbugs (and yes I did check using the advice from University of Minnesota), no lines anywhere and not a trace of staff ennui. I would not really eat here for breakfast lunch or dinner with so many choices in Vegas for great food. However, Gordon Ramsay is opening a steak place in the casino area very shortly. This is not a personal pampering or luxury concept hotel, it is a ginormous hotel that is conveniently located. Only true negative was room service trays sitting in the hallway for more than one day. That's just plan disgusting. In summary, it was pleasantly surprising, economical, well located.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable hotel to access strip”
Reviews.Author: h_atlanta
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Paris on a girls trip to LV. It was my second trip to the sin city. Having stayed in MGM last time, I wanted to avoid extra mile to walk everytime to access the strip. Paris has the best location for that matter. You step off the lobby and hit the strip. Checkin and checkout was a breeze, red room was clean, cosy and comfortable (who goes to Vegas to spend time in hotel anyways ;-P). It is internally connected to Bally which comes in handy in cold weather. Bally's is also a connecting point on shuttles to other hotels - which helps in case you want to catch shows or events at other places. Restaurants and night club were also pretty decent. Overall a good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Is every employee trained to be rude?”
Reviews.Author: Tassels57
Reviews.Content: First stay at this Harrah's property. It seemed that every employee was rude from the reception desk, casino staff, housekeepers.... We actually had a waiter turn his back and walk away when we ordered another round of drinks saying "I thought you were done". Over priced and over rated-overall!

Reviews.Title: “Its OK!”
Reviews.Author: J0eyC
Reviews.Content: The hotel is minimum to be expected on the strip. It is clean and nice, but not worth the extra money. Water pressure is terrible, and too many kids.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it okay, but I didn't LOVE it ...”
Reviews.Author: cachaha
Reviews.Content: I've always wanted to stay at Paris hotel and I liked it okay, but I didn't LOVE it. Why? It's hard to say ... little things, mostly. The airport shuttle drop off for visitors is at the complete opposite side of the hotel than the taxi/limo drop off and the hotel registration. There are no signs explaining this and visitors dropped off at the airport shuttle door (if there's no doorman in sight) have to drag their luggage across the hotel to find hotel registration. There was a terrific doorman on duty at the shuttle door when we left on Saturday, but there was no doorman at door when we arrived (around 1 pm on a Tuesday). That would certainly have helped. The elevators to the rooms are weirdly far from the registration desk. All of the restaurants are pricey - one can't eat a meal anywhere in the Paris hotel for under $15. Other hotels I've stayed in have at least one cheap option - for example, Planet Hollywood has the Earl of Sandwich in which you can have a breakfast sandwich and coffee for about $8 including tax. There is only one place in Paris convenient to the elevators to run down and buy some coffee at breakfast time to take back up to the room, but because there's only one, the lines were always LONG. All restaurant lines are LONG at standard eating times. The pool closed at 5:00 pm and we were asked to leave the area. We explained that we didn't want to swim, we just wanted to sit in the lounge chairs and enjoy the evening, but were told we could only do that in the summer. We were disappointed because there's no other outdoor space available for this at Paris, and this is something we like to do. Both the Venetian and the Flamingo have some lovely pool gardens and we've stayed in these late into the evening (also in March) with no problems. We actually went over to the Venetian to sit in their pool garden - and they let us even though we weren't staying there! Our room at the Paris hotel smelled a bit like dirty shoes, so I went to Bath and Body works at the Miracle Mile shops in nearby Planet Hollywood to purchase an air freshener for the room. I was CONTINUALLY accosted by salespeople from a shop near the elevator - they stand at the door of the shop and very aggressively try to shove a free sample in your hand then try to pull you into the store to sell you a product for your hair or eye cream (obviously I fit their target profile). Do I need to say I hated this? The incessant Jersey Boys music in the elevator made us want to punch something! :-) Even though our room was on the 29th floor and we paid for a view of the Bellagio Fountains, the loud music from the nightclub at ground level woke us up periodically until 4:00 am Wednesday! There was no music Thursday-Saturday.) So what did I like about it? Overall, Paris is clean and pretty to look at. Most of the staff was friendly. The food in every restaurant we tried, though pricey, was well prepared and tasty. I love Le Village Buffet and eat there every time I'm in Las Vegas. Mon Ami Gabi was fabulous - the first real bifteck frites I've eaten outside of the real Paris, France. These are the things that kept me from rating this hotel as poor. However, I wouldn't stay at Paris hotel again. I like the amenities at other hotels better.

Reviews.Title: “Good value!!”
Reviews.Author: Roger B
Reviews.Content: Coming to las vegas as many times as i do... I always wanted to stay at this hotel. Check in was a breeze and the receptionist was very friendly! Iwas in room 2335 on the 23 floor.. I read lots of reviews about the rooms being a little worn and outdated... I walked in and yes the tube tv and furniture was dated but it was still nice, there were lots of ammenities, 2 comfy beds, lots of toiletries, fridge, coffee maker, and shower and tub. The room had a nice view (semi strip). The room was clean except for a ball of kleenex was smack dab in the middle of the bathroom floor..... I overlooked this because it was obvious it had fallen out when they took out the garbage... They should of done a walk through but... Mistakes happen... I did have a problem with the safe and called the desk....someone was up in less then five minutes and fixed it and was very polite. The casino is fantastic with lots of fun slots and table games. The restaurants are worth checking out espesially mon ami gabi which had great service, lovley seating and delicious food... I recommend the brie apple chicken crepe, and their thick slices of maple bacon! The buffet is great too however the line is long so be prepared to wait! At the buffet definatley try the creme brule or bananas foster for dessert. The location of the hotel is amazing walking distance to everything in every direction... That alone should be a good deciding factor for a hotel... The house keeping were very friendly when i passed them in the halls and kept my room immaculate and well stocked while i was there. Check out was very quick and efficient. I think over all i would stay again and feel that the hotel will be upgraded very soon as i saw mini renovations in the casino... And mgm grand and the venetian are doing some renos as well. Definatley give this hotel a try and dont worry about the complaints about dated rooms... If u r in vegas u will not be staying in the room too much and they really are comfortable and large.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful casino, shops and common areas...rooms show wear”
Reviews.Author: Cathy C
Reviews.Content: We found an $80 internet special and had a great time. The decor in the casino and common areas is charming and well done. We didn't have a big meal here but shared a crepe from the creperie that was quite tasty. We took advantage of the two-fer martini special in the round casino bar. Tab? $16. Good thing it was a two-fer special. Our room had a decent king sized bed but the TV was older and small. It was comfortable and quiet. The room did not have a coffee maker in it and coffee in the express cafe downstairs was over $3 a cup for regular drip. A bran muffin from the patisserie was over $4, uninteresting, and a little dry. For $80, it was a good value, but if we had paid more, we would have been very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Dark, smokey, unfun”
Reviews.Author: the_vigliones
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris 3 nights; check-in agent was sweet and friendly; no one else was from thereon, especially at restaurants. We tried the first night to grab a bite to eat and drink, but found, because we were not "gold card", we were cooly asked to stand aside to wait, although no one else was in queue and tables were plenty. We were baffled. Ended up grabbing a slice of pizza at a clearly understaffed little shop. Not what we expected or wanted for our first big night in Vegas! Room was fine, but nothing special. Concierge upgrade was nice, and we did enjoy the variety of food and drinks there. Worse part of the whole thing was the hawksters at the Perfume store, which we had to pass daily to get to the elevators. Paris Mgt should insist they stop barraging visitors with offers. I accepted a sample once and even went in the shop for a personal consultation. That was fine once, but the reps there were merciless in their repetitive attempts to get people into the store. Last note: my sister was staying at Aria -- oh my! Just the walk there through Crystal plaza to get there was incredible -- airy, light, gorgeous architecture, modern ... the complete opposite of dank Paris. We will never stay at Paris again. If you like modern, fresh, stunning decor and smiling people, avoid Paris. Oops one more note: we stayed on the Strip side facing Bellagio, and on Tuesday night (midnight on), there was SO MUCH loud music (booming bass) from outside somewhere, I could not sleep. If this had happened the first night, I would have asked for another room. I am writing Paris for an explanation. It was not an acceptable condition for us. Otherwise, the beds were terrific, and the first 2 nights were great.

Reviews.Title: “Service in the casino was way above the norm!”
Reviews.Author: Fusebuddy
Reviews.Content: This was a business trip and I was barely in the room, nor did I utilize the facilities and restaurants that much. So most of this review pertains to the casino. In the few hours I did have to myself, I did play some blackjack. I have to say, that the dealers and pit boss' went out of their way to please me and I will not forget it. If you gamble, you know how unpleasant it can be, with crabby dealers and pit boss', its no fun. Anyways, I felt very appreciated and I have never felt appreciated in a casino, EVER. I am not a high roller, sot I just don't bet enough to get a lot of attention. But the same great service happened to me three times at different tables, in different pits, there was really a concerted effort to please the customer here and I really appreciated it. As far as my room, it was fine, but they need to upgrade from tube TV's to flat screens. It was clean and the bathroom was nice. I slept fine and the bed was comfortable. Upon check in there was a very big line, I was expecting a downer, but they added staff quickly and the line moved along, problem averted. Overall, the rooms are very good, but I've had better. What made my day was an suprisingly enjoyable gambling experience, I just might go back.

Reviews.Title: “Experince at Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maria M
Reviews.Content: WORST HOTEL EXPERIENCE EVER! BEWARE!!!! My husband and I stayed at Paris Hotel March 19~21, 2012 After the 9:30 performance of The Jersey Boys, which ended at midnight, we went to our room to rest? Once in our room we could hear the music from the nightclub located under the Eiffel Tower. There was a constant BOOM BOOM BOOM. The noise resonated across the pool area to the hotel rooms! When we could no longer take it, at 3:25 am, my husband called the front desk. He was told that IT A NEW TREND THAT NIGHTCLUBS ARE STAYING OPEN ALL NIGHT AND THE MUSIC WILL END AT 5:30 am. We have had 100 complaints. But there is NOTHING we can do!" The music was turned off but by then we could no longer fall asleep! We were checking out and driving home (260 miles)exhausted! At check out we addressed the issue with front desk and they're response was that "it was our fault because we requested a strip view room! There are various clubs staying open all night and there was no way to tell which club had music so loud! WE COULD SEE NIGHTCLUB LIGHTS FROM OUR ROOM!!! What an insult to our intelligence!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with divine food”
Reviews.Author: Karuna-Maharaj
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location on the Vegas strip. You do feel like you are in mini France. Had the most lovely meal at mon ami gabi. Hotel pool next to the mini Eiffel tower was awesome. Just step out of the hotel for the perfect location to watch bellagio fountains! The rooms were big but not as luxurious as the rooms at the Venetian where we stayed on our previous trip. Location of Paris is much better though.

Reviews.Title: “Great view but rooms lack.”
Reviews.Author: Marc T
Reviews.Content: You get a better view of Bellagio's fountains from rooms here than from most of the Bellagio's. However, the rooms here show heavy wear and abuse. The casino is my second favorite in Vegas but has my favorite mix of restaurants. Not a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelnut_10_10
Reviews.Content: We recieved a great value through Travelocity. Our rooms were beautiful with a view of the strip which added to the experience. Rooms were clean and quiet.. Hotel was clean and staff helpful and friendly. We unknowingly, at the time, booked a weekend during St. Pattricks Day and March Madness. It was crazy and busy but the staff was prompt with room service and friendly. I would stay there again for sure. Go see Jersey Boys!! IHighly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: tedWisconsin
Reviews.Content: 4th stay at Paris and stayed in the Luxury room this time........as being a total rewards member for sometime, I always go for comped rooms...was told could up grade at check in, but would have to pay an extra $50,00 a night, no thank you....Luxury room was very very nice....Bar service was slow in the casino as usual...My only advice would be that you buy your own soda, water,beer at some of the small discount stores near by....They will kill you for price inside Paris at there shops....Of the Caesars Entertainmaent properties that I have stayed at, Harrahs, Imperial Palace, and Paris, Paris ranks #1 so far...I haven't stayed at Caesars, Rio, bally's or Planet Hollywood just yet because they haen't offered comped rooms yet, but our next trip to Vegas in June, we are staying at the Flamingo for the first time....see how it goes...

Reviews.Title: “Not awe-inspiring, but consistently pleasant”
Reviews.Author: jhender85
Reviews.Content: My wife and I (in our mid-twenties) stayed 3 comped nights at the Paris for the 2nd time since we started coming to Vegas (this was our 11th time in Sin City). The room we were comped in was the Paris' standard room (also known as their Luxury or Blue room). However, after practically no wait to check in, I did my usual front desk tip trick (sandwiched a $20 bill between my ID and credit card) and without me saying a word the front desk clerk upgraded us to a Luxury Red Room with a Strip view. I'd say the Paris is one of the safer bets on the Strip to "bribe" your way to a better room for all who are curious to try. Our room was clean and updated (where as the standard blue rooms are in need of updates), looking out on the Paris pool, the Eiffel Tower and a spectacular full view of the Bellagio Fountains. Beware the fountains can be a bit loud if you go to bed early and sleep light. The living portion of the room wasn't very large and consisted of a small love seat, coffee table, small bedside desk, king bed, ottoman and entertainment center that doubled as our wardrobe. If you are one of the few people that stay in your room a lot in Vegas, you'll be pleased to know the TV was a nice 42 (or more) inch flat screen and lined up squarely with the bed. As for the bathroom, it was non-proportionally large in comparison to the bedroom. It was only a single vanity but had tons of counter space, a decent sized tub and separate glass enclosed shower. It is quite easy for 2 or so people to get ready in there at the same time. For the women, my wife did say (contrary to some other reviews) that the hair dryer is yet again a disappointment. Low power with low heat. It's not the worst hotel dryer, but if you can find room in your luggage, you may be better off bringing your own. As for the restaurants, whether I stay at the Paris or not, I'm always a fan. There are 2 places we always eat at while in Vegas and they're both here: Mon Ami Gabi and Le Village Buffet. As for the buffet, the lunch and dinner are not very impressive, yet the breakfast is amazing with a wonderful crepe station and a great overall selection of savory and sweet. Just be prepared for a long morning wait, especially during Sunday's champagne brunch. As for Mon Ami Gabi, the outdoor dining with a view of the Fountains is a must do experience, just be prepared for a long wait at dinner time as patio seating cannot be reserved in advance (breakfast and lunch wait isn't normally bad). Also, their "Frangria" is the best adult beverage I've ever had. Lastly, the gaming. It's not a very large casino floor, but at the same time it's never too crowded. You can always find a seat at a table or your favorite slot without much, if any, waiting. I myself normally like to play a low $10 a hand blackjack, however, Paris only offers this in single deck, so I just stick to slots while here. My wife and I have both found the slots here to be moderately loose when compared to many of the larger central strip casinos. Also, the drink service doesn't ignore the penny and nickel slot players like other casinos regularly do. Consistent and prompt service no matter what you're playing Overall, we enjoy the Paris every time we come here. It's not the Venetian or Bellagio, but it's a fairly quiet casino in a perfect location with some of the most incredible Las Vegas views if you get lucky with your room. If the price is right, it's a place we will never hesitate to book.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Selina L
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Paris hotel.Our room was very nice,and the hotel is kept very clean.Great location mid-strip with both buses stopping right out front.We stayed 7 nights and will go back as soon as we can!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoGirl30
Reviews.Content: This hotel has one redeeming quality, it has a great location. Besides that it is the absolute worst hotel I have stayed in on the strip. I usually stay at Wynn properties but came with a group and wanted to stay with them. I wish I stayed at my usual hotel. The staff here was so rude. The front desk acted like you were a second rate citizen and could care less about you or any issues you may have. 1st room was awful...smoking when I am allergic to smoke. It was dirty and stunk...next day they changed my room reluctantly and made me wait in hopes I would be inconvenienced. The hotel overall needs a major upgrade. Pool chairs need to be cleaned or purchased new. Nothing memorable about this hotel and with so many other choices in Vegas do yourself a favor and pick a different hotel. I will never repeat this experience...so not worth the $700.00 price tag. The rooms are worth $50.00 max if you pay above that you seriously are getting ripped off. I know I felt that way.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 day stay”
Reviews.Author: dallasc5
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed here from 3-11 to 3-14-2012. This was are third stay at the Paris. We usually stay here or at Bally’s as we always have a good time at each, and since both Hotels are connected via a shopping walkway makes it all the better. I always get my room comped as I am a Total Rewards members through Creaser’s entertainment. Although our room was comped we opted for a upgrade to a Jacuzzi suite for $ 50.00 a night, it was great. Love the atmosphere at there Paris and the employees are always above and beyond nice which makes for a good stay. This time was a GREAT stay as we won $ 5,000 dollars playing video poker, winning always makes the visit to Las Vegas better. We had the chocolate fondue at the Sugar Factory Chocolate bar, which is located inside the Paris Hotel. If you traveling with a significant other I would recommend this as it is a nice romantic time to spend with each other. The Paris offers good rooms, great food and service and a great atmosphere. The “rack rates” for a room are a bit high as is with all upper tier Hotels in Vegas, I would not pay any of the “rack rates” at any of the Vegas Hotels no matter how upscale, so I recommend finding a property you like and joining the players club for discounts on room, food, entertainment, etc. Anyways I am giving the Paris hotel another thumbs up for our recent stay.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Trudance
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our vacation in Vegas and we stayed at the Paris. We paid for the upgrade and got a red room with a view of the strip and and Bellagio Water Fountains and we were NOT disappointed. The room was nice and very clean and the beds were very comfortable. All of the staff that we interacted with were very nice and courtious and went out of their way to help us. The conceirge staff were very helpful and nice. We did not run into not one staff member who did not go out of their way for us. The las time we were in Vegas we stayed at the Flamingo one time and Bally's the other time and the Paris has them beat hands down!!!! The Paris is located in the centre of the strip so this is convienent. A BIG thank you to the Paris Hotel and their staff for a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “okay place”
Reviews.Author: marycarol4
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights. Rooms were nice; bathrooms very nice, but overall I thought it was overpriced. I was amazed that they did not provide internet service or a coffee maker or a mini fridge in the rooms. We were on an extended vacation and all other places we stayed in were less expensive and provided more. The best part of our stay at the Paris was dinner in the Eiffel Tower - the food was absolutely superb. If I return to Las Vegas, I will stay elsewhere but find an evening to eat at the Tower.

Reviews.Title: “"Blue Room" at The Paris”
Reviews.Author: tminton
Reviews.Content: f you can upgrade to a "Red" room at check in, Do IT....the Blue Rooms have not been updated and the room we were in is beginning to show a lot of wear and tear. Obviously. Other than the room, the hotel was awesome. Clean and friendly. I would have no hesitation to return but will definitely go RED next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location on the heart of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Tarnold8200
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times over the years, and always had a very nice stay. The location cannot be beat, and they have some amazing restaurants and bars. The dueling piano bar is quite fun if you are in the city with friends, although it gets very crowded at nights. They have great meeting space for conventions. I love that they have no resort fees, as this can add up over a long stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jayawayfromhome
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel in March on a trip with friends... At check in there was about a five minute wait to get to the counter... Not to bad really... As we had more than 2 staying in the room there was an additional charge of $30 per person, per night... Pretty steep... But overall check in went quite well. There is no free wifi at Paris except at a cafe right by the elevators. Wifi is expensive ranging from $10 for 2 hours to $35 for 24 hours which will get you access in any of the Harrah's casinos. In room access is $15 a day... Access to the gym is $5 a day... A toll free calls is $1.25. The room was a standard size with an older style tv, we were told we could upgrade to a better room for $40 a night which was the same size but with a flatscreen... The beds were very comfortable. No complaints about the room at all, quiet, roomy, nice sized bathroom... Other than that... Elevators were pretty fast, a fair size casino , Harrah's has a promotion in for $44 that gives you 24 hour access to 6 buffets which we took advantage of and enjoyed... Overall a pretty good hotel other than the add on costs for wifi and gym access being high. Our taxi ride to the hotel was $30 as the driver took us through 'the tunnel... On the way back the taxi took us a more direct route and the ride cost us $13... I suggest mentioning to the driver not to take the tunnel....

Reviews.Title: “Gone downhill”
Reviews.Author: houstnboy
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel a few years ago, but the last visit in December was not good. Bedding, linens, and drapes were ripped tattered and dirty. Maid service was not good and a few souvenir items were taken from our room. Even though there is no resort fee, I would rather pay one to stay somewhere nicer and have internet access and clean rooms. It is still just as much as other hotels with resort fees. Also, the staff is not friendly anymore. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated and dirty”
Reviews.Author: jenniferfaren
Reviews.Content: Really disappointed by Paris. very outdated and dirty overall, rundown and old feeling. Rooms not bad on space but smelled and were just not up to date. Restaurants decent and location great but will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: BKSupaStarr
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all! Great staff, great casino, all types of shops and restaurants! There is always something to do. Endless amenities and special requests.The decor and signature restaurant atop the Eiffel Tower make this hotel unique. You have to go to experience Paris in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Basic rooms badly need an update”
Reviews.Author: Joannetta_9
Reviews.Content: My sister and myself stayed at the Paris at the end of February for her birthday. On arrival we asked about an update but decided that the price increase didn't make it worthwhile. We were allocated a room on the 9th floor with a partial view of the Bellagio fountains, great we thought until the music from the nightclub kept us awake until 4am (not good after a days travelling from UK) We spoke to reception the next day who explained we should have been told about the noise on check-in and offered a change of rooms but as the night club would not be open for the rest of our stay. The rooms need a make over/update to keep in line with other Las Vegas hotels of the same standard, whilst I must say they were kept very clean. We had continental breakfast included in the hotel rate but only took it once as the breakfast was served in the Bally Hotel so was a 15 minute walk, also we didn't know that to take breakfast you had to produce photographic identity luckily I had an ID card with me otherwise this would have been another 30 mins walk. The location of the hotel is perfect right on the strip and very easy for both the public transport bus and the monorail which I found gave excellent, frequent service and were very clean. The bus drivers are all very helpfull. Unfortunately I can not give a good review of the St Louis Restaurant or the Boullangerie restaurants but these problems I have passed on to the groups Customer Service. I great evening was spent in the Napoleon Bar when the had a Soul Quartet singing the atmosphere was great, unfortunately the next night the waitress serving ourselves needed some more training... because when we were there with a friend asked for a repeat order she brought completely different drinks! We must recommend the show Menopause the Musical (Luxor Hotel) and we also enjoyed the excursion to the Grand Canyon with Comedy deck Tours (Jason the guide and Robert the Driver)

Reviews.Title: “Paris Las Vegas Room 2198P :-)”
Reviews.Author: Patricia M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris Las Vegas for one week comped 6 nights woohoo! Room 2198P The room was not redone-still in the older style-but was perfectly fine and in good condition. Housekeeping was great! The fridge is the old mini bar and we kept all our snacks and refrigerated items in it, worked perfectly for us. The TV is an old small one, but we hardly watched tv with the VIEW from the 2 windows! I was soooo excited to have this view!! Eiffel Tower, Paris Balloon and perfect centered view of the Bellagio fountains. Sometimes you could hear the music, sometimes not. On our first night-Saturday February 25th-they must have had the volume or bass or something turned up EXTRA loud at the Chateau nightclub because we heard BOOM BOOM BOOM and it actually shook the room until 4 AM.....but never again for the rest of the week. They were open Tuesday and Friday nights during our stay also, but we only heard it a little bit and nothing like that first night thank goodness:) We liked the casino, The breakfast buffet was excellent-crepes made to order. Le Burger Brasserie was excellent also. Drink service was hit and miss, when we had it it was very very good, but sometimes there were no servers for an hour or more at a time.....shift change maybe. We went to the top of the Eiffel tower, always fun!! Please don't hesitate to message me with any questions...I am trying to write a real trip report about the whole trip but it is taking me a while LOL Patty in PA

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location on the strip - good place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: deryapa
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel if your primary motive for visiting Vegas is not gambling. It is in the center of all strip activity, and when you are inside the hotel, it does not feel like a hotel, but like a neighborhood. Nice restaurants you can enjoy - feels like sitting at an outside cafe when dining in some of them - if you enjoy that kind of feeling, it is excellent place. Room was great, overlooking nowhere particular, but we did not stay in the room much, anyway. Parking was free - but internet is costly. - So bring your my-fi with you and enjoy. The only hickup was the check-in, which I was aware of reading the reviews, and was able to endure 15 minutes of being ignored - with the anticipation of a good rest of the stay - and it was good.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Choice”
Reviews.Author: Alice G
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Paris Casino. The location is perfect, right in the middle of the strip. Lunch at the Bistro which was perfect, and the overall service, room and casino were fantastic. I would recommend to anyone. This was our first trip to Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Huge Suite - Nice but Time to Remodel”
Reviews.Author: execplatscum
Reviews.Content: Full disclosure, I spend too much money on Casino's but in return they treat me well and I paid absolutely nothing for my room for 3 nights. Comped via a casino host, I had no idea what room type I would get so was pretty surprised to find myself in a giant corner suite. Marble Entry, guest bath, living room, dining room, bedroom with magic TV coming from a box at the foot of the bed, huge bathroom. So in the spirit of looking a gift horse in the mouth here are my observations. Check in - Awesome Elevators - Awesome Room Size - Awesome Decor - Perhaps retro mausoleum is a good description. Or my rich french obsessed great grandma offered me a wing in her faux antique decorated condo in Dallas. Stale, Old,, not hip or cool. TV was the funniest part because its one of them magic "tada" rises from a box hidden at the foot of the bed variety but when it finishes its journey its an 30inch box tv circa 1990. Thats really my only complaint. Sorry Horse...

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: horseygramma
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed twice at the Paris Hotel and are looking forward to a return trip. We stayed in their basic luxury room both times. Each time we had a P room at the end of the hall. I like these rooms as they are very quiet and I think they may be a bit bigger. We never had to wait at all for elevator service. We have eaten at the Eiffel Tower restaurant (amazing food and service), Mon Ami Gabi (excellent food and a great view of the Bellagio fountains from the outside patio)try the chocolate bacon waffles!!, the buffet (can experience long lines but we just picked times that were not so busy), St Louis Cafe (Fantastic breakfasts) We also ate at the Sugar Factory, the crepe place and the small restaurant in the hallway to Ballys and they were all very good. The casino is a great size. Not too big that you get lost. There are a great variety of different slot machines and we found that the cocktail service has always been excellent. As others have stated you can not beat the Paris for location! It is accross the street from the Bellagio and Cosmopolitan and in between Planet Hollywood and Ballys. There is also the Miracle Mile Shopping Mall next door for shopping which includes an ABC store for snacks and liquor.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, would return.”
Reviews.Author: 7tocs7
Reviews.Content: Booked a Paris Luxury Room during a conference. The Luxury Room is their cheapest. The room had two queen beds, nice closet space, a safe, iron board and iron, work desk and work chair as well as a chair and ottoman to relax. There was an empty mini bar with a message not to use it. Sigh. I wish they’d just stock it or remove it and put a mini-fridge in, or allow us to use (put items in it) the mini bar (it was plugged in and cooling). The room is a bit dated: some marks on the wall or areas where the wallpaper was slightly rripped, carpet looks like it needs replacing soon. Bathroom was great. Nice sink area, a tub for a soak and a separate shower stall. There is a small tube TV in a console that has the aforementioned closet space on both sides. Sure, the TV is small but this is Vegas….lots of rooms in this price range have small TV’s. The amount of closet space was nice (I was on business so had to hang a suit, couple of jackets, pants and shirts etc ) plus you had three drawers for all your other stuff. I really liked the storage space! My room seemed to have a view of the back / garage / east mountains. It was at the end of the hall and it was quiet and therefore I slept well. I didn’t use the extra facilities but they (Ceasars hotels) don’t charge a resort fee. So overall, very good bang for the buck. I’d return. Sure, items and food in the hotel are expensive but the location (mid strip) is amazing. If you don’t have a car then this is a great location. On one day I walked the north strip and on another day I walked the south strip. I checked in late (just before midnight) and it was less than five minutes as was checkout at about 10:00 a.m. Overall good stay. I’d stay again but would check the partner hotels in the area (Bally’s, Ceasars) to see if they have a comparable room at a better price.

Reviews.Title: “good size of hotel for las vegas”
Reviews.Author: pfl0res
Reviews.Content: it is a nice hotel, with a very good size, not too big and with all the amenities of a big hotel. nice restaurants in it, the rooms have good size as well as the bathroom, very good located

Reviews.Title: “Ooo Lala, we are in Paris in Las Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: valeriemabel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderful. The front desk clerk saved us from a terrible problem. Thank you. You always hope that the front desk can help you. The room was lovely. The hotel has begun to be dated but they have the kept the hotel up very well. I would stay again just to look up at the Eiffel Tower. The pool is on the third floor. Nothing fancy as the other pools opening at the Wynn, Encore or the Cosmopolitian and it seems small compared to the others. It is a great location to walk to the other resorts. We ate at the Cafe Mon Ambi. The sausage was delicious. I gave the room average only because it needs to be updated but it is well cared for.

Reviews.Title: “Locality terrific, environment not so great...”
Reviews.Author: KingGnome
Reviews.Content: Paris Hotel is centrally located on the strip, next door to the Miracle mile shops. There is also a bus stop nearby which takes you north (in front of the sugar factory) or south of the strip (in front of Bellagio). The staffs we encountered were friendly, helpful and knowledgeable about the local area and tourist hot spots (eg. Grand Canyon, Hoover dam). The disappointing bits about Paris hotel were security, poor air ventilation and allowing pets in hotel rooms. Security - anybody can get to the lift lobby and go up to any floors without any questions asked because it is located near the gaming floor which is accessible by the general public. Ventilation - for a non-smoker, walking inside Paris, whether in the lobby, gaming floor (I expected this) , lift lobby or hotel floors feels like living in a smoke chimney. Fresh air is non-existent. This wasn’t an issue at other hotels - Wynn, Bellagio, Cosmopolitan or Caesars Palace. Air quality was so bad at Paris that I spent most of my time elsewhere and was not able to explore the facilitates within it. And lastly, pets, from small dogs to big, Paris resembled a zoo at times. P.s. Beware of taxi drivers taking you on a scenic route from the McCarrran international airport to Paris or Bellagio. Demand that you be taken via Paradise Rd, then onto Harmon Ave (Hard rock café corner). Total journey should cost you $14 to $18 dollars tops. P.p.s If you don't mind the cigarette smoke and decide to stay at Paris, then ask for a room overlooking the Bellagio water fountains!

Reviews.Title: “Great location,Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: feltched
Reviews.Content: My wife surprised me for my 40th birthday with a trip to Vegas and we stayed at Paris with another couple who were also celebrating the same bday. When we got there they didn't have the King size room that my wife had booked so we had a room with 2 queen beds the first night and then had to change rooms the next day which was inconvenient. Also the couple we were with asked for a non-smoking room which they were told was an upgrade so they had to pay an extra $110/night to get a non-smoking room which I think shouldn't be an extra charge. The casino was great, the restaurants looked nice;We ate at Mon Ami Gabies which was very good and the burger place that I can't remember the name of but it was very good as well. If you take a cab make sure you tip the guy that is at the taxi stand otherwise he will be rude. The 4 of us forgot to tip him and when we got in he opened the door and asked us if his service was ok? I think a tip should be voluntary and not expected. Very uncalled for! Because of the bad experiences we had with the customer service we received I'm not sure we would stay here again. There are a lot of other casinos to stay at and they would have to try hard to earn my patronage again. The rooms were clean and comfortable,the washrooms were clean and spacious. Everything is very good here except the service so if you don't mind that then I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back”
Reviews.Author: Jim D
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at Paris for four nights when in town for business. It was my first time staying there, and I wont be back. The room was tired, with an old hard bed and a tube TV from the early 90's. However, on the positive side the bathrooms are spacious and well designed - it is a wonder how they've aged so well but not the room itself. Many were baffled by the long wait at some of the restaurants in the complex. For example, with over 15 tables open in the morning at le Cafe restaurant, we were told that the wait would be 10-15 minutes. Huh? Your better bet would be to go across the hall to the smaller cafe madeline as it is much quicker and the food better. Stay away from JJ's Pizza Window ($9.99 Special for two slices and soda) - may have been the worst pizza I've ever tasted (which is saying a lot!). The staff was very friendly and helpful. The check-in lines were extraordinarily long for a Sunday afternoon - 20 minute wait. The location is excellent as it is right in the middle of the Strip, but all-in-all, there are better places to stay when in Las Vegas than here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Mid Strip Property”
Reviews.Author: emdpetey
Reviews.Content: Im giving this hotel a very good rating due to it being in a good mid strip location and being very clean. I also got the "luxury" room comped for 2 nights so can't complain too much. Prior to checking in here I stayed at TheHotel at Mandalay Bay for 2 nights which I definitely didn't want to leave but Im not passing up a few nights of comped rooms. Here is my quick review: After parking in the lot and entering the hotel, I was first bombarded by the people selling timeshares which I chose to ignore. It took a little while to find the check in desk due to the poor signage but I eventually figured it out. Check in was quick and we were placed on the 24th floor facing the back of Ballys. We had to settle with a 2 queen bed room nonsmoking due to king nonsmoking being sold out. It was only 6pm they must have very few king beds in the place!!! The room was nice and clean with comfortable beds. The bathroom was large with a walk in shower and a separate bathtub. Yes it was an old tv but who cares I turned it on 2 times during the 2 nights I stayed. In summary, for the most part it was a very clean place with good customer service. I ended up getting a late checkout due to a late flight. The 2 downsides of the property for me were the huge crowds this place gets in the restaurant/store areas but then again that is expected in a mid strip hotel. The other as mentioned before the timeshare people who constantly harass you as you pass by. Just ignore them or tell them your not interested as I do!!

Reviews.Title: “everything was great, enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: John L
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days at Paris, and everything went great. Room was perfect, clean. Had a problem with the TV and called down to the front desk, problem was taken care of very quick. All employee were very polite. The table game selection was very good and getting to Bally was easy.Will stay there the next time. Also very good location

Reviews.Title: “Best location on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: PBFla
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating an anniversary so decided to take a short trip to Vegas. We have been there several times before staying on and off the Strip. All the hotels seemed to be offering great prices, but we decided that location would be the main draw for our hotel. Paris didn't disappoint. At check in we were asked if we'd like to upgrade for $55.00 per day/room, and we said yes. We were upgraded to a room on the 24th floor with a view of the Eiffel tower and the fountains of Belliago. The room hadn't undergone the remodeling that the hotel is doing, but the furnishings were tasteful and elegant. The beds were outstanding!! My husband would like to buy one, as they were extremely comfortable. The upgrade also gave us access to the Rondevous Lounge on the 31st floor. They offer a filling continental breakfast and nightly cocktails (limit of two). One night after having a late lunch, the cocktails and appetizers were our dinner. The lounge also offered water bottles, so this in itself saves you from having to purchase extra water. The only complaint I have was that they never varied the breakfast items. If you like bagels, cream cheese, and lox, this is your place! They also had cereal, fresh fruit and a delicious granola, fruit and yogurt parfait. At night they had shrimp, cheese and crackers, fruit, a few hot appetizers and a pasta dish. We found that it was more convenient to eat breakfast here and not worry about the crowds in the hotel restaurant. Also included in this upgrade is a special concierge service staffed by young professionals eager to help. If you are of the "Boomer," age and like a slightly more refined Las Vegas, I definitely recommend the Paris hotel with the Rondevous Lounge upgrade. Paris, being where it is on the strip, was walk able to all the places we like to go while in "Sin City."

Reviews.Title: “A world all its own !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: louise_russo03
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Las Vegas week of Feb. 27 to March 2/2012. What an amazing city. The hotel we stayed at was THE PARIS, great place to stay right in the middle of the strip. Check-in and out were both fast and efficient, no long delays. We were in the red room. Simply beautiful, very nice size room, clean and quite modern. The hotel itself is a replica of small towns in france. Food very good at the hotel. plenty of gambling, never had a problem finding a table. Lots of little boutiques. Everyone from the reception to the maids were simply fabulous. Ready to answer any questions either concerning the hotel or anything else about las vegas. The city itself is magical. Music and lights day and night are something to experience. Lots to see and do plenty of places to eat. Best place for breakfast is at Mon Ami Gabi. You can get to it by the inside of the hotel itself. Visited plenty of the other hotels and shops. Couldn't get everything done in one trip. Going back soon!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: l00k9999
Reviews.Content: Check in and check out personnel were efficient and professional. Business office personnel were great. Room was clean but worn carpet could use replacement and a coffee machine would help in the morning. Casino atmosphere and architecture are fantastic. Mon Ami Gabi and the Le Burger Brasserie produce great steaks and hamburgers, respectively. Wait staff are very friendly. Location on Las Vegas Blvd is perfect - halfway between the north and south ends of the strip. Casino across the Blvd from Belaggio. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel”
Reviews.Author: odonchap
Reviews.Content: This is a very good place to stay, great food and friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: HItesh_Bansal
Reviews.Content: I travelled there with my wife, and we got a great room with strip view. It also gave us the Bellagio fountain view as well as Eiffel tower view in bonus. Location couldn't be better as it is bang on in the middle of strip and hence all the action! Rooms were good, bathrooms were excellent too. There is so much to do at the hotel itself. The casino is great, so is the cafe. The eiffel tower trip must be taken at night, it's gorgeous! Good experience overall!

Reviews.Title: “great 30th at Paris Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: clare-rick
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Paris Las Vegas, from our arrival late at night to our departure our stay was brilliant we upgraded to the concierge package with included a great view of the tower and fountains at bellagio. We also had breakfast and in the evening enough food that we didnt need to eat out and alcoholic drinks. The room was always clean and was a very good size. The casino we felt was one of the best in Vegas and although we didnt eat at the restaurants they always seemed busy. Every member of staff we spoke with was very polite and friendly. Great place and a great trip for my husbands 30th. if we return to Las Vegas we would definitely stay here again it is situated in a great place on the strip best position really.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny if you get a good deal”
Reviews.Author: Brandy146
Reviews.Content: We normally stay at the Bellagio when we are in Vegas but got a great deal on the Paris, so decided to stay here. On entry to the reception area there were grand chandaliers and welcoming staff. We did not have to wait long to be served and the reception person was very cheerful. As was mentioned before, you have to walk slightly through the casino to get to the lifts but this happens in lots of other hotels in Vegas too. We found the lifts and there were plenty, so no real wait time. The halls were clean and bright. On entry to our room we were not disappointed. It was a red room and it certainly was red. The furniture was in old world Parisien style and yes, there was an old tv, but you are in Vegas and this shouldn't matter. We had two queen beds which were very comfortable and very clean. There were coffee making facilities in the room. The bathroom was large enough. The vanity area very good for all the toiletries. There were toiletries supplied but we bought our own. There was a standalone shower and a sunken bath. The towels were fine and the room itself ok. Our room was cleaned to a very high standard every day and I could not fault the cleanliness. Now to the casino. It did seem to suffer with a lot of smoke and it was dark and small. We walked through to the Ballys casino which was much more light and airey. We ate in the Paris Cafe which, sadly, wasn't great. They must have been having an off day. We also had a crepe from the takeaway creperie, which was yummy. We got a really good deal with Last Minute to stay at the Paris and would definitely stay again if we got another great deal. Not sure if we would stay and pay the prices the Paris are asking though. All in all a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Economic to the location”
Reviews.Author: Sudhie
Reviews.Content: Paris stays at the heart of the strip and we arrived on Saturday. It is economic for saturday, not sure if it is the deal. Room was fine but bathroom was so small and no fan. Visited Pizza, Pasta etc restaurant (dont remember the name), I wouldn't recommend this restaurant. Its quality is not worth the money. Eggplant we got came with a price sticker on it. that makes it clear, Vegetables aren't cleaned before being cooked. Chef doesn't bother to take the sticker out. Right opposite to Hotel rooms, a restaurant is available (with a tree). It is expensive but we enjoyed the break fast. It was really good. Casino was good though we lost money. It doesn't have poker room, one more disappointing stuff (but you can always visit Ballys casino. You can use coins purchased in Paris there). Dealer by name chuck was very friendly on black jack tables.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as other hotels on the strip - but it thinks it is”
Reviews.Author: Hectorshouse09
Reviews.Content: We visited Vegas twice on our road trip - stayed here the second time and were quite disappointed. We weren't able to upgrade our room and it was quite small and soulless. The check in was very efficient, but not especially friendly. Roomsl very clean, well appointed etc. Location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible time!!”
Reviews.Author: Tammyherle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after not being in Vegas for 15 years. We had a red room with a view of the Bellagio fountains which was spectacular. Location was perfect and staff were very nice. Gambled lots downstairs and found drink service very good even when you stay up all night long. Would definitely recommend this hotel. Great value for what you get and super clean.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: broomea
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Paris from 2/28 to 3/3. First room we were given was an older room on 16th floor. The mattresses were old and worn out. I immediately went back to the lobby and upgraded my room to a Red Room for a nominal fee (I was comped the rooms to start). Red Room mattresses were comfy and new. Bathroom large enough for 2 women to use. I will say that the pillows need to be upgraded and I found the toiletries to be average at best. We had a view of the mountains and Bally's. The room/floor was very quiet (30th floor). The casino was fun. Played table games mostly at this casino. All the dealers were friendly and fun. We ate the La Creperie, Sugar Factory, Mon Ami Gambi and Cafe Ile St Louis. No complaints at any of the restaurants. The best part about the Paris is the location. You cannot ask for a better spot on the strip. You are convenient to the bus stop that services both the Deuce and the Express Bus (definte must if you go to Freemont street - fewer stops) and to the monrail station that is at the back of Bally's. It is also beside Planet Hollywood and the Miracle Mile shops. For a cheap breakfast, check out the many options in the Miracle Mile Mall.

Reviews.Title: “40th Birthday and First Time To VEGAS!”
Reviews.Author: tandtmk04
Reviews.Content: I celebrated my 40th B-Day and First Trip to VEGAS at the PARIS LAS VEGAS and glad that I did! The location is PERFECT! Located in the heart of Las Vegas and w/i walking distance to everything! The hotel was very nice as were the staff. Room was very clean and spacious. Beds were comfy. Funny how at times I felt like I was in Paris! Ha! If you're looking for a hotel in the middle of everywhere then The Paris is your place! :)

Reviews.Title: “Aussie Vegas Virgins Couldn't Be Happier With Paris”
Reviews.Author: scorpiolee
Reviews.Content: After finally arriving at Paris after 37 hours of travelling, I was totally mesmerised with the reception area and my tiredness soon faded to total awe. This place is gorgeous. We had a bit of a line to check-in but only waited about 20 minutes. The lady who checked us in (I can't remember her name) couldn't have been more helpful. We had prepaid the 4 night stay about 7 months previously and at that point my son was going to travel with us so we had paid for 2 queen beds in a standard room. After cancelling my son's trip, we called the Paris and asked to be changed to a one king bed room which they approved verbally. I was not able to get a refund for the 3rd person as this was paid via a third party booking site. Our check-in lady had offered us an upgrade for $40.00 per night which we were more than happy to take up as this was our honeymoon (although we weren't actually married yet - that was 5 days away). We agreed to the upgrade, she was frantically clicking away on her keyboard and then she asked us if we had received a refund for the 3rd person who had cancelled. We explained the situation to her and she immediately said that she was giving us the upgrade for free - I couldn't wipe the smile from my face - Welcome to Vegas! My husband wanted to give her a $20 tip but I was so happy with the service that I gave her $50. She spent the next 10 minutes explaining where everything was, giving us tips for shows, restaurants etc and mentioned that if we needed anything during our stay, to ask for her. We headed off to the elevators dragging our luggage behind and when we got to the elevators, we realised we were on the 27th floor - very cool! When we first walked into the room (2758), my expectations were blown out of the water - what a beautiful room! Huuuge king size pillow-top bed, fridge, coffee maker and a gorgeous (and big) marble bathroom. At the check-in, they had asked us for a credit card in case of charges to the room. We told them we did not have a credit card and would therefore pay cash for everything and this was not a problem at all. Our entire stay was 100% wonderful, from the room service delivery guy to the concierge and the housekeeping staff, we were treated so well. Our room was cleaned daily up to my high standards and we were basically left to do our thing. Express checkout was a breeze and we even left the key to the room in a box in the lobby - so no waiting to check out. We ate at the buffet for breakfast and it was nice - not great but still a great choice and nice food for breakfast. We also ate at the take away pizza place - massive slices of American pizza - delicious! We ordered take away desserts from the patisserie - again very delicious and we ordered room service - always hot and very yummy. We gambled in the casino a couple of times and found the cocktail servers to be a lot slower than a lot of the other casinos and the slots were definately NOT paying on the few times we played them. Walking through the walkway to Bally's was much better for us - great cocktail service and much better gambling. We are already planning our next trip next year and Paris is the top of my list for accomodation as we had moved to the Mirage for the last half of our stay and were not nearly as happy there. All in all this place has everything you need - location, great staff, great food and beautiful king rooms. I had read extensively on trip advisor before our trip and noticed a few people were compaining about the internet charges - but honestly all we needed to do was transfer some extra money into our account while we were away and the little kiosk in reception was more than adequate for us - I mean how much time do you really spend on your computers whilst your in Vegas? The pool was open whilst we were there (Feb 12-17) but it was a little chilly for awimming so we didn't use it.Can't speak highly enough of our stay - we'll definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “great staff, stay”
Reviews.Author: gfg22
Reviews.Content: stayed for 4 nights and our Red Room was exactly as shown on the web! Small, but nice room, huge clean bathroom, lots of towels and goodies. View was of the back of Bally's but who cares, we came back at 4am, you did see the mountains though, very cool! Halls were a bit cluttered with room service dishes not picked up from 12-24 hours before, a little odd as the hotel and casino was super clean otherwise. We slept in huge one day and maid service called to see if we wanted the room cleaned (it was 2pm ) We thanked them and said we'd be out before 3. Casino nice, but kind of small which is ok, as there are so many. Nice indoor walk from Bally's. Nice shops and restaurants. Fun Piano lounge. Good location on strip and close to street unlike other huge hotels with a 5+ min. walk in.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again- Recommended”
Reviews.Author: KGBnwu
Reviews.Content: Booked the Paris, Las Vegas, for a conference that was being held at Planet Hollywood. Paris had a better deal for the dates that we were staying and was directly next door, making it a good buy. We arrived late on a Friday night. Took a cab from the airport and instead of insisting on a route, we allowed the cab driver to take us to our hotel. Needless to say, he took the freeway, and our trip was over 10 dollars more than our return, where we took the back roads, not including airport taxes. Live and learn. Check in was quick at that time at night (12 am), we learned that our request for a king was not available...but we could change rooms the next day or upgrade to a strip view king for 55.00. This upgrade included a concierge floor with free hot and cold appetizers at night and free drinks, free hot and cold breakfast in the morning. We did not take this upgrade until the last night, and in retrospect, it was a good deal. Drinks were high quality and free, non-alcoholic drinks were available at all times (including free water). Food was perfect for an afternoon snack or for breakfast. We would have done it sooner if we had known exactly what it was like, and would do it again upon return. Room are...older, with warn carpeting and stains, peeling wallpaper, old "box" tv's. They are larger with ample room, including the bathroom, which had both a shower and tub (separate). Our upgraded room was still older, but did have the promised strip view of the fountains, etc. I know they are upgrading some rooms, it will be nice when they are able to upgrade all as they are showing their age. We had no issue with noise, towels and linens were adequate. House keeping was inconsistent. One morning they came before noon, the next day they were there at 5 pm. They left trashcans and other room items in different places, making some things hard to find. The upside to the hotel is that it is centrally located in virtually the middle of the strip. The "express" bus makes a stop directly in front of the hotel and can cheaply and easily take you to downtown casinos and attractions. The actually rooms and hotel elevators are not too far from the entrances, a rarity for Las Vegas hotels. We ate at both Mon Ami Gabi and the Eiffel Tower restaurant. Both were good- pricey, but worth the money in my opinion. Service was excellent as was the ambiance. We enjoyed the crepe place as well for breakfast. The one negative eatery experience occurred at the pizzaria. Multiple pizzas and slices were advertised, however, when we attempted to purchase a slice, we were told that out of 8 pizzas, they only had 2 available. The clerk gave no indication of when or if other pizzas might be ready. We then attempted to order a glass of wine (which was on the menu) and were told that "they didn't have wine". None of this was done with an apology. Casino was enjoyable- we were consistently offered free drinks when playing machines, despite the bet or type of machine. While we liked the martini bar near the guest room elevator, it was VERY pricey (27 dollars for two drinks). We enjoyed the bar in the middle of the casino- it had very nice bar tenders and quick service, however, when you actually sat at the bar, it smelled strongly of vomit. We did not use the pool (still not too warm), although we could see it from our room. Essentially a large circle, nothing spectacular. Check out was quick and efficient, the hotel was able to hold our bags for the day. My main complaint for the stay was related to room charging. We find it easier to charge meals and other items to our room versus pay each time. We set up our credit card for purchases upon arrival. When I charged items, I was asked for my ID and room #, easy enough. My significant other, although he presented his ID when checking in, found it virtually impossible to charge items to the room. Clerks would look at his ID and type our room number in and state that it was not a match. We finally stopped at the front desk to correct the mistake, thinking that they had his name wrong. We were incorrect. It turns out that their system is set up for ONE person to charge to the room. Any additional guests required a phone call from a clerk, waiter, or bartender to the front desk to ok the charge. Not convenient when I was in a conference all day. Seems like an outdated system. Overall, rooms were large and comfortable, though slightly old. Front desk staff and most of the hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Location was first rate and casino and restaurants were nice. The Paris rates as an above average strip hotel (though not five stars) and we would stay here again. Recommended to others.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wheelzofsteel
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel for a friends wedding! It was a great place to stay. My only complaint is that they don't have wireless internet. It is only offered in a small cafe in the hotel. You can buy wired internet in your room but I found it to be very slow and costly. I didn't know this detail before I went as I thought everywhere would have wireless. I needed to get some work done while I was there so I had to sit in this little cafe to do it. The resort, the rooms and the pool area were outstanding. I just think at the price of the rooms which weren't cheap internet would be included.

Reviews.Title: “Paris hotel, Overall a very good hotel (great if you can’t make it to the real thing)”
Reviews.Author: Matti T
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paris during my visit to Vegas this past May for the NHS show. As I was traveling for business the hotel rate was out of my hands and represents no issue. With that in mind, I found the Paris to be a very good hotel. Easy to get around, plenty of dining options and more simple coffee shops. I also found the Casino area of nice size, not a big gambler, but I won about $100. Rooms were very spacious, with comfortable beds. The TV could be better ( upgrade to flat screen…). The Bathroom was nice and clean, and the working area was more than enough (I used it quite a lot). The staff was friendly (although a faulty key and no ID on me took more than half an hour to sort out and finally get back into the room…at least I had coffee with me). In addition, the rather long lines at check in/out are a bit too much… all in all, over all a very good stay (BTW - the hotel is great if you can’t make it to the real thing in France).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: ElaineBI
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas to see Celine she became ill and sadly had to cancel her show. We were talking to the check in lady and she was so kind she gave us very special treatment in the hotel and tried to make up for our disappointment. I believe they went out of their way to make us welcome and our room was lovely..I would recommend this property as they seem to go above the call of duty. We enjoyed our stay...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but room was just average”
Reviews.Author: LandlockedNoVA
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very nice. But, as one of the moderately-new (not brand new) hotels on the strip, I was disappointed to see worn furniture in my room and old tube TV. (stains and small holes on upholstery and lamp shades) And, sheets were thin - towels were fine. Large, clean bathroom. Staff friendly. Great location. Price was reasonable. All in all -- it's very adequate and no major complaints. But, I was just a little disappointed the room furnishings weren't fresher.

Reviews.Title: “Fun fun fun...”
Reviews.Author: GriffoBristol
Reviews.Content: The whole idea of Vegas is fun and more fun. This was a nice (somewhat old) hotel. We (wife and I) paid around only 35$ a day extra for a room upgrade, which was well worth it. Ended up in a mini suite, with separate toilet to the shower cubicle a Jacuzzi type bathroom. Separate clothes closet with safe. Good sized mini bar too. Giant flat screen TV, not that we watched it! The Paris has a good casino, with plenty of slots, roulette and card tables. Caters for big and small spenders. The hotel'alleyways' next to the casino are French like, and have plenty of good places to grab food, though you may want to take a wander outside on the strip and beyond to find better value. Vegas rocks, night and day. And we had a great time staying at this hotel. Just watch out with the gambling...

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best on The Strip”
Reviews.Author: shysue
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at probably half of the casino hotels on the Strip, and I have to say that so far Paris Las Vegas is my favorite. The room we had was very clean, the beds were the most comfortable we've ever slept in, the linens were nice, no weird smells in the room, and the bathroom was super clean, too. We didn't have a great view but that was okay with us. We'd rather be where it's a bit quieter instead of overlooking the Strip and having to hear all the sirens and traffic. A/C was not loud, and we couldn't hear our neighbors slamming their doors which seems to be the norm at these hotels. It was just peaceful. Location is perfect, right across from the Bellagio, and the restaurant choices in the casino are good. The walk from the self-parking garage is reasonable, unlike some places (for example, MGM Grand and Caesars Palace) where they punish you for not using their valet services by making you walk 1/2 mile to get from your car to the registration desk. It's just laid out very well. Casino was so-so; tight like most of the other casinos on the Strip. They have good selection of slots if that's your thing. Drink service was okay until evening, then it was hit or miss. Didn't seem to be enough cocktail waitresses to cover the floor at the time we were there. I would highly recommend this hotel though.
