You can stay at more expensive places. or you can stay at cheaper places, but for our money Paris was just right. We love the City of Paris theme, too, c'est bonne.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; rooms could use a facelift”
Reviews.Author: CrunchyJiff
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic. Across the street are Bellagio and Cosmopolitan, Planet Hollywood and Bally's are on either side. Plenty of shopping, bars and attractions are within walking distance. The casino and "rues" play up the theme, with names like Le Creperie, Cafe Ile and the like. Mon Ami Gabi was by far my favorite restaurant I tried during our stay. I can only speak for breakfast, which was tasty and fairly affordable, and at any time of the day the resto's patio offers a fantastic view of the Bellagio fountains. The rooms could stand a renovation, though. While our room was very clean, the carpet and some furniture were showing some wear. The TV was not of this decade or perhaps the last, even. And yes this is a girly recommendation, but bathrobes are so welcomed when us ladies are getting ready to hit the town (or at least this lady). After having stayed at other hotels on the Strip (Bellagio, Palazzo, Venetian), Paris was just OK. If you just need a place to rest your head, though, it can be a good choice for getting in the middle of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Great themed Vegas hotel”
Reviews.Author: ninjakitty
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week for our anniversary at the end of February. Got upgraded to a red room which was really nicely decorated on the 29th floor so had good views too. The room had a nice big tv, the bathroom was nice and had good amenities and the curtains were blackout, which was really useful with our jet lag! Had room service once, which was lovely but quite expensive. The best bits were... The Eiffel Tower restaurant - a must do for a special occasion but very expensive ($420) for a 2 course meal with wine Mon Ami Gabi restaurant - really intimate and great food at good price Village buffet - good value and looked like something from beauty and the beast! General theme was brilliant fun The location was perfect! Right in the middle of the strip with a bus stop outside! Bits which could be better... Room service was expensive and took a while to come Check in took a while as there was a queue and room should only have been available until 4pm Chateau nightclub, great location but only go if you have a table booking as the bouncers are terribly officious otherwise Spa was great but $320 for 2 50 minute massages was more expensive than the Ritz! Overall, a great hotel would certainly recommend and would go back if going to Vegas again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Riesling
Reviews.Content: Unless you want serious 5 star accommodation I would definitely recommend Paris and would stay again. Large rooms, well kept. The decor is european style (... Paris...) and as good or better than any 4 star I have stayed at in Europe or Australia, except the rooms are huge. All very clean, comfortable beds, lots of pillows and towels, basic bathroom kit supplied (not luxury or branded). The gambling area itself is small to medium sized. What we really liked, as 3 friends in our 30s, was the variety of (reasonably priced) bars, restaurants and cafes, so if one person wants to gamble, or gets up very early, there's plenty here. The only casino's to match this feel are New York New York (reasonably priced) and the Bellagio (higher prices). Going up the Eiffel Tower is a must for everyone. Fantastic views of all Vegas, and especially the Bellagio fountains. Be sure to get. 2for1 coupon from one of the many Vegas booklets you can pick up at various receptions. We had three rooms - 2 red rooms and a standard blue room. They were much the same, except the red rooms were on higher floors. One had a view of the Bellagio which was nice, but not make or break. One room DID hear the nightclub beat all night on a Saturday night, and it was on the 26th floor - so worth asking about this! Otherwise fantastic location, great value for money and all three of us would stay again. Ch

Reviews.Title: “depends what you're looking for.....”
Reviews.Author: leslie232
Reviews.Content: Paris is an average hotel as far as hotels go. However, compared with the other Vegas hotels, it is not that great. Let me first say that the location cannot be beat. So if that's all you care about, it's a good deal. However, we were disappointed with our room. Old TV, no ipod hook up, poor response from the front desk when our in room safe didn't work and the pool was not properly staffed. The hotel did not seem to be prepared for the nice weather on Saturday and the pool area was not ready. Guests had to haul out their own chairs, the bars were not open, and half of the pool was closed until another lifeguard showed up for work. I have to agree with some of the other reviewers and say that the best thing about Paris is Mon Ami Gabi. Make sure not to miss brunch and the Bloody Mary bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not what it was.”
Reviews.Author: McGeepers
Reviews.Content: Room type; standard room Beds; comfy with plenty of pillows Bathroom; clean and roomy. Room size; standard vegas room. Check in; middle of the road, faster then the worst. Overall; the best was to describe Paris is to think of a seeing a beautiful European women and walking towards her and just as you go to say hi, she lifts her arm to reveal hairy pits. This place looks good but on closer inspection needs it's armpits shaved. It just feels tired and grimy, the rooms and common areas are worn and depressed. Room service trays sit in the hallways for over 24 hrs. It's a shame cause at one time it was the total package. If they spend a bit on it it may come good again.

Reviews.Title: “Casino rip off”
Reviews.Author: bobcrisp
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Paris hotel in vegas is Mon ami gabi restaurant... other than that stay far away from the casino where staff and bosses love to make up new rules with every hand that doesn't suit them... their "take it or leave it" attitude is disgusting... it is wornout and old... best thing would be to tear it down and start again... including their self-righteous and rude employees.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: AWBW2011
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying at Paris. Again, not to be disappointed! It is a lovely property and very clean and high class without being over the top. The location is very convenient to both the Bellagio and Caesars. We did not experience any problems with noise either this visit or any past visits. I enjoyed the decor and the nice eateries. There was live music in the evenings and plenty of restaurant options. We enjoyed eating at Mon Ami Gabi outside watching the fountain show at bellagio and also outstanding people watching. I would definitely stay here again, and again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, tired, worn out rooms”
Reviews.Author: stacyfletcher
Reviews.Content: Experienced Vegas traveler disappointed with the accommodations here. Tired, faded, disrepair all sum up the guest room. Faded and stained carpet. Torn furniture. Broken light fixtures. Bedsheets with little pills and towels with fraying edges. The fun theme and great location make this a desirable choice but the condition of the rooms takes this one off the list for us next time. Check out Bally's right next door for same location and newly renovated rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special at the Paris”
Reviews.Author: Stv50
Reviews.Content: We reserved a king bed weeks in advance, only to be told upon arrival that there was none left! They ended up putting us in a handicap accessible room that had a king. Not exactly what we had in mind. When we reserve a room, we expect to get what we order. or I would have booked the room elsewhere. The room itself was ok for a 4 day stay, but the furnishings were pretty dinged up. We loved the location, right across from the Belaggio and its fountain and easy walking distance to most of the big Casino's. The restaurants in the Paris were really busy and we needed a reservation in order to have dinner at Mon Ami Gabi on our last night there. (Mon Ami Gabi was very nice) We found that overall the Paris is not as big as some of the other Casino's and that we spent a lot of time at New York New York, which had a better selection for food and entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Zoe D
Reviews.Content: My 3 girlfriend and I from the UK stayed her for 3 nights at the end of January 2012. We cannot recommend this hotle enough! The rooms were hugh, each of our rooms having 2 queen beds. The rooms were clean and the bathroom was excellent! The location of this hotel is excellent for all things! If you are doing sightseeing trips all of the pick up points for our trips were only a few steps away which was handy! The only thing lacking in the room were tea/coffee making facilities, however the hotel has a lovely bakery downstairs where these can be bought along with freshly baked breakfast every morning! Yummy!! We found the staff to be very helpful too. We would def stay here again and would recommend staying here on location alone! Please go to this hotel with an open mind as some of the reviews I read before travelling did worry me! Maybe I am just no as picky as other travellers but we really enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Paris! with ooh la la at it's best!”
Reviews.Author: Eric R
Reviews.Content: Paris Las Vegas is where we joined our first Rewards Club! Paris is where we played our first "Wixard of Oz" machine! Paris is enjoyment of the Bistro and the "Singing Waiters" as they serve delicious menus! ( located in the Mall) Paris is a ride to the top and grand view of the Strip from the Eiffel Tower! Beautiful SHOW ROOM and Barry Manilo was terrific! Paris provides gracious rooms, well appointed amenities with a smile! Paris is where we experienced a quick check-in/check-out and a feeling of a European Boutique hotel! With it's emence size, glamour and glitz Paris is still charming and atmospheric and one we will select again and again! Oh by the way, we WON a big pot from the Wizard!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but no free wi-fi!?”
Reviews.Author: KTandP
Reviews.Content: So the Paris hotel is in the middle of the strip opposite the bellagio fountains and it's a great spot. Check in was fine as was check out. Staff very pleasant. But I cannot believe there was no free wi-fi! Every other hotel I have stayed in around the world can do it but not here? Crazy. The room was ok but even as a non smoking floor it still had a tinge of smoke in the room. It felt like it needed a blast of fresh air put thru the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, common areas, service attitude lacking”
Reviews.Author: Walter K
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our first stay at Paris. The room we reserved (6 wks prior) was not available. It would be up to 2 hours and no king bed/no smoking at all. We were offered upgrade at $40 per night, take it or leave it. I wonder if it was to just extract more money. The room we received was average for the price. $14.95 per day for internet access is crazy. The bathroom was nice but had hair and footprint on floor. The location is very good the common areas are very nice but sometimes there are long lines.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Parisian "shops"”
Reviews.Author: mmgm
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Paris for 4 nights. Was very impressed by the "Parisian" feel to it. Similiar to the Venetian with the sky above, it really makes you feel like you are outside walking along sidewalks. We had a Strip View room but opted not for the "red rooms" (we were visiting our son who is in the Air Force and it did not seem appropriate since he would be staying 2 night with us...) Our room was clean, had a great view, and other than not liking the pillows, everything was fine. You can't beat the location, right in the middle of everything. We did ALOT of walking, be prepared!! One of the negatives is being directly across the street rom the Bellagio fountains. Although we had a great spot to watch the show, it is LOUD! Sounded like thunder booming. And no matter what hotel you stay in, Vegas is not for sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property at the center of the action”
Reviews.Author: DanBau
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth time staying at this property. It is centrally located on the Strip and is in walking distance to the other Caesars owned properties (except Rio). The rooms are very big, especially their suites. There are three types of suites and each type offers great views, regular rooms facing the Strip can be noisy with the Bellagio's fountain shows (loud booms can be heard during the show). Service is great, although Housekeeping will call you if your Do Not Disturb sign is up all day to make sure you need the room serviced. Room service is very good and tends to be on the fast side (under 40 minutes). This property is one of the more relaxed casinos, gamer friendly casinos- dealers and supervisors are friendlier than the other CZR properties (except for Ballys- they share dealers with Paris and are just as nice.)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, nice room for money”
Reviews.Author: Moose26
Reviews.Content: This our ninth trip to Las Vegas and second stay at Paris. The location is perfect to walk the strip in both directions. We found our room to be clean and plenty big for the short amount of time you spend in a Las Vegas room. We had a clogged sink, called maintenance and it was fixed by the time we returned to our room. Front desk was very nice and informative. Enjoyed sitting outside at Mon Ami Gabi, enjoying a good meal and watching the Bellagio dancing waters. Also had delicious pastries and coffee from the cafes each morning. If you want a nice room, at a perfect location, with a fair price, I recommend staying at Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful surroundings , bad service”
Reviews.Author: ech_zed
Reviews.Content: Just got home from my first trip to Vegas. I have been looking forward to staying here for 5 months!! We arrived and wow what a sight. That was just the outside, the inside was equally stunning. For appearance i will give it an A++ because you really feel like your in Paris or Europe( which I been several times) and liked where it was on the strip. What we were disappointed about was that we were going for our anniversary and booked a king size bed instead we were given 2 queen beds because that's all they had even though we specified for this. Also because I'm asthmatic I'm sensitive to cigarette smoke, well here its allowed everywhere to smoke this is no protection but your room. We went into all the other hotels and noticed that they somehow are able to contain the smoke smell. Our room was disgusting, after arriving and i wanted to shower after flying, well in the shower was a used band aid sitting on the ledge, we told housekeeping the lady said she wasn't working that day. The next day they just removed the band aid and everything else you could tell was not touched. There was cracker crumbs by the bed the drapes were stained, the bedding had chunky's on it. The room felt gross, I hated being in there. I also was disappointed by the lack of interesting restaurants and that the concierge could care less when asked a question. We will returning to Vegas in June but not here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: rporter8555
Reviews.Content: We were comp'ed three nights through the players club, either for the Rio or Paris, and jumped at the opportunity to stay at the Paris on the strip, not having stayed here before (normally out of our price range). The experience was everything you would expect, considering we requested a room on the strip side of the building, and had a marvelous view of the Eiffel Tower and the Belagio dancing waters right outside our corner room windows. The noise level from the Bellagio fountains was surprising, so I would suggest getting a room on the back of the building if you are wanting to get to sleep before the fountains shut off at midnight (but then who wants to sleep in Vegas? :}> The bed was worn and lumpy, and in need of replacement, as were the pillows. Otherwise the triple sheet duvet was adequate. The mini-bar was not stocked or active but the fridge was still plugged in. The safe in the closet was too small for my laptop but large enough for my wife's Nook tablet. Nice large bathroom was almost the same size and features as the Trump Vegas, which is still our #1 favorite. We had dinner at Mon Ami Gabi which is located in the northwest corner of the casino, and were instantly seated at a barside table, not having reservations for the dining room, and were delighted with the excellent service and wonderful steaks and wine. The other two nights we ate at Buzios at the Rio (awesome jumbo lump crab cakes appetizer) and at Toby Keiths at Harrahs (large portions but disappointing compared to Toby Keiths at Bricktown Oklahoma City since the Las Vegas TK doesn't have the favorite rib-eye or cowboy caviar, oh well...). We had breakfast at the Paris Le Village Buffet which has the best crepes we have found anywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: OneMtnTraveler
Reviews.Content: First off, let me say our stay in a "Red Room" was comped, so we can't comment on the regular room or the price of either. That said, the non-smoking "Red Room" we had was spacious, clean, well furnished, and in excellent condition. Clean carpeting, nice furniture, great flat screen TV, no odors, etc. The king-sized bed/mattress was top notch, as were the sheets, pillows, and top coverings. The bathroom was commensurate with the living area: clean, well appointed, and with plenty of counter space. We were on the 32nd floor and had a long view to the southeast over some other hotels and on to the desert. We weren't looking down onto "The Strip" but we didn't mind because we weren't there to look out the window. The hotel's common main level interior spaces were also very nice, clean, and spacious. The walkways were wide and accommodated what we considered fairly large weekend crowds (more on that later). The casino area was clean and spacious as well. As for "smokiness" in the casino, we didn't notice any...the ventilation must be very good, and the ceilings are very high, so we suppose that helps. We just happened to make our trip (a Friday, Saturday, and Sunday night stay) with three other couples who opted to stay at Bally's, an adjacent sister property (they had to pay for their rooms, and Bally's is somewhat less expensive than Paris). The great thing, for our party of eight, was that Paris and Bally's are connected by an indoor walkway. This made it easy for all of us to meet up in either place, but even without that need the walkway connection makes it easy to move from one property to the other if so desired. The two properties also share the same parking garage and at least some of the same parking garage elevators. We didn't see the rooms in Bally's, so we can't compare them to our room in the Paris. The casino area in Bally's, however, seemed more cramped than Paris's. Now to the crowd I alluded to earlier. As we walked around the main floor common area of the Paris where most of the eating areas are located, we noticed pretty long lines in almost every such place, from just coffee and pastries to pizza to the buffet, no matter the time of day or night. We (all eight of our party) got in a rather short line outside the Le Village Buffet on Saturday about 6:00 p.m. and waited about an hour and 45 minutes before we were seated. Do not be fooled by what appears to be a rather short line outside...there is another line inside three or four times as long. Moving on regarding Le Village Buffet, the food was plentiful and as varied as just about any buffet in Vegas (we've been to Vegas before and visited several buffets), but it doesn't come close to the quality or ambience offered at the Bellagio (pretty much across the street...a short walk) that was just $1.00 more at the time of our visit (about $30 per person at either place). However, we weren't there for the food, either. We were there to gamble and our biggest complaint was the 1.75 hours spent in line that we could have spent at the craps tables! BTW, if you've never been to Vegas, staying and eating on "The Strip" in one of the newer properties will cost much more than staying and eating at most outlying properties. Don't expect to pay anything less than $10 for a cup of coffee and a pastry in an eatery within one of the newer "Strip" joints (no pun intended). As for gaming, we can best attest to the craps tables. The Paris has six craps tables and on the Friday and Saturday afternoons and nights we played the action was good, meaning at least four or five of the tables had 6-10 players. Unlike some casinos, the table personnel moved the game along at a good pace (there's nothing worse than a slow bunch working a table) and the drink gals came around fairly often (although not often enough in our opinion, but we're fairly quick drinkers, so next time we'll order two drinks at a time). Overall, we rate the Paris 4 out of 5 stars. Only 4 stars because it's not the highest end of luxury in Vegas and the lines for food are long. Otherwise, it's a fine place to stay that's smack-dab in the middle of "The Strip" - convenient to Bally's, Caesars, the Bellagio, and the monorail that runs north and south between several other properties, if you feel the need to roam. Personally, we never ventured farther than the Paris and Bally's, and to Bally's only because our friends were staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay!!”
Reviews.Author: VIPalltheway
Reviews.Content: First time staying at the Paris in Vegas, and I was impressed! The service was top notch and everyone from the front desk people to the dealers to the cocktail waitresses were super nice. Just walk by a table, any table, and make eye contact with the dealer. They'll greet you with a nice hello. Little touches like that goes a long way to make someone feel welcomed and comfortable. The inside of this hotel is very cool. High ceilings so you're not shy to smoke or be bothered by smokers. There is a walkway that connects this hotel to Bally's. A nice touch that you don't have to go outside to visit another joint. The location is basically right in the middle of the strip, you can't go wrong. If you can get a view of the strip at night, you are directly across from the Bellagio water show. We loved this hotel. It was not the cheapest, but definitely not the most expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, reasonable room for the price. Expect no extras!”
Reviews.Author: medmom2002
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days last week. Their special of $79.00 per night makes it worth staying here. However, no coffee maker, no hot water. One hour wait to get a pot of hot water to take Theraflu ($5.00), or $.70 to get a cup of hot water at their cafe. Check out Mon Ami Gabi, if you have a chance--nice although remote view of the Bellagio fountains from the outside veranda.

Reviews.Title: “Exciting Paris Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: rhphoto
Reviews.Content: Recently got back from the CES show in Vegas. I stayed at the Paris Hotel on the strip. Wow, what a fabulous hotel. Room were spacious, very comfortable beds. TV was not a Flat Screen, for the money you were paying for a room, Flat Panels should be the norm. The Bathroom was huge, STD up shower and a separate Bath Tub. Bathroom counter was so spacious. Fantastic Desk with very comfortable chairs. Rooms are very well lit. The Hotel staff were friendly for the most part, long lines at check in though. NO FREE ANYTHING in VEGAS. I'm sorry, for the price of the room, Internet should be included in the price. AT $15.00 for 24hrs room only (not even hitel wide, that;s another $20.00 on top of) per device, what a rip off!! I know it's Vegas, but really, come on! Restaurants on the premisses were terrific, great food and nice variety. Go to the Buffet Restaurant for Breakfast, better value for your buck, food is fresher and more variety. Casino is a casino, just like any other, except a little more $$ then the average for gambling.

Reviews.Title: “The aging of Paris”
Reviews.Author: bubbafb
Reviews.Content: There was a convention we were attending at the new Cosmopolitan but the rate was real good at Paris so we stayed here. I had stayed several years ago and liked it. The good part about Paris is the location - about as close to the middle of the strip as you can get and real close to the new City Center. However, the hotel is definitely aging. The casino has an old feel to it and was not impressed. Hard Rock and Planet Hollywood are much more fun and Cosmopolitan is much more elegant. The rooms are getting dated with a regular TV and ordinary decor. The room was comfortable and clean, so no complaints there. No complaints on service as staff was friendly. We had drinks at the Le Burger Brasserie during Happy Hour which seemed decent but we did not eat at the hotel. Found good sushi at Ichiban (Bally's), had small plates at Johnny Smalls (Hard Rock), quality Mexican at Diablo's Cantina (Monte Carlo) and a good burger and beer at The Pub (Monte Carlo). While the price and location were good, I probably would not stay again as there are better options on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: SkyeDublin
Reviews.Content: The Paris Hotel is a beautiful hotel in Las Vegas Its theme is Paris. The casino is built around the Eiffel Tower. The reception area is huge at last 6 receptionist and busy from morning to morning. The young man who check us in was efficient but impatient. The bed rooms are very luxurious big bathrooms lots of clean towels and sheets. We booked a continental breakfast the menu read cheese meat bread juice tea or coffee, in reality we had to find a type of take away coffee place where we presented our vouchers and got a fairly inedible breakfast of over cooked breakfast , watery coffee, or weak tea, it was sickening. It bore no resemblence to the breakfast offered and paid for in our booking. The staff were totally disinterested in our complaint. It was disappointing as American breakfasts are a very satisfying experience. The Casino is the important part of all hotels in Vegas. A very unusual holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Great All-Rounder”
Reviews.Author: Nuneatonian
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Feb 2012 with bunch of friends, the location of this hotel (centre strip) is excellent, most places easily accessible on foot or there is monorail and bus stops close by when you want to travel further or take a rest. Check in was smooth and efficient, we all had rooms on 6th floor, they were all of good size with decent decor and facilities (although minibar was not stocked), there was both bath & walk-in shower facilities. We had twin Queen sized beds that were very comfortable and there was plenty of storage space. We made use of many of the amenities in the hotel and found the service to be of a good standard, with all members of staff encountered having a friendly demeanour. We got a great deal on the rooms and would definitely recommend this hotel to use as your base for a stay in Vegas Only negative was that smoking is still allowed in public areas, but that is the case in all hotels in LV.

Reviews.Title: “4 days in Paris (Las Vegas, that is)”
Reviews.Author: Allan S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris for 4 nights in February with a Westjet package.. Our first time in this hotel. The check-in was handled quickly and the room was easy to locate. We liked the ambiance of the hotel, very European. The hotel is located mid-strip, extremely ideal for walking. We got a deluxe room on 5th floor with absolutely no view. In spite of that, the room was large, clean, well appointed, and quiet. We were never in the room except to sleep, so the lack of view was not a big deal. The only restaurant in the hotel we ate at was Cafe de St. Louis for breakfast daily. The food was very good, if a bit pricey. Average bill was about $35 for two. The snack shop was also pricey, but there's a CV Pharmacy across the street that's better. A must do is the trip up the Eiffel Tower. Fantastic view of the entire valley. We should have gone up at night to see the Bellagio fountains in action, but maybe next time. All in all, we really liked the property. We'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just want to get away!”
Reviews.Author: sunvssnow
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at Paris for three nights. We were in our room within 25 mins of picking up our rental car. The valet parking and checking in process was so efficient that we were on the Casino floor before we knew it. The view we had was perfect. The pool was open and the weather was in the mid 60's in Feb. Yes! We did see some guest swimming as soon as the sun hit the water. We were here to enjoy some time away from the midwest weather. The location is dead center on the strip. If you get a chance head over to Cabo Wabo for some cocktails!! The drinks are smooth and carry a good punch.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and worth it.”
Reviews.Author: GIRL A
Reviews.Content: Best view from tower at night to see fountains. The bathroom on lobby floor overhead is funny if you listen to what it says as well as beautiful if a bathroom can be. So beautiful and one problem when we turned a lamp on it blew. Called front desk and maitnance was up to fix it in less then 10 minutes. I was impressed they keep up their property and would go again.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite of the strip hotels!”
Reviews.Author: pcpirate
Reviews.Content: Smaller than most strip casinos but easy to navigate & great location on the strip. Rooms are nice & I recommend upgrading to a parlor room for a little extra space. Craps tables only pay double on field bets (as opposed to triple on 12 at Bellagio) but that is the case at all Caesar properties. Food is above average at all restaurants and it connects to Bally's if you need a change of scenery without venturing outside.

Reviews.Title: “Bonjour- Paris in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: steve4248
Reviews.Content: It has been 20+ years since my wife and I vacationed in Las Vegas and we wanted a hotel which was reasonably priced, central location, and 4 to 5 star. After a lot of research on line we selected the Paris Hotel. It met and exceeded all our criteria. When you enter the hotel the high ceilings are painted as if you are outdoors on a sunday day, nice clouds etc. The stores are designed like you are in a Parisian city as you stroll by you almost forget you are within a building. Restaurants are good and reasonably priced. The pizza place along the promenade offers two very large slices and a drink for $9.99 great when you don't need upscale dinning. Location is directly across from the Bellagio very central. On to the rooms: quite nice and some have been upgraded our was not but is was well worth the money, beds were comfortable and thats our only concern as we didn't spend much time there. They have a large banks of elevators several going to each section of the hotel and we never had to wait which was nice. This is one of the few hotels that doesn't have a daily resort fee and wi fi is free in the coffee shops. Valet parking is also free as are most. For a small fee you can travel up the Elif Tower and enjoy a vast view of Vegas. One think we really liked is there is not a heavy smoke smell anywhere in the hotel, some hotels smell like your in an ashtray. I think because it pretty new the ventilation system is great, being non smokers this was very important to us. The check in process was painless as was check out, we were able to extend out check out time until 2PM without charge and actually it went closer to 3PM with no issues. The gambling was also quite nice many table and lots of slots again almost no smoking. We didn't win much but thats another review. We would recommend this hotel without reservation hope you enjoy your trip and our review helps.

Reviews.Title: “Erietravelers”
Reviews.Author: racefan2360
Reviews.Content: This hotel is spectacular from the outside! You feel so proud to be walking in and staying at this beautiful hotel. However, the room was great but not what I had expected from the other amenities. The staff was courteous and willing to go the extra mile. I had called the laundry dept. to ask for an extra pillow and within 20 minutes they were at the door with not one but two pillows!! This hotel is right in the thick of things and everything worth while is within walking distance. Our favorite every day restaurant, Ellis Island (really cheap and tasty) is one block behind the hotel and out favorite Italian restaurant Battista's (bread basket to die for) is even closer! On the cons side: the food was pricey so we ate out alot, the WIFI is $18.95 a day,the air conditioning was not quite sufficient and no free shuttles to anywhere (including the airport) that we saw anyway. The concierge told us that they would recommend a taxi or limo, however, they told us to tell the taxi driver to stay on the main roads, no highway! We learned that the hard way- our trip to the hotel was $25.00!!!! It is only a 5 minute ride normally! Take heed on that tip! I loved our stay in Vegas and to come back at the end of the night to this beautiful place was magical!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but feeling a bit dated.”
Reviews.Author: EastTexGal
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location of Paris on the strip. Bellagio, Caesar's, Aria, The Cosmopolitan, Planet Hollywood, Bally's, Bill's & the Flamingo are easily walkable even for those of us not in that great of shape. We upgraded to a larger king room to have the extra seating area and the room had been updated with houndstooth carpet and red leather headboard. The bathroom was granite and tile with a separate glass shower and bath. Just outside our room, the rest seems dated. At the end of the hall there are ashtrays right beside the sign that says "this is a non-smoking floor" and several smokers actively ignoring the sign. We were there for a meeting that my husband had, so we didn't really shop for hotels. We did have a Diamond Club card and that was very nice. I can't say enough good things about the check in service or the Diamond Club lounge. We ate in the Italian restaurant in the walkway to Bally's once and twice in the 24 hour sidewalk cafe and both were above average for hotel fare. The fitness center was very out of date with some of the equipment being close to 15-20 years old. We had good service overall, a comfortable room and a good location. Paris just needs to update a few of the central areas to stay on par with the other hotels and they should do it pretty soon.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Paris”
Reviews.Author: Talking_Bob
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights Feb. 17-20 at Paris Las Vegas and here are my impressions: 1. Service was very good and staff were all polite and very efficient. 2. Location is awesome as it is centrally located on the strip with a mall next door. 3. Food at the Mon Ami Gabi was great. 4. For some reason there are no coffee makers in the rooms. Guess they want u to spend $3.50 for a cup downstairs. 5. Casino was nice and again workers were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: len2011
Reviews.Content: The Paris Hotel offers an excellent location and rooms with great views. We stayed in a premier red room which was located on one of the top floors where we had a view of the Bellagio fountains and the strip. The room was nicely decorated and had a safe, large plasma and a refrigerator. The hotel provides a very good continental breakfast and afternoon snacks if you stay in one of their premier red rooms. We dined at the Mon Ami Gabi restaurant which is located right on the strip and is inside the hotel. The food was excellent and the prices reasonable. They also have a very good creperie, sports bar and a cigar lounge. The hotel is within walking distance of Caesar's Palace, Ballys and several other casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SmartieBristol
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Paris hotel for 4 nights with mixed group. Hotel has a great location on the strip, opposite the Bellagio. Hotel check in was quick (even though some confusion over names). Had a really nice room, 2 queen size beds, nice large bathroom. Rooms cleaned everyday. Can't complain about the rooms, were good, especially for the little time you actually stay in there. Rest of the hotel was nice. All the staff were very friendly from cleaners, bar tenders, casino staff to porters. Used the coffee shop for takeaway caffine to keep going, had a nice selection of cakes if you could fit one in! Only ate in the restaurant once - meal was fine. Nothing fancy, had to queue for about 30 mins to get in but it was Valentine's Day and we hadn't made any reservations so can't grumble at that. All the ladies got a rose which was a nice touch. Trip up the Eiffel Tower was worthwhile - fabulous views - and the staff up there very knowledgable and told us some very interesting facts. Very happy with our stay and I would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “PARIS IN NEVADA”
Reviews.Author: Mike A
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Las Vegas many times but this was our first at Paris.The room(Red Room Premier) was excellent with a view of the strip and the Bellagio water show.The angle of the room also allowed excellent views of the Cosmopolitan and surrounding areas.The location of this property was superb! Lunch at the bistro on the patio was amazing.The quiche lorraine was second to none.We also purchased the buffet pass for 24 hrs. and it was a great value.We never did try any of Harrahs other properties that shared the buffet pass as the food at Paris was great!

Reviews.Title: “We Loved It”
Reviews.Author: retiredUtah
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderful two day stay at the Paris. We were in Las Vegas to celebrate our 33 years together. We wanted to see Elton John on Valentine's Day, and our good friends treated us to a two night stay at the Paris. When we arrived we found the check-in to be very fast and friendly . We were given a La Mans Suite on the 23rd floor overlooking the Strip. It was a very nice room with a magnificant view! We dined at the Cafe (breakfast), bought sandwiches and pizza on the casino floor from the food court (pizza and sandwiches were so good)! The casino was small and friendly. Drinks were a little expensive (that's Las Vegas), but free if you are gambling. It was a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Shame on you!”
Reviews.Author: packermanMilwaukee
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I wanted to experience the view at the restaurant at the Eiffel tower. We were turned away because he would not remove his hat! Now mind you we are in our 50's. He has a serious medical condition and has lost all the hair on his body! He is completely bald, and not by choice. He has no eyebrows,eyelashes,facial hair etc. He is by the very least self-conscious of this medical condition and the only he can do to camouflage this is by wearing a simple baseball cap. We were denied axcess to take in the beautiful view of the Eifel tower that everybody raves about!!! Would it really have been that serious to have let him keep his dignity by wearing that cap?? Shame on you. No customer service or compassion at this place!

Reviews.Title: “Back to Paris Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: partroy27
Reviews.Content: It's been a few years since we last stayed at Paris Las Vegas, but the ambiance is the same and of course the friendly helpful staff is ever present. Check in was very smooth and all the staff were very friendly and helpful from the reception desk, to the casino staff. We stayed in the Red rooms which are very pleasant. We ordered room service a couple of times and it was fast and the food was good (although a little pricey). The valet was quick and efficient most days we did run into one night where the cars were backed up and it took a while to get our car. Overall our stay was very pleasant and I would highly recommend the Paris for its location, service and ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel, bargain price if you try!”
Reviews.Author: Margyg
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Paris recently and found it to be ideal in terms of location - and a little more "fun" in terms of theme than some of its affiliates (Harrahs, Bally etc). We had a standard room - still had 2 queen beds (view of building next door - whatever - you're not in the room that much!) and nicely turned out. We paid $48 per night for the first two nights then $80. Note that I looked at this hotel some weeks before I booked and the price for the same room was around $130 - so it pays to hold out, particularly if you're travelling mid-week and there are no conventions in town. They offered us an upgrade to an Eiffel Tower view room for an extra $55 per night - more than the room is costing, so no chance that was happening! One thing to watch for - no resort fees is great, but $15 per DEVICE per day to connect to the internet is steep. I am not paying $15 to connect my Kindle to download a $0.99c book!! Mid-strip location is, as I said, fabulous - Bellagio fountains right outside the door, and head left or right into the Vegas madness!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Wardy09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris for 2 nights in a room overlooking the Strip. It was a beautiful room- very spacious, clean, comfortable, gorgeous big bathroom and a magic view of the Eiffel Tower and the Bellagio Fountains. The fountains go off every hour and the view is spectacular. They stop at about 11 pm so noise is not an issue. The location is great because you are right in the middle of the strip. The foyer is lovely and check in and out was quick. All the staff we came in contact with were delightful! The streetscape of the dining area was gorgeous. I thought the price of $140 was very good considering it was a beautiful room in a gorgeous 5 star hotel in a great location. It was not an outdated room. Would definately stay here again! Paris is a beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average Room, Reasonable Rates”
Reviews.Author: CaribbeanGem39
Reviews.Content: Excellent location on the strip! Right outside is a bus stop, and rooms are oversized. Bathroom is nicely appointed as well as oversized. Bed is a bit hard, but try to get in one of the front towers, because the view is breathtaking!

Reviews.Title: “I the heart of the Las Vegas strip”
Reviews.Author: zilerog
Reviews.Content: The Paris Hotel is right in the heart of the action, all the major hotels and casino's are within walking distance, so is the monorail that will take you to the more areas of the strip. we were there for 5 days and had a great time. the restaraunts are great but the buffet is fabulous, they offer a $45 special for 24 hrs where you can eat breakfast, lunch dinner and snack until you drop. Great deal. As with all hotels and casinos there is smoking everywhere, we asked for a non smoking room and they gave us a room on a non smoking floor, great. As for the casino the ventilation was very good, the only time I had probelms was when someone sat next to me and started to smoke, I am an exsmoker but what can you do, yes i got up and left. I the standard room there was no coffee maker so you had to go down to the coffee shop and pay $3.50 for a coffee or tea. you also have to be carefull of the refrigators as soon as you lift something out, even to look at it and put it back, they charge you room for the cost of that item so be careful. There is a Wallgreens about 1 block south where you can buy all the snacks and drinks you need at a fraction of the cost. There is all kinds of entertainment available in all the hotels but the best entertainment is out on the streets and small outdoor mall where live musicians are playing all day and all night, these peopl really earn their keep. Would I go back to the Paris Hotel.........YES Must sightseeing trips are the Hover Dam and the Valley of Fire that is about 45mins north on I15(exit 75), both are easy 4-5 hour trips.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it here”
Reviews.Author: InnkeeperAllAround
Reviews.Content: Our latest stay in Las Vegas, at the Paris hotel, was very enjoyable. The biggest pros - no resort fees, great location, and good dining options. People have complained about the rooms being outdated, but we thought they were clean, nice, and in keeping with the European theme. We had no line at check-in - that never happens in Las Vegas - and were very happy with all the varied food options onsite, with two exceptional servers. I do wish that I could find really good coffee in some of these Las Vegas cafes - but the Paris is better than the Flamingo.

Reviews.Title: “Just a regular hotel, nothing fantastic”
Reviews.Author: bighead33
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the Super Bowl weekend, the hotel areas are ok, but the rooms need to be remodeled RUSH. Check in was fast and all employees were very courtious. One good thing is that it does not feel as "huge" as other resorts, it does not take you 20minutes to go from the entrance to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Paris is Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jacj2020
Reviews.Content: Pleasant room (Luxury red). Ample bath - seperate bath and shower, only one sink. Most comfortable bed I can ever remember !! Two wonderful night's sleep!! Be prepared to use express ck-out. Line was very long!!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings- Not a Special Experience”
Reviews.Author: travelfoodie1018
Reviews.Content: I really have mixed feelings about Paris Las Vegas. I really want to LOVE it, but for several reasons I don't. The Hubs and I stayed here over Valentine's Day in order to celebrate 10 years together. Since it was a special occasion I had really high hopes we would receive great service, but alas this wasn't the case. During the booking process, the service was excellent. We were given a good rate and told that there would be a note on our reservation indicating our anniversary, so we should expect good service. Upon our arrival I had high hopes for getting a good room and we were told that the room we were assigned was really nice with a view, but it wasn't ready. We were fine with that because we wanted a nice room for our celebration - we were told to come back in two hours and our room would be cleaned by then (he said he put a rush request). Well after 3 hours walking the strip and coming back at 4 for our room, it wasn't ready. I was getting upset and clearly just wanted to plop down in a room for awhile, so the guy gave us another room with a view that was available. He said it was in a good location not near an elevator. Lies- it was the first door after a suite right near the elevators! The room was ok - not the red room we booked, but it had a great view of the fountains and Eiffel tower. Unfortunately, we were next to a suite, which was really noisy. We were really upset and asked to move rooms the next day. The person we spoke to was rude and offered us a new room, but no apology for the nose of sewage smell in the bathroom. The second room we got was a red room. It was similar and also had a good view but a smaller window. All in all, I like the location of Paris and the style inside. We really liked Mon Ami Gabi and going to the top of the Eiffel Tower. All in all, not a bad stay, but surely not the amazing stay I hoped for.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and mostly quiet”
Reviews.Author: viral_smile
Reviews.Content: We got his room for February for about $50 a night, so keep that in mind for my review. First of all, what everyone says is true - the casino is smoky smelling and that's your first impression when you walk in, but to be fair you eventually forget about it and the smell does not extend beyond the casino floor. We checked in early at 12:30 with two queens. We could have had a king if we waited till 3, but after a long flight we didn't care about the bed count. The room did look somewhat dated, but was clean. I was scared of getting a room with that royal blue carpet, but ours was a calm sagey green. Yes, there was a tube TV, but we watched it maybe 2 hours our entire stay. (Who CARES about the TV, people? It's Las Vegas. Go outside.) The separate bathtub was a nice touch, and there was a small fridge that was cool, not cold. I hated the lighting in the bathroom, as there were CF bulbs that made my makeup look crummy. But the extending makeup mirror on the wall was a nice touch. The location was outstanding. We bounced back and forth to Bally's, went to the Miracle Mile Mall's ABC store for cheap liquor and bottled water , watched the Bellagio fountains, and visited Caesars and The Cosmopolitan as well. The clientele was mostly over 35, but there were a few party kids who woke us up screaming "Happy Birthday" in the hall at 2 a.m. Saturday night. But Saturday night was absolutely crazy up and down the street of strip. The rest of the nights were quiet in the hotel. The casino was pretty quiet as the oldsters slowly lost their pensions to slots and video poker. Not a whole lot of young faces around, compared to the newer hotel/casinos. The cobblestone streets and shops were cute, but everything was way overpriced, and the gifts needed more variety. We had a pastry from the shop and it was really good, as was the coffee. Did the buffet for breakfast and that was decent. The staff were very friendly and helpful; we were definitely pleased with the service from the bell desk to the car rental counter. There was nothing spectacular but nothing that angered me either. In short, I'd recommend this hotel to somebody 35 or over who wants a good, quieter middle-grade hotel that's not a dump, and is convenient to the best of the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Gayle S
Reviews.Content: The hotel employees were great. Easy check in and out. Room very clean. Loved the little Paris street effect inside the hotel. Very close to other big hotels, trams, etc. Very happy with the stay. Would recommend to others in a minute !

Reviews.Title: “The good and not so good”
Reviews.Author: DMR
Reviews.Content: I will say that this hotel is a good deal if you can catch a cheap internet rate as the location alone is worth a shot to stay here. It is across from Bellagio so you have a view of the fountain show, plus short walk next door to Ballys. Also short walk to Ceasars Palace. Having said that, I would shop around as the strip is full of great hotels that can beat this one. I have stayed at almost all the top Vegas resorts but this one rates mid to lower end. The room and bathroom was quite large, although we had a room at the end of the hall that followed with a "P". Not sure if this was an upgrade, but the view was nice and it had an entry hall and perhaps bigger square footage than most rooms. It was odd that the room had a host type refrigerator that usually stores items to purchase, yet ours was empty? Maybe they don't stock them anymore as some people touch or lift items then complain about being charged for them. At least you can use the refrigerator for your own food or drink items. The room itself was clean, although the large marble bathroom had some age with issues around the shower stall. The elevators were very quick when called. Two issues that were really annoying. First, the cleaning staff does not make it a priority to collect room service trays and rolling tables from the hall area. Each day you could see items left out all day and night without being taken away. The second issue was internet. Paris Hotel prides itself on being free of resort fees, yet charge $14.00 each day for in room internet. We opted to pay extra to use our laptop, which turned out to be a waste of time. Signal strength was so poor at we were unable to use it much at all. I complained to front desk about this problem and they did refund the cost since it turned out to be useless. Paris is ok if you go with low expectations...

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and cheap”
Reviews.Author: Christy55555
Reviews.Content: I was excited to stay at the Paris Hotel in Las Vegas when I visited for a conference and was so disappointed! My first experience was with the hair that greeted me when I turned down the covers of my bed. There were several other experiences with a lack of cleanliness including something stuck to the wall next to the toilet that I tried not to identify. There was a mini bar fridge which had nothing in it, and which also had a sign that said I was not allowed to store anything in there either. What? This is a major conference center which did not offer free wi-fi. $20 per day or something like that. Terrible! The staff was very friendly which is the only reason I give two stars.

Reviews.Title: “Would Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Rita C
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our Feb 7-10, 2012 stay immensely. Wonderful ambiance throughout. Luxury room was clean, comfortable and the view of both the pool and the strip was surreal. Village Buffet was outstanding as was Le Cafe, food was excellent so was the service. Everyone on staff was very friendly and we would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “beware of rip offs”
Reviews.Author: floridarhyl
Reviews.Content: we were offered upgrades at adecent price only to find rooms small but nice on complaning about this we reverted to the basic room which was twice as big not quite as nicely decorated but ok also bigger bathrooms same bath and showers but otherwise hotel ok i stayed at planet hollywood next door in may last year and that was better

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Sulty1814
Reviews.Content: I go to Vegas every year, and stay at a different hotel each time. 2011 was Paris since they comped my entire stay. The casino is a little small but it has a nice atmosphere. It's connected to Bally's so there is a lot of foot traffic next to the elevators to the rooms. There is little to choose from in the way of food, I tried the crepes, they were expensive and just okay. I spent a lot of time outside the open club people watching and the drink service was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WhereInTheWorldNext
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris hotel for 4 nights in February. The decor was beautiful and the hotel/casino were easily navigated (unlike some hotel/casinos). The hotel staff were very friendly and accomodating. The rooms were typical of any newer Las Vegas hotel. We stayed in a cheaper room (to save money) and the only thing cheaper about the room was the tube TV and the view. if we had paid for an upgrade our room would have had a view of the strip and a flat screen TV. Since we wanted to see the sights rather than stay in our room the less modern ammenity of a tube TV wasn't an issue - although it does appear to be for some. The Paris is in a great location - right about middle of the strip. Right across the street is the Belagio so we had easy access to watch the fountains. The Miracle Mile shops are also just the block over. We did have some "take-out" food from the Belagio. The pizza was delicious (even though it was just a little bit over priced - it is Las Vegas afterall) as well as the keish avaialbe in the bakery near the elevators to the rooms. I have nothing negatice to say about our stay - hope you enjoy yours.

Reviews.Title: “Paris was nice but not as nice as I expected”
Reviews.Author: trustee1
Reviews.Content: Front Staff was okay, housekeeping was GREAT did require maintance twice while there, plumbing problems in future will probably stay elsewhere. LOve Le Crepe was there for special Anniversary

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad for the Price”
Reviews.Author: BigSarge99
Reviews.Content: If you don't care what your room is like then the Paris is ok. Not the best but an average room, had very old TV and had better bedding in the Army. The jewel of this place is the location! Can't bet the central close to the monorail location of this one.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: fabulous990
Reviews.Content: My first time staying on the strip for our conference and it was definitely worth it. Rooms are clean, if u get a room with a strip view expect it to be loud. The bellagio fountain goes off every 15 min and the sound of the air compressors pushing out water is loud. So is the Chateau club when it's nice enough outside to be open. All I heard was techo one night when trying to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Best place I've stayed at yet in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: MichaelJBeggs
Reviews.Content: This place is great. It's centrally located on the Strip which is awesome. I stayed in one of the Red Rooms, which are gorgeous. The only downside is that the rooms are not well insulated so I could could hear the Bellagio fountains going off every 15 minutes. The casino and restaurants were great as well. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: daphne210
Reviews.Content: Mid-week rates were less than $60 a night so I can't complain too much about this stay overall. Check in and hotel services did nothing overly welcome. The room was big, clean but in need of fresh wallpaper and carpeting. Free WiFi is only available in one cafe. Surprised to see that casino workers, dealers and servers were so conservatively dressed, not what I would expect from a Vegas trip. The room on the top floor, 33, was quiet with great hot water and pressure. Be sure to bring your own shampoo and conditioner. The location is good, close to Bellagio, Ballys, Planet Hollywood so a stroll on the strip offers plenty of options for cheaper food and entertainment. After touring the comparably priced hotels, next time I would stay at the NY NY, the food is cheaper and offers more options.

Reviews.Title: “Great value.”
Reviews.Author: ThanksSocialSecurity
Reviews.Content: Well this hotel has definitely seen better days. And yet it's still clean and centrally located. We got a great value for our 3 days stay so the rating reflects that price point. It's not worth $200 a night. But for the $60 a night we paid it cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Value”
Reviews.Author: Moosie57
Reviews.Content: We could not believe it when our friends booked us a room for £47 a night at this superb hotel. The room was huge and high up, which is good. We had a great stay as it was quiet, clean and faultless.

Reviews.Title: “Like Disneyland for adults”
Reviews.Author: M S
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for two nights and had a blast in the casino and restaurants. We didn't leave the hotel except to go next door to the mall. Our room was so-so, but overall we loved the place. Very fun, middle class crowd. I was annoyed that they seemed to nickle and dime us, however. When I asked room service for silverware when a restaurant forget to give it to me, they rudely said they were going to charge $5 for it.

Reviews.Title: “Experience Paris in Vegas, Eifle tower and all”
Reviews.Author: Nancy H
Reviews.Content: My stay at The Paris Hotel in Las Vegas was to celebrate my 40th anniversary. My husband always said he was taking me to Paris one day. With the replica of the Eifle Tower in the casino, the shops that make you think you are strolling a Paris street, the delicious crepes, and best of all eating in the Eifle Tower overlooking the Bellagio fountains, the entire experience was romantic and lots of fun. This hotel is in a great location along the Las Vegas Boulevard, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!!!”
Reviews.Author: Anya80
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful Hotel. Right acress fromt he Bellagio. Great views and restaurants. In the middle of the strip. Great service, great pool. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not what i expected”
Reviews.Author: Joseant55
Reviews.Content: I stayed the first days in a standard room and i was very dissapointed . The tv is not flat ( where do they use that anymore ?. The bed was uncomfortable. For the last days of my trip i requested an upgrade to a red room that was a really good room. The casino and lobby are really good . I would stay again in this hotel but they really have to work on their standard rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Basic rooms unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: G H
Reviews.Content: This was the last leg of our tbig holiday with friends. The hotel rooms were basic we booked rooms with a view but when we arrived were told they did not gaurantee rooms but could upgrade for $50.00. On our last night we had to print our boarding passes and the machine in the lobby was not working properly so we lost $10.00 the hotel staff very very reluctantly printed our tickets but it took them 45 mins and they printed the wrong information. We had an argument with the clerk for 15 mins who would not refund our lost dollars or reprint the tickets correctly let us use their computer or let us speak to the manager in the end he was very rude and said " we are done I have done what the hotel are prepared to do and walked away, there was no one else in the queue and this was 11.30pm . This was a shame as we had booked the restaurant for my birthday on the saturday and even telling him we would cancel if we got no satisfaction he still walked away., very poor un professional service.. on the plus side the beds were comfortable and the location was very good

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: cindyfromphoenix
Reviews.Content: We had a reservation at Paris because we were attending a conference there. I had reserved a non-smoking, king size bed room. At check in we were told that there were not any king size beds available. The clerk then told us they don't guarantee the room requests, "no one does in Las Vegas, those rooms are saved for the gamblers. If you want a king size bed, we have one for $50 a night more". We told her we were disappointed and this was our first time at the hotel. Then we asked to speak to a supervisor. We had to wait ten minutes to speak to someone who could care less about making us happy. He again offered us a higher priced room. Finally frustrated with the situation, we took the room. It was obvious that the rooms they blocked out for the meeting were very old and dated. The bed(s) were as hard as a rock. No extra blankets or pillows. The tv was old and "tinny" sounding. Needless to say we were very disappointed with our stay at Paris. The only thing going for it was a convenient location to much nicer properties.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, elegant, convenient”
Reviews.Author: DivaOn-a-Dime
Reviews.Content: Had king size room. Beautiful bathroom. Not the greatest view but who cares. Lots of convenient shops and restaurants on the main level. Great for take out meals vs paying for room service. Beautiful spa and pool. Great price. The local bus and taxis were available right outside the main door. All other major hotels and casinos were a 2-15 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Oui! Oui!”
Reviews.Author: CathyRSeattle
Reviews.Content: The Paris theme is very entertaining -- complete with "le" in front of every sign in the lobby! But the rooms were clean and decent, and a great price for the location. Front desk staff was super accommodating. Charging $9.99/day for access to their wi-fi was annoying, tho.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: merv39
Reviews.Content: In the middle so it's easy to go left or right when you exit! Clean, friendly, no resort fee and the casino is pretty easy to get around. Also, the air seems cleaner than at other casino's. Rooms nice and clean, we had a corner unit on 26th floor over looking some of the Ballagio and it was a "red room" lol. One downfall, air circulation in the middle of the night seemed to fluctuate. Could have been because it was hot during the day and cold at night but it was weird; I didn't complain, could have been fixed I'm sure. We'll stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great views, great service, great ambiance”
Reviews.Author: jamey s
Reviews.Content: I travel to Las Vegas frequently, and have noticed over the past few years a general decline in the Caesar's Entertainment properties. This was certainly not the case at Paris!!! Everything was as great as it has ever been. From the front desk to housekeeping everyone was courteous, prompt and efficient. On the casino floor the dealers were friendly and entertaining as they took our money. The restaurants were not exceptional, except for Provencal where we had a wonderful meal that wasn't too, too pricey. I suggest that if you have a choice of properties on the strip, you definitely choose Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Basic. A place to sleep in. Plus points for the location.”
Reviews.Author: jronline
Reviews.Content: Got a 20% off deal from Vegas.com and booked this hotel because it was also the pick up place for Tom Dziadek's Red Rocks Canyon tour. Nothing much to say about this hotel... Some observations: 1. Always a long line in the check-in/check-out counter (prepare to wait for about 15 minutes for your turn) 2. No guest services counter 3. Requested for a king bed but gave me a 2-queen BR with horrible view (parking lot). They said they can transfer me to a room with a king bed and view of the strip for an additional $50 per night! 4. Fitness center access for an additional $25!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect...exactly as described”
Reviews.Author: twinspirit
Reviews.Content: Straight up, we had read lots about cutbacks and the economy hitting hard, meaning not much in the way of comps happening at the Paris. So, instead of booking a cheap, unrenovated room with hopes of comp upgrade, we booked exactly what we wanted. And that's exactly what we got. No disappointments. We booked a smoking premium room facing the strip with view of fountains, pool, and tower. The room was a nice size, large bathroom with shower and tub separate, large flat screen tv, couch, large wardrobe space, free in room safe and coffee maker. Average room rate was about $150, some nights being a little less. It's really about your perspective of what you call value. Sure, you can find rooms $31 a night, but will you have hot water or 'guests' in your bed? I prefer comfort ;) the check in staff were great and got us in early as requested, about 10 am. Later in the afternoon, we went to the casino lounge where we were greeted by Noam the bartender and a local couple. We had a blast! The hotel and casino is a nice size, not a huge city you feel lost in. Easy to navigate around. Connects nicely to Ballys and their casino (indoors) with some restaurants, the best buffet in Vegas, and shops along the way. Miracle Mile and Planet Hollywood next door, Bellagio across the street. Central strip location, but not overly crazy with night time activity...that's a bit further down (up?) by Flamigo and TI. Sugar Factory at Paris is pretty cool and not outrageous for $$. We each had a burger/sandwich meal, portions are huge, for about $16 a piece. We were comped a pop rocks martini :) Everyone at Paris were friendly, helpful and welcoming. There is an Internet plug connection in the room and wifi available for a reasonable fee, but front desk guy suggested we just go to the free Internet room on main floor and check email once or twice a day and be done with it ;) No resort fees is a huge bonus. This was our first trip to Vegas and are currently planning a June and September weekend. And booking the Paris :) FYI the Paris told us that yes, about half the rooms are still dated, but the economy is starting to turn again and they will be resuming updating the rest of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Baby”
Reviews.Author: cubakid
Reviews.Content: We just came back from vegas staying at the Paris.. Dec 19 to Dec 23.. Rooms are ok we stayed in a standard room, they were clean everyday and the hotel staff is very good.. You can't beat the location it was a little quite in Dec but that was good.. very good casino and lots of choice's for food.. We would go back again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Julia_Bloom
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel and great service. The casino staff was extremely friendly. I always felt really secure. The small lounge inside the hotel was really fun. The singer was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Bluegoose13
Reviews.Content: This was the 3rd time staying at Paris and although we still enjoyed the stay, the hotel has lost a bit of its luster. Our room was a bit beat up with the curtains not secure on the rods and one of the rods off and just leaning against the wall.The cabinets look worn and much abused at least in this particular room. I will say though the bed was wonderfully comfortable and although on the 29th floor the hot water for showers in the morning flowed immediately!! A great plus! And having a coffepot pot in the room for the first cup of the day is also a good thing, one use to have to go to the lobby for coffee. Would we stay again, probably not although the location is perfect and good room rates are available but even for a good rate I was disappointed this time. The hotel looked tired!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: tammy75
Reviews.Content: Paris was the perfect location for a first trip to Vegas. Being in the center of the strip is was easy walking distance to both ends of the strip and almost every we needed to go. We asked for a fountain view room but the only ones available were the concierage lounge rooms so we passed on them. We had a standard room facing MGM which was fine, as we were only in the room to sleep. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable and the shower was great. It looks like they have heard the comments about the lobbies and rooms starting to look worn, as our last two days there were painters in the halls on our floor and in the lobby that leads to Bally's. We only ate at Sugar our last morning but the food was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay...Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Abrind
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location of Paris Las Vegas! I was very impressed by the cleanliness of the hotel and room although the room did have signs of wear and tear. For example torn wallpaper, missing woodwork, etc. However, these are all cosmetic things. The room was very large and clean with a large bathroom with great water pressure even on the 21st floor. Beds were comfortable. The staff was very friendly and we had an amazing strip view which we were provided with upon request. All employees were very friendly and accommodating. We loved the breakfast buffet, the selection was very large and the food was of good quality. The only minor snag with our stay were the long lines for check in and although we chose express check out, we received a receipt almost week following check out.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere, service and position on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Hamels
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. The only thing was that we got in late and took a shuttle bus from the airport and shuttles aren't allowed to drop you off at the front doors! So we missed the grand entrance at the front of the hotel. This place is beautiful and grand in the front. We got dropped off at the side entrance and then were not told where to go so we were hauling around our suitcases in the casino not sure where the lobby was. Not a biggy but I will not take a shuttle again to avoid this. If I'm paying to go to Vegas I want to feel special and be taken to the front doors. I hope they somehow fix this. I will definately stay here again though!

Reviews.Title: “Eh, was ok”
Reviews.Author: Harry C
Reviews.Content: The lobby and casino are nice but the rooms are sub par. The staff were also very nice. Food I the restaurant was good.

Reviews.Title: “Still a nice hotel, but not aging terribly well”
Reviews.Author: LewNY
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Paris when it first opened more than a dozen years ago. At that time I felt it was opulent, luxurious, and even a bit exotic. Since then, maybe because the competition has stiffened, I just feel the hotel hasn't aged as well as, say, the Bellagio. Rooms feel a bit dated, and some old nice touches, for example, the metal soap boxes, are now gone. I certainly don't feel the opulence any more. It will give you a comfortable stay, but if you want glam and glitz, then it might not be a super choice.

Reviews.Title: “Paris delight, but Sugar Factory is a fright.”
Reviews.Author: KyleFarnsworth
Reviews.Content: Comfortable room, very clean, spacious with nice view of the Arc de Triumph. Super size bath too. Great lighting options, including low voltage that turn on when you open the armoire doors. Friendly and helpful staff and other happy guests do confirm they still treat the public very well here. Asked for and received a no smoking room at the rate promised. Easy check-in (they let me check in early too). Quick check out too and always friendly. Sad to see their fountain (a copy of the fountain from the Place de la Concorde) was replaced by the ugly "Sugar Factory" - this also hides much of the front of the Opera Garnier that was so beautiful until they vandalized it with the "Sugar Factory".

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: CPJanuary
Reviews.Content: I, my wife with my three kids stayed in the Paris in January and we loved every minute of it! The is in front of the Bellagio Water Fountain and it's so exciting. The hotel is in the middle of the strip and I have been impressed with rooms and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Amour de l'hotel et le casino de Paris (Love the Paris Hotel and Casino)”
Reviews.Author: irishqueenohio
Reviews.Content: Amour, Amour, Loved our experience at the Paris. It was my 50th Birthday and my sister's 53th birthday celebration/mini vacation. We had Luxury rooms reserved through our Harrahs Total Awards. When we arrived at around 11:30pm, we were greeted by Brian at hotel reservation. He was taking care of the platinum members registration, but since there was not a line he waved us over. I asked Brian if there was any way that we could have a room that had a view to the strip, which would be overlooking the Eiffel Tower and the Bellagio Fountains, and inquired as to whether they had coffee makers in the rooms. He said maybe. We had requested ajoining rooms with my mother and younger sister. He said this is what we can do......he had two "RED ROOMS" available but they are not ajoining. These are their new rooms which have coffee makers, 42 inch flat screen TV and that they would do this upgrade at no charge. Plus our rooms would look directly over the strip. Wow birthday wishes do come true.....I had hoped that for our birthdays we could look out our window and watch the Bellagio fountains. THANK YOU BRIAN FOR OUR BIRTHDAY PRESENT!!! Our rooms were beautifully decorated in reds, rich browns and down comforter spreads and beautiful bathroom amenities. The entire staff at the Paris were outstanding, friendly, informed and helpful. We ate at the Moni Am Gabi....awesome food. We had breakfast there and my quiche there literally melted in your mouth and the wait staff exceptional. Now on not such a good note, the Cafe du Parc which is a cafeteria style quick grab and go place...Well poorly laid out and designed it took over 45 minutes to get a bag of chips, a soda and a ham and cheese sandwich and it definitely was not worth the wait and confusion. (This was however, the only bad experience we had on our 5 day stay) The decor of the hotel and the recreation of the Paris streets are done beautifully. The location of the Paris on the strip is just an added benefit you are in walking distance of all the major casinos. Thank you Paris for allowing the creation of great memories of my 50th birthday. L'AMOUR DE PARIS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Four perfect nights”
Reviews.Author: ringerb
Reviews.Content: There was no lineup when we checked in and we were able to get an upgrade to a Red Room on the 29th floor overlooking the Bellagio fountains. The elevators were extremely fast and always available. The room was clean and well appointed. A single cup coffee maker was in the room but bring your own brew because their's wasn't that good. Very quiet room, excellent mattress, nice love seat at window for viewing the fountain shows. The location of Paris is very desirable. The Miracle Mile Shops next door have everything you need. We took advantage of the location to dine at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant, Mon Ami Gabi and Le Burger Brasserie, all of which were great.Duelling pianos at Napoleon's Lounge was okay.

Reviews.Title: “A tale of two experiences...”
Reviews.Author: eric f
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Paris twice now and have 2 different experiences. The first time, my parents were guests of Harrah and got us a room. Little did I know that we were upgraded to a suite (Jr suite, I think). This room was very nice. The next time we came back, we had a free stay voucher given to us as a present. What a big difference. This was the normal room. First off, we had reserved a room with a king bed, when we arrived, there were no king beds available. I asked what was the point of having a reservation then? The clerk replied that it was because of our "late check-in." It was 8 pm. Anyway, the bedding was obviously old, and really, all that needs to be said is and will illustrate the type of room it is...it was an old, non-flat screen TV. Seriously? Even La Quinta has flat screens in all their rooms. Anyway, the staff was hit and miss. Some really knew what they were tlaking about and others acted like it was their first day. I agree with whoever it was that said the food selection isnt that great here. Although, I will say, the crepes are pretty good. If you have time, check out the dueling piano bar. Very entertaining. So, I guess my recommendation would be...it depends on if youre getting a good deal or not. If it is a good price, then stay here, but we looked at adding a day (Sunday) to our gift stay and it was a little over $200 a night. We stayed at the 5 star Palazzo for less. And yes, Palazzo is my favorite...now that is a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel/casino”
Reviews.Author: sigs99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris for 3 nights in the Le Mans Suite. The room was way above average. We had more room than we knew what to do with. It was very clean with very little noise from the hallway. The jet tub was awesome plus they give you some great bath salts. The view was just stunning. There is not one thing that I can say bad about the room. The staff at the hotel was far above average. They were always friendly and helpful. The entire time that we were there we never had bad service. The casino had more of an upscale crowd. I like the more low key casinos when I gamble. This is not a negative mark against the casino it is that I just like the older more laid back casinos. I would recommend the Paris to you and to my own family and friends. I was very happy with our stay. Thanks Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Paris”
Reviews.Author: adulttraveler
Reviews.Content: It had been a while since I stayed at Paris, but I received a promotional room rate that was too good to pass up. We went to Las Vegas to celebrate my S.O.'s birthday, so the timing of the offer was perfect. We were upgraded to a room with a view of the Bellagio fountains and the room was ready when we arrived. The decor was a little outdated, but since we didn't spend a lot of time in the room, we didn't really care.
