The bed was comfortable, we had plenty of nice big towels, and the housekeeping service kept the room very clean. We stayed up till the wee hours of the morning, so we never made it to the breakfast buffet, but we did stop in the bakery for pastries when we got up. Very good pastries!!! For the birthday dinner, we made reservations at Mon Ami Gabi. The food and service were excellent. My only complaint was that my steak wasn't cooked enough, but when I sent it back, they cooked it properly. We had wanted to order dessert, but I couldn't manage it after dinner. During general conversation with our waiter, my S.O. mentioned that it was his birthday. After we finished our dinner, our waiter gave him a free birthday dessert, which I thought was very nice. If you plan to eat at Mon Ami Gabi, I recommend making reservations--when we came out after our meal, there were about 50 people or more waiting to be seated. We also had a late night snack one night at the Sugar Factory--awesome hot chocolate! There was plenty of action in the casino, but the room was quiet. We really enjoyed our stay and I would definitely stay at Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located on the strip”
Reviews.Author: lbmastiff
Reviews.Content: The Paris hotel is in a great location towards the middle of the Strip making it easier to walk to all the different attractions. The Sweet Factory restaurant is amazing with ice cream covered waffles. We also saw the Nutcracker in their theatre which was beautiful and so easy to get to and from. The rooms were nice and clean, and the staff was very helpful when we could not find our room keys!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View of the Bellagio Fountains”
Reviews.Author: sandy4310
Reviews.Content: First timers for the Paris and will definitely return. The hotel is in the middle of the strip and so convenient to everything. Our corner room looked across at the fountains of the Bellagio and I pulled a chair up and just watched the show. The Paris is a perfect location for doing the strip, restaurants and other hotels. I can't give it a five, as a room service tray sat outside a door for two days. Don't know why the maid service did not clear it or call room service to pick it up. That's my only complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Pure_XTC
Reviews.Content: Other than a 20min lineup for check-in on a Monday night, the hotel was great. It's joint partnership with Bally's allows for greater flexibility in dining and gaming options. It was like having the best of both resorts in one. The close proximity of the monorail was one of the reasons for choosing this hotel. The rooms are typical Las Vegas, clean, well appointed, but not intended for you to spend too much time there (ie. limited TV stations). The sheets/towels were a little rough, not as soft as some other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice accomodations”
Reviews.Author: BobHEugene
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our 3-night stay at the Paris. The room itself was nothing really special (it met our expectations for the price), but was clean and quiet (ours was located on the 12th floor, in back) and had comfortable beds. A few negatives: the shower/bath and bath sink are all in the same room, no coffee maker in the room, the soft drink machines did not work (I tried them on 4 different floors), our bath sink wouldn't drain and we had to call maintenance. Positives: very friendly and efficient check-in and check-out; great location for just a short walk to many other great casinos, lots of dining choices within the casino; clean and quiet room. We would definitely stay again at The Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Andy521
Reviews.Content: Stayed here when my wife and I were in LV to get married. Awesome! Loved it so much. A wee tip: When checking in, slip a $20 note under your passport and ask if they have any nicer rooms. We got an upgrade to a red room and it was lush! Well worth a couple of bucks extra!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, great room, good service”
Reviews.Author: Ania K
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! Conveniently located in the middle of the strip, just opposite the Bellagio and its beautiful fountains. Big spacious rooms. Amazing bathroom.The hotel is huge so don't expect to be served on the go but they really do what they can and the service is very helpful! The restaurant serves great breakfast! I recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy size casino,friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: capemaydonna
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a regular guest room. Room size was comfortable and clean. Beds and pillows were not very comfortable. Room service and the chambermaids were great.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in perfect mid-strip location.”
Reviews.Author: Reedsar
Reviews.Content: I went on a girls weekend with a couple of friends and stayed at Paris. We upgraded to a red room upon check in and are glad we did. The room is moderately sized but clean and nice for the price. The hotel had many dining options including some good casual choices. I was pleased for the most part. The baguettes are not really French baguettes and the cafe americano at the espresso bar was terrible which is a bit disappointing. However, those are the only complaints I have, which means it was a good experience. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay at Paris again.”
Reviews.Author: princessinbk
Reviews.Content: I was surprised that the hotel was as nice as it was. It is very big, clean, lots of restaurants, shops and the rooms were nice. I went on a girls getaway and 4 of us shared a room to my surprise we weren't fall on each other, the rooms were big. The hotel is also in a great location, right in the middle of las Vegas blvd across the street from planet Hollywood and bellagio. It was convient to get around walking or taxi. The hotel have a mini eiffel tower ride that you should go on. It has a fantastic view of the bellagio water show and las Vegas. There is an outdoor pool and a spa. We spent a relaxing day at the spa enjoying massages.

Reviews.Title: “Just Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: azallie
Reviews.Content: This past weekend my husband and I went to Vegas to celebrate my 60th birthday with another couple. We both stayed at the Paris Hotel, which was a first time for both of us. I cannot speak for the other couple, but I was somewhat disappointed with my stay. I expected the rooms to more current than they were. The beds were pretty worn out and extremely uncomfortable. I had to request another room because of back problems. Hotel staff were extremely accommodating with changing my room. The beds on the 24th floor were new pillow top beds and very comfortable. No further sleeping problems after the room change. There were two other items that were disappointing, the TV’s had not been upgraded to flat screen, no big deal, however, the second bigger problem was the no-flow shower head. This is a major item for me. By the time the water finally hit your body, it was like a dribble. When I take a vacation I so look forward to a great shower, which was not the case this time. On the positive side, the hotel is in a prime location surrounded by the Bellagio, Caesars Palace, Bally’s, Planet Hollywood, Harrah’s, and the Mirage. It’s just a few short blocks from the Venetian. It is fairly easy to get around inside the hotel, and the hotel has one of the better buffets along the strip. I would probably not stay at the Paris again unless they offered a better room rate. When visiting Vegas one hardly spends any time in the room, so it’s not necessary to shell out all that money for average accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Paris - Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: MARGARUSHKA
Reviews.Content: We love the atmosphere of the Paris Casino "complex" so decided to stay at the hotel for this trip. The check-in staff was great. Although they offered an upgrade to a newly remodeled section, we declined. Rooms were clean although a little tired looking. Beds were comfortable. We had a great view of the pool, tower, and a part of the strip. Elevators were fast. The only negatvies: 1) room lighting was poor and two bulbs were burned out (one of them in the bathroom); and 2) room service food carts from other guests' rooms stayed in the hallways for a long time, sometimes as much as an entire day. We'd definitely stay here again, though. --- And we also enjoy the great breakfasts at Mon Ami Gabi located within the casino.

Reviews.Title: “NIce Room But Why Always A Late Check-In?”
Reviews.Author: clint52
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a second time at the end of December 2011(Our first stay was in July, 2010). This time we got the Red Room and it was lovely. Quiet and spacious for two adults. Outside of us not having a strip view and noticing the room is beginning to show it's age, everything was fine except for.................... 1) For the second straight time, our room was not ready at the promised 4PM check-in time. I do not understand why this can not be honored. We had to wait until a bit after 5PM. On our first stay, we had to wait until 4:45PM but we just chalked it up to a Sunday check-in after a big weekend. But this time it was a Wednesday check-in. Geez, I can remember a 2PM check-in time at certain hotels "back in the day." Then it went to 3PM, and now 4PM which means 5PM. Terrible. Maybe someone can confirm if this is just cleaning crew cut backs???? 2) A warning that you must make it clear you want new towels by tossing them in the bathtub. You will see a note with this info so don't leave a towel hanging on a door and expect it to be gone. Also, they no longer change sheets on the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Worn and filled with cigarette smoke”
Reviews.Author: Don H
Reviews.Content: I travelled to a conference at the Paris and the hotel furnishings were very worn and and the amount of cigarette smoke on the first floor was incredible. The hotel staff were oblivous to people who were smoking next to signs that stated no smoking. Cigarette smoke bothers me so I avoided the worst of it by self parking in the garage and coming into the hotel by the back entrance. We reported certain things in the room that were not working and they did not get to them even though we were there a week.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Sam B
Reviews.Content: The Paris Hotel sit's right in the middle on the strip and opposite The Bellagio Hotel. Experience everything you love about Paris, right in the heart of The Strip. In side this hotel you experience the old world sophistication of this French resort. Set amid cobblestone pathways, French wrought iron street lamps and you must try to visit the 50-story Eiffel Tower - the view from the top at night is outstanding. There are two shopping promenades, the Paris-Bally's Promenade and the shops at Le Boulevard. The reception area is beautiful, there is a large casino lounge and many cafe & restaurants for all your needs. Our bedroom was very large with two double beds and a well equipt bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Breakfast Spread!!!”
Reviews.Author: matutina
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Las Vegas where we did the 7-Casinos 24hour Buffet of Buffets... Paris breakfast buffet is the best! You can have french pastries, sausages, ham, made to order omelettes, a variety of egg dishes, crepes, all kinds of breads including flat bread and humus, salmon, different kinds of spreads not to mention their superb dessert station, their beverage choices and their custard ice cream. Definitely a don't miss when you are in Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Maltesejane
Reviews.Content: We liked our rooms and we had a fantastic dinner at the Eiffel Tower restaurant. But the Anthony Cool hypnotist attraction was very disappointing. Especially for the price of the tickets. Having been to hypnotists, all of us came to the conclusion that it was fake.

Reviews.Title: “The "Good" and the "Needs Improvement"”
Reviews.Author: Keith V
Reviews.Content: This was our 11th visit to the "Paris" in a row, and we have not had any negative comments until this trip. Positives: -Staff continue to be super friendly, go out of their way to impress you, in particular James at "Concierge." -Food is consistently very good, and varied -Very central location and love that there is a bus stop in front of the hotel Negative: -Rooms are really starting to show their age, considerable touch ups need to be completed on things like a large hole in the blanket housekeeping delivered to our room, large tear in the carpet, strip torn on the Ottoman, fan in bathroon did not work. -3 sets of room service dishes were left in the hallway without pickup for several days. We will likely stay at "Paris" again on our next trip, BUT hope they have started to notice some of the similar comments posted by recent guests and take action.

Reviews.Title: “The Paris, a smokers paradise!”
Reviews.Author: BCGirlie
Reviews.Content: Price was great but does that mean they should let the hotel upkeep go? Very smelly casino. Rooms small and need updating. Wallpaper peeling, lime scale around showers. Comparable to NYNY but I'd go back to NYNY... I prefer to pay extra bit to get better service, space and more updates. Too small and smelly for us. Upside? Restaurant food, yes, great food at mon ami gabi, also le cafe. Pay a bit extra people!

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: norasaid
Reviews.Content: Good location, recommended to all. Vewry good service.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Wise and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: FirstMaggie
Reviews.Content: The only complaint we have about this hotel is the ventilation system which was inadequate in removing the smoke from the air. We were in a non smoking room on the 22 floor and we could smell smoke coming through the vents. The room was large and comfortable, the king bed could use a plusher mattress, the days of 'firm is best' are gone, but we realize the economy doesn't have room for updates like that. All the staff were friendly and helpful, lets hope they continue that attitude once business picks up. The location is excellent, smack dab in the middle of the strip and a bus stop almost outside the door for those with sore feet, and your feet will be sore at some point in your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Simple, but clean”
Reviews.Author: Beckyli15
Reviews.Content: Not one of my favorite places to stay. Personally, I prefer BAlly's if you want to stay in the same price range, but if you get a good deal at the Paris then that's a good reason to choose it.

Reviews.Title: “Best View of Bellagio Fountains”
Reviews.Author: mack15
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times now and have been impressed with the quqlity of this hotel each time. We usually upgrade to take advantage of the concierge lounge and the improved view from the upper floors facing the tower and the fountains. We love the convenience of the concierge lounge that offers breakfast and afternoon snacks with usually no waiting.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved this place for atmosphere and position”
Reviews.Author: Spangieuk
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Paris and loved every minute of it! Last time we stayed in the Aria - very plush hotel, on the strip - but very impersonal. If you want to go to Vegas for the cheese and the over the top everything - the Paris is the perfect place to go. Granted, the rooms are deffo not as nice as the Aria - but how long are you spending in them? I will be coming back to Vegas again in the next year - and the Paris is where I am staying! The Venitian and the New York, which work on the same principles of replicating the places on the inside of the hotel are just to far at either end of the strip - it really is a walk to get central - The paris is bang central and worth every penny! Love it.

Reviews.Title: “Medium value”
Reviews.Author: Dub2235
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Paris at least 5 times, the reason is the location on the strip. The hotel is decent enough overall, it is laid out fine with relative easy access to the things you need. The spa is clean and the service is above average, the connecting workout area is very good for a hotel (this costs $25 per day unless you get a massage, then the gym is included). The food in the hotel is below average, service is suspect and the pricing is high. The rooms are clean, bathrooms are bigger then average, the beds suck (feels like just a sheet on a mattress) and the television is still an old tube 4x3 tube TV, this is bad, very bad. The front desk, bell and valet services are all slightly above average, I think the people that work at the hotel care and that helps with their overall rating.

Reviews.Title: “Package deal well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Geochick_Houston
Reviews.Content: Bought a package deal direct from hotel for my Mom for Barry Manilow and 3 nights at Paris. Had some problems with confirming our seats for the show so when we checked in, hotel upgraded us!! Great views overlooking the mini-Eiffle tower and the Bellagio fountains. Great breakfast/cafe on main level for amazing Parisian-sweets! Crepe place was amazing too - sweet and savory!! Room great. Have stayed at MGM before but would return to Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice dog-friendly hotel on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: om_sweet_om
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here solely based on the fact that they are dog-friendly. The property is based smack-dab right in the middle of the Strip and it is very busy. The rooms were nicely appointed and the bed was surprisingly comfortable. Room amenities were just so-so but no biggie. Housekeeping was incredible - room was very clean and follow-up visits seemed like time was put into making our room extra comfortable. The bellmen were a mixed bag - some gave 5-star service and some did not. In fact, the bellman who loaded our luggage in our car upon departure threw our suitcases haphazardly on top of other items in our car, resulting in me having to reload our stuff. A couple of cons that stick out for me were very long check-in wait (30+ minutes but it was a holiday) and the so-called pet-area. It is a relatively long and inconvenient walk through the casino to get to the area designated for pets. They had transformed two parking spaces into an area for dogs. I was even scolded by an employee when my dog sniffed a tree on our way to the 2-parking space transformed pet area. Obviously Vegas isn't the ideal place ot bring a dog but if they are going to offer the option, I would like to see a larger area for the dogs.

Reviews.Title: “Good, basic hotel rooms at an affordable price.”
Reviews.Author: Tradewinns
Reviews.Content: The Paris hotel is in the heart of the strip so the location is wonderful. The rooms are maybe 3 star, simple and nothing special but clean and comfortable and since you won't be in the room very often just right for a trip to Vegas. The casino seemed especially smokey and not as busy as some of the other hotels but still nice. Very helpful and friendly staff and housekeeping. Over all, I would consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: berube54
Reviews.Content: thought we would stay at a more upscale hotel this trip to Vegas.Room quality for the price was poor!Enjoy the good restaurants and wonderful atmosphere of Paris,but stay somewhere less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Love Paris Las Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: cmstengel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris in September 2011 and again had a wonderful experience. We booked through the website and were able to get our room comped through Total Rewards. We visit Las Vegas once a year and Paris is now the only place we want to stay. Location on the Strip is perfect, the Deuce picks up right in front, and you can walk to many other places due to the central location. We absolutely love Fili the bartender in the sports bar - we always look forward to seeing him. We ate at the new restaurant at the Sugar Factory - good but definitely pricey. Of course everywhere in Vegas is anymore! We had good luck in the gambling department which we normally do here. Our room was a parlour room, not updated but on a corner with a fantastic view and very nice. Bed was very comfortable and the room was huge. It was also very quiet. Shower was excellent. Some people have claimed issues with no hot water but this was never an issue for us. You just had to wait a few minutes for it to heat up but no big deal. We did attempt to use the pool one morning and it was closed for cleaning. Thought that was kind of strange - couldn't they do that later in the evening when the pool is closed anyway? A bit of an inconvenience but we got over it quickly. Other than the pool issue, I have nothing negative to say about this hotel or casino. We are already looking forward to our next trip to Vegas in the fall and we will definitely stay at Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Decent But Not Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: NVRKNW
Reviews.Content: Our group (4 couples) booked 4 rooms. Three of the couples had to ask to change rooms because of the overwhelming smell of cleaner in their room. The hotel staff was very accommodating and upgraded them to one of the nicer rooms. Comparing the basic rooms and the upgraded, its well worth the price to upgrade. The basic rooms seems a little worn. The upgraded rooms seemed quite lovely until the third day one of the couples had another issues with their room. They came back to their room and found a powerful cigarette smoke smell. The hotel staff said the floor above was a smoking floor so some of the smoke must of filtered down so they pumped oxygen into to the room. Overall, I would choose somewhere else to stay. Vegas has so many great options. This was just ok and is fine if you are just looking for a room to crash.

Reviews.Title: “A solid B+”
Reviews.Author: idocgu
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Paris Las Vegas. We were put in a renovated Red Room. There was a lot of wasted space and few amenities in the room. The bed was comfortable, the big TV was nice, the view was ok, and the bathroom was adequate. The hallways were all beaten up and looked in need of fresh paint. The check in was smooth and the people were nice, it was very easy to get around. The casino itself was good, with a nice variety of machines and games. The restaurants in the hotel were second to none. We ate at the Eiffel tower restaurant, it was super expensive and worth every penny, great views and hip french place. We ate at the Sugar Factory for lunch, it was similar to a cheesecake factory but on steroids, all the portions were huge and very unique, it is worth a try. We also ate breakfast at Mon Ami Gabi it was excellent. I would probably go back to this hotel again, it was a perfect strip location. Maybe just in need of a little sprucing up all around.

Reviews.Title: “Paris but louder”
Reviews.Author: shell93013
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Paris, Las Vegas owned by Harrahs Properties. Great room with a view of the Eiffel Tower, Great food in the many restaurants, Great gambling success. Don't forget to get your total rewards cards for use in the casino. We got our rooms free due to other stays at Harrah's properties. We always stay at a Harrah's property if at all possible!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for leisure and business trip”
Reviews.Author: Mazhar M
Reviews.Content: It was great experience to stay in the Paris Hotel, staff was very friendly and attentive, service excellent, Hotel location is prime, in side the Hotel every thing available, I will love to go back to Las Vegas and I will stay again in Paris Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love it, can't wait to go back again!”
Reviews.Author: DINKS82
Reviews.Content: I have been to Paris twice and am about to go again! Paris cannot be beat for location, size, comfort and quality! My first ever trip to Vegas was spent here, and we went back again the following year - can't wait to drive up to be greeted by the polite and accommodating staff again this year! The hotel is a great size and a nice departure from the often crowded tourist attraction vibe of Bellagio, Caesars and Venetian. It almost feels like a hidden gem - right in the middle of the strip! Paris has a high end feel without being over the top, and non-guests may pop in for a meal or to go to the top of the tower but this is not an attraction hotel like the other big names. If you want a great, high end, but cozy experience this is the place for you. My husband and I have stayed twice and now I'm taking my mom for her first ever trip to Vegas - no worries about getting lost in an oversized place where everything looks the same around every corner - Paris offers great dining options for every budget, unique shopping (no chains!) and an inviting calm atmosphere. I highly recommend Paris - I don't think I'll stay anywhere else! This hotel is also directly connected through a beautiful walkway (the promenade) to Bally's - it's like getting the convenience of 2 hotels/casinos in 1! And...no resort fees! * last time I visited I rolled my ankle on the first day - EMT up to my room to wrap my ankle, provided me with ice packs and extra tensor bandages - the staff are there to please!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, great views”
Reviews.Author: Yogi_Bear_NZ
Reviews.Content: Got a room that overlooked the Bellagio, the Eiffel tower, and brilliant views of the Bellagios water fountains that go off to music. Gaming area and all of the atrium makes it feel like you're in Paris in the evening, complete with artificial 'sky', and the place has a generally cool vibe. Excellent value for money as well, at the 'heart' of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DogmaticDave
Reviews.Content: We stayed here xmas 2011 for 4 days and it was great. The first thing that hits you as you enter the hotel is the casino ceiling that is painted like clouds in the sky. A real spin out when you walk in at midnight. Service was very helpful. We had a stip view room that looks out over the Bellagio fountains that go off every 30 minutes. We never got tired of seeing it the whole time we were there. Strip view is a must !!!! We spent the four days looking inside all most of the main hotels on the stip and returned to Vegas for the new year where we stayed at the Venetian for 3days and we preferred the Paris over all that we saw. Its maybe not as grand as the Bellagio or Venetian but for us it ticked all the boxes for us without over the top pretentiousness. Great value for money. Right in the middle of the strip. The view from the Eiffel Tower at night is the best in Vegas. Room was really classy. It's a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Regular Rooms & Le Mans Suites need updating!”
Reviews.Author: MarkDC-Travel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paris Las Vegas Hotel for two nights December 17 and 18 in a Le Mans Suite, 1275P . I had heard only good things about this hotel and was very much looking forward to experiencing what it was like to stay here. My brother stayed in a regular room at the same time. The regular rooms and the Le Mans Suites are in desperate need of updating, but more about that in a bit. We were able to check in at 11:45 AM. The exact rooms we wanted, single king bed for my brother’s room and non-smoking regular room for me, were not available. My Brother took a 2-queen-bed room while I opted to up-grade to the Le Mans Suite rather than wait for my non-smoking room. Since check-in is 3:00, can’t complain that things were not ready. Early check-in is always a bit of a chance one takes, and checking in was quick and painless. They try to emulate some idea of Paris from the middle ages rather than today, so outside the reception area, the floors are designed to be cobblestone-like rather than flat. This can really reek havoc on your luggage if you have those small wheels on a spinner so just be careful and take it slow if you must. My brother’s regular room was quite basic and the furniture and carpet were quite worn. He did have a separate bath and shower rather than a combo which deserves a bonus point. Also he’s a chain smoker. The windows at Paris do not open but the ventilation system recycles the air so well that he wasn’t bothered that he couldn’t open them. The Le Mans Suite is a large room (see pictures). It has a wet bar with a refrigerator and a one cup coffee maker, but not one of those Keurig K-cup. Coffee is supplied each day at no charge. The furniture is quite old and old fashioned (like your grandma’s). The coffee table is iron and marble and the TV is an old tube set. The bed was not very comfortable unlike many of the beds on the strip. The bathroom is huge, with a Jacuzzi and separate shower. There is a toilet and a bidet. The Bath facilities are quite good. There was also a large walk-in closet and a make-up desk in the hallway between the closet and bathroom. Although the room was a bit dirty when I moved in (crumbs of food on the sofa and such), the cleaning staff took good care of me as my stay progressed and I always show my appreciation to those that give me good service. We ate at the café which was very reasonably priced and had breakfast once at the buffet. The food itself was nothing to write home about. In the café, I had the duck and was left a bit wanting. All in all, I found that the Suite was substandard, but the other facilities of the hotel were average for a low to mid-priced Vegas hotel. Unfortunately, Paris is not low priced, nor is it value priced. It is on the high end of mid-priced, and I think you can find better deals. After the hotel undergoes a renovation, then it would probably be worth what they charge, but not right now. I heard the Red Rooms are supposed to be modern, but I did not stay in one of them nor did I get to see inside of one. If they are modern, then they might be worth staying in, but I was really surprised that a Suite would be in such need of updating with such an uncomfortable bed. I was somewhat disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Paris, would definately come back.”
Reviews.Author: wabeachbum
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris for five nights, my husband had a conference next door at Planet Hollywood and the location was extremely handy. Las Vegas is so big and it takes so long to walk from one hotel to the next but Paris was an easy stroll away and lovely to stay at. The rooms look a little dated but that's the French theme and we found it quite cozy. We had a basic room and it was very comfortable with 2 queen sized beds, tv, table and chairs and desk. The bathroom is also very nice and a good size. Though we didn't have a strip view we could see the Arc de Trimph and Paris balloon from our window which looked great at night. Staff were friendly and helpful. I used the gym and it's got a good amount of equipment is good order.

Reviews.Title: “Not my cup of tea”
Reviews.Author: P0cketAces
Reviews.Content: Nice Vegas Hotel, however its obvious what they are shooting for. We found it difficult to find food to eat that didnt go with the paris atmosphere. Overall we prefer the other locations on the strip but its a nice resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Peaceful”
Reviews.Author: Christina S
Reviews.Content: Beside the rude check in lady the rooms were beautiful and the casino was peaceful compared to the surrounding casinos. It was nice to just sit and play and not see a bunch of loud mouth drunks making a scene.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Paris!”
Reviews.Author: ReneeInt
Reviews.Content: This is our second time to stay here. It's a perfect, central location across from the Bellagio, where you can view the beautiful fountains. The buffets are fabulous and although the lobby is buzzing with activity, the rooms are quiet. The hotel is beautiful--love the Paris theme. The room decor is a bit of out of date.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: richmonite
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris for four nights starting January 3, 2012. We arrived at approx 1:00 pm, and check in took no longer than 10 minutes. The front staff were professional and efficient and we got through quickly. We also asked about an upgrade: Their conceirge upgrade, which included a wonderful room on the 21st floor overlooking the Eiffel Tower and the Belagio fountains. The upgrade also came with a continental breakfast from 7-10 am and then appies and alcoholic beverages from 5-8 pm; both were well beyond our expectations and well worth the upgrade. The staff in the areas for the breakfast and appies was very professional, again, and we were glad to leave them appropriate tips each time we visited. The room we had included a king size bed which was very comfortable and a very big and luxurious bathroom, marble floors, separate bath and shower, larger counter, beautiful mirror, etc. Maid services was great with no problems whatsoever. We ate at Cafe Mon Ami Gabi and the food and service was wonderful. Only downside was the second time we ate at this cafe they sat us outside in what could be described as a wind storm and didn't give us an opportunity to move. Our bagette, utensils, etc. went flying off table and it was rather distracting and not very relaxing. If it's windy, I would suggest that you not sit out on their patio. The first time we visited we were also on the Patio and it was sunny and wonderful! Only other statement is that I was disappointed with the Stores in the hotel. I was looking forward to a little big of Parisian culture, ie: artwork, etc. and there is nothing so to speak. It would be nice to see this type of store in the Paris hotel. All and all we had an exceptionally enjoyable time at Paris, good relaxing break and would definately return again. Thanks to the Paris hotel and the wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great price!! Lobby very crowded though”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaSJmom
Reviews.Content: date of stay Dec. 27-29. I would recommend this hotel in terms of location/location. It’s very central on the main part of the strip, across from Bellagio, next to Bally’s, not far from Venetian, Mirage, CityCenter, etc. Checkin only had to wait about 10 mins in line but we noticed the next day the line for checkin was very long. Seemed like front desk understaffed to handle the workload. We took the airport shuttle to get there which worked great. Only stopped at 2 other hotels before ours. Our room was on the 14th floor, however we looked back towards MGM hotel, not the better views towards Bellagio which I think would have cost a bit more. Room was really cheap – I think only $55/night. If we had stayed 2 nights later, Dec 30 and 31 it would have been closer to $180/night. It was very quiet and we slept well. Amenities etc. were fine (for $55/night -- if I had to spend over $125 I'd probably also comment about thing starting to look a bit shabby in rooms etc). Didn’t spend much time in our room other than sleeping. We ate breakfast in the hotel, 1st day at JJ’s Boulangerie where I had oatmeal and hubby had lox and bagel. We were both very happy although the wait for the food was a bit long (10 mins ) so not really “fast “ food. 2nd day we split a crepe from La Creperie which often had long lines. We probably had to wait close to 10mins to place our order, then another 5-10mins before order was filled but it was very yummy. We didn’t eat any other meals at the hotel. Observations: If you don’t like crowds, this might not be the right hotel for you. I think the buffet and the Eiffel tower draw a lot of non-hotel guests thru the lobby at all hours so it becomes very busy, especially along the “cobblestone” way that goes past the creperie, café’s and stores. Then again, if you don't like crowds you won't be happy anywhere in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “def would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: wgourley
Reviews.Content: i was in vegas once when i was in high school with my family. this was my first time there as an adult. i met 6 guys i graduated college with there for thanksgiving this year. what a blast. the hotel staff was very nice and place was very clean. buffet was great but line got long quick. outside of that not much to say. we were all over the place. did a bar/casino crawl one night, hit about 7 different casinos and casino bars before going to dinner. had a blast out there.

Reviews.Title: “Great visit to Paris... Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: shmeghan
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at Paris Las Vegas! The hotel is perfectly located in the middle of the strip, and conveniently attached to Ballys which offered more gambling and dining options. The accomodations were clean, comfortable and enjoyable! Our check in was quick, easy, and the front desk staff was very friendly. We did ask for a room with a view, and didnt get so lucky with that, but considering we hardly spent any time in the room, it wasnt a big deal. We loved the quaint French village like feel of the shops and restaurants. The casino downstairs was fun, and although I HATE that smoking is allowed in all Vegas hotels, it wasnt nearly as bad in the Paris casino for some reason. The only meal we ate at the hotel was the breakfast buffet which was EXCELLENT and well worth the money! We only had 2 complaints about our stay- First, we arrived late on a Thursday night, checking in around midnight- our group was starving, and we were really dissapointed to find NO dining options in the hotel. We were really surprised at this considering its the city that never sleeps! Second, Im sure its standard with Vegas, but everything in this hotel was SO expensive! Even small things like a slice of pizza, cup of coffee, or drinks were at least $5. It was similar to Disney in that everything costs an arm and a leg! It was just a sticker shock since it was out 1st trip to Vegas, but overall we had an EXCELLENT stay!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Get-a-way!”
Reviews.Author: MLBaker_11
Reviews.Content: This was our third time to go to Vegas in the past 5 years, we have stayed at the Paris each time. First two times were very good....room was in excellent shape, location is great, had a wonderful time. Third time was not so fun, still a great location to the strip, just the room was in very poor shape. Cracked tile in the shower, cracked sink, lights not working, mini bar's used to be stocked, now they stopped doing that. The bed..was hard as a rock!! The Paris needs to "modernize" their rooms. For the price...you can pay just a few bucks more and get a really, really nice room and still be a good location to see the attractions up and down Las Vegas Blvd. Casino, was same ole same ole...very smokey, dank...just not as welcoming as the other ones. We won't be staying there again, unless they re-model adn upgrade!!!

Reviews.Title: “First Times in Vegas, won't do the Paris next time”
Reviews.Author: C F
Reviews.Content: I was in Vegas from the 5th of January to the 8th. We stayed at the Paris. We were given lots of advice by friends who have been to Vegas often and told us what to ask for and what to expect. THere were three of us, two who have travelled many,many times. We asked for an upgrade to a Suite and were told nothing was available. We went to our room and were dissapointed with the smell in our hallway (smelled like dirt, old carpeting) and then the room (dirt marks on the door and bathroom wall just not cleaned and a section of the rug cut out and replaced - frayed) the smell was in the room also. We called down to the desk and insisted on an upgrade and they immediately offered us one of the Red Rooms for $40 a night extra. We took it and moved to a much nicer room that one would expect for a Vegas Casino. We left the made a note and $5 for extra pillows and towels...she took our $5 and left nothing. We had one hand soap the entire time and considering one of our travelling companions was sick it would have been nice to have fresh soap. The taxi stand was great, prompt and friendly service although he made it obvious he expceted a tip for waving the cab over to us!!! We did the buffet twice and although it was pricey it was superb. The food was amazing no matter what you ate. The table both times rocked so our drinks would spill, the silver ware was FILTHY one one occasion, lipstick on two of our cups and rarely was a spoon to stir our coffee found in the silver ware left wrapped at the table??? On our second visit to the buffet the waitress was snippy with us when we told her that the hostess has already taken our drink order and was down right rude to the table beside us (family with kids wanting hot chocolate and she brought chocolate milk with their orange juice...ewww. She snapped at them when they told her they ordered hot choc and not choc milk.). We took some fruit and pastry with us for snacking later it would have been nice to have a take out container so we could take some of it to our rooms. I know they do this in Mexico and considering how much food must get thrown out I would think it acceptable? We did Mom Ami Gabi on Saturday night and sat on the patio under heaters and watched to Bellagio fountains, awesome. The crowds were so much fun to watch and the food was amazing, my compliments to the chef and the waiter (french fella from Quebec) who even offered us the recipe to the chocolate pudding with salted carmel sauce...omg it was amazing. We all decided to return to Vegas with our partners next time only we would DEFINITELY stay somewhere else so we could experience what Vegas is so famous for, service, cleanlieness, customer service and wow factor. I thoroughly enjoyed the trip but the Paris cast a bit of a shadow on it. I never had the feeling that our stay mattered to any staff member.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Hotel Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: gpress88
Reviews.Content: A beautiful place to visit. The ceilings are painted with murals in the casino. We arrived during the morning before our room was ready, and one clerk who was rather snappy told us we would have to wait at least three hours but when we went to leave our bags up front another clerk helped us out and found us a room not the one we wanted but it was okay. I didn't mind the downgrade the room was small though Thanks lady ! The room was clean but the only thing I did not like one would have to pay for WI-FI which was at the time $15.00 a day and in the business center 10.00 really ! No flat sceen tvs No complimentry anything

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will plan a return trip!”
Reviews.Author: CycloneKatie
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure what to expect since some of the reviews had said things like dated, old, etc. but we were very pleasantly surprised. All of the staff we encountered were so nice. We were not in one of the renovated rooms but our room was very clean and I liked the French charm. The bathroom was very spacious. I thought the Paris was a great value and I would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “good value, but needs to be updated / upgraded”
Reviews.Author: joesob
Reviews.Content: fantastic location right in the middle of the strip and near to everything. the hotel lobby,casino areas and restaurants are all wonderful, clean, and welcoming. the rooms, while large and clean, are dated in appearance and in function. the tv in our room was not a flat screen; the towels in the bathroom were paper thin, the beds were of average comfort, and the overall decor of the room was just blah. room size, cleanliness, and value for money? fantastic. would i stay here again? possibly, at the right price, but with so many other available hotels on the strip, i'd most likely try somewhere else. (i must add that the casino dealers at the paris were friendly, and the cafe 'mon ami gabi' had great food with great service.)

Reviews.Title: “ok,”
Reviews.Author: travelmum
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris for one night, as we had to fly out of the LV airport. We'd been touring around and previously stayed at Caesars Palace. Don't know if it was because we booked last minute but the Paris was about the best price of the decent hotels, and much higher than we'd previously paid at Caesars. We'd booked Caesars at the beginning of the trip, partly because they had a special price, and we were put in the new wing and had a lovely room, almost the size of a suite. Paris was ok, a little disappointing compared to Caesars (new wing) especially as Paris cost more. Nothing wrong with it, just a basic hotel room. The location is good and the downstairs 'parisian' area is fine, kind of dark, but ok.

Reviews.Title: “Location & Atmosphere Are Special...Rooms Suck.”
Reviews.Author: OahuHawaii
Reviews.Content: We have stayed a few times with comp nights from the Caesar's points program. We are glad is was free. We would have been sad if we paid for this place. Drive up is very nice and valet is prompt. Check-in has always been long. Elevators to the rooms are a walk thru the casino...does not seem right having to lug your stuff the open casino floor. Whatever. Rooms are SO BEAT UP and WORN. It is clear this is a conference hotel and the owner has put minimul money in to keep it even clean. Hallways and rooms are paint scratched & chipped, dirty rugs, old bedspreads, cheesy linens, etc. The entire room just makes you feel dirty. Hard to even sleep in. It could be so nice if it was just CLEAN and UPDATED. Pool is rooftop...not much atmosphere. Shaded at times. Positive side the views are very nice if you can get a front, strip facing room. Casino is not a favorite of ours...just so so. No restaurant or bar is knock your socks off. SO, it has ALOT of potential(or did have)...but now it is rather run down and nasty. We would not stay if we were paying. There is better for your money in Sin City.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vegas Trip!!”
Reviews.Author: Mats13
Reviews.Content: I have been to numerous hotels in Las Vegas and Paris is now tied for first place with the Bellagio. Great service, great food choices, clean, excellent location and loose slots!! Awesome trip. Would recomend this hotel without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located on the strip”
Reviews.Author: davism24
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Paris Hotel. The hotel manager kindly upgraded us to a room with a view due to a third party reservation error. Our room had a exquisite view of the Eiffel tower and the Bellagio water fountain show. It was quiet and very hot water for shower or bath. I just loved the accomodations. Nice restaurants and decor one of the best casinos with blue sky ceiling for outdoorsy atmosphere. Make a reservation with hotels.com etc. or your night stay can be costly. No resort fees is a plus. The only thing I did not like is the $25 spa fee for workout facilities/jacuzzi. However, this is probably common for Las Vegas hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel”
Reviews.Author: Surftoker
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the atmosphere of the Paris. The casino was a fun place to gamble and they had a nice variety of slot machines. The ceiling of the casino is painted like a blue sky on a sunny day, so it is always daytime in Paris. It was easy to walk to lots of hotels on the strip from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Pros”
Reviews.Author: violeto
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th or 5th time we have stayed at the Paris Hotel and Casino. My husband and I frequent Las Vegas very often, I consider myself pretty well versed with anything to do with Las Vegas. This an annual trip to visit our family who lives in Vegas so we also traveled with our 11-year-old son. We arrived at the hotel later than normal being we were traveling on Thanksgiving night coming in from California. The gentlemen that helped us at the front desk was very helpful and offered us an upgrade when we checked in and also arranged for a roll away bed to be set up in the room. The room was a small suite (we have stayed in a couple times before) very spacious with a small couch, chair, king bed, flat screen TV, and a large bathroom. There was plenty of room for the roll away bed. We ordered room service the first night, which was prompt and hot when it arrived. If you are staying at the Paris you will be extremely happy with the location. The hotel is positioned in the middle of the strip, which makes it easy to walk either direction to visit other casinos. You are also in great position to see the Bellagio fountains. The food at the Paris is decent. If I were going to recommend a couple of places to get a good meal, go to the La Creperie, and Ah Sin (Asian cuisine). Where the Paris is lacking is in the casino and sports book. This trip we did not do much gambling because we had our son, but in the past the casino has been rather dull and the sports book very small. All in all the Paris Hotel and Casino is very nice and the location makes up for the things it might be lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: darlayne
Reviews.Content: This was the millionth time to Vegas, and our first stay at the Paris Hotel. We had a wonderful stay over the Christmas Holiday. The room was very clean and very quiet. We had another wonderful trip to Vegas and would rate Paris as our number one room thus far. Their gift shops and diners were all quite good. I would defintely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Paris and comfort”
Reviews.Author: bonefish2
Reviews.Content: A last minute Vegas vacation due to the pregnancy of our daughter, which probably meant no traveling for 2012. I booked two nites at the Main St Station in Downtown area for $32/nite. I received an offer for Paris at $31/nite and called to make the reservation and was surprised to hear that I was entitled for 4 nites FREE!!! My wife will be elated to stay on the Strip, especially at the Paris Hotel & Casino. The two nites at MSS was uneventful...pleasant, but no surprises on the food, gaming, hotel accommodations, etc., as we've stayed here many times in the past. PARIS, however, was grand..you'd think that a comp room would be standard fare and maybe it was, but very elegant compared to any of the Boyd's properties Downtown (Cal, Fremont or MSS) with a large very clean room and bathroom (shower, tub, large sink, etc.). Talk about wonderful service from front desk to cocktail servers in every venue there. Unfortunately, we did not dine in any of the restaurants as our daughters had recommended other restaurants on the Strip. The proximity to other attractions made it very convenient with a short walk to the Bellagio, Cosmopolitan, etc. I would avoid the Miracle Mile, especially the Beatles Show located adjacent to the Paris. Two nites was really not enough to enjoy all that the Paris has to offer. We would have loved to ride up the Eiffel Tower and dined at the fine dining restaurants. We had fun playing several of the slot machines and table games and was able to recover some of our loses at other casinos. allez voir ici

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in Paris, LV”
Reviews.Author: Jetuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in paris, Las Vegas on the 2nd January for a couple of nights. It was our third visit to vegas and this has been by the far the best budget/ affordable hotel we have stayed in in vegas. Our room was fantastic with great views of the strip. It was clean, spacious and the hotel was a really exciting place to stay with the cobbled french streets and boutique shops, it was typical vegas, we loved it! It was in a great location in the centre of the strip so easy to access any of the casinos without having to walk miles...unless you want to, you can still hike to the stratasphere although unless you want to try the rides we wouldnt overly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you want to be on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: AndyandEm
Reviews.Content: The Paris was a reasonable hotel in a great location at the heart of the Las Vegas Strip. It is opposite the Ballagio and close to all the main hotels and casinos, making it ideal if you want to be at the centre of everything. Our room was reasonably priced, very clean and generally in good condition. Free wifi would have been helpful, as we had to camp in the coffee shop to get any access. The hotel itself is enormous, like all of the main hotels on the strip, so it's a bit of a trek from reception to the rooms, but that means the rooms aren't noisy at all. Service was fine and we had no problems checking in or out. However, we were there in December so very much out of season for them. If you want to escape the central attractions, you will need a car - there are some amazing sights within a 30 minute drive of Vegas, such as Lake Mean, Hoover Dam and Red Rock Canyon.

Reviews.Title: “Tiring but satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: morloff
Reviews.Content: The hotel seems to have decent rooms, but the lobby is awkward to get from parking to check-in desk. We were there for a medical conference, and the ck-in was slow and tedious. The restaurants are just ok, the Internet access was expensive, TVs in room were quaint, not the big screens travelers are used to. The minibar fridge used to be honor-pay, but must have been abused a lot as the fridge was converted to regular refrigerator. Normal room rates don't include breakfast, or wifi, but parking is free. Some ppl like that the basement shops are shared with Bally's, but it was not the best venue for a working conference. The decor attempts to replicate authentic Parisian ambience, but somehow doesn't quite feel sync'd.

Reviews.Title: “Paris, LV, in December”
Reviews.Author: Ginmint63
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at Paris, Las Vegas December 15-19. It was wonderful. The restaurants and the Dueling Pianos Bar were most memorable. I'm not a big gambler, but really enjoyed the hotel, its proximity to other places on the strip, and the FREE PARKING! I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade at the Paris!!”
Reviews.Author: houdi648
Reviews.Content: I first off want to say that when I visit Vegas I always have been able to stay at any of the Ceasers Entertaiment hotels for free. No I am not a high roller just use my players card religiously and they have always been generous with their comps. I like to stay at the different hotels that they offer, so it had been a few years since I was at the Paris. We checked in 12/16/2011 about 9pm. We were helped by Brian who was as accommodating as he could be! While he was pulling up our reservation I asked if they were doing any upgrading that night he said he would see what he might have. Well a double door entrance to a suite on the 33rd floor, marble foyer/2 huge bathrooms one with jaquzzi tub/ living room/sitting area you get the picture. Then he called to see if we were happy with the room and did we need anything else. What a great way to start our trip. Everyone from housekeeping to servers in the casino were great. Do I expect to get upgrades like this all the time? Not at all but it just goes to show it never hurts to ask. We have stayed at hotels that are not part of the Ceasers Entertaiment family and we always seem to go back to where we feel we are treated as guests. Would I recommend the Paris? Yes with or without an upgrade. Location on strip is great and if your not afraid of heights go up the Eiffel Tower what a view! Also no resort fees that can really add up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: brainguy
Reviews.Content: Our favorite place to stay when visiting Vegas-great service-clean, well maintained rooms-took upgrade to room-awesome view of strip and Bellagio fountains- private breakfast and late after noon light meal included with upgrade-allowed to check in earlier-highly recommend this option if available to you.

Reviews.Title: “Dedicated to making everything difficult and expensive”
Reviews.Author: SquishyCupcake
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the apparently low room rates, and the pictures on the web site. The Paris will cost you plenty or will take lots of your time avoiding their cash extraction. The rooms are old and not well maintained - old beds, no blankets, old CRT television, fittings that don't work, no coffee making. Once the initial novelty of the French look wears off, the hotel becomes obviously tacky and defintely not authentic French. The buffet restaurant is very expensive and always has long long lines (why would anyone queue for an hour to pay $30 for breakfast? beats me). Wifi is $15/day PER DEVICE - two people each with a laptop would cost $30 per day; one person with a laptop and a smartphone costs $30 per day. The other small eateries are all expensive. The hotel and casino areas are smoky. The casino has only high-minimum tables. The parking is sufficient but is a long walk from the rest of the hotel. Housekeeping leave you an envelope to put their tips in (what a cheek!) and then never say thank you for the tips. Check in is slow and watch out - there are many stories of people booking a king room only to be pushed one way or another into a 2-queen room on check in . We had this happen to us also - something suss is going on here. The location is central on the strip but the reality is that it is a long walk to anything other than more mega resorts. For anything other than visiting these same mega resorts, it would be better to stay off the strip - far more convenient. A tip for the hotel - you don't turn English into French just by putting "Le" at the front. Staying at the Paris took the edge off our enjoyment of Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Viva la Paris!”
Reviews.Author: alan42Brisbane
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Vegas for 6 nights mid December. The rates for the Paris were amazing (averaged around $67/night and there are no resort fees). I had no idea when I booked that this was such a quiet time for Vegas and that most of the shows I wanted to see (O, Love, Penn & Teller) would be dark the entire time. There were four of us staying in 2 rooms. I'd used the Total Rewards memberships for my wife and I to get the room discounts (always do this even if you aren't a gambler - its free and it saves you money!) but this meant that the hotel had us booked under two different unlinked references. I did email them asking if the rooms could be located close together but got a standard reply saying that room preferences could only be considered at check-in. I neededn't have worried - not only were the rooms next to each other, they were linked right at the end of the corridor with our own private entrance way. This meant that the rooms were very quiet - no late-night revellers wandering past. The rooms were great - big (especially compared to where we stayed in LA, San Fran and NY), the bed perhaps a bit too soft. There are a couple of signs of ageing but for the cost it was definitely the best value for money hotel out of the 8 we visited on our trip. The buffet was excellent - we had a number of breakfast buffets and a dinner one, and if you time it right you can sample both the breakfast and lunch menu for the lower price. And don't forget to get the Total Rewards discount. If you time it wrong you end up in a big queue and the breakfast that you thought you were going for turns out to be a champagne brunch costing $10 more per head. On this occassion we made tracks to the Sugar Factory and had a really nice brunch instead. It was too cold to make use of the pool but it looked lovely with great views of the tower. The tower ride was good to do - great views of the Bellagio fountains atnight - but take a jacket (and gloves in winter!): we went up wearing what we had on for dinner - big mistake! I liked the overall feel of the Paris - it isn't noisy and brash like New york New York and, if your after a mid-priced but nice alternative, it fits the bill. I'd love to have the money to stay at the Venetian or Bellagio but the Paris is a lower priced alternative. Its bang in the middle of the Strip too, so cuts down on the travelling to and fro. Best bit: the duelling piano bar. Spent a couple of nights there and the guys are awesome. I wish we had these things in Australia! Yes the drinks bill was way too high but for sheer entertainment value its a great night:)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good value and lots of fun”
Reviews.Author: buddy070
Reviews.Content: If you enjoy anything parisienne this is the place to stay. The pace you choose is up to the visitor when visiting Las Vegas. This hotel has fantastic restaurants and much to see and do within the Hotel complex. The shows there are excellent Barry Manilow has just finished here after several years stint. The staff could not be more helpful and the gambling well, for me very enjoyable,, a lot of pleasure for little outlay. The shopping outlets are fantastic, a little expensive but one is able to purchase items that are unique to Vegas. Give Vegas a whirl you will enjoy it. We travelled with Virgin and they are excellent. .

Reviews.Title: “Paris is a winner!”
Reviews.Author: txn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris Las Vegas for two nights, 12/28 & 12/29. I had booked a "Luxury" room, which is the lowest level of room that they offer. When I checked in (around 5:45 p.m.) I asked the front desk clerk if there were any free upgrades available and to my surprise, she said yes. She said it was usually a $40/night upgrade. The room was on the 8th floor overlooking the pool (which was closed and looks like it is being renovated) but more importantly, it had a fabulous view of the Eiffel Tower! The room was fairly large with two queen beds, a desk, desk chair and an extra padded chair. There was a minibar that was not stocked, so we were able to put our own drinks in and keep them cold. A free room safe was also included. The bathroom was very nice, with a separate bathtub and enclosed shower, all done up in some beautiful marble. We really enjoyed the room. The only complaint was that the bed pillows were too hard for our taste. When I mentioned that upon checking out, we were told we could have asked for some softer pillows to be brought to the room. The hotel is situated next door to Bally's and not far from Planet Hollywood and a large shopping area. We didn't eat at the hotel, but there were several restaurants on site. If I ever come to Las Vegas again, I will stay at the Paris Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Oooh La La”
Reviews.Author: Frances D
Reviews.Content: This is my second review of Paris Las Vegas. I wrote my first one a couple of years ago. We have spent the last 5 or 6 years going to Paris Las Vegas for Christmas. As a loyal Total Rewards member, I get my room comped. I do have an opportunity to pay for an upgrade, which we did in 2010 but not 2011. The main pro about Paris is its location -- it can't be beat. City Center, Bellagio, Caesar's are across the street, and it's flanked by Bally's and Planet Hollywood. With its center strip location, it's a fairly easy walk to get to either "end" of the strip (i.e. MGM and Wynn). I did notice that after the years of wear and tear, Paris is starting to show its age. But these small cosmetic blemishes shouldn't deter. The atmosphere is comfortable -- and for us, it seems as if it is our second home, at least during the holidays! We will be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “an amazing place!!”
Reviews.Author: cowpat14
Reviews.Content: what an amazing hotel, i thank the lovely lady on the front desk for upgrading us to a suite, which made our stay there even more special. i found all the staff to be polite and helpful and the features/atmosphere of the hotel to be everything we had hoped for and more. i would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Stay there if?!”
Reviews.Author: Halawis
Reviews.Content: If you haunt stayed at the venetian, Wynn, or the Bellagio, then you want feel the difference and you may like the hotel. Unfortunately, I stayed right after astray at the venetian and OMG, the room was half the size that of the Venetian and the space in the lobby was not even comparable. Go there only if you have a GREAT deal and the price is compelling.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location on the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: threekitkats
Reviews.Content: It's located on the Strip, within walking distance of several hotels. It's one of the more affordable hotels, but still comfortable and clean. I liked the fact that it wasn't huge. It's fairly small compared to other nearby hotels. When I go to Vegas I end up visiting several casinos, so it doesn't really matter that it's not the biggest one around. I enjoyed my visit and I love the Paris theme. It's a good hotel to check out, if you're looking to stay on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine!”
Reviews.Author: JellyToast
Reviews.Content: Had been to Vegas once before (stayed at Bally's) and decided to book Paris to celebrate my sister's 50th birthday. Knew that the location was good - was a bit worred about the hotel itself after reading some of the reviews. As it turns out, there was no need to worry. We had a clean, quiet, non-smoking room with a view of the strip. We had one of the older style rooms - lack of a flat screen TV didn't mar our vacation in the least. A slow moving drain was fixed within an hour of reporting the problem. Check-in and check out was breeze (possibly due to our arrival and departure times.) We avoided the buffets (huge lines here and at other casinos) and had good luck with the Sugar Factory, Le Burger Brasserie, and the Cafe Ile St. Louis. Didn't have much luck in the smoky casino (slots players), though fellow travlers reported having great luck (slots and table games.) Servers were everywhere - had no issues getting a drink. Would recommend Paris for a more than decent, clean room at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Strangest booking policy ever”
Reviews.Author: joerizzo123
Reviews.Content: The Paris is a nice hotel, no doubt about that. The rooms are nice and the services available are great. However, they have a really weird booking policy. You cannot be guaranteed a non-smoking room or a room with two beds. You get what you get even if you've booked the room months in advanced. This is the strangest thing I've encounter with a hotel. Even the most flea bitten hotel in a podunk town in America will let you book a non-smoking room if you want to. Not the Paris. When we got there, they had no non-smoking rooms left. After we threaten to cancel our two other nights with them they gave us three suites for our party which I thought was very good of them. We were advised to call the front desk on the day we would arrive for the next two nights so we could get the rooms we wanted. It didn't matter. You talk to one person who guarantees you'll get a non-smoking room and when you get there they say, "There's nothing here that says you requested that." That happened all three nights we stayed there. It also takes forever to check in. Long lines make for 30-40 minutes just waiting to get your room. They could hire more people to help this problem but I think they just choose to save the money. You'd think they'd want to get you checked in so you can start losing money in their slot machines.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter N
Reviews.Content: I attended a convention in Las Vegas and stayed in this hotel for a week. Contrary to the Vegas image of gambling and glitz, the Paris pays attention to good old fashioned hospitality values - such as friendly service, good food, good value and efficiency combined with courtesy. Congratulations to everyone at the hotel - these are tough times which makes your achievement even more impressive. I'm a Starwood Gold member - and the Paris provides a better standard at a lower price than the Westin just down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Best ambience in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: travelsalotfamily
Reviews.Content: Love the ambience and restaurants here. Rooms are lovely. We were really pleased with everything and will likely stay here again. Biggest downside is that they didn't have our room available at check in and we had to decide between an expensive upgrade or waiting several hours to check in. We went with the upgrade but it made me wonder if this is a typical approach in order to get more $ from people :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Alex_54321
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Paris Las Vegas in December 2011 and this is so far the best Vegas hotel that I've been to. Our check-in was in trouble because the original flight was canceled, and instead of coming late evening we were coming almost at noon next day. I have booked the room in advance with Easy Click Travel, paying in full, and assumed that the room should be as good as mine for all days of our stay. In the unfortunate evening of our flight cancellation, I've made a call to Paris thinking that I'm just doing a courtesy notifying them of our late arrival. No so fast! I was informed that they normally hold reservations only till midnight, and, should I not arrive by then, reservation will go up in smoke, prepaid or not. Then I called Easy Click Travel agent, and she was helpful enough to arrange that hotel will keep our reservation till the next noon. We made it in time, but there were a few nervous moments before we reached the registration desk. LOCATION: Paris Las Vegas is in the heart of the Strip, right across Bellagio Fountains. You can walk to pretty much anywhere from there. Monorail station is also nearby, somewhere behind the hotel, but we didn't try it. In a busy time of day it may be difficult for a car to turn from Las Vegas Boulevard to the hotel because there are so many pedestrians and there is no special right turn phase for traffic signal. ROOMS: I was truly impressed with our room. I understand that we've got lucky, maybe because of the low season, but still, a corner room on a fairly high floor for a price of so-so motel in some other market - it's something to remember. From one window we can see the Strip, busy by day and dazzling by night, with a glimpse of Bellagio Fountains. From another window - the airport, outlying low rise part of the city and mountains in the distance. Sunrise over those mountains was amazingly beautiful. At the same time, in the first window you can see how the scarlet color of morning sun slowly edging down the shiny faces of Aria and Vdara across the street. Interior of the rooms is dated, but high quality and well kept. It looks like rooms were designed before people started to use desks as laptop stands and charge their cellphones at night. More electrical sockets would be very welcome. FOOD: We tried only two restaurants inside the casino: Le Cafe Ile St. Louis and Le Village Buffet. The cafe has very nice setting, but the food was not as great. After our first outing to the cafe, it was buffet, buffet and more buffet. And I say it's the best buffet I know so far. Crepes were delicious. But beware - while in ordinary buffet you may gain a few pounds, in le village buffet you will gain exactly the same number, only in kilos! STAFF: We didn't have any problems while staying in the hotel, and staff was always courteous and helpful. ENTERTAINMENT: Paris Las Vegas hosts Barry Manilow show, which I'm probably still too young to enjoy. Eiffel Tower, which we visited during the day, was spectacular. The only downside is that observation desk is one big cage with a few gun holes to take pictures. Paris Las Vegas does not have resort fee, which is good. However, internet in the room still costs $15 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Great anniversary stay.....”
Reviews.Author: Emma-Louise-1980
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Paris towards the end of our holiday to Las Vegas......and I am so glad we did ....this was an amazing stay. We checked in and mentioned that it was our 5th wedding anniversary and our 10 month old daughter's first visit to Vegas and the check in clerk was extremely helpful and polite....she upgraded us to a suite.....and what a suite it was .....we had masses of space for our 4 night stay. I love the Paris hotel and have always wanted to stay, the week before Christmas though was very busy and at times difficult to navigate your way through the casino to get to your room but this wasn't a problem. we got a room rate of £37.50 per night which included breakfast every day. This consisted of $9 per person at either Nosh or java ... I recommend Nosh, you can get coffee and a muffin with a yoghurt for $9 which is enough to start your day, although if you prefer they do all sorts which include breakfast criossants etc..... Overall, fantastic stay, would definitely come back. Thank you Paris for a memorable holiday :)

Reviews.Title: “I expected more.”
Reviews.Author: Sylvia635
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was Okay but nothing more. Service was Okay and again nothing special. We were upgraded to a Red Room and I was sure glad we didn't end up in the blue room, because it can't be anything special. I would probably stay there again if the price was right, as the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but typical hotel”
Reviews.Author: thorpite
Reviews.Content: I had never been to Vegas before and went with a large group of people so we had a couple of rooms all on the same floor. Coming into the hotel and casino, the reception area is beautiful, lots of chandeliers and mirrors, very French. The casino itself was ok. I thought it seemed a little small and I didn't really spend any money there. The room itself was nice, but it was your standard hotel room. Our view was not facing the strip - I think we were overlooking a roof of another building so there wasn't much to see there. The bathroom was clean, room service was really nice and very helpful. We had three people in our room and had requested lots of extra towels and pillows and they certainly delivered. The stores in the hotel had a lot of cute decorative "Parisian" items for sale. Had breakfast one day at La Creperie and it was delicious. But there was a huge line and no where to sit, so we ended up bring breakfast back upstairs with us. It's like a walk up counter so don't rely on eating right there. Another day we had breakfast at Cafe Ile St Louis and it was good, but insanely overpriced for breakfast, but most food in Vegas was overpriced. The hotel is across the street from the Bellagio so it's convenient to go and see their fountain shows and next door are the Miracle Mile shops, where we spent a lot of time and money before heading to the airport. I thought it was in a good location, on the Strip, we were able to walk mostly everywhere we wanted to go. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We were going to make a day trip to the Grand Canyon that we didn't end up doing, but the front desk had very clearly explained how we could do it if we wanted. Depending on pricing, which varies all the time, I would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Dog stay Christmas week, awesome breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: Amy A
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paris the week of Christmas. We stayed there because they allow pets. They had a nice gift in our room when we arrived - two dog bowls, dog treats, and little poop picker-uper bags. The begatives were that you had to walk the dogs from your room elevator on one part of the hotel to the dog area located on the complete opposite side of the hotel - taking them all through the casino area. That is a little challenging in the mornings when they really have to go and the hotel has lamp posts and trees throughout it to make it look like streets in Paris and the poor things don't understand they are not outside! Additionally, the bathroom area is a small square patch of fake grass that smells like urine. It is literally about a 10 ft by 10 ft square. I would recommend pet owners choose to stay at the Paris instead if the pet accomadations are a large selling point for them, Also, the buffet at the Paris for brteakfast was by far the best. They have homemade crepes (as do some of the other hotels but they were nowhere near as good as the Paris') and they have meats and breakfasts from various provinces around France. The location too is much nicer than your standard buffet room.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be UPDATED!!!”
Reviews.Author: Melimae065
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 days over Christmas. I can honestly say that Harrahs owned Casinos in general need to definitely have a "Diamond member" Taxi line! The Hotel is beautiful. The rooms are terrible. The quality of their towels and sheets are a joke. They don't even have flat screens in their rooms. I mean come on it's Vegas people. You'd think they would atleast have flat screen televisions. The beds are VERY HARD to sleep on and CHEAP! I must say I've stayed at Holiday Inn Express back in Texas that is by far nicer than Paris Las Vegas. I won't stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Jay M
Reviews.Content: Great experience. The other guests seem European and upper middle class. Good value for money in terms of amenities. Not to mention, the restaurants and lounges that are worth frequenting. Staff is nice. Front office guys usually give out a room with a strip view if asked politely and if they have availability, for no extra charge. Since the property is closer to Venetian and Wynn properties, overall experience is much better on that side of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Paris in November”
Reviews.Author: Kendmv
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paris again. The rooms are in need of modernization. Tube tv's, old carpet, etc. Better than most Harrah's other properties but not a Wynn or Venetian.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Room, Fabulous Stay +++”
Reviews.Author: Pumpman2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel midweek before Xmas and we requested an upgrade $85 nite and was given the Giverny Suite on the 30th Floor. Not a great view but the room was fabulous. First we got a living room with a flat screen TV couch etc. The furnishings were fabulous and the wife wanted to take them home. The bed was king sized and ample with the upgrade mattress and all the fittings. There were two baths he and she. The mens bath had a wonderful shower with strong stream and two horizontal jets to hit you back. The womens bath had a jacuzzi tub, sitting area for makeup and a mirror for close ups. It has a long entryway into the room. Very classy and worth he upgrade. The hotel staff was great and accommodating. Lines were short we were here midweek. The Chateau nightclub was closed so we went over to The Bank at the Bellagio next door. We ate a couple times at the restaurants and they were good. Very nice Parisian setting. We went up to the Eiffel tower which is 1/2 scale the one in Paris. The hotel is centrally located with the Bellagio across and the planet Hollywood next door. There is a 1/2 price ticket outlet at Bills which is within walking distance. I hate they charge a lot for wireless. The hotels are screwing themselves as I just used my ipad on 3G. No money for you hotel. Its a ripoff for the wireless. We walked to the Bellagio and planet Hollywood, Ballys and Harrahs. Very central location. Overall this was a wonderful trip with a great hotel. Definitely recommend the upgraded room.

Reviews.Title: “Central location on strip”
Reviews.Author: LeannefiveO
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Paris and once again, we had a great stay. Upon check in at 1 am, the desk clerk was very friendly and offered us a room upgrade free of charge. My daughter and her family were placed in the room next door to us which was very convinient for all. We were pleasantly surprised to find our room had a perfect view of the Bellagio fountain. The room was adequate in size for a family of four with a shower and separate tub. The rooms were clean and we had extra towels and toiletries. The room elevators are literally around the corner from the lobby desk area...no wondering around casino floor looking for the elevators.
