The hotel's buffet at Le Village is one of the better buffets in Las Vegas. Our daughters especially enjoyed the Mile Mall next to the hotel. If you are looking for a great hotel conveniently located on the strip, we highly recommend the Paris Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Another great visit!”
Reviews.Author: lrichards51064
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got home this afternoon from a three night stay at the Paris. We booked a basic room and although not plush, it as much better than other "basic" rooms. The casino was not nealy as warm as other casinos as it was really cold outside. It was comfortable where others were very hot (Aria/cosmo). We ate at the burger restaurant near Ballys entrance and it was good but not fantastic. The slots and video blackjack were very tight so I went to Ballys frequently. we didn't eat at the buffet this time but I have had the breakfast buffet before and it was great! We also got a room with a view of the fountains with no extra charge!

Reviews.Title: “Paris week before Christmas”
Reviews.Author: Jay S
Reviews.Content: Vegas the week before Christmas was great. It was the quietest I have ever seen Vegas. We got a regular room with 2 doubles for 4 nights. $60 for 2 nights and $70 the other two. We asked about an uprade and it was $55 more for a room with strip view and $75 more for a red room. We just stuck with the regular room which was fine. The decor wasn't my favorite but it was clean and bathroom very large with seperate tub and shower. The pool was heated to a whopping 75* which was hardly tolerable, but my daughter enjoyed it. The pool is not very exciting this time of year. I can't imagine what it's like in the summer. The size of that pool has got to be way too small. Same with the 2 hot tubs. We are not fancy people so the restaurants were mostly something we passed on at the hotel. Planet Hollywood, Ballys and the Miracle Mile mall had more mainstream places that we great for a family (and much cheaper). The bufet at Paris must be good because there was always a long line. Check in was fairly quickly even though there were only 4 people working behind the desks. Checkout was done on the room TV and was easy. We wanted to go to the top of the Eiffel Tower but there was an hour wait and that wasn't going to happen with a hyper child. All in all, our stay was excellent, just not our type of hotel. We had no issues during the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and room”
Reviews.Author: TaraGMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a great hotel for the price and location. Pros: Red room view and bed, location in the middle of the strip and across from Bellagio fountains Cons: check in was super slow. Do the phone check out to save yourself some time. water pressure in shower was so strong it was painful. wine and beer glass in the hallway outside a door for the 2 days we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Grandeur”
Reviews.Author: zanzibar138
Reviews.Content: This was possibly the most beautiful hotel I've ever stayed at. It was completely over the top, from the massive chandeliers in the lobby, to the cobblestone paved 'streets' and painted murals to make you think you're outside. The room was plush with a beautiful marble bathroom. And the location was great, right in the middle of the strip, opposite the Bellagio fountains. However (and this could just be a Vegas thing), there was no sign of warmth or hospitality. I was in tears by the time we parked because I had no idea where to park or how to get there, and nobody gave us any help. We just about needed a GPS to find our way to the lobby and then our room, and it was a long hike with heavy suitcases. The guy at check in was cold and unfriendly. The crowds were insane and there were massive lines at every restaurant, no matter what time of day we walked past. This was the most expensive hotel we stayed at on our trip, and the only one that didn't offer free wifi. In the end I was glad we were only there for 1 night, and very happy to pack up and leave.

Reviews.Title: “C'est la vie!”
Reviews.Author: Lady_Canuck22
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Paris recently for three nights. Room was clean and just the right size. Excellent location on the strip. I would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Paris - Las Vegas (again!)”
Reviews.Author: MontereyDave01
Reviews.Content: If u are a regular visitor to Las Vegas, then it really makes a lot of sense to join your favourite casino's affinity program. We are members of the Total Rewards Program (Caesar's Entertainment, formerly Harrah's) and we decided to take advantage of a "bounce-back" email offer, for a comped and upgraded room at any one of the Caesar's Entertainment Casinos. We decided to try the Paris Hotel/Casino again. Making the reservations on the 800 number was easy and since we have a Total Rewards account number, they were able to find our email offer quickly and to our surprise, we even had some free casino cash available to use on the gambling floor. Be sure to arrange at check-in for all hotel food charges to be made to your room, because as u earn points on the gambling floor, u may earn enough points for your food charges to be comped. Another good idea would be to order a limo at the time u make your hotel reservations. It's $64 for a personal pick-up at the airport, it saves u time and u avoid having to stand in a long taxi line. The limo charge is added to your room charges and it's well worth it, just for the convenience alone! There is a lot to be said for a visit to Las Vegas in December. The weather is cool, the crowds are smaller, lines for even the best restaurants are short, there are plenty of open slot machines and card table seats and there are some extraordinary Xmas decorations and lights to enjoy. The hotel staff seem to go out of their way to be a little extra-friendly, a welcome change from a previous visit during the busy Summer season. Our comped, "Red Room" upgraded suite was large and very comfortable. We had a beautiful view of the Bellagio fountains and the Strip. The bathroom was huge with a jacuzzi-style tub and large enclosed shower. The bed was very comfortable and we liked the large screen LCD television and easy to use remote. Everything in the room appeared to be new or almost new. We balked about the $14.95 charge for the internet, so we didn't utilize this service and we were a bit annoyed at the petty $5.00 cost to use an internet kiosk, just to print out our departing boarding passes. But our biggest bother was the fact that even with a "do not disturb" sign hanging outside our door, the hotel maids congregated outside of our room to stock their carts, making a seriously amazing amount of loud chatter and noise at 8 AM. The casino is small by Las Vegas standards, while there appears to be a fair mix of slots and table games. Not that many years ago, we could play the slots for hours, some of the time using our money and some of the time using the casino's money. The days of extended slot play are officially over. During our entire time on the casino floor (4 days), including the time we spent next door at Bally's and at the Planet Hollywood, we never saw a single slot player win a "hand-pay." Not even the very minimal $1,200 "hand-pay." We brought the same amount of money that we always do, with the full understanding that no one comes to Las Vegas to win enough money to pay off their mortgage, but we used to get those mid-level "hits" now and then and that made the hunt for the elusive jackpot an exciting adventure. Now, there are no more exciting adventure on the gambling floor - u insert hundred dollar bill after hundred dollar bill into the bill acceptors and u NEVER win anything EVER. U write another check for a thousand dollars and that too disappears with nary a single mid-range "hit." It's simply no longer any fun to gamble at the slots like it used to be. There are simply NO winners and these painfully tight slots make a long day of gambling feel like tedious, grueling work. So, even though we earned significant tier level points towards our next comped visit, I think we will be gambling closer to home, at one of the many local California Indian casinos. Why go to all of the trouble of traveling to a Las Vegas casino, only to encounter the most incredibly TIGHT slots, that just kill any sense of adventure or excitement? This review has gone on far longer than I had intended, but I can't just end it without a recommendation to the Mon Ami Gabi restaurant. The food and service was excellent and if u go, be sure to ask for a seat outside (they have heaters) so u can see and hear the Bellagio fountains perform.

Reviews.Title: “OK experience”
Reviews.Author: mauisnj
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a conference for 3 nights in November. It's a good location and the rooms are clean and there are many amenities. There is shopping right across the street and next door. They also have a free shuttle to the other Harrah's properties. The service is not as good as it used to be here - but I believe the hotel is simply understaffed as seems to be a problem with many Las Vegas properties now.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: Alamink
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have remarked the "older" rooms are a bit tired and in need of upgrading. They do lack any sense of "French" character but overall clean and well serviced. We did ask for an upgrade as the hotel was quiet, being a weekday. Unfortunately, we were in front of a clerk who would fit well into the snobbier establishments. $55 was too steep for an upgrade (even though it included a continental breakfast) so we passed. For what the room lacked, the hotel itself made up for in spades. You did get the feeling of really being in Paris. We did visit many of the neighboring hotels and yes, whilst some were more modern ( Aria, Wynn) the Paris always felt welcoming to come back to. Tips: The older room may lack the view but do have a coffee maker and in our case an unstocked fridge. Both great, as with a quick trip to the Walgreens at the Pallazo, we were able to stock up on breakfast items and leave room for good dinners. The miracle mile next door is just great for lunch with really reasonable prices. The hotel is very central making it easy to walk to almost anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again anytime!”
Reviews.Author: ttknight
Reviews.Content: Came here for 30th wedding anniversary. Service, value were excellent! Explanation of Total Rewards would help. Lines move very well. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “December 2011 Paris weekend stay review”
Reviews.Author: Joe C
Reviews.Content: Valet was good. Check-in was fast and friendly. Found room easily. Standard room is nothing to get excited about. View of self-parking structure and back of Planet Hollywood. If we wanted view of Bellagio fountains it was $40 per night extra. Prices for rooms vary. Room has internet access which is not free. Tv was 26 inch tube, no flat screen. Very limited tv stations, no HBO, etc. Pay-per-view at around $12.99. Room service 45 minutes to an hour. No ventilation in bathroom. Tub and shower seperate, no light in shower. Floor is very slick. Beds were ok. Food was good. Buffet line as usual 30-45 minutes easily. Suggest cafes, etc. Also suggest getting Rewards Card when you first check in and use it everytime you gamble, then at resturaunts for some savings. Gaming layout could of been better. Slots layout was confusing. The amount would go from 1c, to 1 dollar, 5c to 25c and so on. Drink service while gambling in slots area slow. Are you a smoker? You will love it but it's Vegas right. You would think they could improve the overall air quality but the air was thick with smoke even in areas where there was no one smoking. If you are really sensitive to smoke I wouldn't recommend gambling there. Ballys was alittle better, Bellagio even better. All within maybe 5 minutes of each other if your walking. I have stayed at several different Las Vegas hotels over the years. In my opinion they need to update rooms, improve floor service and ventilation for smoke. Do your home work is final words. Do not rush to choose a Hotel or Casino. Joe C. Southern California

Reviews.Title: “Nice no resort fee choice but paper thin doors?!”
Reviews.Author: PinballSeeker
Reviews.Content: Pluses: centrally located. lots of food choices. no resort fees Minuses: Can hear EVERYTHING thru door. We've stayed at several hotels and generally when we had a complaint about external room noise, it was due to neighboring walls or ceilings. Interestingly though, we never really heard any neighbor or ceiling noise. However we were awoken both nights due to loud discussions, yelling and drunkeness in the hallway. Once the morons would enter their room, the noise would be negligible. I am a heavy sleeper and for something to wake me up at all once asleep is notable. For it to happen both nights means there is definately an issue. Aside from that odd issue, no other problems with the hotel. Hopefully you get lucky and get a hallway with people who arrive and go to sleep before you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel; Great View!”
Reviews.Author: Christie411
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Paris Las Vegas around five p.m. on a Friday evening. The registration area was very crowded, but we checked in within 10 minutes. Our room was located on the 20th floor with a great view of the Bellagio fountains and the Eiffel Tower. The room was quite large - with a king bed, loveseat, chair, and desk. The TV was housed in a large armoire with closets on the sides. There was no coffee pot in the room, but there was a minibar that charged for use. The bed was okay; more pillows might have helped. The bathroom was large with a glass shower separate from the tub. Counters were marble. Plenty of storage was available under the sink area. It was very chilly to get out of the shower with no extra heat available. The highlight of the room was definitely the view. However, the water show at the Bellagio was quite loud; sounding like a gun when the giant jets of water fell. The hotel is in a good location on the strip. Lots to do in both direction. We ate at the buffet and were not impressed with the service or the food. Self-parking was free but quite the hike to get to the room from the car. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Been there before and will keep going back”
Reviews.Author: Longmont_Mitch
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was large and well furnished. Parking is plentiful and free. I was disappointed to find that there was no airport shuttle - that meant I had to rent a car for the one night I was here. The location is great; the Paris is opposite Bellagio's and from there one can walk to Caesar's Palace without going outside. The buffet price in the pseduo-Parisian street has gone up a lot and is now expensive IMO, but we found 2 slices of pizza and a soda for a good price and that kept three young children happy. Beware, the cost of Internet access is expensive and it is per laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Trip”
Reviews.Author: Medic-548
Reviews.Content: This trip was with me and my wife, we were going to meet other couples in Vegas. The hotel was nice, the room, we got an upgraded red room with a view of the fountains of beligio and the Eiffel tower. The view was good, but the room it self was just ok. Valet was horrible. When we came in Fri night, the line was easy an half hour and wrapped around, not because they were full, but because they did not move cars in an efficient manor. Check in nice and smooth for our comp. Hotel areas were clean but nothing too fancy. If i was actually paying, dollar for dollar, Ballys is a better deal, but i am comped. One thing going for the hotel, is now the new club chateau Butterfly Club on Sat night is great, except for a few local losers.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixPhoenician
Reviews.Content: This is not a 4 star hotel. The rooms are very outdated, old Philips televisions, broken door handle, just not what you would expect from a 4 star hotel. Our first full day there, we left about 2pm to go out, got back about 7pm, room had not been cleaned. I called housekeeping to let them know and they asked if we were going out again, I said we were going out to dinner after 8pm, they said they would send someone up to clean, when we returned about 2am, guess what? The room had not been cleaned! The only reason any of this was bearable was we paid about 55.00 per night but if we paid any more, I would have been angry. With so many choices in Vegas, we will not be back to stay at the Paris. I think I read where the check-in staff were not the friendliest, it is true as well.

Reviews.Title: “Corner room with views and great service!”
Reviews.Author: jaye116
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze with a very nice young lady. All service staff very kind and helpful with a pleasant "hello". Rooms nice and had been updated. Very conveniently located on the strip to most everything. Food at the breakfast court was good. Napoleon's bar with the dueling pianos was the best thing in Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “Just O.K.”
Reviews.Author: RoseySudbury
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris from Dec.10 -17/11. We take 4-6 trips a year and have a good idea of what to expect. This was our second week long visit to Las Vegas this year. We flew West Jet out of Toronto.The flights were on time and seats comfortable.To us being able to watch "our" own choice of movie is always a bonus on a long flight. As always the flight attendants were friendly and attentive. We arrived late in the evening. Our room was not as requested and were offered to move the following day. We declined. We have tried the procedure in the past and felt we did not want to devote 1/2 day to a move. The resort was far from full and felt we should have had our king bed as requested. The male staff at check in was not friendly and offered very little information on the property. The room was a standard room. Small, dated and overlooked the parking garage. Stained carpet, tube t.v. with poor reception and chipped furniture was not what we had in envisioned when we booked what is advertised as a "Luxury" room. The walls are thin and we were awoken up numerous times by noise in the room next to us. If you are a light sleeper bring ear plugs. I must say. The Paris location on centre strip was great. The beds were very comfortable. The housekeeping staff was great. No resort fees was great too. The elevators are quick and we never had too wait more then a minute or two. Would we return. Not likely. There are so many other choices both on and off the strip. It was not bad. Just O.K.

Reviews.Title: “By far the best hotel for the buck”
Reviews.Author: jacobderosenoir
Reviews.Content: Review in point form - After visiting all the hotel on the strip, Paris came second after the Ceasar as the most impressive hotel. The ambiance is very different than other hotel (the New York and Venetian are close). The high ceallings the "old paris street" feeling and the staff makes the Paris one of the hotel where it didn't feel like we were in a Vegas Casino - The Staff was very responsive, polite and on the spot. Concierges are in demand in the morning so all your questions should be asked at night. - The Breakfast buffet in the morning is a must. Yes it's expansive but it's worth it for the ambiance AND the tasty food - Not many boutique. If you're the shopping type you will not find as many shops in the casino as other casino. But you're right next to the big Mall of the Hollywood Planet and 10 minutes walk away from the Ceasar's shops. - The pool is one of the less impressive we saw. We were there in december so we didn't mind but if you want a good pool area, the Belagio, Ceasar and Venetian are a way better choice. - GRAND CANYON TOUR - I have only one tip for you if you entend on going to the Grand Canyon on buses : RENT A CAR. If you go with a tour, you'll loose roughly 4 hours of waitings after other people or in lines to get things going and you'll be rushed if you go for the helicopter tour. Yes, the helicopter tour and the entrance fee will be a bit more expansive but you'll have control over your day and How you want to do things. I would have love to stay to take photo at dawn or dusk as these are the best photo you can take but if you go with a tour, forget it. IMPORTANT - Helicopter tour can make some poeple drowsy and you'll definitly be rushed all day long. We didn't do it and we felt we couldn't take the time we wanted to relax at each site (in 4 hours) - SKYWALK - It's a bit expansive for what it is. It's a fun experience but I was outrage when the didn't allowed me to bring my camera just to be able to sell me there f%@# photos. If you're on a tight budget, forget about it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence”
Reviews.Author: RIchard G
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while in Las Vegas. Loved it! Beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “What an experience!”
Reviews.Author: Steve V
Reviews.Content: First time in Las Vegas and threw a dart for a hotel...glad I hit the Paris! Very professional staff and the location is perfect to access almost any part of the strip by walking. Monorail is close by and runs up an down th strip but really doesn't help much unless you travel to the very north end by the convention center. Easier to walk to most places from the Paris' central locarion. Ate a few time at the Mon Ami Gabi....French style steakhouse with fabulous service and the best food I've had in years! Inside shopping/dining mall connects to Bally's which does have a nicer casino and the Jubilee Theater. (I wanted to see a real 'Vegas' show and was not disappointed). View from the room was spectacular. I could see most of the strip and the fountains at the Bellagio. Rooms are pretty regular but that's not what we went there for. I suggest they put coffee makers in the rooms. Nice to have a cup sitting in front of that view! They cater to Total Rewards Club members (membership is free and you can sign up as you check in) with great discounts and a nice coupon book. Altogether a wonderful experience and will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: MemoriesForever2
Reviews.Content: Our $80+ dollar room had barely enough room to walk around the beds and small table and chair. Beds were uncomfortable and not blankets and had small size pillows. The service was awful and employees non-service oriented. Their Christmas decorations were non-existant whereas other hotels were decorated absolutely beautifully. We stood in line at the lunch buffet for over an hour with only 15 parties ahead of us and the food was dried out and left alot to be desired for taste. Again it took forever to get our drink orders and dirty plates picked up. We will not be returning to this property as we definately did not get our monies worth as prices were sky high.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: amourdianer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my first trip to Las Vegas for three nights. The room was clean and comfortable. I got a standard king room. I was offered an upgrade to a red room for an additional $40 a night which I declined. How much time are you really spending in your room in Vegas? Not a lot if you are having a good time. All the staff I encountered were nice and friendly. The overall look of the hotel is nice with several great restaurants within the hotel. We walked to the monorail through Bally's. It probably would have been quicker to walk outside to get to it. Paris is in a great location and I will probably stay here again on my next trip to Vegas. Sign up for the Total Rewards card and book through that site for a good deal on the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: christeach2
Reviews.Content: The last few yrs that we have visited Vegas we stayed at Paris Hotel. We find the location fabulous with just the perfect size and location for us. We like that it connects to Bally's Hotel. The rooms are comfortable with elevators working promptly. The cost is always great with no resort fees like most other hotels have. You do have to pay for room internet though. We like the atmosphere of the hotel feeling as if you are in Paris or Quebec City! They always let us check in early, a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Worst staff ever.”
Reviews.Author: finebychristina
Reviews.Content: As far as location, it doesn't get better than Paris, however that's about the only thing Paris has going for it. The hotel is pretty from a far and seems fancy but it's nothing special when you actually spend time in the casino and restaurants. My real reason for giving this hotel only 1 star is because of the staff. By far the worst, unhelpful, rude, miserable staff I've ever encountered (and I'm from NYC)... The reception/front desk are not welcoming at all. They don't want to answer your questions and they just blow you off. The waiters and clerks all look like they're in pain working there and they never crack one smile. The only good thing, like I stated is the location. But for the same view and location, I would recommend staying at Planet Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Trying to get reservations...”
Reviews.Author: Tina C
Reviews.Content: Have been on hold for over one hour tonight, only to finally get to speak with someone at the hotel, and been told I have to call back tomorrow after 9 AM. In my opinion... this is simply unacceptable. The wait time to speak with someone is ridiculous, and then to be told they cannot help me and that I need to call back tomorrow AM, makes me very unhappy with the staff at Paris. Who has the extra time to sit on hold for over an hour to get info????

Reviews.Title: “Awesom Trip”
Reviews.Author: Mukesh1980
Reviews.Content: Although pleasant, the room was very dated and needs refurbing. The buffet for breakfast ($18.99 each plus tax) was understaffed and we were quite neglected when it came to service by the staff,we had to go and ask where are drinks were. The quality of food was very average. Didn't go back to that buffet. Their loss not ours. We found a lovely little cafe/restaurant in the mile of shops where you got breakfast cooked for you fresh at $5.95 including a drink.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: AmyLynn230
Reviews.Content: We are frequent visitors to Vegas, and though we can stay at any Ceasar's property for free, we really enjoy Paris. It is a perfect central location on the strip. The staff is always accommodating. The rooms are always clean and comfortable. It is small enough for me to navigate alone while my husband stays up late gambling, where some hotels are so big that I get lost (i.e. MGM). The restaurants there are top notch, and even the coffee is better than in other hotel coffee shops. We always enjoy a patio seat at Mon Ami Gabi to people-watch and enjoy the Bellagio fountains. If you're a Diamond Player, the best Diamond lounge is at Paris - Michael, Sal and the Team are amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: RBG81601
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 4pm on Friday November 18th. Line was long at checkin, but the hotel was hosting the Marine Corps Ball that evening so most checking in were Marines, and the line moved quickly and efficiently. Once at the counter it may have taken two minutes and we were on our way to the elevator. We were placed in a standard room on the 25th floor. No view to speak of, but the room was very clean, the beds were very comfortable, and the bathroom was very spacious - probably the best standard bathroom we have seen in Las Vegas! The entire stay was very pleasant and the property is well kept and easy to navigate. The casino is fun and the restaurants were great. We saw Jubilee next door at Bally's, which was the low point of the trip as it was such a cheesy show. We will happily stay at Paris again!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: artemon1
Reviews.Content: We have spent 3 days in "Paris" Las Vegas. Hotel is old and needs lots of renovations. Bedding and towels are very worn. Service is OK. Nothing special really. We spent most of the time in Venetian, Belagio and New City Center. However, Paris has much better deals right now, so it compensates.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, everything you need”
Reviews.Author: JLC-tripadvisr
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in the middle of the strip, and comes at a reasonable price. It was clean, the room was a decent size and no complaints about the service. Reasonable range of places to eat/ party including Chateau nightclub, and enjoyed the Paris theme. Other hotels nearby had a greater range of entertainment and dining but all within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Ooh La La”
Reviews.Author: johneotto
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were wonderfully surprised by the Paris Las Vegas hotel. While the Paris street theme of it's shops and casino edges was nicely done, it was the hotel's central strip location and $55 per day room upgrade that made our two-night stay in Las Vegas a memorable one. The upgrade included a room with a fabulous view (22nd floor overlooking the Eiffel Tower replica and the Bellagio fountains), a 5-8 PM evening "appetizer" buffet with two cocktails per person (a good meal for most, a great one for me) and a 7-11 AM continental breakfast, both served in a tastefully decorated concierge room on the 31st floor. About half the 12 tables or so were next to a window with a great view of the strip. We thoroughly enjoyed each of the four meals we ate here whether we had a window view or not. The concierge room was convenient, there were no lines, and we saved the money we would have spent in restaurants. Similar quality restaurant meals would have cost us more than the $110 we spent for the room upgrade. We would happily stay here again if the hotel offers a similar deal the next time we visit Las Vegas. Of course, if you're traveling with children or would like a lot more food choices than a small buffet can offer, this may not be the deal for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, if you like chintz”
Reviews.Author: Lynnep_Willerby
Reviews.Content: I couldn't really fault out stay other than that it was a bit chintzy for my liking but it was my fellas Birthday and he wanted to stay here so we did. Check-in was easy, check out was even better with the express option. View was of the back of another hotel but on a night it lit up like a Christmas tree so it wasn't too bad. Location was superb really, did the Village buffet twice for breakfast which was good. Overall an 8 out of 10

Reviews.Title: “Even Super 8 provides coffee makers in the room, but not Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Nancy W
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice in one week. The first time we were upgraded to a deluxe room that was very nicely renovated! The room had a wonderful king bed, nicely renovated bath, huge flat screen tv and a coffee maker in the room. The second visit, we were told that the room requested (king bed, nonsmoking) is only a request and that they were out of those rooms and were initially offered a queen smoking room. I asked to pay extra for an upgrade--not available, then continued until we were offered the handicapped room. It was a king bed, nonsmoking room, but was not a deluxe. The room and bath was spacious as it had to accommodate a wheelchair. The bed was not as nice as the "deluxe", but still of good quality. There was a large wet spot in the middle of the carpet of which I can only imagine- we put towels over it so that we could walk in our stocking feet and not get a soaking wet sock from God knows what. When I looked for the coffee maker, I couldn't find one, so I called the front desk and was told that the regular rooms didn't get coffee makers. I asked if I could have one brought to me and was transferred to housekeeping where I was told that I wasn't a ViP and therefore didn't deserve a coffee maker--unless the front desk approved it. I was transferred back to the front desk where I was told yet again that I wasn't a VIP and so they couldn't bring me a coffee maker, but that there was a coffee shop in the casino that I could buy coffee at. The entire feeling of the hotel is a bit worn and I'm sure they do this intentionally to get you to leave your room and go down to the casino. Room service is ridiculously uncharged, the tv reception is worse than if I used rabbit ears to get it myself, no coffee makers and the air-conditioning is horrible (but miraculously in the hallway outside the room its cool). Anyway, I've stayed at many different properties in Vegas and won't be staying here again--there are lots of hotels in the same price range that actually treat their guests as guests instead of a commodity to spend money in their casino. Also, as far as the casino goes--there are much nicer ones on the strip too!

Reviews.Title: “Great from the outside, falling apart on the inside”
Reviews.Author: gudgal
Reviews.Content: The Paris Hotel in Vegas had always brought a smile to my face. The Eiffel Tower on the Strip is such a beautiful land-mark. The casino floor with the quaint fake French village with cobble-stone streets and French baguette stores is so charming. That's it. Now turn-around and go stay at some other place. The location of Paris is great - close to the happening casinos - across from the Bellagio fountains. But the Hotel itself leaves much to be desired. The corridors and rooms look very dated and ill-maintained. The TV was a aged-looking CRT from the middle ages while the carpet, lamps and bed could have been used by Louis the XVIth's chamber maids. No wi-fi or complementary internet access either (remember this is 17th century Paris). May be it is a cunning plan to get you out of the room and into the casino. Stay away unless you have the doubloons to upgrade to a suite where I believe you get a strip view and presumably newer carpet.

Reviews.Title: “Walked miles with case from car park!”
Reviews.Author: j3tsetter
Reviews.Content: Stunning all round, I loved this place, the room, the bathroom, the view of the Eiffel Tower!!! Only complaints are... We walked miles with our cases, there must've been a better way to get to reception but there was no signs to tell us?! And fridge/aircon/heater rattling all night... Take earplugs! I would definitely stay here again. We got a free upgrade to a room with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good experience”
Reviews.Author: wintersux67
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Paris for 4 nights in December. Overall it was good. Being at the center of the strip the location is excellent. The room was clean and comfortable. With the hotel being over 10 years old some parts are starting to show the age. Paris does not charge resort fees so it is a 'pay as you use it' hotel. Some of the charges including a $1.25 for an outgoing local phone call seemed somewhat steep. The eating places can be a bit pricey as well. We tried breakfast and dinner at the Village Buffet and found there was wonderful variety and great service. Well worth paying the $$. Definetly would stay there again. Can't beat the location!

Reviews.Title: “The look and feel of a Parisian neighborhood.....”
Reviews.Author: gilmccarthy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Paris Casino twice, stayed next to it at Bally's twice and stayed near it once at MGM. I kept on coming back to the "Village Walkway" (my term: a long snaking boulevard with movie studio visuals of Grand Old Paris) replete with a bakery, cheese shop, sandwich creations, pizza, a cafe, and a restaurant (with typical french waiters), and enough atmosphere to take you for a mental ride. It is a bit like a Montmartre of old at night with muted lighting and shadows. They have a nightclub called Napoleons that has at least 12 great beers on tap. This is special in Las Vegas as it can be quite difficult to order a robust glass of quality draft beer. It is way cheaper for casinos to sell bottled beer. The entire experience at the Paris Casino is geared toward a French reality, but without a Disney atmosphere. The entertainment was way too exciting for this child of the sixties. They had an a Capella foursome that sang just like Smokey Robinson and the Miracles! They would then change up to the Temptations and I would continue singing with them and I didn't stop until they took a break. I have seen the original Temptations and these guys were perfect in their tribute. The casino was a casino except that the presentation of being in France continued everywhere you walked. Statues, fountains, screens, plants and a very large indoor tree all added to the effect of taking you to a Parisian neighborhood. It was soothing rather than jarring. I visit Las Vegas at least once a year and I have never missed visiting this hotel and spending time enjoying the food and entertainment when I was there.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great location, horrible gaming.”
Reviews.Author: sl73703
Reviews.Content: We went in April for our 20th anniversary, so this is a little late. At check in there was a line, and because we were celebrating, I went to the nearest bar to grab us drinks. One rum and coke, one screwdriver, both doubles in tall glasses, $45. I about dropped my teeth. But we were celebrating so oh well. At check in though, we upgraded to a bigger room and got a beautiful suite and the girl helping us was fabulous. We had dinner at Mon Ami Gabi, and it will always be one of my favorites on the strip. We go there every time we visit. Down side was gaming was horrible, and one afternoon we had the misfortune of eating at the Sugar something, the new one, and at a table next to one of the owners. At first we were stoked, great atmosphere, music, staff.... Then he started. He complained through our whole meal, at the staff, about the service, ruined our dinner. If I had been anyone on his staff, I'd have clobbered him and then quit because he so deserved it. Arrogant. So we won't ever go in there again. So, the location is great, gaming was bad, staff was nice, stay away from Sugar whatever, and don't order drinks when your not gaming.

Reviews.Title: “all you need in one center location”
Reviews.Author: Smitty53
Reviews.Content: Paris Hotel/Casino is excellent. It is located in the center of the strip and with all the walking you can do that is a great advantage. The hotel is spotlessly clean in all areas. The casino floor is layed out for anyone to know where to go and what they want. the restaurants are excellent as are the rooms. The best quality is the superb customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Would love to go back to Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Rae A
Reviews.Content: Had a quick one-night stay at Paris Las Vegas that was comp'd thanks to Harrah's points. I was traveling with family who had been to Las Vegas before, but this was my first time, so we tried three different hotels. I loved the Paris and will definitely return. I enjoyed the decor of the casino and public areas. Check in went smoothly, and it's only a short walk from the main desk to the hotel elevators. The room was easy to find. Our room was a Standard Luxury with two queen beds and a lovely view of the parking garage (for just one night I wasn't complaining). The room was clean and comfortable and honestly, average. Internet was an extra charge. The bathroom was extra large with a separate shower and tub. Bath amenities included two soaps and "White Tea" shampoo, conditioner, lotion, and shower gel. We used express checkout by dropping a form into one of the collection boxes scattered near the elevators and front desk area. My best tip for Paris Las Vegas is to have the breakfast buffet. It was really good and I'm still thinking about it nearly a month later! Made to order crêpes, omelets, poached pears, eggs Benedict, roasted cherries, fresh pastries, sausages and potatoes several ways ... it was a delicious buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Fourth visit to Paris in 2011”
Reviews.Author: ariztraveler_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed 11/29 to 12/3.This was our fourth visit to Paris this year. The casino area is not as large as others but crowds are not large either. Previous stays we had a Red Room Premier this time we were only given a Premier. The difference is the Red Rooms are updated and have flat screen TVs, the room this time had a tube 32" TV and the furnishings look like they have been there from the '90s. I recommend to get a upgrade to a Red Room. We ate at Mon Ami Gabi (breakfast and dinner) the food was very good.especially liked the Lemon Skinny Pancakes. Had dinner at Eiffel Tower with a table over looking the strip and had great service from Valentino Crespo. One other night we ate at Le Provencal and the had a Special $29.99 we had a 3 course and we got a glass of wine.

Reviews.Title: “More 3 star than 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Neville1951
Reviews.Content: Although pleasant, the room was very dated and needs refurbing. The buffet for breakfast ($18.99 each plus tax) was understaffed and we were quite neglected when it came to service by the staff,we had to go and ask where are drinks were. The quality of food was very average. Didn't go back to that buffet. Their loss not ours. We found a lovely little cafe/restaurant in the mile of shops where you got breakfast cooked for you fresh at $5.95 including a drink.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the strip.”
Reviews.Author: wrinklieBrighton
Reviews.Content: We booked a short break through British Airways and were not sure what to expect. The location is perfect if you just want to 'do' Las Vegas being about dead centre of the action. We checked in early evening and there was a bit of a que but we got served quite quickly and staff were friendly. Room was a standard suite and a good size with all that you need with a sofa, chair, desk and king size bed. The only surprise was the old fashioned TV set not a modern LCD as you expect these days. We would have liked a coffee maker in the room. The bed was very comfy and the room was just the right temperature throughout our stay. It was quite and we were not disturbed either by internal or external noise. There are loads of shops and dining outlets in the hotel, as well as a casino. We dined twice in the Mon Ami Gabi restaraunt and were very impressed by high standard of service and quality of food at a reasonable price. It is lovely to sit in the window looking out towards the Belagio and the dancing fountains. We asked for a late check out and were given until 1300 instead of 1100 at no extra charge. The hotel porter will store your luggage at no charge if you need. Overall this was a very good stay and we would recommend Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SunnyDTraveler
Reviews.Content: Paris has a great location in the middle of the strip. The gambling area is a little small, but Bally's gaming area is not too far away if that is important to you. It was nice that the hotel is not too set back from the street, so it is easy to get to the Strip. If you use the monorail (I did not), there is a metrorail stop for Bally/Paris. Also, if you want to see Jubilee, the theater is in Bally, so that is within walking distance as well. Last, the interior has cobblestones like Paris, which makes it more fun then walking through the casino floor at other hotels in the strip to get to your hotel room. There are a lot of dining options within walking distance, which is also nice. As for the hotel room itself, I got a luxury room, which was pretty much a standard hotel room, say like in a Hilton or Doubletree. I found the mattresses a little bit on the hard side, I also felt the pillows were a bit hard. The room was definitely smoke-free as promised and the bathroom clean and well maintained. The bathroom had a separate shower area and tub area, however, I felt that shower area was pretty small, so would have rather it been the usual tub with shower. The toiletries were nice as were the towels. A refrigerator (empty) was provided, but there was a warning label on it about being charged for moving anything inside it, so we erred on the safe side and did not use it. The TV was a CRT not LCD, but the channels came in fine. The check-in line was long, but went quickly as they efficiently checked people in. I had reserved only 2 days and called down to extend my stay by one day, which was easily done. Altogether a good stay and a good value for visiting Las Vegas. The LeVillage Buffet was great, but the lines were usually a 30-40 minute (if not an hour) wait. You can do the Buffet of Buffets pass which allows for 24 hours of buffets for $49 (or $45 for Total Rewards members). This was a good value, but one needs to be patient in waiting in those lines.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it”
Reviews.Author: MoreFFmiles
Reviews.Content: We got an excellent price for the Paris. The room wasn't quite ready when we arrived but that was okay - the room was ready within an hour. We were offered the option to upgrade to a recently renovated RED room but we declined. We were offered the option to upgrade to a Strip view but we declined. We got a very *very* good last minute rate and we were thrilled to use the savings on some nice dinners and wines - not on a guest room we weren't planning to spend much time in. So, we had a not yet renovated room and yes, it showed some very minor signs of age but absolutely nothing to complain about. I think the trick is to align your expectations with how much you are spending. If you really want the very latest and most modern decor, there are more expensive options available. This is just such an excellent location. Some of the food and beverage options in the hotel look a bit sad but who cares when you've got City Center and The Bellagio across the street. Given another a good price on the Paris, would definitely return. No resort fees - that is nice. The room was very quiet and we slept very well.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Breakfast Ever”
Reviews.Author: ukeasytraveller
Reviews.Content: Had five nights in the Paris Hotel Las Vegas, we chose this Hotel because of the free buffet breakfast, the breakfast offered was in another Hotel which was 10 minutes walk, at the reception we were given a voucher for $9 to spend on the breakfast, the coffee cost $3.50 in a cardboard cup and the blueberry muffin (we counted 2 blueberrys) $4.00. we had to queue for ages and still could not get a seat, worst breakfast we have been to. We complained to the Reception at the Paris but as we booked the hotel thru Expedia they would not help us at all even though we asked if we could spend the voucher towards breakfast within the Paris Hotel. Spoke to Expedia and they were not aware breakfast was not being served at the Paris. Expedia are dealing with our complaint satisfactory. We would not recommend the Paris even though it is in a good position on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Location and environment”
Reviews.Author: Neil S
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Vegas many times and as a middle of the road traveller, we find Paris to be a great value and location. Not over the top and it is close to major strip sights. Mon Ami Gabi is a great restaurant and the casino area is a great middle between the high and lower end casinos. The rooms are very nice and we found the staff to be professional and helpful. Enjoy without having to leave too much!

Reviews.Title: “Paris is okay”
Reviews.Author: 09202011h
Reviews.Content: Another of the many Harrah's properties, Paris offers very nice rooms and a good variety of dining venues. It was difficult for me to gamble there because air circulation is not good in the casino and smoke can be stifling. The nice part is to be able to stay in the same building and walk through to Bally's, which has a fun casino. We had a lovely room because they upgraded us to a suite, but it needed refurbishing.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: headraccoon
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a quick trip to Vegas. This is my second time to stay here. This time I had a room overlooking the Belliago fountains. That was just great to see. My room was extra clean and everything was in working order. I won one day at the casino but gave it all back. I'll have to say the casino floor staff is the friendlest anywhere. They were all so nice. The drinks were always available. We ate at the steak house and it was fantastic. Service was great in an informal manner. I don't like stuffy waiters. The cafe was enjoyable and the breakfast meals were fine. I really like the location of Paris Las Vegas. I'm not much on walking long distances but this hotel is close to everything and is connected to Bally's. I will stay here again and thanks to all the employees for being so nice.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: msabrown
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Paris Casino and Hotel November 18-21, it was awesome experience. We really enjoyed everything about the hotel. I thought it was neat to have it adjacent to Bally's. Bally's and Paris are separated by a shopping pavilion. It was really nice, and they have a cool burger and bar place in Paris that my husband and I had late night dinner. I would highly recommend Paris to anyone.... I can't wait until next year when we go back. Also, I used my total rewards casino card and I got 3 nights for 180.00

Reviews.Title: “Paris has seen better days”
Reviews.Author: Rio77
Reviews.Content: I'm not saying it was horrible or anything, but it really seems like this hotel has gone downhill a bit. The wood on the bathroom vanity was broken and peeling off, and as others said the rooms are pretty outdated. I also thought it was pretty lame that you have to pay for WIFI as a guest. I understand that they probably wouldn't want everyone in the casino using it, but I've stayed at other hotels where an access code is issued to paying guests.

Reviews.Title: “Paris, oui, oui!”
Reviews.Author: CajunKimo
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite hotels in which to stay in Las Vegas. Check-in has always been fairly quick and the front desk staff have been quite cordial. In fact, on my recent visit, the woman checking me in was from Louisiana and she noticed that I was also from Louisiana, so she took the time and searched for an upgrade for me even without me having to ask. I was booked into a great room with a great view of the strip. The rooms are roomy and have always been very clean. The beds are comfortable and the lighting in the room is sufficient. The elevators are fairly quick - just be sure to take the right ones for the right floors. I've seen a number of people get on the wrong elevator - although it is clearly marked. The casino here is a good one with a varitey of games. Take the ride on the Eiffel Tower - day or night the view is great. Restaurants are varied to different tastes and budgets. Check-out was a breeze. This hotel is in a great location on the strip - pretty much in the middle of everything. Looking forward to my return trip there.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade?”
Reviews.Author: confusedtraveler
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Paris Hotel every year for a conference. The location is great and is convenient. We upgraded to a red room because when we have stayed in the past, the rooms seemed pretty shabby and outdated. Plus, these red rooms offer a flat screen TV, but they don't offer a wide variety of channels. The new red padded head board bed was very comfortable. It was one of the most comfortable hotel beds I have slept in. The rest of the room didn't seem too updated, other than a new couch and ottoman at the foot of the bed. I don't think it was worth the extra money, however, because it was still a basic hotel room with no extras and is standard at any good hotel now. It was preferable to the old rooms, though, but I don't think it was worth the extra cost. It should be their standard room. They should update all their rooms to this level so that they can compete with all the beautiful new hotels opening up on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Tired feel”
Reviews.Author: Ceilings
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay in a standard King ,It was clean and quiet. However when you look a little closer at the rooms and facilities ,it is all looking a little worse for wear ! We have stayed in many Las Vegas hotels our expectation was a 4 star hotel (not to sure it is ?) On the positive side the check in was the easiest we have experienced in Las Vegas ,the room comfortable and quiet. It did have a TV (old tube one) ,limited channels, very expensive wi fi and expensive cost for using a small fitness center ,I guess they want you gambling ! Not to sure we would stay here again ,we have had much better experiences at MGM Grand and Mirage. You certainly are not short of choice in Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but a little pricey.”
Reviews.Author: Naples96
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, clean with exceptionally friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas baby!!”
Reviews.Author: LouisaG08
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent & were very caring . I really enjoyed my stay and plan on going to Vegas again ...

Reviews.Title: “Great upgrade, terrific views!”
Reviews.Author: IdaBoulder_CO_USA
Reviews.Content: Our Thanksgiving get-away at Paris was really wonderful! We took the room upgrade and to our very pleasant surprise, it included a great continental breakfast and appetizers in the evening. Our tastefully decorated room was large with a picture-window view--especially wonderful at night when all lit up--of the Eiffel Tower and Bellagio across the street. The location was perfect for walking, taking the monorail, or the public bus which stops right in front. We will make Paris in Vegas a Thanksgiving tradition!

Reviews.Title: “Paris in the middle of madness”
Reviews.Author: thehej
Reviews.Content: Hotel was a choice in a package . Who doesn't love Paris ? This is in the middle of everything , much shopping and many restirants . The mon ami is great for breakfast and people watching ... Sit outside ! The food , staff and service are the best . Review by a non lasvegas/ gambler type . Went for art, architecture, photo ops and cirque shows.saw o and love ... Cirque is true artistry and heart healing .

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not Great”
Reviews.Author: stellkax
Reviews.Content: I guess it all depends on what you expect from the hotel and may be I expected too much... Why I gave it 3 stars: 1. If you have lots of luggage and you don't want to drag it through all hotel from parking garage to registration and then to your room, then you have to drive to the front of the hotel and get the luggage person to unload it for you and give you the ticket. This person expects at least $5 tip. Then you get to your room and call Bell Captain to get the luggage to your room and here goes another $5 as it's going to be a different person bringing your luggage. The similar thing happens when you depart hotel. We had to wait for our luggage at least 20 minutes and we've been there when hotel had a slow time. 2. The hotel did not do a good job on creating an actual atmosphere of Paris. If you have never been to Paris, it's OK, but if you went there at least once, everything will look and feel very fake. 3. Hotel has very old plumbing, at least our room had. The toilet is the cheapest you can buy at HomeDepot and got stuck after the first serious use. The shower like that is not being used in France for good 20 years now. I could not even move the shower head up or down or side to side. 4. No coffee maker in the room, which is very inconvenient, but I understand that hotel wants to make money even on coffee and tea. 5. The rooms have wall paper and our room had several places with torn wall paper, which made bad impression.

Reviews.Title: “4 night stay over Thanksgiving”
Reviews.Author: Grumpyoldsoandso
Reviews.Content: Our room was very good, large and in the main clean. We asked for a quiet room. Advised that there is a new 'Paris nightclub' and therefore noise and strobe type lights could be a problem if you are senitive to noise at night - which I am. The room overlooked the back parking lot but also showed quite a good view of the strip surrounding the hotel. The queues to get into the Buffet were horrendous! Approximately 150 people waiting. We only managed to eat in the restaurant on 1 occasion and although only 7.30 pm at night, the popular sweets were not replenished, the vegetables were very hard and overall the food was luke warm. Very disappointing - glad we didn't join the long queues earlier!! This hotel is right in the heart of the strip - so for first timers would be very exciting.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: clyde p
Reviews.Content: Had a reservation 4-mon in advance & added red room upgrade & view of the strip, I thought.When checking in, the woman at desk, Jeanna, said I have no view and thats another $55.00/nite.The second I showed I was upset over this, Jeanna, said I will pull your call.If you keep raising your voice I will call security and pull your call.I kept asking what does that mean. That means cancel your room and have security remove you.She started to call security & said either accept or go elsewhere This was Thanksgiving weekend. Management said sorry, did nothing & offered nothing.Never stay there again.Very nasty people.

Reviews.Title: “There are cooler options”
Reviews.Author: serval_girl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights. First impression-shuttle drops you off far from reception so you have to drag your luggage through the casino. It is a pretty, and non-tacky casino, but really, most these days are leaning towards class rather than trashy lights. Check in was a breeze. The room is basic, kind of boring really. You could have told me I was at a Quality Inn in Cleveland and I would have believed you. It is attached to Bally's so that adds to the number of places to eat/drink etc without leaving the hotel. The food was hit or miss. Mon Ami Gabi was delightful and I highly recommend their chicken brie and apple crepes and getting a table outside. They were very attentive there and it was the best view. I ate somewhere else at Paris (name escapes me), got oily escargot stuffed mushrooms topped with soggy bread (the hands down worst escargot ever) and a tuna sandwich that I could not eat because it was clearly not sashimi grade and was so fibrous and chewy, yuck. The pool area is large, the hot tubs are some distance from the pool which in theory is nice because it is quiet and secluded. BUT the hot tubs were old and cracked, there was mildew, and the second day I used it I was left feeling itchy and an odd almost sewer smell to my skin. They need to be replaced. I don't gamble (I am a grad student and too broke!) but I did play some slots. The waitress girl kept the drinks flowing because I was tipping her. Her outfit was worn with a visible tear, I felt bad for the girls working there when elsewhere they had much nicer outfits. Entertainment was lacking. Went to the nightclub and it was okay. There were no shows there that I was aware of (I went to Mandalay for Lion King). The Eiffel Tower is pretty, but Bellagios water show blows it out of the water. On that note-go to Bellagio and get a great shot of the tower during the water show. So would I stay there again? No, unless you get a good deal (under $100 and I would consider). There are too many choices in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: mcbarkr
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a Red Room on the 28th floor. The rooms are smaller in size, but done very well, with large flat-screen tv and very nice bathrooms with separate glass shower. The carpeting was clean, rooms were in very nice condition. The hotel is quiet and clean. The casino isn't the most exciting on the strip, but it is one of the best themed properties; you really feel like you are in Paris. Close to everything, Bellagio across the street, Planet Hollywood to the south, connected directly to Bally's. Very good location. Affordable food choices, one of the best buffets in Vegas with all-you-can-eat crab legs.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are outdated; bedding worn and unkempt; restaurant service is poor; food mediocre”
Reviews.Author: autumnsonata
Reviews.Content: There is no bedspread or comforter, just a sheet. Mattresses are sagging. Dust ruffle wrinkled. Pillows uncomfortable. Service in restaurants is awful. I won't be back

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, GREAT Staff”
Reviews.Author: VenturaTraveler13
Reviews.Content: Following the advice in this column, we asked for and received a nice upgrade to an upper floor room overlooking the Ballagio and its dancing fountains. Room was large, clean and airy. A bit more thought could go into the serviceable but dull furnishings. The bathroom was large and clean. Room to room noise was very low until the last (of three) nights when we could hear the TV blaring next door. The remarkable thing about this hotel was the staff. From the valet who met us at arrival to the valet who packed us up to go home, every member of the staff we encountered was smiling, friendly, helpful -- "Welcome to the Paris. What can I do to make your stay more enjoyable?" . . . And I mean everybody. We asked directions of a security person. Rather than pointing across the casino floor, she said, "here, let me show you," and led us to our destination. Other than the dull furnishings, the only other critique I have is that everything is expensive, there is no bottled water in the room and paper coffee cups sit next to the in-suite coffee maker. Tacky for a property of this calibre. We ate at the Mon Ami Gabi. Very good food. Pasta way overcooked, but sauces and meat delicious. We also ate at the Le Artistes Steakhouse. Probably the best piece of prime rib we've ever had in a banquet setting. Both restaurants very good, both expensive. There is a small pastry shop between the hotel lobby and the elevators. Absolute killer sweets. Could have gone through a dozen of their cheese danish. But, again, expensive. One roll and a small coffee -- $9.00. Gotta say, well worth it. Overall: Better than I expected and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “C'est Magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: jaison_lives
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Paris during the week of Thanksgiving. Its sure to become my new holiday tradition. The customer service throughout the hotel was exceptional. My room was nice and always clean.The elevators are fast, which is important in such a large hotel. The food at all of the dining venues especially The Sugar Factory was a wonderful experience. The hotel itself was absolutely beautiful, they covered every detail to make you feel as if you were really in the city of lights. I can not wait to return for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jwn30
Reviews.Content: Loved the ambiance, felt like we're in France :)) Check in was excellent, maybe we're not in the weekend. Our room was clean, smell fresh, and the bed & pillows were really comfy. The staff was nice and helpful. The restaurants were just great. Great location and close to everywhere. Overall realy loved...loved to stay here! Would highly recommend to anyone !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: missymoo85
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at a couple of other hotels on the strip and this is our favorite. The location is perfect, right in the centre of the strip with easy access to lots of other hotels and attraction. The rooms are really good, very clean and spacious and the bed was very comfy. We had room service for breakfast one of the mornings which was lovely and it came really quickly! The hotel has lots of great restaurants and shops and the casino is one of our favorites with a good choice of slots etc. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Weekend”
Reviews.Author: ajgm
Reviews.Content: This was our 6th visit to Vegas and our first time at Paris, and we will return to this hotel! Rooms were very tastefully decorated, and what a great view! This hotel is right in the heart of the strip. The pool and dining options were top notch.

Reviews.Title: “I was pleasantly surprised and have never been so thrilled to be "stuck" in Paris”
Reviews.Author: materielgrrl
Reviews.Content: I was supposed to stay next door at Ballys but my reservation was messed up and this was the only hotel in Harrah's chain with a room. I resisted because I was told the only rooms they had available were smoking, then gave in when I realized the sun was coming up and my options on a busy Saturday night were limited. I'm actually glad to have to schlep over from Bally's to Paris. First off the staff at the front desk at Paris were much friendlier than what I got 90 min before at Bally's. I wish I remember the gentleman's name (funny how we can remember the people who tick us off, but not those who made things considerably better). When I checked in I explained my aversion to smoking (I was there to give a presentation) and he found me a non-smoking room on a "pet friendly" floor. First, who knew? If I ever have a pet and want to bring it to Vegas or know someone who does, I'd tell them about Paris!. I took the room, the floor was quiet, and most important, the best was comfortable and slept until early afternoon. They were also very good about giving me a late checkout since I checked in so early that same morning. Besides the bed the best thing about the room was the bathroom, very nice, marble tub and shower, very nice relaxing shower with two shower heads. The worst things about the room were the furniture, taking american oak and making it into french style furniture is not french furniture; it's oak carved and styled to look like french furniture. And the view. The worst view of any hotel I've ever stayed in in Vegas. My view was of Bally's. Oh, well, it was a room with a comfortable bed and nice bathroom. For a business trip and begging for a room close to Bally's for the night, I can't complain too much. The best thing about being "stuck" in Paris was walking around the casino and finding out what was there. First, the sports bar by the check in serves the best champagne of any of the establishments in the casino. It's just Ste. Michele, but it tastes the best to me compared to Roger or the house champagne in Mon Ami Gabi. I'm one of those people who actually watch the casino channel to learn about the casino and sometimes I read the magazine. I read an interview with George Wallace who said he ate at Mon Ami Gabi for the great food (strip steak and pom frites) and people watching. He's right. I would love to stay here again on business and if I was stuck anywhere else nearby, I'll be back in Paris to walk the casino and eat in the restaurants. This is also not such a bad hotel or location for families. I rather enjoyed myself.

Reviews.Title: “Buffet breakfast room was dirty, we had poor service, and its expensive.”
Reviews.Author: Lottiloo
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews we went here for breakfast, it was hideous! Hugely expensive, long wait, dirty tables and floor, under staffed, plastic glasses, poor lighting. It's simply not what you expect to find in US. Bellagio same money and outstanding in every aspect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ivy54321
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Paris Hotel and it was very clean. The hotel has a great location and good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Not Paris....”
Reviews.Author: Wilma58
Reviews.Content: We were attending a small 50th birthday group event (hotel chosen by others). I would not recommend this hotel to anyone that wants a modern room. The rooms are old, even though we ended up being upgraded to a "Red Room" which are to said to be the "upgraded rooms". Upgrading means that a flat screen tv was put into the otherwise old tv furniture stand and a red padded headboard replaced the wooden ones found in the other "non-upgraded rooms". Others in the group ended up staying at the Vdara...and let me tell you something, while the Paris is in a nice location on the strip, there are many nicer places to say like the MGM Signature and the Vdara to name a few. Casino is tight; buffet lacks. Explore your options..find exactly what you want. The Paris is probably not it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 4crest
Reviews.Content: Paris Las Vegas has an excellent location...walking distance to the mall next door and other restaurants close by. I like the restaurants on this hotel as well and the buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Paris.”
Reviews.Author: beachlvrm2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris Hotel for four nights and thought the Hotel was very nice. I had booked the least expensive room and was a little worried after reading the reviews. No worries,the room was really nice ,no wallpaper peeling from the walls ,no dirty worn carpet, no chipped furniture but did have an old tube style t.v. but I really didn't care about the t.v. The bathroom was lovely and the beds were very comfortable,we also had a refrig. in the room,I was pleased. The location is great and I liked that the Casino isn't all that big. All in all, I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but a little dated & rough-around-the-edges”
Reviews.Author: brodertr
Reviews.Content: Went there for a recent conference. Check-in: Jenny very helpful. I had upgraded to the next level room and she warned about noise from club that goes into the wee hours. So, reassigned me to another room. However, this was back to the STANDARD room and she didn't reduce the rate! Fortunately, after going back and complaining about the quality of the room, Casey did reduce the rate. I guess to get a view, you gotta take the noise AND pay extra. The room: basic, basic, basic. More in line with a 90's Holiday Inn. Small cathode 24in TV, poor movie choices ( maybe they want u in the casino instead?). A real surprise - the Mini bar was empty. Called to get it stocked (oversight?) and was told they no longer supply or stock minibar but "you can store your personal stuff free of charge". What, the $3 Pepsi's from the lobby? The bathroom big,nice - sort of out-of-place for the rest of the room. Comfy bed, over-whelming number of pillows. Room service - fast, tasty, efficient and friendly. And a beef - $14 a day, per device, for Wifi? You gotta be kidding me. Thank God my iPad has 3G. I can overlook the dinged-up bathroom vanity, the missing trim on the closet/TV stand. But the rooms had a 'run-down' feel to them. Perfect as a 'get-in, sleep, get-out-and-do-Vegas' place but not much more. I hope the suites are better. Maybe I need to lower my standards. Stayed ay Encore, eat at Belliago's and Ceasars (see reviews) and can't wait to go back every time. But overall, didn't meet my expectations of a major theme-resort on the Vegas strip.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Ronnie17
Reviews.Content: Room was very pleasant. Clean and beds comfortable (maybe a bit hard). Bathroom was clean and a decent size. Had a room with 2 queen beds and a view of the pool area. There is some noise that you can hear from the club below at night. It was not so evident on week days, but weekends were a bit loud. If you stay on this side, you may want ear plugs. I slept on the bed further away from the window, so I didn't hear it as much. The good thing is you are so tired when you hit the bed, that once you fall asleep, you hear nothing! I lkked that you can easily walk to Harrah's from inside the casino. We were there for a workshop and I must say, the hotel did a terrific job with food service at the conference. I also like the shops. Very pleasant. The crepe shop is delicious!!! Hotel staff were helpful and courteous. If you chose to stay here, you are right in the middle of all the casinos, making it very convenient to visit up or down the strip. I was surprised at how many visitors were there! You couldn't tell there was a recession by looking up and down the strip! (though they do have their fair share of street performers and homeless people). Don't go to Vegas thinking that you will win a millon! No one from our conference won anything! But we did have a good time and enjoyed the shows and food! I would stay at Paris again...though I don't think I will be visiting Vegas for a while!

Reviews.Title: “We just had another great stay at the Paris! We always enjoy staying here!”
Reviews.Author: ladywp
Reviews.Content: The Paris to me has a little more class and is directed more to the adults! We’ve met the nicest dealers here! The drink servers are excellent, friendly and always coming by while you play the slots. If you like loud music and go-go dancers while you play Blackjack go across the street to the PH (Planet Hollywood)! Vegas always has something for everyone! Walk through the Paris to Bally’s and then outside on to Bill’s and O’Shea’s. O’Shea’s is great for people wanting to learn the games and everyone is learning and having fun together. There is so much central to the Paris to do! Walking the other direction is the PH and its attached Mall. It’s easy to visit all these locations and pop back to your hotel room in no time! What really keeps us going back to the Paris is: our reservations are always correct! The service at the front desk is fast and everyone there is so friendly. The concierge is always helpful and pleasant! The rooms are clean, comfy beds and secure rooms. No overwhelming room cleaners or over-the-top febreze like freshener, just PLAIN CLEAN! They have wifi in the rooms for an hourly/daily/weekly rate, you pick, that for the convenience is well worth it to us. If you are a cheap charlie the coffee shop has free wifi and hopefully you like coffee and people overlooking what you type or who you are talking to! The pool is lovely with lots of space, chairs, and natural shade! The room service is excellent! At the end of each day you can relax in the quiet of your room, and the rooms are quiet!! No room parties or situations that allow 10 girls to stay in one room, as we’ve experienced elsewhere! (with the added screaming, crying, drunk, yelling, barfing in the hallways…..lol) A good rest gets you ready for another great day in Vegas! ☺ Unless you enjoy having Vegas Syndrome then I could recommend another hotel for you….lol. PS - If you get a room with the strip view you have an awesome display each day of the Bellagio water fountains! and the lights of the strip at night are a wonderful site. It really puts you in the Vegas mood! Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: dtboomer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the Strip in the middle of the action. The hotel is connected to Bally's so the services for both resorts are available. The room was very nice and housekeeping did a good job. The staff were friendly and helpful. The casino was ok, but as with almost all the strip casino's the table games are overweighted to the house. Blackjacks only pay 6-5. The wife plays the machines and thought they were very tight. If you want to gamble and make money or make your stash go further, there are plenty of off strip casino's that offer better gaming.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, little pricey. More suited for younger people.”
Reviews.Author: RichardB40
Reviews.Content: Arrived in the morning waited in line for 20min to check-in. got an early check in so it balanced out. Could not win on any slots in our hotel all week. The trip was booked by a family member so no visa was put on our room so we couldnt even call room to room. Great location but dont think we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: smallon
Reviews.Content: Great location! The hotel itself is very chic and quite small compared to most other hotels along the Strip. There is a club in the hotel called Le Chateau. Great night but pretty pricey (like most clubs in Vegas) and i lost my phone there and never saw it again :( I would stay there again for sure

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: 7sunset
Reviews.Content: Paris has a great location and our room had a view of the Bellagio fountains. The room itself was fine but nothing fancy and quite clean. It could have been a bit bigger and I would have loved to have a mirror available outside the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “6th Trip to Vegas in 4 years, Paris is pretty good.”
Reviews.Author: JD778
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed everywhere on the strip from the dank and disgusting Imperial Palace to the grand Ceasars Palace. Paris is slightly above average as far a strip resorts go. If you can find a good deal its a fine place to stay. The rooms havent been updated in a few years but they are spacious and clean. The restaurant in Paris, mon ami gabi is fantastic and reasonably priced for Vegas. Im not much of a gambler but I would say the gaming floor is somewhat small compared to some of the other Casinos Ive been to. The swimming area is tired and showing its use, its also very unimaginative compared to say, MGM, Mirage or Mandalay Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Ambience”
Reviews.Author: Firerunner
Reviews.Content: Great location, ambience, service and value. Across from the fountain. With the distinctive tower. Loved it

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with helpful staff, great food, excellent location, and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Eastsider22
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Bellagio, TI, Mirage, and MGM Grand but like Paris the best. The centralized location, views of the strip, excellent sevice, and great food is what keeps us coming back. The breakfast buffet has good selections and the outside patio at Mon Ami Gabi restaurant for lunch or dinner is a must visit. Your able to view the fountain show across the street at Bellagio and the people watching is our favorite activity. The rooms overlooking the strip do pickup the music and fountain noise at Bellagio but that goes away a 1am but the views are great. If you smoke -- only floors 4 and 27 are available and the strip view rooms are hard to comeby so reserve early. We had a room at the end of the hall on the 27th floor with a partial strip view (facing NE) and it was very quiet. Many of the rooms have been updated but all the rooms are 3 or 4 star rated. This hotel has been here since 1999 so many thousands of people have of stayed here. They do a good job of updating rooms and replacing/cleaning carpets but don't be suprised if the hallway carpeting may have some spots or dirt -- it simply is not a brand new hotel. The casino area, restaurants, gift shops, and lobby area is spotless and shows no signs of aging. The elevators are the fastest I've encountered and the Parisian theme is carried throughout the hotel. We also like the fact that it is connected by a corridor with shopping and restaurants to Bally's. There are also places where you can get coffee and pastries if you want something quick in the morning. The convenient stores in the hotel are stocked with any snack you can imagine along with individual cereal and milk boxes if you want a quick meal to take to your room. Note there is a free compact refrigerator in each room that used to be a "pay type" stocked with liquor and other snacks they have since removed.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again...”
Reviews.Author: cathy191
Reviews.Content: We were down for a convention in March. We chose Paris as it was across from the Bellagio where rest of the group were staying. We tend to do that so we are not constantly running into people all the time. Having only visited the Bellagio which is quite beautiful, I think Paris was better suited for us.
