It was a smaller hotel and didn't seem as crowded as across the street. I liked the idea of reception being off to the side in another room so its not what you are walking into. Where as Bellagio, we went there for dinner and the lobby was jammed with people checking in. It really took away from the beauty of the hotel. The staff we did deal with were great and helpful. The bartenders in the lobby bar are alot of fun. I found the hotel very clean and we had upgraded to the red room. Very nice. Our favorite restaurant was Mon Ami Gabi. It's a definate when you go whether you stay at the hotel or not. All in all I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Short Trip”
Reviews.Author: Chalfont_PAJessie
Reviews.Content: My husband was attending a conference Nov. 9th & 10th so I tagged along. We arrived around 2:30 PM on the 8th which was a Tues. & there was no line. I am a platinum card holder, there was a short line for gold & non-member guests. The woman that checked us in told us there we no more red premier rooms when we asked to be upgraded to one but she said she could upgrade us for free to a regular room with a view. She gave us a choice of a king on the 6th floor or two queens on the 23rd floor. We chose the 23rd floor & I am so glad we did! We had a wonderful view of the Eifel Tower & the Belligio fountain show! When the fountain show started it was quite loud it almost sound like thunder! It was awesome to have a private show so we didn't mind the noise.The bathroom was very nice with a tub & a shower with lots of storage space & plenty of towels. All the staff were very nice. The restaurants & shops were very charming made to look like a street in Paris with blue sky & clouds painted on the ceiling. The food was very good and FYI if you are a rewards card holder, you can go to the hostess & simply show your card & we were able to skip all lines & be seated right away! Gold card holders, however, had to wait in line, it was for 7 stars, diamond & platinum but it was all one line, not seperate lines like in Atlantic City. There was never anyone in line when we went, I'm not sure if there weren't any other card holders or they didn't realize they could use their card in another casino, in any case we were thrilled because there was a long line to get in. The consierge was able to print our boarding pass for free. I found out after I had already paid at a kiosk to print mine. I didn't have my husband's conf.# so I couldn't print his. Then I remembered seeing online that the hotel will print them, so we asked & sure enough they printed his for free, so remember to ask first before going to the kiosk! We had a wonderful time & the slots were much looser than AC I went home with twice what I came with & played on house money the whole time! The only negative part of the strip are the men outside of all the casinos trying to sell women, pushing papers & photos of girls at you with t-shirts that say "girls at your door in 30 minutes"! I was quite disgusted by this because you wonder where are these "girls" coming from. You hear about girls being kidnapped & forced into prostiution against their will. They need to get these people off the street! I would definately return to the Paris Hotel, though, it was very lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay at Paris”
Reviews.Author: Fortun81
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference held at Paris and stayed on site. Lovely hotel and very nice staff. I understand some of the rooms have been renovate and don't know if we were in one of those but the room was very nice, comfortable bed, lovely bathroom. Towels were big and soft ( I am a towel snob). The hotel itself was very pretty (as are most Strip hotels) and the casino area is noisy and a bit smokey but pretty much the same at all hotels. GREAT location for walking the Strip and getting to most things you would want to see. It is connected to Ballyso you have some other food options . I would not pay "retail" for a room, look for discounts. Overall, really nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but needs to be updated”
Reviews.Author: Lizzymom
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful. Casino was typical. Overall the hotel was clean, but the rooms need updated. Wallpaper was peeling and the shower floor was dirty. The staff were all polite and accomodating. All the meals that I had there were good. The Manilow concert was awesome. I was there for a conference, and all of the facilities were top notch and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean rooms and great location”
Reviews.Author: em5585
Reviews.Content: The Paris Hotel and Casino is a great place to stay. Make sure you get a Total Rewards card to earn points and get the best rates. The room we had, even in the bottom category, was very nice. Spacious, clean, two queen beds and a bathroom with a separate tub and shower. We had a view of the Bellagio fountains from our corner room (room 897), yet were away from the strip and a lot of the noise. It is a very central location, which is great for both walking or for taking a taxi. They also offer a free shuttle to the Rio from Bally's, which is next door. The buffet was quite good, although the line was long for lunch on Saturday. You have the option to pay an extra $10 per person to skip the line. Since Harrah's hotels do not charge a resort fee, our friend paid $25 to use the fitness center one day. One of the main reasons I was excited to stay at this hotel was to go to Chateau. It is not owned by the hotel, but they mentioned we could get wristbands from one of the promoters standing outside. The club itself was really nice, with a great patio area with another DJ. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location - Watch for Front Rooms - Getting Tired”
Reviews.Author: Ambermc
Reviews.Content: The Paris is certainly in one of the best locations in Vegas. Watch out for the front rooms - they are very noisey, especially on nights when the outside disco is playing not to mention the Bellagio Fountains. We switched to a room at the back of the hotel and it was much quieter. No mini-bar for some reason. Just a fridge which warned not to place personal goods inside. Rooms getting very tired - needed a good clean, especially the walls. A smell of sewerage coming from shower. TV is poor. Staff down-stairs were very helpful - except for a waitress in the buffet restaurant who was very rude indeed. I would consider other Hotels other than the Paris before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Crazy1995
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I spent 3 nights at Paris. When we arrived, no king rooms were available, so we ended up in a "two queens" room. Room was nice, beds were comfortable, no good view. The tv was the old bulky style, but we didn't spend a lot of time in the room watching tv. The staff was friendly & helpful & we enjoyed our stay. The only negative was that the express checkout in the room didn't work & there was an extremely long checkout line. Overall, the stay was great and we would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: cfolse
Reviews.Content: They gave my room away twice. The organization or the taxi line is horrible, you wait forever. Stay somewhere else, but go visit the property, because the decor is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice time at the Paris”
Reviews.Author: Fran K
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at Paris for 4 nights. We were able to check-in early on arrival and permitted to check-out late on date of departure. Everyone was super nice. We asked for extra towels on 3 occassions and they were delivered within 15 minutes. We asked for a cot and it too was delivered in a very short period of time. Best of all, we were not charged the $30.00 bed fee. Mon ami accommodated a 10 person party despite a line out the door and 2 seperate reservations of 6 and 4. Food is excellant and reasonable. Loved lunch outside there. Piano bar rocked. Conseige went out of her way with directions and travel options to Fremont. As a hotel guest, she got us on the list to the hotel's club without charge. It is a young person place but worth the experience to just see the ridiculous of the club types.The spa was very nice and super afforable with a deal found on ZooDeals. Beds were comfortable. Internet charges are high and it cost $5.00 for 5 minutes of internet time to print your departure boarding pass. Location is GREAT. Right in the center of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: DeirdreRob
Reviews.Content: We stayed over Halloween week (7 nights), it was great really nice hotel good variety of restaurants within the hotel. Excellent staff nice bars. Quick check in and an express check out option! We upgraded to a Red room for an extra $200ish. Gorgeous room, clean etc. and we felt it was well worth it for us. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Las Vegas Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Skiders
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best hotel for the price in Las Vegas. The gaming floor is bright and resembles Paris (in a way). The customer service is fantastic as is the buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! :)”
Reviews.Author: ivie_01
Reviews.Content: Loved the ambiance of the hotel, it was very European..(though the music in the elevator kinda irks me :D) Long line for checking-in but the line moves fast. Our room didn't have a view, but it was clean and the bed and pillows are really comfy. Location is perfect, just in the middle of the strip.. Didn't get a chance to eat at the restaurants downstairs because they pretty much had long lines everytime we passed by. but we got a chance to eat at Sugar Factory, we had breakfast there, I definitely recommend their Banana Split Waffles. It was delish! :) We also went on the Eiffel Tower ride, it's about $10 in the day and $15 in the night. I suggest you sign up for the card there (like a casino card) so you can get a 2-for-1 price :) View up there was amazing, and it was great to watch the Bellagio fountain from up there.. You could really see the moves and shapes the water made. The only con I could say is that self-parking is kinda far from the hotel elevators, so it sucks if you have a lot to carry.. but besides that, I loved my stay at the Paris! and remember 'Everything's sexier in Paris!' :D

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: rianae
Reviews.Content: Paris is a great location to see Vegas. Check in was quick and easy. Room clean, though I would have liked to have used the fridge to keep drinking water cold. (there is ice in the hall) Also, no coffee or tea making facilities in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location and facilities.”
Reviews.Author: Arthur-R
Reviews.Content: This is our sixth time in Las vegas and the first stay at the Paris. Check in was excellent, room was OK (great view of the strip and Bellagio Fountains), pool and surrounding areas were good and the staff were all friendly and helpfull. Would recommend the Steak House Restaurant in Paris (pricey but excellent), Chans in next door Planet Hollywood and the Palms Restaurant in Caesars Palace and for late time entertainment in Indigo in Bally's. Managed to catch some excellent evening shows: Jersey Boys, Matt Goss, The Beatles Love and Frank Morinos Divas. Also worthwhile seeing the afternoon shows of Big Elvis / Cook E Jar at the nearby Bills Casino.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of the strip”
Reviews.Author: PandK09
Reviews.Content: Overall, it is a good place to stay. Weekends can be crowded so my favorite time is during the week. Table limits are lower mid-week as well. The pool while not as flashy as other pools is still spacious enough for all to enjoy and work on their tans.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mykonos20
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paris for four nights, October 27 thru November 3. Had five rooms and everyone was nice. We had two rooms that overlooked the pool and eiffel tower. It also had view of Bellagio water show. The rooms were good sized. I did not find the rooms dated. Some complained so no hot water. All five rooms had plenty. We found the elevators fast. Check in and check out was very quick. We ate at the Le Burger and had very good service and the food was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable!”
Reviews.Author: words2music
Reviews.Content: We went for business and pleasure both. We were truly amazed by the scenery enveloping us - felt like we were truly in Paris (or what I imagine Paris to be). It is RIGHT on the strip and our view overlooked the pool and Eiffel Tower - great view! The room and especially the bathroom could have possibly been bigger, but they were ok - room for my husband's toiletries and mine both. The Eiffel Tower Restaurant had the most amazing view of the water show at the Bellagio, and the food was tasty and unique albeit a small fortune. The night club was much too young for us, but the restaurants were just right. Excellent service, spotless room, had everything we could want! I'll be back to Paris :)

Reviews.Title: “Great casino, lackluster rooms”
Reviews.Author: noodle1976
Reviews.Content: Unless you upgrade to a newly renovated room, the rooms are underwhelming at best. Bright blue carpet, need I say more? I know that they are trying for the Parisian vide, but it just seems tired in the older rooms. Hotel has a great location and casino and is very convenent to the strip and monorail. Pool is dull...and shaded a lot of the time. Spa is nice, but 25$ a day to run on the treadmill??? NUTS! And the TC options in the room were AWFUL but tha's just the hotel in general I guess.

Reviews.Title: “terrible service”
Reviews.Author: jacka82942
Reviews.Content: arrived at 5pm on saturday.2 people handling checkin-16 total stations.needless to say a long wait.I thought goal should be to get you into casino or bars and restaurants quickly. Breakfast at le buffet had same issue.We were there 15 minutes after opening and had to wait half hour not because line was long but hostess took forever to seat anyone.when we left must have been an hour wait.at least food was very good. Our room was never cleaned.about 3pm my wife got tired of waiting and put out don't disturb sign to take a nap. This place must be going down the tubes!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay At Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Zafiragirl
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Paris, this time to celebrate my 40th birthday. We arrived at about 8pm on a Tuesday night, and there was only a couple of minutes to wait at the front desk. The clerk there was friendly and helpful. I asked about the possibility of a complimentary upgrade from the 'Red Room' we had booked. She took several minutes hunting through the system and then offered us a 'Red Room Parlor Suite' on the 25th floor, which is basically a slightly larger room with dual aspect windows. We really liked the position of the room - being at the end of a corridor meant that we heard very little noise from any of the other guests. Paris is a LARGE hotel by European standards, but really quite manageable when compared to the other Vegas mega-resorts, so it was easy to get from our room out onto the Strip each day. A couple of minor niggles with the room. Although the bathroom was very large, there was only a single basin. It would have been useful to have two for his/hers, as there was certainly room to do that. More annoyingly, the only mirrors in the entire suite were inside the bathroom. Normally when we're getting ready to go out, I'll shower and then take the hairdryer and my make-up out to the bedroom so that my husband can use the shower next. This wasn't possible, and was really frustrating when we were trying to get ready together. Come on Paris - get a mirror somewhere in the bedrooms, PLEASE! Other than those minor things, we had an excellent stay this time. All the staff I spoke to were genuine and friendly, from cocktail waitresses in the casino to Wyatt the lovely security man I chatted to and Rosa, our lovely housekeeper. It was nice to feel that dealing with me was more than just a job for these guys, thanks :D We ate twice (breakfast and dinner) at Mon Ami Gabi, and both times were very impressed with food, service and value. Also enjoyed an awesome Strawberry Shake at the Sugar Factory - YUMMY! To top it all off, I had amazing luck in the casino at Paris on this trip, so I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel...Perfect Location.”
Reviews.Author: bambamandginge
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paris in May on one of the busiest weekends of the year! This hotel is in the perfect location mid strip opposite the Bellagio and the Cosmopolitan. We had standard rooms and requested a strip view when we checked in. We ended up with a room that overlooked the fountains! Amazing view at night. Paris is very much a standard hotel. However, it is spotless, has a fab pool and is in the best location. As the hotel isnt too big it didnt take 15 mins to get up to your room like some of the bigger hotels. I would definately stay here again as a value for money base to hit Vegas! Book it!

Reviews.Title: “Costly food, poor facilities, good customer service, very average rooms”
Reviews.Author: paleomatt
Reviews.Content: I got sent out to Vegas for a conference taking place at The Paris so this is where I stayed. I confess, I am not a gambler or a lover of bars. Moreover, after getting off my flight, I flew in from London, I had two thin slices of pizza in the hotel (for $10!) and within a few hours was violently ill with a very unhappy stomach. This forced me to come into close contact with the floor of my room's bathroom and I was astounded to discover that it really wasn't very clean. Later, I dropped some stomach medication down the side of my bed and this forced me to move the bed away from the wall a bit. Ugh! There were glasses covered in dust and grime below the bed itself. They looked like they had been there for eons. With all of this in mind, I did the sensible thing and called the front desk. They apologised and said that in the morning they would make things right by giving me a room upgrade free of charge. In the morning, before the room change, I searched my room for a tea kettle to make myself some stomach soothing chamomille tea. No luck. Again I called the front desk and asked about a kettle. They informed me that only suites had such things (in Britain all rooms have them, but I guess not in the US) they also told me that my room upgrade would not have one either. My heart sank but I didn't have to say a word, the staff member on the phone did the right thing. "Sir, we will make sure you are in a room with a kettle." So I ended up in a suite with a kettle that was probably worth a lot more than the room I had paid for. Even so, it was remarkably ordinary. And so is most of the hotel. Eiffel Tower aside, the hotel is like most others in Vegas. You have to wade through a smoke-filled maze-like casino to get almost anywhere and for me, that was not much fun. The Palazzo and the Venetian, which I visited later in my trip, do not force this same experience. And facilities at the Paris are rather poor for the large hotel that it is. Two, poorly kept up jacuzzis and a single, unheated, outdoor pool service the enormous hotel. It is not enough for the population that they are handling. And finally, a word about food. There are no cheap eats in The Paris. Everything, even breakfast, is extremely pricey. I figured this was just "vegas" but after wandering a bit, I discovered this to not be so. There are hotels that have little places to get food that doesn't cost a fortune. Sure, they also have expensive restaurants, all hotels do, but The Paris does not, and that was a nuisance. So, good customer service, poor facilities, costly food, and even suites that are really rather ordinary. Not a terrible experience, but not a very good one either.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: RosanneNYC
Reviews.Content: I had a lovely stay at the Paris, upgraded room was spacious and well-furnished. Dining and shopping very nice, and the view from atop their Eiffel Tower was spectacular. Surprising long line for check-in. Even more surprising was the $25 charge for a visit to the gym (yes TWENTY FIVE DOLLARS) and there was absolutely nothing special about it. That is just plain wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas has better options”
Reviews.Author: BeachCoach
Reviews.Content: Average of the places to stay in vegas. Prefer Madalay Bay or Venetian(all suite rooms) for overall experience of the room. Nothing bad per say, just find they do it a little better at these hotels than Paris does. One definite plus is the location. Right in the middle of the strip with easy walking access to just about anything in any direction. So if that is your priority - most definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “not as good as expected”
Reviews.Author: helen099
Reviews.Content: i was so looking forward to staying in the paris and it was lovely but maybe i've been really lucky in vegas before but i've always had a view of something which lets face it isnt that hard in vegas but our room overlooked the carpark, it looked like our room had been attempted break in as the door was in need of repair, eventually after much begging and groveling they changed our room but the holiday had got of to a bad start. we then used the internet twice within the 24 hrs period but because it was on two diff days we gat charged twice but it was advertised as 24 hrs not daily so they took off a payment only to add it to my credit card when i left after many emails it was never sorted. also staying in the middle of the strip is a nightmare with taxi charges as the traffic is so heavy.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer08
Reviews.Content: Pros: great location in the middle of the Strip, inexpensive, clean Cons: very outdated decor in the rooms, noisy hallways and LOUD housekeepers who shout up and down the halls at each other Advice: book for the same price at Vdara which is almost brand new

Reviews.Title: “Love the Paris”
Reviews.Author: mrsshep
Reviews.Content: Check in was fast. Upgraded to a Red Room with a view of the Tower and the Fountains. Room had a coffee maker and fridge. Love the stand alone shower. Maid service was fantastic. I love the location on the strip. Room service was fast. The staff that I encountered while there were all fabulous.

Reviews.Title: ““Our 18th trip to Paris Las Vegas””
Reviews.Author: Tigger41999
Reviews.Content: First I will give our review, and then I will give some general information. My wife and I stayed at Paris October 27th through November 1st of this year for the 18th time. As you probably can guess we love Paris. One of the top reasons is the casino. We are both nonsmokers and with a three story high ceiling the smoke dissipates quickly. Unless you are right next to a smoker you really do not notice the smoke. Most of the other casinos have low ceilings with some being only 10 feet high. At Paris we do not feel confined, the three stories high, and well lit daytime sky blue ceilings makes it feel very open. There is plenty of space between the table games and between the slots. Another top reason is Paris’s location, being center strip. You are within walking distance to many of the shows as well as many of the great restaurants. Over the course of our many trips we have eaten at all the restaurants in Paris and have tried a lot of different dishes. All are very good. Some of the best is the Le Creperie, Le Burger Brasserie and Mon Ami Gabi (especially the outdoor café area, no reservations accepted for the outdoor area). We have always found the service at Paris top notch including the front desk, maid service, restaurants, dealers, bars and especially the cocktail servers. When we checked in, our basic nonsmoking comped room was upgraded to a basic strip view room at no charge. We are very late night people when in Vegas, so typically we ask to have our room cleaned in the afternoon and we give a couple hour time frame to have it done and the maids were always accommodating. But, the best service is from the cocktail servers on the casino floor. Three servers are worth mentioning, at the slot machines during day shift Saturday through Wednesday is Andrea, table games during day shift Monday through Friday is Ferra and the best server that we have come across in Vegas is at the slot machines during the swing shift Wednesday through Sunday. Her name is Angela. Please adequately tip all the cocktail servers. Information about the room. The room was clean and spacious. Outlets by the desk as well as by the bed. For us the bed was great. We like a firm mattress and that is what we got. Plenty of hot water and it only took a few seconds to get hot. The shower and bathtub are separate. Yes, we had a tube style TV, so what! As stated by many others, the mini bar was empty, but you can use it like a refrigerator. You have the use of a free in room safe. The AC is quiet and does the job well. Paris has several room types available. If you book luxury or red room luxury you will not have a strip view, therefore do not expect it, even if you make a “special request” months ahead. There have been several posts about the noise from the Chateau Gardens Night Club (open only on Tuesday, Friday and Saturday evenings) vibrating the building. We did not have a problem with this when we were there. You can hear the base coming from the club but if you have the TV or radio on at a normal level you cannot hear the club Free WIFI is available in Café Belle Madeleine. Paris is pet friendly. Check the website for details. Paris does not have a “doorman”, but the first set of doors on the right has a button for “handicapped” access. This button will open both of the outside and inside set of doors. General Information. This information is primary for first timers to Paris and/or Vegas 1) If you drive to Vegas – Virtually all the Strip Hotels self parking lots are far away from front desk. To avoid carrying your luggage a long distance after parking your car you have two options. If you are with someone go to the normal entrance where the taxis drop people off, unload your luggage and have one person stay with the luggage, go park your car and then come back to help with the luggage or in most cases the bell hop can help (for a tip). If you are by yourself, you can leave your luggage with the bell hop (for a tip), tell them you are just going to park your car and then come back for your luggage or have it delivered to your room after check in. 2) From the airport taking a taxi for two people (about $17 with tip) or taking a shuttle for two people (about $15) cost about the same, but a taxi will go directly to your hotel while a shuttle will stop at multiple hotels. Also, the shuttle will drop you off on the back side of Paris which is the opposite side from check in. There are no baggage carts or bellhops where the shuttle drops you off. Then you have to carry your luggage all the way through the casino to get to check in. If you have more than two people a taxi will be cheaper (five can ride for the same price as one). Tell the taxi driver you want to go the Swenson Street route; this avoids the Strip and the freeway. 3) The cocktail servers in the table area as well as in the slot area have a zone that they are working in. Servers are not allowed to cross over to another zone to serve a customer even if it is right across the aisle. Therefore do not get mad if the server tells you that you are not in her zone/station. The servers primarily work for tips and most drinks that they serve you would cost $6 to $15 at the bar, therefore tip accordingly. If you are going to be in an area for 2 or 3 hours, get to know your server. Be nice to her, treat her with respect and tip well. During their shift she will take an hour break and a relief server fills in. 4) Many of the hotels have a mandatory resort fee of $22 or more per night. This resort fee is to cover the use of the gym and WIFI. Caesars Properties, which Paris is part of, does not charge a mandatory resort fee. They do charge $14.99 per 24 hours per device for WIFI in the room, (Smart phones are the same as a laptop) and $25 per day for gym access. There is FREE WIFI access in Café Belle Madeleine. Therefore, if you do not use WIFI or the gym you will save money compared to the other resorts. 5) Food is available 24 hours at Paris with many choices throughout the day. For late night dining (11:00 PM to 6:00AM) food is only available at the Sugar Factory (which has an outdoor seating area). At most of the restaurants they give you a lot of food and if you have an average appetite you can split a meal (some of them may charge a small split plate fee). From about 10:30 AM to 12:30 PM and 6:00 PM to 8:00PM the lines at the restaurants can be quite long, if you can avoid these times your wait will be short. 6) If you arrive at Paris during the peak time of 10:00AM to 1:00PM, expect a line at the check in as people are also checking out. This is especially true on Fridays and Saturdays. To speed things up, the person that made the reservations need to have their ID and credit card available. Just in case, have your confirmation number/printout handy. 7) Paris may look old and that it needs a new coat of paint. Paris hotel and the Casino is meant to look like old Paris with cobblestone “streets”, therefore what may look like old dingy paint is in reality the look that they have intended, i.e. a distressed look. 8) Vegas is a 24 hour city and people are always in the casinos. Paris does a very good job of keeping the Casino area clean, floors swept, ash trays emptied, drink glasses and bottles removed from the tables and slot machines. 9) If you book with a room with Paris at one price and you see that the rates have dropped before you make your trip, just call Paris (at least 72 hours prior) and ask them to adjust your rate. This does not work if you have booked a package deal or with some travel agent. 10) Remember, Vegas is expensive relative to most small towns and cities so do not be shocked at the prices for food and drinks. There are bargains if you do your research. If you have any questions in particular about Paris as well as some fine restaurant recommendations feel free to e-mail me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 16Angel
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in September, slight queue at check in, but only took about 10 minutes. Good room, two huge comfy beds, view not that good, but better rooms were available at an upgrade fee. Ate at the pizzeria at the hotel which was really good, a must is a trip up the Eiffel Tower at night for some superb views of the strip and an excellent view of the fountain show at The Bellagio which is opposite. Kept our luggage for us at check out, and when we were ready a taxi was ready immediately to take us reluctantly to the airport. Will definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Central to Everything”
Reviews.Author: virgo090
Reviews.Content: We booked a king size room but were given a double queen. We were told that we could change rooms the following morning but we didn't bother. In hindsight we should have changed rooms. The location was great and the room was clean. When we arrived we had to carry our bags all the way through the Casino, which was a long way after a long flight. However we found out before leaving that we could have arranged for the bags to be collected and taken to the room. There was a long wait to check-in as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good but showers are short people”
Reviews.Author: Foodwriter2
Reviews.Content: Room is average but spacious. Dinner at the Etower was one of the best we had in vegas the secound was CarneVino. At best the service was impeccable..Kuddos to the managers.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: cmsrosa
Reviews.Content: We had booked just a normal/cheapest room, but when we got there we asked if we could have a nicre view and were amazed when we got into the room and saw the Bellagio and its fountains!! We really enjoyed ourselves. The receptions (I think her name was Shenoyee) was soo friendly and helful. The Paris streets were so nice, and the bar that had the dueling pianos was was excellant. The room was huge, as was the bathroom and everything was spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Prescottwines
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. When we arrived, they were all out of the standard king room which we had reserved so they upgraded us to a beautiful 2 room suite on the 32nd floor with a view of the strip. The customer service was excellent at every level and we really enjoyed our stay. I wish I would have gotten the guys name who check us in so I could mention him here. He was a delight. Thank you Paris for a great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday at Paris, Vegas”
Reviews.Author: checkit
Reviews.Content: We flew Allegiant air from Bellingham to Vegas. Picked up our rental car from the airport and with the help of GPS we found the Paris hotel and were delighted to find the parking was free. Check in was great and our Desk Clerk took a few minutes to find out rooms right near our friends. There was a huge convention going on but she was able to honor our requests. Rooms were clean and nice and quiet. Beds and bedding was very comfortable. The Paris hotel is located directly across the street from the Bellagio so it is very central. Lots of lunch options in the Paris and Starbuck within a 5 minute walk. We found the Paris hotel a great size. We have stayed at the MGM Grand which is lovely, but very big and quite a ways off from the central part of the strip. We drove to the Grand Canyon and enjoyed a wonderful sunset and sunrise at the South Rim. Back to Vegas and enjoyed our last 3 days lounging at the pool at the Paris. Nice and big and lots of lounge chairs available. We would definitely stay at the Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience will stay again”
Reviews.Author: brianla811
Reviews.Content: When I book a room in Vegas, I consider the following: location, parking access and price of room between $100.00 to $275.00. My room price averaged $115 per night and the parking access was okay. I was concerned about the parking as you have to cross the sidewalk on Las Vegas Blvd, but the traffic light would help to get you pass people crossing the sidewalk. The room was very clean and the maids was very nice. We were at the end of the hallway with mountain view. Very quiet. Casino is very clean, the air quality is very good. Unable to detect cigarette smoke unless someone is close to you. Harrahs Entertainment offers a buffet pass for a set fee per person for 24 hours. You can go to any of the Harrahs buffet for 24 hours. I would not recommend this as the food is not top quality and lines can be long. I would prefer to eat at a restaurant where you can choose the type of dining. My only complaint is the walkway to the parking lot and to Ballys is too dark for a major walkway,

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places I've stayed at in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: wrhatcher
Reviews.Content: This is a Harrah's-owned property across from the Bellagio. I arrived at about 8 p.m. in the evening and literally had to wait in line about 30 seconds to check in. I was upgraded to a "Red Room" at no charge (and without even asking). The room was spotless. It had a large comfortable bed, a huge bathroom with a shower separate from the bath tub, and had a little coffeemaker (which is a rarity at many Las Vegas hotels). I had a gorgeous view of the Bellagio fountains The t.v. was a large flat screened type. The hotel hallways looked a little bit worn but had absolutely no negative impact on my overall stay. I stayed 2 nights, and ate several times at the little pastry shop in the hotel. I was there on the 30th and 31st of October, and Halloween was a great time in Vegas! I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Strip experience!”
Reviews.Author: R G
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas for a quick anniversary getaway, and had a wonderful stay at Paris. I had read reviews about the hotel and despite warnings regarding the noise, decided to give it a try based on the location, the still-open pool, and the kitch factor. Upon checking in we were informed that they did not have the King non-smoking room that I had requested. I asked if there were any upgrades available (based on the positive reviews for the Red Rooms on TA) and was given a top floor suite at no extra charge! Wow! The room, while obviously an older suite, was still amazing! Great view, tons of room, and two bathrooms. The amenities were older (no flat screen, traditional furniture) but these things aren't really necessary for my tastes. Who needs a TV in Vegas anyways? To address the noise issue: we didn't have a problem with it. On Thurs night we did the 80s music bumping, but it was off by midnight and we didn't hear it the rest of the weekend. Perhaps they've addressed the noise issues others have experienced in the past. Both the pool and casino areas, while busy, seemed more mellow and enjoyable than the same areas at other hotels. The pool is smaller and doesn't have the amazing landscaping of, say, the Mirage, but it was calm and relaxing. I also liked the lighting and decor of the casino/shopping/food areas. Other strip hotel casinos can feel like you're just in a giant room filled with machines, and the Paris just seemed a little more...intimate and interesting. I also loved that Paris is right in the middle of the strip. While I realize my experience at the Paris was shaped largely on the amazing (free!) room upgrade, I believe I would have enjoyed it without, though I probably would have spent a lot more time downstairs than up in the room watching the Bellagio fountain show over and over again. I wouldn't recommend it if you're looking for modern/chic Vegas or a clubbing/party hotel, though they do seem to be upping the ante with the Chateau nightclub. But if you're looking for a great themed strip hotel with location and a year-round pool I'd recommend giving it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: dvandrv
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Paris for our anniversary. Paris Las Vegas is a wonderful hotel with a great location on the Strip. We bought Monorail passes and found it easy to use and easy to get around on. Our hotel room was large and clean and we had no complaints about the hotel accomodations whatsoever. We made several trips to the Paris hotel buffet. We found it to be the best buffet/brunch we had ever been to. All the food was excellent, freshly prepared, and well stocked. Our room overlooked the Strip and Bellagios. We plan on returning to the Paris next year.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Paris!!!”
Reviews.Author: tess372
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Paris the week of 9/18/11-9/24/11. Went to celebrate my parents 50th anniversary. We were both able to get complimentary rooms for every night except one using our Total Rewards Card. We had points from our visits to Atlantic City.We wound up paying $50 for an entire week in Vegas! My room was 1668. I had a side view of the bellagio fountains and a more front view of Binion's and the Flamingo. The room was pretty standard, nothing fancy but very nice. The shower and tub were seperate. The water pressure was good. The bed was comfy. The tv has to go. Hardly any channels and very old. The maid was very friendly and kept the room very clean. The casino is amazing. Loved the atmosphere. Good variety of machines...not many that I was lucky on though. Gift shops were cute along the way to Bally's. Restaurants were very nice. Went to Mon Ami Gabi, Cafe Il St. Louis, Le Village Buffet and Cafe bel Madeleine which I will review seperately. The Paris is in a great location and is truly lovely to stay at. The pool is really nice. So relaxing and so fun to sit under the Eiffel Tower. The bathrooms by the pool are nearby and clean. I would totally stay at the Paris again! The concierge desk was of great assistance. I called ahead and they did all of my lucnh & dinner reservations for me. I am so looking forward to going back!!!! Miss you already Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade to a "Red Room".”
Reviews.Author: carolanna1025
Reviews.Content: We were originally booked for a regular room but was offered an upgrade to the "Red Room" at an additional $40 per night. We were very pleased...the room was beautiful. If you stay at this hotel, I suggest the Eiffel Tower elevator ride to the top...that was amazing. Also, the staff was really great. I played roulette for the first time and the dealer was patient and assisted me.

Reviews.Title: “Paris - lots of pluses”
Reviews.Author: Jupitergirl_551
Reviews.Content: This Oct 2011 trip was my third stay at the Paris hotel & casino in LV. The rooms are average in size, but the beds are comfy, you get closet space, a desk w/ wifi (which I guess you have to pay for, I didn't use it so I'm not sure about the charges), an arm chair or two (depending on whether or not you have a 2 qn sized beds of a king bed), and a good size bathroom with OK counter space and separate shower & tub. Our room was showing it's age, but it was clean and comfortable. We had a non-Strip view this time and it is much quieter overall (although I still kind of missed seeing the lights, etc). I know this may sound weird, but for the first time I noticed that the mirror didn't steam up when I was finished with my shower - I realized that they had a vent above the shower stall that pulled out all the steamy air. This makes a difference when you have a couple of people taking a shower before they go out - no steamy mirror, the air doesn't feel all sticky while you are trying to get changed, etc. Small point, but it was that kind of detail that made me enjoy the room a bit more. Location is great - on the Strip, between Planet Hollywood (young crowds, louder bars) and Ballys (which you can reach via a short connecting walk past some retail stores & restaurants from Paris); right across the street from Bellagio and Cosmopolitan (which you can reach by crossing the street rather than the above ground walkways that can get claustrophic sometimes). Food - lots of choices here although I was not able to partake of any of their edible offerings this trip (the buffet is good, but didn't have time this trip); from very casual coffee/muffin/sandwich to bistro/cafe to Mon Ami Gabi, a steakhouse, the Eiffel Tower restaurant, etc. I haven't eaten at all of these, but reviews and word of mouth ensure a future visit to one of these in the future. Casino setting is comfortable - you aren't cramped between a lot of machines and chairs, lots of selection, and the architecture inside the casino makes it visually interesting as you walk around (from the fountain, to the 'legs' of the Eiffel Tower that stand inside the casino, there is a definite atmosphere to this place that feels like no other casino). Of course it doesn't compare to the real thing, but hey, it's Vegas.... The rooms can all be accessed easily - there is a main entrance to all rooms (four different elevator 'wings' help ease any congestion or long waits between floors) - and you don't feel like you have to walk two blocks to reach the casino floor. Maybe it's not as plush as some other casinos, Paris nonetheless provides an enjoyable experience and the staff has always provided excellent customer service.

Reviews.Title: “NICE TO BE IN MIDDLE OF STRIP”
Reviews.Author: jjohnson382002
Reviews.Content: A friend and i stayed at Paris for 5 days. It was great to be in the center of the strip. the hotel does need some upgrading but overall a very nice place. we did get a upgrade for $20 at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location....”
Reviews.Author: LondonGirl26_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris Las Vegas in August 2011. The hotel location is absolutely perfect, its right in the middle of the strip and you can access everything really easily. The rooms are a little dated and very average but who spends their holiday in Vegas in a hotel room? The casino and lobby areas are cold and dark. The hotel has lots of bars and restaurants but they are pricey (but hey, thats Vegas!). Mon Ami Gabi was one of our favourites, especially for breakfast. There’s also a burger joint (I can’t remember the name) and the food in there is lovely too. We all thoroughly enjoyed dining in The Sugar Factory. The only gripe we had is with the bar near the lobby, I think it was called Le Central. There were 6 of us in our party (4 between 21-26) and we went in there every night for a pre dinner drink and used it as a general meeting point. The staff we very rude; either harassing everyone in our party for ID or ignoring us completely. One night we asked a waitress for drinks and she replied “it’s not my area but I will get you a drink anyway”. Yikes! It would have probably killed them all to smile. Don’t waste your money in there! Overall I would stay at the Paris Las Vegas again because of the location and I like the Paris theme but I can't call it any better than average. Vegas itself is superb!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: MB_Cine
Reviews.Content: Paris exceeded my expectations! We're usually in other higher end hotels, however, booked last minute to meet with friends and thought we'd try Paris. Apparently, our room was recently renovated. So recent, service needed to be called to reset the tv and safe. It was a beautifully decorated room, comfortable bed, with a view of the Eiffel Tower and the strip. The service staff, and casino staff, were very friendly as well as accommodating. The Eiffel Tower restaurant is a great place for drinks and to view Bellagio's water show!

Reviews.Title: “Still a decent choice but somewhat in decline”
Reviews.Author: Cormell
Reviews.Content: Once one of the nicest and most interesting hotels on the strip, the Paris now seems to be quickly sliding downhill into a shadow of its former glory. That being said, there is still much to recommend about the Paris. My wife and I stayed at the Paris for 1 night in October. I have lost count of the number of times we have stayed there but it would be better than 20. We are regulars to Las Vegas and the Paris has been our favorite hotel for years. We were quite saddened to see evidence of neglect and disrepair throughout the hotel including the rooms, that we had only begun to notice on our last visit there in 2010. I can only assume this is due to the difficult economic times and reflects tighter budgets and narrower profit margins. That part aside the Paris is still worth a visit and I would still stay there again. The food choices are excellent offering quick budget snacks to fine dining and everything in between. The buffet as well is one of the best on the strip with an excellent selection of varied and quality food. The Casino at the Paris is bright an airy with a blue sky painted ceiling and the actual legs of the Eiffel Tower descending in among the slots. We have found in recent years that the Paris has tightened their slots so watch your risks and gamble wisely or all too soon you'll be at the cash machine or up in your room wondering what's on TV. The rooms at the Paris come in 2 flavors, original Blue French Provincial or the newer Red Rooms. Both are good but obviously the newer remodeled rooms are going to be nicer. If you pay extra you can get a very nice strip view room at the Paris depending on the tower you are in. For the best strip view however, be sure to take a ride up to the top of the Eiffel Tower at night. It doesn't get much better than that.

Reviews.Title: “The property need to be updated”
Reviews.Author: xaviercap
Reviews.Content: The big room was a trip in the 70's. Minibar was empty, a big old TV (no flat screen). No electrical plug close to the bed ! Cleaning is not the best quality of this hotel ! I definetely not recommend it and I don't will return.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and fun”
Reviews.Author: GatorMHA03
Reviews.Content: Fitness center charge was negative. Rooms dated but comfortable.Restauarnts good and Napoleans Piano Bar excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic with great location”
Reviews.Author: onthegoCincinnati_OH
Reviews.Content: Our stay was brief, but excellent. We got the room we booked with a very comfortable king bed. Our view was not terrific, but the hotel location puts you right in the middle of the Strip and all the action. We ate in several of the restaurants and took the trip to the top of the Eiffel Tower. The hotel gave us coupon booklets that helped with all of these. Great hotel with a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Average place to stay on the strip but great food!”
Reviews.Author: stromamo
Reviews.Content: I think the room was very average considering it is suppose to be one of the nicer places in Vegas. It would be very comparable to The Mirage. But, the restaurant choices are amazing! I think they make up for what the room lacks. We did have a great view of the Bellagio fountain show but the room was very noisy and you could hear a lot of things going on on the strip. It was a good thing we brought a fan for noise or I'm sure we would have had a hard time sleeping. I would never again get a room that faced the strip. The breakfast buffet was by far the best I've had in Vegas with both a crepe and omelet bar. It was only $16 too which is quite a good deal considering the vast selection and quality of the food. Would return just for the ease of getting to good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Hotel - newly renovated rooms”
Reviews.Author: CNDNgurl
Reviews.Content: We loved staying here, the rooms were newly renovated and very modern. The hotel is very clean. One downside is that you have to pay to use the fitness centre, which is unfortunate if you are already paying to stay there. The Casino is nice, and not quite as loud or rowdy as some of the others. Breakfast at Mon Ami Gabi is a must! unbelievably delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Paris oolala”
Reviews.Author: ratsgirl
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 8PM and walked right in to check in. Was in my room in 5 minutes. Room was very clean, nothing spectacular but very comfortable. Hotel connected to Ballys where my conference was and a short walking distance. The Sugar Factory has EXCELLENT martinis, alittle pricey but happy hour is buy 1 get 1 from 5pm to 7pm so take advantage. Hotel is centrally located so you can walk in either direction down the strip and see many of the other hotels without paying for a taxi. I totally enjoyed my stay. Has a french flair to an extent.

Reviews.Title: “Central and Romantic”
Reviews.Author: Mark H
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the Paris for a week whilst on a quick trip to US for birthday. Our room booking was messed up, not sure if it was the travel agent of the hotel..? But we wanted a king room and when we got there it was a queen bed that seemed to be a standard room. We paid the extra $90 per night to get a king room and wow, was it worth it. Massive room, two toilets, lounge, big bath and seperate shower, writing desk, kitchenette and dressing room. Views could have been better but for the extra $90aus per night we where impressed. Staff at reception always seemed to be busy and whilst not rude you seemed rushed and unimportant, but with big hotels this is expected. Couldn't fault the room or the buffet and restaurants. We don't gamble much but the floor looked great and always alive with excitement. Being opposite the Belagio was great as we loved the water shows (will stay their on our next trip). Had dinner in the Eiffel Tower which was a nice meal, pretty pricey, actually cost more for dinner there than when we went to the real Eiffel Tower but still all well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!!!”
Reviews.Author: Red7280
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, not too crazy about the casino, but the hotel was a great. We checked in at 3:00pm with no wait, got the room that I requested, a red premier room with a view of the tower and fountains. We were on the 29th floor, the view at night was beautiful. The room was just like the photos, the bed was very comfy and the room was neat and clean. It had a coffeemaker and frig in the room, you don't get that in many Vegas hotels. The bell service was very friendly and fast. The view from the Eifel Tower is wonderful. I would stay here again, but gamble somewhere different.

Reviews.Title: “Paris needs an update!”
Reviews.Author: Jlmorris15
Reviews.Content: Service was pretty good and food was above average but the bed/mattress was horrendous! I woke up in the middle of the night wondering if I was sleeping on the box springs. The rooms are outdated and unacceptable for the price paid. At least put in a flat screen TV. There are too many other options to stay at Paris Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “A room with a great view!”
Reviews.Author: szcz50
Reviews.Content: We has a "Red Suite" at the Paris in September. These rooms are well worth the extra price. They are larger than the normal rooms and are on the upper floors of the hotel. Our room faced the Bellaggio across the street and overlooked the pool and the Eiffel Tower. The room was comfortable with a desk and table with two chairs as well as a bureau and flat panel TV. There was plenty of room to walk around without bumping into the beds or furniture. The bathroom was a bit cramped and the shower stall was small. The only real complaint was that on the weekend when there was entertainment by the pool at night, the noise was loud enough to be annoying even on an upper floor.

Reviews.Title: “Above average because the average stuff in Vegas sucks.”
Reviews.Author: Cybertank3
Reviews.Content: The casino here is poor. It's not fun, dealers are bad and annoying. The free drinks even suck and are slow to come by.... even the coke is watered down. The hotel staff are pleasant, the tower in the front is lovely at night... the best thing about this hotel is that it's right across the street from the Belagio.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice casino atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: LifeisaBeach39
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for 3nts at the Paris and had a PREMIER room. The room was decent, but the size is of a typical hotel room. If you are into a modern hip feeling I would recommend spending more to get into the new Red rooms. The location is my favorite part, I am a total rewards member and Bally's and Planet Hollywood are all together here, making for some great point rewards if you gamble. The casino decor is nice and the boardwalk has great shops and restaurants, loved this the most about the Paris. We did not eat there, we went to the Planet Hollywood and Rio buffets, which were great! I also viewed a Parlour suite which has 2 bathrooms and either 2 queens or 1 king with a sitting area...these are very nice. All in all the Paris is nice, but if you like the oversized rooms, like the Palazzo or Rio, you might be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Boom, Boom, Boom, Boom.”
Reviews.Author: amidoc
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights here in order to attend a conference. Having read previous reviews, when checking in, I asked for a quiet room far away from the nightclub in order to sleep well enough to not sleep through my meetings. I was assured that was not a problem and was given a room on the north side of the building. Throughout my stay, I suffered a steady night time boom, boom, boom of club music bass. On the second night the room literally shook until almost midnight. The desk clerk advised me the entire hotel reverberated the beat and I was welcome to check out as my only option. Having prepaid for the room with a 3rd party, I did not exercise the option, rather accepted the discomfort and made the best of it. First, the room. Large and rather outdated. Clean with well worn sculpted carpets, the beds were hard yet reasonably comfortable. Nice pillows, sufficient to bury my head and muffle a bit of the noise. The tube TV seemed strangely old fashioned, but was operable. There were at least 5 channels in Chinese, a couple spanish language stations, 1 gay channel, multiple Vegas activity and Restaurant channels and a dismally poor array of general interest channels. The bathroom was the room's only delight. Covered in marble tile, it was spacious. The toilet flushed well and the drains drained. A separate shower and bathtub with good water pressure gave my room a bit of redemption. I did not eat in the restaurants as longish lines and generous prices encouraged me to victual elsewhere. The casino itself was dark 24 hours a day, making it a bit difficult to adjust to sunlight when stepping outside. The sky painted ceiling, cobblestone like floor and period french architecture gave on a sense of Paris but the background music had a stripclub/rave appeal. Overall, this was not an enjoyable stay, rather a test of endurance. I know some people like the noise, the dark, the titillation, but I would suggest that with a large alcohol primer, many will not notice nor remember. I cannot give this Hotel a nod of approval unless your bathing experience outweighs everything else. There are better, more modern, more accomodating Hotels in Las Vegas and it would behoove you to find them.

Reviews.Title: “great, but.....................”
Reviews.Author: tedWisconsin
Reviews.Content: Do not go to the La Village Buffet...It is way over priced and the food is sub par......If you want a good buffet, go to the Rio..........

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, but nothing spectacular”
Reviews.Author: GoJints
Reviews.Content: A friend wanted to go to Vegas for her birthday, and I'm always up for a trip. We got a good deal for a flight and the Paris hotel. Since neither of us had stayed there before, we thought why not. When we arrived, we were told our room wasn't available, but they had upgradd us. We thougth, OK, this should be good. We walked into the room, and it was nothing special that we could tell. Maybe if we had seen a 'regular' room, we'd know what the upgrade was. The room was comfortable; the view we had was uninspiring. (We were in the back of the hotel overlooking another building.) The concierge staff was extremely helpful when we said we were renting a car to go to the Valley of Fire, giving us directions, etc. They also suggested renting off property as the rental at the hotel was at a premium. One complaint - I always look forward to a particular banana tart at one of the restaurants at the hotel (I don't remember the name of the particular restaurant.) The tart is chocolate in a pastry shell with carmelized bananas on top. When I finally had the tart on Friday, in the first bite there was a massive hair! The reaction of the restaurant staff was EWWWW, I don't want to touch that. My response was I didn't want to eat it either. I got my money back, but missed the pleasure of having that tart (I wouldn't get another - who knows what is in the next one!)

Reviews.Title: “One night in Paris”
Reviews.Author: BLK23
Reviews.Content: Early check-in to Premier level room was much appreciated. Arrived at 10:30 a.m. and was in the room by 10:45. Room was 2 queen room on the 11th floor overlooking Eifel Tower, Caesar's Palace and pool. Linens and soaps were good quality and room was clean. Otherwise quite undistinguished from room in any other large hotel. No coffeemaker in the room but no hotels in Vegas seem to provide that. Bought $44 (with Total Rewards membership) Buffet package and ate at buffet for breakfast, lunch and evening dessert. This is good value and service was very good with minimal waiting in line for entry or for drinks. Paris motif is fun, in keeping with Vegas kitsch, but not obnoxiusly loud. Played some low denomination slots without any significant wins but cocktails were plentiful so had a good time. Location on the strip is great with walkway to the Bellagio and direct connection to Balley's. Took Eifel Tower ride at night. This is great way to see strip and Bellagio Fountains. There are numerous 2 for 1 coupons in local travel guides. Checked bags with bellman next morning as had an evening flight. This too went smoothly with minimal wait to check or retrieve bags. Overall staff courteous, very compentent. Will likely stay here again. Cab $16 from airport and $14 to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: 360travelor
Reviews.Content: Someone needs to let the OWNERS of this hotel know about the state of their hotel. It has the appearance of a fun, well located, beautiful hotel. But is sadly not. The check in staff, car hops, and most fast food eateries all need an attitude ajustment. How can a hotel with such a international draw be so poorly run. Who is in charge of this place. Everyone I spoke to would pass the buck, never taking blame or offering any sort of compensation. Rooms appear to be out dated, wall paper pealing, beds lumpy not due to fine comforters, carpet smells or is coming up, small tv no flat screens, poor window and wall insallation can hear every sound out side when club come alive. Forget about complaining, hotel staff is tired of hearing it. Staff will say that they can't do anything because each eliment of your complaint falls on someone else who owns that department. In some cases the problem is within their area of responsiblity, but they will still dismiss the problem without resolve. On the up side is the food, very good at most resterants, but very pricey. If hotels are in going through tough times it could be due to staff service, hotel condition, and quality. Would recommend food but not the hotel. Needs a serious face lift and staff training and or firing.c

Reviews.Title: “You can not beat location”
Reviews.Author: traveler1954
Reviews.Content: You can not beat the location, middle of the strip close to everything you would want to see. The service was good, the lobby is amazing, the pool nice, the rooms clean but it has been a while since they have been renovated.Skip the buffet, but the other resturants on the property are great. If we got a good rate we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: trip4n8
Reviews.Content: My wife and I received a 2 night stay at the hilton grand vacation (which is a nice hotel but lots of bus rides and walking for any of the fun) we had decided to extend our vacation by more then 2 days and needed a place for an addional night. We decided to try our luck on price line and received a great deal. Once we got to the hotel they offered us a free upgrade to a huge room being we were only staying 1 night. The room was great and we spent most of our time in the Paris hotel complex or near it. It had everything. We plan on going back to vegas and plan on staying at the Paris resort again!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LisaH8
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at some of the newer more upscale hotels, I wasn't thrilled about the idea of staying at Paris. I had stayed at the attached sister property, Bally's and had been very underwhelmed. I was very pleasantly surprised! The rooms were extremely nice and on par with some of the newer upscale places. The food at every restaurant was outstanding. If you can, get a room higher up overlooking the Bellagio fountains and the Eiffel Tower!

Reviews.Title: “A good stay”
Reviews.Author: PGilchrist
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights visiting Las Vegas, having stayed in the Belagio last time I found Paris similar but better value for money. Rooms were clean, had everything we needed, and a decent size. Housekeeping did a good job each morning. Paris is in a great location, central to a lot of very good casinos, restaurants and sites. The rest of the hotel is very laid back and a slightly older crowd than other places in Vegas. I would probably stay here again, especially over the Belagio across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Red room”
Reviews.Author: jaumeAlaska
Reviews.Content: Tripadvisor helped with this one. We booked the red room, one up from their regular "deluxe" room. With the Total Rewards membership ( I am not a high roller, iI had signed up for this once six years ago), it came to $122 inc. tax. What we got was a big room, absolutely no tobacco odor, nice furnishings, big TV, nice view. The regular room would have been half this price and if by myself, I might have tried it, but my wife would not have been able to abide any tobacco residue odor. In this price range, I think it compared well to the other strip offerings. Keep in mind with the casinos, once you are in the room, everything else will cost. But we got what we paid for and a bit more. Thanks for helping us with this decision earlier reviewers.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located”
Reviews.Author: BKBLUELOGIC
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently located with a nice casino.. walking distance to major places on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: RedLily1968
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Vegas 2x per year for the last 20 years. This was the first time I stayed at Paris. The room was comped so I wanted to try it. I love the location and the ability to walk easily to Bally's. However, I had a room facing the pool and it was noisy all day and all night. Never ending thuds from the techno-sounding music. Additionally the several horse-playing guys in the next room were banging on the walls so hard the pictures were shaking on the wall. A phone call to the front desk solved that though. Although I am not saying I would never stay here again it would not be my first choice and never in a room facing the pool again - even if it was free.

Reviews.Title: “FAB Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rc38554
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed this past week. Had a FAB time. The breakfast buffet was incredible. Lots of choices from pastries, fruit, eggs (all different ways), bread. Yummy! We also ate dinner at Le Provencal and that was incredible. We didn't have a bad meal our entire 4 day stay. I do have to say that the spa was not all that. The hot tub was dirty, the showers were out of date (maybe change the shower heads), the service I saw was only at the beginning when you check in and give them your money. The price for the massage was more than the massage I received at Caesar's and Caesar's had an amazing spa. Our room was incredible too. Our view was of Bellagio and got to see the dancing water. The housekeepers were great and our bed was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: arhieatt
Reviews.Content: Took my mom to Vegas for her 75th birthday. Had a very nice room with 2 queen beds. Only one problem was that between 11am - 3pm, the water was disconnected for some work in the area. The following morning, the water had still not got warm enough for showering. Easy check in and easy Express Check-out. Would definitely try Paris again (this was my second stay at The Paris).

Reviews.Title: “Outdated, dark and smelly”
Reviews.Author: wrdlyone
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at this hotel. First, upon arrival, there was no one to help with luggage, or even to open the doors, which is needed when you have luggage. Check in was a nightmare. The room wasn't ready, so we had to drag our luggage back outdoors to check it with the bellman. We headed to the pool, where we were allowed one towel each. No changing room. Had to maneuver in a bathroom stall to change. We were scolded on our way to change, about rolling our suitcase on the cement pool deck. We tried to order a drink at the pool, but after 30 minutes of no service, went to the bar. Since we didn't have a room, they wanted a credit card to pay...really, you don't have a system for that? We checked in and got a room number, it just wasn't ready! The pool was dirty. Finally got to the room. It was dark and smelly, and hot. The bed was so old, it was sunken in. The chair was ripped. Everything was banged up. It was dirty. No coffee in room. Went to the cafe for breakfast, was disgusting food. Tasteless. Ordered a breakfast sandwich, thinking at least fries may be good, only to have some fingerling cold potatoes delivered. We asked why the menu said fries..and the waitress said, "oh, that takes longer". Terrible service and even worse food. The lobby and common areas in the hotel are dark, dirty and reek. The tables in the casino are filthy and smell like some bad cleaner. Upon checkout, rather than working on getting taxis for people, the doorman was trying to sell a limo to the airport instead. Ate at the Eiffel tower restaurant on the top floor. The food wasn't as good as a Bonanza steakhouse. Food was cold, and the short ribs were cold with a film on them. Disgusting. Nice view up there, but not if you want food. Stop in for a drink and get out of the hotel, if you want edible food!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 348SaraK11
Reviews.Content: We got married at the Paris hotel and stayed in the Calais suite. It was amazing. The room was very large and ideal for the wedding party getting ready in the morning. We got various things as part of our package including breakfast in bed (which was enough food to last for days!) The hotel has plenty of places to eat, drink and of course gamble. We went up the Eiffel Tower which gave us lovely views of the strip. Checking in and out was very easy. I was even able to check in my parents whose flights had been delayed. I would stay at this hotel again, it is in an ideal location on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “will stay again”
Reviews.Author: julesmama
Reviews.Content: we got our room comped for one night,so we really did`nt have alot of time........We got there around 1p.m. only a couple people in line and because I know to approach the check-in person with a big smile and a very cheerful,but honest greeting,we were given an upgrade to a red room. It was a nice room,small couch,chairs,nice t.v.,fridge(used to be a mini bar so not alot of space) and a safe......bathroom was nice,nothing to write home about.......Casino was pretty tight on there machines,so went to ballys it was somewhat better..........Ate at the Le something hamburger place,it was very good but pricey...........all in all will only stay again if it is comped

Reviews.Title: “Rooms a bit "worn" and in need of refresh!”
Reviews.Author: Da2011
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Paris, all three times for conventions. Since these stays have ranged over a 6 year period I could really see the deterioration of the rooms over these years. Our room was the standard room and the furnishings were as I remember them. Our granite shower, lovely as it was, had mold. There was a yellow "rust" spot in our tub and made me not want to use it. We were given a room with 2 queens and after my husband layed on the one closest the window he got up and said "ok, this has a big lump, lets try the other". It was somewhat better confirming something I read years ago. It was that 90% of people who have a room with two beds will choose the one furthest from the window- so choose the other for a less worn out bed. Others in our group were equally disappointed and several made comments about it being a bit run down. One person had a hole in the wall behind their toilet! We attempted to go to the pool one of the days. We purchased our "pool drinks" and set up our chairs. Suddenly we were BLASTED by music (if they could call it that) soo loud it was deafening. It went on for atleast 10 min before we gave up and left. On the way out I asked what was going on. The pool attendant advised that they were testing the sound system of the new club. It was HORRENDOUS and ruined my hope for relaxation at the pool. I do enjoy the atmosphere of the Paris with it's little "street" but would not stay here again by choice.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here....Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: SunnyD518
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed here for 5 days over the Columbus Day Weekend to celebrate turning 40 this year. We were very pleased with the Paris. We had no problem checking in and the staff there were pleasant. We actually checked in 2 hours early and it was no problem. We stayed in room 1037 in one of the older rooms. There wasn't a view of the pool or the Bellagio fountains across the street but you could still see the lights of the city and neighboring hotels. The noise level was never an issue in our area. The room was older and dated as some others have mentioned but it was clean, comfortable and roomy. The TV was old and not a flat screen but other than using it to check on the news and weather, we didn' watch it so this wasn't a big deal to us. If it is to you, ask to be placed in one of the newer red rooms. The hotel has several eating establishments to choose from. There is a buffet, upscale restaurants, bistros, cafes, etc. What we liked most about this hotel is that it wasn't full of restaurant chains and mall type stores that many of the other hotels had. It honestly feels like you are walking through the streets of Paris. The atmosphere can't be beat. It was fun to walk around the other hotels on the strip as they each have their own unique theme but again, most of them have a lot of commercial features too. It crossed my mind that it would feel like staying in a mall that also had a hotel. Staying at Paris makes you feel like you're in another country. We rented a car for the day one of the days we were there. There is an AVIS rental office right next to the check in desk. Red Rock Canyon, Lake Mead and the Hoover Dam are all within a short driving distance. It's really worth it to rent a car or to go on a tour to view the mountains...especially if you aren't from that part of the country. It's quite something to drive through the hustle and bustle of Las Vegas and then be faced with this gorgeous scenary and nature within minutes. I will give Paris 5 starts because we really did love it. But a couple of notes....the nightclub Chateau was very nice but a bit pretentious for our style. We went there for a short time then moved down the block to Harrah's "Carnival Court"...this was a much more laid back outdoor bar with bands, DJ's and dancing. More our speed for sure but it depends on what you are looking for. And while we did like the buffet at Paris, we liked the brunch at the Monte Carlo hotel more. Whatever you choose, enjoy your stay in Vegas! There's a ton to do there!

Reviews.Title: “Second stay, love the Paris”
Reviews.Author: MeNanni
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris for 4 nights. Arrived early morning and checked in. This was the only problem we had. We knew we would not get our room too early, but the girl said to come back around 10:30 a.m., we did and were told to come back at 2:00, (the first people were not very friendly at all) long story short the forth time back the young lady was very nice and informed us that the computer did not show that we had already checked in and that our room had been held, like the first person told us. We finally got our room and from then on our stay was awesome. Our room was very spacious, clean and we had a fantastic view of the pool and some of the strip. We would recommend the Paris highly. Their buffet is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Great location”
Reviews.Author: tssammie
Reviews.Content: We had a great time staying at Paris. Location is great as well as amenities on the property. The rooms are overdue for updating. The view of the Belagio is great.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN ALSO”
Reviews.Author: mountianview
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with the review titled "never again". We too stayed during their time frame. The night of October 9th was total unacceptable! We were on the 23rd floor and the music sounded like it was next door. I also called the night manager and same story, with a chuckle. I first called the front desk, the rep knew the music was going to play until 4am, it was the grand opening of the Beer Garden, where as "peter" the night manager did not, he was totally clueless. I also wrote Paris an e-mail upon returning home....and again the same night manager answered it, he said "We are currently going through a trial phase with the Night Club and are fine tuning a acceptable volume." PLEASE! can you not come up with a better story??? I DO NOT recommend this hotel if "upper management" does not care enough about their patrons to let this totally unexceptionable incident happen.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: 2b
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a second three night stay at Paris and found it fitted our needs perfectly. We were expecting a regular 'deluxe' (we were comped this) but received a renovated room which was quite nice. From check in to housekeeping to restaurants to cw's we had excellent service. The casino is smallish but has the new slots available as well as the ones we like to play. While not as large as some on the Strip it is easy to manuver about quite easily. We have stayed at many Strip hotels but would return here just for the comfort, the pleasant staff, the numerous dining options and the location. Well done again Paris!

Reviews.Title: “a week at paris”
Reviews.Author: jersey_coast
Reviews.Content: Paris has a great location on the strip a nice atmosphere and it is not so big that you get lost. the rooms are great size with spacious bathroom. elevators are really fast and centrally located I highly recommend the Paris and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JamoccishGirls
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in September, although didn’t spend much time in the hotel it’s a lovely hotel. Check in was quick and easy and lifts are located to the back of the casino. Room was nice and always cleaned daily. Managed to spend some time by the pool which was quite busy but we managed to find a lounger, pool area is nice and you can even hear and see the Bellagio fountains!! Hotel is in an excellent location for accessing any of the other hotels in the Strip. For our full trip report refer to the Vegas forum.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat Customer of Paris and will return again.”
Reviews.Author: tinah3
Reviews.Content: I visit Las Vegas 3 to 4 times per year, from Canada. I have stayed at many properties in Las Vegas and find myself always rebooking at the Paris. I generally stay for 5 - 10 days (a long time by Vegas standards), to enjoy the strip. Paris consistently provides me with a comfortable place to stay, with well maintained recently renovated rooms accommodating my "view" request (I generally overlook the Bellagio fountains). Another reviewer recently mentioned the noise of the new Chateau Night Club. I will completely second all her comments with the exception of the reaction from staff. My Casino Host immediately began checking on the issue (yes - in every sense of the word, the noise was decible breaking and completely unacceptable until 4 a.m.), calling another manager and going out to investigate. He even invited me to come along, which I did. In a subsequent follow up phone call to me, he stated that they will be working on the problem of the noise, as apparently on this "soft opening" (it was one night only), someone had the sound levels too high. Much research had gone into what was acceptable for the hotel patrons, and this had gone WAY OVER what was acceptable. I've stayed at the hotel so many times without any problems that I forgave this indescretion. I was told that I could change rooms, however, they were NOT going to open the nightclub again at any point during my stay, which they did not.
