Once that problem was solved for me, the remainder of my stay was quite acceptable. I felt that my complaints were heard and they were doing something to resolve them. If nothing is done once the nightclub is opened permanently, this could be a very difficult problem - my best advise would be to call the hotel and find out if the problem has been resolved prior to booking a room. That said, I'm already booked to go back in December. The convenience of being right in the middle of the strip with very easy access in and out of Paris (unlike many of the other properties where you seemingly walk 'forever' just to get to your room), is great. The Mon Ami Gabi restaurant on property is outstanding - best French Onion Soup you've ever had - guaranteed. Many other restaurants on the property are available as well. My only negatives are the standard for ALL the hotels that I've stayed at in Vegas. The other guests who stomp down the hall drunk, laughing, being outrageously discourteous to the sleeping guests at all hours of the night. Not all of us really want to be awake at 3 a.m.!!!!! Why do some people leave their manners at home when they travel to "sin city"? Go ahead and sin - just be quiet about it!! Otherwise, I will continue to return to Paris as out of all the properties I've stayed at, I've enjoyed the atmosphere the most while there. Oh, and be sure to take the ride up the Eiffel Tower to check out the views - I'm sharing my photos in this review (poor quality due to cell phone, but incredible views, nonetheless!). Oh - one more note - the taxi hailer is a total snarky guy. Feels he is OWED a tip for opening a door for you after the cab arrived. He made a very nasty comment about how he hoped we appreciated his service as he was closing the door after we didn't tip him. Everyone in Vegas has their hands out for tips, and you get a bit tired of it after awhile and multiple cab rides (I would never drive a car in Vegas - just too much traffic) - so be prepared to deal with their wrath if you don't tip someone. Personally, I'm comfortable with it. I tip for outstanding service, but can open my own car door.

Reviews.Title: “Above average, older atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: madiw_
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights with a girlfriend in August. The hotel is nice. Room was decent. It was very clean. Pool was average. I found that most of the guests were above 40 or they were families. This is perfectly fine but if your looking for a young crowd it is not here. We wanted to try the buffet but there was a huge line so we decided to go to a different buffet. The pizza from the stand downstairs was delicious. Overall there was nothing wrong with this hotel. It is in a perfect location and is above average for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip, excellent ameneties”
Reviews.Author: Alisarvh
Reviews.Content: We just returned from weekend in Las Vegas and had a great stay at Paris. They now allow pets in rooms so we were able to bring our two small dogs who love to travel. Food at the steakhouse overlooking the strip was excellent. We watched the Bellagio fountain while eating a filet mignon cooked perfectly with a red wine butter sauce and a side of crisps. The hotel location is also great, center of the strip so it's easy to walk to adjacent casinos/sights if you would like a change of pace. The rooms could be updated to keep up with other hotels on the strip but overall well worth the price. Will definitely return here again, hopefully soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: Rick S
Reviews.Content: Great location. Sugar Factory is incredible. Dealers are friendly. Short walk to the elevators from the lobby, or the casino area...very nice at the end of a long day of walking. Room was ok. There was no mini bar, the carpeting was loose and moved as you walk on it. But the view was great. Could see all over the city from the 28th floor. You could find a nicer hotel...but you could also do alot worse than here.

Reviews.Title: “Night Club Noise”
Reviews.Author: Richard G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris Las Vegas Sunday through to Thursday which unfortunately coincided with the launch night of Chateau night club in the grounds of the Paris fronting The Strip. The night club is due to be open on Tuesday, Friday & Saturday nights. Our room was on the 28th floor facing The Strip and was excellent for the first 2 nights. However the noise from the club literally vibrated our windows and was the worst we have ever experienced. It finally stopped at 4:30am even though the front desk had assured us it would finish at 4, although this was totally unreasonable. On complaining the following morning no compensation was offered at all and the managers were extremely reluctant to talk. Opinion on who was running the club varied depending on who you spoke to. We would definitely NOT stay at this hotel again mainly because no one accepted responsibility for the problem

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected....”
Reviews.Author: Tammy D
Reviews.Content: I would like to have rated the hotel higher but could not. Let's start out with the positive items. The hotel is lovely decorated French style with shops, restaurants and such in the Parisian fashion so it was nice to stroll around and see everything. Having easy access to Bally's via a walkway indoors was nice also. I saw Barry Manilow while staying there and since his show is at the Paris Hotel, that was the biggest plus. The restaurants are overpriced so we mainly stayed away but did avail ourselves of two eateries. La Creperie where they make the best French crepes with various fillings was superb. A bit pricey at $10 each but they were big enough for tow people. We also ate at their pizza location next to La Creperie and they had a deal for 2 slices and a drink for $10. The slices are big so unless you are really hungry, just order 1 slice. My husband did go down to get me coffee at their bakery (in the same area) for our last morning and paid $3.50 for a small cup. The room was detailed nicely and the bathroom was very nice with a tub and separate shower which is rare. It was also very large and my favorite part of the room! On the down side, the room had not been updated and had an old tv that did not work 1/2 the time. The bed was lumpy and uncomfortable. There is no coffee pot in the room and when I called about that, I was told that was standard in Vegas. Not true at our last hotel. We also had asked for an upgrade and did not receive it. Our view was of concrete and roofs of other floors. Also, even though the bathroom was lavishly appointed, the shower head did not adjust and sent out a fine mist. It took forever to rinse my hair. Just looking at the surface though, the room was well appointed if you do not mind no to little TV and sleeping on a lumpy bed. The casino at the Paris is one of the smallest in all of the hotels on the strip and the smokiest. I had trouble walking around downstairs because the smoke was so strong. We most likely will not stay at this hotel again. Make sure you do not get one of the older rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Wee Wee”
Reviews.Author: viagero05
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my first trip to Las Vegas and had a great time. Check-in was very fast, the price was very good and the food was amazing. The room itself was average but who goes to Vegas to sleep? The location is perfect because it's right in the middle of the strip. The casino is nice and I love the painted ceiling. I ordered room service and although it did take a while the food was amazing. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THE PARIS HOTEL ... AND WANT TO GO BACK”
Reviews.Author: Aline P
Reviews.Content: I went to Vegas with my dad to celebrate my birthday, and we stayed in Paris Las Vegas for a week, from Sep. 14th to Sep. 21st. It was my first time in the city and I couldn't be happier!!!! Las Vegas is the place to be! The hotel is very good. It made up to my expectations. It has an amazing location, the Village buffet is very good, the employees are very nice (Vicky, one of the waiters from Le Central, is a lovely person). The Eiffel Tower Restaurant is amazing, although is a lilttle bit pricey. Loved the grand seafood platter from Mon Ami Gabi. We got an upgrade when we checked in and it worked out pretty fine, since the room had a nice Bellagio fountains view and we also had continental breakfast and hors d'ouvres included during our stay in the 31st floor for only $55/ day (for 2). In the room, our beds were extremely confortable, the bathroom was big enough, with a tub and a separate shower. Very nice and clean. I recommend everyone to stay at the Paris. I'm already planning my next trip to Vegas in 2012, and I'll probably stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: wendy0187
Reviews.Content: No surprise. Beautiful hotel, amazing location. The only complaint is that the pool closed at 6. We booked same day with a hotel app. We got a great rate. They gave us early check in and rooms right next door to each other. Great hotel, great customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is on the strip close to everything and room was fine.”
Reviews.Author: BOPOHA
Reviews.Content: I’m not big fan of older casino/hotels where you have to navigate the smelly casino maze before you can get to the elevators. But I got a deal ($106 per night) so I choose the Paris. Hotel is on the strip close to everything and room was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a great average, no better, no worse, on a great location..”
Reviews.Author: ndwalsh
Reviews.Content: a good all round hotel. We got a good rate, had nothing specifically to complain about the Paris - checking in and out took too long - 20-30 mins..each - part of our problem due to amex booking, but staff friendly at all times. My first time in Vegas, so wasn't used to the constant noise, no fresh air, inside smoking - but this is true to almost all hotels I believe. We had a standard (Luxury Room) which was a good size and well appointed. I found it odd for Vegas in general that what you usually pay for is free and what is free you pay for, e.g. Alcohol is free if you gamble, WIFI is $15 per device per day! Equally the Gym is $25 per day to go to... An excellent location too - right int he middle of the strip, opposite the Belaggio Fountains. Food outside very good - sitting outside in the Sugar Factory or Mon Ami..

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet hotel at the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: christawanner
Reviews.Content: The Paris is a newer hotel directly at the strip and the Bellagio is on the opposite of the street. They have so many different restaurants inside some with outside seats on a terrace towards the Bellagio and its fountains (Mon ami Gabi). Well prepared frenchstyle food and sweets and so on. Also if you forgot your dress or highheels. You will find everything in this hotel. Rooms are quiet especially on the backside of the hotel. Next monorail station is around 10 min walking distance at Bally's hotel which is connected by a shop mile.

Reviews.Title: “extended honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: DHCDB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were passing through Las Vegas enroute back to London from our honeymoon in Hawaii and decided to stay an extra 2 nights. We booked Paris on the actual day we stayed due to its central location on the strip and its great room rate at the last minute. When we walked in we were so glad we had stayed longer and choosen the Paris hotel. From the Effiel Towel sticking through the sky painted celing to all the shops starting with 'Le' - it may have been cheesy - but like Vegas as a whole was extremely captivating and entertaining. The amenities in the hotel were great - Casino, bars and food outlets as expected. You also have the Sugar Factory that is always open for late night snacks. Location is ideal on centre of strip and you can get the Duece and the express bus from outside. the Miracle Mile Mall is also next door. We were kindly upgraded to a Red Room on the front desk which had a romantic feel and a nice big widescreen tv. Room was clean, tidy and spacious. Poor area looked good although we didn't get to visit. We had the breakfast buffet in the morning which we found fine apart from our own over indulgence. Note that the queue for a late breakfast can be long so get there in good time. The hotel is also attached to the Bally hotel and Casino for even more slot action.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, rooms were ok, valet parking was a PITA.”
Reviews.Author: Bourgeois_Yuppie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paris hotel recently during a trip to Las Vegas, and chose it mainly for it's location, decor, and the great price I got on their website. Overall, I really liked this hotel. The casino is beautiful, the waitresses are very quick to bring your drinks (make sure to tip!) and the restaurants there are fantastic. I particularly liked Cafe Belle Madeleine for the pastries! The room itself was nice and well decorated, but could use a refresh as the furniture seemed worn and the bathroom outdated with gaudy wallpaper. However, the rooms are quiet and the beds are comfortable. Even my non-view room had a decent view of Bally's and the Platinum hotel. I will agree with other reviewers that the checkin staff was less than welcoming, but the housekeeping staff was wonderful. One thing I hated about this hotel was the valet parking. Getting into the valet parking seems all but impossible unless you enter the hotel from the Strip, which of course is a nightmare. Getting out is the same -- you have to turn on to the strip. All the while, there are pedestrians crossing in front of the entrance/exit. If you are lucky enough to get a break in the pedestrians (drunk people aren't very good about following the crosswalk signals, so be careful), it may be moot because traffic may easily be backed up beyond the intersection. I sat for 15 minutes trying to get out of the valet parking on Friday afternoon. I do not recommend using the valet parking, and you may not have a choice because it was full a few times when I pulled into the hotel. If you decide to self-park, access is easy off of Audrie Ln behind the hotel. I wish I had know this from the beginning. Apart from the parking fiasco, this was a great stay in a beautiful environment.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: crazycrush1974
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 day conference at the Paris hotel...and it was one of the most disappointing stays I've ever had in Vegas. My husband and I stayed there for a 3 day conference and the last night of our stay the Chateau night club opened its beer garden. OH MY GOD. It sounded like the night club was IN OUR ROOM. Our windows were shaking and we could make out every word of every song they played. Remind you, this club stays open until 4am. The music finally turned off at 4:30am. The staff at the Paris was awful about the noise. The night manager even told me he was "over it" because of all the calls. See, the Paris can't do anything about it because Chateau is owned by someone else - it's not run by Paris. I was told the music would stop at 2. Nope. 3am. Nope. It went on until 4:30am. I would tell you to call first and make sure your room DOES NOT face the pool (which is really the best view in the hotel since that view also affords you the wonderful Bellagio water show). However, after talking to the night manager and the next day manager, there were complaints about the noise from the back of the hotel, from Bally's and from Bellagio! I will NEVER stay at this hotel AGAIN. The staff was incredibly rude about the offensive noise and offered absolutely NO reciprocity for the inconvenience of not being able to sleep that night. The manager told me it should be the Chateau nighclub that should be giving patrons free nights. It was awful...I wouldn't take the chance. As long as that nightclub is open there - I will stay far away from that area. There are just too many awesome hotels in Vegas to take a gamble with that kind of noise pollution. Unless you are someone who usually gets home at 4 or 5 am...then disregard this review.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was great, but the buffet made us throw up !”
Reviews.Author: adriancastaneda99
Reviews.Content: we ate at the buffet here in the casino and me and my wife both threw up last mornings breakfast! we also had diarrhea and had stomach aches all day! i dont recommend the food from here to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Paris I love it!!”
Reviews.Author: hhwife
Reviews.Content: Stayed at paris from sept. 24 to 28, we had a very early flight arrived at 8:30 am, my room was not ready but the women at the desk took my cell phone number and she called me about 10:00 am to tell me my room was ready which i thought was a nice gesture since i did not have to keep going back and forth to check. When i did pick up my keys since it was my birthday and i am a diamond member she had a birthday cake waiting with my keys (very nice touch). Ate at paris buffet and mon a bi gabi , both were excellent. Housekeeping was very efficient no complaints. i had a room on the 30th floor, which was a red room with a fantastic view. Cannot say anything bad about the paris everyone was friendly and very helpful, will definitely stay there again, I did try the lago buffet at ceasars for the first time, was very disappointed , the atmosphere was nice, but very small with limited food selection, the dessert table consisted of a few small desserts with tons of cookies, in comparision to all the other buffets this one was pretty pathetic, dont waste you money. All in all had a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Great location and greater restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Buffalogal208
Reviews.Content: We had adjoining rooms with our adult kids and rooms were large and comfy. AS non-gamblers we liked that you can get in and out without running a gaunlet of slot machines. But the best part was the French restaurant which overlooks the syncronized fountains. The food was amazing (they lease space and are not owned by the hotel) and even in Jan. we sat on the patio to enjoy the view. Ate a breakfast lunch and dinner there and it was worth another trip. But since they have a location in Chicago also, may just go there instead!

Reviews.Title: “Will not be booking Paris again!”
Reviews.Author: Trubanon
Reviews.Content: BEWARE! Getting one of the rooms facing the pool and/or the Bellagio will subject you to the relentless pounding of techno music to your room. All compliments of the outdoor gardens of Paris' Club Chateau. This will not be an issue to you should you be a twenty-something whose bedtime is after 4:30 AM. Should you be one who wishes to sleep at a more traditional time, tough luck, the party will be keeping you up until 4:30 AM when the Club closes.

Reviews.Title: “Stay In Las Vegas Paris”
Reviews.Author: troopman5073
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Paris for 7 nights from 9/27/11 through 9/3/11. We booked an upgraded Red Room for the week. We arrived early in the morning on 9/27 and got to the hotel around 8:30am. We expected to check our luggage with the hotel until our room was available since the hotel was fully booked. What a surprise that a room was available. We were in our room on the 30th. floor and unpacked our clothes and ready for the strip by 9:30am. A bonus this time around was there was a 1 cup coffee maker (4 pks daily) and a refrigerator (empty) we could use. We put fruit, water and yogurt in the refrigerator for our breakfast and both of us had two cups of coffee and than hit the strip. Room was plenty large for us since we don't spend much time in there. King size bed with our Drawers, and each of us had our own closet space to hang clothes. The room had a 42 inch flat screen tv, a love sofa, chair and desk. The bathroom had a tub and shower. We did not have a strip view but could see the city and part of the airport. All in all we loved the room and location of the Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Red Room is worth to stay”
Reviews.Author: World Passport
Reviews.Content: Paris is not a new hotel. Few years ago when I stayed in their regular room, it was dirty and so dated. These past couple of years I only want to stay in their red rooms. They are on higher floors so naturally with better views. Coffee maker which is very rare to find in Vegas hotels and refrigerator in the room. Internet is $10 per 24 hour. The room is a bit dark. They need to have a table lamp on the desk. Also, a mirror in the room, (other than the one in the bathroom) would be nice. The wall is a bit on the thin side because I could sometimes hear people from another room. The A/C is very quiet and the bed is not too soft. Not cheap but again nothing is cheap in Vegas anymore, especially if you want to stay on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Just beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler187
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights, booked the Red room premier and didn't regret a single penny we paid for it. We had a view of the Strip, Bellagio is right on the other side of the street so we watched the fountain dancing, it was great, but the city really gets beautiful at night when all the lights come on, it gives you SOME view of the city. The rooms are spacious, large bathroom with both tub and shower, everything very clean. The pool is great, we stayed in September so I can't tell if the hotel was full, but there were plenty of free chairs at the pool. Really nothing I could complain of, actually everything was just perfect. Can definitely recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful !”
Reviews.Author: suzanne l
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent 5 days at the Paris the room was enoemous and immaculately clean more white towels everyday yhan we could use. The roof pool was a quite break from all the noise and bustle of the strip. The french restaurant downstairs was exquisite, almost thought we were in france .

Reviews.Title: “Tres Bon”
Reviews.Author: Yardville
Reviews.Content: Paris is one of the better hotels we have stayed in Las Vegas for under $100 per night. The check-in and check-out were easy with good service. The concierge was helpful with even small things. Walking around the hotel is pleasant with street shops and cafes like Paris. The trip up the Eiffel Tower at night was very beautiful, but expect to wait in line for a while to get into the elevator. The location of the hotel on the strip was perfect, being across from the Bellagio and easy access to many other hotels. The room was above expectations, with comfortable beds, a large and very nice bathroom, and it was fairly quiet at night. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, centrally located hotel and casino with comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: G0zzy
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th time in Vegas and our room at the Paris was by far the best one that I've stayed in yet. Tastefully decorated and of a good size, the little time that we spent in the room was very comfortable and relaxing. I slept really well in this hotel, with no complaints about noise from the hallway, other rooms, the strip etc. The room benefited from a room safe, large plasma screen TV, chaise lounge, empty mini-bar?? and a massive, extremely comfortable bed! The bathroom featured a separate bath and shower and came equipped with toiletries, hair drier, decent towels etc. The best thing about our room however, was the fabulous view of the strip. Located at the front of the hotel, we overlooked the pool and enjoyed a fantastic view of the Bellagio lake and hotel. The room was kept spotless by the excellent housekeeping service, who left us a little note to thank us for the tips I left. Outside of the room, the hotel has a decent size casino, resident shows, spacious pool, gym, many bars and restaurants, along with apparently one of the best buffets on the strip, although expect a queue. I found the food at the buffet to be OK, there was certainly a wide choice, but my advice would be to find a decent restaurant instead. You're in Vegas! There are fabulous restaurants everywhere! The Paris is very cleverly decorated to look like you're outside. If you look at the clouds on the ceiling while you're walking, they actually look like they're moving. This combined with the replica french streets, bridge and of course, the Eiffel Tower, create a theme that's fun, but surprisingly not too over-the-top or tacky. I'd recommend a trip up the tower. Buy one get one free vouchers are easy to find and the views are excellent, especially of the Bellagio fountain show. Time it with sunset for some great photo opportunities. The Paris is connected to Ballys via an indoor shopping arcade. You can catch the Monorail from Ballys to other areas of the strip. Although the Paris benefits from an excellent central location, the strip is just over 4 miles long and the Monorail is a great and cost effective way of traveling up and down when you're tired of walking in the desert heat! When choosing your hotel in Vegas, be aware that the MGM Mirage Group hotels, which is pretty much most of the hotels on the strip, now charge a controversial 'resort fee'. When I visited Vegas last year, this fee effectively bumped the room rate up. It's not the cost of this fee that's the problem, its the principle. If you're going to implement an extra, mandatory fee to cover the use of the hotel's facilities, regardless of whether or not the guest uses them, why not add it on to the room rate so your guests know what they're paying when they book the room, not when they check out?! I'm pleased to say that the Paris is not part of the MGM Mirage Group and does NOT charge a resort fee. Thank you Paris. In conclusion, the Paris is a fun, centrally located hotel and casino, offering comfortable rooms when you run out of energy and need to grab some sleep. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good if not paying too much”
Reviews.Author: 1happydisneygirl
Reviews.Content: We were attending a convention and stayed here 3 out of 5 nights. RESERVATIONS: We didn't make them for the convention, but when I tried to make them for the non-convention days, I was pleased with the friendliness of the staff who operate the reservation line. CHECK-IN: Very fast and friendly. The front desk clerk was helpful and willing to answer our questions. ROOM: To put it simply...if I had paid the price they wanted to charge during the non-convention days, I would have been REALLY ticked off! (Thankfully, my company paid for my room during the convention.) The room itself was nice...decorated in French decor, of course. But, frankly speaking, it wasn't worth more than $100 a night! (Which is why we moved to Bally's after the convention.) The beds were hard, the t.v. (the old tube kind) had TERRIBLE reception, there was no microwave and I could hear the person in the next room coughing all night. The soaps and shampoo were nice, but not worth any extra $$. And to top it off...they wanted to charge $14.95 for 24 hours of internet. PLEASE!!! That is absolutely ridiculous. FACILITIES: The Paris "grounds" are quite stunning. The casino area is made to look like it is outdoors. Very pretty. The shops are nice and I found some nice little trinkets to take home. RESTAURANTS: I am NOT into buffets, but decided to try their $15.99 breakfast buffet. It was AMAZING and I highly recommend it to anyone staying at the hotel. I won't get into all the details, but the choices were mind boggling. They had everything from freshly made Belgiun waffles to made-to-order crepes and omelets. There were pastries, bacon, sausage, different types of meats, grits, oatmeal, lots of fresh fruit, the list goes on and on. CHECK-OUT: We tried to check out via the t.v., but couldn't, so I called downstairs. Check-out was completed in 2 minutes by a very friendly front desk clerk. OVERALL: After the convention, we spent 2 days at Bally's. (The "sister" of the Paris hotel.) While Bally's atmosphere wasn't as nice as the Paris, it was fine for what Bally's charged. (Though the Paris room was cleaner.) I just feel as if the Paris charges way too much without any real added benefit. My other complaint...if you use the self-parking, it is quite a trek to check-in. But, Las Vegas isn't known for convenience...it is known for gambling. So realize this...the hotels in Vegas are built around getting you to spend money by either gambling or going to shows..."convenience" isn't in the Vegas vocabulary.

Reviews.Title: “Just a room”
Reviews.Author: tripfriends
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a number of times but the rooms are just an expensive room w/no real style or character. I love the casino & eating places and they do have a WOW atmosphere. Same trip we also stayed 1 night at Mandalay Bay. Rooms are much less, & have character or at least a little style and interest.

Reviews.Title: “Short trip to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: AlvaroLuis
Reviews.Content: We took a short 4 days trip to Las Vegas and chose this hotel based on the price. Check-in: No time to loose here. It was fast, and it was done right. The Room: we picked one of those Red Rooms and did not dissapoint. The bed could have been a bit more comfortable, but the room was spacious, clean and with a decent partial Strip view. Restaurants: there's restaurants for every taste. You will not go hungry in this hotel, and the prices were not outrageous... Did not try the steakhouse. Only regret was that we booked this hotel because we had tickets for the Barry Manilow show, and found out, the minute we walked to the theater area, that the show had been cancelled for that night (2nd time it happens to us with Barry Manilow!). Great location, good service, clean and comfortable room. Wish I could say I'll return to this hotel next time... with so many options is hard to tell... but will definitely recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Great Amenities”
Reviews.Author: reecer07
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March for 4 nights...easy check-in, easy to navigate throughout the lower levels and up to the rooms. Room was clean and nice; location is excellent for walking to near-by areas,etc. Access to the monorail was easy too! The restaurants and shops within the Paris property are great with several choices to pick from. The pool is very nice and well maintained...I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Pedalboy
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas isn't your typical business destination. But when a trade show takes you there, I recommend Paris. Great choices for food, drink and entertainment. Good transportation options with the monorail. Wireless everywhere. Business center, great health club.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay at the Paris”
Reviews.Author: zimmfam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris from Sept. 18 - 23. We go to Vegas every year about this time and have tried several hotels on the center strip. Check-in was a breeze, walked in the door, walked up to the counter and was immediately upgraded to a Red Room without even asking. Now, we arrived at midnight so that may have had a bearing on the upgrade. We were told that we had a handicap bathroom and asked if that would be alright, I replied "certainly". The room was really nice. Very clean, had a fridge and even had a coffeemaker! Not much of a view but we didn't come to Vegas to stare out the window. Now, the handicap bathroom was a bit of a challenge. Can't readily explain the set-up with the shower but it was a mess and I nearly flooded the bathroom on two occasions. The bathroom lavatory had a nice sink but very little space to put your toiletries on. The bed was wonderful!!! That room had, without a doubt, the very best bed I've every slept in during my entire life. I would have loved to have taken it home with me. Housekeeping came around every morning and kept our room clean and neat and we didn't hear any noisy people during our entire stay. I can't give any kind of a review on the restaurants at the Paris because they were very expensive and we found other places on the strip to eat. They did have a wonderful aroma as we were walking through the hotel restaurant area but there was always huge lines to get into the buffet. We did a little gambling there but the casino is rather small and again we found other nearby casinos to give our money to. I found the Paris a little difficult to get around in and a bit cluttered. Check-out was a breeze, we did that with our remote on the TV. Due to a late afternoon flight we had to leave our luggage with the bell captain and found those gentlemen very nice and upon our return had our luggage and a taxi for us quickly. The Paris is a very nice hotel and the staff we encountered couldn't have been friendlier. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but standard rooms”
Reviews.Author: bkvegas
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the Labor Day weekend - check-in was quick and easy, staff was friendly, and the buffet was very good. Rooms do need to be updated compared to other similar hotels (old bulky TV instead of flat-screen, etc...), but it was clean and centrally located on the strip with easy walking to Planet Hollywood, Bellagio, and City Center. Would recommend if you can get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the middle of the strip”
Reviews.Author: hturner21
Reviews.Content: I was most happy with the location--twice I have stayed at the Encore/Wynn and it is so far to get anywhere other than the Palazzo without taking a cab. Our room was a little small, but pretty, and had a nice view of the pool & the Bellagio. Conceierge was heplful & very nice. I guess I am pretty spoiled b/c I was disappointed there was no in-room robes. Wifi access was $15/day I think. The housekeeping was average--all she did was make the bed & put out new towels. The shower was small--the water flow was weak. I am not sure I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Parisian Nights a la Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Polo_and_Marco
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris Vegas for three nights and were overwhelmed by the extravagance and attention to detail to make the place look like a mini Paris. It is truly grand. We stayed in a normal room on the 5th floor overlooking the pool and had a nice view of the Eiffel Tower. The room its self was easy to get too from the main lobby and was clean, comfortable and quiet. We were given the choice between two queen size beds or one king. We choose the king bed which was very comfortable and it was also very nice to be on a completely smoke free floor when you are allowed to smoke in the casino itself. The bathroom was big and clean with a separate bath and shower. There are numerous restaurants however we can't comment on these as we eat else where due to the variety of options. We took a ride up to the top of the Eiffel tower at night to see the sights and watch the Bellagio fountains. The casino is pretty central on the strip giving easy access to the other casinos and shows.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool”
Reviews.Author: mapleguy
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the Paris Sept 19th to 24th. Upgraded to a Red room on the 25th floor, didn't see a standard blue room so can't offer a comparison but the room was fine. Maid service was exceptional while service in the restaurants was hit and miss. Sugar factory was a good choice for lunch but once it got busy at dinner they seemed to drop the ball a few times. Pool at the Paris is great lots of room lots of places to sit but try to hold off drinking until after 4 pm when mixed drinks are 7 dollars instead of 14 and beer dropped 7 to 3.50 buckets of 5 from 35 to 17.50. The gym is 25 dollars a day if you're interested and there is no free wifi at this hotel 15 dollars for 24 hours. We dropped in to Aromi D'Italia in the miracle mile for a coffee and free wifi. In front of Planet Hollywood is a game push to win but you must be a rewards card member to play which they will tell you after you've stood in line for 10 minutes. If you feel you want to try your luck sign up and then line up. If you want to quench your thirst from standing in line try the chandalier bar across the street. The middle bar (there are 3 floors) makes a drink using Szechuan buttons (a small flower) you chew the flower and then taste the drink. The effect is pretty cool, it's not on the menu but I think it is a Verbena drink they'll know what you are talking about.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Las Vegas - Honest People”
Reviews.Author: CruzDiva
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris for 4 days Sept. 11-15, 20011. This was our third visit to Las Vegas and our third stay at The Paris. We choose The Paris because of our past experiences at the hotel and also because of its location - in the centre of The Strip and close to lots of attractions. We were greeted by a very friendly woman who checked us in and she gave us a free upgrade. We had booked a luxury room and usually we would get a view of Ballys and the mountains; this time we still had the luxury room but the view was of the pool and part of The Strip. With the exception of one rude waitress at the Café, everyone at The Paris was friendly and very helpful. Our weather wasn't that great but we did spend a few hours by the pool one day- the pool is great, water was not too cold, and it is larger than you think when you start swimming. We ordered a drink and although they couldn't make exactly what we wanted they improvised and we received a refreshing strawberry daiquari with a touch of banana liqueur. Yummmmm! My reviews of the Café and Mon Ami Gabi can be found under their respective names on TripAdvisor. I did CSI:The Experience and we ate at Canelletto's in the Venetian Hotel and you can read my reviews of those experiences on TripAdvisor. Check out was a breeze. When I was on the plane going home I realized that I had left my prescription and non-prescription medication in the hotel room. Upon my return home I called The Paris and spoke to Nellie (not sure of the spelling) and Marian, both from Security. Long story short, my medications were returned to me last Friday. It was a good feeling to know that there are still some honest people in this world from the housekeeper to finding the medications and turning them in to the people in Security who packaged my medications and sent them to me via courier. I will definitely stay at The Paris again. One comment though: the rooms need upgrading from the furniture (the desk had a handle missing) to the pillows (too soft) to the mattresses (one of the mattresses has a permanent dent in it making the bed lopsided). I will definitely return to The Paris on my next visit to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “grand time in paris”
Reviews.Author: dichma
Reviews.Content: From check in time which was minimal to check-out a great experience. Room service was prompt. Pool was clean and spacious no overcrowding at anytime our room was overlooking the pool. When calling housekeeping for towels they were very prompt. Hotel is pet friendly which we are very pleased with being pet owners.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected”
Reviews.Author: MonaDSF
Reviews.Content: I am here for 4 nights to attend a convention and even though the property is beautiful the shortcomings stand out. The 10 year old tv with either terrible reception and/or a dying picture tube, that's right, picture tube, was very obvious. The mattress on my bed feels like a second box spring so I can't sleep. I figure well I'm awake I'll just go do my morning workout and find out the fitness center does not open until 6am. So I head back to my room to fix coffee and chk my email and agenda for the day, and there is no coffee maker in my room....... I can not remember staying in any hotel, domestic or abroad, over the past 20 years that did not have a coffee maker in it. FAIL.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Vegas hotel.”
Reviews.Author: heyuwiththeface
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel to stay in in Vegas. The casino wasn't enormous, and we loved the theme of the place. It was also in relatively close proximity to the other hotels on the strip, so we were able to see a lot. We would stay here again if we came back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CalifSue
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great! We were upgraded to a suite - what a treat. Checking in was very easy and the front desk very pleasant. The buffet restaurant was one of the best in Vegas. Pool area was very inviting for those of us that want relaxation. The only downside was that it was a very long walk from/to the parking lot . Make sure you take a rolling bag! Location on the strip is great.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: dietcoke85
Reviews.Content: This is the first time my husband and I stayed at the Paris. We choose it because we wanted to try a new hotel and we were traveling with some friends who wanted to stay there. We checked in around 11:30 am, had a players rate of less than $50 a night. They offered to upgrade us for $50 a night to a petite suite. We went ahead and took it and loved our room. Clean, huge, and the bathroom was SO big. A walk in shower, a jet tub, separate bathroom area with both toilet and Bedit. We had drinks in one of the bars in the middle of the casino with some friends and did a little gambling. The only food we had was pastries from the bakery. I would stay there again. The location is great and the area between the elevator and the strip isn't a lot of walking.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bellavie
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the Paris. Very nice hotel. The things we like about it is that it is a great location on the strip, never have to wait for an elevator, rooms are kept very clean, short walk thru the casino to get to the street and the pool is not over crowded like most of the other pools. The staff was very friendly, check in was very quick. The only thing that bothers me is when I have spent pricey money on drink at the pool and i go back for more ice they are quite hesitant to give it to you. Really? how expensive is ice when I'm paying $14 for a drink. And on top of it, when I asked for water and gave the bartender my cup, he told me where the water fountain was. But I would still recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “1st timers in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mikenlisa2
Reviews.Content: We went with friends who've been to Vegas several times and convinced us we must see it. It was beautiful. They chose the Paris Hotel and what a great choice it was. We had a room with no view but there was so much to see outside the hotel we were glad for the down time in the room. The rooms were spacious and clean. The bathroom was enormous. Our room was cleaned daily which was nice. We weren't sure what to expect and each time we left for the day it was cleaned and fresh towels were supplied. There was no coffee pot in the room but there is a small cafe right off the elevator that makes a great cup of coffee, expresso etc. and muffins. They had a few restaurants on the premise but we ate outside the hotel so I can't comment on them. We did get pizza from there one night after we got back from the strip. It was good. The hotel is in a great location across from the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “paris excellent hotel&casino”
Reviews.Author: chumbleyKaukauna_wi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in vegas from september 18-22 and stayed at the paris. The rooms were just remodeled and were spacious and spotless. The staff was also excellent. The restaurants are good, but the sugar factory was excellent. The casino is good and has a variety of games. We go to vegas 3 to 5 times a year and I would stay here again. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing red rooms”
Reviews.Author: Gemrob87
Reviews.Content: Visited Las Vegas for the second time in September 2011. We picked Paris Hotel for the location and on our last visit we fell in love with the casino and other communal areas. We had booked a king sized red room to celebrate our wedding anniversary. When we arrived we waited what felt like forever in a queue to be seen at check in, there was not enough staff to cover the busy period. (After a 10 hour flight all you want to do is check in and relax.) When we eventually got to check in we were told that there was no king sized rooms available and we would have to have 2 queen beds instead or we could upgrade for a minimum of $55 a night plus tax. We accepted the queen beds and went to our room. When we arrived the room was in a terrible state with ripped bed linen, stained carpets and brown stains on the net curtains. We complained about the state of the room and asked to be moved and while they were happy for us to move and were pleasant, we were basically told there could be no way the room would be dirty as they were newly renovated. The second room we were given was in exactly the same state. By this point we were losing our temper and asked to see a manager. The on duty manager was conveniently busy and could not see us but a king room had suddenly become available to us. We agreed to see the room and this time it was in much better condition so we agreed to stay in this room. Although the room still looked tired (and certainly not newly rennovated) it was clean enough to stay in. The bathroom was clean and a good size. Although we were aware when booking this trip that Paris is not the most luxurious hotel on the strip, there was no excuse for it to be dirty. The communal areas of the hotel are so well maintained they should continue this throughout the hotel. I do not see us staying at Paris hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been great”
Reviews.Author: bikenkayak_Al
Reviews.Content: My wife loved it and it did have good features (nice room, great location), but too much about the place bothered me. It was the only hotel in our two week travel around the southwest that had no Wifi, an obsolete TV, no refrigerator, and no in-room coffee maker. Even more insulting, the label on the high-tech min-bar warned of automatic charges if any item is disturbed for more than a few moments. We discovered on the last day that the contents had been removed, probably because no one was willing to pay the excessive charges. Pool area was wonderful, but the fitness center fee was exhorbitant ($25 pp daily) as was the cost for anything in the building ($3.50 for a cup of morning joe at the coffee bar). Service generally mediocre (a curbside greeter made no offer to help or get a bell hop as I struggled with the luggage). Better deals can be had in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Money!”
Reviews.Author: katediva
Reviews.Content: I love Vegas and usually manage to get there a minimum of 2 times a year. I've tried almost all the strip hotels and one of the absolute best values for your money is Paris. The remodeled rooms are dramatic in black and red, separate shower and soaking tub, and the location can't be beat. Right in the middle of everything. And you can get a room with a view of the Bellagio fountains for less than 1/2 what you'd pay @ the Bellagio. It is also not huge so that you spend 10 minutes getting to your room as I had to do once at the Venetian. The casino is also exactly the right size and I have to admit I also like Paris because I do well there! Skip the long lines at their buffet--it's ok but not worth waiting a 1/2 hr in line. Directly across from it is a crepe shop that does wonder crepes all day--I think I've had them all!

Reviews.Title: “fun place”
Reviews.Author: JoanneBrussels
Reviews.Content: This is a great fun place to stay for one or two nights. It's huge; you could easily get lost there. The ground floor has a big casino and lots of restaurants and shops; they've tried to build a small Paris there and they have even added an Eiffel tower which offers a great view over Las Vegas. Our room was on the 7th floor; very nice and quiet with a good bed and nice bathroom. Plenty of elevators which worked perfectly. We were advised to carry our own luggage, as there were long delays for bringing it up, but we didn't mind. The breakfast buffet was absolutely fabulous and service was very quick. One negative point though; the waiting line at check-in was awfully long and made the place look like the check-in rows of an airport.

Reviews.Title: “Super Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sashokchat
Reviews.Content: The hotel really resembles the center of Paris. Eifel tower with French music and buildings. Inside it is decorated like you are in the European Palace. Casino is pretty nice. And of course nice restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: lilizav
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Paris because of it good location, very exiting design and romantic atmosphere. We got marred in Vegas, our weeding nigh was here and it was excellent. The hotel has very good restaurants and buffets. Also we had 1 night free for 4 night booking, so price was very appropriate for such service.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: megs8
Reviews.Content: Great location, beautiful room and bathroom. After a long flight we were hoping for a really good rest but had to wait til 4.00 for our room - the only downfall. We didn't think check-in would be so late. At least we know for next time and we will return. We enjoyed meals from most of the in house cafes. Try a meal at Mon ami Gabi after sundown and watch the beautiful fountains of Bellagio across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Another Fun Paris Visit...”
Reviews.Author: castaways01
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Paris four nights in mid-August with a friend - my second visit within 3 months. A crisp $50-bill (credit card sandwich) at check-in netted an upgrade to a Red Room with two queen beds. Since the room was comped through Total Rewards, I didn't mind giving the front desk gal a large tip for a better room. My room was clean and the bed very comfortable. The Red rooms have a single cup coffee maker, a small refrigerator and a safe. Everyone I encountered at the hotel and casino was pleasant. I didn't eat in any of the restaurants as they appeared crowded nearly all the time. Unfortunately I CAN NOT recommend the spa. It was horrible. Got an expensive detox wrap and was not impressed with the service or faciity. None of the spa staff were very friendly or smiling. They ration out the small bottles of water there like they cost them a fortune. You had to ask and then the gal acted like you were inconveniencing them. Canyon Ranch at the Venetian is much much better!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Paris.”
Reviews.Author: liverpool0
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in august, having read the mixed reviews i must say i really can't complain. the hotel has a central location is clean and our room was roomy with tub and shower. the all you can eat buffets are good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “vacation”
Reviews.Author: shu340
Reviews.Content: Great check in and out, no line. Stayed for a week and ate at most of the restaurants, all were very good to great. Room and house keeping was good. The pool area was great except the hot tubs need some work done to them ( painting ). Pool side cafe was great.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - marvellous views”
Reviews.Author: hmchiswell56
Reviews.Content: we checked in to the Paris on 4th July 2011 for 4 nights. I asked for a strip view room as it was our wedding anniversary, I was told it was an extra $55 USD to upgrade but that she would give me a nice room anyway. The room was on the 24th floor with a partial view of the Bellagio fountains and a good view of the new Cosmopolitan hotel. The room was amazing with a sofa and armchair which we turned to face the full length window and just marvelled at the view!. bathroom was huge with a seperate bath and shower and everywhere was spotlessly clean. The public areas in the Paris resemble an old Parisian street and are absolutely gorgeous although it was quite expensive to drink at the bars. We ate breakfast in the buffet 2 days and that was fantastic with lots and lots of choice, We had liunch in the cafe at the front of the hotel that faces on to the strip La Belle Ami and this was lovely I had the best salad i had ever had and the prices were reasonable. On our final night we had Steak at the Restaurant De Artistes inside the Paris, the steak was amazing and the biggest I had ever seen that I did not have room to eat the creamy mash and creamed spinach that it was served with. The bill came to $100 USD which was great and very reasonable for the standard of food and service that we had. All in all the Paris makes for a very romantic experience

Reviews.Title: “Comme Ci, Comme Ça”
Reviews.Author: anneski76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Paris Las Vegas for 5 nights, September 8-13, 2011. We chose this resort because we had such a favorable impression of the place when we walked over from Bellagio during our previous visit. Compared to the dark and crowded Bellagio, we found this casino to be pleasant, not overcrowded, and not too smoky, so we decided this would be the location for our next stay. I was very pleased with the rate we booked directly through the Paris website -- we were able to take advantage of a 40% off sale offered through the Caesars for a limited time during the summer. This great rate enabled us to book one of the upgraded Red Rooms at a cost comparable to regularly priced standard room. We arrived around 11 pm on a Thursday to prompt service from the bellman and the valet. There was no wait at check-in. Unfortunately, the front desk service wasn't great. He was rather rude and dismissive when we inquired about upgrades (for which we'd have gladly paid). The, after he'd already taken our credit card and applied the pre-authorization charges, he showed us a rate sheet that was nearly double what we'd booked. He fixed the mistake after we insisted, but with no hint of an apology. We then asked if the wrong amount had been preauthorized on our credit card, and he assured us it would not, but as we suspected, that's exactly what happened. The result was that nearly double the correct amount was tied up as unavailable on our credit card balance for the duration of our trip. This wasn't a tragedy for us, as we knew we'd likely have restaurant and spa charges that would easily reach the total being held, so we were fine with having that balance set aside. But, it still shouldn't have happened. A guest traveling on a tighter budget without extra financial resources could have been seriously inconvenienced by such a mistake. We were assigned to room 2695, which had a rather uninspiring view of the back of Bally's, but this was fine, as we spent little time in the room and even less time at the window. The Red Room included a coffee maker and a refrigerator. The refrigerator looked like an emptied-out honor-bar fridge. We appreciated this amenity, as we'd picked up water and other drinks from Von's on our way into town. The room featured smart decor, and it was spotless. The bed linens were comfortable, although one day our bed was made up with stained sheets. The towels were sufficiently large and plush. The bathroom featured plenty of counter space and a separate tub and shower. The shower had decent water pressure and glass doors, but it was not especially spacious. The bathtub was of standard size. The armoire/dresser unit included two small cupboards for hanging clothes, but there was no proper closet and no luggage stand or other horizontal surface for holding a suitcase unless one used the small couch, the coffee table or the upholstered bench at the foot of the bed. Overall, we found the room comfortable but not luxurious. This was in-line with our expectations for the property. For parking our rental car, we used valet service a few times and self-parking for the rest. Valet service was fine, the longest wait we had to retrieve our car was about 15 minutes. The parking garage was rather filthy and there were a few sketchy looking characters around at times, but we had no problems while using this facility. We had great meals at Sugar Factory and the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. A meal at the Cafe Il St Louis featured eggs that tasted spoiled and confusion and lack of effort on the part of the waitstaff who didn't seem to know which menu items were available at 11:30 AM. They offered us a breakfast menu that said "available until 11 AM," and when we asked for a lunch menu they said they couldn't place any lunch menu orders until noon. I also had a visit to the spa and salon where I received excellent services. But the spa facilities looked rather worn and not particularly clean. The spa's jacuzzi, in particular, was about as aesthetically pleasing as the one in my local YMCA. The best part of the stay was the overall ambiance of the casino area of property, which was bright, clean, not too smoky, not too crowded, and offered easy access to the Strip. My husband was disappointed that there was no poker room, however. The worst part of our stay was the poor service at check-in and especially the improper credit card preauthorization that was nearly double what it should have been. On balance, our stay was "Comme Ci, Comme Ça" -- just so-so. I'd consider going back, but it probably wouldn't be my first choice, and I wouldn't set my expectations very high. Housekeeping came by daily and did a great job.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Las Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vicki G
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved the Paris. We had a basic room which we booked as a package through Allegiant Airlines. Since it was our 30th anniversary, we asked about a room upgrade, but were told that it would cost $40 or $55 per night extra. We decided to take the basic room and it was great. Very large bathroom with separate shower and bathtub. The room had 2 queen beds and came with a refrigerator. Everything was very clean. None of the rooms have coffee pots I was told beforehand, so i packed a small 2 cup coffeemaker. Too bad the room didn't have a microwave, but I know they don't want you in the room, they want you out in the casinos. Food is very expensive everywhere in Las Vegas, but the buffets are all excellent. The Le Village Buffet in the Paris was awesome. Of all the buffets we ate at, it had the biggest selection. If you are staying in the Paris area of the strip, I would highly recommend the "Buffet of Buffets" option. It is $44.95 and they put it on your players card. It is good for 24 hours and can be used for up to 7 buffets during that 24 hour period (I don't think that is humanly possible), and it good at about 8 different hotels...some of which are: Harrahs, Paris, Caesar's palace, Flamingo, Rio, etc). If you time your 24 hours right, you can really get your money's worth. My husband and I ate 2 dinners, a breakfast, and a late night snack.

Reviews.Title: “First Las Vegas Visit”
Reviews.Author: 154943Nick
Reviews.Content: I'm not a gambler & have never really had any real desire to visit Las Vegas but my wife who loves it & has been before has talked about going so we took a 4 night,5 day package at the Paris.The hotel is very impressive,the room was excellent,on checking in we asked for a room with a pool view,which the Westjet rep.advised us.The room was on the 23rd.floor with a pool view & beyond is the Bolagio with a direct view of the fountain,which at night puts on an amazing show.Some of the features of the hotel are a half scale Eifel Tower,an Arc de Triumph & a section of the Louvre.One might feel that vthis all sounds really phoney but we were surprised how tastefully done it is taking in mind that we have been to Paris a number of times.There is even a Paris street at the back of the casino.The lots of eateries but on the first day we found at the front of the hotel Mon Ami Gabi,which is as close to a Paris Bistro as one will find outside out of France,the food was excellent,we ended up eating there once a day.I would definitely recommend The Paris although I am definitely not in love with Las Vegas,it's all too much for me,for one thing I found the incessant noise of the slots aweful.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: klam_chowder8
Reviews.Content: Really surprised that most of the hotel staff were either rude or indifferent. The front desk agent, "Jenny", literally only asked for ID and credit card when it was our turn - no smile, no good evening, no welcome to Paris. Just I need your ID and credit card. After we settled into our room, we headed downstairs for a bite and some sweets from their bakery at Cafe Belle. We asked the friendly cashier if we could charge to our room, and she said yes so we gave her our room key. Turns out it's a slip of paper you need to bring for charging privileges that you're given when you check-in (strange system). We apologized and said, no problem, we'd just pay cash. The cashier was surprised that the check-in agent did not tell us about it. Sandwich was ample and pastries were elegant looking and rich tasting. When we went to the Promotions desk to ask a question and sign up for their players card, the fellow there made It clear he wanted read his binder instead of interact with guests. I know the players card sign up is at the next desk, I'm trying to ask you a question. Hello?? You're staffing a public desk and there's a customer in front of you...maybe you should give some service? There were no other customers waiting. After this, I didn't bother trying to talk to any other staff at Paris. At least the room attendants returned greetings in the mornings. Our standard room was pretty bland and showed its age: very old style (non-LCD) and small TV, chipped paint on the shelves. No coffee machine in the room. No full or 3/4 length mirror in the room so one could try on outfits while the other is using the bathroom. Usually after I shower, I can do my makeup in the room while DH showers. However, the room lighting relative to the mirrors was so poor there was no place to do it. Bathroom was large but also an old design: no place to put your towel while you showered so you had to open the shower door and get a blast of cold air (remember it's a large marble bathroom) to get your towel. Make up mirror was mounted too high for me to use. No fan or sunlamp in bathroom. Rooms and layout at Palazzo were much nicer. Room attendents did a good job and the pool area was clean and spacious. Didn't want to deal with the staff so we did all our gambling elsewhere so I don't know how the tables played. Sugar Factory is a fab place to do a bit of shopping and their treats are as tasty as they look. The staff there took care in packing our goodies and even showed us a place we could enjoy them outside. Loved the location of Paris on the Strip, central to everything but there are other places. I won't be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience.”
Reviews.Author: kccharlie11
Reviews.Content: Best location on the Strip. Stayed the last 3days of August and !st of Sept. Not crowded. Excellent beverage service. Great crap games. The slots were also very good. Play the $5.00 denomination slots. The newer $1.00 slots were hot. Play max coins. Dealers were also very friendly.The room was 5 Star. Will return to Paris on next Vegas visit. Most highly recomend the Paris.......

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly and convenient”
Reviews.Author: austravellers303
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris in August for six nights. After a full day travelling, we arrived late evening really tired. Check in was quick and courteous. We were offered the choice of two rooms and chose a Strip view, king bed room on 27th floor. We were delighted with our room which was very clean, large and nicely furnished. The view was great - the Eiffel Tower and past that, the Bellagio Hotel and lagoon. After dark we could watch the illuminated fountain displays. We had the most comfortable bed we've ever had in a hotel, a flat screen TV, a fridge and a lovely bathroom with seperate roomy shower stall and soft white towels which were changed daily There was also a coffee maker here with coffee bags and a good hair dryer. Quiet here too. The location of Paris makes it easy to walk around to nearby attractions. There is also a bus stop outside for the Deuce and the Express bus to the Premium Outlets (North). Tickets can be purchased from the vending machine at the stop. The hotel has some good cafes and restaurants, including Mon Ami Gabi where we had breakfast on the outside terrace. The buffets always had long queues so we didn't join them as we didn't want to waste too much time in the day. There is a lovely Paris style cafe that serves delicious pastries and ice cream as well as other foody delicasies. Check out was easy, we just dropped our keys in the express check out box at reception on our way out of the hotel and received our account statement by email a short time later. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Experience Paris in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Angel12Sweet25
Reviews.Content: First time staying in this hotel and I actually like it. At first I was disappointed because our room was sorta like old school look with the non-flat screen TV lol! But then I only sleep there anyhow and rarely stays in our room. Over all I like the hotel because of the way they made it look like you're actually in Paris, France with the little town inside the hotel that make it look like you're outdoors and many restaurants around to choose from it was pretty cool... The casino was very small compare to other hotels but good enough to accommodate your gambling needs. We went to eat at Eiffel Tower Restaurant and oh my, it was sooo fancy and great view and the food was soo delicious, its a bit pricey but all worth it. This hotel was actually connected to Bally's hotel which was very convenient specially on summer time when it's like 115 degrees outside and it's also an extra casino to play to and extra restaurants to go and eat. The pool was so small but what makes it great was the view of the tower and also it was relaxing and less noisy than other pools... All in all I recommend this hotel to anyone, great staff, great restaurants to choose from and great ambiance for all ages...

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: 1873KB
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 days at the end of August / beginning of September. It was our first visit to Vegas and we thoroughly enjoyed the stay. On booking in, we upgraded to a room with a King bed and the room was fine. We didn't pay for a view of the strip, given that we didn't plan on spending much time in the room at any rate, but it was worth the extra for the king bed. The room also had a good sized (I'd say around 40 inch) tv. The hotel is fairly central on the strip, so great for getting about to view the other hotels. In particular, it's just across the road from the Bellagio and Caesar's Palace. Most folk don't seem to walk much in Vegas, but we did and spent a fair bit of time visiting the other hotels to have a peek at what they were like inside. It's fair to say that we thought that Paris compared pretty favourably and perhaps only the Venetian seemed to top it for how it was set up inside. We didn't go to Vegas to gamble, so didn't spend much time in casino's however, coming from NZ, it would be great to see Nevada catch up with the rest of the world and ban smoking inside. It seems fairly bizarre that the minority get to put the majority out (given that the smoking rates in the States seem to be around 20%). The casinos would be much nicer if they were smoke-free, but this isn't unique to the Paris. While in Vegas, we paid a visit to the outlet stores at the south end of the strip (I actually think that we single-handedly helped to prop up the American economy and dread seeing my Mastercard bill). This was well worth the visit. We bought a 24 hour ticket that enabled us to jump on and off the buses. At $7, this was great value. We used the same approach to get out to Freemont St in old Vegas, again, something that is really worth seeing - especially for the huge screens on the roof. They seem to do a bit of a "show" on the hour, accompanied by music, so it's well worth popping down for an evening while you are there. The other highlight of our visit was a trip to the Grand Canyon. We flew out (a firm called Papillon) in a 12 seater aircraft and then got a chopper into the Canyon itself. It was a little expensive at $384 each, but ensured that we got to see the canyon from above and below, as well as a brief boat trip on the Colorado river. Some of the others we spoke to complained that they had flown out in helicopters and didn't actually land on the rim, so only got to see the Canyon from the chopper and then from the Canyon floor. Our option ensured that we got the best of all worlds and we thoroughly enjoyed it. We also went on the Skywalk. This cost around $35 each and you aren't allowed to take your own camera out with you, so if you want photos, you have to get the ones that are taken of you while you are out. Again, we enjoyed this and were glad that we did it. In summary, I'd definitely recommend the Paris. We had a great time there and look forward to returning to Vegas again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Golfsunnut
Reviews.Content: We have been to Vegas 14 times over the last 12 years. We have stayed at 10 different properties. This was our third time staying at Paris Las Vegas Hotel. We can't complain. The hotel is clean, check in was great, it is central to everything on the strip. Our room was nice and roomy with a tub and shower. The pool isn't full of twenty something crazy kids. The staff is friendly. Food is good but expensive. We would recommend staying here and no hidden resort fees.

Reviews.Title: “Oooh La La”
Reviews.Author: Queen001
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris during labor day week (Sunday thru Friday). The rooms are nice and cozy. Very clean. Refrigerator in room. The housekeepers were very efficient and nice. The TV's need to be updated along with cable channels. The shower head leaves a lot to be desired (very weak). We had a great view of the pool, eiffel tower, Bellagio fountains and the strip. We opted to pay extra for the continental breakfast, evening cocktails and conceriage service. In my opinion, the breakfast had way too many sweets. They did offer cereal, fruits, milk, juices and bagel or toast. But, for a continental breakfast it was ok. Coffee was terrific! The evening buffet with cocktails was much better. A great place to unwind before heading out for the evening. Well worth the extra price. We ordered room service for breakfast one morning and it was great. Food arrived piping hot and earlier that expected. We went to the pool one morning, it is very nice...but to our surprise it started raining! We headed back inside with our bloody marys! They have plenty of lounge chairs and you are given a towel when you enter the pool area. There is a bar close to the pool. Great casino. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Behind the fluff...wasn't worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Sindy022
Reviews.Content: For my birthday I wanted to stay at one of the nicer Harrah's chain hotels, but would have been just as happy at Bally's or Flamingo's. Don't get me wrong, walking through the casino and shops, it is one of the most pleasant ambles. But we arrived early and received rude service from from the bell captain checking our bags. Then he had the audacity to blatantly indicate he deserved a tip. We're happy to tip but not for rudeness. The man who brought our bags up was much nicer as was the check-in and out staff. Rooms are so-so and in desperate need of updating. No flat screen tv's?? And holes in the hallway wall. It was clean and no funky smells, but for location and price there are better options in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Always like staying here.”
Reviews.Author: peterlc63
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Vegas on Tuesday and my wife and I always like staying here. The casino is smaller and it is a lot easier to get around the hotel. Great location in the middle of the strip. The crepes and the pastries are great to have in the morning. The rooms can use some updating as they are starting to look worn but, they are still comfortable. Wish the rooms also had a coffee maker as well. We will probably be back here the next time we come out to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Qui qui”
Reviews.Author: Gxmark
Reviews.Content: One of the best vacation experiences I ever had. Great room service...make sure to book on floors above 17. Ask for the view of the bellagio fountains. The casino is cool the pool is excellent. The miracle mile of shops has excellent shopping and dining options. Well pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: ngagirl
Reviews.Content: Location was great, the heart of the Vegas Strip! The view from the room was wonderful! Housekeeping was very nice and helpful. Our room was always cleaned when we returned from a day and night on the town. Only complaint is no fridge or microwave or coffee maker in room. I know, it's a trap to get you down in the casnio cafe! Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel to hang out at.”
Reviews.Author: Megnolia07
Reviews.Content: Paris Hotel Las Vegas is beautiful. The Eiffel Tower is pretty cool, especially when you're sitting by the pool! The pool was nice and not crowded at all. The shops and restaurants within Paris hotel are all nice. Like any hotel on the strip, prices were high. However, totally worth it. We ate breakfast at Le Cafe and had dinner Moni Ami Gabi. I HIGHLY recommend Moni Ami! Great food, great services. We also visited the Dueling Piano Bar, which was fun! The guys on the piano that night were pretty funny. However, drinks were VERY expensive within the bar; 3 mixed drinks for $35. Yikes. As for the room we stayed in; it was just alright. The beds and pillows were NOT comfortable at all. The view we had was nice; overlooking the pool and the strip. The overall cleaniness of the hotel was good...our housekeeper was awesome! The bathrooms were spacious. Overall, the hotel is nice. However, I don't think I'd stay there again...just based on the beds. I like to be comfortable while on vacation. Especially when I'm coming from a 3 hour time difference. While in Las Vegas, I would recommend going to Paris Hotel and exploring! It's an interesting hotel with cool things to do and see.

Reviews.Title: “View of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: OttawaKelly
Reviews.Content: Just got back from ParisLV on September 9th and had a beautiful view of the Strip. ParisLV offers a great view of the Bellagio fountains as well as the new Cosmopolitan and Planet Hollywood. Miracle Mile shopping is right next door and Paris is connected to Bally's and the Monorail so the centralized location is great. Only 2 miles from the airport - 20$ cab ride. Viva Las Vegas! Had a great time at Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Rooms”
Reviews.Author: sarahlynae
Reviews.Content: We visited the Paris during the middle of August and checked in on a Tuesday. We arrived early and had them hold our bags while we ventured around the strip, the man who handled our bags was quite rude. When we checked in around 2:30pm and waited for only a few minutes to be helped. We called to have our bags brought to our room and they were promptly delived within 5-10 minutes. We stayed in a standard rooms which was quite spacious but, nothing special. The bathrooms were quite large for standard hotel room with seprate tub and shower. The decor is starting to show its age but still has that shabby Parisian charm. The beds were quite comfortable and the maid serviced our room daily and in a timely manner. While the pool offers nothing special, it is quite large and never felt over-crowded. We never had trouble finding lounge chairs and drink service was prompt and friendly. They do offer a happy hour specials around the pool after 4pm.

Reviews.Title: “hotel great, unpleasant front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: fluff
Reviews.Content: stayed in april/may 2011. the hotel has a great location. rooms very clean and roomy. all the restaurant, bar & casino staff were very friendly and helpful. the same can not be said for the front desk staff. at check in our clerk was not only unpleasant but her attitude was she could care less. observed the other clerks who were helping others at the same time and the same attitude was apparent, so this is obviously the culture of the hotel and not just one employee. tried to explain to her that their were going to be different persons in the 3 rooms we had and that the names needed to be updated and she kept insisting that since i had made the 3 reservations in my name than they would have to stay that way, then told her i needed the room with 1 king and that my dad and brother needed one of the rooms with 2 beds.....her answer " i'll give you the keys and you can choose which room you want". (came back to the desk hours later, when she was no longer there and had another clerk get the names correct but only after asking for the manager on duty and telling them that i too worked at a hotel and knew what can and cant be done). i have worked at a hotel for 25 years and the unhelpful, unpleasantness of the desk clerks would never be tolerated by our guests or management or owners. the front desk is the 1st & usually last impression of a hotel and if i held the Paris up to this, it would have failed, but since all other staff were great than i can recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Paris was excellent location with excellent restaurants!”
Reviews.Author: just2njgirls
Reviews.Content: Great first time experience in Vegas! The Paris location was perfect! Dine at Mon Ami Gabi right across from Bellagio and watch the fountains! Excellent food!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Hotel - i would definately go back.”
Reviews.Author: AliO_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris Las Vegas for 4 nights and it was just perfect. We were given a room at the 30th floor (red rooms as they call them) withought the strip view but that didn't bother us. We checken in fairy easy and quick but the check out was a massive queue where we had to wait for at least 30 min. Of course there is an option for express check-out where you drop your room key in a box and they send you the final receipt via email or post. The pool is amazing they have a little bar that serves really nice cocktails and the ambiance was perfect. Pros: Fast check in; quiet hotel; really clean and confortable rooms; very stylish; nice restaurants that serve great food. Free self parking! Cons: the slow check-out (maybe it's not so every time); and the queue at the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Unique!”
Reviews.Author: tmmarmy
Reviews.Content: I had previously walked through the Paris on earlier vacations but had never stayed at any hotel on the strip (always did time shares). I always thought it was unique and was curious as to how the rooms would fair. My mother and I stay there Aug 30th - Sept 2nd. We got in late due to flight delays and were only able to stay in a king bedroom. (It's my mom, so I didn't care.) However, we were given the option to check the next day to see if any queen rooms were available. The room was adorable. Cute little settee, huge flat screen TV, reasonably comfortable bed draped in reds and golds, amazing storage closet, and the prerequisite computer desk. The bathroom was to die for. Spacious with a separate shower and tub, one sink, a niche for the toilet, lighted makeup mirrors, it was great!
