I don't normally take baths in hotels, however, I couldn't resist it since they gave me bath salts! We ate at most of the on property restaurants with no complaints. I would stay here again, but would prefer it to be with my husband. The whole place was darkly lit and romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: Katie S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris 9/8-9/11. It was a beautiful hotel with an old world charm. The room was super clean and the beds were very comfortable. The casino area compared to other casinos was beautiful to look at (Parisian stary night), but had less variety of slot/video machines. On Friday and Saturday nights the casino has a live band which is pretty good and they played a variety of songs/music. We had to pay for our room upgrade $55 night, but it included comp breakfast/appetizers every day and a view of the Eiffel Tower and the pool. The Paris has a great location! Planet Hollywood, Cosmopolitan, Bellagio, Bally's, Cesar's,and Flamingo minutes away with a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Las Vegas is my home in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Texasscout
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Las Vegas this summer and stayed at the Paris Las Vegas. I love it because it is the center of the strip and accessible to all of the hotels on the strip. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The price was right!”
Reviews.Author: dzny16
Reviews.Content: We travel to Las Vegas 2-3 a year, and Paris is not my fav, but the Venetian, Wynn, and Bellagio were all WAY too much considering it was July and over 100 degrees each day. So Paris came in with a 4 nite stay for 376 (including weekend and ALL taxes) so we chose it. We were not at all disappointed, really worth every penny. The room was ready when we checked in around 11:00am, which is always nice. We had a regular room, (not Red) with a view of the pool and the Bellagio fountains. The location really cant be beat, middle of everything. I was always able to find a lounge chair at the pool. Paris is not the luxurious hotel like the others mentioned, but it was definately worth the price, no compalints and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: cromerkp
Reviews.Content: My goal for this trip was to book a decent hotel, close to my friends staying at the Bellagio. I found a deal on bookit.com ($388 + taxes for a Fri. and Saturday), for an upgraded Red room, with 2 queen sized beds. I found better deals for the Four Seasons, Palazzo and Venetian, but I wanted to be closer to my friends. That being said, I would probably stay elsewhere next time I am in the Vegas area, maybe the Vdara, which is non-smoking, eco friendly and doesn't have a casino. We spent more time at the Bellagio and Planet Hollywood than Paris. PH has a Starbucks and decent food- Cabo Wabo (surprisingly good mexican) and Koi for dinner. I wasn't impressed with the front office staff. I am a former Four Seasons front desk supervisor, so my standards are high. That being said, times have changed and Vegas runs on it's own rules. There is a website that teaches people how to bribe front desk employees for upgrades, and a specific section for the Paris Hotel. If I were the GM, I would be horrified. That being said, I refused to do the "$20 sandwich method" they advised. I simply used my usual charm and kindness to request a nice view. The clerk told me they had upgraded me already, but in reality, they gave me the room I paid for on bookit.com, which was an upgraded room without a view. I didn't complain, as I knew I wouldn't be in the room much. Cons: Room was small. Sharp metal piece sticking out of bed. Channels on television were limited. IPod deck worked great the first night, but messed up after room was serviced. I tried to fix it and should have called housekeeping. The lobby bathroom was filthy. Front desk employees not great. Casino employee was condescending when I asked an apparently outdated question about the slot machines. No bathrobe or mini-bar. Pros: Comfortable linens, nice bathroom, ideal location. Housekeeping was great- room was extremely clean and the staff was very friendly. Didn't use spa, but spoke with employee at desk who very professional and kind. Coffee maker in room. Room didn't smell like smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Vegas baby!”
Reviews.Author: james f
Reviews.Content: Right in the middle of the strip and a good base. We upgraded at check-in and got a nice suite which was good for the 4 of us (2 adults, plus a 12 and a 14 year old). Huge pool area which becomes party central mid afternoon with live DJ and buckets of beer. So, if you're looking for somewhere to escape the mayhem of the strip and relax, this might not be it. (mind you, is there such a place in this town?) Hotel is modern, masses of free parking out back and a half scale eiffel tower by the pool which you can take a ride up to the top of after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Jos C
Reviews.Content: We've traveled the states for four weeks, Paris gave us the largest room. Ten by five meters, i like that! Also liked the sense of space in the hallways. I can compare this hotel to two other Vegas-hotels. Monte Carlo has a way superior pool, if you like swimming and dont mind loud clubmusic in the pool, go there. Excalibur dazzles you with too much slot machines, only go there if you appriciate low rates. Paris offers the best value for money for a 90 dollar room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, But...”
Reviews.Author: avantimom
Reviews.Content: We went to the PARIS ~ Las Vegas for my parents 50th Anniversary. We have been to Las Vegas several times and had never stayed at the Paris so we decided to try this hotel for a few reasons its location and because it offers "NO RESORT FEES" this is a BIG plus! My biggest complaint about the hotel was there was no " food court" type choices for inexpensive meals. The days of $5.99 breakfasts are gone and you'll never find a burger or sandwich under $10. We had gone over to Planet Hollywood several times and really like their mall and choices for food, shopping etc,,The pillows on the bed were awful! I woke up with a headache everyday as did my son...We had a great time regardless...We will go back but will stay at a different hotel, but one with NO RESORT FEES! They are unnecessary!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect romantic stay”
Reviews.Author: taureanj
Reviews.Content: Decided on Paris after looking at countless websites and trying to figure out who did/didn't have resort fees etc. Found a really good deal for Paris & gave it a go! REALLY good decision! Paris is located pretty much in the middle of the strip w/easy access to everything. Got upgraded to a strip/pool view red room & it was F.A.B. Special thanks to Joanna & Antonio for making this a pleasant stay. P.S. still puzzled as to how they keep the pool so cool in 102 degree weather but oh well, thoroughly enjoyed it as well!!

Reviews.Title: “Paris is a great experience”
Reviews.Author: JimOSU
Reviews.Content: Nice desk clerk service. Fifth floor room was ready early and had two very comfortable double beds. Room was moderate in size and was classy as in very well decorated with two stuffed chairs, footstool, table, desk, very large armoire and a mini-fridge. Bath had shower and separate tub. Safe was provided at no extra charge View was great - third floor swimming pool and Eiffel tower. This was a standard room purchased over the phone from Harrah's standard call-in center. Asked for and received a better price than anywhere on the internet, including the hotel's own website! Stayed four nights, starting on a Tuesday, The hotels casino and public areas are all first class. Much decoration to simulate French village as well as France's major attractions such as the Eiffel Tower, etc. Buffets and restaurants very expensive at this hotel, so only ate pizza at the hotel. Parking garage is very easy to navigate compared to most others. Like a three lane highway after the entrance. Best entrance and exit ramps ever seen in a parking garage. Room negatives were an old tube type TV and no coffee or tea maker. Room makeup service was very slow, after 3 PM one day- always after 2 PM. All other hotel services were fine. This was an enjoyable experience at an upper class hotel at a moderate price.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: blackie88
Reviews.Content: Overall we'd consider it good for the price we paid. The bathroom could have been a bit better maintained with some minor mold showing on the wall grouting. The rest of the room was well maintained. We did find the lobby and the elevator access to be a bit of a disconnect having to wind our way through a row of shops and part of the casino hall to get there. The buffet spread at the restaurant was excellent although the lines were very long at times, best to be early for that. The location of the hotel is pretty much smack in the middle of the strip so it was convenient to get to places. We'd be back to stay for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located, perfectly comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ald656
Reviews.Content: Although I am a Vegas regular, I had never stayed at the Paris Hotel. I had gambled and dined there but had never stayed overnight. A girlfriend's bachelortte party gave me the opportunity to be a guest. Centrally located in the center strip, Paris was a key location for a group of bachelorettes. Even in the Vegas heat, we were able to walk to the more popular locales easily (Caeser's, The Venetian, TI, etc). I was initially nervous the hotel rooms in Vegas, as I heard many of them have bedbug issues; I was pleased to see that noone in the three rooms we occupied had any trouble in that department. The rooms were comfortable, but simple (perfect for us; as were really just sleeping there!); and we loved the dining options. Mon Ami Gabi, Louis' Cafe and the Buffet were all amazing value for wonderful meals. The pool area was nice - but not very exciting like some of the other Vegas pools are; but we enjoyed the relaxing. The Chateau (the Paris' nightclub) was fun! As guests of the hotel; we were able to go right in - and avoided the lines on most nights. VERY packed in there; but good music and amazing people watching. Overall, we really enjoyed the Paris and would return!

Reviews.Title: “So much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: knlfaz
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on TA for this hotel, we weren't surprised at all with waiting in a very long check in line. We did finally got to the front of the line and were taken by Shirlene -- such a nice lady. We were given a room on the 6th floor at the end of the hall overlooking the pool. It was a great location and nice and quiet., as requested. Inside the room the basic and the bathroom was well appointed and clean. There was an empty mini bar that we were able to use to keep our bottled water cold. The bedding was nice but not as comfortable as those at the MGM Mirage properties. We have stayed on several of the properties on the strip and thought we would give Paris a try and glad we did. It was a nice quaint hotel compared to the mega resorts in Vegas. It seemed as though they were missing all the drunken 20 somethings that we have encountered at the south end of the strip -- didn't appear to be geared towards that crowd. The casino is attached to Bally's via an indoor mall, where you can find places to eat, shop or stop by Napoleans for some evening entertainment. Planet Hollywood is directly on the other side of the hotel where there are many more places to grab a bite to eat. (Earl of Sandwiches is great for a late night snack if you want a great inexpensive sandwhich -- or anytime, I guess) We took advantage of the using pool, since it was so tempting seeing it right outside our window. It was so nice, water was clean and refreshing and plenty of seats open in the shade. They turn misters on from the arches when it gets hot, so you could scope out your seats early if you're going to stay the day. There are cocktail waitresses that come around to give you a flag to attach to your chair. You can flip it up when you need a refill. I saw a couple of c,abanas by the pool, but weren't occupied and don't know how much to rent one. With all the shade available at the pool, don't know if those will be a bit hit. There was a cute little sundries shop right on the way out to the pool if you had forgotten sunscreen or hat, etc. What was nice is that you didn't have to walk through the casino or public areas at all to get to the pool. Nicely done!! The casino, like the hotel, is kind of quaint with very friendly cocktail waitresses and a good variety of machines. The location of the hotel is perfect so will return to this hotel and recommend to my friends. Oh, and the wireless internet is a charge of $14.99 per 24 hrs in your room but didn't work so well when we needed it. Might have just been a busy time of day. It worked great, though, late at night. There is free wireless in Madeline's (sp?) coffee house, which is not kept a secret -- don't know how secure it is, though.

Reviews.Title: “Paris, c'est chic”
Reviews.Author: Swiss_Swimmer
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the Paris Las Vegas. A really nice hotel with big rooms. Very good prices when travelling during the week. Hotel is central Strip so everything is within walking distance - just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for one night...”
Reviews.Author: injustifiiable
Reviews.Content: It's been a while since I've stayed here...I totally forgot to write my review... Stayed here for one night while I was in town for a trade show. I had a room at the MGM Grand for the week but I came in a day early and they were sold out...so Paris, it was! Our room was a standard room on the 18th floor. I got double beds since I was traveling with a co-worker. The beds were kinda hard...was expecting a little better but hey. I probably wouldn't stay here again since there's plenty of other joints in Vegas to try, but I totally love the casino here and the tacky Parisian theme. For a great burger, check out Le Burger Brassiere. It'll cost you but it's totally worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but needs updating.”
Reviews.Author: purplekap
Reviews.Content: Hotel was chosen for price and location. Normal check-in is 4pm but was in room by 1pm, no problem. Rooms look elegant, but definitely need updating. Wallpaper is peeling, marble in bathroom is chipped and cracked, furniture is dinged and chipped,etc. Although room was very clean. Felt like we were right in the middle of the strip. Paris casino not very smoky compared to others due to high ceilings. Seemed like you won more at small casinos like Bill's Gambling Hall and Casino Royale vs. the larger big-name casinos. Ate at Sugar Factory outside with nice views of strip. Somewhat overpriced, but welcome to Las Vegas! Not in any hurry to return to Vegas, but if I do, I would shoot for a 5-star hotel on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Aging beautifully...”
Reviews.Author: onetheroad
Reviews.Content: Visited this lovely property September 6-9, and even though rooms are beginning to show their age it is still a beautiful property. A very crowded hotel (everyone loves it), with long check-in lines that moved very quickly. Dining - well it isn't cheap to eat in Vegas any more, but the value at Paris were good. The sports grille had delicious burgers for around $12-$13 with a discount with your players card. The dinner buffet is $24.99 plus tax per person - at first I hesitated thinking it was too expensive but once I saw the choices for food I was totally impressed, the fresh made crepes alone were worth it. A tip though if you go after 6:30 be prepared to wait in a long line. Since there is no resort fee at this hotel be prepared to pay to print out your boarding passes, probably $7, this can be done at various kiosks throughout the lobby or at the hotel's business center, however if you go to the concierge desk with all your info about your flight with you they may do it for $0. Again since there is no resort fee there is also a $1.25 charge every time you use the room phone. Was nice to see all the dogs that were also enjoying Paris - so it seems that for an additional fee your four-legged best friend can stroll the boulevard with you. Walked over to Planet Hollywood for dinner at P.F. Chang's, which was very good as P.F. Chang's always is and to see the casino - which was alive and rockin'! what a fun place. Decided to check out the new Cosmopolitan across the street, beautiful but the casino was practically empty and very quiet. . . could it be because the rooms are so expensive nobody can afford to gamble?

Reviews.Title: “we loved this place”
Reviews.Author: dgiese
Reviews.Content: we stayed over labor day weekend a bit crowded but that was to be expected , we got upgraded to the red room well worth it the room had a pilllow top mattress, a fridge, a coffee maker and a great view of the pool , the tower , the bellagio fountains, the pillows in the room were a bit stiff, we called housekeeping and they brought us up some feather pillows within 10 min. the employees at the paris are 5 star very helpful , we love this place

Reviews.Title: “ok... nothing special”
Reviews.Author: DIZZY82
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for my 40th birthday get away. This hotel has some really cool ceiling murals and had a pretty cool paris feel. We did have a beautiful view of the Belagio fountain which we did spend some time watching at night before bed. The downside.... The bed was like a slab of granite!! OH MY GOD,,,, i can't stress enough just how freaking hard the bed was!!!! Absolutely no sleep during our 4 nights at Paris. We had hoped to actually get some breakfast at the buffet here.... but if you are up any later than 7am.... expect to wait in a really big line. We went out to the strip and grabbed some eats at another hotel. Honestly, the front desk staff were good and the hotel was something to see and the location is great,in the middle of the strip, but i don't think we will return to Paris ... the beds are something only Fred Flintstone would love, and that's no good for real people. especially for the price. I would give this hotel no more than 3 stars. I can't suggest Paris based on our experience,but give it a shot if you just like the concept??? i guess?

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: jewcpink
Reviews.Content: I stayed at paris for a weekend to celebrate my birthday. I'm away, I was very impressed with the service and the rooms. When I walk through the doors of the hotel I felt I was being transported to paris. the decor is beautiful! restaurants somewhat pricey but well worth it in myopinion. The nightlife here is perfect for young to middle aged as we are a couple in our thirties and found wanted to dance every night. Kelly Rowland was there during our stay and she was amazing ! We definitely plan on staying here again soon....loved it!

Reviews.Title: “A little worn & dated but a true bargain.”
Reviews.Author: rcw198
Reviews.Content: Paris Las Vegas is a bit worn and outdated but if you don't need 5 star accommodations it is truly a bargain. It was clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. The location can't be beat at this cost. When making your reservations sign up for a Total Rewards card to receive an even better value on the room cost.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!... Better than all the rest! (of 4-star hotels)”
Reviews.Author: bush242
Reviews.Content: First of all: the Wynn is best 5-star on the strip. Period! The best! It feels like a 6-star!) This was my 3rd stay (technically 4th stay) as I once checked out to try Mandalay Bay and ran back to the Paris after getting overrun by kids at pool. This time I tried the Luxor and checked out after one hour and ran back to the Paris!! If you into a long walk to a pool with no shade and loud hip-hop music and the tatoo crowd, then the Luxor is for you! If not, then go to the Paris! The Paris has a nice quiet relaxing ambiance. The pool is at the bottom of the elevator. You can get from your room to the pool in 3 minutes versus walking half a mile to the Mandalay pool. The Eiffel tower (built half to scale! Fact. Check Wikipedia) provides a nice view and shade. If you can get a room facing the strip, you can watch the bellagio fountain show from your room. The rooms are nice- clean. How much time do you spend in the room anyway?! Lol The buffet is solid. I rank it #3 behind #1 wicked spoon at cosmopolitan; #2 Wynn buffet. The Paris buffet has great French fare. There is great French pastry Cafe in the Paris hotel. The crowd is nice quiet mild. No tatoo urban hip-hop crowd. Big plus! I have seen most of the hotels in 4-star range. The Paris is the best! My only future stay! Go and stay here! I take the time to write this out of my gratitude to Paris hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Vicki S
Reviews.Content: My mother, husband, and I stayed at the Paris the week of 08/27. Overall, we had a great week and found the hotel to be a pleasant, enjoyable stay, with both positives and negatives. This was our first trip to Vegas and we chose the Paris primarily because of the fantastic location, right in the heart of the Strip, and because it does not charge mandatory resort fees like most of the resorts do. The public areas of the hotel are beautiful and well-maintained. And, for the most part, the folks who work there were very friendly and helpful. In addition, both the public areas and our rooms seemed to be quite clean. Our rooms were standard-sized with no street or casino noise, although both my mother and my husband and I could hear the folks in our adjoining rooms clearly. Check-in and check-out were a breeze and no problem at all, although I am still waiting to receive my receipt from the express check-out. Three of the best restaurants that we ate at while in Vegas are located on the Paris property. These three consistently had the best food and were the most reasonably priced, making it incredibly convenient and easy for us to enjoy a delicious meal at our home base. Each morning when we got up, my husband went downstairs to Cafe Belle Madeleine to get us all coffee and pastries to bring back to the room for breakfast. These were the best pastries we’ve ever tasted, especially the cream cheese danishes. Since it’s located at the entrance to the bank of elevators and we had to pass it every evening upon returning to our rooms, we usually ended up with dessert, as well! The gals who work here were wonderful, consistently cheerful and friendly. Mon Ami Gabi is a fantastic steakhouse with both indoor and outdoor seating. The outdoor veranda is located directly across from the Bellagio fountains and we were thrilled our first evening there to have a front row seat to the fountain show across the street. The french onion soup is, hands down, the best any of us had ever tasted. The remainder of our meal, shrimp cocktail, fish and chips, and pork tenderloin, were all excellent quality and extraordinarily prepared for a very reasonable (Vegas-standard) price. If you go at peak times, though, be sure to make reservations to avoid a long wait. Finally, Le Burger Brasserie prepared what may have been the best burger any of us had ever eaten, cooked to order, juicy and moist. All of the wait staff at these facilities were tops. For the down side, we were disappointed when we checked in that the hotel could not accommodate our request for adjoining rooms. Luckily, we were able to get on the same floor, although my husband and I were down a different corridor than my mother. We both had adjoining rooms to our rooms, just not adjoining to each other. Had we been traveling with children, this could’ve been a real problem. We were also pretty underwhelmed at our standard rooms. For all of the over-the-top ambiance in the public areas, our rooms were disappointing. We finally realized the reason why was there is no comforter or spread on the beds. The bedding consisted of basic, white sheets with a gold-colored band of cloth that was laid across the bottom when it was “made.” If you look at the picture of one of its standard rooms that the hotel has posted on its website and imagine the beds stripped of the comforter that is pictured, that’s what we got. The beds always looked unmade and it cheapened the feel of the room. I can understand that bedspreads in a hotel are considered one of the germiest areas of a hotel room. But, if cleanliness is the issue, why not choose a fluffy comforter with a removable, washable cover. It would’ve made such a difference. In addition, the carpet in our room, #808, had a fairly large patch in the middle of it where it had been “repaired.” The overall effect was somewhat worn and shabby. By contrast, the bathrooms were large and lovely. We were also disappointed at the $15 charge for 24 hours of internet service. Seriously? In this day and age? Finally, we were a little disheartened by our concierge service. Our first day there, we inquired how to obtain tickets for Cirque de Soleil’s “KA,” rated as perhaps the number 1 show in Vegas. We were told to go to MGM where the show is located. After making our way through suffocating record heat (110 degrees!) to the ticket office, we were told that KA was on vacation that week. One would’ve thought that a concierge at a major resort should have been aware that the number 1 show in Vegas was on vacation. In addition, when we inquired about day trips to the Grand Canyon, the same concierge told me that the trip to the South Rim was too long and “not worth it.” Thank goodness we did not listen to her advice. We booked the trip on our own (see our review of Grand Adventures) and it was one of the highlights, if not THE highlight, of our trip. It was incredible. Bottom line: we would probably stay here again if we got a really good deal. However, with all the options to choose from in Vegas, why not try something else? It was good and we enjoyed the resort property, but not enough to elicit our undying loyalty.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodation for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: Jerry H
Reviews.Content: We paid $159 per night to stay in one of the red rooms here. The room was clean and relatively spacious with a good window view of the strip. Like most Las Vegas hotels, there is a casino downstairs along with plenty of restaurants and other attractions. It's also a short walking distance (5-10 minutes) from the Bellagio and Ceasars Palace. Desk service can be a bit slow due to the high number of guests checking in/out.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: Dubbie1205
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal for a 6 night stay there - had previously stayed at the Flamingo a couple years ago - and this was a step-up. At check in - our customer service was great - she helped us pick out a nice room with a great view. The only thing I wish was that the hotel restaurants had more variety. The coffee shop with pastries was GREAT!!

Reviews.Title: “It was adequate. Room was large and pretty clean.”
Reviews.Author: MGAGAHAHNH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris Hotel in August 2011 for a girls weekend. The check-in was easy and amazing. Purchased a package deal through Sun Country so this made everything very easy. The only problem was that the cleaning crew never left us enough towels and when we asked about it we were told that we would be charged for extra towels. Also - the rollaway price of $30 per day was kind of steep. Also - paying guests should be able to go to the top of the Eiffel Tower for free. There isn't even a discount. Pool was just OK. It would be nice if the music wasn't so loud.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeannie846
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a nice Vegas Casino and hotel. It is very crowded in the casino, so it's difficult to really enjoy the Parisian ambiance..but, it's a good alternative to the real thing and made us almost feel like we were in Paris again. The rooms are nice Vegas rooms, nothing special but nice. It's fun to go to the restaurants and pretend you're in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel with an Awful Spa”
Reviews.Author: vickie73_10
Reviews.Content: We held our wedding and reception at the Paris. Booking the event was easy and the staff was great. There are definitely pros and cons to this hotel...when we return to Vegas, we will not be staying at the Paris. PROS: The ceremony was wonderful. Sandra our coordinator was fabulous and things went off without a hitch. Our pictures are stunning! The reception and planning with Tara was easy and the food was wonderful. The staff at the reception was great and our guests still talk about the food and service. Our room was really nice...we upgraded to the red rooms (which we recommend). CON: The front desk was not the friendliest though I find this the case at many hotels. The Concierge Desk was hot/cold. The best person at the desk was Christian and he was very nice and helpful with opinions of shows and dining...he was great. CON: The Mandara Spa was the WORST spa I have EVER been to. I scheduled hair appointments for prior to my ceremony and my hair was done by 1pm. By the time I walked to my room, my hair started to fall apart...called the manager and she said to go back. I had paid over TWICE the quoted amount (my hair was not event washed) and the tip was automatically added. When I went back, I was setup with a different "stylist" with an attitude. I told her all it needed was tightened. She proceed to redo my hair and noticed it was not the same, when asked, she said she "was going in a different direction"...I was furious!!! I left the so-called spa with less than 40 minutes to go before I had to be at the ceremony. The stress was awful and very unnecessary.. .save your money and do not go to the spa. CON: The Paris Buffet - awful service and not clean. We were seated at an unclean table and were given towels to clean the table and chairs!!!! The only good restaurants we found on property were The Sugar Factory and The Eiffel Tower (both are NOT owned by the Paris...I am guessing that is why they were so good) Luckily, there are many other properties in Las Vegas...when we return, we plan on staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: Lizzie58Lincolnshire
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, staff excellent. Rooms really nice. Great value. Lovely terrace overlooking the strip which we went to everyday for breakfast. Excellent swimming pool. Cannot say anything negative about this hotel. Would definately stay at The Paris again. In the perfect position to see all the strip as very central.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Aussietraveller068
Reviews.Content: great theme. Amazing inside everything french. Rooms nice and comfly, you need to upgrade from the standard to get strip view, but includes extras. Drinks are expensive. But free if you gamble even on 1c slots. Well worth the stay

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough - clean and confortble”
Reviews.Author: LETITRIDE99
Reviews.Content: Paris Hotel --- Checked in around 11am on a Sat morning -- bit of a line -- but it moved pretty fast. Nice, friendly clerk , room was assigned and ready for immediate occupancy ( always a plus after a 5 hour plane ride ) . Room was your basic - no frills room -- no view, well I guess you could call it a mountain view - peaceful mountains could be seen in the distance. Room was clean and comfortable, well one bed was - which I didn't find out until the second night -- The first bed I tried sank in and i woke up with a bit of a stiff neck -- Good thing I was alone -- just switched to the other bed for the rest of my 7 night stay, and that mattress was fine . TV old and outdated and small !!! Lucky for me, I don't watch too much TV while in Vegas. Room was cleaned and replenished daily while i was out a breakfast -- housekeeping staff was very efficient and friendly. Ate only once there at Mon Ami Gabi -- had a nice lunch -- food was good and service was excellent ... Would definately return to Paris in the future ...

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: CdnShoeLover
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time to Vegas, and first time staying at Paris. We stayed in room 2298P, we paid extra for an upgrade, it cost an extra $55.00 a nite, but we got a bigger room, a view of the fountains & cont breakfast & appies & cocktails included. The rooms itself are a bit tired, and could use a makeover, however I slept great every nite something I don't do in hotels. The elevators were extremely fast, the water was always hot in the showers, my favorite part of the hotel & the reason why I booked it was the pool. It was large and never to packed. We would always make our way to the pool after 12:00 pm and never had a hard time finding a chair, all day there is really no problem getting a chair, the eiffel tower does get in the way of the sun at certain points but we just moved to get back in the sun. Drinks are expensive $7.00 for beer & $14.00 for cocktails, happy hour is between 4 to 6 pm and drinks are half price, something they do not advertise. Everyday I brought in my own water, and beer, and no one said anything, it seemed to be what a lot of people did, they do have a sign saying no outside drinks, but they never checked. Which I've heard other hotels do. We did eat that pool everyday, the food was reasonable and good. We ate at the Effifel tower one night, it was good, nothing special, and expensive, serving sizes are small so don't be too hungry if you chose to go, but great view of the fountains at Belliago something I never get tired of seeing. We also at the sugar factory, they had tons of different types of waffles, crepes etc, but their dinner menu was smaller, seems to be competing with the Cheesecake Factory which in my opinion is better. The crowd at Paris, is a bit older, (we're in our 30's) didn't bother me, but for someone who is in their 20's, go to Planet Hollywood. Check-in was smooth, but we didn't get there until after 10pm there were many times we walked past the check in and it was packed, which seems to be normal at every hotel though. No free wifi, no biggie, we just went to Planet Hollywood next door & sat at Starbucks, to check emails, etc.... Overall, we had a great time, would I stay a Paris again, for the location: Yes, for the pool Yes, for the rooms: Nope.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Trek8000
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here on three occassions. In the past we stayed in the suites which are large and nicely appointed. This stay we opted for a basic room August 28 until September 2, 2011. The room was well appointed and very comfortable. It was showing signs of wear but very clean. The air conditioning was not as cool as I would like but all the rooms seem to be set at a certain temperature and they must be controlled as the temp never varied. The central location is nice. It is close to the Miracle Mile Shopping Mall and the bus stops. The price varries depending on the tme of year. It is best to keep checking and booling as early as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel for business trip..avoid it at any rate”
Reviews.Author: ofelia28
Reviews.Content: Stayed here attending a trade show at Las Vegas Convention Center. I was going to receive some packages so I checked by phone, prior to my arrival if there was a charge of problem and they said no. I received the packages and upon my check out was told that each package had a $5 charge. Had I known I would have consolidated the packages. Afterward reviewing on detail the receipt noticed that I had been charged more, but I went to their website and noticed the packages policy star with charges of $10 and up according to weight, policy that it looks their employees & reservations people ignore or neglect to inform. At checkout also noticed that internet had been charged twice on the same day, and they reversed teh charge, but check your receipts because you will find surprises. My co-worker had her bathroom clogged and had to call several times to get it fixed and she did the express checkout and had to call several times to get her receipt email to her. There are several places to take breakfast but you will have to endure the long lines everyday. Lastly I called to complained about all of this and sent an email but they simply ignored it.

Reviews.Title: “Triple Check Your Bill!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sondra_sc
Reviews.Content: I have been a loyal Paris customer for many years, staying several times a year. I am a platinum member of the Total Rewards program and thus supposedly a valued customer. During the most recent stay I paid my bill the night before I checked out. Although I had a credit card on file, I also had a Total Rewards gift card, which I used to pay part of my bill. The front desk agreed to use my personal credit card to pay the balance of the bill. I felt the account was taken care of, went home, and thought nothing more about it. I was quite surprised a month later to receive a letter from a law firm representing the Paris for the bad debt which I owed to them. After several phone calls I was able to conclude the front desk had never attempted to bill my credit card, rather billing the gift card again, which was declined. This was an understandable mistake. Where the problem comes in though, is the fact that they never attempted to contact me regarding this bill, simply turning it over to a law firm. And we're talking roughly $200 here. The way this was handled was completely unacceptable. I realize that these resorts must sometimes go after people for unpaid bills but common courtesy and business sense would dictate that they at least contact the customer prior to turning it over to a collections agency. Given the way this situation was handled, I am seriously considering severing my relationship with the Paris and Harrah's properties and giving my business to the MGM chain.

Reviews.Title: “a great place”
Reviews.Author: Swisstraveler1AA
Reviews.Content: The Paris resort is wonderful located on the strip. All major attraction and the monorail are near. The have one of the best buffets in Las Vegas "Le Village", just don't expect to eat real French specialities. The casino is modern and the staff very helpful. From the pool area you have a great view to a model Eiffel tower and the Planet Hollywood towers. Later in the afternoon you can even watch the fountains at Bellagio. The poolarea could be improved with a more exciting pool and some shadow spending trees.

Reviews.Title: “A step below the 5-star properties”
Reviews.Author: callahanha
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paris Hotel and Casino because of the free room offer I received from the slot club promotions department. I have stayed at Paris about 6 times before and it is a very comfortable place to stay. When we arrived the line was about 20 people deep but there were plenty of open check-in windows and we waited less than 15 minutes in line. We were given a room on the 24 floor with a view of Center city and Planet hollywood. The rooms are average size and the bathrooms have a seperate tub and shower. The TV is an old tube type set but we only watched TV when we were changing in the morning or when we returned from the pool to relax for a few hours. I thought the mattress was a bit on the firm side. The pool is very ordinary but there is no loud music so you can relax without distractions. We never had a problem getting lounge chairs together either. We did not eat at any of the restaurants on-site so I can't comment about the food. The casino is small but very comfortable. I had good luck on the slots especially the Deal-or-No-Deal games. I won $200 one night on it. Drink service at Paris is one of the best on the Strip. I never had to wait more than a few minutes for service. Dealers at the tables were a mix of friendly and some non-talkitive types. I like Paris for the location and the fact it has more of a relaxed atmosphere than most strip properties. I will be staying at Paris again when I return to Vegas in October.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to find room”
Reviews.Author: WIsconsingrad
Reviews.Content: This trip to Vegas I brought my daughter with me. She has never been to Vegas and so this was a treat. Our stay at Paris Las Vegas was a treat too. Check in was a breeze. Locating the room was just as easy! I have stayed at many of the larger casino hotels in Vegas and have had to use a map through the casino floor every time to be able to find my room! At the Paris, there was the central core and that's it! The lobby elevators were quick and always immediately available. The room was a standard two queen beds. The view we got was not the best because of the deal we got for the price of the room. But then, who stays in the room except to sleep when you are in Vegas? Even the room service food was fabulous -- try their chicken salad on a croisannt! This was the only meal we ate inside the room -- after "miles" of walking on the Strip and we were too exhausted to even trip downstairs! The buffet was good; not great, and the wait for it on a Saturday was nearly an hour. Get in line BEFORE you get hungry. In summary, the location was great on the Strip, locating the room was easy and the service was great.. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice central hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Llobster
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights from the 26th of August. Room was clean and comfortable with a large 4 piece bathroom. Our room was loud on Saturday at around lunch time as we were just above the pool and there was loud music and a lot of people there. Casino is lively and fun but smoky (no surprise there). Lots of places to eat and everywhere we did stop was fine. Central location is excellent; Bellagio Fountain across the street and in plain view. Monorail is a good deal if you plan on hopping to different hotels.

Reviews.Title: “True to the French Theme But Almost "Dated"”
Reviews.Author: andrealena
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my Las Vegas trip where we stayed at Paris. This was my second visit to Paris and still definitely enjoyed it, but I think the hotel and casino in general need some "polishing". The french theme is beautiful throughout every bit of the property. So it's hard to say that things look "dated" but things do need to be cleaned up/polished just a little bit. For example, I have been coming to Vegas for about 15 years now and have seen and heard that several other hotels have been upgraded... I have not heard of or noticed any upgrades at Paris yet. In our "luxury room" (which is the basic room at the hotel), some of the lampshades were missing some embellishments. The nooks and crannies in the bathroom mirror needed cleaned out a little bit. Some of the wallpaper was peeling a bit. Our king sized bed seemed crooked and it was very uncomfortable compared to the super comfortable queen beds in a friend's room there! The mini bar was empty and you couldn't use the fridge for your own items. To me, none of these are a big deal, but I know there are some people out there that would find this unacceptable. The Cafe Ile St. Louis was very yummy and reasonably priced at about 10:30 at night, but breakfast was expensive and not what I was looking for. The buffet always had hugely long lines, so I never ate at it. The Burger Brasserie food was good, although pricey for burgers and fries. I did, however, have the best vanilla milkshake I've ever had in my life there!!! I also did not eat at the "La Pizza" joint, but the pizza looked and smelled so good every time we walked by! The $17 strawberry daquiri in the Eiffel Tower container was awesome, and quite an eye catcher. Get it at Gustav's Bar while there. Most of the restaurants are also true to the french theme, but do seem to offer a nice menu. The casino is small doesn't seem to offer a big variety of traditional slot machines. There are tons of different new video slot machines. The scenery like a french street is charming though. Definitely ride to the top of the Eiffel Tower! This was one of the highlights of my entire trip - as many times as I've been to Vegas this was my first Eiffel Tower trip. You can see so much of the strip from the top, and we could see the Bellagio fountains from the top too! It was a neat activity to do. There are convenience shops in the hallway, plus other shops between Paris and Ballys. Be prepared to pay about $3.50 for a bottle of water or pop! Check in was surprisingly quick, I didn't even have to wait in a line! I did check out through the phone because the option to check out via the television didn't work. (Just another small example of how the room is "almost dated".) All in all I enjoyed my stay here and was pleasantly surprised at the great rate I was able to get during my stay. I paid much more the first time I stayed... I must have just picked a good time to go. But after staying here twice over the years, I'd probably pick a different hotel to try next time - mostly just for something different. Au revoir, Paris Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “PARIS - OKAY, BUT WEAK IN SOME SPOTS”
Reviews.Author: tmm32776
Reviews.Content: The Paris Hotel and Casino, part of the Harrah's group, is okay but not much of a treat. The lobby, shops and restaurant decor is of course French, although barely. At check-in you are told you can upgrade your room for $40 a night, only to find out that "upgrade" is a euphamism for "one of the renovated rooms" as v. a room yet to be redone. Staff is very pleasant. Food is as un-French as it gets. You don't get better food simply because it is given a French equivalent name. Very disappointing. Weak, weak coffee everywhere. At every outlet the croissant and breads are no better than day old stuff at the local 7-Eleven. Pastries are delicious, though, and a good value. The casino is moderately updated but languishes as "same old, same old" Vegas. You might expect a special stay at Paris but they simply do not deliver. SUGGESTION: If you can get a good room rate, terrrific. Paris has clean rooms (at least the renovated ones) and the location gives you access to the best on the Las Vegas strip. So, grab a reasonable price and stay at Paris - but with an eye for using the hotel as a point of departure for the better offerings just minutes away by foot in either direction.

Reviews.Title: “Paris - stay elsewhere in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: oreostuff
Reviews.Content: Wi-Fi is not free in the room. Really? It's 2011, this is a no-brainer. Check-in is slow if you are not a preferred guest. Front Desk, in general, not helpful or friendly (did I suddenly time travel to France?). The concessions around the elevators to the rooms are crowded and busy; they run out of popular items quickly, like a newspaper or yogurt. Restaurants are hit and miss: Mon Ami: good food; spotty service. The Crepe Place: long lines; dispassionate service. The buffet is excellent, but inefficiently run. Go across to the Bellagio or down to the Monte Carlo for equally great selections in a better-run environment. The Paris Las Vegas is a three stars hotel and does not try to exceed those expectations. Shame on the Paris, in this economy! Bright spot: housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Finding out about Paris”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyeTraveler68
Reviews.Content: After traveling to Vegas for many years and staying mostly at Harrahs, we have decided to stay at Paris and try the other end of the strip. I was somewhat leerie about staying there based on several other reviews. But like anything else, you need to find out for yourself. In the end, I am glad I did. Overall, our experience was very good. As a Diamond card holder, I received a call prior to my late arrival that confirmed a red room suite for me. Once I arrived, I checked in at the desk and the red room was reseved for me. However, not know the room variety that was offered at Paris, I found out at the Diamond checkout that I was to be given an upgrade to the red room suite. The lady was apoligetic and did confirm that I was to be in a corner suite and didn't know why the mix up. Although I was somewhat satisfied with the standard red room, I would have liked more space. Overall the property is very nice, especially the variety of small and quaint restaurants available.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: wofwnr
Reviews.Content: Great location on the strip. Could walk anywhere and find great things to do. Hotel was a great place to gamble. Room wasn't exactly what I was expecting. Pretty generic. Didn't have a good view of the strip. Would probably stay again, but make sure the room we get was nicer and better view.

Reviews.Title: “Ho Hum Hotel dead center on strip good for first timers to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: DeserDoc
Reviews.Content: Clean fairly well run property with the usual post recession service and condition issues. First timers will likely find this property a novel attraction and the location is perfect. Dead center on the strip with Bellagio, Caesars and City Center across the street and Planet Hollywood to the South and Bally's connected by tunnel and to the North. OK eateries but nothing special. Casino is OK too but as is the case with all Caesar's owned properties, the casino slots are collectively older and not on a par with the MGM properties. Rooms are nice and well maintained and the beds are very comfortable pillow tops. The standard rooms are large and decorated like your great grandmother's house in an attempt to appear Parisian. Red room luxury rooms come at a premium and are not worth the upgrade charge. NOTE: THIS HOTEL DOES NOT AND WILL NOT ENFORCE NO SMOKING RULES. I had a NO SMOKING ROOM on a NO SMOKING FLOOR with smoking neighbors. We're talking MAJOR SMOKE HERE. The smoke billowed around the corner and into my room. Three calls to security finally got an agent who said that they could not enforce the rule rather could only request that the guest REFRAIN FROM SMOKING. Needless to say, that this is the first and last time I'll stay at a Caesar's property for this reason. Overall, this property is clean, fairly well run, albeit a bit dated, like most of the themed hotels in Vegas. We are frequent travelers from California to Vegas and always stay at MGM properties. While MGM charges a resort fee, I must say that I feel like we get better service at MGM properties and I have never had the needs of a smoking guest placed above mine, as a non- smoking guest. All in all, good hotel, solid stay, nice crowd, clean, comfortable (except the smoke problem). Also note that because this hotel is dead center, it VERY BUSY ALL THE TIME. Have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice at a discount price”
Reviews.Author: mikesevereid
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be very respectable in many ways- the beds were comfortable, the furniture was nice and the location of the hotel is excellent (right on the Strip and walking distance to other hotels/casinos/restaurants: Bellagio, Planet Hollywood, Aria, Cesar's Palace, Cosmopolitan, as well as shopping malls, too). The Eiffel Tower replica is breathtaking and the eateries are very good, especially the top-rated Les Artistes restaurant (for which we got a good discount through Last-Minute Tickets). Because of the attractive room discount, it was somewhat crowded but not excessively. Staff was very professional and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “MIGHT TRY ANOTHER PROPERTY!!”
Reviews.Author: Fabsecy
Reviews.Content: Upgraded to refurbished Red Room, but they had no strip view available in a King. The sink was clogged the moment we got there; funny the prior guests didn't report it. It was successfully taken care of right away. The bed was comfy, but I find the decorative pillows placed against our clean pillow cases gross. Towels need improvement. The pool was wonderful and huge. I just wonder why they keep stacking together all the broken chaise lounges and not just replace them. They are truly worn and need to be replaced. The buffet was not as good as when we visited 10 years ago, but everyone is cutting back. Enjoyed the teas and crepes though. The seafood not of great quality. For the price, it was a nice hotel. Wouldn't try another Harrahs in the area at all after walking through them.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: snackaddict
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 5 nights in the Red Room- room was very spacious and very clean with flat screen tv. First time staying in Paris, lobby area/casino area was nice. Found the room we were in to be very quiet, which was great. Check in was fast when we arrived, did not have to wait long. Location was great, was in the middle of the strip and close to everything. The cleaning staff was quick and efficient- rarely saw them, and when we stepped out for a short while we came back to a clean room. Dined 3 times a mon ami Gabi, food was great, and even better when we were able to sit on the terrace- prices were reasonable. There was a gourmet burger place on site, we dined there one night and found the food to be amazing- great value, and much better than the over-rated KGB. Only downside would be the valet...some days it took them longer to get your car out...even those that came after us got their car before us. Would come back to stay again- location was great!

Reviews.Title: “great time for a weekend get away”
Reviews.Author: sederia
Reviews.Content: The service was fast for check in, the room was great, I had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jrb2301
Reviews.Content: great hotel,fantastic room very clean n comfortable.the views from our room on the 27th flr of the strip were spectacular.if we went back to Las Vegas we would be staying here again.everything was perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel/Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lacj
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Sunday around 1:00 PM. We were able to check in early though they only had two queen bed ready that early. We were in a standard room. We were offered an upgrade to a strip view room for an extra $55.00 a night which we refused. The room was clean and has all the amenities we required. The TV was the old tube type, but the only time we had the TV on was to catch updates on hurricane Irene since we lived on the Carolina coast. We weren't in our room very much so the lack of a view was not a problem. The room was thoroughly cleaned daily with fresh towels and shampoo, conditioner, etc. The beds were made and all of this was done in a timely manner. We found the beds and pillows to be comfortable and slept well. The staff was friendly during our visit and the concierge was very helpful in telling us the best way to get to Fremont Street since we didn't have a vehicle. We enjoyed the entertainment at Napoleons. We were given discount coupons at check in and were to go up in the Eiffel Tower for 2 for 1. We had breakfast three mornings at Mon Ami Gabi and dinner at Le Village Buffet and the food was good, but a bit pricey. The location was great being in the middle of the strip. You can also catch the Deuce bus right out front and the monorail stop is a Ballys which is right next door. Check out was easy via the TV and dropping our keys off at an express checkout drop off. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would stay at Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location, easy to navigate”
Reviews.Author: LVBeachgirl
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th trip to Las Vegas and my first time staying at Paris. Overall no real complaints about this hotel. Location is central strip which is fantastic, and the fact that they don't charge any ridiculous "resort fees" is great. This is one of the reasons we chose the hotel. Booked a regular room (not a red room). Check-in was a breeze, lady who checked us in wasn't particularly "friendly" though. The hotel is big, but as a guest you don't feel it. The elevators are a short walk from the main lobby, and they have multiple elevators separated by the levels of floors. Never had to wait for elevators. Rooms easy to find. Not a mega-sized sprawling hotel which I thought was great. Room incredibly clean, no issues. Bathroom really nice with stand-up shower and separate tub. Only small complaints are that the TV in the room was old (non flat-screen) but not a big deal at all.... and the fact that there is no free wifi in the room. There is free wifi in the cafe by the lobby though, so worked out OK. Would highly recommend this hotel to people travelling to Las Vegas and would stay here again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at the Paris”
Reviews.Author: Biscuit24
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful 5 night stay at the Paris Hotel. I admit that before going, I was concerned about some of the reviews that I was reading, but none of those were warranted with our stay. We checked in at about 8:30pm on a Sunday. There were only a couple other guests in front of us, so the wait was short. I had heard that room reservation requests were not guaranteed and we had requested a non-smoking king bed room. The front desk lady was checking her computer for our room and quickly going over our reservation ... I heard her say something about "smoking" and quickly stopped her and said that we needed to have non-smoking. She said that there were none available with a king bed, but that there was non-smoking with 2 queen beds available or that we could pay more and upgrade to a red room. We said no to the red room and told her that because non-smoking was the most important to us, that we would take the queen bed room. She did say we could change to a king bed room the following day, but that she was giving us a free upgrade to a view room with the queen beds and that we would lose that if we changed rooms. We were on the 10th floor and very, very pleased with our view of the pool, tower and the strip. The room itself was very clean and nicely decorated. I am usually pretty picky about dated decor and cleanliness and this room was great! Yes, the television is not a new flat screen, but you can hardly tell, as it sits in the armoire. The bathroom was large, clean, separate tub and shower, shower had fantastic water pressure (felt great) and a full length mirror behind the door. The room was cleaned and freshened up quickly every day by the maid service. Loved the location on the strip of this hotel. Loved the high ceilings in the casino, as I think it helped with the smoke, compared to some of the other hotels that we walked through. Spent quite a bit of time at the pool and enjoyed that. Never felt out of place, as there was a nice mix of age groups (same thing with the rest of the hotel). At the pool we never had a problem finding a chair and drink service was fantastic, if needed. The coffee and pastry shop downstairs, right off the elevators (elevators were fast ... barely any waiting) had free wi-fi, so it was perfect spot for a morning coffee and pastry, while checking e-mail, etc., before heading out for the day. Loved our stay and would recommend it and would stay there again. All the employees we encountered were very kind and friendly, room was lovely, casino fresh and not too smokey, location great, and felt comfortable throughout the hotel with the other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and Service”
Reviews.Author: boshmd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights mid-August and loved it. Used the $20 sandwich trick and was upgraded toa Red Room corner Premier after one night that was a corner room with multiple views of the Bellagio fountain and bigger room size. Dont know about others but the King Size bed we had was very comfortable! Staff was very pleasant to deal with especially the table/gaming dealers at the roulette and craps tables where we spent most of our time. Gambled in a few other casinos and found the attitude was more formal and less friendly at Bellagio and Mandalay Bay and elsewhere. Central Location to the Strip made it convenient to go everywhere and still have to walk to get place but better than at Venetian. Next time will hit convenience store to stock up on water/beer, etc. Took advantage of Tix4 Tonite and saw Absinthe which was hysterical and a bargain at under $50 I believe. Highly recommend it - think raunchier version of Cirque de Soleil. Had dinner with voucher for 50% of entree at Ballys Steakhouse which was excellent. Pool area was crowded but nice and water very cool for summer temps. All in all a very enjoyable experience and would definitely go back. Buffett specials at the hotel were also a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay...would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: IslandGirl61
Reviews.Content: Check in process was fine for our 6:30pm arrival, but I did walk by registration a couple of times with large crowds waiting in line over our 3 night stay. Check out was also straightforward for our 11am checkout (priority was given to those leaving over those arriving at this time of day). The room was spacious and comfortable, bedding was good, bathroom had separate bath & shower. I asked at checkin for a room overlooking the pool and got a fantastic view from my window also of the Eiffel tower and Caesars Palace. The pool area was nice enough, but not luxurious. I would not pay for the cabana rentals here. Your money/time would be better spent at The Wynn or at Mandalay Bay (you don't have to be a hotel guest to rent the cabanas-at least not at Mandalay Bay). Eating in the Paris hotel is expensive. The Sugar Factory in the front of the hotel had the most reasonable prices, really good & unique food choices, and a fabulous atmosphere for breakfast & lunch especially.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded at no cost!!!!!!! I love these guys!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SeanPorder
Reviews.Content: I feel it absolutely essential to share with you how well you will be treated by the front desk staff. My girlfriend and I arrived early Friday August 26th to check in (earlier than allowed) for one last 3 day bash before back to school on Monday. We had stayed here July 5th -8th and had a great time. The front desk staff actually remembered how much of a smart-**s I was and not only allowed us to check in early but also upgraded us to a sweet at no cost due to a vacancy. I have never had personal service like this hotel offered us on this trip with all the visitors they see I don't know how the remembered the waterboy!!!! I will stay with them next summer when we return!!!! -- Sean Porder

Reviews.Title: “Nice, easy and no resort fees”
Reviews.Author: cowz
Reviews.Content: Wick check in, free Valet, easy layout, fast elevators, awesome pool. NO RESORT FEE!!!! Bathrooms are nice, separate tub. No coffee pots, no cheap food. I got a great deal online. No discount coupons in the hotel that I found for rides, etc. Husband loved breakfast buffet, I did not go because seemed expensive for me and 9 year old vegetarian ($15 each, but foes include drinks).

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: robl158
Reviews.Content: Check in was very fast we walked up and checked in and received our room. Very nice hotel and the rooms were very nice as well. The restaurants were all good in this hotel. Overall great hotel we had no com-plaints with the service, food, or hotel itself. Recommend staying here at least once in your ventures to vegas

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: marajoe
Reviews.Content: Love the location of this hotel. We and my buddies go out for March Madness. This year we picked Paris. We got a great deal. We liked the hotel for the location, but went to other hotels to gamble. We did not stay at the hotel during the day, nor much at night. its a good place to stay, but for action you will need to go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Wedding and 7 Hotels in 14 days”
Reviews.Author: OzzieExplorer
Reviews.Content: Paris was the second hotel on the list. We were reluctant to leave the MGM Grand until we got to Paris! Despite asking for strip view as we were over to get married (cheeky I know) we were told a strip view was a $50 a night upgrade. As there were mixed reviews on tripadvisor when we went I was reluctant to pay extra. Room was nice despite no view of strip. Smaller than the Celebrity Suite we had at MGM Grand but that was to be expected. Only oddball thing was the minibar that was empty. Also had a tube TV not a flatscreen but so did a couple of other hotels and we weren't there to watch TV. I liked this place so much I left my pillow. We will be back to stay at Paris! Casino had a great atmosphere and was always busy. Food: Le Burger Brassiere was the best! Gorgeous Milkshakes, great food. Incidentally - we booked from Australia to have Wedding Brunch at Mon Ami Gabi but decided to swap to Stratosphere Top of the World Restaurant. When I went in to cancel Mon Ami Gabi - they had no record of our booking, so just as well I checked! Hotels we stayed in were: MGM Grand Paris Stratosphere Bellagio Hilton on the Strip Luxor Venetian

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and casino at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: lrichards51064
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris the week of Christmas 2010 and although it was rainy and chilly outside, we had a great time. I love the casino ad it had a variety of games. I love video blackjack and they actually have it! Food was great and I loved the walkway to Ballys. We had a basic room across street from the bellagio so fountain view. Room was clean and basic not upgraded though.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the strip, but hotel rooms need some TLC”
Reviews.Author: carrie9678
Reviews.Content: We randomly decided to change our launching point to the Grand Canyon to Las Vegas instead of Flagstaff while driving from California and found a great rate at the Paris. We were there about 16 hours- so I don't have a lot to offer but it was a nice little taste of Vegas and about all I wanted my 4 and 7 year old daughters to experience. The theming of all the hotels common areas are amazing- the Paris is no exception. The wait to check in was a bit long and they did not have many stations open; in fact one lady closed down and went on break leaving just 1 VIP and 1 regular check in clerk. That being said the lady who checked us in was very nice and because we were there just one night she upgraded us for free to a high floor overlooking the pool, eiffel tower and the bellagio fountains across the street, which was a big thrill for my girls to be able to watch from the window in our room. We never got to check out the pool because it was closed when we got done eating dinner and roaming the strip. We ate at the hotel, at PARIS LE SAINT LOUIS CAFE, which was a disappointment. It was expensive and they had no kids menu, so thankfully they serve breakfast all day and the girls shared pancakes. Seeing the bellagio fountains from the room was probably the highlight of the room- the carpet was thread bare and the room was in need of a major makeover.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: wc1208
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for a 3 day convention. Our flight got us in very early so we checked our bags outside and started our tour of the city. When our room was ready, which was before the 3pm check-in time, I called the Bell Captain and our luggage was quickly delivered. We did not upgrade to the larger room but felt the room was nice for our actual time spent there. Here is the tip of the day for all who visit. Make sure you go to the "Mon Ami Gabi" Restaurant each morning for breakfast and sit outside. It is such a pleasant way to start each day. We will surely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Beware the buffet”
Reviews.Author: Computergeek60
Reviews.Content: The rest of my experience at this hotel was fine. The room was adequate, it was clean and a good size. However on the last night I wanted to eat at the Paris buffet, and the rest of my family went and got a pizza. I was the only person sick with diarria the next morning, and since the only food I ate that others did not was the buffet, I am certain that was the culprit.

Reviews.Title: “Not Paris, not close, but great service, location and value.”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoLawyer1
Reviews.Content: Just finished first stay at Paris, in upgraded single room. The upgrade rooms are small small small but well appointed with good linens. Concierge service was excellent; check-in and check-out were fast, and nothing beats waking up to breakfast at Mon Ami Gabi before the heat hits the Strip. Best view of the Bellagio fountains, and the food is fabulous. Chateau night club is free to hotel guests, with no line, and great fun. Casino is underwhelming to say the least (more like low end neighbor Bally's than higher quality spots nearby).

Reviews.Title: “great deal”
Reviews.Author: hiba26
Reviews.Content: i stayed at pairs with my husband & 2 years old daughter, we loved the hotel from all aspects. the room was specious & clean, there was an iron & iron table in the closet, the bathroom was with marble floors & a very good size with a shower & a tub. the buffet was with a very good varieties & they have an ice cream machine in the sweets section my daughter loved that.the staff was very friendly & helpful. the room rate was great for the room & service we got.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Hedgeanie
Reviews.Content: We are a family of two adults and two children aged 14 and 11. We stayed at the Paris for two nights at the beginning of a three week trip around California. We have nothing but praise for this beautiful hotel. Firstly its location is perfect, in the middle of the Strip opposite the Bellagio. Our room was lovely, decorated in reproduction turn-of-the-century Parisian style. The room was one of the standard rooms, large, spacious and very clean and had a beautiful marble bathroom. The air-con was quiet and we hardly heard it all night. The pool is lovely - a huge circular pool on a low rooftop, adjoining the mock Eiffel Tower, with plenty of sunbeds all around. On our second day our children spent the entire day in the pool, until it closed at 8pm. There was music playing at the pool but it wasn't intrusive or loud at all. (Later in our holiday we stayed at Planet Hollywood and were actually driven from the pool by the loud banging music that they play there.) There is a rule that you cannot take your own food and drink into the pool area (so that you will, of course, buy their snacks and drinks) which I don't like, but they do not search your bags (which they did at Planet Hollywood, making me feel like a criminal.) The shopping mall belonging to the hotel was very stylish and attractive - a fake Victorian Parisian boulevard full of authentic looking shops and restaurants with French names, all under a pretend sky. We really enjoyed our stay at the Paris - check in was almost immediate; check-out took only five minues in the queue and the staff were courteous and friendly. The hotel was just right for couples and families and it will be our first choice when we return to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “showing its age a little”
Reviews.Author: mattscards
Reviews.Content: First of all, when you walk in the place it is gorgeous. The ceiling looks almost real with the clouds and the huge trees look real too. I had to touch them to make sure. You must walk through the casino to get the front desk. There is sometimes an extremely long line but it moves quickly because on busy days they have a lot of help. Then I go to the room. Definitely NOT 5 star. The pillows were like WalMart quality, if even that. It was almost like a big sponge in a pillow case. Not good. 6 nights and I had trouble sleeping. My neck would always hurt. The carpet was bland. I was at the end of the hallway, and in the morning I had to get up and go turn the water on and wait 7-10 minutes before the water would be "lukewarm" enough so I could not freeze getting in. This is easily fixed with a small Hot Water Return pump by the Water Heater source. You would think a place that generates this much money they could afford one. I know Motel 6 and Budget Inn can afford it. It is connected with Bally's and the place is very crowded. Always. The corridors are always filled up to the max. And, the place is very expensive. I cup of coffee and a muffin is $8.50. Pepsi in a bottle is $3.50 downstairs. But, it is Vegas, so hey I guess you can expect this. If it gets bad, they have a McDonald's about 2 blocks down. The location is great. All the shows are within walking distance. The casinos are nice... but the selection is better in Harrah's in New Orleans. The odds of winning may be a little better here than Harrah's though. All in all. I will give this a "3" Everyone said, 'We should have stayed in Bally's" And "Next Year we are not staying here" Bally's is owned by the same people, but apparently it is better. If the price is the same, go there. The internet is not free. $15(before tax) in room only and $25 per day in room and lobby. Hope this helps you.

Reviews.Title: “Gigantic Room that is pet friendly”
Reviews.Author: Chief_Gypsy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a vacation for a few days to Las Vegas and stayed at Paris hotel because it was a pet friendly place. The room was very clean, updated, and huge! I felt very comfortable staying here with my dogs. The room could have fit at least 6 king sized beds. The bathroom was quite large as well. It had a separate shower that was beautiful. There was also plenty of closet space. The housekeeping staff were very friendly and attentive. The only thing that was odd was the fact that the TV was an old type (not the newer flat screen). It's a nice hotel and I'd expect that would be upgraded. So this is a pet friendly hotel. In order to take your dog in or out though you will need to go through the casino to the North Entrance. They also have a tiny little area for dogs. When I say tiny, it's probably no bigger than 15 ft by 8 ft with a bush, fake grass and a doggy bag holder/can. It was good to encourage the dogs to potty but not much for exercise. The buffet breakfast is absolutely fantastic. Lots of french dishes that were super tasty. There were several stations to offer baked goods, eggs, eggs to order, crepes, etc. All were stocked well and kept clean even though the place was quite busy. I came here in August and I heard that Vegas is so hot that even the pools are too hot to enjoy. I did not find that true at Paris. It was extremely hot out (around 105 degrees) and the pool was still kept very cool and was enjoyable. Overall, I really liked this hotel and if I ever went to Vegas again with my pets, I'd stay at Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Getting a little tired”
Reviews.Author: Toronto_CanadaMike
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled with my son and his girlfriend Aug. 14 to the 18/11. My wife and I had stayed here before and we upgraded to a strip view with access to the 31 st. club floor. Everything went smooth at check in and check out but both my wife and I suffered bites to our legs after sleeping everynite, we were in room 1721, my son and his girlfriend didn't encounter this in their room 2296. The rooms are a little tired and could use an upgrade to match the other hotels on the strip. This was my wife and I's 23 trip to Vegas and have stayed at most hotels on the strip. Everything else went well except for those dam bites.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, great stay in Le Mans Suite”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelingCarters
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas several times and always stayed at a different hotel. This was my favorite location by far. So close to everything I enjoy going to. This particular Vegas trip was for New year's Eve, which is a very crowded time! We stayed 4 nights. We arrived at the hotel on NYE around 11am and were offered an upgrade to the Le Mans Suite that was available to check into right then. So we thought it's Vegas on NYE why not... So all in all check in was rather painless and pretty quick, but I do think that is because we arrived earlier than the normal check in time. btw- this is one of the few hotels that does not charge a resort fee! Room: the Le Mans Suite was beautiful and very spacious. King size bed, sitting area and a wet bar with a mini-frig. But the bathroom was my favorite part. I took detoxing baths every morning. However the elevators seemed to take a long time. Food: We only ate at one restaurant at this hotel: the Buffet for breakfast. I am typically not a buffet person. But I did like the options this one gave, was it worth the price, not for me because I do not overstuff myself at meals. Entertainment: The casino is nice. Very open, clean and bright. After our NYE dinner we spent the rest of the evening in the Dueling Piano Bar at Paris I think it is called Napoleons. They had a special that night that included admission and open bar. It was a great time. Location: AWESOME! This is my favorite thing about the hotel. It is right across from the Bellagio, so great views of the fountains, next to planet Hollywood and near Caesars, so lots of convenient shopping. Easy walk to the MGM and Mandalay Bay, which have my favorite restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the Heart of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: midnightbay
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights at the start of our honeymoon. It's location was wonderful - right in the centre of the strip, opposite The Bellagio and next to Planet Hollywood. We arrived at the hotel after a long day travelling and found the check-in process quick and stress-free. The clerk was very welcoming and upon mentioning we were on our Honeymoon, she upgraded up our room to one with a strip-view at no extra cost. The room itself was spacious, well furnished and spotless. The downsides were that there were no tea or coffee making facilities, no HBO and wi-fi was expensive at $14.99 per device per 24 hours. We understood that the hotel wanted people to spend as much time (and money) in its casino but basic amenities like these should have been offered as standard. Why is wi-fi complimentary in $50-a-night motels and even fast food restaurants but so expensive in an already expensive hotel? The casino/hotel itself was nicely laid out and easy to navigate. A good selection of resturants and eateries were available and catered for different tastes and finances. Having sampled buffets downtown, at Planet Hollywood and The Bellagio, we weren't particularly impressed with Paris' selection but it was okay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Great Casino - Horrible Beds”
Reviews.Author: Page1977
Reviews.Content: Paris is a beautiful hotel. Love the 'theme' hotels. Lobby is gorgeous! I love to play blackjack there, but will never again stay there. Rooms are nice and bathrooms are great. BUT - The beds are the most uncomfortable ever.

Reviews.Title: “Is this what a French Hotel is like? Just a taste of it I think.”
Reviews.Author: readytogoagain
Reviews.Content: The pillows were awful in our room and the bed was worn and uncomfortable. We got no sleep the 1st night. Complainedin the morning and were given a nicer corner room with a Strip view, and a not as worn version of the same fairly uncomfortable bed. No matter for the other nights, we were so tired from attending the convention we were at and running around to see sights, we collapsed in the bed each night from exhaustion. The room we had was original to the 1999 opening of Paris, ugly Royal blue carpet, Tube TV, French furnishings, and of course the uncomfortable bed and pillows.
