We met a few French people at the pool, you'd think they'd want to visit New York, New York, Caesars (Rome) , Mandalay Bay (the Caribbean) , the Venetian (Venice) while in Las Vegas, but NO, they were just too comfortable staying in their own country. How silly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Paris!”
Reviews.Author: melispsych
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a Sunday morning and there was a long line for check-in. After waiting about 30 minutes we got to the front desk to find out there were no rooms ready with a king size bed. We decided to wait and were told to come back in an hour to get out keys. When we went back again the room was still not ready so, rather than make us come back again, the clerk offered us a complimentary upgrade! Of course we took it (our room was already comped through total rewards so any room was fine with us). When we got to the room we had an amazing view overlooking the pool, Eiffle tower and the Bellagio fountains! The room was spacious and clean. Overall, we really enjoyed the hotel and I would definately recommend staying here. The location was great and the hotel was beautiful! My only complaint would be that the casino it's self is actually fairly small compared to others so we did not spend a lot of time gambling there.

Reviews.Title: “Paris in decline”
Reviews.Author: twomenandababy
Reviews.Content: This place is not what it used to be. The buffet is pricy and mediocre (overbooked meats, veggies swimming in butter, etc.). The "premier" rooms are small, cramped, with old, cheap televisions. I expected more. Bellagio, here I come...

Reviews.Title: “This place is sooooo Bad!”
Reviews.Author: sambodie1
Reviews.Content: It would be better of staying at a motel 6 then this place..hey don't even offer tooth paste for the room..would not recomd this hotelll...bath rooms are garbage

Reviews.Title: “So much fun!”
Reviews.Author: Niki_0921
Reviews.Content: Just spent the past weekend in Vegas with my girlfriends, it was our second trip to Sin City. The first time we stayed at the Golden Nugget on Fremont St, but this trip we decided to stay on the strip. Paris is dead center on the strip, right across the street from the Bellagio and you can see the water show from your room! I called a few days before we arrived to request a room with the view, but when we got there, Amber at front desk said they weren't doing any comp upgrades. However, when we entered our room, she worked some sort of magic and got us a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower AND the Bellagio water show! Thank you Amber! We ate breakfast at the cafe right across the way from the elevators, and it was absolutely delish! Get the french toast, I highly suggest the lattes with hand made whipped cream. For dinner both nights, we went to this bar closer to Bally's and made good friends with the bartenders Eric and Daylan. Every employee we met, from the maids in the hallways to the boys that deliver room service, were very nice. I'm sure we've found our forever hotel in Vegas for every girls trip we make. And trust me, i work at a beautiful resort in San Diego, so i know good service when I see it!

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed it!”
Reviews.Author: newlywed_traveler24
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I with two other guys stayed at the Paris in September 2010. It was my first time to Vegas, and I thought the hotel was very nice and updated. When we got there, they even upgraded our room. I slept better in the king size bed in our room than at home, it was unbelivably soft. The breakfast at the hotel is exceptional; if you are on a budget with food, I highly recommend the 40 dollar band for 24 hours, so you can eat at all these great buffets. Also, the hotel is in a good location on the strip. If you want discounted tickets to shows go to Bill's Saloon, which is next to the Paris, and they sell them at a booth in the casino for half the price of the show tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Convention-our stay at the Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: northbendmom
Reviews.Content: O.K. this is NOT the time of year I like to go to Las Vegas, I prefer March or October, however my husband had a convention so any chance to go on a work/vacation is o.k. The temperature was around 105 every day and it feels like you are stepping in to an oven (especially if you are from the NW) My first impression of driving up to the Hotel was that it is very nice. However things went downhill at check-in. We arrived early around 10 a.m. and I knew they probably would not have a room ready so we asked the front desk when we should check back and they said to try around 1 p.m. We left our bags with the very nice bellman and went to the casino for awhile and had lunch at Mon Ami Gabi-o.k. lunch no wait this time of day although they sat us in a corner with a wobbly table (we put a sugar packet under the leg) near the service entrance. When we walked back to the check in area we noticed the line was VERY long and it was very confusing to figure out who was checking in and who was cheking out. No sign for check in - just check out. After a considerable wait we got to the front and took two queen beds as opposed to one King because we just wanted a room and didn't want to wait. I forgot my confirmation paper at home and I reserved our room with a credit card so fortunately it was not an issue-however I spoke with another convention attendee and they told me the Paris had no record of their reservation and it was first-come, first-serve so they were forced to pay $70 extra per night for a suite! Lesson learned-I will always bring my printed out reservation form from home from now on! The room was O.K. I am glad we had a partial view of the strip (room 2341) looking toward the cosmopolitan and PH hotel. The rooms could use some TLC. carpet a little dingy, broken cabinetry on t.v.display-whats with the small 1990's style T.V.??? we missed our home T.V. The beds were o.k.- I hated the pillows-wish I had brought mine from home, but who wants to pack all that stuff. Craked bathroom tile in shower let water run out on to floor. My brother and sister-in-law had an issue with housekeeping coming in to the room (while they were in it) even though they posted a "Do not disturb sign" outside. My husband had the same issue with housekeeping the next day-during a break he came up to freshen up and while he was in the restroom they opened the door! On our check out day I was packing (not dressed yet) and housekeeping knocked and quickly opened the door at 8:45 a.m.!!! From now on I will deadbolt the door! The burger restaurant downstairs was very good and convenient-we ate there 3 time (I wish I had noticed on the first visit that they include gratuity on your bill) We got 2 for I entrees, because I signed up for special "text" discounts from home before we left, also got a 2 for 1 drink discout. Go by the reward center when you arrive and get a players card - use it everytime you eat or buy anything - at some stores you get a discout.Water at the pool area is $4.50 -bring your own. Oh and we found out- after buying a cheese and fruit plate - that we could not take it into the pool area, however the next day we got to the pool early 9:30 a.m. and noticed people bringing food and coffee in-guess you can get away with it before the restaurant opens!? The Paris IS located in a very good spot-I am not ruling out staying again, however there are too many deals in Las Vegas-and I think for $119 a night we will try a new location next time- A votre sante!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff, restuarant,and view”
Reviews.Author: Brandon004
Reviews.Content: The front desk employee actually gave us an uprgraded room with no charge because of reservation accidently being canceled. The room was almost at the top not quite a suite. But the view was very nice and the restaurant in the Eifel Tower was good as well.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best locations on the strip and in the middle of all the action”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoGirl017
Reviews.Content: Paris Las Vegas is one of the best, centrally located hotels on the strip. The decor is beautiful, and the casino is great. I have been to Vegas four times and during two of the most busiest times of the year- March Madness and New Years. Paris is always a happening place to visit and the staff is able to handle large crowds, while still providing great customer service. Their bistro serves excellent breakfast items, but what you cannot miss is dinner at the Eiffel Tower restaurant. The food is delicious, but the view is spectacular. At night, you can enjoy dinner right in front of the majestic, illuminated Bellagio fountains. In short, Paris is a classy, well-maintained hotel with a superb location.

Reviews.Title: “It was a great location”
Reviews.Author: Nmbt211
Reviews.Content: This hotel takes you to Paris with the tour Eiffel & the French streets! Good restaurants around good casino friendly staff location is amazing

Reviews.Title: “Love Paris Hotel, Hate the Check In/Check Out Process”
Reviews.Author: Littlelobo
Reviews.Content: As the title states, we loved our stay at the hotel. Check In/Check Out was another story because to me that is the first glimpse you get of what your hotel stay may be like. Arrived early Sunday morning and wanted to leave our bags with the bellhop till check in. The sign out front is very confusing and no one to ask questions to. Finally a nice traveler pointed us in the right direction, otherwise we'd have been in line for who knows how long! So if you go early, you need to go outside to drop off your luggage, don't bother going in the hotel for this. Later, we showed up at 3 p.m. to check in and the line was as long as a line in Disney Land!!! It was unbelievable that this place allows it's customers to have to go through that nonsense. I was having second thoughts about staying here, thankfully our room, which was nothing fancy, was clean, ready for us to move into and beds were great, no complaints there! The convenience for me is that this hotel is Central on the Strip and connected to Ballys, which makes access to the Monorail nice and simple. Yes, I'll stay here again and will continue to write updates on their Check In/Check Out process, hopefully this will improve quickly.

Reviews.Title: “From A local!”
Reviews.Author: HendersonMimi
Reviews.Content: Being a local, there are certain places we like to frequent & recommend to our friends & family who ask, "Where's a good place to stay in Vegas?" The Paris is centrally located on the strip, in the middle of everthing. We always request a room on the SW or WW wing facing the strip. These are "Premiere" rooms with a view. There is an upcharge for them, however, consider that the view you get is worth much more than the upcharge. You will be facing the Bellagio and their famous fountain without paying the extremely high price for a strip view at the Bellagio which range upwards of $1000/night for a regular non-holiday weekend night. The Le Creperie is fantastic to walk-up, order & take back to the room. Also, in the Le Café Ile St. Louis is the best french onion soup.

Reviews.Title: “Paris in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: hurstdj
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I visit Las Vegas yearly. Each trip we try to stay at a diffent hotel. Searching all the popular travel sites and picking a thrusday start date, We were able to get a great combo. deal. Paris is located middle of the strip, with access to many casions. There is a great pastry shop down stairs for breakfast snacks, coffee and sandwichs. We found the buffey to be very good, great seating atmosphere, The basic rooms are nice. I admit there are lots of cheaper places to stay, but for a 4 star hotel, we really liked this place. Hope this is helpful. pssss. (the slots are looser next door at Harrahs) which has a connecting inside passage.

Reviews.Title: “Introducing a Paris-fanatic to PLV!”
Reviews.Author: SyntheticMilk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here originally in August 09, and knew immediately I would some day have to return with my Mother - who is an absolute Paris fanatic. She loves the real city and I was hoping to spark a little more excitement for her upcoming trip to the real thing. Originally we were unable to book for the first night we would stay, and after ringing and booking (having been given a room for the first night at the Planet Hollywood right next door), we were emailed a confirmation of our stay - the whole thing at Planet Hollywood! I was utterly dismayed, this wasn't at all what I asked for! After another international phone call, we were given a very sincere apology and they managed to find us a room for the entire stay. We booked a Red Room Premier, and due to the clumsy mishap during the booking, we were consoled with a room on the 25th floor, overlooking the pool & tower. Once we arrived, check in went very smoothly and they had indeed kept their promise of the room with a view. My Mother was amazed and incredibly happy! The room itself was very nice, nice bathroom, standard terrible shower head but very nice beds. My Mother has a difficult time sleeping in most hotels due to her bad back however this was not a problem at all! Our fridge wasn't stocked with any minibar items however we were able to use part of it without incurring any fees, which was a nice addition - last time I visited we had no spare space at all! The internet was a little issue, I connected using the cable however despite following all instructions my computer was not able to see the connecting page. I was able to persevere with wifi, which was better than nothing. The entire Caesar's network of hotels/casinos touts a no resort fee policy, which is true - anything you want additionally is an additional cost (a novel idea!). This meant daily internet charges however they weren't too bad considering my love of the web. A fantastic little side note - we were having issues with baggage and the airlines we chose, and were hoping the hotel could help us with some scales. As it turned out, the lady in the business centre was more than happy to accommodate our request and opened up the security door to let us use her package scale. Thank you for the kind help, it was incredibly handy for our trip home! Overall, PLV has a very charming french-esque atmosphere with some great little eateries and restaurants to boot (my Mother particularly loved the Eiffel Tower shaped daiquiri bottle!). The smoke throughout the casino became irritating to walk through each day, but we didn't mind so much when the rest of the hotel was so wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Love me some Paris”
Reviews.Author: Candacewp
Reviews.Content: The Paris hotel is a great place to stay especially in the summer when it is so hot because you have inside access to Ballys and the Monorail. The casino isn't my favorite but there are lots of good places to eat and because it is a little smaller - it is not as hectic. The rooms are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad and the Ugly”
Reviews.Author: msfighter
Reviews.Content: My 24 year old daughter and I spent two nights at the Paris Hotel last weekend. We arrived around 9:45 p.m. and I was surprised to see a line on arrival. We stood in line for about twenty minutes and the check in process went smoothly. We were given a standard room with a view of the pool and the Tower. (We asked for a complimentary upgrade and were told that the hotel does not offer them.) The hotel is very well appointed with (reproduction) antiques and is quite lovely. That being said the housekeeping staff coup step up their efforts a bit! There was bubble gum on the floor in the bathroom the entire time we were there. When they "cleaned the room" all they really did was make the beds and wipe out the sink in the bathroom. None of the trash was removed and the carpets were not vacuumed. The beds were comfortable so we did sleep well. We ordered room service several times...the prices are fairly high and they add a $5 delivery charge. We also ate in one of the hotel's restaurants, "Mon Ami Gabi". Lunch for three (two sandwiches and a quiche, two mimosas and a latte) was $100. The waitstaff here was very cordial. We got drinks from several of the bars and found the bar staff to be quite unfriendly and short with us. All in all, not a BAD place to stay but I think I would stay somewhere less expensive next time and use the money saved to have some more fun!

Reviews.Title: “It worked, not the best”
Reviews.Author: nicolemkelley
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Paris in July for Business Meeting. Room was nice, nothing to write home about but it served its purpose. Make sure you eat at the Burger place on the way to Ballys. Good thing about the hotel is that its connected to Ballys. Nice if you are there on business, you do not have to go outside.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: Duke89
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris for 5 nights to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary. Through AAA we were able to get a room for about $90/night. The first night all of the king size bed rooms were taken. The reservations clerk placed us in a room with 2 queens and told us to come back the next day for a room change. We returned the next day and the room switch was performed easily, almost seamlessly since the room they gave us was right next to the original room. The rooms were tastefully decorated, spacious and clean. They had huge flat screen TVs and a refrigerator. The room with the king size bad had a small sitting area with a sofa and coffee table. On the morning of our anniversary we ordered the Romantic Breakfast. Yes, it was a pricey $85 but it included eggs Benedict, fruit, yogurt, toast, hash browns, pastries, coffee champagne and juice. We saved some of the fruit and pastries and had them for breakfast the next day. The hotel common areas are beautifully decorated to make you feel you are walking through an old French town. However, restaurants such as the Sugar Factory and the club Chateau give the place a modern, trendy feel. The casino has pretty much the same offerings as most of the others. The minimum for table games is $10-15. The best aspect of this hotel is its location. It is directly across from the Bellagio and diagonal to Caesar's Palace. There is a bus stop just outside the front entrace where one can easily catch buses that travel up and down the Strip. All in all, this hotel stands up very well to the other luxurious hotels on the Strip and is quite reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “We love coming to Paris!”
Reviews.Author: bratty13
Reviews.Content: We recently spent eight days at our favorite hotel. From check in to check out our experience was great! We asked for and were upgraded to a strip facing room. We enjoy being able to see the pool from the window and watch the water show at the Bellagio throughout the day and night. On our first night we ordered room service and were told it would be thirty five minutes. The food arrived in fifteen. When we called housekeeping for extra linens they arrived in thirty minutes. There was an issue with a wardrobe door not closing properly and maintenance responded in under thirty minutes. The responsiveness of the hotel staff was excellent! We always enjoy dining at The Cafe and Mon Ami Gabi and getting morning coffee and croissants from Madeline's. The food and service is outstanding! The casino personnel were friendly and professional. We enjoyed earning platinum status on our Total Rewards card. My wife had a relaxing Fire and Ice pedicure at the hotel's Spa by Mandara. We plan on returning again next year and staying for nine days. Au revoir! We count the days until we return!

Reviews.Title: “Paris is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: USAb0und
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed in the Paris for 2 nights. We had a twin room and it was absolute luxury. We had stayed the previous night at the Imperial Palace as at the time of booking the Paris was fully booked for the 1st night. The Paris was more expensive than the Imperial Palace but far superior in every way and well worth the extra money. Check in took quite a while but I think that's standard for a Vegas hotel especially as it was 4th July weekend. The room was on the 24th floor and looked out over south Las Vegas (unfortunaly not a strip view). The best were fantastically comforable and the room was spacious. Bathroom was big with seperate shower and bath. There are several elevators for each tower which was great as the elevators at the Imperial Palace were a major problem. We never waited more than a minute at the Paris. Free parking is also a major bonus although it's quite a walk from the check-in desk and elevators to the rooms. The location of the hotel is also brilliant. You've got the Bellagio across and the Miricle Mile shops next door. It's a great location for exploring the strip. The only negative was that there was no free wi-fi. You could pay for it but it was extremely expensive. I'd highly recommend the Paris to anyone visiting Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lilulu45
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews I was a bit nervous about what we had gotten ourselves into but we were very pleasantly surprised that we did not have any issues. Check in was a breeze, less than 10 minutes. She did ask if we wanted to upgrade to a Red Room for an extra $40. a night and when we were told that the view would be no different we chose not to. We had a beautiful view of the mountains and part of the city. The room was clean and did have a mini bar that we used to keep things cold. The room was cleaned by noon each day and every one that we asked questions of were friendly and helpful. We were on the 20th floor and it was not at all loud during the nightime hours. I am glad we spend the week at the Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Not too flashy, not too trashy--thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: skipsterNewYork
Reviews.Content: First trip to Vegas for me. While I've been fortunate to travel the world a bit (see other reviews), this was my first time staying in Sin City. I liked the Paris. I quickly saw that it is a middle-of-the-road (literally center of the strip and middle of the road style wise) place. As a result, I felt comfortable. Other guests seemed to be of the moderate sort and I thought that most of the casino staff was the friendliest of the hotels we stopped in (about 6 or 7). Check in process was quick and painless. We had a red room on 29 overlooking the strip. It was spotless and comfortable and I felt housekeeping was top notch. Prompt (when I came back to the room one day around 1 pm--room was done) and responsive to notes left for requests. We ate at the buffet for breakfast twice (good) and Sugar for late-night sandwiches once (very good). Never made it to the pool. Other than that, it's hard to remark on the service because I found so much of Vegas to be self-service (at my level anyway). I think I'd choose this hotel again when I return, and definitely will choose one in the Caesar's group of hotels because they are not charging resort fees and are actively fighting against it.

Reviews.Title: “too good!”
Reviews.Author: vacationingallover
Reviews.Content: We arrived late for our vacation and was please to have received a free upgrade to a suite! Was clean, staff was courteous, and room well furnished. The tv was on hydrolics out of the foot of the bed, very nice. Free valle and prompt parking. Had a room over looking the Bellagio which was nice! The tower was pretty at night too. I didn't gamble much so though the casino was pretty I didn't matter much to me. The food was always excellent! Love this place. First time in vegas, had a great time here! I actually stayed in march 2010, but that date was not available for selection in the review options.

Reviews.Title: “Love vegas”
Reviews.Author: designtravelgal
Reviews.Content: We always get upgraded to a nice suie but it is the older room not the remodeled modern rooms. Hope to get one of these soon. I have stayed at bellagio and venetian and for some reason like the gambling area at the Paris. I highly recommend the massage at the blackjack tables. Playing war at the Wyn is fun and they have a great Asian restaurant. The food and drinks are wonderful at the french restaurant as well as breakfast and brunch. Shopping is a bit weak need to go to venetian for better shops.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay ......until the last day!”
Reviews.Author: culturaldiva
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Paris in early June 2011. Had a Red Room on the 26th floor. Room was nice - all the mod cons, flat screen, etc and the room was clean. No problems with noise - would have like a view. Chekc in was quick as was the bellboy service. Crepe place was very nice as was the bakery. Did not really eat here until the last morning when I thought I should try the buffet. Food looked good but the whole area is very dark and not very appealing. Great busboy services - so good that they threw my new magazine in the trash whilst I was getting some breakfast!! Asked to speak to the manager and he had a lame apology, but then asked if I had been sitting by myself - as if that really mattered!! No comp on my $5 magazine - guess I did not complain enough. So mad I took some Danishes in my handbag back to my room!! When I checked out I asked to speak to someone to make a complaint - got the attitude instead and so I am writing this review. Hotel is very centrally located and I had changed my booking from MGM to Paris because of this. Used the Monorail two days - excellent way to travel and the station was at the back of the hotel. Felt safe returning to the hotel late at night and it did have a more mature vibe for the over 35s. Except for my attempt at breakfast and the subsequent poor service - would probably recomend this hotel. ** Also had the buffet breakfast at Ceasars - much better atmosphere overlooking the pool area and better service.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location is great!”
Reviews.Author: marspice
Reviews.Content: My 9th trip to Vegas, first stay at Paris. We stayed 4 nights (Sat July 30 - Wed Aug 3), 2011. Check in went fast and smoothly at 1pm. Was offered an upgrade at $55 at nt (seems others on here were offered it at $40?). Declined. Had a great room on the 17th floor facing towards the strip (but not strip view) could see other wing and part of Bill's. Paid first nt $145 and 3 nts at $70 each. Room was standard size with large bathroom - separate shower, which is always nice. Fast elevators to room, never waited more than 30 seconds. Mini bar items were gone, so we could use the fridge! Old style tv. No free wifi anywhere in the hotel. Closest would be about 3min walk away at Miracle Mile, Sephora and Starbucks. Also Coffee Bean inside the mall has it too. The room next to us had room service tray outside their room for 24hours. Staff was VERY friendly and never felt I was putting anyone out by asking questions. We did the $44.99 Buffet of Buffets, 24hour pass for unlimited buffet eating. Great in theory, however, there are ALWAYS line ups so unless you're eating at 7am or 9pm expect to wait 30 minutes. The crepes at the Paris buffet were the best I've ever had. Make sure you take the free shuttle from Bally's to the Rio's Carnival Buffet. BEST BUFFET EVER. The pool is a generous size with a lot of chairs ... though seem to see quite a few broken. This time of year, the sun hit the pool at 10:15am and seemed to stay over the pool quite late in the afternoon. Nice music. There are 2 hot tubs by the cabanas, in 40 degree heat, I was shocked to see people in it. There was about 5 lifeguards on duty too. Pool was always a nice cool temp, which was refreshing. Sign up to "like" Paris hotel, Chateau Nightclub, and/or Eiffel Tower Restaurant. Lots of giveaways. We got put on the (free) guestlist for Chateau for Pam Anderson's bday party. Great club - outside has great view of the strip, fountain. Eiffel Tower Restaurant was amazing. Ask for a view of the fountain. Service was great, food was awesome. If you are celebrating something they will give you a small dessert at the end. Tickets 4 Tonight or was it 1/2 Price tickets has their closet location outside Bill's, but the line is quite long if you go in the morning, if you keep walking about a minute to O'Shea's there will be a much shorter, if any, line up. Duece and Express bus stop right outside hotel. Duece goes down the strip stopping often. Express stops less and will take you toFreemont St and beyond to to the Las Vegas North Outlet Mall. $7 for 24hrs or $3 per trip. This is the better of the outlet malls. Casino is nice and intimate, not overwelming like some of the others. If you get a chance go see Anthony Cools ... I've seen him 4 previous times and HE IS FREAKIN HILARIOUS!.

Reviews.Title: “I was Holloween and it was a riot”
Reviews.Author: poolman4u
Reviews.Content: The sites on the streets were very interesting, hilarious and very amusing. The costumes that people wore for the full 4 days that we were there were remarkable. The hotel was very nice and a little secret that some do not know is that you can get an upgrade for i think 20 per night and get a buffet breakfast which gives you a breakfast beyond words. You should not get hungry again til evening,and then there is another buffet i think between 5 an 8 in the evening. Two alcholic drinks each are included. This happens on the 23rd floor in a very private suite. You can make phone calls from there and also read a local paper. We went to see O, which never seeing anything like that in my life, I was truly amazed. The Paris also does charge a resort fee like so many do there now.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: wordsworthmama
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and I loved the separate bath and shower in the bathroom. The elevators are extremely fast and the hotel easy to navigate. The pool was okay-nothing special though.

Reviews.Title: “PARIS...WITH LOVE !”
Reviews.Author: picthis1
Reviews.Content: This property is very well located and can be a little pricey. But the rooms are excellent and all the little things you like to see are in your room. Mine had a fully stocked mini-bar and was overall a wonderful place to stay. The casino is great and nice eateries here too. The shopping are is painted to resemble a small french town and as you walk around, it is easy to daydream you've landed in France.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: isabellaChicago
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice. The room was clean and beds very comfortable. Maid service excellent. We always stay at Harrah's properties, We have stayed at Ballys, and the Flamingo. Although The Paris is a very beautiful hotel, i much prefer Bally's. Our next visit we will be staying at Ballys. Not that there was anything wrong with the Paris.....there wasn't.....we just prefer the more traditional type of hotel while staying in Las Vegas. Also we like the lounge at Bally's. The pluses that Ballys did not have that Paris did have was that you did not have to walk for miles to get through the casino and also we did get see some different scenery as we usually walk towards The Flamingo and on this trip we went the other way towards Planet Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: boubou05
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was not clean, the carpet and the windows, sink was clogged. We were there with our baby and had to cover the floor with a sheet. The crib provided was metal and my baby hurt her head it was very old. Bring your own crib if you have a baby. Room service trays were not picked for at least 12 hours left outside. The guest services on the tv did not work. The television was very old. The rooms need cleaning, vaccuming. Chairs at the pool old and rusty.

Reviews.Title: “So-So”
Reviews.Author: JonEP41
Reviews.Content: The room was fine, nothing special. The beds were of low quality and I have had slept on much nicer beds at other hotels in Vegas (MGM Signature and Mayday Bay). The staff does an adequate job of keeping it clean. The pool is not fancy by Vegas standards, but it gets the job done. The pool side wait staff is a bit slow. The casino is average size and nice atmosphere. I can’t say the hotel was family friendly. They charge an arm and a leg for internet service. The spa ha a nice staff, but very expensive and the showers in the men's locker room had zero pressure. The gym was old and tire. I honestly would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLANT HOTEL - GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: lady1974
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to vegas, The Paris is an excellant locaton as it is central on the strip. When we booked the Paris we could upgrade to a red room for appro £250.00 for the week, but on arrival got upgraded to a red room at no extra cost. The Paris is a friendly hotel and there is many restaurnats and bars to choose from and the coule we tried were excellant. At the Paris you can go to the top of the iffel tower for approx £15 for two adults, which is well worth a visit, GIVING YOU A BIRDS EYE VIEW OF THE STRIP. THE BEDROOM AND BATHROOM WERE LARGE AND DECORATED TO A HIGH STANDARD, AND CLEANED DAILY WITH FRESH TOWELS IF REQUIRED. THERE IS A POOL AT THE PARIS AND LOTS OF SUN LOUNGERS, NO UMBERELLAS BUT LOTS OF TREES IF YOU WISH TO SIT IN THE SHADE, I NEVER FOUND THE POOL TO BE CROWDED, IT WAS VERY RELAXING TO SPEND SOME OF TIME ROUND THE pool.

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointed”
Reviews.Author: iss165
Reviews.Content: We had better amenities in a Holiday Inn in upstate NY!! No robes, no shower caps, no coffee pot in the room...And the pool area is a disgrace... paper plates, napkins, cups and beer bottles blowing all over the place...thought it might just have been one day, but we were there 3 days in a row, and it got worse, not better.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: onthegofamily1
Reviews.Content: I expected a beautiful room to match the outside of this hotel. Ours did not! Room was equivalent to a Super 8/ Motel 6. We did go with one of the "less expensive" room options available...but still paid $500+ (after military discount) for our 4 night stay. Our room was right next to the pool which means the daily music blasted right outside our window. This didn't bother us too much except that I occasionally needed an afternoon rest due to pregnancy. Our A/C wouldn't stay cool. Called maintenace and waited 45 min for them to arrive. When they did they changed the air filter...it had about 2 inches of dust/ dirt built up. Clearly the air ducts needed to be cleaned! They were gross looking...which may also explain why I woke up with allergy issues every morning during our stay. We ate at the LeVillage buffet each morning. Great selection and price wasn't too terrible. However, service here was just okay and on the LAST day of our stay, we got no service at all! Someone brought our drinks and NEVER came back! Not to pick up plates, not to refill drinks, nothing. Needless to say, we did not leave a tip that day. Overall cleanliness of the room was okay, not great. I wouldn't have sat in the bath tub. My biggest complaint were the TERRIBLE sheets on our bed. We may as well slept on towels. The sheets were so stiff and coarse feeling...I've slept on better sheets at motels! Staff was friendly and helpful. Casino and halls were smoky, but that was expected. We did win a few dollars at the slots (the only hotel we won at!) However, next visit, we will stay elsewhere for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great room because we got it free and now I see why!”
Reviews.Author: guill34
Reviews.Content: At first look the room looked good. But after taking a closer look it was nasty. I carry my household cleaner with me anytime I stay at a hotel and Lysol spray. So after some cleaning the room is ok. I want set on any fabric furniture because it has stains on it. The carpet also has stains. Thank god I carry house shoes. I wiped my finger over the phone display and the amount of dust that came off was disgusting. I've stayed at many of Harrahs properties in Las Vegas and this one is the worst. At check in they didn't have a king bed (requested that when booked) but we know the excuse, we try to have it available for you and the person at the front desk had an attitude. Requested an refrigerator and never came. Called down and the person had a attitude. We now have the fridge. I would stay at Harrah's Hotel before I stay here again. The great thing about this room is that it's free!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, good view (if it wasn't for the eiffel tower)”
Reviews.Author: Sedins
Reviews.Content: the hotel recently renovated most of its rooms and we were lucky enough to get upgraded to one of its Red rooms. it was really nice and clean, unlike the old rooms we saw. (didn't try the 20 sandwich but it worked out anyways cause we were there during down season) i was on level 21, with strip view. i found the eiffel tower kinda blocked the view. I wish the pool was open because it looked amazing. (its elevated from ground level so you could look down at the strip from there too) one small problem was probably the elevators. the only way to get to the rooms is through the elevators which is in teh back of hte casino. you have to walk through everything (hotel and casino) just to get to the elevators. if you have a lot of stuff this could be a problem. (the crepe place in the alleyway is really good)

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: VegasSusie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Paris Las Vegas for 3 nights from July 25-28. We were comped for a room with a king size bed. When I inquired upon check-in whether or not a free upgrade was available, "Antonio" informed me that there were no suites, but that he could give us a newly-renovated Red Room Luxury on the 30th floor with a view of the Eiffel Tower. I said that would be great. Well....it was more than great - it was fantastic! Our room, 3007, had a view of the Eiffel Tower with the Bellagio Fountains in behind, which we enjoyed for 3 whole days as often as we wanted! The room itself was very nice, typical hotel room size, not too big, but not too small, and featured a 42" plasma TV. Bathroom was nice, marble countertops and separate tub and shower. The bath toiletry items were fine and housekeeping over the 3 days was excellent. The bed I found just fine; my husband found it a tad firm for him. Bed linens were higher end. All in all, a very nice room. Well done, Antonio! The hallways were very quiet and elevators came promptly. For restaurants, we had dinner at Le Provencal, which featured a special of $29.99/person; soup or salad, entree and dessert. It was very nice indeed. I had the chicken and my husband had the baked salmon; both were very good. The Caesar salad to start was very crisp and delicious. We also had breakfast at The Sugar Factory and had eggs Benedict, which was tasty albeit on the small side. The Sugar Factory is a new restaurant right on the strip. We also ate at La Creperie; if you like crepes, this is the place! Absolutely delicious; crepes are big enough for 2 to share. You can get breakfast croissants w/scrambled egg, bacon or ham for $10 which includes juice or coffee. These are good as well. Next time, we are defiinitely going to dine at Mon Ami Gabi; the ratings are fantastic here on TA; we had planned to eat there but unfortunately had to cancel our reservation due to illness. The staff at Paris we found to be very welcoming and friendly. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in vegas”
Reviews.Author: Blerke
Reviews.Content: we stayed here as a family of 4 adults for one night and found it clean with an excellent bathroom and plenty of space for our family. It is very good value for money so Im not going to complain that there were no coffee/tea making facilities or free internet which we've come to expect. The Paris is in a good location though our room didnt have a view of the strip which might have been better Check in and out was efficient though when we first arrived and saw the queues we didnt realise it would be as efficient as it was. Recommend you choose valet parking as we made the mistake of self parking and had to lug our suitcases quite some way.

Reviews.Title: “Great view”
Reviews.Author: Braziliantraveler7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during a business trip to Las Vegas. Initially, after parking, it was a little complicated to find the reception desk and had to walk the mall streets for a while. I soon learned that using vallet parking is much easier. The receptionist was very friendly and the room was made available quickly. The room was very nice and large, with the BEST VIEW possible of the Bellagio Fountains. It was amazing to see them at night from my window. The location for the Paris hotel is very good and there are many options for eating downstairs. I have stayed in Las Vegas before and I would say this is one of the best hotels I have stayed. Not as tacky as some other theme hotels in the city.

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN, COMFY, QUIET”
Reviews.Author: TRavelBug232323
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family- wife and 2 kids. We got a room with 2 double beds, and it was more than ample. Bathroom was very clean with all these great toiletries. Separate shower and tub was a bonus. The staff were always very helpful. We also got an upgrade for a small amount . Parking is also free for all guests- ample and multi level, so all parking spaces are shaded. Lots of restaurants just downstairs,so no need to walk far for food. The hotel was practically in the middle of the strip, thus close to most attractions. Caesar's Hotel is just nearby , but we had to drive to Circus Circus for the kids. The Bellagio Hotel and Fountains was right across the street. TIP: Try to get a room facing the fountains. It was wonderful to see the play of water, light , and music just outside our window.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: tessah25
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. The room was lovely and much bigger than I was expecting. The only complaint I had about the room was water pressure in the shower which was terrible. The hotel itself is great with lots of shops and great restaurants and bars to choose from. The casino is quite small which we liked, didnt win though! We'd stay here again, it's got a great location right in the middle of everything on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Waste Your Money!”
Reviews.Author: Dancingeyes
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week long conference that was held at the Paris. I want to add that I have traveled a lot and written many reviews for TripAdvisor and this by far has to be the worst one I've had to write.There is only one word to describe the property..HORRIBLE!!! Our room had numerous things wrong, no hot water, handle on tub kept coming off, sheets had holes in them, pillows were like laying on bricks. And worst of all, the people that work there were the rudest I've ever met in a hotel establishment! They gave wrong information, lost tickets to a show, messed up orders at the restaurants, and the list can go on and on. My advice, if you're going to Las Vegas, DO NOT STAY AT THE PARIS! You will be sorry!!! Oh, my only positive on this whole week's experience, the bell hops and housecleaning staff were the nicest, most polite, caring people I met there!

Reviews.Title: “Great Anniversary Stay”
Reviews.Author: Boca_Tim
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights for our anniversary in the Red Room on the 29th floor (2982), great view of the stip, fountains, tower, etc. Room was clean and well appointed, bathroom was nice, but who really cares, it's Vegas!. Casino has a great mid-strip location with easy access to adjoining Bally's and across from Caeser's. When it was too hot, you can grab a taxi out front and be at the Mirage for a show, cost $7.50. No complaints at all, felt the price was very fair, and we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “if we didn't have a yapping dog next door it would be a four Star review”
Reviews.Author: summertravel999
Reviews.Content: We picked the Paris for its location and price. The location is very good right in the middle of the strip, most everything on the strip from Treasure Island/Venition to the Excaliber is in walking distance for those of moderate ability. We also got a pretty good deal on the room. Our only two complaints about the Paris were: One no flat screen/HD T.V. Which seems a common problem with Harrahs properties. The other was that this is a pet friendly hotel and we were placed right next to a yapping dog. I don't have a problem with pet friendly properties, but when I am not traveling with my pets I don't want to hear a dog every time some one opens or closes a door, flushes the toliet etc..Staff was not very accommodating when we asked to be moved, we finally decided it wasn't worth the trouble. (something about the package we had) I loved the theme of the hotel and everything seemed nice.

Reviews.Title: “3 days is long enough!”
Reviews.Author: nearlyfiftyNorthwood Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Any hotel along the strip is good, so maybe base your decision on your price bracket. On that basis, we opted for the Paris. Looked fab from the outside and quite ornate in some parts on the inside (reception area). The attention to detail inside the hotel is amazing, you feel like you are walking along a Parisean street with the shops and cafes etc. I particularly liked sitting by the pool looking up at the Eiffel Tower. There is also a restaurant at the top of the Tower (apparently expensive). Check in can be very slow if you are unlucky enough to arrive just when a coach load of others do. Its incredibly busy at the hotel anyway. Didnt see many staff around. Casinos allow smoking and drinking but no kids under 21 so we didnt stay long there. Plenty to see outside anyway! When we were there it was unbelievably hot and Vegas was heaving with people. And we were told its not so popular! Had a great day trip to the Grand Canyon.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: trvlcrazy9
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a convention at the Paris hotel. This was actually my 2nd time at this hotel but my 7th trip to Vegas. I love the atmosphere at the Paris. They did a great job creating a European setting with an indoor street of shops and restaurants. The restaurants are all good! Our room was the Le Mans Suite with a regular guest room (red room) attached. The rooms were in great condition and look recently remodeled. We had friends visit our room and they said their room was no where near as nice. So just be sure to ask for an upgraded room. The pool is just okay here. No frills and the chairs are very basic. The eiffel tower actually provides alot of afternoon shade if you like shade by the pool. We took the ride up the Eiffel Tower, but honestly I was disappointed. We waited 2 hours to go up and then 45 min to just get back down again. I don't know why they were only using 1 of the 3 elevators. I like that the smell of smoke wasn't bad in this lobby or casino. The room rates are very reasonable here for what you get. Overall, the atmosphere is great with alot of attention to detail for the french theme.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Wembley808
Reviews.Content: I was in Las Vegas in July of 2011 for a conference, and my family decided to tag along. Why not? I was going to vegas! We decided to stay at the Paris, since my conference was there, and were not disappointed. We got a bigger room to accomodate all 5 of us. We stayed in the imperial suite which was more than big enough for us. We had lots of room to move around, and 2 full bathrooms which was very helpful in getting ready to go out daily. We had a few minor problems with air conditioning not working properly and a slippery shower floor, but both were easily remedied. As soon as we alerted houskeeping to our problems, they sent up non slip mats for the shower and mechanics to fix the air conditioning. Things were up and running in no time. The paris isn't in the dead center of the strip but close enough. It was close to Planet hollywood, and a short walk to Caesars. That meant that it was close enough to the ABC store at planet hollywood for me to go and get a few gallons of water for us to use. We all kept our water bottles that we bought on the flight over, and refilled them using the gallon jugs. The only drawback for me was the smell of smoke in the lobby and casino area. However, i was in vegas, and this was expected. Otherwise, the hotel was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: siskiyous
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paris for two night in June on business and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. My room was clean and quiet and the bathroom was huge with lovely toiletries. There are a variety of restaurants downstairs that were reasonably priced for a solo traveler. I also got lucky on the slot machines! The only negatives are minor. There was no coffee maker in the room, so I had to go downstairs each morning before my workshop started to get coffee. And, the Business Center charged $6 just to print my Boarding Pass. Overall though, the customer service was very good and the location of the hotel is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “So much fun!”
Reviews.Author: m0nb0n
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had the pleasure of staying at the Paris hotel July 23-26 and I am so glad that we did!! What a BEAUTIFUL hotel/casino. We upgraded for an extra $72 per day to a suite and it was so nice! People say that you don't spend a lot of time i your room and honestly you don't spend tonnes of time there but it was nice to go to our room and relax (we had a living room) and our bathroom had a huge shower and jacuzzi (speperate) and toilet and boday (sp?) in adjoining room. The suite was over 700 sq ft and worth every penny! The casino did't pay out well but it's really pretty and the staff was all really pleassant. Would def stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great as usual!”
Reviews.Author: Chaser662
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip of 2011. Arrived on a Friday afternoon to find there was a mix up in room type. We had requested a double and the only thing available were king rooms. The check in agents were very helpful and we were able to upgrade for a very little. Actually ended up with a penthouse suite for the cost of a regular room! Obviously there were no issues with the room size or amenities. The conference facilities were very handy. We have no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect Honeymoon setting at Paris Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: BuxMontBeerLover
Reviews.Content: My fiance had never been to Las Vegas so we decided to go there on on honeymoon. I had been there before and stayed at the Luxor but we booked our stay at Paris Las Vegas since a co-worker of hers had recommended it. What a wonderful hotel and stay! We both were awed by the beauty of the pseudo-Paris street that greets you when you walk in. The front desk did have a bit of a line when we checked in but the employee that helped us was very pleasant and when I mentioned we were on our honeymoon she said" I'll get you a nice room". The room that we got was only on the 5th floor and did not overlook the strip but other than that it was great. Nice huge bathroom with a glass shower and a bathtub and plenty of sink room for all our stuff. I do believe it was an upgrade of some sort after looking into some other rooms as we walked down the hallways. The king size bed was very comforatble as were the chairs and love seat that were in the room. Not a huge thing but the TV was an old style, 24" tube TV. I would have thought at a hotel like this that it would have had a nice flat screen but then again we weren't in Vegas to watch TV. All in all, a great hotel. Very clean, nice amenities on the Paris Las Vegas properties and a really nice pool that is dwarfed by the Eiffel Tower that towers above the entire pool area. If you go, book a meal at The Eiffel Tower Restaurant. Again, when we mentioned it was our honeymoon, we were treated to a table directly overlooking the Bellagio fountains. Since it was around 9:30 at night the views of the fountains going off and the strip lit up at night made for a memorable evening. It was a night that wasn't cheap (including drinks around $250 for two) but was a highlight of our vacation. We left very well relaxed and would definitely stay at Paris Las Vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: frac
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Paris was very enjoyable. The reviews had me leery but I'm not sure really what people want, we had no problems whatsoever. It took awhile to learn the layout but that's just us. Bally's opens up from Paris so at first that was a little confusing until you know where one hotel starts and the other stops. Check-in was easy and check-out you could do it on the TV or drop keys in a box at the bottom of the elevators. The room was pretty big and the bathroom was nice, loved the huge counter space. (we were in the cheapest room too) Comfy bed. Didn't have any interaction with the staff except for check-i but they were nice enough. The pool is beautiful and you can get sun all day. Most of the chairs stay out of the shade. Drinks are WAY pricey at the pool. The first day we ordered 1 beer and 1 pina colada-$21 w/out tip, after those we did not have any more our entire stay. but, the Chicken nachos at the pool cafe were awesome! Did not eat at the buffet, can't comment. There is a good late-night eats place across from the buffet, forgot the name-pizza by the slice, we did this after coming in almost every night from drinking-perfect! Ate at Sugar Factory late one night too-delicious and price not bad! Enjoyed seeing what the "happy hour" was each nite at the "Le Burger Brassiere", cant beat the deals they had compared to typical Vegas food/drink prices. and GREAT burgers. Wings just so-so. All in all we would absolutely stay here again, we just like visiting a different place each time we come to Vegas. PLUS is that they do not charge resort fee like many others now. Join on the email club/list and get even better prices. I got 5 nites for $435 tax and all staying 6/19-6/25

Reviews.Title: “Great! It was just right!”
Reviews.Author: TeacherGirl80
Reviews.Content: We just came back from staying at the Paris hotel at Las Vegas. It is a beautiful hotel from the outside, especially at night. Cute interior too, very Parisian! It's a smaller hotel/casino area, so it's easy to get around in. We stayed at the Red Room and it was fine. It's just remodeled, nothing too fancy, but I think it's better than the regular/standard rooms at Paris. The red part was cute and made it fun. The location of the Paris hotel is really handy because it's right in the middle of the stip and across from the Bellagio fountains, my personal favorite. You're not far from the nicer hotels when you stay at Paris; Ceasar's, Aria, Cosmopolitan, etc. You can use any of the Ceasar company pools while you stay at Paris. We tried the Paris pool, but it was small and basic, with nothing "Vegas" about it, (also too many kids there!), we went to the Ceasar's pool and it was FAR better. Less kids, great people watching, and just a more posh pool with fountains and all the Vegas bells and whistles you could want in a pool. We liked Paris, but if we go back again next summer, we will try the Aria or Cosmopolitan, just to try a new hotel and see what that's like. We enjoyed Paris, it was clean, comfy, and easy to navigate. No problems, no complaints, everyone was prompt and nice, room was cleaned each day, the hallways were quiet (hubby is a light sleeper!), and we enjoyed our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location on strip”
Reviews.Author: vaughanmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a regular room with no view, on the 11th floor in July. A great way to get good deals on Vegas hotels: sign up for the total rewards card (this can be done by visiting any of the Harrahs hotel websites) and then call the total rewards number after a week or two to see what deals are available. Another way is to sign up to be a guest book member for the various hotels you are interested in staying at a few months to a few weeks in advance and you will receive regular emails with room discounts. Since we don't gamble much, getting compted room, etc... isn't an option for us. As for the hotel, check in was quick and easy and our room was spacious and clean. The rooms and hallways were very quiet, didn't have any loud or drunk disturbances at all. It was nice to not have to pay any resort fees. The washroom was nice and big with a tub and seperate shower which was great. The bed was comfortable to sleep in. We went to the spa for a 60 minute massage which was so wonderful. If you do go to the spa, take time to enjoy the steam room, sauna, whirlpool and the calm and relaxing atmosphere. Men and women are seperated however so if you want to spend time in the spa with hubby or boyfriend, you can't. I think one of the highlights of my trip was the spa and you get a 20$ coupon from the hotel which makes it even better. TV didn't have many channels but not a big deal. Not impressed with housekeeping however. Chips and crumbs that were left near the fridge were not vacuumed for 2 days, I even left the cord for the iron across the room to see if housekeeping would move it or pick it up when they vacuumed and they didn't even bother too! On the third day I spoke to the housekeeping manager, and within an hour someone came up to vacuum the floor properly. The best part of the hotel is the location, it is central and you can go to one side of the strip on one day, and then the other side of the strip another day. Hotel casino was OK but we didn't really gamble much. The walkway to Harrahs is nice with retail and food shops. Being beside planet hollywood was nice because the hotel's mall has some great shops. Outside of the planet hollywood hotel there is a machine (remember the gameshow press your luck) where you can win prizes and money to spend in their casino. We saw two cirque du soleil shows - Zumanity was funny (because of the cast putting members of the audience in awkward and embarrasing situations) and it had some great acrobatics but it is an adult show with nudity. The other was Ka - a wonderful storyline with beautiful costumes, acrobatics and music. We absolutely loved it and I even bought the CD! Went to Tao nightclub (we called ahead to put ourselves on the guest list) so entrance was free! Great music but so packed you could hardly move! We only went to one buffet at Treasure island which was Ok, but didn't seem to have that much food choices compared to other buffets. Finally, be prepared to do a lot of walking since the hotels are quite far from each other.

Reviews.Title: “very pleased with Paris”
Reviews.Author: Death Valley Dave
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to Vegas quite a few times, but we'd never stayed at Paris before. We most recently stayed at Encore (lovely!), but we needed to pay less this trip. I guess the lack of "resort fees" attracted us, as well as having "Reward" points towards the hotel. We checked in late on Sunday, (no lines!), and were told that they didn't have a smoking room for us......ugh......but, they would upgrade us to a "Red" room at no cost. That worked for me, I don't smoke! My wife was a good sport about it. We enjoyed the room, the view, the other guests (Paris seems to attract nicer guests than some other casinos), the employees, the location on the Strip, the pool, the casino (MUCH better than when it first opened), and the FOOD! Crepes each morning, and a nice dinner watching the fountains across the strip at night. We look forward to staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Viva Paris Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: vegablue16
Reviews.Content: I was in Las Vegas for - surprise, surprise - a bachelorette party. We managed to find a really good deal for Paris Las Vegas - $95/night per room, which we managed to get down to $85/night. Of course, that rate gets you a standard room with a view of the backside of the hotel, part of Planet Hollywood and a parking garage. Still, the room was quiet, clean, and very spacious for two people. The beds were comfortable and clean, the washrooms immaculate, and the hotel amenities are great. Mon Ami Gabi is a FANTASTIC restaurant, and not as expensive as I thought. HIGHLY recommend breakfast there - the blueberry french toast is unreal. The best part about Paris Las Vegas is its location - centre Strip, right across from Bellagio and Caesar's Palace, it's easy to walk over to see the fountains or wander the shops. Other hotels are a quick (and relatively inexpensive) cab ride away. I would definitely stay here again, though I might request a room that faces the Strip - the fountains at Bellagio are amazing :)

Reviews.Title: “Stayed there again!”
Reviews.Author: Zoeluma
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris Casino in Las Vegas again and this time they gave us an upgrade to the red room at the 25th floor, just perfect. The hotel has one of the best locations in Vegas, close to the new Aria with the most beautiful designer stores. Will stay there again in october and april 2012!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go again”
Reviews.Author: nobarcelo
Reviews.Content: This is the most beautiful hotel. The decorating is first class and the staff friendly and helpful. Our room was lovely with marble bathroom and a huge king bed in the bedroom. And unbelievably quiet at night. The food in the hotel buffet is excellent featuring selections from different areas of France. For $100.00 we purchased a food buffet pass that was good for 24 hours and included other hotel buffets on the strip. I cannot praise the food enough. I am wheat intolerant and normally have difficulty when eating out but this buffet was amazing and had dozens of things I can eat. The hotel washroom off the casino was exquisite and to die for it was so beautiful. The gift shops were great and had really nice things with an eiffel tower motif and numerous other neat gifts. It cost my husband and I $200.00 for both of us to eat in the buffet from July 16 to July 20. I look forward to visiting this hotel again. Everything was functional in our room and maid service was excellent with toiletries and towells replaced daily.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: barking1RedondoBeach
Reviews.Content: Good overall hotel, the Lobby is looking tired and moves along quite slow compared to other LV hotels. The pool area is pretty bland too..

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Paris Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Tigersam97
Reviews.Content: 20th Anniversary stay for 4 nights. Had a fabulous visit with no complaints. Well, maybe one... When you sign up for the Total Rewards card and they ask you which gift you prefer and if you choose the $20 dining credit - ask WHICH PLACES IT DOES INCLUDE. It might be easier to use rather than making reservations and then being told that the restaurant is not owned by the casino and therefore doesn't honor the dining credit. **Courteous! **CLEAN! **Friendly! **Close to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Paris”
Reviews.Author: nancy553
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 day stay at Paris...and it was VERY nice. Yes, it is showing it's age, but still, it is a beautiful hotel. I ate at Mon Ami Gabi twice, and both times, the food was wonderful. Not overpriced. I ate breakfast at the cafe, and had a very rude waiter. He acted like he hated being there, and any question I asked seemed to be a pain. Regardless, I would recommend Paris. The dealers, the cocktail waitress, pit bosses were all very nice and friendly, with a smile on their faces...made you feel welcome. The room was clean and the maid service excellent. Everyone staying should always remember to leave them a tip, as I think they work so hard.

Reviews.Title: “going back again”
Reviews.Author: schoey1
Reviews.Content: Had Alot of choices on the strip since most were giving out some real deals Paris staff was politite and very helpful.rooms were spacious and very clean. Pool was big with plenty of lounge chairs. Location on the strip is a huge plus.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: Jaycurl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for about 4 nights with our family of 4 (2 adults, 2 children) The hotel was absoloutley amazing!!! We stayed in a room with 2 queen beds which was quite spacious and with an amazing bathroom that was as big enough to be a room of it's own. On the ground fall was this wonderful little 'French' styled village which had a lot of lovely restaurents, cafes and stores. As you continued it con-joined with another casino from another hotel. The eiffel that is places at the top of the hotel features an elevator which you can actually ride up and look at the outlook or eat at the restaurant. Might i say that the restaurant is slightly pricey up there. Our room had a window which looked onto the strip. As soon as you walked out of the hotel you were on the strip which was absoloutley mind blowing!!! The hotel was also very close to the outlet malls. Overall it was a much loved stay and probably the best hotel we stayed at!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun time”
Reviews.Author: Johnellec
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the Paris Hotel. Everything was very clean and well run. The elevators are great! I think we had to wait only once. I don't know how they do it. The rooms are nice and large. Its an easy hotel to get around. Some hotels in Vegas you feel like you have to walk miles to get to anything. Our room had great views of the strip (3147). Its close to lots of stuff so we didn't have to drive. Thank goodness since driving around Vegas is a nightmare. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Chooch
Reviews.Content: We rented the standard Luxury room without the strip view. Rooms are fairly priced, nice and quiet. But the rooms could use a little updating. The common areas are beautiful. Paris is the ideal strip location.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate and Affordable!”
Reviews.Author: ginkaas
Reviews.Content: The desk clerk welcomed me(At 11:30) with a warm smile and proceed to give me clear directions on how to find my room. I really liked the room. I had a large flat screen television and the bathroom had a separate shower and bath tub and plenty of room. Likewise, housekeeping was very prompt. The room was cleaned and towels were replaced by 1 p.m. every day I was there. Though I did not have a strip view I did have a nice view of the Cosmopolitan Hotel on the 30th floor. The Paris and Ballys hotels are connected and the monorail can be found in Ballys. However, this is a fairly long walk but at least it is inside and not in 107 degree heat! I really liked the hotel- not toobig nor too small. I have stayed in about 15 different hotels while visiting Vegas and the Paris is in the top three. The best tip I could give a person staying at the Paris Hotel is to eat dinner at least once in the hotel's buffet. While it is not cheap the food is well prepared and very, very good. The only negative I found was that the slots were extremely tight here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: tig3rs12
Reviews.Content: Perfect location on the strip, pool was great with good service, the cover band in the Casino was awesome

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bmlives1816
Reviews.Content: We were on our honeymoon in Vegas on July 9th to 13th and stayed in Paris. It was our first time staying there. Reading the TA forums and reviews I knew somethings about the hotel, but honestly we both thought it was a great hotel, the room (1063) was great (but with no view), it was always clean. The hotel is beatiful, the casino is great too! And of course, the location of the hotel is very very good, in front of Bellagio, in the middle of the strip.. We didn't try the buffet (too much people), my wife tried the crepes and she said there were great. Overall, we are pretty satisfied with Paris, and we'll probably come back..

Reviews.Title: “First class resort”
Reviews.Author: BarryJ_100
Reviews.Content: Located on the Las Vegas strip, we were a little apprehensive about the standard. We shouldn't have worried, the rooms were impeccable and the facilities first class. Having no resort fee was an extra bonus. Connecting to 3 other hotels by malls was also a plus and the hotel was very well located on the strip

Reviews.Title: “Paris was a mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: janedoeny
Reviews.Content: To start off - I have chosen Paris as my Vegas home due to Caesar Entertainment from which I have comps and offers. Of the CET hotels in Vegas - it is small and works well for my mobility impaired family. This visit however fell short and is making me rethink my decision. 1. With a VIP card, it goes without saying that checkin and rooms are smoother than the average bear would have. I can say the baggage people are extremely aggressive and tip seeking in an over the top turn you off way. My rooms were a petite suite and a red room. The petite suite was large with 2 beds, 2 baths and a living room. It was quite nice - the furnishings are heavy for my taste but they work, curtains work on an electronic system by bed so don;t fall out the window trying to muscle them open or closed LOL. One bath is a large tub - very high and hard to step into and the other is a shower. There is a small sink and fridge area and a large flat screen, sofa and 2 chairs, desk and chair and a small table for 2 to eat. View was ok not spectacular. The red room is considerably smaller with 2 beds, 2 chairs, a small table, desk and chair and a large wardrobe with 2 closets, the flat screen tv between and a few drawers. Bathroom is a shower and an extremely low lying tub. Single sink. The do not disturb was regularly stolen. Housekeeping was a real issue - if you left the room they pounced on you to ask if you wanted service - even if you were practically in your pjs going down for a coffee run. If you room was free for cleaning early like 9-10 am it was done fairly quickly if you were not out it could not be done till late afternoon and sometimes a call was needed. Housekeeper in the suite literally threw the toiletries on the tray on a daily basis. The casino is small - sometimes hard to get a table - limits higher than Ballys next door. Slots tight. Coffee shop is hit and miss. Premium card makes seating easier re: lines but service inside is consistently slow!! Food was pretty good - hash so salty it was inedible - waiter offered to take it off bill - then didn't. So an annoyance. French toast and omelet good. Pastry shop - not bad but no premium line so long wait. Staff not friendly at all. Buffet - I cannot fathom why there are long lines!!! - The food is just not that good. To give credit - it did improve over last year On weekends only you can get your omelet made and brought to you which is a nice touch - on non-weekends the omelet line was ridiculous. Tried for dinner and breakfast and its just not that good - made loops of the buffet and couldnt find anything I wanted to eat and I am not that picky. Go next store to PH - way better! Eiffel tower - nice view ask for window - we did not get one - came at sunset - mistake as they close the blinds as the sun is blinding - better to go after dark. Nice view of bellagio fountains going off. Food was good - ala carte, pricey and snooty service. They do NOT take comps - unless you go to TR first for a paper comp or charge to room. Would have been nice to see a sign re this. Also did NOT take rezzie without credit card. Valet parking - again premium card helped but the day it thunderstormed and they pulled my car out just beyond the awning so I could get soaked - they lost me! One morning was awakened by hammering above and 2 or 3 times all doors to elevator bay closed due to problems - once they said someone set off sprinklers by hanging their clothes on the sprinkler. I have a host and could not get service issues resolved to my satisfaction so I am concerned those without could do much worse. Rented car from Hertz in hotel - check rates sometimes cheaper to start rental at airport but this time it worked and was very convenient you pick up and drop off car at garage level one So it was a mixed bag and I used my displeasure to try out other venues and next time I may not show loyalty to CET because the showed a lack of loyalty to me by providing bad service.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cassie1209
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really center on the strip and the access is easy! The rooms are very clean ans spaciaous! Good place to go back!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: retired060
Reviews.Content: Loved the Paris. Convenient to many other casino's for walking. Ate dinner at the Eiffel Tower Rest., that was excellent. Rented a cabana by the pool for the day. A bit pricey $300.00 for a Thursday, but had a great time. Was concerned since I have been reading so much about bed bugs in Vegas, but our room was neat and clean no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Back Again”
Reviews.Author: IndianaBdaddy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paris before so decided to try again..The rooms were very clean a little tired and in need of updating, but as mentioned very clean..Eiffel Tower restaurant was very good and had a excellent view of the fountains..Pool area clean with plenty of towels and lounge chairs and great drink service..Have stayed at all Harrahs owned casinos in Las Vegas and the Paris has the best drink service..

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Spike190
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked four nights at the Paris as part of a travel package through Allegiant Air. We were staying at the Paris as this is where the couple we were traveling with wanted to stay. I read reviews of the hotel about a week prior to the trip and saw that they were mixed. The check-in process was slow, as some other reviewers had mentioned. There were two counter positions open for the regular travelers and I was the fourth person in line. It took about fifteen minutes to get to the counter. The staff person I spoke with was very nice and did not offer a room upgrade which suprised me. When I got to the room I saw why an upgrade had not been offered. We were given room 3198P and the room was absolutely incredible. The room was a one bedroom suite. The room contained a living room with sofas and a desk, and a dining room with a table and chairs. There was a half-bath off of the entry foyer and the master bath was huge. The room was a corner room and we had the best view of the Bellagio fountains you could imagine. The view toward the south end of the strip was also excellent. The room was in excellent condition with little signs of wear. Sure, the televisions were older models, but we weren't in the room to watch too much television. Everyone we met that was associated with the hotel was friendly and accomodating. Valet's delivered our vehicle within five minutes each time. The buffet offered a tremendous selection and forthe most part was tasty. The only complaint that I had is that I was charged an internet fee on one day even though I never used the internet. I found the bill on the express checkout details on the television and due to the long lines to checkout did not feel it was worth my time to dispute the $14.99 bill. I have stayed at the Wynn and Venitian in the past and this room at Paris was definitely the nicest I have stayed in. I would absolutely stay here again if I could get the same room or type of room for the money that was spent.

Reviews.Title: “pretty hotel”
Reviews.Author: PerthElvis
Reviews.Content: arrived at the hotel to find our red room we booked and payed for was sold out we were offered a premiere red room which we were told had no view at no addition cost. We didnt have any choice other than to take it. However in all fairness the room was decent, clean on the 30th floor so no noise. We did have a view not the one we asked for but it was still nice of the cosmopolitan, the paris balloon, and down to the mgm. I still dont understand the logic of the check in guy but as far as we were concerned the room was nice so was the view. Houskeeping was done every morning most of the staff were friendly conceirge was great overall we would stay again only complaint too much smoke I know its a casino but the other ones we went in didnt have half as much. Other than that it was a good stay in a pretty hotel that is exactly believable that your walking down the streets of paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ThaoTrinh
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a couple of times, some of the rooms needs to be updated. But overall the hotel was clean and close to everything on the strip. The rooms are a little smaller then your average size hotel rooms compared to the newer hotels, but that is to be expected. The pool is okay, just one big round pool, so you have your average kids and couple of drunks sharing the same pool area.

Reviews.Title: “cant ask for more”
Reviews.Author: pocketaces1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been married for 20 yrs so we decided to go to Vegas. Now we have been several times and always have a great time but this one was special. We arrived at 8pm Vegas time there was no line to check in so we were in our room in a matter of just a few minutes, now our room is comped and let me tell you its was FANTASTIC,.Had a view of the pool, the fountains of bellagio and the tower. The beds were comfortable the water is hot and who cares about internet access if your on vacation you should take a break from work , I mean thats why they call it a vacation trust me the work will be there when you get back The casino was not smokey and the dealers were very helpful to people that didnt know how to play the games,esp on the craps table.My wife plays slots while i mostly play tables she said the slots were good to her and the craps tables were good most of the time, The food was very good in every place we ate at the hotel,Overall it was one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in and we are already talking about going to stay there our next trip to Vegas. One last thing would like to thank Elena the NCM host for everything she did to make our stay the best ever and to one waitress who works in the buffet her name is Adriana ,if you go to there for breakfast ask for here she is one of the best there.

Reviews.Title: “Just an ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: anthony725
Reviews.Content: This casino is small and the lighting is just ok. If you really want to see Paris and you do not feel like going to France, then just go to Vegas it has some french flare to it. The rooms are old looking and the bed is horrible to sleep on. If you want to sleep on concrete then you will love this bed.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: mikeyb56LongIslandNY
Reviews.Content: Let me start out by saying that room was comped. We got to Hotel around 1:00 PM. We were immediately told that our room was not available, but if we wanted to upgrade, that was available. After conferring with my wife, we agreed for the upgrade. After we agreed for the upgrade, the clerk informed that it was not available. We decided to not upgrade at that point. We were told our room might be available by 2:30, however I went back at 2:00 and got a room. Very plain room, but very clean. Bed was OK. Bathroom was clean. l.
