The pool is beautiful overlooking Eiffel Tower. Ate at Eiffel Tower restaurant. A bit pricey, but elegant and food was excellent. Great location in middle of Strip, however, that makes for a crowded casino.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel! We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: deezigner
Reviews.Content: Great location, Beautiful Hotel & Room, Friendly Staff!!! We loved it and would love to return! Very accomodating and lots to do! Gorgeous pool and open (even in February)! Eiffel Tower Restaurant is outstanding with a spectacular view and fun atmosphere! Only there for drinks but would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: jenny280
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable,lovely design and architecture. The buffets within the restaurants are not that great. Bellazio buffet is a lot better

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Time in Paris”
Reviews.Author: sargent123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Paris Hotel for the first time. It was elegant,friendly,and priced fare.The slot machines were very good to us,my wife won a lot of money on the lady Bug Machine. Our room was great,room services was great,and the atmosphere in the hotel was totally awesome. We Love Las Vegas very much? We enjoy walking up and down the strip and enjoying all the sites. Some of our friends just don't understand how were became additcted to returning to Las Vegas, Oh well that's there problem. We always had a blast and continually invented ways to have fun and get our moneys worth $$$$ Next time we go out we want to find that Pawn Stars Pawn Shop which is on television. That would be cool to see if the actual guys you see on T/V are behing the counters. Enjoy !!! Have Fun !!! Chase the old Lady Around!!! Live it up because the World is getting to Crazy and Weird!!! Love The One Your With!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Big and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: jjohnboy32
Reviews.Content: Hi Another review of another hotel....... Stayed here for 1 week on my 1st trip to Vegas from the UK. My partner had stayed at the venitian before so wanted him to experience another hotel. After a long 10 hour flight and a 20 min trip by taxi we were welcomed by attentive staff at check in. No problems and went to our room (red room on 27th floor as requested). Room was large with a comfortable super king sized bed, a fridge and large ish bathroom (no mirrors in bedroom though?). Having had a long flight we were shattered but wanted to ride out the jet lag. Arriving at 3pm, at 11pm we flagged and wanted to sleep!! BUT, after 30 mins we were woken by the 'people' in the room adjoining our room having a party! Not good when you have jet lag and been traveling for over 14 hours!! We called security, 10 mins later it started again! Called again, nothing, 3rd call. Nope. Then 4th time I spoke to the duty manager and told him our plight. Within minutes we were offered a bell boy and a change of rooms on the same floor. So at 12 midnight we moved to another room. The 2nd room was a premium room with a strip view (1st room was at the back), and we fell into a quiet slumber.... Excellent service on this part. The rest of the week went undisturbed (apart from 1 night were a drunk man came back into the room next to us at 6am and argued with his wife!!). The bed was huge and very very comfortable. Soft and luxurious to say the least. Large flat screen TV and clean. Maid service everyday, however if you want the bed sheets changing you have to ring housekeeping? We asked for more coat hangers as only 10 in room and these were delivered with no fuss. Le Buffet was divine, although once was enough as the same menu daily. We has breakfast included in our deal up to $9 peer person, but had to be bought in Bally'S next door? The Casino in the hotel was not that big and all seemed to be high stakes...... other casinos were cheaper. Staff were attentive enough but the prices in the hotel do let it down somewhat! Lovely central location but busy, very busy. The foyer is always packed of people, whether they are staying there or just looking it's always packed!! We saw Barry Manilow in concert whilst there and it was fantastic. All in all we had a wonderful stay in the Paris. But, next time we would stay in a newer hotel as this is now looking a little old and dated.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Decent Price”
Reviews.Author: JD1033
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris from June 23-26 and had a great trip! The room was clean and spacious, however the beds were not very comfortable and the pillows were terrible. We arrived on our first day at 9:00am, and while check in was not until 4pm, two separate hotel staff (a porter and front desk attendant) said that if we came back at 11:00 we could get early check-in. We decided to hang out at the pool for a couple of hours to wait. When we tried to check-in at 11:00, we were told it wouldn't be possible until 4. In the end it wasn't a huge problem, just don't expect that everyone knows what they are talking about. As with a lot of hotels, some of the staff were friendly and accomodating and others were not at all. You will be offered upgrades all over the place when you check in, so its best to ask what the cost will be before they go into their speech about how much "superior" your room will be. We had a fabulous brunch at Mon Ami Gabi, the service was excellent, and we had a great view of the Bellagio fountains. Definitely recommended! You get what you pay for at Paris. The location is great and very central without having to pay what you would at one of the bigger hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant”
Reviews.Author: deezee57
Reviews.Content: this is an absolutely great hotel. The room and halls are immaculate. The housekeepers are friendly. after a 40 dollar upgrade the view was spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic French service”
Reviews.Author: hammyaz
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights. Basic rooms ok. Very crowded. All employees EXPECT tips, and get really rude if you don't. Bell hops who open taxi doors will mouth profanities if you don't tip them...my mistake. Food is average, pricey and the lines are long for everything. Eat at the Ellis Island Cafe on Koval street behind Balleys if you want great food, great service and great prices. Oh, and there's no hot water most of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Situated in a fantastic, central position to explore Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: julieandpaul2009
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to the USA and we stayed at the Paris hotel for 10 nights following 5 nights in San Francisco. We absolutely adored this holiday experience! The Paris hotel is situated right in the heart of Las Vegas and proved to be an ideal base for exploring. We had a 'luxury room' which was decent and served its purpose but we did not pay the extra to upgrade on check in to gain a view of the strip. The rooms decor were a little dated but can be expected as the hotels theme is 'Paris' and decorated accordingly in a charming, vintage french style. The foyer of this hotel was super with huge chandeliers, very grand! The food at the buffett was good, the pool was fine and the Spa was very relaxing. Overall the location of the Paris was fantastic however check in was horrendous with long winding queues! The view at night from the 'Eiffel Tower' was superb and their restaurant was pricey, but first class! Las Vegas was fabulous and if we are lucky enough to return i would stay at the hotel i loved and that was the Bellagio!

Reviews.Title: “BUGS!!!!!!!!!!! And no credit to our bill???? Never again.”
Reviews.Author: ladrina142
Reviews.Content: Yes, we got an upgraded room, to a lovely pool view room that was dirty and had bugs. Hair in the shower, hair in my bed. Best friend had bug bites all over her. They moved us to an equally nice - but clean - room. However, when I called to follow-up and discuss our bill, they informed me that they had investigated and found nothing, therefore our bill would not be credited. As I told the Hotel Manager "That's unfortunate, as I would otherwise stay here again." [albeit having checked the room thoroughly before accepting it]. Upon check out I liquidated all of my comps into the room bill and informed I will not be back. THAT IS NOT WHAT I CALL CUSTOMER SERVICE. When Vegas is so down right now, you need to stand behind your product. I am a pretty good Total Rewards customer, but in the future I will spend my time and money at MGM properties.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you can stand the crowds! A little boring for teens.”
Reviews.Author: rhonda2698
Reviews.Content: My family (two teens, hubby, and I) visited the Paris in early June. The check-in was quick and easy and the lobby area where you check in is absolutely gorgeous! Our hotel room was fine (not tremendously fancy but very nice). Toiletries were provided along with a coffeemaker in the room. The room was clean and quiet and the beds were comfortable. The pool was HUGE and the fluffy towels provided were very nice. It is a truly beautiful pool with lots of room to swim even when there are several other people in it. There is a pretty view of the Eiffel Tower from the pool, too. Unfortunately, besides the pool, there was nothing for my teens to do at the Paris. They thought it was the most boring hotel they'd ever visited. The worst part of the visit was the CROWDS everywhere outside of the hotel area! There is lots of shopping in the building and near the casino area - the whole building is huge, and we literally felt like we were in a crowded shopping mall at Christmas whenever we stepped outside of the hotel area. Even to get to check-in, we had to fight throngs of people milling around. That was difficult to do when there was four of us trying to stay together, and we were lugging lots of luggage on the LONG walk from the parking garage to the check-in area. Even at check-out the next morning, the place was still completely packed. Our check-out went smoothly once we made our way through the crowds to the lobby. Unfortunately, we had to take another long walk from the lobby to the parking garage dragging our luggage behind us in the crowds. The evening we stayed, though, turned out to be fun. When my husband and I finally found a blackjack table with two open seats, we had a great time with several fun dealers. Unfortunately, the pit bosses were grouchy all night, and they changed the table minimum to $10 (originally $5) after we'd been there for a couple hours. They didn't grandfather anyone in at $5, and one of the players got mad and left the table. The drinks were somewhat slow to come, but they were good and we had a nice time in spite of the tremendous crowds and somewhat grouchy pit bosses. Overall, the hotel part was good (except for the walk to and from the lobby) and if you enjoyed shopping and being with lots of people, this would be a blast!

Reviews.Title: “Losing its luster”
Reviews.Author: AltGol
Reviews.Content: Paris Las vegas used to be very special, but is now a bit run down. Our room was spacious and clean, but the furniture showed its age and the hallways and elevators were pretty shabby. The casino is not the least bit user friendly, we gambled else where. The masses of humanity shuffling through the public areas make it less than a relaxing environment.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great customer service but needs updated.”
Reviews.Author: Ustravelgirl13
Reviews.Content: We had a great time staying at the Paris. We were lucky to have a room that overlooked the strip and the Bellagio fountains. The hotel is in a great location with good places to eat. The staff was very friendly. The rooms were a bit out dated, but we were in the room much so it wasn't a big deal. I would stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Paris is the place to be”
Reviews.Author: sassperella1
Reviews.Content: We arrived Sunday July 3rd 2011 The hotel is Clean the rooms were well kept and very inviting !! The staff were friendly and helpful, The Casino isnt big so it isnt as overwhelming like the other casinos we walked through ,You could find your way around it . The casino bathrooms were kept very clean especially with all the trafic that goes through . If your printing off boarding tickets go to the business centre dont use the the kiosk it charges to much and will not get the job done . Liked that they had a little corner where the djs played music and loved the sugar factory food was great and filling try the milkshake !!yum Awesome Hotel

Reviews.Title: “it was ok (luxury room)”
Reviews.Author: salo0061
Reviews.Content: normally when i go to Vegas i get very little sleep the night before so i expect to take a nap in the room when we get there. this time i wasn't able to do that since they didn't allow me to check in early without paying a fee. this is the only time Ive ever not been able to check in as soon as i got there and i normally get there around 10 am. finally when i was able to get my room after 4pm the rooms were ok. the bed is really hard and the comforters weren't very comfortable at all. the rooms did have a nice bathroom with separate shower and bathtub and a big mirror which i liked. the room also has a refrigerator which use to be the mini bar. at first i was happy about this but the temperature didn't get cold enough for my food or drinks but i can only speak for my room not every other room. our room was the first room on the left side of the hallway but it was surprisingly quiet and i never heard anyone walking by. the casino floor is kind of difficult to navigate which i did not like at all but i do like the location on the strip. its very easy to get anywhere. i also liked that paris is connected to ballys so i didnt have to walk out in the heat that often. the slots werent very loose here just like every other time ive visited the paris hotel. the only place i ate was at a pizza place in the shops but the crust was burnt and the pizza was very greasy... i didnt like it at all. next time i visit vegas i do want to try their buffet... even though it was fourth of july the lines werent very long and the food smelled delicious! you can also purchase all you can drink beer or wine for $12 while your at the buffet which is a good deal. i normally check out through the tv menu since its way faster than going to the lobby but this time the menu button on the tv was not working so i was forced to go downstairs... what an inconvenience.... the check out line took 40 min! all in all i do not think i would stay here again... unless i get a great deal on a red room.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: arwest1
Reviews.Content: The rooms were subpar at best and the bartenders were extremely rude. I will never again stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: lyndilu
Reviews.Content: Beginning to show its age in places but great location. Had a standard room as we didn't want to pay the upgrade price of $50 a night for the four nights we were there. Large room, decent view, furniture/decor definitely showing signs of use but hey, this is Las Vegas so you're not going to be in your room for long. Cleanliness could have been a better. Toilet/shower were kept clean but otherwise pretty hit and miss (mainly miss). Made the mistake of assuming that their restaurants were expensive when in fact they weren't bad at all in comparison with other hotel restaurants. Didn't try the buffet so can't comment. Went to Starbucks in Planet Hollywood Casino nearby for fast and free wifi. Overall not a bad experience in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Sweetlu4
Reviews.Content: Very nice clean place to stay. Nice room, pool wasn't crowded, and a comfortable atmosphere in the casino. Would definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Ooooh La La! Tres bien!”
Reviews.Author: honolulululu101
Reviews.Content: Felt like an expat living the good life, as I sat in the Hotel's Brasserie, sipping my cafe au lait and munching down a baguette and ham sandwich. From the cobblestone "streets" and lampposts in the lobby area, to the smallest details of the room, such as the french provincial bathroom fixtures, and the extra fluffy pillow top mattress and pillows, this hotel does not miss a step in creating the ambience you would expect, and as the name implies. Ordered room service, and the meal arrived hot and delicious in just a few minutes. I will definitely make this a regular "must-stop" whenever I find myself in Las Vegas. Absolutely loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Again The Paris is unbeatable”
Reviews.Author: alfaromeoKent
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris, Las Vegas as the start and finish of our road trip. We flew into Las Vegas and were given a lovely Red Room over looking the strip. We were only there 1 night as set off on our 15 day road trip to the Gulf of Mexico. On our return we found the hotel very full and was give a room over looking nothing in particular. We were there for 4 days so really wanted a room overlooking the strip. We went back to Reception and was given a bedroom of a suit overlooking the strip, nothing ever seems too much trouble for the receptionists, they will try their best to help. The room faultless, cleaned meticulously, very comfortable beds. The rest of the Paris faultless also, the restaurants and café's are good and and our stay was a pleasure

Reviews.Title: “We Always Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: GoTo5
Reviews.Content: This is my third or fourth trip to Vegas and we always stay at the Paris. Not really a choice as this is also a business trip and we have to either stay here or at Bally's. We prefer the Paris to Bally's rooms. Our first trip we were upgrades to one of the highest level rooms with a view of the mountains. Gorgeous room with a walk-in closet. Next trip we had a lovely room with a couch. This trip we brought the kids and had the most average looking room ever. Although the decor in all three rooms was essentially the same, the size and location makes a big difference. Love the location on the strip, love proximity to Bally's, love Le Village Buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat location, good hotel for price”
Reviews.Author: Katherine0922
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Paris for a business trip and stayed a few extra days to vacation with friends. The location can't be beat, as the hotel is within walking distance to multiple other casinos and resorts including the new Cosmopolitan, Planet Hollywood, Bellagio, Ballys, even Caesar's Palace. Paris is somewhat older, so it does not have the ventilation that the newer hotel and casinos have (meaning the entire reaks of smoke). Nevertheless, the rooms were comfortable. Though my room did not face the strip (and instead faced a concrete wall), that was fine because you don't go to Vegas to spend a lot of time in your room, presumably. The hotel's restaurants were only average except for the Eiffel Tower. We had a very expensive meal from the tasting menu at the Eiffel Tower, and it was one of the best meals I've ever had. The view from the Eiffel Tower restaurant at night is incredible, so even if you don't eat there, I recommend getting a drink from the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located on the strip, great club but dirty pool area”
Reviews.Author: rowagr
Reviews.Content: It is perfectly located and a nice theme hotel. The buffets available are great and the sugar factory is great anyway. They have a cool club connected also to the Planet Hollywood Club which is open longer until 5 a.m. The rooms were nice (however we had an upgrade), self parking is good only the pool is not that cool. There was nobody cleaning neither inside or ouside the pool area and it was walking through garbage. For such high price hotel not acceptable. 15 bucks for free Wi-Fi is rediculous.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: IPJSIllinois
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Paris for 5 nights with a girl friend, husbands left at home. We arrived 12:30am Sunday morning. I had contacted the hotel a month back to warn them of our late arrival as I wanted to make sure they kept our reservation.I had booked their basic room and was getting all nights comped through their rewards program. The hotel was almost sold out but the guy checking us in after making a phone call upgraded us to a room with a view of the pool and Eifel Tower. Room was clean and comfortable. The beds for us were comfortable though the furniture is beat up a bit. Bathroom was also very clean though I don't know why they give you 3 sets of towels for a 2 bed room. Shower had a strong spray and never had to wait for hot water. They kept the mini bar fridge where they use to sell snacks and drinks. So we bought a 12 pack of water to keep in there. I liked the fact that they kept the fridge. Maids in the hallway already smiled and greeted us as we passed by. There is a lounge by the casino so as you played the slots you were able to listen to the music which I liked. It was never croweded at the pool and no matter what time you got there, you could always find a lounge chair. water temp was cool but refreshing. IT was a big pool and I never felt crowded Ate at the buffet for breakfast which wasn't as good as I remembered. Ate several times at their counter service snack bar which at time was just enough Would have a fruit plate, cheese plate and a iced tea for about $13. Overall it was a nice stay and would certainly stay there again especially if I can get the room for free. I'll be happy to answer any questions you may have.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of response was underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: traveler8751
Reviews.Content: Briefly, a friend and I attempted to breakfast at the Cafe Ile St. Louis one morning, early. As we approached the entranve to the cafe, we noticed many more empty tables than occupied. In spite of that, we were told by the maitre'd that there would be a 30 minute wait. When questioned, he said that due to staffing problems they couldn't seat us right away. We went elsewhere. But a very tactful, carefully worded "complaint" written after the fact and submitted to the hotel went unanswered. Apparently, hotel management simply doesn't care. Every business has problems associated with it. Its a measure of the business how they handle and react to those problems when they arise that separates the good from the bad. Paris management . . . shame on them. Bad.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough for a few days”
Reviews.Author: jimlikeschkn
Reviews.Content: Some girlfriends and I stayed at Paris for some Pre-Wedding fun and overall it was pretty good. The beds were ok but overall the room was a little bit of a let down. It was clean but not as well decorated as I would have expected from such a fancy hotel. The staff were OUTSTANDING! One of the concierges was especially helpful, I think his name was John or James, he had a beard and glasses anyway. We wouldn't have had nearly as great a stay if he hadn't gone above and beyond to make out stay so great. The burger place in the hotel was pretty good albeit a little pricey. You MUST get a crepe from the creperie it was fabulous. And the dueling piano bar was great fun too. The service and amenities were very nice however I could have stayed somewhere else for half the price with a better guest room. Did I mention we had to turn the shower on for almost 30 minutes before it would get luke warm? Summary: Room - Meh Staff - Superb Piano Bar and Creperie - Superb

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: SueSheffield
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Paris. However, it was our first visit to Las Vegas, so we can't compare it with other hotels. It was much noisier than we expected, but all the Strip hotels seemed very noisy - that's how Las Vegas is. It was quiet around our room though, so that's fine. We never managed to eat at the Village Buffet, which seemed to have good recommendations. That was because the queue was always so long. We didn't want to be standing for ages in a queue when we had so much to fit into our two days (3 nights) in Vegas. It's a pity, because it sounds a good place, and obviously doesn't have enough space for the number of people who want to eat there. We had a trip up the Eiffel Tower at midnight on our last night, and that was a fantastic way to end our visit - great night views of the city. The room was comfortable. It was at the back on the 9th floor, so we knew that we wouldn't get good views. We were told that a room with views over the Strip costs at least 40 dollars a night extra. Having wandered around several other hotels, we felt that we made a good choice with the Paris. We had trouble with the room key, and it turned out that the battery needed replacing in the door. If you have similar problems, contact Security rather than the Concierge, and they will fix it quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Emy1
Reviews.Content: The Paris Las Vegas has a great location, in the middle of it all. We got a packaged deal with air and hotel and were very happy with the price. Our room had 2 queen beds in it with room to move. The bathroom was spacious. The only thing that wasn't great was the view as we were on the 5th floor and looked out onto a roof and other buildings, but I guess when you get a packaged deal you don't get the view rooms. We enjoyed the fact that the casino part of this hotel wasn't huge. It was great to not have to walk miles to get on an elevator to go to our rooms. The pool was nice and it was great to relax outdoors. The restaurants were great and the atmosphere and the decor made you feel like you were strolling the streets of Paris. We found the staff to be very helpful and very friendly, ready to help with anything that you needed. I would recommend this hotel to my family and friends and would definately stay here again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: CIVOG
Reviews.Content: The quality Vs. price was very good. Half price of Venetian and Bellagio, although I consider that these hotels are nicer and I had a strip view (and you have to pay for it, obviously!). We stayed in a Red Room Luxury and it was nicely appointed, good furnitures, spacious and with a very comfy bed. The bathroom was also nice and spacious. The view was not good; I asked for an upgrade in check-in but as it cost more than $50, so we thought it was not worth it. Didn't have the chance to try the pool, so I can't comment on that. Check-in was really busy and we had a long wait before having it done! They should improve this! Hotel was very busy and everywhere was very crowded. But hey, you are in Vegas in the middle of the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Latkahead
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Paris Hotel a few years ago, so we were excited to be going back for our 40th wedding anniversary. On the surface the hotel seemed the same (really nice), but... - The bed was like sleeping on concrete - The toilet became stuffed 3 days in a row (really annoying) - We had a bad experience with the staff in one the restaurants - The honor bar in our room was unplugged and empty. If they're not in use any more, take it out. - Upkeep of the hotel seemed to be slipping. Someone needs to walk around with a paintbrush, especially in the corridors. With so many hotels in LV to choose from, only choose the Paris if you get a wonderful room rate. I don't think we'll be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “With so many other choices, don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: MarylandRoadtripper
Reviews.Content: The mid-strip location was great but the rooms were nothing special. The first room we were assigned had a king size bed with a terrible mattress so we moved to a second room with two double beds. The mattresses in the second room were OK and we had a good view of the pool and Eiffel Tower. The room was immaculately clean but somewhat run down with a broken bed-side lamp and an old TV (not that we watched it anyway). The pool was great - we lounged and swam every day! We did not eat many meals at the hotel but we did try the buffet one evening and were pleasantly surprised at how good it was. Unfortuneately, we had to have our room keys reprogrammed at least once a day which was a little surprising..and annoying. Overall, we were not all that impressed with this hotel and we would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love This Place!”
Reviews.Author: Jennermade
Reviews.Content: What a hotel this is. They have a miniture version of the Eiffel Tower and great resteraunts too. Best place we ever stayed in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Rude Rude -will never stay again”
Reviews.Author: iamhoneybeerose
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Paris Memorial Day weekend and was greeted by the rudest desk clerk. I travel a lot and this guy-Carey, was the rudest I have ever had the chance of meeting. I booked the room under my total rewards online and was comped 2 months prior. When I checked in, Carey said that I booked the room with a companion (my mom), who wasn't with us. He charged us the highest rate for the room for the entire stay. I had to go back and speak with someone else, who couldn't take the charge off the room because Carey had entered something in the notes about us. The second person reduced the rate for us to the lowest rate at time I booked, thank God, because we weren't expecting to be paying for the room. If we knew we had to pay for the room, we would have stayed somewhere else. I asked for the special that if you book atleast 2 nights, you get 2 free 24 hour buffet pass, and we were told they didn't know of that deal-it's on the Ceasar's website. The room was outdated. The chain lock was broken, there was no refrigerator, nothing in the mini bar, the TV was old and bulky. You would think for paying that much for a room ($250/night), the room would have an LCD screen. There was also no closet or anything to place your luggage on. We ate at the buffet in the morning for breakfast. Harrah's buffet is better and has more food selection. The steak house wasn't bad, but not the best. Not much selection for food late night. The bed and pillows were comfortable though. This hotel has the worse customer service and doesn't even deserve a 3 star rating. One star or less is more like it.

Reviews.Title: “NICE--RED ROOMS ONLY”
Reviews.Author: pupepause
Reviews.Content: After check-in we went to our room on the 9th floor with a view of the Eiffel tower, and pool. The pool music was so loud it seemed the D.J. was in our room. The room was also in need of a face lift—very, very tired!! I knew this would not work for us and called downstairs immediately. They were very accommodating and gave us a room on the 26th floor (VIP Red Room) with a view of the city and parking lot. This room was wonderful and we had no complaints. It is what a 4 Star Vegas hotel room should be.....comfortable King size bed too! Monday night we requested late checkout and there was no problem . We dined at the LeProvencal, Cafe Ile St Louis, Le Village Buffet and a few other in and out places at The Paris. I must say all were excellent both food and service accept the Le Village Buffet---not a pleasant dining experience---we all agreed this is one to skip. We rented a Villa by the pool on Monday (saved $100) and it was a fabulous experience, so relaxing!!! If you have a group of people to split the cost we highly recommend spending the day by the pool in a Villa. The Villa differs from a Cabana as it has a/c and all other amenities you need. The service charge is a bit more (30%) however, we had superb service all day. My only complaint is we had to ask them to sweep all the leaves from the day before---that was a bit tacky! When you are spending almost $400 for a Villa we expect it to be clean! Over all observations on our 3 night stay at The Paris (after staying in 7 other Vegas properties on the strip nothing under 4 stars and three 5 stars): Pro’s: Excellent customer service in all areas, nice lobby, nice theme of Paris, very good restaurants, and Napoleon's Dueling Piano Bar/ lounge is FABULOUS! We booked early on the internet and received a 25% discount. Con’s: All but the red rooms are in need of a face lift , casino feels cramped and I don’t mean your typical L.V. crowd cramped. $5.00 to print a boarding pass, and $14.00 a day for wi-fi. More Recommendations that are highly worth considering: Top of the World Restaurant at the Stratosphere, Café Bellagio, and The Lion King at Mandelon Bay with a bite to eat after the show at Raffles Café.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: quincy84
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6 night stay at the Paris Las Vegas . We had received a great rate (partially comped) for a standard room and as expected, upon check-in, we were asked if we would like to upgrade but declined the offer. We were pleasantly surprised on the standard room we received, a corner room on the fourth floor overlooking the pool on the one side. Huge marble bathroom with separate walk-in shower and bath. The Paris is in a great location - mid strip, with access to both the Deuce and the Express bus right out front. We found all the employees of the hotel to be very friendly and accomodating with any of our requests. We certainly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there on any future trips.

Reviews.Title: “The hardest bed I ever slept on!”
Reviews.Author: Car93
Reviews.Content: We were so excited to stay at this hotel, but that quickly faded. I thought they forgot to put the mattress on top of the bed because it felt like the box spring. We have stayed at five other hotels on the strip and NONE of them were like this one. If a comfortable bed is not important to you, maybe it would be fine, but we will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Never again "”
Reviews.Author: lynnal
Reviews.Content: Last year my friend and had a medical convention. We stayed outside of Vegas and then booked the Paris for avacation. It was terrible. We where treated horrible. We booked a room, requesting two queen beds. At check in, we wereere told the only available room for the night was a "King Size Bed". Come back in the morning and everything will be taken care of. After breakfast we did that. Flat out we were told nothing could be done. The asst.manager came out of offered "Nothing" to compensate. Telling us that bookinga room with two beds does not mean you will get it. Nexzt, we asked for Manager, same thing. Weasked for tickets,meals. "No!" After a few days of final getting to the President of the company we got a room with two beds and a mere $100.00 to spend. That had to spent at their properties. I have stayed at other hotles, Not rated with as many stars and have been treated Better. What was it?? Did my friend and I get "kicked" to the curb because they saw two women?? This was the most unpleasant experience I ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: yippeeholidays
Reviews.Content: Perfect spot on the vegas strip. In middle of all the action. Great restaurants. Very, very busy. No free wi fi. Check in was smooth, even though it was busy, but you have to walk through the casino to get to reception. The rooms are spacious and have everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Celebrating my daughter's 21st birthday”
Reviews.Author: Darlene2010
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had been planning to take a trip to celebrate her 21st birthday for about 3 years. In February I booked our hotel rooms at the Paris for a great rate since we were staying for 3 nights. We had a positive experience at the hotel overall. The Pros: The location is perfect - centrally located on the stirp and with a monorail connection. The restaurant selection is very good. We found the food to be very good whether eating at one of the buffets or the smaller restaurants in the Paris. The rooms (we upgraded to a Red Room) were very nice with better than average furniture and furnishings. The bathroom was very generously sized. The Cons: If you self-park - good luck finding where you go to check-in. It was confusing and it was a very long way from the garage entrance. The website said that a refrigerator was included in each and every room. Correction - there WAS a stocked mini-bar which is no longer in use in each room. We talked to the front office about it twice. They don't plan to replace them but they also don't have them turned on for use. All in all it was a very good time. There was a party next to my daughter's room and they called security and it was taken care of within 10 minutes of the call. I would highly recommend staying at Paris Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Minicoco
Reviews.Content: I had stopped staying at any Caesar's owned properties a few years ago due to the downturn in comps and sometimes crazy rates. Recently, due to the lack of comps from the Venetian and Palazzo, I returned to the Paris for the first time in several years. I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. The room are a litte tired if you stay in one of the non- red rooms. However, they are very clean, and the food and drink available at the hotel is far more moderate than the Venetian and Palazzo, and with good quality. We purchased the 24 hour buffet pass about 8:30 pm on a Monday night and paid the extra $15 to dine at the Seafood buffet at the Rio. Well worth the $45- we had dinner that night, breakfast, lunch and dinner the following day. Now dining at an average of $10 per meal for two days is an awesome Vegas deal! Harrah's/Caesar's must have noticed that their service had declined because everyone I encountered on this stay was friendly, helpful and in great spirits. The player's club desk employees, the front desk, the room service folks, everyone was smiling and helpful- quite a switch from Paris and Caesars of a few years ago. You cannot beat the location- mid strip, across from the Bellagio, next to Planet Hollywood, all places I like to visit. Thank you Paris for listening to your guests and making this turn around. I will be back, and I will bring friends!

Reviews.Title: “Route66”
Reviews.Author: Janep18
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend when travelling USA , could t fault it at all . Upgraded our room for approx 50 dollars each which gave us a perfect view of the bellagio fountains , breakfast in the members club and also cocktails and canapés . The hotel is ideally placed on the strip for all the sights . Would stay again , in fact would go back tomorrow !

Reviews.Title: “Ok Place if your not a gambler”
Reviews.Author: Jackie155042
Reviews.Content: We are Harrah's card holders and are always getting free rooms in the mail. Have tried The Flamingo(YUCK!!!), Harrah's(YUCK!!!), and now Paris. Nice enough place. Rooms are old unless you pay for an upgrade. Some have been lucky enough to get a free upgrade, not us, we begged. Our room had nail polish spilt on carpet and nightstand. The maid didn't even try and clean it before we arrived. We called down once checked in and told the desk so we didn't charged. Two days later it was cleaned. Bathtub plug didn't work so had to keep filling tub while in it. Great shower though. Crappy view. Good food at the cafe. One night when were going back to room by the lobby/ restrooms, Someone had vomited everywhere! They were working hard at cleaning and covering it. Lots of maintanance staff there for clean up. Poor guys! Hard to say if comps are as good as others we stay with because we didn't gamble as much there as would have liked too. The slots were soooo tight and had horrible luck at the $25 blackjack tables too. Nobody plays the $1 slots there. Everyone plays the penny slots. Harrh's properties seem to be catering to the Vegas tourists rather than the big gamblers now. If your there to gamble, try the Mlife group, stay at one of their properties, get a card and get comps. They cater more to the gamblers. However you have to play at least the $1 slots and be betting a min. of $25 a hand at blackjack to get comped. The Paris location is good if you are seeing shows in that area but not if you don't like the party atmosphere. By the way, the pool sucks!

Reviews.Title: “Finest hotel to be in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: karanvni
Reviews.Content: Paris is situated right on the strip at Vegas. It has amazing rooms and one of the best casinos in Vegas. The hotel has an Eiffel Tower which will make you identify Paris very easily from far away. It has beautiful casino, with a very lively architecture. The artificial blue sky, with interiors as you are moving in streets of France, makes you never feel as if it is dark or late even if it is like four in the night. even if you aren't staying at Paris, you can't miss being here. The rooms are huge, and with beautiful interiors. There isn't anything which I would say i missed here. One of the best hotels, I ever stayed. Would love to get back here every year!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: IMForever28
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Paris for 5 nights in June 2011. We chose this hotel based on previously visiting the casino/shopping area and thinking it was nice. Also, our friends had some comp nights they let us use for a discounted price. It was a great opportunity to try it out! We stayed in a standard room. It was clean, but getting very dated. It certainly needs some updating. The carpet was completely worn, the bed was awful and the bathroom was showing its age. We had a view of the Paris hot air balloon and were located above the hotel entrance (16th floor). Some nights we could hear taxi horns honking. Had I paid full price for this room I would have been very upset by the overall appearance and quailty. The hallways throughout the hotel on the way to the rooms are often cluttered with dirty room service carts, empty wine glasses, etc. There were many places I saw broken glass in the hallway as well. I stil love the casino and shopping area. The crepe place is a must for breakfast! The shop next door to the crepes had decent priced, great tasting coffee and you are able to refill for free. We spent some time at the pool. There is a moderate amount of space at the pool, but chairs fill up quickly. The chairs are AWFUL and need replacing. Most of the chairs are broken and do not adjust. Also, if you sit in them for awhile you start to fall through the slats which stretch. The drinks at the pool are outrageously expensive, but to be expected in Vegas. With all the other hotel options in Vegas I would NOT choose to stay here again. We stayed at New York, New York a month prior and were much more impressed with overall quailty.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but needs a few improvements”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireTravelqueen
Reviews.Content: We upgraded to a Premium Room with view of strip which was great but in need of some attention. Peeling wallpaper in bathroom and parts of wardrobe chipped off and not replaced. Good points - View of Bellagio Fountains, comforatable beds, lots of space. Upgrade included access to private lounge & breakfast/afternoon snacks which was very good value. Great casino atmosphere and shops. Bad Points: Ridiculously loud (bad) music from pool area which because of the location of our room sounded like we had a disco in there every day. No one round pool because of noise, when DJ goes at 6, everyone comes out!! Long lines for check-in, no 24-hour concierge. And check your bill, we were charged for Manilow tickets which were supposed to be part of package (as were our travelling companions). This was rectified straight away but shouldnt happen. We noticed this by checking our bill on TV in room the night before we checked out and because there is no concierge at night we had to stand in the check-in line at midnight to get our incorrect bill sorted as we were leaving at 5am following day . Also small point, tickets for Manilow were booked for Friday and as we dressed on Friday we checked tickets which in fact had been issued for the Saturday!! All in all, great place to stay but needs to address admin issues/ staff shortages/training and the unpopular pool noise! And for goodness sake Free Wifi in this day and age should be a must - absolute rip off, these hotels are robbing us charging for Wifi at such expensive daily rates. A one-off fee of $5 per room/per stay should cover it!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK...”
Reviews.Author: GTGal
Reviews.Content: PROS Pool area is VERY nice. Pool bar service was excellent and friendly. Delicious bloody mary (although pricey but it's Vegas) Great location Every restaurant in the place is very good. Had preakfast & dinner at Mon Amie and I thought breakfast was scrumptious - even better than dinner! The buffets are very good too. Went to the Thai place "SEA" in Bally's the last night and it was really delicious. Piano bar was a lot of fun. Maid service was efficient, thorough, and they were very friendly and helpful. Easy/free/quick VIP access to club, but was SO crowded could barely move to get a drink. CONS My room was disappointing - very dark, with a view of the lower roof on the 5th floor, small bathroom. Granted, it was a free room due to a VIP with us, but the other friends with us also got free rooms, which were on higher floors with nice views. Bar service in most places (except pool) was SLOW and RUDE! Especially the ladies in the Lobby Bar. VERY rude, very slow, had to ask even during slow times to have them clean up tables. Horrible service EVERY time we went there. Bar service in casino was also very slow no matter if I was at the Craps table, blackjack, or slots. In summary - I expected a lot more from this place. The room & service were the worst points, while the food, location, and general decor were the nice points. Would I go back? Probably not...

Reviews.Title: “The Paris is "okay" for a first trip”
Reviews.Author: Luvtotravel022
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the weekend of June 10th for 4 nights. The lobby area with restaurants is rather old and dark, but it fits with a Parisian theme. The casino is small as compared to others on the strip. I enjoyed the live band which was right next to the casino floor, but I thought the DJ music the next night was too loud. Our room was located on the 28th floor, but we did not have a strip view as expected (my husband didn't mind because it was quieter than the strip view would have been). My first impression was that the room was smaller, older, and darker than I had anticipated, but it was okay since the room was a comp. We did not use room service, but the room was cleaned daily upon our return in the evening. I can't review the food, as we did not eat at the Paris, but it smelled good as we walked past the restaurants. The check-in process was pretty quick, although there was a line on late Friday morning. The Paris lacks the glitz and "bling" of Vegas. Overall, I would say that the Paris is not where I would choose to stay next time, however, it was okay for a first visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: JKP_Illinois
Reviews.Content: We booked rooms at Paris thinking they would be a bit nicer than the standard Vegas strip hotel rooms but were not impressed. The rooms were advertised as "romantic", but but were really pretty basic. The TV was old. The room had a refrigerator that was an old guttet-out mini-bar. Other than that, bed was comfy, AC worked good, room was clean, and service was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Pakratbob
Reviews.Content: Overall, great experience. Hotel room was clean and orderly. Decor was fine, not new, but in very good condition. Carpets were clean enough to walk around in socks and not have them turn black. Beds were a little hard, but manageable. I would have ranked them a higher, but checking in was a hassle. I showed up for a conference hosted at the hotel. There were dozens of people standing in line at check in and only two clerks. Took more than 30 minutes of waiting before I reached the counter and was able to check in. Once at the counter, the clerk was very courteous and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: cfletcher7
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many hotels on the Strip and we found Paris to be a pleasant surprise. We were in Las Vegas for a long weekend attending our friends' wedding. The wedding party and most the guests stayed at the Paris. Check-in line was quick and we were able to get a room right away. Normal check-in is at 3 PM and we got our room just before noon. Only thing about check-in was the front desk needs to be a little more cheerful. No smiles and we felt like we were bothering them with our request. As a bunch of us checking in were friends, we requested rooms close to each other. Not a big deal if they couldn't accomodate us, but it seemed like a big chore to them to try to coordinate rooms next to each other. Other than that, the whole Paris experience was satisfactory. Spacious, comfortable and clean rooms, big clean bathroom with separate shower (big plus for me), quick, pleasant and delicious room service (for late nite munchies), big clean pool with "excellent cocktail service" and the pleasant check-out and bell desk made for a nice weekend. One more thing, check out Le Chateau (Paris' club), love the outdoor ambiance with comfy couches and fireplaces. We would stay at Paris again !

Reviews.Title: “Gained traction over four day stay but can't recommend it”
Reviews.Author: piacere
Reviews.Content: Had I written this review the day of check in, it would have been a one star rating. That’s because the desk personnel at the registration desk were rude to every member of the eight people (three other couples and two singles) who were meeting up with us at The Paris. But the friendliness of the other staff, the general comfort of a room for which we paid only $78 (tax included) per night and the hotel’s close proximity to Bellagio and The Cosmopolitan led to The Paris getting traction over the four days of our stay to result in a better rating outcome at the end. That said, we will not stay here again nor could we recommend it as a place to stay to others. That is based on eight trips to Las Vegas, including this one, and experience with seven other hotels, of which we would happily recommend and return to five. There are just too many other options for lodging in Las Vegas to be treated as if a hotel is doing YOU a favor by taking your discretionary lodging dollars. As was the case with the desk staff at The Paris. That summary experience posted, The Paris has minus and pluses. If you’re interested in the detail read on. FRONT DESK EXPERIENCE: A BIG "minus". This can be highlighted by the short version of the problem with the desk staff at check in for us. One of our group had arranged for five rooms in a block. Each room had a different confirmation number. Knowing we would be arriving in groups of two and three and originating from cities across the country, he made sure we all had all five of the confirmation numbers so we could check in as we arrived since he might arrive as late as midnight. But the hotel would not let us check in, even though we had confirmation numbers and could provide all of the pertient personal data for the guy who made the reservations – home address, phone, name, employer and so on. The desk staff very frankly told us the hotel was sold out that night, that we had rooms at a deeply discounted rate, and if the person who had reserved all five rooms did not arrive in time, they would simply sell the rooms at $299 given they were sold out that night. Or, they said, we could check in at that time and they would charge our cards the $299 rate. We said to the desk clerk that this could not be the only time this had happened, a party with multiple reservations arrives over the course of several hours and the person who coordinated the reservations is the last to arrive. No, she said, it is not the first time. So, we said there must be a solution for this. Yes, she said, the solution is you lose your rooms and we sell them to others at a higher rate. When my sister in law, who is a mild mannered and charming woman, nearly pleaded with the desk clerk to allow check in at 7pm given she had been up since 1:00a.m., the desk clerk said roughly this, “Do you think that is MY problem?” It would have been laughable for a training video in how NOT to gain customer loyalty if it had not been so intentionally obnoxious. Ta dum. ROOMS: Pluses and minuses. Once check in was finally achieved, all went smoothly. As you can imagine we did not receive rooms in great locations given the low rates we were paying and the full house at the hotel. But that would be expected under the circumstances so we had no complaints. The good news about the rooms is they were generally comfortable and nice and clean. My husband and I had a “P” room which is a bit larger and other members of our group had standard rooms. In all cases the infrastructure showed wear and tear, damaged furniture and paint coming off of woodwork as example, and old technology, as in smaller tube TVs as opposed to the large screen LEDs that one finds even at mid range hotels these days. But with comfortable beds, an adequate supply of decent pillows, quiet floors at night and everything nice and clean, it’s hard to kvetch about the rooms for the price we were paying. However, if we’d been paying anywhere near the rack rate, that would have been a different perspective. Note: wifi is $15 / day. GAMING STAFF: Pluses. From our perspective, the dealers at the black jack tables were top notch. The perfect nexus of professionalism and friendliness, they made playing a lot of fun…at the $10 tables at least which is where those of us playing cards hung out. COCKTAIL STAFF: Pluses. Since we were a big group, we used the bar right on the floor of the casino as a “meet up” location each evening either before or after going on to other things. This is a bar where you’re better off ordering a beverage with no more than two ingredients (think gin and tonic not Sidecar) given the ingredients available to the bar tenders. (For a great quality cocktail we highly recommend the Vesper Bar in The Cosmopolitan across the street.) But the cocktail waitresses were so friendly and could give as good as they got from my wisecracking Brooklyn born and reared relatives in-law. The banter was part of the evening’s entertainment and the service top notch. RESTAURANTS: Pluses and minuses. One of the advantages The Paris enjoys is a number of small, casual places to pick up something to eat…a boulangerie, a patisserie and so on. That made it convenient to grab a fruit plate and coffee to take to the room for breakfast in the morning for those of us not eating a more formal breakfast and it also worked out well for a snack in the afternoon for those of us not eating a more formal lunch. And the Mon Ami Gabi restaurant (reasonably priced as Las Vegas restaurants go) patio provides a nice view of the Bellagio fountains from afternoon through evening. The Eiffel Tower restaurant, where service is great and prices are high and tables are packed like sardines in a can, is not owned or run by The Paris. While you may not want to spring for dinner there, it is a great place to have a cocktail in the bar and see the stunning view. LOCATION: Plus. Easy walk up or down the strip or across the street to City Center, The Cosmo or Bellagio. TIPS: 1) Upgrades to strip side rooms are sometimes available for as little as $40 / night. Our recommendation would be to pay for the upgrade but be sure you’re above the 11th floor or, you’ll look out at a parking garage. (As we did. I'll try to include photos of room.) 2) The rooms ending in “P” are like a petite suite, larger by far than a regular room, with a spacious bath, extra closet space and a small desk and, at least in our room, an in room coffee maker. If you can get a “P” room (ours was offered at the same price) take it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: TartanTeddyBear
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel in the heart of the strip opposite the Bellagio. The strip is deceivingly long and the location of this hotel makes it handy for all the main attractions hotels and shopping. Unless you are going downtown or out of town to the Outlet malls you can avoid the traffic of the strip which is extremely busy and slow esp if on the local bus. It gets worse as the day goes on. From previous experience we mainly went to the Buffet at the Bellagio but also tried the Cafe at the Paris which was excellent esp the superior European (not American) coffee. We also tried the Burger Brasserie which was superb and great value. Room was large and facing South onto the strip (but not a Bellagio fountain view, which I suspect you had to pay extra for). WiFi in the room was not cheap at $15 p day or $25 p day for through out the hotel. Pool area was nice although only one large pool with small hot tub. Perfectly sufficient. The casino, which we were rarely in was bright and in the main smoke free.

Reviews.Title: “Glitzy Vegas hotel that is starting to show it's age”
Reviews.Author: Henrytravels10014
Reviews.Content: The Paris has always been at the top but recent new fancier hotels have left it in the middle of the pack .

Reviews.Title: “Paris in US- Magnifique”
Reviews.Author: HOLLY213Florida
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week at Paris in LV for business. Loved the cobblestone streets and Parisian lanterns. Most convention centers are concrete, bare-walled massive rooms but the designer-patterned carpet and sconces on the walls were a delightful change. Food was delicious especially the French croissants and desserts! Arrived late night so I was upgraded to a suite but then booted out on the week-end.....Boo-hoo. Overall- Viva Paris

Reviews.Title: “Consitently great, as always”
Reviews.Author: jgates8
Reviews.Content: This trip I received a Red room. View was not exceptional, but did encompass south strip. Room was beautiful & bed was extremely comfortable. I love that they have emptied the mini-bar & allow it to be used as a fridge in the room. Cocktail service throughout the gaming floor was consistent. Buffet was good quality & fresh food.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Suite Upgrade”
Reviews.Author: BusyTourist
Reviews.Content: Offered an upgrade to a suite for $85 additional. It was well worth it. We ended up on the 32nd floor right in front of the tower and the Bellagio water show. Noise was not an issue. Room was very clean and well maintained. Amenities were great! Only thing I would pick on is that the TVs in the rooms were still older tube TVs. If offered the upgrade again, I would definitely repeat the deal.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: hdcspike
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas many times for both business and pleasure, and while the Paris is okay, I would not recommend that you stay there. CONS: 1. The beds are worse than any hotel I've stayed in. It was like sleeping on a board. Even the beds at a Hotel 6 are better than the one's at the Paris. 2. The shower had more air than water coming out of the shower head. I understand saving water, but I spent 10 minutes just rinsing my hair, and at my age, I don't have much hair. 3. The mini bar was empty, and when I asked, I was told that it didn't work. It was the kind that charges you money after 45 seconds if you remove something. 4. The TV was a small old picture tube type and the channel selection was poor. 5. The room and hotel just looked dated. 6. $5 to print my boarding pass. Skip it and print it at the airport. There are tons of ticket kisoks at the airport and they are free. 7. $65 to just use the Gym. Are you kidding me? 8. Food was okay, but better selections are available on the strip. 9. $14.95 for 24 hrs of internet. $24.95 if you need it anyplace other than your room. PRO: 1. Everyone who worked there was very nice and friendly. 2. Plenty of free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: acalinda
Reviews.Content: Stayed 8 nights at Paris Las Vegas in May. This was a surprise trip for my husband. While we have stayed at Paris before we have never stayed in one of their Red Rooms. On this occasion we were upgraded to a Red Room that was in a small alcove at the end of the hall. It was really a great experience because we were out of the main traffic of the hall. The beds were comfortable and we really enjoy the ability of using 2 casinos(Paris/Bally's) late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fun casino, less crowded”
Reviews.Author: MyTravelingPanda
Reviews.Content: I lived in Vegas for awhile and worked at Caesars. I was familiar with Paris, but had not stayed here. I attended a work conference and this hotel and was eager to try out the hotel. Sure, it is not as glamorous as Caesars or Bellagio, but it is not as pricey either. But, you get the same great location! Our room was clean and adequate for our needs, nothing over the top, but it was fine. The casino offers nice restaurants, including the Buffet and dining on the strip. The pool is a bit diappoininting, but the views from atop the Eiffel tower make up for it. It you are looking for an ultra hip, super busy place with a great pool, this may not be your place. But, if you plan to explore Vegas and the strip, and want easy access to many places at a decent rate, then this is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Intimate”
Reviews.Author: Dhoom13
Reviews.Content: Chose this to be close to my friends at Caesar's. Price was medium but I loved the hotel because of its central location and because it doesn't feel overwhelmingly large. This has a quaint 'small' (by Vegas standards) feel. Never a line up for elevators, nice fellow guests, great service at front desk, concierge and taxi stand. You wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and great ambience”
Reviews.Author: JohnSally
Reviews.Content: We are a couple in our 50s and stayed 5 nights at Paris in early May. We had a terrific corner room with a fabulous strip view. The hotel is clean and service was excellent. On-site restaurants were good. It is not a hotel dominated by heavy drinking 20 somethings, but has a nice lively vibe to it. Pool is sedate and not tropical like other hotels, but there is no blaring music to contend with. The location is great with easy walking distance to several casinos and is connected by an inside walkway to Ballys. The bus stop is right in front of the hotel. It is a great place and moderately priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: patravelmom93
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Paris and we were not disappointed! We were able to book a standard room at a fantastic promotional rate. Rooms were very clean and Gilchrist & Soames toiletries were great. Towels were a little old and substandard to what I would expect at a 4-star property. Pool wasn't crowded until the weekend crowd rolled in but even then the partying never got out of hand. Lifeguards kept control of the poolside activities and the poolside servers were prompt & attentive. Overall, a great property for those looking for a quieter, non rowdy Vegas experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice views, dirty place”
Reviews.Author: FuzzySD
Reviews.Content: Of course, we wanted a room with a view. Of course, we needed to see the Eiffel Tower, but since we couldn't go to Paris, France, we went to Vegas. Stunning hall with sparky crystal chandeliers & Napoleon pictures created the atmosphere of Paris. Well, at least they tried. We had to give 250 more at the register for a room with a view and lounge pass ( the last one turned out to be a good thing). When I opened the door to our room, I was staggered by the view. Amazing! Bellagio fountains, Eiffel Tower right in front of my bed... And a very strong smell of cigarettes mixed with the smell of dirt in the air. I took my shoes off and the carpet was sticky!!! Yuck!!! But oh well, I sat down on my bed and enjoyed the view of the tower & Bellagio hotel in the rays of the sun going down... Well, the throw on the bed had dirt and grease stains on it and even though the sheets were clean, the throw obviously was NOT. It was kind of stinky. We called the room service to ask for ANYTHING that could help eliminating this horrible cigarette smell. By the way, we booked a room on a NON-smoking floor! So much for that. In 30 minutes after out call they brought the ionizer and we had to leave the room for about an hour. We were going to do it anyway. When we came back, they took the ionizer away and it didn't seem to help at all. One funny thing is that looked like someone was smoking in the closet, because every time I opened the closet door, the smell of cigarettes coming out of there was awful. If someone had smoked there before we moved in just once or twice, the smell wouldn't be so bad and didn't seem so old and thick in the air. Evidently somebody was smoking there many times and those were not just one guests, but a number of them one visit after another. Or the previous guests spent all their time in smoky casinos and their clothes (and thanks to them ours too) smelled of cigarettes. Anyway, lounge at night was free, we got some free wine and light dinner and left the hotel to take a look at the new Cosmopolitan. Which looked really nice. Younger crowd inside. The bar is amazing. But that's a story for another review. So my biggest impression from the Paris hotel was how dirty the room was and the worst part - the rashes!!! I had to use tons of benadryl and aloe gel when I returned home. I knew I'd get something from that room. Those were not bed bugs, the rashes didn't look like it. It was more like a dermatitis. It took me two weeks to recover from it. I think they use some kind of a detergent to wash their linens or it could be just filthy room (the carpet in the room was terrifyingly dirty). I don't think I'll ever come back to the Paris hotel. Too bad, because I loved our view very much. Location is truly amazing. We didn't even have to go anywhere to enjoy the Bellagio fountains. I don't know if I can recommend this hotel... I guess we just were not lucky with the room. But the views and location are the best you can find in Vegas. Buffet is not impressing at all. Lounge that was included was ok. Free breakfast and night snacks and wine were nice. Eiffel tower tour might be worth taking. We did and it was... well, it was nice. Not spectacular but just nice. I liked it. I guess I might recommend this hotel but only because of the location & great views (for extra $$). But then again, if you have extra money, you might as well cross the street and book a room at Bellagio... Maybe you'll be lucky to find a better room at Paris. I'm not coming back to this hotel, that's definite.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, questionable service”
Reviews.Author: mpatrick5454
Reviews.Content: I wanted to experience a big name hotel on the strip. The Paris has rooms at a great rate. My room was exquisite, but the only view I had was of the wing next to me. I guess you get what you pay for. The bed was great, very comfortable. Not too hard, not too soft. The the service was another matter. I pulled up to valet to unload my suitcases and park my car. There was no one else there, but I had to unload the car myself. When a valet finally came he informed me that he only took my stuff halfway to my room and that someone else would bring them to my room, so I needed to tip him now. Very poor move on his part. The casino was great, lots of options for card games and costs. I did not eat at the Paris because the restaurants were quite overpriced and it was very easy to walk a half a block to find more reasonable meals. The location is ideal, I was able to walk to many, many casinos. However, I will not stay here again because the service was not good, from the valet to the check-in to the maids, everyone acted like they were doing me a favor.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: AnnWB
Reviews.Content: It'd been years since hubby and I had been to Las Vegas and we decided to try one of the newer, grander casinos. I'm so glad we chose Paris Las Vegas! What a fun visit we had. From the moment we arrived, we felt we got great treatment from the staff, who all seemed intent on making sure we enjoyed our visit. It is a beautiful property, too. We especially enjoyed how it felt we were really back in Paris in so many ways -- especially just strolling along the shops and restaurants with the sky overhead. Our room was very nice and we got a great deal on it (thanks to others from TripAdvisor who guided us on this!) Restaurants were quite good, though we did not try the buffet. Our favorite bar was tucked away to the right after you enter the casino. We sat outside the bar itself in their exterior serving area; nestled on a couch and enjoyed the ambiance along with tasty glasses of cab. We did take the monorail all along the strip -- not sure it was absolutely necessary as a way to visit the other major casinos because you do end up walking just about as much as if you simply hoofed it along the Strip but it was fun to travel along on the monorail and just hop off whenever we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: Mondoux
Reviews.Content: My husband and two sons went to Las Vegas to celebrate our 25th anniversary. My cousin had recommended the Paris Hotel as it was central. We loved it - the interior is beautiful, the restaurants surprisingly economical. And the Eiffel Tower - well we just laughed - it looked great. And the check in staff wonderful. As far as being central - certainly was. We walked the strip easily. And, we had rented a car to do side trips - free parking at the Paris - another bonus. If we go back to Vegas, this is definitely where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Choice on the Strip-Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: shendrix
Reviews.Content: If I could stay at just one hotel over and over in Las Vegas, this would be it. It is absolutely one of the best properties on the strip. I even got married here in December 2005! The rooms are fabulous and every amenity is wonderful. I love the buffet here, too. Great central location on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “For What I paid for it was great!”
Reviews.Author: deserthillsbnb
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is nothing else but a clean giant Las Vegas hotel right on the Strip, but I can't imagine paying more than the $80 I paid for , considering the abundance of choices right around there. There is no cheap food anywhere downstairs and all the guests end up in endless lines to pay $30 per plate in the restaurants inside. I suggest walking out for better price. The casino is great and very busy. From my window you could see the fountains of the Bellagio, an incredible spectacle! Very Clean it shows very little signs of the hundreds of thousands that have been there. I would not pay the $250 they where asking for the night after for the same double queen room we already stayed in . Got the usual Vegas maid in the room at 9 am without knocking, so make sure you put a do not disturb sign on the door. Also, get ready for a 25 minute line for check in, that could definitely be improved!

Reviews.Title: “Heartbreak breaker”
Reviews.Author: ManeetJolly
Reviews.Content: My first trip to the States. My first trip to Vegas. My first holiday after a breakup. My birthday. Came in a rush, not knowing what to expect. Booked a night before, got in on the flight from San Francisco. Went to the reception. Told her it was my birthday. She upgraded me and gave a room with a view of the Bellagio and it's musical fountains and of course the Paris's own Eiffel tower. From the first roar of the fountains, I knew I was going to recover and be fine. Yes I gambled. Of course you do when you're in Vegas. Lost 200 dollars in 45 mins. Got in a drink. Had a steak. That was my birthday. Once I started getting a feel of Vegas, with the help of the concierge and my cousin, the party started to revv to life. From exploring the wonderful hotels on the strip to buying souvenirs to grabbing beer at every place within walking distance from the Paris to catching some famous Vegas shows happened. I let the couch surfing Vegas group know it was m birthday and that I was buying drinks for anyone who wanted to party. Suddenly messages started pouring in. And I ended up meeting 3 ppl for drinks or coffee or breakfast. I only wish I was better prepared for Vegas and how it works there. The party could've started from the word go. It's an experience I can easily recommend to people. Have it at least once in life. As for me, I plan to experience again, soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: VladanT
Reviews.Content: Got a nice corner 'red room' on the 21st floor, no complaints. Spacious and clean. Restaurants in the hotel were great, especially the steak at Mon Ami Gabi.

Reviews.Title: “everything was wonderful be back soon”
Reviews.Author: violetbragdon
Reviews.Content: paris is first class.period! good slots ect.best resturants, effiel tower is superb!5 stars in my opinion. we were treated like royality!service is great!

Reviews.Title: “PARIS Las Vegas was a unique & lovely themed Casino/Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AuntBunny65
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paris Las Vegas for an Administrative Professional Conference. The service was good, the hotel was clean and for the most part staff was helpful and friendly. The Paris is perfectly located on the Strip and we enjoyed that as we walked up and down the strip a couple of times. We even walked to MGM Grand to catch the "Cirque du Soleil Show KA" which was VERY entertaining, fun and intriguing. I'm an optimist, and even though there were a few "dated" appearances in the hotel I thought the concept and decor was very unique and beautiful. I enjoyed my business trip but I did NOT enjoy the cigarette smoke on the Casino Floor! YUCK! So for all you Non-Smokers or people allergic to smoke, please remember that in Las Vegas SMOKING is allowed on the casino floor!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!! Would stay again and again!!”
Reviews.Author: Bree61
Reviews.Content: The Paris hotel is beautiful!! The night we arrived they only had a room that looked out into the back alley but they gladly upgraded us to another room the next day, we stayed on the 22nd floor in a corner room that had a double view!! It was awesome and so worth it, one side looked to the Bellagio fountains and the other side looked to the side of Planet Hollywood and MGM. It is smack in the middle of the strip and so convenient to get everywhere. The malls at Planet Hollywood were right next door with everything you need including an BC store for liquor. The room was huge with a very comfortable bed and the service was very good. We would absolutely stay here again. 5 stars for me!! The only thing I really noticed is that there was a small worn out rip in the carpet but if that's the only complaint then that's really picky.

Reviews.Title: “Good times at the Paris”
Reviews.Author: jcpKnoxville_TN
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights at the Paris on a business trip in March. Of course, I guess you could question whether you could keep any trip to Vegas purely business, but it was a good time. Not having been to Vegas since I was a kid (30 years ago), it was like never having been before. The Paris is huge. If you've been to Vegas recently, you're probably chuckling at the hayseed comment, but for those who haven't, it's meant to overawe you, and it works. The rooms are plush, and pretty comfortable. Lots of extra pillows, big comfy beds, and everything else you'd expect in a very nice hotel. The walls are a bit thin, so you may want to consider that your neighbors can hear you. The staff seemed pretty nice, and fairly helpful. They did their jobs, and pretty much knew what they were doing. In a place this size, it's almost impossible to expect personalized service. That makes it a lot tougher to judge. Public areas were amazing. They went for a french outdoor feel, and it feels surprisingly natural, from the architecture right down to the very high roof painted like the sky. The food was truly astounding. Don't expect $15 steak and lobster buffets. These days it's more like $38 buffets, but you get some pretty amazing food. The buffet here is, without a doubt, the best I've ever had. We tried the buffet at the Bellagio, and like this much better. The only place much better was the Eiffel Tower restaurant. Expect to pay a lot there, and have it be worth every cent. We had (arguably) our best meal ever there. The atmosphere and menu are high end french, so it's not for everyone, but we were 4 for dinner and loved it. The pool area may have been open, but with temps in the 50's we weren't really tempted to try it out. The casino is very large. Pretty much whatever your game, you can find it. If you're expecting a lot of comps, don't, unless you're a high roller. After 4 days of gambling pretty large amounts at a time, we couldn't get a meal for 1 person for breakfast. The Paris has a really good location. You've got lots of shopping, drinking, and dining options nearby. The Bellagio is directly across the street, so you have a wonderful view of the fountain show at night. There's easy access to the monorail. We liked the Paris a great deal. We may not be back to stay here, since we prefer a more reasonable comp policy, but at the very least we'll come back to eat!

Reviews.Title: “It was great.”
Reviews.Author: Mari046
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a red room. It was nice and comfortable. The maids did a great job. The staff were always very friendly. My children surprised me with a spa package. I had a sweetish massage. It was amazing. Treat yourself to one. We loved the casino, but the machines were tight most of the time. We would stay at Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed it and would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: thekites2011
Reviews.Content: My husband and I usually stay at Bellagio or Venetian but this time we stayed at the Paris Hotel which is where our friends wanted to stay. Needless to say, I was actually impressed with the condition of the hotel. Other reviews had commented about how out dated it was and it certainly had some elements of that but overall it was very nice and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, clean room & property, delicious restaurants”
Reviews.Author: dreamaui
Reviews.Content: We've been staying at Harrah's properties for years, but this was our first stay at Paris. We were pleasantly surprised at how clean the room & property were. The pool is large & beautiful. There is a big variety of delicious restaurants. The staff was consistantly courteous. We'll definitely stay at Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 70sgirl
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Paris hotel and upgraded to a room with a view - so glad we did! It was on the 22nd floor with a great view of the Eiffel Tower, pool area and Belligio Hotel. Watching the fountain show from the room was a treat. Rooms were very clean and a good size. Beds were comfortable. There is a charge for internet and use of the fitness center. I recommend looking for rates at priceline - they had the better rates from all the other places I researched. Book early for the best rates! We will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “HANDICAPPED SENIORS BE ADVISED”
Reviews.Author: MountainMomma1
Reviews.Content: If you are handicapped there are NO seats in the check in lobbies of MOST of the hotels.
