There are NO expedited Handicap Services for buffets, sightseeing attractions, and travelling the strip. The access elevators were closed forcing us to cross the strip in two sections, waiting at the median IN TRAFFIC until the light changed again!!! There needs to be MORE ATENTION to the needs of handicapped Seniors!!! Very few hotels have SEATING OUTSIDE where you can wait for transportation....This needs to be changed. In general long waits were a constant source of discomfort as I cannot stand for long periods of time......Be advised and ask for SEATING or HANDICAP ASSISTANCE. Some guests leave their manners at home...difficult to endure!!! Noise level of music is ear splitting even at the 26th floor level!!! Cabs fares vary in prices, seems to be no regulation...a trip around town can fleece you if you aren't sure where you are going. We had a really bad experience with Grey Line Airport Shuttle...avoid them!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Middletonlass
Reviews.Content: Lovely location, lovely ensuite room overlooking the front. Not the biggest casino but has the advantage of internal parisian style street with cafes, restaurants & shops. Joins onto Ballys Hotel next door. Great location in the heart of the strip with the Bellagio & its fountains opposite. Once off the casion floor the hotel is very quiet. We were on the 6th floor in a non smoking room. The only noise heard was from the pool music in the daytime. Only gripe no tea/coffee making facilities at all in the room.

Reviews.Title: “THE PARIS....JUST LIKE A MONET”
Reviews.Author: bcpixie
Reviews.Content: Just like a Monet alright - beautiful from a distance but a freakin' hot mess when you get up close! Check -In less than standard. Very impersonable. Area is so loud could barely hear what the girl was saying. Upgraded room at check-in-not so easy. Not sure all options were made avaiable. Book directly with Hotel for best rates (& better treatment).Had a red room, deluxe, smoking, view , 27th floor room, in short $$$$. Room was beautiful to look at (both of them) & the veiw of Belagio fountains EXCELLENT! Had to move rooms because walls are paper thin Could not take the TECHNO drug paprty next door so finally at 3am moved us to another room. No sound improvement but liked this neighbour's Bob Marley better than techno so tolerable. Bathroom door handle pulled of when went to close the door; floor lamp fell apart when I went to turn it on; buckles in the badly burned carpets everywhere; hot water absolutely reeks of sulpher. Good bed & nice TV though. Fantastic location on the strip - close to everything because there is minimal in the hotel. The bakery in the lobby is their best feature-understocked & over-priced "corner stores" in hotel - save your $ Walgreens is half a block away CASINO is typical nothing special or unique. You would think that at $200+ a night you would get a free ride up the Tower - WRONG! And that's crap. Pool isn't anything special & standard resort rules regarding deck chairs apply. If your space isn't marked with a towel by 8am you can forget about a chair for the rest of the day. Had access to some lounge on 31st floor. Had a lot of trouble with the keys for it so didn't use it fully. What was there was ....nice. All that said - would definitely stay again-location & view made it all worthwhile - but only for a couple of nights!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous pool, fab room, great location”
Reviews.Author: vixenbees
Reviews.Content: We booked on facebook using their FB rate (cheaper than the website rate) and got a Luxury Red Room with Strip and Pool View. From the pictures you'll see this view was amazing, looking over at the Bellagio fountains, Caesars to the right and the view of the pool was so beautiful. It is well worth paying the extra few dollars for. The room was spotless with cool paintings of Paris in the bathroom and main room. The chair is in the shape of lips! Couldn't have picked a nicer hotel and room..we almost booked PH and were so glad we didn't. Casino staff are really friendly. Mon Amie Gabi is good for the fountain view but food not worth the queue.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we chose Paris”
Reviews.Author: Green098
Reviews.Content: After much reading of reviews, we booked a red room at Paris for our first trip to Vegas. We loved it. The room was beautiful and the bathroom was spacious. And it was quiet and close to everything. I liked it that we didn't have to walk far to get to the room from the casino. The room service was great too. Check-in was pretty quick even though there was a long line and the express video check-out was great. We loved the breakfast buffet at Le Village. It had the best crepes and were freshly made. We weren't that impressed with the pastries though. We were pleasantly surprised to find a coffee maker in our room. We were under the impression there were no coffee making facilities so that was an added bonus. The fridge wasn't too cold but good enough to keep our drinks cold. We loved the pool too. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: maboscel
Reviews.Content: Guest check in area must be one of the most beautiful in Las Vegas. Our room was really nice, however, I'd say most all the room have a rooftop view unless you pay higher. We were on a lower level floor with a view of the roof of the casino - not too spectacular. But - the room was spacious and well laid out. The refrig had been emptied of the stuff you'd purchased, so we used it for personal items. The best thing about Paris is its location. You are at the center of the Strip and can walk to anywhere. The negative is that if you DO decide to drive anywhere, it's a long walk to the self parking area. We dropped our bags off before parking our vehicle. One other negative is that there is no security guard at the room tower elevators. We were headed down the hall to our room one night and a man walked by and then stopped us and gave us a story about losing his wallet and needing a bit of money. Anyone can be roaming those halls. The rooms carried noise more than others we've stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great”
Reviews.Author: WomenTravel22
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for my 50th Birthday. There was no hot water, I told the front desk and they were like did U turn on the hot water? They never fixed it. They did not put in clean towls and the room had a bad view. This was all because I would not pay the 54.00 nightly upgrade fee. Oh the food in the main Restaurant was worse than McDonalds.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Paris”
Reviews.Author: DZJaxFl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Paris 5/30/11-6/2/11. I arrived around 6:30pm, and the check in line was kind of long, took about 30 mins, but the staff was courteous and helpful. The room was very nice and clean (I had a Luxury room, #663). There wasn't much of a view, but that doesn't matter to me. All the amenities worked with no problem (hair dryer, tv, lights but there isn't a coffee maker). The bathroom was very nice with marble tile floor, countertop and shower stall (there is a separate tub). I ended up gambling elsewhere, but the casino always seemed lively and not smelly or smoky. The restaurants were usually busy. The pool area was clean and well kept and the waitresses were friendly and quick. There is also a Deuce bus stop in front. Overall, I had a very good time at Paris.

Reviews.Title: “exelant hotel we will b back”
Reviews.Author: momoo0
Reviews.Content: graet location, we asked 4 a room and got a suit, great service, clean, frisndly stuff, good food, no complains at all!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, but never forget you're in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaGirl40
Reviews.Content: My husband and our two children (13 & 9) stayed at the Paris as the kick-off to a 10-day trip around the Southwest. At check-in I requested a room with a view; our view was the gorgeous Eiffel Tower and the Paris pool, which was just beautiful! We ate lunch at The Creperie (wonderful) and ordered room service for dinner (excellent food). The service was just outstanding, from check-in to check-out. My husband is not one for bright lights, boatloads of people and gambling, so he was less than happy after about 3 hours. But we went for the experience (I've been to Vegas for work, no one else in the family had ever been there) and I prepped everyone as to what Vegas is really like. The kids loved being on the strip and loved everything about the Paris. The only negative: even though they do all they can to make the environment feel/smell smoke-free, it's still there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: EDW
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights at both the beginning and the end of our tour of the national parks. We had the standard (luxury) rooms both times, which we found perfectly adequate for our needs. The first room was a high floor refurbished red room with a view of another hotel. The one at the end of the holiday was one of the older blue and gold rooms on a lower floor, but it overlooked the pool and we could see the tops of the Bellagio fountains which was an unexpected bonus. We ate several times at Le Village buffet, which was fine, but we didn't enjoy the food as much as on previous visits to Las Vegas (to be fair we suspected that this was more to do with buffets no longer being such a novelty for us than with any change in the quality of the food). Having previously stayed at the Luxor, which we were quite happy with at the time, we appreciated the central location of the Paris. If you want luxury, then it is probably not the hotel for you, but if you want good quality without high costs we can recommend the Paris.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, small enough to navigate, large rooms”
Reviews.Author: higgins8294
Reviews.Content: it was our 4th trip to vegas so chose for convenience but was very pleased with the hotel. the room was very large with two large beds but best if all we were given a strip and pool view which was superb, could watch bellagio fountains. the paris is a smaller casino so is very easy to get around without getting lost. we stayed at mgm and thats huge ! rooms and decor are perfect was expecting it to be bit dated after some reviews but it was perfect, clean beautiful corridors and furnishings. very large conferences when we were there and they tend to make it look busy, they dawdle and its frustrating when you so much to see in a few days. pool area superb was never busy always plenty of sunbeds. only drawback is the "eiffel tower" blocks the sun so you have to move around but no trouble cos sunbeds available everywhere. staff were fine and parking no trouble. superb hotel and location in the middle of the strip opposite caesars palace and plenty of bars n restaurants around.

Reviews.Title: “Whole family got food poisoning from the buffet.”
Reviews.Author: studynan
Reviews.Content: Vomiting, cramps, upset stomach...that stole a whole day from our weekend birthday celebration. No one cared about it and I was charged over $138.00 for the meal. Then, the staff was condescending and rude until I told them I was a Diamond Club member. Then they begrudgingly answered my questions. Beware of the food at Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Wow - we loved the Paris”
Reviews.Author: blueskys41
Reviews.Content: First was check-in it was great , the lady was very nice and had a great smile. Then up to our room it was everything I had asked for , 2 beds, nice view, clean and quiet. We stayed for 5 nights had a wondeful time and did win a few $$. Food was great, drinks were good and lots, I even had to turn down drinks because it was gettig hard to see the slots !!!!!!!!!!! Would I go back - you bet a great place to stay. April) back again in May but due to a accident we did not stay at the Paris but did make it for dinner and a few games. Hope to make it back before the end of the year. I want to try the pool

Reviews.Title: “Upgrades, Comps, and Fun!”
Reviews.Author: wolverine160lb
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 3 nights at the Paris Casino in Las Vegas. The staff at the check in were some of the freindliest people I've ever met. I had originally had 2 free nights given to me by a family member. After check in, I had an extra nights stay (free) and the room upgraded to the P series suites. The P series suite I stayed in was on the 28th floor and had just about about every amenity you need. 2 bathrooms, fridge,whirlpool tub, huge T.V. etc... I wasnt even a rewards member at the time. Great place!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lksium19
Reviews.Content: My husband has always wanted to check out the Paris hotel and we were able to get a decent price through the Total Rewards program, so we chose this hotel for our short stay in Las Vegas. For me, Las Vegas is about relaxing by the pool during the day and catching shows/the casino in the evening. If you are looking for a quasi "relaxing" experience at this hotel, I would suggest you look elsewhere. My major complaint with this hotel is the pool and the upkeep of it. Two of the days we were at the Paris hotel we lounged by the pool. The staff onsite for this part of the hotel are a bunch of teenagers. The group that I witnessed both times were disengaged from providing "customer service" and acted more or less as statutes in the grand scheme of things. On both days I was by the pool, the staff in charge of the deck chairs would literally pick vacated chair groups up and slam them on top of each other over and over again. In addition to this, instead of tumble weeds rolling by on the pool deck, abandoned beer buckets would be blowing around and rolling everywhere. The staff was completely uninterested in picking up the area. It was disheartening to see really. In addition to this, the flow inside the casino, if you are staying there is terrible. You have to fight your way past lines of people waiting to eat, lines of people waiting to check in, lines of people rambling in and out of stores and the bar. I might have a better opinion of this casino had I not stayed there, but staying there makes me avoid the place at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “It was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: xmascurt
Reviews.Content: The check in was quick and we were upgraded to a tower view with no problem. The staff we very nice and helpful. The hotel was busy with a convention, yet the hotel staff were all cool and pleasant. The room was nice, clean and comfortable. The pool area was relaxing - drinks were pricey and you can not take outside drinks in...but you can purchase soft drinks at the pool shop, which are slightly less expensive. We were leaving late...and the hotel accomodated us by allowing us to stay until 5pm. Loved Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Intimate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Iszykat
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at Paris Las Vegas. We decided to return to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary. We stayed for one week and enjoyed every minute. The rooms are beautiful and immaculate. The cleaning staff does an excellent job and are very friendly and courteous when you see them. The Paris casino is a good size, where you won't get lost like at the MGM Grand and the other larger hotels. Their breakfast buffet is the best by far - you feel like you're really in Paris and I've been to Paris, France last year so I know what I'm talking about. Le Provencal is a wonderful restaurant and one of our favorites and we loved Mon Ami Gabi. There's no other hotel on the strip that I could care to stay at and we've tried several in the past 15 years. Paris Las Vegas is our very favorite and well exceeds expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great service”
Reviews.Author: LardyUK
Reviews.Content: This being my third trip to Vegas I was under no illusions that this hotel wouldn’t be on par with the Bellagio where we had stayed previously. That said I knew it was in a great location as I love the central part of the strip. On arrival I was offered an upgrade to a strip room view but declined as we had already decided we wouldn’t be in the room that often and would used the money for gambling instead. Booking in was very efficient despite it being busy and we were allocated room 563. The room had two queen size beds which were very comfortable it was spotlessly clean and had all the other comforts we needed including an empty mini bar which was utilised as a fridge (I believe this is common practice in the standard rooms). The view was rubbish as we looked over the roof towards a parking lot and a side view of Planet Hollywood but as I said we couldn’t care less. The casino was good fun here, well lit and good waitress service although it seemed a lot smokier than some of the others we went in. I found that all staff were very friendly and helpful here right through from the cleaners to the pit boss. The pool area had a plentiful supply of beds and you are given two towels on production of your room key. Cocktail service was also very good here and the waitresses were very friendly and would always stop for a chat giving you recommendations for places to go and see. Would I stay here again? yes if it was for a good location and comfortable stay for a good price, No if I was looking for luxury or romantic break. It is clearly a popular hotel with lots of guests on either vacation or conferences.

Reviews.Title: “Will Only Stay At Paris”
Reviews.Author: Loststooge
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at Paris 9 times in 8 years, we will stay no where else! Everyone is very friendly, yes there are newer and more expensive places to stay on the strip, but their is nothing like the experience you will get at Paris. We have never had a issue that was not taken care of, nothing is perfect, but at Paris it is a close as you will get. John Marc & Christine Marion

Reviews.Title: “not bad of a place”
Reviews.Author: thegame0810
Reviews.Content: First time staying at Paris. The hotel was nice, the room was ok. I did request a king size bed but they had none left, so we had to take two queen, The pool area is big and not crowed like the one at the Flamingo is. At the Flamingo sometimes it feels like you need to step over people to get to the exit area. The staff where friendly and check in was not busy at all.

Reviews.Title: “Still an excellent hotel choice”
Reviews.Author: BobHolmes
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Paris now at least six times over a four year period. Service has been and continues to be excellent. Includes check in, room cleanliness, service in casino and bars and restaurants, etc. We always have stayed in a standard room. They are always clean and professionally tended. Bathrooms the same. The rooms are spacious. Dated (as I have read here)? Well, I'm dated (68), and even though the standard rooms have not been recently renovated, they are still nice, and more than adequate for the amount of time we ( and you, probably) spend in them. Location of Paris cannot be beat. And the addition of the City Center stuff makes it even better. Mid strip, close to darn near everything. Mon Ami Gabi is still our favorite restaurant. The buffet for breakfast is still really good, but we did notice there seems to be less food choices than before (but really now, do we need more?). Hamburger joint between Paris and Bally's is excellent. We are not big gamblers, but the slots and video poker machines are OK, even though they still show a propensity to take your money. And, just a suggestion. Rather than book online, give them a call. We have always gotten a better deal on the phone. All in all, I have, do, and probably will continue to recommend Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure if I would return”
Reviews.Author: lovinglife12345
Reviews.Content: Check in was slow, staff members were not very friendly. House keeping was EXTREMELY rude, I called housekeeping as there was an issue in the hotel room, the housekeeping manager, Yvonne, stated she would send someone up. A couple of hours later, the repair person was still not present. I called back to housekeeping and the same employee argued with me over the phone. I was absolutely appalled. If a hotel wants to please its customers and have people return, then they need to be more respectful to the people paying the money to stay there. Overall I think the decor was very nice in the hotel, but due to the rude staff, long wait to check-in/check-out, and the inconvenience of the hotel check-in/check-out location, I don't think I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “good location, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: Aussietraveler01
Reviews.Content: good location, no complaints, well priced, nice pool area, rooms could use a tidy up but again I guess you get what you pay for. Do not use the greyline airport transfer. never arrived to collect us from hotel and had to pay another shuttle operator

Reviews.Title: “Shower lacking”
Reviews.Author: barjlaz
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights for an anesthesia conference. Bed looked lumpy, but was actually an ok sleep. Amenities in the room were lacking. Poor quality toiletries. Water pressure in shower was very poor. One of those water saver sprayers - you stand in the shower several minutes before you feel wet. Didn't try to wash my hair because of it. Uck! THe bathroom was very nice, all marble- separate tub and shower just not enough water to feel clean. We also found clipped toenails on the carpet. Taken care quickly by hotel staff when brought to their attention.

Reviews.Title: “Almost ruined my first trip to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: lilluci44
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vegas, and let me tell you, if you want the true American in France feel, stay here. I checked in wanting a room for 2 with 2 queens and they gave me a king. I called the front desk and spoke to Peter or Pierre, who told me that WE inconvenienced them because we checked in late. Explained I was sorry I couldn't get off work earlier to get there so I could get in earlier than 1 AM. I was lucky enough to spend my first night ever in Vegas on a cot! They were nicer to me the next morning to give me the room I needed, but didn't feel to compensate at all for the inconvenience to me. THEN, after I checked out, the next morning I received a text that my checking was overdrawn. Finally, it was figured out that I was nice enough to pay for someone else's room. I gave this hotel 1 star because it was rather beautiful. But I've never been treated rudely by any hotel before.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: shilee3
Reviews.Content: We loved the Paris!!! Clean, comfortable room, great location, great view, great buffet!!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: tc3trainer
Reviews.Content: Yikes you will go home with a weird rash after sleeping in one of their beds. Not to worry the hotel said, "it will go away within a week if you put an antibiotic cream on it". The hotel denies ever having bed bugs in their entire history and tells guests it is their imagination.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeff5555
Reviews.Content: After reading several less than impressive reviews, I was starting to doubt my decision to stay at this hotel. Happy to say that my stay was wonderful in every way. The staff was very pleasant. The room was exactly the one we wanted. Very clean and nice view. The casino, in my opinion, although small has the prettiest decorations and really makes you feel like you are outside in Paris. The food was great, except for the buffet (dinner) which was a little cold and over cooked. Mon Ami Gabi and Napoleon's are a must! I will be staying hear again when I come back in to town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Convenient Las Vegas Resort Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tonytigerjaz
Reviews.Content: I usually stay next door at Planet Hollywood. This was the first time for me to stay at Paris next door. It was great. I would rate Planet Hollywood equal to that of Paris. The location is great across from City Center. I especially enjoyed my lunch at Mon Ami Gabi over looking the Las Vegas strip across from the Belagio water fountain display on a sunny day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and awesome piano bar!”
Reviews.Author: Hotelsnob1997
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd stay at Paris. We come to Las Vegas every 2 years and we liked Paris so much we came back to them again! We stayed in the Red Room and although it seemed nicer than the standard room I don't know if it was worth it. The first time we came we stayed in a standard room, and next time I think we would continue with the standard room. I was a little disappointed because the carpet in the more expensive " Red Room" needed to be restretched, there were bumps and rolls in it at the foot of the bed. Also, they boast a red couch shaped liked lips... the couch wasn't red, it wasn't what we expected. We did travel with another couple that stayed in the same room and they had the same problem. We also visited the pool, it's nothing great but it serves its purpose. We had a private cabana that made the pool more enjoyable. I would recommend getting a cabana. We had our own lounge chairs, plus a TV and other table and chairs inside. We had a server and cabana girl that made sure we had everything we wanted. It was great, we ate lunch and bought several drinks all day long. The hotel has a crepe shop that is fantastic and we LOVE Mon Ami Gabi, the restaurant that has an outdoor terrace right on the Vegas strip. This is an awesome place to sit and have drinks and dinner every night especially if you like to people watch. FYI, they will not seat you until your entire party is with you, we wanted a table for 4 and they had it available but wouldn't let us sit down until our friends came back from the bathroom. Seemed a little ridiculous but we still waited since we enjoyed the food there . They also have Napolean's, its the dueling paino bar, That is one of the best things about staying at Paris. We love "Bill" he's the piano player with the shaved head. He is the best, if he's not working that night wait to go a night he is. He's funny and an outstanding player/singer. We came here 3 out of the 4 nights we were there. The location of Paris is fabulous too, it's right across the street from the Bellagio so you can watch the fountains and it's in the center of the strip. It has a great location.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay in Ls Vegas”
Reviews.Author: FemBusTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for the hardware show. Not sure who's mistake it was but long story short, had two rooms for my second night. Checked out of the hotel at 4 pm on the second day and asked to speak with the manager to see if I could at least get a coupon or something. They were extremely courtious and didn't charge me for the second night, even though I checked out at 4pm (a rarity in Vegas!). Never disapointed in this hotel. The food is always good. Reasonable prices at the restaurants and no matter where we stay, my husband and I always have breakfast t the St Louis restaurant. The best omellettes anywhere and great sour dough toast. Pancakes are wonderful also. You get a full pot of coffee at your table and it tastes great too. The rooms are nothing fancy but how much time do you spend in your room in Vegas. They're always clean and quiet. If you want a room with a view, you'll definitely have to pay for the upgrade. Again, not sure it's worth it with the amount of time you spend in the room and it's quieter in the rooms in the back. Last time we stayed we rented a cabana at the pool. Also recommended. Although pricey, it was a fun day with the kids and their friends. This is my preferred hotel in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Ooh La La!”
Reviews.Author: deemcintyre
Reviews.Content: Since I'm a Diamond Member, I got a great deal on my room. My husband and I went for our anniversary. He had pre-arranged to have flowers sent to me while we were there. We were upgraded before we even got there. We didn't have a strip view, but we had a wonderful view of Las Vegas and the mountains to the East. The room was a corner Red Room and it was very spacious and very clean thru out our stay. I can't say enough about the staff at Paris. Everyone said Hello or How are you and were eager to help when you needed it. The location is fantastic - very close to everything. You either walk or take the bus or the monorail. The restaurants were also fantastic - La Artiste Steakhouse was a fabulous choice for our anniversary dinner. This was our fourth trip to Vegas and our first at Paris - but we will definitely be back again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Where's my hot water and working TV”
Reviews.Author: barbara_2000
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter to Las Vegas for our birthdays. We stayed at the Paris Hotel because we had been there before and had a wonderful experience. This stay was not what we expected. Arrived at 9 a.m. on Tuesday, May 10. Decided to have breakfast before checking in. Went to check in at 10 a.m. and was told that check in was not until 10:30 a.m. and we would have to come back. We came back at 10:30 a.m. and was told our room was not ready but we could have another room that was ready on the 15th floor. We registered and went to our room. The room was spacious with two queen beds. All the amenities were there to make our stay comfortable. First about our television. We had a rental car so left for the day to return at 7 p.m. to find our television not working. In fact, it would not even turn on. I called Maintenance and a maintenance man was sent up a half our later. He said that he had several other TVs with the same problem. He decided that we needed a new TV and returned a short time later with a new one. He install it and an hour later we had a working TV. On Wednesday we left early in the morning and got back to the hotel about 3 p.m. and once again tried to turn on the TV. The TV would not come on. A maintenance man was sent up for the second time in two days. He decided that there were bad connections to the TV but was able to get it working again. HOT WATER: On Wednesday morning we got up at 6 a.m. and tried to shower. No hot water. It took 15 minutes of letting the water run to even get warm water. We showered and left for the day. Thursday, we got up and were able to shower with warm water after letting it run about 10 minutes. We had an early flight on Friday (6 a.m.) so I decided to shower on Thursday night to avoid getting up at 3 a.m. Friday to shower. At 9 p.m. the shower was once again ice cold. Even after 15 minutes there was no warm water. I went to bed thinking I could try again in the morning. I got up at 3 a.m. and tried to shower again. Once again “NO HOT WATER.” My daughter opted for the cold shower. I tried to access the Menu on the TV to check out and was unable to get the Menu channel. I followed the instructions left in our room about dropping the room keys off at the elevator lobby “Drop Box,” but found no “Drop Box.” I went to the Registration Lobby and waited in line at 4 a.m. to check out. While checking out I informed the clerk about the hot water situation. She told me that the boilers were located deep in the basement and sometimes when hot water was in demand or it was so early in the morning that it was hard to get hot water to the rooms. I found this hard to believe since at 9 p.m. at night the hot water had been running all day and at 3 a.m. how many people were trying to access the hot water. We could not even get hot water from sink. Hot water should be available all day long. I have stayed at the Paris Hotel before with no hot water problems. I am very disappointed with this stay at the Paris and will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely stay there again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: grammydbowlake
Reviews.Content: Great stay, great location, slots were pretty good!Ate at Sugar Factory,was very good.Did buffet at Bellagio,was excellent.Can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: corcrum027
Reviews.Content: I had been concerned about some of the reviews for this hotel before we travelled but I need not have worried. It was a smooth transfer between leaving the car to be parked and arriving in our room. We had been offered an upgrade at reception but had declined. Our room was large with two queen size beds and a large bathroom including shower and separate bath! The staff in the hotel, shops, restaurants and casino were very helpful. As with all casinos it is best to stick to the games you understand as hours of fun can be had on the low stake poker machines. We decided to treat ourselves to a special dinner in the Eiffel Tower restaurant where we enjoy great food whilst watching the Bellagio fountains. Also a trip to the top of the Eiffel Tower after dark gave a great view of the Las Vegas strip when it is fully lit up. We would definitely recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Repeat offender at the Paris”
Reviews.Author: James45_Orlando
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Paris before, and I told myself that I would not do it again. A conference brought me to LV and I stayed at the Paris yet again. The rooms have been upgraded and the pool is awesome. Service is fine and the casino is not smokey. I do not recommend the dinner buffet. Go to Ceasars for food. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Our first visit to Las Vegas was a memorable one because of our stay here”
Reviews.Author: NebraskaJack
Reviews.Content: Overall, much more of a great experience than we had anticipated. I will always recommend The Paris because of the way that we were treated during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed this time in hotel.”
Reviews.Author: pfknewjersey
Reviews.Content: Had issues with the pool- first 2 days they were painting in the middle of the day and we smelled the paint. You would think they would do it early in the morning? The 3rd day we got to the pool at 3:00 to find out that they were closing at 4:00 for a private party. They could have gave notice the day before so we could have gone to the pool earlier that day. I complained to the front desk and the manager said that have that choice. He was a little nasty about it.The last day we got to the pool early to find out that they do not open before 9:00. Others open at 8:00.The could have also had umbrellas and cold water available like the other hotels.Also, we paid to be upgrade to the suite which was great with 2 bathrooms- the standard room was pretty crummy.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: bms1973
Reviews.Content: I booked the Paris hotel through orbits and got a great deal for flight and hotel combo. My friends also came with us, we stayed in an older room not the new Red rooms but they were very clean and nice not much of a view but we were only there to sleep and the bed was very comfy. Our check in only took a few min. With no problems. When we were heading to our room we got stopped by a lady that said to come back to get free show tickets, warning, they are time share people trying to get you to go view their timeshare and waste a couple hours of your vacation. The inside of the Paris is beautiful, looks like you're outside with the clouds on the ceiling. We ate at the buffet one morning and it was very good many things to choose from. I never did see the pool, it was kind of cool anyways, but it would have been nice if it was open later than 6pm. If you want to see any stars hang out by the sugar factory or chateau nightclub. I also recommend renting a car, the strip is about 6 miles from one end to the other or more. I got blisters on my feet from walking soo much the first day. We went to the grand canyon skywalk one day it is about 2-3 hours away and the Hoover dam is only about 1/2 hour away, we had an awesome time there. I also did the stratosphere sky jump that was soo awesome, anyways the Paris is in the middle of the strip , very convenient. We had no problems there. Oh also go to the dialing piano bar, that was a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - Great weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Holidayfromcamberley
Reviews.Content: What can we say except VEGAS BABY! As 3 girls we had an amazing time. The hotel is in an excellent location, opposite the Bellagio and right on the strip. It made getting around really easy as we were literally in the middle of everything. Rooms were a great size with 2 x King Sized beds, lots of wardrobe space and a great bathroom. Pool was nice although given that you are surrounded by other tall hotels you have to move with the sun to avoid the shade! There is a casino at the hotel although we tended to head out to others ones which were a bit more dressy. You could get away with wearing shorts and t-shirts 24/7 but we wanted something a bit more. The hotel also has a walk way through into Bally's so if you don't want a themed hotel but still want to be right in the middle of everyone then Bally's could be a good option. The hotel is really close to Miracle Mile shops. We booked through Hotels.com and got a great rate. We went for Halloween Weekend and the whole place was buzzing. We loved it and will definitly be going back! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable - Pleasant Staff”
Reviews.Author: castaways01
Reviews.Content: A 6 night stay was booked through the Total Rewards club (5 nights were comped). I've stayed at the Venetian/Palazzo a dozen or more times in the past but wanted to be more centrally located this visit. Checked in around noon on a Sunday with a very pleasant and friendly front desk clerk. A $$ credit card sandwich netted a free upgrade to the Red Room (king) on the 29th floor. The room was clean and spacious with a view of the Planet Hollywood Tower. They are using the former mini bars as refrigerators (which was nice) and the room had a one cup coffee pot and flat screen TV. This was my first time staying at Paris and I was pleasantly surprised with the lovely room and clean hallways. Elevators were always quick and I never waited more than a couple of minutes for one. The location of Paris is very central and I probably walked miles on the strip - usually down to Venetian, Wynn to the north or City Center and Bellagio. Played at Planet Hollywood one day and walked to Mandalay Bay another time, stopping at several casinos on the way. Also used the Duece bus once - it stops between Paris and Ballys. I used the pool several times for short periods (1-2 hours at most) . They had lots of loungers and pool towels. I thought the cocktails were overpriced, but the service was good. The pool area was clean and the water refreshing. I didn't see any children at all as one reviewer mentioned. Maybe he was there during spring break (?). I paid for high speed internet and it worked well. I didn't have housekeeping come in to clean, however I exchanged towels and got more supplies from the girl out in the hallway. She was always accommodating and pleasant. The restaurants seemed packed (lines most of the time) so I usually walked elsewhere. I ate at the Harrahs and Flamingo buffets (Harrahs was just ok, Flamingo horrid), Aria, Wynn, and Grand Luxe at Palazzo a couple of times. I also ate at Studio B at the "M" on south strip one evening and it was awesome. I didn't like the Paris casino decor and layout. It was very loud, uncomfortable, crowded and felt claustrophobic. I did play some of the table games and slots, but opted to play elsewhere most of the time. Overall, I enjoyed the hotel and pool but not the casino. I would return, but only if I were in a Red room or suite.

Reviews.Title: “Far from the best”
Reviews.Author: OcalaGator
Reviews.Content: Paris Hotel was just ok. The rooms and food were very much overpriced. Have been to Vegas over 20 times with this being my first stay at "Paris". When I checked in I asked for a high floor... "40.00 more per night"... I asked about a view "50.00 more per night". My friend checked in 2 hours before me, payed the exact same and got a high floor with strip view for the exact same I paid . (I guess she just didnt like me !!) Oh well, Im going back to my favorites... Mirage, Monte Carlo, MGM Grand...... or Bellagio if you want to splurge.

Reviews.Title: “Good value on Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: Travellirpa
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vegas. I was awe struck by simply how huge all the hotels here are. I think that the other reviews I read before my visit were pretty much on the money about this place. The positives: Location - right in the middle of the strip. It's a perfect location for a first trip to Vegas. Price - facebook friend the hotel, by doing so you get in on facebook exclusive deals. By doing so, we got an incredible deal - 80 for wednesday night, 90 for thursday night, and 160 for friday night. But here's a tip - it does not pay to wait till the last minute. Travel companions waited and the prices (for all the hotels on the strip) skyrocketed to 2-3 times the prices we saw a couple months in advance. And the facebook rate was way better in advance too. Onsite eating options - so many to choose from! We ate at the Chocolate Factory American Brasserie for breakfast twice, and had dessert in the Chocolate Lounge one night. Very good! But had our favorite meals of the trip at the Wynn (best vegan options there!) Pool area - very nice, not too crowded, crazy view of Eiffel tower. it was very shady in the pool area which could be a negative or a positive... and servers for poolside cafe were wearing teeny tiny white string bikinis...which also could be a positive or a negative i suppose - but both of these go on the negative list for me. also never got served even though we sat there for a couple hours. finally had to go to counter to get our own drinks. Toiletries at the Paris were nice. I liked them. And the sink area was very nice. I liked the french country blue and cream decor. It just needs a little updating. In room safe was handy. A few negatives: Parking is way far away from reception desk. It's like walking through the mall of america to get from parking lot to reception. I do love how all the parking on the strip is free though! Signage could be better too. I seriously think they should consider having a check in desk closer to the parking area. It is very confusing. Although once we found the reception area, it was very nice and pretty and bright, gorgeous chandeliers. Front desk staff was very nice and helpful. There was a line, but they were good at moving people through quickly. Then it was another super long, long, long walk to the hotel elevators, which were also hard to find. I suppose this encourages people to use valet parking and bell hops. If you want to buy a bottle of wine from one of the shops in the hotel to enjoy in your room, don't bother. Wine selection is horrible. Strongly recommend finding the ABC store down the strip which had a surprisingly good selection of wines, and great prices. This is definitely where you should get your Vegas souvenirs as well. Room - we wanted a good deal, so we went with the standard room. The problem is that the good deal standard rooms are the ones that have not be updated. The worst part was in the bathroom, there is a shower stall, with a glass door. There is mold under the showerstall door, which when it gets wet, then gets onto the floor. Gross. I know the cleaning staff kept wiping off the mold from the floor, but it was still under the door. They need to clean under that shower door or replace it or something. This needs to be addressed. I know i've seen other reviews mentioning the same issue. Also the drain in the bathtub is rusted. Looks gross. TV in room is the old and small style. If i stayed here again, I would definitely pay for the nicer, newer rooms... i have heard the red rooms are very nice. Although, if i ever do go back to Vegas (it might be a while, i got a sinus infection from all the cigarette smoke everywhere, still recovering from that) but if i did, i would most likely try the Tropicana. They recently had a major facelift. My dad stayed there while we stayed at the Paris during this trip. I like that the parking lot was so close to reception and the elevators to the rooms. And even less expensive than the Paris hotel, just a block or so down the strip. Internet was expensive. $15 a day. We paid for the first day, then realized we could use our droid phone as a hotspot for our laptop. Our verizon hotspot via our droid worked great there. Surprisingly, cell service on our phones was not very good in the room. It was fine everywhere else in Vegas and in the hotel, just not in our room. All in all, for what we paid for our hotel stay, it was a great value. But if I do go to Vegas again, I might try some other hotels before staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place, beautifully done, but...”
Reviews.Author: Ioannisutah
Reviews.Content: The casino areas are amazing. Great restaurants and specialty shops everywhere. There are even real hookers on the 'Paris Streets!' :( Rooms every nice and comfortable. But... who charges for wifi? $15.00 a day! What hotel in the U.S. charges outrageous fees for use of the telephone? What major hotel only has 30 television stations - 5 of which are in Chinese/ 4 in Spanish? It shows no class to nickel and dime guests for normal and expected room amenities whilst you are ripping them off in the street level casino.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and overrated”
Reviews.Author: ktjf07
Reviews.Content: The staff was a bit rude when your a young couple. Of course everything is within walking distance. This place is amazing outside and the casino is very interesting, but the rooms are not that great. There was a huge pool, but was closed. The choice of restaurants are diverse and the prices are good for the porportions. The rooms are not very Parisian, but the restrooms are huge and elegant. The decor of the hotel and the casinos are interesting, but I don't think I will stay there again for the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “I give it a b+”
Reviews.Author: callahanha
Reviews.Content: I visited the Paris Hotel in Casino in late April and had a very nice time.Checking in at noon on a Wednesday afternoon was not a problem but we had to take a room farthest from the elevator. The room was small compared to most other Vegas hotels I've stayed in but the bedding was comfortable and the bathroom was large (seperate tub and shower) and clean. Housekeeping does an excellent job as there was no dust in the room and everything was spotless everyday. The pool area had some sun but the water was too cold to uses for any amount of time. There was plenty of chairs available and drink service was above average. The casino: Paris has a smaller casino than most and video poker pay schedules are not the greatest but I did manage to find a deal-or-no-deal penny machine that I played one night and turned $20 into $125. Dealers at the blackjack tables were kind of blah and did were not talkative at all. The best part of Paris was the excellent drink service by the cocktail waitresses. I never had to wait long for a drink during my 2 day visit. I did not eat at any of the restaurants but I did notice the Paris buffet which used to be one of the best in town did not even have a line at dinner time. Some people I met at the pool said the quality has gone down as they experienced cold, bland food. Another good thing about Paris is the parking garage. It is one of the easiest to get in and out of on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Not expecting it, but I was impressed!”
Reviews.Author: Tonya33
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at the Paris because this was the hotel given to us when we big through Priceline. I had read the reviews and seen the pictures and I was not impressed. To be honest, I almost wept when the "Your offer was excepted at The Paris Hotel" sign came up. I went in with a terrible attitude. So, the fact that I am writing a positive review should speak volumes in and of itself. The line was LONG for check in. But, to my surprise, it went fast. The room was better than what I had seen in pictures. No hokey decor. Ample Space. Spacious Bathroom. The service was friendly, attentive and helpful. Now onto the pool...the first day of our stay we went to the Mirage pool with friends staying there. They not to stay with us because they wanted a nicer pool for the kids. WELL, the Mirage pool was beyond packed. We crammed in like sardines (you could not move the chairs from their rows). At 10am we could only find 2 chairs for the 7 of us! The pool was cold and the service was scarce. The next day we all went to the pool at the Paris. Not as tropic looking as the Mirage pool, BUT we had room and lots of it. We had warm water. We had a server that we did not need to hunt down. It was GREAT! So, in conclusion, we were pleasantly surprised by what the Paris had to offer. And, next time I will not throw a fit when we stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Great food - upgrade to suite, if possible”
Reviews.Author: cruiserillinois11
Reviews.Content: I am not a Las Vegas fan, but conferences seem to take me there. I would recommend Paris. The food was fantastic - Mon Ami Gabi restaurant, pastry shop and quick breakfast place had spot on Parisian food. Buffet line was PACKED - lunch rush starting around 10:30am. Never got to try it, but they must be doing something right! Upgrade to suite was $50/night for my offer at front desk. Huge room ahd HUGE bathroom with separate shower - always a plus not to climb over the tub for a shower. Tub was a whirlpool. As much space in suite as my first apt. in Chicago. Well worth the extra $$. Housekeeping was slow to arrive on Sunday - lots of room changes going on, but a phone call (escalated to manager) had a housekeeper there in minutes. No comp for inconvenience, but a very small inconvenience. Parisian music in elevators - Nina Simeon constantly with a little Maurice Chevalier thrown in. Public areas are cobblestone streets with small shops - Parisian in a Disney-esque way. Lots of people walking around, not so many gambling. Lovely sports bar at Paris, but a hike from the room elevators to get there. Caesar's seemed the best for table action.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nice with Upgrade”
Reviews.Author: clairhas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paris hotel this past April and it was a nice hotel with lots of atmosphere. My mom and I got an excellent deal on Southwest Jackpot Deals. I asked for a complimentary upgrade upon check-in which they didn't have, but they did offer me a room with a fantastic view of the strip which I enjoyed day and night. for an additional $300 which I can't believe I paid, but to me it was worth it just for the view alone. I attached a picture of part of the few from our room and to the right (not in this picture) was Caesars Palace. Breakfast and happy hour (daily) in the Concierge lounge came with the upgrade which really did save on the cost of meals. Their breakfasts consisted of fruit, cereal, bagels, salmon, croissants and pastries plus fresh squeezed orange juice and a coffee machine that made any type of coffee you could think of. For happy hour they offered cold boiled shrimp and other foods that you could make a meal on plus this wonderful selection of desserts. Our bathroom was a nice size with a walk-in shower and a separate bathtub. The only complaint I would have is the towels and wash clothes they provide were very rough and not at all soft. Plus the pillows they use on their beds were the worst pillows I have ever seen in a Vegas hotel room so was really surprised at that and wish I had complained. Obviously they don't care about your sleeping comfort. Plus I got some kind of weird breakout on the third day I was there and first thought it was bed bugs but didn't see any so I chalked it up to the soap or shower gel in the bathroom they provided. I have read past reviews about the casino constantly filled with cigarette smoke and this was very true. This is my fourth time to Vegas in a year's period and I would vote their casino the worst when it comes to extremely heavy cigarette smoke compared to the other casinos on the strip. We did have a power outage for a few hours while I was there and the elevators were down so you couldn't even get to your rooms. We did see a few shows at other hotels which I would recommend - the Beatles Love show at the Mirage was excellent and we saw Rick Thomas Magic and Tigers show at the Sahara, but the hotel is getting ready to close very soon so if you are going to be in Vegas the first week of May I would recommend going over to the Sahara one last time. We ate at Mon Ami Gabi located in the Paris hotel which was excellent. Be sure to walk over to Serendipity and try their frozen hot chocolate - it was so good! I plan on coming back to Vegas end of this year and unless this hotel had an excellent deal where I didn't have to pay extra for the view and got better pillows, I probably won't stay at this hotel again. It is a shame that they charge you so much to get a nice view, but I would definitely recommend this hotel for the variety of french restaurants they have.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, accomodating staff, will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: DFranczak
Reviews.Content: We had a comped room for 5 of the 7 nights we stayed. Our room was on the 4th floor, with no view so we requested and received an upgrade for 50/night. Well worth the price. The view was great, the room was spotless and the housekeeping service was excellent. We had a bit of trouble with the TV and it was rectified right away. We found the bed very comfortable. I do wish the pool area was laid out a bit better in order for the sun to hit it earlier in the day at this time of year, but other than that, we have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “I was very disappointed in the way my friends where treated"”
Reviews.Author: Vegaschick11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned a vacation to Las Vegas with another couple. We all had "free" rooms with our total rewards cards. My husband & I have stayed at Paris numerous times and have always enjoyed the location. My friends seemed more interested in another hotel/casino but trusted our suggestion. First of all, they where strong armed into "upgrading" their free room to the "Concierge Level" They tried to used their upgrade a couple of times for breakfast but the staff was very rude. Also, their "upgraded" room had a plumbing problem. they took a shower in 6 inches of backed up water for several days. They reported it to maintenance twice. When they checked out, they asked not to be charged for their " upgrade". They where treated like liars and cheats, told they never reported the problem and that the manager did not believe there really was any problem. Both their room and ours was shabby and in much need of updating. Because my husband and I have stayed at Paris about 7 times in the past, it was a huge embaressement for us!! I don't think we will recommend Paris again, nor will we stay there. Beware for the expensive upgrade to concierge level!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Buffet, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: angiebabytraveller
Reviews.Content: Food First.....Best in the Strip. Hotel is quite nice though next time I'd stay at Caesar's so there will be shopping at the same time. Any hotel hopping will cost taxi fare of 22 dollars more or less each way, so its quite expensive going back and forth anywhere in las vegas.Use the coupons they give you upon check in.

Reviews.Title: “The Paris has great location, great staff, lots of pool area and good for conferences.”
Reviews.Author: Hummingbird303
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about the staff! From Jenny at the front desk, to Chuck, John, Mike, the Lunch Servers in the meeting rooms, Leon and the Bellman that help with my luggage. I happen to be on crutches and everyone offered to accommodate. The restrooms are funny with the french conversations basically "what happens in vegas stays in vegas". One of my colleagues had an issue with a room and the manager was not so accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: nanners15
Reviews.Content: I am the kind of person who reads reviews to know good and bad. This trip I didnt get to cause the hotel was picked by a group of friends. But I felt the beds were so comfortable, great to cuddle in when hungover =) Room was clean the workers always said hello when in passing. Only problems I had with the hotel was one neighbors were fighting and could hear almost everything granted they were screaming other then that we didnt hear them. Also, when traveling I like getting all the flyers coupons that most hotels have of the surrounding area. I couldnt find one in our hotel granted it is a place of elegance but definately looking for flyers and only ones i would find were outside of the hotel. Plan to stay here again next trip. But loved the hotel overall.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but nothing great.”
Reviews.Author: Hanson111
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at a different hotel on the strip with friends, then had to get my own room for the last night. I found a great rate through Total Rewards for Paris. I was basically just looking for a place to sleep and in that regard, Paris was adequate. The lobby, check-in area, casino, and grounds were nice. The legs coming through from the Eiffel tower were cool. The room was average. Average size, nice TV, decent bathroom. The entertainment unit had the closets built into the sides and the large unit kind of overtook the room. Also it forced them to mount the TV really high which made it a little bit awkward to watch. I ended up spending my time at a different casino/hotel and just coming back to sleep. If I could get a rate as good as I did, I may stay here again, but I would definitely check out some other options before I booked at Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay at known hotel”
Reviews.Author: vickzz
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris with friends to celebrate Christmas in Las Vegas and I was pretty excited to have stayed at one of the best hotels. We had specifically requested for a room facing the Bellagio fountains but when we reached we were disappointed to see that we got a room facing the other side. We had a suite and a double connected room but suite did not get ready until next 2 hours of check in. The casino at Paris is always bustling with visitors but is a decent one as they allow you to play small bets too. Though quieing up for breakfast in the morning was a big turn off and we opted to eat out always.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: KarenMG_10
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised to see this hotel gets good reviews because I wasn't impressed and I don't plan to stay here again. The negatives - The beds are hard, the pillows and bed linens are worn out and the carpet in the room was either dirty or just in need of being replaced. There was a mini bar but it was completely empty. The rooms really need updating. The pool was warm one day but very cold 3 other days...too cold for kids to stay in the water for very long. The pool water wasn't dirty but lots of dirt and leaves settled to the bottom and on the stairs. The pool staff was rude to the adults and the kids and I think they need to be reminded that they are employees who should be meeting the needs of the guests, not the other way around. The positives - Great location and good restaurants - especially Mon Ami Gabi which has great food and a view of the Bellagio fountains. The Sugar Factory is a fun place to get sweet treats and the food in the restaurant was good. The Parisian theme is also done well. Also, both early check-in and late check-out were available.

Reviews.Title: “Better hotels out there for the money”
Reviews.Author: Loriwisconsin
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at the Paris Hotel and I was disappointed with my room. There was a stain in the carpet and the bed was very hard and uncomfortable. I woke up with a backache every morning. The bathroom was the best part of the room. It was nice and big with lots of mirrors. I liked that there was a tub and separate shower stall. Although the room was non-smoking, the casino and lobby were smoke-filled and I had to keep going outside for some fresh air. When I got home I was coughing for days because of all the smoke. Not good if you have asthma. Service at the hotel was average, not all were friendly and the wait time was long. The arrangement inside was nice. The hotel gave you a feel of being in Paris. For the money I could have stayed at a nicer hotel and probably will my next trip. They also will not offer you any free upgrades when celebrating a special event like other hotels have done for me in the past. You have to pay more if you want a view of the strip. Overall I would rate the Paris hotel as average compared to alot of the other hotels on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “My New Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: RanMan07
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Paris for the first time April 24th thru 27th. Check in was very smooth & quick, received a Red Room on the 25th floor. The room was very nice & clean. It had a large flat screen tv, clock radio with a dock for your I-pod and a small refrigerator. Bathroom was nice in size and featured a tub and seperate stand up shower. Bed was very comfortable as well. The location of this hotel is fantastic, just about the center of the strip. One thing I really love about this place is the short walk from the elevator to the strip. The pool area is actually located on the 3rd floor, it's decent in size with plenty of loungers to go around. It's not one of the best pools in Vegas, but it's fine by my standards. The casino itself is easy to navigate thru and features some great restaurants. The Piano Bar is alot of fun as well as the new Chateau Nightclub. The Eiffel Tower is a must do, the view at the top is fantastic. Another plus about Paris, it connects to Ballys via an inside walk way that features shops and dining. This was my 12th trip to Vegas and I've stayed at Mandalay Bay, MGM, New York New York, Mirage & T.I., Paris will now be my hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Vegas,Spend a lot expect more get less”
Reviews.Author: FrankfromSanDiego
Reviews.Content: To be fair I am not a fan of Las Vegas. I typically stay here on the way to or from somewhere because it is a good distance from Southern California to stop on the drive home coming back from vacation.I always stay on or near the strip because lets face it that is the only thing is Las Vegas worth seeing. Otherwise it seems to be a town of nearly homeless people working menial jobs and people who have never been to Las Vegas here to get a photo in front of their favorite landmark. The city is just depressing, and I am no feminist but it is wholey disrespectful to woman, if you have a daughter just stay out of the city entirely. Ok, so you can see that I have some bias. So I flew into the airport and got a cheap 6.50 shuttle on the Grayline just outside doors 12 and 13 by the baggage clain, very quick and easy. I get to the hotel and am dropped off in what appears to be a loading zone at the back of the hotel. I get to wander through a maze of half empty table games to eventually find check in. Check in lack lust. I am informed that wifi is billed per device, so you smart phone is 14.99 a day and so is your laptop for wifi. Luckily that is paid for by y organization. I am upgraded because I feel I might fall off the wagon and ask for a smoking room. I eventually find the elevators after wading through the ever present herd of people that is Ls Vegas. Lets be honest there is NOTHING to do here so mainly people wander aimlessly about. I find the elevators and get to my room. Typical room, same thing you would find at super 8 or any cheap motel. 2 queen beds. The bed has a duvet and sheet on it. The cover on the duvet has stains and has obviously not been washed. The decorative pillows have stains and have obviously not been washed. The "Free TV" on the tv menu has about 30 channels of your most basic cable. Much less than most cheap motels. The fidge is empty and warm. The furniture in the room looks old and worn, lots of nicks and she bathroom has not been wiped down, there are water stains and dried, formerly sticky puddles on the sink. The Shower has already unwrapped soap in it from the previous guest. It basically looks like and old room in an inexpensive hotel which in addition has not been cleaned. This is typical of Ls Vegas, beautiful giant buildings full, of tiny, dirty hotel rooms. Paris was no exception.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back real soon!!”
Reviews.Author: DarrenN69
Reviews.Content: Great facility and I highly recommend this to anybody wanting to stay in a great location with large spacious rooms with all amenities and very reasonably priced. Staff were very friendly and obliging and was given a room upgrade without asking. No problem with an early check in either. I will have no hesitation coming back to Paris Las Vegas on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, but theres always a catch”
Reviews.Author: jtventilator
Reviews.Content: First of all, let me say thanks to our total rewards membership our rooms started out free. But if we wanted the "Strip View" rooms we requested.....it only cost an extra $50 per night. Now that wasn't all bad, you did get a couple of free drinks between 5 and 8pm, and a "Continental Breakfast". What was strange....you had to go to the 31st floor in a different wing...in what was surely a hotel room converted for entertaining. Our rooms were fine. The food downstairs was great. And I left the casino a winner...so I really can't complain at all. but our free rooms cost $200.00 each for the three nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Okay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frostdogs
Reviews.Content: The good: Location is about as in the middle of the strip as you can get. Easy access to just about anywhere you'd want to go. Check in was a snap, even though we got in about 11 in the morning. We thought the "concept" of Paris was very well done. It's got our most loved restaurant, Mon Ami Gabi, right in it too. It's not a huge place, which we liked. It's still really large compared to anywhere outside of Vegas, but for Vegas it's a medium sized place. It's right on the Strip too. Some of the new and larger places make you walk forever just to get off the property. The bad: What's up with the Red Rooms. Okay, we are Vegas regulars so got comped our room. We paid the $40 / night extra to get the Red Room. The website makes these rooms sound like your getting something amazing. First, there was hair in the shower . . . and we hadn't showered yet. Second, there is a fridge in the room . . . and its empty. Okay, I'm the kind of guy that, when in Vegas, I don't mind paying $6 for a bottle of water. If I come in my room around midnight, I love to just grab a bottle of water or maybe some chips (even for $5 a bag). But the fridge was empty. Hey, Paris, load those suckers up and make some money!! And I just don't know what was so special about the rooms. By all accounts, the bed, carpet, the view, the A/C, the TV, whatever, it was just a normal room. It was windy one of the days we were there. Totally sunny, about 85 degrees, and the wind was blowing about 20 mph but gusting to about 30 mph. They closed the pool at 2 p.m. Yeah, in Vegas, for us, there's only so much to do. Gamble, eat, drink. And during the day, unless you want to get drunk all day and make a mess of yourself (which isn't unheard of for us), there's not much to do but sit by the pool. AND THEY CLOSED IT. They said it was too windy. Totally lame! Everyone in the whole pool area (about 100 people) was upset and couldn't believe it. Yeah, we may stay here again. And maybe the non-red rooms are totally disgusting. I just don't know what we paid for. The good may outweigh the bad.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to work on customer service for some of their employees.”
Reviews.Author: datamaze
Reviews.Content: There was a problem in my room and maintenance told me I would need to change rooms. I went to the front desk to leave my cell number for them to reach me when a room was avail. Oh my gosh....the woman was so rude. She actually said to me that it was a little too early in the morning to be requesting a room change. I explained to her that maintenance told me that they would need to cut a hole in the wall to get to leaking pipes that caused the carpeting in the room to be soaked. She asked what I had done. WHAT????? Are you kidding me? NOTE TO MANAGEMENT: Perhaps your employee could have said something like; "so sorry for any inconvenience this might have caused you".

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Weebentherdunthat
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly & accommodating, room was clean and the bed was comfortable. On the down side the walls are paper thin! A normal conversation taking place in the hallway sounds like they are in your room!! Check in and out was great, no problems there. Food quality gets a thumbs down with the exception of The Sugar Factory, the food and service was great and they ARE open 24/7. When I research a hotel to stay at one of the criteria I look for is a nice little restaurant or cafe the is open 24/7 and was very disappointed to discover that while advertised the St. Louis Cafe is not open after 10:00 or 11:00 pm. Also they pool was closed due to inclement weather, it was 80 degrees and sunny although it was a bit windy but not inclement If you are just looking for a great location it's ok, but in my opinion there are better deals on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL ... BUT..”
Reviews.Author: AndreasMam
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 days for a convention with more than 3000 colleagues! Arrived with taxi straight to the reception, unbelievable queue, got along pretty fast. We were amazed by "paris" look of the halls, the casino and everything. It's just like walking in the streets of PARIS !!! French music as well , made the atmosphere just like in Paris! Convention rooms and ballrooms are unbelievable, very nice and clean, and most of all HUGE!!!! :) Location location location, right on the strip opposite of my favorite Las Vegas strip attraction BELLAGIO Fountains!! Great restaurants nearby as well!! BUT... service was not as friendly as i've seen in other places in USA or in general the well known american service. My calls were 100% on hold for long time, and with that i would like to mention about the restaurants and food services in the hotel. Compared to the hotel's capacity... THEY ARE NOT ENOUGH!!! You must wait AT LEAST 20 min before you get a table or any kind of sandwich or whatever. THAT was my "BUT" on the title review. Thousands of people, very few eating options inside the hotel. Packed, JAMMED crowded hotel 24/7 , so we could NEVER eat when we wanted. There were ALWAYS 24/7 long queues for any kind of food or small kiosks . Rooms are very nice with great beds. Overall we loved the Paris hotel, its atmosphere, its style, its location!!! Avoid it IF the queues for food bug you. If you are a queue person, then you'll really love this Paris-Style hotel !!!

Reviews.Title: “Average room”
Reviews.Author: broncofan15
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and spacious, the bed was average, no big deal. The hotel is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Really felt like I was in France - rude staff, horrible conditions”
Reviews.Author: k_nurse99
Reviews.Content: You think you are going to stay in a five (or four based on some web sites) hotel? Think twice! Horrible conditions! Staff is rude from the registering clerk to a waiter in the buffet! Only couple of nice accommodating staff members in the Concierge. Not enough staff at the Valet area or check in area with longest lines i HAV EVER SEEN TO PARK AND TO REGISTER! Rooms are small, furniture old, TV is from 1980th! Everything looks like was gotten from the second hand store. Mattress is so horrible, it keps bouncing (which I guess was good when trrying to get your toddler to fall asleep), Not accommodating to handicapped people!

Reviews.Title: “Great central location for exploring the strip!”
Reviews.Author: D_KNottingham
Reviews.Content: This is one of the more affordable hotels in Vegas, that still has a good location. Some of the hotels on the outskirts of town I'm sure are much cheaper but are extremely dated and a good way out i.e. Circus, Circus, Sahara. The 'Parsian feel' is a little bit tacky, but then this is vegas. The room and bathroom were a good size, and were well maintained and clean. The only annoying thing with our room was the adjoining door to the next room. This meant that we could hear our neighbours quite a lot! We eat in the Eiffle Tower restaurant which was quite expensive but very good - great views of the strip and the Bellagio's water-fountains. There are more exciting looking casinos in Vegas, but the one in the Paris served its purpose.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: KarenD20
Reviews.Content: They were verey friendly and helpful. The shops and the resturants were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Hotel is showing its age”
Reviews.Author: NashvilleTNGuy
Reviews.Content: No room to complain when you have a comped room, but for the sake of a review.... The Good: - Location! You really can't beat it. Easy walk to all the big casinos or to the monorail. - Staff. I had no problem with the staff or their courtesy. Everyone was fine. Nothing out of the way, but nothing bad or rude. - Room 848 was big and clean. Only complaint was that it was on a low floor in th back so we got the parking lot but no complaints since it was free. Had a safe, good shower, comfy bed. - NO resort fees even if you are not comped!!! - The pool is not a super luxurious place, but it is big, plenty of chairs and a cool view of the tower, balloon and cosmo in the distance. The Bad: - It's just starting to show it's age. The walls are a little dirty, the wallpaper is peeling off in spots, the carpet is worn. By no means is it a dump when when you walk across the street to the Bellagio, Paris feels old and nothing special. - The bagel breakfast sandwich from the quick cafe next to the crepe place was $9 and not good I'd stay here again a thousand times if it is free. If I have to pay, I may go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas Paris Hotel Casino”
Reviews.Author: DebbieTS
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at Paris Hotel last week. This was our 2nd time there. We will definitely return. We love the hotel and the staff. We didn't have any problems. Everyone was very nice. We highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Jambo069
Reviews.Content: Yes the decor was a bit dated and some cosmetic work is needed in the rooms and the halls but really how much time do you want to spend in your room. IT IS VEGAS BABY!!!! I would like to have more comfortable mattresses in the rooms but overall I would have no qualms about staying there again or recommending Paris to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “There was nothing good about the Paris except the view from my room and leaving”
Reviews.Author: CocktailsAtSunset
Reviews.Content: I had read so many reviews about Vegas hotels before going and picked the Paris thinking it was one of the upmarket hotels and that for that extra quality and service I wad prepared to pay a premium. sadly, the service was non existent throughout my entire stay, the room was clean but untidy in areas and a little disheveled and lifeless and decorated entirely in this awful pale mustard collie that made me feel ill. The one positive I have to say is that the view from my room wS exceptional: of the Eifel Tower, Bellagio, Cesars and v the pool. However, after the lady at check-in failed at her hard push to get me to pay hundreds of dollars go upgrade to a suite she told me a million times that she had upgraded me to a room with a view for free and one thankyou from me seemed not enough. Perhaps she was badgering me for a tip not she did not get one. This was after she had rudely told me that the king bed room I paid for in full months in advance in non smoking was not available and that all she could offer was 2 x doubled beds in smoking and I said this was not acceptable. Her initial response was basically deal with it and she even said 'your booking is only a request and we don't guarantee to give you anything on there'. I explained to her that such Bait and Switch approach is quite illegal and that there is nothing in the terms and conditions stating what she is claiming. After being forced to lug my 3 bags all the way through the casino and lobby to check in (no porters, no doorman) this was enough for me to never return. Others things that make this hotel a disappointment and not 4 star: not kettle and comp teas and coffees as is the norm of proper hotel; very old tv with malfunctioning volume; no guide at all to hotel in room except brochure trying to get me to pay for spa treatments and when I did call to ask about pool to reception staff was so rude and said the phone was all crackerly but made no Attempt to fix it; towels very hard and dry; pool only open 9-6 and barely heated; no spa or sauna at pool. no idea about fitness centre as I did not dare go and injure myself and be trapped at the Paris any longer than necessary. I could not recommend this hotel go anyone and suggest if you want style and sophistication go to the bellagio (the check-in is right at front door and floral display spectacular) or go to a $25 a night budget hotel on the strip and you will not mind a crappy room or service as you are saving your $ to go out and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: linxey
Reviews.Content: Good location. No hot water in the bathroom. I called maintenance and they didn't tell us they couldn't fix it until I called hours later to fine out. Had to go to front desk twice to get room keys for a new room. They should have brought the keys to us. Then in the new room there were no light bulbs in the lamps. We were offered no compensation for the trouble. The customer service in the restaurants were also bad. We waited for ever to get drinks and our bill at the end.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: hhwife
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the paris for our anniversay for five nights, we arrived before ten oclock in the morning, and our room was available, we received a red room with a fantastic view of the fountains and the eifel tower and pool area. the room was immaculate. we ate at mon a mi gabi for breakfast and dinner, quality of food was suburb and the service was excellent, i cant say anything bad about the hotel or the service, from check in to check out everyone was very polite and helpful, i have stayed there several times, i had not been there in a year and half and was concerned about some of the bad reviews, but i can honestly say i dont know where those people are getting the bad reviews from, i will be staying at the paris the next time i go without a doubt

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: toinfinity
Reviews.Content: old and outdated hotel, needs a paint inside and out. we paid $300 a night and it was far from worth that money. gamming is also very outdated. its the place to stay if your over 50 and just want to plod around. if your under 50 stay somewhere a bit more hip (which would be anywhere)

Reviews.Title: “Jaded employees set the tone for poor service at this once stellar property.”
Reviews.Author: Matt_from_Chicago
