Reviews.Content: I'm very disappointed in my stay thus far at this once grand property. I am here two more nights and I would switch hotels if not for the conference I am attending. Shuttle dropped me off at a side entrance all the across the casino from the front desk. No bellmen in that area, so I dragged my luggage across thick carpeting and cobblestones to reach the front desk. Tried to check in, but no rooms avail. Bellman told me where to go in the public area of hotel for free WIFI while I waited for my room, but when I went to the designated place it was not available. Offered a handicapped accessible room to expedite room readiness, had to check back three times over a couple hours and then was assigned a different (ready) room Approx 2 hours after arrival. Front desk and concierge have been nearly the only employees with a positive attitude I have encountered here. Otherwise, bad attitude has been rampant. Walking down the hall alongside a room inspector from housekeeping, she told me how tired she was and how much she did not like her job! My room needs minor maintenance. Mini bar is completely empty. I tried to shut the bathroom door and the knob came off in my hand. Hole in the bathroom wall where something was previously attached. Marks on the bedroom wall that should have been corrected.  Considerable amount of mold in the shower. Desk chair very uncomfortable. Room does not cool down adequately. Alarm clock is completely off, yet makes a loud static noise about every 40 minutes (I unplugged it and am calling maintenance). Gym closes at 7pm and pool at 6pm, despite LV being a 24 hour city. Food has been good thus far. However, I tried to go to the popular buffet, but after waiting about 30 minutes it was clear I had another hour to go, so I left for another restaurant. Staff thus far has generally been jaded and brusque - but I hold out hope for a little more humanity in the hotel and restaurant personnel. The spa needs a good cleaning and the workout room has some weight lifting and aerobic equipment, but could and should be better appointed for $25 per day. Over all, not a good experience. There are so many nice and new properties on the strip to choose from. I wish I had made a better choice. Matt M.

Reviews.Title: “Great location lousy hotel with very rude staff”
Reviews.Author: brendine
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in numerous Las Vegas hotels. This was my first (and last) visit to Paris. Desptie a great location and some fine dining options the rooms and service are horrible, and no free wifi $15,00 per day (obscene) Other options like the Mirage, Treasure Island, the Venetian, , MGM Grand, Aria, Bellagio, and Ceasers are better choices with modern amenities and friendly staffs. It is worth a few extra dollars to sat anywhere but the Las Vegas Paris hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can take the reservation, just can't hold the reservation”
Reviews.Author: Echlin
Reviews.Content: The check-in clerk wasn't very polite or helpful. We had reserved 2 rooms, both king sized beds, with coffee machines, one non-smoking the other smoking. They said they although we had reserved those rooms they were only available for an additional $40 a night for the king beds and $40 a night for the coffee machine, so $80 a night for what we had already reserved. We were told there reservation system works on the "first come first serve basis". Then after hearing a complaint from a women in line about having to change her non-smoking room twice to get one that didn't have smokers on it. So I asked the clerk "if he was sure the non-smoking room was non-smoking" he answered me with a "why do you care you smoke" shocked at his ignorance I just mumbled something about knowing that my friend in the non-smoking room hated the smell of smoke. The room we hadn't reserved was looking out on to the gravel roof of the lower level of the hotel and the side of another hotel, we just left the blinds closed for the 5 days. Although it was down season (January) and we were honeymooners there was no upgrades or any special extras just the view of the roof. Romantic yeah!! Only good thing I have to say about the hotel is it does have a great location on the strip and the room service food and prices (food) were great. Try the Philly Steak sandwich, delicious, only thing I would return to the Paris for. My husbands mother and cousin are both going to vegas in the next couple months and we told them both NOT TO STAY AT THE PARIS. It was disappointing because it wasn't just our honeymoon it was the first time my husband had ever really traveled and was really looking forward to the kings treatment we were told we would get at the Paris. I have done alot of traveling and told him this is bad business and not typical treatment when you stay at a 5 star hotel. This is 2 star treatment. And the 2 stars are being kind.

Reviews.Title: “Not the City of Lights, but enjoyed Paris LV.”
Reviews.Author: Baron45
Reviews.Content: My buddy got some comped nights at Paris, hence I got excellent value! The room was on the 30th floor with views of Planet Hollywood and Cosmopolitan. The room was average in size but had a big flat screen TV and a fridge which I was not expecting. For a busy hotel, bell hop and car valet service was quick. The one drawback for us was the Strip traffic. Having rented a SUV for golf, it was a nightmare trying to get to the hotel from I-15 around 6pm.

Reviews.Title: “Think About It”
Reviews.Author: SYD-LHR
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Qantas.com. Was very average for a hotel of its class. There were the previous guests nail clippings on the bed when we arrived, the room needed a good dusting, the mini bar had been removed and the shower was poor. It made a lot of noise and seemed as though heaps of water was coming out you never got properly wet. All the staff were rather rude especially the concierge. The only exception was the lady who checked us who was very warm and friendly. On the up side the hotel is in a great location, the rooms were nice and quite and the hotel had everything available from restaurants, kiosks to the casino. Just be prepared.

Reviews.Title: “Good not great”
Reviews.Author: mattnamyl
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, not great. Rooms are very dated, I was fine with the French decor, not so fine with the old rug, faulty toilet & suspect stains on the couch. Oh, and by the way, We stayed in a suite. That being said, we didn't spend much time in our room, the gambling area is decent but somewhat small, compared to the larger casinos. Restaurants were good, we didn't eat at any of the high end places but Le Burger Brassiere was fantastic. Overall,the place was clean, service was good, and food was average but no comparison to other high- end casinos in Vegas like Bellagio, Venitian, & Mandalay Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Paris is in a great location - right in the middle of the strip”
Reviews.Author: godawgs315
Reviews.Content: I really loved the location. There were also a ton of shops to walk to. Obviously not as nice as the Wynn or Venetian, but I would go back for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Never left the Paris complex, had everything i needed.”
Reviews.Author: nfrasercolumbia
Reviews.Content: had a great time at the Paris hotel and casino. I went for a business convention that was held in paris and the connecting ballys. Paris was great. just want i wanted for my first time in las vegas. the rooms were standard, nothing special, nothing bad either. i ate at a couple of the restaurants, they all were pretty good. when i wasn't working, i was gambling. and the tables here were pretty good to me. i would definately stay here again and probably will.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with Paris”
Reviews.Author: alkan50
Reviews.Content: My wife & I liked the ambiance and atmosphere at Paris and we thought it has one of the best locations on the strip. We were happy with our room, the food and the staff though we didn’t go to them with any problems that needed resolution. When we got there they didn’t have a standard non-smoking room so they upgraded us to one overlooking the pool and the Bellagio fountains. We liked the various café’s off the lobby, we didn’t get a bad meal at any of them and the pastries were fantastic. The piano bar was good even though it was packed every night, weekdays included. The sugar factory had good desserts and surprisingly good drinks. There are nicer hotels on the strip but not for the price.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: francescaLChicago
Reviews.Content: We have been to Vegas many, many times and decided to try something different from were we usually stay mainly because of the room rate we got at the Paris Hotel/Casino. We chose this hotel mainly for the location and the rate we got was fantastic. This property also does not have a "resort fee" that is added onto your bill when you leave. We took a taxi from the airport to the Hotel- $18.00 including tip only to learn that you can now take an airport shuttle for $12.00 round trip (per person) if you make reservations ahead of time. Check in took about 20 minutes waiting in line at 3 p.m. We requested an upgrade even though our room had already been pre-paid and we were upgraded to a corner room which is larger than the standard room and is designated with the letter 'p' after the room number. We were asked for a credit card for incidentals which we provided. However, we were not told that the Hotel would immediately charge $150.00 to the card. At other hotels we have stayed at, we were informed that there would be an initial charge and we were informed of the amount that was going to be charged and that any balance would be refunded. This was not the case on this check in. The room was clean and suited its purpose --that we were centrally located on the strip and were just basically using the room to change in and sleep there. The rooms do need an overhaul as they are outdated according to 2011 standards. The television was circa 1996 and the bathroom had the old standard tub in it. No ventilation fan in the bathroom and the mini bar is no longer stocked. You can use the mini bar as a refrigerator if you wish to...which is what we did. The housekeeping was immaculate but the bed did not come with a blanket so if you need it you would need to ask for one. Minimal towels in the bathroom, but we did notice that housekeeping would tidy up our room mid day and early evening. All in all, it was a good deal. However, there are so many newer hotels to stay at that I doubt we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the middle of Las Vegas strip”
Reviews.Author: QueenMimi
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel because it was at the best price. Our room was spotlessly clean, the bathroom large and clean. The decor was nice enough, based on the idea of French countryside. We stayed on a high level floor, so the express elevators were very welcome. We ate at the Marketplace restaurant (not very good) and had a dry muffin at their bakery cafe. But then we found The Sugar Factory, which opened 3 weeks ago. There is an entrance from inside the casino or you can enter from the street. The food and service were absolutely fantastic. Decor is contemporary French. The casino is a little quieter and less frantic than some further down the street. The lobby where check in is located is beautiful with crystal chandeliers. The ladies room down the hall is the nicest one that I have found in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Sewer Gas in Bathroom--a dog would love it!”
Reviews.Author: PropellerJourney
Reviews.Content: All we heard was "this is our favorite hotel in Vegas." Now they'll hear me ask: How long ago was that? We decided to try it and this is my opinion of our experience. We had what appeared to be a nice room on the North/East corner of the Hotel. Walking down the hallway to our room, we saw a hole in the wall–guest damage we guessed. Our room was fine, two queen beds, old CRT TV. There is no hope of fitting a HDTV in here! To the left and right of the TV, are small closets. In the morning we noticed a strange smell in the bathroom–it smelt like sewer gas. Only three ways for the gass to enter the bathroom–through the drains, air vent system or in the walls where the piping was installed. We called building maintenance and they bleach everything. In the afternoon it seemed ok but we noticed the same smell outside the hotel. This smell was not noticed at other Hotels. When we returned to our room around 9:30 PM, the smell was present again. Another call to building maintenance–I requested them to send someone with a good nose. About 45 minutes latter, he arrived but said his smelling powers were not good. He said it could be the Hotel's grease traps--ok but our room was alittle high for that. I put a plastic bag over the shower drain and covered that with a wet towel–put some water in the tub and sink & plugged their overflow to keep the sewer gass out. No room exchanged was offered, so I really checked out the bathroom air vent. WTF, it was full of dirt–just look at the photos. The shower stall had either mold or water deposits where the door opened. Some floor tiles were broken. Our room was quiet but I would never stay here again. In the morning, there was no smell but once I removed the shower's drain seal & drained the tub & sink + cleared the vents for the tub & sink, the smell returned. Upon checkout, I asked if the Hotel had a waste vent system problem that was causing the smell. NO-- WE HAVE NO ISSUE! Then I explained the smell outside was the same as in our room. I feel PARIS was great in the long ago past, but its day has come and gone. I would strongly suggest to the maintenance department to clean the bathroom's vent, fix the shower door leak and scope out the drains for damage. Mostly, there's a blockage that is causing our water trap to be sucked dry upon many flushes within the hotel. The water trap contains water that keeps out the sewer gas. If the water is missing, the gas will enter the room. At checkin, we noticed some dirt on the wood trim and paint chips on the trim--that was a warning of a Hotel's lack of proper maintenance. My tip: do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Okay Stay”
Reviews.Author: LIKETOTRAVEL125
Reviews.Content: Can't complain, but just okay. Service was fine. We were able to do an early check in. Have stayed at better but like I said nothing to really complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Our 17th trip to Paris Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Tigger41999
Reviews.Content: First I will give our review, and then I will give some general information. My wife and I stayed at Paris March 17th through March 22nd of this year for the 17th time. As you probably can guess we love Paris. One of the top reasons is the casino. We are both non smokers and with a three story high ceiling the smoke dissipates quickly. Unless you are right next to a smoker you really do not notice the smoke. Almost all of the other casinos have low ceilings with some only being 10 feet high. At Paris we do not feel confined. Another top reason is Paris’s location, being center strip. You are within walking distance to many of the shows as well as many of the great restaurants. Over the course of our many trips we have eaten at all the restaurants in Paris and have tried a lot of different dishes. All are very good. Some of the best is the Le Creperie, Le Burger Brasserie and Mon Ami Gabi (especially the outdoor café area). Service at Paris is top notch including the front desk, maid service, restaurants, bars and especially the cocktail servers. When we checked in, our non smoking comped room was not available. Shirley at the front desk upgraded us to a strip view room at no charge and we did not have to ask for this. We are very late night people when in Vegas, so typically we ask to have our room cleaned in the afternoon and we give a couple hour time frame to have it done and the maids were always accommodating. But, the best service is from the cocktail servers on the casino floor. Three servers are worth mentioning, at the slot machines during day shift Saturday through Wednesday is Andrea, table games during day shift Monday through Friday is Ferra and the best server that we have come across in Vegas is at the slot machines during the swing shift Wednesday through Sunday. Her name is Angela. General Information. This information is primary for first times to Paris and/or Vegas 1) If you drive to Vegas – Virtually all the Strip Hotels self parking lots are far away from front desk. To avoid carrying your luggage a long distance after parking your car you have two options. If you are with someone go to the normal entrance where the taxis drop people off , unload your luggage and have one person stay with the luggage, go park your car and then come back to help with the luggage or in most cases the bell hop can help (for a tip). If you are by yourself, you can leave your luggage with the bell hop (for a tip), tell them you are just going to park your car and then come back for your luggage. 2) The cocktail servers in the table area as well as in the slot area have a zone that they are working in Servers are not allowed to cross over to another zone to serve a customer even if it is right across the aisle. Therefore do not get mad if the server tells you that you are not in her zone/station. The servers primarily work for tips and most drinks that they serve you would cost $6 to $10 at the bar, therefore tip accordingly. If you are going to be in an area for 2 or 3 hours, get to know your server. Be nice to her, treat her with respect and tip well. During their shift she will take an hour break and a relief server fills in. 3) Many of the hotels have a mandatory resort fee of $22 or more per night. This resort fee is to cover the use of the gym and WIFI. Caesars Properties, which Paris is part of, does not charge a mandatory resort fee. They do charge $14.99 per 24 hours per device for WIFI in the room, (Smart phones are the same as a laptop) and $25 per day for gym access. There is FREE WIFI access in Café Belle Madeleine. Therefore, if you do not use WIFI or the gym you will save money. 4) There is food 24 hours at Paris with many choices through out the day. For late night dining (11:00 PM to 6:00AM) food is available at the Sugar Factory. Café Ile St Louis used to be open 24 hours (Starting April 11th they will close at 11:00 PM and open at 6:00 AM). At most of the restaurants they give you a lot of food and if you have an average appetite you can split a meal (they may charge a small split fee). From about 10:30 AM to 12:30 PM and 6:00 PM to 8:00PM the lines at the restaurants can be quite long, if you can avoid these times your wait will be short. 5) Paris may look old and that it needs a new coat of paint. Paris hotel and the Casino is meant to look like old Paris, therefore what may look like old dingy paint is in reality the look that they have intended, i.e. a distressed look. 6) Vegas is a 24 hour city and people are always in the casinos. Paris does a very good job of keeping the Casino area clean, floors swept, ash trays emptied, drink glasses and bottles removed from the tables and slot machines. 7) If you book with a room with Paris at one price and you see that the rates have dropped before you make your trip, just call Paris (at least 72 hours prior) and ask them to adjust your rate. His does not work if you have booked a package deal or with some travel agent. 8) Remember, Vegas is expensive relative to most small towns and cities so do not be shocked at the prices for food and drinks. There are bargains if you do your research. If you have any questions in particular about Paris as well as some fine restaurants feel free to e-mail me.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking in customer service”
Reviews.Author: Vanc0uver_traveller
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a couple nights at Paris. Overall, the stay was okay but would've been great if staff had been the least bit helpful or polite. We started our stay at the front desk with the clerk insisting there were no strip views available even though I'd requested one with my reservation months ago. She was downright rude as she kept trying to put us in a room with a king-size bed even though I repeatedly told her we needed 2 queens and had made a reservation 2 queens. Finally I flat out told her I was travelling with a friend, not a boyfriend, and we would not be sharing a bed! In the end, the premier red room requested with queen beds overlooking the strip was a mediocre red room overlooking the parking garage. I know hotels can't guarantee requests like views but I also know those rooms were most likely given to people who booked their rooms much later than I did. Not sure what makes their money better than mine? One morning we would've liked room service but there was no book in the room to peruse choices so we opted to go downstairs. One afternoon I walked up to the counter at Le Cafe to order a latte. The young man behind the counter refused to acknowledge me even though there was nobody else at the counter. Finally I flat out asked if I could order a coffee and he replied "yeah". When I asked for a latte I was told his steamer didn't work and I should go to the place across the hall. Then he proceeded to tell me that this was a "bar NOT a coffee shop" I told him that the sign right above our heads said "Le Cafe" and mentioned espressos so they should change the name then! Walked across the hall to Cafe Belle and had a very average latte there. We had lunch at Le Village Buffet and the food was very good and our waiter was pleasant and on the ball. Waitresses serving the slot machines were also quicker and more efficient than most we found at the strip. Had a dinner at Mon Ami Gabi that was overpriced but great food.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: TumbleWeed4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris in March 2011 to celebrate my birthday. We were given an upgrade to a Premier Red Room upon check-in, 29th floor. The room was cleaned spotlessly everyday & the bed was very comfortable. We had great views of the south strip out of one window and the Cosmopolitan out of the other. We had brunch at Mon Ami Gabi - seated on the patio - the mushroom omelet & blueberry french toast were fabulous. We had lunch at La Creperie - fast, affordable & yummy. Cafe Ile St Louis was convenient & tasty for middle of the night eats. We also had a wonderful dinner experience at Les Artistes Steakhouse - the service was flawless, the steaks were huge, the lobster fantastic - definitely worth the splurge. I can't think of a bad thing to say about this hotel. The location mid-strip was convenient for getting around, the ambiance of the hotel was romantic, the staff we personally encountered were friendly & helpful. Oh ya, and the drink service on the casino floor was reasonably quick. I would definitely stay here again! Make sure to take a trip to the top of the Eiffel Tower at night to see the Bellagio fountains show & some great views of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SVL
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel last minute through hotels dot com and got rooms for $70 per night. The hotel was great and we decided to stay there again after our trip to the Grand Canyon. However, the rate for advance booking was $250 per night. What I learned from surfing hotels dot com is that you can get great deals if you are willing to book last-minute in Vegas, and they have enough room capacity so you will always get a decent room even at 3:00pm, and the rates just keep dropping the later it gets. If you are staying multiple nights, the difference between $70 and $250 really ads up!

Reviews.Title: “Used Condom, Hole in the wall, pizza stains on the floor....”
Reviews.Author: mcg2582
Reviews.Content: I used some of my points to bring my colleagues on a weekend trip. As soon as we checked in we noticed the hole in the wall, the dirty bed sheets, and the pizza stains on the floor. Before we could call housekeeping to change the sheets and clean the floor my guests found a used condom behind the bed. We immediately informed the front desk about the issues that need to be taken care of right away. Roberto at the front desk assured us that a housekeeping manager would clean the room and resolve the issues before we returned. After spending several hours in meetings we returned to our room to find that the bed sheets were changed but the stains in the carpet and the used condom were still in the room!!!!!!! After calling once again we were informed that the manager was too busy right now and would call us back. We waited for over two hours and have not received a call. We will be checking out early and never coming back to this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing at all special; least favorite place to stay in Vegas thus far”
Reviews.Author: airjesse123
Reviews.Content: My stay at Paris wasn't terrible, but it is the least impressed I have been with a Vegas hotel. For the amount we paid, we could have gotten TI, Mandalay, etc, all of which I prefer to Paris. The rooms are very small and motelish. We even used the "20$ trick" and only got upgraded to a view room, which was unimpressive. The casino is small and the minimums aren't lower than elsewhere. The sportsbook is not great, either. The decor is NY, NY cheesy, but trying to be the venetian-- which it isn't. The only saving grace is Mon Abi Gabi-- a great value for a prime strip restaurant. Great food and service there.

Reviews.Title: “Sadly a fading beaauty”
Reviews.Author: VegasTraveller001
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Paris when it forst opened and a few times since then. The hotel/casino was take over by Harrahs [now Caesars] some years ago and has slowly declined since then. Currently, upkeep/maintenance is poor [a look at the fading paint on the balloon outside is a bit of a giveaway] the older rooms are tired with tube TVs and old, worn decor and furniture. The "red rooms" are the ones they could afford to renovate but they are also beginning to show wear and tear. The casino is spacious and bright, but the games themselves are not a good value -- you can do better at most other non-Harrahs/Caesars casinos. The machines are tight and table games rules are not what they could and should be. Blackjack rules in particular are not good -- few tables pay a full 3/2 for blackjack and the limits are high for the house advantage on those tables [hint -- the Bellagio has a much better casino -- just walk across the street]. Drink service is average to poor. I found the dealers a bit discouraged and the pit staff was disinterested and, in one instance, actively rude to simple inquiries from players at my table. We did eat at Mon Ami Gabi which is still quite good -- an exception to the other choices available at Paris. It would take a significant investment and massive change in culture to bring Paris back to what it once was. I will stay and paly elsewhere in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELADIX
Reviews.Content: Great location, good price. Great service throughout casino & restaurants. Bed was to firm for my wife.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Room Refurbishing”
Reviews.Author: kbnej
Reviews.Content: Wi fi is a rip off for what they charge No handle on wardrobe doors, missing mouldings Bathroom tile looks mouldy Main floors might look like old pARIS but are not easy to walk on

Reviews.Title: “Cannot fault this hotel”
Reviews.Author: alfaromeoKent
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel twice and are staying there again this year (2011) the beds feel like you are sleeping on air, the staff just cannot do enough for you. Always 'ask' for a strip view, you will probably get it. The restaurants are lovely and the Eiffel Tower amazing, even though I have been at the top of the real one. I fully recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: fenton27
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Paris for foun nights in March, a Saturday thru Wednesday. Shocked about how busy the casino was even on Monday and Tuesday during the day. This was our second stay. Upgraded to a "Nice" suite on the top floor. Great room, clean and comfy. Room service was fine. Ballys Steakhouse is outstanding for food. Construction nearby made the pool area noisy and half of the pool was closed due to painting. Won money! Great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Money Pit”
Reviews.Author: LadyYQ
Reviews.Content: Did not get the upgrade paid for online. (additional 300) Was told the upgrade was the coffee maker, flat screen t.v. and red bedding. Did not think that was an upgrade coffee maker and flat screen t.v. is standard for 3 to 5 star hotel. Service was the worst, there is a fee for all amenities. Gym 25 a day and internet 15 a day. It is a money pit determined to take all of your money. Stayed at this hotel several years ago and service was the excellent. Need to remodel and improve customer service. Would not stay again nor recommend.

Reviews.Title: “I love Paris in the springtime and the winter too!”
Reviews.Author: sarleo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Paris for a conference that was held at the Flamingo. Didn't want to stay at Bellagio, Planet Hollywood again, so decided on Paris. What a good choice. Our room was large, clean with a very comfortable king bed with crisp sheets. The large bathroom had a huge shower and a seperate tub, along with double sinks and lots of storage space. The room had wardrobes, not closets. We paid $42 extra each day to receive a room with a view of the Bellagio fountains (could also hear them). Included was a declious breakfast on the 31st floor from 7-11am and hot and cold food before dinner (5-7pm) that was practically dinner. All was tasty and soft drinks and alcoholic drinks (2per person) were included. The concierge was also available. It was very nice and well done. On the last day, I had a late night flight, and I was allowed to keep my room late and didn't have to pay the $112 that I had booked. The buffet was wonderful, as were the bakeries and the little place that made crepes. Reception had us check in six hours early! We ate at La Provencel for my birthday and enjoyed dinner immensely. The staff was positive, helpful. The hotel was clean, well maintained. There was no smell of smoke. I loved my stay more than Bellagio, Treasure Island, Mandalay Bay, Planet Hollywood or any or the other places I stayed. Can't wait to go back-it seemed like I was in a hotel in France!!

Reviews.Title: “Uptight and NOT service minded!”
Reviews.Author: bslansky
Reviews.Content: Non-existent service from staff at the hotel, casino and bars. They acted as if you were bothering them and I even had a server in the Casino tell me she was on break and to find someone else! I spent my money at other casinos. I booked and paid in advance for 2 rooms, adjoining, in December and they couldn't accomodate me in March????? I promise you that the Luxor or even Hooter's Casino is going to give you amazing service.

Reviews.Title: “High Quality for the Price”
Reviews.Author: tryin4birdies
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few times now and will definitely be back. Clean rooms; comfy beds; great location; helpful staff; nice restaurants ... basically all you could ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a first timer”
Reviews.Author: jleigh81
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my 30th birthday and had never been to Vegas before. ROOM Booked a Red Room and got 1on the 27th floor... Room was Nice, Big king size bed. Kinda hard for me as were the pillows but wouldn't stop me from staying here again. Didn't have the greatest view(the airport and backside of PH. But again wouldn't stop me from staying here. Spent very little time there anyways. Casino Is Cool but they are all the same...big huge place that suck away your money.LOL FOOD To tell you honestly only ate here once and it was for lunch at the buffet. Not the best. We got there about 1130 and i thought it would be at least brunch but since it was Mon. it was not. I was HUNGOVER and wanted eggs not yucky looking leg of dried out Lamb..so not much to say there. But to their credit i hear the BREAKFAST buffet is really good:) Two Bad things.... The cocktail waitress's(ALL BUT ONE) kinda suck...they are slow and tend to no come back for a VERY long time...which sucks b/c i make my living off tips and these ladys were getting tipped well. So after waiting so LONG we just ordered from the bar...16$ for a bud light bottle and Crown and Coke! WOW !!! Only other thing was the room service trays were left in the hallways for a VERY long time(like 12 hours)..KINDA gross and smelly:( But ALL THAT SAID YOU CANNOT BEAT THE LOCATION! Right IN THE MIDDLE OF EVERYTHING AND A GREAT PLACE TO STAY! Vegas wasn't really my cup of tea...I'm a water girl but in 10 years from for my 40th i might go back just to see the changes. Overall a great place to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paris las vegas - an excelletnt stay”
Reviews.Author: crazee4trains
Reviews.Content: Recently we spent 4 nights at the paris in las vegas. The hotel is in the center of the strip which makes it very easy to get anywhere. The staff is very friendly, the hotel is clean and the buffet is the best in vegas. The 24 hour buffet promo is available here and at 6 other ceasar entertainment operations. You certainly won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, decently priced, but with a smoke-filled casino”
Reviews.Author: Nicola_Six
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Paris hotel as part of a flight and hotel package, which amounted to around $630 CDN total for four days and three nights. The reception area is quite beautiful and reminded me of when I visited Versailles in France - glittering chandeliers and marble countertops. I also cannot say enough good things about the service - the concierge was amazing, and the people at the reception were great as well - courteous and prompt. As for housekeeping, they were very attentive as well - when we put a "do not disturb" sign on the doorknob, housekeeping left a voicemail to confirm that we indeed did not want to be disturbed, and told us to phone them back if and when we ever needed anything. We stayed in the cheapest room, the luxury guest room, on a smoke-free floor, so it didn't have the glamour of the reception area. The room had a view of the rear of Bally (a hotel that has seen better days), which wasn't a great view, but hey, you get what you pay for. The room and bathroom were clean - the shower was beautiful (gorgeous coral-and-tan coloured stone) - and although the decor was a tired-looking (it obviously was not a room that had been renovated recently), it had charm. Minor complaint: the pillows on the bed were thin and rather skimpy - there were only three flattened pillows per bed - and the bathtub had two holes in the ceramic, which turned me off to taking a bath there. In general, we found it a quiet stay - I have no complaints about noise from the other rooms. The martinis at the bar in the casino were priced at roughly $12 and were some of the best martinis I've ever had, and Le Provencal provided a pretty good dinner of Italian food. The one thing that would deter me from staying at this hotel again is that the casino in Paris is filled with second-hand smoke - more so than other in hotels like Mandalay Bay. This is a pity because everything else about the hotel is great. It's hard to avoid the smoke in the casino because you have to walk through it to get to the elevators to get to your room, and the ventilation in the casino isn't great. I think next time I'll opt for Mandalay Bay; by the end of the four-day trip, I, a non-smoker, was hacking up brown phlegm. Now, it's not because of solely the casino in Paris, but it definitely didn't help. So I recommend this hotel if you don't mind breathing in second-hand smoke to and from your hotel room. If you do mind - I think Mandalay Bay is probably a better option as there seems to be better ventilation there (which I gleaned from the hour I spent walking around there, where my lungs recovered somewhat from the smoke).

Reviews.Title: “c'est magnifique!!”
Reviews.Author: lulucitron
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 nights in vegas and had an amazing time. I loved the Paris hotel. The location is amazing. you're directly across from the bellagio and caesar's palace hotels and I could see the fountain show at the bellagio from my hotel room. The decor is amazing and I love how the inside area looks like an outdoor street with all the stores looking like outdoor store fronts. The ceiling has sky and clouds painted! The faux cobblestone floors, however, are tricky with heels; especially after a night of drinking! We went up the eiffel tower and looked at an amazing view of the city. Ate at the Mon Ami Gabi steakhouse and the food was very good. I found it funny that the waiters have french accents but cannot speaking a word of french! The minute I said "Je voudrais..." and saw a blank look on his face, I knew he didn't speak a word of french but the effect is cute for the theme of the hotel. As far as the rooms go, we upgraded to a room that allowed an outside view of the strip and the bellagio and other hotels. The room was comfortable and well appointed. The only pitfall is I wish the bed had more blankets rather than a sheet and thin coverlet. The bathroom as large and generous with a nice stand up shower. The bathtub was a little small so not used. I prefer a deeper tub. I did hear the people in the room next-door but no big deal. I also upgraded to include continental breakfast and happy hour munchies. The food was really good and plentiful--had smoked salmon, capers and eggs and tomatoes and cheese, which was nice. I grabbed extra water and fruit to drink and munch on throughout the day. Happy hour had amazing snacks. They said two drinks per person but they definitely didn't monitor so we had a good amount of alcohol. The table next to us got a fresh bottle of rum and drank 3/4 of it by the time they left. We also took travellers with us in tall lidded cups so it's worth the money and alcohol is expensive in vegas. Went on the grand canyon tour, which I highly recommend. It was amazing to see the canyon and the hoover dam. We didn't see any shows due to lack of time but went to the pure nightclub at caesar's the saturday night and I wouldn't recommend going. the VIP area is large and hardly anyone was in it so the remaining area where us normal schmoze could gather was small and they played house music, which I abhor. An amazing hotel and experience. If I went back to vegas I would definitely stay there again. Although bellagio and caesars are amazing as well, they're huge and takes forever to walk around it. I like something more smaller in scale that's easy to traverse but still elegant and well equipped. Didn't get to use the outdoor pool but it looked amazing from our view up high.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: CaddyShack4Skier
Reviews.Content: Paris has it all--great rooms, great service, and great casino. I've stayed here many times and have never been disappointed. Location. Location. Location. Paris is the best!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, nice rooms, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: frieda-f
Reviews.Content: This was my second time to Vegas and I loved staying at Paris. Yes, it's a bit older now, but the standard rooms were spacious and clean (with great showers) and the ambiance of the hotel and casino is much more intimate and pleasant than some of the others. My only complaint is service in some of the restaurants (the Ile St. Louis Cafe was so slow, and they only ever had one person making sandwiches in the self service cafe down the way), but Mon Ami Gabi - the full service restaurant at the front was fabulous both times we ate there and the Madeleine Patisserie has fabulouse pastries). The ride to the top of the Eiffel Tower was fun, but probably not worth the price (especially if you've been to the real one). One of the best things about Paris is its location - an easy walk to Bellagio and Planet Hollywood and the new Cosmopolitan across the street. A little harder to get to the Aria (which shouldn't be missed), but it's Vegas, so cabbies don't seem to mind short trips. I would definitely stay in Paris again, but maybe next time I would upgrade to a newer room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel on strip”
Reviews.Author: etan92612
Reviews.Content: Convenient location. Great customer service from check in to the guy who helped with the poor $15 wifi service. Wifi was painfully slow and they took it off our bill. Bring your own shampoo, conditioner and lotion. What's provided is really weak...like watered down. PET FRIENDLY!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but they nickle and dime there”
Reviews.Author: sunnyweather001
Reviews.Content: The Paris is a beautiful clean centrally located hotel on the strip in Las Vegas. It is expensive and they charge you for everything 15 dollars a day for internet 40 dollars a day for the excercise room, expensive coffee.

Reviews.Title: “What guarantee?”
Reviews.Author: VTer24
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the Paris at the end of February. Room was clean, large, food was super, we had great serviceand we got a great rate. HOWEVER, despite advertising a "price guarantee" they do not honor it. The price for the first night for Rewards members went down by $70. nine days prior to our trip. After over 20 telephone calls and not getting a live person, I just gave up. It was impossible to get through. They would not honor the lower price that THEY offered even when we checked in. email complaints were also ignored. The only other negative was that it took forever to get hot water in the shower. The location is super and would would stay here again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: mar0883
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay 3/1/11-3/5/11. We were in a corner room on the 26th floor. There was direct elevator service to the upper floors, and we rarely waited more than 30 seconds. The room was large, great views, and quiet. This was an upgraded room with an all new bathroom and new pillow top bed, which was extremely comfortable. You can't beat the location of this hotel, and we have no complaints at all. We will be back, and we will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, sweet french feel!”
Reviews.Author: Katathome
Reviews.Content: Very nice indeed. Ask for a room overlooking the pool if you can get it. Watch the water show @ The Bellagio from your room. The crepes are yum-yum with a great cup of coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Experience”
Reviews.Author: zoom802
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed at this wonderful hotel for 2 nights, celebrating our 42nd anniversary. Check-in was a breeze...I asked the desk clerk if we could have a room overlooking the Strip, and was thrilled with our room he gave us on the 22nd floor, with 2 large windows, looking across to the Bellagio thru one...and Planet Hollywood, the Cosmopolitan and other hotels thru the other. It was a very large room, with very nice amenities. While in town, we also had tickets to 'Jersey Boys' at the Palazzo, which was TERRIFIC! Paris' casino isn't as easy to navigate as some other Vegas hotels, but was still fun! We stayed away from the outrageously-priced Paris restaurants, and enjoyed restaurants off the Strip. Service and attention to detail by Paris' staff was impeccable. Would I consider staying at Paris on my next trip? Absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Time”
Reviews.Author: SydneyAussieFamily4
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 night in Vegas as part of a L/NY Holiday. Booked a standard 2 * Queen Bed Room for 4 of us (2 Daughters Share) and found the room a great size. great bathroom and spotless. Food and restarurants in the Casino was excellent as was the level of service from doorman to cleaning staff Centrally located in midlle of the strip this was the ideal place to stay Went to the opening day of the "Sugar Factory" a Candy/Lolly shop of grand LV style within the Hotel. Missed Kim Kardashian cutting the ribbon by a day or so Family have already talked of booking back in ASAP We saw all of the other key hotels/casinos and I checked out a room at the Wynn (a friend was staying there) and would take the Paris any time for location and value. PS - Wife said that these were the best beds she had ever slept in

Reviews.Title: “enjoy starlit night”
Reviews.Author: sks3010
Reviews.Content: It is wonderful hotel with good facilities. we have enjoyed our stay here. WE have also enjoyed the starlit night from the top of Eiffel tower in Vegas \. Over and above the tariff is also affordable

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: HubieTrout
Reviews.Content: Never really considered the Paris a top tier property, but it was a business trip, and was near where we needed to be. Gave it a try. MUCH better than expected! Room was great (Red rooms - not huge but nice. Great view of the Bellagio fountains.) Front desk went above and beyond helping with early (very early) check in. Thanks Nikki! Suggested Based on our needs - which she really listened to - that we upgrade to the concierge level for some benefits. Great choice! Note to Nikkis manager - promote her. Or give her a raise. Concierge lounge on 31 - great service from everyone. Special props to Ale. Somebody please promote her to customer service manager before I hire hire her away from you. Ate only at the burger / sports bar. Best burger I have had in ages - and better service than we had at Delmonicos! (Nicolette - thanks) All around a surprise. Have to be back next month for business, and already rebooked my wife and I for Paris. Two thumbs up for whoever is managing andc training personnel here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but they lie!”
Reviews.Author: BBilka
Reviews.Content: If you buy the $55 per night room upgrade, and the front desk person tells you that the upgrade will allow you to use free wifi in the Concierge lounge throughout your stay, don't believe it! After you are nicely settled in your upgraded room, the concierge in the lounge will tell you that the lounge wifi is not included in the upgrade. You will pay a $15 per night, PER DEVICE charge for in-room wifi. Ouch. When checking out, after forking over a total of $150 for the in-room wifi, we told the manager that the check-in person had given us the wrong information and we asked for a comp on some or all of the wifi charges. The manager was completely unwilling to reverse any of the charges, stating that we "should have told someone" as soon as we found out that the check-in person gave us the inaccurate information. When we told her that we had indeed "told someone" (the conceirge, who wrote down the name of the check-in individual and said that she would look into it), the manager responded that we "should have told the front desk instead." Also, immediately after checking into the room, a maintenance man knocked on the door and said that we had called him about fixing our sink. When I told him that there must have been a mixup because we just arrived and had not called, he argued with me about it. After a moment, I told him that I needed to go and started to shut the door, but he continued to stand there and said, "Wait, wait." He then found our room number written on a piece of paper in his pocket, and tried to use it to convince me that I had actually called him after all. Weird! I ended up having to shut the door in his face to get him to go away.

Reviews.Title: “One of the BEST hotels ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ginagina5592
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed at this hotel in October 2009 and finally - I'm able to write my review. When this hotel was first built, I've always wanted to book a room here. I finally did, and I'm so glad I made the choice to stay. This is one of the most beautiful hotels I have ever stay at. First of all, the Reservation area is absolute beautiful. The chandelier is absolutely gorgeous which made checking-in fine. The service was pleasant and gracious. The location is fabulous. The concierge assistants were very friendly and provided me with passes to the nightclubs. LOVE THEM FOR THIS!!!! I love the cobblestone walkways and the connection to Bally's. The room was very nice and clean. The bathroom was a nice size, and my bed was very comfortable. This is definitely a hotel to book and stay in. Whatever the price is will be absolutely worth it!!! The theme is wonderfully depicted. I'll be staying there again in April 2011 and looking so forward to it. Each time I've stayed at the Paris hotel, I was never disappointed. I have a feeling that this is going to be my best stay ever, and all I can do is SMILE!!!! Paris - here I come!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Service”
Reviews.Author: Laura G
Reviews.Content: This was my 6th stay at Paris, Las Vegas. As a Total Rewards member, my stays have always been comped so I am less likely to complain about the view or the pillows. I do, however, still expect to be treated with courtesy. Unfortunately, this was not the case on my last visit. I encountered rude staff at the front desk and the Total Rewards desk, and some strange new rules that made no sense at all. For example, while playing at a slot machine, I ordered a tall Malibu and pineapple juice. The cocktail waitress asked to see my Seven Stars or Diamond reward card. I showed her my Platinum card and she told me that without a Seven Stars or Diamond reward card I could not have my drink tall. I wasn't asking for a double. Just a taller glass so the drink wouldn't be too strong. I can't figure out why they would reserve this special 'privilege' for their highest tiered players only. She told me she would have to ask her Manager because she didn't want to lose her job. I don't get that at all. There is no extra cost for them to put a drink in a tall glass instead of a short one (except maybe a little extra ice). I was also disappointed to see my favorite breakfast (southern style eggs benedict) has been dropped from the room service menu, my favorite slot machines have been removed from the casino (jackpot party progressive) and my favorite alcoholic beverage (Smirnoff Ice) is no longer available on the casino floor. One of the things I like best about Las Vegas is that you always have plenty of choices. I chose to walk across the street to The Bellagio and sign up for their new mLife players program and spent the rest of my stay with the family of MGM Resorts where I was treated very well. I stayed 3 nights at The Bellagio and couldn't have been happier. I won't be staying at Paris in the future although I will definitely dine at Mon Ami Gabi again!

Reviews.Title: “Liked it very much”
Reviews.Author: Meno1965
Reviews.Content: I liked the location, de small stores and restaurants, staff was friendly. room very comfortable, the price was very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and price !”
Reviews.Author: underwaterhairdryer
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Paris Las Vegas we had a great view and a great jacuzzi in the room ! Love the Casino downstairs and the Buffet at Paris is one of the best in Vegas ( and I do suggest you getting a 24 hour pass to all the Buffets they offer , can save a lot of money that way. Room servise was fast and very nice Security of the hotel however was pretty rude. I had someone come up to me at the casino part of the hotel offering me to buy drugs and I didnt really know what else to do but go to the security that I saw standing really close to where it was all happening and his response was : "SO ?" I didnt think that a creepy guy offering people drugs should have been there but I guess the security had other things to worry about at 4 am ... But over all it was a great trip ! Just dont hang out in the casino at 4am all alone

Reviews.Title: “Not work the money”
Reviews.Author: TorontoPrincess11
Reviews.Content: We travelled from Jan 26-Feb 3, 2011 for our wedding at the Paris Las Vegas Hotel. As we are Total Reward members, we decided to use our points to upgrade to a "Red Room Premiere". It was not worth using the points. The room was slightly larger than a regular guest room, with a large screen TV. In addition, the room wasn't even red, it was purple. The room itself was supposedly recently renovated, but in the bathroom the wall paper was peeling off the ceiling, as well as the trim in the room was badly damaged. There was no hot water to take a bath, as the handle would only turn half way. We contacted housekeeping to repair the issue, they came within a few hours, but never resolved the issue. The next day we upgraded to a regular room suite, which was much nicer and worth the money. The houskeeping staff were friendly, and the room was always cleaned well each day. The rest of the service in the hotel left a lot to be desired. The staff within the main buffet restaurants as well as the 24 hour restaurant was poor. The staff were unfriendly and unhelpful. The food at the buffets was mediocre, and several in our party were ill after eating there. The food and beverages were also quite expensive ($16 martini's!), but to be expected in Vegas I guess. There was one exception in service. In the lobby their is a bar, which we used as the meeting point for our group during our stay. The bar and service staff in this area were always attentive and friendly. The Eiffel Tower Restaurant, which we found out once we arrived, is not associated with Paris Las Vegas, and is a seperate entity in its own, was incredible. We booked our wedding dinner there for our group (14 ppl). Everything was amazing. The service and quality of food was five star, and the event coordinator, Erika, was professional and accomodating. Our guests wanted for nothing. It was expensive, but worth every penny. Lastly, the wedding chapel and coordination services were great. The package we ordered included webcasting, which worked well, but was not simultaneous as advertised. Our family at home were not able to view it until several hours later. The flowers, minister provided, and the ceremony were fantastic. The photographer was a highlight to the day as we had extra time to take shots around the hotel. He did an amazing job capturing the day. One great heed of warning to all travellers to this hotel (if coming as a group) is the Total Experience Service - which is advertised on the Harrah's website. We booked all of our flights and rooms seperately as we were unaware of this service until after. When we called, they informed us that we were "out of luck" and were not able to take advantage of their VIP group services as we were already booked. When we responded via email to the manager of the service, we received no response and decided to discuss the issue in person when we arrived. When we went to the Total Rewards desk at Paris to discuss it, they had no idea what the Total Experience even was, or how it was associated with Harrah's. Later in the week we discussed it with the hotel manager, who gave us $100 food and beverge comp for our troubles. We are still not clear how the service works, and there may be an office at Caesar's Palace, we are still not sure. To date, we have had no response from our letter to the manager. Overall, with the issues with service at the hotel, I would not recommend staying at Paris, its not worth the money. I do recommend the wedding facilities and services, they were exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Time”
Reviews.Author: Ctyangel
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our stay at the Paris Hotel and was extremely pleased. After reading many negative reviews I must say we were very fortunate to have nothing but praise for the Paris. You could definitedly find fault in any establishment that has the volume of guests that Vegas has. Carpet does get worn and wall paper does peel over time,but overall this hotel is clean and well maintained. It is situated in a perfect location on the Strip which makes walking in either direction very convient. The Deuce stops right outside the hotel for those who prefer to travel by bus. Check-in went smoothly. Donna in the Diamond Club was friendly and accommodated us with a lovely upgrade to the Red Room located on the 30th floor. The room was clean--a comfortable king size bed, and an amazing view of the Effiel Tower and Bellagio fountains. Check out the dueling piano bar nightly in the Napolean lounge. No cover charge and very entertaining. The 24 hour buffet special is worth looking into - you don't have to pig-out and still manage to get 3 or 4 meals depending how you time it. We especially enjoyed the breakfast buffet at the Paris. Fresh omlette and crepe stations - yummy. If you're a Manilow fan you won't be disappointed. The theatre is very cozy--even the last row in the house offers a great view. Overall - the Paris is a great place to stay. After all, this is Vegas--How much time do you actually spend in your room!?

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: indyoes
Reviews.Content: There are so many options in Vegas. We found Paris to be very clean, the staff kind and helpful, and the casino not as overbearing as in some of the other hotels. Our room was recently updated and comfortable. We would stay here again. p.s. If you can, request a room with a fountain view. We didn't have this but I hear it's great.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kittykat012
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Paris Hotel Las Vegas after a horrible flight from orlando. was very tired and when arrived had booked two rooms adjoining the only rooms they had was in smoking as to tired to complain excepted them until morning. I would not except a smoking room even if you are a smoker the rooms smells terrible really dissappointed but in the morining approached the reception staff who were more than friendley and accomodating changed are rooms to adjoining non smoking on the 15th floor absolutley fantastic rooms were clean tidy fresh and comfortable the maids very friendley nice clean hotel staff were more than friendley great location on the strip have been to las vegas and stayed at the mandalay which was also lovely. I would stay at the Paris again brillant well done to staff they were brillant.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice view, everything else in this hotel SUCKS”
Reviews.Author: igorkigel
Reviews.Content: I came to celebrate my birthday. What they say luxury hotel is not so luxury to me. We asked for upgrade, they give us a room with a nice view, but everything in the room was not how we expected it. Bar where used to be drinks inside the room was empty and sign do not put any items in the bar cooler. Then why the "f" do you put the bar in the room empty and we cant use it as a storage of drink and stuff. #2 the TV drawers the drawers were missing handles. I complained to front desk and they said sorry but there is nothing we can do about this. I mean then one night we were walking in the hallway it was about 1 am and there was a person on the floor and personal was giving him a CPR and stuff. I could not sleep all night because of what we saw. The hallways is dark and bothers my eyes. Casino is not that great.

Reviews.Title: “good ma not the best in las vegas”
Reviews.Author: Dp60
Reviews.Content: my personal expectations from this hotel was much higher than received, as it was not my first time in las vegas and already been to MGM, monte carlo, stratosphere and Whynn hotels, this was just similar as room type and size as all others, nothing more nothing less. The location is absolutely convenient and good to walk in many other casino and hotels near by, also just in front of the Bellagio hotel, beautifull hotel with gorgeus fountain music show. Bad things of this hotel, was the minibar which was empty from any items, so it was turned on for nothing, and it was making such high noise that could disturb during a night sleep, and \i could not figure out how to switch off. One time I want to try the room service, nooooooooooooooooooo bad idea, stayed 25 minutes at the phone waiting for the answer, and after that somebody finally decide to answer she told me I must wait for my dinner 1 hour minimum, so if you realy don't need do not ask for room service. I will go back every year to las vegas as I love shows and life style but definately not in Paris again, with so many hotel choice and maybe with better service is stupid to came back to the same place. Las vegas and all sights parks around are my favourite destination and i suggest to every one to rent a car, as whenever you want to visit all casino from one end to other is miles away, and all casino have free self parking where you park and visit all other casino near by the one you have parked, also is much cheaper and easy with a GPS to visit by yourself HOVER DOME, gran canyon, death valley, and any other sights you may want to visit, good roads good indications and cheaper than buy a tour.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: 10-12Toronto
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Good location. Beds were fine, however, the pillows were the size of a postage stamp & you get 3 for a king size bed. They ran out apparently. People were nice enough, however the service in general was very slow. Lines everywhere we went. The aggravating thing was, there were a lot of empty tables. Not enough servers. Paris- hire more people!! Took the monorail a lot while we were there. Price was reasonable & it was convenient. Saw the George Lopez show while we were there. Big disappointment. We are huge fans but did not like his show. He would be a lot funnier if he wasn't so angry with his ex-wife. After all, she did give him a kid and a kidney. George, if you want to vent, see a shrink, don't make your fans pay for your therapy.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, not ideal for party scene”
Reviews.Author: Hotelguru2009
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with 2 friends back in July 2010 and had a good time. The hotel is clean and pleasant but isn't really part of the Vegas scene if you're there for partying. The casino in the hotel isn't great either. The pool area is nice and clean and on weekends has a DJ there during the day. You don't get sun in the morning by the pool until about 10.30 because it rises behind the hotel building and you end up sunbathing at the foot of the Eiffel Tower. The rooms are well decorated, however aren't huge. The check-in was slow however they did accommodate a request to have our rooms close to each other. I probably wouldn't go back to this hotel as I think there are better ones on the strip, but given how cheap Paris was, it was great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Joie81
Reviews.Content: We love the location of Paris! It is pretty much center strip and the rooms are comfortable. We try to stay in a corner king suite and are generally pleased with the rooms. They do however need to be updated. The TV is old and the remote was a little touchy. We like the separate tub and shower in the bathrooms, but they too need to be updated. The only time we heard anyone else while we were in our room was when the maid was cleaning the next room. The staff was exceptionally friendly and more than willing to meet our needs. We called in the morning and asked housekeeping to clean our room early and the room was always clean and neat when we returned in the early afternoon. We also enjoy the casino area. The buffet is excellent for both breakfast and dinner. We will surely return and recommend Paris to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location...Now they just have to update the rooms”
Reviews.Author: NYCtravelboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at PARIS for four nights earlier this month. Haven't stayed there in several years, yet the rooms were exactly the same. Same off color carpet; same very heavy front door; same old, small counsel TV; same furniture exactly. Bathroom is large, but towels and amentities are very poor. Had a room with two double beds. They were lumpy and the sheets were old, itchy and very worn. Service at the hotel was great. Everyone we encountered was friendly and knowledgable. There is a wide variety of food options that are available. We ended up eating often in the complex. Parking is easy and you are not miles away from the hotel walking from the garage. The view from our room was amazing including a perfect view of the Bellagio fountain show. I enjoy Paris, but I wish they would update the rooms. They are so worn at that it will really make me think twice when booking there next.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - so so hotel”
Reviews.Author: melstl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Paris for a wedding in mid-January. This was our first time to Las Vegas so we really didn't know what to expect. The hotel was right in the middle of the strip so the location itself was perfect. However, compared to some of the newer hotels, the decor was lacking. The rooms are in dire need of updates but we didn't spend a whole lot of time there, so it didn't bother us. One thing that we loved about Paris is the restaurant - Mon Ami Gabi. We had brunch there 3 days in a row! There is inside and outside seating (we always chose to sit outside) and it is right in front of the Bellagio, so you always have a perfect view of the fountains. The food was always very good as well. As far as the wedding was concerned, the chapel was very cute and the couple stated that they were very happy with the coordination that they received. While the Paris was suitable, my husband and I will definitely try out a newer hotel on our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - would recommend.”
Reviews.Author: CowtownFolk
Reviews.Content: We started our stay with a free upgrade to a Red Room with a Strip View! Great start to a great stay. Pros: Location, location, location! Great amenities including the best buffet on the strip Friendly staff with a couple of exceptions (in the wine shop and the valet) Clean rooms Lots of character Mon Ami Gabi is fabulous Terrific hotel for the price Cons: Staff at wine shop cranky Valet expected a tip for motioning for a cab to move up 15 feet for us Our room was an adjoining room which was loud - will request a non-adjoining room in the future! Had a great stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone! You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Paris is a winner.”
Reviews.Author: notjustsittin
Reviews.Content: Food wonderful--I still crave some of the breakfast buffet items. The lobby decor was breathtaking. Great central location. View from tower can't be duplicated. Would stay there again. In fact, we probably will sometime because we didn't have time to enjoy the gorgeous rooftop pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at The Paris”
Reviews.Author: Carzrich
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at The Paris and would stay there again. We did not particularly like the rooms that we would have been given, they had no view, so we decided to "upgrade". After the upgrade we had a wonderful view of the pool and tower and the waltzing waters across the street. We upgraded to the level of getting the breakfast and lite dinner on the 32nd Floor. What a wonderful suprise all of this was! We would stay there again in a heart beat...providing we were not an a budget. We planned ahead by 3 months. Our time frame was open, so we just picked the week that was the cheapest. $70/nite for The Paris during the last week in September. Then we upgraded from there. The staff was extremely polite and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Only Average”
Reviews.Author: San Diego is best
Reviews.Content: Good location in the near center of the Las Vegas strip can't overcome the disappointments. There are enough hotels in the relatively same location-go there. The check in was going well-"Luz" was very friendly & personable up until we delined the $55/night upgrade. Then it was "here's your room key, next person please". The non-upgraded room was clean and average in size. The bed was so uncomfortable, I woke up every few hours. The amenities (shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, lotion) were fine. TV was old but it worked. $15/day for internet access. "Teresita" who was cleaning near the elevators was very sweet and the ladies in the bakery cafe in the morning were great. If you find a really good rate for an upgraded room, then Paris would be a fine choice. If not, there are plenty of other options.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous food, great view”
Reviews.Author: BellaTavares
Reviews.Content: For an exceptional dining experience try the Eiffel Tower restaurant in the Paris hotel. It has a prix fix menu, flawless service and each course is more incredible than the previous one. Panoramic windows overlook the Bellagio hotel's dancing waters show which runs every 15 minutes. Tres romantique! Bring your wallet - it isn't a cheap date but it IS worth every dime!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location, so-so hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveling_teacher611
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned to Las Vegas for just our second time this past weekend. We knew we wanted to stay center strip, and the Paris was one of the best options within our price range. We had previously stayed at the Flamingo. Although both hotels were ok, we did probably prefer the Paris as it seemed a bit newer and "fancier." The decor made it feel a little more romantic as well. I must also state that we are spoiled in terms of hotels. My husband travels weekly for business so we are accustomed to staying in top quality Hilton hotels for free. So for us to pay what we did for an average quality hotel can be frustrating for us. I must say I have no major problems with the hotel. The bathroom was clean, as was the room. The carpet was showing its age and I was a little surprised to not see flat-screen TVs in the rooms. We also requested a king bed and got two queens, which is not a huge deal but a minor inconvenience. Our view was of the neighboring casino, and I was ok with that as we did not pay for any sort of upgrade. I did really like that the pool is open year round. We are hardy mid westerners and made our way out there in the 60-65 degree weather to "catch some sun" (since it's been below 30 degrees for what seems like forever in our neck of the woods). The pool area was fine - you have to remember that it is definitely not peak pool time and probably was not a priority for the staff. It was clean but there were no frills out there this time of year (we had to unstack our chairs and there was no pool bar or any food for purchase out there - which I understand why as there were probably only about 20 people out there!). Although there was a gym, there was a fee associated with it (maybe $25 - I can't remember exactly). So although I was hoping to work out, I didn't want to pay for one visit what I pay for nearly a month at my home gym... The room was quiet and comfortable. The beds were ok - not a nice pillow-top but also not rock hard and uncomfortable. Overall, I have no real negative things to say, but nothing outstanding either. The staff was friendly enough, my room was cleaned in a timely fashion, and the location can't be beat. I would stay here again, but would probably explore another option the next time I'm in Vegas. Happy gambling!

Reviews.Title: “Tough competition in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Mushy187
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas several times, but this was my first stay at the Paris Hotel/Casino. I'm including both the hotel and casino in this review. Keep in mind, it's very difficult to have a bad time in Las Vegas, and if you're enjoying it properly you're spending very little time in your room no matter where you stay. Starting with the good: The location is fantastic. Directly across from the Bellagio and within reasonable walking distance of both the north and the south end of the strip (for me the "strip" runs from the Luxor to Treasure Island). There is a monorail station located between Bally's and Paris so if you wanted to save yourself a little walking and don't want to spend the money on a cab this option is a nice alternative. The hotel/casino is very clean (although most of the places along the strip are pretty imaculate). The room was very clean and housekeeping was by every day. The bed we had was very comfortable, and we had quiet neighbors, but when walking the halls we could hear inside a lot of the rooms so I'm guessing the walls are very thin or poorly insulated. I'll admit, I typically had a couple of beverages that aided in my being able to sleep, but I slept fairly well here. It didn't appear to me that this particular hotel draws the truly wild crowds so I would think most people could get a good nights sleep here too. Now the not so good: Service is tricky to rate. The hotel staff, cleaning service, and everyone we encountered in the casino (dealers, pit bosses, waitresses, etc.) were 1st rate. A lot better in fact than I can say for other places I've stayed or played. That being said, the reason I can't give this a very good rating was one very critical thing for me in Las Vegas. There is no-where to eat after hours, and when I say after hours I mean 11pm. If this were any other town I would say this is no big deal. For me though, Vegas often requires eating a late dinner/early breakfast. The only thing open at that point are the bars (without food) or the tiny store selling water/pop/wine/candy/chips/etc.. Again, for some people this may not be a big deal but this was a major disappointment for us on a couple of occasions. The cost of the room when we booked it was right in line with other comparable places on the strip. There are cheaper rooms, and there are pricier rooms. Typically you get what you pay for in Vegas. In spite of the average price, I would have to say the room itself was below average. We had booked a non-smoking King, but only a smoking King or a non-smoking Queen was available. We took the room with two Queens and that might be why the room felt very squeezed in. A small desk pushed against one shared wall with the entertainment center/dresser/closet. A small chair pushed into the corner next to one of the beds. A small nightstand between the two beds. The bathroom was big enough, as it had both a shower and a separate bathtub, but I think that added to the living space of the room being even smaller. The TV was a dated old tube TV with a remote control that didn't want to work half the time and the only way to get internet was through a hard wired ethernet cable that cost extra. Again, I never plan on spending most of my time in my room when I'm in Vegas, but for those who do I would caution against a stay at Paris. Or at least upgrade to a suite, or confirm that they have the King your reserved.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service/Great room”
Reviews.Author: whitewolf678
Reviews.Content: I stay in Vegas at least a couple of times a year, usually Harrah's properties. Hadn't stayed at Paris in a few years. Service - from Valet to check in to Conciege was awesome. Upgraded to a stip view room which included conciege level breakfast and evening snacks/drinks. Was well worth it, looked right out on the Eiffel tower, pool and Bellagio dancing waters. Room very clean and nice. Hotel overall quite clean and all personnel very friendly and helpful. Superbowl party in Napoleon's was low key (as low key as a Superbowl party can be) and great buffet food. ONLY negative at all that I saw was terrible return on slot machines. I tried a heck of a lot of different machines and couldn't win on any of them, not even really "play" money. I have stayed at Flamingo,Rio, Ceasars and Paris in the last few years and like Paris and Ceasars best.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for location, but that's about all”
Reviews.Author: ibg008
Reviews.Content: We got a room for a little over 100 dollars a night. A decent value for the location and amenities. The room itself is below average, box t.v., uncomfortable mattress and pillow, other than that its pretty decent. The resturant in the hotel that overlooks the strip isn't worth your time. The waiting staff certainly scouts their clientel to see who gets what service. The steak is cooked well, but lousy quality for Vegas. I loved the sports book at Paris, its low key but comfy. I also loved the convenience stores, convenient lunch spots, and easy accessibility throughout hotel. Considering to get into the Bellagio its 175+ this is a decent value... Again your paying for location in the price IMO

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but busy”
Reviews.Author: wanderingman09
Reviews.Content: We booked the Paris as part of a deal through Expedia. The hotel room was comfortable and quiet. The restaurants and cafes in the hotel provided enjoyable meals and snacks although the breakfast buffet was disappointing (more because of ambience than food). Our main issue was just how busy, noisy and smoky the casino and public areas were. Nowhere to get away from all the activity except for our room. Th location of the Paris in the centre of the Strip is fine but I would look at the Bellagio or venetian next time.

Reviews.Title: “When in Vegas, I will always stay at the Paris”
Reviews.Author: AstridWilson
Reviews.Content: When in Vegas, I will always stay at the Paris. I love the way it feels. It has great ambiance and atmosphere. It’s the right size and the buffet is excellent for breakfast. The room we stayed in was an average hotel room. The room was Clean and comfortable and very quiet. The water pressure in the shower was perfect. The self park garage is fairly easy to get to from the hotel room elevators. Our mid week price in February was $56 per night. This is a no frills room, no view room. Of course one of the best things about Paris is the location. Mid strip so you can walk to almost anything. It is right across from the Bellagio fountains and they are my favorite free attraction in Vegas. They give me goose bumps every time. My only complaints are: No coffee pot in the room for hot water to make tea. I brought my own tea bags and coffee express gave me free hot water in the evenings and charged $1 in the mornings. The Kleenex was very stiff and sandy, as Vegas is very dry, softer tissues would have been a nice touch. Tips: If you wish to ride the Eiffel tower, get a total rewards card for any of the following casinos total rewards desks: Caesars, Paris, Harrah’s, Planet Hollywood, the Imperial Palace, The Flamingo and Rio. There is a coupon in the rewards booklet that gives you two for one rides. The cost is now $16 per person. The View is awesome; however I am not sure it is worth $32 for two, but is worth $16 for two. Be sure you stay long enough to see one Bellagio fountain show from the top of the Eiffel tower. I recommend the Buffet of Buffets. It is $40 for a 24 hour time and you can eat at 7 buffets. This includes Caesars, Paris, Harrah’s, Planet Hollywood, the Imperial Palace, The Flamingo and Rio. So you eat Dinner first day at 6:30PM, breakfast before 9:30AM, lunch and then Dinner again at 6PM. Note: I recommend NEVER eating breakfast at a buffet after 9:30AM and never eat dinner at 7PM as the lines are too long. We ate at 5:30 one day and walked right in. So you get the potential of 4 all you can eat meals for $40. Even if you are not a big eater, the cost is great. We stayed in Paris so we ate breakfast at the Paris twice and Saturday morning they even had crab legs and crab claws on the buffet.
