The $40 is a great deal as breakfast on the weekends is $19 and dinner during the week in $25. So essentially lunch is free and if you can double up the hours, then two meals are virtually free. I loved breakfast at Paris, because of the way Paris made you feel. We tried Planet Hollywood and Harrah’s for Dinner; however they lacked the atmosphere that Paris exudes. At the Paris buffet, you feel like you are on the sidewalks of Paris, while the other buffets had the atmosphere of a K&W or any other buffet in the USA. I would at least do the buffet once during your stay and time it so you get two dinners.

Reviews.Title: “i would expect better”
Reviews.Author: jake80Bologna
Reviews.Content: nice entertainment, room was ok, not particulary rich as las vegas use but ok, the climate was really too cold, and we cannot adjust becouse if we switched off the ac, the room would be fill of smoke of the rooms of the other floors.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and theme. Worth checking out.”
Reviews.Author: chrismedia01
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Las Vegas and stayed at the Paris. If you are looking for a place to stay in vegas, its definitely worth considering. There were a lot of “Pros” and a few “Cons”, depending on how you look at it. Service The people at the front desk are pretty good, although we did get one guy that was rude. When we first got there, we got to the hotel at 11:30am and the guy was rude and said that the rooms weren't ready until 4pm. When we asked politely if anything was available a bit sooner, he said he would put a "rush" on a room. However, when we went to check up every hour, it still wasn’t ready. It wasn’t until we got a really nice lady at the front deck around 3:30pm who said the room wasn’t ready but she could give us another room exactly the same that HAD been ready. Also, be prepared to tip EVERYONE. You want info, a tip. You want them to watch your bags, a tip. You want a map, tip. And try to avoid making phone calls from the room, even the local ones are $1.25 each. If you can avoid it. Regarding checkout, they were VERY accommodating. They extended our checkout 2 hours past for no additional charge since we had a late night flight, plus they were really nice about it. So for the most part, the service is pretty good. Rooms The rooms were very clean, and the housekeeping insisted on cleaning our room every day (even when we didn't want to). Didn't know how I felt about this at first, but it really did keep the place VERY nice. The bathrooms were amazing and the decor in the room was very nice, and super clean (hence cleaning our room every day) Location: I gotta say, the location was PERFECT. It was right in the middle of the strip and surrounded by everything. We were VERY happy with the location. Plus, it was right across from the Bellagio, so you could see the water shows. VERY nice! Also a lot of the nightlife was very close. You could walk either way, north or south, on the strip and within minutes be at a bar or lounge. Shopping: Do not plan on shopping in the shoppes within the hotel unless you got extra cash to burn. Bottled waters were $4. A “Paris” chocolate bar was $18. and a bottle of local sparkling wine was $60 (and it wasn’t anything fancy). Also, we ate from one of the restaurants the first day and my boyfriend got sick from the food and it was a bit overpriced. Since the hotel was so close to other restaurants, I would suggest checking out one on the strip. I did hear that the buffet in Paris was really good, but we never went cause there was always a huge lineup. Atmosphere: The atmosphere was nice, but if your looking for somewhere “young and hip”, this probably isn’t the place for you. The majority was an older crowd and we saw a few families. There weren’t any good lounges or clubs in there either. However the eiffel tower and the decor was beautiful. Definitely take lots of pictures. Overall, I would say this is a pretty good place to stay and definitely worth checking out. I would go back, although probably not my next time in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, lots & lots of Kids”
Reviews.Author: Beavsgo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris Dec 18th-Dec 21st 2010 for my birthday. The room was great, one of the red rooms. Very nice, clean, and comfy. The casino was good, a bit upscale, but nicely laid out. The location is fantastic. Right in the middle of the strip. Couldn't ask for a better spot. All that being said, I couldn't believe the amount of young children that were present in the hotel all day and night long. It was crazy. They where everywhere! One morning we woke to kids in the hall playing and having a fun kid time....a noise fun kid time. Downstairs strollers and kids everywhere. The buffet line was 1+ hour long wait the ENTIRE time we where there, parents and kids waiting in line. Seriously, from first thing in the morning until late at night. We won't be staying here next time we are in Vegas, simple because we like to be away from kids while we are drinking/gambling and being responsible young adults. Isn't that what Vegas is for????

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Awesome trip”
Reviews.Author: jgm820
Reviews.Content: We visited January 21-24, 2011 (6 adults). We've been to Vegas a few other times, staying at Caesar's and Monte Carlo. This time we decided to try Paris. It was a great hotel. We spent each afternoon at the Central Bar that had 2-1 martinis from 12-7 daily. Great wait staff - very fun! We stayed on the 14th floor - pretty uneventful view, but the room was spacious and comfortable. Old school TV (in the flat screen age), but we didn't watch it much anyway. The partnerships between Paris and the surrounding hotels afforded some great deals/coupons during our trip. The current promotion is 7 buffets! If you open a Total Rewards card at the casino (free), you get a 24 hour buffett pass for $39 that is good a 7 different hotel buffets. We had champagne brunch twice at Caesars and dinner at the Paris buffet - we thought we'd be able to squeeze a 4th buffet in, but ran out of time and appetite :) We ate the last evening at Mon Ami Gabi and despite the cool evening, enjoyed al fresco dining under the propane heaters on the patio. Once again - great wait staff! All in all a great trip - didn't win anything, but had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “PARIS - Excellent Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Hotelnspector
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 days at the Paris in January 2011. It has the wow factor from the moment that you arrive at the resort. Check in was very speedy. We were given the option to pay for upgrades but chose not to. The lady on the check in desk,however, realised that we would be staying for 6 nights and said that she would give us a room with a view if we did not mind having 2 queen sixed beds instead of a king. We accepted and what room it was - I believe that it was the standard luxury but it really was excellent. We had a superb view of the pool, part of the strip, the eiffel tower and the bellagio fountains. The hotel is really clean and well maintanined. We only ate at the buffet for breakfast - this was great as it is set up as a Parisian cafe - breakfast was $15.99 each during the week and $18.99 at weekends - the choice was brilliant. Casino is small by Vegas standards but is more than adequate and not very smoky. Drank in the Sports bar and a burger brassierie which is still part of the Paris complex but on the walkway through to Bally's casino which connects with the Paris - the burger brasserie has some good food and drinks offers each day. Pool area was great and we were fortunte in that the weather was good and was able to used the pool. Location of the hotel could not be better. Coming out of the main entrance to the hotel and going down to the end of the hotel drive - if you turn left then in walking distance is Planet Holywood Resort , MGM, New York, New York and others - there is a McDonalds and Denny's, 7-11 store and other shops - if you turn right out of the hotel then you come to Caesars Palace, The Mirage, The Venetian and others. All in all a brilliant trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the strip”
Reviews.Author: travelbug155032
Reviews.Content: Average hotel on the strip. Restaurant prices are high. Long lines at the buffet. Rooms are fairly large. We would go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Give it three stars.”
Reviews.Author: beachbird129
Reviews.Content: We had a party of 8 arriving at the Paris to attend a convention in Vegas. As we were the first to arrive and it was 12 noon - our room was not ready in fact the check in chick didnt want to know (had a french attitude even though she is filipino) couldnt find the booking name etc. said we couldnt check in now until 4pm.and advised the head of our party had to check in before we could . Not happy we left the hotel went for a drive which was fine and checked in later on. Another problem with this hotel is the check in is a long distance from the elevators..its fine if you dont have to dodge thousands of people with all your bags to get to it. The set up on the casino floor is a maze of avenues, shops and is quite dark. Most other casinos in Vegas are dark but easier to get around. In the end we were given a double room on a lower floor away from the rest of the group. This is my second visit in 4 years. (hotel was not my choice). I personally wouldnt stay here again...the staff have attitude, the food isnt great, the place has no vibe and the overall layout could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Not my cup of tea!”
Reviews.Author: Nicoleb1978
Reviews.Content: When my husband and I first walked in we thought the Reception area was beautiful but the casino was very small. The rooms are very outdated. When I went to open the dresser drawer… the drawer fell apart. The lighting fixtures were all broke. The toilet paper holder was broke and the toilet was very finicky. I would never stay there again. The furniture in the spa sitting area was really dirty. I did not even want to sit down. The hot tub was filthy. It had dirty bubbles all in it. In the left corner of the hot tub there was this icky dirty glob. BUT I must say even though the Hotel is very out dated and dirty the service was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get any better than this”
Reviews.Author: Sav50
Reviews.Content: Our first time to stay at the Paris the room was newly remodeled and was very clean. The service was very good lots of good restaurants and shopping the location is great because you can walk either direction... The layout of the casino is great and easy to get around thanks for a great time

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Paris”
Reviews.Author: mariejo71
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, nice clean. Good location A ++++++ The buffet is so good and you have french music.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Nauman-M
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Paris Las Vegas for 4 nights in December 2010. You can find cheaper accomodation on the strip, however I got very good value at Paris for the $s spent. The hotel is centrally located on the strip. The rooms are large, neat and clean. I checked in early but was given a room promptly. I requested and was given a room with a (partial) view of the lake and fountains of Bellagio across the street. Both check-in & check-out were quick. First night I had some problem with the hot water in the wash room, but it was fixed promptly. Great place to stay. This was my second stay at this hotel and I look forward to staying there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and awesome location”
Reviews.Author: fearlessinfuquay
Reviews.Content: The location is dead-center strip, directly across from the Belaggio and their incredible fountains. Considering that the strip is 4 miles long, location is very important. This is one of the older resorts, but 5 of their floors have been renovated. Fortunately, our room on the 27th floor was one of them. The room was exceptionally clean, and very roomy. The marble bathroom was to die for! And our view was spectacular! The gentleman who checked us in, and assigned us our room, was a doll. The inside of the Paris was a combination of just beautiful, and very interesting. The inside ceilings gives an optical illusion that you are outside. It's really something. We had heard that the Paris Buffet is excellent. We did not think so, at all. And we did not go to any of the other restaurants at the Paris. We purchased for $40 per person, for a 24 hour of all-you-can-eat buffet (with 7 resort buffets to choose from). Hands down, the Planet Hollywood Buffet (which is right next door to the Paris) was the best. It was excellent. Breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Lots of variety and choices. Where can you possibly eat for $40 a day? Let alone King Crab, Shrimp, etc! If we ever get back to Vegas, we will definitely be staying at the Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Room Amenities and Smell”
Reviews.Author: lana90025
Reviews.Content: We just stayed one night on January 24, 2011. The bed in the room was very uncomfortable it was hard like a rock and the pillows were awful - very uncomfortable. We didn't sleep because of it and got up the next morning feeling like a truck hit us. The room amenities are very old, worn and outdated.The ceilings are very low as another reviewer stated. There was also a terrible "rotten egg smell" in the casino, especially near the "Gustav Bar" by the eiffel tower in the casino - it was so bad I had to plug my nose. It was also at the other side by the blackjack tables near the front desk. It seemed like they had sewage problems. I complained about the room to the manager in the morning and he didnt seem too concerned. we wont stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Casino and Features great - hotel room average”
Reviews.Author: wayneblen
Reviews.Content: This is one of the better casinos in terms of theme - especially with the tower and all but the thoroughfares were a little crowded and the room was only average. Decor was dated, (possibly the French look), there was no tea and coffee facilities in the room (maybe this is standard for Vegas Casino hotels?) and internet connection was $14.99 per day. The fridge was a specialised mini bar which was no longer stocked but not much use for keeping your own beer or wine or water or whatever in either - if they are going to do away with the mini bar they may as well get a normal fridge. The bed was too hard for my liking. There is no "business centre" where you can go and check your email or print boarding passes etc. either (a business centre "store") - again maybe this is standard for Vegas - we might be too used to the Courtyard and Fairfeld. Tried the 2 for one Martini happy hour one evening - at $16 we were glad we didn't go outside HH... Food seemed expensive at most of the restaurants - even the coffe and pastry shop. We didn't eat at any... Pool setting was nice (wrong time of year though) - I think there may have been a fitness centre but I never managed to find it...

Reviews.Title: “I moved to another hotel after 2 days at the Paris”
Reviews.Author: katya73
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, we did not have a very nice stay at the Paris hotel. The staff complained that service suffered due to an abundance of people visiting for the New Year celebration. But rooms are run down, furniture is in distressed condition ( we changed two rooms while at the hotel), the ceiling is low, the bar in the room is empty, pillows are terrible and etc. We felt is if we were renting a bed for the night with little additional conveniences. We spent 40 minutes standing in line to get into any of the restaurants at the hotel in the morning, and ended up ordering breakfast into the room - which was excellent in comparison to the rest of the food we had there. Service at restaurant is terrible. Basically, we felt like we should avoid this place until the night comes. The last time I stayed there was 12 years ago, my experience was different. The outside of the property is very nice! As a result, we stayed for 2 days and moved to Bellagio! It was worth it. Chose a different place to stay if you are seeking care and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property, quality restuarants!”
Reviews.Author: dubord207
Reviews.Content: I was here for 5 nights with my wife who was attending a conference. As a former owner of two hotels, I look at hotel amenities with a sharp eye. This is a well-run hotel. Our room, 1598, was clean and although it didn't face the Strip directly, we still had a great view of the fountain at Bellagio. The room was quiet, clean, the beds were comfortable and we slept very well. One annoying issue is the lack of a place to plug in the power cord for your computer. There are other comments about this, but management hasn't addressed the issue. Time for some flat screen TV's. We didn't watch it much, but the picture would be good for a few minutes and then deteriorate. The bed lights weren't well thought out as they are inconvenient to reach when it's time for lights out. Other then that, the room was well appointed. We tried several of the restaurants. Mon Ami Gabi is a solid 4 stars. The patio area fills up quickly but is a great spot for dinner. The seared scallops were excellent as were the crab cakes and of course the escargot. We also had the Fillet Mignon with the Merlot reduction sauce and it was superb! The caulliflower puree was a nice side. Breakfast: the Le Cafe is the first place you'll see when you get off the elevator. Their breakfast is very limited but until folks realize there are other choices, they stand in line! Skip this and head over the Mon Ami. Try the homemade hash and the breakfast hashbrowns are second to none. We didn't eat at the buffet but went in and walked around. There's a huge variety and it all looked great, we just don't do well with buffets. On Fri, Sat and Sunday, at the bar advertizing dualing pianos, there is a Motown quartet that will blow you socks off. Sit up front and let these talented guys flirt with your wife/girlfriend. We dined at the Eiffel Tower restaurant one night, had a window seat and a spectacular meal we won't forget soon. We started with the foie gras and the smoked salmon, perfectly prepared and presented. My wife had the beef Wellington with au gratin potatoes and I opted for the lamb chops that were 2 inches thick and perfectcly prepared. We finished the meal with a scrumpous chocolate creation. The service was perfectly paced and of course the view of the strip and the Bellagio fountains added a nice and romantic touch. We opted to rent a car, first time I've done so in many visits to Vegas. The valet service was quick and efficient and a right turn out of the property and a quick left and I-15 is a block away. Our stay was pleasant, relaxed and we enjoyed not only the location but the many fine amenities this hotel offers.

Reviews.Title: “Have never had more problems at a hotel in my life!”
Reviews.Author: cmf123
Reviews.Content: When I booked my room, through the Paris website, I booked an upgraded luxury room. When I checked in, I was very rudely told by Marie that my room - which I paid for - was just a request and not an actual guarentee. We had three rooms booked and none of them were given the correct room. Marie tried to convince us that she was upgrading us to a better view room but the rooms I had booked had upgraded beds, sheets, tv, bathrooms, EVERYTHING! So then the next day we went and were moved to another room which was much nicer and didn't even compare to the room that I was told was basically the same. I was given a $50 resort credit for having to stay in a bad room one night and having to move all of my things to a new room. Then I used the resort credit at a restaurant on the property and have just found the charged my card for the meal anyway. The hotel refuses to reverse the charges. Normally I never write reviews on hotels or anything but the hotel created so many problems for us that I will never return! There are tons of options to choose from in Vegas - so don't pick Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “Paris on a budget”
Reviews.Author: yeoyeoyeo
Reviews.Content: My wife and three children booked 5 nights in two standard Paris rooms and were thrilled beyond belief. Though our rooms did not have the strip view but we looked at Ballys next door and some street scenes. Our rooms were clean, spacious are a fridge as well. One shelf in the fridge could be used to put our cold drinks in....a plus. As for the hotel/casino, wonderfully decorated but fun and campy. The pool is a picture takers fantasy and my girls loved it. We loved the location to all the center strip action. We walked everywhere. Do the eiffel tower ride, it's a great view of the strip. Check in was long but effecient. We would consider staying there again in a heartbeat. Sorry for taking so long in turning in the review but we are planning another vegas trip and it was on my mind. Vegas or is it Paris....here we come.....

Reviews.Title: “Great location, large rooms, great price!”
Reviews.Author: ms24sp
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paris hotel in Jan 2011. Paid $25 a night through booking.com and didnt expect to get a good room, just a central base to stay on the strip, but I was very suprised! The room was a very good size with 2 double beds. The bathroom was massive with bath and seperate shower. We were on the 7th floor looking out onto some AC vents but this was no problem at all - it was so quiet at night. The staff member tried to get us to upgrade to a suite at checkin as well as to a 'Paris' room which we declined to both and I'm glad we did - this room was perfectly adequate for us and much more than we expected anyway. Free parking although it is a long walk from the main reception/lobby area. The Paris street scenes are very cool. Would not both with the restaurants though as we found them quite pricey compared to what you could have got outside of the hotel. Great location - opposite the Belagio, next to Miracle Mile shopping centre, you could not ask to be more centrally located. Overall, very good and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the free room”
Reviews.Author: thespottedtraveler
Reviews.Content: Check in was slow, as there was only 2 people working, and one kept leaving the area and chatting with someone. Our room was spacious, and the bathroom was very clean. The beds weren't that comfortable, but the shower had great hot water pressure!! Lots of space to put luggage. We did order room service one morning, was delivered promptly and piping hot.

Reviews.Title: “Centre of the Action”
Reviews.Author: RunninAllOver
Reviews.Content: Paris! is a nice enough Vegas strip hotel. It is at the centre of the strip making walking to other locations very easy and has the Bellagio water show directly across the street. The "Paris theme park" atmosphere is fun, over a short period. Great casino, one of the busier casino's from what we could see. We upgraded to their "red rooms" but not sure what we gained for the extra money. The linen and pillows were nice. We enjoyed their take on the French sidewalk Bistro with the restaurant "Mon Ami Gabi".

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Woozster
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Paris in Las Vegas many times, most recently on Jan. 10-13, 2011. The hotel hasn't changed much in 10 years. We upgraded our room to the Red Room for an extra $40 per night. Our room was on an upper floor with a view to the east. It was clean and did have a coffee pot and a king-size bed. The hotel/casino is nice, smallish compared to some of the newer ones. The line for breakfast in the coffee shop is long but moves quickly. We would NOT recommend Mon Ami Gabi restaurant in this hotel. The location of the hotel is great, right in the thick of things.

Reviews.Title: “Tired rooms with fair service meet to deliver only the basics”
Reviews.Author: Golliwobbler
Reviews.Content: Room was very basic. They are evidently upgrading their rooms, but they waited far too long. The rooms that have not been dealt with are terrible. Mattresses are about the worst I've ever seen - think of that low quality motel you pulled into on the side of the highway only because you were tired and needed a place to stop. Problem is Paris charges top dollar for the pleasure of sleeping on an ancient mattress with a balled up mattress pad barely covered by the thin fitted sheet. Floor was dirty and spotted - and in Vegas who knows what that spot actually is. Finally staff are very nice but not very detail oriented. Don't seem to genuinely want to cater to their guests. Just book them in and book them out and if there is a problem, well don't worry, we have another coming right away just like you. My suggestion is "stay at MGM."

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: ljkabby
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed her between Christmas and New Year's. We arrived a little early but were told we would be able to check in. As it was my birthday, I requested an upgrade and was told we could get a better room for an extra $50/day. We declined, and the girl said she had a higher floor room at the same price, but it would be ready between 4-6 pm. We said ok and they took care of our luggage until the room was ready. The front desk staff was competant but not friendly. The room was very comfortable, no complaints. However, I found it odd that there wasn't a hotel services book. I wanted to know where and when the pool/fitness was. What restaurants etc. I would recommend the room service, the food was delicious and not too expensive. My only complaints would be that they charge for everything, eg. wifi (connection was not good), fitness center ($25/day)

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: ADKtraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on recent business trip and the hotel was acceptable as stated in the title. The rooms are fine but not too fancy. Most importantly they were clean and reasonably comfortable. The only issues I had with the room is the lack of outlets to plug in a computer or charge a phone and lack of light. I was going to unplug the light at the desk to plug in my computer when I realized the person before must have had the same issue as the light was already unplugged. To compound the issue there were not enough lights in the room to begin with so unplugging the light made it a bit difficult to work at the desk.. I had no issues with noise in the room, the access to the rooms was convenient off the casino floor and there is a small 24 hour mini store outside the elevators - which is convenient to pick up something when heading up to the room. I would stay here again if the price is reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Oh La La”
Reviews.Author: Debwj
Reviews.Content: Was hesitant staying at The Paris after reading some reviews on Trip Advisor but decided to stay because of the location. Lesson learned - don't believe every negative thing you read. The rooms were great - beds were comfortable and bathrooms w/marble floors gave you that special Vegas feel. Front Desk checked us in early, no fees or hassle and made sure our rooms were next to each other. No resort fees. Mon Amie restaurant had great food and even better service and watching the Bellagio fountains while eating was a wonderfully (warm) treat. Would rebook and we're picky.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Service”
Reviews.Author: RLThierry
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 9:00am and was informed that early check-in was not available until 11:00am so I took a walk over to Gustav's bar and encountered Ray who was working behind the bar. Ray couldn't have been friendlier and it was a true pleasure to spend a couple of hours with him. Ray made sure that I always had a glass of scotch in front of me and was always quite entertaining. The young lady at the front desk upgraded my comped room to one that had an excellent view of the fountain across the street and was supplied with the coffee maker that I had requested. The room was clean and I couldn't find a single thing that could have been approved upon. Every single employee that I made eye contact with during my stay always greeted me a warm good morning, afternoon or evening depending on the time of day. The housekeeping staff did a great job making up the room each day and I couldn't have asked anything more of them that would have made my stay more pleasurable. The cocktail waitresses in the casino were very attentive and never needed to be reminded what I was drinking after the first order. On one occasion one of the cocktail waitresses came up to me and told me that she was getting off in a few minutes and wanted to see if there was anything she could bring me before she left for the day. I didn't try any of the food oulets in the hotel but I did have several conversations with people who had dined at them and I didn't hear a single complaint. The bellhops were prompt with my bags and also very friendly. I couldn't have asked for anything more and would like to thank the entire staff for making my stay a truly delightful one. I've stayed at other hotles in Las Vegas in the past but I don't think that I will be staying anywhere other than Paris in the future.

Reviews.Title: “very clean...but noisy”
Reviews.Author: haleyscomet389
Reviews.Content: I went to Las Vegas with my mom when she went on a buisness trip. This hotel was very beautiful, as was the eiffel tower. In addition to the view of the strip from the eiffel tower, you were able to see the "water show" at the Bellagio. The staff were always looking for a tip, but they were very helpful. This hotel was very noisy, which made it hard to sleep in. This is a very small hotel compared to the other hotels on the strip, but it is very beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Boring...”
Reviews.Author: WNNX
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a French ooh-la-la experience, keep on walking. This hotel is boring, uninspired and almost tacky. The rooms are not special at all. The staff is rather snarky and are not committed to helping the client. I paid too much for this no-frills MOTEL to be treated so poorly and have a lackluster stay.

Reviews.Title: “FUN THEME”
Reviews.Author: loreal3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris over Labor Day weekend. Our room was fantastic, it happened to be a corner room so it was very spacious and had a great view of the fountains at the Bellagio. The room was very clean and the bed was also very comfortable. The hotel had a band playing in the evenings in one of the bars right off the casino and that was a lot of fun and they were very good. Also the dueling piano bar was very fun. The buffet was good very diverse. Stay far away from the spa, very over priced and not the best massage I have ever had. The massage therapist would not stop talking, even when I would not talk back, he just kept talking. The fitness center also is a very high fee to use.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with service”
Reviews.Author: seema60
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel due to the above average reviews on Tripadvisor. We were so disappointed with the service in this hotel. We had just driven back from Springdale where we had a fantastic time. We drove into the self park area of the hotel and dragged our bags to the reception which was a good ten minutes walk. It's not very well marked and the hotel lobby is extremely busy and crowded. The decor was very good, a bit garish for my taste but that's Las Vegas I thought. We waited in line for the check in. Not a smile on the lady's face while she checked us in. Initially she gave me grief because Expedia had booked on my husband's name. Luckily for me, my husband's name is my middle name so she accepted the reservation. We went up to the room on the 8 th floor..right in the corner, facing the back. We discovered there was no coffee maker, the fridge was not stocked, the light on the side of the bed was not working. We called housekeeping to discover that only suites and rooms above the 25th floor deserve a coffee maker!!! I thought that was quite ridiculous. The fridge did not get stocked until we left. The light was changed right away though. I just thought the hotel was overpriced..we paid $125 for the first night and $250 for the second. Maybe that's just the way prices are in Las Vegas. It is centrally located on the strip and well connected to all the other hotels. The one restaurant that we went to was Cafe Provencal which had the worst pizzas I have ever had. It actually wasn't a pizza. It was a warm flat bread with prosciutto and arugula leaves with cold shredded mozzarella on top. Overall I was quite disappointed as I had expected it to be much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice service & room”
Reviews.Author: labsfive
Reviews.Content: Our first room was dirty and two double beds. We requested another room & were given one with a killer view of the sun coming up over the mountains in the morning and a king bed much cleaner than the first (no stains on the carpeting & chairs). Not overly friendly staff great location on strip.Eat at the Mon Ami for their incrediable breakfasts though a bit pricey very good. There is so many hotels in area would try another one next time for a different experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: travel_junkie3000
Reviews.Content: We booked a last minute trip through priceline and reserved the Paris Hotel as part of our package. I checked the reviews of the hotel on Tripadvisor after I booked, which is really unusual for me - I travel quite a bit and always check the reviews first. I guess since this was last minute I took a chance and I'm very glad I did. Our room was lovely and overlooked the Las Vegas Eiffel Tower and the Bellagio fountains. It was wonderful watching the fountain show from the windows in our room. Other reviews have indicated the rooms were shabby and worn, this was not our experience at all. Our room was completely updated and extremely clean. Bed linens were new and contemporary and the bathroom was beautiful. The hotel itself if like others on the strip mostly casino with shops and restaurants intermingled. We ate breakfast at Mon Ami Gabi, which recently started serving breakfast. It was easiest to get a seat as it's located away from the other restaurants and cafes which had lines out the door. Breakfast was delicious and resonably priced... for Las Vegas prices. Service was the only average thing at the hotel. Adequate but not over the top. The location is fabulous as it's essentially in the middle of the strip with easy access to all of the other properties. I'd recommend the Paris and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “First Rate Experience”
Reviews.Author: jimboCA
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a vacation through Southern California, Arizona and Nevada. This included a 5 night stay in Las Vegas. It was our first trip to Las Vegas and we had the great good fortune to stay at Paris Las Vegas for the time we were there. Many friends had told us that the Bellagio was the place to stay, but we adore Paris and France, so decided that if we could not be in Paris for the holidays, Paris Las Vegas might be a good second choice. We were not disappointed. We also noted that your hotel seemed like the only one to openly market to the gay market – a factor that helped us in our decision. Both of us are involved in public service and know that many times you only get to hear about the bad experiences and the troubles that clients or guests have had. We wanted to make sure that you go some good feedback on our experience. From the very minute we stepped into the hotel, the staff was amazing. The front desk clerk was delightful, friendly, and helpful. She suggested that we might want to upgrade to a suite and it was the best decision of our entire vacation. Being able to escape to the 32nd floor and to the peace and quiet of our room was very much appreciated. The housekeeping staff took incredibly good care of us. We noticed that even as we passed them in the hall they would acknowledge our presence and give us a morning greeting, including a “Merry Christmas” on Christmas morning. The rooms of the suite were spotless and well done. It was a beautiful space and well kept. The staff at every restaurant that we ate at was truly amazing as well. We ate at the Ile St. Louis, Le Provencal and Mon Ami Gabi. Every single staff person from the host/hostess, wait staff, bus staff provided an excellent job of service to us even though the restaurants were always busy at this time of year. We never felt neglected or hurried as we ate our meals. We particularly would like to call out the staff at Mon Ami Gabi. It was such a delightful experience on our first morning there that we ate breakfast there every morning for the rest of our stay and decided to have Christmas dinner there. All of the food in these restaurants was superior and cooked perfectly. They were some of the best meals we have ever had we had and we have traveled a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but difficult to bring in luggage”
Reviews.Author: POLDIE
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very nice with a lovely Parisian athmosphere. One could easily imagine being in Paris France. Impressive lobby with giant chandeliers, courteous staff. Our room was comfortable, clean and very spacious and so was the bathroom. All necessities were supplied including hairdryer and coffee machine. Problem was with the luggage. The Airport Shuttle drops you off in a side street at the rear entrance of the hotel. There is no hotel help available, no luggage cart in sight. You have to carry all of your luggage through the entire casino and try not to get lost finding the lobby. Lovely little Cafe's throughout the hotel but huge line-ups for breakfast... I highly recommend the restaurant MON AMI GABI, especially since they also had a gluten-free menu. All in all our stay was quite pleasant and I can easily recommend the Paris Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok”
Reviews.Author: Romfordman
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights as part of pre paid package holiday in Vegas, on arrival we got lucky and checked in with a guy called Brian - he was great and upgraded our standard two bed room into the Imperial Suite - This room had two bathrooms, two beds sofas hot tub etc. But when you got over the initial wow factor of the upgrade, you then analysed & noticed that the room was just a big space that they had put various items in to fill it out - the shower was not a power shower and the finishing of the appliances in the bathroom was not good. The toiletries were sparse and low cost and there were bearly enough towels for two people. Room service was good, as were the general cleanliness & service levels of the staff. Overall an ok experience but we would try a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Nate226
Reviews.Content: You won't be disappointed. Purchased the romance package and it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Food poisoning from in room dining at Paris - definitely do not recommend”
Reviews.Author: Srandall50065
Reviews.Content: I contacted Paris yesterday to explain that my husband had gotten food poisoning from in room dining on the evening of Dec 28th at Paris from the pizza and was furious when the manager simply stated that he would turn the info over to security and if they needed anything else they would contact me. Here is my problem... I did not call to get a discount, future coupon, or refund. I wanted to inform the food service dept of the situation so that the issue is handled for the future and so that other guests would not go through what my husband did. We had to fly home the next morning so my husband was sick the entire plane ride and he is still sick. I would have thought that the manager would apologize for the problem but he stated only the above. I work in the customer service industry and I expected to receive better from such a large company. Especially since word of mouth recommendations are so big and customers keep the business running. The first thing I would have done was apologize on behalf of the company and explain that it would be looked into and someone would be contacting me back. It would have been nice to hear that at least. I can definitely say that we will never stay, play, eat or recommend Paris. It infuriates me that the customer service the manager provided me was so poor. On top of that the rooms and hallways were very old and small. They had a tube tv that was maybe 22in. Maybe most people come to Vegas to gamble, party or site see but you also want to know that you are laying your head somewhere comfortable and that to me means a tv that I do not have to squint at to see what I am watching. House keeping even stopped by to ask when we were checking out so they could clean our room. I thought when you put "Do Not Disturb" on the door that is exactly what it means but apparently I was wrong. I also thought that they received a list of when people checked out so that the guests were not disturbed... wrong again. On the up side... no bed bugs but that is the best I can say about them.

Reviews.Title: “O.K. but not a four star experience”
Reviews.Author: tenthousandlakes
Reviews.Content: My husband accompanied me for a business trip to Las Vegas. We had never been to Las Vegas before and went through travel brochures and chose the Paris based on the idea that is seemed interesting but not super tacky. We were amused by the theme and tried to take into account the fact that Vegas is about fun. The room was disappointing. The decor was a bit worn. The bed was old and uncomfortable. The pillows had seen better days as well. When we checked in, we were told that we could only have a room with two double beds but we could switch rooms the following day. The bed was very uncomfortable. Also no flat screen and no coffee maker. Coffee could be purchased in the lobby for $3.50. We were very disappointed by the view. We were on the eighth floor and faced a parking lot. We were told we could upgrade to a room with a view for 50 dollars a night. I guess the room overall was okay but more on par with a Best Western than the Bellagio or the Venetian. Again, not a four star experience. Additionally, we ate at the Buffet and were annoyed that they had separated food into regions but had included things like Sushi. The food was okay but not worth what we paid for it. Some of it was very annoyingly standard cheesy starchy tasteless buffet fare.

Reviews.Title: “Went to the buffet and *YUK*”
Reviews.Author: ppaamm__gg
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a xmas visit to Las Vegas. Almost stayed at the Paris but decided instead to stay at the Encore. Retrospectively, glad we did. We did go to the Paris for the buffet and what a huge disappointment from our great experience 5 or 6 years ago. The line was 1.75 hrs long and I should have known better than to hand over my money when I saw *fried turkey legs* were on the menu. All in all, a filthy restaurant. Tables unbussed. Food slopped and dribbled all over the different food stations. Overcooked food. A lot of the food was not French. What a let down. Go to the Wynn buffet instead and enjoy the excellent food, service, and setting.

Reviews.Title: “I love it so much we stayed 3 times!”
Reviews.Author: jasmin711
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the Paris. We upgraded everytime , the rooms facing the Bellagio fountains and Eiffle Tower were awesome! The upgrade includes the continental breakfast and evening appitizers. The food is very good there so I highley recommend the upgrade. It really has the romantic ambiance of Paris. The location of the hotel was perfect , there is so many things to do within walking distance. I would recommend the Berry Crepe at La Creperie, I never leave Vegas without getting one because they are fabulous. The food at Mon Abi Gabi is good and for a buffet I suggest the Bleggio buffet it is the best and worth the wait. I have been to Vegas 4 times in the past 2 years and we stayed at Ceasars once and wouldn't go back. The other three times were at the Paris. We are going again on January 2011 for three days and we will be staying at the Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: MMa08
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice and spacious room at the paris. The room was quiet and quiet modern. The location in las vegas is excellent. The hotel is located on the strip quite close to other hotels/casinos and a huge shopping mall. Check in and check out were efficient.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time”
Reviews.Author: suecline127
Reviews.Content: I had read all the reviews of this hotel before comming and most were not good but we found that they were not to be true.Staff was great , helpful, and friendly. Room was nice and clean, with a view. Located right where we wanted to see the most. Would stay there again , found some shops were really more affordable than we thought that they would be. For sure take the Eiffel tower to the top at night to see the whole strip , cost was I believe 10.00 may have to wait in line but well worth it.No coffee pots in room three guesses why.(They walk away) I took my own.

Reviews.Title: “Attention to Details Would Help”
Reviews.Author: ADL99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Paris this last weekend with wife. The other reviews saying rooms need to be updated and refreshed are on point. We were on the 16th floor. A toilet paper roll acted as the door stop for the door leading from the elevators. It was there all three days so it was not just a temporary fix. Room attendant was terrific, room itself nothing special. No coffee maker, had to call maintenance to have refrigerator turned on (no self serve items, had received gift that needed refrigeration), television very outdated (true you are not in the rooms much but it would have been a positive touch for th trip if it was nicer) Common areas in the casino were packed. I don't get why anyone would wait in line to go to a buffet for what appeared to be hours but that's just me. Mon Ami Gabi was terrific, eating on the terrace was quite fun. Given all the other hotel options in Vegas I would not stay at Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “If you can spend more stay elsewhere...”
Reviews.Author: UmaKS
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Paris and also very disappointing. The basic luxury room given to us initially was terrible. It was on the 8th floor of the hotel and faced the back with a view of a parking lot. The entire floor was smelling very stale and it felt like their air conditioning was not recirculating the air very well. The room looked very tired and dated. The bed was hard, and the TV remote did not work. The bathroom door's lock was broken. And to top it all off there was no coffee maker in the room and no fridge. After spending 2 nights in this room we decided it was high time we asked for an upgrade. We were offered an upgrade to a red room that faced the strip and had views of the Eiffel tower and the Bellagio fountains. This upgrade cost us about $ 75 more per night in addition to what we had already paid. But it was worth it. This room had a flat screen TV and a coffee maker. The bed was ultra comfortable and the views out from our room located on the 30th floor of the hotel were breath taking. Everything was updated and clean and fresh completely unlike the tired luxury room given to us earlier. So if you want to enjoy your stay in this particular casino i would suggest you opt for an upgraded room and avoid their basic room offering. As far as the location went the casino is perfectly situated, right across the Bellagio casino and diagonally opposite to the new City Center with its shopping and hotels and also Caesars Palace. The ride to the top of the Eiffel tower for $ 15 per head was little expensive but the views from the top were good. The hotel also has quite a few restaurants. We ate at the Mon Ami Gabi which was excellent and also at the Le Village Buffet which was over priced and over crowded and the buffet stations were for some reason very dirty. It appeared to me that the service and wait staff were unable to keep pace with the considerable demand that this buffet has. We also ate at the Bellagio buffet which which was a much better choice and had an amazing variety of desserts. Be prepared for humongous lines everywhere. The wait to get into a buffet was nearly an hour long every time. Another problem area that this hotel has is the Valet Parking service. We used this to park our car almost everyday. But the wait while they retrieved our car was horribly long. One morning we had to wait for nearly 40 mins for our car. That was unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Paris is a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: brokenarm22
Reviews.Content: Paris is a pretty nice hotel and a cool casino. My room had no view, but for the most part it was comfortable. The bathroom was mid sized and the room had ample space to move around. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Worse Experience for this stay”
Reviews.Author: worseExp
Reviews.Content: This is the worse experience I ever had in Las Vegas. First, after i get off the elevator on the floor to my room is sting, terrible smell. It is really disgusting. Second, the room has no coffee maker. It is very very inconvenient. I suspect the hotel owner force the people to buy their coffee or tea. Any cheap hotel will provide with this. Third, my room was flooded with overflow water from the toilet. And the sink is kind of half clog. I will never never recommend any stay for this hotel. This is the worse.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL!!!”
Reviews.Author: natashacampbell77
Reviews.Content: Stunning place to stay! We stayed in a 'red' room, it was gorgeous, the bed was so comfortable. So much to look at in the hotel/ casino, even if you dont gamble. The bakery and french steak house were delicious! The pool looked amazing, it was too cold for us to swim. Great location right on the strip, everything at your doorstop and heaps of FREE parking.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for family visit to Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: SINN
Reviews.Content: Nice comfortable hotel perfectly located. We were at Paris, Las Vegas with 3 teenage kids. We asked for two adjacent rooms. We arrived late and were upgraded into a two rooms combination at the end of the hallway. Basically two rooms out of a little entry way that has its own door leading to the hotel corridor. Very convenient. Rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. The good thing is that you're able to enter the hotel without a long hike through the casino. As a matter of fact Paris's casino is not that big. There is a variety of restaurant options. Overall all, I would say it was a perfect choice for a family stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little corner of France”
Reviews.Author: madagou
Reviews.Content: We didn't have a reservation and hopefully there was 2 rooms side by side available for one night. The room was spacios, the bathroom amazing, everything that you may need! The staff very helpful. It seemed that I was in Paris, so crazy how you feel there. The location of this hotel is amazing cause just opposite to the Bellagio, so in the Strip mannn!!!! To be connected to internet, you have to pay but if you walk "in the street of Paris" you can connect to wifi!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never again..”
Reviews.Author: johnsonlmi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Paris a few times and the service has never been super, but to be fair the rooms are clean the casino is bright and its busy. This time we checked in on a Thursday afternoon for a fun trip in early December. We are Total Rewards Diamond members and get a complementary room in most places we stay. I had booked the room online and asked for our normal king bed room. We checked in on time and went up to the room to find 2 beds and a dirty room. I politely called and asked if we could get our king size bed room and at least a clean room. This room obviously had not been cleaned well and had smears on the mirrors the shower was dirty and the floor needed a good vacuuming. To my surprise the front desk told me they had given all the king rooms away and we had to sleep in a double for the night. Also they said the room had been cleaned and to call back in the morning to see about a king bed room. I told the person I was very disappointed and asked to please speak to a manager. Then I was hung up on. After calling back several times we were able to leave a voice mail for a manager. The manager never called back. We went about our night and enjoyed other casino's making sure not to gamble at the Paris. The next afternoon I went to Diamond check in and asked for a king room. They said at that time we had not called the night before and we did not have a king room. After a bit of please and thank you we did finally get to move to a standard king room.. I can say we did not gamble at this casino and we will not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Meetin with friends and family...at the Paris.”
Reviews.Author: linament99
Reviews.Content: Our family booked this hotel, from Amsterdam The Netherlands. We are Californians, but had never stayed on the strip . We were pleasantly surprised. Our room had a great view of the E. tower and the Ballagio fountains. The beds are comfortable. The bathrooms are slippery, watch out. The Paris is located close to everything...we never had to get in our car. A enjoyable walk to most attractions...in December, nice weather. We had breakfast at the Buffet , good selections. The staff and the store keepers and friendly and helpful. Get your reward card, it gets you unexpected discounts. There is no resort fee here. However if you want internet, it will cost you 31$/da. No coffee in the rooms, yikes, had to go downstairs for watered down $3 coffee. Tip; there is a Starbucks next door, enter the Mile Mall, right next door.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: krawner
Reviews.Content: Pros: Excellent location at center of strip. If lucky, your room faces the Eiffel Tower and the Bellagio Fountains. No resort fees. Comfortable beds. Cons: No free wifi. No coffee machine in room (and coffee costs 10 dollars from room service). Long lines for check-in and check-out. Furnishings and decor are on the older side. No cirque show. No awesome nightclub. I would stay here again if I they had a killer sale. Otherwise, I would consider staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Could use a renovation”
Reviews.Author: Daylove
Reviews.Content: The location is the only positive of this hotel which is quite old for Vegas standard. Room decor and furniture are old giving a bad feeling to the whole stay. The personnel was not the nicest one and room service food was not that good and delivery was slow. I do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: catmalways4ever
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel smack dab in the middle of the action. planet hollywood to the left, caesars towards the right and bellagio fountains in front... couldn't ask for better. luxurious enough to feel special, but not too stuffy to feel out of place.

Reviews.Title: “ooolalala”
Reviews.Author: abgal62
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a last minute shopping trip to Las Vegas and just had to write a review of the Paris. We arrived very late on December 12th and still we received a fabulous room overlooking the strip, the Eiffel Tower and the Bellgio fountains. Our room and the entire hotel was clean and very well maintained. Due to it's location we were in the center of everything yet our room was quiet for the few hours we slept. It is very apparent that Las Vegas is looking for travellers, so make sure you take advantage of their discounted accommodations. I strongly recommend this hotel for couples and friends who want to have a wonderfully luxurious getaway. We rented a car which I totally recommend for the power shoppers out there. For $50 (rental and gas) for the 4 days we were there was a great deal. We drove to every outlet mall and to the downtown core and other locations. Taxi or bus would have cost allot more and not as convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Paris Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Sasafratz
Reviews.Content: We arrived on December 11, 2010 at 2:00 PM and did not have long to wait for check in. Front desk was great, she confirmed our booking for non smoking with two queen beds which we got. We were situated on the 24th floor (non smoking floor) in room 2430. This room does not have a view except for the parking garage and the back end of Bally's. This didn't bother us we were not in planning to stay in our room for long periods of time. The only problem we had was that the remote control for the tv didn't work the first night but one call to Maintenance and we had new batteries put in while we were out. Had a voice mail message waiting for us from Amanda from Maintenance to check to make sure everything was working, which it was. The location can't be beat. Everything is within walking distance. Monorail is accessible through Bally's which is connected to Paris and the Gold Line transit stops in front of Paris to take you to the Premium Outlets or to the Fremont Experience. The added bonus was having a fridge in the room to store our bottled water which we bought at the ABC Store at the Miracle Mile Shop in Planet Hollywood. A simple hello from the staff (maintenance, housekeeping, front desk, bell captains) throughout the hotel and casino was great. The cocktail waitresses in the casino were attentive to your drink needs. I find that it's the little things that people do that make a big impact. Check out was a breeze and we were able to leave our luggage with the bell hops for storage until our shuttle picked us up at 6:20 PM. This was my mom's first time to Vegas and it probably won't be her last. This was a great vacation for my mom and myself. We will definitely be staying at the Paris on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good starter”
Reviews.Author: joleary1889
Reviews.Content: Great starter if it's your first time in Vegas, gives an insite to what is available both above and below the price you can pay, good all round hotel with a great location just lacking a few more eating options but there are many to be found in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Woke up with rash all over legs...”
Reviews.Author: monaco10
Reviews.Content: The hotel seemed to be beautiful and I cannot complain about the service quality of their staff. Housekeeping SEEMED to be top notch, but after waking up with a disgusting rash that spread all over both of my legs made me question the cleanliness of this property to say the least. This also occurred to the person that I shared a room with, as well as family members in two other rooms. Being a part of the Harrah's group, I found this to be very disappointing and completely unacceptable. I do have the room number, incase anyone has questions regarding this stay.

Reviews.Title: “No love in Paris, Wedding blues!”
Reviews.Author: southtxshine
Reviews.Content: Check in 12/8, arrived a little early..front desk says that nothing is ready, pls. check back in an hr or two. Front desk staff is very quick to move you along, short & rude, almost a "your dismissed attitude", next pls. Got room & it was NOTHING like what you see in pictures on the internet! The "blue" room is actually beige & run-down-bed-sinking in the middle-can actually see the springs-no comforter-dirty looking furniture-TV-channels that have no sound-scratched furniture type room. So tired from travel, took room expecting to speak w/frt. desk nxt morning. Got the "dbl. talk", sorry we're booked, check back with us, if you would like to upgrade to the "red" room that will be another $40 per day, anything else we can help you with? THIS WAS NOT GOING TO RUIN MY WEDDING DAY, which was on 12/10! Hotel knew ahead of time that we were to be married in Vegas, they COMP nothing! Received better service & attitudes at the MGM, Bally's, Bill's & the Flamingo during stay! The whole staff of the Paris is horrible. I'm NOT a "bridezilla", but this was ridculous...save your money & book somewhere else. Pluses of the Paris, the Tower & housekeeping (friendly) and watch out for the Wyndam time-share people, they try & rope you in w/"free" gifts, nothing is FREE at the Paris! Happily married & back in Texas where the people are friendly & I'll be glad to buy you a drink on your wedding day!

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: Nimps
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris Las Vegas for 6 night. This hotel is situated in the centre of the strip with the Belagio water fountain right accross the road. The staff upgraded us to a superior room with a view over the strip with an adjoining room for my brother and partner. The rooms were spacious and well maintained. Due to the windows being double glazed it was very quiet and almost impossible to hear street noise. I would definatly stay here again. The only sugestion I would make to the hotel management is to include a hot water jug in the rooms for making coffee or tea and having free Wi Fi in the rooms or in the loby.

Reviews.Title: “Location and View that can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: baileyfirestone
Reviews.Content: Although we stayed at the Aria, Wynn and thehotel @ Mandalay Bay for our last 3 trips, to Las Vegas, we decided to stay at the less expensive Paris this time. We were taking our 96 year old grandfather who wanted to be in the heart of the action, and the Paris seemed like a good choice given its location in the middle of the strip and our price sensitivity since we were paying for 2 rooms. We booked a red room with a view of the Eiffel Tower for us and a standard room for our grandfather, and without us asking, the front desk upgraded our grandfather's room (although without a view) so he could be on the same floor. Our initial reaction to the Paris was disappointment with the decor at check-in, in the elevators and hallways. However, the red rooms were large with upholstered red headboards, a large storage unit with flat screen TV and safe, desk, love seat and a king size bed. The bathroom was also large, with a separate tub and stall shower. The tub was quite small and shallow and the shower head was very high and small. We've been spoiled by having 2 sinks, large tubs, good lighting and bathrobes in the Aria, Wynn and thehotel. When we called Housekeeping to ask if bathrobes were available, we were told only for purchase. Despite its shortcomings compared to the other LV luxury hotels, the Paris grew on us because of its amazing view and location. Our room not only overlooked the Eiffel Tower, but had a view of the Bellagio fountains. We turned the loveseat around to have a panoramic view of the strip. It was simply fabulous. Some great things about the Paris: - The view and being in the center of the strip - Getting a late check-out (1pm) - Having a very nice EMT on-site when one of us had some digestive trouble - The shops downstairs where a good variety of carry-out food was available 1 quirky thing - The empty fridge in the room. Obviously this had once held a mini-bar, but it was now cold and empty which was handy for leftovers and a morning OJ.

Reviews.Title: “City of Love has become a dump”
Reviews.Author: MHTbased
Reviews.Content: From the unwelcoming frenetic lobby to the shoddy rooms, pick another place to spend your dollars. The staffing was light so they weren't prepared for the crowds - lines everywhere. The carpet in the guest rooms was thin and needed to be cleaned. The mattresses were hard and uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, good service - so happy we chose it”
Reviews.Author: auznewbie
Reviews.Content: We arrived in vegas after 24 hours of travel in Australia. This is going to be a very complementary review but I have to start with a negative. Because it was before 4pm, every line in the foyer said `checkout'. That meant that teems of people trying to check in got confused, queued with the concierge desk, went to the show tickets booth and generally didn't know what to do. Since we had a young kid and were very tired, wasting 30 minutes trying to figure out where to check in was annoying. Then we had a room debacle. Having paid for a premier red room,w e were allocated to a red room on a very low floor (level 10 or so). I immediately realised the error, but when I rang the front desk she told me there was no error and I had received what I'd paid for. Luckily, I had printed my booking receipt from the Paris website and took it down. The supervisor was very apologetic and told me it was lucky I had a copy of this with me as there `system' hadn't recorded it appropriately. He then told me this had happened a few times lately. Assuming this is a real mistake, it strikes me that this is pretty unacceptable if you are booking directly with the hotel. However, we got re-allocated to another room on about the 30th floor. It was lovely with a fantastic view of the Bellagio fountains. We could hear the music pretty easily and we turned our couch around so that we could sit and watch easily whenever the show started. Because we arrived about 4pm, we had a sleep prior to catching a show. No problems with noise at all. This was to continue on both nights. The first night we heard some young guys playing with our room service table for a few minutes but our sleep was excellent. The bed was exceptionally comfortable. After the show on our first night, we ordered room service and we found that we received excellent value for money. There was more food than we could imagine we could need! Also, everything arrived very quickly. I'd have to say the service was very good. Overall, you just can't beat the location of Paris, and this became obvious when compared to our second hotel (The Signature). We could get anywhere relatively quickly from Paris and this was important when travelling with a kid. Maybe if I had been travelling to Vegas in summer a better pool complex would have been important but we didn't go anywhere near it anyway. We had breakfast in one of the restaurants inside Paris on our last morning there and the pancakes were EXCELLENT! I would definitely stay at the Paris again, though the sheer number of choices in Vegas would probably make me choose one of the others in the vicinity just for a different experience. If you are a young couple looking for a romantic getaway, I can definitely recommend a Premier Red Room - you won't regret it at all.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: WeThreeAdventurers
Reviews.Content: We chose the Paris Las Vegas due to its wonderful central strip location...but it was not worth the rude staff and horrible rooms. Upon arrival, the check in staff was rude...never even smiling. They messed up our reservation, which we provided written confirmation for to prove our request, but told us we could pay an upgrade fee to another room or take what they had. They never tried to correct their mistake. When we asked for a supervisor/manager, they said we would have to wait about a half an hour and go sit somewhere to wait. It was not worth our time because we were tired from traveling, so we paid the upgrade. We had a King Suite with an adjoining two queen room. The suite's room and bathroom were huge...but in horrible condition. There was so much mold along the base of the outside of the shower, the wallpaper was peeling off and the mold was "eating away" at the drywall that was exposed. There were numerous other places the wallpaper was peeling. It looked like the ceiling above the jetted tub was going to fall or cave in. The mattresses were hard and uncomfortable. The carpet looked stained and dirty. We ate dinner at the Provincial in the hotel...again rude staff, poor service. We notified the hotel at check out and again, the staff was rude. This time we were able to talk to management about the condition of the room and rudeness of the staff. She comped one room, but we still had to pay the upgrade and the two queen room. We agreed we would never again stay at the Paris Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay, Eiffel tower is a must do”
Reviews.Author: 6grancorbin
Reviews.Content: This is nice place to stay on the Vegas strip. This hotel is within walking distance of everything on the strip. The check-in and check out went very smoothly. The valet parking is very easy to use and considering how busy it was, they were very quick and courteous. I can't say the staff is overly friendly nor helpful inside the hotel. We had breakfast a couple of mornings in the cafe and the first morning we were enlightened with a little swearing from one of the wait staff in reference to another co-worker . We ordered scrambled eggs for breakfast (they were listed on the menu as fresh) and I think they tasted more like powdered eggs than any fresh egg I have ever eaten. We did eat dinner at Les Artistes Steakhouse, it was a little disappointing to spend over $200.00 for 2 people on our 20th anniversary, I would have thought a complimentary cup of coffee would not have broken the profit margin. You pay for each item you order. You order a steak and that is ALL you get.....Our room overlooked the pool area and was very nice. The noise from the Bellagio fountains across the street sounded like cannons through closed windows. They do stop later in the evening, so you do get a good night rest. The room was always cleaned when we returned from our day out and about. If you like a cup of coffee in the morning, the room does not have a coffeemaker. To have a cup of coffee in the morning we had to take the elevator to the first floor and get a cup to bring back up to the room. I believe the ride to the top of the Eiffel tower at night was the highlight of our stay. The view of Vegas is breathtaking!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location - resonable price - No resort fees.”
Reviews.Author: ilttatw_2222
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay. Def worth it. Nice ambience and fast check- in. Valet was a nice things to have.

Reviews.Title: “Upped at check in”
Reviews.Author: DDaveca1
Reviews.Content: We're still here, on a three day visit, but a few things right out of the gate. I was comped for one room, and booked another for my grandson and friend. Though we reserved non smoking, upon checkin we were informed that room preference are just that, no guarabtee, but for a fee of 40.00 per room, per night we could upgrade to a on-smoking "red Room". So the comp really cost 160.00 for two nights. My second beef is the unconscienable 14.95 per day charge for high speed internet.. The location is awesome, the red room is okay, and food, we'll be reporting on. but the bait and switch on check-in really put me off.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Las Vegas was a wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lilpeach101
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Paris from Nov 23-26. We are Canadian and thought it would be interesting to be in the US for their Thanksgiving :) We arrived at Noon and a pleasant clerk checked us in early without issue. I had reserved a Luxury Red Room and that was what we got. The room was fabulous and well worth the $30 extra over the standard room when I booked online. The King size bed was like sleeping on a cloud and the pillows were heaven. Not much of a view, just some parking lots but there were the mountains in the distance....we didn't care, we were there for more important things! We had a 42" Plasma, coffee (which you don't get in regular rooms) and a beautiful marble bathroom. The room was very clean and well stocked with towels, toiletries etc. We had the best steak and eggs EVER at Cafe St. Louis at 2am and a fabulous dinner at Mon Ami Gabi on Thanksgiving night. We took a trip up the Eiffel Tower (it was an extra that was included with the Red Room package we booked) The view was awesome and we caught a Bellagio fountain show while we were up there. I can't say enough good things about this hotel, especially the location. It can't be beat! As for the Total Rewards program, it is a total joke. Don't go out of your way to collects points because we gambled a few hundred dollars (probably $7 or 8 hundred) between Paris,PH, Bally and Caesar's and got a whole $6 out of it!! I think the MGM/Mirage program is WAY better.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID THIS HOTEL !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ladyboxer
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not live up to its promises, we booked for 7 nights and were really looking forward to our stay, however one night we were woken up by the sound of heavy machinery from outside, so we were moved to another room, lovely until the second night when at 2 15 AM !!!!!!! we were woken up by the sound of the housekeeper cleaning the room next door, when we went down to reception to complain we were told by the Assistant Manager " well this is Las Vegas, do you want to check out". Going down for breakfast at about 7.30 am, the restaurant had its fair share of drunks behaving badly, shouting and annoying people trying to have a quite breakfast, possibly the worst hotel on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs- beware”
Reviews.Author: Jazzopie
Reviews.Content: We went with friends for 3 days over Thanksgiving and their room had bed bugs- she had them all over her legs. I cannot remember the room #'s, but it does not matter as the bugs travel around anyway. I remember we upgraded to a Red room facing the strip. It was reported but no one seemed too concerned.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury/deluxe Rooms are dated”
Reviews.Author: mimi100
Reviews.Content: The Paris hotel is a beautiful hotel from the outside, but the "deluxe" rooms are due for a much needed up date, starting with new furniture, flat screens and carpet. After seeing our so called "deluxe" room we up-graded to a view room for $55 an night extra (included continental breakfast). The view was fantastic, but the room was dated. The hotel should start investing some money in the up-grading of rooms or they'll be the next Flamingo on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Atlantadood
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris during Thanksgiving week. Our room was on 24th floor with partial strip view. The beds were very comfortable but the shower door leaked water every time you took a shower (I mean lots of water). Our "clean" sheets every day weren't so clean. The room was really hot so we turned down the air conditioning which didn't help much. With the exception of the buffets, the staff in the restaurants and boutiques were not friendly at all and acted like we were bothering them. There were no coffee makers in the rooms and WIFI not free. Not sure we would stay here again. I like the south side of strip better. It seems less crowded and more friendly down there

Reviews.Title: “A shame”
Reviews.Author: Mgcbad
Reviews.Content: After a six night stay during Thanksgiving, this place needs some work. We have stayed several times at this hotel and must stay the service, the value, the cleanliness and feel has gone down hill. stay here if you want to wait for ever for average food, pay for simple services, and be waited on by very rude staff. Simply, if you want to go to Vegas and like this general area, stay at PH or Cesars. If you want some special, stay at Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “The room was very nice and the location of the casino was excellent for sightseeing!”
Reviews.Author: gibby41
Reviews.Content: My wife and I both enjoyed our stay at this hotel nestled in the middle of the strip. Our room was nicely appointed and clean. Friendly cleaning staff. One coffee shop (excellent pastries) and a restaurant conveniently located near elevators to the rooms. One improvement at the coffee shop would be to have an express coffee-only line however not much seating capacity for guests who only want to sip their coffee. I also think that free coffee should be offered in the registration area or alternatively a coffee pot in each room. Casino area is large and free drinks are abundant and served by cheerful staff. Large pool area however the weather was not conducive to tanning or swimming unfortunately. Will definitely be coming back here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MarilynBrien
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Paris and were a little concerned after some of the negative reviews. We had a great experience and no complaints. The mid-afternoon maid service may be inconvient for some, but may be unavoidable. We appreciated the pleasant and quiet atmosphere in the public areas. The cobbled streets allowed avoiding the casino to get to elevators, restaurants, and shops. There is an interior hallway connecting to Bally's, but only outside access to Planet Hollywood. The Village Buffet was a disappointment, but the Mon Abu Gabi and Grand Cafe were up to expectations. Overall a great choice of a hotel in the middle of the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Paris is a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MrMirage
Reviews.Content: My second stay at Paris and really enjoyed it. Total rewards member was comped and upgraded to a Red Room with a great view of the Bellagio fountains. Check in and out was quick and pleasant. I have stayed at many of the hotels in Vegas and excluding Encore, would say Paris is a my first choice; good rooms and great location. Because the casino is so open, it tends to get a little loud but nothing a few drinks wouldn’t solve. Drink service is great but the casino coffee is disgusting, lol. Cocktail Waitresses are quick and friendly. Security has really improved over the years and it’s nice to see them checking the floors at night. The public washrooms are in need of upgrading but they are kept clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, great location!”
Reviews.Author: TicoLee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris for two nights in the beginning of November. Booked online and upgraded to their "Red Room" for $40 a night at check-in. Room on the 29th floor was cozy with a nice partial view of the strip. Rode the elevator to the tope of the Eiffel Tower ($10) and were fortunate to wat ch the dancing fountains at the Bellagio accorss the street. Had a delicious crepe breakfast at "Le Creperie" restaurant in the morning, $10 each but delicious and filling. Overall, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “in the middle of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Serhiy_Vagabond
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in this hotel and definitely like this place. Staff is friendly and ready to help, excellent parking capacity. Good choice of food, swimming pool. We had room on the 26th floor with view to Bellagio hotel with singing fontains - this was really GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Had a ball!”
Reviews.Author: birdieEssex
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our stay at the Paris, and have to say we had a ball!! From easy check in to a great room, which was spotless, to helpful staff wherever we went! We cannot fault the hotel at all! Have to say by far was the Eiffel Tower Restaurant!! We had the best waiter ever in Valentin! And the food was excellent & great value! Loved it!! We went for the Rod Stewart concert at Ceasers and had a ball!!

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Hanjo4
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 4 nights in the Paris Hotel, it is situated in just the right palce on the Strip opposite the Bellagio, it is very nice the rooms were comfortable and the staff very obliging. A helicopter trip to the Grand Canyon is a must, also don't miss the Minus 5 ice bar in the Mandalay Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE, LOVE, LOVE!”
Reviews.Author: June6186
