Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The location is perfect. I can't stress enough about the location because it determines if I go to Vegas for a weekend. It is right in the middle of the strip and across the street from the other major casinos (Cesars, Mirage, Bellagio). The rooms were perfect for a standard deluxe room with 2 queen beds. The rooms were clean. The bathroom was spacious. I recommend to upgrade when checking in, because they give a complimentary breakfast for 2 (which was excellent), 2 free drinks at a private happy hour area, and a room that overlooks the Eiffel tower and the Bellagio fountain show. This upgrade was $50 per night but it was well worth it. The hotel has a portion where it feels that you are walking in the streets of Paris. Also, the buffet is recommended, but the RIO is the BEST EVER! (and don't go to Cesars) The Paris hotel is connected to Ballys which is convenient, and there is a shuttle that starts at Ballys and then goes straight to the RIO. The only bad thing I have to say about the hotel, is that the pool was standard. I wasn't impressed by it that much when compared to other hotel pools. Overall, I will definitely come back the Paris when I come back to Vegas and recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Out-dated, Tired Hotel With Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Urban_Traveler_100
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights for a conference held in the hotel. I had booked a "Red Room", but since they were sold out, they "upgraded" me to a corner suite on the 30th floor. The room was large and had great views of the Strip, but was really tired and outdated. The furniture was dated and there were noticeable stains on the ottoman, curtains and bathtub. My bathtub had not been cleaned when I checked in, so there were soap rings on the edge from the last occupant. No bathrobes were provided. The windows were not well sound-proofed, which meant that every hour or two when the Bellagio ran their fountain show, there was quite a bit of music and noise. Luckily I had brought ear plugs, so it wasn't that big of an issue. The only positive things I could say about this hotel are that it well located on the Strip, within walking distance of many hotels and close to the monorail. The Creperie stand is actually pretty good as well. However, I think there are definitely better choices to stay in Las Vegas, and I won't be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “The Paris Las Vegas needs an upgrade more than the Sugar Factory”
Reviews.Author: BigEZ0811
Reviews.Content: The only good things about the Paris Las Vegas is the Bellhop Station, the Concierges, and the location. This place is a huge disappointment with all of the great options in Vegas. The Sugar Factory? That's lipstick on a pig....these rooms are archaic....no Flatscreens, a view not facing the parking lot is $45 more, no ESPN2, all of the amenities feel 10-12 years old. The check-in process took about 20-30 mins, there was no early check-in, and no late checkout. Furthermore, the concierges recommend far better restaurants at other places away from the Paris Las Vegas. Spend a bit more $ and stay at the far nicer and modern Aria, Bellagio, or the Planet Hollywood. The only way I would stay at the Paris Las Vegas again is if I was forced to again on a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Paris did not have the hospitality I was expecting”
Reviews.Author: unhappyparis
Reviews.Content: My 2 friends and I had to stay at a hotel for one of our classes at UNLV to rate and review a hotel. We figured we'd stay at a great hotel on the Strip and Paris looked wonderful...in the casino area. Beyond that, service was awful from the check-in lady who couldn't look at our eyes or take the few compliments we gave her with anything more than a grimace to the Check-out lady who was just as bad. When we went to get a late-night snack (around 11pm) we went to what looked like a cute and delicious little cafe/bakery place. The service there was unvelievable. The women behind the counter sighed when we walked in, got angry with me when I told her I was paying with card and had no cash on me, was frustrated because I asked for something they were about to take to the back (for closing time purposes) but was still on the shelp and the reason for why I thought it was okay to order it and then had the audacity to glare at us while we ate out treats, which at that point made us feel like unwanted nuisances. The one reprieve we had was the concierge who not only was extremely well informed, but made us feel like we were all that mattered to him at that moment. He was very nice. I wish I would have written his name down to include it here, but this will have to suffice. I'm sorry to say that Paris was not what I had been expecting. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “Best cocktail servers”
Reviews.Author: Tigger41999
Reviews.Content: We stayed 11-4 trough 11-9. Checkin took less than 10 minutes. Booked our 5 night stay no charge through Total Rewards. At checkin got upgraded to strip view no charge. Great view. Room was great. Great lunch at Mon Ami Gabi, sat outside.Great Bordeau- Chateau Laronde Desormes 2006. Best casino because of the 3 story high ceiling painted as nice blue daytime sky. Smoke disappeared quickly. The best part was our evening cocktail server in the slot area, Angela. Very pleasant, always had a smile, quick service 15 minutes or less between rounds. We always sat in her work station. Angela works Tuesdays through Sundays, seek her out if you want great service. For daytime service at the tables look for Ferra who works Mondays through Fridays.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Okay Rooms”
Reviews.Author: bandsinger
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a dozen different hotels over the past decade of visiting Las Vegas, but this was my first time at Paris. The line at check-in was long, but things moved quickly and all the employees we encountered were pleasant. I got a great online deal for a standard room, and that's exactly what I got....a standard room. It was not particularly elegant; just worn-out looking with stains on the carpeting and old wallpaper. Don't get me wrong...the room was clean and comfortable. It just seems that its time for Paris to upgrade its decor. Considering what I paid for the room, I was satisfied. That said, I love how centrally located the hotel is! We were able to gamble in Planet Hollywood, Paris, and Bally's without walking outside, and the bridge over to Caesar's made it very easy to access that casino also. Everyone in our group won on the slot machines, which is a rarity. We enjoyed ourselves, and would consider Paris again if we wanted to see Vegas on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed our expectations”
Reviews.Author: merrinell
Reviews.Content: Just returned from four night stay at the Paris Hotel. Check-in was easy, room was on the 15th floor, corner room overlooking the pool with view of Bellagio Fountains from both windows. Ate at Le Cafe, but breakfast was $42....long line at Buffet, so we chose to go next door to the Miracle Mile Mall for a breakfast at La Cantina for $3.99 (plus $2.45 for coffee!) Room was very clean. Service was good throughout the hotel and casino. Service staff was slow picking up dirty dishes from hallway. Concierge very helpful in obtaining an SUV tour to the Hoover Dam by Sweet Tours. Two more passengers and a delightful tour guide. Food is pricey everywhere in Vegas, but we were delighted with an evening meal at the Cheescake Factory in Caesars Palace Forum building. Worth the walk! Would be delighted to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mamagoogoo
Reviews.Content: Loved the location; fast check-in and friendly too. Offer a $39.00 buffet at 7 different hotels; just go to any/all in 24 hrs. Great idea to do dinner at one place; breakfast buffet at Paris, then try to fit more food in for luncheon buffet; and get in another dinner before the time runs out!

Reviews.Title: “Unacceptable!”
Reviews.Author: dmcarmel
Reviews.Content: Went to Las Vegas with three other couples and stayed three nights in early November 2010 at the Paris Hotel in Las Vegas. Without kids for our stay, we were hoping for an exceptional, Adult experience at a fairly high-rated hotel/resort. Unfortunately all of us experienced many of the same poor service/treatment at different times and would not stay there again! From rude Bartender's ("you have to bet the Maximum to get your drinks comped") at the bars, to hang-ups from the bell-hops, to noisy housekeepers (slamming drawers/closets in rooms next to us while cleaning), we might as well have stayed at a Motel 6! While the weather was awesome (75 - 85 degrees during our stay) , the pool was un-exceptional and the pool shop (carrying swimsuits, sunscreen, etc.) was closed. i called the front desk to see if Paris had reciprocity with other hotels and was told "no." I then called the concierge and was told, that yes, we could use the Bally's pool, but that the Paris pool was larger and that we could use several other hotel pools nearby for a fee of $20. If you want an upgrade (vs. view of other roofs or parking garage) be prepared to fork out more mula! Based on all of our group's experiences, we would definitely stay at another hotel on our next trip to Vegas - one which appreciates their guests and treats them accordingly... If you have low expectations - this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Las Vegas Views Awesome”
Reviews.Author: castlecreek
Reviews.Content: I toke my mom to Las Vegas Nov 6-Nov 9 we were in room 1488 and had a awesome view of the tower and the Bellagio fountains. The evening buffet was awfull, the casino was great and we finally won a little money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at Paris!!”
Reviews.Author: skyutah
Reviews.Content: I went with one of my friends and met up with others that stayed at another hotel. Check in was busy, but not too bad at all. The hotel itself is beautiful and in a PERFECT location! We just got a standard room that was great! I have stayed in a lot of hotels as I was a flight attendant and this basic room was better than most. I had asked about an upgrade for free, just for view sake and the front desk girl said she would see what she could do. When we got to our room, it was facing the pool and the tower. We could see the fountains at the Bellagio, but just the top of them as we were only on the 9th floor...so not really sure if we got an upgraded view, but is was better than what we could have got. All in all, we had an amazing time and would not hesitate to stay at the Paris again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ladybug1964
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Vegas and had booked our package through Allegiant Air. There was no line up at checkin and our luxury rooms were ready early. They were huge corner rooms with a partial view of the strip. Very quiet for sleeping and very clean. There was no line for breakfast at 7:30am and the buffet pass worked out perfectly. There was a fast line for dinner, waiting no more than 15 minutes. The food was really good! The location was right in the centre of the strip. You must go up the Eiffel Tower at night for a fabulous view of the strip. Because of the high ceilings, it was much less smokey in the casino compared to other casinos. The Napoleon's piano bar was rocking at night. Everyone who worked there from checkin to checkout was friendly and helpful. It was our first stay and we wouldn't hesitate to book at the Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Hotel could care less if you came back to see them again!”
Reviews.Author: Gordon-Biersch
Reviews.Content: Probably one of the worst experiences I've ever had in Las Vegas. Waited over 10 minutes to talk to the baggage dept and then was hung up on when I couldn't imediately locate to ticket. The had to wait again. The bartender carded our 44yr old friend who had to go up to her room to get her ID. Then the Bartender declarred that none of the rest of the party could be served drinks until her ID was confirmed. There were 8 of us. They looked at her ID for more than ten minutes and when we wanted the manager, he finally OKed the ID. Attitudes from many of the people we concluded that this was a culture issue, not the staff. It just confirms that I will never stay there again or at another Harrah's cassino again. There are just too many other hotels to visit without the bad attitudes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location on the strip”
Reviews.Author: redexcels
Reviews.Content: Overall we were happy here and it was value for money in a good location. Given so many people are in and out of the hotel beds it is not surprising some creepy crawlies nibbled on my partners legs when sleeping. Here's the tip hotels need to start vacuming the mattress on beds to ensure the mass amount of skin we lose is removed before the next guest arrives. I would pay a little more knowing this has been done.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, use Harrah's TR site to book your stay”
Reviews.Author: jands4ever
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the first time 10/21 - 10/24 during the PBR finals. I booked through Harrah's Total Reward site and received two "Luxury" rooms at no charge. Upon arrival, we were pleasantly surprised at the ease of accessing the self parking deck (no charge)from the Strip. We never used valet because it was always backed up. The walk from the parking deck to the check in counter was quite a hike, especially when hauling luggage through the crowded casino/restaurant areas. We arrived on Thursday about 2:30pm (check in wasn't supposed to be until 4:00). The line was not long at all and the check-in rep was very hospitable and accommodating. I handed the check-in rep my driver's license and a $50 bill and asked if there was availability for an upgrade for both rooms to overlook the Bellagio fountains on a high level floor. Since we arrived early, not all rooms were ready so the clerk took my number and called me about 30 minutes later. She offered me a nice, large suite in the corner on the 18th floor but could not get two rooms close to each other on that floor. We opted to wait a little longer (about 15 minutes) and got two king rooms together on the 24th floor overlooking Bellagio fountains. The rooms were a little dated but clean and comfortable. With the high cost of adult beverages, food and the long lines for restaurants, we elected the Concierge service for an additional 55.00 per night (which covered two guests per room). Concierge was on the 31st floor overlooking the fountains. It was open from 7am - 11am and again from 5pm - 8pm. During the evening service (while we were there), they offered ravioli alfredo, peel and eat shrimp, fruit, cheeses, wonderful breads and baked goods, adult beverages, beautiful desserts, coffees, juices, sodas. During the morning service, they had cereals, fruit, cheeses, wonderful breads and baked goods, adult beverages, various coffees, juices, sodas, etc. It was all you could eat and drink and all included. We were pleasantly surprised at the quality and will choose this again even though they did not have hot breakfast options. We also indulged in a Napoleon and coffee at the pastry shoppe near the elevator. It was scrumptous. You've got to stop there. We had a late night dinner at Mon Ami Gabi. The ambience was fantastic. The steak was very tough but everyone else enjoyed their entrees. Overall, our service was great at this property from beginning to end.

Reviews.Title: “I reequested luggage assistance when checking in to a handicapped room.”
Reviews.Author: moten
Reviews.Content: The Lady at the reservation desk instructed me to go to the front of the hotel and find a cart myself. I did not enter the front of the hotel and did not know where to go. Is this your policy no assistance for guest with handicapped asseciable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Another Awesome Stay at Paris”
Reviews.Author: juniatajodi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from another great stay at Paris. We travel to Vegas several times a year and stay at Harrah's properties. However, Paris is my favorite. We are both diamond players and are treated wonderfully from the great check in (Kathy) to the super friendly housekeeping staff. We initially were assigned to a La Mans Suite but were upgraded to a Calais Suite the 2nd day of our stay. Although the check in was very busy the girls in the Diamond check in were super fast and friendly in expediting our room change. The Calais was incredible with perfect views of the fountains at Bellagio and 2 flat screen TV's. The casino has a great atmosphere and Le Artistes Steakhouse is awesome. Also, Kelly T. in the salon is super friendly and provided a great Fire and Ice Manicure.

Reviews.Title: “Best gift for our 30th wedding anniversary”
Reviews.Author: CanadaChristian
Reviews.Content: We booked a luxury room for 4 nights to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary and the staff in reservation and main desk congratulated us and offered the greatest gift, this is a Calais suite with the best view (there are only 2 on each floor in the middle) and pure luxury. Great hotel, staff, amenities and location. We recommend to all travellers and you can be sure we will be back. Thanks again to the very kind staff for this amazing gift. You don't see that in other places.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: gafarmgirl623
Reviews.Content: In mid-October three friends and I had nearby rooms on the 17th floor. After checking in, one room was discovered to have a horrible smell. After a check by maintenance, the seal on the toilet had to be replaced, delaying settling into the room. The next day, after a pleasant talk with Steve (?), an assistant manager, we were given two "red" rooms on the 29th floor as well as a free night. The original rooms were nice enough, if nothing special; the main difference in the red rooms was renovation - new decor with pillowtop mattresses and large flatscreen tv. (We missed the extra mirror over the desk in the original room though.) I have stayed at Paris before, and both times I had what I thought was a good deal - this time the rooms were in the low $90's with tax. I have been very pleased both times - the location can't be beat in my opinion. The only negative thing I could say is that a couple of staff dealt with - a woman conciege and a woman at the key pickup desk - seemed to have a just-waiting-to-put-you-in-your-place manner. I also have to agree with an earlier review that I observed long lines at restaurants near the elevator. We only ate at the Mon Ami Gabi and the Creperie, where we had reservations at the former and encountered no long wait at the latter.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: oldkiwi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights after a Grand Canyon trip. Had earlier stayed at Planet Hollywood (choosing both hotels for their position on the strip), and there was no comparison. The rooms here (we had the standard rooms at both hotels) were much superior - fresh, spacious with plenty of light. A stylish hotel offering a good rate

Reviews.Title: “We had free rooms at Paris - Had we paid, we wouldn't have been thrilled”
Reviews.Author: ScottJayhawk
Reviews.Content: Underwhelming. Everything was rather average at best. Location is it's biggest asset for sure. The breakfast buffet was not very good. The rooms were nothing special - they were just hotel rooms - and in our case the wrong room - we should have had a King Bed we got 2 Queens and they couldn't (didn't) accommodate the correction when we called. I get that preferences aren't guaranteed but room type absolutely should be! The dealers at the casino were friendly enough. As I write this the thought "nothing special" is in my head. And normally their prices are above average. So my title sums it up - we had free rooms for 3 nights so we can't complain. If we don't have free rooms somewhere we would not pay to stay here. With free rooms again - maybe.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Nevada in the Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoeRoeNewJersey
Reviews.Content: In Las Vegas, we stayed at Paris - a lovely hotel on the "Strip" that has "old world" charm. The best thing about the hotel is it is fairly easy to get around in the common areas. It is not so big that you get lost. I would rate the hotel a 4.5 out of 5. As far as Las Vegas itself, it is an absolute entertainment capital. Aside from gambling, which we engaged in mildly, there are many other attractions and things to do. Shopping malls are everywhere - from the high end to the "dollar" stores. There is also a "downtown" Old Las Vegas area, and that is quite interesting. The dining choices are very extensive, and most provide a fairly good value for the dollar. October seems to be a particularly busy time in Vegas, so there are some long lines to contend with. One of the best shows that we saw was an Australian group called: Human Nature that do tremendous renditions of many Motown songs. Cirque du Soleil "O" was also very enchanting. Go and HAVE FUN!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in the Paris”
Reviews.Author: Tine5
Reviews.Content: When I read the review's about the Paris I was not sure what to expect as some reviewers painted a very bad picture of this hotel. But there was nothing I can complain about in this hotel, the room was nice, clean and we even got a room with strip view and we didn't had to pay the resort fee. The staff in the hotel was friendly and helpful, the only downside was that you had to queue a lot for everything, but hey, that's Vegas! It is worth having a meal in the Eiffel Tower restaurant, but be prepared for the high prices! The view from there is stunning, especially at night time and the food was excellent. Unfortunately we must have looked at the prices of the lunch menu as we were a bit shocked when we saw the evening menu prices. But I guess you pay for the view and it was definitly worth the money! Long story short, do not get turned off by the bad reviews!

Reviews.Title: “Worse place i have ever been at in my life”
Reviews.Author: mpluke1
Reviews.Content: The Paris hotel , is by far the worse and dirtiest place i have ever ( tried ) to stay at in my life. Be warned , if you or anyone one in your family is allergic to tobacco and its smoke . The Paris Hotel is not the place to be ! I would not recommend this place to my worse enemy The help is rude and the cleaning people hands were dirty , I heard from one person in my party , she said her room had bedbugs . A nasty place full of 2nd hand smoke , even at the entrance ways , I saw a man put out a cig out on the rug in the hour wait at check in line ! No one said anything to him , that worked at this place , just some other guess , asking 'would you do that in your own home or around where you live ? '

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, welcoming and sophisticated”
Reviews.Author: fastingbuddha
Reviews.Content: Paris Las Vegas had a friendly atmosphere, a nice pool under the Eiffel Tower and a top quality restaurant. We stayed in a Red Room which was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: Eng1JC92
Reviews.Content: Arrived late Weds. night and did the typicial $20 room upgrade. We had 5 rooms total for my family and each person set up their own room. Family members who did not tip had better upgrades than we did with tip. Our upgrade was a King room and we requested two beds. When we asked for two beds we were told to come back in the morning at 11 and they would get us a room with two beds. Went back at 11 and manager said we never should have been told that. Was told to come back a 1/2 hour later, came back, rooms not ready. Took our phone number and said they would call. 45 minutes later they called and said we needed to come to the front desk for our key. After an extended wait the manager was too busy to give us our key the desk clerk asked for our ID's. We just came from the pool and had to go back upstairs for our ID's. Ruined our whole first day. Rooms are dated and one day maids forgot to clean part of the room. Internet and Fitness Center very expensive. At the pool each day and saw many young workers doing NOTHING, mostly siiting around talking to each other.. We said to one that we hoped it would clear up and he said he hoped it wouldn't. Pool staff starts to stack chairs, loudly, at 4:30 when the pool doesn't close till later. One night at the bar near the front desk the waitress was the rudest waitress I've ever had, she just threw the napkins on the table and had zero personality. Staff and food at Mon Abi was excellent as well as pool wait staff. This was our third stay at Paris and we've decided it was our last, I guess customer service is not a priority.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Guests......Little Staff”
Reviews.Author: adenverdude
Reviews.Content: This is my 10th trip to Paris Las Vegas. Service here has always been just so-so. B-minus, if you will. It's now nearly non-existent. The manager said that they laid-off staff during the economic downturn and have not hired them back. Expect to wait in line for nearly an hour just to dine in the cafe and, once you're inside, you'll see half the tables are empty. They just don't have waiters and waitresses to work them. Same story at the bakery, the burger joint, the buffet, room service, housekeeping and pretty much everywhere you turn.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: roxypev
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in October and really enjoyed our stay. The decor is great, some would say more French than France. Apparently, we had a free upgrade. Our room was very nice but I don't think that was the upgrade, more the fact that it faced the pool, Eiffel Tower and Bellagio. Not that I'm complaining, it was a great view. It's best to watch the Bellagio fountains from across the road to get a full view but it's still pretty good from Paris. The bed was very comfortable. The decor was lovely. The bathroom was fab - bath and separate shower cubicle. All very clean and fancy. One of the nicest rooms I've stayed in I think. We ate in the Sports Bar and had breakfast at one of the cafes. Both had good food but not that reasonable. We ended up going next door to the Miracle Mile Mall for dinner for the next two nights - a nice Italian and then a Mexican restaurant. In terms of location, it's great. We spent one day heading north visiting The Mirage, Venetian and Caesar's Palace, then the next heading south visiting New York New York, Excalibur, Luxor, Mandalay Bay, MGM Grand and the Bellagio. Of all the hotels, the Venetian, Caesar's Palace and the Bellagio are the fanciest followed by Paris, which isn't as pricey as the others!

Reviews.Title: “Super Location”
Reviews.Author: dwluvsvegas
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a six night stay. Reception was great-quick and freindly. We did not upgrade and had a basic room. It was ok for the money we spent. Elevators are VERY quick. The walls are pretty thin, but Saturday night was the only night that was noisy but it is Vegas. The pool is nothing special, you don't even have to show your room key to get in.It's a good place to stay if you get a deal. I wouldn't pay more than $90 for a basic room. I think Total Rewards suck. We styaed at the Wynn in March and averaged the same amount of gambling and were comped 5 times as much.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Caz1987
Reviews.Content: I stayed in The Paris with a group of friends. We paid as little as £125 each for 5 nights and we couldn't believe how nice it was when we arrived. The rooms were very large, had double basin, bath and large shower, the room was very comfortable and we were lucky enough to have the view of the Bellagio fountains which was amazing! We ate breakfast in one of the restaurants one morning and it was one of the best breakfasts I have ever had aswell as one of the biggest! The queue to eat there was huge, so i recommend going there early. We ate in the French restaurant on the ground floor, that has outdoor seating one night for dinner and that was truely wonderful and very authentic. The staff were very helpful, one night I had misplaced my camera and the conciege luckily had it kept safely for me, after being found in one of the restaurants. Location wise, it couldn't be more perfect, it is right in the centre of the strip near all the best attractions and nothing felt too far away! All in all I would 100% recommend this hotel to anyone, whatever the reason for being in Vegas! Perfect hotel for the perfect trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: anggpc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris hotel from the 16th-19th. Check in and check out were a breeze. I loved the location of this hotel. It was central to both ends of the Strip. The room was your typical room. We stayed on the 30th floor b/c I requested the room upgrade for $40/night. I have NO idea if this was worth it b/c I don't know what the standard room looks like. This room was supposedly renovated. The bed was super comfortable. The bathroom had a separate shower and tub. It was clean which is always a good feeling. This hotel is connected to Bally's and it was super convenient to get to the tram. The rooms were very quiet. I don't even know if anyone was staying next to us. The casino and the tables were good. We took a trip to the top of the Eiffel Tower. During the day, it's $10/person. We watched the Bellagio fountains from up there. It was pretty cool. I wish it hadn't been completely enclosed b/c it took away from the view but I understand safety precautions are necessary. Overall, this was a great hotel to celebrate our 2nd anniversary. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Paying $55/- more per night for upgrade was worth it. We got great view and access to Concierge service”
Reviews.Author: Pari072808
Reviews.Content: Paying $55/- more per night for upgrade was worth it. We got great view and access to Concierge service. It looked like they didn't want us to take shuttle to the airport wanted us to take taxi. That worked out good for $6/- as I was to go to the airport by myself.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: AlyceBostonMA
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel over the long Columbus Day weekend along with 13 other people. This is my third time in Las Vegas and my first time at Paris (last time we stayed at the Bellagio). Las Vegas was very, very crowded....10/10/10 for weddings and there were a lot of brides and grooms. Our party liked Paris because we could find each other fairly easily...it is small enough to do so. We had crepes at LaCreperie for breakfast two mornings because they were delicious and reasonable( $10 each). We never made it to the breakfast buffet which is rated one of the best in Vegas but there were always lines. We had dinner at Mon Ami Gabi and sat outside. Would recommend this restaurant. The last time we were in Las Vegas, we sat here for lunch and drinks and had a great view of the Bellagio fountains. Our room was very clean...I got a bit nervous after reading a few reviews here. Truthfully, I only used conceirge services once....she printed out our boarding passes and was very accommodating. And like the Bellagio this hotel has LOCATION, location, location. It is in a perfect spot and it is attached to Ballys if you want another place to gamble and don't want to walk far.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay, you will love it!”
Reviews.Author: JAXOM01
Reviews.Content: My husband are currently staying in the PAris Hotel. We chose this hotel due to a couple of reasons. We stayed in the Luxor in 2008 and were disappointed by how worn don it was and how paperthin the walls were. We also found it a bit of a walk to get onto the strip So I reviewed Trip Advisor for the other hotels and chose this one over Bellagio for value for money. We are staying on level 25 which is one of the newly renovated floors. The room is lovely. We did not care about having a view but if you pay extra you can overlook either the pool or strip. The bathroom is nice as is the room. Huge TV, fridge, internet etc. The location is great. Right smack in the middle of the strip. Deuce and Gold bus both pass by out the front to catch to the Fremont Experience and the Outlet Stores. The hotel has some lovely looking resturants. We did not eat at any of them instead preferring to go out an eat depending on where we ended up.. We did not gamble in the casino as such but it is not too chaotic o smelly from the smoke. They have some good little shops and deli's to get food and drink. The pool area is nice and the bar staff quick. You have the Eiffel Tower standing over the hotel. We have not encountered any problems at ll in our stay and would be very heppy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect setting, superior service and the most comfortable beds.”
Reviews.Author: chris_5321
Reviews.Content: We were married in Paris France 33 years ago and thought it apropos to celebrate our anniversary at Paris Las Vegas. We were very impressed with your hotel and staff. We have stayed in many hotels all over the world and yours is definitely worth being proud of. Even room service meals which are typically a challenge were excellent. Coffee was superb, a nice surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff and restaurant. Right on strip”
Reviews.Author: shareenie
Reviews.Content: A great hotel to stay with your girl friends. Eat crepes and drink coffee at their "street side" cafes. Snooty boutique owners-don't go in there. Tunnel to Bally's. Right across Bellagio. Nice staff. Awesome Eiffel Tower restaurant-see the water/light show from above at night! Got a good deal on their website.

Reviews.Title: “It's Vegas so don't expect much with a name like Paris”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkie042
Reviews.Content: Our room had a great appearance bur poor cleaning staff. They literally only made the bed. Recommend it if you don't mind three star. I would not go back. Don't go to the patisserie either. Croissant was awful and latte was instant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Food and Location”
Reviews.Author: linfrat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our trip to Paris Las Vegas; the room was very clean and the food was excellent. The room was cleaned promptly and the marble bathroom was beautiful with a great shower. They do have a tendency to nickel and dime you, however, so we just stayed away from using the workout facility (at about $20 a day) and stayed away from the computer (we are in Las Vegas, after all) so as to not pay for Internet access. The buffet was excellent for both breakfast and dinner - probably the best we ate. We also went to see Barry Manilow and it was nice to be in the same hotel as the show. There is a guidebook that gives you a 2 for 1 coupon for the Eiffel Tower ride; it would have been nice to see this at night, but the line was 1 1/2 hours long so we went in the daytime. You can't beat the location of this hotel as everything was relatively close by. The only issue we had was in the room next door to us where a couple of drunks started to bang on our door in the middle of the night so we called Security and it was promptly addressed. Otherwise, it was a great stay and I would recommend Paris highly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: BeachVacationeer
Reviews.Content: Chose the Paris Hotel after many hours of research and reviews and made the perfect choice. The location of the Paris is very centrally located and with so much walking you definelty need to be as central as possible. Loved the feel of the hotel and found all the staff very friendly and profesional. Wait till you check in to upgrade if you choose. We upgraded to a Red Room with a view. The room was very clean and nicely appointed and the view of the Bellagio water fountain was Fabulous. Our rooms had coffee pots with supplies and a beverage cooler for our drinks. With our upgrade we could use the concierge lounge on the 31st floor for breakfast and dinner. We found this to be a good value and really enjoyed the fresh fruits, delicious pastries, bagels, cereal, yogurt, toast, cheeses, sandwiches,pasta, veggie tray ,desserts, cookies, coffees, juices, soft drinks, water, and even alcoholic beverages. We wanted the view so the added bonus of two meals was great. Enjoyed the pool one day. There were plenty of lounge chairs and towels available. Also book several shows they are wonderful. The O show at Bellagio is amazing. Enjoy Paris Hotel it will be a Perfect choice while in Las Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “Great first trip to Vegas at Paris”
Reviews.Author: NorskGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris Oct 14-17 for our ten year wedding anniversary, and this was our first trip ever to Vegas! Unlike some reviews that I have read, check in was a breeze. There was no line and we were waited on immediately. We booked through Sunwing travel which guaranteed a Red Room upgrade upon check in. There was only a double queen Red Room with no view available, so we settled for a king standard room. We were too chicken to slip the check in girl a $20, thinking that letting her know that it was our 10 year would be enough. Well we were wrong, she wasn't the nicest, but we didn't really care. We did pay the additional $55 a day for the concierge service. What a deal! Continental breakfast included smoked salmon and bagels, loads of pastries and fruit. Not to mention endless lattes and whipped coffees! Appies were served from 5-8 pm every night which included peel and eat shrimp, cheeses with baguette, sandwiches and then 2 hot items which varied from spring rolls to penne alfredo. It also included sodas and juices, and 2 alcoholic beverages a day. Considering 2 pastries and coffee at Madeline's cost upwards of $20, I thought this was a great deal! Our room 2101 was pretty standard. I can't even say pretty to tell the truth. The bed was comfy and it was very clean. But the view was amazing. Directly across from the Bellagio, so we got great views of the fountain show every time! But oh my it was loud, even on the 21st floor. We also did a spa service which we got a $20 discount on. Ladies - ask for Ivanka. She was amazing and super knowledgeable. Note the additional 20% "service fee" that is tacked on to your services - ouch! I wasn't sure if this was a hotel fee or a built in gratuity, but the massage was worth it. With any service you get all day access to the spa, and the steam and sauna were great. We're not huge gamblers, but we did spend an evening at the slots. The casino is nice, not too busy or overly loud like the MGM was. Waitresses are hit and miss though, some are super nice and give great service for a $5 tip, others are a bit more snarky. Highlights were seeing KA at the MGM, getting super cheap snacks and beers at ABC, and the seafood buffet at the RIO. It was a great first trip to Vegas, but I might want to stay at MGM or even Ceasar's Palace next time from what I saw of the properties.

Reviews.Title: “The way Las Vegas should be”
Reviews.Author: travelsat55
Reviews.Content: This may be long, but I will cover everything. I got there at 11:00am and not to my surprise, my room was not ready. No problem, they took my luggage, refrigerated my medicine, and said they would call me when my room was ready. I got called at 2:00PM and got a beautiful room. It was clean, spacious, and had the refrigerator I requested for my medicine. The coffee shop stinks and it cost almost the same as the buffet - which is excellent. One morning I only wanted a bagel and coffee so I walked over to the Stage deli in Cesars palace. (worth the walk for a REAL bagel). Also, if the weather is nice and cool, you can have breakfast outdoors on the Mon Ami Gabi terrace. Also pricey but it really is a great way to start the day when you are on vacation. The concierge desk is excellent for show and basic strip info. The race book is great. It is clean and the people that work their are good at their job. Refreshing from other places where they are just bodies filling a station. The table dealers are great. Adults with the time to explain the games. The slots are a little tight so I walked next door to Planet Hollywood. Great slots, but a VERY young crowd that gets rowdy late at night. The Eiffel tower restaurant is over priced and over hyped. Take the money and go to the Bellagio buffet on Friday or Saturday $40 bucks a head but phenomenal.(get there by 6PM or the line is very long) Paris is a great place and the staff knows how to make your stay as good as it can be. After that , it is up to you to get the best out of your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Paris close to Perfection”
Reviews.Author: BBtravel4us
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris Las Vegas in early August 2010. It was our first stay at this beautiful hotel. We had a smooth check-in with only a five minute wait. The gentlemen who helped us was professional and accomodating. We had reserved a Luxury Red Room and mentioned to him that it was our 25th Anniversary and he provided us with a "P" Luxury Red Room on the twenty-nineth floor ( a corner room) with two windows. One window overlooked the mountains and the north strip and the other window had a perfect view of the Bellagio Hotel and the fountains. The room was well appointed, clean and very comfortable. We were very impressed with the hotel's location. It was very convenient to Planet Hollywood and the Miracle Mile Shops. It was centrally located to both north and south strip hotels. Having interior access through the streets of Paris to Bally's was appreciated, especially in the 42 C heat. We enjoyed the ambience of the hotel, the casino, the shops and the restaurants. It brought back fond memories of our trip to Paris, France the year earlier. Wandering the shops and enjoying the restaurants and the Piano Bar was highlighted by the feeling of "being outside' on the cobblestoned streets of Paris. We ate three times at the Le Village Buffet using the 24 hour buffet pass - supper, breakfast and lunch. There was on average a 30 minute wait for each meal, but well worth it. The atmosphere of being in a french village and the vast array of food choices was outstanding. The crepes and omelette stations were fantastic. We also frequented Madeleine's and enjoyed coffee and french pastries. Unfortunately the wait was about 30 minutes. We spent about two hours each day by the pool enjoying lazing around, sunning and enjoyed looking up at the Eiffel Tower. We had many happy hours (two for one drinks), with the waitresses coming around often. We had no difficulty finding lounge chairs when we went in the late morning or in the mid afternoons. The music was kept at a nice level. The pool was large enough but could use an upgrade. We have previously stayed at the Excalibur and the Monte Carlo and to us there is no comparison. Not only is the location better but the hotel is superior in class and ambience. We cannot wait to go back to Las Vegas and would not hesitate to stay at the Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Paris Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: gstove
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Paris very much. The front desk staff was great. The rooms were large and very clean. The pool was also nice. Great location on the strip. Would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “The TIME of your life, FUN all day & night long, WOW, what a vacation!”
Reviews.Author: fourtylove
Reviews.Content: WOW, the VIEWS were AMAZING, I even took the BEST PIC's from my hotel room of the Bellagio w/the fountains. You can walk to other Casino's or stay at the Paris. Food galore, shopping if you dare. The rooms are great, sunning in the afternoon for a break from the gambling tables and slot machines are a must, it's a perfect atmosphere to take a breather. The scenery is just like you were in Paris with all it's hidden treasures. Every year it keeps getting better and better. I just never get tired of Las Vegas. I keep coming back year after year! It's the vacation you will ALWAYS remember!

Reviews.Title: “The best honeymoon hotel!”
Reviews.Author: daninlogan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon and the staff was so nice in giving us a good room with a view, dinner at the restaurant in the lobby was excellent, and it was a great memory! We look forward to going back!

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL BUT NONEXISTANT SERVICE AT POOL AND BUFFET HAD COLD FOOD”
Reviews.Author: irisheyes15
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and beautiful. Only complaint was our first day at the pool, the waitress ignored us completely . Obviously she didn't need our money. Also the buffet at the restaurant was cold. We went over to PH for remainder of our 24hr buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, but a bit $$$!”
Reviews.Author: GinMcG
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, but there seemed to be a charge for EVERYTHING! Internet access was $15 a day. Printing a bording pass was $5. The restaurants were good, but pricey. The ride to the top of the Eiffel Tower took a long time and cost $10.50 for two hotel guests. The room, however, was very nice with a great bathroom. The hallways and other rooms were quiet. Good lacation.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: LeroyWirral
Reviews.Content: How could we not give the Paris 5 stars. Had read some bad reviews beforehand so was a little apprehensive that we may have to queue for ages to get our room. Not in the best of moods as we had just been raked off by the taxi driver from the airport who decided to do a tour off the freeways to get to the hotel (not an uncommon practice at Vegas airport I believe). As it happened, we arrived at about 5pm and were served immediately by a charming lady who gave us an upgrade. We had only booked a basic room for one night but were upgraded to a suite. The suite was brilliant...entrance area leading to a dining area and lounge with a window overlooking the "Eiffel Tower" and Bellagio fountains. Off the lounge was a separate area for the bedroom with a bed big enough for four. Off the bedroom was a door to two separate bathrooms. It doesn't get much better than this. We didn't eat in the hotel in the evening but did use the buffet restaurant which was very quaint (Paris street theme) with a very large selection of good food. We went to breakfast quite early and walked straight in but on leaving, about 8:30am, noticed that a long queue had formed so advise getting down before 7:30am.

Reviews.Title: “A Great stay with some minor flaws”
Reviews.Author: steveskin1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I checked into Paris Las Vegas on Sunday, October 3rd. We were comped for 5 nights based on previous play at the various Harrah's properties, but this was our first stay at Paris. The line to check in was very long, and upon reaching the desk, was told that no regular rooms were available, but we could upgrade to a Red Room for 40 more per night. It seemed like a bait and switch, but tired from 6 hours of flying, we took the bait. We were assigned room 2818. The view was behind the strip of Planet Hollywood, and further away MGM Grand and the airport. It looked like the window had not been cleaned in some time. The rest of the room was very clean and spacious enough for two of us. The TV was a nice flatscreen one, although there were not that many stations to chose from. The room was cleaned well throughout the stay. We enjoyed most of the restaurants within the hotel, especially the buffet. One negative is no cheap places for a quick meal. At the quick service place, a bagel and cream cheese and coffee set us back almost 15 bucks for two people. The casino atmosphere was pleasant, even though we didn't win. I would have no reservations about staying at Paris again on a future trip to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: cmstengel
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at the Paris LV. This was our second time to stay here and we did not regret it. Upon arrival we checked in quickly with no wait. When we told the girl at check-in that it was our anniversary weekend she started pounding away on the keyboard to see what she could do for us. Even though all 4 nights were comped, she still upgraded us to a red room with a decent view, and did it with a smile. The room was beautiful and clean, beds comfortable, noise level pretty low compared to other places we have stayed. Casino is bright and open, and smoke was not an issue. The bartender Phil at the Sports Bar was wonderful. He took good care of us for the weekend. My only casino complaint was that almost every video poker machine at Gustavos Bar has sticky buttons and are in desperate need of a good cleaning. I guess too many drinks have been spilled on them. Location of this hotel is perfect - you can walk almost anywhere you want to go. The walkway out front by Bally's gets you across the strip to Bellagio and Caesars in minutes. We walked over to Planet Hollywood - OMG - that is the loudest place I have ever been to. We are in our late 40's and felt way out of place. Definitely for the younger crowd! Our best gambling was at Harrah's - we all walked away winners there. I would not hesitate to stay at Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Hotel-pay extra and go to better hotel”
Reviews.Author: smokefree81
Reviews.Content: I had requested 2 non-smoking rooms. The smoke was so bad coming thru the vents that my 2 sisters and I got sore throats. I have ashma. We did not enjoy this hotel because of the bad venting system. We went to Bellagio and Venetian and they did not have this problem with their vent systems. When I got home everything had to be put outside to get rid of the smoke smell. My brother and his friend could not even check in because the smoke smell in the lobby was so bad. He just got over throat cancer. The hotel would not refund his money and were very rude. He is going to file a national complaint for people with disabilities. The bathrooms had mold on the shower door. We ran out of toilet paper and kleenex and after paying fora 3rd person in our room were not supplied with extra towels, etc. Restaurants were dirty. Very disappointed in the Paris Hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I had hoped for”
Reviews.Author: nkristie
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel...not too big as other Vegas hotels. Not as loud as other hotels. Fantastic food, CLEAN upscale hotel (you won't find drunk 20 somethings staggering around at 3am or clientile you are afraid to walk by like Planet Hollywood --UCK!!) music not blarrigng so loud you can't hear yourself think! Free DJ that rocked...nice break from the shows and gambling. I can't say enough about our stay. La Provencal restaurant was so good we ate there twice out of three nights. Ask for Ross...great service!! (Even after they have cut their staff liek everyone else due to these trying economic times! )

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - just a couple of "hickups"”
Reviews.Author: Nila01
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a conference from Oct. 2nd through the 6th and found the accomodations satisfying. Check-in (as well as check-out) only took a few minutes not long at all as some reviewers on this site have mentioned. My room was clean and fresh towels and glasses were provided every day. I was disappointed to hear in advance that there wasn't a coffee maker in this room so I brought my own one-cup coffee maker with me. The mattress was a bit lumpy and sleep didn't come easy as the walls are paper thin and I could hear people walking down the hall most nights. I was awakened one night by loud snoring coming from the room next door. Most of the staff at the Cafe Madeleine were courteous but veeeeeery slow in service. One of the staff had such a bad attitude that after the second day I stopped going there. Not sure if she was having two bad days in a row, however I didn't feel comfortable going there any longer. Even though the this hotel's theme is "parisienne", not one employee spoke french. It's all for show. There are plenty of other places to eat on the strip that aren't as expensive as the restaurants in this hotel. There is a $14.95 daily fee to use the interent.

Reviews.Title: “PARIS IS WHERE I WANT TO BE”
Reviews.Author: keshia9494
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best hotels in Vegas! we stayed there for 5 nights and the hospility was WONDERFUL!!! When we checked in we did not wait in line for more than 5 mins. Every day they came in and cleaned our room and every night they came back and turned our bed down and left chocolates on the pillow. The view from our room was Spectacular we were facing the street and could see the fountain show at the bellagio hotel. The Casino was clean and never smoky.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Rooms = Vegas luxury”
Reviews.Author: VAdesign
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Paris Las Vegas from Aug 19-21. I am a frequent business traveler and have visited Vegas approx 20 times over the last few years. This was my first experience in Paris. I was truly surprised at the size, decor and amenities of the standard room at this hotel when compared with other nearby properties. Room cost was slightly more, but the value was clearly evident in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: Larisa16
Reviews.Content: I went with two friends of mine, this was our first stay at the Paris. The rooms weren't that great but the staff and atmosphere more than made up for it. We ended up changing rooms twice during our stay, first room was right above the employee smoking area and we could hear them talking all night, second room smelled like smoke even though it was on a non-smoking floor. The front desk staff was wonderful however, they switched us twice without any problems at all and our third room was fine. Everywhere we went in the hotel, the staff was fantastic. Very cheerful and chatty and really made our stay memorable and fun. We went to diner at the Eiffel Tower restaurant and it was amazing! The food was delicious and the staff (again) was superb. Definitely worth the splurge.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular...views, food, service!”
Reviews.Author: crosel23
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Paris Hotel for 3 nights at the end of June. I would stay there again in a heart beat! I got a great deal on the room (averaged less than $100/night), and we got an upgrade when we arrived (it was my birthday!). The room was beautiful! We ate at the restaurant in the Eiffel Tower, and the food was delicious. It was definitely pricey, but worth it. The portion size was perfect, and the raspberry souffle was so fluffy and wonderful. The pool area is smallish, but fit the bill. It was clean and felt so luxurious to lay on a lounge chair looking up at the Eiffel Tower (not to mention it was around 105 degrees everyday, so the cool pool was a delight!). The inside of the hotel was my favorite on all of the strip! It feels like you're walking through the streets of Paris (I've been to Paris!). All and all, it was an amazing place to stay, especially for the price. The location is also ideal--we walked the strip in both directions! Also, if you have a strip view room, you can watch the Bellagio fountains from your room--very romantic!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Paris for a great room and service”
Reviews.Author: NorthDakotaDickinson
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Paris, now it will be our only place to stay for Harrah's properties. We had a premier room comped for our 5 nights (Mon - Fri). We are only gold status, you have to make sure you get a players club card immediately upon arrival. I slipped the check in gal a $50.00 bill to see what kind of upgrade we would get. She gave us Suite Nice (1150 sq feet). Of course the maid service was several times a day. You don't have to be a high roller to get these rooms. We have been to vegas many times but as we are getting older, the less walking is better. Its about 5 mins from your room to the strip compared to Ceasars - which is atleast 15 mins. Thanks again Paris for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, very typical BAD french service.”
Reviews.Author: Soly20
Reviews.Content: I don't know if the owners of this hotel intended to copy everything from France including the BAD service, but they actually did. The reception service is bad, no one to take your luggage unless you specifically as them to. It took us ages to check in, apparently the rest of the check in counters are just for decor only 2 were working with about 50 people checking in. They did not have non smoking rooms so they gave us a smoking room with the smoke smell reeking as soon as you walked in. Casino is dull, the restaurants are average. The whole thing looks unorganized and cramped up together.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but don't eat there”
Reviews.Author: jrjan1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. The food wasn't worth the long wait. The silverware was dirty on 2 separate occasions. After the second time, we asked for a manager whose only response was "it happens". He acted as if he really didn't even care. There are many other places to eat in Vegas, just skip Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service.”
Reviews.Author: Blackwater165
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris Las Vegas in September 2010 for three nights. I had originally booked one premier room with two queen beds direct through the website but on arrival we upgraded to one premier room with two queen beds for the kids and an adjoining room with a kig sized bed for the adults. The rooms were lovely and had great views over the pool and 'Eiffel Tower'. The girl on check in was extremely helpful and found the best value way of altering our booking for us. We also got the concierge service which included a continental breakfast and pre dinner appetizers and drinks daily. The meals, service and drinks in this package were great. The resort was located right in the middle of the Strip which was very convenient. Parking was provided and it was easy to find a good parking spot. Pool hours were unfortunately too short, leaving us few opportunities to enjoy this facility. The gym was an additional cost but was well equipped. WiFi was available but at an additional cost. I was perhaps expecting more 'wow' factor being Vegas but it was a lovely place to stay and was very comfortable. I would definitely recommend this to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “What a great suite”
Reviews.Author: LOVEMYVEGAS
Reviews.Content: Just had to say what great suite we had at Paris. My host (Debbie) upgraded us to an Imperial Suite and it was fantastic. Paris and it's staff are first rate, we will be back in May.

Reviews.Title: “had a great birthday in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: R0adtrip2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Paris Hotel for 2 nights in July. Spent my birthday there. Our original room had a foul smell to it when we checked in. We immediately called the front desk and they changed our room and up graded us to one with a nicer view. The bell service was exceptional in helping transfer us and even got our new room key for us. The front desk was very efficient and nice. We ate at an Italian resteraunt in the Paris and had a great meal both nights we ate there. The Paris casino is nice but limited, especially when compared to the Wynn. That said, the Paris was centrally located and we walked everywhere we needed to go. The pool was beautiful although it was 107 degrees and a little too hot to spend too much time outside. I do think they closed the pool too early ,though, because it would have been nice to swim after the intense heat was gone.

Reviews.Title: “24 hour fun and sun ,if you go outside”
Reviews.Author: mercedesbk
Reviews.Content: the slots were hot and lots of choices.dealers were very friendly.staff waas great and helpful.definately get a players card ,the rewands are great.

Reviews.Title: “not bad. but expected better for Las vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Bineyehcha
Reviews.Content: it was not bad. the rooms are confortable, clean, nice. but i expected something more dazzling, more fun for a 4 stars hotel in las vegas. the casino is good, and the choice of restaurant and cafes is very good. a long waiting line to check in! the staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Paris pool”
Reviews.Author: MplsMack
Reviews.Content: We love staying at the Paris when we go to Vegas. The pool is on the 3rd floor and you can always find lots of SUN...Us Mn. don't always have that....The pool service could be a little better.....The rooms are nice and clean, and you are in the middle of everything staying at the Paris...Will go back again then it will be our 5th time...Stay on the no smoking floor if you can.....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travgirl1962
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Las Vegas. We decided to book the Paris based on the location and on the advice of friends who had been to Vegas, and we are very glad that we did. The size of the room was larger than I expected, the basic room was very spacious and was certainly adequate. The reservationis were accurate and everyone we encountered (front desk, bell service, valets, and buffet restaurant staff) were very friendly Location cannot be beat, right in the heart of the strip. We will certainly return to the Paris when we visit Las Vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Las Vegas, NV - FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: LovesGambling
Reviews.Content: Paris Las Vegas is absolutely my FAVORITE Casino, Hotel in Las Vegas ! Everything was absolutely perfect from the time we arrived, to the time we left. Our room overlooked the strip & what a view at night. Fantastic. I definately would reccomend Paris to anyone. Try the Concierge Lounge for a day or 2. We signed up for this service with the front desk person who was extremely helpful. Just remember to tip the people in the lounge, as gratuity's aren't included in the price as we were told.. We met a Fantastic concierge named James, who went out of his way to get us tickets to Cher & Love,plus getting us a reservation at the Eiffel Tower, which we couldn't get on our own. This guy must live at Paris, as we saw him in the morning for brunch & when we went to the concierge's desk, there he was again. He was even there the next morning ! The service is EXCELLENT , the employees make you feel special, like they are there to serve only you. We definately will see James & the rest of the wonderful employees we met while there on our next trip at Christmas. I can't praise the staff at Paris enough. You'll have to go for yourself & experience what we did.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: NCT_Saskatoon
Reviews.Content: The service was good, the hotel was clean, staff were helpful and friendly. The Paris is perfectly located. When we weren't walking, we used the bus system to get around -- good value and very handy. Shopping at the outlet stores was great. We always try to catch a good comedy show and have at least one special dining experience.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday getaway”
Reviews.Author: dedejm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here 4 nights midweek. The location on the strip can't be beat, the hotel was lovely with very nice, spacious, clean rooms. We ate at the buffet for both breakfast and supper, and it was very good. Other restaurants in the hotel were rather pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing interlude”
Reviews.Author: Barbarinasa
Reviews.Content: We were offered an upgrade (highly recommended). This included a 23rd floor view deluxe room and a private lounge breakfast and Happy hour. Starting the day with a lovely buffet in a quiet setting gave us energy for the day. By six o'clock we were back at this lounge (also overlooking the Eifel tower and Belagio fountains) and enjoyed another appie buffet and two free drinks. Service was five star at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Trip”
Reviews.Author: 037SLEO
Reviews.Content: The room is clean and employees are helpful and very accommodating..

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for older crowd...Very laid back!”
Reviews.Author: annilynn
Reviews.Content: We got bumped at the airport so we missed our flight and room for the first nite. When we got to the hotel, the line was very short and the check in process was flawless. They even upgraded our room for free! The staff was very nice. and the place was very clean. The hotel itself felt a bit crowded to me with no real "lobby area". Everything on the main level is occupied by the gambling area. We were not big gamblers. The area with live music was very nice and the band was great!!! Other than that...not much entertainment for someone 20-40yrs old. I also hated having to pay $20/day for fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Buffet is NOT all that !!”
Reviews.Author: LuvsDogsNJ
Reviews.Content: We went to the Breakfast Buffet because it was supposedly rated the best 3 yrs in a row. The line was long, the food average, and to make the experience as true to being in real Paris, the staff was rude and inattentive. We were first stuck in a back dining room that resembled a school cafeteria. When we went back to the hostess and asked to be seated in the open area she was obviously annoyed, and just barked " you'll have to wait". Eventually we were seated in another closed in dining room, but it had some ambiance. The family next to us asked for bottled water three times, then the 4th time, the sullen waitress said they don't have any. Come on, no bottled water in an enormous, prestigious place like Paris ??!! Save your $16 and go eat an Egg McMuffin, you'll be happier.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at Paris”
Reviews.Author: DearJenn
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 2 nights at Paris and had another very good experience. Check-in was super easy. I don't think it took more than 3 minutes. I am a diamond player and Paris had a special check-in room for diamond and seven-stars. I haven't seen this before and it worked out so nicely. I was given the exact type of room I had reserved online and didn't even have to ask at the desk or go through a host. We had a Red Room and it was modern, immaculately clean and elegant. The bath had a tub and the shower was separate. The beds were comfortable and had enough pillows. The air conditioning was very cool. The room also had a huge flat-screen tv, a fridge and a small coffee pot.

Reviews.Title: “Ooo La La”
Reviews.Author: portlucayaprincess
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Paris Las Vegas September 22-25, Wednesday to Saturday. My entire stay was comped in a standard luxury room. After reading some of the reviews, I was a little hesitant of how I would like this property. I was pleasantly surprised... I got to the hotel check-in at 10pm on Wednesday evening after my flight was delayed. There were approx. 15 people ahead of me on line. The line went fairly quick, maybe 15 minutes total. I was checked in by Virginia. I asked if they had any complimentary upgrades available. She checked with her manager and offered me a Le Mans Petite Suite. I graciously accepted and handed her $20.00 as a thank you. I headed up to my suite and was happy with it. It was a very large room with a king bed and wet bar. There was a full size sofa, 2 chairs and cocktail table. The television was not a flat screen...but truthfully, I never even turned it on. I had a small fridge as well. The marble bathroom was huge with a jetted tub. I also had a walk-in closet. The furnishings and rugs were in very good condition and clean. The room itself was immaculate. Housekeeping came every morning and did a wonderful job. I left $5.00 each day for her. When I requested extra towels, they were left in my room for me. I had coffee and pastry each morning from Café Belle Madeleine. Getting there early is key, since the line can become very long at about 8am. They make a great cup of coffee. I made it out to the pool Friday morning. Plenty of lounge chairs placed around the pool. I had to keep changing my spot to keep out of the sun. It actually became comical after a while. I ordered lunch from Cafe du Parc, it was very good. All in all...I was very pleased with my stay at Paris. I will definitely return to this property!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: lianderson
Reviews.Content: Paris is the one! Great location, large room, great food, best part the staff - no matter where you go in the Paris you will find happy employees. This is my 3rd stay at the Paris. I have stayed at Ceasar's and Bellagio and to compare I now stay at the Paris. Mainly the staff. From the check in to the room service, the maid, and the pool all staff are extremely happy to serve you and help you. Most Enjoyable. We were the 2nd last ones to leave the pool as it closed at 6 pm. No rude comments just happy staff stacking up chairs...we took our time and left at 6:05pm only to see an older couple just sitting there ready a novel each...no pressure. Always recommend the Paris. Eggs Benedict - the best!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable time at the Paris”
Reviews.Author: AJA999
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three-night stay at the Paris in Las Vegas (Monday through Thursday). The line for check-in was long and at first the hotel only had two people behind the desk, but added more. We made our reservations online and everything we asked for (king bed, upper floor, away from elevators, non-smoking room) were provided. We stayed in a "red room," if that matters. The room was ready earlier than expected and it was clean and comfortable. We paid a small fee for an upgrade to a view of the Strip and had a nice view of the watershow at the Bellaggio. The Paris has ample gaming and several restaurants. Their main cafe had long lines for breakfast, so we walked through the shops to Bally's and ate at their Sidewalk Cafe. It's the same menu, same prices, but service is faster. Check out was simple and was completed using the television in the room. High speed internet is offered in the room for $14.99/day. The swimming pool was a good size and there were plenty of chairs. Overall, we had a nice time and enjoyed our stay at the Paris.

Reviews.Title: “incredible”
Reviews.Author: travelagt747
Reviews.Content: if you are a harrahs diamond card holder,they treat you like royalty.check in was quick.the room had an incredible view,no waiting for seating in restaurants.the service was superb.I will recommend the paris to all my friends.stay away from the buffet.....service and food inferior to other casinos

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, smelly, tired, rude staff, poor food.”
Reviews.Author: janine2115
Reviews.Content: We have visited Las vegas many times and stayed in many of the hotels on the strip. We chose the Paris as it was mid range in price and a central location. Upon arrival we asked if there was anything available with a view, we were told a partial view was $100 extra per night so we decided to look at the room we had been given before upgrading, the lady at reception was very helpful. When we got to the room on the 33rd floor it was filthy, the curtains were thick in dust the stale fusty smell was overwhelming, the bathroom floor had dust and hair on the floor and it was generally dirty. I will accept that the hotel is in need of a refurb and everything is very tired, this doesn't bother us at all, but a dirty room does. We returned to reception and spoke to another person, I told her the room was not clean and I would like to upgrade, to which I was told it would be just as dirty as I obviously had high standards! She then went on to tell me there were 'cleaner' rooms available at a premium price. I refused to pay extra for a clean room as this should come as standard as far as I am concerned. We were given another room and told they wouldn't give out a room if it was unclean. We went to the second room which was significantly cleaner than the first but still dusty and a little smelly, we opened the fridge to find mouldy fruit and old bottles of water. We decided to draw a line under it and not spend any time in the room so we were not wasting any of our holiday in search of a clean room and simply told reception the room they would not let out if unclean was dirty and could somebody sort it, obviously when we returned the mouldy fruit etc was still there so we sorted it ourselves. We ordered breakfast once and it arrived 1 hour later cold and of a very poor standard. Overall not what you expect from a las vegas hotel, really dissapointed and it could have ruined our holiday if we had let it. Visit the casino its nice with great effects but dont stay in the hotel, there are much cheaper hotels with much higher standards of cleanliness and customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in the middle of the strip”
Reviews.Author: Monique12345
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for three days.The hotel itself is very nice, the lobby & main hotel area is elegant and stylish. The Le Provencal restaurant in the hotel serves excellent food and is good for a special occassion. The rooms were roomy and finished to a good standard and we had a great view of the pool, Eiffel Tower and strip, this was especially nice at night when illuminated. Overall this hotel is excellent and in a great location on the strip across from the Bellagio Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very Expensive and not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: joanna1957
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Paris for 5 nights in September . On arrival ,our room had some work done to the toilet and the plumber had left a mess. We called down to reception and it was sorted . The next day , the toilet was blocked again . Again we called reception and it was fixed after several hours and the threat of having to move rooms . It was agreed that we be given 25 dollars for our trouble . In order to give us this we had to give them a credit card and were told to spend the credit in the hotel . Having returned home , our purchases appear on my credit card bill . The 25 dollar credit does not appear to have been made . Having contacted the Paris , they are not able to rectify this as we spent money at the bar and not in the room which was not explained to us . The hotel is very dark and old fashioned to many others on the strip . The hotel is very expensive for drinks and food , Two drinks , a beer and wine were 14 dollars. No tea/coffee facilities in the room . If I were you , I would spend the small extra and stay at the Bellagio , a different class.

Reviews.Title: “French flair in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Bennyboy08
Reviews.Content: Family goes to Vegas every year and have stayed in various hotels along the strip, so it was the turn of Las Vegas Paris to accomodate us. This was my first time to America therefore didn't really have any expectations however I was very impressed with the hotel upon seeing the replica Arc de Triomphe upon arrival in the taxi. Was very surprised to enter the hotel and walk directly into the casino, I expected the reception first. Check in was quick and we had our suitcases brought up to our room by bellboys. The room was a standard room however it was very roomy, my cousin and I were sharing. We both had large comfortable beds. The bathroom was very roomy with bath and shower and a large sink/dressing top area. The room had an empty mini bar which we used for our own drinks/water. There are ice machines and vending machines in a room on each floor. Rooms are air conditioned as no hotel windows open in Las Vegas. There is also a television offering several interactive services and the usual mix of insane American television which was quite entertaining to watch in the early evenings before venturing out for the night! Lots of health/medical and lawsuit ads! The room was tidied daily by maids and the actual hotel corridors/public areas were spotless. The pool was a very nice area to relax in the afternoons beneath the large Eiffel Tower, which acted as a huge sundial in the late afternoons. The pool is open until 6pm and has bars and shops around it. Towels are provided upon entry to all hotel guests. We did not see much of the other hotel facilities as being in Vegas, so much to see and do with all the hotels intertwined, we saw the massive casino and the shops and restaurants. Didn't really eat in the hotel as again was out and about everyday and likely to eat elsewhere however I did frequent the small coffee shop several times to buy orangina and a cake from the patisserie which were absolutely lovely to look at let alone eat. Service from the staff were very friendly, especially on the front desk. I thoroughly enjoyed staying at this hotel and would again. In fact I became rather accustomed to hotel living and could have done with another week!

Reviews.Title: “Mired in mediocrity”
Reviews.Author: WVARMYRN
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to Las Vegas on many occasions and have stayed at many different properties from the Riviera to Bellagio. I must say that my expectations of Paris were high but after spending a week there, I can say that it is mired in mediocrity. The rooms were comfortable but at the price we paid, I expected more. The walls are paper thin and the noise level made me feel like I was in a cheap apartment next to a subway rail. The food was average at best and the slot play was the worst I have experienced in the past ten years. Was it a horrible stay? No, but I will be staying someplace else in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: QueenSandy
Reviews.Content: I chose Paris simply because I got a really good package deal. I didn't know what to expect since my paperwork listed the room as one of the "red rooms" but it was quite nice - and NOT red. Roomy and clean with a nice big bathroom. I originally requested a view of the strip but was told it would cost me another $60/night, so I declined. However, I was too early to check in and when I came back I was given a room directly across from the Bellagio fountains on the 24th floor (at no extra charge) so I was happy. It was really nice to have a perfect view of the fountain show, but the music that accompanies it is VERY loud. I heard it just fine inside my room. If you want a central location as a base of operations, Paris is perfect. It's right on the monorail line that goes from MGM Grand on one end of the strip to Sahara on the other end. If you don't have a car, I highly recommend buying the 3 day pass for the monorail. It will pay for itself in just a few trips. The station is actually at Bally's, but the 2 hotels are connected with a shopping promenade between the 2 casinos. If you plan to eat at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant, keep in mind the prices for lunch are about half what they are at dinner. If you are only eating at the restaurant to get a front row view to the fountains, be advised they don't start until 3 pm and lunch prices end at 2 pm.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: lagipp
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Paris Las Vegas over Labor Day weekend for approximately 4 days. Very nice place. Clean, and the location is perfect. Can walk either way on the strip and get to anything very easily. Beds were very nice and the hotel was very quiet. Had a great little pastry/coffe shop that we hit every morning before heading out for our day. Only draw back was that we booked a king non-smoking room. They put us up in a double queen room, but tried to "up sell" us to a new remodeled king room for $40 more a night. All in all, a very enjoyable stay. Spent one afternoon at the pool, which was very nice. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Attractive Hotel let down by the stale tobacco smell of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Rita_and_Alan
