Reviews.Content: From the moment you step out of your car you can't fail to be impressed by the look of this hotel as its' quite spectacular. But what should have been a thrilling and exciting part of our holiday was sadly let down by the terrible smell of stale tobacco that permeated not just this hotel but practically every casino in Vegas and also the fact that some of the hotel staff have no qualms when it comes to ensuring you give them the tip they want rather than the one they deserve. This was our first trip to America which in the main was thoroughly awesome but alas we were very disappointed with Vegas particularly after everyone told us how brilliant it would be so expectations were quite high. But when the first person you meet ticks you off because $5(over £3) apparently isn’t a big enough tip to park your car and the smell of tobacco permeates the restaurants and worst still your bedrooms so you have a restless night and wake coughing its hard to remain impressed. Of the two hotels we stopped at in Vegas this was probably the better of the two but until they do something about the tobacco problem I couldn’t recommend it or Vegas to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “not a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1037wolf
Reviews.Content: a disappointing stay at Paris Las Vegas. Quality has certainly gone down as prices have gone up. Buffet prices are high with less on the table. Cutting corners everywhere in the quantity and quality of food.. example: Orange juice is not REAL orange juice, breakfast is cold potatoes, no flair. meats are just the basics. Bacon fatty not crisp etc. Oatmeal, no blueberries available. Coffee pot on table with half a pot only. VERY LONG LINES and very slow.If you want an updates room, be prepared to pay more. Why have a price for a room with no modern amenities, and then if you want a flat screen TV or a nicer shower head you pay more? We were supposed to be in the better part of the hotel, without an upgrade, but it was so obsolete and worn. Paris is not a four star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Hotel – Great Atmosphere and Convenient Location!”
Reviews.Author: AlabamaAllie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights at the Paris in Las Vegas. The staff is friendly and helpful… check in/out was fast, easy and accurate… restaurants are very good… and the casino has a wonderful light-and-airy feel about it. The hotel is conveniently located in the middle of the Las Vegas Strip and within walking distance to most of the major attractions. If you can afford it, I would recommend you upgrade to one of the hotels “Red Rooms”. These are large, attractive, comfortable rooms have been recently updated. My husband and I also opted for a Red Room “VIP Package”. It costs a little more per night, but we enjoyed the perks that went along with the package. This package allowed us to have a room on a higher floor with windows facing the Strip and the beautiful Bellagio Fountains – they were amazing to see from above looking out of our hotel room window. (FYI: Some of the rooms in this hotel have view poor views of parking lots, walls of other buildings, etc. If views are important to you, inquire beforehand.) The VIP Package also includes a VIP dining area serving a continental breakfast and light supper daily. There is no additional cost for this dining area because it is included in the cost of the VIP Package. My husband and I actually used this dining area and the money we saved on breakfast and dinner made up for the extra charge for the VIP room. The breakfast is typical “continental-style” and the supper has sandwiches, fruit, cheeses, pasta dishes, bread, shrimp, etc. You are allowed up to two non-alcoholic beverages at each meal, and up to two alcoholic beverages at the evening meal. The selection of food is not large or “fancy”, but it was well prepared. We chose to eat out at nice restaurants for lunch and utilize the VIP meals for breakfast and supper. The hotel also has nice shopping areas and a relaxing spa. Our room had a coffee pot, large refrigerator and large HD flat-screen TV. We encountered no problems whatsoever during our stay. We had a great experience at the Paris and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade concierge lounge worth the extra - room not really”
Reviews.Author: hayrh
Reviews.Content: We started our honeymoon at this hotel so we upgraded to have a room overlooking the strip. Personally I don't think the room was any better (in fact it was probably noisier!) but the access to the concierge lounge with the upgrade was well worth the money - a lovely little perk! Generally speaking though it's just another Vegas hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, great view, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: roaminnomad
Reviews.Content: Loved the Paris Hotel. Stayed for three nights with a friend and we both agree that we would recommend this hotel to anyone heading to the Strip. The only "grumpiness" we encountered was when checking-in and the front desk clerk was quite obviously less-than-enthusiastic with having to repeat the same hotel info over and over again to guests/tourists. We asked if there was any chance we could get a room that faced the Strip and she told us yes -- for an additional fee. We decided to take our chances with the basic non-Strip view room and we ended up being thrilled! Our room was on the 10th floor and directly overlooked the pool area and Eiffel Tower. Just gorgeous. Beautiful lobby and walkway through the shops, casino and restaurants. Painted sky ceiling and fake cobblestone made you feel like you were in Paris (well, almost). The room itself was very pretty and very clean,with French decor motif throughout. Bathroom to match with ornate light fixtures and wallpaper, separate shower from bathtub. Housekeeping did a phenomenal job and we made sure to tip them daily. I can only imagine half the things they encounter, but we did end up having a bit of a spill on the carpet and by the time we returned to the room it was as if nothing had happened. One of my favorite elements of the room was the bedding. Paris Hotel puts a duvet between two crisp, clean white sheets instead of using one of those tired, old standard bed covers (that rarely get laundered). The bed felt fresh and clean and very comfortable. There was a (empty) mini bar in the room so we were able to use the refrigerator for our own drinks and snacks. Would have be great if they had coffee makers in the rooms but I suppose that would detract from buying a coffee for $3.50 at the cafe downstairs... Lots of restaurants in the hotel - we very much enjoyed the upscale hamburger place. Location was fantastic. Across the street from the Bellagio and next door to Planet Hollywood and the restaurant Caba Wabo's that had a great patio with refreshing water misting (SO nice on a hot day).

Reviews.Title: “Paris is a mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: janedoeny
Reviews.Content: Paris has declined since our last stay. We had a nice room with a horrible screeching door we asked to have fixed day and throughout stay - they called the day before we left so needless to say it was never fixed. Very hard to sneak in after a late night :) Room was nice but hairdryer missing and later after being cleaned housekeeping took the toilet paper roll and a call had to be made to return it. Nice view of north end strip. LCD TV - not sure if remote broken or you cannot pause a pay movie - but we couldnt. The coffee shop just off the casino - cafe st louis was awful - staff was nice enough but so slow, sandwiches were dry and untasty - breakfast nothing special. Convenient but not worth it. The Buffet has gone downhill big time! Very crowded if you don't have a premium card (long lines) - food was just bad - only thing to eat at breakfast was the omelette - everything under the lamps was just gross; tried once for dinner and could make do with ok crab legs and shrimp but after several laps around still could fine nothing else to eat. Custard not ice cream the best dessert. Service was ok but very disappointing overall Had an excellent meal at the Paris steakhouse - sat on 2nd floor - ok we had seafood but it was very good. Pricey and service slow. Diamond club had bad hours, minimal snacks and drink quality varied with the bartender - once while watching a game in front of our table the waiter changed to another game for someone who just came in even though that game was on at the bar. Computer or printer broken off an on all week and no idea how to fix. Gambling was very very tight. Dealers at tables just not friendly and waitress service slow to not available. Did way better with food, gambling and drink wise at Planet Hollywood. All in all - its small and not much walking for the older folks but we had to leave so often b/c of bad food, gambling or service - I really would have to think twice about staying there again

Reviews.Title: “We always stay at Paris when in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Phylgary_10
Reviews.Content: Paris has become our favorite hotel to stay in when we visit Las Vegas. The atmosphere is wonderful with Parisian-style rooms, restaurants, shops, and casino. We have dined at Mon Ami Gabi many times, and if you time it just right, you can sit on the patio at Mon Ami Gabi and see the water show across the street at the Bellagio. For upscale dining Les Artistes is great for that special dinner. If you want to get away from the Strip for a while, you can take a taxi to Fremont Street and experience old Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Mr. and Mrs Fawaz Sweis ELEGANT”
Reviews.Author: explosion
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Las Vegas. We arrived at the Paris around one o'clock in the afternoon, and in less than half an hour we were in our room. The room was very nice and overlooking wide areas of Las vegas, It was clean and very comfortable. The streets and the atmosphere around the Paris were very beautiful. The trip and the Paris Hotel was just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE PARIS”
Reviews.Author: Davidedetta
Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful.... it' s like being in Paris, nice restaurants, nice rooms, nice staff!! we really enjoyed staying there for 4 nights....absolutely recommended!!! The rooms are really nice, big and elegants.

Reviews.Title: “A great place!”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel720
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest, most clean hotel/casino's we have ever stayed at in Vegas.. Great atmosphere, pretty and everything you could ask for. A nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “You gotta love Paris!”
Reviews.Author: pslandry
Reviews.Content: A co-worker of mine recommended this property and I loved every minute of my stay. My room was a little small, but other than that the stay was great. I had a decent view of the strip and the hotel is pretty much located in the middle of everything---great location. Check in took about 15 minutes as there were several people arriving the same time I did. The hotel front desk staff was friendly and there were plenty of agents working to check in guests---but there were a lot of guests checking in. I ordered room service and breakfast service each morning which was delivered quick (guaranteed in 10 minutes or it's free)! I will definitely stay at this property again and certainly recommend it to anyone heading to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Preferred Hotel of BED BUGS!”
Reviews.Author: bitten2
Reviews.Content: The day we arrived at The Paris Hotel we noticed two red stains on both bed spreads. I don't believe the sheets were changed before we got to our room (obviously). We did not think much of it, just had called housekeeping and had them change both sets of sheets. I awoke the next morning feeling itchy all over and had several bite marks (one very prominate bite mark on his wrist). Both the hotel cleaning manager, and security / EMT officer confirmed I was bitten by something. They had me fill out a claim form, but none of the hotel managers would speak with me after I was bitten. They told me I would need to speak with Risk Management. They changed our room but not until almost 5pm that day. I left several messages for Risk over the next several days with no response. After continued calling I spoke with Risk Management. He told me they were denying our claim and that I would have to speak with the hotels insurance company (although he would not give me their contact information). He also told me that they rented out the room we stayed in (which my husband was infected by bed bugs) after they changed our room. Since being bitten by bed bugs I have been suffering from extreme itchiness', and bites all over my body (that might even scare). This experience has been the most horrible incident I have ever experienced. NEVER STAY AT THE PARIS HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mentorman1
Reviews.Content: Paris is in a great location on the strip. Has good restaurants, pool is nice with sun and shade, and the feeling in the casino is friendly. The dealers are nice and the clientele seems to be friendly as well. Never a disappointment. Connected to Bally's so you can walk to the other casino without a long distance.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary stay at Paris”
Reviews.Author: mybughannah
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay at Paris Las Vegas. (September 12-15) My husband and I celebrated our 8th Wedding Anniversary. Nice hotel lobby. Arrived around 2pm to check-in and the line was fairly short. Only waited about 5 minutes. Used the $20.00 sandwich trick. Seemed to work. Check in clerk took the $20.00 and said let's see what we can do. Didn't get a premium or Redroom upgrade, but did get an excellent view upgrade. 18th floor with view of the pool, Eifel tower and Bellagio fountains. Nice bathroom. Separate shower and tub. Nice tile. As it was our Wedding Anniversary, was hoping to maybe get a better room upgrade, but the view was very nice. Room was a little worn. Wall unit/dresser had parts missing, roomservice book covered in dust, older tube TV. Not a big deal for us but might bug some. Read online that the rooms do not come with coffee makers. Before we left, we purchased a 4 cup Mr. Coffee maker and packed in our suite case. Worked great!! Did not have to spend $13.00 a day plus tip, tax and service charge on coffee. Did go down to the bakery every morning to buy fruit and croissants. (excellent croissants) Quick service. Not super friendly but I didn't care. Did order a hamburger to go at the 24hr cafe around 2am. Very nice hostess and great service. Hamburger was the best I had on our trip. Didn't gamble here so can't comment. Pool was average. Did not like their lounge chairs. Check out was fast. No errors on our final bill. Bellman held our bags for a few hours prior to our departure. Fast and efficient service. Overall nice stay. Not the most luxurious. (Encore/Wynn/Bellagio in a different class) but much better than most. Would stay again at the right price but would book a Red Room or Premier room. (stayed in a Luxury room)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and BEST Location”
Reviews.Author: danielc316
Reviews.Content: Paris Las Vegas was the best. The location was great, middle of the strip accross from Bellagio. Check in was easy, they had a room ready. Took little bit but I was in no rush, was on vacation. Got there at 10am check out is 11am, so if you arrive around this time there could be a little bit of wait, but the staff was was on getting people in and out. The room was clean and had a great view of the mountains and the Bellagio fountains. Did try to sell me an upgrade but I was happy with a regular room The casino was nice, didn't gamble much. The Paris streets are nice, lots of little shops and cafe's. Didn't do the buffet but there was always a long line to get in. Looked good and people raved about it. Service was excellet, did room service twice and they are fast to deliver. Did the whole strip and notice that Paris is a little more down key compared to others like Planet Hollywood. That was great for us since were not into the party scene. All in all great hotel and location.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible check-in service”
Reviews.Author: Pez1847
Reviews.Content: I arrived (after a four hour flight) at 7pm to Paris and my room was not ready. I was told that I could wait 45 minutes, or pay $50 extra a night for an "upgrade". I chose to wait, and was told that when I come back I can skip the line and get my room key. When I came back, they would not service me immediately and told me to go to the back of the line. Horrible, horrible, check-in experience. I will never come back to Paris or any Harrah's facility. The room is old, small and nothing special. No coffee machine in room. Got a notice today that the water may be turned off tomorrow for a few hours. I beg you, please don't stay here - there are many other choices for around the same price.

Reviews.Title: “If size matters”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Weston
Reviews.Content: When my husband and I decided to stay at Paris, I pre-booked our non-smoking room with a king bed two months in advance. We arrived at Paris at about 5:00 p.m. and we were standing at the check-in within 5 minutes, which was great. Not so great: no standard rooms with beds at the pre-arranged rate. We were offered a jacuzi suite with a king bed for an extra $50 a night (which turned out to be $56 a night for a total of $106.00 a night) which we decided to take. On the plus side, the room was huge, easily the largest we have ever had in Vegas (and we have stayed at the Venetian, the Belagio, at Caesers in the Augustus and Forum towers, and, two weeks earlier, at the Aria). The room had a fridge that you could actually use (unlike the bar fridges at most hotels now), a sitting area with a couch, several chairs and a desk, a king size bed, a bathroom with a two-person jacuzi, double sinks and a shower (the toilet in a separate room) and a very large area where luggage could be stored out of sight and another desk. The furniture, including the bed, was very comfortable: we slept very well. The room looked elegant, but somewhat dated. The jacuzi worked well and fit two adults comfortably. On the negative side, while rooms of comparable price now have two or three flat-screen televisions, including one in the bathroom, this room had one very small box television in a place that you really couldn't watch comfortably from bed (not that we watch much television in Vegas, but it's the principle). Again, the room looked elegant but dated: we had payed $79 a night for the Aria two weeks before, and although the Aria room was much smaller, it was also far more stylish. Most disappointing was the view: at a room rate of more than $100 a night we expect something nice to look at (the Strip, the mountains, something), but we overlooked the roof and air-conditioning. We see little point in having a huge sitting area if the view discourages one from spending any extra time in the room. Regarding the hotel, we love the look of the casino and Mon Abi Gabi is by far our favorite restaurant in Vegas (AVOID LE VILLAGE BUFFET LIKE THE PLAGUE! READ THE RECENT TRIPADVISOR REVIEWS, INCLUDING MINE). Do not stay at Paris if you want to use the pool: it is unbelievably small and unattractive for such a big hotel. In short, we would stay at Paris again, but only during winter months. The rooms and hotel are warm and cozy, not stylish and sexy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ashn
Reviews.Content: My only complaint was how long it took to check in. It didn't help that I had 2 tired boys and 3 frazzled adults and just wanted to get into our rooms to freshen up. The wait of almost 1 hour didn't help the mood. Appreciated the airconditioning in the hot desert! The food at the "French village" was excellent - plentiful and tasty. Pretty long lines here too. The breakfast buffet was expensive though, considering how relatively cheap the rooms were. Rooms were very good. Good-sized beds. Comfortable and clean. Good-sized bathroom. Casino was spacious and airy. Taxis were freely available - too hot to walk even though Paris was kind of in the centre of all the interesting casino/hotels. Had fun taking the day trip to the Grand Canyon. Lots of places to eat around the Strip, if you want to avoid the long lines inside Paris. The other negative thing about the hotel is that there is nothing for kids below 18 to do, except go to the top of the Eiffel Tower. The arcade at Excalibur was a great thing for them, along with seeing the sights at the other theme hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice But Lacks Energy”
Reviews.Author: Spalaw
Reviews.Content: In the last 2 years, I have been to Vegas eight times, and have stayed at Treasure Island, Planet Hollywood, MGM Grand, New York New York, Mandalay Bay and now Paris. I don't go to Vegas to gamble, but like to stay at hotels that have a "fun vibe." I generally travel with my wife, but have also taken the kids. Overall, Paris is a really nice hotel. However, I did find it to be more quiet and low-keyed than the other hotels I have stayed at. It doesn't really have any hip lounges, bars or clubs. There is no music playing in any areas of the hotel like a lot of other places. We also booked a standard room that, while decent enough for the price, was outdated and in need of renovation. There are newer updated rooms if you want to pay the extra money. I would recommend this hotel if you want a nice place to stay and don't really care about a hotel with energy or up-dated standard rooms. If you want something more hip, fun and with more energy, or want a renovated room like you can find at many other hotels, you may want to try other 4 to 4 1/2 star hotels that will be in the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “At the top of the theme hotels in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ppinzon
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all and is right in the heart of the strip. Large casino and pool area, great selection of restaurants, shopping and entertainment - all within the hotel premises. I had the opportunity to spend 4 days at the Paris, the concierge service was #1. Rooms were cleaned a little later in the afternoon but this didn't bother me at all. The food at Le Village Buffet is great however the service needs improvement, Keep in mind there is a lot of people walking in and out of this restaurant at any given time. I also tried Le Burger Brasserie, also at the Paris. The food and service is top notch. You must try the Lamb burger (Le Mediterranean) medium rare ofcourse - it's out of this world. When spending time at the casino ask for Alva (best server in Vegas) and play wherever she is because the drinks just keep on coming... Careful though - there is a reason for this :-? There are many theme hotels in Vegas, New York New York, Excalibur, Luxor, Venetian, etc. If I had to recommend one, I'd say stay at the Paris, you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to its namesake”
Reviews.Author: IrishDawn
Reviews.Content: I spent an expended Labor Day weekend at Paris and was completely satisfied with the experience. Check-in was seamless and we received the room we booked for the price we booked it at. No resort fees meant that we didn't pay $15 a day for bottled water and a newspaper, like other Vegas hotels charge. The pool, during a very busy weekend, always had available lounge chairs. The food was adequate, and several of the restaurants had specials that made it particularly affordable. Our room was kept spotless for our entire visit. The location is among the best on the strip. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Hotel Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Kev1963
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel with wonderful rooms, nice decor and central location. Got upgraded to a super suite as well.

Reviews.Title: “Can't disagree with mediocre reviews”
Reviews.Author: blueswriter
Reviews.Content: Been coming to Vegas for decades now, and every year it gets a little more ordinary... Paris and sister hotels currently owned by the Harrah's group have been through numerous owners since I began visiting. Previous owners cared about clients, particularly gaming clients, however this current regime has chosen a different course and there's nothing special about it. Spa is pricey and very mediocre. Restaurants are the same. Pool deck is large but ordinary. Casino floor hasn't changed much over the years...less smokey and less crowded...apparantly I'm not the only one being lured away to other hotels with much better amenities. Rooms are ordinary and don't have the plush "sleeper' style beds other chains have. All in all, this chain is no longer worth the price of admission. Marriott Grand Chateau and City Centre have new, roomier and cleaner properties nearby that provide more. Harrah's strip hotels will continue to decline until they remove the current penny pinching management team, and start restoring some of the panache and class that Vegas used to have to their numerous properties. A wake up call from the front desk is overdue.

Reviews.Title: “Great position -wished could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: Relaxation_Finder
Reviews.Content: We arrived at midday after a 4 hour drive from LA & didn't expect to get into rooms straight away. However got free upgrades with rooms overlooking the pool with immediate access. Have been to Vegas before & stayed at the Luxor. The Paris has a far superior position (straight across the road from Bellagio & Caesar's), is much cheaper & more up to date. Kids loved the theming. Liked the pool - loads of free sunloungers. One general word of advice if using the monorail - it costs. We used the one previously that runs from Mandalay to Excaliber & it was free.

Reviews.Title: “Paris is great”
Reviews.Author: sandyjoe
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Paris August 29- Sept 1. I had asked for a king room and it was not ready when I got there. She said it would be two hours until ready or I could have two queens. I took the two queens. I was by myself, so I really did not care. I was on the 9th floor 908 and look down at the roof of the building. No view at all. Old Tv as well. The Tv worked, I was not in the room to worry. The room was very clean, had plenty of towels. Never had to wait more than a 60 seconds for the elevator. Casino was clean. They were not very busy, being Sunday-Wednesday. Dealers were all very pleasant and freindly. Have been before and remembered many faces. Ate at the buffet for breakfast and lunch, had the 24 hour deal. It was very nice and great for the money. Dinner was at Planet Hollywood, great as well. WEnt to the Mixx bar in Mandalay Bay, it is on the 64th floor so you had a great view. All in all I had a very nice time in vegas, and not bad for a solo trip.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Resort”
Reviews.Author: sarah5450
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at Paris on our way to Zion National Park. We were very pleased with our room. We stayed in one of the Red rooms on the 30th floor. We had a great view of the Eiffel Tower and the Bellagio fountains. The hotel offers all of the amenities one could ask for. We enjoyed our short stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay...Great Location on Strip”
Reviews.Author: Katmandu623
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at many places in Las Vegas and have to say this was one of our favorite places. We arrived on 7 Aug, a little earlier than check-in time and the staff was very friendly and didn't make us wait to check in. We were upgraded to a room with a great view of the pool and Eiffel Tower. The room was very nice and comfortable and was always made up very early, unlike some of the other hotels we've stayed in. The location in the middle of the strip was great for walking to almost anywhere on the strip. We thoroughly our stay and will definitely stay there again. I even enjoyed gambling there, although it got very very crowded late in the evening. Plenty of parking and although we didn't eat there, there were definitely plenty of options. We definitely thought it was and overall great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and price”
Reviews.Author: TravelingGirl69x
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the middle of the Strip, a little walk to the monorail, we had a great view from our room of the Eiffel tower and the pool. Friendly service, no problems with anything. Would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay ay the paris”
Reviews.Author: dixon123
Reviews.Content: we booked our to stay at the paris hotel las vegas with book hotel.com it was a special occassion our 26th wedding anniverssary, we did not get a up grade when we told them but we decided we would up grade anyway ,we was glad we did as our red room was fantastic we did how ever after move rooms because of some work being done outside the hotel we had been woken up at 6am for two days !! we asked the staff on the desk to be moved there was not a problem and we moved rooms this was a hassel, but we still had a fantastic holiday and would go back to the paris hotel again the locaction is excellent but we did still use the bus to up and down the strip, everyone who visits las vegas must go to freemont street at night time and see the light show.

Reviews.Title: “Married at Paris Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: LVNewlywedTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed and was married at the Paris hotel. We had a total of 18 people for our trip. The guests were able to get discounted rooms. I had the Eiffel Tower morning package it was great and everything went very smoothly. I got a ton of compliments from friends and family about how it was the best wedding they had been too. We had a brunch reception at the Eiffel Tower restaurant - we had the pre-selected 3 course brunch menu - where the food was amazing and the Creme Brulee was to die for - people are still talking it was the best they have had in any restaurant. Personally, for me the food was way too rich and creamy - but I guess that comes with food type. For dinner we had our group at the Mon Ami Gabi in the private indoor room facing the Belligo fountains, the setup of the room was perfect and the service couldn't be beat. Everyone raved about the meal being the best of the trip by far - smaller groups of us also returned for breakfast and lunch because we were so impressed! This is a breakfast place that can't be missed - sit outside for the great view along with the tasty food. If you can swing it, between our brunch and dinner we rented a pool cabana. It was THE way to spend the day at the pool. They had an indoor room with A/C, TV and mini fridge, and an outside lounge area with misters - which is a bonus for those hot Vegas days in the sun. The drinks at the pool were pretty pricey as well, but it was a great day and well worth it. The downside - I hate to complain because everything was so wonderful for our special day, but a few things I would change if I were to do it over... my now husband and I were the first to check-in, a few days ahead of the rest of our party, and come to find out - we were given the worst room. Now normally I wouldn't mind - but being the bride and groom I was sort-of expecting extra special treatment. We had one of the lower room floors, and our room had not been renovated as the other rooms our guests received were - on higher floors. The higher floors also had the much better views, so I would recommend staying the highest floor you can reserve. I didn't want to request to change once I saw the difference in the rooms, because I had so much stuff with my dress and all - and also it wasn't in our nature to throw a fit to the staff for our wedding trip. The higher floors also go a turn down service in the evening which we did not get. Also, on the weekends there was loud music at the pool - being on the lower floors - you better like Jersey Shore fist pumping club music - because unless you turn on your TV, that is all you will hear... all day long. Our room did not have a flat pannel TV or ipod doc like the other rooms. I also wish they offered free wi-fi. In this day and age I think it would be a given, esp with all the bucks the hotels rake in, I think they can afford this perk to their guests :). For wedding coordinator I was expecting more of a best friend type for guidance - instead I got a drill sargent. She did get the spa to open an hour early for me - which I was unable to get them to do, in order to get my hair and make-up done at their hotel in time for the ceramoney - so that was a benefit to her toughness. The spa was nothing compared to Ceasars - don't waste your time at the Paris spa - for sure it is worth the walk and $ to check out Ceasers spa, it is amazing and a night and day difference between the two. You don't even need to get a treatment to enjoy their spa - they have a whole set-up with pools and saunas you could easily spend the whole day at - (the only scary part is some of our fellow spa guests who should not be allowed to follow the clothing- optional choice for the sake of the other people there - be advised :), The photos - you only get standard size prints - so be prepared to shell out a pretty penny to get the CD so you can make your own prints when you return home. My photos did turn out great overall, and I printed them online through a popular online photo site to get the larger prints and books. Overall - I would say Paris was an awesome place to be married (esp in the tower) - but just make sure to get yourself an awesome remodeled room on a high floor facing the strip to go along with you stay. The night time view of the tower and the fountains is amazing!!! I was told repeatedly that everyone loved the trip and it was THE way to do a wedding. So - I don't think you can go wrong if you get married here. It is a little scary to plan from a distance, but for me it turned out all better than I dreamed!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view, awesome room, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: randy2469
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Paris, truly an enjoyable experience. At check in I had a deluxe room compted for 5 nites , so I thought I would try the $20 trick, to see if I could get an upgrade, when the clerk handed back my twenty I figured I was out of luck ,but instead she said lets see what we can can do. I told her I was in Vegas to get married and that my fiance had never been to Vegas before. Well she offered us the Calais suite on the 33rd floor for $80.00 a nite, which we took, when I checked the rates later that room as going for $470.00 a nite! The suite was fabulous. two baths ,wet bar etc., the view was the best in the hotel! Our entire stay at the Paris was exceptional, and thanks to our check in clerk, Shirlene, we will be coming back again!

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: dss222
Reviews.Content: I used to go to this hotel 8 years ago, it was top of the line, only a little small, but perfect, now the rooms are falling apart, the cleaning of the room is terrible, the maintenance of the room also. I went to the VIP room , the doors needed a restauration urgently. It is really dissaponting. The casino is very nice. The restaurantas are lowering their quality, and the prices getting up.

Reviews.Title: “a good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: richie_63
Reviews.Content: A family of four including 2 teenage girls. The paris hotel was a good themed hotel. entry to the hotel and casino area is impressive with the paris theme - eiffel tower, painted ceilings like open sky, themed street. the room was a family room 2 x double beds and was spacious and clean. we were on floor 20 at the back of the hotel. we were asked if we wanted a "strip" view but this was for an extra $55 per night. we didn't take them up on the offer as it wasn't worth it - you don't spend that amount of time in the room to enjoy the view! we asked to extend our check out on the final day as we had a late filght and they agreed to extend for a few hours without extra cost (as most hotels do) and also store our bags until it was time to leave. we only ate an evening meal once in the hotel at le provencal - this was at about 10 pm after seeing a show. we were not best pleased. the food was mediocre and the service was poor. the waiter seemed to be uninterested especially when i pointed out some plastic in my food no apology or explanantion etc. the price was as to be expected and more expensive than other strip restaurants. the pool area was good and uncrowded. the pool was quite shallow approx 1 m deep so no diving jumping etc. it seemed sheltered and was a nice break to the busy days. the location was really good right in the middle of the strip opposite the bellagio for the fountains. easy to walk south or north (although as everywhere it is longer than at first thought!!) overall i would stay here again for the size of the room and its location.

Reviews.Title: “Great 30th Birthday!”
Reviews.Author: sa2121
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews (good and Bad) I was very reluctant to stay in Paris. When we got there the staff were fantastic! The woman at the desk (Cheryl) was wonderful. I told her it was my 30th birthday and we got a great upgrade to the 27th floor in one of the newly renovated rooms....it was beautiful! We did get the 24 hour pass...and ate breakfast there for the first morning..,it was ok. But going to the Ceasars palace breakfast the next day...choose paris...there is much more to choose from. The pool was great...very crowded but plenty of spaces open and some shade too. The only dissapointment was that there was no airport shuttle. And we all know how much cab rides can be! Other than that I loved staying at Paris, and it made my 30th birthday one to remember!!! PS even though there is not internet (unless you pay like 15 bucks for 24 hours) they do have great kiosks to print out your boarding passes and surf the internet....(you have to pay for it though)

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, poor housekeeping.”
Reviews.Author: Galant
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paris Hotel from 8/22 to 8/27/10. Location of the hotel is the best. Just in front of the Bellagio fountains and close to Miracle Mile Shopping Center. If you are a budget traveler like me, pay $18.00 for a beakfast is too much, so, 200 mts north there is a Burger King at Osheas Casino, there is also an Earl Sandwiches store at the Planet Hollywood where prices are low in the $8 or $7. Good? Yes. There is also a Hard Rock Cafe 150 mts south, with a Wendys and a Subway close to it. Good? Better. Ok, more tips, 1) The Deuce: Impossible to ride if you are not an early bird. The only way to see everything and take the deuce is waking up early. The whole day is full. Reason? $7.00 for 24 hours ride is a good deal. So be early at the strip and you will be able to ride it. Also, going early to the strip, you will also find the day more cool, the later at the strip, the hotter will be the day. Everybody is drinking till morning hours, people wake up late, and because you want to see the strip, you wake up early. OK. Whe i say early, means between 830 am to 9 am. 2)The best way to see the strip, is walking. You can not take picturesof the strip, from the inside of car or a bus. Go to google maps or panoramio.com, there are lots of pictures. Youtube.com have a lot of videos of the Strip, watch them, you will learn a lot, the more you learn, the more money you will save by knowing where you are. Study the place before going. You can save hundreds of dollars by doing it by yourself. 3) I was in a "deluxe" room. The cheaper one. There is no fridge, but there is an icemachine in each floor. If the ice machine is not working (that happened to me), go to the lower floor, each floor layout is the same. You will save $55.00 per night without a fridge in the room. 4) Go to the Top of the Eifell tower, by day $10.00 ride, by night $15.00, with $22.00 "VIP ticket", you do not have to make the line to take the elevator. Remember, the Bellagio Fountains show starts at 3pm, until 12am every day. So, stay looking at the Bellagio to take good pictures while you are in the top. 5) The best way to see the Bellagio Fountains show, is waiingt for it. If you leave, it starts, and you will not be there. Have a little patience and you will have a front seat! Is every half and hour and is a must see show. 6) There is a Seven Elleven at the Hawaiian Market, 200 mts south of Paris Hotel. Buy water, this place is really hot in summer time. There is also a Walgreen beside the Hawaiin Market. Housekeeping...terrible. They did not clean my room daily, i had to look around the floor to see the cleaning girls to see why it was 3pm and the room was not clean. The second day was the same. So i went to the lobby to complaint about it. The front desk clerk Luz, told me, "You want to be cleaned the room daily?" ,,,,,, WHAT!!!. So, i was dissapointted how rude this lady was. There are 2,925 rooms in the Paris Hotel, so, that nobody cares about you, you are another number, that is the way i feel. The hotel lobby looks like an airport, people going and people coming. Casino- Is beautiful, but like every casino in the strip, they smell the hell of cigarrete smoke! Be prepare for that. Upgrade- I galantly suggested an upgrade during check in, but Deborah (the clerk) did not help me, remember this name Deborah! If this is your clerk at check in, forget it, no complimentary upgrade! Period. Rude people.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location nice room hotel easy to find your way around not to big”
Reviews.Author: teritravel
Reviews.Content: checked in at 10am our room was being cleaned and were told to come back in 1 hr for the keys which we did and the room was ready., but the check in employee next to us told a couple they were too early for check in and had to wait till 3pm Really what's the diiference to them if the room is clean and you check in early. Anyhow nice room, premier on the 29th floor view of the pool and partial view of the fountains. comfortable bed quiet room flatscreen tv. never a wait for the elevators. drink prices high in the bars and the pool .looked like the buffet always had a long wait to get in. most employees we dealt with were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience All Around”
Reviews.Author: DineOutOften10
Reviews.Content: We travel to LV once or twice a year and have stayed at Paris half a dozen times. Love the location in the heart of the strip. Check in was painless - mid afternoon on a Friday - however the valet was jammed so we self parked. Comped room was one of the older ones. Showing it's age but everything functioned. The bed definetly needed a new mattress but we slept well. All of our encounters with staff were pleasant. The poolside servers were friendly and attentive. Mon Ami Gabi is one of our favorite restuarants on the strip and we were able to get a table on the patio on a Friday night with only a 15 minute wait. Great place to people watch and the food is very good. From a gambling standpoint we also like the connector to Ballys where the table limits are often lower (I'm a craps player). I like the option of being able to change casinos to change our luck without having to go outside. I think Paris is a solid option if you're looking for a reasonably priced mid-strip location. We're in our 50's so we look for a little less intense vibe and Paris fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “be aware”
Reviews.Author: rostami
Reviews.Content: During our staying in the hotel we had to make 4 phone calls to a line phone in Long Island NY. To understand what will be the expected cost of the calls we checked the brochure in the room, which note that the price of one minute to the service of AT&T will cost 1.25$ and any other call will be charged according to AT&T rates + 20%. We were very surprised to discover the price was more then 10$ !! for each call that lasted only a few seconds. The respond we received from the clerk name shirlene (she wasn't willing to give us her full name) was; there is a line of people and that she or that manager do not have time for us so if we will not pay the bill she will raise it by including another call of 10$ that the hotel didn't charged us yet. Shirlene response was angry and aggressive. We were astounded from the threat. We have never been threatened like this as customers.Shirlene didn't let us talk with the manager about the service that was given by hers and added one more call to our bill. We would like to note that this incident was exceptional, in every time we needed the hotel services we received all the help we could ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time at the Paris”
Reviews.Author: momof3inbc
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on here; we were concerned with our booking - but were pleasantly surprised upon arrival. The hotel was absolutely breaktaking! The check~in was smooth and kind (not rude like mentioned here). We were offered an upgrade and did offer to take it as it was our first time in Vegas and our anniversary to boot. We were on the 26th floor and didn't have a view of the anything spectacular...but the room itself (one of the Red Rooms) was absolutely beautiful. We dined at the Eiffel Tower restaurant for brunch ~ be prepared the food is to die for ~ and we came away quite "stuffed" ~ feeling like we needed a nap :-) We also had dinner at the Steakhouse...which served a plate sized Prime Rib that was so tender it melted in your mouth. The Eiffel tower ride offered some gorgeous views but I found that the enclosure (for protection) that it was hard to take pictures. The coupon book that you are given upon check in makes Vegas (and the ride) a little more 'enjoyable' (grin). A must see is the "O" at the Bellagio...a wonderful performance by Cirque de Soleil :) Make sure you try out the pastries in the Paris too, absolutely delightful! Check out the drinks at the Coyote Ugly as well ~~~ I will definitely be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall it was clean, safe, friendly and the location was to die for!!!”
Reviews.Author: windsova
Reviews.Content: The hotel was definitely nice. It had the "french flare" but it seemed a bit dated. The front desk, staff and anyone else I encountered while I stayed there were really nice and happy to help - no one was rude to me - but I used to work in the customer service industry so I know how to treat another human. ( I stayed for 5 days) We were upgraded to a pool view/fountain view room. Pretty nice, but we didn't get a red room - so the room was a little "old" looking. They are going for old school paris, which works but compared to other hotels it wasn't as nice. Be warned, we walked in via the back entrance once and were scooped up and pressured into joining one of those "free events where you get free EVERYTHING" - it's a time share that i'm just not interested in.... they are pretty aggressive and can be found almost anywhere so watch out. Just say "no thank you" and walk away, FAST! The pool was nice - nothing too fancy but nice. Casino was loud and hectic - much more than at surrounding hotels. Overall it was clean, safe, friendly and the location was to die for!!! The hotel is VERY impressive looking from the strip so it's cool to say "I stayed there" but I wouldn't go back. I only wouldn't recommend it because there seems like there could be much better elsewhere. I know that Planet Hollywood right next door is a bit cheaper and much more hipper/modern looking.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Get A Way”
Reviews.Author: kitten81360
Reviews.Content: Paris was great, upgraded to a Suite on the top floor for $50 a night from comped rooms. Staff was great, slots good, buffet average, did the 24 hr pass. We love staying at Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the best place of the strip!!”
Reviews.Author: Tonimus73
Reviews.Content: The Paris is s lovely hotel bang in the middle of the strip opposite the Bellagio and 10mins walk to The Mirage! Very nice eateries too (avoid the Cafe for dinner, expensive and food not of good quality!) the creperie and the bakery serve excellent food for good value! Nice pool area! Very busy hotel like all Vegas Hotels! Check in pretty fast condidering the long line that were before us!! All in all a great place!

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT place to stay in Vegas...”
Reviews.Author: TMAC20
Reviews.Content: Each time we travel to Vegas, we try out a different hotel. We got an excellant price ($89) for a fantastic room at the Paris. The room was: spotless, huge (two bathrooms, sitting room, bedroom, foyer), beautifully decorated, quiet, amazing view and excellant service. The valet service was friendly and problem free. We would definitely stay here again. Small thing but is something to remember... even though there was a coffee machine in the room (which is NOT standard at the Monte Carlo), we ordered a carafe with milk that was delivered in approx 15 minutes - they guarantee this service in under 20 minutes or it's free! Carafe cost $10 (same service is $17 at the Monte Carlo with a 45 min wait). Customer service... that's what it's ALL about.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Hotel...good and bad”
Reviews.Author: PittsburghFrankS
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in June. Took our son and his wife and daughter and her husband. Upon check-in, told the woman I had three rooms, she told me, I did not. Well I had three confirmation numbers, but she had their names. One strike there. Asked for a nice room, my daughter's first time in Las Vegas and she was celebrating a birthday. Nothing was available. We got rooms on the ninth floor overlooking the air conditioners...again. Daughter had a small view of the mountains. My son, arriving later, different city of departure, got upgraded to a lovely suite, only because they sold their room. That was nice for them. Had a very nice time at the hotel, as it was really nice and centrally located. Nice restaurants. Pool wasn't nice, dirty (beer bottles and cups everywhere) and not one of the nicest around. The room was pretty nice, except the view. Had some luck with video poker and rewards card came in handy. Checking out, we got the same woman as when we checked in! Paid our bill, and politely asked if she could take my only post card and drop it off for me. She started to raise her hand and point, then nicely took my card. I know you can't get a upgrade everytime you go to a hotel, you win some, and lose some. Fine. Listen to this, my wife works at a credit union, the following week she spoke to a member who just returned from Paris in Las Vegas. The woman was a French teacher at a local high school. She saw the check in clerk was from France, so they began chatting in French. Ended up getting upgraded to a suite overlooking the Bellagio fountains! I will never go to Vegas again in June. Too hot!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay at Paris Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: smartelek
Reviews.Content: Paris Las Vegas is the perfect location on the Strip - we didn’t have to take cabs at all this trip. The temperature was 100°+ so we did most of our sightseeing during early mornings and after sundown (with a mid-day siesta). We used indoor walkways, people movers and hotel trams as much as possible. Paris’s central location made these excursions easier despite the heat. My sister and I booked our trip through USAirways Vacations and paid less for the three night package than the airfare alone. We had a standard room with a view of the Paris Balloon and the Arc de Triomphe that wasn’t bad. We could have upgraded, but decided it wasn’t worth the extra money. We’d previously stayed at the Wynn and Venetian so Paris Las Vegas was small by comparison - but so was the price. The room was clean and quiet but could have used a little TLC. The hotel was very easy to navigate with all of the amenities expected at a fine hotel. Paris Las Vegas is in the shape of an “X” with the elevators at the center so there wasn’t an endless, confusing walk to our room. One morning, we had three Mimosas at the casino (free), then walked across Le Boulevard and had crème brulee and coffee - the perfect Las Vegas breakfast. There’s also a lovely bar in the casino, under the trees, that’s a great place to sit with a beverage and people watch. We found a small coffee station directly across from the elevators for that quick jolt of caffeine without the restaurant lines. The service staff was very attentive. Check-in took about ten minutes. The Bell Captain and housekeeping were friendly and helpful and the waitresses in the casino were always available. We are low-rollers and don’t eat at the gourmet restaurants but we were glad we did not purchase the 24-hour buffet special. During peak times, the lines for the buffets were very, very long and would have cut into our valuable vacation time. When we ate at the hotel, Le Café was an excellent choice for meals with reasonable prices (for Las Vegas) and great service. Tip: When the menu says “peppercorn crusted” they mean it. Our waiter warned us but we didn’t listen. Our bad. Naturally, there are lines at regular meal times with special access given to big spenders. If waiting in lines aggravates you either become a high roller or stay home. If you think yelling at the wait staff will make the line move faster you’re wrong. You just provide entertainment for the rest of us and run the risk of the staff pulling a “Miss Celie” in your water glass. The mini-bar was completely empty and turned off. (A mini-bar isn’t listed as a room feature on Paris’s website.) It didn’t matter to us but some people might want this amenity. One of the reasons we had a great time on this trip is we came home with some of our money. I can’t say it’s entirely because we stayed and played at Paris Las Vegas - but it helped.

Reviews.Title: “Rough start”
Reviews.Author: 25andcounting
Reviews.Content: We had just flown 4 hours and arrived in the evening for check-in. It was about 9:30 Vegas time but it would have been 12:30 at home. We were tired and frustrated when the young girl behind the desk informed us that there were no more rooms available with a king sized bed as we had requested when we had made our reservations. Evidently, according to her, you are not guaranteed what you reserved. We could, however, upgrade to a newly renovated room with a king sized bed for an additional $40 a night. It was our 25th anniversary and staying at Paris was already an upgrade for us so we were not prepared to pay an additional $160 to get what we thought we already had signed up for. We resigned ourselves to the room with the two queen sized beds. Not very romantic and something we can get at home. Fortunately, the next morning we spoke with Gina at the front desk. Thank you Gina for putting a rush on cleaning a room with a king sized bed for us. The room was a bit more worn but it was larger and had a partial view of the strip. The housekeeping staff did a nice job keeping it clean during our stay. We ended up having a nice time at Vegas. We are on the fence whether we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelforfun67
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great and the staff friendly. Really enjoyed our stay. It is in the middle of the strip so very conveniently situated. Go to the top of the tower for a excelent view of the strip and the musical fountains that are accross the road. The Miracle Mile Mall is next door for some great shopping

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RKNLOVESCOFFEE
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first time in Vegas, and the location was great. You are right across the street from the Bellagio, which has the best fountain show (free and every 15 minutes) choreographed with music. You can walk through the Paris shops and go directly into Bally's next door and catch the tram at the back of the hotel which will take you to either end of the strip ($5.00 fee on way, $12.00 24 hr. pass). We had an end room facing the strip on the 20th floor. We could see the fountain show from our room and could hear the music (which wasn't too loud). The show stops at midnight anyway. the Front Desk person gave us a great room with a view for no additional cost (I did give her a tip afterwards). The only downside to this hotel, was to our surprise after a long, hot (101) degree day of walking, we wanted to relax at the pool at 6:45 p.m. The pool is at the base of the eiffel tower, but THE POOL CLOSED AT 7:00 P.M. AND THEY LITERALLY KICKED US OUT! We couldn't even sit by the pool area. Staff told us due to budget cuts their attorney's didn't allow even access to the pool area. they didn't seem very happy either. they were quickly stacking the lounge chairs around us, and were disgusted (they probably were under the gun to complete their job and leave!). We were not happy with that. We were able to eat at 3:00 a.m. in an all-night restaurant that had excellent quesadilla's! The Vodka and Tonics that were free when you gambled were the best we had at any casino. Our room was clean and spacious. The bathroom was BIG AND BEAUTIFUL. Our standard room had a big soaker tub, walkin shower, large vanity. It was great for the 3 of us gals trying to get ready at the same time. Beds were Queen sized and comfortable for 2. Nice squishy chair with ottomon in front of big windows. Shops are fabulous! Lots of eating. Little bakery with coffee in morning, moved slow, but was worth it when you had the pastries. Breakfast buffet on Sunday Morning ($17.99, not the Sunday brunch which was a little later), was DELICIOUS! Great Crepe station. Good selection. LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS HOTEL! stay there......

Reviews.Title: “Buffet”
Reviews.Author: dexter1223
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's and we were referred to the Paris Hotel Buffet. We waited for 40 mins. on line and when we were about to be seated they had empty tables and people waiting on line. Their breakfast buffet was not good and we had to wait almost 15mins. just to get a cup of coffee.The only thing that was good was the fruit. The service was not good at all.It was too expensive for what we ate

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: okie103
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at Paris. This is the third time I have stayed at this hotel.The room was part of a US Airways Package. Upon arrival late at night I was so disappoined with the room view that I called the front desk to ask for a room change. They could not change us that night but they did the next morning to a room overlooking the pool and Eifffel Tower, much nicer than concrete. I guess I expected a little customer loyalty but....Anyway I still believe that this is the most convienent location on the strip. Sort of in the middle so that you can go either way and not be too far away. The rooms are clean but showing a little age. Staff were readily available for anything we may have needed. Casino is also a nice size, not too big which I like. Pool area is nice and not too crowded or crazy. great choices for food as it has a long walkway connecting it to Ballys with restaurants along the way. Cafe for breakfast was always crowded and a little understaffed but good. With all of the newer hotels I think I may have to try a different one next time but do not hesitate to recommend Paris for the reasons above.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tucco123
Reviews.Content: First time in vegas. Stayed at the Paris August 8 -12. Enjoyable stay, Great location. You can't beat it. Checked in at 11:30 p.m. Long line that moved slowly. However, we when did check in we were provided with a suite on 31st floor at no additional cost. Suite was just awesome. Thanks Marissa!!! Many of the shops were crowded and long line ups everywhere. We ate at the Eiffel Tower restaraurant and the Steakhouse. A little expensive but food and service was outstanding. Ate at the buffet once and it was good as well. Went to Mon Ami Gabi once. Worst service I have ever had. I have never stiffed a waiter or waitress on the tip. I did that day. Waitress treated us like we were some kind of nuisance to her day. The entire hotel/casino was smokey. Really smokey. On the whole, good place and great location. If you want luxury go to Bellagio or the Venetian.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Stay”
Reviews.Author: RabbitHockey
Reviews.Content: Ok, Sometimes Paris gets beat up a little in reviews but so do most hotels. I've been to Vegas close to 15 times, and stayed at many of the hotels. So take my review for however you like. Pros- Like most reviews, location is great. Its tough to beat on the strip. Checking in the line was quick at about 2:00 PM, maybe 10 minute wait. Also I scored a free upgrade the check in clerk was great, make sure you tip if they hook you up. It was common trend the service was great through out my stay. My room had a great view of the strip, the AEifel tower and the fountains from the 25th floor, it also overlooked the pool. I visited the pool and all though its not the most busy or flashy pool in vegas, I really enjoyed the laid back atmosphere and it wasnt over crowed, but had a good number if people. The Casino its self is good, not great but cocktail waitress do come around frequent which you dont always get at all casinos. I ate at the French steakhouse. Had a great server and food was good again but not superb. I would go back for sure, and the price was decent. Napoleans paino bar was ok for a little fun, but didnt stay too long but good atmopshere. Cons- Not a lot of Negatives this time around. 6:5 Blackjack on some tables is kind of joke if you play the cards. I really dont have much else for Cons.

Reviews.Title: “Good times!”
Reviews.Author: ADS3
Reviews.Content: Neat hotel/casino. Clean rooms with great view! Casino was nice, with shops and a street-like feel.

Reviews.Title: “Family Reunion”
Reviews.Author: Fressia
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Paris Hotel, we had not traveled to Las Vegas for over 28 years, what a difference. The Paris is a beautiful Hotel, the cobblestoned streets and all of the shops and restaurants give one a sense of being in a village. The room and the rates were wonderful for the middle of the week, and the Buffet, though a bit pricey was worth it. We rode the monorail to meet out family and that was great. We were disappointed in the Effiel Tower elevator ride, the sights from up there are beautiful, but no one is around to give any history about the structure, it would have been nice to receive a brochure or have a guide explain the history behind the actual tower.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly great!”
Reviews.Author: ILoveTexas
Reviews.Content: The staff at this perfectly located hotel were friendly and helpful from beginning to end. We received a complimentary upgrade to one of the beautiful red rooms, with refrigerator, big screen TV, and coffee maker. Our housekeeper did a wonderful job, and the hotel has lots of good dining choices of all types/prices. The only drawback is the expense for extras, as previously reported: $15 a day for Internet, $3 for a bottle of water, and $16 for 2 martinis at the advertised 2-for-1 happy hour in the bar near the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: jkuykendall74
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at Paris. The staff did an outstanding job. We got an early check-in and a late check-out. It is a great location, the mall in Planet Hollywood has ABC store where you can get snacks and drinks for a great price. The rooms were very nice and the beds were comfortable. When we called for bell service or more towels it never took longer than 5 min. We will stay there next time!

Reviews.Title: “"Paris" in Vegas...Yes & it's fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Mypinkparis
Reviews.Content: I have always wanted to stay here in Vegas being a Francophile and visiting Paris France regularly. I was a bit reticent after reading the bad reviews though. I will say first of all that if you want a luxury room at the top of the hotel with their amazing sweeping views, just book that room and pay for it. I'm sure that the staff gets tired of everyone wanting something for nothing. We were on floor 28 with a red room premier and it was spectacular. The views were gorgeous, especially at night. The room was so clean and beautiful. Room stayed very cool with AC even though it was 108 degrees when we where there. We tipped the maid daily and our room was cleaned and supplies restocked as soon as we went to breakfast. I personally loved the pool area. There were always ample chairs, you could always find shade and where else can lay on a chair and look up at the Eiffel Tower. Their music wasn't blaring loud but I didn't like all of the music played. There was one song that was a remix that had the f-word the entire 3 minutes. We complained. Totally inappropriate. I loved all the shopping in the hotel. They had some fun little shops. The Crepe Restaurant was fabulous. We had a crepe every day. Cafe Madeline's was great for breakfast. Free wifi also. We checked in at 11:00 in the morning with no problem and no wait. There seem to be many reviews stating the staff was rude. However, all the staff we encountered was kind and considerate. Normally in life, people treat us the same we treat them so a little niceness on our part goes a long way. This is a huge hotel with 1,000's of people and I'm sure the staff gets harassed non-stop from people that expect to be treated like royalty all the while as they are demanding their free upgrade, etc. A fabulous themed hotel/casino that I would visit again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: greatriptn
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Vegas. On company trip/vacation. I was worried after reading all ther reviews on here that I had picked the wrong hotel. But I was very pleased when I got there and had the experience of a lifetime. I have to say that being a Diamond card holder has its perks, which by the way is payed for all year long if you want to keep it. It was great never having to wait at check in or any of the restaurants. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to have a romantic get away with there parnter, which is exactly what I did.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff made all the difference!”
Reviews.Author: Stephen-Shipman
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the negative reviews I was a bit worried prior to our stay. My wife and I and another couple went down to celebrate our 10 year anniversaries, so I had high hopes and high expectations. Upon check-in, we asked to see where our room was. It was a room with a king bed, but a lousy view. We asked if there were any upgrades available and for $55/day, we could have a room with an amazing view and the concierge service. The very nice lady behind the desk explained what this service entailed and before she finished her sales pitch, I had said yes. A previous review had mentioned this and had recommended that travelers take advantage of it. I must agree. The "continental breakfast" just means that all food is cold. The selection is amazing. The "appetizers" are two hot items that can pass as meals. The two alcoholic drinks per person per day is worth it in this high priced city. Upon arriving in the room, we noticed what all reviews had mentioned: the rooms were adequate. Nothing special, except for the view. During our first night, our neighbours decided that 1am was time to party in their room. They were up at 6am and I could hear their TV from my room. I went to the front desk and they immediately upgraded my wife and I to a larger room. All the food we had within the hotel, including room service, was amazing. Every person we dealt with, from housekeeping to pool staff, were polite and helpful. After staying for 3 nights and 4 days, I could not see why people would complain about this hotel. Will I come back to this hotel: Yes ... I am just not sure Vegas in August will happen again!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: homesource
Reviews.Content: Arrived late on August 4th - advised Kig Size bed (as promised) not available..this was not a problem as the rooms were well appointed. Pool area was first class. Service was sorely lacking. Found staff indifferent and not welcoming at all from Le Cafe/Mon Ami Gabi and Casino Bar. This was disappointing and not the hospitality we expected. Security Staff entered our room while we were sleeping and found it difficult to locate and inform security until the following day when Catherine (Security) recorded and reported our concern with this situation and reported back to us. Location of Paris is great however we would never stay there on future visits and this is due to poor customer service and poor attitude of staff. Lydia who cleaned our room was the exception to the rule as she was firiendly and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Centre of the Strip Hotel Perfect For Las Vegas Stay”
Reviews.Author: Carebear1977
Reviews.Content: Arrived to the Paris Hotel late evening feeling jet lagged and extremely tired following twenty four hour trip. We were given a room with a view of the tour d'eiffel and could just hear the sound of the dancing fountain display. Needless to say this immediate immersion into Vegas life soon perked us up. The location of the Paris hotel is so perfectly central it allows for the traveller to visit different hotels at different sides of the Strip and then return halfway if the legs get tired or the heat gets to you. Loads of restaurants to pick from and a dueling pianos bar to entertain you while you have a beer.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but basic”
Reviews.Author: TheBearsAway
Reviews.Content: It was ok but now is looking old compared to the newer hotels on the strip. The room was clean and the pool was satisfactory. We spent our evenings in other more comfortable hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Sunlover5
Reviews.Content: We checked in on Aug. 1 and were there till Aug. 4. It was myself and my daughter who is age 29. Check in line moved quickly. The nice lady at the desk (Rena) told me about the upgrades and cost. We declined and after she gave us our room, she said she gave us a complimentary upgrade! Our view was wonderful. The room was wonderful and spacious. Only complaint was the beds were hard, but every night we were so tired we never noticed again! Hotel is easy to navigate. Didn't feel like we walked forever to get anywhere or back outside. Location, location, location....it was the best. Center strip, close to everything. We ate breakfast in the Cafe Madeline. Very good. Ate at Mon Ami Gabi for breakfast. Was very good, but we good have split a meal......huge portions. Liked you could view your bill on the television. Safe was great to have too. Loved the separate bathtub and shower. Pool area was fine for us. No problem getting chairs. Pool was very clean. Ate lunch at the pool twice. The club sandwich was great. Again, it was huge, we shared and had plenty. Check out was a breeze. We did the Eiffel tower to view the city. If you show your room key you can buy one ticket and get one free. Found this out by accident, as no one told us at check in. It was 15.00 for both of us and we thought it was worth it. Loved the hotel, the service was great. We plan on staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel/great location”
Reviews.Author: mulled01
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel and would stay here next time I go to vegas without hesitation. I see a lot of people criticize this hotel for service and the employees' attitudes. I have to say that I did not interact with anyone at this hotel, other than the person who checked us in, who was pleasant and quick. Oh, and the dealer/casino staff were very nice. Also, I did not eat here, so I can't comment on that either. That said, here are the highs and lows from my perspective: 1. The room was fantastic. It was large, clean and appointed very nicely. The bathroom was the highlight. Huge, all-tile, stand-alone shower, kohler fixtures, lots of nice towels etc. All very nice. And, the bed was very comfy. The furniture was very nice as well. 2. The elevators were crazy quick. I honestly don't think I waited longer than 10 seconds for any elevator ride. This is WAY different than I've experienced at other Vegas hotels. 3. The hotel is easy to get in and out of. There is a dedicated stop light on Las Vegas Blvd, you can turn left or right onto Las Vegas Blvd from the valet and you can enter the hotel from Las Vegas Blvd going either way. This is a huge plus if you are a casino/restaurant hopper or shopper. 4. You can use the empty row in the Mini Bar for your personal use, so you kind of have a fridge in your room. 5. The Pool is awesome. It's huge, clean and in a beautiful setting. You're at the base of the eiffel tower. It's a beautiful setting and a fun time. You can chill out or play with the youngin's playing beach ball and drinking. 6. The location is as good as it gets. It's in the heart of the strip. Most things are walkable. The Bellagio is across the street. The location is one of the best features of this property. 7. The place is just the right size. It's big enough to have a good choice of restaurants, shops and amenities. But, it's not huge. You can easily find your party. The casino is not huge at all - just the right size in my opinion. If you've ever stayed with a group at MGM, you know what I mean. 7. No Resort Fees! Cons: 1. The TV is a crappy old tube type, but who goes to Vegas to watch TV? 2. Valet parking is very slow (the self-park is way quicker and the walk to the room is about the same). It was busy when I was there, but the valet was a bit of a disaster, honestly. I would do the self-park. And, I'm not a self-parker. 3. Internet is like $15 a day, which is expensive, but who goes to Vegas to surf the internet? 4. If you care about your view, you're going to pay a lot more. I think they said a strip-view was like $50 or $60 a night more. Totally not worth it to me, but if it matters to you, consider that. For my needs, I highly recommend this place. Meaning, if you're looking for a very nice, affordable hotel room in Las Vegas with a great location - this can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: almays
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel July 18-22, and overall we enjoyed our stay. The line to check in was long, but it moved pretty fast. We was ask if we want to upgrade for $40.00 more per night, we declined but was given one free of charge. The room was nice and clean and really like the walk-in shower. The location is great it's in the middle of the strip and next door to the mile shop mall. My only disappointment was the food, the buffets are so expensive and the food was not that great. You can purchase the 24 hour pass, but the food was not warm and the chooses of vegetables was not good. Although you on vacation,you still want a good hot balanced meal. We ate alot of sandwiches and burgers(Earl's Greatest Sandwich at Planet HollyWood was a good place to eat). Overall we did enjoy our vacation and would stay at the hotel again. I had to write after reading some of reviews it's really is a nice hotel and everyone we encounter was nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will return”
Reviews.Author: bratty13
Reviews.Content: My wife and son spent last week at the Paris. Other than a very new check-in girl the hotel was excellent. This was our third stay at this hotel and next July will be our Fourth. We felt the casino and the sports book was just the right size. We really have no complaints about the hotel or the staff. My wife sleeps in a reclining chair due to 2 surgeries, however when I requested a chair I was informed that they did not have them. The person I was dealing with gave me the info to obtain one from the local Rent A Center. It was very simple and when we arrived to our room her chair was waiting. We certainly would recommend this hotel. We will return and look forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Get it in writing”
Reviews.Author: eyetravel22
Reviews.Content: Thank heavens I printed my room reservation for a Premium Room because they insisted on giving me just a Luxury Room. They wanted to charge to use a refrigerator. I can get free drinks in the casino -don't bother. Nice to have seperate bath and shower. Room was clean with a view of pool & Eifel Tower. Hot tubs at pool in very bad conditon with broken cement around edges. Pool staff not friendly. Casino floor cleaning staff was rude and the front desk staff pretended to make a report. Never heard from the management. Buffet was wonderful. The 24 hour cafe had terrible service and bland food. I stayed here 4 years ago and everyone then was so friendly. With the economy suffering, I would think casinos would be nicer to keep people returning.

Reviews.Title: “All a ton of BS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: UtahLucy
Reviews.Content: I researched hotels in Las Vegas for over 3 mos. Choosing the Paris Hotel to celebrate my 50th Birthday, with friends joining me from other states. This was a VERY important time for me, as well as my friends. I picked the red room, with the big comfy beds, and awesome red couch. Having lots of room for company, and working on computer and such. Knowing that we would need a wheel chair for my friend, who just had foot surgery. So, to make a long story short... We get to the front desk to check into our room. Expecting to pay 155 a night...The guy tells me, it will be 40 dollars extra a night, due to the fact that the rooms are all redone. I tell the guy, not my problem, as I was told 4-5 times over the phone, it would be 155 a night. We get to our room, and there is NO RED COUCH, that I was promised...NO FRIDGE as promised. They told me that would be 15 dollars a day!!! And....as others have stated I was also told over the phone several times, a wheel chair would be waiting at no cost to us..We get there, and are told 20 dollars a day for a wheel chair...Which I cannot believe the hotel does not own the wheel chairs, and another company does!!!! What is this world coming too?? and that it would be 25 dollars a day to use the GYM!!!! What did we pay the 155 a night for....oh ya, to sleep a few hours and to take a shower!!! The staff was rude, when ever I tried to take care of a problem. The rooms were clean, and the view on the 28th floor was amazing...The air did not work all that great. So, would I ever stay at the Paris hotel again??? Hummm, not a fat chance!!!! I will spend my hard earned money, on another hotel that will appreciate my business. and Also understand, that if it was not for us coming to Las Vegas in the first place...Paris would not even be in business!!!!

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A LOUSY EXPERIENCE!!”
Reviews.Author: trew11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Paris Las Vegas on the July 4th long weekend. Booked the hotel because of its great location and good price on Expedia. The hotel was ok but the staff was rude and surprisingly unknowlegeable. They must hate their jobs because'they definitely did not try to please. I won't go into details but my wife and I checked out after 3 days and move to another Harrah's property -- Bill's Gamblin Hall -- and had a totally different experience.there because the staff was SUPER FRIENDLY AND ACCOMODATING, unlike at Paris. No comparison as far as the hotel and the rooms are concerned, but my wife and I enjoyed our stay there immensely. My wife wants to contact the CEO of Harrah's, Gary Loveman, to tell him about our incredibly BAD experience at Paris and how much better the less glitzy Bill's Gamblin Hall was. Something is terribly wrong at Paris and it shows in their treatment of their guests. Judging by other reviews of this hotel, I expect a major housecleaning at this property in the near future.
