Reviews.Title: “Paris, Las Vegas does not cater to persons with disabilities”
Reviews.Author: beachlady808
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the 'Paris' this past week...we requested an 'accessible' room nearby the elevators....after we checked in with the impassive, unfriendly desk clerk, we headed to our room......our room was as far away from the elevator as possible. the room hadn't been 'prepped' before we came....there was dirty underwear and socks in one of the drawers, the toilet was backed up, and as we were unpacking, someone barely knocked on the door and walked in ....she apologized and said she thought we had checked out (?). the hotel is all about raking money in at the slots.....there aren't any benches or seats available to sit down except at the slots or tables. however, we found this at the wyn, venetian, and mirage also, so bottom line, if you're handicapped in any way, find someplace else to vacation. vegas was a sincere disappointment. the drinking water is yellowish in color, and smells, so we purchased all the water we drank to the tune of almost $4 for a 20 ounce bottle.....meals are expensive....a modest breakfast at the paris runs about $20 per person.......they have buffets, but lines are long. we were surprised there wasn't any complementary coffee in our room.....like I said, its all about making money at the slots. there was a 'dueling piano bar' in the hotel, but each night we went to hear the music and nobody was playing....lounge in casino was empty......very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Paris was... Fair”
Reviews.Author: Goose99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on a Tues-Fri in July. The hotel is a prime location, middle of the strip and a short walk to basically everywhere. The decor in the lobby/casino is beautiful and does look like a Parisian street. The casino is laid out well with lots of table games. The sportsbook is a little lacking, fewer screens then other hotels, but still provides a good service. The room was average. Certainly nothing special. We were upgraded from a Red room luxury to a premium guest room. The room is small, but provided enough room for my wife and I. The bathroom was clean and the separate tub and shower is a plus. There was just enough closet space for a 3 night stay (might be tough if you are staying longer). The view was spectacular -- 29th floor, looking out at the Eiffel tower and direct view of the fountains at the Bellagio. The hotel has a lot of shops and restaurants (separate reviews). Room service was lacking, we called for a late night snack and was told it would be at least 1 hour to be served, which to me is ridiculous for such a resort. Maintenance was needed once, as there was only luke warm water in the shower and tub the morning after we checked in (hot the night prior), they were at the room within 15 minutes of being called and took care of the problem, whatever it was. Overall its a good hotel, small rooms, great location, helpful staff. Would recommend it if you can get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TurinaY
Reviews.Content: Many hotels in Vegas are very highly recommended...However, the hotel we sayed at "Paris" was not only affordable, but also 5star rated. The inside of the hotel as pictured, has an outdoor appearance with shops and street lights, high sky painted ceilings and designed after Paris, France.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Service in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: wildchild64
Reviews.Content: We booked a package deal air and hotel stay for 4 nights. Thought The Paris was an upscale hotel. I have gambled here before but never stayed. After a long day of flying and flight delay, we finally arrived at Paris for check in. Was told they were sold out and no rooms were available. What the Hell, everything was prepaid. After about 45 minutes they finally had the manager find us a room. We had booked a Luxery room. If this was luxery I would hate to see a standard room. Upon arriving at the room, we had only 3 sets of towels. I called housekeeping for another set and an extra pillow. Delivered the towels, out of pillows. This went on every day, 4 people on reservation only 3 sets of towels and no pillows. I guess one person was not supposed to shower. Left note for maid and even talked to her personally. No results. Had to track down maid one morning for a roll of toilet tissue. Evidently guests don't use bathrooms in rooms. Room was never totally cleaned, Glasses, shampoo and soap not relpaced. Waste baskets not emptied. At least the beds were made. Buffet was excellent except for bird flying around one morning. When I told the staff about it , it was like no big deal. Maybe they like bird droppings on there food. I DON'T. Gambling area is great and casino staff totally great, unlike hotel staff. I'm not a first timer to Vegas. This was my 42nd trip there. Have stayed at many of the casino hotels, old and new and have never been treated with such disrespect. For an upscale hotel, the lack of service totally takes away my desire to ever stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: DanaK2
Reviews.Content: Clean, affordable, very cool theme, lot's of good food, cute gift shop, access to the Eiffel Tower from the lobby (elevator ride to the top), safe in every room, nice tv. Room service is super overpriced but anywhere is so keep that in mind. Also it's pretty much in the middle of the strip so easy access to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Darren_on_business
Reviews.Content: The title says it all really. This Hotel was nothing more than Average for Vegas. The staff was mixed between being pleasant and those who seemed disappointed with their lot. The Rooms themselves, while clean, were merely functional and certainly nothing special for the price we payed. The food within the place was simply so-so and the drinks were quite expensive. Obviously the location was good, but the same can be said for any of the main hotels on the strip. Basically I've been a couple of times to various Hotels within Vegas now and generally my friends and I have spent a large amount time actually at whatever hotel it was that we were staying in. The Paris was the first Hotel were we spent the vast majority of our time outside actually outside the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Paris”
Reviews.Author: shelljo
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas to surprise my Dad who lives there. Was comped all three nights at any of Harrah's hotels. Picked the Paris and glad we did! Room was pretty, clean, plenty of towels, soap, shampoo, etc. They asked if I wanted to upgrade but I declined, noone got an attitude like some of the reviews say. Any staff we spoke to was helpful and courteous. Definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: dwife921
Reviews.Content: To all you vegas travelers, who are reluctant, to book this gorgeous hotel, HAVE NO FEAR! After reading some of the reviews on here, And a few other sites, I almost was ready to change my reservation. From check-in to check-out, Paris was an incredible week! I was in some pain ,with a bad back, and, was able to rent a scooter, to get around. the staff at this hotel are extrordinary. We were upgraded at check-in, to a suite, A wonderful check-in girl! Always offer , no matter where you stay, a tip between your licenseand credit card, it really shows them , your appreciation. Room was spectacular, as well as restaurants, cocktail, waitresses, well, you name it...Just plain Fantastic! We will not hesitate to return to this Beauty again. Give the Paris a try, and, you will be rewarded. Also, harrahs has the best ever Players card. Hint!!! always ask for a casino host...They are the best!

Reviews.Title: “We are so glad we stayed here at Paris.”
Reviews.Author: PortCityPirate
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay, clean and comfortable room. Our room was a deluxe room it had a view of the mountains. They room was in very good condition, very well decorated and furnished. The bed was very comfortable our room had a King. We did get a chance to see a Dbl room and we really liked the way it looked too. Overall it was great, we enjoyed the resort Casino and would recommend staying here. This was our first trip to vegas and we were so happy with the location it is right in the heart of the strip. Easy to walk to all the big resorts. Free valet parking was great. We will stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “On Par with other Similar Hotels in the Area - Great Restaraunts”
Reviews.Author: Arctic-R6
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at several Vegas strip hotels and this is definitely on par with the rest of the similar 4-star+ hotels in the area. We did like the French theme, casino, eateries, pool etc. Staff was average on the friendliness level. Pool waitresses were awesome! The Mon Ami Gabi restaurant was fantastic, a must. Eifel Tower Restaurant was great, but pricey. You are paying for the view, which is hands down the best on the strip overlooking the Bellagio fountains. Rooms were nice, clean. Elevators plentiful and fast, unlike some other hotels we’ve experienced. The only bad thing was parking. Valet was often full and very slow compared to others we’ve stayed in. Self parking is a long walk to the room elevators, especially with luggage. All in all we were very happy with our stay there and would go again.

Reviews.Title: “When we checked in I mentioned to the...”
Reviews.Author: Mark107
Reviews.Content: When we checked in I mentioned to the desk clerk we were celebrating a special occassion. She excused herself for a few minutes and came back with an incredible complimentary upgrade to the 31st floor - and it made our stay so enjoyable. I was a little nervous about staying here once I read the reviews --- but the front desk staff was courteous and our stay in Paris was fantastic. From the food to the location on the Strip - you can't beat this hotel! And the pool - where else can you swim at the base of THE Tower? The gardens were beautiful and the location of the 2 spa tubs --- well you'll just have to go and find them for yourselves! Thank you Paris staff for a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Totally amazing.”
Reviews.Author: johnjohnHull
Reviews.Content: Short and sweet. All of it from start to finish was amazing. Stayed for 2 weeks and did not want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel... BY FAR!”
Reviews.Author: RuralKsGirl
Reviews.Content: Offered a free room upgrade upon check-in, which we gladly accepted. The room was HUGE, with 2 marble bathrooms, separate bedroom, dining & living areas. VERY impressive! Hotel staff was very pleasant to deal with, and room service was surprisingly fast. The champagne buffet was amazing... HUGE! It was quite a long wait (hour and a half) but VERY well worth the wait! The Paris' centralized location made it easy to walk the Strip, and if you're lucky enough to get a view of the Bellagio fountains, it's quite romantic to sit in your room in the dark, sip champagne, and watch the fountain show. Our stay at the Paris was my husband's first trip to Vegas, so any other hotel is going to have a lot to live up to with him. We've stayed now at the Paris twice, both times of which we were very impressed and pleased with the service and quality of rooms. We will DEFINITELY stay at the Paris again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TexasRagingBull
Reviews.Content: Visited this Hotel from 7-18-7-21-10 and it was amazing. Long line at check in but moved fast. We were upgraded to Red Room. Hotel was extremely crowded for sunday-wed visit. Hotel has everything you could want. Room was clean and had seperate tub and shower. Casino was busy with lots of good entertainment such as live band playing in casino and entertaining crowd at Napolean's piano bar. We ate breakfast and dinner at buffet and food was excellent. Staff was very helpful and pleasant to deal with. No complaints of any kind and would definitely recommend hotel to anyone. The location of Paris can not be beat in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “A good value on the strip”
Reviews.Author: boneyard
Reviews.Content: 1st stay at Paris Las Vegas, booked a $99 rate then upgraded at check in for $50 more to a suite, which was a great deal. The hotel is what you would expect on the strip. No real problems here other than if you enjoy airport security lines you'll love check in. Appeared to be the same at other hotels we saw. Employees we dealt with were all very friendly and helpful. I don't understand why the hotel did not offer free internet, but it does not. We did see "The Jersey Boys" and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_LisaB
Reviews.Content: Perfect location - within walking distance of just about everything. Beautiful decor and great service. The only negative would be the beds - very very uncomfortable. However everything else about my experience was nice enough to overshadow that small detail. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Magic”
Reviews.Author: SyntheticMilk
Reviews.Content: With a strip/Eiffel Tower view just shy of the Penthouse floor, it couldn't possibly have been a nicer room. We could see the pool, and the fountain at the Bellagio across the road, and although you knew when it was going off by the noise it made - it was never irritating, always a great reminder to look out the window (in case you needed one). The staff were great, the room was plush and the hotel facilities were what you would expect from a themed Vegas resort - fantastic. The only "issue" was having done a several hour haul from another state, we arrived at reception to find a line 50 people or so long to check in. Some seats in the lobby would have been nice for those minding bags instead of dragging them through the line, but it is difficult to know when you're going to need extra staff for these things. All in all, a top hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “No better than the far less expensive hotels nearby”
Reviews.Author: kelesp
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving to our room, we noticed an ice bucket on the floor outside our room with remnants of beer and limes... tacky enough, but then entered the room to find a used glass on top of the refrigerator, which also had the previous guest's cheese sticks still inside. In a rush to get to our scheduled show on time, I decided to address it with the staff when we returned. Upon returning, we also noticed that the soap in the bathroom was also from the previous guest, as was the half-used bottle of shower gel and shampoo that was in the shower. At this point, I notified the front desk. They transferred me to housekeeping. The lady was very friendly and offered to send someone to clean it right away. I said I would reather be moved to a clean room. She sent me back to the front desk and a move to a clean room was arranged. I was told a bell boy would come to our room with the new keys ASAP. This was after midnight. 20 minutes later I called the front desk because I had not yet gotten my new key. I was told it would be at leats 15 more minutes. By about 1:00 am he showed up wit the key and was very insistent on taking our bags to the new room for us (I'm sure expecting a tip) be we declined the offer. The new room was clean and a credit to our account was given for teh inconvenience. The beds were comfortable, but I will never stay there again. The nieghboring Bally's or Tropicana hotels are priced much lower and their location is every bit as central on the strip. In fact both have better pools, and the monorail to take you to the other end of the strip is at Bally's. The food at the Paris was mediocre at best - but that was our experience with most casino restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: charlie153
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Paris for 6 nights. Apon arrival at check in we asked if we could be upgraded to a Red Room and this was offered at no extra charge. Thanks Shaylee! The room was great, very clean with a very nice bathroom, separate tub and shower was great. Maid service was very prompt and did a great job. Beds were extemely comfortable. Had a problem with our tv the first day, but maitainence come within 5 minutes. Great service! One afternoon I was walking back to our room and I peeked into a suite that was being cleaned. Maid offered for me to come in and have a look. Very friendly. Slots were tight, but they were most places. Weather was great, very hot and very busy in Vegas in July. I find it strange people bring kids to Vegas, definately not a place for kids. Miracle Mile mall was very handy and so was the ABC store. Didn't dine at the hotel as the lines were long and there are so many other choices in Vegas. Had a great time and would definately recommend the Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great view at a great price.”
Reviews.Author: Tech-key-Guy
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a Paris in Las Vegas. First of all, the nice young lady give us an awesome room with view above the 16th floor over looking the pool and Bellagio. Did I mention "Awesome View"?. The Paris was really crowded. I had no problems with crowds, so be aware. Wouldn't want it to be dead. I love the super fast elevators. no more than a 5-10s wait). Bath rooms was very nice. House keeping service was fast. The ladies at Café Belle Madeleine was really nice. Nice shops and plenty of places to wander off. I have a few small compliants. Cons : ( 1. Small single stale restroom was dirty in the Buffet resturant for 200 people and had walk across to restroom in other resturants. 2. No free internet. 3. TV was not LCD Pros. Price per night was around $80. Free Parking, everywhere you go. In the middle of the strip and in good view of the free water fountain shows. : )

Reviews.Title: “WOULD NOT RECOMMEND”
Reviews.Author: GFB_10
Reviews.Content: We found this Hotel nice to look at from the outside but very poor service inside. I get the impression that this hotel is so busy and successful that they could not care less about individual service or one families,person or group needs. We found long line ups for everything within this hotel except the Mon Ami Gambi Restautent which is quite nice. Mangaments total disregard for our well being was obvoiusly displayed on a couple of occasions. They were rude,apathetic and generally did not care about indiviudal customers. Their motto....Next!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay...but”
Reviews.Author: Critter3
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night on a recent west coast road trip we did. This was our first time in Vegas so maybe this is the norm for Vegas but.....we had to wait in line for about 10-15 minutes for the valet. It seemed like there was only about 2 guys working the valet but lots of cars. And when we checked in it took about 15-20 minutes. There was a line up of about 120 people and only 3 people were serving the non-gold/platinum/diamond members. So it took a while to get through. Once we got to the desk it didn't take long though. And there was a lineup of about 150 people for the supper buffet at 9:30. I assume not everyone was staying at the hotel, so it would be nice if there was a separate line for guest entry or something. I noticed there was a separate entry for gold/diamond/platinum members. And to top it off we heard someone say it closes at 10:00 (but the manager can keep it open longer if she wants). We didn't feel like staying in line only to have it close so we went across the "street" and got a sandwich. But like I said, maybe that's the norm for Vegas?? Pros - The free valet parking was nice since we had paid for it the last few stops on our trip. The hotel is really nice and there is lots of elevators that are fast. There was plenty of restaurant choices. The grounds are awesome with the Eiffel Tower and Arc de Triomphe. The room was a good size and we had a decent view (upgraded at time of purchase). Although I noticed on the backside of the hotel people would have a terrible view, so be aware of that. The location is great for anyone wanting to experience the strip. We were in the P-room and I thought the value for the room was good considering the free valet. Cons - The big one for me was tipping and the valet/bellman. I noticed (with myself and other guests) that after they were tipped they would always look down at the amount you gave them. It was not professional at all and made me not want to tip them. Tipping is something that is earned not expected. Also, they use different bellman at your room and downstairs. Sorry, but I'm not going to tip $1 a bag to BOTH of them. Another head scratched for me was that the pool closed at 8:00pm! I thought this was Vegas?? I was looking forward to a late night drink and swim after a long hot day of walking the Strip, but I was shocked to find out it closed at 8:00. Not cool at all. Although the hotel was very nice, it was a bit too cramped. There was a small walkway around the casino area to get to the restaurants and elevators, but there was always so much people that it was too packed. Paris is suppose to be romantic, but it was much too crowded. All in all though, it was a good stay. I really wish we had more than 1 night so we could take advantage of some of the stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: KirkOut
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out, not one problem. Two minute wait at check in. Vary gracious clerk, whom had just been blasted by some jerk who could not speak English, gave us an upgrade room...beautiful, clean, no masked smokey smell whatsoever, on the 29th floor. We were here for relaxation and pool time, and that is exactly what we got...105 degrees, lots of room at the pool, very attentive waitresses at the pool. Lots of restaurants and coffee shops to choose from and if you can 't find something at Paris, Planet Hollywood and the Miracle Mile of shops and restaurants, or Bally's is only a few steps away. Paris is right in the middle of the strip it is a nice walk either north or south to cover the whole strip. The hotel has car rental service at the front desk. No hassel rental for our last day as we did not have a flight out of Las Vegas until 9 PM. Picked up the keys at the desk, express checked-out, and we were gone. This was the easiest, most relaxing time we have ever had in Las Vegas. We have been many times and have stayed on the strip and off the strip. We will be back to Paris Las Vegas, guaranteed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: genelary
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Paris, and I have to say the number one attraction is the location. Being in the middle of the strip, it offers you walking distance to most of the strip hotels. Check-in desk attendant was not overly friendly, after about a 10 minute wait in line. I don't tolerate smoke, and tend to notice it more in this casino than in others. The buffet line wait was 45 minutes for breakfast, and I noticed that every time we walked by there was a very long line. The breakfast buffet was very disappointing, after hearing good reports. Certainly not worth the price, and they seemed to be understaffed. The Anthony Cools experience was hilarious, and very adult rated! The rooms are well appointed and clean. A coffee pot would be great, like the ones you get at a hotel that costs half the price. Same for free internet. Although Paris is a great hotel, I think next time I will try something less expensive like neighboring Bally's or maybe Planet Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing... no payout at machines”
Reviews.Author: jonjoncapy
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were given a VIP treatment the moment we arrived in Las Vegas. The hotel was magnificent, room was exquisite, and the staff were always courteous and friendly. I'll definately go back again... but I don't know if I would play there again!

Reviews.Title: “Paris anyone?”
Reviews.Author: vancouvertraveller10
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, beautiful view of the Eiffel tower and Bellagio fountains. Friendly service and cheap upgrades (thanks to my sweetheart who slipped the receptionist a 20 for the 'red room')! There was great dining variety, cheap eats ($1 margaritas at & $3 breakfasts at the Tequila's bar), as well as high class dining and sports bars. Loved the quaint shops and euro vibe. Only downer was the pool- the earlier you go the better; by the end of the day there were floating cups, french fries, and hair... . I would opt for a dip in the ultra shallow bathtub before I’d swim there but other than that we enjoyed the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: delriocobras
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice and clean...that is it. Stayed four nights and was the worst experience I have ever had in Vegas. We vacation in Vegas at least twice a year and this has been the worst experience yet. We have stayed in numerous hotels on and off the strip over the last 20 years and this was by far the worse one yet. The machines were tight the food was terrible. The kicker was the staff...the staff (especially at the registration counter) was extremely rude. I had problems with getting our keys to work in the door and was never able to get it resolved. We would spend 20 to 30 minutes trying to get into our room. When we would confront the staff we were ignored and treated like Crap!. Again I will never stay at this Hotel again. Too much money spent to be treated this way!

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Location”
Reviews.Author: Kam2310
Reviews.Content: For Las Vegas I think location is the most important. This is right in the middle Buffet is very good Remember the wrist bands for the buffets are for 24 hours not 1 day. - Def. look into Casino is good I have also stayed at the MGM and New York New York and would reccommend MGM as the best , although this is nearly as good - New York is small but also good

Reviews.Title: “A Very Enjoyable Stay at Paris”
Reviews.Author: breanna501
Reviews.Content: For the past 5 years or more, I have been staying mainly at Venetian or Palazzo when in Vegas. On this trip I was travelling with a "newbie" so thought the Paris location would be an ideal home base due to it's central location. HET offered a special rate for my travelling companion for the second room, so we booked. After reading many of the reviews on TA, I contemplated cancelling our reservations, but took the chance and am happy I did. Many of the complaints on TA are centered on the front desk check-in. Our check-in experience was excellent. We arrived early, around 11:30 a.m., no line and the front desk was well staffed. We were greeted by a very friendly and helpful front desk agent Nicky. I upgraded my room to the concierge level and my travelling companion upgraded to a red room. Our experience at check-in was excellent. My room (3123) was dated, not one of the renovated rooms, but had a fantastic view of the strip, Eiffel tower and Bellagio fountains. It was conveniently located on the 31st floor where the concierge lounge is also located. The upgrade included breakfast offerings in the lounge from 8:00 a.m. until 11:00 a.m. and appetizers and drinks (beer, wine and spirits) from 5:00 p.m. until 8:00 p.m. All of the food was fresh and well presented, definitely worth the extra fee. The concierge in the lounge arranged for the hotel limo to pick us up at the Hard Rock after the Kenny Chesney concert on July 2nd and printed our boarding passes for the return flight. The lounge offers a nice little escape and relaxation away from the casino. Housekeeping service was prompt daily.....my room was always cleaned sometime after I left in the morning and before my return and at some point when I was out in the evenings I received nightly turn-down service with the chocolates which was was a nice touch. These rooms do need a renovation and I certainly hope they get one so that the rooms will do justice to that wonderful view! Each and every staff member we encountered during our stay was pleasant and helpful. When I asked any of the Casino floor staff a question, they were always pleasant and helpful. The cocktail servers on the Casino floor were always pleasant and the service was good. I did not encounter a single staff member at Paris who didn't make me feel as though my business was valuable to them. Because we used the lounge for breakfast daily, we only dined once at Paris at the buffet. It was good, but I prefer the Flavors Buffet at Harrahs, Spice Market at Planet Hollywood or Carnival World Buffet at The Rio. Our other dining was offsite. The Paris location can't be beat, very central. On arrival, we went to the ABC Stores next door at Planet Hollywood to stock up on water, beer, etc. From the Paris location, you are an easy walk to many other hotels and Casinos. The Paris Casino is easily navigated and you are quickly from your room to the strip. The pool area was spacious, sunny and you could always get a lounge chair. Often in the more upscale hotels, that can be difficult and the areas are often over-crowded. Our check-out experience was just as pleasant as our arrival and I have nothing but praise for the staff at Paris. To any contemplating a stay at Paris, Bon Voyage! I wouldn't hesitate to stay again, would definitely recommend the concierge level upgrade, but I would recommend a "red room" and would go that route on my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed all of our stay at the Paris”
Reviews.Author: a1valuesom
Reviews.Content: Had brilliant service at check-in. Arrived 3 hours before check-in was allowed, had a choice of room (no upgrade for free), such as King or 2 Queens. Room was spacious and very clean. No problem at all. Staff throughout the hotel were great, treated well at the pool, great location. Would definitely stay here again. Well done the Paris :-) P.S. We also stayed at the MGM, more than twice the nightly rate - spend 90 mins for check-in and room was maybe just as good as the Paris, staff were not as friendly and the Pool was not big enough for the size of hotel. Could not get a sunbed a lot of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Par for the Course for Vegas, but I'd stay again”
Reviews.Author: Caseyamcl
Reviews.Content: I was very happy that we got a nice room with a view of the Bellagio Fountain when we checked into Paris. I would stay here again, but there is nothing too special compared to all of the other hotels on the Strip. The rooms are all decked out about the same. You can't beat the location, and the restaurants downstairs are all excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mustangchick2
Reviews.Content: Things started off great from the beginning. We arrived early (11:00 a.m.) and expected to pre-register. We were pleasantly surprised to get in the room right away. The rooms were clean, quiet, comfortable, and the ac worked great. The pool water was cool, and there were plenty of clean towels and chairs. The hotel is centrally located and within easy walking distance of everything on the Strip. The restaurants were pricey but comparable to other Vegas hotels. The staff was very friendly, and the long line at check in/out went very quickly. The only criticism I have is the $15 charge for internet and the $25 charge to use the fitness center. We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: gmon
Reviews.Content: I went to Vegas during the week so I didn't encounter any of the check - in problems that some of the previous reviewers had. The rooms are nice but the room I had only had a view of Planet Hollywood next door. House keeping was excellent as I was out of the room by 09:00 each morning. It was a hot week. The temperature averaged about 108, so even at the pool, it was hot. The only place I ate at in the hotel was the buffet. Nothing to write home about and I believe it was $24.00. My other meals at other restaurants were worth the money. Best thing about the hotel, location. You can walk to the other big hotels and watch the bellagio fountain show when they are on. I caught the bus to the outlets, which is nice because last year, you had to take the bus to downtown, then transfer to another bus to take you to the outlet center. Bus fare one way is $3.00, or you can buy a 24 hour pass for $7.00. Hint, if you take the bus to the outlets, go before 2:00 pm otherwise the buses get pretty full. From my stay, I would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Barbzal
Reviews.Content: We checked in on a Monday afternoon, so the line was not that bad. Keep in mind reviews that say they waited in line forever to check in, it is usually is on a weekend. The hotel is very nice, but a tad expensive, but is not everything in Las Vegas. We did not have the picturesque view from our window, but we did not stay in our room a lot. The Village Buffet had quite a big selection, but I did not get the French cuisine part, maybe the crepes were the only French food. Just keep in mind the deal they have with the 7 buffets for 24 hrs is only for 1 person, you cannot buy 1 bracelet and share it. We made that mistake. Honestly what 1 person can eat 7 meals in 24hrs. There are plenty of good restaurants near and have great prices, so look around before committing to the buffets. The location of the hotel is great. You can walk to The Venetian or MGM Grand if you can stand the 108 degree Temperature outside during the day. Taking the Deuce Gold line bus line can get you from one end of the strip to the other. A 24hr pass is $7.00 per person and the north bound stop is right in front of the hotel. Beware the buses can get VERY crowded after 5:00 pm. All in all it is a great hotel and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Paulista05
Reviews.Content: I really do recommend this hotel. Great room, amazing place with big cassinos inside.

Reviews.Title: “Lock Your Valuables”
Reviews.Author: ogottogo11
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at many Harrah's properties (and others); however this is the first time an item went missing from our room. We filed a report with Security, However their response is to ignore you. We live in Vegas so it should not be tough. We have a high deductible on our homeowners insurance - so we are just out. Nothing was ever offered to make thing right for us. It turnrd out to be an expensive "Free Weekend". We are Diamond Players and this has left us with bad feeling towards their management and we plan taking our gaming dollars elsewhere. Additionally the Hotel is designed with a "V" shape facing the Bellagio fountain. This is a great view, however many times the LVPD run their sirens all night. We could not get to sleep until 4 AM when it finally quieted down. The back sid eof the hotel without a strip view should be much better if you like to sleep. Harrahs has also offered the one price for 24 HRs of Buffet for one (really good) price. The downside is I've noticed very lomg lines - that may make this offer not as appealing as it sounds. Beware of Weekends and Holidays. You could possibly eat several times during you 24HR ticket; however you could spend hours and hours in line.

Reviews.Title: “26th wedding anniversary”
Reviews.Author: SandraB254
Reviews.Content: The Paris is a great place to stay, the location on the strip is perfect, the hotel staff is so friendly and helpful. The rates are one of a kind and the view is spectacular. Best hotel on the strip for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Bad front desk and stinky bathroom”
Reviews.Author: MistyD
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel on June 27th 2010. When I got to the hotel to check in the lines was curved around the corner and only four clerks working and it was at least 100 people in line. I booked my package on LAS VEGAS .COM and that was a mistake I won't do again. The front desk lady put us in a room with a great view but the bathroom smelled like booboo when you turned on the water, or flushed the toilet. I called got a different room that was not not cleaned and the view sucked. Bree who works for the Paris hotel was who I spoke with got smart and was very nasty about the room. I will not recommend the paris to nobody. I take a trip to Vegas every year but i will not stay at the Paris and I will tell all my family and friends how bad the service was. What happen to good customer service you guys sucked.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is not worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: tashan7
Reviews.Content: The hotel is grand and expensive but it is only good for gamblers. The pool is just alright and built for the namesake. They charge you for everything possible and it never feels like in a 4-5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Front Desk People Ever Encountered”
Reviews.Author: cookie36
Reviews.Content: If I could give service a negative rating, I would. Arriving in the mid-afternoon, patiently stood in the long line for check-in. Had read bad reviews so I was determined to be pleasant. The woman who checked me in asked if I planned to charge anything to my room, I said maybe a phone call home, she then went on & on about a previous customer who had $150.00 in phone charges he didn't agree with, she said she had a big fight with him and she told him "not my problem",She said 'you'll be charged even if you pick up the receiver' which made me very leary to use the phone. I asked if my room might have a view, she said "no maam, you have to pay for that" (I had booked through Expedia) I was tired and realized when I got to my room, she hadn't given me info on the buffet that was supposed to be included. I tried talking to a concierge guy, I got a vague answer and he shrugged his shoulders, I then got back in the long line, this front desk person actually walked away on me when I questioned what my understanding of the reservation said regarding buffets and she left me standing there. No I would not recommend this hotel as these are the first people you see upon arrival and it can set the tone for the stay. There were no pleasant comments like welcome or enjoy you stay. I'm sure their not all that unpleasant, but I didn't encounter any pleasant front desk staff. The one bright star was the fellow who guides you onto the shuttle or taxi's outside, he was extremely friendly & helpful. Room was okay, quiet and the temperature for sleeping was perfect for the room but the 2 thin sheets they put on your bed are lacking, the 'throws' are useless, we asked for an extra blanket, but I was still chilly. It is an extremely busy hotel, the crowd intensifies as the day progresses. If I was to go to Las Vegas again I would opt for one of the older hotels as they were quieter and they had people just standing there waiting to direct us or answer any questions when we visited, very pleasant. The buffet was very good, great variety. Pool area is nice but very open, no shade. Tip - Mono-rail is great, little hard to find but not busy Didn't have much luck with the bus system (Bell), we bought a 24 hour pass, but it was so full, it didn't stop and we were forced to walk if we didn't want to miss our 4 pm show. Fremont street was worth the trip, beautifully lit up at night.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't get an updated room. The hotel...”
Reviews.Author: mattgid
Reviews.Content: I didn't get an updated room. The hotel is made for couples and families. It is slower and less active comapred to ph or bellagio or casears. Excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Well located on the strip. Room mattress...”
Reviews.Author: Lifetravel
Reviews.Content: Well located on the strip. Room mattress was poor quality. Pool area was full sun, no shade available during the day except for expensive cabana. Avoid taking taxi from hotel due to poor traffic flow after 2pm. At checkout they wanted to hit me with room upgrade charge. Make sure you sign everything at checkin and ask for a copy. Front desk was rude and aggressive at checkout.

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SoumyaM
Reviews.Content: Gamble and enjoy your stay. Located in the souther strip with Bellagio, Ceasar Palace, Bally's and Planet Hollywood being neighbours you will have a sure shot at entertainment

Reviews.Title: “Great Hote, Great location on the strip”
Reviews.Author: travlr247
Reviews.Content: Pool was nice, spacious , not like other hotels where the chairs are on top of eachother. Buffet lines were LONG.... food was ok, not extraordinary. Location is perfect, short walk to Ceasars, planet hollywood and other great hotels, casinos. We rented the cabana and for 200.00 (mid-week price) We got a nice snack basket, sunscreen, unlimited sodas, waters and juices, 2 rafts, TV, music, waitress and those misters that kept us cool the whole day! I would recommend this hotel and would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location & View, Few Issues”
Reviews.Author: southwest2010
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vegas. We wanted to be in the middle of the strip so we selected the Paris. It was a great location for our 2 night stay. We arrived at the airport early so we called Paris to see if we could check in. The rep on the phone immediately tried to upgrade us for addt'l $55/night, we declined. She did say rooms were ready but none with any view (unless we upgraded). When we arrived at the hotel, it was not clear we could unload our bags at the front entrance so we went to the parking garage. After dragging our bags through the hotel to check in, we were greeted by a friendly, smiling desk agent. She gave us our key but I wasn't expecting much after the earlier call. When we got to our room, it was on the 7th floor, overlooking the pool, Eiffel tower and we could see a portion of the Bellagio fountains, it was great! The room didn't easily accommodate all of our luggage for the four of us but we were packed for a 10 day trip. The one meal we ate in the hotel was good and reasonably priced at the Cafe St Louis. We aren't gamblers but enjoyed walking through the lobby (except for the cigarettes).

Reviews.Title: “Paris Las Vegas...Average”
Reviews.Author: JAM2813
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Paris Las Vegas for a four night stay. We arrived early and had no wait time in line. However, when I inquired about a "complimentary upgrade", there was none available unless I wanted to pay an additional $40 per night. I tried the ol' $20 between the license and credit card but didn't work! I did give the casino host a sad story and ended up with the free upgrade anyway. The rooms at Paris were very clean and always stocked efficiently, however, I was glad we didn't pay for the upgrade as the Red Rooms were just "average" compared to like Planet Hollywoods upgrade. Location was the best as it is pretty much center strip. Lines were slow, extremely long at the Buffet and service just ok. Food was very good but the breakfast at PH was much better. The hotel was easy to navigate through without getting lost. Great pool w/ lots of chairs. Lots of nice shopping and pastries were great! I would recommend this hotel but there was nothing spectacular to draw us back.

Reviews.Title: “J'aime Paris!”
Reviews.Author: star_travel_girl
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vegas and I must say that the Paris Las Vegas Hotel met my expectations and then exceeded them! Upon check in we were notified that we were eligible for a free upgrade to the "red rooms". This was wonderful news to us and we graciously accepted. Although the rooms were on the smoking floor, and we are non-smokers, this did not impact our decision as the rooms were clean and did not reek of smoke. The rooms: Absolutely beautiful rooms with the most comfortable bed! Everything was so clean and the housekeeping service was fantastic. Room service: The room service was a little bit pricey. I did not appreciate having to pay $4.00 for a soda but the food itself was great. The room service took roughly 20-35 minutes depending on when you place your order. We were disappointed to have cold eggs for breakfast but all dinner was delicious. Overall atmosphere of hotel: What a terrific atmosphere. Walking through the lobby and around the casino to the different restaurants, one can easily forget where they are and imagine themselves in Paris, France. The cafe has a lovely terrace which overlooks the casinos. The lobby has beautiful chandeliers and overall thoroughly impressed with the hotel. Location: The location of Paris is perfect! It is really central on the strip which is nice because most things are a walking distance from the hotel. If not, the valet service outside helps you get a cab and send you on your way. MAKE SURE you specify where you are going because we were taken to the wrong place once. Paris is very near the Planet Hollywood mall which has wonderful shopping and great eateries. Pool/Weather: DRY HEAT! I don't think I need to say more. Escaping the humidity that we get in Toronto was amazing. Great weather. Don't forget to pack your sunblock if you're swimming and laying out by the pool though because you will be scorched. The pool is beautiful and has the "Eiffel Tower" right there. It's a great view and perfect place to tan. If you want to order a drink by the pool be warned that they might forget about you...I was forgotten about. But the pool was so beautiful that it didn't bother me. Nightlife: The night life in Vegas is great! We are in our 20s so we went out to the nightclubs. We went to Tao in the Venetian and XS at the Wynn. Both are recommended. Be prepared to pay highish covers (10-30 depending). Try to get your concierge to put you on guest list.

Reviews.Title: “How long before Willard takes up residence?”
Reviews.Author: Dissenter
Reviews.Content: I have praised this hotel previously as being eminently serviceable -- on balance, the best of Harrah's properties in Vegas -- but must emend my remarks accordingly. When I moved into my room, a room service tray with a disgusting black substance in a bowl was lying in the hallway -- no immediate problem. When I left two days later, the same tray was still lying in the hallway, despite my complaints to four separate persons. One of the employees explained that staffing cuts were to blame. Harrah's was taken over by a private concern, which appears to know nothing about running a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fab -lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: C_Sutty
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Las Vegas and this was a great place to spend it - unavoidably our arrival coincided with American Memorial Weekend so we paid over the odds but I think it was worth it to stay somewhere nice. The room was huge, the bathroom was huge and the bed comfy. Check-in was quick and easy. The whole atmosphere of the hotel and its casino was more calm and uncrowded than many of the others we looked at during our stay (Caesar's Palace was packed to the rafters, and others were tatty and smelly!). We didn't get to eat where we wanted as the place was so busy but we ate in Le Provencal restaurant in the Paris - whilst there was resticted choice the food itself was lovely and the cost of the set menu (including a glass of wine) was fine. I thought it was brilliant. I would love to visit Las Vegas again (maybe mid-week and definitely not on a holiday weekend!) and would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hmm... expected more.”
Reviews.Author: Phatony1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paris for my final two days of my trip. I had stayed at the Palazzo the other days. The good part about this hotel is the nice pool area right next to the Eiffel Tower and interior design of the shops. I mean it's not excellent, probably because it's not a brand new hotel. I was able to check out the pool at night which is cool. The music from the Bellagio while the waterworks go off was actually kind of nice. I can hear it from my room but I enjoyed it. The room itself was kind of disappointing compared to the Pallazzo, but I paid much less for Paris. The TV was old school and the room in general seemed worn. I didn't like their gambling options. I prefer going to another hotels poker room. I think it's worth it to spend a little more and stay somewhere nicer. Everything here just seems older...

Reviews.Title: “Great Room - Wonderful View!”
Reviews.Author: huntress-on-tour
Reviews.Content: Again, a lovely stay in Las Vegas. The Paris Las Vegas hotel is ideally situated if you want to be near the mid-strip excitement! We booked a luxury room but upgraded on arrival to a Red Room Premier (strip-view). It was beautiful! The room was very big, the bathroom was big and luxurious. The mini-bar had a shelf in it you could use for your own use, without charge. Perfect if you need a cool drink during the night! The room was cleaned to a high standard every day. Front desk staff were nice, but honestly could do with a little more customer service training. Compared to the staff at MGM Grand, they weren't as accommodating. Brilliant place to eat is Le Burger Brassier, which is between Paris and Ballies. It's a sports bar and it serves great food! Service is very quick and staff are very friendly. The buffet was very good too in Paris Hotel, but a little expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A Totally Wonderful Holiday Experience”
Reviews.Author: BluebellEssex
Reviews.Content: We stayed on 18th floor and it was a lovely size with 2 queen size beds and was very quiet. The beds were so comfortable and the rooms spotless with towels changed every day. Everyone was so helpful and any query we had the staff dealt with immediately. The hotel is in the middle of the strip so easily accessable to all amenties. The food in the hotel at the various restuarants were all excellent. Our favourite was the one at the front of the hotel, that had an outside seating to have breakfast and watch the world go by. We would highly recommend this hotel and have nothing but praise for it.

Reviews.Title: “Picky about hotel rooms”
Reviews.Author: cindyw56
Reviews.Content: I am very picky about my hotel room. It was clean but when we got there to tub was not. We called downstairs and they came right up to clean it. We bought the $34 buffet which you can eat at 24 hours. It is a good deal. The breakfast was excellent and lunch and dinner was okay but I have had better. There is a great pizza and sandwich shop across from the buffet. The sandwiches are huge and only $8 you can split it with someone and still have plenty of food. The lines were pretty long but I am a diamond member so I didn't have to stand in line. Also, right outside buffet there is a window where you can get a bloodymary for $5 and they are outstanding. The machine didn't seem to pay off very well but could have just been my luck. The table were okay but I was playing on a table that was $5 so it was $20 a hand. The pit boss came over and raised it to $10 so now it is $40 a hand. It was Wednesday night at midnight there were four players. I asked that they not raise it but they did any way. We all left and they closed it. Later in the night I asked that a table be lowered to $5 and they did it but when I asked the next night they wouldn't do it. So, I guess it is dependent on something that I am unaware of or it could be just who is on duty that night. The hotel staff were very friendly and always willing to help. Our room was on the 27th floor and had a view of the mountain not the tower but was still very nice. I love the elevators because they went from casino to the 26th floor so there was never any waiting. The pool was very nice nothing fancy but big and there were always chairs. It is a good place to read and relax but it was not a party zone if that is what you are looking for. The lines for check in and check out were long but I am unsure why anyone would stand in line to check out when they can do it from their room. I will be back to this hotel is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice theme hotel, but something is missing.”
Reviews.Author: OttawaCat314
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice, the staff is great. But something is missing...luxury. In Las Vegas, I usually full out splurge on hotels. I was expecting the same kind of treatment I get at Bellagio or Wynn. Normally, in any other city, this hotel would be spectacular, but in Las Vegas, I found it a bit lacking, I guess we're supposed to be wowed by the French theme, which I was, but it lacks the extra touch of class I like to see. The indoor "city" of Paris with the skybox was amazing, the bakery is to die for, the buffet...OH the buffet is also to die for! But the service and rooms are just above average. They're great, but for someone like me who visits Vegas often, I just think it could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Just like Paris I would imagine”
Reviews.Author: WWwalker
Reviews.Content: check in took 40 minutes. Didn't have enough people working. Gave you a long speech about all the charges. Didn't have a king size bed luckily they were two queens and not full. Felt like France since there was smoking everywhere (other hotels had areas that were smoke free, couldn't find one here). Rooms, casino and restaurants were very nice except one really bad breakfast service where we got comped and there was small areas of peeling wall paper.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed this property”
Reviews.Author: TopekaDucky
Reviews.Content: Paris is in a great location on the Vegas strip, and we found our room to be perfect for our needs. We were in standard room with the blue decor, but it was clean and didn't find a thing wrong with the carpet, bathroom, bed, hairdryer, TV, etc. We were on the 11th floor and overlooked the pool area, and we had a full view of the Eiffel Tower (we were directly across and level with the Eiffel Tower Restaurant). One item that pleased both of us was the excellent water pressure in the shower and the sink (we never used the tub)! We had a surprise 60th birthday party planned at Mon Ami and received wonderful attention and excellent service from the staff. We had breakfast at the buffet and liked the coffee but loved the crepe station. It is convenient to be able to cut from Paris to Bally's through the back hallway, and we parked in the garage so also pleased that we could go to either casino when we entered the building. We did find out after we parked that we could have used valet, and the bellstaff would have delivered our luggage to our room. We would definately stay here again and found the standard room was fine for us.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: brynnd
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Paris June 6 - 9, and had a wonderful trip. I have been to Vegas a handful of times and have stayed at other properties bu this was my first time staying at Paris. I chose it because I had been up the Eiffel tower and gambled in the casino on a previous trip and I loved the she-she decor =). I booked my trip (package deal - Allegiant Air, Bellingham - NEVER AGAIN!!) and then read some traveller reviews of Paris and I was a little nervous prior to my stay after going through them. After my trip I can honestly say that everything was five star and I had nothing to worry about. My room (petite suite) was beautiful, modern (not run down at all!), the bathrooms were sparkling clean and large, and the room was made up nicely every day before I even made it back from the shops. The view was nothing spectacular but really? I can't even imagine sitting in my room in Vegas! Every staff member I encountered in the hotel (front desk, housekeeping, cocktail waitresses, sports book...) were courteous and helpful, and the pool bartenders were downright fun! The pool itself was maybe a little boring but it was quiet and I was able to sunbathe in peace and cool off when I wanted to without fighting through a drunk pack of people to do so. Lastly, some people have commented on poor cocktail service. I wonder if they were tipping? When I was playing in Paris I was being offered another drink before I even had time to finish the one I was working on. All in all I had a wonderful time and would absolutely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: queentasingtao
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris Hotel. The hotel is beautiful to look at. The staff seemed very nice and professional. The room was another story. When you first walk in you think it is beautiful. The clean towels smelled as soon as the water hits them. There is no microwave, no complimentary coffee pots or anything. The refrigerator has loads of things to buy. We found out that the refrigerator can be locked from the front dest. It keeps track of everything that is removed from it and it is charged to your bill, so be careful of what you take. They have it set up where you have to go downstairs to spend spend spend. Not even the water is free, unless you are buying a meal. Everytime we went to get something to eat, we found that the lines were long long long. It was quicker for us to go back to the room and order room service. We got our food under 30 minutes and no standing in lines. We enjoyed ordering breakfast every morning. Ahh the peace and quiet. We found the main hallways to be like a jungle, so wear shoes that you can manuver on cobblestone floors. It seemed a bit wild! But we laughed and made the best of it. We brought our exercise clothes and never used them. You have to pay to use the facilities. The hotel says that it is owned by someone else. You have to pay at least $25-$30 bucks per person, per visit. Unless you can afford it, walk around the hotel. Unless you gamble, drink, shop, or a big eater, there's not much to do but spend money. Remember, nothing is free there. You pay for EVERYTHING. On our last night we did enjoy the Eiffle Tower Restaurant. That was the icing on the cake as the best part of the trip and the view was spectacular. I found that some of the tourist were rude. My husband is white and I am black, and some had a few words to throw our way. We just ignored them. We just figured they were ignorant, and we still had a beautiful blessed day!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent hotel. Period.”
Reviews.Author: solara08
Reviews.Content: The hotel desk upgraded our room (at no charge) to one that had a view of the Eiffel tower, Bellagio, and the Las Vegas strip. We were advised that the room was recently renovated. The room was on the 29th floor and the view from the room was breathtaking. We visited 75% of the casino hotels on the strip during our trip and the Paris Hotel was easily one of the nicest. The location is the best on the strip being in the middle of the strip and direct monorail access.

Reviews.Title: “"What a View!!!!"”
Reviews.Author: HenryW
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Paris Las Vegas at the beginning of June, and found the hotel unusually hospitable for such a big property. From the check-in agent who patiently worked to resolve a small problem, to the servers in the Le Village Buffet, to the lifeguards at the pool who found some strip bandages right-away when I skinned my knee, the staff were all considerate, attentive, and friendly. Our "Red Room" on the 16'th floor had a great view of the pool, the Eiffel Tower, and the Bellagio's fountains across the street. We worried about noise the first night, but the pool closes early and the loudest distraction we heard was the music that accompanied the Bellagio's fountain show. It was pleasant, though, and it stopped at midnight. We enjoyed our package that included unlimited buffet dining at all Harrah's properties. Breakfast at Le Village Buffet was exceptional, with custom crepes and omelets, and fresh fruit that was ripe and flavorful. We enjoyed dinner there as well, though, like others, we would have liked to see more authentic French dishes. We especially enjoyed the buffet next door at Planet Hollywood - the Spice Market Buffet. We thought the Mediterranean station's lamb kabobs were wonderful, and the tabboulleh, hummos, and olives were equal to our favorite Middle Eastern restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: HillaryLethbridge
Reviews.Content: We booked the paris and then upgated for $50/night in order to be closer to the other couple we stayed with. Our room was 820 P and it was pretty big and nice. We had a king sized bed, fridge, coffee maker, living room area, big closed and a whirlpool tub, which was nice after the long days of walking. The swimming pool was nice, but I preferred the look of the Bally's pool with palm trees and music. The hotel was pretty easy to navigate and was a nice central location on the strip. I was really excited to eat at the paris buffet, so we purchased the package for $37 for unlimited 24 hour buffet. The first buffet we ate at was planet hollywood; it was amazing and all 4 of us loved it. The next day we ate at the paris and I was disapointed, compared to the planet hollywood buffet, and would not eat there again. The breakfast buffet at the paris was average. I would stay at the Paris again but would maybe book another hotel just to be different if we found a good deal

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but won't return”
Reviews.Author: ogrkkco
Reviews.Content: My opinion about the Paris is conflicted. Some of the staff such as the house-cleaning staff were awesome! Service at the tables and all of the black jack dealers were great. However, this casino is VERY short staffed on cocktail service. We sat at a machine for an hour and half and never seen a cocktail server. We asked four other staff members how we could get a drink. This was on a Tuesday night! Same story at the pool, one day we had a great server, the next day we couldn't get a drink at the pool. When the server finally arrived she had an attitude. This was on a Wednesday. The buffet at the Paris is not at all impressive. The rooms are pretty normal but great mattress and quiet room. Due to poor service, mediocre food, and unimpressive pool, we won't return. However, it is a very clean property and you will sleep well there.

Reviews.Title: “What a MISTAKE!!”
Reviews.Author: OldNo.7
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Paris June 01, 2010 - June 05, 2010. It is not the worst hotel we stayed at but it was not far from it. The staff there is as rude as we have EVER experienced with the exception of the check in staff. After check in it was all down hill. The bar that is close to the elevators to go to the rooms employ the rudest staff I have experienced in a bar. Ask anyone for something as simple as change in one of the stores and see what happens. We did upgrade to a petite suite and that also proved to be a big mistake. The suite was spacious but was runned down and in serious need of repairs. As far as cleanliness there were stains on the pillows, mirrors were spotty and the furniture was dirty. DO NOT MAKE THE SAME MISTAKE!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: djwalksalone
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick & very courtious. Complimentary upgrade was suggested I didn't have to ask! Luxury Red room was given with the Eiffel Tower right out my window! Room was very clean, bed very comfortable, room was very quiet.. Was treated like a Queen from all staff/employees...Will go back for sure!!!! Ate at the buffet - line was long but moved fast and the food - Fantastic!!! I had a wonderful time and will return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ohhh The Red Room”
Reviews.Author: goingplaces96
Reviews.Content: I have visited Vegas in the past but it was my first time at the Paris. Our room was great and it had a spectacular view. We secured a 3 night comp in the Red Room through Travel and Casino, and couldn't have been happier. My wife and I love Vegas and we had one of our best trips yet. The hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating. It's just an overall beautiful hotel and we will be looking forward to returning. As an end note...try the crepes place a bit past the casino, the dessert ones are delicious had one every night... the hazelnut and chocolate was our favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, great value”
Reviews.Author: jamNorthants
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Las Vegas Paris Hotel for 3 days and wish we had booked for longer. This place is just amazing - the Eiffel Tower - Arc de Triomphe - cobbled streets etc. Has to be seen to be believed. The room was great - lovely bathroom - sparkling clean - great service. Could not understand the odd bad review we read before we booked. The Mon Ami Gabi restaurant is fabulous and having been in real French restaurants was very authentic. We hope to return sometime and will definitely book into the Paris again - couldn't fault it!!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Holes! Unremarkable.”
Reviews.Author: idontgetit
Reviews.Content: Our check in experience was average. Felt like herded cattle. The room we got from booking on the third party website was in the lower quality location view wise so we took the upgrade for $ 50 bucks. The agent was very proficient in the upgrade. It included the use of the executive lounge which had the free breakfast buffet (cold) but very good and happy snacks and beverage. (I felt that was very good value). The upgraded room was a nice suite but with a horrible view of the roof top parkade. We upgraded to another view room facing the pool, strip and Belagio water show. Very nice up on the 24th floor. The corridors were dirty. Dirty room service trays for longer than 8 hours, beat up and chipped moldings, dirty albeit high quality wool carpet, and there were actually gaping bashed in areas in the walls. The room was well appointed but TV's have not been upgraded. Bathroom had slow drains and a terrible smell of sewage. Sheets had a hole in them and we found a dead moth on the floor which indicated poor cleaning. Bed was comfy pillow were not. Room attendant kept calling my wife and I "honey" but she was friendly enough. The rest of the staff seemed appropriate. We didn't care for the buffet restaurant. It seemed like a trough and the atmosphere was not pleasant (personal taste). The smell of cigarette smoke proliferated the common areas on the main floor and really put us off. When we checked in I had to go and ask about the coupon book which was included on our book it.com reservation. The first fellow discounted it when I brought it up so I had to call book it and then go down and insist he provide it. (I never used it anyhow ) but it's the point. I used the pool area and it was nice enough, but again smokers all over the place. No designated non smoking area on the pool deck that I could find. It was quite gross actually. (I'm Canadian) and this is just something you don't see anywhere in our Country. $ 25 fee to use the fitness center is not appropriate for a hotel of this caliber. We expressed our disappointment about the smell of the bathroom and the lady at the desk was very accommodating and friendly and offered to credit us $ 50. Well she actually did the opposite so now it's been almost two weeks and haven't heard back from the "Hara bill disupte centre." She actually charged me another $ 50. I'm tryign to avoid calling VISA to sort it out to see how long they actually take. Kind of makes you wonder why they have a dispute centre for billing? In any case I wouldn't stay there again. We checked out and went to Mandalay Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: slimknyzer
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights at Paris and arrived over the Memorial Day weekend. Although the hotel (practically the whole city) was filled with people, we found our entire stay exceptional. Check in - Although there was a long line, it moved fast and we were at the desk in about 10 minutes. The desk clerk was friendly. Although very busy, she answered our questions and confirmed our stay. Here directions to the room elevators was helpful. Room - We booked a Red Room and it was awesome! Very large with lots of room. I had a mobility scooter (more on that forthcoming) and there was ample room for entry, parking, and recharging. Never got in the way. We were on the 30th floor and had a great view of the City Center, Bellagio fountains, and South Strip. A little noise made it's way through the windows when the fountain show "exploded", but quiet (after nidnight). Housekeeping was prompt every morning and our room was completely made-up when we returned from breakfast (around 10 a.m.). Very long hallways, so try and book a room near the elevators that are also close to the ice machine. Food - We purchased the "Buffet of Buffets" package. 24 hours of buffet at any of the Harrah's properties. This was awesome. We timed our purchase so we had bkfst, lunch, dinner, and bkfst the following morning...all on the same 24 hour pass. The price was right. Be sure and get your total rewards card to save 5 bucks of the price of the ticket. Although the le village buffet was awesome for breakfast, we found the dinner meal had a better variety at Planet Hollywood and lunch at the Rio was truy fantastic. Great buffets. He had dinner at Harrah's buffet one night.....good but not great! Casino - Some 5 dolar tables early and during the week. 10 to 15 were the norm. Higher if you want. Poker Room - Planet Hollywood by far was the most comfortable. Great padded chairs. Mobility Scooter - I rented over the internet. The last day I left it at the concierge desk and returned a few hours later only to find the rental company picked it up.....a day early! Next time I will rent direct from the concierge. Same price and better service. Overall our experience at Paris was phenomenal. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Vegas at it's finest”
Reviews.Author: Chad M
Reviews.Content: First off, I am going to say that I am glad I didn't cancel my Paris reservation based off all the negative reviews on here, they seem very far fetched and after my stay, very unbelievable. We arrived at Paris around 430pm Tuesday June 1st, the check in line was short and took about 10 minutes to get to one of the 6-7 clerks working, every clerk appeared to be friendly. The female clerk we got was quick and was able to upgrade me from my standard comped room to a Luxury Red room when I asked if there were any complementary upgrades. The room was extra clean, the bed was very comfortable and the room appeared to be recently updated, there was a iron and board, coffee maker, flat screen TV, shower and tub, hair dryer and when we called housekeeping for 2 extra pillows, they were in our room within an hour. The view was not spectacular, but who just sits in their room and stares out the window in Vegas??? Although at night the view was better. The hotel was easily to navigate through. The pool was quiet and relaxing when you want to catch some sun. One secret to all the lines you could potentially face when you want to dine: Eat at off hours!! The service is much better, you get your meals faster and you will feel much more relaxed. I recommend Paris for the Location on the strip and the benefits you receive on your Total Rewards card for everything you purchase, play and dine. I also signed up for texts to my phone through total rewards (its on the total rewards website how to do it) and I got 2 for 1 rides up the Eiffel Tower, free drinks, etc. Also check out the Dueling Piano's at Napoleon's Lounge that goes on every night!! I have traveled from Atlantic City to Las Vegas and will always stay at a Harrah's owned hotels. Thank you for a spectacular stay!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: pizzadog
Reviews.Content: We recently travelled to Vegas with three other couples for a family wedding. We stayed 5 nights at The Paris and it was really a great experience. We had booked a hotel and air package through Allegiant Air at a very good price My husband and I upgraded our room so that we had a view of the Bellagio and the water show, as well as the Eiffel Tower and pool area. We bought a package through the hotel that provided us with a continental breakfast, 2 afternoon drinks each with appetizers and the enhanced room. The package was $55.00 per night extra but when you consider how much breakfast (which was more than a continental breakfast as far as we were concerned) and appetizers with 2 drinks each cost it was more than worth it. This was offered in the concierge suite which only had room for about 40 people - very quiet and pleasant - no ding-ding-ding going on. A welcome relief. We are not gamblers but the hotel offers so much more than just the casino. The pool area is very nice, large with lots of chaisses and good bar service. The restaurants are amazing - especially Le Burger Brassiere and Le Provencal. There is also a lovely little pastry shop that you can either use as eat-in or take-out. There is a very good selection of shops, and the hotel is attached to Bally's via a walk-way and their shops are good as well - a nice combination of affordable and high-end. The flavour of the hotel is very French, with quaint decorations and chic surroundings. All in all a wonderful place to stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Give it back to the French”
Reviews.Author: rickrico7
Reviews.Content: Booked a room with a king size bed and got a double instead. Opened the drapes of the room to see a 5ft. high concrete wall. Complained to desk to be told they would upgrade me for a price. T.V. and furnishings were dated. Bed was terrible, would have been just as comfortable sleeping on the floor. Everything from food to drinks was greatly over priced. Lines were long for everything. Hotel just seemed extremely over crowded. Couldn't walk anywhere in the hotel without feeling like a salmon going up stream. There are nicer places to stay on the Strip for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: syac
Reviews.Content: Paris is a great hotel. Location is great, right in the middle of all the action on the strip. Most of the hotels are all withing walking distance of Paris. Service was good, quick and friendly. No problems there. The ONLY grip I have is that the bed was not very comfortable. It was hard, and seemed lumpy. With a nice, plush bed, the room would have been top notch, and 5 stars!!! If you get a good deal, its a great place to stay. I've heard good things about the buffet, but to be honest, my husband and I weren't impressed. Maybe it's because of the memorial day weekend crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely give Paris a try!”
Reviews.Author: HotelCritic0917
Reviews.Content: Everything about the Paris hotel was very nice. The rooms were spacious and comfortable, there were many choices of restaurants to dine at. Everything is clean. The concierge is very helpful. My only "criticisms" (if you want to call it that) are: (1) it's a very long walk from the parking garage to the front-desk to check in. Especially when you're lugging a number of suitcases. Maybe drop off your luggage at the front entrance with one member of your party, and then go park the car; (2) the parking garage is very confusing - lots of one way sections and no left turns. Other than that - it's a great hotel, and one of the few on the strip that doesn't charge a "resort fee". Definitely check it out.

Reviews.Title: “A place to be in”
Reviews.Author: RajiniR3
Reviews.Content: Excellent ambience, loved the casino and the view rom atop the Tower! awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Here's the Truth....”
Reviews.Author: chuby1000
Reviews.Content: If you have children? this isn't the hotel for you. It's a couple friendly hotel; dark and romantic. The art work is amazing the details are impeccable.. I didn't see a child in sight and that's always nice when WE'RE TRYING TO GET AWAY from kids... We booked the standard room; very nice and clean.. Bed was plush and room service was quick and sweet. Check out a tad slow but no skin off my back; while I was waiting I was paying attention to details.. very nice. If you're on a budget? maybe this isn't the spot for you either.. it is pricey.. an example? I paid $7.50 for a small glass of orange juice...enough said. When I walked the strip I entered the other hotels (curious) and boy was I glad I made the best choice! Paris all the way!

Reviews.Title: “Rude service”
Reviews.Author: Abhi21
Reviews.Content: Everyone from Front desk to room service are rude. The service in the Le cafe was rude, concierge was rude. If it was not in the center of the strip, I doubt if this hotel is worth even considering.

Reviews.Title: “Service in The paris hotel in vegas IS...”
Reviews.Author: chefjulio
Reviews.Content: Service in The paris hotel in vegas IS terrible....employees are rude. Worst service in Vegas. Good location but service was so bad that is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ChristineV4
Reviews.Content: it was a very nice hotel. the beds were pretty comfortable and the bathroom looks really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: Robin_Sheboygan
Reviews.Content: Although a charming exterior, public interior spaces, and a really great burger restaurant and some shops, the hotel room was infested with bed bugs! Also a daily fee for the Internet ($14.99) and the gym ($25.00 per day). Now back to the bugs. The room decor was fine, but I shared a room with a co-worker for a trade show and we were bitten up from head-to-toe. Once at the trade show, I found out that the others from my company staying at Paris actually moved to another hotel after the first evening for the same reason. As the stories swirled around at the trade show, I also found out that when we stayed at the same location this past Jan. 2010, a few other collegues were bitten up and refused to return. Something I wish I had heard of sooner. I filed a report and security talked with me. I was moved to another room with no other incidents HOWEVER, I was neither comped nor upgraded or was my co-worker. No compensation whatsoever except a "sorry about that." I travel extensively on business and this is the second time this has happened to me over the past 10 years. The first experience was very different and expected -- the hotel was mortified, moved me to a suite and took off one night's stay. How Paris felt they had no responsibility for something as disgusting as bed bugs, that the manager didn't even personally speak with us, and that any one of us would consider returning makes me understand why they have let the hotel go the way they have. I was there on business -- but what a way to ruin a vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complain”
Reviews.Author: dorianplus
Reviews.Content: I have spent two nights at the Paris Hotel and I should say that it is a nice hotel. The room and the carpet are clean. The bathroom has a shower and is clean too. I travel mostly for business and I don't have to complain about that hotel. If you can get the room for a price below $100, go for it. The bad thing in Vegas is that you have to pay $15 for any internet access for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “All night long ALARM and the too high TELEPHONE COSTS”
Reviews.Author: BobbyNL
Reviews.Content: I've been in the Paris hotel 2 years ago, it's a quiet beautiful, good and nice hotel. But this year I was really pretty pissed off. It was one night, the alarm went off, every room has good speakers so that's waking up in the middle of the night. WIthin a half an hour they said the problem was under control, but problems in their alarm system causes that the alarm repeated every half - hour all night long !!! Next to this they charged us for 5 calls with a total of 7 minutes (within the state of California) a $ 101 , that's an outrageous amount of money ! And in the end by checking out, there was helping us the biggest annoyance women we ever have seen!

Reviews.Title: “Four Star... My Butt!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MWSPRINGFIELD
