Reviews.Content: The hotel was a disappointment. We stayed from April 20 - April 25/2010. We had room number 1847 on the 18th floor. We would walk to our room constantly and observed holes running along the base of the wall in the corridor. The furniture in the room was from pre-Napoleon era. I do not expect the hotel to give new furniture for each guest. However, it would be nice if it was not all scratched up along the base of each piece of furniture. Each concierge seemed dumber than the one before. We would ask questions about outside our hotel and they seemed very uninformed. I have travelled numerous times to Montreal and stayed in four star hotels and their concierge seemed very knowledgeable about the whole city of Montreal. The concierge seemed only to push what their hotel had to offer. We used the swimming pool and recieved towels that had holes in them. My wife gave back the towel to the pool attendant and they seemed very uninterested. These were all minor inconveniences and did not ruin our vacation. However, I would not recommend this Hotel to anyone. Each person that I told about my experiences were quite surprise because it was a 4 star hotel. Word will travel throughout our employee network about this experience. I will avoid the Paris or anyother Harrah owned properties on my next visit on October 29/2010. Thank-you.

Reviews.Title: “great Location, great food, room was OK but staff and check in very slow.”
Reviews.Author: trishwhite
Reviews.Content: Room was comfortable, disappointed we had a view of nothing was roof tops (we were on the 17th floor) Checking in was a slow process when you are tired after having travelled from Australia. Meals were not too bad actually, plates were way too full. Plentyy of on site resturants, shops, bars. All in all, great deal for the price, given its location. The Paris thing was a bit tacky and false.

Reviews.Title: “A room with a view”
Reviews.Author: BigsteveChorley
Reviews.Content: We requested a room overlooking strip. Which we got brilliant views. Room first class and very clean. Drinks a little pricey, but in keeping with the decor. Music bar 2 drinks for the price of one from 6am to 9am. Brilliant shopping center, right near hotel, we also went to ceasers palace to see Cher brilliant!!!

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of other nicer places to stay on the strip”
Reviews.Author: jorellie
Reviews.Content: Stay away from the Paris hotel. It is in desperate need of updating. Staff was rude. Our room was not made up on two occasions and when we called the front desk to report it, the rep (I think his name was Mike) was very combative. We were out of the room from 9 to 5 so needless to say when we returned to get ready for dinner, we were suprised we didn't have fresh towels, etc. We were told the floor manager would 'get back to us" but that never happened. A few calls later to housekeeping, we finally got towels but they were delivered to us by a stone face guy who "tossed and ran" when we opened the door!! Also, there were glasses, trash and a sponge left out in the hallway for two days!! We had room 1249 and had to walk that long corridor every day. The carpet in the room was worn, the sink didn't drain well, the armoir had a big piece of wood missing off the front door. Business center charges to run off boarding passes. This place was run down. I stayed at Paris 4 years ago and had a delightful experience. Sad to learn it's gone down hill and the staff was very rude. Spend your hard earned money elsewhere. There are plenty of other nice hotels on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: ILLV
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel on the strip. We have stayed here several times and we go 1-2 times per year. If it is your first time to Vegas, I highly recommend Paris. Central location, great restaurant (Mon Ami Gabi), good sports book. When eating at Mon Ami Gabi (open for b, l, and d), you can view the Bellagio fountains on their outdoor patio. Service is always amazing. Walkways wind through cafes to Bally's and to a monorail stop. Monorail is nice and clean with good views after walking up or down the strip to return to Paris. Great shops next door at Planet Hollywood. Remember all parking is free at LV hotels, but if you take a taxi from the airport, the driver will ask you the following" First time in Vegas?" followed by "Ok if I take freeway?". The strip is about 1 mile from the airport. Tell them to go Tropicana to LV Boulevard to your hotel. It is about $5-7 fare. If they go the freeway, it is illegal and called long hauling ($25 fare). They take you in a giant circle to get an inflated fare, but it is only legal if you consent to them going on the freeway. So, remember, tell everyone to instruct taxi drivers to take Tropicana to LV Boulevard. If they long haul, call police and they will get a citation and you get a free fare.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised and nice rooms BUT must get the Red Rooms..”
Reviews.Author: MARK10408
Reviews.Content: We (four of us) booked our first trip to Vegas from our Atlantic City hostess so we had no clue what to expect and we were told ahead of time that we could upgrade to the nicer red rooms since all four of us have good play (meaning spend a lot in AC) but when we arrived the reservation person gave us a real hassle and would not give us the upgrade rooms free but instaed insisted on charging us an extra $50 per room per day (we had 2 rooms). We were outraged but once we got into the connecting rooms I immediately called a host at Paris - name I was provided at check in - and this host was EXCELLENT!!! His name is Jimmy Brown and he is the best and I will book the next time through Jimmy Brown, He gave us 2 free upgraded red rooms and told us dinner was on him and what a dinner it was. Let me also tell you the red rooms are FABULOUS, very nicely appointed, clean, fairly large, with large flat screen TV, and the bathroom was huge and one of the nocest bathroom I have seen in a hotel. If you go to Paris it is a MUST to get the RED ROOM - and you can get it upgraded for free. I saw the normal rooms and they were crappy looking - avoid them. The locationof Paris as everyone has said is perfect with Bellagio and its beautiful water display right across the street and its a must to eat at the restaurant in front of Paris, Mon Ami Gabi, is an EXCELLENT restaurant with views of the fountains - sit outsside and enjoy. their buffet was also the best I have ever had and the prices are reasonable but you can eat excellent food and nice amiance... Paris casino is smaller than many of the other vegas casinos but I liked it a lot and I won big on the poker slots. Overall, it is an excellent hotel priced reasonably with nice Red rooms and great restaurants and the host Jimmy is the best.. I would highly recomend this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Worth the trip”
Reviews.Author: WindsorCanada91
Reviews.Content: We are a Diamond member of Harrahs and decided to stay at the Paris for 2 days on our 4 day trip in Vegas, Everything was amazing at the Paris, the service, location and ambiance. Regreted moving to the Rio. The Diamond Lounge at the Paris is great it has a wireless wifi, computer with printer to print our boarding pass. Will refer the Paris to anyone. We had the Deluxe Red Room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel & Pool”
Reviews.Author: lilygovernal
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel May 8- 12. This was our first stay at the Paris hotel, we usually stay at Bally's but got a better rate at Paris. We upgraded to a Red room for an additional $40.00 a night. We were in a corner unit with 2 windows. One facing the fountains the other facing City Center. The room was very nice and clean. Loved the pool area. It was a little more relaxing than the Bally's pool. There was plenty of room and the music was not blasting like it is at Bally's. Did not spend as much time in the Paris casino as we usually do. We thought they were lacking some of the newer games and to needed to upgrade. We enjoyed our stay and hope to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice. Perhaps 'too nice' for our style…”
Reviews.Author: Hood007
Reviews.Content: Service was decent. I had read complaints about check in. It took as about 25 minutes, but this was at 2:00pm on a Sunday. Our rooms were not ready, which was understandable. They were ready in about an hour. I asked for a free upgrade, which was denied, but we did end up in a basic corner suite. The bathroom was awesome with a tub and stand up shower. The bed was comfortable and the room was large. Perhaps my tastes are changing, but the casino experience was extremely boring. The sterile, themed-based casinos on the strip don’t seam to do it for me anymore. At Paris, it didn’t seam like people were having a good time, although we were! Buffet: $15, but you better budget $25 since $10 lets you skip the line, which always looked incredibly long. It was your average buffet. The pastries were incredible. Mon Ami Gabi: You know, that fancy restaurant right on the strip? For 4 people, no appetizer and bottle of wine, the bill came to $178. We ordered the “cheapest” Pinot Noir, and it was incredible. We got tables right on the strip so we could people watch. As a bonus we could see the Belagio water show. You cannot make reservations for those seats, so come fashionably early, around 5:30pm. When we left, it was packed and the ling was huge. The pool: Big and boring, but a cool view of the Eiffel Tower. Service was just OK. We learned that Bally’s is more our style, which is connected directly to the Paris Shops. We won’t go to Paris again, but not because of a poor experience. It’s just not our Style.

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: Angelw36
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris our trip last year in Sept 2009, We stayed at other places in the past 6 years but chose this time to go back to the Paris. The pool is great, nice and cold for the hot weather. The room was nice, even though didn't have a good view. Clean We are going again in Aug and are looking forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience, use your concierge!!!”
Reviews.Author: LivinItUpAlways
Reviews.Content: This was a great trip the hotel was amazing. The lobby was amazing and the room was much better than I thought it was going to be. They were cleaned daily and had more than we expected such as a love seat and a coffee table and lights in the closet/entertainment system. The food was great in the french style cafe's along the old school looking cobblestone road that lead you tto shopping, restaurants, gambling (of course) and to Bally's hotel. The Eiffel tower is worth the trip up the rickety old elevator especially if you get it timed right and go while it's dark outside and when the fountains at the Belagio are gonna go off. Very Cool!!! The only thing I didn't care for was the size of the casino it was quite small and didn't have a huge selection of machines like some of the other casinos have. Use your concierge services they are amazing and will hook you up with coupons for discounts on shows, shopping and exhibits all you have to do is ask. Oh and the audio in the bathrooms made me laugh everytime I went in them. The location is phenomenal as it is right in the center of the strip and always had cabs waiting for us whenever we needed one. This was a great experience I will definitely return to The Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheesy, but cute..”
Reviews.Author: goldfisharenice
Reviews.Content: My wife had a business trip to Vegas, so I tagged along.. we're not Vegas-types, but enjoyed our trip.. Paris is cute, but cheesy.. it tries to imitate Paris, but I've been to Paris, and it's not really authentic.. plus the actual construction looks cheap.. it's cousin NewYorkNewYork is the same. The annoying parts were the gym which my wife was charged $25 to use, and check-out was super-annoying. I'd still recommend it though, because I'm not the demographic, and it wasn't bad. If you're looking for classy though, don't go there.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST!”
Reviews.Author: sodavp11
Reviews.Content: I've visited Las Vegas several times ove the past few years, but Paris if my favorite! The hotel never has disappointed me. As a single woman - safety, security and luxury are important to me. Paris meets - no, exceeds my needs beyond compare! I can't imagine staying anywhere else in Las Vegas! Way to go, ma très chère amie!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Visit!”
Reviews.Author: LAURIEK2
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Paris. Rooms were comped with our TR card. Received a really nice view of pool, eiffel tower and Bellagio fountains without asking. Just had the older room not red room. The carpet was old but it was clean and the bathrooms were really nice. We ate at the breakfast buffet and at Cafe' St. Louis while there and liked both. They had some of the newest slots and hubby won on craps. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Paris was great”
Reviews.Author: DrG001
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris Hotel/Casino in May 2010 upgraded to a suite and found the room, hotel, facilities all great. Very smoky in Casino like all of them could do with better air conditioning. Overall our stay there was very good, position fantastic, overlooking Bellagio fountains and near most attractions on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Traveller1968
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 nights for a recent convention. I was given a free upgrade during check-in to a large room with a magnificent view of the Bellagio Fountains across the street. Nicely furnished and very neat and clean. The hotel is centrally located in the middle of the strip with monorail access to the convention centre close by. The Deuce bus also stops at the door (great for getting to the Outlet Malls). The French Pattiserrie has desserts to die for! Unfortunately, it seems the quality of the food in the 24 hour Cafe and the Buffet has slipped since previous visits - not enough staff mean long queues as many eating sections are not utilised. Overall though, the hotel is well located, clean and very good value.

Reviews.Title: “perfect place, centrally located on The Strip, perfect view”
Reviews.Author: Plusz
Reviews.Content: It was our second visit in Las Vegas. First stay near The Strip. Paris has the best location. Every evening you can decide if you want to visit north or south hotels and casinos, all are in walking distance. If you have high floor with Bellagio fountains view - it is magic. There is also very nice swimming pool when you can rest after night entertainment. Rooms are spacious, very clean. Housekeeping perfect. Check-in, check-out extremely fast. They can improve two things - internet access could be cheaper or free, and if you get option with buffet included, there were always long queues - we didn't take this, but saw whole day long lines to restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel On The Strip”
Reviews.Author: MizzouLincoln
Reviews.Content: We were here from May 3-7th, and For our 10th trip to Vegas, we found Paris to be a very nice hotel/casino. We had very good check-in service. Our room was very nice, overlooked the pool. We did have some very loud young ladies next to us the second night we were there, but they quieted down after a call downstairs. The table game dealers were very nice and fun to play with. Drinks and restaurants were a little pricey, but that is the way of things on the strip these days. Enjoyed Mon Ami Gabi. Nice location on the strip. Would probably stay here again, but would try a luxury red room.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't impressed...”
Reviews.Author: Hypnosys
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this past weekend with friends and I wasn't all that impressed. Here's what went wrong with us: The room wasn't vacuumed, we asked for housekeeping to come at 5 our second day and they never showed up until the third day. I had to call and visit the lobby to make sure they will clean our room. Breakfast at the buffet wasn't good, the food didn't seem fresh and it was expensive 17.99 The hostess seated us without a table setting and the waitress complained it wasn't her fault we didn't have forks/knives or spoons. So i got up and got them myself. Waitresses at the pool where nowhere to be found, they never came to our section, again to the bar I went to get my drinks. I would only highly commend the table dealers. They were very friendly and helped you if you weren't sure what to do with your hand. Other then that, the price has to be right for me to stay at the Paris again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not a huge fan of the casino”
Reviews.Author: Vote Quimby
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris for four nights and enjoyed our stay. The Standard rooms were comfortable and quiet and the beds were fine. The best part of staying here was the location as it is center strip and close to transportation and an easy walk either north or south. We arrived at the hotel on a Thursday at around 2:45PM and there was NO lineup at all. We walked right up to the counter and our room was ready. We were on the 23rd floor but did not have much of a view (air conditioning units). Not a big deal since we spend very little time there except to sleep. Bathrooms are nice with both a bath and shower. TV is the old style tube TV. Room service was good and the cleaning staff were also good and prompt. Room was quiet and after a little confusion, we figured out the best way to find the bank of elevators is to look for the lobby and work our way down. Not a very big fan of the casino as it seemed to be smokier then others, the waitresses seemed very slow and the dealers generally seemed disinterested. Overall, I have stayed at other Hotels on the strip and this one is just fine. Great location, good service and below average casino. We had no issues that needed taking care of so I can't comment on how attentive they are to issues but other then the waitresses in the casino and some of the dealers, we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - but maybe Mirage is more central on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: canIgettawootwoot
Reviews.Content: perfectly clean. no bed cover, they have cleaned sheets on a duvet. I thought that was fantastic. never want to think about what's happened on those hotel bed covers which never get washed. Had a single serving coffee maker! lots of LV hotel reviews were unhappy about no coffee maker in the room. was happy to have one. Bar fridge offered it's (very small) middle shelf for guests use. All staff in the hotel were friendly. Location was excellent. had the Ace/ Duce bus stop right out front. Would have been more central at the Mirage - but then you have to listen to the Treasure Island show/ fireworks(?) still, Paris is pretty central to the whole strip. DO get a bus pass though! week pass or day pass is available. your feet will thank youl Hotel is laid out in a manner that the elevators are confusing - at first - but then you are grateful there are 6 elevators each to serve every few floors. the walk from the elevator is never long. we were in the last room of the hall and it was only a few steps from the elevator. (not like the Flamingo YIKES!) king bed was not comfortable but after so much walking I was too exhausted to care. Heard the Bellagio fountains from my strip view room, but once in bed it was too faint to keep me up. no loud clubs pumping base nearby :) Food in Paris was expensive but was close enough to walk to any other restaurant. the buffet line was always long but always quick and the food selection was excellent! love the decor with all the details. great location. good layout but confusing to find the exits from the elevator(all casinos are laid out to keep you trapped in). shower/ bathroom was nice n big. no pluming issues. had all the hot water i wanted. avoid lines with the television check-out. would recommend this hotel to anyone. :)

Reviews.Title: “Attended a conference here recently. The...”
Reviews.Author: GardenDiva88
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference here recently. The hotel is marvelous, the conference facilities are lovely and the conference staff were outstanding! Beautiful facilities-- you never need to leave the grounds. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Center of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: guoning
Reviews.Content: Room: The standard room is about the same size as all the other Vegas hotels I have been too, smaller than the Venetian standard suit types. Not much view from room, as I am too cheap to pay for a strip view. The setups in the room are not very exciting, standard amenities, the theme of the room fits the hotel's name. Bathroom has good size. Location: Good thing about Paris is pretty centrally located on the Strip. With a short walk, you can reach many other hotels. It is easy if you want to go to either end of the Strip as well. Take a taxi back from MGM or Wynn will not cost you much. Food: Only had breakfast buffet in the hotel twice, selections are good and not very expensive. You can even buy discount vouchers on the Strip to bring the price down even further. There are so many choices in hotels in Vegas, I would probably try somewhere newer.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: mcalbreeze
Reviews.Content: My BIL booked this hotel and as I read the reviews I was a bit concerned, but upon arrival those concerns were gone. We stayed at this hotel twice during our trip. One night upon arrival in Las Vegas and then returning from our road trip to Utah we stayed here. The first night's stay was a standard room, it was large, modern and the view from my room was the Bellagio Fountain. Very nice and I was looking forward to returning at the end of our trip. Which that night was even better! Apparently, my BIL had prepaid for the room and had thought I was staying as long as they were but I was actually only staying one night. The front desk handled it beautifully. They couldn't refund the money that was overcollected until I checked out the next morning so to make up for the inconvenience they upgraded all of us. It just so happened that because I was only staying one night they were able to offer me a suite and let me tell you it was very nice and completely unexpected. It was large, living room, bedroom, huge dressing area with walkin closet and makeup table, huge bathroom with walkin shower and jetted tub. It was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing - Upscale”
Reviews.Author: sunscreen5
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paris for my 40th BD. It was very clean, nice decor and the beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was well equipped with full shower and tub. We bought he $50.00 per day package with appetizers, drinks and continental breakfast. It was well worth it to go to the private seating area and the food was great and so was the service. Lots of amenities in Paris, tea coffee shops, restaurants....the ride up the Eiffel tower is beautiful at night, you can see the water show at the Bellagio, breathtaking! Pay a little extra and enjoy. It was much quieter than other hotels on the strip and great for couples. No Spring break types here.....nice pool!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: louloucantagrill
Reviews.Content: I was more than happy and satisfied with my stay at the Paris Hotel. Having been in the city of Paris in June, I enjoyed it even more. We were first ignored during many minutes by the younger man at the reception, but it is the only bad comment I can say about this hotel. So I was very glad when someone else finally got free. The lady at check-in was very nice, smiley and accomodating. She pick-up for us a beautiful room on the 30th floor. It wasn't overlooking the Strip and Eiffel Tower but I prefered that since I had been there 18 months before, saw plenty of it and it was quieter. Even though it was fully booked, we never heard a sound coming from our neighbour or anywhere else except when the maids started their shift. The room was splotless and was cleaned up every day. We even had someone cleaning up the outdoor windows just holding by two cables. We did not eat at the Buffet since I do not eat much and would not wait hours in line before getting in. There were plenty of restaurants in and out of the hotel. I loved "La Creperie" where I had a very good seafood "crêpe". Some people hated and complained about the french songs played in the elevators but it really felt and sounded like Paris. I would go back any time since I never felt I was in a hotel but more like in a small Paris street, compared to all the other hotels I visited in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Emplacement fabuleux - Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Mousekala
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Paris hotel at 1:00 p.m. on Thursday, for a 3 night stay. Prior to our arrival, one of my friends called and asked to block a number of rooms on the same floor, but when we checked-in there was no record of the request, and the girl at the check-in counter was a bit rude. We were, however, able to check in right away (not have to wait for 4:00 p.m.) so that helped a bit. The room was adequate and clean. The bathroom had a separate shower and I liked the bathroom products (White tea) that they supplied . The room and bathroom could use some updating, but the bathroom was spacious with enough room under the sink to hold your toilettries. Enough closet space as well as drawers for your clothes. The best part of the hotel is the location (which is right in the middle of the strip) and it is not as big as some of the other hotels. As soon as you come out of the elevators you don't have to walk a mile to get to the casino, and restaurants. Mon Ami Gabi is a fabulous restaurant with a patio that faces the Bellagio and definitely recommended. I saw huge line ups for breakfast at the various restaurants and one of my friends mentioned that she had to wait over 40 minutes to get a sandwich at one of the cafes, so maybe they should hire more staff. There are 3 bars, (that I could see) Le Cabaret and Napoleon's and another open bar (can't remember the name and that one is open 24-7) which is along the path to the elevators. Cabaret is more open and faces the casino; Napoleon's is closed-in and more private. We held our meet-and-greet at Napoleon's and for that particular event it was a better choice. Both bars have entertainment in the evening and open around 5:00 p.m. Would I stay at this hotel again? I would like to experience other hotels in Vegas, but if the price was right, then I definitely would.

Reviews.Title: “Used to be one of our favorite Hotels/Casinos...not anymore.”
Reviews.Author: jojo627
Reviews.Content: We arrived late Thursday evening with our group of about 40 people. My husband and I had requested a Non-smoking, Kingsize bed w/view. When we got to our room (1898P) we thought it was a bit outdated and smelled a little moldy. Also the safe was broken so we had to call someone to come up and fix it. The worse part was the bed. OMG, it was horrible! From the mattress to the bedding...I have never been that uncomfortable. I tried to sleep but ended up only sleeping for about an hour. I called the Assistant MGR and was told that the hotel was full but that they would get us another room as soon as they could. I called back at about 7 AM to find out what I needed to do. I was told to call back bet. 8 and 9 and see if anything was available, and to pack. We were staying for 5 days, so I had a LOT of re-packing to do! I called at 8:30...still nothing. They said to come back to the front desk no later than 3PM. So we packed everything up. It ruined our 1st day there. I was concerned the whole time about whether we would get a new room or not, and I could NOT sleep in that bed another night. So we showered and got ready to go out. The shower smelled very moldy. It was terrible. We went out and I tried to enjoy the day but I kept checking my watch to make sure we were back by 3PM. We arrived back at the front desk Check in line at 2:45. There was still a problem. It took them about 15 minutes to finally get us a new room. We schlepped our bags to the new room. It was definitely better! To top it all off, when we got back home, we noticed a rash on my husband's back and on my legs. I hate to even think what this might be...but I'm certain it is from that horrible room! We didn't have it before we arrived... The casino was not as nice as I remembered. It was sooooo smokey. The tables were hard to get a seat on, day or night. The lines for the buffet were ridiculous. The food at the Cafe was not very good. The pool was not so hot either. Only 2 jacuzzi's for all of those people??? Sadly, we will not be going back to Paris Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised"”
Reviews.Author: deedeepotts
Reviews.Content: I was almost scared off by some of the negative reviews for the Paris, but decided to stick with my reservation, and am so glad I did. The location is perfect and I especially like that the hotel is not set a mile back from the strip. Caesar's is my favorite (but can't always afford it); love The Hotel at Mandalay Bay (but too far south); and is heads and tails above the Flamingo. We didn't get one of the upgraded red rooms, but we did luck out and got a corner/parlor room with two windows--one facing the pool and Eiffel Tower and one facing strip south. Very roomy and comfortable (though the bed could have been better). We also really liked the feel of this casino compared to some of the others. All in all, it was a really comfortable stay. Oh, and the pool was perfect (plenty of chairs and space to spread out--unlike Flamingo where you have to crawl over people to get around). Whoever complained on their review about the 2-1/2 foot pool at the Paris must have had an axe to grind, cause it's definitely not true. It's a great pool! So glad I didn't let some of the negative reviews deter us--we love this hotel and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Canadianv
Reviews.Content: The Paris is located right in the middle of the 'happening' part of the Strip. Our room was clean and though we did not pay extra for a view it had nice big windows. The hotel has several dining options including a patio restaurant that faces the Bellagio fountains. There is a really fun piano bar in the shopping area that leads through to Bally's. Line ups were ofcourse inevitable. The only down side to this hotel is that the casino is very very smokey...worse it seemed than the others. As non smokes we booked rooms on a non smoking floor. The pool area was pleasant with lots of poolside chairs. I will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great location”
Reviews.Author: i_m_good
Reviews.Content: The main reason I booked the Paris was because of the location. We arrived around noon, the check in lines were a little slow, but were given a room right away. Decided to upgrade to a package (about $50/night) that included strip view, renovated room, $10 voucher for the spa and access to the guest lounge. The guest lounge was the best part, it opened at 8:00 in the morning and had continental breakfast, and since we were travelling with friends, this was a really convenient meeting place in the morning. It was also opened for appetizers around dinner time, they had lots to choose from and we were able to fill up there one night before a show. There is also alcoholic beverages included. Strip view was nice, but it should be noted that the Paris is right across from the Bellagio and when the fountains are on, it can be loud. I didn't mind, I enjoyed watching the show from my room a couple times. Thought the pool was really nice, went out there most afternoons, and there was lots of sun as well as shaded areas for everyone. I would definitely stay here again, and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Solid stay at the Paris”
Reviews.Author: abbalish
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Friday evening at around 7:30 and had to wait for around half an hour to check in. Finally, we made it to the front and went to our room. The room was nice, but nothing spectacular. The beds were pretty comfortable. I did appreciate that the bathroom had a separate shower and tub, although the water pressure in the shower was kind of lacking. For $85/night we could have done worse - although maybe we could have done better. We actually didn't spend much time at the Paris. After a few occasions of bad luck in the casino, we took our business elsewhere - mostly to Bill's Gamblin' Hall. I did appreciate that our room wasn't super far to get to, like I've seen in some other other hotels. Honestly, the best part about the Paris is its location. It's right near the Bellagio (and you can see the fountain shows from across the street), Bally's, Bill's, Caesar's, Harrah's, etc. The hotel also has some pretty good dining options - during our stay, we hit up the Cafe St. Louis for late-night take-out (eh), some fast food Italian place (pretty good), Mon Ami Gabi (good), Le Burger Brasserie (really good), Le Creperie (really good), and the Eiffel Tower Restaurant (good, but probably not worth the price - although the view of the Bellagio fountains is truly spectacular). The only other hotel I've stayed at is the MGM Grand, and between that and Paris, I think MGM was a bit nicer. But the location of Paris is most definitely better, so it's probably a toss-up. I'd probably stay there again if the price were right.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time”
Reviews.Author: fordtoy
Reviews.Content: Had a terrible experience with rowdy people in the room next door. We called the security people which is what we were told to do by the front desk. Security commented " we will be right up" after twenty minutes security was not there (these people were so noisy you could hear them three quarters of the way down the hall). We then called a second time security commented "we are on another call" After about 45 minutes I had to go to the front desk at 4:00AM in the morning and they called security (which should have been done in the first place) security then came and took care of the problem. Also, the walls in this hotel are paper thin. You can hear everything going on in the next room. The buffet (Le Village )was always a two hour wait, unless you want to pay a $10 fee, $15 on brunch days, then they would move you to the head of the line. What a way to treat your hotel guests. The guest should have priority at the buffet. I always felt like I was working the whole time for Paris (Harrah's entertainment) not on vacation. I have been to Las Vegas at least 12 times over the last few years and never been treated like this. I had to pay $5 to print out a boarding pass for my plane. I stayed at Mandalay Bay with a cheaper room just as nice and printed a boarding pass for free.

Reviews.Title: “Paris was better than expected....”
Reviews.Author: nlyron
Reviews.Content: we just returned from 5 days at the paris hotel in Vegas and we were pleaseantly suprised. We ate at most of the places on the property, used the pool (when it wasn't raining) and even needed the services of the concierge. All aspects of our stay couldn't have been better. Over the last "#$% years we've been to Vegas 8 times and stayed at places as varied as the Holiday Inn to Mandalay Bay and the Luxor and I'm sure we were as pleased this year as any. Special thanks need to be given to James the concierge who spent considerable time calling places when my wife lost her wallet. He even called the police and saved us a trip to a sub station that had closed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: mws813
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paris for seven nights comped in a red room premier! Thought the room was great- clean, comfortable with an excellent view of the Bellagio fountains! The only downside was you could hear the fountains going off and it sounded like thunder! Thought the casino was nice, but they needed some newer games. Venetian had so many new games it was mind blowing! Paris could learn something but checking out the games there. I also would have liked to see more money denominations for video poker. I like to play ten hands of dimes or nickels Super Times Pay or Ultimate X and neither was available. The buffet was above average, but the 7 casino all you can eat for 24 hours passm has lines at least an hour long most of the day! Had I not been a Diamond player and able to avoid the lines I would have been disappointed to say the least in the long wait times. The rest of the resort is beautiful and I would stay here again in a heart beat if comped!

Reviews.Title: “If you want a hotel that cares about you, don't go to the Paris Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LadyMeg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Paris 3 years ago and I was impressed with the lack of cigarette odors. But, this has all changed. The BLUE domed sky is now covered in cigarette smoke clouds. The Paris now smells like all the old casinos in Las Vegas. The customer service at the Paris was so disappointing. My friend became very ill and even had to go to an emergency clinic. Upon learning of her illness, there was absolutely not one person in this hotel that showed her any concern. I have never stayed in a resort that so poorly trained their staff about how to treat guests. Our stay there ended any desire to visit Las Vegas in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Naniwa
Reviews.Content: Smack bang in the middle of the Strip, this hotel has a great location. It's possible to walk around and see some of the other hotels and what they have to offer, as well the amenities at the Paris. As with most hotels on the Strip, it is massive. Free self-parking is available, and spaces were abundant. It is quite a walk from the car park, but that's not a major concern and the walk is all indoors. The check-in queue tends to be long and snaking, but everything was efficient and we weren't waiting too long. Our room was good. We had a "Red Room Premier", which was on the 30th Floor and had great views of the Eiffel Tower and the Bellagio Fountains on the other side of the room. The room was well appointed and the bathroom was good. Quite quiet as well - didn't hear anything from the corridor nor the neighbouring rooms. We could hear the music which was played during the Bellagio Fountain displays, but this didn't go on too late into the night. The amenities themselves were fine. Shops, bars and cafes were all around the casino. We ate the buffet for dinner, which was good value. As with most things, there was a queue to get in, but once in and seated, there was a large variety of things to choose from and quality wasn't bad. Certain seating areas were a little like a cheap canteen, but the staff were quite good at clearing things up. Would we stay there again? Yes. It is what it is - a comfortable Vegas hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: MaggieS166
Reviews.Content: Everything was great, easy check-in and check-out, good service took advantage of the 24 hour buffet special, one night the line-up was extremely long, for $7 more you could get the express pass and get right in, nice that they offer that option if you don't want to stand in line for a couple of hours to eat, check-in staff very accommodating, I had our room switched from Floor 31 to Floor 4, no problem, booked all our show tickets at Paris, made it very easy for us.

Reviews.Title: “YOU decide what you want out of YOUR vacation”
Reviews.Author: kimbini
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Vegas for a retirement and a get-a-away. The check in was fast (5:00 pm on a Thursday). We are friendly people, so we were treated according to how we treated the hotel staff. We had pre-paid for a Red room premier. At check in we asked to make sure we had a room with a nice view. 30th floor, tower view and Bellaggio fountains. Gorgeous. Loved the I-pod dock to play our own music. Huge HD flat screen. Liked the his/hers armoires for our clothes. Plenty of hangers. Could have been a little cleaner; more attention to minute details (the windows had kid's hand prints on them). We liked the fact that the windows have a portal opening that vents fresh air and we could hear the street sounds and fountains. Non smoking room, which we wanted. Our experience of Vegas that "non-moking" doesn't mean you won't smell smoke. Our room was completely smoke free!! Pool area was very nice. Drinks were spendy at the pool. Good poolside service, however. 4 drinks came to $74.00. Ate dinner @ Mon Ami Gabi. The most spectacular steak ever! A little dark for my impaired vision. Great wine selection. Room did have a coffee maker, but it was missing a component so it wouldn't work. Did have continental room service and it was fast and delicious. We gambled at 4 casinos and I only one at the Paris. Pretty much every time I played slots I walked away in the positive. Also, casino drink service was great at the Paris, but we did tip well. We packed a couple of bottles of liquor from home so when we got there we had a bar all set up and we could have drinks in our room while getting ready to go out. Another thing we liked was the little, over-priced store at the foot of the elevators; when you were ready to retire for the evening and needed a last minute bottle of water or snack, it was right there. Over all, I would stay here again and if you want to be really picky and spend all your time looking fo things "bad" things then you will ruin your vacation. Go on your trip and have a good time and don't spend your time fretting about the little things. Check out the Imperial Palace and you will feel really good about the Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Paris”
Reviews.Author: MimiW1
Reviews.Content: Direct located across from the Bellagio! It's beautifully decorated. Don't forget your Paris Balloon and Eiffel Tower cups.

Reviews.Title: “Paris! you just love it...be it the city or the hotel in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: ALLIGATOR9
Reviews.Content: My friends in Phoenix decided to treat me to a night in Vegas considering I was meeting them for a weekend. & we decided to stay at the Paris! Having been to Vegas twice earlier, Paris would make it different this time. & it did! Right across the fountain & the cirque de soleil show, it saved us so much time. & with night falling, the casino was a great place to gamble away the only night. With the delicious food at the cafes & a nice room made me ask for more. The lavish breakfast after a long night at the blackjack tables was the icing on the cake. With 3hrs sleep it was time for us to head back & Paris calls me again!

Reviews.Title: “What a joke”
Reviews.Author: cd20100
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas 5 times. I was completely appauled at how different this hotel was. The staff was rude throughout our entire stay, and could have cared less about us. I didn't get the room I reserved because they said I checked in later than most, so what are reservations made six month's in advance for? As far as prices, it was very expensive to just about anything, including have a drink,and comps were vitually non existent. Ceaser's palace in 07 was soooo much better and for a couple dollar's more I should have gone back.

Reviews.Title: “30th Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: lesfergie5
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our stay at Paris. We had a wonderful celebration of our 30th wedding anniversary. We arrived on Sunday evening and checked in with no wait. We did not get the king size bed we had booked because of conventions in the hotel. We were told we could move the following day though. Jennifer at the front desk was polite and tried to be accomodating. We were offered an upgrade to a red room for $50/night. Our roomed turned out to be very nice so we did not move. Manny at the Total Rewards desk was especially helpful. What a wonderful representative for the hotel! We enjoyed the casino and found the waitresses to be attentive and friendly. We had 2 meals at Le Cafe and both were average. The wait staff was overworked and unfriendly. We were never asked if we needed anything or how the food was. We ate at the buffet one night and it was very good. The music in the piano bar and the caberet was great the atmosphere was fun. There was an Avon convention there and the Avon ladies were having a blast! The pool area was very nice. We stowed our luggage with the bellman since we had a late flight out. Jack was very friendly and personable. Overall we had a great stay and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - no complaints”
Reviews.Author: mlang11
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Paris Hotel on the Las Vegas strip and enjoyed ourselves. The room we stayed in was clean and comfortable. It is great to be right on the strip! The buffet and restaurants were good - but pricey. Hotel staff were nice and attentive. On the days I didn't want to walk the strip or shop, I relaxed by the pool and read a book. The hotel was a nice size - not too big that you got lost but not too small that you were bored. Paris is close to Planet Hollywood which contains a decent size mall. The ABC store near Planet Hollywood had cheap bottles of water and snacks. i booked a South Rim Grand Canyon tour at the Concierge (which was $15 less than another tour operator was wanting). It was well worth the time and money.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and location but be prepared to pay for extras”
Reviews.Author: JanSWales_UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights, walked in. Took 20 minutes to get to check-in desk. Long queue, staff didn't seem like they were in any hurry and there were only 2 of them operating at any one time, although there were loads around. Room was beautiful , spacious and spotless, looked over the pool and tower. It was quiet, very comfortable and beautifully decorated. Pool was nice, great towels and the staff there were friendly and courteous. The downside: . No coffee in the room - it was $4 per cup downstairs or $10 to have a pot sent up (plus tip of course). They charged $14.99 per day for internet access. They even charged for toll free calls ($1.25)! The worst part was the cafe where we had a meal one evening. The food was shockingly bad - how can you get a salad so wrong? After that we didn't even have breakfast there. Shame really because the hotel itself is really nice

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: Carollwhe
Reviews.Content: We had two birthdays we were celebrating, we had a great time. I really like our rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Tfime”
Reviews.Author: SherryG888BD
Reviews.Content: We vacationed at the Paris from the 30th of March to the 3rd of April and had a great time. It was a Birthday Vacation. My daughter just turned 21, my mother just turned 70. So, my sister, the 21 year old daughter, the 70 year old mother, her aunt, our great-aunt, and I all made the trip to Vegas. We had a great time. The room was the regular room, but who stays in the room anyway? The bathroom was large enough for three women to get ready for the day, all at the same time. We did get the second room adjoining, that was real nice. Each night, when we returned to our room it was clean, and the beds made. Fresh towels, just a real nice place to stay. There is a safe in the room that you put in your own 4 digit code, very safe. There is the refrigerator that will charge your room if you take anything out. But, one shelf in the refrigerator is left empty for the room guest to use. Also nice, my mother needed to keep her medication refrigerated. All the people we encountered were super nice, ready to help us with all of our questions. I do hope to vacation again in Vegas, and I will stay at the Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “I know we won't go back”
Reviews.Author: sweden10
Reviews.Content: Got there and checked in fairly quickly. Got to room went to the bathroom, flushed toilet and overflowed. Took all the towels to soak up the stuff that came out of the toilet :(. Ran out of room and got hold of room attendent. Explained what happened and she just picked up the towels. Didn't wash the floor. I tried to explain about the toilet etc, still didnt get the floor washed. In the end I washed the floor. Called twice for plumber -- he was in and out in three minutes. Said happened all the time. We had lunch at the Le Cafe. Had a clubhouse sandwich. We wanted to share it and it was an extra $5.99 for the extra plate. My son got married. We booked 14 rooms between both families. No perks for the newlyweds. No even a free bottle of champagne. I questioned this at the Front Desk and she said everybody gets married in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Charming...Pleasant...Front Desk Staff HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: LeaveFromPA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paris over Easter 2010. I had a great, clean room that faced the fountains at Bellagio. I would echo an earlier review...you can hear the fountain going off all day...the first time it's cool...the 1000 time, it's like having a nailgun shot in your ear. I'd recommend the property for things like, cool casino, some good eats, great drink specials and access to the strip. Minus the below experience, everything I would say is positive. Be warned though: the front desk staff is awful! I mean top 3 most poorly trained people I have ever encountered ANYWHERE on the planet. I mean, if you had the choice to wait in line at the Paris or get tossed from a speeding bus, JUMP! I arrived later on a weekend night. There were three folks ahead of me in line and two folks checking in (only two employees checking people in). Both groups checking in were at the desk for more than 20 minutes each. At one point, I heard the desk clerk talking about how to drive to Hoover Dam. Absolutely a worthwhile trip, but something for the concierge should handle. As if no one was waiting in line, the conversation continued...and included compliments of women's handbags and what color countertops everyone had in their homes. It was insane.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service?”
Reviews.Author: sam-cmh
Reviews.Content: Did not personally stay here, and never will. My parents are flying to Vegas today and staying here for the week. I wanted to surprise them with a gift waiting in their room...a basket or flowers, whatever. Called the Paris and kept getting transferred around to different people. On the 4th person I spoke with I was told he was just to busy to worry about my request right now and I would have to call back later. As if spending 1/2 an hour on the phone to get one simple task taken care of wasn't eating in to my time? WOW!

Reviews.Title: “Got a cheap price...got what I paid for”
Reviews.Author: markbene
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms were ok. They were clean and I paid $60 per night. The location on the strip is pretty good but overall, I found myself spending more time at Ceasars and Ballys than Paris. Avoid the food, its ok but the price is the same as the Bellagio and the quality is sooooooo much less. My wife spent $30 on two breakfast pastries and 2 coffees.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Paris”
Reviews.Author: CanuckFoodie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paris for 4 nights with friends. The wait to check in was long, about 30 minutes, but the staff were very friendly. We were offered a free upgrade to a Red Room without even asking, which was a very welcome surprise. The rooms were beautiful - clean and nicely furnished, with a flat screen tv and a lovely comfortable bed. All four of our rooms had a view of the Eiffel Tower overlooking the pool, and we could see the Bellagio fountains perfectly. Maid service was prompt and efficient, if a little early ( 9:00 am), and services such as concierge, bellman, and wake up calls were excellent. The pool was clean and well-staffed; the breakfast buffet was a terrific deal with excellent variety of dishes. We ate at Mon Ami Gabi and as it was on the last visit, the food was fantastic and the service commendable. The entire atmosphere of the hotel was comfortable, charming and friendly. We all agreed that we would definitely stay here again. Did I mention our rooms were only around $70 a night? Fantastique!

Reviews.Title: “It was OK for Vegas"”
Reviews.Author: talklikeapirate
Reviews.Content: Parked in the garage and walked into the Paris "street scene", which was cool. Requested a strip-facing room so we could see the fountain "show" at the Bellagio. Hotel seemed a bit "worn". (i.e. toilet paper roll holder almost falling out). On our second morning, we woke up, had breakfast at the cafe in the hotel. Had to send lattes back because they were just warm. They said they re-steamed them, but then all the foam was gone. Chocolate croissant was good, bacon bad. When we got back to the room, we found the water shut off in the entire hotel. (emergency shut-off they said). It wasn't fixed for several hours, so we did some sightseeing. Thankfully it was back on in the afternoon. Coffee makers would have been nice in the room. We chose the Paris because it seemed a good value for Vegas. Caesars and Bellagio were $60 or so more per night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: WirralLady_10
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel, big room, in centre of the strip-. Free Indoor parking. We only stayed two nights, which to be honest was enough for us. Ideal for a stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: Hoff-dk
Reviews.Content: Upgraded to a room with a Strip-view. No line at check-in or check-out. Nice breakfast at the 31th floor. Clean rooms. Good service. If going to Las Vegas again, I would definately go for Paris

Reviews.Title: “A must miss!”
Reviews.Author: traveler12355
Reviews.Content: The casino floor itself was fine, just like all the others. However, for what we paid per night the room was a total dive!!!! No water pressure in the shower, requested a king bed and got two queens with linen that was nothing to write home about. Outdated television and the mini bar didn't work. For over 250 a night it was a major disappointment!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, friendly staff, great experience”
Reviews.Author: mlw44
Reviews.Content: On arrival checked in without any queues, even though it was Saturday. There were plenty of staff ready to assist. First impressions were "WOW" and just how clean the place was with a great atmosphere. The room was very pleasant, my only complaint about the room was the walls were very thin and could hear the conversation from next door, although our room was a interlinking room. Bed was very comfortable, very spacious bathroom. The Eiffel Tower restaurant was amazing venue for our anniversary meal, it was very expensive but very nice. It was expensive for food and drink in comparison to home, but in line with the rest of Vegas!!! The Beatles show "Love" was amazing!!!!

Reviews.Title: “BEDBUGS!!!”
Reviews.Author: Crazytraylor
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE!!! We stayed here for 4 nights and had a terrible stay. My husband and I both developed a rash while we were here and had the EMT in our room - never considered that it would be bedbugs in a 4 star hotel bud it was confirmed for us when we got home.Never mind that we were hung up on twice before we got through to talk to someone. I thought that possibly the hotel might show some concern - very funny. When I got home to follow up with our health care provider and found out it was bedbugs, then contacted the hotel their response was- "we can't confirm that" so BEWARE- unless the hotels determines that you have bedbugs it isn't their concern. No customer concern- BE WARNED!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Refused to accept Luxury Room”
Reviews.Author: wclady
Reviews.Content: I red several reviews before booking Paris. I could have made reservations at less expensive hotels, but like many reviews stated. Location - Location - Location! Our number one goal was to visit the new City Center, my guy is quite heavy, so I wanted to lessen the walking. The check-in line was ridiculously long! It was a 30 to 45 minute wait in line. Once checked in, we headed straight up to the room. Elevators are relatively close. From the doorway I could see the King sized bed SUNKED AND SWAYED LIKE A HAMMOCK! C'mon Harrah's, Seriously?! Normally I would just put up with it. There was just no way this time. I CHOSE Paris over many other options. I immediately called down to the front desk. Linda was VERY helpful, I explained the status of the room. She said that she could upgrade us to a Red Room with a View. Unfortunately, there are no handicapped accessible rooms with a view. We did however get the Red Room, only we had no view. We faced the back of Bally's hotel rooms. Inside and out, Paris is beautiful. The ambiance inside is as other's have noted. Slots are super tight, as I've found with all of Harrah's casinos in Vegas. Liked - Red Room Didn't like - Disabled people can't get a Strip View Room?

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: DonzodogIndiana
Reviews.Content: Stayed at paris from march 16-20 with the guy`s for march madness, Everything was fantastic from the great staff to the great food. Rooms were clean and very nice, checkin was a breeze, and location A +. The bartenders and cocktail waitresses were very good and friendly. over all this hotel was fantastic Thanks Donzo Indiana

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zoeluma
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Paris hotel twice and will be there again next may 20th thru 27th. We've experienced Caesars and Monte Carlo before but the feeling of France is special to us. We hope to get an upgrade this time, because the rooms we've had before had no views of the strip or the pool. Once again, we will dine at the Mon Ami Gabi, one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas. Try the buffet for breakfast, it is simply marvelous.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: weluvmick
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paris Hotel in Las Vegas in December 09. Trying to get away from the cold weather, it followed us. Record lows of 33 degrees that weekend. The location was great. Directly across the street from the Bellagio. The rooms were ok. They were clean but seemed a little outdated. The hair dryer didn't work at all so you may want to bring one as a back up. Overall it was a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “C'est manifique!”
Reviews.Author: cburtond
Reviews.Content: The service day in and day out from everyone at the Paris - reception, housekeeping, concierge, casino staff, meals, shopping etc was exceptional. It was the coolest place to stay (and I checked out a lot of the hotels) with the footings of the tower from the casino floor punching through the sky ceiling. Right across for the endlessly beautiful Bellagio fountains.

Reviews.Title: “Still a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: greenseahorse
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris from 3/2/10-3/8/10. We arrived at 7:30 pm on a Tuesday evening with no line at check in. Check in was fast and efficient. Unfortunately, no complimentary upgrades were available but the check in agent did offer some upgrades at an additonal cost per night. We chose not to take these, and stuck with our luxury two queen bed non-smoking room that we had requested. I had stayed at Paris when it was first opened and was worried that the rooms would be showing their age badly as most rooms have not been remodeled since the opening in 1999. Fortunately, the carpet and bathroom were clean and the furniture was still in pretty good shape. The only thing that really stuck out at me were some stains on the upholstered furniture. The bedding in a standard "luxury" room is firm and not pillow top. The linens were clean and the bedspread was a light down blanket wrapped with two fresh sheets. I prefer this approach to the standard old-fashioned bedspread since you feel things are recently laundered. The room had efficient daily maid service, but the maid took liberties that I would not have preferred, such as putting pajamas away in a suitcase (how did she know what suitcase they belonged to?). The mini bar was expensive, but the $4 water in it was a better value than the smaller $4 water in the gift shop (everything is expensive in Vegas). The best feature of this hotel is the location. It is centrally located on the strip and it is quick and easy to get out of your room, through the casino and out onto the strip (compared to other strip properties). The casino itself is beautiful but boring. The pool is nothing to write home about. Would stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “If you fancy Vegas, try it out.”
Reviews.Author: burnski
Reviews.Content: Friendly top rate hotel, superb positioning on the strip,couldn't fault it.This was my third stay in Vegas in four years,i have stayed at the Luxor, Caesars, and now Paris, and i can honestly say that Paris is as good as Caesars, if not better.In Paris try out the Village Buffet not the cheapest in town but one of the best.The rooms clean, comfortable, and quite spacious, made this a great hotel to stay at .

Reviews.Title: “Vegas meets Paris meets Disney meets Chinese New Year”
Reviews.Author: travellerfourlife
Reviews.Content: Vegas is always a strange place, honestly not my favorite, but we went for a quick getaway burn up some Southwets point that were going to expire. Had not been in years. Paris, well, it is Vegas. Which means the hotels are huge, the lines for everything are very long, and there is a decided feeling of being hustled every time you turn around. Throw in Chinese New Year's with all of the decorations and gambling groups in town for that, President's Weekend and Valentines day and wow! The line for the buffet was 90 minutes. There were no tables at the Bistro, people were standing around with their trays waiting for you to finish. The staff form the hotel with whom we did intereact were all nice enough; the buffet manager came out ot pass out water bottles for everyone standing in line. But wiht the massive size of the hotel, there was just no way it could feel anyything but big, impersonal, almost industrial inthe way it processed the guests in and out. Nice room. Probably more a reaction to Vegas than to Paris in particular. Will not be backanytime soon. Oh, and the hotel charges for EVERYTHING. $5 to check in for your flight, no free internet, $7 for a bottle of beer in the bistro, no complimentray bottle water in the room. Vega$ baby.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome surprise”
Reviews.Author: funmumof4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris in Vegas back in October...I've been meaning to write this review because we were so happy with our stay there. We found a great CHEAP package deal with Allegiant Air and took a chance...didnt know if it would be cheesy or just fine...it was awesome. I think we paid $500 for both of us total, flight from Montana and 5 nights stay. When we checked in, a lovely lady (spanish, maybe? ) at the front upgraded us to a spectacular room for FREE, we didnt even request it. Our room was sweet, we had an amazing view of the Bellagio fountains just out our window, the view was the best part- the bathroom also was a real highlight...marble, separate tub and shower. The little french village theme of the hotel was really fun, the buffet restaurant was great with a good selection and yummy creme brulee. A real surprise, when we checked in at almost midnight, starving, was to go to this little restaurant- Ile St Louis...we ordered the special, preparing ourself for the worst and it was fantastic! Filet mignon, gourmet vegetables and rolls, for like $12. Finding internet was almost impossible and we were too cheap to pay an arm and a leg and the girl inside actually helped us out, made some phone calls about car rentals for us, just great service. Definitely going back.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Vacation”
Reviews.Author: PattyC3
Reviews.Content: Paris was a wonderful hotel , especially the suite we had over looking the pool/ and in our front widow was the paris baloon. and you can here the fountains of the Belagio.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and spacious but not overwhelming.”
Reviews.Author: shophappy36
Reviews.Content: Paris is large but doesn't feel that way because of the lower ceilings and smaller walkways. The food and pasteries are wonderful and not too overly priced. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The pool is okay. Not a lot of atmosphere out there but it was clean and beautiful and plenty of chairs were always available. This is a beautiful hotel and hotel staff is very nice. We got a good deal so it was a good value. I'm not sure that it's worth the overinflated price they usuallly charge though.

Reviews.Title: “I Had Fun At Paris”
Reviews.Author: mscman5
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Paris in a red room premier. The room had plenty of room if a bit dark in color. The bathroom was well nice and roomy. My view was not great but who sites in thier room and looks out the window. Maid service was good a bit slow but so what. I ask for some towels and was given three towels right a way. The room had no coffee maker since paris has a cafe that serves coffee. Check in and checkout where simple and as painless as possible. Overall I enjoyed my self and would have no problem going back and staying at Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Less than glowing this time”
Reviews.Author: stgregorygirl
Reviews.Content: Well, first of all, here is the good news. We stayed at the Paris several years ago and really enjoyed it. We were pleased when we first arrived with the general appearance of the hotel and the room as well as the ease in check-in. This hotel is in a great location across from the Bellagio. Mon Ami Gabi is a great restaurant( very good food at a reasonable cost), at this hotel with a terrific view of the fountain show at Bellagio. This is a particular favorite of my husband who just loves to watch that show. I also spent some quality time sitting by their lovely pool. Unfortunately, I must report that I was very disappointed in the maid service at the hotel. When one of my shoes went rogue, I looked under the bed. Big mistake! There were treasures there ( a pair of someone else's slippers, etc) These were not mine. This was a big turnoff for me. I would not recommend the hotel now. I hope they can get their act together because there are many good features here but I was very disappointed on this last visit.

Reviews.Title: “It was great !”
Reviews.Author: Allison040
Reviews.Content: Rather great experience from to end. Spa service was excellent. Restaurants were great! Will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, affordable, and fun!”
Reviews.Author: pumpkinpasty
Reviews.Content: So some friends and I booked a night at the Paris for some pleasure after our business stay at Caesar's Palace. We would have just extended our stay at CP but it was actually less expensive to go to Paris, so we did. What a huge difference! Pretty much every bit of the experience was more pleasant. All of the hotels on the strip are ostentatiously ornate, but I have a soft-spot for the Old World details of Paris. I've been to actual Paris, and I'd have to say that this hotel captures all my misty-eyed nostalgia about it. I'm completely ambivalent about that actually, but I have to admit that the incredible attention to detail both inside and out did charm and relax me. The rooms were fantastic. Unlike CP, they were uniform and also much more comfortable, despite actually being smaller. There were more places to sit and all of the amenities you expect (mirror in room and bathroom, closet in room NOT bathroom, soundproof, desk, TV, hairdryer, iron and ironing board, etc). The mattresses were divine. Service was very courteous and prompt. The restaurants ranged from extravagant to affordable. We ate at the Asian place (affordable) and the food was great. Nothing amazing, but reliable. The servers were also brilliant--very funny, and they would dance whenever a song from the Bellagio fountains (across the street) came on that they liked. If for some reason I ever find myself in Vegas again, I will definitely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great sisters weekend”
Reviews.Author: MissionViejoBoomers
Reviews.Content: We celebrated my sister's 60th birthday. We stayed at Paris Las Vegas and had an amazing view of the Eiffel Tower and the Bellagio Hotel. We could see the water show, the lighted tower and much of Las Vegas. It's cheaper to go the top of the Eiffel Tower on the day pass because in March it was dark before the 7:15 p.m. cutoff. We also went to see "Menapause the Musical" at the Luxor and it was hilarious. It was a really fun weekend and the perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Was Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: 03242011h
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 34th anniversary on Feb. 28 at Paris Las Vegas. Actually there from Feb. 27 thru Mar. 3. It was Nascar weekend and crowded. At checkin my wife did the $20 tip and we got upgraded to a red room. First night we had 2 queen beds ( room 2575), but on sunday we got to move to a king bed (room 2848P). It was a corner room with a great view to the south and east. Harrah's comped our four nights, and even let us stay well past checkout, because of late flight. Played only at Harrah's properties and and used comps to eat at them. Rio had a $24 eat all day there. There is a lady between Imperial Palace and Harrah's that hands out coupon for $5 off each person at all Harrah's and Flamingo's buffets. The dealers at the tables in Bally's and Paris give out 10% off coupons for the Paris Buffet. The shuttle bus drivers between Paris/Harrah's and Rio also give out 10% off buffet coupons to Rio. (You can't use coupons on all day, though.) Thanks Harrah's for letting us celebrate our anniversary with you. We had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “EXPECTED MORE...”
Reviews.Author: wen1973
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not a cheap hotel.... I would expect more from a higher end of the market.... Upon arrival the lady at counter on check-in was nothing but helpful and a delight to be greeted with.... The main lobby is a BEAUTIFUL site to see..... But once we opened the door to our room i was disappointed.... The room was tiny with a small beds not great for sharing with friends... It had a very old fashioned small television... Bathroom was a good size but when a friend tried to use the bath water leaked out everywhere.... When needing assistance from the reception during our stay the staff were not very helpful.... Also on departure after staying quiet sometime.... The little bit of survice we had went straight out the window.... This is my second trip to Vegas i stayed in the lower end of the market the first time (SAHARA HOTEL) and i found this hotel not worth the money....

Reviews.Title: “Paris is a wonderful place to stay - It's well worth checking out”
Reviews.Author: Mcstx
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Paris on several occassions and always enjoyed our stay. We are returning again next month for our third or fourth time. Forget the so-so reviews as they do not represent reality. We love the Red Room Premium with its Parisian appointments. The bathrooms are first rate and the cleanliness of the entire room is impecable. The Central location on the strip is exceptional. The food is good as is the entertainment and slot area. There is even a corridor connection to Bally's which gives you a change of pace without going outside. Harrah's has recently purchased Planet Hollywood which is right next door. Great shopping mall and slot area. The pool is great at Paris but don't forget that you can hang out at any pool located at Harrah's properties. You can be at any one of six or seven great pools within a safe, five minute walk. Be sure to obtain a Player's Card as it can be used at all of the Harrah's properties. The comps on the slots are very good at all of Harrah's properties. Take a free shuttle ride to Harrah's Rio Hotel. In addition to being a first rate hotel it is also a great base from which to enjoy the entire Vegas experience. P.S Check out the antique auto display at Imperial Palace. Awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious marble bath, clean room, great location”
Reviews.Author: RQR08
Reviews.Content: I was concerned that Paris might be showing wear and tear, especially compared to the newer hotels going up on the Strip. We stayed there because of the 3-night deal we got, and we were very happy with the room. I really object to shabby hotel rooms, but the bedding was clean and fresh, everything clean, and I really liked the spacious marble bathroom, big hot shower with great pressure, good light, plenty of room for my stuff AND my husband's on the counter. And the room was extremely QUIET, thick heavy doors. The lobby/casino, however, is LOUD. The location is great. Next time, I would probably pay for a room overlooking the Bellagio dancing waters. The food at the cafe right across from the elevators is really good for breakfast or lunch. Don't let the long line discourage you--it moves fast.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best value for money”
Reviews.Author: Dog_in_the_fog
Reviews.Content: Certainly, the outside appearance of the hotel and the location are superb. I booked the Red Premier room, and basically it was ok. Room was spacious, bed comfortable, it was rather quiet, bathroom - stylish. However, there was issue with cleanliness: some of the towels were dirty, and the sofa had very visible stains on it. View from the window was somewhat obstructed in its lower part with a kind of decorative railing. In general, I found that although this was a good hotel, the price was not adequate.

Reviews.Title: “No poker room! but a nice view”
Reviews.Author: bmsozzy
Reviews.Content: I couldnt believe it when they said they didnt have a poker room!!! You had to go next door to Bally's (the 2 are attached) to play. Thats just crazy. My room was comfortable but not fancy with a very nice view of the Bellagio fountains. Overall a pretty nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Paris was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: dachsielover
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at paris las vegas and enjoyed every minute!! It is a lovely hotel I was very nervous after reading other reviews but those people either had a bad experience or are just too picky!! We did the dinner and show package thru the hotel and would highly recommend this Anthony Cools is hilarious!! The location of the hotel is fantastic as well.

Reviews.Title: “Not what i expected”
Reviews.Author: weeza69
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in the perfect location on the main strip, looks awesome form the outside and overwhelming on the inside, the service on check in for us was over and ubove expectation...BUT, our room was ordinary, Basic TV, uncomfortable pillows, dirty bathrooms walls, leaking bath, one towel each. Our room had many faults, and was well below our expectation. Service was 50/50, depends on the day and the staff. On checkout all service was null and void, they were rude, stupid and not at all helpful. Not value for money here.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Wedding”
Reviews.Author: redismyneutral
Reviews.Content: The Paris Hotel was better than expected. The rooms were a nice size, the beds comfortable. We ate in three restaurants there, which were all well above average fare.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: zagnut01
Reviews.Content: Paris has a great location and was very accomdating. The room had a great view and the rooftop pool was pretty cool.

Reviews.Title: “They took care of us”
Reviews.Author: dbeaty
Reviews.Content: We were booked at Paris through Orbitz and I had never stayed at this resort before. I was pleasantly surprised. This hotel was the official hotel of the DSE expo and I'm not sure if it was booked directly through the website portal of the Expo. When we checked in at 12:45AM we had been travelling all day and just wanted to get to our rooms. We had parked in the FREE self parking in the rear parking garage. It's a walk to the front desk but not to bad. They gave us all rooms on the 31 and 33 floor! All "P" style rooms. I was told these rooms go for four figures on special dates. We paid $129 per night. Each room had two bathrooms, seperate bedroom, living room with dining table, office desk and fax, couches charis, two TV's, wet bar, whirlpool spa tub. TV that rises out of the table in the bedroom. These were old CRT tv's. We were very happy with this totally killer deal and I don't know how we got these great rooms for the price. Fluke, or was it the Expo/deal? I can only tell you that if you get these floors and these rooms, they are great!

Reviews.Title: “Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EJCorretjer
Reviews.Content: It has everything you are looking for if you go to Vegas for fun and not a confrence.

Reviews.Title: “Aweasome!”
Reviews.Author: Jolene33
Reviews.Content: Was very comfortable bed and very soft pillow's. Made me want to live there. Great stores and wonderful thing's to eat and buy! Wish the smoking was non-existent!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel5791
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at "Paris" and loved it. Check-in was a breeze, upgraded to a "Red Room" with a fabulous view of the strip. Didn't want to leave and can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Frenchness GUARANTEED!”
Reviews.Author: Kinjockity
Reviews.Content: Gr8 location, Gr8 food, hotel and casino! Enjoyed the stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place..........”
Reviews.Author: tedWisconsin
Reviews.Content: First time staying at Paris......Would stay again...............Big rooms, clean, staff was great from check in to check out.....Three recommendations that we could make would be, more than one shuttle to Rio in the evening hours, room hall cleanliness(dirtty dishes in the hall) and was surprised at a visit from the "room check lady", knock and immediately enter....Otherwise a very nice stay...........Need more bar wait staff...Too long for a drink...

Reviews.Title: “It really feels like your in Paris”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaHasil
Reviews.Content: THis is a very classy hotel. My new husband and I were getting married in Las Vegas and stayed at the Paris for four nights. It was absolutely fabulous. We felt as if we were rich although we can only afford modest priced hotels (we booked through Travelocity), and had a grand view of the Belagio's water show from our window!!! We were also especially delighted with the fact that we were so close to everything. In addition, the restaurants in Paris are fabulous. Many are within a reasonable price range with excellent food. Although the Consierge did make an error on a show we booked by telling us the wrong directions, he made up for it by crediting us for the Taxi we had to take and also sending us up champaigne and chocolate strawberries through room service. It was a wonderful surprise for us. We will stay here again the next time we come.

Reviews.Title: “Celebration Trip”
Reviews.Author: SherryA2
Reviews.Content: We had a great time. The Red rooms overlooking the tower are the best!

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: gasteph83
Reviews.Content: Nothing special.. the food was OUTRAGEOUSLY priced.

Reviews.Title: “Superb value”
Reviews.Author: nick1759
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel which I cannot fault in anyway. Just got back from 8 nights at the Paris, we booked through Cityand Show.com and got the 8 nights for £320. On arrival we wer offered an upgrade and decided not to take and then wondered what room we would be allocated, we should not have worried, as we were given a corner room on the 18th floor which overlooked the Bellagio fountains.
