The room was enormous, we had read on previous reviews about asking for a corner room, as they are about double the size of a conventional room, so recommend that to everyone. This was our fourth holiday in Veags and first at the Paris, so can compare and this was definately the best value of any

Reviews.Title: “our wedding and honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: AmandaM13
Reviews.Content: we married in las vegas on Oct. 25, 2008 and stayed @ the Paris Las Vegas Hotel.. Everything about Paris Las Vegas is AmAzInG!! Such a beautiful place~We ate at the Eiffel Tower restaurant the first night we came into town and the food was absolutely to die for! Such a wonderful and elegant restaurant with an stupendous view of the Las Vegas strip and the Bellagio hotel and water show.. The rooms that we stayed in at the Paris Las Vegas hotel were just as amazing! Very comfortable for me and my girls before the wedding and for me and my husband after the wedding!! I would recommended that anyone planning a trip to Las Vegas to look into the Paris Hotel... You certainly get your moneys worth at this fine establishment! Viva Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Paris Las Vegas Hotel and Casino”
Reviews.Author: JohnT24
Reviews.Content: French themed hotel.Including great dining,shopping,and entetainment.Large hotel,but feels cozy,due to French decor.Very classy.Never looks dated.Convenient location.Public transit outside hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Johnnydark
Reviews.Content: Have never been around a more rude staff than Paris Las Vegas. Only one employee seemed to be nice and that was the check in clerk. Everyone else from the casino floor workers to the servers in the restaurants were incredibly unfriendly and rude. Have stayed at all other Harrahs properties in Las Vegas and found Paris to be the worse. Room was nice but that was it.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: WalidA1
Reviews.Content: I personally guarantee that you will have fun, what happen in Vegas stays in Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: KatieG6
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay thery bumped me up from a regular room to a room with a view because it was my birthday and the room was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: hockeymom02
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris while attending a convention that was being held at Bally's. We found the staff to be very friendly at check in and very helpful when we needed a map or directions. Our room was clean and the bathroom spacious. We stayed on the 22 floor and had no trouble with noise, in fact, I was surprised at how quiet it was at night. The is a nice hotel for the price and has a good central location. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in LasVegas”
Reviews.Author: sml1332
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd time staying at Paris - I will never stay at another Hotel in Vegas - centrally located - great food - wonderful & friendly workers - clean rooms and fantastic views!

Reviews.Title: “Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: dms1989us
Reviews.Content: great food and nice hotel, would stay again. friendly staff, go to the top of the eiffel at night its better than in the day and you can see the water show below

Reviews.Title: “Lauren's 21st Birthday!”
Reviews.Author: LorraineW1
Reviews.Content: It was a great trip, first time for all of us! Beautiful hotel!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KathyS7
Reviews.Content: It was the best location, best price and beautiful hotel...make sure you visit the bistro directly on the strip sidewalk....best food ever

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Robindevuono
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful inside and out. The location was perfect and the food was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “I was scammed in the hotel elevater at 2 am for money.”
Reviews.Author: trudyvanhorn
Reviews.Content: I was going up to my room alone at 2 am. I got on the elevater and a nicely dressed amn got on an pushed a higher floor. He asked if it was just him or were there a bunch of rude people that worked at Paris. I told him everyone had been nice. He tells me he has a masters degree and his bussies had stayed at the hotel but they had left and took his wallet and his flight was leaving in 3 hours. He needed me to LOAN him $17 to get a ride to the airport. He got off on my floor where no one was around. I got in my pocket and gave him a $25 chip. I wanted him gone and I was not getting into my money. I did not feel scared untill he was on my floor and no one was around. He thanked me and got back ont he elevater. He fekt he was lieing but, I still didn;t know what to do. Had he asked me on the main floor it would have been easy to say no. I called security and they said" Tell me you didn;t give him any money" Easy for them to say they werent alone with a strange man,. There is an emergency phone on the elevator. Stay on the elevator and use the phone is my advice.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious fun”
Reviews.Author: LotusH
Reviews.Content: It's a beautiful hotel, with a great view. I went in November so I didn't get a chance to partake of the pool. but the lobby is huge and very luxurious

Reviews.Title: “Paris, France in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Bordnsac
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paris Hotel in Vegas during my birthday. I told the lady at the front desk that it was my birthday and she booked me in the best room ever! We were on the 29th. floor with views of the Effel tower, Bally's, Bellagio and the beautiful fountains in front of the Bellagio hotel. I have been to Paris, France and the hotels there are old with antique furniture. I thought the furniture at the Paris Las Vegas was going to be the same. It was very modern and the room was beautifully decorated with a huge flat screen TV. I also enjoyed the separate tub and shower as well. Walking along the shops and restuarants by the casino, I felt as though I was back in Paris. I would definately stay there again. P.S The fountains have music with a booming sound, so if you go to bed before midnite beware, it is really loud!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Decor and Superb Views”
Reviews.Author: katyford
Reviews.Content: My friend and I travelled to Vegas in October and spent four nights at the Paris hotel. We were really lucky to get upgraded to a room with views of the Bellagio Fountains, Pool and Eiffel Tower which was amazing!! In summary... Pros: - We loved the decor in the hotel and rooms. Very sumptuous and cosy - Food was very good, although the buffet was not as nice as I remember in 2008. - Great atmosphere and good variety of machines, if you're into the gambling. - Excellent views - Good size pool and very good poolside service - Beautiful hallways on each floor - sounds odd, but each floor has a beautiful lobby with mirrors and plush seating, which I really loved! - Very comfy beds Cons: - It takes a while for the sun to reach everybody around the pool - at 11am half of the poolside was still in shadow and by the time it reaches everyone, it starts to creat a shadow again. Not good if you're a hardcore sunbather! - The pool is all one depth and not at all deep. I like to have a proper 'deep end' where you can't touch the bottom, but I think the entire pool is around 3ft deep.

Reviews.Title: “upgrade to the premier!!!”
Reviews.Author: kolarbear
Reviews.Content: Without the view this would be just an average review, but the red room premier upgrade makes all the difference. The room itself was nice, not fantastic. Good closet space, nice alarm clock, nice tv, free space in the mini bar fridge, nice bathroom. The bed wasn't the most comfortable; weird pillows,minimal covers, small shower. Room service was really good, quick and a reasonable price. With that said, the view is worth the price of the upgrade. It overlooks the pool, eiffel tower and bellagio fountains. I assume some even face the new city center. I turned the sofa around to face the window and enjoyed many of the different fountain shows. You can even hear the music. That could be the one draw back though, the boom of the fountains and music is quite loud, but I enjoyed it. The rest of Paris is just okay. I like the atmosphere of the casino and ceiling, along with the street of shops etc. But the restaurant selection did not suit me. The service at the 24 hour cafe was sub-par. There was a 15 minute wait for a place that was about 10% full. The rest of the service was also slow, understaffed I guess. The food was not very good. The other sandwich shop (JJ's) was also operated poorly. Very slow, confusing, not very tasty. I recommend room service or eating elsewhere. The Paris location is nice, very central, but I would not recommend this hotel unless getting a room with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Don, Bother staying at Paris”
Reviews.Author: Zades
Reviews.Content: The food is fair, the rooms are marginal,and the overall service is poor. This hotel is grossly understaffed and therefor is not interested in providing good customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the RUDE and COSTLY ROOM UPGRADES at Paris!”
Reviews.Author: wangy
Reviews.Content: After booking our trip two months ago via Expedia, the time finally came to check in to our hotel the Paris. Part of Harrah's. We arrived at 7:30p.m. right from the airport. We were then told our room was not available. We had reserved and paid for two months ago...a King, non-smoking room. Well, they told us rooms like that are gone at 5p.m. All that was left was smoking rooms. How can this be if we reserved our room two months ago? They told us to call Expedia. So to get our room, we had to pay $40.00 per night for an upgrade to a VIP room. A room that is not any bigger than what we had rented. And had no view or anything. Just a scam they pull during these tough times to make a buck extra. They were very rude at Paris. Its just like being in France. They hate Americans. Well. We hated our stay, and hated the rip off. So avoid this place at all costs!!!! Stay at a MGM/Mirage hotel if your going to Vegas. They have the best beds anyways.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay at Paris”
Reviews.Author: luci5
Reviews.Content: Check in is normally 3-4pm, but we managed to check in at noon. Got a nice check in clerk and asked if there was a P room available. The only rooms that were ready were a P room on the 4th floor or a regular room on a higher floor so we opted for the P room and were allocated Room 472P. She checked for the next few days, but there were no P rooms on a higher floor available. I asked if the hotel was busy/full and she said they were at 98% capacity and had never gone below 85%. No wonder they can keep their rates relatively high. We were in the room by 12 o’clock. Nice room at the end of the corridor on a corner. It had two windows, one facing Bally’s and the other with a partial view of the Bellagio fountains. King size bed with 3 drawers each side, 2 closets, one housing the iron and ironing board with the TV and 3 drawers between. There were 2 armchairs and a table under one window and a sofa under the other. Well stocked mini bar. The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable as it was a pillow top mattress and was like sleeping on a cloud. The desk with internet cable was in a small room between the bedroom and bathroom which also had a large closet that housed the safe. The safe was set up high so not handy for checking if it was empty without standing on a chair. Internet access is $14.99 for 24 hours. Good sized bathroom with toilet, single sink, bath, large separate shower and hairdryer. Nice toiletries including mouth wash and a vanity kit. We really liked the room as it was spacious, well furnished and spotlessly clean. There is a note in the room saying you can use the middle shelf of the mini bar to store your personal items. This is unusual as most of the mini bars in Vegas are fully stocked with items on pressure pads and items are charged to your account if you remove them for more than a few seconds. There are loads of nice restaurants including Mon Ami Gabi which is a French Steakhouse with a patio area overlooking the Bellagio fountains. The Eiffel Tower restaurant is more expensive, but has fantastic views. There are also plenty more casual eating places. The casino is large and is beautiful inside. The ceiling is painted to resemble the sky with clouds. The location is excellent as it is centre strip. This was our second stay at Paris and hopefully won't be our last.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and tawdry, but a good deal”
Reviews.Author: hrme17
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I were in Vegas for a convention and we stayed at Paris four nights. Paris is definitely a "second tier" hotel, not nearly as nice as some of the others on the strip but the room was acceptable and clean. The other casino/hotel features are pretty depressing and have seen a lot of abuse. This place is tired. Location: Central strip across from the Bellagio. If you want to be on the strip, you couldn't ask for a better location.The elevators are not too far from the main entrance to the hotel, which allows for quick access to the strip and other amenities (which you're going to need, because the Paris is lacking a lot of the support functions that some of the other casino hotels have). Room: adequately sized, with a comfortable bed and a spacious bathroom. The furniture was cheaply made and some pieces showing wear, but everything worked (and the one lamp that didn't was fixed quickly and efficiently by hotel staff). View: most rooms at Paris do not face the strip, but we were happy to be looking out on the mountains beyond the city. Below us was the parking garage and air handlers, but who's really looking down anyway? The support areas (restaurants, shops, bars, casino) are where the Paris really seems to be lacking. The stores are all in-house stores (with annoying names like "Le Journal" and "Le Tabac") selling "Parisian" souvenirs. The main drag, or "Boulevard", is loud, crowded, dark, and dingy. The waitresses & cigarette girls wear cheap, tawdry bustiers which are ill-fitting, creating a trashy rather than sexy ambience. We went elsewhere for almost everything (drinks, spa treatment, snacks, dinner, shows, even breakfast). We did eat at "Le Buffet" once but found it to be more cheapo cafeteria style than nice. There were very few bars that didn't have gambling tv-screens built into them, and those that didn't were deafeningly loud. The one think I can say about Paris is that the service was friendly and efficient. Our check-in/check-out was quick, when we did have problems with the rooms they were dealt with pleasantly and quickly. Still, next time I'm hitting one of the less dingy hotels, maybe the new Aria at City Center across the street, or Wynn which looks way classier.

Reviews.Title: “1st Vegas Trip”
Reviews.Author: msindependent09
Reviews.Content: Great place, lots to see, great view from my room of the Bellagio light show.

Reviews.Title: “LeCafe..slow service, dead and cold food, uncaring staff, and overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: jeannelg
Reviews.Content: Waiter said he likes pancakes at LeCafe, I complained cold and tough. Of two people that ordered them neither were able to eat them. He didn't pay for them but we did. Will not stay at Paris again. Live and Learn.

Reviews.Title: “5th time at the Paris, still great fun but a few concerns.”
Reviews.Author: madbeach1997
Reviews.Content: My husband and I retruned to the Paris during Super Bowl weekend. We had three nights comped and wanted to take advantage of it. We were completel satisfied with our room. Houskeeping was (as usual) helpful and efficient. Check in was quick and friendly. As we do each trip, we ate at the Mon Ami Gabi (once for dinner, once for breakfast) Food wa terrific and the service beyond reproach. We did not realize that they served breakfast until the server at dinner suggested we come back for breakfast. We did for the simple fact that it was impossible to get in the Cafe St. Louis. We could not get in becasue of an obvious shortage of staff. There was a long line to get in but due to the fact that they were letting in only "Diamond Club" members, our line never moved. Being Vegas we realize that "high rollers" get priority. No problem...However, with an additional staff at the reception desk, they could have served us regular people as well. Will NEVER go back to the Cafe St Louis. It worked to our advantage since the Mon Ami Gabi had a much better breakfast for about the same price. No waiting! Total Reward staff was excellent this time around. Very helpful and did not try to rush you. We attended a Tailgate Super Bowl party at the Le Burger Brasserie. Somewhat disapointing. Very expensive for what you got. 90$ each. For that amount there was an all you can eat buffet with tailgate like food, two Miller beers each and a Miller T shirt (we were led to believe that it would be a Super Bowl shirt.) It wasn't. We had also expected that the food would be the excellent food normally served by Le Burger, it wasn;t. The big TV screen was great, the servers friendly and all and all it was fun. Just overpriced for waht you got. Also the procedure for getting in was not handled well and there was a lot of complaining by those of us who had reservations but still had to stand in a long line. Even with these concerns, we do enjoy the Paris and will go again. We just won't over pay for a Super Bowl party again and will stay away ffrom the Cafe By the way, the staff in the Sports Book were GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: jk020285
Reviews.Content: this hotel was brilliant we had a free upgrade due to renewing our wedding vows we had requested adjoining rooms and they sorted it for us without any problems. Nothing was too much trouble, the rooms were great large and comfortable with all the luxury you would expect. location is perfect. We had a hire car and parking is free. We asked for directions and tourist info and this was given without any problems. Everyone wants tips in america and Paris was no worse than anywhere else. The tower made an excelent location for our photos and staff were willing to take photos for us. An excellent hotel with comfortable rooms and I would certainly recommend the upgrade rooms.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: tink1016
Reviews.Content: It might not be the biggest but the Paris Hotel & Casino is the best in Vegas! It is such a fun and romantic place to stay. The rooms are beautiful & clean! The casino itself is such a fun place to play. LeVillage Buffet is the BEST place to have breakfast. '

Reviews.Title: “Dangerous - Theft is a Major Issue”
Reviews.Author: heitkamp2
Reviews.Content: As noted by several other reviewers, you are very prone to theft at the Paris. Apparently there are no security cameras anywhere. Our car was broken into while in the Paris garage. Clearly an inside job that the Paris won't even acknowledge. If you try to report a theft to the staff they act like you're wasting their time. Probably because they are in on all of the thefts going on there. STAY AWAY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location.”
Reviews.Author: KLEwing
Reviews.Content: I love being in the middle of The Strip. Paris is in the middle of everything. We had Bally's on one side, PH on the other and the Bellagio, Caesars and the new City Center on the other side of the street. Its easy walking to everything. Our room was a standard, 2 queen sized beds, on the 10th floor. The room was a normal hotel room, although the bathroom had both a shower and a tub. Rooms in Vegas don't generally have fridges, coffee makers and microwaves and this one didn't have any of that. The minibar in the room needs to be locked if you have kids because if anything is taken out for more than 45 seconds, the room gets charged. If you have kids, that could get very expensive, very quickly. Service at the hotel was good. We arrived early on Thursday and were able to get into our room right away. The staff was friendly. The beds were comfortable. Internet is $15 per day, so we did not use it. There was a free safe in the room. All in all, a good value, And try the buffett. The deserts alone are worth the price. Yummy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paris was a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: winky2me
Reviews.Content: Service was bad, not all bad, but enough to make me not want to return.

Reviews.Title: “Good cafe, central location”
Reviews.Author: madtsara
Reviews.Content: The Paris Las Vegas was a great place to stay -- it's centrally located on The Strip and the rooms were nice enough. There was a little French bistro type place on the ground floor and great pastry shop for breakfast. The casino was a bit small, but I'm used to Foxwoods, so it's weird for me to see smaller rooms. I didn't like that although we were staying at the hotel, we were supposed to pay to go to the top of the fake eiffel tower. We didn't go, and every time we thought about it we'd get cheesed off.

Reviews.Title: “Great Class, great food, and great ambiance!”
Reviews.Author: scottlove
Reviews.Content: Great hotel either for that short getaway or for that business trip that you need to close a deal fast. Either way, you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: LindaR123
Reviews.Content: The ultra luxury of modern travel. The in-room massage was exceptional and professional! Steam sauna shower with in wall jaccuzzi jets along with jeted tub and marbel floors. It was simply elegant. Mind you all on my bosses credit card!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay at the Paris”
Reviews.Author: skimoak
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas for 4 nights, from Saturday, Jan. 30 through Wednesday, Feb. 3. We needed a room for one night on Saturday (were staying at the Mirage Sunday through Wednesday), and decided on a comped stay at Paris. My husband has always wanted to stay there. The room type we reserved was Premier. We arrived at the hotel around 8:30 p.m. At check in, I requested a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower which we received. I tipped our helpful clerk $20.00, he was very polite and genuinely nice. Our room was on the 19th floor, I believe. The view was very nice and what we expected. We were able to see the Bellagio fountains, also. The room itself was clean and nicely decorated. The TV was older, but that wasn’t an issue because we never turned it on. The floor looked like it had just been vacuumed (you could see the vacuum lines), the bed was freshly made and the furniture was not dusty. The bed was not comfortable, the mattress was very hard and the pillows were lumpy. The bathroom was clean, with no stray hairs or trash lying around. I didn’t notice any mold issues in the shower or tub areas. The water never seemed to get hot, and the water pressure from the shower head was weak. The hairdryer looked fancy, but was not very useful. It was also very heavy. I have very thick hair, so for others the strength of the dryer might be adequate. We played in the Paris and Bally’s casinos until early morning. Both casinos had plenty of games that entertained us both. We enjoyed some slices of pizza from JJ’s Boulangerie. The slices were large and served hot. Overall, we did like this hotel for its excellent location. I would be curious to stay in one of the Red Rooms next time.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: LeonardoG1
Reviews.Content: the resort is amazing and beautiful, the frescos on the ceilings. the buffet is worth every penny

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff, dirty room”
Reviews.Author: Beancounter314
Reviews.Content: The location is great! But on our last day when we went to get the phone book there was a used condom wrapper in the drawer and a used condom box under the ottoman (moved it to put my feet up). No point in complaining on the last day, but I sent a message to the hotel that they should probably clean the room, but have had no response (it has been a couple weeks). - Beds are okay - Staff were nice for the most part - Rooms are average - one of the more open casinos on the strip I would go again if they had responded to my cleanliness issue, but they did not.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: LisaA4
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel. Staff was great rooms were very nice, food was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “One of the jewels on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: patsymolly
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful experience at Paris and would like everyone to know that it is a beautiful hotel with wonderful amenities. The staff is gracious and all employees are so friendly and helpful. My room (red room) was beautiful and extremely well kept. I love all the restaurants at Paris especially the Eiffel Tower Restaurant which is a must for dining. The food, service and the spectacular view are the best in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Paris - watch out for fraudulent charges”
Reviews.Author: BOLTON_10
Reviews.Content: Travelled for my 40th birthdaywith husband - paid to upgrade to a suite on arrival - suite was OK and hotel was OK - returned home to find $550 charged to AMEX for damage to room. Very puzzled as we were hardly in room and for sure did not damage anuthing - queried with hotel who said was dut to damage to a tsable but have not sent any proof through at all and I am definite we did not damage anything. Still awaiting more info from Paris about it but they are very uncommunicative and we have had to pay despite no proof from Paris about thedamage. Ruined my birthday! In future will photograph room on arrival and departure so as to not be RIPPED OFF AGAIN - in meantime still aswauiting a response from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but not in top tier..”
Reviews.Author: wsteinhauer
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Paris, and I will give it a good to very good rating. The room was nice, but noticed stain on wall and chair, and rip in lampshade. These things would not be tolerated in Bellagio. Self-parked, and the carpet from garage to casino is worn and dirty. Time to replace, and I would not advise tile, not carpet. No turn-down service as in Bellagio. Buffet was good, but a little dark, as are most of the common areas. Nice pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Great time, lovely hotel, very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: fertues
Reviews.Content: Reading the reviews before I left on vacation left me anxious of the hotel I had chosen. But, no bad reviews from me. We arrived at 11 am Friday, one person ahead of us at check-in. Staff was very nice, offered a upgrade to suite-and the room was available right away. Room was lovely-large bathroom, dressing area,fridge, coffee maker, very clean, king bed, a truly non-smoking room. Hotel is beautiful, halls at night very quite except last night we were there-we were awakend at 2 am by our new neighbors coming in, loud talking/laughing and and one of them beig sick in the bathroom. We called security and they were knocking on their door within 5 minutes-to quite down, in which they did. We didnt use the internet or spa, but it shouldnt be a surprise on the price because it says it clearly in the room. Great area on the strip, easy access to all others hotels, restaurants, shopping. Some areas on the strip kinda raunchy-past the Wynn hotel expecially. They need to remove the people passing out those vulgar/prostitute cards. All them end up on the ground, littering the streets, saw a lot of homeless people begging and one even urinating in public. Dont see much police present. Gambled a little, broke even, all fun. Wish we stayed one more day-because there is so much to see and do. Would recommend this hotel-GREAT EXPERIENCE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paris Las Vegas: Great Strip Location, Decent Rooms, Awful Parking”
Reviews.Author: trooks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris for four nights in early January and were satisfied with the hotel. Its location on the strip is fantastic and our un-remodeled room was OK. Our only real complaint was the trek to and from the parking garage when checking in and out. * Price. We paid $120 (Fri, Sat) and $79 (Sun, Mon) and thought this was a good deal. * Lobby. The lobby is nicely appointed, but is oddly located in the center of the hotel where the shops and restaurants are - i.e. a very busy area! * Room. Our room was older and had not been remodeled (they offered one for $40 a night more); it was comfortable and was certainly adequate for the money we paid. * Bathroom. While clean, it is on the smallish side and was certainly in need of remodeling. There is only one sink with a small vanity (a lot like European bathrooms). The tub was slow to fill and the caulking needed some work. * Parking. As other have mentioned the parking situation is not good. The parking lot is in the back of the hotel and is accessible from the strip or from Audrie street. Accessing the parking lot from the strip can be a problem when the strip gets jammed with traffic and pedestrians (which it often does). So I recommend entering the lot from Audrie street which is easily accessible from Harmon (see the accompanying photo). Once you've parked, to get to check in, you have to drag your luggage to an elevator, walk to another elevator or escalator, then navigate through all of the folks standing in line at the various restaurants to get to the lobby

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gbdoux
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Paris because of a great rate. Will go back because of the location and the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “do not park ur car in valet!”
Reviews.Author: baomihua0410
Reviews.Content: i lost my ipod-touch in the valet parking!!!! No one is taking care of this things! I cant believe they treat their customer like a nobody!!! guys, just wacth out ur things when u parking at the valet!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful romantic stay at Las Vegas Paris”
Reviews.Author: Texasgirly76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Las Vegas Paris over this past weekend. This was our second trip to Vegas, the first being over a year ago at Harrah's. We really enjoyed our stay. Room was clean and beds were comfy. We were upgraded to a room with a view of the Bellagio fountains, just lovely! Not sure about some of the negative reviews, were these people at the same hotel? Staff was very friendly. I think the ones who complained were probably ugly and got ugly in return? We found everyone very courteous and helpful. Love the architecture, lots of attention to detail. We walked over to the new Aria? complex nearby, impressive (in size) but not for us. Very cold, no interior plants and lots of white and silver. BOLD describes it best. I always appreciate living plants inside, it makes a huge statement. Bellagio does an exceptional job with plants more than anyone else. Unlike the other reviews, we did not notice the cigarette smoke too bad. Yes it is present, but not as bad as some other casinos. Harrah's seemed much worse on smoke, however, we loved the energy in the casino at Harrah's slightly better. Although, Paris' casino was smaller and easier to get around. Overall, very pleased, restaurants terrific too (for dinner, many closed for lunch except for burger, sandwich, buffet). A word of caution, however, buffet lines do get long for breakfast/lunch. If you want something reasonable with no line, try PF Chang's next door at Planet Hollywood. Also heard rumor that Harrah's, which owns Paris, Caesar's Palace, etc. has purchased Planet Hollywood, but is not on total rewards card yet. Watch for it in future. Would return again! Thanks for a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid, much better options in Vegas, all Trip advisors should ban this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: flowerbrdg
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Paris hotel, when I could not get a reservation at another hotel for a friends wedding and business meeting. Because of some unforeseen events I had to delay my arrival from mid morning to afternoon and I was checked in by my secretary, she told me that I received a complimentry upgrade to a suite and that my card keys would be waiting for me at the front counter. When I finally arrived the girl (Marie) that checked me in was acting suspisciously: asking "who checked you in?" and kept going back and forth between the front desk and the back room, people who were inline in 3 places behind me were already checked in and going to their room and she kept typing and walking back and forth, I definitely knew something was going on. Finally when I got my room keys and arrived to my room the first thing I remarked on was, "wow these suites are very small, they are the size of all the other hotels regular rooms." That night I had a small function with my collegues and saw my secretary who asked how I liked my room, I told her I was very unimpressed and described the room to her, she noted that that was not my room, infact it was even on the wrong floor that she checked me into, she came to see the room and she noted that this was not a suite but a regular room. Since it was so late I waited until the next day to call the front desk to ask what happened to my suite and why I was put in a regular room. The person I was talking to said "you did not get you room because you refused it, it is noted here." I told her that that was absurd, first I would never turn down a free upgrade (who whould?!?) and I was never even asked if I wanted it or not. I spent the rest of the day talking to other people in the hotel and I came to find that this Paris Hotel representative, Marie, took my room away from me and sold it to somebody else so she could make a comission. This was very upsetting and I reported to every person in the Paris Hotel I could find as well as Harrah's corporation (who owns Paris) of what Marie did, every single person, website, letter, email and etc. was ignored, no response, no appologies, nothing, what a disgusting company. Then to add insult to injury they charged my credit card twice for my hotel stay. Nothing but a bunch of crooks I tell you, never stay there, give then none of your business, we need ban these companies that think they can treat customers like this.

Reviews.Title: “My take on the Paris Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: KarenR16
Reviews.Content: The room was a corner room with King bed and large bathroom with separate shower and tub. The room was clean. The view of the Bellagio and the lake with fountain show was great. Walking through the casino was awful due to the extreme level of cigarette smoke. We ate at a cafe just off the casino the first night and all we could smell was the smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was better than I could have imagined!”
Reviews.Author: csuralph
Reviews.Content: We parked in the very easy to navigate parking garage, entered the hotel, and walked through the beautiful hotel. We easily found our way to the front desk where there was a line of about 15 groups. As soon as we got in the line, a manager approached us and asked if we would do her a favor and give the clerk a card so that she could track how long we had to stay in line. We had to wait for about six minutes and we received a free room upgrade just for doing a little favor for the manager. The desk clerk was extremely friendly and professional. We found that if we smile at workers they treat us with respect and they will be extra friendly. Our room was amazing. It faced the Eiffel Tower and Bellagio fountains which were awesome! Everything was immaculate and the bed was very comfortable. There was a huge flat screen T V, a comfortable couch, two huge closets, and a beautiful bathroom. There was also a safe which was nice because we kept winning money! We went to the spa one morning for massages. It was a terrific facility with everybody so helpful and courteous. The locker room and showers were perfectly clean and comfortable. There was water, juice, fruit and coffee for free while we waited for our massage and overstuffed chairs and couches to relax in and watch TV. It was cold and drizzling the entire time we were there so we didn't use the pool but we walked around the deck and it was really nice. There were cabanas and plenty of lounge chairs. The casino is typical with plenty of table games. The sportsbook is pretty impressive with plenty of places to sit and watch a game or the horse races. In the back of the sportsbook is a very cool sports bar. It is very well laid out. We ate in the French bakery for breakfast one morning and at the burger restaurant for dinner one night. It was pretty expensive but really delicious. The waitresses dress very nicely (wink wink) in the burger restaurant. Napolean's dueling piano bar was raucous, loud and a ton of fun. They really get everybody to join in and party. We had the time of our lives and I would recommend the Paris Hotel to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Pass on Paris”
Reviews.Author: brdennis
Reviews.Content: This hotel gets my first review ever, and long story short - I will not stay here again. I normally stay at the Rio when I am in Las Vegas, but thought I would stay on the strip this time. Check-in as mentioned below is a joke, poorly staffed and just indifferent with guests. The room was extremely clean, but maybe the worst mattress I have ever experienced - the individual coil springs could be felt just by placing your hand on the mattress. When I called down to the front desk I was told all the rooms have the same mattresses - did I mention indifference by the staff. Several rays of room seervice food that were in the hallway when I checked in at 2:30 PM were still there when I checked out the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Bon Voyage! Viva Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: theboyvegas
Reviews.Content: Think crepes. Delicious french faire served from vending carts around the mall and casino. Rooms are spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Wedding/Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: rrmorris
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice upon entry and the food there in the buffet and casino area was good. The rooms were clean and I have no complaints with housekeeping but the staff was not overly friendly. There are other hotels on the strip that are just as nice at half the price. We were married at the hotel chapel and was very disappointed in the photos that were taken by the photographer. It was a very rushed photo session and for the price. The spa is way way way over priced and did I mention the 18% tip that is included, no matter how great or horrible the attendant may have been they still made tips. I had hair and makeup done there for my wedding and I don't mind spending money if it is something I have asked for, however during my makeup session false eyelashes were applied which was fine but I would have liked to have been notified of the 35.00 additional charge for the lashes I could have applied myself for $10 or less, and the two tiny hair ornaments that were placed in my hair during the style cost me $12 each, which after the fact I was informed they were not included in the price I was given initially. So the attendant received a $58 tip and I was very unhappy when I received my bill. Also they do have a fitness center available but it will cost you an additional $25 per day for the use of the facility.

Reviews.Title: “Disappoint with front desk service”
Reviews.Author: FRONTPAGESAINTLOUIS
Reviews.Content: There was alot of things that were really nice about this hotel especially most of the people who work there. However, when checking in I requested a room facing the Bellagio Water Show, I was told that I would have to purchase the Le Rendevous Lounge Package in order to get a front facing room. I bought the package, which was nice as was the room. I later found out that buying the package was not required and I felt I was deceived by the front desk clerk. But eveything else was really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a First-Timer”
Reviews.Author: hulksmashdave
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris from 1/12/10 - 1/15/10. This was (except for a one day trip to a rushed wedding) our first trip to Las Vegas and we were pleased with Paris all together. The casino was clean and we liked the atmosphere. (Like the streets of Paris) I asked while checking in if we could get a room with a view considering it was our first time on the strip. The lady, who was nice, told me that it would be an extra $55 a night for a better view. We settled for a room on the 32nd floor. The room was very clean and the maid service was fantastic. However, aside from the shower stall, there was nothing that couldn't be found at a nice Holliday Inn. The location on the Strip made everything fine, though. I will say the restaurant Mon Ami Gabi was great and we ate in the Eiffel Tower restaurant on our last day and it was great also. The food at both places is worth going to Paris for. All in all, we had a great time in Vegas and Paris was part of that great time. If you are VERY PICKY about the stuff your room has in it, (Why you would be with so much to do in that city is beyond me) maybe you should stay somewhere else. Paris was great for us, though.

Reviews.Title: “Goodd for 1 night”
Reviews.Author: TGBWorcestershire
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night at the start of a fortnights drive around the canyons and national parks of this bit of the US. Was quite tired and grumpy by the time we got arrived having waited for nearly 2 hours to pick up our hire car at Dollar (another story!) so didn't hesitate to upgrade for $40 more to a King room. It was large and spacious, with an excellent bathroom plus coffee making facilities and an inroom safe. The bed was very comfortable but overall we thought Paris was a little shabby. It was a good comfortable start to our holiday though albeit the Bellagio where we stayed at the end was far, far superior.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: conigs
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paris with my wife for three nights earlier this week. We had the room comped through Harrahs so the price was right! We were given a "Red" room, which I guess are their newer rooms. No issues at all with the room, but I do have to agree with other comments, that the sheets where not the best in the world. We only ate breakfast at the Village Buffet and we both enjoyed it. We did sped time next door at Planet Hollywood, and the mall. I mist admit, the Strip itself is just to busy and expensive! We spent a couple of nights down in Old Vegas and had a great time. The Micro-Brews at the Main Street Station are great, and just $1.50 compared to $7 on the Strip, and yes the porn cards are beginning to build up on the curbs, please can we get Vegas officials to do something about this? All in all another good trip to Vegas, the Paris met our needs.

Reviews.Title: “1st time in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Marius R
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Las Vegas. We stayed at Paris hotel. All was perfect. The room (luxury) and the view (Eiffel tour and Bellagio), too. This, maybe, because I tipped the receptionist to get a free upgrade. We arrived on 1st of January and I can say this period is much agglomerated. The pool was great (heated water) and also there are 2 jacuzzi with hot water. The weather was great, too (around 60-62 F for the entire period of 7 days). The only thing we didn't like on strip was the dirty on street caused by the pleasure cards distributors who were very aggresive sometime. I recommend to everyone this hotel due to its reputation, offered services, cleanliness, location on strip. If you are at Vegas, we recommend to rent a car to see the Grand Canyon. We rented a car for 2 days and we saw Red Rock Canyon, Valley of Fire, Hoover Dam and Grand Canyon. It's cheaper than organized tours for each location. Just wait to return back. There are a lot of things not seen.

Reviews.Title: “Okey Dokey”
Reviews.Author: Happyslots
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the last four years on our annual Vegas Trek. Great strip location which is BIG if you are a newbie in Vegas. Village Buffet is really interesting. Always hit the coffee shop in the AM for croissants and java...really good. Diamond club is mediocre compared to AC but that's Vegas...all are overrated compared to Atlantic City. Rooms are always clean and nice..The pool and gym are really good if you are in to that. Elevators are close access and work great. Have mixed luck there on the slots but our comps make it worth wild. Always get comped for rooms so have no complaint.....will be back in Sept. God willing.

Reviews.Title: “really nice”
Reviews.Author: baghdadlian
Reviews.Content: WE stayed at this hotel for 5 days in jan 2010 It is really beautiful and clean The check in was fast and staff very friendly The casino area is really nice The village buffet fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Does not live up to the Hype”
Reviews.Author: Scottinaboat
Reviews.Content: I travel to Vegas at least once or twice a year and have stayed at many of the strip hotels. This year Paris had a discounted rate and decided to try the hotel. You only get a view of the strip if you pay extra, and the hotel is average for Vegas. I would not stay here unless you got a very good deal. The internet is $15 per day per laptop!, a total rip off... to work out at the gym it's $25 per day...

Reviews.Title: “The Paris; Las Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarkS2
Reviews.Content: Great trip. Fun hotel. Great location on strip. Great service. Great room.

Reviews.Title: “Not too shabby, enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: nxtprodigy
Reviews.Content: Wow, where do I begin....well i just stayed from dec.24-27th 2009 and it was my first time in vegas ever. First off, our check-in didnt take so long, but we luckily beat a large line that formed after us. My friends and I requested adjoining rooms and they happily found us a pair. Location was best.....many casinos nearby to hop over to and its connected internally to bally's. I learned the gaming floor is smaller than most other casinos, but I liked it because we used it as our last gambling destination before bed anyway because the weather was frigid. Plus it was easy to navigate through and not overbearing like all the others. Theres a wonderful bakery for breakfast and I had room service food on the second night...a delicious turkey melt with enough fries to feed an army (and fair priced). All other food places inside were average to me. The rooms were very fair, not that visually stunning but more than adequate. Bathroom was pretty nice and had toiletries i needed. I also used the wonderful in-room safe to store my winnings. There was internet access but we didnt use it (not sure if its free). The tv supplies a lot of purchasable viewing stuff and amazingly 10 chinese channels (but we didnt order anything lol). The view was okay from our 22nd floor but it was pointed away from the strip, but I didnt mind too much. My only gripe was the beds (very uncomfortable) and lack of a microwave and normal empty fridge (they had the type where you touch something and get charged). There was also a convenient small store before the room elevators where i was able to buy a razor to finally shave my face and my friend bought pepto bismol LOL. All in all, paris is a great choice for a first timer....fun atmosphere, beautiful scene, and great location. Staff was also friendly (frontdesk, maids, dealers). I will probably stay at different hotels for all my future vegas trips, but thats because I want a different experience every time and to see what they all offer. Still, I'm glad paris was my first one and maybe one day I may come back to it. PS....funniest thing ever, we watched tv briefly just one night in the rooms and saw an episode of "Cheaters", and where did the big showdown occur? right at paris! LOL

Reviews.Title: “We've stayed at better .......”
Reviews.Author: Late-Starter-7
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th visit to Vegas and decided to stay at the Paris this time, but it was our least favourite hotel so far. The hotel is very well situated on the strip but the layout inside the hotel is not great. The reception area and elevator access are all located along the far wall which is also the main thoroughfair for people trying to get to the restaurants and cafe's and also the route into Bally's next door. Hence, this area gets very congested. It was always a struggle to get to and from the rooms each day through all the queues of people. None of the other hotels that we have stayed at have been laid out like this. In addition, the rooms seemed to be noisy, we could hear people in the neighbouring rooms and the housekeeping staff from the hall way. Our room was not made up on the first night and I understand these things can happen but it was not sorted out in a satisfactory manner which is why I am commenting on it here. The queues for food at the hotel were very long so we found it quicker to walk to Bill's or PH Miracle Mile Food court to get food. We had a great stay in Vegas as always and all in all the Paris was ok, very average, but not great.

Reviews.Title: “PARIS - Comme ci Comme ca”
Reviews.Author: OntarioChris
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home from four days in Vegas at Paris ( Dec. 29 - Jan 2 ). We have travelled extensively around the world and do have high expectations when it comes to our accommodations. It was our first visit to Vegas and we generally had a great time. The hotel itself bills itself as a FIVE STAR property. In our opinion, four stars would be a stretch. Please look closely when you arrive. Even though the property is only 12 years old, many parts of it are in dire need of a makeover. The entry doors to the rooms desperately need to be repainted and we found numerous holes in the drywall in the room and the hotel corridors. The rooms are looking weathered as well. They really need to be re - wallpapered in spots. If you expect to be rated as a five star establishment, these little details need to be addressed. I am objective enough to say that you do not go to Vegas to stay in your room; however, if you charge $200 plus per night, these deficiencies need to be fixed. The location of Paris is its greatest asset. The spectacular Bellagio and its magnificent fountains are right across the street and Ceasar's Palace and The Venetian are 10 to 15 minutes walks from the property. We celebrated the New Year at the Eiffel Tower restaurant. It was an excellent ( and very expensive ) meal and the subsequent fireworks show at midnight was awesome. We were lucky to see the Black Eyed Peas at Mandalay Bay and they put on a great show. We also caught a production of Zumanity ( Cirque de Soleil ) at New York New York. Once again, the show was outstanding and if you are there without kids, this show is an excellent choice. The absolute highlight of the trip was our helicopter tour to the Grand Canyon. We used Sundance Helicopters and their service was top notch. The helicopters themselves have little room but the pilot was very good. Let's just say the scenery is jaw droppingly beautiful - Mother Nature at her finest!!! Try the basin landing for champagne lunch; it was worth the extra $ to actually walk around the basin floor and marvel at the sheer size of the walls. Overall, our trip to Vegas was very good. The hotel itself was average. Next time, I would try The Bellagio or The Venetian. I would recommend it only for its excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “EXTREMELY OVERPRICED RUBBISH, Good location though!”
Reviews.Author: NICKtheMONKEY
Reviews.Content: Don't even bother, just carry on browsing others, get yourself into Caesars Palace, everything is overpriced, stuffy, and dirty, the staff are the most miserable people ever, even when taking your money, its just like being in france, HORRIBLE!!!! The rooms are disgusting and they dont tell you to get a strip view you have to pay a minimum of $40 per night extra on arrival. I had a great view at $100 per night for five nights over new year of seventeen air con units, cleaning staff are loud, and the stores etc are overpriced! The authentic french coffee or chocolate is straight from a machine, and its better in starbucks (next door in Miracle Mile arcade), dont bother trying to eat here the lines are bigger than the arrivals at the airport!!!!! TWO WORDS, DONT BOTHER!!!! Oh and another thing, the internet in the room is $15 per day PLUS tax, next door all three ways, Planet Hollywood, Bellagio and the one the other side of Ballys is FREE!

Reviews.Title: “Paris Hotlel”
Reviews.Author: bolsaguns
Reviews.Content: Great rooms with a view for a decent price. The room we stayed in had a great view of the strip. Lots of gaming to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay, friendly and neat”
Reviews.Author: RichardR4
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay, people are heplful, casino not to big, rooms are great. A lot of places to eat and centally located on strip

Reviews.Title: “Free upgrade to the Honeymoon Suite”
Reviews.Author: tonypenn217
Reviews.Content: I checked in alone because my friends were staying at another hotel down the strip. The young lady asked if I was alone and I told her "Here, yes, but my friends are staying down the street". She said , "Then I'll upgrade you to the Honeymoon Suite because you don't look like the type to trash it!" That was VERY nice of her...and my friends were jealous because down the street, they were staying and it WAS their honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “I Have A Whole New Respect for the Paris Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: lifeisshortOhio
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from December 27 until January 3, 2010. I must say this stay was superb from start to finish. We were upgraded to a RED ROOM with a nice view of Caesar's Palace and Treasure Island. Both of those hotels were launch points for the New Year's Eve fireworks so we had quite a display right outside our window. Lines were long all week for all of their food options so we walked to Bally's for quicker service and cheaper prices. The location is right on the strip with easy access to the Bellagio's Atrium and water show. The staff is courteous and helpful. Believe it or not the rooms were relatively quiet at night with most of the customers being on the elderly side. This stay was much better than our previous two stays because of the huge difference between the Red Rooms and the older, regular rooms. I would recommend the Paris Las Vegas to anyone and even the slot machines were relatively kind to us on this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Try the 'sandwich' -- it's worth it!”
Reviews.Author: ryandk
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Paris around 1pm on a Sunday afternoon. I had reserved a "Luxury" room for $55/night through one of the e-mails I had received from the hotel's e-mail list. I had read about the 'sandwich' on another site -- you slip a $20 bill in between your ID and credit card and ask about a complementary upgrade. The clerk we ended up with was a woman, probably in her early to mid-40s. I tried the sandwich when she asked for my ID and credit card, and asked if it would be possible to get a complimentary upgrade. She took the 'sandwich', and put the $20 on the counter next to her computer terminal. She searched for a room for us in the computer, and told us she'd found a room for us on the 26th floor. She didn't tell us which category of room it was, so I was excited to see what we ended up with. We took the elevator to the 26th floor, and was quite happy when I saw the room. We ended up with a beautifully renovated room with a view of the Eiffel Tower and Bellagio fountains. From the description on the hotel's website, I believe this room would be in the "Red Room Premier" category. The room was very clean and comfortable, and the room was pretty quiet for one facing the strip. The only noise we really heard was the Bellagio fountains across the street, which sounded a bit like firecrackers going off. The staff at Paris were very courteous, and the hotel's mid-strip location was perfect for exploring. I was thrilled with this hotel. I'd definitely recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kawaineko
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Paris 4nights. The hotel is great location. The room is very comfotable and clean. But buffet is not so good.

Reviews.Title: “PARIS, baby!!”
Reviews.Author: Piagirl1018
Reviews.Content: Excellent service! Gorgeous rooms! Right at the middle of The Strip! Yummy margaritas! LOL

Reviews.Title: “Location 10, Restaurant 10, Rooms 6”
Reviews.Author: Buffalogal208
Reviews.Content: Located in the middle of the strip, the Paris has a great exterior is convenient to shopping. There was a 3 hour delay in getting to our rooms which weree adequate, though everything is done to keep you in the casino (no free internet, limited TV channels, charge for spa). We don't gamble, but we won the jackpot with the Paris' Mon Ami, Gabi, an independent French restaurant with indoor and outdoor dining that faces the Bellagio and it's great water show. Over four days we ate 1 breakfast, 1 lunch and 2 dinners and all were outstanding. Since getting across the street can take 30 minutes in Vegas, we were glad to be in the Paris for the restaurant alone. So if you like to eat good food, don't mind a hard bed and small pillows and want a central location, this could be a good place for you. (PS Our 22 year old son got sick and the conceierge was very helpful in finding a walk-in clinic across the street. Kuddos for that.)

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade wasn't worth it.”
Reviews.Author: JonathCommerce_Mi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Paris Las Vegas many times over the years. This last stay I was told of an upgrade (for $40.00 per night) and decided to accept it. Well it sure wasn't worth it. The only real upgrade I saw was new carpeting, a head board which was mostly red,the mattress I think was new, a new flat panel TV but the furniture was a left over as it was scratched in many places. I was standing by the window and saw a layer of dust between the wall and the bottom of the bed which was white from the many weeks it had been there. For the most part I like Paris,however in combination with the Casino host tracking down a friend of mine ( I introduced myself to him, as I gamble as much as my friend does, and all I got was a fist bump then totally ignored) I will look somewhere else for my upcoming trip in March. That was an embarassing moment. I would still recommend it though to those who are new to Vegas or are not regular visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: macmomWyoming
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at Paris on several diffrent trips now ( Total Rewards offers) and have found our stays very nice. Rooms have been large, comfortable and clean. Love the extra pillows. Check-in has been quick and correct every time. Staff curteous and helpful. Their steakhouse and cafe is excellent. We also love the central location on the strip and access to the tram as well as the attachment to Bally's. We are planning another trip in March and will very likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - terrible room service”
Reviews.Author: snissie
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Paris a couple of times. The rooms are nicely furnished and clean, but for the money you can get a nice suite at other hotels on the strip. We ordered room service for breakfast and it was very disappointing. It was 45 minutes late (we waited an hour and a half for pancakes), the pancakes were dry, and the carafe that held hot water for tea had obviously been previously used for coffee so it made the tea taste terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Great restaurants, location, fine room.”
Reviews.Author: vegasniceguy
Reviews.Content: The wife and I stayed at the Paris for two nights right after Christmas. We have stayed at virtually every Strip hotel and a couple of downtown ones and a few local hotel casinos. We like the Paris tremendously. We have always been treated very politely. The rooms are nice but nothing outstanding. If you are fortunate to get one with a Strip view, it really is nice. We overlooked the Bellagio Fountains, very beautiful. They do need an electrical outlet by the desk. The water pressure of our shower wasn't the best and the TV is not a flat panel. Maid service was fine. The restaurants are excellent. Their buffet is one of the best in town and definitely not over-priced especially considering the variety and quality of food. We got a bottle of wine for $14. (it was fine by our standards) Mon ami Gabi is one of our favorite restaurants in Vegas. Get an outdoor seat so you can watch the Bellagio Fountains. Le Burger Bar was very good and has a 2 for 1 happy hour. The piano bar was much better than the one at the Pallazzo. The Steak House is fine, get a seat in the upstairs. We ate once at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant, it was exceptional but was expensive. Unfortunately, Paris stopped having a band nightly in the casino and went with a dj. There is a short walkway to Ballys next door. Ballys does have a quality band playing nightly and a much better gift store. The rooms aren't as nice as at the Bellagio or Wynn, but the elevators are great and easy to find. The casino isn't large so you can't get lost. If you have a car, the garage is one of the best in the entire city. It has easy access and is a short walk to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not as romantic as expected.”
Reviews.Author: mariposa01
Reviews.Content: For a hotel that sells itself as a romantic choice, I was really disappointed with the room (we got the basic guest room). The shower can only accomodate one person, and not all that comfortably. The bed was king size but not super-comfy. No pillow top or nice soft sheets or anything special. The tv was not a flat screen. It was just a small-ish regular tv. I had a much better, more romantic stay last year at the Mirage, also in a basic room. One other issue with the Paris is the very long lines at the majority of the dining options. We did splurge on a dinner at the Eiffel Tower restaurant. We didn't love the food but the ambiance was very nice and the service was good, though slow. I would not go back to this hotel for a romatic getaway no would I particularly recommend it given all the choices in Vegas. That said, there was no major problem with the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Yes to Paris!!!”
Reviews.Author: Susieq1047
Reviews.Content: First time at Paris. It was a comp from Harrah's group. This was a trip with a larger group which were actually staying downtown. First of all, at check in, even though it was a comp, I used the $20 tip trying to get a view and it worked great! Beautiful view of the Eiffel tower and the Bellagio Fountains! Check in was actually very easy and the the lady was very nice and informative. The room was smallish but very well appointed..I can't believe I forgot to get pictures. Double queen beds as I was staying with Son and his wife. Nice storage. The bathroom was nice with a soaking tub and glass shower. Towels and Linens were high end and comfy. We ate the LeVIllage buffet every morning and loved it! The food was delicious and the selections were great. Even in Decemebr..fresh sweet fruit! The Strawberries were awesome! They had a "Crepe" station and a Omelet Station too. Nice thing that happened was I slipped a tip to the omelet chef and he gave it back and said.."I accept your compliments but not your money!" What? In Vegas? I was impressed!! We ate at another little restaurant there and it was very good also. Getting around the hote/casino was easy. Elevator service was never a problem. Room service was great. Absolutely no complaints except the room was a bit small for 3 people...but have no problems with returning!! Access to the strip was easy and a short inside walk to Bally's. The location was easy access to several properties and right across the street from Bellagio and City Center. Didn't visit the pool or spa but if they were anything like the other things on property I am sure it would have been a great experience. The Valet service was really fast and again very accomodating and friendly! That was important because we were moving people around several times. Dealers were friendly but were greedy...lol Great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, poor maid service!”
Reviews.Author: WindsorTenor
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at Paris in as many years. Upon check in (with a very friendly and helpful front desk) we paid for an upgrade to a suite. A great deal ($50.00 per night) for a HUGE room. Two full bathrooms, one with a shower large enough for a party (that's another story) and the second with a 2 person jacuzzi tub. Separate sitting area partitioned off by a large armoire. The king size bed was very comfortable and the pillows provided were of various firmness. Our only complaint about the room was the maid service. Dirty glasses were not removed. Tables were not wiped off. The little plastic bag for the ice bucket was never replaced. Empty boxes that the shower soap came in, were never taken out of the shower. We are not messy guests, by any means, but the effort to clean our room was minimal, at best. I always tip the maids at hotels, but there wasn't a chance that was going to happen on this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Establishment”
Reviews.Author: Craazylulu
Reviews.Content: Yes, Paris does nickel & dime you a bit since there are no "in-room" amenities, but it is a beautiful establishment. The rooms are comfy, clean, and nicely decorated. Not having to pay for wifi would have been a nice treat but, not so much from them. I think it was a very nice place to stay for the weekend, and they give you a decent coupon book when you check in with some great deals to be had. This included a free ride for 2 to the top of the eiffel tower - superb! All of the staff we dealt with were very polite and helpful. It was a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay - swam in December!”
Reviews.Author: gloria001
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Paris 12/19 - 12/24 with a great rate in a regular room on 19th floor. Room was fine, nothing special and no complaints. The lines for the buffet were ridiculously long and while we wanted to try it, we were not willing to spend the time in line. On our last day we saw at 8:00 am there was no line so we tried it for breakfast. Maybe it was just the fact that it was breakfast but I seriously cannot see why people would line up for hours for that buffet. It was good but equal to any other buffet in Vegas (and we have tried many!!). You must try Le Burger - a wonderful little cafe with great food and unbelievably great wait staff!! We were very pleasantly surprised - one of our favorite meals and all staff smiling and friendly and made the trip enjoyable. Yes, we swam! It was chilly but the sun was out, the water was around 72 and we got in the hot tub first to not feel so chilled. The lifeguards were probably not happy about having to leave their little enclosed area to freeze in a chair but they were always good sports. There were very few people attempting the hot tub so had it to ourselves one day - it was very nice, so glad it was open (but closes at 4:00 and only one of two hot tubs open) This was our seventh different hotel in Vegas and it ranks right at the top. I would definitely stay there again, especially at the price ($75 Saturday night, $55 others). It was easy to get around in the hotel and I never got lost (unlike staying at MGM). You were always offered a drink in the casino, all staff were very friendly - we even had a note of thanks from our housekeeper for the modest tip we left! As stated before - location cannot be beat and now with the tram open from Bellagio to Monte Carlo it is quite easy to get to the far end of the strip. I would highly recommend Paris for everyone that is not looking for elegance but wants a nice hotel with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MIKET11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 5 day 4 night trip to Vegas, we chose Paris for the location, theme and value. We had a red room (2839) the room was great the bed was comfortable, the pillows weren't. The bathroom has a seperate shower which is great. We arrived 11:00 am local time and asked about checking in early, no problem, the lady at the front desk was very polite gave us our room with no hassel. The valet parking was perfect every time. My only real complaint is they charge $15 a day for internet service, a little high in my opinion. The pastry shops are a good place for a quick snack, don't expect anything cheap, a bottle of soda is $3. The Eiffel tower restaurant was great as well as the ride to the top of the tower. With all of the hotels to choose from we were very pleased with our decision to stay Paris and would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: sahawk
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Vegas in 2009 and we stayed Dec 11-14th. We arrived approximately 4:30 on Friday afternoon and had < 10 minute wait to check in. I read horror stories about the check-in staff, but we had no problems. We were able to get a King Non-Smoking on the 18th floor (room 1833). Our only view was of Miracle Mile and a parking garage, but we were only in the room for sleeping so didn't mind. The decor was okay, definitely not our style, but it was to be expected. The furniture/carpet did look worn as I read in other reviews, but again, we were never in our room so it didn't bother us. The halls were very loud in the middle of the night from people coming back to their rooms, but this happens a lot in Vegas. Our 3 nights were comped and we couldn't ask for anything more considering our stay was free. The location is the best part of the hotel, mid-strip right accross from Bellagio. I think I would have been disappointed with the room if it wasn't free. We have a more modern style so didn't appreciate the French decor as others might. We did not dine at any of the restaurants in Paris. We instead went to some of our favorites. Mr. Lucky's at Hard Rock for the off-menu $7.77 steak/shrimp special, Ellis Island for the very large and inexpensive breakfast, and Cafe Ba Ba Reeba at the Fashion Show Mall. I am checking "recommend" solely based on location and not the actual room. P.S. Do NOT let your cab driver take the tunnel...our cab fare to the hotel was $25 + tip.

Reviews.Title: “This was a Very nice and comfortable place”
Reviews.Author: danairozo
Reviews.Content: We really liked LeVillage Buffet and Le Cafe. We had great breakfasts in the Cafe. The ambiance of LeVillage Buffet was very very nice. The rooms were nice with great views. Getting a Taxi at the end of the stay was very easy thanks to the Paris staff. The ambiance of the Buffet was better than that of Monte Carlo....though the food at Monte Carlo was very good. We walked to the Venetian and the Palazzo....they had beautiful lobbies and ceilings and all.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel with a Great Location at an reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: PaxExplorer
Reviews.Content: Having been to Vegas on several occasions this was first time I stayed at the Paris mainly for its location for our friends wedding across the street at the Bellagio. I had booked my hotel room through a Expedia for king non-smoking “red room” these rooms are somewhat larger then there standard size. The room itself was very clean, with a separate shower/ tub. The most interesting part of the room was the 50” LCD TV planted across from the bed. Note the HD channels begin at 100 and up. We arrived very early that day from the east coast around 10 AM and were informed that a King wasn’t available yet, but I could have two queens. We held out until later in the afternoon, and left are bags with the bell caps. We returned around 3:30 pm and were able to check-in without a problem. Although the woman at the desk stated they normally don’t honor room request reservations, but since I had checked in very early a room was reserved for me. I didn’t bother to elaborate on her comment, since I heard the couples next to us were in an argument with their desk person. The Paris is centrally located to just about everything, on the strip which made it easy for us to travel about. We took a taxi more often the usually because it was quite chilly that weekend. The casino is smaller then some of the others, with lower ceilings so we could fell the effects from the cigarettes in the gambling areas. The best place we found we liked to eat especially for breakfast was their outdoor café Mon Ami Gabi. A little pricy but no lines and food was very good. We also was two free tickets to go up the top of the tower which had some nice views.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WKGsmom
Reviews.Content: First time to Vegas, we wanted a hotel located mid strip. We were very happy with the location, the staff, and the accommodations. One thing we liked the best was that you did not have to walk a half a mile from the sidewalk to the hotel elevators. Some hotels were located so far back from the street then you had to walk thru the large casino before you got to the hotel lobby, front desk and elevators. The Paris had a perfect set up, good size casino, but not overly massive. The room was good. Don't plan on using the internet. The cost is $14.95 for 24 hours. The street ambiance was nice with the shops and restaurants, dont expect a fast food place here. But you can continue down the "street" and walk to Ballys. Food is a touch cheaper there.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay - great location”
Reviews.Author: bagspacked2travl
Reviews.Content: Being center strip is definately a big draw for Paris. I booked a flight and hotel combo through one of the airlines because of the great rate. On my last trip to Vegas, stayed at the Bellagio and enjoyed looking at Paris, so this time I decided to stay at Paris and look at Bellagio. Upon arrival, there was no line to check in. The staff was pleasant and knowledgeable. Since my original reservation was for a standard room over looking Bally's, they ended up offering an upsell for $50 a day for the Strip view & Rendez Vous Lounge special. I ended up taking the offer since the Rendez Vous lounge offer contained free breakfast each day, a cocktail hour buffet and 2 free alcoholic beverages a day... This definately ended up paying for itself. Upon arrival at my room, there were a couple of minor issues. The hairdryer didn't work. I ended up calling for a new one and it was there within 30 minutes.... I had to leave immediate to get to my show. Upon arrival, I noticed the room looked a little worn and was shocked that the TV was an old tube TV. I ended up sleeping in the room that night but in the morning went to the front desk to inquire changing rooms. The staff was very pleasant and they ended up putting me in a beautiful Red Room. All in all, it was a very pleasant stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: crazee4trains
Reviews.Content: The paris is very clean, reasonable priced and the staff was friendly. The village buffet is by far the best in vegas. In the past we had always done breakfast and this time we also did dinner and it wwas great. Well priced as well. Go early if you don't want to wait in line. The line is there because the buffet is so good. The food is well presented, at the right temperature and very plentiful. A very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Paris was great”
Reviews.Author: MandyCt
Reviews.Content: I went to Vegas for first time in Nov of 09. We went during Thanksgiving holidays so it was expected for vegas to be very crowded. This hotel was in a perfect location on the strip. Right in the middle of everything. Rooms are comfortable and quiete (great for resting when you are in your room). I found the restaurants a bits pricey but there is a McDonalds, Denny's and a number of small burger joints within walking distance. Walk through the hotel to Bally's and then cross to Bills for great dinner like restaurant with really good food and then go to bar for .99 margaritas :) Also, go to top of Eiffel tower in the evening for the best view of the city and make sure to catch the Bellagio water show from the top. Lastly, hotel has shuttle to Rio and you can take Bus from right in the front or the Tran (subway that goes up and down strip) from just next door on front of Bally's. All and all this is perfect hotel to be in the middle of everything. The only gripe was that the pool was not heated and the jacuzzi closed at 4PM!!!

Reviews.Title: “So very gross”
Reviews.Author: camwa4
Reviews.Content: Booked a night at the Paris for our 25th Anniversary. Was very excited as we had always wanted to stay there. After checking in, we went to our room and basically, it just wasn't really clean. The bed cover "decoration" and the bedcover itself was stained and worn; the carpets were not that clean looking; the bedside table needed to be wiped down (I wiped it off with a tissue); and the room just was not what we were expecting of such a hotel. It looked like semen on the bed as well as some other unknown stains. So very gross. We went back down to the front desk and made a complaint and they said they would give us a different room. That was good. We went to the other room and it was also not clean. The bedcover didn't appear to have semen, but it was stained and not very clean looking. We again went down to the front desk and they were just not too pleased to see us. The lady (not the manager, just a desk clerk) disappeared into the back a long time and then came out and said they could give us another room or we could pay a early departure fee and leave. We ended up paying $50 just to get out of there. We were not the only one waiting to make a complaint about the quality of the rooms. I really got the impression that they just didn't give a crap what we thought and couldn't be bothered. In the many hotels we have stayed, we have never dealt with something like this. Having to pay to not be charged the entire $250 for not staying was really low. This hotel was such a disappointment. My husband and I thought it would be a great place for our 25th anniversary. We were really wrong. The entire hotel and their housekeeping staff need better management.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - pretty lousy service”
Reviews.Author: DanniDanni
Reviews.Content: I HAVE TO MARK THIS A 3 AS THE LOCATION IS SO PERFECT. This was our second time in las vegas and we wanted to stay centre of the strip. The Paris is ideal for this. I think the Casino on the Paris is fabulous, but as a hotel I felt it was lacking in some customer service. On arrival, we checked in and were told our requested type of room wouldn't be available until day 2 of our trip. We decided not to move in the end. the receptionist wasn't very friendly and didn't even tell us where to go to find our room... or the lifts. The houskeeping staff were great until the last day. At 9am on our day of checking out, I was in the shower and my husband was still alseep. The privacy sign was on the door and it had the security 'chain' across. Despite this, they knocked on the door and I called out that we were still in the room. They continued to knwock and then opened the door. When the door clunked against the security chain she called out 'Hello'. I thought something wsads wrong so I wrapped the towell around me and opened the door. She asked me when we would be leaving. I then jsyrt said - at last check out - 11am and she vitually huffed and walked away. NO APOLOGIES OR ANYTHING! Anyway we then checked out with the unfriendly reeptionist (different one) and went out the front o wait for our Limo. Bell staff were GREAT - as were the restaurant and bar staff!!

Reviews.Title: “a very great stay”
Reviews.Author: sparkie_tee
