Reviews.Content: the staff from the time we check in to the time we left were very helpful. we loved the look of the hotel and the tower. location was very good, we walked the strip two afternoons. my brother stayed at the paris after us and also had a great time. thank you

Reviews.Title: “The flight/hotel package price was reasonable, the hotel location on the strip is perfect and its restaurants are good.”
Reviews.Author: MMR18
Reviews.Content: The title sentence sums it up. ADVICE: Check the coupon book you may receive at check-in because it may have discounts for the restaurants or activities you are interested in. If you don't get a coupon book, go to the concierge desk and ask any question. He/she will probably give you a discount card for a hotel restauarant. RECOMMENDED: Village Buffet, especially for breakfast; reasonably priced and a bargain with the discount. The PARIS is within easy walking distance to several other major hotels and connects with BALLY.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for your money”
Reviews.Author: CAgirl209
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4-night stay at Paris. We upgraded to the Red Room since she told us at check in if we wanted a King Non-Smoking in the room grade we ordered it would not be available till Monday and we could move. We were aware that they would want to upgrade us from the room we ordered and we were very glad that we did. We asked for a strip view and were told it would be more but we did have some view of the strip and the new City Center hotel that is going up. It was a very nice stay as the room was very comfortable and I feel it was a great price for the location on the strip. We were also able to sleep in late, as the rooms are very quiet. We ate at Mon Ami Gabi and the food and service was fantastic. I had the best Beef Bourguignon ever and we even got to enjoy the water show from the hotel across the street. This is a wonderful hotel. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Look no farther then Paris for the best hotel in Las Vegas!!!!”
Reviews.Author: schnoobs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely gorgeous inside and out! It is beautifully laid out and very easy to find your way around. Our room was spacious, had a wonderful view of the fountains across the street at the Bellagio. The room was fit for a King and the bed was exceptional. I can't say enough about the entire staff we dealt with as well. From the moment we checked in, to the room service and to the staff on the casino floor they couldn't have been nicer or more eager to help you anyway they could. We are by no means " High Rollers" so it isn't all about how much money you spend at all. We had dinners in the Steakhouse that was out of this world and the buffet at the other restaurant that left us completely stuffed for a very reasonable price. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that wants to have a first class experience and wants to have wonderful memories to last a life time. Thank you Paris, we will be back next year for sure and will never consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location / Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Squeech57
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a week at the Paris hotel to celebrate a wedding anniversary. Check-in was a bit slow but Imelda at the check-in desk was able to accomodate our three couples by giving us adjoining rooms on a quiet end of the same floor. Our room was simple but clean and the house-keeping staff was very friendly. The hotel is ideally located in the center of the strip and we were able to walk easily from one hotel to the next. The Paris is not huge like the MGM so it is easy to get from your room to the casinos/restaurants very easily. We especially enjoyed the 2 for 1 Martinis offered in the afternoon at the casino bar! We ate at the Mon Ami Gabi restaurant one evening to mixed reviews. Gerard the waiter was very professional and knowledgable. Internet kept cutting out but we were compensated at check-out. My only complaint is that the SAME room service trays of dirty dishes sat outside in the hallway all week long in front of several rooms. Also some friends had ordered a wine,cheese and fruit basket for us but we did not receive the cheese. This we discovered upon our return home so our friend called the Paris and was reimbursed for the mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service & everything costs extra”
Reviews.Author: soccerman22
Reviews.Content: From the minute I checked in on Sunday, I knew this wasn't going to be a good stay. The smell of cigarette smoke was especially strong as soon as you walk in the door. The lady at reception said that my room wouldn't be ready until 4pm (normal check-in time) and so gave me a room with 2 Queens instead of the 1 king I'd ordered, so that I could check immediately. When I questioned the normal check-in time she was rude. I said "I don't have to stay here" and she replied, "No you dont". Anyway, the room was fine. The extras are frustrating. In-room Internet costs $15.00 per day. The gym costs $25.00 per day. Overall I wouldn't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LYNNDNorthYorks
Reviews.Content: Asked for a view of the strip and Bellagio fountains and got it.Clean comfortable room.Hotel has great facilities, bars restaurants shops etc. Made use of the spa, found it very expensive, but the treatment was good.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: lardiel
Reviews.Content: My first time at the Paris but not my last. It was everything and more that I expected. We had the Imperial Suite which was awesome. The room was clean and amenties were great. We had a coffee pot which was a life saver as we did not have to rush down each morning for coffee. I am not sure if all rooms have the coffee pot but they sure should as it would save on the number of people having to go down on the elevator for their first cup of coffee. I booked the Paris as it was central to everything. We pretty much walked everywhere we went. Ellis Island restuarant is only two blocks away and is a great place to eat. Check in was a little slow but checking out was a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more for the price”
Reviews.Author: K2654
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Paris in November 2009 for a nice mini vacation. We had this trip booked for quite a while and I was thrilled that we were going to stay at the Paris because the virtual tours made the rooms look so beautiful. To our dissapointment the room was not that great. It seemed old and weathered. Our view was horrible. All you could see was the parking garage and the roof of the hotel. When asked if we could change to a better view we were told that no other rooms were available at that time. The bathroom wasn't the cleanest either. I will say that the concierge desk was amazing and very helpful when we had questions about activities we were doing. The staff was great as well...very friendly. The lobby and casino are really beautiful! A very romantic feel as if you are really walking down the streets of Paris. The location on the strip is perfect! It is right in the middle so it was easy walking distance to see everything. The view from the Eiffle Tower is amazing at night! All in all I would say that our vacation turned out great and we would stay at the Paris again if we ever make it to Vegas again!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: JRDelirious
Reviews.Content: It has to be said again, the Paris has an outstanding location, right at center Strip. combine that with frequent rate deals and you have an excellent Vegas homebase. Access to the Bally's monorail station (but beware, you have to go though Bally's to get there, and man is that a long schlep!) and regular shuttles to the Rio keep it hooked up with many other properties. For a "theme" Strip hotel it's of human-manageable size and apart from the Eiffel Tower replica it does not contain all those extravagant attractions others seem to favor (zoos, gardens, water attractions, rides) As for its use as a hotel, per se, definitely a middle-of-the-road property. (Part of the Harrah's group). The high-floor rooms that got renovated/redecorated are now sold as "upgraded" "Red Rooms"", for a higher price. (and premium if you have an actual Strip view) Comfortable and well appointed but the bathroom did not quite get the attention you'd expect -- non-adjustable, cheap-looking showerheads, and the separate tub is small. A person could be well served with just the base room if they care nothing about decor or view. One hint to give: unless the intention is just to pig out, many senible people should opt out of the buffet -- pricey and very long lines -- and instead hit one of the standalone dining sites in the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Wegas”
Reviews.Author: CindyH4
Reviews.Content: It was exciting, entertaining and fun-Stomp was a great show, the Eiffel Tower was awesome and the french bakery was "to die for".

Reviews.Title: “Just not as good as I expected”
Reviews.Author: slotloverBc
Reviews.Content: Maybe it's because our trip was comp'd but even tho I paid for a room upgrade (to get a view of the Eiffel Tower) the room itself was a disappointment. Peeling paint, dirty door to the bathroom, a shower head hanging out of the wall, dust and cobwebs hanging on the wallpaper....all of these and more tend to leave a bad taste. Add to that the "attitude" of the hostess of our first meal and now I am starting to get the feeling that we really weren't welcome. After two days of this treatment we took a trip downtown to the Golden Nugget and were reminded of what Vegas used to stand for, good service and gracious hosts. Our next trip to Vegas will find us staying in the downtown area and having fun again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful yet frustrating honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: danwilkie
Reviews.Content: My new wife and I purchased both the wedding package and the 4 night honeymoon package from Paris, Las Vegas. The wedding was unbelievably perfect and I would highly recommend the experience to anyone. The honeymoon suite and accommodations we're superb and I again would recommend this to anyone. I do however warn anyone interested to insure that the coordinator informs EVERYONE in the hotel that your accommodations are to be honored. We had to make several trips to the front desk to explain that our package was purchased through the chapel and that we indeed have credit to our room included with this package. Even then, on our last night in the suite I had to argue with the VIP representative that I was indeed who I said I was and would not be going to the front desk for the 3rd time to verify my ID just so I could have room service delivered. The casino is very beautiful but very spread out. It's a long trip from the parking garage to the front desk and back to the rooms with a full load of luggage. The staff is very courteous and the bartenders are flawless, however the wait staff and front desk needs completely cleared out and restaffed. My wife was forced to come down to the front desk in her wedding gown when my room key de-magnetized because we didn't use my credit card on the package reservations. In summary it was a very beautiful, very tiring, and very frustrating honeymoon that actually amazed us how it could be both so wonderful and aggravating at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room......Service needs improvement...Oversize vehicle parking was a nightmare.”
Reviews.Author: tcbsu
Reviews.Content: Our Stay started out on a bad note. When we talked with the reservation specialist we were told we could valet park the the truck pulling the trailer. We were pulling her car with my truck and we were very specific about the size of truck and trailer. Upon arrival we were told that we would have to park around back. There was no map available and the verbal instructions were not good. When I did find the lot I was told I had to move to the other side of some imaginary line. Getting from the back lot to the Front desk was not much better. I had to make my way in from behind the employee garage. Total time to park and find my way to the front desk was 32 minutes (I know because my now very annoyed fiancee was keeping track) I let her off at the front . She had waited in line only to be told it was the wrong line. after waiting in the right line she was told she'd have to wait for me before we could check in and that they had been very rude. When we got to the room it was very nice but we'll probably pick a different hotel for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “The Paris”
Reviews.Author: glomar97
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel! What better than to fall asleep looking at the Eiffel Tower!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: HampshireJudy
Reviews.Content: I was really excited about staying here, as hadn't visited Las Vegas for 15 years ish, and stayed at the Excalibur last time. I was really drawn to this hotel by it's luxurious French presentation, but to be honest I wasn't overly impressed. It was only just Ok, and lacking some of the glamour I expected. Also the waiter was so rude, after tipping him only $4, he took it as an insult. Check-in at the hotel was fast and my friend lost her bag, and they were very helpful. We had two queen beds and had requested a king, they said that room requests are not guaranteed, but they did put us in a room with great views particlarly of the Bellagio fountains and the Eiffel tower which is opposite, so we didn't bother to change the next day. The casino area feels very dark, as the theme is Parisien/French and the lighting is very low, and the casino was not that busy. Preferred the atmosphere you get down Fremont street area, have a look at the Golden Nugget, great casino. Maybe that was because I won there, though. The trip up the Eiffel tower is fantastic, go just before dusk, by the time you get up there the light will be changing, but you go up there for the day time price. Travelled on British Airways, when we had our meal, they left a lot of half price buffet coupons etc., Helps with the budget. Couldn't stay in Las Vegas for more than 4 nights, exhausting but fun. Saw 2 shows the Rat Pack and Legends. Legends is great. Went to the Wyndhams presentation, and got 4 free buffet tickets at Harrahs and 4 theatre tickets, but time share selling got a bit heavy sell. All in all had a great stay at Paris, beautiful building, but not quite up to expectations, a bit shabby in some areas.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: JLost
Reviews.Content: Had a good stay. Staff seemed helpful to me although I've read differently in some reviews. I called for a requesting a late checkout and had to wait on hold for a while but it was my fault for calling during peak check out. There was a shelf in the drink fridge for personal use which was nice. My room was nice, clean, and modern with separate bath and shower. The water in the room had water pressure restrictors which made showers and face washing slightly less pleasurable. Elevators were fast and there was no noise from other rooms. My wife didn't find the bed particularly comfortable. The pool looked really nice, but didn't jump in. I was told the sun only stayed over the pool until around three. Have stayed in Vegas 6 or so times and this stay was fine; about 3rd place out of six places.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby”
Reviews.Author: Trish074
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel lobby beautiful, but the staff very unfriendly. The room we had was so nasty the carpet was stained and for a non smoking room it had burns all over it. When we approached the staff on this they provided no help. The rooms are in need of a major update, which is sad for what could be a beautiful hotel..

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT PARIS HOTEL - WE WERE PHYSICALLY ASSAULTED AND NO ONE CARED!”
Reviews.Author: becky5980
Reviews.Content: My 4 friends and I were assaulted by a drunk man who forced his way into our room on the 26th floor, one of my friends was injured in the attack. We filed a police report, they caught the guy, but the PARIS Hotel refused to take ANY responsibility. No security cameras are in place on the hotel room floors - they say they are too expensive and require too much manpower to monitor - are you kidding?! There are cameras over every single casino table! We know where the priority lies! It is certainly not about the safety of the hotel guests! PARIS refused to comp out the room, did not offer anything to us. Not only was our weekend ruined, but we will tell everyone about the lack of commitment to the safety and well-being of the guests by the PARIS HOTEL. This was a HORRIBLE experience. DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Vacation”
Reviews.Author: kevinsgirl52909
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great but the pool had too many kids. The hotel staff yelled at two adults that were cuddling? The pool is cold in the summer due to the towers block the sun.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: RomoChicago
Reviews.Content: The Paris is a great place to stay. The location is perfect and the hotel/casino is very managable. The rooms are nice enough with a seperate shower. The rates are usually really good. I noticed this time that they added a $11.20 reservation charge to my bill for booking my reservation via telephone. I protested and was successful but watch out...im sure they just tried to sneak it through.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: natedogg235
Reviews.Content: It was a great location for the money you paid. The gambling was cheap during the day, and the cafe and shops were great. The pool is very small for Vegas standards do not reccomend using their pool.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Malim27
Reviews.Content: Booked well in advance for the Paris so got a good rate. Stayed for 4 nights. At check in, we were upgraded to a room facing the Bellagio fountains - a pleasant surprise. Room was OK and nothing special; but I was quite happy bearing in mind the rate I paid. Cafe areas and walkways were nice, quite atmospheric. It was very busy even though it was midweek....I think there was an Auto-parts conference on at the time....loads of people walking around with name tags etc. Best thing about the place is its location...right in the middle of the strip. Also used the free shuttle to the Rio for a look/see. Would usually stay elsewhere on the strip (Wynn/Palazzo/Bellagio) but the Paris was fine for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Oui, oui”
Reviews.Author: Girlgolfpro
Reviews.Content: Paris is a great choice for staying in Las Vegas. You are right in the middle of the strip and the hotel is easy to navigate. Best of all is Mon Ami Gabi; a terrific French bistro in the hotel with indoor/outdoor dining. The food is great and very moderately priced for an expensive city. We loved seeing Bette Midler at Caesar's Palace. If you are an animal lover don't miss the Secret Garden and Dolphin Experience at the Mirage or the free Lion Habitat at MGM.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but front desk not so helpful”
Reviews.Author: TammyM
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying at the Paris Las Vegas for 4 nights. We didn't arrive until about 6pm & we had requested a King bed. Of course, when we checked in, we were told there weren't any available unless we paid $40 per night more. This I don't understand! When I asked if the room was nicer, bigger or had a better view for $40 a night, I was told no. I was told we could get the same King room the next day for but if we wanted it that night we would have to pay!!!! This makes absolutely no sense but typical. We did end up moving the next day but our view was almost worse. Go figure. The girl at the front desk was quite rude as well when I questioned her about a King room that was the same as the one we would get the next day but if we wanted it then, it was $40 more per night. Not impressed. The hotel itself was in a great location & I would stay there again. If you have a chance, go to Love by the Beatles, it is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing-expected more for the money”
Reviews.Author: KerrandJulie
Reviews.Content: I told the receptionist that we were here for our wedding anniversary but she told me it would be about $50 to upgrade. Considering it was midweek, quiet and this made the Hotel about the same rate as Bellagio I declined . She then smiled that disdainful smile of service industry staff where they forget to tell their eyes to smile. The room we got was very basic compared to cheaper hotels and the pool area was so bland it looked like it belonged in the state prison. We went to the casino and there was more chance of finding a yeti at the tables than a smiling gambler. My clothes went in and out of fashion by the time a waitress brought us a free drink.. Mon Ami Gabi restaurant redeemed things with a great meal as usual and the eifel tower view was great. Overall the hotel was not good value for money and bland compared to others

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Informal Gambling & Cheap Martinis but disappointing breakfast”
Reviews.Author: SaintsOnTour2009
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Vegas, having stayed in the Luxor before. Of the two we much preferred Paris, the rooms and service were just that notch better. The atmosphere in the hotel & casino floor was more informal than other casinos we've been to and that made for a better occasion. We also enjoyed the 2 for 1 martinis that were on offer! After a great evening (just breaking even on the tables) and a good meal in the burger/sports bar the room was a comfortable & quiet place to relax & recover. Breakfast the next morning however was a disappointment - over priced & under flavoured with unusual service standards. When we go back to Vegas we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Quality”
Reviews.Author: joaoosorio
Reviews.Content: The best hotel I ever been. With an excelent room, free parking. The only thing I didn't like was that the wi-fi is not free. BTW, the quality of the room is outstanding

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - great location but not enough for people wanting the full on fun Vegas experience”
Reviews.Author: HolidayVegas01
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas recently for 5 nights, myself and my husband and a group of 8 other friends (mixture of couples and singles aged late 20's early 30's). We have been to Vegas a number of times and stayed in the Luxor, Wynn, Excalibur and friends in the New York New York and Encore. This trip we wanted to stay somewhere in the centre of the strip within walking distance to shops etc we had visited Paris on our last trip and loved it. (More the girls on the trip than the guys) We were drawn in by the beautiful chandillers and ceilings within the lobby and casino and were told the breakfast buffet was amazing We booked this trip and got a good deal on ebookers. We wanted our trip to Vegas to be all fun for 5 days, we enjoy the nightlife, drinking, eating out, sitting by the pool, shopping, buffets, my husband likes to play the tables. Checking in was fast and no problems, staff were friendly but nothing special, they didnt go out of there way to make you feel special like other hotels have. Our room in Paris was just ok the decor is old and its just ok. It was a bit dark and dingy, the bathroom was nice. The casino didnt seem to have much of an athmosphere, we like a vibrant feel with lots going on, the people in there seem a little older and it was just lacking that Vegas fun feeling. We were there for Haloween and there was not much party effort made and there were not many people dressed up (well not like us anyway) We played slots for hours and there seemed to be only 2 people in the while casino serving drinks, we had to wait an hour atelast for one drink and the women that came round were rude. The buffet was also disappointing although they had lots of sweet pastries etc there was not as much choice as in others. The pool was basic and sold out of food when we went to get a sandwhich - this I didnt understand as it is a big hotel, surely they could have got bread and filling from another part of the hotel! We ended up spending most of our time in Ballys as we wanted to stay local and that had a better atmosphere. We still had an amazing trip as you cant not in Vegas. Other friends were staying in the Encore and when we went to visit them it was like another league and the price they paid was not that much more. Once we had met them we actually upgraded to a suite in the Paris as we realised what difference the room meant, the suite was lovely and made a difference but it was much more and the bed was so comfy. I think the fact that we have stayed in other hotels made us more disappointed with Paris, you may not think so if it was your first stay in Vegas. My advise to anyone who is young and wants to enjoy the nightlife and have a scream in Vegas is not to stay in the Paris! It is a beautiful hotel to visit and if you want more of a relaxing experience, definately go for lunch or for a look round. I dont think it was the hotel that was the problem it just wasnt right for us. Most of the reviews are really positive on here which is part of the reason we booked but I just wanted to make people aware that it is not for everyone. If you are lookig for more of a fun hotel the Luxor is better Next time we will look for a fun hotel with the Paris location as that you can't fault!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Rizingsun03
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd time to Vegas. My fiance and I are planning on making Vegas a yearly trip for us. Last year we stayed at Harrah's and after walking in every casino on the strip we knew that Paris was our next destination! The only complaint that I have was when reserving the room I indicated we would checking in around 10pm. Our flight was delayed and we did not get to Paris until around 10:45pm. When checking in we found out that they were still cleaning our room and it wouldn’t be ready until around 11:30pm. We grabbed a drink at the bar and waited to go back and pick up our room keys. When we went to pick up our keys we politely asked if there was anything they could do to compensate us for the inconvenience of our room not being ready (a credit, meal voucher etc). She said very rudely that I could ask the manager but she assured me that there was nothing he would do for us. We weren't the only ones that this happened to and that when we first went to check in we insisted on a room with a king bed and non-smoking. Those words never came out of my mouth however that was what I indicated on our online reservation. She proceeded to say that they could have given us a double bed smoking room but they wanted to accommodate us. We asked what the point of having a reservation request was if they didn't want to follow it. We asked for the manager and she came back 10 minutes later with an even bigger attitude saying that he was too busy and that we could check back tomorrow if we wanted to speak with him. Other than that our stay was amazing. The room was very nice and they cleaned it daily, I was a little surprised that the TV’s in the room have not been updated to flat screens. The casino in itself was well kept and the staff was friendly. We ate dinner at the Eiffel Tower restaurant which had a great view and romantic atmosphere, the food was delicious. We were able to lay out by the pool in the morning and afternoons. We had friends that also came along and stayed at Bally’s. The good thing about this was there was a walkway in between the two hotels that connected them. This made it very convenient to go back and forth. The only other down fall is if you are into sports betting their sports center is not the greatest. The TV's are outdated and there is really only space for those who are betting on horse races, it's not really a lounge to hang out and watch the games. We were very happy with Paris and would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Paris is a romantic, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ohiovanillagirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paris Las Vegas October 28-Nov 1, 2009. It was lovely and romantic. The food in the restaurants was delicious. It was a little pricey, but not too high. They have a lovely restaurant that you take an elevator upstairs and it overlooks the fountains of Bellagio and another one where you can eat outside on the porch on the Las Vegas strip. The Paris Las Vegas hotel is made up like a movie set of Paris, France with a ceiling painted light blue with white clouds like a daytime sky. It's beautiful and great for a romantic stay. We arrived on a Wed at 10:15PM and had no wait time to check in. We checked out at the front desk on Mon at 10:45AM and had no wait time. I've read other reviews where people had to wait, but I guess we came at a good time. You can go up in the Eiffel Tower for $10 per person and take pictures. If you want internet in your room, it is $15 per day. If you want a refrigerator, it is also $15 per day. We had a mini bar in our room that was refrigerated and had a small amount of space for food if you have left-overs from the restaurant. There is no charge for the mini bar unless you take something out of it. From the ad, I thought all the rooms had whirlpool bathtubs, but they don't. Our tub was separate from our shower, but the tub was not a whirlpool. The whirlpool tub was a $50 per day upcharge, so we didn't get one. The Paris is centrally located on the strip (across from Bellagio), which is a bonus because you do so much walking in Las Vegas. Paris is a little fancier and pricier than Bally's, Harrah's or Imperial Palace, but it's not as pricey as Venetian or Bellagio. We stayed 5 nights at Paris and 1 night at Imperial Palace. Imperial Palace is not fancy, it's just basic. Our TV picture was fuzzy at Imperial Palace and we had plastic glasses. I have champagne taste on a beer budget, so the Paris suited me. We paid $470 for 5 nights at Paris before tax. I would stay there again because it's nice, clean and pretty and not as expensive as Bellagio or Venetian. There is nothing wrong with staying at the cheaper hotels in Vegas if that's all you can afford, but if you can afford Paris Las Vegas, I recommend it. If you can only afford a cheaper hotel, I would stay in Bally's, Harrah's or Imperial Palace. I wouldn't stay at Hooter's because their casino is ugly and they are too far away from the center of the strip. I also wouldn't stay at Circus Circus or Stratosphere because they are too far from the center of the strip. If you stay at Hooters, Circus Circus or Stratosphere, you will spend too much in taxi fares in my opinion. I usually try to stay toward the center of the strip for convenience sake. Paris is a nice hotel and I would stay there again. I highly recommend the "O" Watershow at Bellagio. Also, make sure your suitcase doesn't weigh more than 50 lbs or you will get an overweight bag fee if you are flying. Carry-on bags are limited to 40 lbs and certain size and liquid limitations. Bring tennis shoes because you will walk, walk, walk. You can print your return boarding passes at the business traveler's center in Paris. We paid $3.50 per person for our boarding passes and we had one layover on the way home.

Reviews.Title: “Paris is a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: vegasvicki
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at the Paris hotel in Las Vegas this past July. This was the 1st trip to Vegas for my husband & I. We really loved our stay. The Paris hotel is quite beautiful. Loved the high painted ceilings in the casino. Our room was very nice. The view wasn't great, but we didn't care. Housekeeping was immaculate (at least on our floor) and I am very particular. The buffet for breakfast was really good. We really liked the half-priced martini bar that they had every night in the casino. The location of the hotel is perfect. Right in the middle of the strip. Take the free shuttle & go to Rio hotel one night. Lots of fun over there also. I highly reccommend the Paris, Las Vegas hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated”
Reviews.Author: TEH3
Reviews.Content: Experience was poor from check in to check out. This supposed luxury hotel was far from luxurious. Food was over priced and blah. $4 for a bottle of ice tea.....highway robbers. Need to learn customer service, room maintenance and basic hotel skills

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, GREAT location!”
Reviews.Author: Kimmyl1144
Reviews.Content: I haved stayed at Paris twice and like it both times! The rooms aren't anything to brag about but overall are clean and nice. The pool is great. The location of Paris is just perfect, its in the middle of everything! I would stay at Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Bullit2
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Las Vegas. I am so glad we chose Paris! The service was excellent, the cleanliness of the rooms was impeccable. The ambiance in the casino was one of the best I saw while there. Staff was courteous and helpful. Plenty of eateries available inside the hotel/casino. Food excellent. Registration easy and close to the elevator. It was just a great, no worry,experience. We also got some great pics did not download as yet. Pool was clean & nice; however, water not heated, so a little cold & unexpected. We had a great view right on the strip & could see the Bellagio fountains and the lit eiffel tower every night.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with some flaws”
Reviews.Author: giraffe1York_England
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the Paris after a 15 hour flight from the UK (at 20.30) the service at check in left alot to be desired! There was a small queue when we arrived but we didn't expect the one person behind the desk to totally disregard the waiting people and instead open another desk to serve the 'platinum customers'! Eventually we checked in after 30 minutes without so much as an apology for having kept us waiting. However..the room itself was large and very clean, the beds were extremely comfortable and the there was no noise from other rooms or outside. Very peaceful! The amenities in the hotel were varied and although smaller than some of the other popular hotels on the Strip there was enough variation to suit most tastes.A visit to the Eiffel restaurant is well worth it for the fantastic view of the neon Strip butalso the romantic ambience. One disappointing experience was on our last night. We went for a drink in Le Central (the lobby bar) and my husband (age 36) was asked for I.D, something we had become used too when we have been in the States. When he produced our driving licences he was told that they were inadaquate as only a passport would suffice!! I was appalled and left, we walked less than 100 yards and were served a drink at the Gustav bar without a second thought! Perhaps the hotel needs to get this ridiculous inconsistency sorted out. On the whole we would recommend this hotel due to the fantastic location on the Strip and the overall asthetics of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: IdoTLV
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Very nice rooms and bathrooms - Hotel and rooms are mostly clean (we found some garbage behind the minibar) - Location is excellent - Hotel interior and exterior is lovely - Very good buffet Cons: - Casino is a bit pricy for beginners - Not too much to do at night in the hotel except gambling Conclusion: you won't be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with fantastic service and rates!!”
Reviews.Author: CHAdams123
Reviews.Content: We were picked up at the airport and taken promptly back to the hotel! We had an extremely fast check in and our room was clean and ready every day! The room itself was large with a nice sitting area. The bathroom was fantastic with every amenity and upgrade imaginable!! It's a great location on the strip and easy to get to other hotels and casinos. The pool area was large with plenty of seating and fast service! The only disadvantage to other places was our room looked out to the side of Ballys.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms, Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: ParkLovers
Reviews.Content: We really loved the rooms here. We decided to upgrade our room for the last night and we almost regretted doing so because it was such a hassle. Everything was taken care of, but we had lost half a day because of it. The rooms are absolutely beautiful and incredibly well furnished. The beds are plush and comfortable. If you do stay at the Paris hotel, you should request a strip view, it's absolutely worth it. If you're really hungry go to the buffet. If you want a snack, eat a crepe. They are both delicious. Skip the Eiffel tower and go to the Stratosphere. It's roomier there and not nearly as long a wait.

Reviews.Title: “Au revoir, Paris Hotel! We won't miss you much...”
Reviews.Author: Halluxone
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled to Vegas for the first time for a long business weekend and stayed at the Paris hotel for four days. We were originally supposed to stay at the Wynn, but our arrangements were made by corporate folks who probably didn't know the difference between some of the Hotel/Casinos on the strip...big mistake. This hotel, like many others on the strip, has taken its theme of "classical French decor" and turned it into a horrible parody of itself. Everything about this place was gauche. Check in was marred by the fact that no King bed was available, despite a request weeks earlier. An indifferent shoulder shrug was our consolation for this inconvenience. The check in folks were clearly immersed in their roles as annoyed French locals and didn't break character the entire stay. Amazing! The room is on par with the finest 2 star hotels in rural Arkansas....dirty, small, poorly furnished and dim. The beds are an absolute joke with awful linens, mattress that rivals my pullout couch at home, pillows that smelled oddly like eggs. The shower water pressure is like an 80 year male with end stage prostate enlargement. No coffee machines, electronic amenities are circa 1986....old TV kept switching off every 20 minutes for no reason, limited stations, Wifi? Mais non, there is nothing remotely business worthy of a hotel that is supposed to cater to the conventioneer or business person! Room service took over an hour for a simple breakfast order and I think I saw plates lying in the hallway for two days before they were collected off the dingy carpet. Did I mention the carpet looked like floral and paisly threw up on each other? Mmmm, this place just keeps getting more French every minute! The only restaurant we visited was Mon Ami Gabi, which was actually very good! Eat outside on the patio for a great view of the Bellagio, where you will invariably want to stay after this place leaves its stain on you. Otherwise food and drink are predictably overpriced, and the cocktails were incredibly weak....much more so than any other casino we visited. Stick to beer and wine and you'll be fine. I am not much of a gambler, so I can't really comment on the experience...suffice it to say that if you are not a smoker, you will not like walking around this place. Paris is ventilated like hermetically sealed tupperware....even for an occasional smoker like myself, my eyes and lungs burned like a raging UTI all weekend. The only, and I mean ONLY thing this place has going for it is the location. Centrally located along the strip, I spent most of my time in other hotels and casinos that far surpassed the Paris experience. Of course, that would have meant paying a bit more, but this place is an absolute joke. If you have any travel experience whatsoever, you'll know that this is a Howard Johnson with cheap "French-like" amenities, substandard cleanliness and spotty service From what we saw, I'd really recommend the Venetian, Bellagio, or Wynn. Just stay away from this horrible excuse for the "French experience." At least in Paris, France, I would overpriced rooms and lousy service....just not in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated”
Reviews.Author: Simopel
Reviews.Content: This was the 3rd and 4th night of our 6 day trip. I stayed before in Las Vegas at the Bellagio and I was very disapointed so this time we choosed the Paris because of the reputation and the location. At check in we were offered an upgrade to a Suite for only $70.00 which was okay for us. The suite was of couse very spacious. The TV stands lonely in the middle of the room bettween the bed's and the sitting area. This looks definitely odd, I think you could do this better with a smaller side board. However the room has it's own business area, a desk with printer and fax. You get your own fax and direct phone number with this room. If you use it pretty cool. But who want's to fax and print or even work on a computer when you are in Vegas???? Anyway the carpet had a few "big" spots and if I would have had paid the full price I would have complaint and I would be very upset. We had 2 bathrooms. one had a shower the other one a jacuzzi. Very elegant, clean and pretty. The staff was extraordinary friendly. I never had such a nice person at the check in's in Vegas. Ususally they are all stressed and focus on the facts. Here I really had the feeling that they care about you. We had breakfast at the buffet which was also great! I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Not the best but not the worst either”
Reviews.Author: sallyzzz
Reviews.Content: we chose the paris hotel because we got a great deal to stay at this hotel. we had the most basic room. the room was clean but with a really old feel to it. I think this is what most hotels in paris look like anyways. I wasn't too impressed just because we had previously stayed at the Venetian and I like the more modern look. but the room was very clean and the bathroom as well. they cleaned our room daily, and the cleaning lady noticed i really like the lotion so she left me a few extra. Nothing was stolen from our bags (Its happened to me before at other hotels). all in all it was an OK room but if i were to stay at the paris again i would upgrade to their red room or one of their other better rooms. the casino was spectacular. the dealers were very friendly and always had a smile on their face (even if I was the one winning). the atmosphere was laid back which i really liekd. I didnt try any of their restaurants but they looked ok. I would highly reccomend the lunch buffet at the bellagio, it was excellent and a really great value. the pool wasnt the best...it was overcrowded and not that big. the location is excellent, you are in the middle of everything. there were no nightclubs or lounges open at the time we were there, so we went to the bellagio and caesar's at night. I love vegas and I will always go back to gamble at the paris but not stay in the room category i stayed in before. the venetian was more suited for me.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Spend My Own Money here”
Reviews.Author: jackosan
Reviews.Content: Just completed a 4-night stay here as part of a convention. Reserved a king non-smoking room. Arrived around 10 p.m. on a Saturday night. Was told they didn't have a King room, but were giving me a non-smoking room. We knew things were not going well as we approached the room. There were holes kicked in the wall in at least three places and the whole floor seemed kind of shabby. The room was non-smoking, but only if you believe that non-smoking means "no one has smoked in this room during the last 20 minutes." Complained, but was told no other rooms were available. This room was along the lines of a 2.5 star room. Thin towels, older furniture, no coffee maker, smallish. Certainly not worth paying more than $50 per night. There was a refrigerator, but it was stocked with overpriced booze and munchies and set to automatically charge you if you moved anything. After complaining again the next day, we were upgraded to a mini-suite for the remainder of our stay. Better, but still not great. The room was quite large and had a sofa, chair and wet bar with a usable refrigerator. There was a separate corridor leading on one end to a large walk-in closet with a lighted make-up table. At the other end was an oversize bathroom with a separate shower and jaccuzzi bath and a separate toilet room. This time, there was an in-room coffee set-up. The carpeting in the room was tired. This room still had the same thin towels, no bathrobes, and neither room had a 21st century TV. There was some serious nickle-and-diming. Want to use the gym (above average, but nothing great), $25 per person, per day. Want internet access, another $15 daily gouge. Had room service twice. It was overpriced, but decent. Expect 1.5 hour delays on breakfast unless you order the night before. The breakfast buffet downstairs, however, is great value at $15 per head. There is a vast selection, including omelet, crepe and belgian waffle stations. We ate there twice. Ate at the steakhouse. Again, overpriced for what you got. There are far better steakhouses in this town. We also had a meal at the burger-oriented sports bar, which was fairly priced an had great service from happy, friendly servers. One major disappointment was the Louis Cafe, where my wife was ignored for half an hour, which was probably the high point of her dining experience. Thereafter she was treated to shabby service, cold food, and a watery drink. As a tip, she wrote on the check, "AWFUL DINING EXPERIENCE!" Hope they get the message. All-in-all, Paris was a poor choice for a convention hotel. Judging it from the point of view of a casino hotel, it was just OK. From what I have seen, there are far better hotels for the money to be had in Las Vegas. I would not return here on my own dime and would probably stay elsewhere even if a business meeting/convention were venued here.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we chose this hotel ... good value, true Vegas experience”
Reviews.Author: jeyno
Reviews.Content: I think the Paris Las Vegas hotel was a good choice for us - the hotel is right on the Strip, near many impressive attractions and it has all the impact and ambience of the full-on Vegas experience. Very glad we chose it. The room could have been a little bigger and better furnished and equipped but it was comfy enough and the rest of the experience was very good indeed. You can expect some long waits to check in or for concierge services ... that said, not sure that would have been any different elsewhere. All in, a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “This place is self contained, you never have to leave!”
Reviews.Author: ljmzta
Reviews.Content: We went to Las Vegas to celebrate my husband's birthday. We met up with some friends who are Harrah's members and wanted to stay at a Harrah's property. They recommended Paris, having stayed here before. Our standard room was not very large but it was adequate for our needs, the beds were comfortable, the bathrooms were nice. Our view was of the back of the strip, a parking lot basically. Our friends had a red room which was not much different from ours, they got a better view, Bill's Saloon. I'm glad I didn't shell out for the upgrade. Lines to check in and out seemed to be very long. There were lots of restaurants in this hotel to eat. This hotel even connected to Bally's and a sort of "mall". The Eiffel Tower restaurant was my favorite but they didn't take Harrah's rewards points which was disappointing. I had breakfast a couple of times in the hotel, it was good but very expensive for what you got. The restaurants always seemed to be crowded and it was always difficult to get a table...unless you were with a diamond player. Even the lines for the buffet always seemed to be very long. We ordered room service instead which was reasonably priced and quick. The casino was fun, I love free cocktails! I was disappointed that I was unable to find a $5 craps table, oh well, maybe next time. I did catch some shows, though none at this hotel. This would be a great place for a Cirque Du Soleil show, being French and all.

Reviews.Title: “Reception Staff greeted us chewing gum!”
Reviews.Author: Villagefolk
Reviews.Content: Our first impression of this hotel was not good, a massive check in area with only 3 desks open, we waited in a queue for about 15 minutes to be greeted by a GUM CHEWING receptionist, she seemed a bit fed up with the day and didn't come across as friendly. Our room was OK, nothing special, a bit well worn, but clean. Our big disappointment was no facilities in the room for coffee/tea making. We ate one evening in the Ile St louis in the hotel- disaster - cold steak, rude staff when we complained, 'what do you want me do do about it ?!!!!' We should have refused to pay the bill but paid up and left _NO TIP there. Wouldn't advise anyone to go to the Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jodyh47
Reviews.Content: I recently came back from Las Vegas and stayed with friends at Paris. I've stayed at Caesers and Bellagio before and would reccomend this hotel highly. I found out you can check in at the Las Vegas airport and save yourself time waiting at the front desk, although the front desk area is very beautiful. It's so pretty inside, you feel you're walking the Paris streets. The Village Buffet is great and you'll wait in line but it's worth it. The cafe beside the Buffet was also very good. The shops are cute and you have to go up the effiel tower to see the city. Mon Ami Gabi looks over to Belliagio and you can people watch while you eat. The standard room that I stayed in was very nice. A little on the shabby side but still a nice room. The standing shower is wonderful. My friends had an upgraded room that was much nicer. A big screen TV and upgraded furnishings. I would definately stay at Paris again. It's close to the action and a very beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Get a corner room - better views”
Reviews.Author: ACC1979
Reviews.Content: We booked a standard room and managed to get room 14xxB - i guess the B is for corner rooms? (can't remember the xx numbers) Anyway, the corner room was great - two floor to ceiling windows on two of the walls, a view of the bellagio fountains - perfect. The bed was very comfy. The hotel itself is really pretty and charming and the pool just below the Eiffel tower is great. Try le village buffet - really good value. I preferred the Paris room to the Caesar's palace room I had before

Reviews.Title: “Motel 6 with a facade”
Reviews.Author: pmillerny1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a convention. I have only stayed in four or five different hotels on the strip but Paris is the only one I would equate the accomodations to a cheap motel. The mattress was thin and uncomfortable; linens were rough; there weren't any extra plugs to charge a phone or plug your computer in - I literally had to unplug a light to charge my laptop on the desk; tub was pathetic; furnishings reminded me of a holiday Inn; TV was ancient. If this place was in a small town, the room would be acceptable at best. In Vegas, it's a joke. Compared to the the other hotels on the strip that were charging less for the same nights (Bellagio, Venetian), it was a disgrace. To be fair, room was clean and neat much like any no-frills hotel I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: vsfboston
Reviews.Content: Paris is conveniently located. It's a fair hotel for a fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, perfect location on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Isky
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from Sunday - Wednesday. First night rate was $105, last two nights were $60. Breakfast buffet is excellent but the server did not do a great job at checking on us. A small pizzeria had excellent food and was wonderful for a late night snack. The casino is nice and I won $50 on the nickle machine after just two spins. Check-in and check-out were simple. Stayed on the 18th floor and the elevators are quick. The room and bathroom were a nice size. I did notice the outside windows needed cleaning. Coffee in one of the shops was $3.50, but that was expected at a luxuy hotel. The location is perfect because it's right in front of the Bellagio and we watched the water show from our hotel window. Planet Hollywood is on one side and Bally's is on the other.The city bus stops right outside the hotel and the $7 pass to ride all day was perfect for getting around the strip all day. A shuttle near the bell stand takes you to the Rio for free. We got on just to see what was over there and it was okey. On arrival, traffic on the street was awful, causing our taxi fare to be $24. Going back to the airport at mid day, our taxi fare was only $13 for the 10 minute ride. If you want to eat outside the hotel, we found the lunch buffett at Bellagio and Ceasars Palace were the best. MGM's dinner buffett was very disappointing. Pink's hot dog stand is next door in Planet Hollywood and that was decent for dinner one night. Don't buy bottled water if you play the slots...the waitresses will bring it to you while you are seated. Three printers are in the lobby to get your boarding passes. The cost was a $5 minimum to log on to the internet. People were using them like mad to print out Southwest Boarding passes. If you have a blackberry, just log in and check in, you can always get the boarding pass at the airport - especially if you have to stand in line to check your bags anyway! No freebies at this hotel, no bathrobe, slippers, coffee pot, paper, etc. You will pay for everything, but you will have a good time - it's Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “I love the Paris”
Reviews.Author: rodjune
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed here. It's a large hotel but has a more intimate feel than some of the other large casino hotels, and a guest is least likely to get lost. Check-in formalities was handled at the Diamond check-in room as I was a conference attendee. The elevators are close to check-in, which is nice. The regular check-in area wasn't too busy early in the morning but developed a queue after 12 pm. The room is comfortable, large and nicely appointed but not luxurious as a 5 star but is a solid 4 star, which is what most publications rate this hotel. The room I stayed in showed a little bit of wear and tear on the lounge chairs and the desk area but overall it was above average. The view from my room was towards the Bally Hotel, so it was nothing to brag about, and the windows were actually quite filthy with dust. It made looking out the window rather painful. The bed was comfortable for me and I had no problems with the bedding or pillows. I thought that the wall between the bedroom and the bathroom should have had a picture or something to break up the starkness of that particular wall. The lighting in the room was adequate for leisure and taking care of business work. The television was the standard issue that one finds in most 3 star properties; a flat screen would have been a nice upgrade to the room. The closet space is contained in the television armoir cabinet. It wasn't my favorite arrangement as I prefer a separate closet, but was efficient I suppose. There was the standard ironing board and iron. There was an in-room refreshment bar if you get the hungries. Also, 24 room service is available. I thought the prices were fair for room service at a Las Vegas hotel. The bathroom was solid 4 star, lined with marble, with a separate bathtub and shower enclosure. What the bathroom could have used was a little more light, especially in the shower enclosure, where it was rather dark and hard to see. Water pressure is very low with a water saver shower head so don't expect taking long, luxurious hot showers; drought plagues much of the US Southwest. A nice bath would probably be the better choice if you have the time to fill up the tub. The bathroom toiletries such as shampoo and conditioner have a very pleasant smell that works well for women but maybe a little to flowerly for men. I found it to be so mild that I doubt it would be an issue for men. The airconditioning system was easy to use and worked well, and was very quiet. The rooms in general were quiet with no noise intrusion from my next door neighbors. Being on a non-smoking floor, I didn't have to worry about obnoxious odors creeping into the room from under the door or the a/c system. I ate at the Eiffel Tower and Le Artiste Steakhouse. Both had very-well prepared foods but the Steakhouse opens up to the casino so smoke was somewhat of an issue for me. The Eiffel Tower Restaurant was excellent, and I would patronize this venue for dinner on my next trip. I love the buffet at the Paris. Granted, it's a hotel buffet so the quality of the food dips a notch below plated service because of the mass quantity preparation and the standtime in the steam trays. Still, the overall quality is very good and the variety of foods from various parts of France make this an adventure for those who like to try something non-conventional versus the typical Las Vegas buffet offerings. The public areas are reminiscent of Paris, which really appeals to me. It may be too "Disneyesque" for many but I think it's well thought out and easy to understand. Most of the hotel casinos in Las Vegas are rather gimmicky anyways. The casino and main walkway through the hotel casino is a little easier to navigate due to one main walkway from the front of the hotel to the back. Walking distances at this hotel are minimal if you want to get down to the action of the first floor or if you're the type to get out of the hotel and explore other places along the Strip. In fact, the central location of the Paris makes it easy to walk most other casino properties in 15 minutes or less. Overall, a nice hotel, not too large, easy to navigate, and intimate enough to where you don't feel like one in a big herd of cattle.

Reviews.Title: “Not the luxury place I remember”
Reviews.Author: molbeth
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel a few years ago on my honeymoon, so when my job took me to Vegas this past week, I wanted to stay somewhere familiar. I had read reviews on this site that said it had gone downhill, and I have to admit they were right. It is still a great location, still great restaurants, but not the service I remember. It took me a while to check in, and I asked for a room close to the elevators. I was given a handicap-accessible room at the end of a long hallway, about as far from the elevators as I could get. I was exhausted after ten hours of travel, but still wanted a bath/shower! So I called from the house phone on the 10th floor, was told a bellhop was bringing up new keys for another room. After a half hour, I dragged all my luggage back down, all the way through the casino, to the reception desk. This time I got someone much friendlier, who gave me a nice upgrade on the 15th floor, facing the Eiffel Tower and Bellagio. Then I went to get ice and there was a previous guest's old fruit in the bucket. Then I washed my face and dried it with a stained towel. Other than those things (which, much to the credit of housekeeping were quickly corrected), it was a decent stay. They gave me a discount the first night because of the housekeeping issues, without my having to ask for it. Also the bed was springy and hard. That could be my problem...I have a Tempur Pedic at home and nothing compares to that! If I stayed here again, I would get an upgraded remodeled room. I should also note that the Paris is quieter than other casino hotels, so that is a plus. And the food selection was great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Very Nice, Very Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: cpi-man
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, Great Location, Great food inside the hotel, Great Lobby, Great Atmosphere, are you getting the point. This is what you expect when you go to Vegas only the best and this is in that catagory. It is beautiful on the inside you will actually feel like you are in Paris with the little sidewalks and street lights. I have no desires to stay anywhere else when we go to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “needs updating! great location though..”
Reviews.Author: sweetcakesbc
Reviews.Content: nice hotel on the outside, but the rooms need some updating. service was nice, everyone was friendly and proffesional. Mon Ami Gabi is a great restaurant! its worth a visit during your stay. i wouldnt stay at the hotel again though. dont waste your time going to Ah Sin restaurant... food sucks, service was bad too. being from Vancouver we get spoiled with great sushi, lesson learnt dont have it at Ah sin! also not enoughrestaurants in the hotel. there were half hour line ups to all the restaurants at breakfast...we stayed at mandalay bay last time and no line ups there ever! there were twice as many restaurants though. final word, nice to visit this hotel but dont stay there..enjoy some food at Mon Ami Gabi!

Reviews.Title: “Great location...not so great service”
Reviews.Author: barbie90210
Reviews.Content: We (husband and I) checked into our room, Room was ok, beds werent very comfortable. average hotel room. On the side of the night table there was some white hard not sure what it was stuck to night table, nor sure how long it was there for. Had to get house keeping to clean it. Went to had lunch in the cafe St.Louis, waiter asked us what we wanted to drink..before I finished what I wanted he left and returned 10min later with not what I wanted. Same thing with our lunch. We went for breakfast to the buffet, after waiting in line, which is ok. I expected line ups but we had people cutting in front of us. Not talking about 2 or 3, about 40/50 people at seperate times through the line up. Got up to the til, then just as we were going to pay a man cut in front of us (he was with a travel agent) he thought that justifed cutting in front I guess. Sat down and table beside us were drunk and obnoxious, dropping tongs at buffet putting back on table told one of the servers, took about 5 minutes for them to replace tongs. Much better service at different buffets/restaurants. Very poor service. Really disappointed 4 different times we ate at hotel. However, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: claystephens
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Clean, spacious rooms, great views even with the standard view. The hotel lobby/casino has a great Parisian theme that emulates an evening in Paris. To me, the best part about the hotel is that it is not as large as other Vegas hotels in which you feel lost.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: sharicbrb
Reviews.Content: We go to Vegas every year and the first part of October is usually in the 80's but this time it wasn't, the Paris Hotel had a long line when we went to check in but the line went fast. We had a room with a great view of the Bellagio Fountain and Eifel Tower,the room was clean but the bed wasn't real comfortable "o.k". We ate at the Crepery restaurant that only serves Crepes and it was o.k, if you really are a crepe lover you will like this restaurant alot and if your not they will be o.k but the buffet is the same price for breakfast. There was only one day we were able to sit by the pool because it wasn't as warm as normal and we moved about 3 times because of the shady areas. The Paris was nice but I will stay somewhere else next year.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Tys63
Reviews.Content: My Better Half and I stayed here after being in Europe for 5 Weeks on our way home to Australia. We stayed for 6 Days. This was our first time at the Paris as we stayed at MGM last year. It is in a fantasic location on the strip making it very easy to get around. Access to parking if you have a car is very simple and very quick with quick return of your car when you need it. To get to your rooms is very quick (Compared to MGM where you walk miles) The room its self was quite comfortable with 2 Queen beds. It was cleaned daily and all services where taken care of. All in All good value for money. We ate in some of the resturants - would recommend booking a meal at the Eifle Tower reasturant as it was good food at not a bad price. Great view. We also ate at Ballys next door which has a great steak place that I would recommend. Tip - we are not into big breakfasts so I brought some cereal from Walgreens and could get small milks daily from the newsagent in Bally's (You cant put it in the fridge as they will charge you for what ever you use) All In all good value for Money - The only down side was that the Casino floor was quit smokey so you had to find an area that was light on for smokers - which we could on most occasions.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly nice Vegas hotel, but low class bedding”
Reviews.Author: redheada1
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas many times, but this was my first stay at Paris. It's a nice hotel, I'd say it's on par with MGM, but not quite to Bellagio or Venetian standards. My only problem was with the bedding. The mattresses were bouncy and you could practically feel the springs, the sheets were the roughest I've ever had in a nice hotel, and the pillows were lumpy and awful. The feather pillows, you could feel the feathers poking out, so I had housekeeping bring some foam, and they were incredibly lumpy. Very disappointing as the rest of the hotel was fine. The friends I was traveling with mentioned this, as well, and they are not as picky as I am. The room was big, the bathroom was pretty with a separate marble shower. Everything was very clean, and I am a picky traveler. The blow dryer was a "real" dryer, not the usual hotel "breath" dryer. The pool was nice, although too cold to really enjoy in October. I guess it's a seasonal thing, but the pool didn't open until 10a. Even though it was chilly in the mornings, I still would have liked to have my mornings there. There were only a couple of waitpeople working the pool, even though it was a holiday weekend and got pretty crowded in the afternoons. The shops in the hotel are nice, plenty of choices for snacks and dining, and it's small enough to get around easily. The location, in between Ballys and Planet Hollywood, is not great, in my opinion, as neither of those hotels interest me. It's not too hard to get to Bellagio and the Caesar's complex, though. Overall, I would not stay here again simply because of the low grade, motel quality bedding situation. It was not cheap, and for a similar price I think you can do much better in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, food and ambience.”
Reviews.Author: Umechan
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Paris Hotel in Vegas. The hotel is beautiful and very well-done, but the best part is its location on the strip. It is very central and you do so much walking in Vegas that this kind of a location is at a premium. Also, the hotel itself is not too big and it is easy to navigate. We used the pool both days and rented a cabana. The pool is large and never seemed the least bit croweded. The cabanas were great, but a bit more expensive than those I've rented at other properties. If you have 6 people or so, then it is totally worth it. I had a massage at the Mandara spa. The therapist was wonderful. DH used the steamroom on the men's side and thoroughly enjoyed it. Overall the service and amenities were great. The staff was friendly and very accomodating. We were in 1034 (premier) and had a great view of the Eiffel tower and some Bellagio fountain views. The sheets on the bed could have used upgrading. They just weren't smooth and soft. The shower felt like a sprinkle, but what can you do???? The room was clean and nice, otherwise. We didn't eat at the buffet, but we did try Ah Sin (just okay) Mon Ami Gabi (very nice) and the pastries place for breakfast was wonderful. Also, our friends had the concierge room added to their plan so I tried that once or twice. I think it is worth the upgrade. You can easily get your $40 worth if you at 2 people and have breakfast their and take advantage of the free drinks (incl. alcohol.) BTW: I didn't gamble here. Instead we went to Bills, 2 doors down. It has lower minimums and a nice middle-of-the-road crowd. Highly recommend it. I would definitely recommend Paris to stay at and Bills to play at.

Reviews.Title: “Paris is such a beautiful hotel and in the center of all the action”
Reviews.Author: kristieluchky
Reviews.Content: You don't have to walk far for food, gambling, entertainment! The hotel is very accommodating. Rooms are spacious and clean. We spent 4 nights there and always ended up back at Paris Casinos. Very enjoyable stay!! Will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Nice property, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: WXYandZ
Reviews.Content: Great experience of being right on the strip. The casino and indoor passages are nice because it does not appear that you are outside. Nice blend of elegant and casual; trendy and traditional; bohemian and chic. It may not be the best property in Las Vegas but it is for sure unique! Give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “Good - clean room, fair view.”
Reviews.Author: ouachitalion
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean and very roomy. When checking in, we asked the lady at the front desk for a room with a fountain view. She acted as though she could accomodate us - no problem. Our view was of the pool and the tip of the fountains. It was not a bad view, better than the alternative. It was a nice hotel. Good food. Would probably stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Love it here, but this time...”
Reviews.Author: Sanmanz
Reviews.Content: This is the third time this year we've gone to Vegas. I always love to stay at the Paris because of the location. It's smack right in the middle of the strip and you just literally walk out of the casino and you're on it. The rooms are nice and the Red Rooms which are on the upper floors are newly renovated and the best. The casino is easy to get around and the cocktail servers are always good. This is the first time I've been up the Eiffel tower and I would say that, One, I wouldn't stand in the line that there is for it and two, I wouldn't pay that kind of money either. (my husband was comped VIP tix up from the pit boss) The check-in staff wasn't as friendly as they usually are and not very accomadating when it came to getting us a strip view or anything close to where we wanted our room. So, we ended up staying in the Bellagio where we had a view of the lake and strip. We went down with 6 friends and we gave our Paris room to 2 of them. I love the Paris, don't get me wrong. The casino staff is fantastic! I couldn't believe that they couldn't get us a better room considering they invited us down for a poker tourney and gave us the room. Anyway, I'll still go back and maybe get better service at check in. The pool is just a round pool, so if you're going to be at a fantastic sunning spot, this isn't it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not that nice”
Reviews.Author: GABoy55
Reviews.Content: I recently visited Las Vegas for a six-day conference and made the Paris LV my home. The hotel is very upscale and operates almost like an amusement park, with the themed stores and restaurants. The Eiffel Tower landmark and the simile of the Arc de Triumph make you feel as if you are visiting Europe. The check in experience was typical Las Vegas on a Friday, meaning it was about 1/2 hour standing in line. Since I was traveling on a group hotel rate, I was not too bothered by the room with two queen beds, nor the "wonderful" view of the Bally's Hotel next door, but as I walked to my room, there were several cigarette butts on the hallway carpet, (that had not been cleaned up until late the next afternoon). The room was generally clean, with the exception of mold clinging to the grout in the shower. The design and size of the room was adequate, (even if they had to stuff two queen size beds into it), however, why do the beds have to be situated so close to the walls that you have to climb over the bed to turn on or off the lights mounted on the wall next to them. In addition, in a city that depends on it's convention business, why can't there be at least one wall plug situated near the desk in the room in order to plug in a computer. And as long as I'm talking about computers, one would think that a $15 per day charge for internet access borders on the obscene. The romantic atmosphere would bring me back the Paris, if I were traveling with my wife, but I would not try it again as a business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel & very clean”
Reviews.Author: LasVegas200910
Reviews.Content: My husband & I along with two other couples just came back fro m Vegas. The hotel was very beautiful & clean. We stayed in a standard room & it was very clean. The breakfast buffet was delicious & lots of choices especially crepes. Our group was very impressed. & would definetley stay there again. We also did the eifell tower ride & it is a must see espcially at night. The view is absoutley breath taking.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: rucingok
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Thurs Oct 1 to Sun Oct 4, 2009. We were in room 649P. The room was the biggest non-suite room I have ever stayed in. It has absolutley no view (parking garage). We pd the following for each night before taxes. $79, $129, $129. I got this rate on the Harrah's website. We were offered a upgrade to strip view for $55 per night. We declined, I could care less about the view. We wanted a centrally located hotel. We do not gamble, we just wanted easy access to everything. The hotel was very nice,,,4 star IMO. We did have coffee maker and hair dryer in our room. I will have to add that the french pastries in the pastry shop are delicious!!! They were as good as the ones I ate in Paris, France. I had a different one every day. I highly reccommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Paris is a lovely trip to another place, a transporting, ethereal experience.”
Reviews.Author: TMMao
Reviews.Content: First, Paris is beautiful. Waiting in line to check-in, my eyes caught sight of glittering chandeliers, gold-accented walls and marble floors. The wait to check-in was short and the clerk who helped me was pleasant and offered a complimentary upgrade, as the King size bed I'd requested was unavailable. The hotel is small by Las Vegas standards, so it was very easy to get around. Fast elevators, lots of signs and wide hallways made it easy. All the staff I encountered were helpful, friendly and professional. I dined at the attached French bistro, Mon Ami Gabi, every night of my stay. Housekeeping service was excellent and friendly. Don't forget to tip your housekeeper!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous las vegas”
Reviews.Author: normanhudson
Reviews.Content: Paris hotel ou la la great place central posision on the strip room decore excerlent clean spacue well eqipite house maid very helpful eating outlets good celection of food On l room was not ready so they up graded us to a super room no charge

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nancy129
Reviews.Content: I went with my boyfriend for 5 days in Las Vegas. It was a great stay there. When we checked it, we faked that we were engaged and planning to get married that weekend. They upgraded us to a mini suite in the blue room. The room was pretty big. Paris had happy hour every day and the drinks were huge. Also we ate in the Mon Abi Gabi, the restaurant had good food (steak was the best). The Paris buffet was delicious. Location was great, middle of the strip. Pool area had lots of kids, but very nice view of the effiel tower and Planet Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Reviewing Paris Hotel Buffet (not hotel)”
Reviews.Author: travelinmax
Reviews.Content: We have always enjoyed the buffet at the Paris Hotel for many years. This last trip though will be our LAST. For 3 adults and a child, we paid over 90.00 for some of the worst food and service we have EVER experienced. We arrived just as dinner was being served (tip: eat at the last of the lunch service and save tons of $) and I doubted if much fresh food was put out. The quiches were dry dry dry, with NO flavor. The potato dishes tasted as if they had sat out all day and were warmed, the sushi (do they eat that in france?) was so awful we all 4 spit out the bite we put in our mouths. Dry- crumbly, terrible. When we got up to get dessert (yes- we were trying to justify the $$$$ we spent) we had to literally come back to the table and hold up our dishes at shoulder level with 1 hand to get service attention. The plates stayed while we were up getting dessert- approx 5 min, then another 5 in our hands. AWFUL !!!! The soda cups were stacked 4 high for table room and not removed for over 10 minutes. THey had lots of wait staff, they just were not paying attention. PLEASE- until they decide to return to the quality buffet they ONCE were- stay away from this crappy venue. THere are better deals and much better food in Vegas. The coffee shop at Treasure Island was 10 times better- such friendly servers and large servings of very delicious food! At 1/3rd the price. Try it out !

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, loved the Red Room”
Reviews.Author: jennystephenson
Reviews.Content: No complaints. We stayed in a Red Room on the 26th floor and th eview was great. Pool was awesome. Loved this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Delightful, relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: mustang88actuator
Reviews.Content: Easy, pleasant check in, front desk most helpful, great room, spacious, with appealing views of Las Vegas. Easy to get from room to parking garage, casino, restaurants. Enjoyed strolling through the shops between Paris and Bally's. Floor staff on casino floor very easy to find and very accomodating. Cocktail service excellent, never had an empty glass. Cannot wait to go back to this hotel/casino.

Reviews.Title: “vegas was awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: mcastro315
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Vegas for our 10th year anniversary and we loved it. We stayed at the Paris hotel, which we absolutely loved. But then again there are so many awesome hotels in Vegas, that let me tell you, we have about the next 7 trips planned. Anyhow, its the best week wee ever had and I cant wait till we can go back on our next anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: wine4501
Reviews.Content: We have been to Vegas a few times and i have to say that this was our best stay! We were early so our room wasn't ready, but there was a place for our luggage and they delivered it to our room right after we were in our room. We had a (P) room (larger room on the corner) and it was great! Large and very comfy! I wouud suggest asking for one if possible. The hotel is attached to Bally's which was great because lots of choices for food, etc. Gambling was actually a huge surprise and we both ended up winners! We played slots and all table games. Morning's were best for getting quick drink service at the stots (great coffee, starbucks I think!) night service was great on the tables. Perfect location, would definitely use the monorail to get to all hotels quickly!

Reviews.Title: “More than just gambling”
Reviews.Author: Tampa47Bob
Reviews.Content: We found many things to see and do in Las Vegas. My absolute favorite was the Eiffel Tower ride at the Paris Hotel. You go 50 stories up an elevator to the top. It was amazing to watch the fountains at the Bellagio from there. U could see the mountains and the airport. Beautiful at sunset. You can stay up there as long as you like to walk around and look out. The conservatory at the Bellagio is changed seasonally. We also took a day bus trip to the Grand Canyon-well worth the long ride.

Reviews.Title: “CLASSY HOTEL ON THE STRIP”
Reviews.Author: Jesnebas
