Reviews.Content: We had visited this hotel/casino several times but this is the first time that we actually stayed here. It was pretty much as we expected - a clean, attractive hotel on the strip that was reasonably priced. Service was slow in the restaurants even when they weren't particularly crowded but the choice of restauants was excellent. We particularly liked Mon Ami Gabi. Nice place if you want to be on the Strip and not pay a fortune!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Crabby Service”
Reviews.Author: scarlson35
Reviews.Content: Hotel was beautiful. Love the look, location and atmosphere. Hotel staff could have been a lot nicer but maybe they were going for the Paris thing? Rooms were standard but Casino was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Romantic Getaway & Adventure...”
Reviews.Author: hckynut56
Reviews.Content: It was my husband and my first experience in Vegas together, and we could not have picked a more perfect hotel! The Paris Hotel was the perfect combination of dining, shopping, relaxation, and Romance that we were looking for... The staff was impeccable, the rooms were very nice and clean, The restaurants where amazing, and the Eiffel Tower experience put the icing on the cake. I would definitely recommend the Paris Hotel for anyone planning to stay in Vegas, especially those celebrating a special occasion with their loved one.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, especially with a discount, beware of deposit.”
Reviews.Author: tygerchick
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights with my husband and children ages 14 and 8. I got a large discount on the room due to being a member of the Total Rewards program which this casino is a part of. While the room rate was very good for 2 people, around $59, with 2 added people in the room (my kids) the rate went to around $100. What I failed to notice on the reservation confirmation is that I was required to pay a $250 deposit for the room when I checked in. They do not just imprint your card, they either charge the full $250 to your card, which I was told would be refunded to my card within 10 days, or I could pay them in cash and get it back at the end of my stay. I chose to pay cash, as I have played the refund game before. Because I chose cash, the mini bar machine in my room was disabled. Which was fine. I got a room with a view of the model of the Arc d'Triomphe which was nice. The pool was open but really too cold to enjoy. The location was great and the room was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Genteel Crowd Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: cxrrep
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location and views from the hotel. Right next to the mall in Planet Hollywood. Super huge pool. Very few kids.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: mockingjay
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Paris Las Vegas after over 30 consecutive hours of travelling and was completely exhausted. Thankfully because of the early hour I was able to check in straight away but because of some error my booking was not in their system (despite prepaying with hotels.com). The room I had booked was completely unavailable for the first night of my stay so they upgraded me to a beautiful room with a nice view. I expected to be moved once the type of room I had paid for became available but I was not. The room they put me in was decorated in the French style and was very elegant like most of the hotel. It was extremely spacious and had a large and beautifully fitted bathroom. I never visited any of the more formal hotel restaurants as I was travelling solo but i had a few great meals from the vendors and cafes along the "paved street" which adjoins the Paris to Bally's. The hotel is centrally located on the strip and is within very easy walking distance of all the major casinos. There is also the monorail system nearby (Bally's) which can take you quickly and cheaply to almost all the casinos which is a great option in hot weather. The staff were always incredibly friendly and polite in all my interactions with them and I would definitely recommend this hotel to others for service, location and incredible value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Metalhead55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for five nights from 9/25 to 9/30/09. We had no problems with check in and were even allowed to check in early. From reading previous reviews I was expecting less than mediocre service, However Florieda was very nice and helpful. We got a great room with a excellent view of the Eiffel Tower and Bellagio Fountains. Our room was clean and roomy. Our housekeeper Claudia was excellent, very nice and prompt! We used valet the entire time with no problems til checkout, we waited quite a while to get our car and the bellman coulden't wait any longer and just dumped our luggage on the curb while we waited. The casino itself was fun and we had great cocktail service. The buffett was good, however the meat carver was extremely rude to us. For as much as you pay to eat there you should atleast get service with a smile...is that too much to ask??? Overall, It was fun, I would stay here again but eat elsewhere : ) AND last but not least the small bar outside the Eiffel Tower...WHAT GREAT SERVICE from the bartenders. These two changed our outlook on our stay! Very nice and customer oriented.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: MsND
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the paris hotel for 4 nights in september with my partner. When we arrived i expected large queues as I have been to vegas before but the service was very quick and the receptionist was really pleasent. I asked for a strip view and paid for an upgrade which gave us a huge room with a great view of the pool and the bellagio fountains, it also incuded a continental breakfast, pre dinner snacks and drinks. It was really great value and I would recommend doing it. The bathroom in the room was also large and the shower was huge. The room and the hotel in general were kept really clean. We booked a trip and a show through the hotel and they were really helpful and searched really hard to find the perfect trip for us. We used a few of the cafes and the service and food was lovely. I loved this hotel and if i was back in vegas I would stay again without question.

Reviews.Title: “great view, but”
Reviews.Author: rijets
Reviews.Content: The view from our room was spectacular as you can see the big Paris globe and Eiffel tower in front of the hotel and the Bellagio fountains at night. You can see all the fountain shows except that you can't hear any of the music. Kind of disappointing since I always enjoy the fountain shows whenever they are going off. The room itself was kind of small and the furniture seems dated since this is one of the only hotels I knew of where they didn't have a flat screen television.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Paris”
Reviews.Author: fgambi1
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at Paris Las Vegas for two nights near the end of September 2009. Overall, our 2-night stay was very nice, the location is great, and the room clean. Check-in was quick although the employee seemed irritated and was unable to find our reservation until I provided my confirmation print-off. Room was on the small side and a little cramped, but clean. It showed some wear, but still nice. The bathroom was large and clean, as well. We had no view (except of the side of another building), but didn't ask for one either. There were lots of food options. We ate at the burger place and the little deli/bakery. The food and prices at both were good, the service was okay. For the price we paid, location, and generally nice accomodations, I would stay at Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrific Service”
Reviews.Author: medic215
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had been to Vegas once prior to this trip and thought the Paris looked like a beautiful place to stay - which it is from the casino, the shops, and the outside. There are no benefits from being a hotel guest. We booked the room on their website directly. When we arrived to register they tried to change our room to a double queen rather than the king that we reserved. They screwed up our debit card and put a HUGE hold on it so we were without funds for 36-hours until our bank opened and we could force the hold off of our account. They had no explanation or apologies for our troubles they simmply said "that's standard operating procedure". I understand how holds work, but this was HUNDREDS more than necessary. As a motel guest anywhere else in the country you usually get free internet, but not here. A bottle of water is $4!! Beer is anywhere from $5-$8 for a draft beer! The best customer service we had from the Paris was the bell man, he was very kind and helpful. All of our other experiences with staff was horrible, we were treated like pond scum! We will NEVER stay at the Paris again. By the way, if you get hungry and want room service to bring some chips and dip to your room, it's $35. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else. For the amount we spent, we should have received better service.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique!!!”
Reviews.Author: CanadaLoveparis
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about Paris Las Vegas Hotel!! I have been to Vegas at least 10 times and stayed at many hotels there but this was my first time at Paris.We plan to go back next year and will stay there.The food, room, service, check-in and out were all a Class Act...You will not be disappointed!!!! Tina and Stephen from Canada

Reviews.Title: “Paris Hotel Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: charlottetate
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Las vegas for the third time and stayed at Paris Las Vegas. When arriving after traveling from England for 24 hours on a plane then queued for 30 minutes at check in at 10pm at night Vegas Time. We where asked if we wanted the following Up Grades .90 dollars a night for a Le mann Suite or 55 dollars for a room on the strip. As we had already payed a lot of money to get there and where leaving our stuff for two day to go to San fran did not feel it was worth it. The room we got was a nice clean room with a large showe for two and a bath and showed the side of the end of the hotel and could see the fountains if we stood at the end of the window. We visted the pool three times and was great but was full of leafs and a little bit cold to swim in but nice to sit by. Drinks where very expensive at 20 dollars a cocktail . We ate in the hotel for breakfast at the buffet but did not enjoy it and was not worth the money. Nothing was in the right place . For example cereal was not with milk. Cereal bowls and spoons had to be asked for . There was cake for breakfast which was wierd. We ate at moni gabi and although ate before was not good at all and where sat next to a man and two ladys of the night who all ate off one plate. We went to the Night club which was tiny and the bar made screamed at me as i asked for Rum and coke and she gave me Brandy . When i said that i had not ordered it she screamed you saw me pour it out. The place was so dark i could not see anything apart from her screaming in my face. The main problem was that our room keys would not work 5 times and had to be let in the room after passports where shown . The good thing about paris is it central the bad think is its plastic Paris. No one is french but they pretend to be and the french music in the lift gets on your Nerves. They also do not clear the room service plates away and are left in the hall for two days to three.

Reviews.Title: “PAris Hotel WAY better than other reviews would led me to believe”
Reviews.Author: landscapemaker
Reviews.Content: I was terrified, just terrified to stay at this hotel after I read the reviews on this site; well, thankfully they were all wrong, all of them. We arrived for our conference at 11:00pm, there were no lines, the lobby was beautiful, sparklingly clean and the check in was easy. Paula, who works the night shift there, gave us a free upgrade to the most beautiful suite, it is larger than my NY apartment and reminded me of the old Plaza Hotel. The room was clean and lovely and had two bathrooms and a huge jacuzzi. The hotel halls were clean and well lit and the maid service was spectacular. We got turn down service and that was just sweet and lovely. The food in the hotel is just o.k. and the casino seems dark but we didn't gamble there so who cares. The pool was beautiful and the hotel is very quiet. I would stay at this hotel again, no question and I would recommend it to anyone. I don't know what these other people are going on about, really.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Paris Las Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SOOregonBeatnik
Reviews.Content: OUR STAY AT THE PARIS LAS VEGAS HOTEL My Wife and I came back to Las Vegas to celebrate our one year anniversary, we were married there in 2008. As usual, our trip to Las Vegas was fun and exciting. We decided to stay at the Paris Las Vegas, for our return trip, and considered it is a good place to stay for the price. However, this most recent stay at Paris Las Vegas, was a little disappointing. Before our arrival we called to confirm our reservation and to inform of our arrival time, we upgraded our room to the Premier Room with a view of the pool and the water show at the Bellagio, across the street, as well as, the Eiffel Tower (a $55 a night upgrade). When we arrived to our room, we had noticed the room with a view had to have the dirtiest windows, looked as though the windows had a film/water spots, etc. (very cloudy), not very appealing for the room with a view. We had also noticed clutter from the previous visitors on the floor, which was left throughout our entire three-night stay. In addition, two of the four light bulbs were burned out in the bathroom, again all three nights, as well as, plumbing problems with the toilet (We called for maintenance, it took an hour to show up). The shower stall / door had mold & mildew growth around the door and floor of shower stall. We were also disappointed to find, no refrigerator, microwave or coffee pot for visitors’ use, although we were charged for moving items around the mini bar to make room for our own items (the charge was corrected after discussing the issue with the front desk & Housekeeping.) Another incident occurred while we were there, the room next door, had a lot of commotion going on, banging on the walls and yelling. Evidently, it got worse the next day, Hotel Security was in the hallway, blocking it one afternoon when we were coming back to our room. The persons occupying the room, were being told they needed to leave, not sure what that was about, but made us feel uncomfortable, upon arriving back to our room. In the past we have referred our friends / family to stay at the Paris Las Vegas, and hopefully they did not experience any of the inconveniences we had. We hope Paris Las Vegas strives on improving the items / concerns mentioned above.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with poor service standards claiming to be 4*”
Reviews.Author: xdaisyj
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 nights in late September 09. I was disappointed. From check in to check out, there was nothing special about my stay. The check in process is like a cattle call, as you wait in a massive line for about 45 minutes to be called to the next station. The woman I had check me in was unpleasant and rude and very unhelpful. She acted like I was being a pain by asking what the account balance was. When enquiring about the internet and whether it was secure she just looked at me then finally said 'when you log in you'll find out'. Um, ok! I asked about late check out and she said 'don't know, call on your last day'. If you need any help during your stay and want to speak with someone you have to wait in the massive check in queue just to ask a simple question. The concierge is very limited and just direct you to check in. The room itself was spacious but nothing great. My window was so dirty I couldn't actually really see out of it. There are no special little extras you expect to find in a 4* hotel. The TV is limited, and the internet is $15 a day (and no it is not secured). Overall I have come from staying in about 20 Eastern Europe hotels before Paris Las Vegas and even they were better than this hotel. I wouldn't stay here again, and recommend paying a little more to stay at some of the other hotels on the Strip that will offer you good service.

Reviews.Title: “Our bargain find turned into a great holiday”
Reviews.Author: lawrencelins
Reviews.Content: myself, my partner and two other couples booked a really cheap deal to stay at the Paris Hotel in Vegas for a long weekend. We knew it was going to be nice but oh my god what a place! When we walked in the doors we were in awe of the way the casino was set out. It was just like being outside, with stars in the sky, just like on a summers evening on the streets of Paris. Unfortunately when we all booked in our room wasn't ready so we were asked to wait an hour. We went and looked at the other couple's rooms which were fantastic and then went back to reception. Our room still wasn't ready so they gave us a different room a few floors up from the others. OH MY GOD what a room is all I can say! It was absolutely amazing!!! The view was fantastic, the facilities werew great, we couldn't have asked for more. The other's spent the weekend very jealous of our upgrade!! There are so many food outlets, all looked very nice and the ones we tried were very good. The only down side is the casino. It doesn't seem to have any atmosphere. But lets be honest with so many other casinos around we never spent too long in the Paris casino.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but in need of updating”
Reviews.Author: RTW_Aggie
Reviews.Content: Recently spent Thursday – Sunday at Paris. In short, if you are looking for a mid range hotel (with a good location) without service and rooms that need updating – this is the place for you. One week before arrival we received an email upgrade offer for an upgrade to a view or an upgrade to a view and lounge access. We decide to take the lounge access upgrade since it sounded like a decent deal ($60 per night for breakfast and drinks / food at night). We checked in late (11 pm) on Thursday. Somewhat surprisingly there was no king room available (had requested), but were told we could switch on Friday. The check in lady was useless. Her main purpose was to try to up sell -- She did not tell us anything about the hotel (elevators, lounge location, what the hotel charge slips were). The room we had overlooked the pool and was dated. The windows were in a major need for cleaning and the entire room had seen better days – the alarm clock was broken, hair dryer was useless, TV was old and not good, etc. On Friday morning we went to the lounge for breakfast, after calling the front desk to find out where it was (our keys did not work, but the rep in the lounge fixed them). The breakfast options were very basic (fruit, cereal, bagels, coffee, OJ) – no hot items. We left and went to the front desk to change rooms – the rep was helpful and arranged the change. We also told them we did not want the lounge access anymore and she made it clear that we would also lose our upgraded view – we did not have a problem. We could keep the old room until we received a message to change rooms (around 3pm). Later in the day we returned to the room and no message light – around 3 I check and found we had a message (the phone light was broken) to change our room (the room was ready 10 minutes after we were at the front desk (makes me wonder of it was available the night before). Our new king room was in slightly better condition, although the hallway leading to the room had numerous holes in the wall. The new room again had extremely dirty windows and a bad hairdryer again (this one actually stopped working when it over heated). If it were not for a good location on the strip and decent casino (poor sports book) I would not consider the hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: gioia26
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Paris, Las Vegas. We were surrounded by elegance, great service, great food, and fun! The rooms are lovely, the Mon Gabi restaurant is excellent. We sat outside every morning for breakfast there. The casino and shops are all so well designed with an eye for detail and interesting settings. The service was wonderful and the location is really great at the center of the strip. We enjoyed the park-like pool setting and music in each area of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No Lagniappe”
Reviews.Author: cork2000
Reviews.Content: Lagniappe is the Cajun word for a little EXTRA. Meaning a service surprise over and above standard service. The Paris has none. The bed was hard and as the employee of the month confirmed at checkin, all floors from 24 down were not updated the past ten years and recommended an upgrade for $40.00 more a night. As a gold card member I realized you do not get any benefits, which was confirmed by the low return in the casino. My recommendation is to go to a MGM_Grand hotel, where they charge more for the room, but give you a chance to win at the tables and slots. The food is also better at the MGM-Loews Hotels. TRY um...ie: Belllagio Buffet and Greenburgs Deli.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I Had Known These Things”
Reviews.Author: KathiinCA
Reviews.Content: We got a pretty good deal with Southwest Vacations on airfare and hotel. Then we paid more for the concierge lounge to get a view but they put us on the 15th floor. Turns out that the 15th and 31st floors have a concrete fleur de lis things outside the windows that block your view a bit. You also need to be pretty high up to see the Bellagio Fountains (my favorite). The lounge was nice and the food was pretty good. The room was very clean. The showerhead was not adjustable and you had to stand under it twice as long to get the soap off. Doesn't that defeat the purpose? Mon Ami Gabi-Not that great. Very noisy. Would have been nicer to go to one of the Bellagio restaurants and sit on a terrace. Probably wouldn’t have cost much more, if at all. Paris Buffet-Not as good as we remembered. No crème brulee at breakfast. Cabana-We were in the last one on the side by the hot tubs and closest to the Eiffel Tower. The couch was not as nice as in the other cabanas I noticed and the lounge chairs at the other cabanas had cushions.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Paris!”
Reviews.Author: CruzDiva
Reviews.Content: My Mom and I stayed at the Paris for 4 days – Sept. 13th to 17th. This was our first time in Las Vegas. First, the Paris: We arrived at the Paris at 3:45pm and waited in the check in line for 20 minutes. Farida, who checked us in, was EXCELLENT! We got the room we requested (Luxury) on a non-smoking floor. Farida was very personable and friendly and the person you want to be greeted by after a long day of traveling. The reason for the long check in line was 1300 conventioners checking in that day. Farida asked if we would be using the mini-bar and said no. We had no problems with any unauthorized charges for the mini-bar on our credit card. Remember: this is not a fridge for your personal use so if you buy any beverage at a store, go to the ice machine on your floor to keep your drinks cold. The Paris was a very clean hotel, from the lobby to our room (#1693), to the restaurants. We don’t gamble so we did not spend any time in the casino. The hotel is located mid-Strip which makes is accessible to many hotels close by (Bellagio is across the street; Ceasar’s Palace just down the road; Flamingo across the street; Planet Hollywood is next door). The monorail is great for traveling to the hotels further afield (such as The Venetian, the Sahara). It runs from Ballys which is connected to the Paris. The cost is $5 for one single trip; $13 for a full day pass; $30 for a 3-day pass (they sometimes have discounts on these prices). We ate at Le Village Buffet on the first night for dinner and the food and variety were excellent. We only ate there once as we do not eat a lot food to get our money’s worth at buffets. We ate twice at Mon Ami Gabi – lunch and dinner. We were lucky to be able to get a table outside on the Strip watching the people and the Bellagio fountains. The food at both sittings was very good. We had breakfast at Le Café each morning as we only have cereal or toast and tea. We had dinner there once and had a bad meal – bad as in they advertised one thing but brought something different. Sent it back and ordered something else but the dinner was spoiled because of that and the waiter’s attitude didn’t help either (he was the only person at the Paris that was rude). Check out was a breeze. We checked our account on the tv each day to ensure there were no charges on the card. You can check out on the tv between 7:00am and 3:00pm (I think I got that right). Attractions: 1) Bellagio Fountains: they were great, a must see especially at night. We went to see the botanical gardens at the Bellagio but it was being torn down that day as they were changing from their summer display to the autumn display. 2) Secret Garden & Dolphin Encounter (The Mirage) – the Secret Garden holds lions, white tigers, a black panther, and a 10 month old leopard. The Dolphin Encounter does not provide a dolphin performance – it’s a research and training facility and you can watch the trainers with the dolphins. 3) The Venetian Hotel: you must go and see the lobby and look at their ceiling – magnificent! We took the gondola ride ($16 per person for about 15 minutes) and enjoyed the experience. We had dinner one night at Canelletos – excellent food. We ate outside (actually inside but it looks like you are eating outside with the ceiling painted as the sky as you will see in some of the hotels) and we were entertained by singers. Shows: We went to the Terry Fator and his Cast of Thousands show at The Mirage. What a laugh! He and his puppets were hilarious. A must see! The only bad experience in Las Vegas was the people standing on the street flicking cards constantly and trying to give them to you as you walk by them – these cards are promoting girls and sex. I’ve been told (whether true or not) that the city can’t get rid of them as they have claimed “restraint of trade”. The cards are thrown on the ground and left there dirtying the street. I say make them pick them up. There were many other hotels and attractions that we wanted to see but we couldn’t fit them into our 4-day stay. I guess we’re going back to Las Vegas next year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Hotel and Location! Good selection.”
Reviews.Author: AJ_0001
Reviews.Content: The Paris is an excellent hotel - Very central on the strip, great food, great service, great rooms. We just had 10 days there - fantastic. Good Casino (average size i'd say) - a little more mature/grown-up than the nearby Planet Hollywood, Luxor, Excaliber - but the guests aren't too old - so not like the Flamingo, Caeser's, Rio. Its relatively quiet in the day (nice) and of course heats up at night - but didn't get too busy that you couldn't get great service. Good Pool area, not so good Spa (a bit over-priced and actaully a little dirty/run down too - not up to the class you'd expect from the rest of the place). Try the very reasonable buffet - and the other restaurants are good too (except the Italian - which was poor). Pick this hotel - get a good price - and it will make your stay a great one!" Top Tip:"Ask for an upgraded room when you check in - try for something 27th floor or higher (dont worry - there are elevators just for 27th+ floors) - we got a great room with view over the pool, Effiel Tower and Bellagio fountains - Nice. Just pass over $30-$50 when you check-in to smooth the way....small price to pay. When your playing at the tables - ask if they have any discount markers to the restaurants and buffets - we got 20% - 40% off every time - great!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at Paris Las vegas!”
Reviews.Author: oleandrum
Reviews.Content: We came to Paris Las Vegas on our anniversary and have been so disappointed from the begining. The key from the King Luxury room we booked in advance we never got. After walking around for 3 hours, we came back at 9pm and the room still wasn't ready and we got just a stardant room with a pool view. (We think the room was clean but somehow they didn't want to give it to us). I came down 3 times to get my King Luxury room keys and the lady worked that night talked to me so depreciatingly, started argue with me. She even ask me if I have a problem with a standart room? Yes, of course I did. All my plans I had that night went out and only one nice thing to remember about this stay is because we went to Ceasars Palace. Was beautiful! We do not understand how staff can work at the places like this without any smile, talk to us so unrespectable. We are coming to Las Vegas to rest and have fun after flights all day long and expecting a liitle bit more attention. If your staff can't do it, then it's a time to review your enployees. I really got hurt by a lady worked that night. I'll never ever come to this place again! I'm living in this beautiful country, but this experience I wish to forget because of the some person not care about doing a job well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mapl
Reviews.Content: Paris is located right in the center of the strip---easy access to everywhere. Pool and all dining great; even had a small store with late night snacks. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Second stay at the Paris, it's ok, not great.”
Reviews.Author: JayLSeattle
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel is the location as most reviewers have pointed out. My wife and I recently stayed 5 days/ 4 nights from 9/7 - 9/11/09 to celebrate our anniversary; we spent 3 nights at this same hotel the year before. The hotel is nice, the service staff is somewhat friendly. I've found that the housekeeping staff to be much friendlier than the front desk. The rooms and hallways are showing some wear, but this isn't exactly the Four Seasons nor The Ritz Carlton. Lenotre is a cafe within the hotel which offeres pastries/sandwiches and coffee; however, just like the year before, the service line is slow just to get a cup of coffee. For some reason, the operation in this cafe just isn't the most efficient. If you don't need the immediate caffeine hit first thing in the morning and refuse to wait in line for at least 10 minutes, walk 5 minutes to the south where Planet Hollywood is located, there's a Starbucks there. Otherwise, we dined fairly casually throughout the strip. We spent the afternoons gambling at various hotel casinos up and down the strip. In the evening, we would return to the Paris and play the slots there. The payouts at the Paris was awful, I had much better luck at Planet Hollywood next door and at the New York New York. Walgreens and CVS is just 3 blocks south of the Paris (they are very large blocks), it's the best destination to stock up on bottled water and accessories. The Miracle Mile adjacent to Planet Hollywood has an ABC store which is affordable as well. Try to stay away from the hotel gift shops for water if you don't mind a 5-10 minute walk. My wife wanted to shop at the Premium outlets near downtown/ Fremont street. Rather than renting the most basic car for at least $50/day, we took a cab which was about $20 each way to the outlet. We later found out the some of The Deuce's routes, the double decker bus that runs up and down the strip, also goes up to Fremont street. For only $7 for a 24 hour pass, this is the way to go. If you work out, the gym in the hotel will cost you ~$20 a day (forgot the exact price); internet access within the room will cost you about $15. They'll get you for everything. Overall, we would stay at the Paris again; but I do wonder, what are the other hotels like?

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: sb1967
Reviews.Content: First we did have to wait in line to check in but not long. The room that we had was okay nothing special I had a great view of a parking garage.( I guess someone has to get those rooms ) The room did have a nice size TV. I was a little annoyed that I couldn't use the Refridge. If you did you had to pay. NOT WORTH IT!!!! The buffet was excellent we ate there lunch and dinner we didn't make it to the breakfast one but people that we were with said it was very good. Over all I probably would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tripsterz
Reviews.Content: we just got back from Vegas, Paris. Beautiful ! we enjoyed all las vagas has to offer. We did the sight seeing. All the walking in 106 dgree tepms. Always felt like home returning from our outings. the atmosphere is amazing. We were upgraded to the Les mans suit. Very nice ! Staff was awsome. Lou Lou is great ! We'll be back !

Reviews.Title: “Just average!!”
Reviews.Author: tfc63
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one evening, before returning home. We had stayed at Bellagio the week before, so we thought we would try another place. Price was not that great; room was large as we did a petite suite. Bathroom was very nice, and clean, but overall service at the restaurant was fair to poor, Not very friendly people. We travel to Mexico at least once a yr, and we are spoiled by their willingness to provide great service, something you just don't get at other places. Overal value not so great at any place we went to in Vegas. I would recommend taking the time to go to the old part of town, at Freemont St. People there were more friendly, and definitely not as crowded... I wouldn't stay at Paris again unless the price was more reasonable..

Reviews.Title: “Paris was awesome.”
Reviews.Author: Zoey72
Reviews.Content: Don't forget the coupon book. There are free tickets to go to the top of the Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: susie041
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Las Vegas - Paris Hotel booking in - 1st class,staff polite, lovely room, buffet village - great for breakfast and evening meals - did not manage lunch. Absolutely no complaints. Susan Thornton, Scotland

Reviews.Title: “greatly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: SUNSETWV
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for the location and look. We called prior to our trip 3 times requesting a higher floor if possible and facing the strip if available without additional costs if possible. We were told we would be helped if possible. We arrived at the desk and inquired about a room facing the strip and we were told it would be an additional $55.00 per night to get that room. If there was an additional charge we should have been told during one of our 3 phone calls! We did get the 21st floor with a great view of the alley. The room was worn, the tub faucet dripped and the ironing board was very unstable. The buffet for breakfast was great but overall I would not stay there again or advise anyone else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Recession? Then where's the service one would expect?”
Reviews.Author: 2row
Reviews.Content: We have to say this was the worst trip to Vegas we have had. We have been 5 times and stay at different hotels every time. We are always greeted with a smile and friendly front desk staff. Not at Paris. We arrived on a Wednesday before Labour day long weekend. It wasn't busy, yet. When we were called up to the front desk, it felt like I was back at the airport waiting to go through security. Jenny, the desk agent bellowes out "Next" We were excited to be there and was expecting the typical warm greetings, but she had nothing to say to us besides the least she could to get us on our way. I requested a king bed and a strip view when we booked over a month prior. We were told they offer this and that the request is put in. When I asked Jenny, she simply says not available. The strip view can be purchased at an additional $55. I think this should have been told to us when we called last month. Call me crazy, but any time I have stayed somewhere if you request a king bed, you get a king bed. It's like requesting a non smoking room and getting to stay in an ashtray. Anyway, I had to ASK Jenny how to get to our rooms, so I wasn't about to ask her any other questions, since most agents will politely point out on a map where to go. She obviously isn't a people person (good place for her to work). We got to our rooms and had 2 queen's not a King. We were told we could switch in the morning. Super....not! We also requested a late check out for Sunday at 5:00 for a fee of $100. We were told this wasn't a problem. Well being a long weekend, we called the day of, and were told absolutely not. The hotel was 100% capacity and there is nothing they can do. At this point, we were mad. There were lots of other things leading up to this, such as a rude hostess at the cafe, my wife not getting a drink in the casino that she ordered at least a half hour prior, no coffee and half the draught beer out in Napoleons lounge, etc, etc. Mostly little things, but they add up when positive ones don't start happenning. One would think in a time of a recession, a business would extend a warm hand to want guests to return, as we all feel the pinch. Paris must want to extend the pinch to their guests as well. I phoned to speak to management. After being on hold for several minutes, I was hung up on. Finally I got through to Nikki. She was the only staff member who made this trip worthwhile. She deserves a raise as she was friendly, accomodating and relaxed. I was only on the phone with her for 3 minutes starting to describe the stay, and she let us stay in our room until 6:00 for no extra charge. We will not be staying at Paris again. Perhaps we just had a run of bad luck, but with so many other choices, why risk it.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Hotel Lies”
Reviews.Author: NovemberRI
Reviews.Content: Paris Hotel advertises on Vegas.com that if you book 4 nights between Oct 31 and Jan, 2010, you will receive 25% off your stay. When you book it, it does not give the discount. I double and tripled checked my dates to make sure they were not in the BLACKOUT dates under category "Terms and Conditions", and my dates were NOT in those dates. I called the phone number on the page, and the person on the phone could offer no explanation, only that the "hotel can do what it wants".

Reviews.Title: “clean room, good view”
Reviews.Author: FKS
Reviews.Content: good: clean room, bathroom. staff was friendly. view of pool and strip was great. pool is huge, but sun goes down early. second time to stay at paris. buffet has a decent selection, but one staff member was unaware that there was rice available. bad: TV needs to be updated. sprint reception is spotty. internet is not free.

Reviews.Title: “Bathroom Backup”
Reviews.Author: Kathiie
Reviews.Content: Type of Room - Premium - stayed 2 nights Check in clerk was somewhat arrogant and snippy – complained about how she was tired and was looking forward to going home. Called us over to her station, started processing our reservation, then left for about 5 minutes with no explanation. Room had a view of the Eiffel Tower and pool and a very partial view of the Bellagio Fountains. Took about 5 minutes for hot water to reach the bathroom every time. Bottom sheets on the beds were not fitted and barely came to the bottom of the mattress. Noticed that dirty food trays were left in the hall for many hours. Housekeeping for our room was fine - the only reason I rated one star for cleanliness was because of the following incident (I just hope this bathroom was thoroughly cleaned before the next person stayed in this room) - On the morning we were going to check out, we had packed up everything and gone to breakfast. We were back in the room, zipping up our suitcases, when I heard a gurgling sound coming from the bathroom – there was black, smelly sewerage backing up from the sink drain, overflowing the sink and spilling onto the floor. Called housekeeping – first thing they asked was if our toilet was backing up. We told them the sink was backing up and spilling onto the floor. After calling housekeeping, someone did show up within a few minutes – at that point we were going out the door with our suitcases – apparently the rooms across the hall also had problems. We did an express checkout and left.

Reviews.Title: “Not Gay but excellent location & food!”
Reviews.Author: mycrysie
Reviews.Content: First off I should say that one of the main reasons I went to stay at the Paris hotel was because they often market themselves as Gay Paris and me and my partner thought it would be great to stay at a place that was gay-friendly. However this hotel is NOT gay at all...not to say they are anti-gay or anything like that but there is zero evidence that they are gay-friendly in their signage, events, or anywhere. So we kinda felt dissapointed in that respect but despite this, we thought the hotel was AWESOME. The location is centre strip with so much going on to the north and the south that you really get the true Vegas experience. The rooms were clean and the housekeeping staff (in fact all staff) were very friendly and the service was consistently good. Our room was the basic room on the 20th floor and the view was non-existent (we were looking out on a building rooftop) but you don't come to Vegas to stay in the room all day. I would say that this hotel is better for couples and older adult groups because the vibe is very different then some of the more well-known gambling hotels like Ceasar's or Bellagio. The Paris Casino is quite ordinary and not that engaging and small compared to other places. We found that we only used the hotel casino for when we were waiting on dinner reservations, killing some time, or when you get that "i gotta bet some money" urge at 3am. If having an awesome casino in your hotel lobby is important to you then stay someplace else. The pool is on the 3rd floor but is outdoors. Large area with lots of chairs and clean. The FOOD is DELISH! We ate at the Village Buffet which to be quite honest was the BEST buffet we ever had. High quality food and well-prepared--highly recommended. We also ate at the hotel cafes and ordered room service and everything was delicious! However the prices are higher then maybe 3 star hotels which is why I'm assuming there were few children/families staying there. I wish they had a like a fast food court or something in the lobby like other hotels like New York New York because sometimes you don't want to spend $10 on a danish and coffee. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for the Paris feeling (maybe you prefer sightseeing or shows instead of gambling), good food, centre strip at a good price (ie not Bellagio) and enjoy a laid back vibe. I would stay here again but would probably check out another hotel like Ceasar's on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: uMickey
Reviews.Content: We paid $100 per night (£60) for a standard room and we were very impressed with the size of it & the huge bathroom. Expect a very budy hotel with a possoble delay at check-in. We were sefl-drive and this caused us no issues as huge free car park @ rear. Siutated right opposite the Bellagio Hotel in the centre of the strip it is ideal location for walking/sight-seeing. Excellent noise-free air conditioning in all rooms and despite 3000 bedrooms our bags were delivered to our room(s) within 10 minutes of check-in by very friendly staff. Restaurants - 10 to chose from - expect to pay good money for an average bottle of wine but food was good - v/good in the less formal burger restaurant - huge portions and good value for money. 115 degrees during our visit but air conditioning works a treat in all hotels. If you want big, busy and "WOW look a that do Vegas! MJL

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong with this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: stephers66220
Reviews.Content: My mom treated me to a trip to Las Vegas for my 40th birthday and we couldn't have picked a better place to stay. Right from the moment we arrived, we enjoyed our stay. Everyone that works at this hotel were very friendly and accommodating- smiles all around. We upgraded our room for $55 a night- this included breakfast everyday, and a light dinner with complimentary drinks every night. We also received two free passes for the Eiffel Tower which was a great way to see the whole strip lit up at night. Our room was very clean and comfortable and both of us found the beds to be very comfortable. The food in the restaurants was excellent and we really enjoyed our meal at Mon Ami Gabi. I also booked a massage treatment at the Mandara Spa which was worth every penny- they treat you like royalty there. One of the best things about this hotel is the location- right in the middle of the strip. As it was so hot there, it was nice to be close to many of the other big hotels. It was a fabulous trip I would stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Viva La France”
Reviews.Author: solotravlr45
Reviews.Content: I was apprehensive because of some of the other earlier reviews, but once I got there I was happy that I decided to spend my stay here. Firstly, Check-in was easy however, there was a line when I got there and had to wait for 15 min. This is totally understandable given the size of this property (nearly 3,000 rooms to check in and check out). The Paris theme is a special touch, faux cobblestone street scenery paths through the main level of the property that leads to quaint shops and eateries. The casino was packed on the weekend with lots of gambling action. (More so then other casinos) Good gambling energy to see everyone in a great mood. Daily Happy hour at the pool was also a nice touch. Get to the pool early, as it does get busy, however, I didn't have trouble finding a chair. The staff were all extremely helpful and friendly. Service was great from everyone. The room I had was a premium view room. At check in i was offered the upgrade, but i declined and was happy with the room and the Eiffel tower view. The room was clean and the decor was comfortable TV amoire, safe, two queen beds, two side chairs and a desk and chair. The bathroom was large all marble with separate shower stall. No problems with this property. I would definitely stay here again. Cons: Internet surcharge, most of the hotel on the strip are charging this fee. $15.00 a day for Paris. The hospitality industry works on tips. Friendly smiles and tips go a long way to enhance your experience at this hotel and any hotel on the Las Vegas strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and really nice room.”
Reviews.Author: stevesgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris Las Vegas for a cheap quick nights sleep on our way to Death Valley. What a value it was! Check-in was extremely slow as they only had three people working and this was at 7:30 at night. However, the room he gave us more then made up for the inconvenience. I have no idea how we got so lucky, but we ended up having an Eifel Tower and Bellagio fountains view! I was ecstatic as this is what I really wanted, but I didn't want to pay the extra charge. The only thing that I asked for when I booked the room is a high floor, away from elevators and at the end of the hall (I'm a light sleeper and I don't like a lot of traffic by our room door). The room was amazing! It wasn't fancy or exotic, but just really nice and big. Everything was clean and looked pretty new. The bed and pillows were comfortable for me and I'm quite picky when it comes to comfort. The bathroom was HUGE and beautiful. Large vanity area, somewhat separate toilet, large bathtub and totally separate glass encased shower. The outdoor swimming pool looked amazing and I sure wish we would have had time to take a dip. From what we saw, the rest of the hotel was very nice. It was neat to walk the streets of Paris. Lots of shops and restaurants located all around. Very easy to navigate. No problem with parking and parking exit is located close to the "streets" of Paris. Over-all a wonderful stay and I'd go there again if the price was right!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, needs updating”
Reviews.Author: SpartyHolt_Michigan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris several years ago, just after it opened. The room and floor on this trip was the same decor as our first stay. The hotel is showing signs of the high use and abuse that Las Vegas hotels get. While clean and need, there was damage to the tub that had been poorly repaired, holes in the wall were fixtures had been remove and a old TV that was on its' last legs. I understand that some areas have been renovated, but we were not offered a chance to upgrade. I was suprised to see room service trays sit in the hallway for over 24 hours. Room service, however, was extremely prompt. As long as your not paying any more than the cost of a three star hotel, this is a good bet.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: deb49
Reviews.Content: this was our third stay at the paris and it was wonderful.Service was great...location was great...food and gaming was great. we are going again the first week of sept. Just my husband and myself I cannot wait. We have recommended this hotel to all of our friends. keep up the great work. We have yet to be disapointed with our rooms

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Bamath77
Reviews.Content: Just a great hotel. Perfect location and amazing restaurants if you like a cozy warm inviting hotel. Other hotels try to be fancier but if you want feel like home, then the Paris is a great hotel. highly recommended and definitely try to weasel your way into an upgraded room. No harm in trying!

Reviews.Title: “Paris - nice for the amount paid”
Reviews.Author: DebnDen
Reviews.Content: Overall our stay at the hotel was nice, the beds are not comfortable they are hard. But the bathroom was large and the room was a nice size. We didnt spend much time in our room any way so it worked out fine. There are lots of places to eat and the hotel location was great easy access to the walkways. I would have liked entering the hotel and the first thing you see would be a beautiful lobby and check in counter, but the first thing you see upon entering is the casino floor - only downfall. Bottled water in this and all other hotels is expensive $3 for a 12ounce bottle. There are other places to buy water so buy elsewhere like walgreens or cvs. Overall our stay was nice and we were happy with the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “"MAGNIFICENT HOTEL"”
Reviews.Author: EliAn2
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at different hotels in Las Vegas thru the last 20 years but the Paris is the most beautiful place so far, it is central, clean to perfection at all times, the staff is courteous and very friendly (always waitresses around offering you drinks at the casino), the restaurants are fabulous and the food at the buffet to die for! We had a penthouse suite on the 31st floor that was spectacular (we never had to wait more than 45 seconds for the elevator which in my opinion it is fantastic), the bed was a dream, like sleeping on a cloud, the furnishings are so luxurious we felt like royalty!! We will go back very soon. Try this hotel you will not be disappointed!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paris is great!”
Reviews.Author: Texas_Bubba
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Paris from 8-16 to 8-21 on a reduced rate we got from HET. Checkin was a breeze even though there were about 50 people in the line, but they had 6 open windows and it moved well. We were given a room on the 27th floor, facing the strip with a great view of the fountains. We called for out luggage and it arrived in about 5 minutes. Elevators at this hotel are set up by groups of floors and we never waited more than two minutes. The maid service was efficient and everyone we encountered was helpful and friendly. The casino was fun and lively and I really like the vibe of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Paris was excellent!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nessa1dc
Reviews.Content: My Husband, Mother-in-law and brother-in-law went to Vegas from Sunday, August 16th through Wednesday, August 19th. My H and I are both Diamond members and had complimentary stays at any Harrah's property. We decided on Paris. We are so happy that we did. We arrived in Vegas on Saturday morning at about 10:30am. We took a taxi over to Paris for check-in. We were allowed VIP check-in because of our Diamond status, however, we did notice a long line at the front desk. I couldn't tell whether it moved fast or not, but it was extremely long. Our room wasn't ready, but we had 2705 (red room). The room was lovely and the view was spectacular. We could see the Bellagio fountains and the Eiffel tower. My MIL and BIL had 2708 and had a view of the pool. They too had a red room. I'm going to give you the basics: Food - We ate at the Buffet and the cafe. The service at the cafe was long...but the food was pretty good. The Buffet was good, but not alot of variety. Hotel - The rooms were kept well and all the staff seemed very nice. Casino - We didn't win, but the dealers and drink service were excellent. I loved being able to go between Bally's and Paris. Spa - My MIL and I went to Bally's spa for a swedish massage. It was excellent. The Spa at Paris charged more for the same service and didn't allow our discounts...that was displeasing, and in my opinion, not that smart. Location - You couldn't ask for better. We were in the middle of everything. It was too hot to walk anywhere, but everything seemed close via taxi. We enjoyed our stay and plan to pick Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I read was right”
Reviews.Author: hysterical
Reviews.Content: I stayed this past week with family and friends. Just like other reviews, our room wasn't ready when we checked in. I called 4 days prior to our arrival to request 3 king rooms on the same floor. When we checked in the person at the counter was rude and said "that was a request with no guarantee". We had to wait 2 hours for 3 king rooms and they were not on the same floor. The room was clean and nice enough and anytime we requested extra towels they accommodated quickly. The restaurants were good but the service was a little slow. All 3 rooms had views of the parking garage which is not Las Vegas glamour. Everything in the hotel is close and easy to get to and the dealers and cocktail waitresses were nice. I'd recommend this hotel but don't be in a hurry to get to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service Terrible”
Reviews.Author: rmfba
Reviews.Content: We experienced a 2 1/2 hour check in with a reservation months in advance paid for two rooms. Treated rude by front desk clerks and "manager of front desk". We were sent to one room which was not two queen beds and then changed rooms to a room that was not cleaned. Upon getting our credit card bill we were charged four times the amount for our roms as indicated on our reservations. It took over two weeks to get my credit card credited back and I was treated like they were doing me a favor. I have always stayed with Harrah owned properties but I will never stay at the Paris again. When I spend my money I expect to be treated at least with some courtesy. Front desk staff needs to be retrained or clean house. Patrons will spend their money else where to be treated with kindness and dignity.

Reviews.Title: “decent place, great location”
Reviews.Author: kahersh
Reviews.Content: Arrived to check in at approximately 6 p.m. on a Thursday, there was a rather long line with only two open spots to check in, after about five minutes another four employees came from the back as the line had continued to grow, after they arrived check in went relatively fast. Was offered to upgrade to a suite for an additional $70 a night, declined as $210 would have been about 1/3 of the entire trip cost, including airfare. Our room was 852 and was one of the "older" rooms. It was in good condition and clean, the only issue was the wallpaper slightly peeling in one corner of the bathroom, the bed was comfortable and the sheets were clean. The room view was to the southeast and over looked one of the Bally's buildings, not much to look at but I wasn't there to look out a window. As far as food goes I would recommend JJ Boulangerie's, very good deli style sandwiches and decent pizza as well. Le Burger Brasserie was very good as well. We ate at Mon Ami Gabi for breakfast, it was $30 for two, but was very, very good. We never tried to buffet or Cafe Ile St. Louis, lines to both were always very long, the buffet hasn't received kind reviews here, and at $25 a head we passed. The dualing piano bar was very fun and entertaining, get there early as seats go fast, buy one get one beers from 4-7 or so I think. Went to see Anthony Cools the hypnotist, highly recommended, very, very funny, also very adult so don't bring kids, or if you don't enjoy adult/filthy humor. As you may know booze is very expensive in Vegas, we had our cabbie stop at the 7/11 behind Paris and grabbed some beer there, there are constantly people bringing in cases of beer so dont feel like you will stand out, either way north or south down the strip there are a few liquor stores as well, although pretty far in each direction. Went to the pool one day, was very nice, and big, right under the tower which was neat. This place has a great location, right across from Bellagio, I have a few recommendations if you venture out, House of Blues at Mandalay had a great lunch, FIX at Bellagio has the best wings ever, no kidding. Margaritaville was pretty good as well, the line was long but moved very fast. We went and saw "O" and the Bellagio, was very good although not as great as some people had stated, it was worth the price of admission, wouldnt see it again though.

Reviews.Title: “Very great hotel for first time and those who speak french”
Reviews.Author: daniz64
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to las vegas so we werent sure what to expect. We tried to chose a hotel that was cheaper and in the middle of the strip. Turns out, after we scoped out the other hotels ours was the best of the cheaper prices to our opinion. i found that the rooms were comfortable anthough my room faced out to a parking lot, we were high enough to see other hotels on the distance and also the airport so at least there was some kind of view. We also chose a non-smoking room after I read some of the reviews on trip advisor so i had no issues with that. Room service is expensive!!!! Since we visited from canada we found the hotel comforting because everything was written in french and english and couldnt help but notice that other canadians and people from france were lodged there. It was in the centre of the strip and very easy to get to every hotel and attraction via "the deuce" and "free rio hotel shuttle" the casio was unique because it was made to look like you are outside and thats my style. i love the eiffel tower and how it was outside and inside the building Well i guess to sum it up it was very great value!

Reviews.Title: “I'd do it again!”
Reviews.Author: Whatshakin
Reviews.Content: There was a line checking in but with plenty of desk clerks the line moved quickly. I had reserved three rooms and one of those was made clear at reservation to be a smoking room. I was told checking in there were no smoking rooms but they could upgrade for an additional fee of $40. We said no and they did in the end upgrade at no additonal fee. It was a handicap room but no additional fees. That was the ONLY complaint I have. Staff was courteous. The room was clean. The buffet was a great value. Ceme brullee on a buffet what more could you want. Mon Ami Gabi was to die for. We ate on the patio and watched the fountain show at the Bellagio. They stay was very nice. Nice atmosphere. No complaints here. Meri

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rachee1025
Reviews.Content: We got to Paris through a shuttle from the airport. This costs $6.50, that is how you get to the strip from the airport....or take a taxi. If you take a taxi they will leave you at the front drop off, the shuttle will leave you at a side door. Once we got the the hotel (7:30 PM), there were only a couple people in the check out line, took less than 10 mins. I got to the counter and asked if they had a complementary room upgrade available. The man was quick to give me a free upgrade to a Red Room (27th floor). It had a great view with a side view of the strip. It was amazing, HUGE TV, beautiful bathroom (shower and tub), a coffee pot, hairdryer, iron and board, and the MOST comfortable bed I have EVER slept on. The only thing I didn't like about the room is that there was no mirrors outside of the bathroom, and the sink was not separate from the shower/toilet. (Although there were 3 mirrors in the bathroom.) Maid service was wonderful. The Providential restaurant in Paris is wonderful!! Tons of bread and delicious Lobster Bisque. The Le Village Bufftet was wonderful. (make sure you ask the front desk for a coupon book, there is a $5 off per person) Also, take advantage of the 1/2 Price ticket place. We got 2 tickets for Criss Angel, 2 for V- Variety show, and 2 buffets and 1 other meal. We saved a TON of money. From Paris, go to Bill's Gambling Hall the day of the show (some shows you can even buy ahead of time). Paris is a pretty calm hotel. There is a nice casino, but not what I would call a "gamblers" casino. If you are going to Vegas to stay in your hotel and gamble, I would not recommend Paris. If you are going to see different places, sight see, have a wonderful vacation, and eat great food, Paris is the place for you! The location is PERFECT! In the middle of the strip, really close to Planet Hollywood, Bally's, Flamingo, Bill's, Bellagio, and Caesar's Palace. There is a nice casino bar that we had drinks at every night. NIce wait staff and nice atmosphere. Drinks are expensive, but they are all over Vegas. Gamble a bit if you want a couple of free drinks! At the end of the trip, I asked to extend our check out, the man on the phone was SO nice and gave us an extra 2 hours! That was so kinds because we needed it after a 15 hour Grand Canyon bus trip the day before!! Everyone is nice, helpful and willing to make your stay better!! Just ask!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not the same crowd as the Wynn”
Reviews.Author: MajorDad04
Reviews.Content: A week in Vegas, 4 days at the Wynn, 3 at Paris. Definately a different client then the Wynn. If you want to be entertained, meet middle America, and not break your bank in a half hour go to the Paris. Rooms are not large, but nice, beds are confortable. The table games range from $5+ during the day, $10+ in the evening. Major differences between the Wynn/Encore and Paris: 1. If you want to pay for a beautiful room, reserved enviroment, good service go to the Wynn. If you want a nice room, good service,fun, lively, sometimes loud enviroment go to the Paris. LOL, don't know why, but at the Wynn someone beats the dealer in BJ, makes their point in craps or hits a big payout on slots, they just sit or stand there. No excitement. AT the Paris, someone hits anything that beats the house and everyone within site/sound cheers for them. 2. Both hotels had great service. The amazing thing was the Paris had 2-3 times the number of people playing/drinking and the service was excellent. 3. If you want a nice, quite, relaxing/reserved enviroment that would be the Wynn/Encore. If you want a more intense, having fun crowd that would be the Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Expected More”
Reviews.Author: Calister
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed from 08/10/09-08/15/09. I anticipated more in regards to what the rooms offered. The bathroom was cool and that was it. You are surrounded by all this oppulence and beauty, you arrive in your room and it's like WHAT? We couldn't use the fridge, unless we paid. The food was excellent in Cafe LeVillage. I did appreciate the two free tickets to ride up to the top of the Eiffel Tower. The view was spectacular. We dined at the Eiffel Restaurant very expensive for food that didn't taste as good down in the Cafe Buffet. My suggestion would be to have a Peasant night at the Efiffel Restaurant, that way your average working man who is on vacation could enjoy some fancy stuff, for low price.

Reviews.Title: “Paris is starting to show its age”
Reviews.Author: NYCtravelboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Paris for the first time in awhile. Have stayed there before and enjoyed it. The hotel seems to be getting a bit old. The service, rooms, public areas are need some freshening. Arrived early and got a room right away--without any real kind of wait. The room was on the 22nd floor and had a view of the parking garages below and the mountains. No worries really, we were glad to get into a room and start our day. The room itself was worn. The bed was very comfortable, as was the sofa in the room, but around the edges, things were not good. The carpet was soiled. The dresser that held the TV (small unit) was all banged up and part of the molding was entirely broken off. The bathroom is long, but bland. The water took about 10 minutes each morning to warm up. We would run it for awhile before getting in the shower. The front door is very hard to open. The restaurants also have fallen down a bit. The service was brusk. At the first place we ate, our waiter greeted us seconds after sitting down saying "I am ready to go off shift, so I need you to order now". We hadn't even opened our menus yet. The pool area is very basic. No beautiful grounds or area. If you can find a great low rate here, you might want to take it. If not, you might want to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: Crewguy
Reviews.Content: Booked an online rate for $89.00 for 2 queen beds at the hotel. Arrived around 1am so check-in was fast. Hotel check-in area was very ornate as you would expect to find in a European hotel. The room was small, but very nice and clean. The room appeared to be a little dated and some of the wood was "fake looking". The room was more "dark" than I had anticipated it would be. The bathroom was tile/marble and very nice; but only 1 vanity. Beds were very comfortable. All in all, it did not live up to my expectation. It was the base level room, so maybe some of the pricier rooms are nicer.

Reviews.Title: “best place to stay on the strip”
Reviews.Author: philipe20
Reviews.Content: After staying at the luxor the previous weekend, arriving at the Paris hotel was like arriving at the real Vegas, check in was painless and they let us check in earlier than the 4pm stated time (@1pm). The room was great we opted for a king size bed and although we didnt have a view of the strip or pool we didnt care. We did the buffet once only due to the fact that we were always so full!! It was/is really good value, the choice of crepes, fruit, pastries, and roast ham!! is brilliant, although the teabags were horrible. The casino is great, really friendly atmosphere and unique on the strip due to the decor and ambience. There are so many nice restaurants within and around the hotel, our favourit was mon ami gabi which is situated opposite the bellagio with an option to eat outside. The steaks were amazing and my girlfriend will remember the pancakes with bananas with foster sauce for a very long time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Perfect Rate.”
Reviews.Author: jcall
Reviews.Content: We were traveling through on our way to California and needed a nice place to stay at a decent rate. Paris was a great deal for $69. It has a perfect location on center strip across from the Bellagio and Caesars Palace. Parking was easy enough with a large garage that was attached to the hotel. There is quite a bit of walking involved though from the parking garage though and dragging your luggage through the shops and casino just to get to the desk is a work out. The lobby is beautiful and check in was fairly easy even though there was a long line. The lady that checked us in was nice but a little preoccupied in closing out her shift. We had room 2087 on the 20th floor but had a view looking straight into rooms at Bally's. Elevators are quick and the hallways are quiet. The room was a decent size with some nice furniture, calm colors, large windows, and even a fully stocked mini bar, though quiet pricey. The bathroom was beautiful with it's separate shower and nice vanity. Quite large too. Wireless Internet costs $15 for 24 hours so I ended up bypassing that for the evening. The beds are comfortable but are not as comfortable as a pillow-top. Just a personal preference. The casino area is nice and has lots of great restaurants surrounding it and in she shopping area. Beautiful architecture adds to a nice ambiance. We only ate at one restaurant in Paris as it was the most economical for both breakfast and dinner; Ile St. Louis Cafe. Just like any restaurant in Vegas, quite pricey. $4.50 for a glass of orange juice? Though the prices for food in Vegas is rediculous, quality is never an issue. Very good food! The buffet always had a LONG line each time we walked by so we did not get to try it. As for shops, there are some interesting shops and neat bakeries, all with a neat French theme. The pool is on the third floor and has a great view of the strip. The pool is just a basic round pool with lots of seating. There are two nice hot tubs set in a garden area and plenty of towels are available. There's even food by the pool. I did get a chance to go up the Eiffel Tower for a beautiful view, but the weight was an hour and a half. I spent the extra $10 for the express option which gets you right up. Well worth it instead of waiting in line. Beautiful view!! Overall a great stay for the price though the food prices are horrible. Great location adds to the appeal for any Vegas traveler. I highly recommend it if you can get a cheap rate.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Improvement & Understaffed”
Reviews.Author: CW3DC
Reviews.Content: Check-in was a slow process. First 2 rooms I was put in were dirty. The first was covered in dust and clearly had not been cleaned in over a week and the second bathroom had mildew. In the restaurants, the service was slow due to a extremely minimal waitstaff. (There were 2 waiters for the entire restaurant!) It took over 45 minutes to receive our food despite the restaurant only being 3/4 full. The concierge line was so long I gave up after 20 minutes. There was 1 person at the concierge station for all hotel guests. I have stayed in the Paris previously and the service has gone noticably south. I seriously doubt I will stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “OK but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: rednotdead
Reviews.Content: Our first stay in Paris. The room was ok (twin queen beds) and the bathroom was fine, just not overly large. Room service was very efficient and the reception staff were helpful and polite. Room service staff could be surly though. Typical of the large strip hotels though it is just too big to be welcoming. Treat it as somewhere to sleep with no frills and you won't go far wrong.

Reviews.Title: “okay....”
Reviews.Author: disfanatic702
Reviews.Content: went to vegas with friends for their 21st birthday and stayed at the paris. overall hotel is nice, i was just unhappy with a few things. i didnt like walking right into the casion when i came off the strip...it was always very crowded and hard to walk through to get to the elevators. i also thought the rooms were nice but the beds were extremely hard...not fun to sleep on. i as there is august so it was very hot but the pool was always freezing, it would have been nicer if it was a few degrees warmer so i could have spent more time in it. overall a good stay just somethings that irked me.

Reviews.Title: “Stay was comfortable but encountered glitches”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_2410
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vegas and I decided to stay at the Paris upon recommendation from family. For a hotel, the room was comfortable and kept well and clean; also the hotel has a great location. However, during my stay, I encountered two glitches - not exactly fun to encounter when you are expecting a relaxing holiday. First one was that when I checked-in I was given the wrong room (one king sized bed instead of a twin share), so I had to head back to the lobby and explain the the person at the hotel desk the error. The person at the hotel desk made it out that I was given the correct room and I had to explain to her that there was a mistake made by the hotel since my booking was for a twin share. Luckily that problem was solved! The second glitch pretty much tainted my view of the hotel. As noted by a previous reviewer, he/she also encountered the same problem as me, in which they were erroneously charged for the use of the mini-bar. Prior to checking-out, I noted from the TV check-out screen that I was charged for the use of the mini-bar that I didn't even use. The hotel staff explained that there was a misundertstanding for the charge since I had used the mini-bar to store my own beverages! (first time ever that I heard from a hotel that you cannot use the mini-bar!) Anyway, I was later informed that since I didn't use the mini-bar, I would not be charged. However, low and behold a few days later, my credit card was charged. I wrote two emails to the hotel requesting them to reverse the erroneous charge, and I received a response which said that the amount would not be reversed. I called the hotel to repeat my request and finally got a refund. The principle is, "that I should not be charged for items I did not consume!"

Reviews.Title: “Paris - Very Very Good”
Reviews.Author: OandRee
Reviews.Content: When we checked in we were told that there were only queen rooms left - we had reserved a king. We were told we could wait 1 hour until a king was ready but we had just got off a long flight from England so wanted to get in asap. The room was really nice - very large and clean and the bathroom was fantastic. We spent one night in this room. I went down to reception the following morning to say we were a little disappointed that we didnt get the king we had booked, and got moved to a king "p" room (p is obviously upgraded). The room was fantastic. Not only was it very large, it also had a dual aspect view looking down the strip towards MGM and also out the front towards Bellagio. I was really impressed both with the room and the customer service. The pool area was nice and the location of the hotel, in the centre of the strip couldnt be beaten. I later stayed in the Venetian which was even better but also came with an extra cost. For around £45 per night via hotels.com you couldnt do better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Past it's prime”
Reviews.Author: lopezjohnc
Reviews.Content: The Paris Hotel has lost it's luster. Crowded, understaffed, and no efficiency. Check-in took 45 minutes; long lines at the restaurants even though there were many tables available; unfriendly staff; rude porters and doormen; plain rooms. Hotel needs to be rated a 3 star. I'll not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Victim of Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jimmyle
Reviews.Content: REG. Paris Hotel :Stolen Items (Money & Jewerly), Caution _Poor Security _No Survellant Camera in Hallway/Stairway _Bad customer Service/Manangement. We Stay in Paris Hotel in 3 nights. The last night of departure, someone get into my room while my wife & I sleeping. They took my wife purse/my wallet/jewerly. I file Police report but no action have been resolve. Paris hotel disclaim all liability, they did say to me there no camera in hallway that where I stay in Suite room? I am very disappointed about this situation with Paris hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome. Loved the casino, buffet and location. Great room!”
Reviews.Author: drgirl2
Reviews.Content: This was my favorite hotel in vegas. My boyfriend and I stayed in some other vegas hotels on the trip we took, but this stay was our favorite way to end the trip. Got this for a great price on EasyClickTravel.com and we luckily had a fabulous view of the strip overlooking the pool and could see the Bellagio fountain shows and hear the music from the window. We ate at some other buffets on the strip on this trip, but this was out favorite buffet, completely french themed! Felt like I was in Paris without flying across the ocean. I suggest you check it out :)

Reviews.Title: “i would rather stay at the flamingo”
Reviews.Author: Red4080
Reviews.Content: if your going to stay at the paris expect to lose more money then what you gamble away. during my stay there i was missing too hundred dollars out of our hotel safe, after filing a police report we fond our safe was accessed when we weren't even in our room, the conclusion the hotel gave me was basically tough [--]. on top of that they charged me 155 dollars for a mini bar that had never been touched after i called to complain about the bogus charges they said they have removed them over a week later i still had not been credited my money and i got an overdraft fee for the taking my money out so in total i lost 280 dollars at the Paris....about what my stay there cost......i will never stay there again and wouldn't recommend anyone else to either

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: pattizu
Reviews.Content: This hotel was dirty and the main services was terrible. I complained to the front desk and they could care less. No even an apology. Stuck up hotel atmosphere that I can do without. If I am going to blow all of my money at their hotel the least they can do is kiss me first. I'll go to the Golden Nugget next time.

Reviews.Title: “Paris? Like a dream come true!”
Reviews.Author: lasvegasparis
Reviews.Content: We came to Paris Las Vegas for our wedding with Family and friends.The whole experience was magical. We took the option of the La Rendezvous package upgrade to include room upgrade and access to the Le Rendezvous concierge lounge. The vip lounge upgrade was well worth every penny,made only better by friendly service received by concierge Mariann Mohos.This property is a class act!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: FlGirl81
Reviews.Content: From the minute I walked in I was in aww of the Paris hotel in Vegas. At check in they offered our friends and us an upgrade to a suite room for $89. Neither couple took the upgrade. But we did want to be close to our friends room. There were not any regular size rooms available near them, but there was a suite 2 floors up from them. The lady checking me and my boyfriend in offered us that suite for no extra charge. I don't know if it was because she wanted to please us with good customer service by trying to fullfill our request to be closer to our friends as much as possible or because of my boyfriends hurt foot that was all wrapped up from surgery he just had on it. She said he would have more room to hobbile around in the suite. Who knows...I did not complain and took the offer. She was right, there was plenty of room. The view from the suite was not the best, you could see almost in the windows of the hotels close by and a partial mountain veiw. But once again I was not complaining. The suite was very roomy, clean, and the bathroom was more than enough. The bathroom had a jet garden sized tub that worked very well. It was a great option to have. When coming back to the room after wondering all over Vegas it was great to relax in. The shower was seperate right next to the tub .
