There was a large mirrior on the bathroom wall that was very helpfull in getting ready to go out for a night on the town. There was a sitting area next to the good sized closet for doing make up or placing your lap top on. I was very happy with the suite. When you walked through the casino you felt as if you were out doors in a little town with blue skys, shops, reasturants, and the bottom of the eiffel tower showing through from the roof. Just like paris :) They really caught the feel for it in this hotel. All in all this was a great place to stay and one of the more reasonable priced hotels in Vegas. I liked the Paris casino much better than the one at Ceasar's Palace. It just had a better atmosphere. The pool area set under the effiel tower was another great benefit. It was a very nice and not dirty like at the MGM. Although I plan to try out other hotels on future trips to Vegas, I would also definitley go back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the price”
Reviews.Author: vp629
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Paris for my bachelor party. For the price that we paid I was definitely surprised at how great our view was. The hotel was beyond my expectations! There were so many styles of food to choice from within the hotel. I must admit though the ceiling when you first walked in confused me, basically because i was sleep deprived. The front desk staff was very helpful I must say, the lines were always relatively short, the staff was polite but got what I needed right away. The most important thing I found was that the hotel was very easy to navigate when your hammered unlike ceasars.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Melanie123100
Reviews.Content: We go to Vegas every year; this has always been one of our favorite hotels overall. The buffet is our absolute favorite; the pastries and croissants are excellent. One of the best things about the hotel is that the casino is on one side and the shops and restaurants are on the other; the elevators are in the middle. So if you don't feel like walking through cigarette smoke while you shop and eat (but don't want a hotel that's so big you get lost) this is the place. It's a beautifully quaint hotel; rooms are a nice size with a sitting area, marble bathroom, separate shower and tub. We had a basic room and were very happy with it. Look for deals by going mid-week; it's much cheaper than weekends. In the morning the breakfast croissant is delicious, then get to the buffet before 3:30 for lunch pricing. This buffet is less expensive than many of the others. Rio's buffet is our close 2nd favorite. The Eiffel tower trip is a neat experience, go at night about 8 p.m. to avoid long lines and see the Bellagio fountains from a front row view. The pool and hot tubs were great, never overcrowded. Drink service was fast (which is surprising for pool service). We don't have any complaints. A solid 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Four star prices for a three star room.”
Reviews.Author: bddfc99
Reviews.Content: The hotel property is very nice and the location is great, but unless you want to pay an extra $50 per night for a renovated (red) room, expect to get a below average room for a large vegas resort. Upon check-in, we discovered damage to the armoire and the toilet paper holder was ripped out of the wall. The funny thing was the housekeeper folded the toilet paper and placed the roll on the back of the toilet. So the staff knew about the damage but didn't bother to fix it. I called the desk and the holder was replaced on day three of our visit. Well, the holder was attached to the wall, but the damage to the wall was not repaired. The carpet in the room could have used cleaning, but the housekeeper did a great job. The bathroom was great but getting hot water was hit or miss. The public areas of the hotel are wonderful and it is attached to Bally's. We really liked the casino and the restaurants, so I think if we wanted to come back to this complex we'd probably stay at Bally's. We went to the Price is Right and had a ball. There are just too many really nice rooms in vegas to spend this kind of money at Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: fortworthbobby
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay and will be our last at this resort. The room was located on the 7th floor. Carpet was dirty and worn, furniture had scratches, and the windows were filthy. Two lamps in the room did not work. Trash was on the ground at the Main Entrance. Glass doors very dirty an all entrances. I think this place is turning into a typical Harrah's property and is just depending on it's location to keep it profitable.

Reviews.Title: “Paris was excellent”
Reviews.Author: shoptodrop
Reviews.Content: We checked in to Paris late one evening when we were also going to see LOVE at the MIrage- so not a lot of time to spare. There were not too many people waiting at check in, we asked for a complimentary upgrade and got a choice of a Red Room or a room with a view of the strip. I knew the Red Rooms were recently refurbished but as we had two rooms booked- one for our kids opted for the strip view and we weren't disappointed. Huge room, huge bathroom, all marble walls and floors, and fantastic view. The hotel was perfect for us and so central. Breakfast simply the best at Paris too. We booked through LCI and got a simply great deal as I would have paid more.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best visit this time”
Reviews.Author: mcball2708
Reviews.Content: My brother an his wife arrived a day eariler with my mom and the hotel was nice enough to put our rooms together on the 4th floor. When we went to our room they had all the furniture except for the armoir on the double beds. They were fumigating the room and cleaning the carpets due to the smell of smoke (4th floor is smoking floor). The maintenance man said it would be 10 minutes so we waited took our shoes off and the carpet was wet. We went downstairs and Adely moved us to a very nice room on the 11th floor (Adely was great!!). We were getting married at 230 pm on Thursday and the water was completely turned off at noon. We called and they said it was a line break for the 4th-14th floors and the water would be turned on at 1pm. We paid $150 to have our wedding moved back to 4pm and waited. Water came on at 110 pm and no hot water, my brother called and they told him the only thing we could do is use the salon, but must pay for the useage. We ended up not taking showers, got married and returned to the Paris. We expected hot water at 530 pm, no such luck (my 70+ mom took a cold shower in her room, I'm very pissed about that). My bride called, spoke to a manager Adam? and he said he would get the water fixed immediately and work something out for us later. Maintenance fixed the water problem within 30 minutes but no followup from management. We called before we checked out today and left our cell phone number with management, we would just like an apology. I have stayed at the Paris numerous times through my company, this was the worst visit to date. II understand there are emergency maintenance issues but at least offer us another room to get ready. I will be writing a letter to Starwood Management.

Reviews.Title: “Secure your valuables... Maid service will rummage through your belongings”
Reviews.Author: maids_steal
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference in May 2009 only to have my handheld game system and games removed from it's case and placed back (the case) in the luggage. Simular incident occured with a co-worker with his laptop and ipod.. on the same day. Hotel staff was fairly indifferent to the matter and the case was pushed to their 3rd party co. CCMSI. Dealing with CCMSI was a complete hassle.. the individual on the case has yet to supply any documentation aside from form letters and thanks to the inkeeper statutes law I will not be seeing anything. Lesson learned.. will never stay at the Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “won't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: geckofan
Reviews.Content: I hadn't been to Vegas since the early 80s. What a lovely experience we had...All of the staff was so helpful and friendly. From the bell captain advising us to garage the car and walk or take a cab, the best advice EVER! My sister and I played 'Stump the Concierge'...we didn't, he had the answer to everything. Room service great, the rooms very nice with an in-room safe which we loved. Every restaurant we dined in at the hotel was delicious, we really don't have any complaints about our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Got what I paid for and MORE”
Reviews.Author: preach305
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 7/14-7/16. Got to the hotel at 9:30. tried to check in : ( Left bags at the luggage dropoff. Was told to come back at 11:00 to see if we can check in early. No problem went to Mon Ami Gabi (strip viewing restaurant, Good food/Good service). Went back at 11:00 no luck, since I didn't want a 2 queen room, to celebrate 6yr anny! Lady said "come back at 1:00, however check in is officially 3" Wife, got a little pissed, but i played it cool. Went and gambled and dranked. Le Burgrer Brassere (sp) Went back to check-in at 1:00 still not ready. Went walking around some more. Called 1/2 hr later to see, and they told me to come back. Got upgraded to a suite, for waiting patiently! Never had a long line when i tried to check in. Suite-jacuzzi and sep. shower. not a good view but the Room/View in Vegas is overrated. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: katsncasinos
Reviews.Content: Been a Diamond-level Total Rewards member for years, but this was first stay at Paris - and probably the last. Cool attitude at check-in held over for most of the visit with only a couple of exceptions. The server in the buffet couldn't have been nicer, and the housekeeper during our stay was very personable and helpful. The room, supposedly an upgrade (a Red Room) was small, cramped with furniture and the smallest bathtub I've seen in years. Only one sink despite room being a double queen. Only view on the 26th floor was of Bally's hotel and rooftops. NO security by guest elevators. No refrigerator for guest use which is pretty standard in other Harrah's properties. Developed dental emergency overnight on a friday - concierge desk called, but was closed until 8 am. Must admit when I called at 8 they were as nice as could be and had me in a dental chair in 1.5 hours. Proved to be the saving factor of an otherwise gloomy stay. Location of hotel on the strip can't be beat, but the food outlets are overrated for the price. Other Harrah's properties offer better facilities often at lower prices!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel-staff very friendly”
Reviews.Author: GSTraveler88
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many hotels on the strip and what sets this hotel apart is the staff. Every staff member went out of their way to exceed expectations. Staying in a big hotel can be overwhelming, but I never had that feeling at the Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Non-smoker forced to take a smoking room”
Reviews.Author: jlr541
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are both health/fitness professionals, and we frequent Las Vegas for conferences and leisure. We've stayed at Paris several times before, and in the past had a nice stay. On July 10, we checked in for a 3-night stay. We had reserved a non-smoking room 2 months in advance. Yet when we checked in we were told there were no more non-smioking rooms and that this is a 'preference' and not a reservation. I found the individual who checked us in to be very rude and not at all accomodating. I've never experienced poor customer service at Paris, but now I am hesitant to come back. Our floor and room reeked of cigarette smoke, which made us very unhappy.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: AmandaBon
Reviews.Content: Great casino, several tasty restaurants, and a little casino area bar that had yummy martinis. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for a Great Strip Location”
Reviews.Author: Fondy
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights with 22 y/o daughter. We both felt very safe at Paris and Strip. Stayed in a Red Room on the 30th floor. Room was clean; nicely updated bathroom/flat screen tv. Really liked the fact that we could go to the Pool (3rd floor) w/o having to walk through the casino. Ate at the Cafe, Buffet, and Eiffle Tower Restaurant. Enjoyed all. Also ate at the cafe at Bally's due to a $5 off coupon we received at check-in. Again it was a satisfying, cheap breakfast. We found all staff at Paris to be extremely friendly. Felt that this hotel is a great value considering it's central Strip location.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, downmarket - a fall from grace”
Reviews.Author: Scott G
Reviews.Content: The credit crunch has obviously hit Harrah's and instead of working harder, they simply lowered their standards. Housekeeping was sketchy, the corridors dirty and despite informing them, a chicken wing lay in the corridor of outside our room for nearly 3 days. Complaints were largely met with indifference. Requesting a shower cap turned into an extensive negotiation. These guys have no interest in providing you with an enjoyable stay. They just want your money. I previously posted a positive review of Paris and it is so heartbreaking to see it go so rapidly downhill.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: MuffinAlexandria_LA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris for 4 nights (July 8-11). I believe we were in what I have heard others refer to as a "Red Room". The room was smallish, but very nicely decorated and clean. It included a King bed, small couch w/ coffee table, and a large storage armoire with a very large flat screen TV (not that we ever turned it on). The bathroom was nice with marble/tile. It had both tub for soaking and a shower. It was a little difficult for two people to get ready in front of the mirror at the same time, but not too bad. I would definitely recommend this place to others. Within this casino, we ate at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant (anniversary dinner $$$) and Mon Ami Gabi (breakfast $$). Both restaurants had excellent food. The Eiffel Tower Restaurant was a real treat. We made reservations ahead of time for our anniversary. They had dusted the table with rose petals and we had the best seat in the house, overlooking the Bellagio fountains. The wait staff were very attentive and our waiter offered to take our picture with personal camera several times. We ate chocolate/bacon waffles and French Toast with blueberries at Mon Ami Gabi. Both dishes were to die for! If you have never been to the strip, I can tell you this is where you want to stay, as it is centrally located. TIP: stop at a gas station on your way in and buy a case of water to keep in your room. It is much cheaper than buying bottles in the hotel convenience shops. It is extremely hot this time of year and you will need it to stay hydrated. Also, don't forget your lip balm and sunblock if you plan on doing alot of walking down the strip. Also, rewetting drops are essential for those of you who wear contacts. The sun and wind are fierce! If any of you out there are motorcyle riders, then I HIGHLY recommend a motorcycle tour with Todd Harbach of Vegas 2 Wheel Tours. We took a one day tour (8 hours) of REd Rock Canyon and Mount Charleston that was so AWESOME. He also treated us to a local summer theatre group at Spring Mountain Ranch, where we saw Westside Story, the night before our day tour. The show ended after dark, so our ride back to the trip was amazing. Nothing like riding under a full moon back into the lights of the Strip! This was by far the highlight of our Vegas trip. We fleyw in and rented a bike from Henderson Harley Davidson (discount rates for HOG members and Emergency personnel). You can Google both for tour/rental information.

Reviews.Title: “Spend your money elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: shuffrn
Reviews.Content: We checked in at 10 pm. The hotel sold us an "upgrade" package for 100 a night extra plus cost of room. When we went to utilize the free drink portion we found out that this was only offered from 5-8 pm and could not get them and for the 100 bucks we would only get a 'continental' breakfast" and a paper not exactly a great value and they still tried to act like it was a great value when it was a straight out scam. When we pointed this out the the desk we had been sold a package we could not even use they told us we could "move out" or downgrade rooms as this room was only being sold with the package. We had seen this room online without any packages and the manager that came to talk to us and told us to "move out" JOLEE, was very abrupt and arrogant and never even asked us what she could do to work this out. She could have given us the room for the night without this "package" but made us move instead. I only stayed because of my husband and while the other room without the package did not have a view it was actually cleaner and larger. The slots were nothing short of crap, no one winning anything larger than a grand or two and very few and far between. We had a large sum of money we would would have spent at this casino had this matter been handled differently. If it weren't for the bartender "Lilly" we would have moved out. She was wonderful and made us feel like we were royalty although we are not designer cutout people and made things right for us. We played slots there once or twice but the money got eaten up in minutes, they were not even steady. The paris is beautiful to look at but for the cost, the rooms suck. The hallways had sticky crap all over the rug, stained and just disgusting. They looked like they had not been cleaned in months. The pool is nothing special. It is worth walking through Paris and the Crepery is good but the Le Cafe, nothing special for the money, once again designer prices for common fair although the waiters were very entertaining.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: castlepark06
Reviews.Content: Paris hotel was great. I went with a group of friends. It was 8 of us. I stayed in one room with another friend and the rest spit up in 2 other rooms. I got 2 nights friday and saturday for about 380 after taxes. We had a blast!!! Real friendly staff and great room service. We all showed up at separate times to the hotel and were all able to stay on the same floor which was great!!! we stayed in the deluxe room and they were really nice and clean. Our view wasn't great but hey we're just there to sleep. The casino is alright and hotel overall is very clean and welcoming. We just went to vegas to party. For sure you must go to Pure Nightclub and LAX. Be sure to arrive early though. Before 10 to avoid long lines. However the Paris is very well centrally located!!! Right in the middle of the strip. This hotel is well worth it. Ive stayed at Excalibur, Flamingo, Circus, Hilton, and others but this is the best one so far if you are on a budget. If you get room service try the buffalo strips! they are delicious!!! OVERALL GREAT TIME!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paris, Las Vegas is a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mrsla0903
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I was a bit hesitant at staying at Paris. I got 4 nights comped, so I figured what do I have to lose. Besides, this is Vegas how much time do you actually spend in your room. We stayed in the Luxury Room. I was pleasantly surprised how big and clean the room was. The hotel is centrally located on the strip. I didn't want to pay the $60 per night room upgrade for the strip view. The view out of our window was the central air-conditioning system on the roof. I wished the outside bar would stay open past midnight. Not too many choices for a late night snack. The only restaurant that was open was understaffed and unorganized. The dueling piano bar is a fun place to go.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: kath6
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Paris for 7 nights. Although there was a big queue at check in when we arrived we did not have to wait long to check in. We were given a Red room on the 27th floor and although we did not have a view of the Bellagio it was a lovely room. Very clean and the towels were changed daily and the room left immaculate. The hotel is very central and the Deuce bus can be boarded right outside so travelling up and down the strip was easy. Overall a very nice hotel, well kept and would definately consider staying if in Vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “affraid to stay, but pleasantly surprised!!!”
Reviews.Author: mimi711
Reviews.Content: Boy...I was so affraid to stay at this hotel after all the bad things that I have read and yes some of the areas seem to need renovated but it was not something that was gross like some people on this site may think... but to our surprise it was very nice...we had a standard room no upgrade...even though they tried to if you gave them an extra $40-55 a night and since we were staying a week we did not want to spend the extra money...with no view except for the mountains and the airport but the room was clean and spacious...the bathroom was very nice with it's own seperate shower and the maid cleaned the room everyday and did a great job...the restaurants are great...shopping great...pool very nice...and the gambling was good...I liked the casino because is was not as big as some of the others and it seemed to always be crowded which makes it a nice feeling and the best part I won a nice jackpot which made the trip even better...the location was wonderful and we could get anywhere on foot...all in all I would stay at the Paris again on our next trip to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “A Taste of Paris”
Reviews.Author: GQ_Trippin
Reviews.Content: HOTEL. The Paris is a great mini escape. Cobblestone floors and sky- like ceilings with boutique shops and cafes as if straight from the streets of Paris itself. STAFF. Accommodating. ROOM. Small rooms with slightly stiff beds. SHOWER. Nothing special. Very Las Vegas. LOCATION. On the Strip across from the Bellagio. ATTRACTION & TIP(S). The Eiffel Tower Restaurant is a must. Reserve a window table overseeing the Strip and the Bellagio water show.

Reviews.Title: “Very Tired Hotel with a crappy spa”
Reviews.Author: mkatz1
Reviews.Content: We checked in late and had to wait as we had supposedly already checked in, got upgraded to a suite which we thought would be nice, but room was not clean, very dusty. Had room service one day and dishes stayed for two days. The spa is the biggest rip off, if you want to waste your money, try the slots, at least you may walk away satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: eagleputt2000
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick and easy. Room was very clean. Great casino. Plenty of shops. Restaurants were excellent - especially the Eifel Tower. You have to experience it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: chermar72
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. Barely any kids around. Sophisticated adult-oriented pool atmosphere. Great restaurants -- delicious breakfasts. Awesome location on the strip. Easy access to stores, casinos, shopping, etc. Very clean rooms. Very friendly and helpful staff. Would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Paris customer service lacking - location good point”
Reviews.Author: pmazcomm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to Vegas twice a year. Our trip last year was free due to having Lettuce Entertain U points after spending tons of money at one of their restaurants for my daughters Bat Mitzvah. So the package included free air fare, meals and free stay at Paris. When we arrived at the Paris, the line to check in was aweful and there didnt seem to be any interest on part of the desk to add more people. There were two people working with the line going into the casino. When we finally got to the front, we were annoyed but continued on to ask for an upgrade to their large suite. We were able to upgrade to a beautiful room that overlooked the pool and strip and Belligio fountains. The room was huge, two bathrooms, sitting area, it was awesome.....UNTIL I found things were not very clean. Crums on the sofa, window ledge, and worst of all there was a stain that I didnt notice until the day we checked out on the duvat cover. I was sooo totally grossed out. This was an expensive upgraded suite and they couldnt clean it properly. When I called to speak to the hotel manager or perhaps the front desk manager, they apologized and said they would replace it. I said we were checking out and I certainly hope you would replace it for the next person. While I didnt ask, I would hope perhaps a discount off the room would have been nice or complimentary breakfast but nothing offered. Five minutes after getting off the phone, I hear a knock on the door, its the supervisor of housekeeping asking me about my complaint and she had an attitude. While the room was lovely, the cleaniness was certainly a factor and customer service is lacking, definately not a top rated hotel at all. We rented a cabana for a day and again, the cleaniness of the cabana was bad, The staff working was bored and customer service again lacking. Thisis our second time staying at Paris and probably would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Confusing”
Reviews.Author: jojo1955
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at other Harrah's properties so thought we would try this hotel just for a change. VERY hot outside 108 and sitting in a black car waiting for valet to get to us was not really the way to start the vacation. They had only two people working the valet at noon and not blaming them but they were walking very slow when going to cars. There were about ten empty cars ahead of us and each of them had to be parked prior to anyone even talking to us. Okay now we move to the inside which is very cold and the checkin went pretty smooth. We were asked if we wnted an upgraded room for an extra $40.00 per night so we said sure. The lady checking us in was nice, but we to ask how to get to the elevators as no directions were given to anything. The way this hotel is laid out getting lost is easy to do. Made it to the room which had a good view and the room itself was very nice. As we were unpacking room service came in and put a $8.00 bottle of water in the mini bar as she had forgotten earlier. Found out had she not done that we would have been charged for the water. Three days here turned out to be ok but not special enough to return. The check out was a nightmare at 9:15am went to the front desk to check out because we could not see the bill on the TV. After a short wait stepped up to the desk and the lady working it just looked at me as if I was intruding in her life. I had to start the conversation by telling her I was checking out, at this point she told me the computers were being upgraded and I could not see the bill nor have a copy but would just need to trust that it was correct and they would send me a copy of the FINAL bill if I really wanted it. Ever leave someone a blank check and hope they don't take all of your money? I gave this lady my fax number and ask her to send my bill as soon as possible. Two days later I had to call again to try to get the bill, guess what the computer system had not beeen upgraded it was just broken, big difference. I did get my bill faxed but will not be going back as I do not like being lied to or asked to just trust that my final bill will be sent to me without me looking at it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Crackedwheat
Reviews.Content: Everthing went smooth as silk...recommend the restaurant Mon Ami Gabi which has great seating outdoors, opposite the Bellagio fountain show. The meal was good too! All in all a great location and nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Paris is Superb~Our hotel choice for all future Vegas Trips~”
Reviews.Author: spadesqueen74
Reviews.Content: Arrived on Father's Day, June 21, 2009 for a three night stay. Check in line was long; however, they had many employees working so it seemed to go quick. We got their most basic room, I think they call it a luxury or deluxe room, whatever, it was comped for all three nights so I didn't care. They offered us a Suite for $85 per night. The checkling told us their suites usually go for $550 per night. We declined. Then they offered us an upgrade to a Red Room for an additional $40 per night. No thanks. We are no-frills type of people who are rarely in the room anyway, besides their basic room is more than adequate. We were given a King, Non-smoking on the 8th floor. Not much of a view but we did see a little of the Bellagio. Bathrooms are gorgeous, all marble, stand up glass shower, great toiletries. Wonderful Beds, the best sleep I had of our entire two week vacation. I highly recommend the Paris, the location, restaurants, casino are all fantastic. You will not be disappointed unless you are the type who is never happy. I can't believe some of the things people find to complain about on trip advisor, keep in mind some people just can't be pleased. Oh well, we appreciated the free stay and enjoyed every minute of our visit!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lghgirl23
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth trip to Las Vegas and my second time staying at Paris. We took the Showtime Shuttle from the Airport - $12 per person round trip. I have always used Showtime and find them to be prompt, reliable and affordable. Only issue is that you get dropped off by the side door and have to walk a bit to the lobby. A cab drops you off right at the main entrance. We arrived around noon and checked in right away - no lines and our room was ready. We selected a Red Room without a view. The room was okay - not as nice as the Augustus Tower at Caesars, but it was less expensive. The bathroom has a small tub, shower and toilet all in one room. Augustus Tower room has a separate water closet and jacuzzi tub. But - how long are you in the bathroom in Las Vegas? The shower door didn't quite close all the way and therefore water leaked and the toilet ran a bit ... again, not big issues, but just small things that kept me from giving Paris a five star review. The room was fine for what we needed. The pool is on the third floor of the hotel and that's nice because you don't have to walk through the casino or shops in your bathing suit like you have to a Mirage, Caesars or MGM. The salon and spa facilities were fine - I had a manicure and got my hair styled for my wedding. My husband used the steam room and liked it - although it wasn't anything fancy. The restaurants, cafe, and shops are all located together and that is also nice because you don't have to walk all over the place to get a coffee in the morning. It's easy to get in and out of the hotel and there's a walkway through Bally's to get over to Bellagio. Once you figure out the path, it's very easy to navigate. The casino was fine for what we needed, not as big as others, but I never had a hard time finding a slot machine I liked. My husband frequented the Sports Book and always received friendly service. I had never bet on sports before and the associates were very patient and friendly during my learning curve. The best thing about Paris is the location. It's right in the middle of the Strip and easy to walk to the other hotels. We'll stay somewhere else when we go back, but only because that's part of the adventure to try out different hotels. I definitely recommend Paris. A few other notes of interest: Peepshow - take it or leave it ... "O" - finally saw it, it's excellent! Zefferino's at the Venetian - amazing food Diablo's at Monte Carlo - fun atmosphere and good food Nathan Burton at Flamingo - fun time, appropriate for kids

Reviews.Title: “Paris Part Duex”
Reviews.Author: Thunder70306
Reviews.Content: Hi all, Just returned from another fantastic week in Las Vegas. This is my second time at the Paris and was just as nice as previously stated. With that said there were some disappointments but nothing to stop me from staying again. The disappointment that I spoke about was my travel documents. When I booked the room through my travel agent I received a run of the house room. Now I was hoping for a red room which is there nicer rooms. Although the room we had was nice, deluxe room, I would have really preferred the red room. When I asked for a free upgrade, all they offered was a $40 a night more for the room. I respectfully declined. So next time we stay I will book the red room through the website. (use the hot price to get really good rates, also sign up for e-mails.) This time around the valet was awful. I went to Utah to Zion and after a three hour drive back all I wanted to do was go back to the room and take a shower. Not only did it take 20 minutes to get from MGM to Paris it took another 20 minutes to park the car it seemed nothing was moving!!! Was it a fluke, probably, but it got me on a wrong day... If you bring a laptop be prepared to pay 15 bucks a day for internet and 25 bucks a day for the gym, unless you go to Mandara Spa then fee is waived FOR THE DAY. So your wondering , would I go back? Definately and I would pay for the red room. Do me a favor when traveling to Las Vegas, find out if a convention is staying there. We had a convention with for the deaf. I am sorry, but I am a special education teacher and there was no reason for the rudeness of people.

Reviews.Title: “25th Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: RedpopOhio
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking for some place nice to go for our 25th wedding anniversary and boy did we find it! My wife had never been to Vegas and it had been about 29 years since I had. So after researching all the different hotels, we decided on the Paris. We wanted on the center of the strip, not too expensive not too cheap. The Paris sure fit the bill. We Arrived Around 9:15 and took a taxi from the airport. The ride was quick and the driver was very nice, the cost was around $22 dollars including tip. Went to check in and we were on our way to our room in under 15 minutes. Told the woman at the checkin counter it was our anniversary and she up graded us to a red room with out us even asking. Plenty of elevators so it seemed like you never had to wait. Room was very nice and very clean, Only complaint was the pillows on our bed seemed a little small and cheap. None the less we had no trouble sleeping at night. The rest of the place, casino, shops, and restaurants were very nice. Service was very good with the exception of the buffet restaurant, there was always a line to get in but when you walk by there were alot of open tables and the staff working there did'nt seem as friendly. The location on the strip is great not a far walk to any of the other casinos on the strip and plenty of action close. We also took a taxi back to the airport quick easy and only $15. When we go back the Paris will be high on our list.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MartaZanchi
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights. Paris has large rooms, good beds, nice bathroom, but no lcd tv and you have to pay to high speed internet...we booked luxury room (basic) with no view. The health spa was not great and I dont have any lucky in cassino. Great Location, in front of Bellagio, near all atractions

Reviews.Title: “Great room, enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Ellesmereporters
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights paying only £36 a night by booking a few weeks in advance with Great Late Deals! We had a blue room which faced the Bellagio fountains and the Eiffel Tower. Beautiful at night time. The room was not dated as some have stated, but perhaps we were lucky in room 2290. We didn't have a wait at check in and it was very smooth. Ate at the Buffet in the Paris having been given a discount voucher at check in and also went up the Tower for free with similar vouchers. We took the free bus to the Rio using other vouchers and had a great night there for £10!! Thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel especially as it was a bargain price and in a great location on the Strip!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and loved the food.”
Reviews.Author: RUDRIDER
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in , we had a 15 minutes wait, which I did not mind. I was asked if I wanted to upgrade to a remodeled room for $40 more a night, I declined. Our rooom was onthe 14th floor and I view was the front side of the the City Center complex. What a complex that is. Our room was the basic room with the blue carpet the slightly worn furniture and a very very uncomfortable bed. The bathroom was big which was a nice bonus. The bathroom did not have a well working exhaust fan though. The temp. in Vegas was around 100 for the four days we were there. The room a/c was set at 66 and it ran all the time. If you were on the bed closest to the a/c you did feel cold, on the next bed not so much. We really enjoyed the food there, we ate at JJ's Boulangers three times. The breakfast items were great and so was the pizza. The breakfast special was a ham and cheese croissant with a coffee or juice for $9. We did eat at Mon Ami Gabi, with the view of the strip and the fountains. It was great, a little expensive , worth it though. The pace around the walkway to Bally's was a nightmare, I felt you had to have a turn signal on to get onto the walkway. On the other hand, the casino was the opposite, that was easy to walk around. The slots pay out for me anyway was very poor, we gambled at other casinos and did better. Over all a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room”
Reviews.Author: rmpca
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Paris hotel/casino. We did not have one of the more recently updated "Red" rooms, though it was clean and the bed fairly comfortable. The bath was nice size and nicely decorated. Location is great, being center strip and the Bellagio is right across the street. Having a beer was ridiculously expensive...$6 each for domestic. So most of our beer was bought at "Casino Royale" for $1 each. The Eiffel tower is in my opinion worth the time, especially at night. What a view...and if you pick up a Vegas.com book, which are available in most hotels/shops or the little boxes in various locations along the strip, there is a 2 for 1 coupon for the tower making it only $12 for two people.

Reviews.Title: “In Love with Paris”
Reviews.Author: ChoNic
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, I was impressed with the cleanliness of the hotel. Front sidewalk was even polished. The France theme is beautiful and the details are remarkable. This is my first time checking into a hotel and this is my best experience yet. The staff was top notch! When people are great to you, how can you ever have a bad time? I had no problem checking in early (10AM). The desk clerk was very nice, friendly and accommodating. Since I’m celebrating my birthday, barely legal (just turned 21), she upgraded us from a regular luxury to a red room luxury with strip view room on one of the top floors at no additional charge. (I had to do the sandwich trick though). The Caesars Palace and Bellagio fountain view was breathtaking! The room seemed a little plain to my boyfriend but for me, I thought the room was well decorated and the furnishings were elegant. The French colors and fabrics were really classy. It was cleaner, bigger and newer-looking than most. Service was fast. I called and asked for additional towels and soaps and I got them in less than 10 minutes. No fuss made though I mentioned that I was celebrating my birthday, but that’s fine, I got free room upgrade anyway! Casino was nice enough and feels a lot less dark than a lot of them on the strip. Valet was slow but it didn’t bother us that much as it is pretty common with all gaming hotels. So we just decided to self-park, not much of a burden at all. Parking structure is pretty close to the elevators. I like the fact that the pool is on the roof. You wouldn’t have to walk through the casino in your swim suit, all wet. The pool isn’t all that big but the view of the Eiffel tower is lovely. I can’t say enough good things about this hotel and would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: teachernate
Reviews.Content: It was a wonderful location and a great place for a business conference. We were able to see most of the strip from outside the front door. Service was prompt and polite and the restaurants were good. A very satisfactory stay. It was not life altering, but it was memorable. We suggest skipping the in house entertainment to go across the street and see what is happening at the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: joel76
Reviews.Content: Great location in the centre of the strip, within easy walking distance of lots of good hotels for activities, such as the Bellagio fountains, Mirage Dolphins and New York rollercoaster. The room was quite a traditional style but in good repair and clean. Bathroom was bice with separate shower and tub. Amenities ie shampoo were a little disappointing though. Food options in the hotel are quite good for evenings, especially Mon Ami Gabi which was excellent with fantastic views of fountains. Seemed a bit minited for light breakfast options unless you wanted to line up for buffet or 24 hr cafe. The pool area is large, unlike other Vegas hotels I have stopped in with plenty of beds so it did not feel overcrowded. Drinks by the pool are pricey though. Didn't gamble in Paris but instead went to other hotels with lower minimums, best is still TI in my opinion. Don't bother going up the tower it's rubbish and the grates on the view make it virtually impossible to get a decent photo. Only complaint was check in, long queue and only 3 people serving on 10 desks!!

Reviews.Title: “Oh la la !!!!”
Reviews.Author: ChampsNZ
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay in Las Vegas. Very close to everything. You could walk anywhere along the strip. The hotel staff were great. We had booked in on a very good deal and when we got there they asked us if we would like to upgrade for further dollars. We said no, but because we had travelled so far they upgraded us anyway to the most amazing room with an incredible view all over the strip and Las Vegas. The staff could not do enough for us although one downside was one of the cafes in the casino was poorly run and the staff obviously did not enjoy their job there. We asked to hire a car for a day while we were there and it was no trouble for them to do that for us. The room was incredibly spacious and quiet and so clean. All facilities were in good working order and well organised. A great place to stay. We wanted to have a game of golf and they even offered to organise that for us as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Paris”
Reviews.Author: Jerry1031
Reviews.Content: Last year were married on top of the Stratosphere on the BigShot ride and would recommend for anyone who wants a thrill wedding! This was our first anniversary visit. Overall a great stay at the Paris. Last time was Excalibur and that was nice with two teens and we almost stayed there again, but the reviews seemed very good for Paris and the mid-strip location was good and got a good deal through Alligent Air. This time just us two and first time at Paris. We got in so late because of plane problems 5:00am that our non-smoking room was unavailable which was our only gripe. All hotels seem to be first come first serve for the rooms and that is wrong!! We had to accept a smoke room and change at 11:00. The smoke room was an upgrade to a Red-Room, but when we did get our lower rate Luxury room , it was almost just as nice #731. Separate nice shower(bathroom appeared the same), 27" TV, but who watches in Vegas, but maybe a little news(did not try the adult movies,lol) Overall atmosphere is wonderful at Paris with many shops and eateries and the architecture and detail is great along with the Eiffel tower!! Casino was laid out good with plenty of room to walk. Although we did not win we had a great time. Bally's next door was also nice, but I think we had the most fun just walking up north and stopping at all places. Every casino was fun and different! Everywhere has different drink prices and atmosphere so hard to say which was better. A beer and shot of house Tequila was $6 at Bills,but 10 or twelve up the road? I think most people know that drinking on the strip can be pricey! A night spent downtown at Freemont street is a must for Vegas. We had a great time with all kinds of entertainment and people to watch! We took the Duece Bus $3 one-way or $7 for 24 hrs(good deal) Took about 30 minutes, but the ride is fun with good views if you can sit on top and in front part. Another night we also tried the monorail down to MGM and went to Excalibur, NYNY and Tropicana and had a great time $5(one-way) We also rented a car for 2 days and hit the local resorts during the day around Vegas. I will do this again next year! Boulder Station was our favorite for wins and atmosphere, but also nice were Sams Town and the upscale Red Rock Casino & Resort. Arizona Charlies had great food. There are quite a few to hit . I took a $6.50 shuttle ride from Paris and picked up the car at LAS car center and then dropped it off when we left town. I booked ahead with Priceline and got an SUV for $37 The new car center and buses to the airport are great and quick (7min) with plenty of signs to show you where to go! Stop at The "Welcome to Las Vegas " sign just south of Mandalay Bay on Las Vegas Blvd for pictures! Last year stopped at Hover Dam and South rim of grand canyon and would also recommend! Beautiful scenery but takes most of a day. So much to see and do so will have to come back next year to continue the adventure. Hope your trip will be as fun as ours!!!

Reviews.Title: “No Electricity In My Room!”
Reviews.Author: Marissa235
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paris for a conference. I had a 6:00 a.m. flight, so I got up at 3:00 a.m. and had no electricity. I called the lobby and was told that it was a scheduled maintenance outage. When I explained that I needed to shower and pack, all they would do is to send up a small flashlight. When I called and requested a partical refund, I was told they would not make a refund because they had post signs stating there would be an outage. Although I never saw a sign and there was no message on my phone, I surely did not receive what I paid for - a room with electricity.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel..... Check in/out Staff needs work”
Reviews.Author: Prechus
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas two years ago.. and Paris was the Hotel we were amazed with. So this time... there was no question of where to stay. We booked and when we got there check in was a little odd. They had one clerk for check in and then 3 clerks working for players members. Which wasn't busy. Check in did go quick.... we asked about an upgrade, bluntly she said 60.00 a night more... she did say some rooms already have a view so maybe we would have a view.... So we said we would check that out first. Got up to our room and looked like someone had already layed on our bed. The view was construction... we headed downstairs and decided on a better view. It was 64.00 more a night but well worth it. Got up to our room and the keys did not work... called security and then after putting our stuff up .. headed back downstairs to get keys that worked...The lady was just like, oh guess i didn't scan them... The day we checked out.... the lady checking us out was very loudly rude to a customer before us... she had no smile... no thank you... no nothing... she did ask us if we had a nice stay then said ok your done.... Next.... i then heard her being rough to the next person. Other then that... the room is spacious... gorgeous veiw of Bellegio.... bathroom spacious... room cleaned... nice ....nice. Just wished the check in/out staff could of been a little kinder.

Reviews.Title: “paris and trip thoughts”
Reviews.Author: vegasteve
Reviews.Content: First off thanks to all who write reports , I love the read and it keeps my juices flowing for my next trip. This was my first stay at paris , my wife and I started by trying the twenty dollar upgrade and it worked but unfortunately my wife is a smoker and the upgrade was to a non smoking room cause that was all they had so I politely declined the upgrade and told the check in clerk to keep the twenty because she did what we asked but the non smoking thing would have put a damper on my wife's vacation. So our view was a view of parking garage I think but the room was ok nothing spectacular but adequate enough for us ,as we do not spend a lot of time in our room to begin with. The gambling was fairly good to start, I started at roulette about twenty minutes into our trip and within 15 minutes I was up over a $1000. We pretty much stayed even the next few days with little wins and little losses. our daily gambling budget runs about $1000 per day and we stayed up until the last day which was just awful and we (I) took a [--]kicking on the craps tables at ballys on our last day. So our gambling totals are -100$ for our trip. Food and entertainment: We didn't venture out like we normally do we enjoyed meals at burger brasserie (B+), margarittaville (A+) the chicken caeser and wings were awesome, the buffet at Planet Hollywood was yummy (B+), Ellis Island restaurant (Steak special 6.95 for 10 oz ribeye, baked potato, caesar salad and a beer was unbelievable A+),and paris room service food was good as well (B). Now the bad , The Paris Levillage Buffet was not near as good as I remembered and the lines to get in were crazy(C), The tequila bar at bally's ,right next to the sidewalk cafe was awful terrible food and service(D)and the absolute worst was the Hooters restaurant at the hooters casino I ordered wings and they were absolutely horrid and I couldn't eat them. It was like eating grease by the mouthful and trust me when I say I LOVE WINGS. This was the absolute worst (F). Went to the live airing Of the one more round radio show outside at hooters pool and it was fun got to meet a lot of fighters there, and then went to UFC 98 at mgm the next night had a great time and we didn't have great seats but that didn't matter cause there didn't seem to be a bad seat at the grand garden arena. We also did a cabana rental at the paris pool and we loved it . It was the first time we ever did that and we really enjoyed it. If your with a group of four or more I would highly recommend doing the cabana rental as it was a blast. Well another trip done and I'm starting to plan my next one for probably september and yes I probably will stay at paris again, so everybody keep writing and I'll keep reading!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Love Paris Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mjlass
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Paris Las Vegas from a 3 day weekend. This was a very belated Christmas present for my parents. We had a wonderful stay. Checkin was quick and rooms were ready by noon. They called my cell to keep me updated. Rooms were red rooms, which are newly renovated with flat screen TV, down comforter and pillows. Bed was very comfortable. Buffet was great with different sections daily. (Go at 3:30 and pay lunch price but changes to dinner at 4:00). Crepes are phenomenal. Drink service in the casino was readily available no matter the time. Casino was smokier than in the past, but I attribute this to a slightly older clientale..... not just the young 20's. All the staff we encountered were genuinely helpful and friendly, not "fake friendly" or prententious. Paris is large, but not too big, yet small and quaint. Will absolutely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: LondonForestlondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris hotel. It was a great, clean hotel. It was walking distance to other hotels. Check in and Check out was very quick.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: spursgirl73
Reviews.Content: A truly luxurious hotel situated in the central strip, lovely views of the bellagio fountains. Good bars and restaurants within the hotel - check out mon ami gabi steak house (book ahead!). Helpful staff, will help you to book tickets for shows, etc. Rooms are lovely and big with good sized bathrooms. Mini bar a bit pricey. Overall a great place!

Reviews.Title: “Red Rooms are a SCAM-service is terrible”
Reviews.Author: we3kingsKentucky
Reviews.Content: Please don't bother with the Paris. They lure you with cheap room specials, get you to upgrade($100) to the exact same room you booked -except for the Red headboards. Mentioned it was my 40th b-day and gave the front desk $20, and still nothing special. Carpet was wet, room was smokey........PLEASE GO TO THE FOUR SEASONS

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: budlady
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel yet. We've stayed in a couple in the last 2 years but Paris is the best. The deco, the shops, the boulevard leading to Ballys was great. Service was good and we were accomodated even though we were early checking in. The rooms are clean and spacious. Express check out was handy. It was a great place central to the strip. I would defo recommend this..

Reviews.Title: “the price was right, great value and at the centre of strip”
Reviews.Author: nickss1
Reviews.Content: just returned from a 5 night stay at the paris. the price was right, through expedia. although the dollar to pound rates aren't great at the moment, it was stil good value. as mentioned by several reviewers, the check in is very slow. only one clerk in duty at 8pm on the evening of arrival (sat). to be fair, she was very attentive, and helpful. 11th floor room (1124) was at the end of the long corridor - very quiet, and had view over the entrance, and planet hollywood. i could just see the very edge of the bellegio fountains. the room was clean (the windows dirty). two queen beds, easy chair, good range of tv channels and great bathroom; seperate shower and bath. housekeeping cleaned room everyday. the pool area is great (sun hits the area at 930am). large pool, plenty of sunbeds. le buffet is great for breakfast; wonderful selection, and superb crepes. didnt use for lunch or dinner. plenty of eating choice in the hotel. check out (at 6am) was a breeze. overall a great stay if you can get a good price. (just be prepared for a wait when checking in!

Reviews.Title: “Great value at current rates!”
Reviews.Author: muell384
Reviews.Content: I went out as a 21 year old with my mom and older brother, stayed at Paris and had a blast. I did my research beforehand and thought the location of Paris would be perfect for a first legal trip out to Vegas. Checked in on Memorial day took 10 minutes at most. $20 trick got us strip view overlooking pool, Eiffel tower and clear view of Bellagio fountains! The room was very clean and housekeeping was helpful every day. The pool is basic, but it was plenty big and it was very cool looking up at the Eiffel tower. Very European feel in the pool area, I liked it. The casino was kept very clean in my opinion, very little smoke circulating and drink service was attentive. Check out the cobblestone streets leading to bally's, lots of cool shops and restaurants along the way. We ate at Le Burger Brasserie one night and it was AWESOME. One of the best burgers I've had. Overall, Paris was a great choice at the rates we booked at... Awesome value for the $$$ and I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Liked our stay - 5/24-5/30”
Reviews.Author: tutfam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris Sunday, May 24 - Saturday, May 30, 2009. A little background. This is our 3rd stay at Paris. Last one was for one night last September and another trip a few years ago. We typically stay at Bally's. There were 3 of us: me (mid 40's), husband (50) and daughter (mid 20's). Check-in took about 25 minutes or so. We got in line right before noon when several people were checking out. Clerk was friendly, got checked-in and off to our room. If you aren't familiar with Paris, there are 2 or 3 different banks of elevators that go to various floors. Each bank has about 8 elevators. We never had to wait long to go up or down on the elevator. We were in room 437. It was a little over 1/2 way down the hallway. View was of a roof and looked toward the Paris balloon. A view would have been nice but I didn't want to complain about the view because most of our nights were comped. The thing that was not so great was that the service room was right across from our room. The service room was where housekeeping got towels, blankets, pillows, etc. So there was quite a bit of noise and chatter going on every morning. The room has 2 beds, a desk with chair, 2 cushy chairs, a cushy footstool, a small glass table, night stand between the beds, lamps on each side of the bed, a lamp on the desk, and a stand up lamp. There is an armoire that has a closet on each side of the tv area and below the tv are 4 dresser drawers. There was a small refrigerator in the room that I think was stocked and we didn't touch because we didn't want a charge. There is no closet and no luggage stand. There is an ironing board and iron. The bathroom has a blow dryer, magnifying mirror that pulls out from the wall, and large vanity with 1 sink. The glass shower with glass door is separate from the tub. The room is a bit smaller than I remember. No problems with our room being cleanly. The one day I accidentally left the Do Not Disturb sign on the doorknob, they called and left a message to explain why they didn't clean. I called and they came up later when we were ready for them. When we first arrived we needed called for extra blankets and towels. They were delivered within a matter of minutes. The pool is on the 3rd floor so that was a bonus of being on the 4th floor. Take the elevator to 3rd, walk a very short distance, and you are at the pool. The pool was busy on Sunday and Monday due to the holiday weekend but was less busy as the week went on. There was a DJ on Sunday but music only the rest of the time we were there. Saw the cocktail waitress a few times. Never had trouble finding a lounge chair. We tried to go to the pool in the early afternoon most days but a couple of days we went later (around 3:30). By that time the sun has definitely shifted and you have to be strategic in finding a lounger or place in the pool that is in the sun. We didn't gamble a lot in Paris, just not enough time. I went to the casino one morning while waiting on husband and daughter. Found a blazing 7 penny machine. After playing it for about 30-45 minutes, I hit the jackpot! Needless to say I was very happy. We did not eat at Paris. We did eat at Ballys Sidewalk Cafe. Disappointed to find out it is now only open 6am-2pm. The RIO shuttle picks up outside the door (side toward Planet Hollywood). It's free but we tipped $1 for each of us. Monorail station is located on the lower level of Bally's, back near the pool. We like staying near the center of the strip so Paris was perfect for us. We had to catch our plane at 11:00 so checked out around 8:00 a.m. Only waited in line about 2 minutes. Check-out clerk was not a friendly person at all. We wanted to apply any comps to our room charge. Husband had already packed his Total Rewards players card away and she said they couldn't look it up. Grouchiest person I encountered during our entire trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: bobfrombc
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed at Paris, first time, June 1 - 5. Also my first time in Vegas. We arrived at the hotel around 11:00 pm and checkin was very smooth. As we had prepaid via an Allegiant Air package clerk advised us we didn't have to leave a credit card impression, our choice. We were upgraded from a regular deluxe room to a "red room" on 28th floor. From touchdown at airport to entering our room took 40 minutes. We ate breakfast and dinner a couple times at Cafe Ile St Louis, creperie for breakfast a couple of mornings at La Creperie and Mon Ami Gabi for dinner one evening. Certainly not inexpensive for breakfast as eggs benedict and coffee for two plus tax and tip ran $40. Crepes and coffee for 2 including tax $26. Cafe Ile St Louis had a great dinner special of filet mignon Oscar, about 6 oz of meat, veggies and roasted potatoes for $12.99. Waitress who served us our first dinner there remembered us two nights later, even our names. The night we ate at Mon Ami Gami they were featuring chateneuf du pape for $40 rather than their usual $90. Of course we ordered a bottle. Pool was ok, water around low 70's. Got a 12 oz plastic glass gin and tonic at the pool bar - $12. Felt that was a bit of a rip-off. Walked, walked and walked. Didn't do any gambling, wife blew $40 on slots in about 10 minutes, nor did we take in any shows. Next time we'll do that. Overall, it was a good experience and we'd go back although I'd like to try some of the other hotels like Mirage, Belagio,Venetian, Pallazo but would need more $.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely visit again”
Reviews.Author: DivaLvs2Travel
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on Tripadvisor and was nervous about my stay at this hotel as most commented the rooms were small. My stay was wonderful. The buffet, both breakfast & dinner, surpass the buffets at the Bellagio & Ceasars. The atmosphere is very tranquil, and the Parisien theme sets it apart. It is centrally located, a big plus. The staff is very accomodating, as I had a problem with my shower; my room was changed immediately, without asking. I stayed at the Mirage and now much prefer the Paris. The room size is slightly larger than any hotel chain, and the bathroom has a full bath, with a free standing enclosed shower. Roomy. I hope your stay is enjoyable !

Reviews.Title: “paris i will be back”
Reviews.Author: smokeychicago
Reviews.Content: we are going june 22 2009 but i stayed at paris at least 10 times.stardust was my favorite because i knew where everything was,well guess what now i know where everything is at paris.the rooms are very nice the food is great and the casino is cozy.i have been to other casinos on the strip and paris is by far the best.i cant wait to go,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location ~ Comfortable Room ~ Nice View”
Reviews.Author: TravelsCheapo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris on our 8th trip to Vegas. The location and ambiance are excellent. Paris offers many great food choices at reasonable prices. We stayed in Room 1911 and had a view of the tower and Bellagio fountains (drawback, windows were filthy). For the most part we had excellent service, but the housekeeping staff were inconsiderate in the mornings with their shouting out good mornings to each other while the hotel guests tried to sleep. The pool was very nice. I absolutely loved our stay at Paris and would return again on another trip.

Reviews.Title: “the only place”
Reviews.Author: Kali2Vegas
Reviews.Content: We have been travel to LV for many years and came to the conclusion that THIS IS THE ONLY HOTEL we would stay during our visit. the services, atmospheres, gaming, etc..etc... even the guests whom staying here are a cut above.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was nice, but service not so nice.”
Reviews.Author: happymomoftwo
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a very nice hotel. I visited it last year and knew I wanted to stay there someday. The rooms were nice, but not so clean. When we got there, there was a toothbrush in a drawer and garbage in the can. They made the bed the next day and kept my husbands shirt under the sheets while making the bed. We walked out in the hallway the morning after we got there and 3 rooms had room service food on the floor waiting to be picked up. Three days later after complaining someone finally got it out of the hallway. Gross!! I like the location of the hotel, but I don't think I would stay there again. You could never find anyone when you had a question or wanted a drink.

Reviews.Title: “Paris - worth the money”
Reviews.Author: resting
Reviews.Content: We've gone to Las Vegas every year for the past ten years and stay at a different hotel every time. We've actually stayed at Paris twice because it is so nice. If you want more bang for your buck upgrade your room to include the continental breakfast and evening cocktails. It was worth it for two of us to get breakfast each morning and 2 drinks per person and snacks in the evening for the cost of the upgrade. Also, if you like French onion soup you must try La Cafe right outside the elevator entrance. Regardless of what hotel we stay at we always go to the cafe at least once during our visit for the soup.

Reviews.Title: “an ideal get-away”
Reviews.Author: Skiffer
Reviews.Content: We have been to Vegas before and hesitated about going again. Staying at Paris,LAs Vegas made all the difference ! The room was excellent,providing one of the best bathrooms we have ever had in our travels. We enjoyed Mon Gabi ,the pool and the pool cafe. the holiday was all we expected and more.We will recommend this hotel to all our travelling friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel and rooms in the most central location”
Reviews.Author: tradeshowtraveler
Reviews.Content: This was our "splurge" while in Vegas at about $75 for a midweek room. It was like a 5-star hotel with mini bar, room service, a great pool scene and lovely buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Smokey and Dirty”
Reviews.Author: queenofthedamned
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel several times when it was part of the Hilton family of hotels and it was beautiful and clean. We went with friends for New Years and extended weekend. Since becoming a part of the Harrahs chain; it was smokey in the casino, disgusting bathrooms in casino area, not enough staff gto wait on guests and overall the whole hotel was dirty including the elevators. In comparision, one has to only walk to Venetian and smell roses upon entering or ride the tram to Luxor which was clean and smoke free. The cuts that Harrah's made to save money have hurt the Paris and even the top of the chain Caesers was dirty and smokey. The room was ok but obviously needs some help after 7 years with cracked tiles, stained rugs etc

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Ebazinam
Reviews.Content: By far the best hotel we have stayed at on the strip so far. We have stayed at NY/NY, MGM, Luxor and Monte Carlo. Our check in experience was a great experience. We booked through expedia at a basic room rate, but when we arrived i showed them a military ID and we were upgraded to the next higher room! The room itself was roomy and inviting. The bathroom was large and exceptionally clean. It had a bathtub and a separate walk in shower. The casino was clean and the drinks were flowing unlike some of the other larger casinos. Paris is attached to the Bally's casino so you don't have to go outside to walk a good ways, north, down the strip. Planet Hollywood is next door with numerous shops and cheaper eating places. We ate every morning at "Mon Ami Gabi" which has an extraordinary eurpean style breakfast with a al fresco dining area right on the strip, with a great view of the bellagio hotel water display. The rooms have a stocked refrigerator, cable TV and adequate heating and air. We also never ran out of hot water (in the shower or bath) which is something that we have had a problem with consistently at MGM and Luxor. We booked this hotel at around $105 per night. Exceptional pool, lockers are a problem (not enough of them), and there are no resturaunts (fast or otherwise) in this hotel open very late at night.

Reviews.Title: “I love it here”
Reviews.Author: Mme_X
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel before, and was not disappointed this time. First, the location is very central on the Strip. It is across from Bellagio, between Bally's and Planet Hollywood. There is a monorail station at the adjoining Bally's hotel. You decide if this is a convenient way for you to get around, but the fact is that there is a station in easy striking distance. The "basic" room and bathroom are spacious and very clean. Two small closets flank the TV set (NOT flat panel) in an armoir-like case. There are three drawers in the unit, and more drawers in the nightstand -- enough room to stash a fair amount of stuff. Two comfy armchairs, a table, and an ottoman outfit the room. There is a mini-bar, but one of those with spring-loaded bottles and cans that incur a charge when jostled. Still, we could manage to find space for the odd piece of pizza or fruit, but not much. There is also an ironing board and iron. Lots of nice toiletries in the bathroom -- shampoo, conditioner, lotion, bath gel. The bathroom has a separate tub and shower. Room 630 looks out the back, but we got a good rate and were on the go, so that was okay. The pricier rooms look out over the fountains of Bellagio and the Strip -- nice if you need a special view. The pool here is really nice. First, you are in the shadow of the Eiffel Tower -- such goofy fun. It did not feel at all crowded. There are more than enough chaise lounges for everyone, and the staff do not over-crowd the chairs, i.e. some are kept in reserve and put out when it looks like things might get a little crowded. This made the area seem very nice and spacisous, compared to the crowded pool areas at other hotels. For those who don't want full sun, there are potted trees around, and some parts of the pool area are shaded by the hotel itself at different times of day. There are also private cabanas for rent. A poolside cafe can supply food and drinks at your chair, or you can have lunch under a scrim-rook (I wish it was more shaded -- too much hot sun gets in.) We really like the lobby amenities here. The casino decor has all of the kitschy cliches of Paris -- more goofy fun. There is a really nice range of restaurants from quite expensive fine dining (Eiffel Tower) to moderate places. Mon Ami Gabi, Ah Sin (Asian,) the Cafe, and a steak place all have atmospheric setting, even if off the casino area. Back down a hall are a casual ITalian place; a crepe stand; the buffet; and a breakfast/lunch spot. The find: go to the Lenotre cafe that is very near the elevator bank and newsstand. The morning coffee is slightly less costly than the other breakfast spot and better, and Lenotre also has wonderful pastries and muffins. Also: I don't think people see the very good sandwiches and salads in the case here. You can eat at tables, or grab these items for a quick lunch on the go or when you need to get work done in the room. There are also good ice creams. There are a number of good shops to poke around in. Gustav's bar is a good place to park yourself with a glass of champagne to view casino action, and there are other good spots for drinks throughout the lobby. Service was uniformly nice and friendly throughout the hotel, whether at the check-in desk or business center or pool or on the casino floor. Downsides: internet access in the room is $15 a day -- very annoying in this day. Also: the pool has no charge, but the fitness facility will cost $25. I didn't want to use it, but this always feels like nickle-and-diming. Managed downside: There was one day when a DJ appeared in later afternoon, cranked up some music, and gave away free items, but the next day it seemed like someone (thankfully) asked that the noise level be turned down. So far, Paris has NOT adopted that tacky promotion of fencing off a "European" sun area (read: topless sunbathing, often for a surcharge of the priviliege of being in that area, and/or ogling.) I hope it never does -- that would spoil the nice setting. To sum: while we still might check out other hotels on future stays, there is a strong preference to stay here. It is definitely a place to check.

Reviews.Title: “don't waste your money on a "red room"”
Reviews.Author: 1037wolf
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Paris Las vegas. We booked a "red room" as they were supposed to be more elegant and renovated. The only thing I saw that made it different than the traditional luxury room, was red paint in the bathroom and some kind of red bed boards behind the bed. I think Paris needs to make it what it should be and that is an elegant, classy hotel and a step above a Harrah's property. Also, watch your bill at checkout. We had a charge on our bill for a movie,( which we did not rent) and also three charges for the mini bar (which we did not open). I called the front desk and they told me that there was no way this could happen unless we used those services from the room. The front desk person was not nice about it either. After thinking it over I checked and saw that the charges were made at 1:00 p.m. the day of check in, the only problem there was we did not get our keys until after 4:00 p.m., so that shut them up, and the charges were removed. That was also something we had not seen before. You are not allowed to check in until after 4:00 p.m. as they are all booked, but you can store your luggage for a fee and play table and slot games and spend money until you can use your room to freshen up. Things are changing on the Harrah properties. Maybe check into some of the other hotels, such as Mirage, or Treasure Island, Wynn or Venetian.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased again!”
Reviews.Author: VegasGirlOhio
Reviews.Content: A group of friends had 5 rooms and we were all pleased! We weren't in the newer "Red Rooms" that we stayed in last year but the rooms were still clean and nice. We went to the spa for the first time and we were all rather disappointed. There weren't as many ammenities and products to use and the treatment rooms were nice but, some of the rooms have windows which brings in way too much light while trying to relax during a massage. Like many of the other reviews say, location, location, location! You can earn your comps easily at all the other nearby Harrah's properties. Food was great in all the places in Paris and nearby Ballys. Sure can't tell we are in an economic slump in Vegas! The hotel and stip was packed!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: chapperette
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for the strip. Very pricey for basic things like water, breakfast etc. No tea and coffee facilities in the rooms, forcing you to buy from the hotel which is expensive, but so is all of Vegas. The french street in the hotel is great and there are some great Patisseries!

Reviews.Title: “Debra W. from St. Louis, Missouri”
Reviews.Author: Topapple
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival I was in awe with the cleanliness of the hotel. The workers were very nice and helpful. The room was extremely clean and the view was lovely from the 26th Floor. It is directly across from the Water show, close to Planet Hollywood and various establishments on the strip. There were alot of shops and restaurants inside the hotel itself if it wanted a romantic getaway. The only thing I didn't care for was the congestion of the casino slots and it was extremely crowded (Mother's Day weekend). Also there is a $15.00/day fee for internet service excluded from the hotel rate. I would definitely stay again with a better idea of what I would like to see.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Employees, Poor Value, Poor Service!”
Reviews.Author: JPHALL
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I were married at the Paris Chapel One year ago and we returned for our one year anniversary this May. Back in May 2008 We found the staff to be pleasant towards us when we were married and they seemed to be gay friendly at that time. We remember having a lovely experience with a nice congratulatory staff, this of course was when I was a Diamond card holder. When we returned this May to celebrate our one year anniversary the experience was not as pleasant as before, in fact it was drastically different. My Diamond membership that renews every six months renewed in April 2009 prior to our stay. Due to the poor economic times I wasn't able to gamble as much as the prior year and my card was re-established as a gold member (lowest tier) after holding Diamond status for the past 6 years. We were treated significantly below average after this happened, the staff was rude and Not gay friendly, we did not receive one anniversary congratulations from any of the Paris staff after informing them that this was the reason for our return, they simply looked away as if we didn't exist. The room we were assigned was old and run down. Our Le Artiste dinner reservation was lost, the food quality was poor and extremely overpriced in all areas of the property, and the staff was rude and unorganized. The gaming was terrible taking without even the smallest return, overall the Hotel was understaffed and inefficient. This was worst service I have ever experienced in the past 15 years of my travel and gaming in Las Vegas. I don't know what has happened or why they would allow their hotel to be run so poorly but it was BAD. I am also a player at the MGM/Mirage and I will be booking my stays with them in the future and I will spend my money there as well. The MGM now owns half of the strip and I always get treated very well at their properties. I am sorry to say that Harrahs seems to want Gay travelers to book at Paris and spend large amounts of money there without returning the favor with even as much as a smile. I felt very uncomfortable at this Hotel being a gay man and my husband who is in the resort business was extremely disappointed as well. Paris if you expect people to pay your extravagant prices than you should provide extravagant service.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with the Paris”
Reviews.Author: mishlmarie
Reviews.Content: We were really concerned to stay at the Paris after reading some of the reviews. Despite what we read, we were really pleased. Check in was at 8:30pm and it went quickly. The very nice part is that we were upgraded to a suite with no extra charge. Everyone was friendly and helpful. The staff was pleasant. It is a really great location on the strip. Make sure you eat outside at the Mon Ami Gabbi.......good food and service. The annoying part of the trip was the people handing out the cards and the people trying to get you to see a time share. A very good experience overall. I would go back there.......location, location, location.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED The paris”
Reviews.Author: alleycat53
Reviews.Content: Wonderful room, just the luxury room, but big and clean and perfect - The best food and service ever. I would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “First Time and I will Go Back”
Reviews.Author: mymisfit
Reviews.Content: Stayed May 11-14 for my 50th. Birthday. Room was a comp. but because it was my birthday they upgraded me for free to a room with a view. And the view was fantastic. I could sit in my room and look out the window and watch the fountains and if you lifted the little windowseal part of the window you could really hear the music too. This hotel is in need of upgrading, but I thought it was just fine. The location was great, the people that worked there from front desk to the bellmen were all really nice and always had smiles on their faces. This was a great place to stay and I would really thing about staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: sandmanj
Reviews.Content: For a basic Vegas hotel room, this more than met our expectations. First, it was bigger than most. Second, it was cleaner and newer-looking than most. Third, it was really classy, with the French colors and fabrics. Fourth, I've noticed over the years that the Paris still keeps all areas really clean, including the public rest rooms. Finally, where else in Vegas, does one get to really feel like you're in the city the hotel is named after? Only the Paris. New York, New York? Fuggheddaboutit!
