Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Loftypines
Reviews.Content: 11th trip to Vegas but first stay at PARIS, Saturday check-in. Tried for an upgrade and the $20 tip worked for a KING RED ROOM on the 30th floor. Very clean modern accommodations. Our friends were not lucky with an upgrade and had a traditional room on the 16th floor which was also very clean. Our room had a big flat screen, they had a standard 27" both had about 12 channels (I don't go to Vegas to watch TV) our room also had a little iPod stereo alarm clock which was excellent....might buy one for my room! Bathroom very nice with separate shower. The room had no coffee maker or fridge and the coffee shop at the bottom of the elevators charged $6 for 2 large coffees. Mon Ami Gabi is a great restaurant overlooking the strip, we ate breakfast there. If you and your travelling companion can agree on something to share the portions are HUGE and plenty big enough to split so french toast will cost you $5.50 each, coffees again are $3 each. The pool is plenty big enough with lots of chairs, on the weekend they had a DJ. The Paris location is very convenient on the strip, 10 minutes to the IP, Harrahs, or Flamingo or 10 minutes the other way to MGM. It was a little bit of a walk from the parking garage to the check-in but once that was over getting from my room to the casino or the strip or the pool was quick and easy. Paris has a nice casino but no Poker room, no problem since Planet Hollywood is really just next door. I would definitely recommend PARIS!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: bhoffa24
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights at the Paris Hotel and have nothing but good things to say about our stay. The staff was top notch and always asked if there was anything else we needed to make our stay better. We upgraded to a room with a view of the strip which gave us a view of the Bellagio fountain across the street as well as free breakfast, a couple of free drinks and appetizers every night. We thought it was well worth it for the price we paid. Not the flashiest hotel in Vegas but for the price, location, and staff we would stay there again in a heartbeat. We did have a mystery charge on our bill at checkout that was taken care of with no questions asked. If your looking for a nice hotel in the heart of the Strip, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed over all...”
Reviews.Author: ConsumerSOS
Reviews.Content: My wife and I paid our first visit to Vegas in late April and we stayed at the Paris. On the good side; it's a terrific location. You can't ask for more. Architecturally, the building is outstanding. The shops in the mall between the hotel and Ballys are quite good. You can find breakfast for 8.95 which includes ham and egg croissant and coffee. That's good value. We enjoyed a fantastic dinner at Mon Ami Gabi, the restaurant that includes the outdoor patio on the strip. One of our travelling companions has eaten there several times and his recommendation did not fail us. If you want to check out the dueling pianos in the lounge you will be entertained; but better be drinking or the bartenders will enforce a two drink minimum. On the downside: the smoky public areas were nauseating. I can't tolerate smoke much and don't have to, thanks to legislation that bans it most places. But compared to other hotels, the Paris's ventilation system does a poor job of clearing the air. I wouldn't spend any time in the casino for that reason. As for service, it was less than cheery at the front desk. But possibly, in character with Paris... Our room, the basic variety was just that: very basic. Not refurbished in a while, nothing to cheer about. But it did have decent mattresses and a working safe, which are both pluses in my book (and I travel a fair amount). All in all, however, this experience wasn't up to what my wife and I had expected. The Paris is a nice place to visit, but next time we'll stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Paris, a bit dated, but excellent service”
Reviews.Author: dnvrjeep
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris for the 2nd time 5/8 to 5/11 for the Dave Matthews concerts. Previous trip was 5-6 years ago. The room was a smoking room and it was a bit war torn. I wish I had thought to bring some travel Febreze for the carpet to freshen it a bit. Although I had read the reviews about the TVs being dated, I didn't think it was an issue, given the amount of time I stayed in my room. It was a bit inconvenient having to scroll through 8 channels of Asian TV to get to CNN, and the tvs/furniture do need to be updated (some of the furniture was scratched). Bathroom was OK, not as nice as I remember, the shower, while a 4 piece bath, was a bit cramped. The floor service (cocktail waitresses, dealers) was GREAT! I prefer gambling at Planet Hollywood as you can not hear any music at the craps tables at Paris. The buffet at Paris was OK, lots of people enjoying the crab legs, which looked good, but not somehting I'm into. The food we did have, (chicken/beef/pasta) was kind of cold. Desserts were great! The St Louis restaurant had mediocre service at best, but better food. One meal my meal ticket was buried under my entree! They didn't even take if off my bill!

Reviews.Title: “Great position, one of the best places to stay in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Welshsheep101
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the first three days of our honeymoon and I must say that it was fantastic. We initially chose Paris for its location and were not disappointed-if you want somewhere that's bang in the middle of the strip then this is it. Unlike other reviewers it was quiet when we booked in, although our room wasn't ready for an hour (it gave us a chance to start our gambling and drinking!). Was a bit disappointed that no fuss was made with it being our honeymoon although we were offered an upgrade...for $90 a night. I would say don't take this up as the room we were given was excellent anyway! The bedroom was massive, and the room itself nice and clean. Loved the cocktail bar next to the pool and was great to sip mohito's and sizzle in the baking sun. Ate at the buffet for breakfast and thought it was fantastic. In short, if you are going to Vegas for the first time then I would recommend Paris-it ticks all the right boxes

Reviews.Title: “just booked again for 14 night stay”
Reviews.Author: lindajackson
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at paris many times it is a lovely hotel set on a great part of the strip we always upgarade to a la mans suite the pool is fab the food is good and the staff are great we always stay in vegas for 2 weeks it takes a long time to get from ireland we sometimes stay in three different hotels on one trip but this time we will stay the 14 nights at paris you can catch the free shuttle outside and have a great night at rio another favourite of ours

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Paris”
Reviews.Author: Reddleigh
Reviews.Content: My step sister and I stayed at the Paris hotel for two nights. I had always wanted to stay there so when Harrah's offered 2 nights comped, I couldn't pass it up. Upon arrival, I asked for a nice view on a high floor. I was quickly informed you had to pay for a view. It was 65.00 a night etra to have a view of any kind. She also offered to upgrade us to a Red room with concierge level priveledges for 150.00 per night. We declined since we don't spend much time in the room anyway. We were placed on the 22nd floor with a view of Bally's. The room was alot smaller and more worn than I expected. I always assumed since it was usually quite pricey, that the rooms were larger but that is not the case. The bathroom was small too but very nice. There was a seperate tub and shower and the toiletries smelled very nice. The bed is very hard, not very comfortable. The location is awesome. We love the breakfast buffet at Paris so it was nice to have it right down stairs. We also loved having Planet Hollywood and Bellagio (our 2 favorite gambling places) so close. Overall, it is a nice place to stay and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for a quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: maprak
Reviews.Content: Great location, great rooms, great staff most high end hotels are a ripoff with fancy reception rooms and little substance. Paris is not like that. The quality is everywhere and it makes it a very plesent stay. Dinner at the effial tower is great as well

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: tk4683
Reviews.Content: Check in was easy. We were upgraded to one of the remodeled red rooms just for asking. At no additional charge. Rooms had huge flat screen tv's and seperate tub and shower. Plenty of food options at this hotel. Mon Ami Gabi has great food, and the outdoor seating is a great seat for the fountains of Bellagio and people watching. We were able to walk to everywhere we wanted to go as this hotel is in the middle of the strip. We had excellent service at the spa, one of the best messages I have ever had. Layout of casino and hotel restaurants and shops make them easy to find. We will definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Room”
Reviews.Author: JenABQ
Reviews.Content: When we arrived they didn't have any rooms available except a handicapped accessible room (this was at 2:30 p.m.). They told us if we wanted a different room, we would have to wait two hours. Since we were tired and didn't want to wait until 4:30 p.m., we took the handicap room, but it didn't have the same amenities as a regular room. The clerk at check-in was a little rude, curt, and not friendly. She didn't offer any compensation in exchange for waiting for a room. Her attitude was basically "take it or leave it." Next time I go to Las Vegas I'm staying somewhere else. Paris was definitely a disappointment. On the good side, dinner at Bon Ami Gabi was wonderful. Our table was perfect, just inside the patio in front of an opening facing the Bellagio fountains. The food was fabulous, but expensive. Don't bother going to the Paris buffet for dinner. Very uninspiring food choices plus the chairs are very uncomfortable if you are taller than 5 feet. The chair was so low I felt like I was sitting in a child's chair.

Reviews.Title: “We thoroughly enjoyed the Paris Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Here There and Everywhere
Reviews.Content: We selected the Paris Hotel due to its proximity to both the monorail and the Strip, as I was attending a conference at the Hilton. (My husband could "stay and play" while I was at the conference.) The resort is beautiful, and our room was lovely. We had a very spacious, clean corner room on the 8th floor with two large windows, one facing the Strip and one facing Bally's. There was tons of closet space, and the bathroom was huge, with both an excellent shower and a tub. We had the opportunity to dine at three of the Paris restaurants during our stay: Le Buffet, Le Cafe, and Mon Ami Gabi. All three were great, especially Mon Ami Gabi. We'd stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “DREADFUL!!!!”
Reviews.Author: toptraveler5
Reviews.Content: I was simply disgusted!!! The lobby is awe inspiring, it took us no time to check in- our room wasn't immediatly available but we were offered another room that was. Elevators as well as corridors - really, really nice! When we entered our 2 queen room this is where everything went wrong! Carpeting was completly ran down, there were holes in the bed shams, the bathroom door knob fell off in my hand, the lamps attatched to the wall in the restroom had pieces broken and the bulb was not tightened which made it flicker. And to top it all off at 8am on the morning of check-out, the house keeper knocked on the door, not waiting for a response, she opened the door walked in and asked us what time we were checking out!!! I was completley dumbfounded...needless to say all of this was reported to management and the only thing I was offered was a late check out! I do not recomend this hotel at all...there are alot nicer hotels for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Paris? Oui!”
Reviews.Author: LittleTigerLily
Reviews.Content: My mom and I spent a weekend in Las Vegas and although I had had my heart set on staying at the Mirage I simply could not deny the great deal we were offered at Paris. Once we were there I never regretted my decision for a minute. The location was even better than my last stay (Treasure Island) and the only con I could find compared to Treasure Island -- which I love -- was that the beds were not nearly as comfortable. But the bathroom was great! We even did the touristy thing and went up the Eiffel Tower Experience. I think the 12 dollar price is reasonable and if you come across one of the 2-for-1 coupons around then it becomes an obvious no-brainer. ABC Store is conveniently located at the Miracle Mile shops right beside you and, even better than the ABC store at Fashion Show mall, it's open till midnight so you can grab some bottled water and breakfast for the next morning for cheap. The Cafe (Ile de St Louis?) has a late night deal from midnight to 6am: 9.95 for 2 pancakes, 2 sausages or bacon strips, 2 eggs, and 2 biscuits with gravy. Not a bad deal but there's also a 3.95 breakfast at La Salsa Cantina (Miracle Mile) that has 2 eggs, 2 sausage patties or bacon strips, southwestern potatoes, and 2 tortillas (flour or corn). PLUS they have 99 cent bloody marys. But if you don't want to walk over the 9.95 deal is still good. The creperie is pretty good, too. I'm not a big fan of crepes but these hit the spot if you want a quick meal. I like the fact that the pool is on the roof. I find it awkward to have to walk through the casino in your swimsuit, even worse once you are all wet. Their pool isn't all that big, just like Treasure Island, but it does the job. I do have to give them credit over TI however for more attractive pool surroundings

Reviews.Title: “5 stars for the peeps”
Reviews.Author: palmbriez
Reviews.Content: Incredible staff.......what more can i say, when people are great towards you, how can you ever have a bad time.......Paris is the best.......To housekeeping, thankyou for taking such good care of us........

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Paris”
Reviews.Author: nanwdwnut
Reviews.Content: Celebrating 25 Glorious Years we booked the Paris with Harrahs rewards, I reguested a Red Room upgrade but we were only offered it for an additional $60.00/night. So I requested a P room for no additional charge and it was just lovely. A large room, with double floor to ceiling windows. Great view of the moutains and sunrise each morning. Large bathroom with tub and shower, a sitting area table 2 chairs a small couch. The weather was perfect 80's so the pool was crowded but never a problem to find a lounge chair. While we ventured out to other hotels, Paris was just perfect for us, not too big but big enough, Tables were plenty even $5.00 tables available on a weekend, unheard of in AC. The best was the Mon Ami Gabi restaurant, worth the wait to sit outside and watch the Bellagio Fountains while dining. Best French onion soup, steak and chicken delicious, Very affordable. The Buffet Breakfast was very good too. The hotel is like a little french city inside with the cobblestone floors, and beautiful decor. The Eiffle Tower experience was an added bonus with the 2 for 1 coupon we found. Great location on the strip 1st day we walked toward MGM the 2nd day we walked to Venetian. Maid service was excellant and very friendly staff. We would definatley stay here again on a future trip.

Reviews.Title: “Smoky, disgusting experience”
Reviews.Author: mjm629
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paris for 4 nights for a conference that was held at the hotel. Waited in line over an hour to check in (despite them knowing they had several thousand attendees arriving, they had 2, then 3 staff working the front desk in the hour I waited. Several colleagues waited more than 2 hrs to check in). The smoke was overwhelming from the second I walked in the door. My floor was non-smoking but it didn't matter - the air quality was just as bad as the casino. Disgusting. I wheezed, sneezed, and coughed the whole 5 days I was there. It was awful. Rooms were worn and not very exciting. Bath was quite lovely, though. Staff were rude and not helpful. Maybe they're trying to really recreate the experience of the REAL Paris. Well done. I disliked the real Paris, and now I hate fake Paris too. The only great food was at the Creperie. Delicious crepes. Buffet was busy and not great. Burger Brasserie was average. Meeting accommodations were a joke - a tiny business center serving both Paris and Bally's that could not deal with conference attendees' needs. Very expensive wireless internet ($14.99/day), and very expensive business services. A dump overall. Will NEVER return.

Reviews.Title: “first trip,not bad”
Reviews.Author: KansasBeenthere
Reviews.Content: My wife won our trip to Vegas in a contest in March and we chose to stay at the Paris over Easter weekend which was also my 40th birthday.We saw pictures of the hotel over the internet and read many of the reviews here so we felt prepared. Arrived around 1p.m. on Friday the 10th. Took a few minutes to find check in as shuttle dropped us off on the side of the Paris so we had to walk through the whole casino to find it. Waited maybe 5 minutes in line. Lady at check in was not the friendliest but had no problem getting our room. We didn't mention my birthday or try the $20 trick. We got a room on the fourth floor with a view of a retaining wall. Room was clean and big enough for us.Definitely not "luxury" as on our reservation but more like a suped up Econo-lodge. Housekeeping did a wonderful job during our stay. We didn't eat in any of the restaurants as we preferred to take the bus to Fremont Street to eat and shop on a limited budget. Check out on Monday the 13th was fast and hassle free. No hidden surprises. For transportation I recommend getting the round trip shuttle from the airport. Other than the time share spiel they try, it is worth the money. On the strip we got the 24-hour pass on the Deuce, a good deal. There were alot of things to see and do on the strip but as mentioned before, we liked going to Freemont Street where we got more bang for the buck both food and shopwise. Overall, we had a good time in Vegas and the Paris was fine for us.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: edhellab
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a regular room for 4 nights last year and absolutely loved it. Definately recommend the Breakfast buffet and the Burger Brasserie. We are going back to vegas soon, and will be visiting both restaurants. Great loaction for exploring the strip. TOP TIP: for a cheap breakfast checkout the cafe n the PH mall, next to the tropical rainstorm. Cheap quick food!!

Reviews.Title: “The Paris-Vegas”
Reviews.Author: soonergirl23
Reviews.Content: We travel to Vegas several times a year for business and pleasure. Sometimes we bring our kids (12, 9, 8) and sometimes not. We love the Paris in Vegas! It is a smaller casino, so it is easily and quickly get to places around the casino and hotel. It is located in the middle of the strip, so you have great access to other casinos-The Planet Hollywood (great sportsbooks, rockin' music, flat screen TVs everywhere). One of the best restaurants is in The Paris-Mon Ami Gabis. (I highly recommend the filet mignon with merlot butter sauce. And they have great French beer and wine.) There is a piano bar in the Paris, which is rockin' most nights. Lots of fun! We go there every time we are in Vegas. Sports bar is nice, usually has beer specials during big games. The Paris has an open stage in the casino, so live music is played on one side of the casino. The bad: The rooms are getting tired looking-not fabulous like other hotels on the strip. The pool does not get sun until noon, so the water is very cold (even in the summer). The drinks are way over-priced at the pool area. Cocktail waitresses at the open stage in the casino are never nice, so we have stopped going there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in all departments”
Reviews.Author: buzz6872
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris Hotel in April, our second vist to Vegas, last time staying at a different hotel. We were in Vegas for a friends wedding and found the Paris hotel excellent and excelled in all departments. The location is superb bang in the middle of the strip and right opposite the Bellagio fountains. I would certainly recomend the buffet breakfast at only $17 each for all you can eat and with a vast choice of food to choose from certainly sets you up for a busy day sightseeing. But I would recommend to get there early as the queues can be quite long to get in but they do more quite quickly. We found the rooms spotless and well furnished comfy bed and with a huge flat screen tv. The only little niggle was our room was one of the rooms where they had not yet installed a seperate shower cubical so we had a shower head in the bath. They told us that the rooms are in the process of been upgrading. We found the staff friendly and only too willing to be of help and assistance. I ordered flowers for my wife and i got the impression I could have asked for the them to be delivered at 3am they would have obliged!!! We were both very impressed and if we go back deffinately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS in every way!”
Reviews.Author: TVannsgirl
Reviews.Content: This was me and my husbands first trip to Vegas so not knowing what we were getting for our money was a little scary. There are all kinds of wonderful and not so wonderful places to stay in Las Vegas. We were fortunate and stayed at what I found to be the most beautiful hotel in Vegas. The Paris has comfortable, quiet rooms with roomy bathrooms, luxury mini bar for those who would endulge in them and an exceptionally warm feeling. When you enter you have a casino area but it is modest and doesn't send you into some kind of slot machine noise hell like some of them can. The larger casino is in the back connected to another casino. Inside is a gorgeous setting like being in the middle of old France. The detail is remarkable! The food is great and the staff is friendly. This hotel is HUGE, we were there for 3 days and I still couldn't see all of it! I went into every swanky hotel there just to see them and they all had something to offer but the Paris by far made me feel comfortable. A real plus is the fact that they have a rental car company on the premises. That came in real handy since we wanted to go to the Hoover Dam while we were there. I can't say enough good things about this hotel and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Crowded Quarters”
Reviews.Author: hal9341
Reviews.Content: We have been to Las Vegas numerous times, and for this trip decided to stay at Paris. It is not one of the best in town (though not the worst either). Most people say they love Las Vegas but wouldn't want to live there. I can now say the same about this hotel - Great place to visit and check out on your trip, but not to actually stay at. Why do I say this? Well firstly the actual hotel feels very crowded and cramped. The casino and shopping area are always bustling with 'passers by'. There are no quiet spots to relax in. We found it extremely noisy, cramped and confusing compared to most other casinos. There is no sense of sophitication or elegance that one might associate with all things Parisian. Worst still it permanently feels like it's the evening in there. Not great when it's a bright sunny morning outside. There is absolutely no natural light in the buliding at all. Not even at reception. The cafes and restaurants almost always had long lines, so even getting some breakfast felt like a chore. One night (2am) we decided we wanted a cup of tea. We waited in line for twenty minutes to be seated, only to find the cafe actually half empty. Why on earth we had to queue is anyones guess.??? (By the way - They do NOT know how to make a decent cup of tea either) In the end we resorted to McDonalds for our breakfasts. Where we had less of a wait, better tasting tea, and a much smaller check! The rooms are average for Las Vegas. Probably seem amazing to anyone who's never been there before, but take it from me they are nothing special. The bad design of the building also means 75% of the rooms face either the side of Bally's or Plant Hollywood. The adjoining hotels. If you want a strip view it will cost you $65 extra a night. Not worth it in my opinion unless you can bag a room higher than floor 15. Otherwise you basically see the pool and Eiffel Tower. Speaking of the pool - again distinctly average. Only one big round pool. Only 3ft deep even at the centre. No umbrellas to shade anyone, so you'd better want to fry in the sun. On the plus side they do have a nice cafe area there. This can only be accessed by guests, so less busy and actually fairly pleasant. If the management had any sense they would utilise this in the evenings too, with pool side dining and music. Lastly I have to say the service overall was not very good. The exception to this was the buffet where we found all our servers very pleasant and accomodating. I can't reccommend this hotel to anyone really. If you want better casino environment opt for Bellagio, Monte Carlo or Venetian. If it's a great pool you want go for Mandalay Bay, Caesars, Pallazzo or Flamingo. If great shopping is your thing opt for Caesars (for Forum Shops) or Wynn, Pallazzo or Treasure island (for Fashion Show mall). If you want a young, slightly more urban feel opt for Planet Hollywood on the Strip, or Palms or Hard Rock off the strip. Can I think of a single overriding reason why you should choose Paris? Sadly no. It's just average in all respects.

Reviews.Title: “Fun girl's only vacation”
Reviews.Author: AnonymousConnecticut
Reviews.Content: Visited Vegas for a girlfriends vacation and stayed at the Paris. Great location at center strip accross from Bellagio. While the rooms were not huge they were large enough and comfortable with a mini bar, small sitting area and separate shower/tub in bathroom. Common areas of hotel are decorated nicely. Check in was fine but check out was long as it was Saturday afternoon. Casino area is large enough without being overwhelming. Bartenders were very friendly as opposed to over at the Flamingo where one was downright rude. Buffett and restaurants were very good. One complaint, room service charges for coffee based on number of cups you request not size of the pot.

Reviews.Title: “Got Upgraded - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jmschn
Reviews.Content: I booked a reservation through Harrah's Friends/Family discount and got the room for 2 weekend nights at $70 each night. I arrived late around 9:45pm and there was no line at all...front desk said there was only a standard room with 2 beds which I didn't want...she ended up telling me that she's going to check to see if i can get upgraded to a suite...she comes back and happily says we've been upgraded to a P room....huge room for 2 people! Separate entry way for the closet, restroom and toilet. Came with mini fridge and coffee/tea maker. Really great value and really great location!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Loving Hotel Well Designed Well Situated”
Reviews.Author: Oysterboy6
Reviews.Content: Right in the middle of the Strip and attached to Bally's where you can access the Mono-Rail or walk on over passes to the Flamingo or to the Bellagio or to Cesears Palace. Also very short distance walk to Planet Hollywood and the fun shopping stores and eateries. Mon Ami Gabi is truely a life-like experience of Paris France. The steak au poivre(pepper) is just succulent! The Village Buffet was outstanding and I would say one of the best in Vegas. The Ile St-Louis was also excellent. The bartenders at the casino bar were very very friendly! The staff at Napoleons bar had an attitude and I would not recommend this place. The only bad experience during this stay. I would have loved to have tried the craps, roulettes & BJ tables but I was to shy. The thing with all casino's is that they really don't try to teach or explain so I just keep away! A secret afternoon fun bar place is Carnaval in front of Harrah's/Imperial Palace(about 15 minutes walk from the Paris). The Pool at the Paris is very well laid out! Check in service was excellent, very friendly! I was upgraded to a Premium room with a wonderful view. The concierge & bellman service were excellent! This was one of my best vacation stays ever!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location with the most detail”
Reviews.Author: duhbear30
Reviews.Content: It was a beauty of a hotel and casino - literally transporting us to Paris with the cobblestone(like) streets and faux storefronts and painted ceilings, replicated eiffel tower etc... . It was centrally located on the strip so easy to go in either direction. Helpful staff and good wait service in the casino. Gambling not so great - not too much of a run for your money on the slots and tables were all a $10 minimum (a bit much for our taste were hoping for a $5). The hotel itself was very nice, they gouged us at check in claiming that there were no smoking rooms available even though that was requsted at the time of booking and verified 3 days before hand so they graciously offered us an upgraded smoking room on the 27th floor with a good view that we would be pleased with (had requested a view of the Bellagio fountains) for a mere $40 more a night. We only paid $60 to begin with so being eager to start our vacation we agreed. The room was beautiful, one of the newly remodeled Red Rooms - yes it was on the 27th floor which offered a georgeous view of the back of Bally's outdated hotel. Was not pleased with the view but whatever you don't spend much time in the room anyway. The bathroom was beautiful it was all very clean and well kept. Easy video check out and ability to check your bill on the tv screen - good thing because they had charged us several mini bar charges that we had not even used. Come to find out that the mini bar is hooked up to sensors and if you move anything out it charges you - well we had a few things we needed to have kept cold so moved things around and set them other places hence the charges, they were taken off when we called the front desk to dispute. Overall a good experience - learned a few lessons in the process but a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, good, clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Joanie17
Reviews.Content: Went with 3 other woman, to celebrate our birthdays. Have been to Paris before, and found it to be just as nice as before. Wonderful location, good clean rooms. Service was good at check-in. They let me in the room before the 4pm check in time, probably because it was a Thursday and they had a room available. They did provide lots of towels etc in the room as us four woman shared a room. The casino is not as big as some, so that may disappoint a few, but I loved the location and all the amenitites. The buffet was awesome on Easter! Would go back in a heart beat. Also, don't miss the dueling piano's at the bar in Paris....too cool!

Reviews.Title: “So Pretty!”
Reviews.Author: little_S_Vancouver
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel around 3:30pm on a Friday and there was a line up for check-in but it went quite fast. I got the non-smoking 2 queen bed room as I had requested. The room was clean but I didn't think it had enough lights. It's ok in the daytime if you have your curtains open but if you don't, it seems like even if you turn on every single light, it's still not bright enough. We went to the pool for a few hours and it was quite nice. The water was cold but the pool area was clean and they had lots of chairs for people to use. The drinks from the bar in the pool area were really good...but I thought they were kind of expensive! It was my first time in Vegas so I loved the location - very central so it wasn't a long walk in either direction. I also got a super deal so I thought the value was great...I paid less than what I would have if I went to a 3 star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location / Dated Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Tristan017
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at most of the hotels in vegas over the years, as I have visited this town over 100 times. This was my third stay at Paris Hotel & Casino and my least favorite. . I don't think the rooms have changed since they opened as they are now showing signs of wear, dated decor and old tv's with a poor cable package. The bathrooms are still very nice but the hallways to the rooms on my floor smelled of old carpet with years of trapped chemical odors. { I have asthma so I am very sensitive to overuse of carpet cleaners, chemicals & smoke.} I had one morning that the hot water for the shower was barely luke warm. If you do not plan a lot of time in your room then these are ok but not luxurious. Check in was a breeze here {about 5 minutes} but I always plan my arrival in Vegas a little early, [usually between 12 & 1. I have found from 2-4pm most of the Las Vegas Hotels have pretty long check in lines. The location of this hotel for 1st time visitors is very good, as it is near the center of the strip across from the Bellagio and connected next door to Bally's. I used the Las Vegas Monorail at the back entrance to Bally's to get down to a convention at the MGM each day and this worked out pretty well. It was a pretty good walk from the Monorail to my room at Paris but it certainly a good option for getting to the other ends of the strip. The pool area at the hotel is ok, but for those wanting a pool scene this would not be on my short list of great vegas pool areas. Try Caesars, Mandalay Bay or even the Flamingo Hotel & Casino if pool time is your top concern. And always make sure to call ahead to see if the pool area is open. I do like the Casino here more then many in town as the high ceilings make for a little less smoky atmosphere. I have eaten at many of the Paris restaurants. The bar atop the Eiffel tower has some terrific views for a cocktail. Mon Ami Restaurant is it quite good and the atmosphere terrific. I have also eaten at Les Artistes Steakhouse and found the food to be just ok but the room itself quite stunning. In the walkway from Paris to Bally's you can find the less expensive food {bakery, crepes, buffet, etc} along with a spirited bar that had dueling pianists on one night of my stay. I did notice during my stay the buffet line looked ridiculously long each morning when I walked by. All in all Paris is in a good location but the rooms are getting a little tired. If you are going to stay here make sure you get a really good rate. If you need 5 star luxury in your room and would like a smoke free environment check out Palms Place {the high end resort attatched to the Palms Casino. I stayed there about 2 weeks after staying at Paris Hotel and could not believe what a different trip I had for not much more money. It was the best hotel stay I have ever had in Vegas. {Note Palms Place is not on the strip but a very short 2 minute cab ride away.}

Reviews.Title: “Paris!! Well Done!”
Reviews.Author: Coylie14
Reviews.Content: Hey everyone! First of all I am a 44 yr. old Vegas traveller with over 25 visits in the past 10 years. I really enjoy this town. This was our first experience at Paris. Here is our review! We booked to go Easter weekend and decided to stay at Paris because it was the only Harrahs property we had not yet tried out. We got two nights comped and paid $57 for Fri. and Sat. night, so the price was right for four nights. We arrived late (about 11:30pm) on Thurs. night of the long weekend. The check in line had about 8 people in it and we waited for about 10 minutes. The young man who helped us was very polite. He told us unfortunately all standard King rooms where gone so we were going to get a free upgrade, but would have to settle for two queens the first night. He offered us a much bigger upgrade to a King suite (1000 sq. ft.) for an extra $85 per night so we said that is just too much for us this time. So, he put us into the queen upgrade. Strangely, I decided that since he treated us so politley I would tip him $20 as a thanks ( I know, you should do this before he assigns the room). He quickly put it in his pocket and as we started to walk away he motioned us back. He said he really appreciated the tip and was going to put us in the nice King suite for free!!!!!!! It was a really nice room. Great space, furnishings, the bedroom had a wet bar in it with an empty fridge for us to use, business desk and armoire with a TV. Even in the suite the TV was only a tube one, but that didn't bother us! We had a granite coffee table with some nice chairs around it and a couch to sit on. It was nice when we had our other two couple friends to entertain. There was a corridor which came to a "T", one way led past another desk (where we kept our laptop) into a walk-in closet with the in-room safe. The other way led to the beautiful, huge bathroom!! Lots of marble, wonderful big shower and a separate jacuzzi tub, two vanities, mirrors, etc. No T.V. though!! Then of that room was a door leading to the toilet and the second porcelin toilet which was the one to wash your butt on!!..LOL Who would ever use this?? Very funny. The view was nothing special, 11th floor overlooking the roof with a side view of Planet Holleywood. I WILL ALWAYS USE THE $20 TRICK FROM NOW ON!!! What a great room upgrade for four nights for $5 extra per night!!! The casino was fine! We didin't gamble too much here but we could have. Our friends were both at the Rio so we spent some time over on that part of town. We had a ball playing at the Gold Coast. I did play some Keno machines at Paris and did ok, making about $200 profit. We didn't notice too much smoke. It's actually a pretty nice casino. We only ate at Mon Ami Gabi at Paris and it is as advertised...outstanding!!! You can eat there for reasonable prices as well if you want. The couple we went with only paid $60 for their meal, tip included. I had just won a $200 Keno jackpot outside the restaraunt waiting for the others to arrive so I splurged on filet mignon and it cost us $100. The service was great, I made our reservations online a month before we left and noted to them then that I had celiac disease so I would need gluten free food. When we arrived at the restaraunt they had a special menu for me with all gluten free selections on it...nice service!! We had to wait 15 minutes past our reservation time for an outdoor table cause we wanted to see the view of the Bellagio fountains!! It was great!! The pool area is fine, nothing special bet nice. The view of the Eiffel Tower right in front of you is cool. The two hot tubs where kind of secluded from the pool and big...very nice. Maid service was perfect, we needed a couple of foam pillows delivered as I am allergic to feather and we needed a new remote for the TV as ours did not work. They brought both up to the room 10 min. after a quick phone call from me. All in all it was a great location, room and hotel. Oh ya, we NEVER waited more that 20 or 30 sec. for an elevator either. Same with Valet parking, never waited more than 5 min. for our vehicle. We would stay there again for sure, but we like to try new places so we will see. Loved Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: jfp50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris April 5 - April 12, and everthing we encountered was better than expected. Our room faced the Bellagio fountains (22nd floor) The whole staff was friendly, all the buffets were incredible. Le Cafe had a special (filet mignon with crab meat and roasted potatoes)for 12.95 and was great! Our room was kept immaculate. We asked for and received a King bed, non smoking and was great. We will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great, Overall, Minor Flaws”
Reviews.Author: stageguytx
Reviews.Content: After a delayed flight, we arrived at the Paris Hotel Casino at about 2am. We had called to let them know that we were arriving late - thankfully at our arrival, our room was still booked for us and check-in was quick and easy. We stayed in a Red Luxury Room. Furnishings were nice, furniture comfortable. We only had two issues with this property. First, the hotel directory binder was missing form our room. This meant we had no information on hotels service, room service, maps, available services, etc. Despite asking both the front desk and the concierge for a binder, none was ever provided - in fact, the concierge said that he would place the request with housekeeping, but he admitted that they would probably not follow through on the request. There were many occassions that the binder would have been helpful. The second issue was service at the Cafe restaurant. The food was acceptable, but service extremely slow. Both times we were one of only about five tables seated. It took an unacceptable amount of time to take our order, and unacceptable amount of time to receive our order, and an unacceptable amount of time to receive and pay the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal but don't expect any frills--”
Reviews.Author: 1AvidTraveler
Reviews.Content: This was my third time in Vegas and while we got a great price on our standard room at the Paris, and I was excited to be "center strip", if you will, I'm not sure I would stay here again. There were too many minor issues and there are too many other awesome hotels in Vegas! For instance, the Mirage is usually about the same price, it's not much farther up the Strip, and the rooms are FAR superior to those at the Paris. That said--I will start with check-in. We arrived sometime between 4 and 4:30 PM on a Thursday and they only had TWO people working the "regular" guest check-in line, which meant we waited about 20 minutes, a bit much in my opinion. When I stayed at the Mirage we had to approach the front desk numerous times during our stay, for check-in and otherwise, and we never waited more than a minute or two. Also, the Paris casino is something of a maze and very difficult to get around in! Much more so than the ones at Mandalay Bay and the Mirage. Anyway, on to the room--we stayed in a standard room and let me tell you, at the Paris, you get what you pay for. Although the room was nice and big and the bed/sheets/pillows were soft and comfortable, I had the following issues: -There was no comforter on the bed. I like to "sleep cold" (with the A/C on a lower temp) and if I hadn't had someone to cuddle with, it would have been AWFUL. -The carpet was very worn and there were random marks all over the walls. -Even though we didn't watch much TV, the other Vegas hotels I've experienced led me to expect a flatscreen. Not so at the Paris--if you have a standard room, expect a crappy, small, old tube television. -It was annoying to see the usual sign in the bathroom about how the hotel is trying to be "green", so "hang up your towels" etc. "if you want to re-use them". Personally, I don't mind using my towels/washcloths for a couple of days and usually hang them up to save water etc. at hotels. But at the Paris this is impossible because there is only one TINY towelbar in the entire bathroom! They really shouldn't have those signs at all, considering. -I brought a travel-sized container of facewash with me that happened to be the same size and shape as the shampoo/conditioner/lotion etc. containers that the hotel provides. They threw out my facewash on me because apparently every day they take all of the slightly used containers out of the shower and toss them! This is both silly and frustrating because I had to go without facewash because of it. Otherwise, I will say that the bathroom was awesome! Very big, with a separate shower and tub. Much nicer than the bathroom in my room at the Mirage, which was tiny. We ate at four of the "restaurants" at the Paris during our stay there. The Lenotre Bakery has great food but crappy coffee. My latte tasted more like water than coffee and my boyfriend's cappuccino wasn't much better. The bakery was also pretty expensive. I ate at Mon Ami Gabi for the second time and was just as impressed as the first time I ate there. Not cheap by any means, but awesome food and service! We had breakfast at Le Cafe on our second morning there and it was just okay. The hollandaise sauce on my Eggs Benedict was questionable, my boyfriend's bagel with eggs and salmon was average, our cappuccinos were the same blah ones that we had at Lenotre, and the service was ridiculously slow. Finally, we had crepes from Le Creperie and while they were tasty--don't expect anything like a REAL French crepe. They were too thick, first of all, and they felt the need to smother my Nutella Crepe with hot chocolate and whipped cream on TOP of the Nutella. A bit much. Check-out at 11 AM on a Sunday was a long process, as is to be expected. The luggage storage service at the Paris was great/easy, though! All in all, while I can't give the Paris an amazing rating, if you can tell that you're getting a good price on the rooms I say go for it.

Reviews.Title: “We won't be staying there again.”
Reviews.Author: gt91367
Reviews.Content: I was on travel for business and my family met me at the end for a long weekend. The rooms are TINY. The bathroom was dirty. The room service menu was not in the room. When I called to order room service, i received my order but it was wrong. I told the server that the item included a topping that I wasn't aware of, and he said Oh, well, it's in the menu". I told him that I didn't have a menu and ordered with the assistance of the phone staff, he again said "Oh well" and left. The issue was resolved quickly with a phone call, but it was off putting. The hotel is a theme hotel, so we thought it would be fun for children.....there were no children's channels available. It was not really worth the money and we will be staying elsewhere next time. The service at the restaurants was great! They were very pleasant and my daughter loved "Lee Cafe". Aside from the room service attendant, the staff was really nice and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “No better then a Motel 6, everything is fake.”
Reviews.Author: Lmaralin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there last weekend with a group of friends. We called a head of time to get rooms side by side. They said no problem. When we checked in, they over booked and could not accommodate our requests so we were on separate floors directly above one another. However, to their credit, they "upgraded" us. If our room was the upgraded room, I would hate to have seen what the "economy room" looked like. Our drain in the bathroom sink did not work, took 20 minutes to drain the sink. There was mold or crud growing on the shower doors. The bathroom was nice and roomy though. There was not coffee in the rooms. I suppose this is to get the customer out of the room. King bed was hard as a rock, and pillows were small feather pillows that we kept getting stuck with the quills. The walls were paper thin so could hear the neighbors TV blaring or other things. Holes in the walls of the hallway, someone puked in the hallway and it was not cleaned up. Another room had ordered room service and left their cart in the hallway when done. That is fine, however something smelled rotten and it was left in the hallway for over 24 hours so the entire hallway stank like BO. The TV in the rooms were old 19" boob-tube. There were about 14 Asian channels and only 8-10 English channels. The pool is less than to be desired. It is basic and no frills. It was filthy as were our windows looking out of the room and directly below to the pool. When I spoke to the manager, all they offered was a comment card. I told them for a 5 star hotel, they were no better then a Motel 6 and he just corrected me, that they were only 4 stars. As far as I am concerned they were no better then 2 stars, and we will NEVER go back to this hotel. Completely not worth it! There is nothing here that you can’t get at another hotel and spend a lot less. The furniture is cheap and shabby, beat up and missing pieces. I could have saved our money and stayed elsewhere on the strip, but we wanted elegance and fun. This hotel held neither. Entertainment was less than to be desired. We spent most of our trip gambling elsewhere. Save your money and your time and do not even bother with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to get around.... not so nice room.”
Reviews.Author: breezeyj
Reviews.Content: For my husband and I, this was our first trip to the "fabulous" Las Vegas. We had an easy time getting around the hotel and the people were all super friendly, but our king bed didn't have a conforter or a bottom fitted sheet. There were just light blankets on top and a flat sheet that didn't even fit the bed on the bottom. The bed was rock hard to boot! Our view was amazing, but we only got that by upgrading when we got there, because they had us in a queen bed room. Our upgrade came with continental breakfast every morning and appitzers everynight (which was like dinner) and that "special" dinning room was very nice. The location of the hotel could not be better, in my opinion. I felt like it was basicially in the middle. We did half of the strip one day, and the other the next. Overall this is a good place for first timers, but we’re not staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “See My Review of Paris (the attraction)”
Reviews.Author: Sarizona
Reviews.Content: I just got back, and I'm still jet lagged. That's the excuse I'm using for posting my review in the wrong place, anyways. Short overview: Excellent service, including free room upgrade and extended check-out time. Nice ambiance. Awesome restaurants. Perfect location. Can be a bit pricey, but you can get excellent deals online, like I did. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and I would even consider staying here again, even though I like to try a different hotel every time I go to Vegas. I miss it already! See my review on the Paris Las Vegas attraction page for details.

Reviews.Title: “We would never go back!”
Reviews.Author: Consultanttraveler55
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at Paris for a large conference (4,000 people). Our poor service experience started right at check in. It took an unbelievable 45 minutes as they only had 5, yes count them 5 staff at the desk. When I complained they said they had just layed off staff. Come on, really? You have 4,000 people checking in and 5 staff is the best you can do? The room and bath were spacious but the bed was uncomfortable, more like sleeping on the floor. My husband remarked it was their way of getting people to go to the casino. We waited almost 30 minutes at Le Cafe for breakfast the next day and never saw the waitress. The buffet (our second "breakfast") was a mess, they didn't keep up the food so it was over cooked and cold. But our biggest complaint was the ubiquitous smoke. The Paris hotel is not that old but our eyes watered from the smokey casino at the door. Everything had to be dry cleaned when we got home. Other newer hotels have figured out better air ventilation, Why can't Paris? We did manage to escape to the pool every afternoon around 4:00. The pool area is large, the pool was not heated and there was no cover. We cherished our shady spot under the "Eiffel Tower". Shortly after we arrived each day the pool staff began relentlessly and noisily stacking the chairs. When we complained they said they were getting ready to close. Really? The pool hours were until 6:00. Was that necessary, policy, or just plain rude? I will say that Mon Ami Gabi was an excellent restaurant but pricey. Stay away from the all you can eat sushi deal Wed-Sunday at the other signature restaurant, it was awful sushi. The lowest moment was when we went to print our boarding pass and found out that they charged $5.00. I travel for a living and stay in some wonderful hotels. I have never been charged that much for a boarding pass. There has to be a better way to enjoy Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic first time stay at Paris!!”
Reviews.Author: batesy30
Reviews.Content: Every year I head out to Vegas for the first weekend of March Madness. I love trying out different hotels each time. Last year was Caesar's, this year I tried Paris. I must say that I was MORE than impressed by the Paris. It exceeded my expectation in every category. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. I will definitely be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amidgett
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Paris. The room is nice and clean. Beds are very comfortable. The location is great... it is on central strip. You can walk easily to Bellagio, Ceasar Palace (Forum Shop), Planet Hollywood and Bally's. They have good restaurants; I like their buffet, they have a wide variety of selections. The downside is it is located in bad traffic area.

Reviews.Title: “Get room, but RUDE employees”
Reviews.Author: sunflower1210
Reviews.Content: I went to Paris with my mother. When we arrived at the hotel it took over 45 min. to get checked in because the line was so long. When we got to the desk the lady was very rude and snappy. We asked how are view was and she responded, " It's 65 dollars extra for a better view". We asked her if they were able to print out our boarding passes when we were ready to leave. Her response was , " it cost money".In our package we received show tickets ( 2 for the price of one). The next day I went with my mother to the front desk to get our tickets. When we showed the lady our information and she had no idea what we were talking about. She said she couldn't do anything. After speaking to the manager he made no effort to help us. Before we went to the front desk to get out tickets, the manager was talking to a woman who was very unhappy because her credit card got charged for something. I've read on here before to never leave your credit card with them. She continued to talk to him for over half an hour. The room was beautiful until I saw poop on the toliet seat!!!! I would never stay at this crappy hotel. I've had wonderful stays at MGM( free printing of boarding pass and very hospitable) and the Bellagio. This hotel is not hospitable and doesn't care about their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Sign me up again!!!”
Reviews.Author: csumms
Reviews.Content: Top Ten Reasons to stay at the Paris Hotel 1. Hotel Staff is kind and courtious 2. Rooms - comfy bed and great view 3. Village Buffet - excellent food - don't miss the crepes!! 4. Pool Side - Lots of space and clean 5. Shops - good variety 6. Le Renezous Concierge Lounge Packaged - well worth the upgrade 7. Location is excellent - A comfortable (sometimes lengthy walk) to the nightlife 8. Dueling pianos very entertaining (although drinks are pricey) 9. Interior makes you feel like you are actually in Paris! 10. Mon ami gabi ......MMMMMMMM! (10.2) did I mention that you shouldn't miss the crepes!!! DONT MISS WALKING DOWN THE BOULEVARD!! Singing restaurants and Le Burger Basserie should not be missed. A few things to be improved.... 1. No real night life bar for dancing during the week (Risque only open on weekends) 2. No $5.00 tables, but it means the cliental is respectful (no frat boys... no offense!!) 3. A long line up at check in, but that is to be expected when a hotel is sold out. Staff very quick at storing bags and then bringing them to our room when we got our room!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms and Location are nice; Staff and policies not so customer friendly”
Reviews.Author: Kat&John
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at over 25 hotels in Las Vegas and so I like the review to place the hotel in relation to other well-knowns. I would place the Paris about equal with Mirage, TI and NYNY. It's a notch or two above MGM, Luxor, Planet Hollywood & Monte Carlo. It rates lower than Mandalay Bay, Rio & Cesars. On the plus side: The location is great and there are a large variety of restaurants on the property. It is also very clean. On the down side: Like most big vegas hotels. You are a number and they do little to dispell the notion. On my reservation I asked for a smoke free king room (not too exotic right...) I was told when I checked in AT 6 PM! that this type of room was not ready yet. What's up with that? They can't get rooms cleaned by 6PM?? At 8 AM the following morning, I was greeted with "....Housekeeping... Housekeeping!... They also have a 10 am checkout time. So I guess at the Paris, don't count on a hotel room for much more than 12 hours. Talked with the mgr about this, They just really don't care. This must have been the hotel that Bob Seger stayed in when he penned that seminal classic from the '70's " I feel like a Number"

Reviews.Title: “Conference Stay February 2009”
Reviews.Author: golfnfool
Reviews.Content: Overall pleasant experience, but nothing spectacular. Had a king room...514. Furnishings nice for average hotels...but average at best for Las Vegas Strip. Housekeeping did great job cleaning the room all week..but did not restock my fridge once during a 5 day stay. Just as well, as they saved me from buying $4 mini cans of soda nightly. LOL Conference facilities were more than adequate...and not as long a walk from the rooms as at some Strip hotels. Dueling Pianos bar was great entertainment, located right at the corner of the wlakway if you are going to self=parking garage or to conference facilities. Not enough outlets in the room. In order to plug in my phone at laptop at the desk, I was forced to unplug a lamp. Same thing by the bed....NOT ONE extra outlet by the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel exceeded my expectations whether in Vegas or not!”
Reviews.Author: Freedomatlast99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved the way the hotel and Casino areas were decorated as streetscapes of Paris and other regions of France. The meals were fantastic and compared to other locations on the strip, reasonable. Leave dietary concerns at home though and simply endulge and enjoy. Far more comfortable feel to hotel than what we envisioned by viewing the website. Service for the most part was excellent and being interconnected with Bally's was a bonus as the two Casino's have quite a different feel to them. Right in the heart of the strip and convenient to most other big named locations. Walked both directions on different days to see each and every Casino. That only reconfirmed that we picked the right hotel to stay at to begin with for our tastes. Two things that were sub-par was beverage service while playing at the tables and our room (no upgrade chosen) that faced south-west towards parking garage and airport). Did not care that room did not have a great view but McCarron Airport is quite the busy place and with planes arriving late and taking off early, facing this direction is a major nuisance unless you live close to an airport and have learned to live with this noise. Facing north or east (strip) would have been much preferred and offerred a more restful, longer sleep. This problem would exist though for all hotels in the south end of the strip with many even worse off than Paris! Vegas can be an in your face, overwhelming place, but the Paris L.V. Hotel was an oasis in the middle of what can at times be a very chaotic place. By the way... absolutely loved how the tower was integrated into the design and building of the Casino area!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience at the Paris Hotel In Las Vegas would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: scarlett329
Reviews.Content: My hustband and I recently stayed here for just 1 night on our way to visit our daughter in Arizona. We try to stay at different hotels in Las Vegas every year for comparison. The Paris was very nice and as someone else posted NOT a party hotel but for us it was fine. As others have posted, the location is central, the hotel was clean and the restaurants in the hotel had good food but a little pricey. For those of you that gamble there were NO blackjack tables under $10 per hand minimum. I was surprised to see a lot of penny slot machines...maybe and sign of the economic times perhaps. FYI: The cab ride from the airport was about $20 plus tip. I liked that the Miracle Mile Mall was right next to the Paris. Once you go inside that Mall you walk and walk like it goes on for more than a mile. There are places to eat in there too if you do not want to eat in the Paris. We walked to the Monte Carlo since they have a brew pub there but it was a farther walk than we had anticipated but well worth it. I've posted a picture of the view from our room #1222. We had a standard room, not a Red Room and it was more than adequate especially for the $70 a night price I got through a promotion they sent me via email. So sign up to receive email news and promotions. The casino is not very big in fact I kept asking is this all there is to their casino? Our cab driver said that business is way down in Vegas. The streets weren't empty but you could tell it wasn't crowded for people being on Spring Break. Someone else posted about the elevators. We were on the 12th floor and you couldn't even tell you were moving and 3 seconds later the doors opened and we were there. FYI: The doors open and close very quickly:) I would not rate this hotel a 5 star since the halls did show signs of wear and tear but if you like the ambiance of being in France the sky painted fresco in the shops and casino were very nice and I would stay here again for the right price.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: Windsong_9
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Vegas and thanks to our great hotel choice, the best. Check in took like 5 minutes. The elevators were the fastest I've been on...never had to wait for one either. The room was very comfortable. My only negative thing I could say is that there wasn't enough space for our clothes, especially since it was February and it was cold so I had alot of sweaters. I loved the pillows so much that when I got home I had to find similar ones. House keeping was even great.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: coventry4
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was very large and had a separate shower and tub. There are a lot of shops and restaurants. We ate at La Provencal and it was a very cozy, warm atmosphere. Our server was very attentive and the food was great. It's connected to Bally's via a short interior walkway.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location. Well worth a visit.”
Reviews.Author: Angelus0704
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from March 4th to 8th. On check in, the lady started chatting and asked if we were there for business or pleasure. I said it was my husbands birthday (that day) and it was our first visit to Vegas. Extremely friendly lady and she told us she had given us a room with a view. When we arrived to our room on 27th floor, she wasn't kidding. She had also upgraded us from a deluxe room to a P room. We had a view of the Eiffel Tower and the Bellagio fountains. If you are a light sleeper and get a front view, bring some ear plugs, as the fountains do go on until midnight and on the first night there we were extremely tired and crashed out at 8pm (4am our time) but the music and noise from fountains kepts me awake. They have 3 separate groups of elevators to different floors. This way there is never lots of people waiting for the lifts. The room was kept very clean thoughout our stay and had more than enough toilettries for us both. There was a HD widescreen TV in the room, mini bar, ironing board, iron and in room safe. The bathroom was marble with separate shower and bath. There was also a hairdryer in here. Extremely comfy beds too. We had two buffet breakfasts at the hotel and they were really very good. On both days, that breakfast lasted us well into the evening before we started to feel peckish again. There was bacon, eggs, omlettes, pancakes, crepes, waffles, fruit, pastries, yoghurt, cereals, bread, bagels, etc etc. It was huge and had something to appeal to everyones taste. Coffee and juice were plentiful. On the first day (due to the time difference) we were awake very early and were at the buffet for 7am with very little wait. The following day we got there for 7.30am and waited for around half an hour. The next day, we didn't go as the queue was huge. My advice would be to get there at 7am each day if you can. It is worth it. There are lots of lovely shops in the hotel where you can buy souvenirs to designer clothes. There is also a small hatch where you can purchase a souvenir container (Eiffel Tower or the Paris Balloon) and fill it with drinks such as Pine Coladas for $15. You can walk directly from the Paris, pass their shops, and into Ballys Hotel and the casino. This casino is bigger than Paris'. They also have more shops downstairs, plus access to the Monorail. Right outside the Paris is a deuce stop. Very convenient way of travelling the strip for $7 for 24 hour pass. There are several restaurants, bars and cafes in the hotel. The only one we tried was the Creperie. I had a lovely crepe, but it was huge and I couldn't finish it all. The location of the hotel is amazing. Right in the middle of the strip, opposite the Bellagio, next door to Planet Hollywood, and minutes from The Flamingo, Caesars Palace, New York New York. The casino is good, but not as big as other casinos. The slots that I liked (Wizard of Oz and Monopoly) they didn't have. They did have most other slots and table games. Waitress service was good at The Paris and would bring you any drink you asked for. Plenty of ATM machines in the hotel. On departure, the hotel has a room whereby you can leave your luggage after you have checked out. The bellboy gives you a slip for your luggage, which you give back when you want the luggage back. They they put it in your transport (taxi, shuttle etc) for you. We throughly enjoyed our stay at The Paris and would go back in a flash. If I have missed anything you would like to know, feel free to ask via message,

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Bold, but Boring”
Reviews.Author: jelly72
Reviews.Content: I did really like the Paris, could not get a better location on the strip. Friendly staff especially in the casino. Rooms big and clean, upgraded to tower view room after a quick five minute check in and cheeky flirting with the receptionist! Buffet queue very long, but ate a few times at Planet Hollywoods Buffet which is next door and is out of this world!!!!!! I went with the lads and I found the bars to be a bit subdued, boring in fact, but is does have acalm ambience. Ok really because it is a great comfortable and luxurious base. So we went to bars at other hotels, My favorites were Coyote ugly, and the Piano Bar, both in new york new york. See Anthony Cools Show at the Paris, it is Hysterical. Don't go if easily offended though. I can,t wait to go back to Vegas, and I would recommend the Paris to couples or older people. People who want liveliness, go to New york, new york, The Rio, The Luxor or Planet hollywood. Lads: The Pleasure Pit at PH is the best place to Gamble Trust me!! also try the rides at the Stratosphere, bring some spare underwear (terrifying)!!!!!!! All in all, we had a fab time, but the hotel itself is a little too reserved and too serious. But great if thats what you want, and like I said it is the perfect base. You can walk anywhere on the strip without shelling out for cabs. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, if it were clean.”
Reviews.Author: hfh46
Reviews.Content: Upon entering our room, it looked like your average 3 star hotel room. Nothing stood out but was still nice. 2 queen beds, average sized tv, armoire, etc. Then we started to settle in and noticed hair on the counter and in the sink of the bathroom. There was also what looked like a straw wrapper behind the faucet and next to the wall of the mirror. It was dirty and looked like it had been there quite a while. Over the duration of our trip, it stayed there the entire time. Obviously housekeeping did not pay attention to these things. When we peeled back the sheets we discovered a laminated card on the bed, the ones which teach you how to play Blackjack. NOT OURS! Seems like the sheets were not changed. So we tried the other bed. This one had a blood stain on it. Needless to say, we opted for the bed with the card.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Auntie_L_9
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms, nice flat-screen TV, comfortable beds, and the best location - right in the middle of the Strip, across from the Belligio.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Joanne73
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris for 4 nights in February '09. We originally had a suite booked at MGM, but after checking out my rewards card, I found I was comped for 3 out of the 4 nights and the night we had to pay for was pretty inexpensive so needless to say, we canceled our reservation at MGM and stayed at Paris. I think the biggest complaint I had was that we arrived at the hotel at about midnight and we waited 45 minutes on line to check in. To us, it was 3 am our local time and we were exhausted, due to not being able to sleep on the plane - so having to wait so long to check in was an annoyance. I'm not sure if it was just an unusual thing for the hotel to have so many people checking in at that hour of the night or what, but every night that we passed the lobby, I'd always peek to see how long the lines were and they were never anything like the night we checked in (which was a Tuesday night). A positive thing though was that we were upgraded to a suite - without even asking for it (and no, we didn't even complain that we were waiting so long...we were too exhausted at that point and just wanted to get to our room). The view was nothing spectacular...not much of a view really, but the room was nice. It had a nice living room area, the bed was comfy and the bathroom was a great size -wish I could put one of them in my house!! Everything else about the hotel and the room was satisfactory. Once inside the room, you couldn't hear anything from outside or the hallways which was nice. We had room service for breakfast a couple of times which was ok. We'd definitely stay there again - especially if we're lucky enough to get comp rooms again!! The location of the hotel is great, right in the middle of the strip so you can walk in either direction and get to the other area hotels and casinos. We went up to the Eiffel Tower one night and enjoyed the view of the Fountains at Bellagio from up above.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but other options might be worth it”
Reviews.Author: sjcan8119
Reviews.Content: This is a great location and a fun place to be in the middle of the strip. If you can get one of the rooms, like we had with the view of the fountain show, then it is definately worth a shot. The casino and public areas are fun with the Paris theme. The rooms are a bit small and did not have alot of storage or areas for a stay of 5 days. There were some stains and etc on the carpet and the hotel seem to start to be running down

Reviews.Title: “Great room and great location”
Reviews.Author: jparker65
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris Hotel Las Vegas in January 2009 and found it great. The service was really good, the room was huge and clean with a great view of the Eiffel Tour, Bellagios and the strip. There's a wide selection of restaurants inside the casino and being in the middle of the strip it's within walking distance of all the other casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: tatuink
Reviews.Content: My wife and I go to Las Vegas every year. This was the first time we stayed at Paris and it certainly won't be our last. Clean quiet comfortable room. Superb resturants. Great location. Freindly helpful staff. I could go on and on. If you've never stayed here I highly recommend it. Can't think of one negative experience.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel; Best location on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: MMY86
Reviews.Content: Great experience at this hotel! We stayed Friday-Monday for my birthday weekend and had booked a room at no cost, but my husband upgraded to a superior room for $60 a night -- SO worth it! This room (more like a mini suite really) was attractive, spacious, clean, and the views were simply amazing! One window faced the Eiffel Tower, and the other faced the Bellagio where we watched the fountain/light show over and over all weekend - what a treat! :) This alone would have been worth the $60/night, but the upgrade also included access to a wonderful cafe on the 31st floor for both breakfast (8-11a) and cocktail hour/dinner (5-8p). We thought the food selection was great (even had pasta dishes at night) and we ended up eating every meal there because of the comfort and convenience! Flatscreen TV, USA Today newspapers, view of the Eiffel Tower - what more could you want? And when you think about how much you would spend at the very expensive restaurants throughout Vegas, this was a welcome (no-brainer!) alternative. The check-in was somewhat slow (long line upon arrival) but the checkout was quick and easy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vegas trip @ the Paris”
Reviews.Author: bryanelliot
Reviews.Content: Wife and I flew from JFK on Delta nonstop...no problems. Queue at Dollar RentACar was VERY long and slow...but we eventually got our car. Arrived at hotel on Monday afternoon around 2pm from airport via rental car for 4 nights. Used the free valet parking. Luggage was taken by bellhop and we were given a ticket and told to call the desk when we arrived in room. Check-in was smooth and quick...although by the time we had finished, there were about 10-15 parties waiting to check in. We had booked this trip thru a travel agent with a "standard" room...I "tipped" the very pleasant desk clerk $20 and politely asked for a complimentary upgrade...we ended up in an upgraded "red room" on the 28th floor with the 50" plasma and the ultralux kingsize bed. Luggage delivered to the room with no problem. Everything was very clean and new. Bathroom was excellent with good water pressure. Elevators were quick (there were express elevators to the 26th floor and up). I looked spa/gym...that was very nice-->but there is an upcharge to use it ($25/day or $65 for 3 days). It was too cool for the pool...but it looked fine. We did room service breakfast x 2 mornings...it's relatively reasonable when you stick to a continental breakfast "for one"...it was enough for two to start the day. There was a free coffee maker in the room and an "honor" bar-->we brought food/drinks into our room because of the outrageous prices. I think the little airline bottle of JackDaniels was $8 ...but a 375ml bottle in the hotel gift shop was $15. There are plenty of convenience stores/pharmacies in the neighborhood. Paris Hotel venues: We ate at Le Provençal...that was very good...and reasonably priced when you used the coupon. We did some serious drinking and carousing at Napoleon's (dueling piano bar)-->the drinks were wicked expensive...but we had coupons for that too!! La Creperie had good coffee and desserts. There was also an chocolate/ice cream shop right in the hotel. We went to the top of the Eiffel tower for the view...but the restaurant was VERY expensive so we skipped eating there. The more casual restaurants and the buffet at the Paris do NOT take reservations...and we did not care to wait on line to check them out. We also ate dinners at McCormick/Schmick's Seafood and Pinot Brassiere (at the Venetian). I burned some AmEx points to get gift certificates to these establishments. The meals/drinks were very good. We went down to Fremont St--I was not impressed. However, our cabdriver told us to get dinner @ Tony Roma's...they have a lobster/steak combo for $12 after 9pm...so that was a bargain. We did casual lunches (Food court @ NewYork NewYork was very good) in a variety of places. We did 2 day trips..one to Hoover Dam and one to Red Rocks Canyon. Both very nice and well worth the time. The valet takes about 10 minutes to bring your car up. If not for these day trips, you do not need a car...plenty of cabs, trams, and the monorail to take you around Vegas. Warning: Our first two cabdrivers took us on an "safari"...we learned to tell them to take a direct route. Paris location is PERFECT...right in the middle of the Strip across from the Bellagio. There is plenty of sleeze on the Strip--you have these guys in red tee shirts handing out the "business cards" of the hookers. I came back with a decent collection! We could walk to all of the major hotels...and each one looked great (with the exception of the run-down Strastosphere). MGM, Venetian, Bellagio, Luxor, Excalbur, Bally's, Mirage all looked great. Lots of stores with $5 teeshirts and $1 souveniers...so that was good! Gambling: We gambled a little bit. I got lucky at the roulette wheel for a while (I forget which casino)...but ended up losing about $100 for the whole trip. Shows: Barry Manilow-->Very good show...a true Las Vegas experience (Cher/Elton/Bette were dark during our stay). Expensive and pretty short (1.25 hrs). Cirque de Soleil: LOVE (Beatles theme) OUTSTANDING show. Try to sit in the middle tier...you will miss stuff if you are too close. Well worth the $$. Jubillee: Traditional (topless) Las Vegas showgirl show---worth seeing with the 2 for 1 tickets. We sat up front (table service) with a bunch of Asian guys...we had a blast. That was the night my blood alcohol level exceeded 0.15 (at least). So the bottom line: Paris was excellent. Most of the major hotels on the strip would be fine. Try the $20 front desk trick. Look for coupons...they are all over the place and when you use them wisely lyou can lower your costs without lowering your standards. We would not hestiate to stay at the Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Smokes for Smokes”
Reviews.Author: harser
Reviews.Content: If you like being around the bus crowd with beer and cigarettes, the Paris is for you. I was on a business trip with my wife and to summarize, I would refer my enemies to this hotel. Dark, smelly and lots of smokes at the casino. Disgusting. The rooms were like being in a best western.

Reviews.Title: “Great time/ Good value”
Reviews.Author: antsandi1
Reviews.Content: We have been going to las vegs for 20 years and Paris is now one of our favorite casinos to stay. From check-in to check-out we were treated like friends not customers and everyone made us feel very comfortable. Our only complaint was the drinks at the bar lounge were a little pricey but service there was great. we will be comming back to paris this fall for another vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Best 60th Birthday vacation ever! They treated us right!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sprtwareor
Reviews.Content: First visit to Paris; it was WONDERFUL! Big room; lots of space; loved the Parisian decor in the room. It was a fantastic trip! Great room with a view, and the employees rocked! They were SO nice and professional. We were impressed. Great restaurants; fresh roast Parisian coffee and fresh baguettes! Yum. Slots were generous enough to have fun for many hours; and drinks were generous. Room was romantic decor! Room was cleaned early each day, and we enjoyed the class act clientele--quiet and upper class. Will DEFINITELY keep this as our Number #1 pick for our Las Vegas vacations.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we returned to Paris”
Reviews.Author: Wolfgame
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at Paris. We really debated on staying at Encore or Wynn...one of the newer casinos and am glad we didn't.
