We really like the casino at Paris...open, high ceilings, well lit...and we really like the location. We upgraded rooms for $100 per night and had a really high floor and overlooked the Bellagio Fountains. The room had the new decor and was really nice. Gambling was good and drinks were served often and quickly....something we noticed had gone downhill in other casinos we visited. The only downside to Paris is that I wish they had more options for dining. Highly recommend Paris, Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: minimeg714
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled that we chose to stay at Paris during our trip to Las Vegas. We went to Vegas with friends who stayed at Stratosphere and they were so far from the other hotels on the Strip. We were halfway between Mandalay Bay and the Wynn, which made walking between all of the hotels much easier. Paris is one of the most distinctive of the hotels on the Strip and has a unique feel when you walk into the casino...it does feel like you're walking down a street in Paris with all the boutiques and cafes. Before our trip I had read other reviews about the hotel rooms and was not expecting much; the room was better than I had anticipated and was kept very clean by the staff. We requested a room overlooking the Bellagio but the upgrade would have been an additional $65 per night. We decided not to upgrade because there is so much to see in Las Vegas that we knew we wouldn't be spending much time in the room. We got to see the fountains at the Bellagio several times; the best show was from the top of the Eiffel Tower at night! Our first night in Las Vegas was Valentine's Day as well as my fiance's birthday. We had an amazing dinner at Les Artistes Steakhouse; the veal forestiere was the best veal I've ever had and my fiance loved the filet mignon. We definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone! Friends had recommended the buffet at Paris; we had dinner there one night and weren't impressed. The best part of it was the crepe station where they can make dessert crepes with fruit and chocolate. We tried the breakfast buffet on our last day there and that was much better. The omelette station was great and they still had the crepes available. One other thing we would have enjoyed on this trip was an indoor pool. The pool was outdoors and wasn't open during our stay. Our next trip to Vegas will be in the spring or the fall when the temperature is higher and we can spend an afternoon relaxing at the pool!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Pam010
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Paris LV in October 2008 and are already looking forward to going back, The purpose of our trip to Vegas was to get married and we decided on Paris LV for both our stay and wedding. The hotel is amazing, attention to detail is just spot on, the foyer was clean, the staff friendly and the feel of the hotel is just perfect. We were upgraded to a suite and the room was huge and very comfortable. Even the standard rooms are very comfortable. The hotel has a fantastic pool where you can swim under the Eiffel Tower which is just fantastic. Lit up at night the tower is amazing and definately worth a view, especially as you have to walk over a bridge and look down on the casino. There are shops full of gifts to remember the stay and the restaurants and cafes were reasonable and very nice. it really did feel as though you were outside when you were in. The hotel is very centrally located with easy access to the monorail which is highly recommend when travelling around. The wedding chapel and staff were amazing too so this really does get a thumbs up. It may not be as luxurious as the Wynn or Bellagio, but if you are looking for a good time, great location, reasonable cost and a more relaxed atmosphere you have to check out this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Paris”
Reviews.Author: mexpri
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was great. We were right in the middle of the strip. We can't wait to go back later this year. We had a great second honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Wow wow wow wow”
Reviews.Author: JustaHeadsUp
Reviews.Content: Must be the best hotel ever, OMG was it beautiful. I stayed at the Lemans Petite Suite. Very nice hotel great theme, best casion out there. It had the best customer service ever

Reviews.Title: “lack of security and customer service”
Reviews.Author: partroy27
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my annual family trip to Las Vegas. We usually stay at the Paris, but this year we had a terrible experience. We made arrangements through our casino host and the upgraded room they assigned us had a terrible view of the backs of buildings. My wife was robbed on the casino floor and security told us this happens so frequently they no longer report it to the local police. Lastly our host obtained tickets to a show for us and the seats were the worst in the theater. When we tried to contact our host he did not even return our phone calls.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the ambiance”
Reviews.Author: ILoveVegasALot
Reviews.Content: I just got back from staying four days at Paris and was very impressed. I have stayed at Imperial Palace, Treasure Island, Harrah's and Planet Hollywood - and think Paris was the best so far. The room was very comfortable, the beds and pillows very great. The atmosphere is very relaxed in the hotel, from the cobblestone walkway, the soaring ceilings the the casino area and the French music in the elevators, The room was very clean and the cleaning staff were friendly. If you go, eat at the Creperie - its inexpensive and very good.

Reviews.Title: “Keep coming back”
Reviews.Author: tripper040
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers the best value on the strip. I keep coming back to Paris everytime I go to Vegas. The hotel is very clean and the rooms are quite nice. This hotel is more geared towards couples vs. Guys weekend. Hint: Become a Total Rewards member, you will recieve great rate offers to come back. Better than anything you can find through the web.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms and wonderful ambience!”
Reviews.Author: tinaferns
Reviews.Content: We loved the rooms at Paris and its beautiful! The bathrooms are spacious and have lovely soaps and lotions. Its centrally located on the Strip. There is an extra charge if you want a room with the Eiffel tower view as well as for the internet.

Reviews.Title: “A Pricy Hotel if no discount is offered”
Reviews.Author: myohoren
Reviews.Content: My reservation was starting from Luxor, Excalibur, Harrah’s, Mirage, Pairs, Planet Hollywood and Caesar’s Palace. Before this trip I have spent tons of time on TripAdvisor and read different hotel review every time I changed the choice based on sale or discount offered at times. I really appreciated members’ feedback on a wide spectrum including restaurants, shopping & etc. I wish I could come up with a format to simplify the pros and cons. However, all the tips learned are worthy if you have time while planning your trip. I settled at Pairs for 4 nights ($90/night regular room) due to the 4th night was free but I WILL NOT return if no discount was offered. Here are pros and cons: Pros: It’s at a considerately convenient location close to Bellagio, Caesar’s Palace, & Planet Hollywood if you like shopping in addition to gambling. As many members stated before, you can inhale less second hand smoke in-and-out the hotel and self parking garage is within a reasonable walking distance from the rooms and navigation through the premise is fairly easy. Cons: The reservation is based on double occupancy and $15 for each additional guest even kids. You need to do the math to see if this makes sense to your group. I requested two interconnected double beds rooms at reservation but was told to call back when time gets closer. I did call one week prior to my first day of stay but still was told no guaranty. Finally at the check-in, the staff told me there is NO such room layout at the entire premise. All the interconnected rooms are one King size bed and another two double beds room. Apparently, many staffs were not aware of this either. Each room stay comes with one coupons booklet contains half of those are 2-For-1 drink and another half are Harrah’s own other properties but NONE of the coupons are for Pairs. I complained to the concierge and was given a $2 off coupon per person to the Tower. I later signed up Total Rewards card and was given a similar coupons booklet with one of them is “Buy one ticket; get one free” to the Tower. I can understand the marketing strategy but for four days stay with NO coupons at Paris really throws me off. By the way, save your trip to Flamingo and Harrah’s Buffet restaurants or you’ll be sorry. Housekeeping starts considerably early (around 7 am at 8th floor). I found broken pieces of glass on the hallway by 9:30 am and told one of the crew. She immediately went picking up large pieces by her hands; however, small pieces were still there by the midnight. That would be a big surprise for people coming back from pool bare-footed. There is a small refrigerator full of pricy beverage and snacks that you’ll be charged if you open the door beyond certain time without consuming anything inside. I personally felt that’s ill-minded design. One of the elevators from the lower levels has mal-functioning sensors that will close the doors regardless the loading is still in progress. We’re in there twice for the 4-day stay. Apparently, it was not considered a maintenance item. Neither theater nor night club inside for entertainment should be considered as a con for most people visit Vegas. Parents consider Vegas a family vacation should really give it a second thought for the younger children. Side note: I have no affiliation with them but a trip to Tkx4Tonight is a must. In addition to show tickets, they also have discounted restaurants vouchers. They close at 8 pm which I missed twice. Once you purchased the tickets from them, remember going to the box office as early as you can to secure better seating, especially during a peak tourist season.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CandyCane71
Reviews.Content: Paris Hotel & Casino exceeded my expectations. The room was beautiful, clean, and couldn't have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Great ambiance and location”
Reviews.Author: SeattleTrvler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in July. While it was hot outside, we did manage to visit all the major hotels during our trip and this was by far the best. The ambiance is immediate as you walk in, and the lobby is gorgeous. Our room was immaculate and the staff did a great job. It would have been even better if there had been a frig in the room. Upon checkout, I saw included in the bill was an item from the in-room bar and once I brought to their attention that we didn't partake...didn't even open the door, it was removed from the bill. While they have a fitness center, access for a day is extremely expensive (about $23/day).

Reviews.Title: “Great buffet, and plenty of walking to burn off the calories”
Reviews.Author: thehankster
Reviews.Content: We self-parked in the parking garage and had a heck of a time making the trek to the front desk with suitcases and laptops in tow. It's Vegas, after all, and like pretty much everything in Vegas, Paris is gargantuan -- and kind of a pain in the neck because of it. Anyway, after the monumental journey to check in, another similarly grueling hike up to the room. Once there, though, we were surrounded by peace, quiet and tasteful, understated luxury. We had a great view of the strip (one of my colleagues was not so lucky, though, so don't expect all rooms to have a great view). The bathroom was gorgeous and the shower water pressure great. Go out of the room, though, and you really have to do some walking just to get out of the hotel -- does anybody else miss places like the Boardwalk that were reasonably sized and easy to get in and out of? The walking was good, though, because you have to pay extra to use the fitness center. My girlfriend spent the $25/day fee, but I didn't think it was worth it. You also have to pay extra for the internet ($13, I think), and I'm sure there are plenty of other amenities that aren't included in the room rate. I personally can't stand the extra fees at places like Paris, a hotel which, after all, isn't exactly cheap. But again, it's Vegas, and they want you to be gambling, not working out or checking your e-mail. We really loved the buffet, and I thought it was reasonably priced (about $25 per person, as I recall). A great selection and one of the few buffets I've visited where there were just too many choices for me to be able to sample everything I wanted to try.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Vegas Escape”
Reviews.Author: Wanksta
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend and I spent 5 nights at Paris Las Vegas over SuperBowl weekend. (Go Steelers!). A lovely hotel, with nice shops and good, not overly expensive restaurants. My favorite part was that the pool and hot tubs were open in Jan/Feb. I was disappointed, though, that the rooms did not have a coffee maker, refrigerator, or actual closets(although the armoires did the job). Also, it seemed that our shower took a very long time for the water to get hot, and the beds a wee bit uncomfortable. Service was fantastic, although in the morning, the cocktail waitresses are hard to find and a bit slow, yet very pleasant, friendly and helpful. (E.G. directions and info about the city). One hint, I read above that you must pay for a fridge for personal use, but it is not that difficult to squeeze your leftovers and own bottled drinks inside the minibar. A good choice, located in a central spot on the strip. Be sure to eat at the sidewalk cafe Mon Ami Gabi, for a truly French experience. We enjoyed ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Paris, a grand place!”
Reviews.Author: Vermont95
Reviews.Content: Booked a luxury room, knew that it was not the upgraded or view room, but was happy with it, especially the marble bathroom! The 2 queen beds were very comfortable, there was an armoire (no closet) and a medium sized tv, a bit older decor. I was on the 9th floor facing the mountains and airport, however, just about even with the top of the parking garage. For the short time we looked out the window, that was fine, watching the planes take off and seeing the lights in the distance. Was there with friends, no need for romantic view, so this worked out. Lots of elevators make getting to the lobby and casino quick and easy. Check in was fast, but of course the upgrade was offered for $50 a night, which I decided against. Again, if it was a special occasion, I would have considered looking out to the fountains and the Eiffel Tower. The bathroom was fantastic, large tub and separate glass shower, marble counter top, pretty spacious! Downstairs, the casino is beautiful with blue sky ceiling and one leg of the Eiffel Tower jutting into the area. The restaurants are great, we ate 3 times at LeVillage Buffet for breakfast, well worth the $14.95 and sometimes a wait. LeBurger Brasserie (located in the connecting hallway to Bally's) was excellent, try the turkey burgers! The cafes are nice, and we enjoyed sitting outside looking across to the fountains. You can also run next door to Planet Hollywood to PFChangs for their famous lettuce wraps and a nice entree for a good price. Perfect setting center of the strip, lovely amenities and restaurants, think about the Paris for your next trip. They have new, updated rooms, rooms with views, and suites as well. In my opinion, it has lots to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Paris!”
Reviews.Author: cathy0516
Reviews.Content: Great stay at the Paris!! We loved our room, quiet, nicely furnished with a super view of the Arc de Trumph and Vegas. Tried several of the Restuarants there, Mon Ami, Le Provencal and JJ Boulangiere ( they have the best cranberry bread and olive breads ) and enjoyed them all. The street scenes and atmosphere made me feel like I had escaped..... to Paris, not quite but indeed a less expensive pleasant version of it. The Cirque de Soliel, Love show is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “In the midle of Strip”
Reviews.Author: LVEH
Reviews.Content: We love the hotel!!!! VERY well located, very fancy and romantic! We ask an extra night and they gave us a nice price! The bathroom is very large and the room very confortable. Don t miss the Eiffell Tower. Don t miss the very parisien bistro Mon ami Gabi !! Delighytfull!! You can see the Bellagio water concert eating a very french steak and fries.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel Room - Travleing with a Platinum Member is Awesome”
Reviews.Author: mmoran27
Reviews.Content: My mother, who is a Harrah's Platinum Member (yes!) got us the room for free and we went into special lines all week. The reason this is important is becuse it colors my review somewhat. Would I have knocked it to a 3 if we'd been in lines all week? Anyway, the room was a basic hotel room. Very clean, but nothing special. The good: I liked the huge window overlooking the strip. The sheets were nice and the beds comfortable. The staff seemed pleasant. The bad: I did not like the old-school tvs - no flat screens. The bizarre: There are no closets. The location: Fabulous. The safety problems: We moved to a handicapped room (my mother used a scooter) and the bathroom floor, when wet, becomes a skating rink. Did no one consider that someone with mobility problems to start, should not be on a frictionless floor? Also, the makeup mirror is about 5 ft off the ground - in a handicapped accessible room. The restaurants: Cafe Ile St. Louis - Terrible. Want to be rushed out like you're at Friendly's, but pay $80 for a meal for 3? This is your place! They come by, take your entire order (drink, appetizer, meal, etc.) in one shot. Runners bring you your food. Then you don't see your server again until the check comes. The food was mediocre. Le Burger Brassiere - This is an example of fast, but in a good way. Our server was constanly asking if we needed anything, then she'd get it for us in about 4 seconds. Maybe 5 seconds if she was really busy. It was a little pricey ($11 burger plus $3 for fries), but the food was good so I was happy. Mon Ami Gabi - Totally worth the splurge. Service was unbelievable. If you make reservations ahead of time you'll probably get a great table. Steaks were out of this world. I got the Steak Roquefort - if you like Roquefort (similar to Gorgonzola or a block of Bleu Cheese), you will love this. Definitely get steak - the fish, I'm told, was only so-so. So... do I recommend this hotel? Depends on the deal you can get. At $100/night you're going to feel like you got your money's worth. At $200/night you're going to be walking around wondering where they hid the closet and flat screen tv.

Reviews.Title: “No Healthy Option”
Reviews.Author: Carmel32
Reviews.Content: Booked Paris Las Vegas for the Superbowl. Of course, staying in Las Vegas one has a tendency to over eat and drink. That's why I like to start the day in the gym. Just a quick walk on the treadmill and catch some news. At this hotel it costs an extra $25. I can get a free gym by staying at a Hampton. Why not here? Forget the minibar...let's get a healthier option.

Reviews.Title: “FantabPARIS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jocoarm
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Vegas and the Paris Las Vegas was awesome! After strolling through most all the other hotels on the strip, I must say the Paris Las Vegas was tops! Our room was wonderful - not much traffic in hallways going to rooms - elevators quick and the accomodations were superb! Location of Paris is also a big factor as it is right in the center of the strip. The resaturants in the hotel were fabu and the decor was divine. When we return to Vegas there is no doubt that this is where we will stay!! Louisville KY

Reviews.Title: “Loved Paris”
Reviews.Author: laphamma
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to Vegas in the last 18 months. Previously we stayed at Flamingo and Ballys. Paris was by far the best hotel of the three. We stayed in a "Red Premier" room. The view was fantastic. Right out the window was the Eifel Tower with the Belagio fountains behind it. Mon Ami and Eifel Tower restaurants have fantastic food with great views. The video poker schedules are pretty tight but not unlike other Strip properties. The service was excellent. I can't comment on price since everything was comped. I am loyal to Harrahs and will certainly be staying at Paris on my next trip. A+++

Reviews.Title: “Get rid of the Time Shares Sales People, Please!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: chuckg2
Reviews.Content: We used our Harrahs Total Rewards card and were able to stay at the Hotel Jan. 26th thru Jan. 28th for $37.00 per night. so even if we had any problems, we couldn't complain. We were given room 2693, on the 26th floor, but any view was blocked by the Bally's Hotel next door, and the back side of the other wing of the Paris Hotel. The room was average size, any may have been recently remodeled. The room was extremely clean, brightly painted, had a very comfortable bed, and a wide-screen TV. Check-in to the Hotel was fast and well organized, and the clerk who took care of us was very friendly and courteous, as were all the hotel staff we encountered. The casino and the restaurants in the hotel never seemed crowded (probably due to the problems with the economy) with the exception of the little counter where there was always a line of people waiting to buy crepes. (The dessert crepes were excellent). A previous reviewer complained about to many "old" people staying at the hotel. We disagree, but if so, that could be the reason there aren't a lot of small kids running around and getting in everyones way at a place they shouldn't even be at anyway. We gave this hotel a 5-star rating last year, and we're giving it a 5-star rating this time. We highly recommend this hotel for a great vacation. Now if they would only get rid of the Time-share sales people that accost you every time you enter the hotel from the parking garage. If you try to ignore them, they now grab your arm to get you to stop and listen to them. I consider that an assault, and the Hotel needs to evict them.

Reviews.Title: “Fit our needs”
Reviews.Author: mcamel1
Reviews.Content: I had 5 nights comp'd for this hotel so I cannot comment on the price. For free, obviously this hotel was great. It's location was directly in the middle of the Strip. The room was average but it was nice to have a shower stall and a separate bath tub. We had a tube tv which I haven't seen in years! The one complaint I had with the hotel was that my friends and I felt like the youngest guests in the hotel (we are in our mid-20s). Overall, I would stay here again and recommend it to people that consider location and average amenities important when picking a hotel on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “love going there over and over”
Reviews.Author: carafid
Reviews.Content: I have been to the Paris several times and love it there. It has the best location in the middle of the strip. Yes, there are nicer places but the floor is a good size and you don't feel overwhelmed. I get comped there and continue to use the hotel. The slots are great.

Reviews.Title: “Don't feel safe in your room”
Reviews.Author: colcayl
Reviews.Content: My husband took us and 2 other couples paid for their rooms, did $700 worth of upgrades for all 3 rooms. We went to bed and woke up to find our room door propped open with a towel and someone?? had taken my husbands wallet with $2500 and all our id, credit cards WHILE WE WERE ASLEEP IN BED...my purse was in the hallway and the hotel did NOTHING to help us, NOTHING at all..They left us hanging..sent my husband on a wild goose chase trying to find a police station which were all closed...Didn't offer us anything knowing this was obviously an inside job. The next morning my sister had one of the staff come to her door at five in the morning bringing a tray of coffee and muffins saying they ordered it and we figure they were just testing to see if anyone was in the room...LOCK EVERYTHING UP!!! Her room was next door to ours....There are no cameras in hallways to protect the guests. Absoulutely did NOTHING to help us feel better, didn't offer a different room NOTHING

Reviews.Title: “Paris-One word---Perfect!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ChefBrian
Reviews.Content: My freinds and I stayed at the Paris on Nov. 14 -18 in 2008 to have a 40th Birthday Bash for me and 4 other freinds. The staff went out of there way to make it a time we will always remember! We stayed in suite 2900. It was beautiful and very large with two full baths and a great sitting room. The food was perfect and always fresh and hot! I have stayed at alot of different Las Vegas hotel and by far the Paris is the best!!!! Thank for a time of my life!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Dooley4556
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Paris for a friend's wedding Dec. 5-7. We Loved it! We have been to Vegas before, so we knew what to expect. When we checked in we were asked if we wanted to upgrade to a strip view, and a refurbished room...we agreed. I believe it was $65 a night extra, but I can't remember. it was worth it though, we loved our view of the Bellagio fountains! If you upgrade you also get free continental breakfast buffet and snacks in the evenings. And two free drinks per person per day. My friend, as I said, was married at the Paris. They had a wonderful staff that made her wedding day very special. I was impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: strobes83
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying my wife and I have traveled to quite alot of locations and we like to stay at nice places, but at the same time do not expect world class accomaditions where everything has to be perfect to the tee. In saying that we were both pleasently surprised at our stay at Paris. i had read a lot of the reviews on this site and was a little nervous on our way there.... Check in was done about 2:30pm on a Monday, there was a line but more check ins were opened so we maybe waited 10 minutes. We were offered the upgrades and what each one included and decided to go with the extra $65 a night for a room with a view, we were given a larger room with a king bed on the 22nd floor overlooking the pool, Eiffel Tower, and Ballagio fountains. The upgrade also included access to the lounge for drinks and continental breakfast. The one issue i found was that the lounge was on the 31st floor so to access it we had to take the elavator to the main floor and then take the elevators to the 31st floor, a minor inconvenience but one that we lived with. The room itself was very nice, tastefully decorated and was always clean when we arrived after maid service. The Bathroom was fantastic, the separate shower from the soaking tub was a great thing and my wife found the soaking tube very relaxing. The beds themselves were very comfortable, the pillows were on the fluffier side which was OK. The room itself was very quiet and we heard very little to no noise from the halls at all. We tried the buffet one morning but had just missed breakfast but for the $17 price it was excellent, with a lot of variety and very tasty foods. The crepes were fantastic. We also ate at Mon Ami Gabi for dinner one night and had a table on the patio with views of the fountains. The steaks were incredible, very tender and cooked to perfection. The apple and pear crumble for dessert was the icing on the cake. Overall i would highly recommend this hotel, my wife and I, as well as the couple we went with both had fantastic stays. I have stayed at the Excalibur, The MGM Grand, and New York New York, and Paris is easily at the top of the list.

Reviews.Title: “rude staff”
Reviews.Author: lebyvr
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the hotel Jan 6th,after booking two weeks in advance using their website. we arrived at 3 pm, I showed the customer service representative my email of confirmation , she looked at it and said , impossible , u cant have this room for 195 $ it's 295 minimum , i said , i booked it using ur website, so u better fix it if it's giving wrong rates . she was like "whatever !"I am gonna give it to u this time but next time NOWAY. i felt so embarrased as if i dit soemthing wrong . I asked her how much is internt , she said "its not for free " i asked , how much , she was like" around 15 $ . and asked to help the next customer ... extremely rude maybe she had a bad day butall in all , sooo rude i wrote to the hotel but no reply the room was nice , huge tv , awesome view I will not stay there again , I d rather stay at the other end of the strip, excalibur or new york , they are friendly .

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Camipoo
Reviews.Content: The Paris hotel was beautiful. The standard room was a pretty good size. The casino was also very large and the slots are on the loose side. It seemed like there were a lot of french people there...I would think they would want to stay at the New York hotel! I loved the restaurant Le Artists and Mon Ami Gabi. I found Le Burger to be too greasy for my taste. The cafe was open really late, but there was no service, which is a pity really because the food was so good there. They have some unique jewelry, shoe and clothing shops. I would definately stay at this hotel again when I go to Las Vegas. PS: do not order room service. the food was cold and it came 3 hours after I ordered.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected - quite disappointing”
Reviews.Author: EmptyNestersVA
Reviews.Content: I wish I could write a wonderful review for Paris in Las Vegas but it was not anything like I expected. I visited Las Vegas with a family gathering a few years ago and had the opportunity to walk through Paris and had dinner there one evening. It was lovely and I thought it would make a great vacation spot for my husband and I after our children were grown. Well, the children are now grown so we decided to celebrate New Year’s Eve at Paris in Las Vegas. We expected mostly adults, maybe younger or older, but adults. What we discovered is that it must be marketed a bit different outside of the US because there were people from all over the world – nice - with their small children - not nice! The children were not so much in the casino areas but they were EVERYWHERE else! Babies in strollers, toddlers, young children, adolescents, and teens, most not understanding English. Then on New Year’s Eve, some well-meaning planner came up with the bright idea to close the main street on the strip but not let people walk freely up and down Las Vegas Blvd. So you could not walk from one side of the road to the other. Then to make matters worse, they fenced off the strip hotels leaving only small access gates for thousands of people to pass through. Plenty of drinking with single serve pitchers of beer for $15, an Eiffel Tower of daiquiri for $19, and other similar drunk fest drinks and still small children all around the area. Minutes after midnight as my husband and I were making our way back to Paris after unsuccessfully seeking out the non-existent fireworks that we were told we could see from the front of the hotel, we found ourselves pushed and shoved and I ended up being a shield for two small children with their parents trying to get to Paris. A security guard finally opened another section of the fencing to let them in and fortunately I was able to pass through as well before they closed it off again. My husband and I mentioned the incident to 2 other Paris security employees that just stood and watched the action and nodded that it was an unfortunate situation but offered no solution to prevent further problems. It was sad and our entire New Year’s evening was quite disappointing. Our observation is that Paris in Las Vegas wants to have it all and they are missing doing anything exceptional. Let the kids go to Orlando and let Las Vegas serve adults. Or if they want the young families, build a Disney Paris near Las Vegas. But for God’s sake separate the drinking and gambling from the kid activities! It is bad for the kids and it is bad for the adults that are trying to enjoy an adult vacation without children.

Reviews.Title: “Their Motto is 'upgrade' !!”
Reviews.Author: greatexpectations076
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris from Dec 22 until check-out on Dec 27. We planned a holiday stay to accomodate one of our children's work schedule (performer at Bally's, had to work over Christmas). We chose Paris primarily because of its location, especially in terms of proximity to Ballys. My review is based on my comparative experiences of similar hotels/resorts across the US. I made reservations for our family getaway back in September and after revewing prices and options on the website decided to call the Paris reservation agent number for some assistance. I requested and reserved 2 connecting rooms, newly renovated, with a view. I was sent an email confirmation of my reservation, outlining my request. My BIG MISTAKE was in not printing a copy of the email confirmation to bring with me. Upon check-in we were surprised to be told that I had booked 2 standard rooms, with no view, and that was what I was going to get unless...(drum roll)...I wanted to UPGRADE! When I told the desk agent that I felt misled by the reservation process she became hostile and said they could pull the original telephone call to see what the agent told me. That's fine, but she said it in a manner that implied that I was lying and trying to get a deal that I hadn't reserved. We had a lunch reservation we didn't want to miss and asked her to please check the details and we would be back after lunch. The second agent was more helpful, but extremely condescending. We got the same song, second verse, with the accusation that we must have made our reservation through a wholesaler. The call was pulled and the agent told us in a curt tone that our request would be granted, EXCEPT they had no rooms available that met my orignal request! Then she tried to convince us to take the 2 standard rooms with a view of the back. Guess what? We ended up having to UPGRADE to a suite with a connecting room, for an additional $135/night. Due to the nature of the holiday and our desire to have a nice family time, we agreed. The suite was quite large and supposedly refurbished, but lacking in some details you would expect in a suite. The mini-fridge in the bar wasn't working and obviously hadn't been for months. We requested a new one and it was promptly delivered. It was ancient, like the first one and wobbled so badly we had to hold it steady when opening. After a few days it didn't work very well either. (Why refurbish the room and not include a new $100 refrigerator?). The TV's and internet connections worked off and on throughout our stay and we had to call tech support and maintenance several times for repair. Suites usually include bathrobes, but not at Paris apparently. We had a lovely view and lots of space, but it was the most ho-hum suite I ever stayed in, especially since I UPGRADED under duress. We ate at the Mon Ami Gabi restaurant several times on this trip and like all other visits it was fabulous. The hotel was packed and the line at the buffet was so long we never bothered eating there. My biggest complaint with Paris is that I felt like I was duped by the reservation process and that desk agents operate like sales staff at health clubs; they are expected to get guests to upgrade and use a list of unpleasant behaviors to make that happen. I wouldn't be surprised to find that they are getting a commission for every upgrade they sell. My family has traveled extensively and we've rarely had desk agents with worse attitudes. I wouldn't stay there again unless I was willing to take the cheapest room with the worst view and call it a day. Document all your reservation plans and bring them with you -- and good luck!!

Reviews.Title: “Third time this year at the Paris”
Reviews.Author: nefariousvegas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have spent a week in early December in Vegas as a Christmas present to ourselves for the past few years. We have stayed at many of the resorts on the strip. Last year, we splurged and stayed at Bellagio. This year, because of my previous two trips within 2008 to Paris, I was comped almost the entire week. Our final bill was just about $200 for 7 days. I find Paris to be just what we need for a fun Vegas adventure. I LOVE the location -- right in middle of the action, front and center on the strip. A nice walk down to MGM, NY NY, Bellagio, Caesar's, Ballys and Flamingo within a 5 minute walk, and a nice walk up to Venetian, Wynn, TI and MIrage. I think the location is the #1 reason why I kept going back to Paris, along with the great room rates. The rooms are nice. Yes, they have an upgrade sheet at the Front Desk that tells you how much and for what sort of upgrade. I also get an email about a week before arrival with an upgrade opportunity. We always pass the upgrades, figuring we aren't in the room but to sleep and would rather spend the money saved on gaming or eating out at a nice restaurant. This time, we had a nice non-renovated room on the 7th floor. Our view was of the rooftop and parking garage, but that was ok -- we didn't expect a view. The room was just like the one we had in September and in April, and was in good shape for a non-renovated one. Our room was way on the other end of the corridor from the elevators, so it was very quiet in our little corner of the world. We played a lot in Paris, but found that we did better and had a bit more fun over at the connected Ballys. Since it was below average temperature wise when we were there, it was nice that Ballys is connected to Paris -- no outside walking in the cold and rain. I love the gaming atmosphere of both properties and we did pretty well both on the slots as well as the table games. We had the Paris breakfast buffet almost every morning we were there. For $14.95, it is a good deal and good food. I love the eggs benedict. They also have a cook to order egg station and cook to order crepe station. We ate a sensible breakfast, trying not to stuff ourselves, and found we weren't hungry until dinner. Don't forget to show your Total Rewards card when you pay for breakfast, you can earn points by eating as well as playing! One evening, we ate at Mon Ami Gabi. We requested, and received, a table out on the terrace underneath the heated poles. We had a fantastic view of the Bellagio Fountains, which made the dinner even more special. The meal itself was out of this world. One of the best dining experiences I've had in Vegas. Very nice! And the price was within reason for Vegas standards. We also ate a few nights at the Bellagio Buffet -- I would recommend that as well. I can't wait to go back and already planning a trip for April with a girlfriend. Since I will probably get comped again and with the awesome location, it is a safe bet we'll end up at Paris again! If I had to make one constructive criticism -- the pillows were not that comfy...but the king-sized bed had a swarm of pillows and after a night or two, my husband and I had found the pillows that were right for us! Oh, and I find that out of all the mega resorts on the strip, the Paris self-parking garage is actually more convenient than most. The garage itself is a little weird in terms of layout, but we never had any trouble finding a suitable parking spot.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great experience”
Reviews.Author: chaliekwok
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Treasure Island from Dec 10-12, and then at Paris from Dec 13-15. We would rate Treasure Island better for location and comfort. The beds were squeeky and not comfortable at Paris, but they had a great line of lotions, creams and conditioners. Difficult to find everything coming in from the parking lot. Wake up call system not user friendly and has no confirmation program/notification. And in room safe did not work. Close to Planet Hollywood and Miracle Mile. Far from centre of the strip (Venetian, etc.).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel public areas - have to pay for room upgrade”
Reviews.Author: MSfreespirit
Reviews.Content: I was invited to a slot tournment at Imperial Palace with 2 nights free stay. Decided I wanted to stay at Paris Las Vegas. One can stay at any Harrah's hotel when invited to a tournment. I chose to stay 4 nights and was given a reduced room rate for the extra two nights. Advised that this was my first stay at Paris and requested by telephone and email a hotel room with a good view. Upon checking in the front desk clerk was not friendly, and since previously twice requested a view room, I did not ask again. I was given a room on the lowest floor (4th) with a view of the adjacent roof. I tried to convince myself that it didn't really matter, and did not contact front desk for an upgrade. From reading previous reviews I would have been asked to pay more. Honestly, I don't know about you, but the view does matter and interfers with one's overall enjoyment of the hotel. Nevertheless, the casino and public areas are lovely with charming atmosphere and ambiance.. The excellent city of Paris decor is well done and enjoyed by the visitor. The staff at the round bar on the right was very friendly and accommodating, as was the staff at Mon Ami Gabe. I really enjoyed that delightful restaurant. The menu offered an array of choices with reasonable prices, PLUS, a very good view of the Bellagio Fountains. I'm not a "buffet" person, so cannot review. The casino slot machines are very tight, some old with faded numbers.. Not the place to gamble. Paris Las Vegas has a subdued quiet atmosphere compared to some other Harrah's properties--nothing wrong with that depending. I don't know if I will stay there again. Perhaps if I was assured a room with a view..

Reviews.Title: “Liked it, did not love it”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoResa
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at the Paris from December 1-5th, 2008, and I was excited to find a great rate on the Harrah's website. We paid a little over $95 a night for a Monday night through Friday morning stay. We arrived at the hotel early, and had no problems checking in and being allowed to go straight to the room (even though "official" check in is not until 3 p.m.). We were offerred an upgrade for an extra $60 per night (which we did not take) and the employee at check in started to push it with a sales pitch. We still did not take the room and he seemed offended that we didn't. Overall, our luxury room was nice. It had all the necessities, and a lovely view of the roof. I thought the beds were quite comfortable. The bathroom had both a tub and seperate shower (a nice touch). The room was very quiet, and seemed removed from the hussle and bussle of Vegas, which was right outside. One of the best things about the hotel is that you did not have to walk through the middle of the casino to get to the room elevators or to the reception area from the main doors. There were also a large variety of places to eat within the hotel (including a great chocolate shop, a good creperie, and a nice bakery). Bally's was a comfortable walk and also had several places to eat (the portions at the Sidewalk Cafe there were enormous!). The free shuttle to the RIo also stops right outside. Food was a bit on the pricey side, but this is Vegas. I thought the Crepes were reasonable and the cafe and bakery were not bad. My mom and I starting splitting meals, which was not a problem with most places and provided more than enough for both of us to eat. My only complaint was that we were there during a very large conference, and I felt that I was constantly getting run over while walking in the hotel. The theming in the hotel is awesome, and it is true to Europe in the summer: small pathways and lots of people makes terrible gridlock! Also, there are timeshare salespeople hanging out in the middle of the most crowded throughway, and they made it worse! Overall, I would come back to the Paris again for a good price. It is probably not worth the non discounted rack rate that they charge, but the theming, food variety, and location make it a solid overall choice. I would highly suggest sitting on the patio at Mon Ami Gabi at night and watching the Bellagio fountains while eating one of their incredible desserts!

Reviews.Title: “Expected More”
Reviews.Author: doloresandjeff
Reviews.Content: Arrived 12/7 for 5 night stay. Asked if we wanted to upgrade and when we declined, were given what we were told was an upgrade. 30th Floor - overlooking the arch with view of construction of city center. Room was remodeled but I was not impressed with the size of the room. Everything was fine until we wanted to shower - no hot water. Were told to run tub, shower and faucet at full force. Took 20 minutes and I felt terrible about all the water running down the drains. Finally got warm enough (but not hot). When hubby went to shave - same problem. We were told that because of low occupancy, rooms at end of hallways has trouble with hot water (we were in 3024). After 2 nights of this nonsense we asked to move to a room with hot water. We were changed to 3030 which was on the back side of the hotel where I enjoyed watching the planes. This was also supposed to be a renovated room but the chipped chocolate paint and terrible caulking job made me think of a Motel 6. Flat pillows, holes in the sheets, face cloths made of cotton and polyester (which were dingy white) and the mattresses all left me wondering why this hotel was rated as 4 star. The buffet was good, the atmosphere in the gaming area was nice, and housekeeping staff accomodating. It seems many hotels have renovated to the modernistic, asian type decor. I didn't like it and felt it wasn't a good fit with the theme of the hotel. While the large flat screen TV was nice, the room was taken up by the combination entertainment center, closet, dresser combination. Will we go back - no. There are nicer places in Las Vegas with hot water and nice bedding and linens.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful for your smoking grandmother”
Reviews.Author: towniemel
Reviews.Content: Paris would not have been my first choice, as I don't love the whole "fake Europe" thing, but we stayed here to be near the quiwedding party and because we got a great rate online ($440 for 4 nights, taxes included.) Our room was fine, but not great. For our cheap rate we got one of the older rooms, with a view of a parking garage. ( We had to re-check in when our departing flight had problems. The desk clerk took pity on us and gave us an older room, but with an Eiffle Tower, strip and pool view for only $90/night. Fabulous. Pay extra money for this view if you have to. We left the curtains open the whole time to take it all in.) There are newer, updated rooms that are more chic, and less "shabby Versailles" which is what I would call ours. If you look on their website, the featured room is one of their updated ones (a friend of ours stayed in one, very nice.) Our beds were comfortable, the bathroom was large with a nice, glassed-in shower. The toiletries were not really up-to-snuff for a hotel that promotes itself as 4-star. The worst thing about our room is that after the second day, it got a "dirty diaper" smell ( not the good view room.) We didn't complain as we we thought it might have come from some leftovers we brought in (though we realized later it didn't) and we didn't notice it after being in the room for a little while. So, we didn't give the hotel the option to make it right. The casino was so smoky that we didn't spend much time in it. I have spent time in several of the casinos on the strip. MGM Grand and Bellagio in particular do a great job of filtering out the smoky smell. Not Paris. Me and my non-smoking friends got scratchy throats and burning eyes if we spent too much time in this casino. The food options in the hotel are really quite good. Mon Ami Gabi, with it's heated patio facing the Bellagio fountains, is a nice place to eat in the evening, and you can hear the music from the fountains, so it is really fun and festive. The food is good, too. Not spectacular, but definitely worth the price. The 24-hour cafe served up great fish and chips, and burgers with fries late night. The pastry shops have really nice bread, and I got a wonderful prosciuto crepe at the creperie one morning for breakfast. There are also some nice shops in the fake European village that takes you through the back and into Bally's (another horribly smoky casino.) Although we did have a nice stay here, it is not really suited for people looking for a hip, happening vibe. Every time we came back to the hotel, we commented on returning to the "grandma" place. (Sorry to you hip grandmas out there, I know you exist!!!) I won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Try another Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lisa0022
Reviews.Content: Went to The Paris Dec 1-8, 2008. Made my reservations about 5 months before directly with the Paris by phone. Was unsure where to stay, talked to a very nice lady who gave me a good rate ($75) & told me, since I had never been to Vegas, she would give me a high floor with a view of the Bellagio Fountains. Of course, the front desk people are not too nice or accomidating and gave us a room on the 4th floor with a view of a roof top. When I asked for a different room, they said I could upgrade for for a nice view for an extra $65/night. Also I have a Harrahs card from Atlantic City. For $119 dollars a night, minus 10% for AAA, I could have stayed much cheaper at the beautiful Venetian Hotel, in a mini suite, with a pool view. Do this. All staff, but the front desk were nice. Needless to say, we hardly played at the casino there - play at NY, NY - really a cool place. I feel like I was cheated at the Paris

Reviews.Title: “Oui, Oui Paris”
Reviews.Author: travelcricket
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Paris Casino Hotel in Las Vegas on a Thursday, for a long weekend stay. I have gone to the Paris for shows and to play in the casinos, but this was my first time staying in the hotel itself. I know that they have done a lot of new renovations to most of the rooms in the Paris. The rooms are spacious with modern decor. I loved the flat screen tv in the room. Having traveled to France and Europe before, I have to say that when you are in Paris Hotel, you think you are really in France. You have to do the Eiffel Tower at Paris. It is so nice. I enjoyed eating at one of the best buffets ever, "Le Village Buffet" in Paris. It is about $25 p/p and worth every bit of the money. The dessert station is decadent and the service is top notch. The french cuisine is so good. You must also try the crepe station!! I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone. The hotel sits in the center of the "Las Vegas Strip" and are close to everything. If you want to go to Rio (another Harrah's property) there is a free shuttle from Paris that will take you there. Once you get to Rio you can take another free shuttle to Bally's and Harrah's. Paris is right next door to the new Miracle Mile shops and Planet Hollywood (the old Aladdin hotel and casino). You are near Caesar's too and the Forum Shops. I love LV. Check out the Fashion Show Mall as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: LoveDiningOutChgo
Reviews.Content: Thursday-Monday Vegas run; Check-in was especially quick, even on a busy weekend (DeLaHoya fight/Rodeo); Utilized my Harrahs entertainment card and was in and out of check-in in no time; They placed us in a fantastic newly redone room and it had the most amazing Strip view with the Eiffel Tower and the Bellagio Fountain show (this view was incredible, and I am not easily impressed). The room had a seperate shower/tub, huge lcd and hipper decor, that was nicer, yet still warm. After check-in, we went to a nice little cafe in the corridor leading from Paris to Ballys where we both had good quality and very generous portion sandwiches (lox & roast beef); Following this, we hit the Paris gaming hall, where the cocktail servers were super impressive in terms of efficient offerings and the gaming areas are well spaced. Friday morning was a run down to the book, where the older gentlemen working there were personable, but the younger guys had indifferent attitudes; Breakfast was at Paris' buffet (they have awesome java and desserts), where we enjoyed a good meal and drink service was impressive (special note: If you game at a Harrahs location, sign up for a free card, as it will enhance your entry shall you reach a higher level); Following this, we headed to the MGM via the monorail to pickup our fight tix (Re: the monorail, if you will use a few times, get the 3 day pass, well worth it). We gamed at MGM and their drink service was slow and it was extremely smoky and really hot in there. We left there and headed back to our hotel to game and take a rest before getting ready for a evening dinner at the Eiffel Tower restaurant. When arriving at the restaurant at our reserved time, we were met by smiling personnel who were also professional in demeanor; We did not know that we were to be in for a truly signature meal at this romantic place; Our seating was overlooking the fountain show, which is a marvel in itself and the service and food, particularly the filet/crab and bleu cheese pudding soufflet appetizer, were just dynamite (special note, if you drink vino, the bottles are on the pricey side). This meal was a gem; If you enjoy fine dining, this is a MUST-DO and is not simply a restaurant based on the vanity of the Tower experience, which is really cool in itself; Following this, we gamed on the main floor and headed to Ballys (conveniently located through a connecting tunnel with shoppes/restaurants) where we had a fun time listening to a fun, versatile band in the Indigo lounge (free, so-so waitress speed, though they were spread thin) and let me just say that the people watching was second to none. You name it (demographic), we seen it, in a fun way! We closed them down and walked through the walkway, past our favorite novelty slots and headed to our room. The next morning, after hitting the sports book for a minute, we returned to the Paris buffet and enjoyed mimosas and great service. We had just went to Bellagio to view the beautiful Christmas displays and peek in at the boutiques (where there were sales galore); Following breakfast/lunch, we gamed and got ready for the fight, where Oscar subsequently got beat and quit. We did get to see a scumbag wannabe gangster rapper at the MGM try to instigate a fight with a much older man after the fight, who was classy and ignored the thug. We took the monorail back to Paris and gamed yet again, where my girl celebrated her Pacquaio winnings (1st book bet ever for her!). After gaming and more speedy beverage service, we called it a night. Sunday led us to field trip to Harrahs on the monorail where we walked over to Venetian for a lunch and were told there was no buffet there, so we went to Wynn, where we waited an hour (would never do for food again), yet had a high quality assortment of food to choose from and have to say, it made the wait worth the time...thankfully! We enjoyed the walk out of the Wynn, as there is some great mosaic tile to view amongst the gardens etc... We went back to Paris, and hit the Ballys gaming floor where the return was generous and the atmosphere was old-school fun Vegas, and I would say everyone should play here at least once. After a fulfilling night, we slept a couple hours, did quick check out (dropping keycards in a box right outside the elevator) and jumped on a plane where it is recommended to fly out early, especially if on a sun/mon, as the airport becomes a zoo quickly. The personnel there were efficient and personable. Overall, the trip was a pleasure and Paris contributed quite heavily to that! We both were happy and will definitely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Hotel alright but clearly can’t handle crowds”
Reviews.Author: Sild_og_Snaps
Reviews.Content: Spent the last weekend in November at the Paris Las Vegas. Unfortunately didn’t realise it was US thanksgiving. Clearly the hotel has neither the staff or amenities to handle a near capacity hotel. Line ups for all restaurants, all the time. Took fifteen minutes just to get a coffee at the Boulangerie. (The servers in Paris, France had more personality than those that worked at the Boulangerie!) There were no comps nor freebies to be had here. I had to really look for a waitress on the casino floor. When I finally found a waitress to order a drink, she started grilling me about whether I was gambling or not. I mentioned that I had to stop gambling in order to find someone to order a drink from. When she finally returned, I was in between machines and she wasn’t going to give me a beverage because she wasn’t allowed to serve drinks to those NOT gambling. (FYI – this wasn’t an issue at the other Harrah’s properties we went to). I’ve never seen so many old machines. Most of the machines I played on had faded dials! Go to Bally’s – better machines, better people. The Harrah’s rewards club was pretty lame too despite the $5 food coupon I got for signing up. I gambled for 3 days and only earned $1. Nice. Ultimately we spent most of our time outside of the Paris Las Vegas because we couldn’t get near anything within the hotel without a 2 hour wait. Nice enough hotel but I won’t be back. One good tip I got from a cab driver – If you’re staying at any hotels on the Paris side of the strip, ask the taxi driver to take Paradise. It could save you about $10.

Reviews.Title: “Falling in love all over again!”
Reviews.Author: kajames19
Reviews.Content: oh my, oh my, oh my!!!! Can you say oooohhhhhh.......la.....la!!!! I fell in love all over again with my husband at the Paris Hotel. Not only was it a beautiful artistic environment, it was a replica of the real thing, down to the Eifel Tower and I fell in love with my husband all over again. The facility was clean and fun and romantic. I love how all of the signage is in French (a french minor in college), and even the furniture was French antique. Our room was upgraded unbeknownst to us, b/c my husband requested a king size bed and b/c he can not live without a king size bed (b/c he IS my king)! I will return, quickly, and will make certain to stay at this location. Of all of the places I've been in Vegas, this one captivated my heart!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paris very unique!!”
Reviews.Author: coach_lynn
Reviews.Content: I really loved staying at the Paris! I stayed with my best friend, we are in our early 20's and had a great time! Good location, right in the middle of the strip, close to everything. Rooms were not super new, but still nicely kept. Bathroom was gorgeous. The inside of the hotel was decorated really nicely, and was a fun feeling! The pool was also very nice, had both shade and sun. I would stay at Paris again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Escape to Paris”
Reviews.Author: Twins1977
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent Thanksgiving weekend at the Paris Hotel. It actually was our anniversery and we were imppressed with the room we received. I read the reviews and didn't quite know what was getting in for. We checked in late Monday night and I had my choice of receptionists to choose from. My rooms were comped but I was immediately offered upgrades for as musc as $100 a night. I calmly tried the $20 trick and asked the gentlemen what he could do for me. I was given a nice room with all my requests met, (King bed, no smoking, safe, refinished room, & a coffee pot.) As most of you know you don't spend much time in your room anyway but we were well satisfied. We go to Vegas 3 to 4 times a year and we usually stay at Harrahs. This was our first time at Paris. We will probably return to Harrahs because we like to do our gambling around Harrahs & Imperial Palace but I will not rule out staying at Paris again. One other thing, we purchased tickets throught the Tickets-4-Tonight stand at Bills Casino for the KA show at MGM. We used a credit card to purchase them. I tell you this because after we were all sitting down the show was cancelled. They told us our refund would automaically be put back on our card. Luckily I stoped by the Ticket stand the next day and they told me I had to do it there to get the refund. I would have left for home and probably would have been out of the money.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not brilliant”
Reviews.Author: TwoOxontravellers
Reviews.Content: Getting into the Paris is difficult. Directions to the self-park garage are non-existent until you get to the sign on The Strip (there is a back way but we couldn't find it). Once you are in the self-park garage it is a long trek to the lobby with bad sign posting, cobbles over which to lug cases, multiple level changes and very crowded through the shopping area. Having checked in you then have to retrace your steps to the elevators. Not a stress free way to start your stay. Don't forget you have to repeat this in reverse on the way out after check-out. The room is fine - if a bit over ornate. there is a separate shower cubicle in the bathroom which is very convenient. The bed is not as comfortable as the TI where we had stayed at the start of our vacation 2 weeks earlier. The buffet is great. We managed to avoid the queues/lines. We particularly recommend the blueberry crepe which is freshly made in front of you. We went up the replica Eiffel Tower. Again the signs to find the entrance are difficult and we had to ask. The views from the top are terrific - both ways down the strip and of the Bellagio fountains. We managed to get in (unplanned) on the day rates right at the end, before the higher evening rate. This meant we had the night time views at daytime rates, as there is no limit to length of stay. Beware - it is crowded and there was a wait to get in the elevator to get down.

Reviews.Title: “another enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: FP4BMO
Reviews.Content: This is the 5th time we have stayed at Paris, we come down every year, take in a show, do some shopping. We traditionally come the week prior to Thanksgiving in a effort to catch some pre-sale sales. We arrived at 1:00pm for check in, had to wait a few minutes, no big deal. Had requested a king/nsmking room but they had no record of this for our reservation. As others have mentioned, there are fees and surcharges for any deviation from the standard room. Want a renovated room add $40/nght instead of offering some goodwill and providing the guest with the best available room. The 3 nights we stayed there we had no complaints, the Paris room we had this time was the same as before and the same the time before that, clean, quiet, in good repair, made up daily. There is no real wow factor but there is also no concern over what to expect, consistent time after time. We ate at Mon Ami for lunch the first day, our room was not quite ready. We both had salads, nothing special but the patio area is nice to be able to people watch. We would go next door to the Miracle Mile shops and grab a bottle of wine at ABC and chill it in the room, this is the way to go. We got back to the room late one night and instead got two glasses of wine from the piano bar, $14 each, it was not that good. Check out was expected, do it through the TV and you are off and on your way. We will be staying there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Room Hassle - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: janevada
Reviews.Content: Arrival Aggravation Arrived Saturday, Nov. 22nd - Stayed 6 days. Booked over a month in advance - requested King Bed, Smoking Room near elevators. Was given double beds, no smoking for 1st night. And then moved to a smoking room the next day. So, on a Saturday night I couldn’t unpack and ended up sleeping in my room - your loss Paris. Sunday I was busy moving and unpacking - so didn’t bet on football games - your loss Paris. I lost a day of my vacation. I was offered a smoking suite for 1st night at an additional $235/night. My husband is a Harrah’s Platinum Level Player. Rooms 1st night room with double beds was cramped. Bed skirt was so wrinkled that I sprayed some of my Downy wrinkle releaser on it. Room given 2nd day was better. Comfortable chair and French styled bench loveseat. Same room they show on web site. View was of a half concrete wall which was probably put there to block the spotlights on the ugly roof below. Could have had room with a view for $60/night. Amenities? No coffee maker, no refrigerator. Called & informed no coffee makers unless you are on floors 6 & 7 or floors 12 and above. My recovering broken toes were not going to hobble at 6 a.m. downstairs for coffee. ½ mile down the Strip is a Walgreens - my hubby picked up a coffeemaker for $10. We brought our own Starbucks from home. There is NO Starbucks at Paris or Bally’s. I also brought along a fold flat insulated cooler. Mini Bar is huge and you cannot store anything in it or you will be plagued by the mini bar lady or charged. Big note on supplies - Next door at Miracle Mile Shops is a store called ABC. Very reasonably priced soda, liquor, beer, coffee - you name it. Food Small Food places such as Creperie, Pastry shop & JJ’s - expect $10 per sandwich or crepe - very tasty & Big. Le Burger Brasserie was great. If you are a sports fan, the main TV screen is HUGE. You can get a burger for about $10 & up but they are BIG. Buffet - disappointing - $25 for dinner of dried out food under a heat lamp. Their little quiches are enough to turn you off of quiche for a lifetime. Eiffel Tower restaurant - want to save money? Go there for lunch - very good food. Room service was OK for breakfast but the hash browns were horrible. Food next door --- Paris is connected to Bally’s - There’s a walk up Deli sandwich place called “The Nosh” $3. for breakfast sandwich, $7. for lunchtime sub which was so big I could only eat half for a meal. Good thing I brought that cooler. Other side of Paris is Planet Hollywood and Miracle Mile shops - they have a Trader Vic’s outdoors where you can see the Bellagio fountains. Happy hour is 3 till 6 pm. $5 baskets of chicken wings and calamari. 2 for 1 well drinks. Get a map at Miracle Mile & there’s a coupon for 2 for 1 Mai Tai’s at Trader Vic’s. Food other places this trip. There’s a Mexican Restaurant at Luxor that is fantastic - best Margarita I have ever had & water glass size. We also went to Batista’s Hole in the Wall behind Bill’s Gambling Hall on Flamingo that was old style Italian, lots of fun with plenty of wine and classic old accordion player that was a hoot. Casino Slots were tight at Paris - I heard there were 2 Royal Flushes hit the 1st night I was there after a long previous dry spell. Had better luck at Bally’s. Gustav’s video poker bar was typical video poker bar. Le Caberet was better. Female bartenders - Tiffany & ??? were fun and gave fantastic service. The music at Le Caberet was great - the band was called Odyssey. They also have Dueling Pianos at a club called Napoleon that has a cigar area. Sports book bar is a joke. They have TV screens around the perimeter of the bar up at the ceiling. I think it would take a day to un-crink your neck if you watched a game there. Shows - we checked out the Price is Right stage show at Bally’s - FUN. This past March we saw Bette Midler at Ceasar’s which was fantastic. Transportation Shuttle from Paris will take you to Rio (have stayed at Rio at least 10 times - 650 ft. open room suites). Rio has shuttles to Ceasar’s, Harrah’s & Paris. We took Presidential Limo from airport because Vegas’s new method of renting cars stinks. However, on the way back to the airport, the limo driver dropped us off 5 exits from our airline. I wrote them about it upon my return - no answer as of yet. Big shout out to Trans Air Airlines - 1st time flyer with them. Upgrade to Business Class is $99. Free Cocktails and comfy seats. If you’re going to do cocktails - drinks are $6 in coach - so figure how many cocktails you want and the price reduces! Ha Ha. On my 4 hour flight out to Vegas, I was able to reduce my price pretty well. They also have Satellite radio on board for free for all passengers - Nice! The Stews were awesome. Miscellaneous My MAJOR advice to anyone who stays at one of the 6 Harrah’s owned hotels in Vegas on a regular basis is to get the Harrah’s Total Rewards Visa Card. Every Dollar you spend gets you a bonus point on your players card. We pay for regular living expenses through our card and end up with lots of Total Rewards points to cash in. Then in Vegas, charge everything to your room and then apply your points to your bill before you leave. We lived very well for 6 days and everything we charged to our room was paid for by our points. (over $450). In addition, our rooms were comp’d for 5 days because of my husband’s platinum level playing. I really do like the ambience of Paris’s Casino & Restaurant & shopping area. Old European cobble stone streets and walls that look like you are in a Paris Village. The location is great, right in the middle of it all and walk able (if your toes haven’t been broken recently!) I’ve been going to Vegas for 30 years & I know I’ll go back again. But be aware Vegas people - we Trip Advisors are watching you! And we watch and tell!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Enough but Money Grubbers”
Reviews.Author: jlzick
Reviews.Content: We checked in the Sunday before Thanksgiving for 5 days. Check-in went smoothly - - less than 5 minutes. At the time of the reservation I requested a standard, non-smoking, renovated room. At the time of check-in, we were told it would be an additional $40/night for a renovated room. We turned this down. The room we got was quite comfortable although did show some wear. Definitely nothing fancy and wouldn't have been fancy at the time of opening in 1998, but it was clean. We found the mattresses to be hard even though my husband and I have a firm mattress at home. The bathroom has a separate tub from the shower and it's nothing special. There is a blow dryer and typical amenities such as shower gel, shampoo and conditioner. Be prepared to pay for anything you move in the in-room refrigerator. We didn't get sucked in but have read about it in the other reviews of this property. EVERYTHING is very expensive - - not just at Paris but all over Vegas, especially on the strip. We ate at the LeCreperie 3 mornings. A crepe is $9 and that is all you get is the crepe with whatever filling you choose. Your drink costs extra (minimum $3). The breakfast buffet is $15. The buffet line was very long every time we passed by it at various hours. We did not eat at the buffet so cannot comment. We ate at LeCafe for 2 evening meals and although the food was above average, it is VERY expensive. Beware that bottled water is a minimum of $3 ($4 for a large) everywhere on the strip unless you go to a CVS or Walgreens. The same size water downtown is 2/$1.00. No kidding! We say head downtown even if you stay on the strip. We did the $5/day (24-hour period) Deuce (bus) on and off privileges and found it very accommodating. We had the best prime rib meal we've ever had at Magnolia's at the Four Queens (downtown). Prime rib, potatoe, vegetables, dinner salad and rolls for $7.99. You won't regret it. Excellent! Four Queens also gives you a deck of playing cards for signing up for their player's club. Over at Binion's, you get a free Vegas photograph of yourself and/or spouse, a deck of playing cards and it's easy to win a t-shirt. I think I played less than $20. Also, the Plaza is easy to win a t-shirt for playing little. There is nothing for free (even if you gamble) on the strip. In my opinion, Vegas is going in the wrong direction. There is no money to be won and there are NO freebies like it used to be even 5 years ago, let alone 20 years ago when we went for the first time. Also, there is no need to take dress-up clothes because you will look out of place. Everyone is in jeans or sweatpants - - even at the high end places. As for shows: We saw Jubilee at Bally's and it is quite the production of old-time Vegas. Well worth the time and money (if you use the 2 for 1 coupon you receive upon check-in). We also saw Mystere at Treasure Island and it was fabulous, if you can afford it. Actually the best value for your money is to be entertained by the shows in Vegas and forget the gambling because you won't get anything in return. We didn't see anyone win any significant money - - $5, $25, maybe $100. Plan on losing anything you gamble and plan on spending a lot of money to be fed. Have fun and enjoy!!!!!! Feel free to e-mail me at [--] if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “what a place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sjduf
Reviews.Content: Felt obliged to write this review as i found other reviews most helpful whilst planning my trip.Travelled from manchester airport on a direct flight with bmi on 23rd november staying for four nights at the paris hotel.The flight went pretty quickly considering it was 101/2 hours,asked about an upgrade to premium but were put off by the £200 price tag per person one way.Had a nose when we got on the plane and personally dont think its worth the money.Had seat back t.v with a choice of 11 movies in economy which helped to pass the time. Arrived at the paris about 2pm after a 5 minute cab ride from the airport(15$)and asked about upgrading at check in to a renovated room(well if you dont ask you dont get).Had read other reviews about the 20$ tip but we were quoted 60$ per night and decided to take a look at the standard room.Our room was located on the fifth floor room 349 and we were pleasantly surprised with what we found.Although not the greatest view in the world the room was clean and tidy with a fab bathroom.The tv had a few news channels,weather channel,vh1 music and if u.s football is your thing(im a big fan)you can catch the game on c.b.s or espn.Didnt touch the mini bar having read other reviews! The casino in the paris is certainly one of the smallest on the strip which we didnt mind one bit although we tended to walk through to ballys(connected to the paris)most days, we seemed to have more luck there.Didnt eat in the paris at all but the buffet always seemed quite busy(discounts at tix 4 tonight on the strip)and most of the other restaurants(eiffel tower and mon ami)were very pricey.The paris is all about the location which is the best on the strip by far. Restaurants- P.F.CHANGS Located in the planet hollywood hotel you simply cannot afford to miss this place.The best chinese food i have ever tasted,great service and great value(100$ for the four of us!!).If chinese is your thing you must try this place. CHINA STAR BUFFET Stay away is all i can say.This place is the pits, walked out after five mins after discovering the entire buffet was stone cold and looked days old.Should of realised as we were the only ones in there! PLANET HOLLYWOOD Located in the forum shops at ceasars palace.Mediocre and a bit pricey.Wouldnt put you off but wouldnt reccomend either. MIRACLE MILE SHOPS We ate in a small italian restaurant located opposite the v theatre inside the miracle mile shops at planet hollywood.The pasta here was great and this place is well worth a visit. We ate our breakfast most mornings in mcdonalds for convenience(why cant we get hotcakes in the uk)and one day we ate lunch at panda express which was fab. SHOWS/TRIPS- PAPILLON HELICOPTERS Had been reviewing the grand canyon helicopter tours for weeks before we left and this company had some bad reviews.We booked our tour on the strip when we got there and paid 334$ per person to go on the sapphire skies trip.Picked up on time by limo we arrived at the airport and to my horror discovered we were flying with papillon(had booked with grand canyon helicopter tours).Had nothing to worry about the whole experience from start to finish was unbelievable.Were originally going to book to land in the canyon but discovered if you dont you get more time in the air(1 1/2 hours).This is a once in a lifetime experience and i fully recommend the sapphire skies trip. STEVE WYRICK-REAL MAGIC Couldnt decide which show to see but on the strip there are five tix 4 tonight booths were you can buy show tickets at half price on the day(hence i wouldnt book any shows before you go).Were planning to see lance burton(no half price tickets)originally but decided to save $40 each and see the steve wyrick show which was a mistake in hindsight.The theatre wasnt even half full(holds 500)which wasnt a good sign and although it wasnt too bad i would pay the extra next time and see lance burton. EIFFEL TOWER My girlfriend had this on her to do list but unfortunately it never got crossed off.Due to inclement weather they closed the eiffel tower for the last two days of our stay and we never got a chance.so dont put this off get up there while the sun is shining. Overall my first las vegas experience was fantastic and i cant wait to go back.Although i would stay in the paris again i would probably choose planet hollywood next time as it is still a great location(right next door)but a bit more modern.If money is no object and you want the best the wynn and the palazzo were out of this world but not in the best location.

Reviews.Title: “Waiter tried to rip us off. Expensive upgrades.”
Reviews.Author: Whispery
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Paris for 3 Nights comped for poker tourney last week 17-20th. I have stayed here a few times now. The room was great as usual, always nice comfy beds & clean with huge bathroom & separate shower. Had low floor with pool view as it was $80 a nite to upgrade to strip view & even more to get higher up.. Sad since it’s the SAME ROOM basically. We had to change rooms once as she gave us nonsmoking after asking me 3 times what we wanted. Room service was nice & fast but expensive. We did not touch anything in the spenda-bar as there was no price list. Ate at the café right outside the elevators twice, the food is always good there. On one of the meals when we got our bill when checking out we had used a $10 comp & the waiter gave himself a $10 tip on top of the $5 I gave him. It took a lot of arguing to fix a $15 tip for a $18 meal??? Finally she took it off my bill after screwing around for 20 min. Wouldn’t comp anything else though for the trouble or anything. After gambling over 2k between Harrahs properties you think I could have gotten a $60 food bill comped. Also had to fight with the rewards people because SOMEHOW 5K of my points keeps disappearing. Thought we had it straight but still not fixed. This actually started last year. The casino was cheap once again because of G2E I think, as I was there again today & was actually winning. Overall the place was nice & I love staying there but I think for the hassles, not caring if their employee tried to rip me off & cheapness of comping room charges etc I will end up skipping Paris from now on. ONE thing we did get to see the WINE arrive by Helicopter on our last nite for the celebration. WE got there just before it landed. That was interesting to see.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Eiffel tower restaurant, don't go for the pool”
Reviews.Author: lbmoriarty
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris Nov 17 - 20, 2008. I don't know where the idea of tipping the front desk clerk $20 for an upgrade comes from. They have published rates that they keep behind the counter if you want to upgrade.
