I got a good price on a consolidator website, but the upgrade to a view room is $65 per night and if you want one of the remodeled rooms you'll pay $100 per night more. We did this and had a great view of the Bellagio fountains. The standard room was small for the money, regular sized bath tub was disappointing, separate shower was nice. The food selection in the multiple restaurants was great and the Eiffel Tower Restaurant dinner experience was pricey but worth it. Go early, get a window table overlooking the fountains. The pool is heated but definately not warm (every guest who ventured in within earshot commented on the temp). Sterile surroundings, all concrete with little privacy landscaping. The Nov days were unseasonably warm (high 70's) and they only had one side of the pool open. The lone "lifeguard" yelled from her perch at anyone who dared to go in the other side having not seen the small posted sign that that side of the pool was closed. The pool restaurant was closed even though there were more than 100 guests at the pool and the bar was closed intermittently because the bartender "had to take a break". It makes sense to limit offerings when they are not in demand. But for the price guests were paying they should have found a way to staff the pool and f&b outlets. I would go back for the location on the strip and the view of the fountains. Not the best pool experience in Vegas though.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, quiet comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Toonces
Reviews.Content: My husband, mother-in-law, and I spent four nights at the Paris last week for my husband's professional meeting. The location is in one of the nicest areas of the strip with Bellagio and Caesar's Palace across the street. We received a $50/night decrease in mom's room rate by using her Harrah's Total Rewards number when making the website reservations. I think the meeting paid $164/night for our room. The professional check-in staff was able to assign us adjoining standard rooms on the 16th floor (1668 and 1670), a non-smoking floor. We were offered rooms on the newly remodeled floors for $40/night extra, but declined and were glad we did. The rooms we had were lovely, with tasteful French decor, not new, but not worn, and had nice fabrics. One a king, the other two queens (that's how all the adjoining rooms are), spacious, room safe, mini-bar, very comfortable beds, exceptionally clean, no odors, no noise from other rooms, and a pretty bathroom with new marble-tile shower and separate tub. Had a regular tv as opposed to flat screen in the remodeled rooms, but that didn't matter to us. Maid service was unobtrusive. Room service (two breakfasts) was quick and the food good. Seems like a well run hotel. Our only complaint was the loud two booms every 30 minutes from the water show of the Bellagio across the street...I wouldn't have wanted to be in the wing of the hotel closer to the Bellagio (imagine the music accompanying the show would have been annoying). The models of the Arc di Triomph and Eiffel Tower are impressive, and beautifully lit at night. They are 2/3 and 1/2, respectively, the scale of the originals. The Versailles Hall of Mirrors decor in the check in area was also beautiful. The French theme is well done in the shopping mall and restaurants, tho' the continuous French music is a bit much at times. All the staff in the cafes and shops were patient and friendly. We ate early dinners twice at Mon Ami Gabi, the sidewalk cafe, but chose the lovely inside seating because of the traffic noise on Las Vegas Blvd. Good atmosphere (linen tablecloths and candlelight), great wait staff, and the shrimp cocktails, crab cake, and fish and chips were excellent. Dinner with wine came to about $120 without tip for the three of us (would have been more except that mom-in-law only ate salads). Avoid the Le Village Buffet restaurant; ate there twice for lunch: much of the food was cold and tasteless, or else over-spiced, and it was noisy and hectic. The casino was pretty with the three-story sky painted ceiling and outdoor cafes lining it. Cigarette smoke was faintly detectable, much better ventilation than previous trips years ago to Vegas, tho' our eyes were slightly reddened the entire trip. The casino and entire hotel were clean; after a trip to the seedy Riviera to see La Cage, we appreciated the Paris even more. Mom spent a good bit of time on the machines and got excited when she won $120 on a penny machine...it made quite a bit of noise and took a long time to ring up 12,000 pennies, which thrilled her. The convention center rooms were beautiful, elegant, like Versailles, and well run (good audio-visual dept). My husband didn't like the charge for the business center use, came to $50 for five sessions. Spent one afternoon at the lovely, spacious pool area. Weather was 75 degrees with low humidity; it was peaceful (no kids), and very good pina coladas. We would stay at the Paris again; they do a good job for the convention attendees and had a more professional clientele than some other hotels. Beware the taxi rip-offs of driving blocks out of the way to run up the fare; I posted on the forum site about this. It shouldn't cost more than $14 for the trip in from the airport. Hope this helps you.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: MCHCA
Reviews.Content: A friend from college and myself try to make a yearly trip to Las Vegas in the summer. We stay at a "medium" priced hotel (ex: Wynn and Bellagio being above, Excalibur and Tropicana being below - Treasure Island being equivalent to) and this August we stayed at Paris for the first time. We were totally pleased and I"m sure will be staying there next time. The room worked perfectly for us as we are two girls and we each had our own closet. Given they were small but we were only there for the weekend so it worked. The bathroom was beautiful as was the room and the pool scene was great. A great young crowd. We also really liked the location on the strip. The one downside was that there was always a line for pretty much every restaurant. BUT the Eiffel Tower experience (going to the top) was amazing, the Bellagio is right across the street so my suggestion is to do the tour of the tower at night so you can watch the Bellagio water show from up there. Truly amazing.

Reviews.Title: “not so pleased as i expected”
Reviews.Author: janneman10
Reviews.Content: payed a lot for a standard room, but the room was dated and had several problems on the outside the hotel still looks great on the inside ... we saw many many hotels on the strip who looked much better as paris next time no paris for us. breakfastbuffet is top, parking is top, the rest of the hotel is not my piece of cake it misses style

Reviews.Title: “Overall Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: NurseStan
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas for a work conference and got a great deal through Travelocity to stay at the Paris. Apparantly a lot of other people got this deal as well, we waited in line for 45 minutes to check-in! Finally got to the desk at 4 p.m. only to find out that our room wasn't ready! and to find out the pool was closed for the whole week we were there. We asked for an upgrade because of all the waiting and pool inconveniences but were declined. They offered the pool at Harrah's Casino connected next door. Our room was finally ready at 6 p.m. The room was just a standard room but it was a corner room so we had two large windows and a view of the bellagio water show, overall it was really nice. The bed could have been more comfortable. The food prices were kind of expensive in the hotel -water 4 bucks, which is a Vegas standard, walk a few blocks over to 7-11 and you'll get a better deal. We also signed up for the rewards card and got food coupons and discount at the gift shops. Kind of annoying to walk through the Paris hotel and through Harrah's casino to get to the pool but I can't complain about the 85 degree weather once at the pool. Remarkably there were enough chairs considering the shared pool, and I would recommend an IPOD or something while poolside, the music is hideous!

Reviews.Title: “Paris hotel great value!”
Reviews.Author: MeirToronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paris Las Vegas in September. It is great value for the money. Room was spacious-just short of mini-suite size. Pool area was great in that there was always plenty of room and lounge chairs available. Hotel was just the right size-no long wlaks to get to pool, restaurants etc. Plus the location on the strip can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, but it's just a hotel room when you get right down to it”
Reviews.Author: lindymae
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a King room. My company was paying for it, but I asked about an extra night and was quoted $200. Not sure what my company paid. It was all very antiquate, but nothing that made me gasp. I've stayed at upscale chains that felt about the same. I liked the separate tub and shower. The honor bar is computerized so don't even move the stuff around, you'll get charged. Housekeeping was very attentive and nice. We stayed in the north wing (1470) and ended up with a partial view of the Bellagio fountains, but mostly we looked out on the dirty roof tops of Bally's next door. The elevators were plentiful and quick. The general theme-ing of the hotel is fine, not over done, but kind of pointless once you get past the public areas. Something in my room made me sneeze a lot. Eventually we turned off the ventilation and it stopped. The little vents on the windows that let fresh air in are tricky, ask your bellman how to operate them. Nice location for Strip Strolling. Old-school Vegas is near by (that's what we like) at Ellis Island - straight out the back of the hotel on Kovel and Battises's Hole in the Wall - just across Flamingo from Bally's and Lawry's Prime Rib less than a mile down Flamingo. We also were able to walk to the Peppermill, although a somewhat long walk. It was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: NG_Travel
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has one of the best location on the strip...Prepare yourself to walk in Vegas especially if you want to go inside every casino...The room at the Paris was nice and clean,nothing to argue about...The concierge was not very helpfull and desperately needed a smile...Overall we enjoyed our stay...

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel for a Special Holiday!!!”
Reviews.Author: SharonBLondon
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weeks stay at the Paris, Las Vegas for my partners birthday and really enjoyed it! I was glad we chose the Paris as it was in the perfect strip location, central right opposite the Bellagio, and we found the hotel itself to be superb - very smart and well looked after! The check in (Thursday afternoon) was quick and easy, no queue and the staff friendly. We booked a standard room and we were on the 21st floor and found our room to be perfect - comfortable, clean, spacious and well tended to by our maids all week. The view wasnt great but why pay extra for that when you dont spend much time in the room anyway - there is too much else to do and see. The casino was large and we found the dealers to be friendly and talkative, the drinks ladies were good and seemed to come round quite regularly and we also had small wins on the slots in the Paris once or twice. A tip for the dealers if your winning and the drinks ladies when your drinks come is appreciated. Roulette tables at the Paris are mostly minimum $10 bets so if you dont want to gamble that much go to Bills round the corner which are $5. Breakfast buffet is good, long queues at the weekend but not so bad during the week. They change to lunch at 11am so try to get there before 10am to get a better selection. It is $16 - eat all you like. On the one morning we decided against the buffet we bought a croissant and a juice each in the Boulangerie but that came to $8 each which we thought quite expensive so opted back to the buffet after that. The Italian restaurant opposite the buffet is divine for dinner - lovely pasta dishes!!! Eating out in Vegas we thought was pretty expensive in general. Pool was large on the 3rd floor roof terrace and there were plenty of sunloungers and room to put them out and the hotel supply plenty of clean towels so no need to take your own pool towels. Eiffel Tower view from the pool is fab and we found it all to be clean and well kept. Things like snacks and water in the hotel and mini bar are very expensive so get them outside of the hotel when you can. The hotel is connected to Ballys via the shopping mall walkway and you can also get the monorail here if you wish to use it. Overall our stay at the Paris was fantastic and I would definately go back. I have deducted one star from the rating though as there was a $5 mini bar charge on our bill and we hadnt even opened the mini bar in our whole stay - I was going to query it at check out but the queue to check out was so long we checked out using the express kiosk and decided to just pay the mystery $5 charge!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Rooms, weird blue sky in Casino”
Reviews.Author: Kristangel
Reviews.Content: The Paris hotel was clean and comfortable but it was the blue sky of the casino that was very weird. Check in was quick and painless and the concierage friendly. You can even checkout through your tv in your room. Very easy to do. Restaurants were generally OK. The buffet for breakfast was friendly but the food was just passable. The Eiffel Tower restaurant was excellent with great views of the Strip. Expect line ups during breakfast and dinner periods and make reservations at the Eiffel if you're planning a visit. Warning: beware of the "information" booth as you walk from Paris to Bally's. We were tricked into going to a timeshare presentation with Wyndham vacations. We thought it was a real information booth but it turned out to be Wyndham promo reps. They said the presentation would take two hours, it took four. Do not go...no matter what they offer you, it's not worth it. I had a good vacation but I don't think I would stay in the Paris hotel again. Great location but Paris wasn't great enough for a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Going downhill fast... terrible service”
Reviews.Author: islandhopper72
Reviews.Content: Mom and I come to Vegas every year in November. This is my 9th time and each time, we try and stay somewhere different. In 2005, mom and I stayed at Paris and quite liked it. We decided to stay here again in 2008. What a difference a few years makes. Check in was slow, service NOT friendly, not one smile. Her whole attitude was disinterested, uncaring and made us feel like we were inconveniencing her. The room was fine, beds comfortable. We had to wait 3 times for blankets as all you get are sheets on the beds. When we got the blankets finally, they were stained badly. No apologies from the manager Nicole nor housekeeping. Management does not call back when they say they will. Le Notre has wonderful pastries but grouchy staff and we got hot water when we ordered our tea today, no tea bag came with it! So we paid for that for nothing. Dealers seem disgruntled and the machines were tight. The cleanliness of the hotel and overall look and feel is terrific. The staff could just benefit from some training - they need attitude adjustments! We all pay good money to stay here! Final bill was a bite too. Make sure if you do stay here you check it carefully. I doubt we will be back unless things shape up here.

Reviews.Title: “Great as always”
Reviews.Author: thecoronaqueen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 nights (We always book the last night even though we leave around 10 PM) Check-in at 10 pm was quick, but a "P" room was not available til the next day, which was fine by us. Picked up our keys the next day without a problem. I don't think it was a renovated room, but everything was satisfactory. Housekeeping was very good, but I must admit, the hand lotion left much to be desired, actually went to Walgreens to get a better one. The dry climate really affects our skin. I really like the separate bath & shower. Lots of room. The corner windows were nice - we had a view of the pool & the fountains. We are not pool people, but I did notice it always seemed quite crowded. Because the P rooms are at the VERY end of the hallway, there was no noise. Like many hotels, you must call housekeeping to get the bed linen changed, otherwise they just remake the bed. We tend to sit at the bar to play video poker, and we really liked Gustaves. Bartenders are very friendly & efficient - never waited long for a drink! Food choices are plentiful, from Mon Ami Gabi to the Creperie, or the great salad/sandwich place. Can't remember the name. All employees we came in contact with were pleasant, and they didn't use the fake French accent! The passageway to Bally's is very convenient, and the location just can't be beat. I would highly recommend this hotel, & we will stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “There are better hotels in Las Vegas...look around”
Reviews.Author: tobler2beone
Reviews.Content: I visited a friend that moved here 2 months ago and stayed at the Paris Hotel for 1 full week. We were able to check-in early - the room was ok - there was a hole on the wall that we immediately reported (we don't want to be held responsible for the damage). I was impressed at first but after walking the whole strip and seeing other hotels, I wish I would have made my reservation at the Venetian - which was brighter and had friendlier staff (the Paris Hotel is dark, expensive, congested). The one time that we had a Housekeeper clean our room, we had some issues - my friend lost his retainer which he left on top of the bathroom counter. We understand it was an accident (the housekeepers are the only staff that were friendly) - but the dissapointing part is how we were treated when we reported the problem. Not only did they blow us off, the Managers yelled at us on the phone, blamed us, and hung up on us --- very rude!!! People here DON'T CARE. We requested for a return call to resolve the problem but no one did. Don't bring back left over food - they charge $2.00 for each borrowed item (fork, spoon, knife, plate, glass, etc). The internet connection is bad and expensive. I wanted my stay to be great so I didn't mind spending the extra money but after this experience, I will NEVER stay here again - it's a good thing there are a lot of hotels to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Prime Location!”
Reviews.Author: Jozymouse
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Paris. We got a GREAT deal at $89/night through the hotel website. The room was beautiful and so was the bathroom with a nice bathtub, a glass shower and big counter spaces. It turned out to be our favorite hotel on the strip (theming wise) so we were really glad to be staying there! The $89/night rate was for a room with no view but it was fine for us. We went to a great place called TixforTonight (on the strip) and got vouchers for the Village Buffet at the Paris at a discounted price. The breakfast Buffet with the disocunt was at $9.99 per person instead of $14 (I beleive) and i'm NOT a buffet person but that breakfast buffet was OUT OF THIS WORD especially for $10 a person. The discount also applied to the lunch and dinner buffet but we didnt try those. Overall, the Paris is a GREAT hotel, in a prime central location on the strip and has beautiful theming. The rooms are really nice and we enjoyed every minute of it! We would stay there again if we got a great deal like we did this time!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: JupiterJoe
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Paris at the end of October. Have to say it is the best time of year to go to LV. Weather was outstanding. I go to the Paris twice a year and for this year here it is. Yes rooms are in need of renovation. Unless you want to pay extra for the few floors that have been renovated, it's just not worth the extra money. No': their is no coffee service in the rooms any more, to remedy that I traveled with a small coffee pot ,packed my coffee in plastic bags and my cup was ready in the morning. No big deal. Yes,. the buffet seems to be missing something but where are you going to get that kind of selection for that price. The lines were long every day, so the price must be right. Now I did not say perfect. The Italian restaurant accross the walkway was this time absolutely horrible. They must have changed hands or something it was bad. The only good part was the wonderful tennors that sang. They deserved thier tips and I'm sure they are not getting enough of them. Now on to the gambling in the casino, tight, tighter and winning at the slots is almost impossible. Paris and Ballys, you my as well take your money and throw it on the floor and leave. Everyone was complaining. They are not letting you leave with even a little bit. My husband and I had a car rental and headed to freemont street where we ended up having a ball. We won every night. We also were surprised with a wonderful restaurant in the Golden Nuget called the Grotto. The food, service, waiters were outstanding. We ate their 3 nights the food was that good. Also would not hesitate to stay at the Golden Nuget. It was the diamond of the district. The casino, restaurant, pool, aquarium and the warmth of the whole place was great. You also have all of those casinos at your feet without having to get back in the car. So the location of the Paris is still great I will say it's not what it was but take a look at some of the other casinos in that price range. You'll still pick the Paris and no matter it still has the bang for the buck. Here is hoping that they meaning the casinos realize that we travel their to gamble be treated like a king and queen and walk home with the feeling I want to go back. That feeling is only if I win the lottery . So Las Vegas, please wake up. The middle class is what built that town. We would like to come back and I know you want us. Right now you are feeling that pinch and it's the middle of the road vacationers that want to visit Bring us Back. Treat us better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: ahab345
Reviews.Content: WE stayed at the Paris for our 30th anniversary and they did a great job. I used the "20 dollar trick" to upgrade our room to a strip view with a plasma tv. The rooms were very clean. We had booked the lovers packaage which came with a complete breakfast in our rooms and a $75 credit at Le provencal restaurant. Although I thought the rooms were a little cramped, the view more than made up for it (Bellagio Fountains). I would only book the Hotel again for a special occasion, because of the cost, but we had no complaints

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but some staff training needed”
Reviews.Author: flydriver
Reviews.Content: We were booked into a double queen room at the Paris for 2 nights last week. When we checked in we were offered a deal on a suite at a charge which we accepted. However, when we went to the suite (which was lovely) there was only one bed and so nowhere for my daughter (adult) to sleep unless they brought up a roll up bed and so we had to go back to reception and ask for our original room. The room we had was recently renovated with a partial view over the Bellagio fountains which was great. Unfortunately, the pool was out of use, although we could have used the one at Ballys, but we couldn't be bothered to do that. Good location. We thought the Village Buffet was excellent. Excellent choice of food and of a really good standard. Our main problem was the minibar. We made the mistake of opening it and looking at what was available. We then found charges appearing on our account for items we had not taken. Apparently the bottles are on a sensor (no warning on fridge door) and if you move anything you are charged. We took this up with reception who said they would get housekeeping to check nothing had been removed and then remove charge. This didn't happen so we then spoke to a man call Devlin on reception who was extremely rude and unhelpful. Eventually we manage to get the charges taken off. The other staff were fine but some staff training definitely needed by this person!

Reviews.Title: “A super great hotel with great service!!”
Reviews.Author: MidWestBeachBum
Reviews.Content: I travel for quite a few conferences each year, and in October it was time to hit Vegas. The only negative thing that I have to say about the hotel is that I walked around for about 15 minutes after entering through the North doors to find the front check-in area. I would think that there would be better directions to that. The overall service, the room-service food and timing, staff friendliness, amenities in the hotel, the overall hotel design- everything was fantastic. Lots to do, lots to see... just great. Having the Eiffel Tower observation and restaurant was just icing on the cake. The bathroom was great- large and lavish- with a separate glassed in shower- and SUPER clean! It was impressive. Everything was brand new in the room or at least gave the illusion that it was. The room was very, very quiet... even by elevator doors- they've done a lot to ensure that when you want peace and quiet, you can get it. I ordered room service the last morning there before I left and it was up to my room within 20 minutes of when I ordered, which was just great! The food was wonderful and hot too. What I thought was just so neat was the roaming streets of "paris" on the ground floor with all sorts of shops and restaurants. It was a fun place to meet up with people to get away from the Casino atmosphere and they had some great food down there as well. No complaints about the Paris. I would definitely go back in a moment.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: karw
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with great price. Large room and bath however shower could use some mold/mildew treatment. About time also to do some upholstery cleaning on the chair. Easy check in other than the expected lines. Did not like however that housekeeping opened our door twice during our stay to ask if we wished to have turn down bed service. They did knock first but entered the room before we could even get to the door. Last visit to Vegas was 10 yrs ago and will not go again. It has gotten way too crowded, overpriced and families with kids which I can't believe. Vegas should have a no entry unless over 18 rule!!

Reviews.Title: “French, but not in a good way”
Reviews.Author: drbobPittsfield
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Paris, Las Vegas during a medical conference in late October of 2008. It had the expected casino frenzy along with the Disney-esque French theme which pervaded the property. My wife stayed with me for the weekend before the conference began, so the initial impression was for a pleasure trip. The stay then concluded in a more business traveler mode. The restaurants were very good; Ah Sin, their onsite Asian restaurant was outstanding. The pool was nice, but closed for most of the week for maintenance. They provided access to the pool at Bally's right next door which was easy to access without even going outside, which was very nice. My major complaint is that normal services that a traveler, especially a business traveler, relies on were an additional cost. The only exercise facilities provided were in the spa, and cost $25 per day to use. Internet service was $20 for 24 hours, with no options for briefer use nor a weekly discounted rate. This is outrageous. The only explanation that I can think of for such alienating treatment is that time spent online or on the treadmill is time away from the blackjack tables and slot machines.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Paris Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: lasierra20
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Paris Las Vegas October 20th-October 23rd 2008 for our honeymoon and it was fantastic. First of all the hotel has an excellent location on the strip, right smack in the middle. It is beautiful with the fountains outside, beautiful chandeliers and the cute french shops. We arrived early that morning before check out and they offered to hold our luggage until check in. However the front desk representative checked and found a suite available and offered it for our first night and we could switched the next day. Of course we took the suite even though it had a bad view the room itself was nice, large bathroom with a 2 person jacuzzi tub and 2 person shower. The next day we simply checked out at 11 am and they gave us a non- renovated room but this room had a view of the strip. We actually liked the second room better becasue it was an end room (1049P) with 2 walls of picture windows, a hallway entrance, a couch and 2 plush seats. The bathroom was nice and we liked the set-up of the room overall even though it wasn't renovated the room was still nice. The staff was extremely nice and very helpful, no complaints at all. We made friends with one of the door/bell man, hey Marcus! The buffet was excellent and the price was more reasonable than we expected. But if your are looking for a little more variety in restaraunts you should try Ballys which is connected. We ate breakfast at the Sidewalk Cafe and it was so good. The pancakes were awesome and the prices are great. As for Las Vegas, Loved it!!! It was our first time and we had the best time. We can't wait to get out there again!

Reviews.Title: “Paris LV - Very Good”
Reviews.Author: dudekarma
Reviews.Content: This was our first (and so far only) trip to Vegas. Paris was very good. The location of Paris is very handy - right across the road from the Bellagio Fountains and one buildng away from the Miracle Mile shops at Planet Hollywood. The self parking garage had plenty of spaces and our floor was quiet and good for catching up on sleep. The room's mini bar was pricey (even for a mini bar). The groundfloor shops were also expensive but the bakery/deli was still good value with good selection. The Pool was good but it cost $25 a day to use the fitness centre (not included in room price). The Eiffel Tower Restaurant was the highlight of our stay with great staff, atmosphere and of course cuisine.

Reviews.Title: “Expected Standard”
Reviews.Author: burrowsydney
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 2 nights during October for the purposes of access to the Grand Canyon. Relatives had stayed for 4 nights in the preceding month and recommended. The standard of the rooms was as expected i.e. above average. We weren't overlooking the strip however did have a partially obstructed view of the Bellagio fountain. I read in another report of the variance in the prices and standards at the eating places which we found to be accurate. On our first night the check in took quite a long time, it was around the 3pm however on the second there was a much shorter wait albeit it was around the same time or maybe a little later. Also in another review we read of the pressure pads in the mini - bar. We 'd experienced this in other hotels and yes we also find it irriating there is no where to keep milk or food cold. We did the usual things, looked at a few of the other hotels, Bellagio, Ceasars Palce and the Venetian. We'd been to Las Vegas 20 years ago and how the place had gotten so much bigger and still growing. Neither of us have an interest in gambling nor are we partial to crowded streets and venues so the Las Vegas experience was lost on us to a certain extent. We figured you have to be a gambler, a younger person or both to really enjoy Las Vegas. However it was an experience and something we will remember.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but never got the room I wanted.”
Reviews.Author: skilikeagirlUtah
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got away to Las Vegas for two days and decided to try Paris Las Vegas. When I called, they assured me that for the extra priced room, I could get a front view of the Bellagio Fountains. So I booked it only to find out upon arrival that they were overbooked. They gave us our first night for free but it was a double bedroom in the rear of the hotel with a horrible view. They also assured me that my room would be ready in the morning and that it would be on the same floor. This was not the case. After calling the front desk by noon, our room still wasn't ready. Finally by 2pm it was ready and I called a bellman to help me with the luggage. They moved me to a junior suite on another floor but the same view! After calling the front desk again, they told me that they only had one room left with the front view and that it would cost me another $320. It was a special occasion for me and my husband and it was a shame I just didn't book The Bellagio instead. The buffet was wonderful even though I swear I thought I was in line for some Disneyland ride. The pool was also nice where I did get my desired view. And, I liked where the hotel was on the strip. It is centrally located and we did have a wonderful dinner across the street at Olives at the Bellagio. Just be careful of a very nasty women who answers the phone at the front desk. She was very patronizing which irritated me even more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time in Paris”
Reviews.Author: anmelbourne
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Vegas with friends on who were on their honeymoon, and so decided to go up-market and stay at Paris. We booked a standard room each and were offered an upgrade on Check-in for US $80 per day. Glad we didnt take it. The standard rooms were extremely comfortable and well appointed, with a huge and comfortable king bed, desk, sofa and television bureau (including hanging closet space and drawers if you are inclined to unpack your belongings). Paris is a small casino/hotel by comparison with other hotels on the strip, which makes it a little less daunting walking through the front doors. Check in was extremely speedy and the staff were friendly. We took the shuttle from the airport to the hotel, but our friends arrived later and they took a cab which cost basically the same as 2 people on the shuttle. We spent one afternoon at the pool which was great fun. It's a pretty crazy scene at the pool, but if the weather is fine, it's worth the experience! Paris is in a fantastic location, right in the middle of the strip across the road from Bellagio. There's a monorail stop next door at Bally's although we preferred walking the strip and so didnt make use of it. There are a couple of nice places to eat nearby and there's a Walgreens and CVS not too far away for stocking up on bottled water and other such things. That stuff is way more expensive in the hotel shops. All of vegas is amazing. We saw pretty much all the casinos along the strip and agreed that, for the price, Paris was the nicest. I recommend taking some time out in vegas to do a trip to the Grand Canyon and Hoover Dam. We did a helicopter flight with Sundance and it was really quite an experience. It's pricey, but well worth it. We also saw "O" at the Bellagio (which is an amazing casino), which was also well worth the cost for the experience. Vegas is like Disneyland for adults, so pack a sense of fun and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “ALMOST AS GOOD AS THE REAL PARIS.”
Reviews.Author: DOCTORTEE
Reviews.Content: Great location, easy access too blvd and rooms. We arrived on a monday for 5 nights, where upgraded to a renovated room n/c. The room was 390ft with a larger than normal bathroom. Only complaint was no hand bar in shower to hold on too. Also only 4 draws for 2 people.Other than that everything was fine. We where on the 28th floor the upper floors have larger windows great views. The restarants le buffet and mon ami gaba where great also you can dine in ballys which is not as crowed and less expensive.Napoleon bar has entertainment after 9pm,effill tower has great views of the strip.The casino is typical of all harrahs propertys $15 b/j tables, 7/5 video poker and 20 cent minimum on so called penny slots.The hotel draws crowds of people to see the paris theme which has been done expertly..

Reviews.Title: “great first impression of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: kat061
Reviews.Content: Paris Hotel was the first impression I had of Las Vegas, I stayed there for 10 days, I had a blast. The service was great, the casino was fun. The location was also wonderful, being right in the mist of the strip. My room was clean and comfortable. The line-ups to the resturants where long, but once inside the food was great, the buffet was very good. This hotel made me want to return to Vegas, so I planned another trip one year later and stayed elsewhere, a mistake. When I go again I will stay at the Paris Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First & last time at the Paris”
Reviews.Author: dechmont
Reviews.Content: Must admit we were rather disappointed with the Paris. When we booked in we did ask if any renovated rooms were available. We were told that "none had been released" to them. Wouldn't you think management would prefer to make a good first impression rather than bad one? Our room rate was not a discounted one. This was our first time at this hotel in Vegas and it will be our last. The rooms we were assigned were dingy and in need of a complete renovation. The wallpaper had dirty marks, the bed skirts were really dirty as well as the totally useless piece of fabric used on top of the bed as a bed runner. The carpeting had stains. Bathroom wasn't bad and it was good to have separate shower and bathtub. Getting breakfast in the hotel proved to be almost impossible as each restaurant had enormous lines outside. We did enjoy a dinner at Mon Ami Gabi. The noise level of the music pumped into the Casino area is a bit overpowering and did not entice us to stay for very long at the slot machines. Other casinos managed to have music without making you deaf! Our overall feeling is that it is time for the Paris to update all accommodations. We have enjoyed better accommodations at other Vegas hotels.

Reviews.Title: “What Luck”
Reviews.Author: Forgottensage
Reviews.Content: We paid a bit more than we usually do, but it was completely worth it. Our room was just beautiful and the view below was spectacular. To add to that, in the middle of the night, it snowed . . . neither of us had ever seen a Las Vegas postcard with snow in it. Turns out it was the first time in five years it had snowed there. It was probably not even an inch worth but looked like two inches. Everything glittered and made us feel like we were in the real Paris. The Eiffel Tower, half the height of the real one, and that balloon thing (sorry, don't know what it's called) kept drawing me to the windows over and over again. One thing no one mentions is that the legs of the tower go below the ground level and into the casino. There is also a bridge inside that leads to the Eiffel Tower (not sure which French river it is supposed to cross over. . .) Really, it is a very nice place to visit, even if you aren't really that into gambling, like me. Now, if only they would make the casino smoke free . . .

Reviews.Title: “Will Not Stay in Paris Again...”
Reviews.Author: RCJOFGA
Reviews.Content: We choose Paris Hotel for two reasons: price and location. I will say that if you are looking for cheap and a decent location, Paris offers that, but that is all you should expect! My first issue is the casino area. Compared to other casinos, Paris casino actually seems pretty small. Even though the casino is small you have to walk completely around the building to get to the elevators to take you up to your room. I constantly found myself wondering around long lines of tables just to get up to my room. Although I did encounter some friendly staff, most people were short and curt. I was offered to pay for an upgrade to my room which in the past most Vegas hotels have upgraded me for free if the room was available. Not only did I not get an upgrade but it seemed I was put in a "comp" room. I was put on the 10th floor and the back of the building. I did not pay for a view so that was fine. I actually like looking at the beautiful mountains. TOO BAD I COULDN'T SEE THEM! The windows in our room were so dirty you could barely see out of them. Glad I didn't pay for an upgrade because a friend who had a better view had the same dingy windows in their room. The room had "seemed" fairly clean. There were large stains on the chairs and the furniture was alittle banged up. We also had leaks in the sinks in the bathroom. Upon leaving, my husband took a peek on top of the armoire. OH MY GOSH! Talk about disgusting. Just because you can't see it, does not mean it should not be cleaned. There was not only dust a foot deep, but all sorts of things had been flung up there. Including some cloth with unknown substances on it..yuck! Speaking of the armoire...that is your only closet. There is no real space to store luggage. I had my clothes all hung up and when I went to iron something I realized the ironing board was behind all my hanging clothes. Kind of aggravating. There were always long lines at all the restaurants and at one restaurant I could only find the Diamond Entrance. My husband signed up for rewards at this casino and after 10 hours of play in one day he was only comped .50 cents. They said they only had him at the table for 2 hours. The casino also has NO POKER ROOM. The last night we ordered room service. Although the food was average, they screwed up the order. I didn't complain as I thought I would get the same look as I did in the Paris Café when I complained that it looked like my eggs had been sitting out for hours. They were hard and that thick crusty yellow. FYI: Went over the Planet Hollywood next door for a wedding. Saw there standard room which was very nicely decorated and fairly large. The casino was bright, large, and had high ceilings. They also had an awesome breakfast buffet which we ended up eating at several time (although the hostesses attitude lacked something to be desired). Also when we signed up for their rewards card we got a coupon book with LOTS OF FREEBIES. I didn't have to put one dime in the slots to get this coupon book and probably used well over 100.00 dollars in comps from this book. My husband ended up gambling here as well. The casino was clean and did not smell of smoke. Wish I had booked here instead of Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: LtColBuckRobley
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Paris on Friday morning 10/13 around 8:45. I knew it was early, but since I'm a diamond member I thought I'd see if the lady in diamond services might accidentally have a room available. To my surprise, one was available and she put me in a remodeled one at that. The room itself was very nice and clean. The bathroom had a separate bathtub and standup shower. Not as nice or large as the bathrooms at Caesars Palace Augustus Tower, but still very nice. The bed was more than comfortable enough and the room also had a small couch which I only used to pile my suitcase on. It also had a very nice flat screen television, mini-bar (I never opened having heard all the horror stories) and a safe which I made use of. I tried two restaurants at Paris, one being the buffet for breakfast which I found to be nothing special. I also had breakfast one morning at a basic cafe next to the buffet which was also adequate. Not a whole of restaurant offerings at Paris which appealed to me to be quite honest. I found the gambling to be pretty similar to other Harrah's properties on the strip. Fifteen dollar tables were hard to find at night. Most everything was 25. I spent a lot of time at the poker bar and putting down the beers. Actually did fairly well at them. Saw several people hitting jackpots, unfortunately I wasn't one of them, though I didn't do too badly. I enjoyed the poker bar in the race and sports book, though they put the TV's very high on the wall in there. It's kind of like sitting in the front row of the theater. Lots of people and excitement on football Saturday and Sunday. All in all I enjoyed Paris and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay At Paris”
Reviews.Author: DearJenn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris for 5 nights (Sun-Fri) in mid-Sept. We arrived around 12noon Sunday and were allowed an early check-in. The check-in line had about 25 people ahead of us but moved quickly and didn't take more than about 15 minutes. We were given the type of room we had reserved (2 beds, non-smoking.) We didn't have a view but the room was comped so I didn't expect one. From the pictures I have seen in other reviews, I don't think we had a remodeled room, but our room was fine...very clean and neat. The room was labeled as "luxury" on my reservation. The air conditioning was wonderfully cool. The beds were comfortable. We didn't hear any noise from neighboring rooms. Housekeeping did a fine job daily. The elevators were quick. Check-out was hassle-free and done via the TV in the room. As for other aspects of the hotel, the pool was nice with lots of available seating. The water was very cold though...probably the coldest pool I have ever felt. We ate the buffet almost daily. We enjoyed it for breakfast because it had an omelet station and a variety of other items. We didn't care for it as much at dinner time because it had very unique foods and we would rather more plain cooking. Also, alot of the items seemed cold at dinner time. It's a deal though because for the price you get everything including your drinks. The crepes were a nice treat. The casino was very smoky but otherwise fine. I would stay at Paris again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Paris is okay”
Reviews.Author: caverunlake
Reviews.Content: Nice looking hotel on the outside. Busy inside and lots going on. It was a verrry long walk from self-parking to check-in and rooms, down elevators, and escalators, etc. "Luxury Rooms" reminded me somewhat of holiday inn, but got a good price so shouldn't complain. Asked for a king bed, but couldn't get one. On front leg of trip, stayed at Bellagio and liked it much better.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on the strip!!”
Reviews.Author: Antsuz78
Reviews.Content: I can't gush enough about how fantastic our trip to Paris Hotel Las Vegas was. We had previously stayed for 2 nights at the Venetian and were so disappointed that we moved to this hotel and never looked back!! First of all on check in we were offered an upgrade to a Penthouse room with the most magnificent views for an extra $120 night - this was so worth it and I would've paid twice as much had I known how fabulous it would be. Our views of the Bellagio fountains was incredible. Staff in the hotel seemed friendly enough, although we never had real reason to deal with them except for checking in and out. Our room was spotlessly clean and redecorated in traditional Parisian style. Bathrooms were huge and clean. Two plasma tv's were fantastic. Come to think of it, my boyfriend accidentally bought a movie on the TV and when I rang the reception to try and get the charge reversed they were more than accommodating and wiped the charge straight away. Food in the hotel was great - we ate at the buffet and several crepes from the creperie. The location is amazing, right in the heart of the strip. We couldn't have asked for a better stay!

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE Service!!”
Reviews.Author: GAME702
Reviews.Content: Room was just ok. Staff at front desk were very rude. Me and my lady ate at the Moni Mi Gabi and the food was average & overpriced. The service there stunk too. Our waiter never smiled and neglected us. I left a whopping and well-deserved 50 cents tip. Nice lookin' hotel/casino, but if I was the hotel manager, I'd re-staff the place. 2 thumbs down.

Reviews.Title: “Only good thing was location.....”
Reviews.Author: dcblock71
Reviews.Content: And that could be questioned. Granted all the reviews you will read rave about the location on the strip, which my wife and I agree, is awesome!! We went to 14 casinos in our 5 nights there, but the atmosphere and people there leave something to be desired. First, it was our honeymoon and we were first time visitors. We are both well traveled and being from florida, we know what is good and bad service. Ours started out the latter, with check-in. The valet, bellmen and front desk clerk did not give us any info on how to recieve our bags, and after 30 minutes, we called to find out they didn't bring them up to us until we call. Now it wasn't busy 6pm at check in and you think they might have had a better system in getting your bags to you. The clerk at check in (Jorge)seemed bored, unattentive and he seemed to just be on autopilot. We were the only people in the 10 minutes it took to check in, to need anything from the front desk. Second, I have read the rooms evidently on the higher floors were renovated recently. Well , ours was on the 15th (1574) and we had one that was warn and beat up. Mind you the view was of the partial fountains and pool area, and was pretty. We stayed for 5 nights and after the 3rd night we started to find things wrong in the room. Towels had mold, stains and holes on them. Garbage was found in the nightstand (used kleenex and soda bottles) and behind the towels in the bathroom. Floors were dirty and sheets were worn and had holes in them. We notified the front desk and eventually the housekeeping floor super came by to see. She was a non factor because after being told it would be better cleaned, the garbage remained for two more days. There's a good chance it could still be there. Front desk was not very helpful either. On our second to last night, we were gambing at the connected casino (Bally's) and due to review guidelines, an incident happened that we can't mention, but made national news. Check it out online. Now its not the hotels fault but the security could be better and keeping incidents like this one from happening so close to the guests and lobby. We loved vegas and plan on going back, but unless we get some upgrades or better service, we won't be staying here anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “not so great”
Reviews.Author: layedbacktravellers
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas - Sept 08 Hi, this is my first review as I am new to this web site. This web site has been very helpful in choosing my upcoming vacation. Thought this information on this recent trip to Vegas and other trips to Vegas would be helpful. My wife and I love Las Vegas we go mostly for the pools and the nightlife not so much for gambling. It"s a quick 4 day vacation, we have stayed in many different Hotels, the best Hotel has been Ceasars but right now there is construction going on, building a new tower by the pool do not know if the tower will block the sun. If you stay there I recommend you stay in the (Palace Towers) it is right by the pool entrance, you don't have to walk through the Hotel to get there like many of the other Hotels. Pure Night club was very expensive, no seating at all unless you go for the bottled service, starting at $400.00 per bottle, you will get a seat and a hostess to wait on you. recommend cleopatra barge no cover charge live band and can sit and dance. Paris hotel our last visit rooms not so clean, the pool was very plain, but roomy. Most Hotels set up chairs so close you can't move, so this was nice about Paris Pool. We took a small cooler this trip, the best thing we did, filled up with bottled water and beer with plastic cups. The drinks again at the pool are quite expensive. MGM pool is nice but long walk through everything just to get there. Had good time at Studio 54. Luxor, bad experience , hallways and rooms not cleaned, had to keep asking to clean. Went to Ra nightclub it was really good. The Rio Hotel has a great bar called the Voodu Lounge it's very high up and overlooks the city, beautiful at night. Everything seems to get more expensive, one more recommendation, taxis at airport seem to take the long way to Hotel, but on the way back to the airport the short way. So hope this info is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fab location!”
Reviews.Author: sarahBuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first week of our honeymoon and were not disappointed. The room we were allocated was on the 26th floor and had a partial view of the Bellagio Fountains and I think must have been recently renovated as looked very fresh. It also had the biggest LCD TV I've ever seen!! The location of the Paris is great as you're right in the middle of the strip so easy to get to everything. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “3-Star Dressed Up Like a Cheap Date”
Reviews.Author: Terri65
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four night stay at the Paris Hotel. I was really looking forward to staying at the Paris for the first time. Previously I had stayed at the Mirage and Venetian. We booked a Calais Suite for just under $700/night. This is not chump change. We walked into the suite and found it to be rather small. As others have mentioned, the furniture and carpet were so shabby and dirty, I wouldn't let my dog sit on it. The sofa was particularly disgusting. Buttons were missing from the tufted upholstery and fabric was pilling on the chairs. The thing that really got me was that for $670/night you did not even get a robe or slippers to use. The design of the bathroom was strange. There is a tub in the main bathroom, but to shower you had to use the guest bathroom. We called to the front desk to convey our disappointment about the condition, size and lack of amenities in the suite. A very nice person named "Brie" said that there was a larger suite available for a "nominal charge. " She checked with the general manager and said the "nominal charge" would be an additional $250/night! We said that adding $1000 to our bill was unacceptable, so she suggested we take a standard room. Why would we do that? We headed to the pool and couldn't believe that they use the cheapest of cheap chaise lounges; the kind with plastic straps across the frame that often break. Yes, many of them had broken straps in stragetic places, if you know what I mean. Instead of eating and balancing food on my lap, I decided to go over to the poolside restaurant for lunch. The decor is very low-end with cheap furniture and a basic sunshade overhead. I ordered a cobb salad. The waiter brought it to me in a plastic take-out bowl complete with plastic lid. I said, "Doesn't it come on a plate?" He replied, "This is basically fast food here." I was flabergasted. I remembered many a lovely lunch I had at the Mirage poolside restaurant under a gorgeous palapa served in style. The salad wasn't very good; using common mixed greens that were not crisp. Overall I have to say that this property has somehow managed to fool the general population into believing it is a nice upscale property when it's not. Your money is much better spent on properties that care about their reputation and offer some value like the Bellagio, Venetian, Mirage and others. The one positive I can say is that the breakfast buffet had good variety, quality and value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel service and location”
Reviews.Author: Abeach4me
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris hotel in Las Vegas for 5 days over the weekend of September 20, 2008. The first thing about the hotel is it's great location. Directly across the street from the Bellagio, the Paris is in walking distance (long walks, Vegas style) to Caeser's Palace, New York, MGM Grand, etc. Connected directly to Bally's, the hotel offers first class accomodations and finishes. We spent the weekend with friends, and each day enjoyed the weather by the pool. The pool area is extremely well done, sitting on the roof in the shadow of the Eiffel Tower. Because of its location, surrounded on two sides by the hotel, and the Eiffel Tower on the 3rd side, you are able to enjoy the sun, and also use the shade from the buildings and tower when the tan starts to turn to burn. Well laid out, with plenty of room to have private conversations, and more chairs than were ever used. The pool service was fantastic, with a different waitress each day, all of them were personable and very attentive to our needs. I read on this site that drinks by the pool were expensive, however, 16 oz. Bud Lights were $7 each, or a bucket of 5 for $30 (of which we consumed many). As usual in Vegas, there were no hassles, no ID required, plentiful towels, and an outdoor restaurant (try the nachos). Check-in took us 5 minutes. Request one of the remodeled rooms, as there is a great difference in the quality of the finish. While all rooms I was in were clean, our remodeled room was beautiful and included a 42" plasma HD TV, while the non-remodeled rooms were slightly dated and had a 27" tube TV (not that you'll spend much time watching). Breakfast took a wait in a line at the buffet restaurant, some of the smaller specialty shops weren't as bad. We found ourselves going off site all but one day to avoid the lines. There are many assorted shops available, a quality cigar stand, a bloody mary and screwdriver booth in one of the shop halls during the mornings. We listened to a fantastic rock band at one of the bars one night, and found all of the dining areas to be well staffed. Checkout, of course, was painless, done on your TV in the room. Our limo driver, Brad, was unbelievable. If you want a limo service, contact me and I will give you his number. Funny, friendly and quiet when you wanted him to be. All in all, a great trip and a great stay. We would go back next time just for the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Time, Great View”
Reviews.Author: wilcox109
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Las Vegas before, I had no idea what to expect. We had a wonderful time and had a beautiful view from our room on the 24th floor--you could see the Bellagio's fountain show perfectly, as well as the tower. The rooms were a good size and clean, and the property has a wonderful location, especially since the other end of the strip seemed pretty dirty. The food was good and not too terribly overpriced, but of course they nickle and dime you for internet, minibar, etc, like any nicer hotel. You just have to accept that nowadays. The staff and dealers were very friendly, and we had a great time in the casino, although it was WAY too cold in there (bring a sweater ladies). My only complaint was that we had booked an upgraded room with a view and a king bed, and by the time we got there--admittedly late--the desk clerk said they only had double beds with a view and king beds without a view. My boyfirend is really tall so double beds are not an option but we booked Paris for the view. So, after reading the reviews on on here, we slipped the desk clerk a 20 and ended up with our room--king bed and a view, and maybe on a nicer floor than we would normally get. It's irritating, but it's Vegas! Money talks. It all worked out and I would defintely go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Great”
Reviews.Author: hendoco
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not the quality it should be for the price. It is not value for money, rather more like how quickly they can take your money. The mini bar has no prices listed and if you even move something it is charged to your room within 45 seconds. There are no tea and coffee facilities in the room, so you have to buy them. Breakfasts available at their cafes and restaurants are questionable, no cereal or toast anywhere only greasy fatty foods. Conditioner and body lotion in the bathroom but no shampoo.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: cathomson
Reviews.Content: We flew from Calgary where we were visting family to Las Vegas for a 4 night break. Our son had booked the Paris for us and we were very happy with the hotel and the location. We too were upgraded to a front facing room and on the 23rd floor which was great. Although older fashioned in style the rooms were spacious and clean with a nice roomy bathroom, Our upgrade to included the breakfast/evening buffet in the private lounge on the 31st floor which proved a bonus for us. The buffet continental breakfast had everything we needed provided free and the evening buffet replaced our having to search for somewhere to have an evening meal on a couple of nights. There were also two alcoholic free drinks per person included per night with an extensive choice available and as many soft drinks as you wanted. We found all the hotel staff very helpful and pleasant. The location of the hotel is ideal and with the Deuce bus and monoriail options for transport up and down the strip everything was within reach. Would recommend this hotel to all 3/4 star hotel users but those used to 5 star would not be satisfied I am sure.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Conference Hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: hypercritical
Reviews.Content: Of all the hotels to stay on for a conference in Vegas this has to be one of the worst. The facilities are limited, the staff unhelpful, and the rooms have limited and out-dated facilities. If you enjoy queuing for every meal (unless you've reserved in a premium restaurant) then you'll love it here. You can't book the larger suites even if you want to pay for them, and so cannot get VIP/concierge service. That means that every room service order takes over an hour and you need to predict what your next meeting will want to eat and drink before they arrive. My colleague was sent to Bally's next door as the Paris was full, despite confirming a reservation four months early. No mini-bar. No water in the room. Old fashioned TV's with ancient VOD services that you can't pause or rewind. Plus side, the Calais Suites do have a fax machine. Internet is an extra $13.99 a day - even in a $670 a night suite. Stay somewhere else. Anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: Max-Huckleberry
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Paris in Las Vegas on 8/15 - 8/18/08. We upgraded to the Eiffel Tower view which was well worth the extra $50 per night because we were also able to enjoy the Bellagio water show. The lovely lady that checked us in to room 2605 said the room had been recently re-decorated. The 26th floor was perfect because we had a bank of elevators that serviced from the 26th floor to the top floor, so we were always the first stop going up. The only stop coming down was for the floor the pool was on, and the only time we stopped there was because we chose that floor. We always had an elevator arrive in about 30 seconds. For another additional $15 per night, we upgraded to a concierge package which included a continental breakfast (fruit, sweet rolls, bagels, yogurt parfaits, cold cereals & juices) on the 31st floor and hors d'oeuvres (fruit, shrimp, finger sandwiches, hot pasta dish & desserts) and two alcoholic drinks per person from 5pm to 8pm each evening. There was an honor card to fill out to have your alcoholic beverages charged to your room. At check in, I recalled being told our package included two alcoholic beverages per person. I asked the concierge and he looked in his computer and said our package did include the beverages, so we did not need to fill the form out, so keep that in mind if you go with this package. You serve yourself from the buffet line, but you are expected to leave a tip on your table. I thought the room was very nice. The decor was not traditional "French" decor. It was decorated in tans, browns and reds with contemporary furniture instead of the blue and cream Victorian type furniture I saw on other floors. The bathroom was the first room off the entry. It was roomy and had a marble vanity with one sink and marble stand alone shower. There was a separate standard tub, and I did not notice any jets in it. There was a lighted magnified make-up mirror on the bathroom wall. There was no mirror outside of the bathroom, so there was no place to style your hair or put on your make-up while your partner is using the bathroom. We had a large flat screen TV, and a large armoire with closets for hanging clothes on each side. I hung all clothes on one side and stored the empty suit cases in the other. There was an in-room safe that you programmed with your own entry code in one of the closets. We had three pillows which were very soft and compressed to almost flat once your head was on them. On the second day, we twice requested an additional pillow and were told that there were none available and they would send one up once they had one. We never did receive a pillow. Watch out for the in-room mini-bar refrigerator. The mini-bar refrigerator is designed with two spaces with rubber bottoms for each type of beverage they stock. There were three empty spaces, so we placed our own bottled water and sodas in there. We rearranged two of the mini-bar drinks to make more room to keep our drinks cold. When it came time to check out at 11am, we started our check out on the TV. There were mini-bar charges for each day we were there. We only had house-keeping come in one day, so I wondered how they would think we were consuming their beverages each day when we had not been. We had to go downstairs and wait in the line to check out in person to ask why we had mini bar charges when housekeeping had never had to re-stock our mini-bar. The lady behind the counter told me that the pads are pressure sensitive, so if you pick up a product to look at it, and then decide you do not want it and put it back in the same spot or even put your own bottle in an empty spot, you are automatically charged for the product. I said that it would have been nice to know ahead of time and asked where they provided guests with that information. She said it was printed on the mini-bar pricing list (which was placed in an inconvenient spot behind the Paris glass balloon souvenir - the biggest item in the mini-bar). She then printed the bill and presented it to me to sign and it had all the mini-bar charges. I asked if I had to pay the mini-bar charges even though I just had explained that I did not use a single product. She then called housekeeping and asked them to check the room's mini-bar. She waited a minute and after receiving no response, she took the charges off the bill but said she transferred all mini-bar charges to a different bill and if housekeeping found some items missing, I would be charged for them. I told her if housekeeping is not restocking items, I do not see how they think they should be charging me. There should be a checks and balance between the pressure sensitive pads and the inventory housekeeping is restocking to the mini-bar. Paris is penalizing you for putting your own drink in their refrigerator instead of buying their $5 bottle of Aquafina. We ate breakfast one morning at the cafe by the pool. I thought the menu said O'Brien potatoes, but we were served French fries with our eggs. I consider O'Brien potatoes to be diced with onions and peppers, not shoe string French fries. We had dinner at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant which is about on the 11th floor (not at the top). We had very good service and a spectacular view. The captain will place your napkin on your lap for you. Be prepared with tip money if you visit the restroom because there is an attendant on duty to provide you with a paper towel and there is a tip jar on the vanity. Visit the Eiffel Tower at night so you can see all the lights on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, But Definately Not 4 Stars”
Reviews.Author: RandJ0806
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Paris for business purposes and although I knew free time would be limited, I was really looking forward to staying at this particular property. It was one that I was very curious to see. Since this was a business trip, I can't speak a word about the pool, the actual eiffel tower experience, etc. - only the hotel itself, rooms, restaurants, all of which i was not impressed with. All that said, i work in the luxury hotel industry so i am likely overly-observant when hotels that bill themselves as 4 star luxury are not. Check-in was fast. I was there around 11am and happy they had a room for me. Woo-hoo! The room was clean and a decent size for a standard guestroom. The bathroom is a nice size. However, no bathrobe/slippers, coffee maker...all standard items for any luxury hotel. They had analog TV which surprised me because I've been reading in all of the trade publications how lack of LCD tvs is causing people not to book properties who haven't upgraded. The Paris is even below that standard! The bed was just AWFUL. The matress felt cheap, like the one you'd find on a college dorm bed that is covered with thick plastic. The pillows were on the worn side and the blanket was cheap. And while they do a great job keeping the furnishings in the style of the entire hotel concept, the drawer on the desk was broken. With regard to food, while there are plenty of restaurants there, most of them are not open for lunch. If you want a sit down place (granted, I was only there during the week), your choice is a buffet - where the line was out the door - or a hamburger place. You can get a crepe to go elsewhere but again, I wanted to sit down and unwind after my flight. I chose the burger place - it was good. Can't speak about anywhere else though, as it was the only meal I had in the hotel. Checkout was also fast. There is no denying that the staff is wonderful. And there is absolutely nothing WRONG with the rooms. But, if you are expecting a luxury hotel, don't stay here. Go across the street to the bellagio (where I have also stayed) - it is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice hotel but with one turn off...”
Reviews.Author: bellavie
Reviews.Content: We generally stay at the Flamingo but wanted to try a different hotel this year. Overall we liked it. Check in: The line was extremely long and I thought we would be there forever but they handled it quite well and we were through in about 25 mins. The person at the front desk was nice and helpful and even though it was early we got our room right away. The Room: We had a room on the 23rd floor that overlooked the pool, the Eiffel Tower and the Bellagio fountains, very nice. The room itself was clean however the sheets were a little worn to the point there were some holes in them. The bathroom was a nice size, larger than most. The Pool: The pool gets plenty of sun, we were in the sun by 10:30 a.m. Doesn't seem to get very crowded which was nice. But by most Vegas pool standards, it was a bit quiet. And here is the part of the hotel I didn't like...the drinks at the pool were expensive. I got a large (but not that large) Bloody Mary and it was $18. Later I took that cup to have some ice put in it and they want to charge you $1.50 for ice. Never heard of such a thing and I hate being nickle & dimed. If I'm paying to stay at the hotel and paying $18 for a drink I feel I should be able to get ice without having to pay for it. This totally turned me off of this hotel. I have never stayed anywhere where you had to pay for ice. If seemed to be a general complaint of most people around the pool. Some people were going to the ice machines on the floors and coming out with ice in a bag. The food at the pool restaurant was okay but the service was horrendous. The waitress could barely speak English and seemed to have trouble understanding it, she had to bring someone over to help her. And the service there was very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at Paris”
Reviews.Author: taw522
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Paris from August 17 - 22. Our room was comped for 6 nights. Check in was quick, no long lines. The room was recently renovated and the view was great, over looking pool, fountains and tower. However we did find the room a bit small. But bed comfy and linens good. We did find all the little cafes to be quite nice with a great variety of snacks/food available. Mon Ami Gabi was also great we ate outside over looking the dancing fountains. The only down side was we were seated right behind the menu sign and everyone from the street would stop and read it, it made dinner a little awkward at times. Just ask to be changed if you get these seats and you will enjoy. We asked but no other seats available at that time. Never got a chance to eat at the buffets, to crowded to long of a wait. Pool area... after reading some of the negative reports we thought we would be disappointed in this area, Having stayed at other hotels on the strip with amazing pools. I have to say we enjoyed the pool. Always being able to get lounges no matter what time of day and moving them from place to place, sun to shade with plenty of room around you. I will say sometimes the area could get bogged down with rubbish from the lunches being served, and a couple of windy days some of the trash would end up in the pool... Yuk... they could improve in that area .Also if you want to rent a raft make sure you have a credit card with you or the paper they give you at check in... your room key or room # is not enough. All in all we found our stay pleasant . The employees always had smiles on their faces from the bellman at the front of the hotel to the people at the check in counter The location is perfect, center strip. We would probably stay here again but we like to try different hotels while in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Stay Ever at the Paris”
Reviews.Author: supermantis14
Reviews.Content: Apparently TripAdvisor does not let users describe negative experiences. I posted a long review of a bachelor party trip to Las Vegas, and it magically disappeared without any notification from TripAdvisor. It's great to see that you let users post honest opinions and experiences. During the trip in May 2008, we were robbed inside our room while sleeping at the Paris Hotel. My advice to anyone is not to stay at this worthless hotel. Nobody makes any attempt to check ID at the elevator, and anyone can come and go to any floor. The security did little to nothing to help us once we were robbed in the middle of the night. The insurance company refused to pay us back, saying that the Paris did not demonstrate "gross negligence". Ok, I fail to see how not following through on any security investigation, not checking cameras or IDs, or not returning calls regarding our filed reports does not constitute gross negligence. Furthermore, we were robbed by a man who apparently was just released from jail for robbing other people at the Paris Hotel! He was only caught last time because he jumped off the roof and broke his ankles. We were also told that some of the doors do not shut or lock properly, and people can push on the doors in the middle of the night. This seems to be an ongoing problem that the hotel has not resolved. So, why don't you fix it??? The hotel did not send anyone up to the room from management to see if we were ok after being robbed. A worthless security guard came up later, and he was amused at our situation. He did nothing to help, and recommended that we call the police. Another worthless investigator named Dorothy Stewart was "on the case". She works for the hotels, so she apparently did not believe our story. Thanks for your help, "Dot", and not getting back to us about anything for months. The police detective that was supposed to help us did not return phone calls. He mysteriously was out of the office for a month after we were robbed. Needless to say, I will never stay at this garbage hotel again. If you want to get security to do something, apparently you have to take a chip out of the casino. In that case, they will have SWAT all over you. However, if you happen to stay at the hotel and lose a few hundred dollars by getting robbed in your bedroom by a repeat offender, then don't expect them to help you with anything. Yes, we did use the safe, but you can't keep everything in a tiny safe when there are four people in a room. Furthermore, I shouldn't have to worry about all of our belongings while we are sleeping in a supposedly decent hotel. Anyway, thanks for nothing, Paris. There are many better places to stay where you don't have to wake up in the middle of the night to the sight of a man crawling on the floor at the foot of our bed. Please stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: smiley2269
Reviews.Content: As a total rewards member I was comp'd several nights. I was pleased with the hotel. Our room was the last one at the end of a very long hallway but we got our exercise for the day. Room was comfortable, always kept clean and bathroom was big and roomy. Our view was of the Fountain show and tower which was nice. Pool, boring and average. Probably my least favorite part. Ate breakfast by the pool. Food was good, fair price and no wait. Buffets were too long of a wait. Crepes was a must and crossiant as well. Gambling ok- friends won on slots, I lost. If I could get same deal I would consider going back but would want to try a place with a more exciting pool scene. Drinks were 12.oo for small and 18.00. HOWEVER location was great!!

Reviews.Title: “Paris Las Vegas Sept 8 to Sept 12”
Reviews.Author: dakota101
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Paris. Arrived on Monday at noon. Check in was very quick no wait at all. Requested a smoking room with two queen beds. Room not ready and would not be ready until 4pm. We flew from the east coast to Vegas. We did not want to wait so we took a non smoking room (Room #2949). We went to the room and it was a remodeled room. Very nice decor but had a bad smell in it and the air conditioner did not work in the room. We called down to the front desk and they relocated us to (Room #403) not a remodeled room but had a better smell and the air conditioner worked great. The view was of the pool but there were two trees blocking the view. Overall the room but was very nice. The machines at Paris were extremely tight and did not win anything there. Went to the Cafe for several meals nothing special about the cafe but a little pricey. Played in Ballys,Bills gambling hall, Circus Circus, Tropicana no big wins there at all. Went downtown played along time at Vegas Club and went to the Four Queens played along time also no wins but had a good time and actually was able to play awhile. Went to the MGM Grand and played there for along time played the new Gamemaker HD machines and hit TWO Jackpots within 20 minutes of each other. First game was blazing 7s and hit the 5 blazing 7s for 1000.00 and switched games on the same machine and played double double bonus poker and hit a Royal for 1000.00 so overall the MGM Grand was a great place to play. We also rented a rental car the car rental building is 3 miles from the airport but they take you there by bus so it was easy. There was 10 people in front of us so it took awhile to get to the counter. The rental was 60.00 for 5 days it was a great deal until they add all the taxes and misc. charges and then want to charge you 10.00 per extra driver. So finally cost was 111.00 not that big of a deal but they should let you know when you do the reservation what your finally cost will be instead of the surprise you reach the counter. THIRFTY CAR RENTAL just beaware of this. I have been to Vegas many times and this was the first time with a rental car. It was a great idea you can come and go as you please and do whatever you want. NO waiting for busses or monorail or anything like that. I actually drove the whole strip and had no major issues at all. Went to the Hofbrauhaus it was okay the beer was great but the food sucked. I expected real german food but it was not like that at all. Went to the Cher concert at Ceasars the show was great even the 17 outfit changes that Cher did in the 90 minute show.
