I thought it was a little much doing all those outfit changes but everyone else said it was expected. Went to Texas Station and Gold Coast they were okay. So overall it was a great trip just thought I would pass on some information for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Reluctant_flyer333
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed at the paris the last week of august and over the labor day weekend and really enjoyed it. When we got there they were overbooked and gave us the option of staying at Caesar's Palace for one night. They offered $20 for taxi fare and $100 for food & drink when we came back the next day. We took the deal but regretted it; apart from the trouble of packing/unpacking and traveling back and forth we had the unpleasant experience of having a Caesar's check-in clerk who was not happy to have to give us a room for just one night so he gave us what i am sure must be the worst room they have, in the Roman tower. The room was dusty (because i'm sure they don't rent it out very often), filthy, in bad repair, and had a view of a concrete wall. So it was a very pleasant relief the next day when we got our room at the paris. The room was clean and had a nice view of the mountains and part of the airport (we could see planes taking off/landing but never heard one). The overall hotel is kept very clean and there is a good variety of places to eat, most of which are relatively expensive, with one exception being J.J.'s boulangerie (bakery/deli), which is cafeteria style and served everything from breakfast to late night snack. Line ups at the buffet were usually quite long; we sometimes ate for less at Bill's casino across the street from Bally's (the Paris is connected to Bally's by interior walkways), or at a very nice and affordable food court at Caesar's (forget the name of it...they call it something-street and it includes one of those Java-something coffee shops. Being centrally located it was very easy to take the 'Deuce' bus and visit the strip in either direction; there is also a monorail station at Bally's. The Deuce goes all the way downtown to the Fremont street experience but it can be slow; take the monorail as far as you can go before switching to the bus. The staff at the Paris (especially the check-in/out counter, and Housekeeping) were very friendly and helpful and the hotel itself, inside and out, is quite nice to look at with all the sculptures, fountain etc. The Paris is right across the street from the Bellagio, which is a real bonus because we got to see several shows of the Bellagio fountains (BTW just visiting the lobby of the Bellagio is a treat in itself). I would highly recommend the Paris hotel, it is hard to beat for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: traveltrixie
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in Vegas. Centrally located on the strip so it's easy to get anywhere. The cafes inside are quick and accessable. Easy check-in and out. The front desk was helpful and informative with no wait. There is a crosswalk out front so it's easy to cross the street. I plan on staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay! Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Peaches0422
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights this month and recieved a great room rate, 89.00 per night. Easy check-in, no hassle about upgrading which is unusual. I did ask sweetly about a renovated room and all I know is that the room we had was lovely with no upcharge. No one was rude, in fact, everyone went out of the way to help in any way possible. Great location. I would stay again in a heartbeat, though I will say that the Venetian was my favorite hotel and casino. Nothing could come close.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: SallyFoodie
Reviews.Content: We travel to Las Vegas 2-4 times per year. We vary where we stay. I found the Paris very nice based on: quiet, clean, ease to get to rooms from the strip, comfort of beds, and location. The rooms are quiet; there may be noise in rooms from the hallway, but once in your room, you don't hear it. The decor is a bit tired, but the rooms are spacious and they were kept very clean. In some hotel/casinos, it takes 2-3 days to figure out your route from the strip to the hotel elevators; not so at Paris. It is very direct. I found the beds and pillows to be comfortable. The location on the strip is hard to beat....you're in the middle! Easy to get to most everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: fremantlewa
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at the Paris. Had no problem with check in or check out - the staff in the lobby were very friendly and we had no lines either time. We were travelling with another couple and they had no problems puting us both on the same floor. The room was renovated and very clean. Ice machine located just down the hallway. Loved the location on the strip - directly opposite the Bellagio and as we love to walk we loved the fact it was central to both ends of the strip. Had the buffet one morning - and found the waiter to be quite rude and obnoxious and the food was not of a standard that we were expecting. ( the waiter did not get a tip - and boy he was mad about it !!!) Would happily recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your money - the hotel is a scam”
Reviews.Author: LuckyArtLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: My wife and I checked in and were offered an upgrade to a suite "for less money" than the room we reserved. We apparently signed something that says we knew the cost would be in addition to the room. (We were sober when we got there, and neither of us remember signing something that said that.) Well, they have this scam covered air-tight because they faxed us our signature on a document that says the upgrade is extra in ALL CAPS to cover their you know what! When I asked how many people complain about this, the supervisor "Mike" said, "oh, not that many". My wife and I don't mind spending good money for quality service and fun, but we feel really violated when the hotel is the pick-pocket.

Reviews.Title: “toxic”
Reviews.Author: emoniker
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying that there is absolutely nothing the matter with the rooms -- they are uninspired, but very nice. You'll hear little else positive from me. In their greedy zeal to make money, the Paris, and most of the other big hotels in Vegas have designed their hotels such that their visitors are constantly trapped in a toxic cloud of cigarette and cigar smoke. There's no escape from it. The ONLY access to guest rooms is through a large and completely smoke-filled casino. Clearly the hotel cares nothing about the health or comfort of it's guests. If you go there, there's no choice -- smoke and nicotine will be your companions. The (very few) small areas that were non-smoking were poorly marked and the signs were ignored. And they were open-to and adjacent to areas of heavy smoke. Every restaurant was completely open on one or even two sides to the smoke-filled casinos and were all filled with smoke. If you intend to eat, shop, gamble, or lay at the pool, you will have to choke on smoke the entire time. It's disgusting, harmful to the health and inhumane. I felt like the canary in the cage in a coal-mine filled with toxic gas. Paris Hotel -- wake up and smell the decade! It's no longer acceptable to poison your guests and your poor employees. I will NEVER return.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth The Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Diaking
Reviews.Content: First night on the strip, vert noisy moved to a mountainview room, much better and the room was alot larger, rate less than strip view. Also, we had dinner at Mon Am Gabi, the salmon was very salty, not worth the money and the steak was overdone, my husband order medium rare and the steak came out a second time medium.

Reviews.Title: “Tres bon - great hotel in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: HI3
Reviews.Content: The Paris is located right in the middle of the strip, perfectly positioned for exploring the main hotels that make up Las Vegas. Our room was on the 23rd floor and had a lovely view out over the airport, the suburbs and the desert (and it wasn't even a pay-extra "strip-view" room). It was a huge room with sofas, an enormous comfortable bed, a big marble bathroom, and lots of good extras, like a massive tv, an iPod dock, an extensive mini-bar etc. It's definitely the best room that I've ever paid fifty quid a night for. We had no idea where to start when choosing which of the myriad of Vegas hotels to stay in, but I'd definitely recommend ending your search here...

Reviews.Title: “Everything is Sort of Sexier in Paris”
Reviews.Author: JaXprat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two mid-week nights in August and were throughly pleased. We initially booked a standard room via the "Hot Deals" on the website, but when we arrived at noon they were out of King non-smoking rooms. We decided to splurge and get upgraded to a suite, and the receptionist was so accommodating she put us in a high-level "P" room with a view of the Bellagio fountains and the pool. For $185 a night, it was worth it. Check-in took about 20 minutes so despite the long line, they were zipping through us pretty quickly. Even so, I would have preferred airport check-in which they got rid of earlier this year. Our room was lovely. There is a half bath, parlor area, dining area, and bedroom that is separated by french doors. The bathroom has a jetted tub (wish we had time to use it), stand alone glassed-in shower, and separate commode room. The toiletries were of generous size and of good quality. There was a lovely scented potpourri in the room so those with environmental sensitivities may be put off. I was not a fan of the bedroom TV consul which raised and lowered via remote, nor of the marble coffee table with multiple sharp corners that stabbed my husband and I on numerous occasions. Maid service was excellent and they even left a little chocolate on the pillow - a nice touch I have not seen in a few years. Internet is about $14 extra for 24 hours and they offer both wireless and jack. We don't really gamble but we did hang out in the casino quite a bit and enjoyed watching others win big. Our cocktail waitress was a doll and gave us the lowdown on the service industry in Vegas over the past 20 years and well as some great drink suggestions. I also love the collectable ceramic Paris balloon goblets you can get when you order a frosty drink. We did not see any of the showgirls walking by or little dancing girl shows that we remembered seeing in the casino when we walked through on our last visit. The pool scene looked like our kind of mellow, but it was 105 degrees out so we preferred to stay in the A/C. We ate at several restaurants inside the hotel and enjoyed every one, especially the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. Because our room was so high, we opted out of going to the top of the tower (have to save something for next time) and enjoyed the view from our room. I wish we could have tried the sushi place and hung out in the dueling piano bar, but there is only so much you can fit into 2 nights. We had two snags during our stay. Our room keys stopped working the first night and when we went to get them re-keyed that receptionist said we were not registered at the hotel. It took 10 minutes to sort out but we were exhausted and not in the mood. Meanwhile, a somewhat drunk and belligerent guest was making a scene with the manager and I have to commend how the manager handled it - I would have blown my top at the stuff the guest was saying to her. We were also billed for a fax that was sent to a guest at the beginning of the month, but it was quickly taken off on request. Overall we were pleased, but not ecstatic with our stay. There were lots of little things that kept it from being a 5-star and I felt like there was a little sparkle missing from the whole experience. We will defiantly be back to dine and lounge, but probably not to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: bigwaverider9
Reviews.Content: Booked this holiday through Virgin Holidays. They made a mistake on their Web Site, listing the total price for a 7 night holiday at £500 pound each. Within a few hours the price had been corrected to £1250 each. Fair play to Virgin they did honour the price but only after trying to cancel the holiday. Now to the Paris. All staff were friendly, polite and good at their jobs. Check in was good, I took the $65 a night upgrade for a strip view and use of the concierge lounge this was well worth it. On arrival in the room there was a damp musty smell, as we were very tired from the flight we stayed, but the next morning we were moved to another room on a higher floor. This still has the smell but not as bad. The smell was evident in the corridors so we decided to stay in this room, as another could have been worse. The room was ok, a little rough at the edges, no were near as smart or as big as the Venitian where we stayed last year. Access to the room from the lobby was easy and quick no endless corridors as with the Venitian. The best asset with the Paris is the location, step out of the front door and you are in the centre of the strip. To the left is the Miracle Mile Mall, opposite is the Belaggio and Caesars palace. Another asset is the pool, large, clean and not too busy. Check out was very slow, only 4 stations open wlth a queue of 50 or more. Some people were complaining of the missing their flights. Overall the hotel was ok for the price I paid. Full price and I would be giving 1 to 2 stars. Tip, pay a little extra and pick a 5 star hotel, Caesars palace.or The Hotel for me next time. And Top Top Tip, do not back down if you get a bargin with an incorrectly listed holiday price. They will try and get you to pay full price, but legally they haven't a leg to stand on.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Scotiascott
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paris and found this to be an above average property.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced lackluster hype”
Reviews.Author: chino53
Reviews.Content: Paris Hotel was hype, not worth the price. I found a half drunk soda bottle in my clean room, and the coffee maker was missing the cups! When I complained it was oh well you should have told us sooner. What a contrast with the Golden Nugget, which is privately owned and everyone there is helpful, the rooms were actually bigger and nicer with feather pillows and comforters and plush terry clothe robes for you to wear in the closet. Skip the Paris, it does have a good location but Bally's has a far nicer pool, big and deep, and it right next door to the Paris, and you can walk over to the Paris shops. r g g g g

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel - Mostly Great Service”
Reviews.Author: SEAsiaTraveler27
Reviews.Content: Paris - Las Vegas is a beautiful hotel - we found the ambience to be just right, and the premium rooms overlooking the Eiffel Tower and the Bellagio fountains must be among the best views on the Strip. I'd have rated it 5 stars, but for two quibbles: Service was mostly outstanding, with the exception of the less-friendly UPS Business Center and their prices ($25 to send an 8-oz. package on 3-day delivery? Hmm.) There's also some nickel-and-diming with the online room rates. Expect an extra $65 charge for good-view rooms and access to the executive lounge. But wait: On top of that, children get charged $10 PER VISIT to the lounge (and they don't even drink the wine). On the whole, I'd go back without the kids. And mail my stuff from a regular post office.

Reviews.Title: “(Probably) worth the money”
Reviews.Author: MPG1971
Reviews.Content: My friends live in southern CA & go to Vegas frequently, which is how they earned a free weekend's stay at the Paris hotel. They invited me out to share the room with them for the Fourth of July weekend and I happily accepted. The short version is, Paris Las Vegas is a fantastic hotel that is not suited for budget travelers. We stayed in a basic room, which was very clean and quite comfortable. The bathroom is absolutely gorgeous, albeit a little lacking in counter space for three people (two of whom were women), with a separate shower and plenty of marble. The safe was a welcome addition - especially after my friend won $2700 playing the slots! The only free TV programming is a non-stop infomercial from the Harrah's corporation, but of course they would rather you get out of your room and into their casino. The food court has a bounty of options, all at inflated prices; however, I do recommend getting a crepe for breakfast at least once during your stay. Lounging by the pool (something I never do in my "real life") was a treat - there was something about gazing up at the facade of the hotel against the bright blue sky, with the miniature Eiffel Tower at our backs, that was beautiful and serene in that odd Vegas way. All in all, I would gladly stay at the Paris again, if I could afford to and didn't feel the urge to check out a different hotel. (Here's a tip I learned from my friends, though: if you want to gamble, take the short walk down the Strip to the Flamingo casino - also owned by Harrah's - as their games are somewhat "looser" than the ones at the Paris.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: kevyleo80
Reviews.Content: Paris Las Vegas is a spectacular sight and the decor inside is worth the price alone (which is a bargain as well). The staff was very friendly and the location on the strip is central to many other attractions. Although I booked a standard room I was a little surprised the room was not a little more lavish. However the bathroom was top notch. Decor in the rest of the room could use some upgrading, however this did not detract from my stay. The overall setting of the hotel is wonderful. Probably would give it a 3.5 star rating personally, and not a 4, but I would recommend for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Oui Oui Paris”
Reviews.Author: jenniqw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris on our recent trip to Las Vegas. I was a little nervous due to mixed reviews I had read, but I was pleasantly surprised by how quaint the hotel felt, which is funny considering how busy the hotel was. But really, there are cobblestone streets & cute French looking store fronts. To get in & out of the hotel you have to walk through the casino for the most part & it was surprisingly not that smoky...that's alway a good thing. We were upgraded to one of the remodeled rooms & it looked just like the pictures on the website...very nice! Yes, the bathroom is huge & nice. Prices in the restaurants are pricey, but so is everywhere else in Vegas. If you don't know, Paris is practically right in the middle of the strip, right next to Planet Hollywood, connected to Bally's & right across the street from The Belagio & Ceasar's Palace, so definately the right place to be. As you can tell, I was happy with my stay & would definately return to Paris Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Just Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: boysx2
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out the experience was fantastic. Lovely place to visit. Everything you would need under one roof. Resturant choices were excellent. Staff was willing to help. Great view from room of the fountains and the tower. Decor was very pretty.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: dersky
Reviews.Content: stayed at the paris for the first time in june . what a great place for the price. great location. room service was served fast and hot and plenty of food. the breatfast buffet was also worth the price, everything you could want and more. the only draw back was the poker room , needs more action and tourneys still had a great time

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in a great spot at a great rate”
Reviews.Author: jaguaracer
Reviews.Content: We found Paris a great hotel at a great price. Certainly there are cheaper but you can't beat the location. Our room didn't have a spectacular view (we checked in a little early), but the room itself was very clean and very big. The bathroom was great: again, big and clean. Safe didn't work and tv had problems (fixed shortly after problem reported) but we're low-maintenance travelers so it didn't diminish the experience of Paris. Restaurants were, as expected for the area of the Strip, quite pricey but still great. Pool was very nice: great music and good pool-side drink service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: realtor99
Reviews.Content: We always stay at a Harrahs property but this was the first time at Paris. Had received an offer from Venetian and originally was going to stay there, I am sooo glad we stayed at Paris instead. I was very concerned when I first made the reservation since we were not too familiar with this hotel/casino other than a short visit in the casino last year. Anyway, arrived around midnight. The line for check in was short. Checked in by a young man by the name of Sam. Friendly and professional. I said a view was not important to us (we have been to Vegas many times, have seen the view as many times) He upgraded us to a suite and a suite it was. In all the years we have visited, been upgraded at various hotels, this one took the cake. 3 room suite, living room, dining room and bedroom, 2 baths, one with a jaccuzi tub and a huge separate shower, two makeup areas, marble everywhere, 2 TV's, coffeemaker. We were very impressed. Used room service each morning for breakfast, got a pizza one evening for dinner before going out and a late night snack one night. Everything was excellent. Rooms service arrived promptly. We enjoyed gambling at the casino. By the time everything was said and done, with our total rewards points, we paid $70. In my estimation, it was at least a $2000 trip. Needless to say, we will return. Casino was good to us also.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for 'The Strip'”
Reviews.Author: NickyU
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in July. Hotel is well located on the Strip within easy walking distance of the other big hotels. It is attractive inside with the Parisienne street scene, although a bit crowded at times. Our room was large, and good for our family of 4. We arrived at about 4.30 p.m. and checked in really quickly, we were travelling with friends and as requested our rooms were close together. The pool area is really large with lots of sunbeds, and didn't feel crowded on the afternoon we were there. I would not recommend visiting Las Vegas in July/August due to the heat, it was normally 41 (once hitting 46) and the wind blowing was like a hairdryer in your face. It was necessary to take cover in air conditioned buildings at all times.

Reviews.Title: “As usual FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: djtoby44
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Paris a few times now and it's as fabulous as ever. The rooms are a nice size with some being updated having flat screen TVs and new colors. I personally like the French decor better, but have stayed in both rooms. This time we could not get a room with a view of the Bellagio, but did get one of the Pool area. Still a nice view. *We checked in very late at night and wanted two rooms together to let the view room go so we could have two room together. We ate at the buffet a couple of times. Good, but not as good as the last time I was there. We ate at the Le Cafe many times because it is open 24-7. However, service can be slow. The casino offers a band on many of the nights---and they are good! But the slots themselves have never been tighter. In fact, the whole strip is tight! Even downtown. We were a little disappointed as we have always been able to JUST PLAY a little while without going through a bunch of money. But not this time. The slots are tight. BEWARE. We went to see CHER at Caesars --- great show. CHER was even sick and still performed--and did it well. It was the highlight of the week since the slots were not paying. Also, we went to see LOVE at the Mirage--good---and different. The week in Vegas was fun, but the money was not being stretched because of the slots being so tight. Paris slots were especially tight this time around. *We rented a car to pick us up from the airport. I highly suggest this as the taxi lines can get long. Paris will provide a car for a fee and of course a tip to the driver. But, Paris is really a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: mosley41
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in Vegas for a family reunion. And this was my first time in Vegas so I wanted to stay somewhere nice and on the strip. Most of my family stayed at the Jockey Club (located right across the street) but I neglected to stay there due to the amount of construction that surrounded the hotel. Paris had a great deal going for the time that we would be in Vegas and I didn't want to pass it up. Wow! I didn't realize the location was so prime. Located next to Planet Hollywood and across the street from Bellagio and Caesar's. Check in took maybe 15 minutes. They had given us two queen beds without requesting it. The view from my room was spectacular. I could watch the Bellagio fountains from my room and had a great view of the pool. We ate breakfast at their cafe and the prices were pretty reasonable. My french toast was only $9 and that included a drink. I would advise that if you want to go up and down the strip, get a ticket for the deuce. It runs up and down the strip and is only $5 for 24 hours. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: Habfan
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Las Vegas, and the Paris was perfectly situated on the strip. We arrived late morning only to wait in a 45 minute check-line. Note that if you arrive around check-out time the line-ups at reception are quite long. However, once we were served, they did not have any rooms with king size beds available and were offered to wait until later in the afternoon for one to be available or accept a room with 2 queen size beds. We chose the latter because a)we were tired of waiting and wanted to settle in after a long flight, and b) rooms with 2 beds seem to be more spacious. We had no view. Our room overlooked the parking lot at the back of the hotel. The recepetion staff did their job, but were no more welcoming than they needed to be. (When in Vegas, ask very direct and accurate questions, because as we experienced, your question will be answered, but no extra effort is made to elaborate or give any more information than is needed!) The room was clean and spacious, though not much drawer space, mostly hanging. The bathroom was large, and had both a tub and shower. The water pressure in the shower was very low and it took about 5 minutes to heat up. Amenities in the room included a safe, an ironing board and iron, soap, shampoo, conditioner and body moisturiser. In terms of location, the Paris is centrally located on the strip, so you are never more than a 20 minute walk to any of the other hotels. It is also connected to Bally's so, walking to the monorail station can be done indoors. We spent very little time in the hotel, but the details and effort put into the decor is astounding. The Village buffet is a must. It is designed to be a small French town each section of the restaurant is like being on a different street in the town. Very cute! I do recommend this hotel. The rates were very reasonable and we found we got our money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Less Ritzy than expected”
Reviews.Author: pkerx
Reviews.Content: We went for a 3 night stay to celebrate my birthday and have a romantic weekend away. I live in the second most popular vacation destination (Orlando), so I suppose I have high expectations when it comes to "wow factor". I have been to Vegas only once prior to this and was eager to stay at Paris because it looked like it would be very opulent and romantic. We arrived on a Friday morning around 11am and the check-in desk was swamped. We had a very friendly and helpful staff member check us in. She assisted us with an upgrade to a room with a view of the Strip (and Bellagio's fountains, although they won't say that) and offered us an upgrade to the Concierge level which gives you a continental breakfast each morning of your stay and a Happy Hour with 2 alcoholic beverages and a heavy appetizer buffet and as much non-alcoholic beverages as you care. That was a deal, really because nothing is too cheap in Vegas anymore. Definitely worth the extra if they can offer it and you like a drink before dinner or don't need a huge breakfast every day. We weren't able to get into our room until after 3pm, but we found plenty to keep us busy and the bellman kept our luggage (which they later delivered to our room). The room was on the 25th floor (plenty high enough for a good view), but it was a 2 queen bed room, instead of a 1 king room as requested (it was a romantic trip, after all). Unfortunately, there was nothing available that was comparable with a king bed so we didn't move. The bathroom had the pink marble and the separate shower and tub that other reviews described, but certainly nothing unusual or "wow" unless you live in a home with a dinky bathroom (I don't). The bath products were nothing special either (you would think they would provide some fancy French milled soaps or nice lotions/shower gels). The towels weren't particularly thick or soft and they will only bring robes to the room if you pay for them upfront-forget trying to ask for one from maid service...not happening! Another thing I should mention is the "fancy" drink/snack refrigerator: we had brought back 2 bottles of soda to the room and displaced a couple of beer bottles to make room for them. The refrigerator automatically charges you for anything that has been moved from it's spot for more than 45 seconds! We had to request those beers be removed from our bill, as well as a "romance kit" that contained KY and condoms that we had laughed about for at least a whole minute. The pool- it was only open to 7 or 8pm (still too hot in August to attempt that water which would actually feel cold compared to the 107 degree air). There were a lot of folks making a day of it there, though. The day we went to check it out (just before closing time) we were apalled. There were dirty/used dishes and glassware, food bits and trash all over the pool deck. It appeared that the wait staff had delivered food/drinks, but not bussed the remains. At the very end of our trip around the deck there was a large area where some partier vomitted his/her excess of the day and it was not cleaned. To be fair, we reported this to staff and wrote a complaint card which made it to the hotel manager the next day. As a result, we were allowed to check out late (6pm) which was helpful, since our flight wasn't due to leave until 1am. The casino_ I'm not a gambler and it's not my focus when I have gone to Vegas, but the casino is rather small. We won NOTHING and they don't really comp anything (free play) like some of the other places on the strip. They didn't really do well masking the cigarette smoke there either. Many of the other hotels work hard at making the evironment bearable for both the smokers and the non-smokers...not here. My husband sneezed every time we entered the Casino. The design of the casino floor/lobby was very pretty and different. It was confusing finding the various places you needed to find however (the check-in desk, the elevators, the path to Bally's). We didn't eat at any of the cafes, but we did eat at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant for dinner our last night. We had a spectacular view of the Bellagio fountains and the Strip. The wait staff seemed to say "thank you" just a bit too much, but they were very attentive. The food was delicious, although pricey (like I said, not too many inexpensive places for good food anymore). We made it to our last show of the stay (Anthony Cools-hypnotist) with only moments to spare, no thanks to a line of folks at the Will Call line picking up tickets for their ride on the Eiffel Tower (they really need that to stay separate) and staff members unwilling to "bend the rules". Anthony Cools' show was very funny, but very adult. If you are easily offended by vulgarity or sexual inuendo...this is not for you. Thankfully, neither my husband or I were hypnotized, but it was very entertaining watching those who were. They were extremely good sports. The last staff member we encountered was the bellman in charge of our luggage until the Gray Line shuttle was scheduled to pick us up. He was very helpful and was patient despite the fact we were his last set of luggage of his day. All in all, it was an ok hotel, but not as "fancy" as I expected for the same or less money.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mariaplancashire_UK
Reviews.Content: Great location for Las Vegas.The room was good with a decent view of the "strip" and the Arc de Triomphe!Breakfast in the village buffet was excellent value for money even though we did have to queue.The meal we had in le Provencal was so , so -it was expensive and the service was slow, but the singing was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mclaren1Ireland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Paris on Honeymoon in May. At check in we asked if there was any posibility of an upgrade given that we were on Honeymoon; the check in lady said we could upgrade for $200 a night for the next room up (which wasn't much diferent than the room we already had)! Obviously we declined, she didn't even congratulate us or wish us the best of luck for the future, just another example of staff with little or no people skills dealing with the public. Anyway aside from the check in lady being less than friendly; the hotel was great. The casino is nice & airy; there are plenty of restaurants & bars close to the casino floor. The bar & restaurant in the Eiffel Tower are fabulous, they have fantastic views of the strip & the Bellagio fountains & the menu is fabulous (Perfect for a romantic meal). The room was clean & had a large plazma TV but was nothing spectacular (it is identical to the rooms in TI), The pool area is the star of the hotel, the pool is huge & the staff are really friendly & there were always sun loungers available The Paris is a well located hotel that I would probably visit again

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: pje39
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the Paris - the location is ideal for las vegas. The rooms were large with 2 queen size beds with a really large bathroom. the check in took about 1 hour though!

Reviews.Title: “Quite Nice!”
Reviews.Author: PDXFolks
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend at the Paris and for the most part, really enjoyed our stay. Check-in was a breeze - I requested a room with a view of the strip (which I'm sure everyone does) and after a couple of attempts to upsell me, the Desk Clerk finally found a room where no additional charge would be necessary. It was a corner room on an upper floor with a lovely view of the Bellagio fountains. The Bellman was very expedient in delivering our bags as well! The decor was authentic French in shades of blue and taupe and the room was extremely spacious. The bathroom was also roomy with a seperate tub and shower. I did notice a slightly foul smell when running the sink but I've found this to be common in Las Vegas. The shower was slow to drain but I did not report it. I also noticed some moldy grout below the shower door but overall, it was clean and nice. There was also a high quality blow dryer which in a city like Vegas where I like to style my hair in the evening was a plus. The bed was nice and comfy! My husband and I were both pleasantly surprised at the cost of room service as well as the availability of reasonably priced food in other areas of the hotel. Continental breakfast, which included coffee for two, fresh squeezed juice and a nice assortment of pastries was only $13 and the service was quick. We also ate at the pool and once again, very reasonable - quite a few choices under $10. We split a turkey wrap and fries which was huge and delicious! Mon Ami Gabi is a favorite of mine and we had a nice dinner there as well. I'd say the only disappointing meal was a breakfast in one of the cafes - generic quality bacon and greasy hashbrowns - Denny's would be much the same. Note: the gift shops all charge $3.95 for a bottle of water. If you walk through Bally's which is attached and out the side door, there's a campy liquor store across the street which sells it for .79 cents a bottle. For beer and wine though, skip it and visit one on the strip - it's more economical. We both like the sun and the pool at Paris was really fun. They have a DJ and the music is quite loud but other than that it's a great atmosphere. The water temp was nice too! Gaming wasn't bad in the hotel - the machines did pay out somewhat and the Cocktail Waitresses were right on top of it. Proximity wise, Paris is in a great location to walk to other properties and offers a complimentary shuttle to the Rio Suites. The staff was friendly at every level down to the Housekeeper who said "good morning" each day in the hallway. We would both like to return and won't hesitate to recommend it to our friends. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Caniac
Reviews.Content: I took my mother to the Paris Hotel Las Vegas for her birthday on July 14-17 with a free 3 night award stay (Harrah’s) offer. We took the Grey Line shuttle from the airport and arrived at the hotel at around 12:15. At the ck in desk I told the nice lady that we would like a room on a high floor that had been renovated, non smoking. ( I had also made this request when the reservation was made by phone a few months prior.) I mentioned to the lady upon ck in that it was to celebrate my mother’s 81st birthday and that we were willing to wait awhile until a nice room became available. She assigned us a room # (2809) , gave us a piece of paper with a phone # on it and asked us to either call the # by 3 pm or ck in at the desk to see if the room was ready. With that, we went to have lunch at the cafe across from the lobby. A word about the hotel now.....it’s very impressive when you first see it...very tall and has an impressive replica of the Eiffel tower out front and the Arch de Triumph. The casino is the first thing you walk through on the way to the lobby ck in....very tall ceilings painted like the sky with clouds, at dusk, old fashioned street lamps, Parisian music in the background, sidewalk cafe adjacent to the casino and a long passageway of shops and restaurants that leads to Bally’s next door.....I felt like I was in Epcot Center the way it was done...but indoors....The Eiffel Tower base is actually on the casino floor and goes up through the roof beyond the ceiling....a bridge hovers over the casino floor that leads to the tower elevator......the lobby is done up like Versailles with gold and white walls, marble inlaid floors, and many brilliant ornate chandeliers. Our room was ready by 3:30 pm....with over 2000 rooms, it takes awhile to get them cleaned. We ascended to the 28th floor, which turned out to be a non smoking floor and entered our room....wow! What a view!! The nice lady at the desk gave us a view that was dead center looking out at the Eiffel Tower and Bellagio fountains...pool below....my mother was so happy, she went down to the front desk to personally thank the lady...who said...”Well, it’s your birthday”.....in addition to that, the room was renovated....metropolitan design in reds, blacks, beige and dark woods...red and gold silk drapes...pink marble bathroom floor, shower and vanity tops...large tub.....dual sinks.....2 queen pillow top mattress beds with duvets, huge entertainment center that housed a 36 inch flat screen HD tv...could have been larger than that.......it was incredibly nice for my Mother.....at bedtime it was fun to turn out the lights, pull open the drapes and watch the fountain show and tower all lit up..... The casino had good clientele but we had better luck across the street at the Bellagio. We had the buffet just one time at Bellagio and it was good. The cafe at Paris was great for breakfast and lunch. We like table service so it was great, but the hotel also has other options...self serve cafeteria style eateries in Parisian themes...and a walk -up Crepe station shop with adjacent seating. Did not try the Paris buffet......All I can say is, this hotel was just excellent in every way for us.....the monorail station is next door at Bally’s and we did use it to go over to Harrah’s and Mirage one day to gamble. Also, there is a free shuttle out in front of our hotel that comes every 30 minutes or less to take you to Rio Hotel and Casino.....we went once....did not care for atmosphere at Rio...looked older and not so fresh...also, was way off strip and in a rather sketchy area. We plan to return to Paris next time an offer comes up.....great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Just so-so”
Reviews.Author: LBLiz
Reviews.Content: I was in LV for a bachelorette party and we were in comp'ed rooms at the Paris so I obviously can't complain about the nightly rate! The rooms overall are okay but the beds and bedding desperately need updating. The mattresses are uncomfortable with zero padding between the sheets and the top of the mattress. The linens are so bleached that they are rough to the touch. We also were stuck in a smoking room (awful!) and although they came to spray twice it did not help. The smell permeates everything!

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: 4flyers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Vegas for a friend's wedding. The moment we became disappointed was when we walked through the door to our room. We ended up with a handicap room (not a big deal, but not what we wanted). We had a view of the rooftop to the hotel. There were long lines to get in the restaurants and they seemed a bit overpriced. The pool was closed for one day during our stay. The staff was friendly, but not very helpful. The good points are that the Paris is centrally located on the strip and the monorail runs through Bally's which is connected to the Paris. Needless to say, we probably will not stay there again. We were a bit disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Central Location”
Reviews.Author: brownsugar1
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Las Vegas, July 24-27. I went with 3 friends and we stayed at the Paris Hotel. Check-in was smooth and we waited about 10 minutes max in line. The room and bathroom was a good size for 4 women to feel comfortable. The beds were very comfortable. However, the room had a terrible view! Anytime we requested any items from housekeeping the staff we very prompt in filling our requests. We found it annoying that we had to walk through the maze of a casino to get to the elevators. This hotel is in a great location on the strip and close to Caesar's and Bellagio. We got a good rate on the package through US Airways vacations and we were all very pleased with this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Oh La La! Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: NE_FamilyJourney
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Vegas – We are not gamblers; We were celebrating our 10th. Anniversary and found Paris Las Vegas a great place to do so. We stayed for 3 Nights from 8/27/07 – 08/30/07. The Hotel is spectacular and we found everyone that we came across with at the hotel to be very helpful, polite and eager to help us. The rooms are decorated very nice and the bed were also comfy and great view it had a marble bathroom, very clean. The food was very good. I would highly recommend this hotel to my friends and I don't think I would be regretted by doing so.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive service- great for a convention”
Reviews.Author: howboutit
Reviews.Content: I was at Paris for Business, and had a wonderful time in the process. For our $119 weekday convention rate, I got a great room with a view of the strip, tower and fountains. The convention center is a great size and very accessible from the rooms, passing 2-3 places to pick up coffee or a snack. The employees at the business center were fantastic. I had several pick-ups, deliveries, copies and all were done quickly and cheerfully- a first in my business center experience. It is also conventienly located next to the convention areas. Most impressive however, was that I left my car keys in my room after checking out and leaving town. I figured I was out of luck, but a Paris employee (Maryanne) called me first thing the next day and let me know I left my keys, and asked where she should return them. She overnight mailed them for the next day delivery.

Reviews.Title: “Paris was nice.”
Reviews.Author: hypnoticrichard
Reviews.Content: Paris Hotel in Las Vegas, was exactly what I expected. very nice rooms, a mega-resort. Paris has one of the best buffets in town, great location (can't do better- center strip). Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: JulieCSTX
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Paris, previously we've stayed at the Bellagio or the Luxor. We booked this trip through Expedia with a luxury room. At check in, we asked the person if there were any complimentary upgrades available, he quickly gave us a premier room, newly decorated, with a GREAT view of the Eiffel Tower and the Bellagio Fountains right outside our window. Of course we did tip him a $20! The room was clean, comfortable, and I could not have asked for a better view. The staff was polite and courteous as well. While there we ate at the Le Artiste Steakhouse, tenderloin was great and caviar was perfect! The casino was not generous with drinks or winnings. Location was very good, walking distance to several fun casinos.The hotel stay was great, we will stay there again and we suggest to others give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Paris”
Reviews.Author: youngatheartdublin
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Paris for three nights with my two sons who are aged 18 and 16. We had a wonderful time. The Paris is one of Las Vegas’ "themed" hotels. The hotel has its own (almost life size) Eiffel Tower and Arc de Triomphe. Inside they have recreated a Parisian streetscape complete with cafes and bars and with a beautiful ceiling which gives the impression of being outdoors. Cost We paid $200 a night for a large en-suite room which contained two double beds, a table and arm chairs, a well stocked mini-bar and a stunning view of the Bellagio Fountains across the road. Las Vegas This was our first visit to Las Vegas and we were quite blown away by the place. I don't gamble but there is lots of free entertainment to be enjoyed here, some of which is unwittingly provided by fellow tourists! It's a greet place for people watching. Because of their ages my sons were asked to leave anytime they went into a casino, but these minor brushes with authority only seemed to add to their enjoyment of the place. Tony, Dublin

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: richard1s
Reviews.Content: Overall our stay at the Paris was very positive. Check-in process was a little tedious with a fairly long line on Sunday afternoon and took about 20 minutes. For a modest $65 a night we upgraded with the “Rendezvous Package” and got a great room on floor 29 with an incredible view of the Strip. The upgrade also included the hospitality room for continental breakfast, snacks and drinks. The hotel room was nicely decorated, had great linens, a very nice flat screen TV, I-pod player and a safe that was easy to set up. The hotel location is great, connected to Bally’s and a very easy walk to many hotels and casinos. Dealers and staff we encountered were friendly and courteous; for those who like a Sports Book, the Paris has a great one. The steak restaurant (Les Artisans) was excellent. Also, the casino doesn’t reek of smoke. We are frequent Vegas visitors and our first stay at the Paris was very positive; I wouldn’t hesitate to book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Rough start, great finish”
Reviews.Author: edboogie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Paris from July 13th to 16th. When we checked out of Bally’s and walked over to Paris check in there was a long line for people checking out and no positions indicating check in. We asked and were told to get in the line. The line moved pretty quickly and after 15 minutes we were talking to the desk agent. She was rather rude and abrupt. When my wife’s credit card was denied she was extremely condescending. When we tried mine, it too was denied, and she was even more condescending and told us to come back when we could pay for our room! We got out of line and called the credit card company and they said Paris didn’t even attempt a transaction! So we got back in line with the same girl who then tried my wife’s card again and it was denied. When we explained what the credit card company said the agent said it was against hotel policy to manually type in a credit card number but she would try, and it worked. Of course her card reader wasn’t working. The people she helped after us had the exact same problem. A very unnerving way to start a stay. We got a room on the 12th floor facing the airport. We just dropped off our bags and headed out for the day. When we got back my wife asked to talk to a manager at the front desk. She explained that the agent was very condescending and rude, and the manager said what could he do to make it better. My wife only asked for a room on a higher floor. The manager gave us a room on the 28th floor, facing the Eifel tower and Bellagio's fountains. The second room was the same size as the first, but was much, much nicer. Both rooms had separate showers and tubs, marble and granite in the baths, but this room had an individual cup coffee maker which the other room did not. It also had a HUGE flat panel HDTV. Also red leather embroidered head board on the bed and Ipod docking station. The whole room seemed to be a notch above the first. There was shampoo, conditioner, lotion and body wash in both rooms. Looking down from our room the pool looked huge, but when we went swimming it didn’t seem that big. We found chairs easily by the pool. We did go up the Eifel tower at night to watch the Bellagio fountains with the lights, really pretty. There are little vents that you can pull up on the windows and you can hear the Bellagio music. We ate at Mon Ami Gabi, and even though they were out of one dish, and ran out of one kind of wine, we had a very nice dinner. We also stopped in at Napoleons bar because we had a coupon for buy one drink, get one free. It was a pretty nice place, and the coupon really helped. We also bought a soda at the gift store by the elevators, and the clerk was extremely rude. As my wife was digging the change out of her purse he kept repeating over and over in a very irritated manner how much she owed him. I don’t know if they are trying to be like that, but I could do without the rudeness. Overall, our room was very clean and comfortable. The view was great. The rack rate on the door said $2000/night. The casino was clean and comfortable also. If I got a great deal to stay here again I probably would. The location is great. I could just skip the bad attitudes.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Kimbo2626
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris and overall really enjoyed it. The casinos are very nice, but the coctail waitresses seemed to be a little sparse. Our room was nice and comfortable, but we got two double beds instead of a king, after requesting a king. Really, not a big deal though. The rooms were clean and had ample room for all of our stuff. Our only complaint was the lack of hot water. I could never get any hot water in the bathtub and it took awhile to get any in the shower. We heard little noise while in our room (on the 17th floor). The pool area is very nice. Overall, we would definitely reccomend the Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Sucks, don't bother”
Reviews.Author: ladydocinchitown
Reviews.Content: Want to smoke? It's free on every floor - even the non-smoking ones and management doesn't care. I should have just slept on the casino floor. Want to check in? Be prepared to wait more than hour to do so, unless you have special status. Want your room cleaned? Sketchy at best. beware of the rubber glove(s) that get left in the hall way and stay there for more than 24 hrs. Wash your glasses before you use them. Want to sue? Go get ice. There are huge puddles that after calling into mgmt don't get resolved. Great for a slip and fall. Sure fire for a win in Vegas. Want to complain? Good luck!!! 5 phone calls to the front desk and 23 transfers later - the MOD (manager on duty) tells me to live with it. Want a concierge? Ha Ha - service is only available 4 hours each day and you have to wait in line for more than an hour to get it. Want to buy sundries? Wait in line for 45 minutes as the operators are not trained on the machines. God forbid they run out of paper (who would have thought that they would do volume?) The folks can't work the cash register and tell you to run across the street to do so - only they have the same issues. Want to watch to TV? Good luck with the remotes - the batteries need changing and most often we could'nt get it to come on. Want to complain? See above. Want restaurant recommendations? (oh wait, the concierge only works 4 hours a day and requires a line wait before servicing) Summary - if you do nothing but gamble and just need a place to crash and you don't care about the smoke smell - perhaps it is fine. If you are here for a conference and need to get work done - good luck. If you are a pampered guest - forget about it. With all the hotels available in Vegas, why stay here?

Reviews.Title: “un client heureux”
Reviews.Author: pcryan5
Reviews.Content: We visit Vegas about 6 times a year - mainly for business. We spent 3 nights at Paris for the first time and it was just fine. The location clearly is perfect - especially in the Vegas summer. Upon arrival we were perturbed to see a LONG line for check-in and had visions of an hour plus wait. Nope - the hotel had 12 windows open - check-in proceeded briskly and we were done in 20 minutes. Not award winning but hey - it was prime time. Our room was great - clean - above average bed - decent size bathroom with tub & separate shower. Nice big HDTV. The romantic french love seat however. très inconfortable. The only "low" point was their steakhouse. French it ain't. We were seated RIGHT next to a solo dinner in an otherwise empty and cavernous room. Why do they do that?!? A very mediocre meal for $350. Inattentive service. Pedestrian food. Boring. The pool was fine - not too crowded - lots of free chairs. Nice view of the surrounding environs. Good bar service. All well. Paris is what it is - an inexpensive hotel with a great location. It's not a 5 star hotel - nor does it charge like one. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: tatyanna
Reviews.Content: Very cool hotel - the Eiffel Tower is a must at night...AWESOME views!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Great Location, Although Not Happy with Management”
Reviews.Author: Coopsaremad
Reviews.Content: One negative experience with our billing and the manager's attitude and response to our issue overshadowed an otherwise great stay at Paris Las Vegas. We booked the basic room with a spa coupon code on the internet and were quoted 76/76/80 a night for a Sunday - Wednesday stay just after 4th of July. Booking a stay just after 4th of July is a great value and seems to rank right up there with the week before Christmas as a time to get some great rates. For the price, the room was a great value. Paris' room was very nice with updated furniture, TV, and internet access. The bathroom had a standalone shower and was a good size. The housekeeping staff and the rest of the service staff at the hotel were very pleasant and friendly. Compared to other places we've stayed such as NYNY and MGM, I was more impressed by Paris for value and quality. We used the spa which was nicer than NYNY's (by way of comparison) and my wife was happy with her spa services (stone massage and manicure/pedicure). For gaming action, I preferred to walk to Bally's which was connected without having to go outside. It seemed like the Bally's slots were looser and the tables were more friendly. I also like to play Poker and found Paris' room to be lacking. They have a 730pm NLHE tourney for a $65 buy-in which was a decent/standard tourney. However, I didn't like the cash games. With the poker room located in the sportsbook, cell phones are not allowed and it is annoying to deal with the management constantly reminding players to shut their phones off. Games also didn't last very long there (poker room is not open 24hrs)...Instead, I really enjoyed playing at Bally's Poker room for constant action and a good influx of players since it is located right on the casino floor. Anyway, in sum, I would avoid gaming/Poker at Paris. On the upside, I thought that the shops, restaurants, and buffet were nicer at Paris and provide for a good time when going out with your wife for the night. Paris is also conveniently located on the strip for access to Caesar's, Bellagio, etc.... The Paris pool was not fancy but serviceable...the nice part was that it was not crowded so it was a good place to relax without dealing with the crowds. So, overall, I would recommend Paris. However, I am only giving it two stars due to my issue below (long post): Now, for the bad part which was probably just unique to our situation: We booked through the hotel website using a spa code and ended up with discounted rooms. When we showed up, the desk clerk printed out a bunch of comp coupons for drinks, etc.. and one of them included "2 free stone massages." When my wife tried to use the coupon at the spa, the spa personnel seemed confused as if they had never seen this coupon (apparently, it was a newer promotion). They made some calls and told me it would be settled at the end of our stay. I should have known better. Since we had to settle the coupon up at the end of the stay, we had to go to the front desk vice using express check out which is a pain to start off with. When we tried to use the coupon, the front desk clerk was also confused and told us that we didn't have the spa package. She was friendly enough and got the manager to assist us. The manager told us firmly that we didn't have the spa package and asked to see our email or online printout. I didn't bring these with me on the trip and I found it annoying that I was being asked for proof for something in their computer system. Then he recalculated what the cost would be with the spa package and the bill came up to be $280 more even though my wife only did one massage for $170. So, now the manager was trying to charge us $280 more than what we had bargained for (including the "free" massage we were no longer getting). After arguing to no avail that we had booked at 76/76/80 (as the front desk clerk told us at check-in and what I reserved online) and arguing that we were given the free massage coupon by THEIR front desk, the manager was sticking to a charge of $280 more for a $170 massage! I told him that was unacceptable and that I would have been at least better off if I had just paid the cost of the massage and basic room night charges. He seemed confused because when he compared to the two bills he forgot to apply our deposit and finally figured it out. Ultimately, we ended up paying for the massage plus the 76/76/80 rates. Not only did we not get the "free" massage under the coupon provided to us at check-in, what I found most annoying about the experience was the manager's attitude towards us. He implied that we were lying to him about what we had booked and generally could care less about our concerns. From our perspective, I felt like we were "baited and switched." We booked at 76/76/80 online, the front desk gives us a "free" massage coupon, we use it (only half of it), and then they try to hit us with an extra $280 charge for the $170 massage. My wife would have probably gotten a massage anyway without the coupon, but the whole billing mess and the manager's condescending/could care less attitude really upset us. When I asked how I could provide feedback to his company about the apparent bug in their online code system, he seemed to cast me off and said you can fill out a comment card. No matter how decent a value Paris Las Vegas was----- I will not stay there again because of the management's treatment of our situation. I will plan to stay at another location where our business will feel more appreciated and will make sure to pursue Paris' management about how we were treated.

Reviews.Title: “Reckless, Thieves, Rude”
Reviews.Author: ShebaLio2099
Reviews.Content: BEWARE when booking the Paris Hotel………….the staff at the Paris is RUDE, CONDESCENDING, THIEVES and RECKLESS. Because I booked my travel including hotel through Expedia they refused to honor the promotions advertised on their website at the time of booking. Next, when we were checking out, we declared no incidentals but the front desk staff refused to provide us with a “close-out account” bill because we had prepaid our reservations through Expedia. When my credit card bill arrived, the hotel had posted mini-bar charges that we NEVER consumed. This is now being disputed with the credit card company and the Paris Hotel. Finally, because their checkout time was at 11:00 and our flight was not until later that evening, we left our bags with the bellmen. When we came back later that evening to pick up our bags and take the shuttle to the airport, my NEW convertible backpack/roller-wheel bag’s (I paid $90.00US) handle had been broken off and they conveniently hid the handle in one of the front pockets. We did not notice this until our bags were handed to us by the shuttle driver at the airport. We immediately called the hotel’s security office before boarding our plane to report the incident and I was later contacted by an investigations company, Cannon Cochran Management Services Incorporated (CCMSI) who basically sent us a letter two months after the incident, closing the case and attached a copy of the “Nevada Revised Statues”, they misspelled “statutes”. CCMSI stated that “the hotel is not civilly liable for loss, damage or destruction of property brought onto the premises by a guest in the absence of gross neglect by the owner or keeper of the hotel”. Hmmmm, why am I not surprised?? We could have figured this out and saved the Paris Hotel their $200 or $300 fee for CCMSI and our aggrevation. It makes more sense for the Paris Hotel to own up to their negligent and reckless behavior and pay $90.00. In all the years that I, my family, and my friends have left to gamble, we will NEVER go back to the Paris Hotel or any of its affiliated properties: Harrah’s, Caesars, Bally’s, Flamingo, Rio, Horseshoe, Casino, Casino Windsor, Grand Biloxi, Grand Casino Resort, Harvey’s or the Showboat! I would much rather pay a few dollars and do all my gambling at the Bellagio, Venetian, Wynn or the Mirage who have impeccable customer service, treat their guest and their property with RESPECT. BEWARE of the Paris Hotel in Las Vegas!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Paris Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: austravelAustralia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paris Las Vegas in early 2008 as part of a world trip and I loved it. The rooms were spacious, well appointed and clean. The room had a TV, excellent mini bar (best I had in the US) and coffee maker. The facilities in the hotel were also very good. There is a business centre (shared with Bally’s) that can be used for internet access, printing, etc (it is a paid service but is not very expensive). The choice of cafes and restaurants is also very good. The self-parking is good but it is a long walk to the check-in desk of the hotel, which is a bit of a downside. The only other negative for me was the walk through the smoky casino at ground level, which you would get in any Vegas hotel, but I must say there wasn’t even a hint of smoke in the rooms themselves which was excellent (as sometimes even non-smoking rooms can get smoky in casino hotels due to the air-conditioning systems, but not in this one). Vegas is an exciting city and this hotel provided an excellent base for exploring all attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a little improvement, but liked it!”
Reviews.Author: MaYBaBeOSU13
Reviews.Content: Check in: We checked in on a Saturday late afternoon, July 5th, and it went very quickly and smoothly. Room: Other reviews are right...the beds are VERY hard! Yet, neither my mom, who is 55 with arthritis, or I woke up sore from the beds. But, the beds had nice feather comforters on them, not the crappy thick, old cotton ones you often get at like a Holiday Inn. We could not get one of the renovated rooms, so we were in an older room. However, the room looked amazing for being an "old" room. The shower and bath tub were separate, so that was nice, and the bathroom had plenty of space and amenities. The decor was very nice and fitting too! Everything from the hotel lobby, walkways, room, bathrooms, etc. was EXTREMELY clean. I'm a clean freak, and it impressed me. Our room faced the construction, but we could still see MGM, Mandalay Bay, and PH. It costs $65 to upgrade to a room with a complete view of the strip, but we didn't do that. We were only in the room to sleep or change clothes, so the view wasn't a concern. Pool: Some people in past reviews complained about the pool, and I see why, but it was still amazing to me. The pool wasn't anything fancy like some of the cool designs of other hotels' pools, but it was still amazing just because of the view. The pool is a big octagon with plenty of surrounding space & chairs and fun, current music. It's right next to the Eiffel Tower (the base of it is literally right next to the pool area), and straight ahead of the pool you look at Caesars (it's not behind the hotel like most pools). It was a very nice setting, even though it didn't have a lazy river or cool waterfalls. I loved it because laying out is one of my fav. things to do, so it made the hotel worth staying!! You get a free towel by the pool and drink/food wait staff too. Tips: If you're going to watch TV a lot (which I assume few people will!), don't stay here because other than FOX and a few crappy sitcom channels, you only get Asian speaking channels, Paris hotel promotions channels, and channels that teach you how to play different games/slots. Also, my mom is a huge coffee drinker, and the room did not have a coffee pot. It cost her $13 to order a pot of coffee! As for the stocked, in-room fridge...be careful! If you take any item out of it for 45 seconds or longer, you automatically get charged for it because it has sensors that detect when items disappear. My mom bought a bottled water downstairs (there is a little convenient shop by bottom elevators) and put it in an empty slot in our fridge (from a bottled Gatorade I previously drank), but when she took it out to drink, she got charged for it because the sensors assumed she took a fridge item out, not something we already bought! So, needless to say, you cannot store anything in the room fridge. Casino: Everytime I went to the casino, not many people were playing cards, but they always were at Bally's. The slots weren't very loose, so we hardly played there. Overall: I really enjoyed it because of the atmosphere and pool. I would stay again, but I would look at other hotels too because hard beds are just ridiculous, and I want a fridge where I can store my own food/drinks because it's too expensive to buy every drink/food from a pre-stocked fridge or restaurant. If you see random people on the walkways selling bottled water for $1, take it! It's just the cheap spring water they prob. get for 30 cents a bottle, but it beats paying $5-6 bucks elsewhere! Just make sure the safety cap hasn't been busted! :) It seems like the hotels try to get you to pay for every little thing, which is ridiculous, because we would spend more money gambling if we weren't paying outrageous prices for other things! The location is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Paris didn't meet Expectations”
Reviews.Author: TresLaLa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, as well as 2 other couple friends visited Paris Las Vegas for the 3 days before the 4th of July. The rates were great - about $80 each night booked directly through the hotel's website, using a link I found on Facebook. (I wasn't able to find this rate just searching through the Paris website, which was a bit frustrating.) This was my 3rd time in Vegas -- other times I stayed at the Venetian (on business) and MGM Signature (for my bachelorette party). I was really looking forward to staying at Paris, but was disappointed. We were on the 19th floor - a nonsmoking floor. But, our bathroom smelled like cigarettes. Same issue for one of the other couples with whom we traveled. It was almost unbearable the first night. I think the smoke traveled through the vents, and housekeeping had our bathroom door closed, so it was "stuck" in the bathroom. Once we kept the door open, it dissipated a bit on the other days. We couldn't change rooms because they didn't have any other king rooms available (which seemed odd). There were certain things that I expect of a hotel of this calliber, but were missing: robes and coffee machines in the room. There are also extras that would have made it better - not necessary, but "would be nices": a little refrigerator that we could use (the minibar was timed, and if you moved anything, within 45 seconds you'd be charged for it) and an iPod docking station. At MGM Signature, every room gets 2 bottles of water a day - really nice when it's 108 degrees! Also, being in the desert in June/July, I would have assumed that the hotel would provide body or hand lotion (along with the shampoo, conditioner, etc.). While I brought some, my husband was not too keen on using my "glittered" body lotion! It'd be so easy for them to provide this!While none of these are obviously deal-breakers, it was frustrating that we were at a "Luxury hotel" without any real luxuries - even missing basics that I could get at the Courtyard by Marriott! The parking garage seems to be really far from reception. I'd recommend valet parking. We ate at 2 restuarants there: the deli-type place, where we had a chicken salad sandwich & soup, and at Le Village, the buffet. The deli was disappointing. How do you have a french deli without a brie sandwich? I'll be posting another review for Le Village, but I would definitely recommend it (just pace yourself!) We spent the first afternoon at the pool. It's on the 3rd floor and can get a bit windy. We rented 2 rafts ($15 each) for 4 of us to share. The pool was much more subdued than the one at MGM - different clientele, apparently. The frozen drinks were good (a bit pricey at $18 each for a large) -- just be sure to drink it before it melts -- once that happens, it's like drinking strawberry syrup... The very central location was great, and the bloody mary at the little kiosk bar in the little village was fantastic! I also really enjoyed my strawberry daquiri in the ceramic hotair balloon! Overall, for the price, it was definitely a steal. But, for a higher price, I'd prefer to try something new or go back to MGM Signature.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location near bus stop”
Reviews.Author: yeowon
Reviews.Content: We were a family party staying in three rooms for three nights. Our rooms averaged $144 per night incl tax, booked through the hotel website. We got 8th floor rooms facing the Eiffel tower and pool, no view of the strip as too low down however you really do get the atmosphere when you get this view as opposed to other parts of the complex that don’t look out towards the tower. The check in person said we could upgrade to views of the Strip for an extra $70 per night. We declined this offer. Good central location near bus stop and opposite the Bellagio fountains With the 100 degree heat everyday we were there the best aspect of this hotel is the central location, there is a bus stop just outside the hotel that has the Deuce, double decker bus that takes you up and down the strip and into downtown – tickets $5 for 24 hours. By having it right outside you don’t get too hot and bothered before your day has even started. The other great thing about this hotel is that you can catch the Bellagio fountains across the road several times. These fountains must be the most beautiful fountains in the world. The highlight of the trip for us was seeing those fountains. They go from 12pm till 12 am. Half hourly until 6 I think and then every 15 minutes. We quite often would go out for the evening and then get back to the hotel about 11pm and watch a few sessions of the fountain. Food outlets are decent The hotel is midrange, the food outlets are pretty good, buffet breakfast was great for $14.99 incl drinks, a bit of a queue at 10am when we went down. This cleared quickly. The crepes restaurant opposite is also very good. Extras at the hotel are pricey The only think I didn’t like about the hotel is that there is an obvious drive to clip the ticket at every possible moment. Eg no coffee maker in the room so you have to go and buy a drink, nowhere to sit down in the reception and common areas so you have to buy a drink, there is a machine in the lift entrance for printing airline boarding tickets, this costs minimum $5 access fee and $1 per printout, so could get pricey for a big group, internet access for your laptop is $13.99 per day!. There were a couple of maintenance issues in our room, one being the air con didn’t work well, however once the filter was changed it was fine. The maintenance people came within 20 minutes every time we called them. All in all I think the hotel is good value, if you book early enough ( I noticed the rates on the website went up considerably in the 10 days before our arrival – may have been due it being booked out by the moose conference that was staying there.) The central location is the key to the hotel and it’s midrange pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: dinot2000
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Paris Hotel during our honeymoon from 6/26 to 6/30. Check-in process took about 10 minutes and the person at the desk was friendly and quick. Having booked our room through a broker (hotels.com), we expected to get a room overlooking a wall, garage, or something like that, but were pleasantly surprised with a view of the pool, Eiffel Tower, Ceasar's, Bally's and part of Bellagio. Room number was 623. We're not big on gambling so the casino was not too much of an interest to us but should say that it's probably the smallest casino on the strip. There are several restaurants inside the hotel but we only ate at two of them because every time we went downstairs, there were long lines. For breakfast, you should visit La Creperie and for dinner, Mon Ami Gabi which is an excellent and romantic restaurant with very accommodating wait staff. Another great place to eat is at Rio's Carnival World Buffet. We ate there twice. With so many different choices of food and desert, you will soon realize why even the toughest critics rate it as the best all-you-can-eat in Vegas. We also spent a lot of time just hanging out by the pool. It's big enough to accommodate a large group of people. Water was warm but it helps when the the weather is between 104-108 degrees. Paris Hotel is conveniently located near many of most desirable locations on the Strip. It's close to the Forum Shops and it's right across from Bellagio Fountains and right next to Miracle Mile Shops which has a convenience store where you can actually get bottled water for $.99. Our stay was enjoyable and would recommend it to anybody. Rooms aren't as great as some of the other upscale hotels but they are not bad either.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: ndmd
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, 3rd time I have stayed here. It looks even nicer since Harrah's took over. Rooms and bath are spacious. Staff is friendly. Check in and check out easy and quick. Food in cafe is very nice excellent bakery. Excellent value I left the Bellagio as I was disappointed and checked into the Paris - consistently excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Really liked Paris Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Nurseaudrey
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with Paris Las Vegas. Here are the facts: the room was nice and large and had ample sitting areas. We had a view of a concrete top to the casino so I can't review on the view. The TV was not a new flat screen like so many places now have. The bed was very flat - I am learning I am spoiled at home with the thick pillow top I have! So many hotels do not have pillow top beds and it really affects my sleep in hotels. The bathroom was large and nice. The charge for Wireless internet was around $15 for 24hrs and I found that to be a bit much, but it didn't bother me. There were TONS of sightseers at the hotel/casino and made it difficult to get around. The casino was nice and fun but I found that I had more fun at downtown casinos where the minimum at the tables weren't so high. I really enjoyed the lovely bathroom. It was large and had a nice bathtub and separate shower. The shower was very nice - a little bit of mold but I think it is to be expected. The cleaning staff occasionally left things in the room - when we first got in the room there was an empty bottle of cleaner next to the phone. The next day a used cleaning cloth was next to my sink. Little things that really didn't matter too much but did stay in the back of my mind. The bell hops were great - one did mention a good way to get downtown was by the shuttle system. It costs $5 per person (I think for a 24 hr day). It did take a while to get downtown (35 min) since it stopped at many major hotels but definitely worth it when you consider the cost of a cab ride would be about $40. The ride back was considerably longer (1hr) because it was about 4:15 in the afternoon and EVERYONE was going to the strip. Going downtown during the day was a great idea. We stayed there all day - Fremont has that wonderful awning(?) and I didn't feel the heat of the day at all. I was very surprised. The crowds were non-existent, unlike the strip! Overall a great trip and was please with Paris. Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “il est horrible”
Reviews.Author: timbovt
Reviews.Content: My partner and I attended the APA conference in Las Vegas. The opening dinner reception was at Paris. The worst ever. The room was not big enough for the crowd,. Not enough seats, people sat on the floor. They stopped serving as people were still in line. Ran out of food. Ran out of desserts. Ran out of drinks. The sound. Was retched, it was like being at a boat show. The public address system was so loud you could not make out what was being said. There was nothing vegetarian, Evey thing was meat. Cheese in salad. Cream in risotto. Egg in the little quiche. My ticket was $70 to sit on the floor. The beef was so salty you could not eat it. How are you supposed to eat a slice of beef while standing, with no table. I guess I expected more from a city of conventions. I expected Whow from a convention hotel in Vegas. I thought the food was going to be amazing not food service heat and serve from Costco. I thought the sound from the band was going to be amazing, considering all the shows in Vegas.
