Not all garbled and distorted like a garage band. I was expecting something that I would go home and rave about, not coming on Trip Advisor and complaining about $70 cold, supermarket appetizers, and sitting on the floor.............. (if you work for Paris by all means contact me, be more than happy to give you the low down) Very Disappointed, the $1.99 shrimp cocktails on Freemont St were better than this.......

Reviews.Title: “Paris: Not the real thing, but close enough. :)”
Reviews.Author: uvaleg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris for two nights in mid-June. As a Francophile, I had always wanted to stay there just for kicks, and we also booked the trip through Travelocity and received two-for-one tickets to see Penn & Teller. Paris is just like every other hotel on the Strip in that you have to weave your way through what feels like acres of slot machines and stores to get to the guest elevators, but once you make it to your room, they're quite comfy and nice. Ours had a nice, big bathtub that I wasn't able to take advantage of, and a spacious shower. (I tend to gauge hotels by their bathrooms... this one was excellent... it even had a sweet ceramic hair dryer that made me want to come home and splurge on one. :) ) One of the things I loved about Paris is the pool right under the Eiffel Tower. We were less than impressed with the service at the poolside restaurant for breakfast (it took an hour for french toast and a breakfast burrito), but we heard other patrons saying that just the day before they had received very speedy service, so we are pretty sure that part was a fluke. The staff were very friendly, and there are many, many food and shopping options in the casino, all laid out in a quaint French avenue setup. Having been in most of the casinos in the central part of the Strip, I found the setup at Paris the easiest to navigate and most convenient... but that could just be because I like imagining I'm back in the real Paris. :)

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special at the Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: megan_e_m
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 2 night stay at the Paris hotel. We'd requested a corner room, but none were available so we were given a different room which did have a nice view of the Bellagio fountains. I used to love going to lunch at Le Cafe Ile Saint Louis but we went there for breakfast and it was horrible. The poolside food offerings were fine, but none of the food there was very good. I wasn't too impressed by the 2 long black hairs in the shower, or the greasy fingerprints on the window. Obviously the room wasn't cleaned very well. I complained to the front desk about these things when I was checking out and wasn't offered any discount, which was upsetting. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Sarafina77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married in Vegas and honeymooned at the Paris. I was a little worried because I'd read some negative reviews, but I have to say there wasn't a thing I would have changed! We had heard that if you slip a $20 to the front desk clerk and ask for an upgrade that you get one, and it worked! She advised me that all of the renovated rooms (above floor 20 something) belonged to the casino, but they released what was left at 3pm and we could have one. The room was really comfortable, the bed was great, we especially loved the shower and tub seperate in the bathroom, as it helped us get ready quicker in the mornings. We loved the central location, all the employees were pleasant and helpful, all of the food we ate when we were there was great. The restaurants at the Paris were much better than next door at Ballys. They have create your own mashed potatoes at Les Artistes Steakhouse - we did Brie and mushrooms and they were amazing. Food is a little spendy there, but we got in and out with no problems, and had great service.

Reviews.Title: “A most excellent adventure”
Reviews.Author: BostonGazelle
Reviews.Content: First time in Vegas - am not a gambler Stayed last week from 6/17-6/20/08 while in town for a convention. Arrived on a Tuesday afternoon with a splitting headache and it must have shown because the desk clerk asked if I felt OK. When I explained she arranged for a room on the 30th floor at the end of the hall so that it would be a little more quiet. She inquired if I wanted a view (I told her no that I would prefer "peace & quiet") and offered a 1:00pm checkout on Friday if I would like. The room was big and comfortable; king size bed, plasma TV, love seat, desk, separate tile shower, hairdryer, iron/board, personal safe, coffee maker. After a short rest and aspirin, went downstairs and had a late lunch/dinner @ Mon Ami Gabi which ran @ $80 for two main courses (halibut and filet mignon) , wine and a tip. Service was excellent, waitress helpful and attentive. Had breakfast the next morning at La Cafe Ile St. Louis which was good but a little pricey (@ $54 with tip and they charged $4.50 for a12oz glass of OJ - had the Eggs Benedict.) The hotel got busier closer to the weekend so I noticed that the lines were a little long at some of the restaurants during peak meal times. On Thursday and Friday morning we ate in the Patisserie - coffee, croissant breakfast sandwiches, etc. Noticed that people would go in with their "used" coffee cups and get refills at no charge. Don't know if this is an accepted practice but no one stopped them. Since we were at a trade show at the LV Convention Center with even longer lines - grabbed a couple of the baguettes (bacon/cheddar - olive/rosemary - sour dough) and made lunch with those which worked out well. Used the monorail which you can access through the walkway between Bally's and Paris which I found very convenient and fast. Took advantage of the pool late in the day (it had been 106 degrees everyday we were there) so I didn't mind the fact that the pool is not heated. Water clean, towels available and lounge chairs seemed to be in abundance. Upon arriving home, hubby realized that he must have left his keys in the hotel room (think they fell out of pocket when he hung pants over the love seat and they fell behind the seat. Called out to the hotel, spoke to lost and found and was told housekeeping had found them and turned them in. The hotel policy is to UPS Ground deliver such items at no charge to the guest - we opted to have them overnight them on our company UPS account. Good as their word, they arrived today. The only criticism I can offer is that when it came time to check our luggage for a later pick up there was some confusion as to where to go and how the process worked - but I tend to be hypercritical on organizational details. I found everyone I came in contact with at the hotel to be helpful, polite and eager to please. The food was uniformly good to very good. I recently stayed at Disney World, Coronado Springs Resort for another convention and paid $50 more for a much smaller, less comfortable room, and the food was just OK. I would highly recommend this hotel to a friend and I don't think I would be embarassed by doing so.

Reviews.Title: “Just So So”
Reviews.Author: Snugdad
Reviews.Content: I'll preface by saying my wife and I are not gamblers so it's not a review of that aspect. The casino was the nicest we saw with respect to atmosphere. The high skylike ceilings were impressive and the open feeling was refreshing compared to the others we saw. The room was adequate. I'd rate it a notch above a decent Holiday Inn type room. Nothing special but nothing wrong either. The food options seemed quite limited. All restaurants had a French theme and all seemed a bit stuffy. Unlike the Toby Keith Bar and Grill at Harrah's, there was no casual place to grab a drink and/or sandwich. I will mention the prices seemed incredibly high but that's probably more indicative of Las Vegas than Paris in particular (although I can't say for sure). Finally, the service seemed authentically French in a stereotypical way. Many servers and bartenders seem adept at treating American tourists like crap. The bartenders at Napolean's piano bar were so bad I completely stiffed them on any tip the last night there (this is something I have never done). The staff "attitude" in general ruined the overall pleasantly unique decour of the hotel/casino. If I return to Las Vegas in the future I will definitely try someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Fun at Paris”
Reviews.Author: TomiJohn
Reviews.Content: We had a great time. The renovated rooms are decorated nicely. They are on the small size but ok for the time we were there. The casino was very fun. Smoke was not an issue at all. We only play slots and had good luck and a lot of fun too. The drink service was excellent. I had a nice time at the pool. It is very cold but feels good in the summer heat. Drinks are very expensive at the pool. Make sure you have dinner at Mon Ami Gabi. It is excellent. There is a Mexican Bar and Grill in Bally's that has good $4.00 shots and margaritas from 4:00-6:00. They have guitar music. We had a ball there. The lady at check in was a bit snooty but everyone else was very nice and helpful. One thing that annoyed me was we didn't get our room cleaned until very late in the afternoon. We like to get up early and rest in the afternoon so we can stay out late so this was a problem for us. Do the Eiffel Tower Experience at night. It is breath taking. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “C'est Bon!”
Reviews.Author: AgnesTheScottie
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I were meeting in Vegas for our first annual girls' weekend. Originally we were planning to stay in New York, New York, but we discovered they were undergoing renovations. After some thought, we chose Paris for the location. We checked in after midnight on our first night and the staff was very accomodating. They didn't have a room that we'd paid for, so they upgraded us to a suite for no extra charge that night. The suite had a view of the Eiffel tower, the pool, and the Bellagio fountains across the street. Once we moved to our regular room, we had no complaints. It was a fairly standard hotel room. The bathroom was spacious and well lit. The beds were a little on the hard side, but not unbearable. My back probably needed the extra support anyway. I was pleasantly surprised at how not smoky the casino area was. I'm very sensitive to cigarette smoke and I sat for an hour with no problems. We ate at 3 of the restaurants in the hotel and all of them were very good. We probably could've eaten every meal in the hotel and never repeated a restaurant during our stay. The shopping areas were nice to just walk through and window shop. The one negative experience was with the spa. We booked several treatments and the price was grossly misquoted. When we showed up, we were informed that we would pay almost double for what we'd booked. However, since it was already booked we would incur a fee if we canceled any of the treatments (50 minute massage, facial, and mani/pedi). I would recommend going to the spa directly and asking about prices and booking. I was left to the mercy of the person who answered the phone and clearly had no idea what was going on. Overall, I would definitely stay there again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Newly Renovated vs Older style Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ginberry
Reviews.Content: Don't worry if you aren't able to get a newly renovated "red" room. We missed out after arriving very late one Thurs and they didn't have any left that night (however they did offer us to switch rooms for the remaining nights). We were thinking of doing that but after seeing and staying in one of the older styled rooms we decided to stay put. They are much nicer than what they look in the photos. Clean, comfortable, good temp. We found the hotel to be the perfect location (esp in the heat), had great amenities (more shade options around the pool would be good) and the staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sreynolds
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Paris Las Vegas and we treated very well throughout the stay. Having arrived with thousands of other Brits for the Ricky Hatton fight in the Ballroom located in the hotel we thought that the staff would be a little overwhelmed with the numbers, but in fairness it was the complete opposite. No matter what time of day or night the staff are friendly, courteous and reliable. The rooms themselves are Clean, tidy and spacious more than adequate if you want to spend some time there (Not sure why you would want to!!) or even if you use it as a base. Room service was readily available and fast no matter time of the night you called them and the price of the food was very reasonable. Check Out was painless and with the Airport at the other end of the strip you dont have to leave too early which is a good thing as we nearly missed our flight!! The staff were friendly and helpfull even when we returned to the UK. I left my mobile phone in the room and with a couple of calls to the Hotel to confirm some details it was arranged for the phone to be Fed Ex'd to me with minimum fuss or expense. It is a hotel that i would recommend to anyone and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Expected a Bit More”
Reviews.Author: nadine2885
Reviews.Content: Perhaps this hotel was inexpensive for Las Vegas standards but we expected more. The room itself was fine, although the beds were very, very hard. There was a small fridge in the room but it was only for the beverages they wanted guests to purchase. The ground level (to exit the hotel) was very, very smoky due to the casino so if you hate cigarette smoke, this isn't the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Paris”
Reviews.Author: bfm336
Reviews.Content: We did our honeymoon for five days at Paris Las Vegas. We're an early 20 something couple but we act like we're 40. We really enjoyed Paris, we had a great room facing the Eiffel Tower and the Bellagio Fountains. Many a night we spent on the little sofa by the window watching the fountains. The room was nice, luxurious king size bed with down pillows. The room was clean and everything was replaced each day (except sheets, which you had to ask for). Room had a 42" plasma in it which was nice, and there WAS HD programming. The concierge was helpful, booking us tickets to see "O" (which you MUST see, I don't care what TA says it is the best thing to see in Vegas) and by letting us know to go to the Bellagio buffet before 4pm to pay lunch prices and get switched food at 4. Overall the Casino isn't bad, it seems a little small and I prefer the casino at the Bellagio if you like it a little upscale. We didn't do much gambling, spent most of our honeymoon checking out all the free things to do and took in two shows. The monorail was a great idea. Paris had a great atmosphere that I would recommend to anyone (especially younger folks) looking for a great place to stay that isn't the best casino and isn't the best early 20s party club. But hey, it was a great place to stay and we took advantage of all the stuff on the southern strip.

Reviews.Title: “Oh La La!”
Reviews.Author: DelilahsPicks
Reviews.Content: Booked this through Vegas.com for a 3 night stay in Vegas. You have to watch these online sites because though we booked a King Room when we arrived we found out that it was first come first serve so we would have to upgrade to get the room we wanted. Not ideal but the room was beautiful and had a view of the Eiffel Tower and the Mirage water show. The hotel was very nice - rooms were clean and the help was nice if a little snooty - But what's new when you go to Paris? Restaurants were yummy but watch the buffet the long line isn't really worth the price and if you get on line at 10 and don't get in until 11 you'll be served lunch instead of breakfast. Perfect for a Romantic getaway or family trip. We did take advantage of the pool and enjoyed - they'll serve you Pina Coladas in the water!

Reviews.Title: “Little Overrated in my Opinion”
Reviews.Author: DarthBane
Reviews.Content: To be honest, I was a tad disappointed with the Paris Hotel. For the price, it may not be quite a tear 1 hotel on the strip (Wynn, Bellagio, Mandalay Bay, Venetian, MGM, Caesars), but it's pretty close, and I didn't think it came close to those others in terms of quality. The rooms were nice and open. Beds were very comfortable. Had a nice view and felt at home in the room. Pool was just ok for me. Not big enough to accommodate the crowds really. Food was above average especially Ah Sin, the Asian restaurant there. Really good and is has outdoor seating. I'd avoid Le Provencal as it's overpriced and just average. Stick to the top tier places to eat there. Front desk was a little slow and only had 2 people working with a long line. That always irritates me as other hotels on the strip are not like that. Overall it was just average. If this hotel was anywhere else, I may give it a higher score, and let me tell you why. In my opinion, if you're going to go to Vegas and spend over $250 for a room, then go first class and go to the big boys I listed above. For me, it's a lot of money to spend on a place that's a tier 2 hotel in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Paris ???”
Reviews.Author: robster_8
Reviews.Content: The OOO La La show was the worst money we could have spent. Even at half price it was a joke. We were glad it was only an hour . We kept waiting for it to get better but that never happened. Should have left early for a refund. Definitly a tourist stop. Spend you gambling dollars elseware. The hotel is ok but there are much better for the dollars spent. Credits were taken out of our players credit instead of compted. Very dissapointing. Harraghs are great properties but not this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NanNanDaphne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Paris from June 1 -5, 2008. Check in was very smooth and took about 15 minutes. Staff was very courteous and the room was great. Everything looked brand new. The pool was great (water was very cold). The only negative thing I have to say is that the prices of drinks by the pool were very expensive but I guess you expect that at a resort. $7 beer and $12 or $18 for mixed drinks. The $18 drinks were big drinks but that's a little steep for a drink in my opinion. We booked the OOh La La show there at the Hotel......don't waste your money. It was very cheesy to say the least. I would certainly stay here again. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool area”
Reviews.Author: max_washedup
Reviews.Content: The Paris Las Vegas has some good and bad features although mostly had a good experience. Stayed there 5 nights, staff were friendly, an amazing rerstuarant that looks across to the Bellagio, pool area really nice. The cons were noise and the cost of the extra's. To use the gym was 25 dollars per person per day to use internet access was 13.99 dollars per laptop per room a day and casio in general was fairly smoke filled.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and value for money”
Reviews.Author: ChaninSydney
Reviews.Content: There is no single mistake I can pick on. It was fantastic. - Conceige was super friendly, - The room was clean and tidy with excellent TV with hundreds of channel, - Room services was friendly and smart, - the bathroom is huge and grand, - Buffet at La Village (downstair) was awesome. - Good location in the Strip,

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but overpriced for what you get”
Reviews.Author: luvmy3jewels
Reviews.Content: During the last week of April, I attended a conference that was held at Paris/Ballys. I decided to book a room at Paris for my husband and I for the convenience. Overall, this hotel was OK, but I really expected something nicer for the money that we paid. On the second morning of our stay, we heard a commotion from the room next door and saw a hotel security man knocking on the door. We later found out that the couple's room had been broken into the previous night and several things were stolen. The same morning I noticed a young woman crying in the elevator, and she also had had her room broken into the night before. Needless to say this made us a little nervous, and for the rest of the stay we blocked our door with a suitcase before going to bed every night. The rooms were clean and Paris has a great location mid-strip. However, I was spooked by the two room burglaries and for the money spent we could have stayed somewhere much nicer. If you do choose to stay here (or even if you stay somewhere else), don't miss the breakfast buffet or Mon Ami Gab, where the french onion soup is to die for!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VipB
Reviews.Content: The Paris Las Vegas is not as glamorous or as big as some of the other hotels in Vegas, but it is an excellent choice to stay. It is located in the center of the new part of the strip, it has great restaurants, and its prices are usually very competitive (I paid $190 for two nights, a Wednesday and a Thursday in May). This was my second time in vegas and the second time I stayed at the Paris. When I go back I will look to stay at a different hotel only to experience something different, but will not hesitate to stay at the Paris again if the price is right again.

Reviews.Title: “Paris was great!”
Reviews.Author: Kerrysnaith789
Reviews.Content: We stayed the middle 2 weeks in May 08 and it was fantastic. We checked in around 2.30 pm and there was no que at all. We got our room straight away and it was on the 17th floor, big room too! Everything was ok apart from the sheets needed replacing as they had a small tear in some of them and the maid never dusted either bedside unit. Other than that it was great. The view we had was the side of Bally's hotel from one window and the other window we saw about 3/4 of the Bellagio fountains, we were never bothered by any noise either. The food places were nice but a little more costly than outside the hotel, not much though. The breakfast buffet in the Paris was really good, a massive selection of all sorts for £14.99 each before tax and tip. The cocktails by the pool were very expensive $12 for a small strawberry one. And you can sit at the slots etc and get all drinks for only $1 tipping the waitress. We enjoyed sitting by the pool as it was not busy at all really for the size of the hotel, the pool was very refreshing it was very cold and quite a shock when you first get in, but when it is 100 degrees in the sun then you need it!! The staff were very friendly and helpful never had a bad experience at all through the week we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: vamktpro
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paris 5 years ago and was concerned the rooms were tired. No reason to worry, we were on the 28th floor and rooms were recently redone. Best of all it was quiet. A friend stayed at Bally's and complained about how loud the noise was from the street. Loved the room, dark and quiet. Check in took a long time, guess that is expected on a Saturday. Only negative issue was the long lines for food. I never ate at the Paris as all of the food spots had excessively long waits.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: sol789
Reviews.Content: Several co-workers recommended this hotel when my husband and I were planning a trip to Vegas for a few days. So with so many recommendations, we booked 3 nights at Paris. It was a great choice! The staff of the hotel were all very friendly. Even just passing someone in the hallway they were smiling and would tell us to have a good day. When we arrived the check in line was very long, but it went very fast and we were in our room within 15 mintues. Our room was very big and clean. We didn't have a great view-but that wasn't a big deal to us. We had a great time at Paris and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Las Vegas Review- Read this one!”
Reviews.Author: trbjax
Reviews.Content: Just got back last night, May 15, 2008, from 4 day stay. Checked in around 10 am Vegas time on a Sunday morning. The express check in does not work if you have a long flight in, as we did from Florida, as you can call only 2 hours in advance of arrival. That said, the check in line was short, and the process took less than 15 minutes. Asked for a renovated room, but was told they were for Diamond players only. Pressed this issue, and was told that "maybe" we could get one after 2 pm local time, if "they released one", but no guarantee. We decided not to wait, and got room 1426, a clean room that met our needs. The gambling in the casino was better than I remembered from 4 or 5 years ago when we last stayed at Paris. Sufficient number of table games, and while not the biggest casino by any means, was big enough for an avid gambler. Place got a littly noisy after 9 pm, as a band plays off to the side of the casino, but this is not that unusual in Vegas. Service by the Staff was good in the hotel, only fair in the Paris restaurants. Food was above average, I thought, others in the party thought very good. Charge everything to your room for possible comps at end of your trip. Valet parking was good, no long delays. Location is excellent, and you will like connection to Ballys, a short walk. That casino is as good if not better than Paris. Overall, a better than expected stay, email me with questions, tballas@sjgcc.com

Reviews.Title: “A Week At Paris”
Reviews.Author: Redi4Vegas
Reviews.Content: Just back from staying at the Paris for 7 days. Overall, we thought the hotel was very nice. We did stay in a Premier room 2303 and had a great view of the Eiffel Tower and Bellagio Fountains, although the windows were quite dirty. Can't beat the location right in the middle of the strip. Our room was nice and clean and we were perfectly happy with it. Our king size bed was very comfortable and the floor we were on was quiet. The breakfast buffet was excellent, we ate there at least 3 times. Good food and selection for the price. The pool at Paris was nice although rather plain compared to some of the other hotels. The biggest complaints we had about the pool was the sun does not hit the pool until late morning and the water was freezing. There was never many people in the pool at any given time. They obviously do not heat the pool there unlike other hotels we visited where the water was much warmer. The hotel is also lacking in restaurants compared to other hotels. We found ourselves leaving the hotel often and eating elsewhere. We did enjoy our stay at Paris and would recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Rock solid Four star..”
Reviews.Author: TC5020
Reviews.Content: Lets start with check-in. No long line as others have stated. I did see a long line twice but oddly it was around 11:00PM, maybe reduced staff? Anyways I checked in early (1:00PM) and my room was ready and I was offered an upgrade to a LeMans Suite which I accepted. Room was spotless and everthing was in it's place. Huge bathroom, Mr and Mrs. will have no problem getting ready to out while using the bath area at the same time. Room had wet bar (sink and mini fridge). Room included flat screen LCD TV, iron and board , electronic safe, hair dryer. So.. why didn't I give it a Five star? While the room was perfect MY view was not. It overlooked the back side of adjacent properties. Also for the price of these rooms they should throw in a free-bie of some sort. No robes. No free HBO, internet, newpaper, continental breakfast I mean nothing. This is the only reason I didn't give it a Five. Paris has a great location mid strip. All in all I would recommend and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “had a good time -- But OOO you must Nooooo !!!”
Reviews.Author: vegasmurphy
Reviews.Content: Boy -- where do I start -- check in was great , rooms were clean, if you would like to pay an extra $70.00 - to $150.00 -- you, yes you --can get a view of the strip. My wife and I just got back from a 4 day stay - over all we had a good time. Staff was good in all. If you're a slot player and like Wheel of Fortune . 25 cent machines - there are a bank of 4 machines & a bank of 4 $1.00 machines -- in the casino -- that's it - if you like playing poker TEXS _ HLDM) - forget it-- the poker room is dead !!! - as well as the spots book. I played a great deal of video poker at the bar. The employees were great to talk to and were friendly. If you are going to stay at the Paris in the near future- the best advice that I can give to all of the pool/sun lovers is don't get to the pool early. You don't get much sun until after 12:00, being the sun rises behind the building. The pool is open from 9:00 am to 7:00 pm daily. The pastries and desserts across from the buffet is to die for. If you are a light breakfast eater, it is a must. The one downside is the lines are very long at times, but is worth the wait. Over all YOU WILL LIKE PARIS !! --

Reviews.Title: “Really Liked Paris”
Reviews.Author: 77Molly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here comped, so I can't say much about the price. The room was nicely sized and really clean. We were on the 12th floor, and didn't hear any noise come bed time. You can beat the location, and the pool area provides a good getaway from the chaos of the strip (especially during 2 for 1 happy hour). We were pleased with our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, just don't get a cabana poolside”
Reviews.Author: MKMBerkeley_CA
Reviews.Content: The Paris Hotel is fine, except for the staff who runs the cabanas. Apparently, when you reserve a cabana, you can actually be connected to the Bally hotel rather than Paris. Therefore, you are actually being quoted Bally prices and reserving a Cabana at the Bally. The staff at Paris will not accomodate this mistake, blaming it on the hotel operator rather than accepting any responsibility for the miscommunication that is the result of their company. The end result, a higher priced cabana (75.00) shaded by the Eiffel Tower all day. When I politely complained to the managers (Miranda and her boss Stephanie), they were simply pedantic. They even said some guests like the shade. Who pays $325.00 a day for a cabana all day in the shade? I will no longer stay there and with so many different options in pools, I will avoid their cabanas all together. Isn't the point of a cabana to have sun and shade? Enough said, spend you pool side money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Paris”
Reviews.Author: leelerlei
Reviews.Content: This is a bit of a late entry... I stayed at this hotel for my B'day in 2006. I did a lot of research and it paid of.. The Paris has a prime location on the strip and unlike a lot of the other hoels i looked round it isnt too big you get lost on the way to the elevator. The rooms are nice, not the most luxurious you will ever stay in, but for the amount of time i spent in mine it was fine... I would say for the price and location this is one of the best value hotels on the strip...we got it for £100 a night, which when you compare it to hotels in Britain, it rates pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but very crowded”
Reviews.Author: fwmaggie
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed @ the Paris for 5 nights. The reviews were pretty good so we thought we'd try it for our first time to Vegas. The hotel is very pretty, classy looking & centrally located. The king sized bed we requested, was not available the day we arrived but they said call back to the front desk the next day & they would se what they could do. We did & we accepted an accessible ( handicapped) room. It had a tub but not a separate shower like most other rooms. It was fine w/ us. That room was large & comfortable. Housekeeping was prompt & friendly. We had an ok view but nothing great since we did not upgrade. We did not use the pool but we checked it out 1 day & there was not any loud music like listed previously by a reviewer. The hotel & casino lobby is one of the busiest we saw on the strip. It was always very crowded & very smoky. Including cigars. Yuck, but the smoking is like that all over. Plus, Paris has a cigar store in house too. Once you get thru that, its not too bad. The elevators were different since we're not used to staying in high-rises. It had 2 sets of elevators one for floors 1-15 ( or so ) and the other for 16-25, in different locations. Kind of confusing since there is so much to look at there. The self-parking garage is in the rear of the hotel & is free, like most in Vegas but if you arrive late in the day like we did, jet lagged & exhausted, its hard to figure out. When you turn into the hotel, and want to self park & not use bellhops, keep to the far right & the garage is on the left. There are elevators that go to the casino but its a good haul & probably worth it to have them bring up your bags but we were too cheap! Our biggest issue was when we wanted to do a late check-out since our flight was not until after 10 pm. We called days in advance to see if this was possible & no one would give us a straight answer. It was always call back later. Finally, I got mad & questioned the person who answered the phone & said this was the 3rd time we called to no avail. She said that I had to call back after 7 am of the day of departure & then its up to the manager on call and it depends on if they are @ full capacity. She couldn't or wouldn't tell me how much it would be. Once again, it was up to the mgr on call. We finally gave up. Also, use the hotel tv for express check out. Lines can be awful there checking in or out but we noticed this is a common problem where ever we went. We ate @ one of the restaurants in Paris, it was one right by the casino. It was one of the more reasonably priced places there. We got sandwiches & appetizers & it was very good. We ate @ LaSalsa on the strip too and it was very good as well. Service was not top rate @ either but it was ok. All in all, we enjoyed our stay there & would stay there again. We thought the location of the hotel was a huge plus. We walked to the other end of the strip and the Paris side is cleaner, newer & classier.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay at Paris”
Reviews.Author: dkgram
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Paris from April 21 - 27. We arrived around noon and a room wasn't ready yet, so the front desk clerk took our cell phone number and called us when it was ready, which was within the hour. I am a diamond card holder and they have a separate room for check in for diamond and seven star card holders, so there wasn't any wait. Our room was on the 27th floor, the view wasn't great (we looked out on other hotels and the mountains were in the distance), but we weren't there for the view. Our room was a decent size, spotless, the bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was above average size, there were plenty of drawers and closets for storing everything, and there was a coffee maker and safe. Housekeeping was in before 1pm every day and was exceptional. There were never any trays left in the hallway for any length of time. When we left in the morning, if there was a breakfast tray in the hallway it was gone when we returned a few hours later. All the employees we encountered were very pleasant, helpful and always had a smile on their face. The only problem was the wait for drinks while at the slots (but this seemed to be the same in all the casinos we were in) We had breakfast at Le Village Buffet, which has everything you could possible want on it, and the food was very good (especially the crepes). There were always lines to get in, but again, being a diamond card holder we never had to wait. We also had breakfast at Cafe le Parc, which was also delicious. We ate dinner one night at Mon Ami Gabi and sat outside, which I think is the best place to be. The French onion soup was great and the creme brulee was the best. Service was excellent. The location of Paris is perfect. We did walk alot of the strip and also used the monorail a couple of days. One night we went to Fremont Street, took the monorail to the Sahara and then a taxi to downtown. Be careful of the taxi's - they take a roundabout way to get places. It cost $14 to get to Fremont Street and $17 to get back to the Sahara. If you need to print a boarding pass for your return flight, use the business center (between Paris and Ballys). They copied our flight information and the day before we left they printed it and we picked it up. They charged $5, and it was well worth it. We also did a pre check out the night before and all we had to do was leave the keys in our room, which saved time. I can't compare Paris to any other hotel, since this was our first trip to Vegas, but I can't say anything bad about it.

Reviews.Title: “Safety is now a concern ...”
Reviews.Author: BostonBeans1
Reviews.Content: We've stayed many times at the Paris Las Vegas, but our most recent stays have seen the place go down hill. Because this hotel does not require room cards to access the hotel elevators, we saw female strangers knocking on doors trying to get into rooms. They ran down the corridor when I inquired what they were doing. Hotel security was somewhat slow to respond on the first day, but security was present on the second day. They escorted away an incoherent transient, who was "looking" for his room key on our floor. The security people knew him by his first name, so he'd obviously been around the Paris rooms before. We're surprised Paris has let the situation go so far. The room (at over $200 a night) had what I thought was a musty smell, but my spouse said it was a residual formaldehyde smell from the new carpets. Not the greatest for one's health. The smoking from the casino patrons was also exceptionally bad this time. Not enough air filtration to handle the crowds. Our favorite in the past was the Village Buffet, which has now cut back or eliminated several dishes. The staff doles out small amounts of some pricier food items, so the buffet is constantly running out -- even on a slow Sunday evening. Dinner at the Eiffel Tower restaurant was outstanding, but very expensive. We'll be looking to stay next time at the Venetian or one of the newly opened hotels in Las Vegas. Aurevior, Paris!

Reviews.Title: “great stay hotel rooms feeling "tired"”
Reviews.Author: rhonda7325
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Vegas 6 times and at a variety of hotels from the Flamingo, Caesars, Platinum, and yes event the imperial way back when!! The Paris is a location we spend a lot of time at so we thought we would try it. Check In: No problem, we used the phone in service and our room was ready. We asked for a renovated room which had a view of Bally’s, no up charge. Room: Clean, well decorated however it was renovated and still looked old and a bit tired. Beds average for comfort. Daily service no concerns. This is one of two main concerns was the rooms are bland and in need of major upgrading. To me it depends what you pay. We average 150 per night so no complaints however if I was paying 250 and upwards I would not be happy with these rooms. Casino/Services: All great, friendly staff clean. Restaurants: Good choice of restaurants particulary the filet at Mon Ami and sitting on the deck. Room service was fine, slow, of average quality. The brassiere had good pub food however there are so many great spots in Vegas to eat so we tend to avoid the casual spots. Try Daniel Bouchard in the Wynn. Spa: Treatments great. Atmosphere poor. The front desk woman chatted and the quiet charis/lounge are right beside this. Also new guest present to this desk and you can hear it all. Bright and not relaxing. Spa area was very dated décor. Gym was fine. Pool: Fine décor and size however as most hotels in Vegas they play music all day. Mid week I was used to it and could read and fall asleep however on the weekends starting Friday they bring in speakers and loud house music with a DJ. I know the atmosphere is for a party however they need to advertise this as this was why we stayed away from another hotel. If you want to read and get some sun it’s impossible, it’s even hard to hear yourself talk so if you don’t want to party and are nursing a hang over the music is LOUD. By day 2 we just went with it and had drinks but it was annoying as I see the pool as a relaxation place. Overall I would stay here again if the price was right but I would chose another hotel if the rates were high. For example the Bellagio was average 215 and I would try there before coming back to the Paris. I would also look for a hotel where the pool music is optional for the party scene.

Reviews.Title: “Good mid-range hotel, good central location on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: fjpanda
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent on the Strip, in that it is very centrally located. Good for checking out all the well known hotel casinos, in any direction from the hotel. Paris Las Vegas is interesting/different - very pseudo (fake) Paris which you may like, you may not, depending on how you feel about Paris, France and what your expectations are for Las Vegas. It's a good mid-range hotel. Many restaurant choices, something for everyone. We especially liked the bakery, the creperie and the breakfast buffet. I only have one of the 3 names at my finger tips, LeNotre. We were disappointed in one restaurant. Mon Ami Gobi, recommended for the views of the Bellagio fountains. The French onion soup was not authentic and rather awful, really. We loved the central location and walked all over the Strip checking out many well known hotel/casino properties. We also took the free shuttle to the Rio to see Penn and Teller. If you want to explore the Strip, you need very good walking shoes and lots of stamina, each property is HUGE, or, you will need to take short taxi trips. You cannot just walk across the Strip from any location, there are barricades/medians/divides and lots of heavy traffic. It's a very long walk to a crosswalk or a pedestrian bridge. You may need to take a taxi to get across the street (Seriously.... down one side and then a U-turn) Or, you can spend all your time in Paris Las Vegas, (and on the same side of the Strip) it's a self-contained, full service resort. You don't need to leave unless you want to explore. If you want to shop, the Miracle Mile, your typical mall is next door. Upscale shops are in nearby properties including the Bellagio and Ceasar's Palace (but they are "across" the street). Again, plan on lots of walking, through crowds, or very short taxi trips. The hotel pool area is very large, plenty of room for everyone. As another reviewer mentioned, loud music was played in the late afternoon which drove me back indoors. The hot tubs were small, a little crowded and a little worn/worse for the wear. The deluxe room was OK, on the 17th floor, bathroom extremely large and probably recently renovated. We declined a check-in offer to pay an additional $80 to be upgraded to a room with a great view of the Strip and so we had a lousy view out the back - but that was our choice. We felt we had already paid what we wanted to, for a room. Another reviewer mentioned an express check-in which can be arranged only on the morning of your arrival, by phone and which cannot be used 11 or 12 noon. (Study previous reviews/hotel website carefully). Definitely make arrangements for this expres check-in (by phone) in advance of your arrival, or plan on waiting in a line for a good 15 to 30 minutes or more when hordes of people descend upon the front desk. It's just a very, very large resort. If all stations are manned, the long line should move quickly. Very similar to a long check-in at an airport. Plan on lots of time for check-out as well, or, use express check-out. Each day, review your bill on the TV screen so you'll be prepared to use express check-out. It's really, really easy to get lost in the lobby, casino, hallways and boulevards. Plan on lots of extra time for getting lost, walking in the wrong direction (indoors) and especially for meeting up with others. Plan on group meeting points, cell phones and lots of asking the staff for help/directions. It's all very confusing. We liked trying out the Monorail one night, taking it from one end to the other and back again to see all the lights at nighttime. Again, LOTS of walking. The closest stop/entrance is in the hotel next door (Bally's), but it's a very long walk from the front of Bally's hotel to the Monorail. It runs all along the BACK of the properties, quite some distance from the hotels. It would be OK, if you can walk a great distance from the front through to the back of the properties with stops on the route. If you're not actually going to a hotel directly on the route forget it, and use the sidewalk out front or a taxi. We thought it was fun to try out one night to see the lights at night, but otherwise, too far out back to be truly practical. There are many escalators involved, so it did not seem to be wheelchair accessible. Finally, maid service, very prompt on the first days (mid-week), really, really late on the weekend (as in mid to late afternoon). Again, it's a large place. Try calling housekeeping to see if you can get improved service. Try tipping well on a daily basis and speaking to the maid directly. It might help, it might not. Room service - we had a good lunch in the room mid-day, but here is another issue a previous reviewer mentioned. Each morning we would see room service trays/plates/carts outside many rooms in the hallway (many people did not want to wait in the long lines at the restaurants). All day we went in and out of our rooms and the used trays/plates/carts remained in the hallway all afternoon, leaving an odor and obstacles to step past/around. This is where the most improvement is needed, clearing away the dirty dishes and carts from the hallways much more promptly. I've stayed in hotels where you were requested to phone for removal as soon as you were finished. The hotel knows who ordered room service. Come back and check the hallways in 60 minutes and every 30 to 60 minutes thereafter. How long does it take to eat inside a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Love Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jelita
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel, nice view.. overlooking the ' Eiffel Tower' and the Bellagion fountain.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: KitKat08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from staying at the Paris Hotel, and really enjoyed our stay. The hotel was beautiful and the rooms were clean. The hallways were quite and the casino was smoke free, unlike some of the older ones, where you can't breath. The only thing missing, was a mini fridge, in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, you can even feel the Bellagio Fountain show!”
Reviews.Author: RisingSun33333
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at Paris last January. When it comes to the view it provides, I don't think nothing beats Paris. Let me explain from my experience. Whenever I visit Vegas, I try different hotels to see how I like them. The first time I went to Vegas was back in 2000. I didn't know anything about it, and I stayed at a hotel called Sahara Hotel. It was actually very affordable and very close to Hilton (where the conference was held), but when I tried to reach the main part of the strip (Bellagio fountain, Forum Shop...etc), I had to walk to the point I got soaked with sweat and my legs got numb. Second time, I stayed at Harrahs, which turned out to be OK. Nothing to brag about, but close to where the major shows are and very affordable. Caesars Palace was a big disappointment. It's much more expensive than other hotels in the area, but the room I stayed was very generic (with ordinary bathroom and beds) with a dismal view of the parking lot. Come to think of it, most rooms at Caesars Palace seems to have same kind of views. Unless you are ready pay a lot of money and stay at the rooms of the Augustus Tower facing Bellagio, this hotel does not provide any views of any kind. Venetian, less expensive, was OK. All the rooms are suites and the basic one I stayed at provided enough space and the bathroom looked gorgeous (better than Bellagio, and probably the best on the strip). And this hotel is scented wonderfully (kind of magnolia/lilac-ish). The problem was the view, again. You can look down on the Mirage volcano, but other than that, virtually no views at all. Deluxe Lakeview room of Bellagio was OK at best. the room was not that large and the window was kind of small in size. The bathroom was mediterranean (sort of), but the artificial vases looked weird and after experiencing Venetian, it's just plain-looking. You can look down on the fountain, but the window is so tightly built in that you don't hear a thing from outside. You have to turn on the TV and turn to some channel to listen to the fountain show music. It felt weird standing at the narrow window looking down on the fountain "down there" while listening music coming from the TV set behind.....Never again. When I got to the front desk of Paris, I asked for a room in the northwest wing (as north as possible). The room I reserved was called Premiere (as opposed to Luxury) and they're the more expensive rooms and they're facing the strip. Based on what I learned from this trip, the Premiere rooms are numbered XX23, XX21.....XX03, XX01 then XX76, XX78.....XX94, XX96, from south to north on each floor. My room was 2196. I was pleasantly surprised by its view! Just because Paris is shaped like a cross looking from up above, none of the premiere rooms provide straight-forward view of the Bellagio fountain. The views are a little bit oblique. And unfortunately, the maintenance people don't seem to keep the window (outside) clean, and you'll find some dirts on the outsideof the windows. Looking at the Bellagio fountain and the Eifel Tower through my window, I quickly learned that though you choose Premiere rooms, you may have bad luck having the Eifel Tower in your way blocking the view of the fountain! Looks like the center of the Bellagio (shaped like a tripod) and the Fountain is about 1/4 block more north than the center of the cross-shaped building of Paris and the Eifel Tower. So, (this is my guess with IQ of 164 based on my own observation), if you stay somewhere between XX13, XX11...... XX03, XX01, probably, the Eifel Tower will be located in the dead center of your view. If you go all the way south towards XX15, XX17......XX23, you'll have a decent view of the Fountain with the nothern part of it being blocked by the Eifel Tower. Actually, the view from my room (2196) must have been better than any other Premiere rooms on the same floor, because the Eifel Tower is far left in your vision and it does not block the view of Bellagio at all. I thought it was the best view, having a full view of the Bellagio fountain with Eifel Tower and the arc of Triumph on its side. I loved it. Actually, there was another surprise waiting for me. I must have dozed off in bed (looking forward to the shows that night). I was waken up by the sound almost like thunders. I thought it must have started to rain.......wait. I'm in Vegas, where it almost never rains...... Turned out it was the fountain show. The windows of Paris Hotel are kind of dirty, but it's not firmly built like Bellagio, and you can actually hear and feel the fountain show from your room! At night, the Eifel Tower is illuminated, and the fountain shows looked enchanting! If you're looking for a hotel which is affordable and comes with a great view, I strongly recommend Paris. Book Premiere Room, and ask for XX94 or XX96 on the higher floor. The lower you are, the less great view of the fountain since the Eiffel Tower gets thicker towards the ground. You need to expect some dirts on the window (not that bard, though), and a very unremarkable bathroom and beds. But once you enjoy the fountain show from there, you'll agree with me! They provide the best view on the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Themed Hotel and Casino. Nice room and good value.”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirrrl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here arriving on Dec. 25th. My fiance and I met my parents there, so it was a great little family reunion/vacation. My parents had a non smoking room and we had a smoking room thus we were on different floors. Our room was much nicer. We had new furniture and a very comfortable bed. My parents room was just not as nice. It was apparent our room had been recently renovated. That's just the risk you take in staying somewhere so big, some rooms will have been more recently updated. While our room was superior to my parents room, both were very nice, and I would say worth the room rate. The hotel and casino was really nice. I would reccomend this place to others. I would not reccomend the room service. We ordered late at night, and it took forever to get the food which turned out not to be too tasty. If you're looking for a good late night snack head to the coffee shop at TI.

Reviews.Title: “A few head's up re: the Paris”
Reviews.Author: MindyHB
Reviews.Content: Paris was lovely, just not the most "lux" hotel on the strip. The good: The hotel is clean, the casino isn't as crowded or smoky as many, and the rooms are modern & spacious. Our suite had a newer flat-screen TV, a separate jacuzzi tub & shower & even a bidet in the water closet! The linens on the bed were slightly scratchy, but overall, the bed was cozy. The downsides: No water bottles in the room! I think better hotels chould stock water for their guests - even if they are for purchase. Tap in Vegas is not pleasant. Le Central bar did not offer bar snacks, but told us we could go purchase them in the sundries ship. Strange. Worse: When I called to request a cabana, I was told that the rate posted on the website was wrong, ($250), that they were actually $300. Because the cabanas were currently booked, we were placed on a waiting listt. Then, the next day I got an e-mail saying the rate was now $325, and would I still desire the cabana? The reason I am willing to pay for cabanas is because I have had skin cancer in the past, and I prefer to sit in the shade. We ended up in a "Villa", which is really an outdoor room, but the lounge chairs are all in the sun. When I requested an umbrella, I was told they had none!! I sat with my lounge chair plastered against the side of the villa in the only shade it provided. When my husband requested fruit, they brought us the $9.95 fruit plate with yogurt & cut up fruit, but we had to ask for plates & utinsils to eat the fruit. 1/2 hour later, our complimentary fruit basket arrived. I wish the waitress had told us that we were getting the basket when we ordered the fruit plate. The very worse, was the tip, which was apparently included, but we were not informed. We gave our server a very generous 40% tip, and then, when we checked out, we realized that they added a 20% tip to the original bill, then added our 40% tip to that, meaning that we actually paid a 60% tip - I am a big tipper, but that was ridiculous. We would have disputed it, but the line to check out that Sunday was so long, that our time was worth more than the money we would have saved. Bottom Line: Centerally located, clean & modern, but don't expect shade, and watch your bill!!!

Reviews.Title: “A more modern interpretation of Paris”
Reviews.Author: DanielJW
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just a couple of weeks ago. What can I say apart from “wow” and “fantastic”. Car Park is a little difficult to find if you approach from the rear of the building, easy if you approach from the strip (entrance between the Paris and Bally hotels). Apart from an initial issue with booking in, which was mainly to do with me not having any form of photo ID, the process was very quick and very pleasant. Our room was on the 17th floor and, because we asked the agent if we could have a room with a view, managed to get a room with a view over the strip and Bellagio (including the fountains). Room was huge! Bed was nice and hard, bathroom huge with separate shower and bath, free safe and controllable heating/cooling. Hotel/Casino itself is amazing. The main walk looks just like a Parisian street with shops and restaurants/cafes. Apart from a sandwich and a coffee, we didn’t eat at the Paris. To sum up, a great hotel with nice staff, a great casino and a fantastic location right in the centre of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ccmnova
Reviews.Content: Just stayed a few nights at the Paris Hotel - have stayed at most others on the strip but never the Paris. Its central location is great and it seems to be close to everything. The room rate was reasonable and we had a great view. Dinner at the Eiffel Tower restaurant was way too pricey but excellent. Not much shopping in the Hotel but the mall between the Paris and the PH Hotel with 170 stores was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: vailtraveler81658
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Paris celebrating a birthday. We arrived on a Wednesday afternoon at 5pm to find out that the room type requested was "unavailable." So, no king beds to be found at a reasonable hour on a weeknight seemed a little crazy. We were offered an upgrade at a cost of $85 additional if we wanted the bed type requested. We were told we could move the next day to a nicer room with a view but there was nothing else available. For a two night stay, it seemed a little useless. Being in the hospitality industry, I have higher expectations and returned to my room to let the MOD know. I spoke with the manager who told me she wasn't sure why the front desk staff told us there were no king rooms available, as she had one ready for us in 10 minutes. Perhaps poor communication, or perhaps the staff is not empowered to make guests happy; either way an unnecessary start to the trip. There is no excuse for poor service in a town where the lodging options are so plentiful. We will most likely choose another hotel when we return. On the positive side, the rooms are in good condition and the ammenities are great. The french treats in the coffee shop are amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrading will make you happier”
Reviews.Author: crazyandcrazier
Reviews.Content: Reading through these reviews, I feel like it's pretty obvious that paying for the upgraded room definitely makes visitors to the Paris a lot happier! That's been my experience...I stay here every September for a trade show. The years I pony up extra money for a premier room, I definitely feel better about the hotel--a nice view helps! But that means your stay won't be cheap. Overall I like the Paris...I'm not a gambler, so I'm grateful for a smaller casino. I like that there's one restaurant where you can actually eat outside, on the strip! I like the pool. I like the breakfast at the little cafe near the elevators. And I like that you can walk to tram that takes you to the convention center. Having tried everything from the Tropicana to the Four Seasons, I feel like this is the hotel for me -- the convenience and the price are right.

Reviews.Title: “Paris was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: jaysmom03
Reviews.Content: My husband had a conference in Las Vegas and I tagged along. We chose Paris Las Vegas as our hotel for several reasons: It's location, the free shuttle to the Rio (where his conference was taking place, and the fact that I was born outside of the "real" Paris and left when I was just a baby. We arrived about 12:30 AM, since our flight was late arriving into Las Vegas. As our taxi pulled up, there were no Bellboys to take our luggage. Even the taxi driver said he had never seen that problem before. We started to wheel our luggage in when suddenly someone appeared and finally took our bags. Check-in was easy and fairly quick. I had called earlier to make sure we would get our Premium room and we did, 825P. The room was at the end of the wing, with an excellent view of the pool and Eiffel tower out one window and a view of the Paris Balloon out the other large window. The room was neat, but a little tired looking. Everything was very clean. The Premium rooms are large, with a little dressing area and a marble bathroom with separate shower and a telephone. There is also a minibar, large armoire with more closet space and drawers. Our room had a kingsize bed, two chairs, small table and a loveseat. Maidservice was very good and prompt. We did not use the minibar, but I did have a serviceman come in one day to fix it! He said it was not "communicating" with the computer, so they would have never known if we had taken something! Oh, well. All in all, we had an enjoyable experience and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,great location”
Reviews.Author: traveller33Ireland
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on a great location on the strip across from the Bellagio and Ceasars Palace.It is linked to Ballys and next door to Planet Hollywood.The room was a good size and was spotless with a lovely en suite which was also spotless and a decent size.The pool is great and you get towels on entry.The casino is great and we had dinner in the eifel tower restaurant which was expensive but very nice and worth a visit.We went to cirque de soleil show in the Bellagio which was amazing and the casino there is also cool.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, Good Location...”
Reviews.Author: Tsigana
Reviews.Content: After a long winter, we jumped at a 50% discount sale 3 night stay at Las Vegas. This was our third visit to the city; the last one being 11 years ago. We had previously stayed at the Luxor and the Monte Carlo. In comparison, the Paris hotel is smaller and therefore, easier to get around inside. The lobby of the hotel is configured to look like a village square with a gazebo in the centre (Gustav's bar). A 'Main street' with shops and restaurants streams away from the lobby and toward Bally's hotel. The 'Main Street' is where you find the buffet. The designers have done an excellent job of recreating the 'feel' of Paris and small-town France. If you've never gone to France, this is a good facsimile. Registration went easily but I will agree with other reviewers that the staff is sombre. I don't believe that is so much the staff's personality but rather a reaction to dealing with the high volume of people. When we were there, they were dealing with one convention and getting ready for another one; and for that reason, the lobby always seemed full. Check in time is 4 pm and check out is 11 am. [We did manage to extend our checkout time to 1 pm. complimentary since we were leaving for the airport at 8pm. ] Since we arrived at noon, we had to store our baggage with the valet. Make sure you take what you need with you because everytime you go to the valet to get something out of your bags, you need to tip him. In fact, keep a lot of $1 and $5s handy. You'll be tipping everywhere. The shuttlebus driver, the busboys, bellhops, cigarette girls, etc. The room was standard issue; a little dated but clean. There was no view unless you consider the garage rooftop a view but it was quiet. I think if we were paying top dollar we might have been more fussy. Food: There is a Sweet shop next to the elevators (as well as a convenience store) which is good for coffee, etc. Further down the 'Main Street' there is JJ Boulangerie (a cafeteria style deli) which also has outside seating. My husband and I both had the tuna salad special. Big mistake. There were two icecream scoops of tuna salad on a baguette with a potatoe salad side. ($6.99 ea.) The food was good but way too much. Many couples were ordering one serving and splitting it in two. Try this approach if you're not a big eater. Across the 'street' is the Village Buffet and there are also a couple of restaurants. There is also a large outdoor cafe which overlooks the lobby. We ate there for our first night. The food was blah. I ordered penne pasta with pomodore. What I got was disintegrating overcooked pasta with a can of stewed tomatoes dumped over top. ($12.99) Excellent service however. The following morning we tried the Village Buffet. The line-up was 50 people deep. The Paris Hotel is owned by Harrah's Group so upon registering with the hotel, you should get a book of coupons with discounts entitling you to eat at the buffets at one of their other hotels. Regardless of which hotel you go to, breakfast buffets are $14.99 each, lunch $17.99 and dinner $24.99 each. We decided to go to the Flamingo buffet. They gave us a discount of $5 dollars EACH so, in effect we were paying $10 each for a full buffet. Harrahs buffet was so-so. We had the lunch buffet at Caesar's. The waiter tried to scam us and only took off just the $5. After some confrontation, he did us a 'favour' and compted us the other $5. We also decided to try the 'Nosh' in Bally's for a quick bite. We found it to be a great place to grab a coffee and toasted bagel. You can get to it as you come out of Paris into Bally's, turn left and left again and follow the back wall to the escalator. The Nosh is at the base of the escalator. For our last night, we decided to eat at the Bellagio's dinner buffet. ($27.99) For a few bucks more, it's worth it. King Crab legs, sushi, roast lamb, etc. The best buffet we've ever had. Oddly enough, we never went to the Village buffet. Every time we passed it, there was a line up. Size-wise, the buffet is small which may account for the line-ups. In comparison, the Flamingo buffet is large and spacious so the line-ups move fast. Even with 20 people in front of us, we were inside within 7 minutes. In general, most of the hotels on the strip have long line-ups at meal times. If you're prepared to eat off-hours, like 2 pm or 8:30 pm, the wait time, if any, is considerably shorter. In general, our overall experience with the Paris hotel was pleasant. The staff was always efficient, courteous. The location is fabulous. You're in the heart of the 'strip'. The Miles of shops is next door. Great shopping and many eateries. For a good selection of general souvenirs, try the ABC store. Note: Paris hotel does not offer free internet access. You need to pay a surcharge of $35. However, there are internet access machines which look like ATMs near the elevators. For $0.35/min ($5 minimum charge), you can access the internet, if you want to confirm / book your seats, etc. online and you can print your boarding pass too for $1 each. (Although at the airport, they tore up our boarding passes and issued their own instead so you might want to save a buck.)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at the Paris”
Reviews.Author: arubbound
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned today from our second stay at the Paris. (first stay was May 05). We took my son and his soon to be wife. Booked two rooms through Expedia. I enjoyed our stay very much. Check in was so fast. Valet parking attendants and bell hops were helpful. Cleaning staff did a great job. Extra pillows were delivered quickly when we requested them. Beds were soft and well made. Bathroom was large, towels thick. I stayed in room # 3001. It overlooked the Belagio fountains, the Eiffel Tower and the pool. I actually don't know what room my son stayed in but he said it was nice. The only thing I was not crazy about was the very loud music at the pool and it got louder by the hour. Even my son and daughter-in-law to be thought it was loud. (They are in their early 30's, I am 51) Still though we enjoyed out time there. We really don't gamble so I have nothing to offer on that. My boyfriend and I did upgrade our room for an extra 70 per night and that included the better view and conceirge lounge with appetizers in the evening and continental breakfast. We were offered that at check-in. I suppose it was worth it..It did not include alcohol which was available in the lounge by the honor bar system. We ate lunch twice at the Mon Gami and it was just OK in my book. Maybe the dinner is better there. Hope this was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, Awful Casino!!!”
Reviews.Author: clrblueskyz
Reviews.Content: I have got to say that I like the room that we had at this casino. My main complaints were down in the actual casino. First, the casino is too small. Cocktail service was VERY SLOW....I always tip $2.00 for a drink, which I feel is alot better than some, but I spent most of my time and money having to keep going to the bar for a drink. I think I had a cocktail waitress around about every hour to an hour and a half. So, I spent most of my time over at Bally's gambling. Love the Keno area. The Staff there was great and drink service was alot better. All in all its a nice hotel, but i will NOT gamble there...table limits too high and slots are way too tight!

Reviews.Title: “What a view”
Reviews.Author: gator90gal
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4 nights at the Paris We were able to check in at 11 am Given a room with a view of the pool, fountains and mountains We did pay for a Premier room Everything was great Very central location We went to the Village Buffet fantastic and also a great deal for $ 14.99 The Beatles Love was the best i have ever seen We had a coffee maker in our room which was nice I wished they did not charge $ 25 to work out each time

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Paris”
Reviews.Author: thatsmystuff
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend at the Paris with friends, and were very pleasantly surprised. It really does give a good sensation of Paris, and unlike many of the other Vegas hotels, this one feels like people are meant to walk around the 'streets' and browse, not just admire the decor and play. We upgraded to a junior suite on arrival, and thoroughly enjoyed our room with all its space - and the jacuzzi. It is odd, though, that a hotel of this class would not provide toiletries beyond shampoo and soap for those forgetful travelers who may need some cotton wool or toothpaste. Instead, you have to call housekeeping to get some. There is also no minibar, only an empty fridge which didn't even seem plugged in. Brunch at Mon Ami Gabi is excellent. We did not try the other restaurants - the queues could put anybody off. However, getting coffee and pastries from the boulangerie, if you care to take them outside, is a good way of escaping the crowds (although not for long - this is Vegas after all).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our Extended Family”
Reviews.Author: Finnishbybirth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris for 4 nights (Thurs-Sun) in early April. We needed 3 rooms near each other and the reception was very accomodating. We had rooms 748p and 749p, which were across from each other and one room a few doors down the hall. (The "p" rooms were larger than the regular room.) There was no view, but I knew that when I booked the room and it was fine with us. I had read on Tripadvisor to call the morning of our stay and check in over the phone. What a great tip! We did not have any wait when we arrived that evening from the east coast. The rooms were very well appointed with marble bathrooms, separate shower and tons of room to store our things. I especially enjoyed being able to have coffee in my room in the morning (the room had a small coffee pot, which the maid kept stocked with coffee). Since we were traveling with kids, it was nice to be able to walk past the casino to reach the restaurants and shops. The hotel is very charming with a fake sky that ensures perfect weather at all times! We enjoyed several good meals including Mon Ami Gabi where we watched the Bellagio fountains as we ate. Cafe St Louis and JJ's Boulangerie were also good. All of the staff that we encountered were friendly and helpful. We'll happily go back.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms fine but casino disappointing”
Reviews.Author: DDDCalgary
Reviews.Content: Restaurant and hotel service was fine. Room was on 19th floor overlooking tower, pool, and Bellagio fountains. Room was reasonably quiet even with fountains going off and noise from the strip. Pool was fine for adults but a little boring for kids. Bring water toys or a ball for the kids. Recommend the patio cafe on the strip for watching the Bellagio fountains in the evening. Plan to go before 8 am if you want the 15$ breakfast buffet. Line ups can be long everywhere for these types of things so plan ahead before you go. The Deuce is a 5$ per day bus service up and down the strip. Bus was totally full most of the time so walking or a cab may be faster depending on the time of day. Casino was dissapointing. Layout was a maze to get through, bar service slow, blackjack dealer made a rude Canadian joke THEN asked me if I was Canadian (Oops). Sports book area was dark depressing and empty. Wynn casino was much better for service, excitement, and people watching. We saw Spamalot at the Wynn and would recommend for all ages. Look for online coupon for free seat upgrade and 25$ free slots when booking tickets. Don't take the monorail to the Wynn. Cab it, bus it, or walk it.

Reviews.Title: “Really Liked Paris Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mjballet
Reviews.Content: Just returned tonight from Paris Las Vegas, and it was a very pleasant stay. Liked the center strip location, the room was very nice, atmostphere of the casino was good, restaurants were good although a bit pricy, and liked the fact that you had basically two hotels in one -- Bally's was connected by a nice walkway lined with shops and restaurants. It was very convenient to the shops at Planet Hollywood, which is a good place to shop, and directly across the street from the fountains of Bellagio. Both check-in and check-out was fast and efficient. Breakfast buffet line was long on Saturday, so opted for breakfast at the cafe instead, which was ok. I got a good rate on hotels.com, and was very pleased with the accommodations. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked Paris”
Reviews.Author: Davegilk
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean, easy to check in. Hotel is a little hard to find inside - lots of walking in circles. But that Vegas, no clocks and they make you walk so you will stay. Middle to the strip - nice location.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay and was just as good”
Reviews.Author: Hanisa
Reviews.Content: For me this hotel is one of the best on the Strip. It's the perfect location, being situated close to the Miracle Mile shopping arcade, the Bellagio fountains and Caesar's Palace. The hotel itself is brilliantly themed with the Eiffel Tower and the Parisian streets. There's a great patisserie too! The rooms are spacious, with comfy beds and chairs. There's the usual facilities - TV, phone and mini-bar. The bathroom is lovely - marble, huge, clean and with a big shower (although water pressure wasn't great). My recommendation is to get a cocktail served in a ceramic Paris Balloon. It's a great keepsake!

Reviews.Title: “Up and down experience....”
Reviews.Author: jasontraci2006
Reviews.Content: I first booked my reservation on the website about a month prior to my arrival. I checked the website again about two days before my arrival and noticed the price had dropped by $50 a night. I called the reservations number and had the rate changed. Was unable to change the resevation on the website. Check in process was horrible - the bellman informed me several times he would not see me again - hinting at a tip just for taking the bag inside the building (a different person brings the luggage to the room) I was unable to get the room I reserved since it was just a "preference" not a guarantee - I had hoped for king size bed, but recieved two beds inside. Service at the bars were slow and non-existance later at night. Cocktail service at the $1 machines were faster than getting one while playing blackjack.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: phoenix57
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks nice from the outside but is definitely a big disappointment. The rooms are shabby with old, chipped furniture and an outdated decor. I also found the amenities and service to be seriously lacking. Rather than housekeeping delivering a tube of toothpaste when we called to let them know we forgot ours (something which is common practice in most nice hotels), they told us that we could take one out of the mini bar. It was a bargain at $5 for a mini tube. The ridiculousness continued when I brought leftovers from a very expensive meal and found I could not put them in the fridge in the room. I was told it is actually a "vending machine" and that I would have to pay for all items that were moved, regardless of whether or not I actually used them. To get a fridge, I needed to call housekeeping and have them bring a separate one, which they charge $10/day for. Save your money and go to a proper hotel where they do not charge for these types of basic amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Paris!”
Reviews.Author: NellesMama
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at the Paris Las Vegas and we loved it. Because it was my birthday, they upgraded us to a gorgeous suite with two bathrooms, a lovely living room and an unbeatable view of the Eiffel Tower and the Bellagio fountains. The check-in staff was really friendly and very accommodating. The French theme is fun (okay and maybe a little bit kitschy), and the casino is lovely. And I have to comment on a previous review from memberkansas! We ate at the Eiffel Tower restaurant and I was so full when I left that I had to go lie down! The food was truly divine (and I used to live in the real city of Paris). The seared salmon was the best I've ever had. We were STUFFED. The waitstaff was great. We also ate at the top-notch Mon Ami Gabi (great!) and Le Notre patisserie had really good pain au chocolat. The only slight fault was that the coffee table in the living room had been overlooked by the housekeeping staff, which makes you question the cleanliness of the rest of the room, but overall everything was great. Really, really enjoyed it and I have stayed at five-star hotels all over the world. Just make sure you ask for a renovated room with a view and you're in heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Would have been above average except for the noise”
Reviews.Author: lesgirlone
Reviews.Content: Very busy hotel, nicely appointed. Too crowded and, especially, too noisy, when trying to sleep. I know it's Vegas but 3 am shouting in the hallways is not cool. Hotel staff was competent and friendly. FYI, there is a charge for high speed Internet access and it is not high-speed, in any event. DO NOT use the kiosks outside elevators to print airline boarding passes. So slow, they freeze up. Better: go to the business center; staff there will print the boarding passes for you. Eat off hours unless you enjoying waiting more than an hour in line. Best bargain, surprisingly, was room service for breakfast. Order one meal for two, with 2nd coffee cup.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovetheseaschafer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris from January 18 - 21. We really enjoyed our stay. We stayed on the 18th floor. The room was very clean, as well as the entire place. The bathrooms are large, and there are lots of amenities. We ate at the Burger Brassier while we were there, and thought that the food was really good. We also ate at the buffet at the Rio. That is a must. It was by far the best buffet that we have ever been to. The location of the hotel is also nice, as you are only a short walk from many of the other hotels. The drinks that they serve while gambling met our expectations. They would try to make whatever you asked for. While there, we went up in the Eiffel Tower.
