This was a fun experience, and we got some great pictures while in the top. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. We are going back in August, and we will be staying at the Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy”
Reviews.Author: Drizzt_Calgary
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Paris for 5 days during the last week of March. We had decided to stay there after having a poor experience at the Excalibur several years earlier. Our impression of the Excalibur was that everything was understaffed except the casino. We booked the Paris 5 months ago based on its star rating and the reviews on Expedia. In the last month I discovered Tripadvisor and was very chagrined to find a number of negative reviews. To be honest, after reading many of the reviews, we weren't sure what we would get. As a teacher and an accountant we are unfortunately members of the "firmly indebted middle class" and therefore not "big spenders" or "high rollers." Many of the reviews left us with the impression that poor service, room assignment and inflated expenses awaited us. The Paris did not disappoint us, we were treated very well. The service was excellent for the entire stay. We arrived in Las Vegas at 8:30 in the morning and taking the advise of another traveller, phoned the express check in. The man was very friendly, he told us to come directly to the hotel rather then assigning us a room later in the day. He mentioned that they had rooms that were not rented the previous night and he was pretty sure they would have something available. We were at the hotel by 9:30 am and were assigned a room. It was a fantastic start to our holiday. We easily could have received the popular "check in time is 4:00pm" Our room on the 16th floor, was clean and nicely decorated. The bed was very comfortable and housekeeping was friendly and thorough. We have no complaints. The room did face the back of the hotel and the parking structure but the views of the mountains were nice. People who book in Vegas and most other places need to realize that 65% of a hotel's rooms are either going to be too low down or on the backside of a wing to get the sought after view. Those going in with the attitude "Give the person in front of me a shitty view and give the person behind me a shitty view, but give me a good one or else I'm going to complain" just set themselves up for irritation and disappointment. Unless your paying $800/night , accept the fact that room assignment is going to be a proverbial crap shoot We ordered room service for lunch. The service time was reasonable (30 min) and the food average. The cost was high. It was $56 plus tip for a soup, a sandwich, a hamburger and a three cup carafe of coffee. Again though, reasonable expectations will lower your probability of disappointment. Don't stay at the Paris, Caesar's, Wynn etc if you want to save money. OF COURSE THEIR EXPENSIVE their four and five star hotels in the middle of the Vegas strip. We often walked over to Planet Hollywood where many of the restaurants were lower priced. Breakfast omelettes could be had for less then $10. Although our experience was that after the omelette, juice, coffee and tip, the average price of breakfast or lunch climbed upwards of $20/person. We realized after our third day, that often you get more variety for basically the same price by doing the buffets. (Crawl out of bed after 10:00 am however and look for long line ups) We checked out using the T.V. in the hotel room and avoided the long check out line. Overall we enjoyed our stay, felt we had good service and would stay again at the Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: memberKansas
Reviews.Content: When we checked in informed the staff that we did not want a room with a view of the wall of the hotels nears by. Yet that is what we were given. Read earlier reviews that stated table games were high in dollars that is correct. Read the slots were loose not correct. Eat dinner in the tower the service was great, however if it was not for the bread would not have left full for the cost. Dinner portions are very small and my wife ordered a side dish (you pay extra for all sidedishes) she had 2 bites and informed out waiter that she did not care for it, and it was not taken off the bill. Last year we eat at the 40's room at the Flamigo the cost of the diiner was about the same but you leave there full.

Reviews.Title: “Miserable experience, it's not very good!”
Reviews.Author: vatterna
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a lot of hotels in Vegas and this was without a doubt the worst I have ever experienced! Generally overall the people that worked there were miserable - checking in the gal at the desk treated me like I was inconveniencing her by showing up - brutal! The people that worked at the restaurants seemed generally unhappy to be there... that says alot to me about a workplace! The worst experience at this hotel was the salon - it is a complete DUMP - filthy and dirty - the hairdresser that washed and blow dryed my hair was horribly dressed (dirty unclean clothing and her hair was a MESS!) and not properly trained at all! Her particualr area in the Salon was filthy - combs/brushes everywhere, not hygenic at all!! Hair and dirt all over the floor, paint chipping of the walls, dirty feet marks all over the chair... ugh... i could not leave when i saw it as they told me that i would be charged for the full amount of my appt. as they needed 24 hrs cancellation notice... My hair looked horrible when she was done (how do you screw up a blowdry??) and they charged me $154 freakin' dollars (for a BLOW DRY???! - i know things are more expensive in Vegas, but COME ON!) PLUS 18% gratuity even though the gal did not even deserve it! I was outraged.... told them I was not going to pay the full amount b/c of the level of service and quality of the final product and they said "well, we'll just put it on your room then"... i had NO choice... I ended up paying it with no say.... anyways i went to a salon in the fashion mall to get my hair done a few days later ($65 - GREAT JOB!) and she told me that a friend of hers works at Paris and when it's slow they charge way more if they think they can get away with it.... she was pretty upset by the amount they charged - said that is WAY out of line - even for Vegas. i had also ordered room service a few nights and you know when your done with your tray you put it outside your room to be picked up, correct? well, i put my tray out one night and somebody somehow knocked it over and there were fries all in the hallway the next morning - that sucks, but fine i figured it would be cleaned up... after a full day of meetings (first mtg was at 8:30AM) i got back to my hotel at around 7PM and the tray and food were ALL still there except the food was now knocked down the hallway and trampled into the carpet - it smelled so bad! it was until about 2AM that morning that I heard someone outside my door cleaning it up! The day that I was to check out of Paris (check out is a 11AM) I had a morning mtg that went until 10AM at Balley`s and when I got back to my room at 10:10 AM my cards were deactivated and I couldn`t get into my room to get my luggage. I talked to a lady that was cleaning the room across from mine (she was actually a wonderful kind lady - my only good experience at this hotel) and asked her to call security or give me advice to what I should do as I had to catch my flight at noon! Anyways long story short it took security 45 minutes to show up (at 11AM!) - his excuse was that he was on his coffee break til 10:30 and then they sent him to the wrong floor... AND THEN he started to tell me that I had already checked out and that is why they deactivated my room key(s)! of course, i hadn`t and didn`t have time to argue because i had to catch my flight... after a hassle he let me in, i got my stuff and got the heck outta that hotel NEVER to return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: SouthMilwaukeerocket
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a quick trip to Las Vegas March 26-28. With an early flight in and late flight out the two days were just right. We have been to Vegas a number of times and stayed at many hotels up and down the Strip. We selected to stay at Paris for this trip because we had not stayed there before and also because we have had a number of good experiences at the hotel's restaurants and attractions. We checked in about 10:00 am and I didn't expect to get a room immediately. Much to my suprise the friendly desk clerk said there was a room and it was available. Our room was a corner Parlor Suite (we only reserved a standard room). The accomodations were superb. Great views, spacious room and bath. We were very happy. We have had breakfast many times at the buffet in Paris. Hands down it is excellent. Try the freshly made crepes. They cannot be beat. We also tried the Cafe which was also very good. Mon ami Gabi was our final stop and to me there is no better location for people watching. A glass of wine, fresh bread, and a sunny day makes a pleasant combination. All staff at the hotel and restaurants were friendly - We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: castortopp
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Paris from 3-22-3-26. It was a great stay. Our room was very clean and quiet. We didn't have a great view, but we weren't in our room a lot so it wasn't a big deal. The casino was nice and the Paris buffet was awesome. One of the best things about Paris it is very easy to navigate and it is centrally located on the strip. There is also a pick-up for the Rio out front. Great trip, great place, can't wait til next time.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: MinneapolisRuby
Reviews.Content: I would stay here again even if I had to pay! The rooms were spacious, the lobby is grand, there is an excellent crepe place, and the pool is beautiful. The minute I walked in I was exciting to be staying here. I was lucky to be staying for free since my brother's company paid for the room! Vegas is quite the popular place for trade-shows! I ate at the crepe place in the hotel each morning since it was right downstairs, tasty, and reasonably priced. They had lots of different varieties to choose from too. The hotel room had lots of space and the bathrooms were spacious as well. It was also clean and the decorations and furniture were pretty new and cute. I spent a few afternoons at the pool and really enjoyed my time lounging there. DO NOT get a drink from the bar though! It was a total rip off since I was basically drinking syrup. They put barely any liquor in the margarita I ordered and didn't mix it up at all. The location of the hotel is perfect since it's pretty much in the middle of the strip and right across the street from the Bellagio. You can see the fountain show easily! You can also get back to your room easily at this hotel. It's very nice after a long day of walking. Some of the hotels force you to walk thru their large casino in order to get back to your room. When you have tired feet and are exhausted it's not fun! Be sure to try their dinner buffet too! It's $25 for all you can eat and there are many great pastas, veggies, and desserts to choose from. That is a deal in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Money!”
Reviews.Author: phmartens
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our stay at the Paris Hotel & Casino. We had a renovated room on the 20th floor and for the money we paid, it was great (our vew wasn't that great -- it was out the back), but we couldn't complain. The bathroom is really big and that was a pleasant surprise for me. We never had an issue with the towels or bed linens either (we must have picked a good week). We only went to the Hamburger place to eat, which I thought was a little pricey but we arrived around 8:30 PM, so we didn't really have much of a choice at that time of day. I would highly recommend the hotel for its convenient location too. We even had a relaxing time at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we changed Hotel plans to Paris”
Reviews.Author: OhsoLuckyt
Reviews.Content: My wife gave me a surprise trip to Las Vegas for my 60th B'Day from March 16 to the 21'st I love the city & have visited numerous times over the years. Since I enjoy the center strip area she made hotel arrangements at the Mirage which I had never stayed at, however, as I do with all trips I checked out the reviews on Trip Advisor where I've never been misguided whether for domestic or international travel. Boy am I glad I did, there seemed to be many complaints re: the Mirage needing a make over so I checked out Paris where there was a more positive consensus. I had our agent rebook us to Paris. The price was the same!!! We arrived at noon Sunday & had to wait in line at checkin for no more than 5 minutes. I asked for a strip room but as seems the case was told it would entail an additional cost , I opted out. She offered a room on the 6th floor which was ready I asked for higher & she pleasantly found one on the 18th floor that the maid was just finishing up in. She gave us a number to call back & we did so about 10 minutes later, the room was ready for us! The room 1871 was in the back of hotel looking down at a parking lot roof below , however it had a beautiful view of the mountains as well. Who cared, we spent little if any time in the room anyway. The room was recently reappointed with great furniture & the batth was brand new ,all tiled with both a glass enclosed stall shower & a separate tub. The place was immaculate, & the service from housekeeping was phenominal. We did have to call for service since the shower had a slow drain & the iron wasn't working. Both were handled immediately. The hotel is centrally located on the strip & a short walk to all major hotels & malls. The monorail is just behind it & Paris is connected to the Bally's Casino next door without having to go outside. The layout is a theme of the streets of Paris & you really feel as if you're walking on them, including the blue sky & clouds above you on the ceiling. The restaurants are very good & reasonably priced. The breakfast brunch we heard was great but you really need to be there by 8 am. Anytime around 9 & all the restaurants have long lines. We ate breatkast at a small bakery & sandwich shop just across from the brunch & it was unbelievable, the rolls were the best I've had . We met couples who came from the Bellagio to Paris each day for those rolls. (Olive & Tomato rolls) They were from New Jersey as well & know what good bread is! The staff is consumer friendly , if we asked where something was located ,they didn't point, they brought us there, despite our saying 'Its Ok you don't need to do that", they continued with us until we were where we wanted to go. Now thats 5 star service. This service was afforded by all staff from security to maintenance! The only bad thing is the machines were a bit thrifty on me, however a young newly married man did win a million + on a $1 Wheel of Fortune progressive on Monday evening the 17th. It was St. Paddy;s day & O'Shea's at the Flamingo was "nuts" however, their usual $3 & $5 tables were not to be found this day. Oh well supply & demand, the place was JAMMED to the gunnels! It was a little windy & brisk so the pool was not an option until Thursday the 20th. We went & found courteous staff, pleanty of chairs & towels. Its not too big or too small, :comfortable" I would recommend this hotel to anyone & we'll be sure to revisit & stay the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: mholcomb
Reviews.Content: Being my second trip to Vegas, and my first trip with my boyfriend we decided to get a center location and hope for a romantic hotel – Paris did not disappoint. We loved the place, the location, the efficiency and the friendliness of the staff. We even opted for the view of the fountains with the breakfast and appetizer package and I am really happy that we made the choice to upgrade! We ended up getting one of the newly renovated “diamond” rooms on the 29th floor and it was absolutely beautiful. There was so much space, a beautiful view of the strip, Eiffel tower and the fountains, a ton of space and a great large bathroom!!! Just keep in mind that the maid service will come and clean as well as make your bed, but if you want your sheets changed you will have to specifically ask for it with the card that they give you in the room. Although the Paris was always busy, the minute you stepped into your elevator the madness seemed to melt away. Room service was quick, but the food was just “ok” – we had wings and a burger. The food for the breakfast and the appetizers (up on the 31st floor) were excellent and contained fresh fruit, parfait, bagels, cream cheese, lox, fresh juice and many pastries and cereals. For the appetizers (from 5-8) there was cocktail shrimp (sooooooo much of it!!), a variety of cheese, crackers, bread, pastas and kabobs and an optional bar (which you can pay for if you decide to drink – and you pour your own beverages!). I also did the pool for a day (one of the last days we were there and it was really nice. There was an abundance of reclining chairs, so there was plenty for everyone and the pool was enormous. Although the pool has hours from 9-6 it seemed like the shadow overcast the pool around 4:30 so arrange your lawn chair on the immediate side of the pool if you are going later. There is also a bar and waitresses that you can order from, as well as tables by the bar and cabanas that you can rent out for a day. The hotel provides you with towels once you get down there so no need to bring one to the pool. The location of the Paris was perfect – only a few blocks away from everything and a short duce (the double decker bus) ride away from downtown Vegas with Freemont Street. The duce ($5 all day for a ride or $2 each way) stops right in front of the hotel if you are going downtown and you can also catch the connector bus to the Outlets about half way to down town. We did not visit any of the restaurants in the hotel but a couple looked great. The restaurant at the Eiffel tower was closing for lunch the day we decided on going and the As Sin restaurant looked great (if you like sushi) , but we had already eaten elsewhere. Mon Ami was always busy but I had been there before and had a terrible experience where I will not go back. As for the gambling experience the Paris seemed extremely classy. Tables were as low as $10 to play depending on what you wanted to do and the craps tables seemed hot. Waitresses were everywhere and no one was without a drink. Also, the waitressses weren't getting tipped much so when we flipped her $2 she came back every 5-10 minutes. We had multiple drinks readily available!! Only one suggestion for those that are checking out in the morning – don’t go around 10 or 11 because it is when everyone is checking out and they have the least amount of staff at the counters. If you do want to check out at that time be prepared to wait 20 minutes in line OR use the express checkout if you can. Also, keep an eye on thier hotel site - after I had booked my stay with them, the prices went down. I called them to see if I could take advantage of the prices that they were currently offering and they ended up saving me $200 without any hassle! We will definitely go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location on the strip!!!”
Reviews.Author: 9xKINGx9
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paris for Easter weekend....great hotel, nice rooms, great food, nice pool area. You have to go up the Eiffel Tower at night to get a great view of the Strip and the Bellagio fountains! The only dissapointing thing was the size of the poker room but with so many other casinos around, that wasnt an issue! The best part about the Paris is its central Strip location....right in the heart of the action and seems to be close to everything. Overall a great experience....would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in ideal location on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Stirling0955
Reviews.Content: Have now stayed at Paris 7 times in the past few years and never fails to impress. On this occasion we had a suite on the 33rd (top) floor. Very well appointed and very large bathroom. Having the extra space in a suite is worth the extra in the room rate. Paris cannot be faulted on it's location - right in the middle of the Strip. Have stayed at other hotels - MGM too far down one end, Venetian too far down the other way. Stayed at Bellagio and Caesars - both also great locations - would choose one of those two again if Paris not available. All in all another great trip. Slight downside was that it was Spring Break week (hadn't realised it would make such a difference) and so it was very busy. Plus the University basketball tournament started the same week so it was full of sports nuts. Meant that the casinos were busy and walking up and down the Strip took ages due to all the people. Still, at least it gave the place a buzzing atmosphere! Can't recommend Paris enough. Always first choice and great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Paris”
Reviews.Author: Lbgrrl
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay the Paris Hotel. The hotel was wonderful. The gentleman at check in was very friendly. I asked him if we could get one of the renovated rooms, not a problem! We were given a very nice room on the 25th floor with a great view of the strip! The new renovations are very nice. Our room had red accents and red is my favorite color, so it worked out well. Great 46 inch HD flat screen TV in the room! The bed was very comfortable and the room and bathroom were very clean. The staff that we came in contact with were very friendly and helpful. From room service, to the housekeeping, to the cocktail waitresses. All very nice. The only complain I would have, if any, is the water pressure in the shower. I had to work on getting the shampoo rinsed out of my hair. But I survived. I also loved the fact that the entry way of the room was carpeted. Which definately lessened the noise from the hallway. It also helped that we were at the end of a hallway. All in all, we had a very nice stay at the Paris Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Paris”
Reviews.Author: Bia_Mascarenhas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Paris Las Vegas with my husband for 3 nights, between February 24th and 27th. We loved the hotel. Check in was quick and friendly. The room and bathroom were big and absolutely clean, and the bed was confortable. We also liked the food a lot. We ate at three restaurants there (Le Burger, JJ Boulangerie - for breakfast - and Les Artistes), and all of them were excelent!! We had a great time there! I definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated Rooms”
Reviews.Author: lindaabc
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely renovated room on the 28th floor. It was done in reds, blacks, and golds. The bathroom was very nice with a separate shower and tub. The room was cleaned very nicely every day, and the glass in the window was clean. The linens were of a high quality, and the mattress looked new and was quite comfortable. The elevators are super fast. We never had to wait more than several seconds. An earlier reviewer mentioned a strange smell in her room. We noticed that, too. I called housekeeping, and they set up a machine that was supposed to clean the air and make it smell better. It looked about like a vaporizer. It's what they use to remove smoke smells. It worked for a while, but the smell returned the next day. I talked to one of the maids, and she said they've figured out it must be the new carpet that smells. It's a darling houndstooth print in black and tan, and I think the dye has an odor about it. It's just...musty. Hopefully, it will go away with time. It wasn't too bad for us, but we aren't very sensitive to smells. It might be a problem for someone who is highly allergic. It's a lovely hotel; however, it's pretty loud in the casino area and in the cafe. It's designed to look like an outdoor cafe so the casino noise comes through. The Diamond lounge is nice, and everyone treated us very well. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here at Your Own Peril”
Reviews.Author: Ishernyro
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I were all set for a relaxing three days in Las Vegas. I had been in the lobby of the Paris on a previous trip and thought it'd be nice to stay there. We were tired our first day there, after having flown from NY, so we decided to retire early. The next morning, we both awoke, only to find that all our cash was gone! The thief had broken in our room while we were sleeping. Luckily, he/she did not take our driver's licenses or credit cards. I shudder to think what would have happened if either of us had wakened up while the robbery was in progress. Granted, we should have deadbolted the door, and in the future we'll make sure we do so. When we alerted the hotel manager, he gave us a card for a claim agency, whose offices, we later found out, were in Chicago! We didn't check out the next morning, as another couple who were also robbed, did. (Yes, the desk clerk told us this news when we were checking out.) Rather, we spent money at the Paris's spa, the Paris's buffet, and also room service. We thought we would receive some sort of recompense for having gone through such trauma, but we didn't even get an apology from the hotel manager! We found out that the Paris had recently been bought by Harrah's, so perhaps the changing of hands had something to do with the burglary. You can rest assure that we shall never, ever stay at the Paris again, or at any hotel that is owned by Harrah's. What a horrible experience, and what slipshod management.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be...”
Reviews.Author: siropderable
Reviews.Content: Our room had a great view but when we arrived it still had trash from the previous occupants including dirty bars of soap in the bathroom. Our shower stall was in desperate need of caulking and there were numerous unidentifiable stains on the ceiling and walls in the bathroom as well. The caulking behind the faucet in the vanity was green with mold and the air vent in the bathroom was choked with dust that fell onto the vanity each day. Our room did not seem to be dusted daily and late one afternoon after returning from the pool we found our door wedged open with a wooden block and no maids in sight. No telling how long our room was open for anyone to walk in and steal our belongings. We wrote to the hotel after this and got a form letter from Marilyn Winn thanking us for our stay. I don't think we'll go back until we see them get their act together. It's a shame because the Paris is a great property.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is going downhill”
Reviews.Author: Twooldfolks
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay at this hotel. I understand Harrah's is now the owner. The bathroom had a very musty smell (although it appeared clean). There was damage to the carpet in the room with no obvious attempt to repair it. The windows were dirty, appeared to not have been washed for years. The mattress was most likely the original one, needed replaced. I do not intend to ever stay at this hotel again. The rooms (at least ours) was in bad need of updating.

Reviews.Title: “Better and more attentive service than the real Paris (in France)”
Reviews.Author: donvictor
Reviews.Content: We spent a 3 day weekend from Mar. 7 to Mar 10 at the Paris in Las Vegas. The service from all the people that we were in contact with was exceptional (valet, bell man, receptionist, waiters, waitresses and housekeeping staff). The room was clean, comfortable and well appointed. The beds were perfect for my taste and I am fussy about beds. They have huge LCD flat screen televisions with HD programming and even a clock radio with a built-in I-Pod dock built in. The food in the restaurants was excellent and their buffet is probably one of the top 3 in Vegas. Location is a huge plus as The Paris is almost right in the middle of "The Strip" (across the street from The Bellagio and next door to Planet Hollywood). We will most definitely stay at the Paris again as they are a class "A" operation.

Reviews.Title: “great location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: boots22
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Paris for 3 nights last December. When checking in we asked if it was possibe to get two rooms beside each other but the only rooms available where if we upgraded which we decided to do. They didnt have any renovated rooms available but the two rooms we were given were still quite nice rooms. It was lovely decor and such great views out to the strip. We could also see and hear the bellagio foutains which was really cool to watch. We had breakfast every day at the french buffett place(cant remember what it was called) which was really good. We also had dinner there one night and it wasnt as good. The only one bad thing about Paris was how far away the carpark was but really that didnt effect our stay there. I would defiently stay at Paris Las Vegas again!

Reviews.Title: “Worked for us”
Reviews.Author: Beaner32
Reviews.Content: Paris definitely has a theme park feel. But hey, it is Vegas after all. Be prepared for a line checking in and out. It goes pretty fast though. All the staffers were friendly. Our room was nice (we had a MUCH bigger flat screen TV than our friends staying at the Wynn!) but it smelled funny. Oh well, we just stayed there 1 night and it was just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Tamarakjack
Reviews.Content: We have been to Vegas five times in the last four years and have stayed at TI, MGM twice Bally's and now Paris. Bally's and Paris were pretty much the same as to the way we were treated (everyone thanked us for staying and playing there no matter if it was the dealers, the front desk folks or the cocktail waitresses). When we stayed at Bally's we walked through the connecting hall (which is ALWAYS crowded) and into the Paris casino but didn't gamble there. We did eat at the Le Burger Brasserie Sports Grill that trip (it is right next to the Bally's entrance) and the food was great and pretty reasonable. After that trip to Bally's Harrahs sent us offers for free nights at both Bally's and Paris so we decided to stay at the higher end hotel of the two this trip. (If the rooms weren't free we would not have stayed there-it's a little out of our price range) Everytime we go to Vegas we pick up little tidbits to make the next trip easier. Paris offers Express check in. USE IT!! Just call [--] and choose option 6 at least two hours before you arrive and tell them what time you expect to get in. I think they start answering the phones at 6AM. You will need to give them your name, the credit card that you booked the room with and what time you expect to arrive and they will have everything ready when you get there. (I called a couple of days early and asked some questions about the procedure and the person I talked to was most helpful.) We landed at 10:30 AM. We took a cab to the hotel (forget the shuttles), and checked our bags with the bellman. He told me where the express check in line was. I went inside and there were at least 80 people wound through the ropes waiting in the regular check in line. The express check in line had one person ahead of me. In fifteen minutes I was in my room and my bags were on their way up to me. Great room, strip view, best and quickest check in in the five trips we took there. It was a great beginning. The maid servce was wonderful-I did leave a $2 tip on the bed each day- so we had no problems with that either. We didn't eat at the buffet although there was always a line so it must be good- but we did eat at Le Provencal one evening- I had soup and a sandwich and it was really good. We also got our coffee at a little place to the left of the elevators (Lenore I think) but beware-the pastries taste better than they look. Most mornings I had to have a delicious treat along with my caffeine fix! In the afternoons the shelves are filled with fresh made desserts of all kinds and are out of this world. (I have never been to France so maybe that is what they are used to) The casino is pretty dark compared to most of them and it is beautifully decorated as most are. The poker room is relatively small but has restrooms attached so there is no need to walk clear across the casino to use the facilities. Planet Hollywood (right next door) has wonderful shopping that is a very short walk. If you go to the Fashion Show Mall take a cab as it is farther than you think. (especially if you have packages) We were at both ends of the strip when stayed at TI and MGM and Paris is right in the middle which is really nice. The night before we were to leave around midnight I went to the front desk and had the gal there pull up my bill just to double check it. Everything was fine and the next morning we used the Express Check out on the TV and left our keys in the room. I don't know if it was because this was our fifth trip to Vegas or not but this one was one of the smoothest ones yet. Harrahs is the best. We receive offers all the time in the mail and email for comped rooms and will not stay anywhere else now whether it be Bally's or Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy, but not over the top”
Reviews.Author: jdelor
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the Paris & it was great, not sure what some of the other reviewers are on about. The check-in & out was easy, the service was great & the room was spotless & very spacious. All the ammenties were good as were the shops, dining & the casino. My only minor gripe is the walk from the strip to the elevators through the casino. It wasn't that bad but a bit disorientating as every side looks the same. I have stayed at Planet Hollywood & the Imperial Palace before. Paris & Planet Hollywood are similar & both are good value. The Paris is in a great location & I really have no complaints. You really do get what you pay for here.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!! Stay On The Sidewalk, It Will Be Better!!”
Reviews.Author: kissyou
Reviews.Content: THIS IS THE WORST HOTEL IN THE WORLD. I had an "engineer" come into our room while I was changing, not 20 minutes after we checked in and WITH NO WARNING, no call, not even a knock. We let that go. Our safe didn't work, so we called to have it fixed and were told someone would be up to our room in a few minutes. Try a few hours! He couldn't get it to work, so two hours later, another guy came up to fiddle with it. Most of our day was spent waiting for this when we had told the front desk when we called that it could wait and we had plans for the day. We let that go. After a night out, we put the "DO NOT DISTURB" sign on our door before going to bed. The housekeeper come by three times to knock and see if you wanted the room cleaned. When she kept getting turned away, housekeeping CALLED our room. When my boyfriend told her that we had a "DO NOT DISTURB" sign on our door and had not been able to sleep for more than an our at a time, her response was "The sign doesn't say DO NOT DISTURB AT ALL." I have never seen one of those. We called the front desk. BIG MISTAKE. The manager on duty had to be one of the rudest, most ignorant, and ill mannered creatures I have ever had the misfortune to communicate with. We ordered room service and EVERY SINGLE TIME, our order was late, missing something, and virtually inedible. We got coffee and no cups, food with no silverware with which to eat it, breakfast for one when we had ordered two, and cold, soggy, or dried out items that had not survived the hours between being cooked and delivered. On one occasion, I called housekeeping and, upon getting the enthusiastically barked "HOUSEKEEPING," I said "Hello, how are you?" and got a lovely "uh huh" in response. Asking for turn down service, I was told it was not available on our floor at all. Another "manager" said it was available after two days, and yet another said it was available, but having spent so long trying to get the right answer on the matter, it was now too late to get done that day. Requesting bathrobes, which EVERY hotel provides, we were told that they would be sent up, then told that we had to get them at the spa (huh?) then that we had to BUY them, then informed that we had to get passes at the spa to get them, and finally, the hotel does not provide bathrobes to its guests. When my boyfriend called room service once, the response he got to his "Good morning, I'd like to order room service" was "Where are you from?" Apparently he had an accent no one else had managed to pick up on. EVERY SINGLE THING ABOUT THIS HOTEL WAS AWFUL! I cannot get over the terrible treatment , bad manners, lack of respect to their guests, absolutely unacceptable behavior of management, and utter disrespect one receives at this miserable hotel. When we told our friends and family about our stay, those who had been there laughed and told us they had warned us, those who had not thought it was a joke. We always stay at the Wynn, which is, without a single doubt, THE ABSOLUTE BEST hotel in Vegas, but had thought to try a new place once. Sorry, Wynn. We've learned our lesson and will never stray again. We go to Vegas very, very frequently and will never ruin a trip like this again.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service? Not so much.”
Reviews.Author: VegasBride102007
Reviews.Content: I've been going to Las Vegas at least twice a year for the last 6 years. The Paris was always on my list of places I wanted to stay. In October, 2007 I finally stayed there and was less then impressed. Let me start out by saying I got married in Vegas on 10/20/07 and had 60 of my closest friends and family out there with me, most of which stayed at The Paris as well! The Paris is a beautiful hotel! The outside is FULL of gorgeous detail and style. The inside is awesome, like the streets of Paris. In my opinion the most beautiful area inside The Paris is Registration, it's gorgeous! However, The rooms are less then impressive! Honostly the rooms at Hooters (which are half the price) have more bells, whistles, and comfort. The rooms are small and don't have closets which can be a real pain in the rear especially when you have more then two people staying in your room. I also had a situation with the staff the night of my Bachelorette party. I was locked out of my room and my fiance (at the time) was sleeping "soundly" in the room and didn't wake up to my knocking or phone calls. I went to the front desk where I was talked down to and told unless I thought he wasn't breathing they would not let me in. I showed them ID and everything and yes, the room was in my NAME! When I became "appropriately" upset. The man at the desk told me I was being unreasonable! Maybe it was because it was the week of my wedding and I wasn't comfortable lying/pretending that I thought my fiance was dead ....just to get into my hotel room (that was in my name, whice I had paid GOOD MONEY FOR)! I appreciate security however, I don't appreciate someone pulling rank and being difficult just because. Basically it took me approaching a less "unreasonable" staff member to finally get to the bottom of the issue and get into my room. I think this situation was a huge turn off for me. However, had my room and the rest of my service during my stay been EXCELLENT it probably would have been forgotten about......That wasn't the case!

Reviews.Title: “All good except the dirty window”
Reviews.Author: FrozenDesert
Reviews.Content: Checked in Friday, Feb 8 around 4:30pm and were told that there were only double rooms available. I said that was not acceptable so the gal kept looking and got us a nice king room on the 7th floor that overlooked the pool. We could also see part of the fountains of the Belagio (the rest was blocked by the Effel Tower). The window was so dirty that the view as kind of ruined, otherwise I could have parked myself in front of that window for hours - great people watching at the pool that entertained us to tears. If you don't get the room you want, keep asking-don't settle and a room will eventually "magically" appear. From the other veiws I have read, this seems to be their way of doing business. Great location in the center of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place........”
Reviews.Author: leogirlyd
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paris for 3 nights (2/15-2/18) and have no complaints. Check in was very easy, few people in line and it went quickly. Was given room "548P" a king bed on a non-smoking floor (which was requested). The room was on a corner and had windows on 2 sides.. the only down side is they both faced parking garages. This wasn't that big of a deal as we were rarely in our room. The bathroom had seperate shower/bath and included a hairdryer and also tolietries (shampoo,conditioner,shower cap, mouth rinse, lotion & shower gel). Called housekeeping to get an extra blanket and it came in a timely manner.The housekeeping staff did a great job of cleaning the room. Wake up call came when expected. Used the express checkout so can't comment on that but as we were leaving there were only about five people in line. Over all this was a great hotel to stay at and I would stay here again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Super Bowl Weekend in Paris -- Oui BABY!”
Reviews.Author: TIMGeorgia
Reviews.Content: The Paris Hotel and Casino hosted a tremedous SuperBowl weekend. As it turns out, SuperBowl Weekend is one of the busiest times in Las Vegas. I was skeptical about Paris as our Home Base, however given its location, and proximity to Bally's, Caesar's, and Bellagio...how bad could it be? Not to mention as a Total Rewards member, the room nights were comped. So, who's complaining. Well certainly not me. We ended up in the Lemans Suite. Upon arrival the room, we discovered someone else's belongings in the room. The staff worked quickly to fix the "problem" and gave us another LeMans suite on a higer floor that had been renovated. The room was basically a large ~ 700 square feel complete with 50 in. flat screen HDTV with a King bed and the room connected to another room with 2 queens and another 50 in. TV. It is the appoximate size of a normal room ~ 350 Square Feet. This was plenty of room for 2 guys. The casino was really nice with high ceilings. I liked the theme and really enjoyed gambling there. Drink service was great. Never had to wait. We played golf a Paiute Golf Club, which is about a 25-30 minute drive. It was about the most affordable course for Super Bowl Weekend. They have 3 courses there, and they're designed by Pete Dye. We played the Wolf course complete with Island green. GIR, but 3-putted. We payed about $135. Nice clubhouse and the course was in good shape. Greens were brown, but rolled fast and true. I was floored by this. They looked terrible, but were the kind of greens you expect when you pay this kind of money. Anyways, the diamond lounge is very nice and convenient to the casino. We ate breakfast at the restaurant next to the buffet. Can't remember the name, but it was pricey. About $40 for 2. It was good, but would have been happy with a Denny's, Waffle House, or Cracker Barrel type of breakfast and price. Long line for buffet. I have read this in the past, so I don't have a good solution for this. I liked being connected to Bally's. We gambled there as well. Sometimes they will offer lower table limits. $15 on craps (one table) and $25 on the others. All the tables at Paris are $25 and during busy times will have one that is $50 or $100. BTW, on Sunday night after the game, all the craps tables at Caesar's were $100 and only one $25 table. All of the tables were full. The crews/dealer's at Paris were very pleasant and helpful. They would get into the action, but the boxmen/pitbosses were mostly standoffish. I like interacting with these guys, but they hardly spoke, even when engaged. It appeared that they simply wanted to be somewhere else. But, they ARE at work. And everyone has their days. Housekeeping was great. I called down at 5 PM for service, went to dinner and 2 hours later had a clean room. I would recommend Paris to anyone who wants to be in the heart of the strip and likes to gamble in a unique setting. Service, hotel employees, and facilities were great. BTW, we were lucky enough to get some armbands for their VIP Superbowl party and it was amazing. Can you say, 8 x 20 ft. screens, and all the food and drink you can stand. AWESOME!!!! I plan on returning in a few months. I can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: sonofagunn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled to Las Vegas in January 08 for our friends wedding and chose the hotel entirely on the basis that it was handy for the Bellagio where they were getting married. We have visited Vegas once in the past in 2006 and stayed at the MGM Grand that time in one of their new West Wing rooms so that was our "benchmark" for this trip. Initial impressions were good - we were efficiently and quickly checked in and offered an upgrade to a "strip view" for $45 extra per night. I wanted a view of the Bellagio fountains so agreed to the upgrade. I was initially disappointed with the room itself. It did not appear anywhere near as luxurious as the room we'd had at the MGM Grand, however after a good nights sleep I had a good look around and the room was actually quite well appointed. I think the old fashioned decor is by design to give the rooms a "olde world parisian feel". The rooms have everything you need - even the mini-bar was reasonably priced. (Beer out of the mini-bar was actually cheaper than in the bars in the casino). My only gripe would be that there was no free internet access which I kind of expect nowadays. We had one issue with a blocked toilet, however we went out in the morning and this had been fixed by the time we returned. The hotel and casino itself is much easier to navigate than the MGM Grand. The whole place is quite compact by Vegas standards which makes for a nice atmosphere (plus your legs don't hurt as much from walking around). I can recommend the Paris Creparie for a morning snack - the best crepes I've tasted outside of France. Overall, Paris has much to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve”
Reviews.Author: Lighttraveller1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Paris over the 2007/08 New Year. Though the cost was a little more expensive than during the offpeak season, the cost was well worth it. The rooms were large, spacious and well set out. The bathroom was modern and well set out. We found the staff service to be freindly and well trained in assiting their guests. The location was perfect right in the heart of 'The Strip' and everything was well within walking distance. I do warn everyone not to eat at the Planet Hollywood buffet, the linesfor the seafood we're rediculous and the food was probably the worst of all the places we ate. I also suggest you look at booking through the hotels own website, the prices we're by far cheaper and you also can assure yourself of an upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Started off poorly. Saved with an Upgrade.”
Reviews.Author: yazdnil
Reviews.Content: I booked a Romance package to stay in Paris, Las Vegas and would have cared for less hassle and more romance. Upon arrival the front desk line was long and slow. The girl (Marie) who helped us out had a thick accent that was hard to understand. She offered us rooms only with two beds in them (for a romance package, this seems crazy!). Finally, after debating for a few minutes, and being offered suite upgrades for an additional "X" amount of dollars, a room type that we requested "just opened up". It was a handicap room with a kind sized bed. We took it, and upon entering we were very disappointed. It was apparently recently renovated, however looked old, had a terrible shower, small bathroom, and not so good view. Definitely not "romantic" at all. To make things worse, I was walking down the long hallways and peeking into the rooms that were being cleaned and they seemed sooooo much better than ours. We went to the front desk the next morning and asked for room switch. Jerry was very sympathetic to the bad room we had, and upgraded us to a room with a better view. He also started arranging the romance package for us, which turned out to be perfect. From here on out, the stay was great. Lots of champagne and chocolate strawberries! Yum!

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Stay at the Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: debsgas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights at the Paris Hotel on the Las Vegas strip. We gambled at this hotel in the past but, have never stayed there. We arrived at approximately 3PM. We were booked to a standard room. However, I requested and received a complimentary upgrade to a premium guest room on a higher floor and with a strip view. Although, not a suite it had a lovely view of the "Dancing Waters" at the Bellagio. The marble bathroom was large and luxurious. It featured, among other amenities, a shower, a separate bathtub and a separate "water closet". The only minus was an armoire in lieu of a clothes closet. I do realize however, that this was designed as a "French period" accent. However, we had no choice but to "hide" our luggage behind the sofa in the corner. I must say that all of the employees were exceptionally cordial. There was always a greeting or a smile as you passed by. When you asked for directions they were more likely to walk you to the location than to simply point it out. It really made us feel welcome. There were some very nice restaurants. The dinner buffet at "Le Village Buffet" was above average. The food was appetizing and nicely presented. There was something for every taste, (not to mention the crab legs of which, I am particularly fond). The pastries were scrumptious. We also had breakfast at "Le Café Île St. Louis". Yes, it was pricey but, we enjoyed the casual European café flair. There is a 1/2 size scale of the Eiffel Tower in the hotel. A short elevator ride takes you to a fabulous panoramic view of the LV strip and surrounding mountains. If you like to gamble there is a casino. I didn't have as much luck here as in other casinos. However, I can't blame the casino. That's why they call it gambling.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelsTexas
Reviews.Content: We booked at literally the last minute for New Year's Eve and the pricey rate of over $300 was charged. The room was clean, but rather small and plain with no view. Excellent central location for the Vegas strip and within easy walking distance to many of the surrounding hotels and casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Great Escape, In More Ways Than One!”
Reviews.Author: In2Muzikk
Reviews.Content: I had booked my trip to Las Vegas through a vacation package with US Airways. My original reservation was at the Orleans, but after experiencing a number of problems there the first night (beds too hard, the sounds of slamming doors at 7 a.m.), I decided to book my second night at the Paris instead. This was the weekend of the Monte Carlo hotel fire, so many guests had been displaced, and most other casinos were unexpectedly on overload. Arriving at the Paris shortly after noon on Saturday, I expected that I'd have to leave the bags and come back after 4 p.m. to check in. Instead, a very nice lady greeted me, was sorry to hear that I had a bad experience at another casino, and immediately gave me key cards to the room, which was on the 12th floor and had a nice view of the Bellagio fountain and Paris' Eiffel Tower (also a lot of construction and cranes, but I was forewarned about that). After explaining that the bed was too hard for me to sleep on comfortably at the other Casino, she said to call Housekeeping once in the room, and they would cover the bed with a "cell foam pad" to make it softer. That turned out to be a 2-part process: A very overworked housekeeper dropped of the cell-foam in a giant plastic bag, then said someone else would put it on later. Four hours later, another housekeeper arrived to "install" it, but I had already put it on myself. It did make the bed very comfortable, and I got a great night's sleep the second night of my stay. The room was decorated in classic French-style and was immaculate. The windows were double-pane glass, but I could still hear the music playing from the Bellagio fountain after 10 p.m. I was concerned this would keep me up, but either the music was turned off later, or it wasn't loud enough to bother me (and I'm a pretty light sleeper). Paris has a great breakfast buffet, which was $14.99 the Sunday morning I was there. After 11 a.m., the price goes up something like $10 more for "Champagne Brunch," but I thought the regular breakfast was excellent! Included all drinks, including juice, and a glass of juice that size would cost almost the whole price of this breakfast at IHOP! I know that it's all a facade, but I like the French feel and environment of the Paris Casino. It draws a lot of European tourists, many who were speaking French while there. It was a pleasant escape from the first night of my vacation. I wouldn't hesitate to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “4 star experience”
Reviews.Author: Anand_Narayan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris, Las Vegas on the dates of January 13th to January 17th 2008. It was my first time in Vegas so it was a great experience to be at the Paris for the first time. After arriving at the airport we were taken to our hotel via shuttle bus. I believe a shuttle is a great way to get around vegas since you don't really need to go off of the strip for anything. Paris is connected to Bally's Hotel and you can pick up a free shuttle to Rio hotel from there. This will allow you to have a peek at some other hotels that are off of the strip. Since we were in Vegas during a time when there were no major conventions and very few people in Vegas we requested an upgrade to our room...a strip view. We requested this at the time of booking and were granted our request with some bit of additional coaxing. I'm sure if we slipped the attendant a $20 or something she would have given it to us without hassel. Staying at the Paris like I said is a great place to be on the strip because it's central. Walking the strip can be a real chore after awhile because it takes so long to get from one end to the other. Staying central means you can walk one end...then come back to your room. Rest a while and then hit the strip going the other way....or wait the next day to go the other way. Looking at the strip I didn't think the walk would have been that difficult...but believe me it is! Take some good shoes with you because you end up walking forever. Unfortunately Paris doesn't have free wireless internet in any points in the hotel. You have to have a hardline to the internet so take an extra network cable with you. Being that it was January Vegas was on the cold side so we didn't get a chance to try out the pool. It looked good though...but if you ever find yourself down there in January pack an extra fleece jacket. The nights are cold. For food Paris has several restaurants to choose from including its own Buffet and 2 restaurants we tried. One of them you can get a good breakfast and pick up some coffee. I can't remember the name of the eatery, must be a bistro, but for $2.00 bucks you can pick up a good med coffee since the rooms don't come with coffee pots. There is another JJ's Boulangerie that sells sandwiches and plate food for cheap but I don't recommend it...you can pick up some eats outside on the strip somewhere. I would recommend the eiffel tower views plus visiting the restaurant there. Its a must see when you are there. I don't gamble so I can't really give any feedback on the casino.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Chic”
Reviews.Author: MDFreqTvlr
Reviews.Content: Great room with lots of amenities. With so many cookie cutter hotels, Paris stands out for its stylish decor and layout. Excellent restaurant choices and good customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Good Stay! Prices were high for what we got!!!”
Reviews.Author: HattieS
Reviews.Content: First of all - the taxi cab ripped us off major. He took the tunnel and then went to the freeway to take us to the Paris. I told him he was going the wrong way but he just ignored me. Cost was $24 -From the hotel back to the airport it was $10.30. So BEWARE! IF YOUR CAB DRIVER DOESN'T TAKE YOU STRAIGHT TO THE HOTEL - TAKE HIS CAB NUMBER - THE CAB COMPANY NAME AND PHONE THE CAB COMPANY. Also only pay him the proper amount - if he argues tell him to call the supervisor. Even if the strip is busy it won't cost that much more to go down to the Paris, Bally's, Flamingo, Planet Hollywood, etc.!!! We stayed at the Paris from Jan 16 to 22, 2008. Our first room was nasty - shower hadn't been cleaned - leftovers in it - UGH! Floor wasn't vacumned!!! Dust balls around the furniture! Called down and was changed rooms. Different floor so we wouldn't have same housekeeper!! Room was small but okay. Restaurants: WOW! What a rip off - they charge way too much for the food you get - bacon and eggs for $13 doesn't include coffee. Buffet was $27. Anyway go to Johnny's at Bally's - Same breakfast for $5.99. Casino - I go to Vegas every year - this casino didn't pay - there was 30 of us there for a wedding - all had pretty bad luck at the slots - usually someone will win. No $5 Black Jack tables - only 2 - $10 Black Jack tables (that I could see) a few $15 and then the rest were $25 and up. DRINKS!!! Very high cost. Bud light was $6 - Coors light was $7 - Captain Morgans (1 oz) was $9 and Rasberry Vodka (1 oz) was $10 a drink at the lounge by the registration. Drinks even more at the dueling piano bar. Go accross to Bill's casino - way cheaper and the machines paid better. Gosh - I hate to be ripped off!! Very noisy and smoky casino - they must have all the machines turned up on high! Won't go back to this casino. I even sent a email to customer service (they say they will reply within 24 hours - still waiting 2.5 days later). Guess they don't care.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the pastries, but nothing else”
Reviews.Author: WendyKramer
Reviews.Content: This hotel's only redeeming features are the pastries and the Anthony Cools show -- oh and there are two wastebaskets in the room instead of the usual one. I waited in line at least 10 - 15 minutes each time I had to talk to the reservations people and my room key failed mutliple times so I did that almost every day. I hurt my back and asked the concierge for an ice pack / ziplock bag / twist tie and he told me to go to Walgreens up the Strip. He could not help an injured person get a little ice! As I limped up the hallway looking for a ziplock or twist tie, the woman in the wine shop finally helped me out with a piece of shoestring. The pool and whirlpool closes at 5 pm. The computers were "down" for several days, meaning we had to pay cash for everything - with ATM fees in the hotel astronomical. The decor was ok but there are plenty of beautiful hotels in this price range in Vegas -- choose another. WN Kramer

Reviews.Title: “I Loved Paris, would stay there again!!”
Reviews.Author: Nina1967
Reviews.Content: My husband suprised me with a trip to Las Vegas in July, and it was the vacation of a lifetime. The staff at the Paris hotel were wonderful and even though we arrived early, we were able to get into a room with no problem. The room was very nice and had a wonderful view of the Eiffel Tower and the fountains at the Bellagio. The location of the hotel was ideal, in the center and made it easy to work the strip in either direction. I would also highly recommend seeing The LOVE SHOW at the Mirage. That showed was amazing. If you see the show, try to get seats in the higher part of the theater so you can see everything. I will be back to Vegas very soon, and I will stay no where else but the Paris Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I Love Paris in the - anytime!”
Reviews.Author: scher
Reviews.Content: I had a great time January 15th and 16th. I knew I would not be able to get much sleep the night before my flight, so I knew I would want to be able to take a nap immediately upon arrival. Paris has something called Ambassador Service. This service provides you with immediate check-in to your room IF you call a couple of hours before arrival and if you arrive early enough and if they have any clean rooms available to your liking. It's free: you just need to present a credit card in case of incidentals. I wanted a King-sized bed on a high non-smoking floor and I was sure I could be at the hotel by 1:00 PM. Over the phone they said, no problem, and they'd put me on the 17th floor. When I got there, they put me on the 23rd! So I went straight to my room at 1:02 PM and took my nap - no need to store my luggage and wait! I love the bed - eiderdown duvets, as in Europe. The slots were good to me and they have the best restaurants. Nothing beats the Village Buffet in variety, price, quality and service. And of course, you gotta know how to play it to get the best deal, pricewise. They have lunch running from 11:30 -3:30. Dinner starts at 3:30. Lunch is $7 less expensive than dinner because at dinner, they bring out more elaborate food, roasts, etc. Some of you are way ahead of me here - but, for the others - what you do is get there at 3:15 - you pay the lunch price, and 15 minutes later, all the lunch dishes are still there, plus they bring out the rest of their complete dinner menu! Ahh! Pure decadence! Pure relaxation! ... sigh...back to the gym...

Reviews.Title: “Paris Hotel Vegas - Let someone else pay and enjoy”
Reviews.Author: DosJumboMargaritas
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews for Paris prior to arriving on business. I did not chose the hotel, but it worked out very well. Make sure you get an updated room with big screen TV and comfortable bed. The view was good, but not great, however I'm cursed and rarely get good views regardless of price. They charge you for everything and the room rate was over the top high. Fortunately, I was on businesss and did not have to pay the final tab. The casino is light and open, my one tip, buy your beer from the gift shop and not the bar, save a couple of bucks. Of course, you can enjoy free drinks while you gamble, but if you're just walking around, check out the shift shop for booze. The food was ok, nothing too spectacular at the little Italian restaurant inside the walkway to Bally's. If you're paying your own way, check the nightly rates find the best deal, if someone else is paying, sit back and enjoy! Overall, not bad!!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming theme, average accommodations”
Reviews.Author: readytogogram
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at The Paris, and this time I made my reservation by contacting the Hotel directly. We had complicated requests that cannot be handled over a web site. We were celebrating my Dad's 85th birthday, and we required three rooms. A handicap accessible room for my Dad, with a connecting room for his caregiver, and a separate room for my husband and I - all non smoking. The internet rates were $99/night per standard room and with our AAA discount it was more like$88/night. More comments see below. I give the Hotel an A+ on location, and the convenience of entry from Las Vegas Blvd. Some properties, make entry to casino/hotel more challenging and require lots of walking just to get to the front door. When pushing a wheel chair you think of these things. I give them an A+ on room service, it was quick, delicious, generous portions, and the Coffee is really delicious. Dining: I loved dining at Mon Ami Gabi, we had a mid afternoon lunch, and the service, menu and food were all excellent. The hotel cafe was moderate and pricey, but convenience was important. We wanted to try the Creperie, but found out you have to wait in line, no table service. A minus for them. We also dined across the street at the Bellagio Cafe one evening and had a wonderful meal, with excellent ambiance, varied menu, and acceptable prices, not to mention excellent service.. I gave an A+ for the property in general. I know it's not the most elegant of properties. It is charming though and the theme was fun, the size of the property made it large enough to find new things, but not so large that we felt exhausted exploring through crowds of people. We loved the Boulevard just for the ambiance, and the ride to the top of the Eiffel Tower was a fun experience. I also gave an A to the Conceriege, who helped us effortlessly with the purchase of tickets to see La Reve at the Wynn, an amazing show. The biggest negative in my opinion was the bed and the bedding. The bed is very firm, which I would overlook, except that the hotel does not use fitted sheets on the bottom mattress. (A trend throughout the industry.) I hate the way the sheets become un-tucked when you roll over, which you have to do because the mattress is so uncomfortable. I was sleeping on lumps of bedding - which was very annoying. The top bedding was much better... two higher thread count flat sheets enveloped a decent down comforter. The look is clean, but no where near luxurious. Note sheets will not be changed out unless you call housekeeping to request the clean sheets. They only remake the bed instead. The towels were soft and large enough to be passable. I agree with everyone about the TV's in the rooms, they are not flat screen. They are the old style - not HD. In the case of my Dad's room, which was the Suite, the TV was so far from the bed that he would need binoculars to watch it from bed. They'll have to figure out something, since all their French styled armories hold the TV's, and they are NOT wide enough to hold a flat screen. My thoughts on the Accessible Room issues: I have to say that making reservations for Wheelchair accessible rooms is always an experience. " Requests can be made but no guarantees can be promised." Once again, we arrived at 2 PM (one hour BEFORE check-in) to find out that there were no more rooms meeting our requests. This happens to us SOOO often as we travel quite a bit with my father. I have tried every method I can think of to get the hotels to guarantee me a room, it usually doesn't work. In this case I called to the Hotel direct 24 hours in advance reconfirmed the reservation, and underscored the importance of getting the accessible room etc. (The girl at the desk did hint that checking in mid week or early Friday we would stand a better chance than on a Saturday as we did. Go figure.) So our reservation assistant got to work, searching their system for something that would satisfy our needs. We eventually settled on an accessible suite ($85 upcharge) connecting to the two queen room, but both were smoking rooms. We were offered these rooms for review, and if not acceptable they would hold the non smoking rooms with everything we wanted but they were not connecting. (The connecting issue is a big factor for us) Anyway, after reviewing the smoking rooms, the smell was clean, and Dad loved the suite - so we accepted those rooms. I give our Reservation Desk assistant an A+ for effort, however I know from experience, that copping an attitude when they are beginning to tell you the bad news gets you no where. You have to act sweet and patient, even though you might be boiling underneath. At least we ended up with something accessible. My last Hotel experience, I personally had to go out and purchase seating for the toilet and shower so my father could use the bathroom, as they had NO accessible rooms left! Since we were attending a WWII reunion, going to another hotel was not an option. I have to say that the reservation clerk tried for over 30 minutes to meet our needs, and even offered to move us on day two, but that would require us to stop our plans mid day and make the move ourselves, not worth the effort! The three days spent in those smoking rooms was not a problem for my Dad or the caregiver. One further note, the accessible rooms were on the 4th floor, which offers no view. Our room was on the 23rd floor, and we faced Planet Hollywood. Honestly it wasn't the best view either. I guess, if the view was the only thing that was important I would have started there, but you always have to compromise somewhere - right? Yes, I would stay again, but only if I got the same price on the rooms, otherwise I'd try a different property and hope for a more comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: bb24aka
Reviews.Content: If you get an upgraded room, Paris is a great hotel. I was in room 2927, and it had a modern touch with a flat screen TV. the bathroom was basic, but it did have a separate shower. I didn't have a view, but i preferred the updated room over the older rooms, so it was fine. Paris is a GREAT location, right in the middle of the strip across from the Bellagio. the hotel is fun with a great theme, and the cafe has a great breakfast. As long as I can get an upgraded room every time, I would always stay at Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Paris now merely average”
Reviews.Author: Macmanmk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Paris, Las Vegas in the week following Christmas and the only way I can describe the property is "serviceable." At one time Paris was considered one of the premium properties in Vegas. They may have a premium location at the heart of the Strip, but the accommodations themselves cannot be considered anything special. First problem came at check-in. When we were dropped off by the airport shuttle, the hotel's bellhop informed us there were no rooms available at that time (10:30 am), but he would be happy to hold our bags for us until the afternoon. It turns out there were rooms available, although we didn't have an easy time finding this out...there was no signage indicating a check-in line, other than for the hotel's "platinum" members. We had to ask two hotel employees to direct us to the proper line. My friend had previously stayed at Paris six years ago and found the rooms to be spacious and elegant. Our deluxe room this time seemed cramped, especially in relation to rooms at Bellagio and the Venetian (suites, of course) The wallcoverings and carpeting seemed a bit dated. The mattresses on the bed were firm, yet comfortable. The sheets and blanket were not very soft. On the upside, we never had to wait more than a few seconds for an elevator (contrast that with elevator waits of several minutes at Mandalay Bay) There were two wardrobes for hanging clothing (no closet in the room) and three drawers for folded clothes. The hotel has an excellent selection of restaurants and a nice casino.

Reviews.Title: “Merci!”
Reviews.Author: cindilouredhat
Reviews.Content: The last time we stayed in Las Vegas was at Circus Circus 14 years ago when my kids were small. I always wanted to go back and see the new hotels they were building, but it always seemed too expensive. Then, we discovered the websites where you could book hotels and flights together, and suddenly we were in Paris! Well, the Paris Hotel in Las Vegas anyway! Check in and out were fast and very easy. All employees we encountered were very helpful and sweet. Our room was elegant, clean and very European! We had been to Italy in the last couple of years and had stayed in a room in Rome that was actually pretty similar!, so we were thrilled. The hotel itself is spectacular with foot of the Eiffel Tower actually in the casino, and on that floor, there are shops and restaurants (crepes are amazing!!) that make you feel like you are walking down a cobblestone street in Paris. It was really entertainment enough just being in that hotel, but we were able to visit other hotels on foot and using local transportation and that was great fun. Where else can you see Paris, New York, Venice and Egypt in one trip?

Reviews.Title: “Paris at New Year”
Reviews.Author: Jmpf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris for 5 nights over Christmas and New Year; 4th time in Vegas and a return trip to Paris. Thoroughly enjoyed our last stay and was pleased to see that not too much had changed, for the worse. Arrived late at approx half past midnight. Long queue at check in with some rather disgruntled guests looking either to check in or out, only 3 check in desks open. Some guests said they had been waiting for an hour; maybe it was their complaining that speeded up the process as we were through in 20 mins. Management said they were short staffed. Room on 21st floor, not one of the newly renovated ones, view not particularly inspiring [Hey, how much time do you spend in your room when in Vegas so the view was no problem] but it was clean, well appointed and during our stay, well serviced by housekeeping [Contrast to our last trip to Vegas in 12/06 staying in Bellagio where the room was filthy and housekeeping was v poor]. Bathroom was nice and big and my wife was pleased that the hairdryer was decent! The other member of our party was initially on the 8th floor but check in were good to their word and had her transferred up to the 21st floor the following day; nice room wth a strip view. All in all, staff were helpful and polite. No problems on check out, the express service via in room TV worked fine. Casino was lucky for us, no problems getting drinks. Tip......expect to pay a lot for drinks at the bar. $30 for 3 gin and tonics; from the waitresses in the casino, say $6, do the math! Took breakfast most mornings in the cafe st louis, good food, good service. Alternatives were the buffett or the various coffee shops or creperie. The thing we like about Paris is that it's well sited on the strip , spend a few days mooching up the strip, the next, down the strip. The link to Ballys next door is convenient for the monorail link. Were in Vegas to experience the New Year festivities. Have experienced 'large' events in London and Edinburgh and have to say that Vegas was on a par, fantastic fireworks and really nice, happy, even if inebriated partygoers. Had dinner at Smith and Wolensky's on New Years eve, they serve steak to end all arguments, highly recommended. Have eaten before at the steakhouse in Paris which was awesome as well. The only problem we had was trying to get back into Paris on New Years Eve. There was no advance notification given to guests that there would be access restrictions that evening (other hotels, like Bellagio had notices everywhere). As a result, there was an unholy crush to try and get back in and there was only one access through the barriers operating; at one point, mounted police came through the crowd to ease things. Security weren't allowing famillies and children over the barriers even when they were able to produce room keys. I guess it's all part of the experience but maybe next time, the management could do to revisit its' planning. Anyhow, that won't detract too much from what was overall, a really enjoyable stay. Will undoubtedly be back in Vegas and would thoroughly recommend any one to stay here, good price, good location, great hotel. We'll stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Las Vegas? More like Motel 6 Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: tinknclink
Reviews.Content: We were lured to Paris Las Vegas by it's smaller size, and by online reviews which raved about the service and quality of the rooms. Sadly, neither is true of this hotel/casino. Here's a list of our problems in a short 2 day stay. 1. Not so sweet suite - We asked to upgrade from the standard room to a suite, we were told that we could do that for just $85.00, which seemed like a deal because we were told the standard price for the suite was $550.00 per night. We were slightly disappointed in the size when we opened the door, for a suite it's the smallest one I've ever seen. In fact, it's not even as large as a large regular hotel room in many hotels. Add to that fact the small 25" non digital useless TV, and we were glad that most of our entertainment would be outside the room. 2. Holy bedsheet Batman! That's right, holes in our bedsheets. The first set was fine, but when they changed the sheets they put on sheets with holes in them, large enough holes that my wife's toes got caught in one as she slept, lol. If these are the sheets for the 550 a night room, I wonder what the standard rooms get, plastic tarps? 3. Shocked again - The outlet by the sink in the room tripped it's GFCI breaker any time something got plugged into the bottom plug. 4. We wanted to see a show in the hotel during our stay, so we went to the shows and tours desk when we first arrived. We were informed that the cost of the show was $58.00 per person, and no discounts were available. We told the person we would wait and come back, she informed us that we'd better hurry because the show sells out quickly, we distinctly got the feeling of a hard sell being pushed. We went back to the same desk a few hours later, a different person was working, and we inquired if show tickets were still available. She said they were, and she asked if we were staying at the hotel. When we said yes she said we get a discount of two for one. 5. Our second night no turndown service, no towels were picked up, no nothing. 6. Worst of all, when we presented this same list to the front desk as we checked out, it was blown off completely. The clerk said "I'll pass it along to the manager". No apologies, no nothing. Not only will we never stay at Paris Las Vegas again, we'll probably never go to Vegas again at all due to this experience. The only good thing was that we only lost $6.00 in their casino!

Reviews.Title: “Ooh la la!!”
Reviews.Author: native*texan*2005
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris with 4 other couples over the last weekend in December. Paris is a beautiful hotel with a compact but wonderful casino. The rooms were spacious. We were not in updated in rooms but liked them very much. The linens were worn but that was minor. We really enjoyed the location. This hotel connects with Bally's so it was very easy to move around and sample the gambling! One item to point out - there was no "check-in" line. There was a sign labeled check-out. That was actually the check-in/out line! It moved quickly and check-in took about 20 minutes. We arrived about 11am. Three of the five rooms were ready - two couples paid for upgraded views. Those rooms were not ready until much later in the afternoon. We will be back to the Paris Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Stay on Comp”
Reviews.Author: IntegrityTravel
Reviews.Content: This was probably my fourth stay at Paris on a comp. For the Harrah's properties, this is probably their best. Caesars is good, but you have to watch which tower they'll book you in. At least with Paris there's a guarantee of what kind of basic room you'll receive. Parking is a decent walk from the garage to the hotel elevators and registration. Check-in always seems as if it's insanely longer and more time consuming than it needs to be at Harrah's properties. It's as if the employees at check-in are starting from scratch looking for your reservation. Regardless it's expected at this point and I took my room keys. Found the room to be typical of the Paris, clean, modern and stylish accomodations. The bathroom is all marble making a very comfortable experience. The bedding is kind of average. Nothing like the chain hotels that are in a race to have the best bedding. Paris' is just average with a sheet and a blanket. As far as the hotel's common areas, it seems that they can become very crowded with people. Especially at breakfast time as the restaurants are full and the buffet line is out the door.
