The guestroom floors are nice and quiet, but the casino level can seem to be very loud and congested. I've found the Cox internet service to be intermittent. It can be frustrating if trying to stay online for a long time. Internet access is in the $12-13 range.

Reviews.Title: “Great Suite, staff”
Reviews.Author: peddler665
Reviews.Content: We checked in at 7:00 PM on Christmas eve. We were informed that only 2 bed, smoking rooms were available I expressed dismay saying not only was this a romantic trip but we do not smoke. The Desk Clerk excused her self returning about 3 minutes later telling us her manager had approved a Spa Suite for us at the $90 per night rate we had booked through Southwest Airline's Senior Rate. Our suite was fantastic, huge, clean & all the amenities one could ask for including Spa, fridge, coffee pot, fax machine, INTERNET Etc. The suite was furnished with taste & quality. Xmas morning will ordered the "Loves In Room Breakfast an Incredible feast. Salmon Benedict, French Pastries, Breads, Juice, A huge fruit player all fresh, a large bottle of Champagne & lots of coffee. It was enough that we stored the left overs in our fridge for the next Morning. The entire staff was top notch & seemed to want to please their guest. There was a small error on our bill & it was corrected with no discussion. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jwhuffman
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Paris over Christmas. This hotel is quite nice, when you enter in the front, you will be walking through the casino to get to the hotel check-in area. The ceiling of Paris changes from bright blue sky and clouds during the day to a dim look in the evening. Very nice shops and restaurants located thorughout the hotel/casino. I do advise making reservations for the restaurants, as the wait can be 2 hours or more at times for a table. The rooms are nice, they continue the "French" design, which many people not accustomed to French design, may think they room decor is dated, but is not. Be careful if you have children in the room, near the refreshment center, as they have motion censors, that if you pick anything up, even to read it....will automatically charge you. The bathroom is very spacious compared to many hotels I have been in. As many others have posted, they have 3 elevator sections, that take you to certain floors. This hotel does have a connection to its sister property Ballys, which is next door. Overall, I will stay at this hotel for the price is great, food is wonderful, very helpful staff, easy to access from airport, and centrally located around many venues.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at Paris Las Vegas - oui!”
Reviews.Author: kmccolli
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paris Las Vegas in May of 2007. I was pleasantly surprised and really enjoyed this hotel. The rooms were basic but very comfortable. Of course, the location is fantastic if you want to be right in the middle of everything. We ate at one of the hotel's restaurants, Mon Ami Gabi, and it was fantastic. I was also particularly impressed with how clean the casino and lobby areas were. So many of the other casinos are almost unbearable to spend time in with all of the heavily-scented carpet deodorizer (on top of all of the standard casino smells like smoke and alcohol!). This could be influenced by the fact that the Paris casino is relatively small compared to other hotels on the strip and perhaps easier to keep clean. As I recall, the service and staff were friendly. If you luck out like we did and get a great deal on this hotel, you will not be disappointed with your stay.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: gotpunk200202
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our wedding. The guest rooms are a pain to get to with luggage. The elevators are through the casino and you have to battle casino patrons to get elevator "bank." To get our friends rooms we had to take more then one elevator. Most hotels have a cab and limo stand out front, not the Paris. The limos out front are all reserved for “special guests.” i walked to Ballys -which is connected from the inside- as got a limo in 30 seconds. We rented a car for a few days, getting the the parking garage is a 30 minute haul and not maintained or secured. Not really a problem for most, but no limits under 25$ after about 3pm. Had to walk to Bills to even get a table I could afford. I personally did not eat at any of the in house restaurants, but some people I talked to, loved them very much. Amazingly, the slots were very loose, did not lose a penny over 4 days. No closet in the room only an undersized armoire. Beds not comfortable at all. I personally do not think this hotel is anywhere worth the price, but you may have a very different feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice - could improve a bit”
Reviews.Author: CTTom
Reviews.Content: Stayed nights of 12/26 anfd 12/27/07. Previous stay in Sept. 2004 for 2 nights. Restaurants, boulangerie, cafes all have excellent food. Decor is pleasing to the eye. Smart elevator arrangement to the rooms with dedicated elevators (at least 6) to specific blocks of floors, ensuring short waits. Had standard room: spac ious, nice bathroom, well-lighted, but strange positioning of bedside lamps (to the outside of the two beds, vs. in the center). Hotel provided a small refrigerator for medications upon request, at no charge. Comfortable beds. Ordered room service breakfast using the automated system via the TV the night before - when it was 15 minutes late we called and were told that the TV ordering system was not working! However, they did a good job rushing thru our order and served an excellent breakfast to us in 20 minutes, and extended check-out time by an hour so we were not stressed for time. Fortunately, we did not have a plane to catch. We were at the hotel during an especially busy time, and I think Paris' staff did a great job overall. The parking valet, bellmen, front desk staff, and telephone operators were all a pleasure to deal with.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: nunda
Reviews.Content: Our 2-night stay at Paris Las Vegas was an amazing bargain - luxury at a budget price. We booked a midweek flight+hotel package online, and as a result of the early-morning flight we arrived at the hotel about 9 a.m. In spite of the hour we were able to check in right away, and we were given an extra-spacious beautifully decorated corner room (no view) with a very elegant bath. Exploring the hotel was half the fun! The spa and pool are spectacular; we were impressed that although the temperature was in the forties, there were shivering but cheerful staff members on duty at the pool watching over a couple of enthusiastic swimmers who must have been part seal. The casino and the buffet reminded us of the the inside of Disney's Pirates of the Caribbean - painted sky, building facades, etc. We thought the buffet was the best we'd ever eaten, well worth the price, and better than the Bellagio's. We also loved the pastry in the coffee shop; it was as good as what we've had in France. We had a problem with a frayed wire on our Internet connection, and it was fixed as soon as we called. Staff was courteous throughout the hotel. We'll probably never make it back to Vegas, since we went for the sights rather than the gambling, but we'll definitely recommend this hotel to our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Paris was OK”
Reviews.Author: vegasholic
Reviews.Content: My Mom and I stayed at Paris from Dec 16th to 19th. I was so excited because the hotel looked so beautiful and I had read good reviews. Well, Their customer service is lousy! I have a harrahs rewards card and we received an offer to stay for free at any harrahs property (besides Caesars). When we got to Paris and went to check in I asked if we could have a renovated room, and the woman behind the desk could not have been more rude. She asked if we were diamond members and when I said no, she told me those rooms were reserved for diamond members first. The older rooms, which is what we stayed in, are just that....older. There's nothing really negative about them except the beds are kinda uncomfortable. The bathroom was nice, very clean, and the room service was OK. We went to the Spa by mandara at Paris the day we arrived. My Mom had never been to a spa and I was a little disappointed that this was her first experience. I told them we had never been here and still no one showed us around, they just pointed and said "the lockers and showers are back there". I had a facial don't get me wrong, it was AWESOME, but the rest of the spa is just so-so. Upon check out I asked to talk to a casino host but I was told that we didn't need to. I gambled well over $2500 at Paris alone and always used my card, but I was informed we had only accrued $20 in comps. It would have at least been nice to talk to a casino host. We ate at the buffet which was great, and at Mon Ami Gabi, which was also great (a little expensive) and the burger brasserie which was excellent. All in all, nice clean place, but not really worth it, and bad customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Paris: Where the extras always cost, well, EXTRA”
Reviews.Author: applegator
Reviews.Content: If you're someone who likes to judge a book by it's cover, then Paris will create an amazing first impression. However, once you actually start to look inside the book, some less than favorable things will start to surface by the end of the first chapter. The positives? Paris is one of the few hotels on the strip that really shines when it comes to establishing a theme and carrying it through. The common areas are beautiful and do a great job of making you feel like you've traveled across the pond to France. There is a great amount of attention to detail and the casino common areas and promenade between Paris and Bally's are just lovely. Overall the food is quite good. The 24-hour cafe and selections from room service were very tasty. The Burger Brasserie, situated just outside Bally's, was a great, quick choice with burgers and fries that kept us coming back several times during our stay. And best of all, the Burger Brasserie's prices are a great value for the quality and amount of food you get. Also, the drink service in the casino area was among the best I've ever encountered, you never go thirsty while playing and the cocktail servers are very, very sweet and professional and remember what you like to drink day after day. Mon Ami Gabi is just a magical place to eat. If you can sit outside, it's worth the effort and wait. Dining while the fountains are dancing across the street is unforgettable, and the food and drinks are among the best for the dollar. The business center staff are to be commended. Unbeknownst to myself, two of my credit cards and my social security card fell out of my wallet while I was rummaging through it at the business center. The clerk found them after I left and called by room to let me know. So nice to know honest folks still exist. The negatives? Quite a few I'm afraid. 1. At check-in, you get the feeling you're at a used car lot trying to get a good deal. Make a request for a room upgrade (even when willing to pay extra for it) and you'll find that they're "totally full" and "nothing's available." However, the mere appearance of a $20 bill in your hand subtly placed on the counter causes miraculous things to happen. I'd read about this trick from other's experiences on this board, and sure enough, once I let the front desk person notice the folded bill, we went from having a low floor, bally's roof view to a 28th floor fountain view, recently renovated, corner "p" suite... at no extra cost. I feel bad that I helped promote this practice, but it did work. Ultimately, it's just bad business for mgmt to allow this to happen. First come, first served ought to be rule. 2. The place just can't handle crowds. The shopping/dining promenade between Bally's/Paris simply can't handle the traffic with numerous bottlenecks that make you feel like you're in line for theme park attraction. Want to eat at the buffet? Be prepared for at least a one-hour wait for (at any time of day, even 2-3 pm). Aside from breakfast, it's a buffet experience that's as average as they come. At one point, the line stretched from the entrance of the buffet to just before the Burger Brasserie, which is about 50 feet from the Bally's entrance. According to the signs, that would be at least a 2 hour wait... for a buffet. These lines for the food establishments also exacerbate the crowding of the walkway and trying to navigate the crowd will quickly try your patience. This lack of sufficient dining capacity is a major, major miss for a hotel this popular. 3. Daily upkeep. On our first night (Monday) we ordered room service. Once finished, we placed the tray outside our door as people normally do and rang room service to have it picked up. The next morning, it was still there. And guess what? It was STILL there the next morning. The tray sat there until 11:30 am on Thursday and it was joined by no less than 2 other trays down our hall section (both there for more than a full 24 hours). That's just unacceptable. Not even the maids acted on it. Imagine the pest problem that could lead to. Inside the room, there was an obvious white stain on the red coverlet on the bed. Any maid paying attention to what she was doing would have noticed it and replaced it with a clean one. We called and asked for a replacement and never got it. We removed it from the bed and each day we found it placed back on the bed after the room was cleaned, the stain still as obvious as ever. 4. Prices. For room service, a burger/fries and two soft drinks came to $28... and gratuity was not included (as most hotels do). Complete and utter rip off of the guests, especially when the same meal at the cafe or burger brasserie is less than $16. 20 oz bottled soft drinks? $3 each. 10oz glass bottled soft drinks from the mini-bar? $4. 5. The 31st floor lounge. Huge rip off. $45 a day for two guests gets you whole/sliced fruit, croissants, toast, coffee, juice and some less than edible smoked salmon for breakfast. For evening, you get cold cut finger sandwiches. Glass of wine? nope. That's not included. Save yourself the money. Have a 3rd in your party? It's $10 per extra person per visit. All in all, I just felt totally taken advantage of at Paris and not well cared for or appreciated. I've stayed at most of the larger properties on the strip, and I won't go back to Paris, except maybe to play and to eat at Mon Ami Gabi. It's such a shame. There's a ton of potential and you WANT to like the place. At the same time, you leave feeling like you paid far, far more then the value you received for it.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel...but that's it.”
Reviews.Author: summertexas
Reviews.Content: It is safe, clean, and in a great location...but you can get that for half the price next door at Bally's. The only difference is its prettier because it has a french theme and is more updated. If you want a pretty hotel and are planning to stay in your hotel suite then I recommend it...however, if you just want an affordable, clean, and safe place to sleep then it is not worth it. In addition, the casino was small compared to the rest in the Strip. Overall, I am practical, so I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hotel, Nice Stay, Overall a great experience”
Reviews.Author: andie325
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Paris Las Vegas in late October for a belated anniversary trip. We were very satisfied with the overall "feel" of the hotel and we loved the location and it's close proximity to most of the main attractions of the Strip. I especially loved being right across the street from the Bellagio. Our room was a nice, corner room, was LARGE and had a great bathroom with a nice tub and a glass shower. We did not get placed in one of the "upper" rooms that had been renovated, however, we were pleased with our stay. We also liked that it was linked to Bally's... it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location but ONLY location”
Reviews.Author: Tipoti
Reviews.Content: Other than being located right in the middle of the strip (and being half the price of the Bellagio and Ceasar's) this hotel has not much going for it. We arrived at 11:30 at night and they did not have our room available even if we had booked it 3 months in advance. The clerk explained they were "overbooked" which reminded me this practice from airline companies... We had to ask twice to finally get the manager to get out of his office and come see us. He had nothing more to offer and hoestly did not seem to care. As long as the slot machines go... Off to a bad start to say the least... They offered to upgrade us to a suite but only for that 1 night. We had to move the next morning... not the preferred activity when in Vegas for only 3 days! The upgrade ended up being terrible as this was a smoking suite, let alone the fact the furniture was quite tired... The room we ended up in the next day was good. Large room, decent bed and great bathroom. The restaurant for breakfast was less than ok and I was also disappointed by the shops that were not as representative of Paris/France as I would have hoped. Overall, one of the worst hotels on the strip...

Reviews.Title: “1 a.m. arrival graciously rec'd. What a wonderful bath area!”
Reviews.Author: gediminas
Reviews.Content: After a long series of flights (interrupted twice by "mechanical problems") whereby I arrived 12 hours later than planned, after midnite. the nice yg lady at the desk, to my relief, processed me quickly. Thankfully my room had not been given away! The distance to the desk from the entrance where the shuttle dropped me was long and winding thru the casino, which was aggravating. I was so tired I would have appreciated a bellman's assistance, but none was evident. I did not ask for one because I was too tired to wait. When I got to my room, I found the secondary lock device did not work. I called the desk and asked to be moved. A bellman arrived within 15 minutes to move me next door. After this frustrating day, I decided I should treat myself to a Heinekin from the refreshment center, even if it was $6 a bottle. Problem, after I had removed the bottle, I found it was not a twistoff and there was no opener. I would have just put it back, but the rules of the the Center were that one is charged within a minute or so of item removal. So I called the desk for an opener. The bathtub is separate from the shower (good thing since there was a hairball in the shower--which, BTW, was still there the next afternoon despite my leaving the maid a note about it). Bed very comfortable with pillows of variety of softness so one may select. Bathroom counter space fantastic. Wish there was keyboard available for TV internet instead of just internet connect.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: Patrick35
Reviews.Content: Thankfully, the hotel has replaced the initial chaotic, free-for-all check-in system with the orderly cordoned-aisle one, whereby guests are helped by the next available clerk instead of waiting in vain if someone in front of them has a problem. The only thing that does not fit the superb impression created by this hotel is the fact that, perhaps in a misguided effort to save money, while the hotel has on the one hand installed large flat-screen TVs in the rooms, on the other, has opted to keep the old remote controls which do not enable guests to adjust the digital aspect of the picture. As a result most of the time the picture is distorted horizontally thus negating the benefits of the high quality TV.

Reviews.Title: “Paris by Name”
Reviews.Author: MikeandAnn
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Las Vegas. Taxi from airport took the longest possible route so that was a good start. Room was tired but relatively clean. After a few days we started to suffer skin rashes which we ultimately put down to harsh chemicals in the laundry. The position was good but as a hotel it was no better than OK. Buffet breakfast next door in what was the Aladdin was superb and the shows that we saw excellent. Helicopter to Grand Canyon was awe.......( overused!!!!! ) Enjoyed our break very much. Gambling is not essential. You do what you like there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: MississaugaCharChar
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel!! Location was great, would not stay anywhere other than on the central strip and for the price Paris cannot be beat. Perfect for a couple just wanting to get away. We had a non-renovated room on the 8th floor facing the back of the hotel. Room was nice and pretty standard. We only went to the room to sleep and shower so there were no issues. We ate at several buffets and restaurants during our stay and I have to say that the buffet at the Bellagio was by far the best and it only cost us $18.99 each. We went there for lunch on our first day and nothing else could compare. The other 2 restaurants we liked was Les Burger Brassier at Paris and Wolfgang Puck's restaurant at the Venetian. Advice for all the frist time visitors: Be prepared for ALOT of walking if you want to see each hotel and there's no need to get up early in the morning, stores don't open before 9. (Definately a night city!) Overall, a great hotel, worth the price and both my husband and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location inside is grotty.”
Reviews.Author: cynbyn
Reviews.Content: Had to move to the Paris hotel after our cheaper stay at the signature expired for the weekend rates. The outside looked like something from disney howver the rooms were bland and a bit grotty overlookin the top of a car park. It was howver in a great location to explore the top end of the strip howver I would not stay here again, the bar staff were very rude to a companion of mine even though we have gambled all night.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed for the price”
Reviews.Author: Dok_K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris Las Vegas on Sunday, December 10. This was the busy weekend of the NFR, so all the hotels were pretty crowded. Checked in about 2:00 and it took less than 5 minutes. There were a lot of stations open and I never saw a line more than 3 people long when walking by. Thumbs up for registration! We were offered an upgrade to a Suite for an additional $85 and we decided to try it. We were there with 2 other couples and thought it would be nice to have a place where we could all meet and hang out. The suite was large and worked great as a place to gather, but overall I was disappointed with the quality of the room. On the plus side it was about 800 square feet, had a mini fridge and sink in the sitting area, and the bedding was attractive. The bath area was very large (15'x15' ?) and had a separate room with toilet and bidet. There was a large jacuzzi tub, but not quite big enough for two, and a separate shower. Negatives: Decor was pretty spartan. Walls were almost bare of decoration and everything was done in shades of dull beige. Lots of nicks and chips in the furniture, paint, and moldings; wallpaper was dirty and lifting in many spots . . . overall it just looked worn and tired. Bathroom amenities were skimpy and on par with your average Holiday Inn. I guess I was expecting a Paris suite to have robes, fancy soaps, designer towels, etc., and I was disappointed when it didn't. My biggest complaint was the TV. Just a single, standard 21" color TV. A suite that size screamed for a couple big screen plasmas in the living area and another near the jacuzzi. Casino is huge and disorienting. I have been in there on several other trips and I still have a hard time finding my way around. Lots of table games, but $15 minimums for BJ with the majority of tables at $25 and up. Very few video poker machines, and they had horrible pay tables. Mostly 7/5 for $1 Jacks or Better. I saw a few 8/5 for $2 and $5 machines. Cocktail service was almost non-existant away from the tables. I didn't eat at Paris, so I can't comment on the restaurants. Overall it was a nice hotel, but sub-par for the price. Not a good gambling spot, either.

Reviews.Title: “just okay”
Reviews.Author: ekbmtm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris over Thanskgiving weekend with 12 add'l family members! We booked the trip in April ( 6 months ahead of time) , but when we checked in there were "no rooms' available. They had told us they were putting us in a "diamond club" member room and the rest of our party in suites. Everyone had to move the next day. No one was on the same floor. we were in different parts of the hotel. we were pretty disappointed because we booked our rooms thourgh a travel agent and booked well in advance. when we requested a late check out, we were told anything after 1pm would incur an entire day's stay of $109.00. this never happened to us before. we always fly the red eye home and checked out of our hotels at 6pm and sometimes even 7pm! i was really surprised. also, skip the spa- completely overpriced and so not worth it! I must say that the hotel was gorgeous, close to everything, the bed was comfortable, buffet yummy, the burger place was fantastic, but I lost big time at the tables! we probably would not stay again because there are so many other hotels on the strip that we want to try, but I am glad we tried it!

Reviews.Title: “2nd time staying here, loved it.”
Reviews.Author: sd_carlsbad_NM
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying that the Paris in Las Vegas. We chose to return to this hotel because we enjoyed the rooms, the central location on the strip, and the breakfast buffett (it is buy far the best in town). This was our 5th trip to sin city and we really had a great time at this hotel. We did a decent amount of gambling at the hotel but probably the majority of it at Bally's we enjoyed their poker room better. This hotel is great if you like to get out and see the other loactions on the strip. It is also great if you just want to watch the water show at the Bellagio. Be sure to get a room with a view of the water show!! Also, if you stay here you would be a fool not to eat their breakfast buffett. We would head over in the morning and it would hold us off until dinner. Overall, the hotel is nice with nice accomidations. You will probably pay a little more than some places to stay here but it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, but beware”
Reviews.Author: Luna1124
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I drove up to Vegas and we stayed at the Paris Hotel. The hotel itself, in and out, is just exquisite. Yes, while everything in Vegas is over the top, the Paris Las Vegas has done a terrific job of capturing the European flair. The check in area was adorned with crystal chandaliers, and the staff were very helpful upon check in. As we were staying during the week, and in the "off-season", we were offered an upgrade to a suite for an additional 80 dollars. We grabbed it, and were not disappointed (well, it was a delayed gratification, as you will see below). The only major setback we had was when we checked in we were given a room that was absolutely filthy. There were very obvious "stains" on the bed linens, the couch and a chair. I was appauled that they would even give out a room in that condition. We immediately went to request another room. The staff, however, were not thrilled with our request for another room, nor were they overly apologetic about the condition of the room. The lady we dealt with was, in fact, rather rude, and almost threatened us with the removal of the "special offer" to upgrade if we were going to be picky. We complained to the manager about her conduct, but they didn't really seem to care too much. We then had to wait for another 2 hours for our room to be ready. Having said that, the room we were given was absolutely gorgeous, so it was worth the wait. It was a brand new room (had just been remodelled and had only been available for occupation in the last month). Unlike the traditional decor and overly ornate room (tassels anyone?) we had at first, this room was chic, modern and simple. It was something you would expect in a boutique hotel, except, as it was a suite, it was just enormous. The decor was red and chocolate brown - simply divine. The bathroom was adorned in limestone had a glass enclosed shower adjacent to a whirlpool tub. There was also a separate powder room which was next to a closet - every woman's dressing room dream. And while we didn't watch TV, the room was equipped with an enormous state of the art flat screen TV. The piazza, shops and entire atmosphere of the hotel and casino were just amazing. I can't get over the attention to detail (minus the incident we had with the first room) in the design and construction. While a few of the shops are a little tacky (in terms of their wares), the patisserie was just splendid, albeit overpriced. We ate in two restaurants at Paris. We ate at the steakhouse (which name I cannot recall) in the main casino area and it was very expensive and rather disappointing. While the decor was lovely and the staff friendly, I've had better steak at the Keg, frankly. We also ate at the Thai/sushi place located in the main casino area, and it was well-priced and just delicious. On a recent visit I stopped by that same restaurant, but it seems that they may only serve sushi now.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas What a Suprise ... Had a blast”
Reviews.Author: CanJusp
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 2 nights in Las Vegas at the end of a visit to friends. We werent real excited about it but figured we should at least experience it since we were flying in and out of there. What a suprise, we loved it! There really are a million things to do here. We stayed on the strip at the Paris Hotel. We got a great discount rate from the hotels website itself. (about half the price expedia had) Our room was very clean and decorated beautifully. I didnt like that you had to pay for wifi though - 12.95 for 24hrs seemed like a rip off. The strip was a blast. We felt very safe as long as you didnt venture down the side streets. You can walk around with your drinks which we loved since we are from NJ where you cant do ANYTHING lol. There are tons of bars, dining and shopping. you can walk almost anywhere on the strip or take the monorail (trust me you wont be driving here. Check out the wax museum at the venetian its great. Also see all the BIG hotels each one is beautiful. This is a great place for a 2-3 night stay, any longer you may get liver poisoning lol or become extremely broke!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mike'sgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris from Wed 11/28-Sun 12/2 and had a great stay. It was myself, my husband, our 4 month old, and my mom. We got two rooms. My mom booked the rooms through the hotel directly. She is the gambler so one room was comped and the other was not. The first night we had adjoining rooms on the 30th floor and the next day we moved to non adjoining rooms also on the 30th floor, but these were strip facing with a gorgeous view of the Bellagio. The rooms themselves were very nice. They had been recently renovated. I did not see any of the non-renovated rooms, but I would recommend trying to get a room above the 25th floor as these are the ones that have been redone. The room was large enough for us, with a large tv , desk, loveseat, coffee table, and a comfy king size bed. We also had a crib, which was provided by the hotel. The bathroom was very nice and the toiletries were replaced daily. Housekeeping was great, in fact the entire staff at the hotel and casino were excellent. No complaints. We ate twice at the breakfast buffet and loved it.. We used the $5 off coupons in one of the fun books we had. There was anything you could want for breakfast and then some! If you like mimosas go between 8am-10am, they are $.99! We ate the first morning at Le Creperie and it was actually more expensive than the buffet. We had lunch at Mon Ami Gabi, which was excellent. We sat outside and enjoyed a leisurly meal. One night we had dinner at the Burger Brasseire. Every kind of burger in a sports bar atmosphere. My husband had room service one night and said it was delivered quickly and was nice and hot. He also said the portions were huge and he is a big eater. My mom is a Diamond Card holder so we were able to enjoy the Club Lounge, which was very nice. She was also able to have a private check in and check out. I did notice that the lines in the main check in area were long at times, but there were a lot of staff so I'm sure they moved quickly. Overall, the Paris was excellent. It is center strip, which made it easy to get everywhere. The monorail stops at Bally's, which is connected to Paris. I'm so happy with our decision to stay at Paris and will hopefully return someday!

Reviews.Title: “Pass”
Reviews.Author: zippo_7
Reviews.Content: Rude and indifferent staff. Enough said.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: plambecksride
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris for Thanksgiving weekend. The room was nice, but it took a long time for the to get hot water in the room. The room was not vacuumed everyday. The location was very good, only steps away from Planet Hollywood, Caesars, Bellagio, etc. Service was very good, friendly. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shanester81
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for the first part of the trip (21-23 Nov). We arrived at Paris around 4:30pm and there was hardly any wait. We checked in and the desk clerk tried to get us to upgrade to the bigger suite for $135 which we declined as we already paid for a LeMans suite. I did notice that the person next to the clerk offered the same suite for the same price to another couple and they were staying in a regular room so I did feel glad that I didn't take her up on the offer as I would have felt ripped off as I paid for for a suite and received the same offer amount as a regular room. I did not do the $20 dollar trick as a result and we ended up on the 6th floor with a view of the air vents and Ballys so we kept the curtains closed the whole time but we did not come to Vegas to sit in the room. The room was really nice and the bed was comfy. The bathroom had a giant tub that was great to relax in after a long day out. There was also a bidet in the bathroom and I hadn't seen one since the last time I was in Europe and had to explain what they were used for to my partner. Maid service was very good and she restocked the ammenities which was nice and we never lacked for towels nor was our room run down like some have complained about on here. Only noise we heard was from the room next door when the kids woke up and where running around the room yelling. We had gone to the buffet on prior trips but not this time as there was a huge line all hours of the day, so we went to Rio for the Carnival World Buffet that was pretty good had the usual Thanksgiving fixings. We did eat at the creperie and JJ Boulangerie and the crepes and sandwiches were delicious also the chocolate twists were great for a snack as well. We saw Anthony Cools show at Paris and it was hilarious to see the things he made people do and he put on a good show but he does have a foul mouth so if you are offended by profanity this show is not for you. We also saw KA which was great other than Love it is my next best show on the Cirque line. I don't really have any complaints love the connection between Bally's and Paris, only minor gripe would be the slots were extremely tight at both casinos but we would definately stay there again though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel, Great Casino!”
Reviews.Author: nymark2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paris Nov 22 through 25 (A Thanksgiving Holidays getaway). The hotel is beautiful and the casino has high ceilings and clouds, so you don't feel so closed in like at many of the other Casinos. The check-in was fast and the woman was very friendly. I witnessed very friendly staff to other people when checking in and out. The room was on the 27th floor, so it was remodeled. It was very nice. The flat panel TV is great; the view was not of the strip, but still nice. The bathroom was huge. Maids were very friendly. Elevator is express and fast. I ate at the buffet for breakfast and it was very good. Pros: one of the Best locations on the strip. Right in the middle of everything. Can get into Ballys without going outside. Rooms are big, quiet, clean and the remodeled ones are modern. Bathrooms are huge. Staff is friendly. Casino is clean and nice. There are many restaurants to choose from. Here's a few cons: the line to the buffet for dinner was way to long (all nights). The casino gets very crowded at night. I couldn't find a quick place to grab coffee or a sandwich for lunch. Same slots as all of the other Harrah entertainment group hotels & I got tired of them. The bottom line: I have stayed at the Luxor, Monte Carlo, Alladin and Golden Nugget. The Paris is by far the best. I would definately stay there again. It is a very enjoyable hotel and a good experience for me! Make sure you book a good rate on the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: MillerCorona
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris hotel from Nov 18th-22nd. Checking in was a pretty quick - only had to wait 10 mins or so (we checked in at around 6pm). They had no king beds left so we got a room with 2 queen beds. I also had asked to get a room on the 25th room or above but at time of check in she said nothing was available. She noted to try the next morning when people were checking out. We got room 1950 - it was actually pretty nice - it was a bit dated but for the 99/night it was pretty good! The bathroom was really nice actually - very clean and elegant looking. The next day my spouse lost his key and so we went around 6pm to get another one. While we were there I decided to ask about getting a king bed and a room on the 25th floor or higher (we weren’t going to b/c the accommodations we had were fine) and we got room 2952 (for free - no extra payment)- which was super nice. Only rooms from 25-30 are renovated- and they are nice rooms! They are just fancier and newer looking. The large screen TV was awesome and the view was better since we were higher up. Overall we loved the room and we didn't hear much noise or anything (and i'm quite picky). Overall everyone at the hotel was super friendly and very helpful. We book tickets to David Copperfield through the concierge (although not a show I recommend - better spend your money on cirque du soleil). We loved "Le Notre" which is a pastry shop right beside the elevators!! They had the MOST amazing deserts - and the prices were reasonable. 5.50 for these deserts which are pretty big! but by the end of the night they do run out of most of them. We also got a cheese platter which was awesome. We basically bought things from there every day and it was well worth it. We also tried the restaurant "Ah sin" - and that was awesome as well - prices were pretty reasonable- we had sushi, shrimp tempura rolls and won ton soup -service in the restaurant was impeccable. Anyway loved our stay - it was well worth the 99/night.

Reviews.Title: “Preview of Coming Attractions”
Reviews.Author: conrich
Reviews.Content: It took four room assignments to get an adequate room. The first room had soiled linen, second room had broken closet door and third room was very dim and dark. Paris still has excellent public areas and restaurants, however, we will not stay there again until they renovate the rooms. The service is good and it is convenient for travel along the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, Magnificent !!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hawaiitrader
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from staying at the fabulous Paris hotel. I had overnighted there before but my husband had never been there. I have been to the "real" city of Paris and I must say, this took me back to that locale. The hotel is beautifully decorated and one of my friends that lives in Vegas said the casino is so well ventilated that she didn't smell cigarette smoke like one does in most casinos. Our room was beautifully appointed and the staff was most gracious. From the exquisite tile on the elevator floor to the pool that is overlooked by the Eiffel Tower everything was flawless. I will definitely stay there again and I am counting the days until I return.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Paris...”
Reviews.Author: murphysmum
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we'd stayed at the Paris; we loved it the first time and our opinion hasn't changed. I had asked for a room with a view of the Bellagio fountains and all was in order when we arrived. We were on the 24th floor, which I guess is the next one for renovation. The room was identical to the room we'd had before except this time the colors were green and yellow instead of blue and white (this was my only tiny disappointment). My husband was going to a conference and we were meeting friends for dinner. I immediately headed downstairs for the Creperie (best crepes outside of the Left Bank) for lunch and then enjoyed quiet time in the room and by the pool. We've eaten at every venue there now and overall I've been quite pleased with the quality of their food. Since I don't "get" gambling and don't need to shop, I enjoy time alone when on short vacations and the rooms at the Paris are like large well equipped private oasis....Love it! We had an unexpected third night after getting an airport announcement that the plane wasn't flying that night so we called the hotel to come back and were graciously accommodated. This time we were on the 25th floor in a renovated room. They're quite dramatic with black and cream herringbone carpet, tall red leather headboards, taupe art deco love seat with round red satin pillow and new lovely bedding...all white...I love that look. They've managed to affect a clean, chic look and not go over the top. We didn't mind not being able to get home when we "had" to spend an extra night at the Paris, ordered room service and just relaxed....and there are always those Bellagio fountains to watch. I think the Paris is the best moderately priced hotel in town.

Reviews.Title: “paris a good choice”
Reviews.Author: kingsizehomer
Reviews.Content: After staying at the excalibur last time, we wanted something a little bit more upmarket and after looking at nearly all the hotels on the strip we chose paris, and i am glad we did. Arrived at 3pm on a thursday and only had 2 people in front of me at check in. Observed check-in staff while waiting and most seemed to be smiling and being friendly with people they were dealing with, however lady i got must have been off sick on the day the staff went to charm school, but having stayed in vegas before i know this is not uncommon. Had room on 23rd floor with great view of bellagios fountains, room was clean and did not hear any noise from other rooms or in the hallway. If you dont want budget and cant afford top end like wynn or bellagio then for a good stay in vegas i would say stay at paris.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated rooms vs the old rooms...”
Reviews.Author: rkgoshi
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for the third time this year and maybe the 14th time in my life. We got married there in 2001 and stay there several times a year. Despite being a frequent guest there, still no recognition on the hotel side. Casino dealers remember us and usually provide friendly, attentive service. Arrived at around 1000am and asked if all rooms had completed renovation and was told no, not yet. Asked if we could get one of the renovated rooms as this was our 6th Anniversary and got married there on property and that it was also my birthday and it was our third stay this year. .. despite all of this, we were told that we would have to wait until 3pm and informed that no guarantee even if we waited till 3pm that we would get a renovated room. Decided not to wait and took a room which was ready but not-renovated yet. The room is still okay. A little old with small picture tube tv, slightly worn furniture... Just like it was when we got married there in 2001. Once again, we could only fantasize about the rennovated rooms. After three days of gambling, acheived "Diamond" status as Total Rewards member. Proceeded to the Diamond member front desk to inquire about a room move to a rennovated room and was allowed to move to the rennovated room!!!! Even though it was for only one night, it was nice to see the new room. Hugeflat screen tv, new bed, carpet furniture, I-pod dock....NICE! Same room just updated...no comparison. Overall, nice stay again, still hoping to one day be greeted by the hotel side by a "Welcome Back!"

Reviews.Title: “1st stay at Paris”
Reviews.Author: 15mwaltrip
Reviews.Content: Check in at Paris was quick and easy. We had a rental car this trip so we used the bellhop and valet parking, which made check in hassle free. The bell hop and valet were very efficient and we never had to wait more than a few minutes for our car. We asked for a room with a view or complimentary upgrade and were told that rooms with Eiffel Tower and fountain views are normally $60 more per night. We declined. The agent did some magic on her computer and was able to put is in a room with a view on the 12th floor, room 1217, for no extra charge. We tipped the desk clerk a twenty for her effort. The room had 2 queen beds, not a king, but that was OK by us. It was before noon but we were able to get keys and access our room. Our room was very clean and well appointed. Along with two queen beds on the right wall, it had a small table with 2 chairs in front of the window, a small desk on the left side of the wall, an armoire next to that with a decent size TV, drawers, small lit hanging spaces with hangars and a safe. I did not see a large closet but we typically leave our stuff packed and take out what we need when we need it. The beds were very comfortable and the linens seemed of very high quality. The pillows were comfy too. We had no issues or complaints with either bed. The sheets were stark white with no rips, stains, etc. The bathroom had a marble counter, sink, small bathtub and separate shower stall. The bathroom had a full size mirror on the door, no fan (I haven’t encountered a bathroom fan yet in Vegas) and a make up mirror attached to the wall. The bathroom lighting could have been a little brighter for my taste, or had more than one switch, but it wasn’t that big of a deal. The towels were snowy white and were average to above-average hotel towels. Nothing super-fancy, but no problems either. The bathroom was impeccably clean, which to me is most important. There was a supply of Gilcrest & Soames shampoo, conditioner, mouthwash and lotion. It was restocked each day and I’m sure you could ask for more if needed. There was a mini-bar with a sensor – don’t touch anything! In all, I would stay again at Paris. The location is great and I love the atmosphere. I get comped rooms here but if I were paying, I would probably stay at Bally’s as the rooms in the north tower are very comparable to the room I had at Paris (except for the view) and a walkway connects the two.

Reviews.Title: “Just returned”
Reviews.Author: Joyce333
Reviews.Content: Disappointed by the hype. I don't think this hotel had any real spark. I did not find it overly clean. The room was shabby, carpet stained, bathroom fixtures starting to break, drapes stained. Bed was comfortable. Room 3271. Was a no smoking floor (32nd) and we could smell people smoking on and off all night. Dedicated elevator banks was great. Never waited too long. Staff were rude or didn't speak English very well. Bathroom amenities were cheap. Room service breakfast was good. View was horrible. Bathtub looked stained, separate shower was good. Good location Casino was ok, shopping was fine Restaurants inside complex were good. Would not recommend it to anyone other than someone needing a mattress to get some shut eye.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: DAC
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a great trip to the Paris. We have stayed there before and will continue to return. The hotel is average or below average in cost but is very clean, nice and the location is perfect. I have stayed at higher priced hotels such as the Venetian which is nice but you are also paying three times the amount. For us we are hardly in the room so this suits our needs. Cosider this when booking and your expectations will be exceeded. I enjoy customer service especially if I am losing money!!! The Paris dealers seemed to be very friendly and fun in comparison to other hotels. In fact one dealer Anny N. had us laughing so hard the pit boss came over to check on us. She was a blast and made us lose more moeny then we could afford becuase we stayed so long. So when you go there be sure and find her and tell her the people from Chicago and Bloomington Illinois said hi. The only downside to the entire hotel was that one pit boss was rude and unfriendly......he should take the lead from his staff and learn to have fun. A must is the crepes in the morning. Guys get up early and pick up the apple crepes or the bananas foster then go back up and see your loved one's face light up!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Paris”
Reviews.Author: LuGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Just back from 5 days at the Paris and would highly recommend this hotel for location, comfort and amenities. We splashed out on an upgrade to front facing room on 22nd floor overlooking Strip and Bellagio fountains, beautiful fittings and bathroom with sunken bath , well worth the extra as we watched the dancing fountains from room. Staff were helpful and friendly everywhere. Could not fault this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Paris, oui... oui!”
Reviews.Author: nicaribbean
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Las Vegas around noon. Stepped in the lobby and was impressed by the chandeliers. It looked like a classic parisian ballroom. Check-in was fast. The friendly clerk told us that check-in is only at 4h00. They took our luggage and we started to look around for a place to eat. We had a nice lunch in a brasserie at the Paris. We walked around the Strip and played some slots. Around 4h00, we went to the lobby key pick-up. They said that our room was ready. We headed towards the elevator and went to the 14th floor. Our room was a "p" suite. It is a corner room that is slightly larger than a regular room with two windows with two different views. Upon entering, we noticed that our room was tucked in at the end of the corridor, away from the elevators. Nice and quiet! The room is nice and give a feeling of being in France with hues of blue and yellow. The bed was comfortable. There was plenty of closet space. There is a safe in the closet. We had a sitting area and a desk area. The bathroom has nice marble floors. The separate shower and tub gives it a nice touch. We didn't get a Strip view but we didn't pay for one either. However, we could see the mountains and the airport. Las Vegas is a very busy place! The location of the Paris is the best. It is center Strip and close to everything. One evening we had dinner at Mon ami Gabi and we sat on the terrasse. The food was good and we were serenaded by Bellagio's dancing fountain right across the street. It was beautiful! We also had an upscale dinner at the Eiffel Tower restaurant. The food and service was top notch. The view up there was incredible! It was quite the experience! The casino was a bit smaller than some of the neighboring hotels but that was ok for us. We are not high rollers. You could always find a slot machine or a seat a poker table even on the weekend when you notice more people than ever. Our friend won $1500.00 on a slot machine. We were so excited! They came over and asked a few questions and asked for ID. When they came back, they explained that the casino keeps 30% of winnings over $1200.00. He ended up with a little over $1000.00. Not too bad for our second day there! The rest of our group won $100-$200 each but ended up loosing it again in the machines. Our new saying is "The money we gambled in Las Vegas, stayed in Las Vegas!". We had fun and that's all that matters. The waiting time for a drink in the casino was 5-10 minutes. Pretty good! All the staff we spoke to were polite and friendly. The pool area was very nice! We always had towels and chairs, no problem! One day, we noticed Tony Danza was sunbathing next to us. We were a little starstruck but we did not talk to him. He still looks the same as 20 years ago! He plays in a musical "The Producers" at the Paris. We saw it and it was pretty good! If you stay at the Paris, you get those tickets half price. The front of the hotel is quite impressive with the Eiffel tower, the fountain and l'Arc de Triomphe. All in all, we were very impressed with the Paris and would go back in a flash!

Reviews.Title: “Bad impression”
Reviews.Author: rgl48772
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Las Vegas Paris. The hotel is beautiful from outside and location is great. Very good restaurants. Pool area is lovely. Location is super, it is across Bellagio and close to everything. But the compliments stop right here. Disappointment starts as soon as you get inside. It starts imediately in the lobby at check in: waiting in long lines, unfriendly and extremely rude hotel stuff. For the four stars class this hotel could afford to have the lobby and check in area to be inviting. Instead it is very uninviting:not a single flower arrangement, not even a bench to sit down after a long flight. To get to the check in area you need to go through a very crowded and extremly smoky casino. Poor ventilation system let all the smoke from casino into elevators leading to the guests rooms. I've had the worst allergies from inhailed smoke. Someone in the room next to ours had the same problem and was coughing all night, so we could not sleep. Our room was good size, nicely decorated and clean, big plushy towels, however the TV reception is poor, pillows are cheap and very lumpy, toiletries are given only for one person even two people are checked in. We never experienced such poor service before. We'll never come back to this hotel. Overall I would say this is probably the worst hotel we have ever stayed in. Even the most convenient location can not make up for the discomfort and unfriedly and rude hotel stuff.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: ovalball
Reviews.Content: The Paris hotel enjoys a wonderful location right in the heart of the strip and opposite the fabulous Bellagio fountains. With it's half scale Eiffel Tower, Arc de Triomphe and French style shopping street; the hotel is nicely themed. The rooms are, as you'd expect, excellent and everything is high quality. I wish we'd upgraded to a room with a view over the strip but the one we had had a half decent view anyway. It really is a great hotel and you're sure to be impressed. But it's the location that really makes it. We had dinner over the road at the Bellagio, looking out over the fountains and over the Paris hotel with all it's imagery and bright lights - absolutely fantastic. If it wasn't such a long flight from the UK I'd be going back again very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Visit Paris in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: No1Lighthouse
Reviews.Content: All I can say is "Oh My Goodness!" My experience at the Paris Las Vegas was absolutely amazing. If you ever want a delightful taste of Paris without going to Europe, visit this Hotel. It is so quaint and beautiful from the cobblestone walkways that resemble the streets of Paris, to the 50% scale structure of the Eifel Tower. Just amazing! My room was elegantly designed in the utmost taste and comfort. If you ever want to treat yourself to Europe in the US, try the Paris and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “In Love with Paris”
Reviews.Author: lisa_sean_travels
Reviews.Content: We planned our wedding at the Paris and all the chapel staff were great to work with and the wedding and chapel were beautiful. We had a large group of friends and family, most of which stayed at the Paris. We all enjoyed the experience and the beauty of the hotel itself. My husband and I were not impressed with the tower tour, but we think we should have saved that for an evening activity. We stayed in 2 different rooms- standard and a suite. Both room were really wonderful. Check out the breakfast buffet, it was great but we were not impressed with the lunch or dinner menus. Overall, it is a great place to stay or plan your wedding.

Reviews.Title: “A Favorite!”
Reviews.Author: malvlover
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Paris several times in the last year or so. The first time was Dec. '06 I think and that was the worst visit. We booked a smoking room and was told there were none available! Being a long time very addicted smoker, I have my habits and had to have a smoking room;we checked in but opted to stay at New York New York (I had booked 3 nights there first then was going to move to Paris for 2 more nights) I was promised a smoking room the next night...even told I would get a "concierge suite" after 5 PM. That didn't happen! The High Roller already there decided not to leave! I guess they figured we had a nice room (over looking the Bellagio right in front) but they were adament that I could NOT smoke in that room! So we asked to be moved to Bally's. We got a really crappy room that reeked of cigar smoke. I went to the desk and asked them to move us... told them that even though it wasn't their fault, we had been in a much nicer room. They moved us to a newly renovated room that was much better. My husband was not happy dragging our luggage all over the place! Anyway, I went back to Paris in March and took an elderly Aunt. We were on the 8th floor overlooking air conditioning vents and roof, but the room was nice and it was a smoking room! They also gave us a room close to the elevators because my Aunt has a few mobility problems. She didn't fare very well on the walkways in the lobby/eating areas due to the cobblestone-like floor,so we rented a wheelchair that cost $45 for 3 days! We both enjoyed the casino though...which is why we go! She dropped a wallet out of her purse on the last day there(no money in it thank God!) and the Security guard at first was a little "funny" when I said I didn't know if it was dropped or stolen. He got a bit huffy and told me I could not say it was stolen if I didn't see it get stolen! Lo and behold, someone found it and turned it in, although my Aunt had to come down to ID it herself (I had taken her back to the room because she was so upset I thought she was going to have a stroke!) The same guard went to the room with a wheelchair then and brought her down himself, and was very nice! The last time I stayed was in Aug.'07 and again we were on the 8th floor with a crappy view but nice room! No smoking room issues this time. We enjoyed the pool, although it was SOOO hot outside the second day (107!)we couldn't stay out very long! Very pretty area with all the greenery around the Eifel Tower...a break from the concrete jungle that Vegas is! The casino had been changed around a bit since March and I noticed that they "upped" the price on some of the former penny machines to nickels... making the max bet $5 a spin! It takes your money quick! Didn't win anything there on any of the trips and spent a ton of money! I definitely like playing at some of the smaller casinos for more pay back. We ALWAYS rent a car...found out the hard way the first time we went in '03 that you spend the same amount of money taking cabs as you do for a rental car. You have to really scour the internet for deals! I got a mini van once for 3 and 1/2 days for a little over $100! Of course you can take the Tram, but we like to go up to North Las Vegas(not Downtown!) Didn't like the new rental car garage when we went in Aug....takes 10 times longer to get your car. And I had checked in on the internet, which was supposed to take me right to the car. Not anymore!!! Plus you feel like your 20 miles away from the airport now! Back to Paris... the thing I do not like about it is NO STARBUCKS! The coffee shop is very expensive and not so good. We ate at the cafe a couple of times, it is also over priced and so-so food. Bally's (which is actually connected to Paris) is a much better bet for food! And don't go to the new burger bistro down towards Bally's... it is just burgers and fries for beaucoup bucks! And we waited forever to get the food. A little known place I stumbled upon was the shopping/eating area down an escalator at Bally's. They don't really advertise it is there, but there is a pizza place and and a sandwich shop, as well as a Harley shop my husband wanted to go to but it was closed by the time we found it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Paris Casino”
Reviews.Author: Psychrus
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the Paris during October 2007. I've also stayed at the Rio, Flamingo, Luxor, Monte Carlo, and several other properties. I must say I liked the Paris the best. Great location in the center of the strip. Easy access to everything. Check-in was a breeze and the rooms were very nice. I even hit a jackpot ($1,045.00) which made the trip even sweeter. I'd recommend this property. An Ohio Visitor

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars Again...The best on the strip”
Reviews.Author: JenandMatt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from another fabulous trip to Las Vegas and we felt it was important to let travelers know about what a wonderful hotel PARIS is. We arrived in Las Vegas at 11:00 am and figured we would have to check our luggage until 3:00 when we could register. PEGGY at the front desk of PARIS could not have been any nicer or more friendly. She welcomed us with humor and excitement and found us an immediate room to check in to. While she was processing our information she advised us that they had just renovated some floors and would check to see if any of those rooms were available. She found us a room on the 26th floor and it was OUTSTANDING. The room was very clean, had a huge flat screen TV, a wonderful bathroom with glass enclosed shower and seperate bathtub. There was an iron and ironing board, coffee maker, IPOD jack and internet jack. During our stay, housekeeping was great and it was VERY QUIET. The beds were INCREDIBLE and comfortable. There is nothing negative I can say about this Hotel. Now, we are not HIGH ROLLERS and we try to hit Vegas once a year, I have never had a bad experience at PARIS and this year was even better then last. The casino is just the right size, food is great and there are shops inside the hotel also. Just a note: While we were walking the strip, we stopped into the VENETIAN hotel. This hotel is beautiful but they are pumping a air scent into the casino that smells like Coppertone lotion. While gambling there, the scent was so overpowering inside the casino that my wife and I had the leave. We both could taste the scent when we left. Again, we are not HIGH ROLLERS but just average Vegas visitors, but just thought we would share this with you. So, If you are wondering where to stay in VEGAS, stay at PARIS. It is clean, located in the middle of the strip and the staff is GREAT.....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: TravelMonkeyCanada
Reviews.Content: Arrived near midnight so check-in was simple. Got a lovely, clean room with a rather dull northeast view, but that's okay. Travelling companions got a view of the Eiffel Tower and Bellagio fountains which was great because it was their first visit to Vegas. Big, flat panel tv, comfy beds, big and clean bathrooms. Elevators are not too far from the entrances and are easy to find. Location on the Strip really is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “not for me”
Reviews.Author: francesanne
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent a night at this hotel and it is not for us! The huge casino/lobby area resembles a railway terminal in the rush hour. The check in/check out lines are very long and we found the staff to be like robots with no personal service whatsoever. The rooms was large and clean - as was the bathroom, but totally lacking in individual charm or personality. My daughter wanted to pay for internet use for the night but was told she could not pay the fee for this service but would have to have a large deposit against her credit card, which would then entail joining the long check out queue for a refund, instead of using the express check out. After a lot of haggling the somewhat aggresive duty manager agreed to our request. We ate at a so called 'French' restaurant which was horrible, the scallops were served in TIN shells and the pate was cheap and commercial. The steak was thin with synthetic sauce and the waiters appeared to have no knowledge of their wines. No 'do not disturb' sign sign was provided in our roomn and we therefore had the maid knocking at 8.45am. On a one night booking you are hardly likely to have vacated the room at that time! We were too late for breakfast and the snack in the coffee shop was even more horrible than the restaurant. We will not be visiting this establishment again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: IrishOpinions
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paris Hotel, Las vegas from 8th Oct until 11th October 2007. I stayed the first night by myself and felt totally safe there even though it is a big hotel. I was joined then by friends for the reminder of my stay. The location is great as it is in the center of the strip and is opposite the Bellagio with its fab fountains. Caesar's Palace is nearby too so you don't have far to walk to see some of the bigger hotels. I booked this hotel because of its location and would definitely recommend it for its location but it is easy to get around the strip so even if you are staying at one end of it you can still visit each hotel easily. My room was spacious and very clean. I had looked at many reviews on this site and asked for a room above the 25th floor to ensure I got a renovated room. I was staying on the 26th floor and was very happy with my regular room. The TV was a bit annoying in that I couldn't get regular TV at all. I was only able to look at the channel that tells you how to use the casino and also to pay for movies. I only wanted to watch the news so it wasn't too much of a disappointment that it didn't work properly. I didn't find my room to be too noisy with people passing by late at night and I didn't find the casino area smoky at all and I hate smoke so I would have noticed! One thing that did get to me a bit was that there is nowhere in the lobby/downstairs area to sit down. Often my friends and I would be waiting for each other downstairs but there is nowhere to just sit down for a minute or two. They want you to sit at the casino or bar areas so don't have any regular seating areas so we sat outside to wait for each other. The breakfast buffet was great and kept us going for most of the day. It cost us $17 each. I found it strange that there wasn't much information in the rooms relating to getting around the strip and things to do etc., except of course for what was on in Paris Hotel. I had read on some sites to get the 'Deuce' which is a bus that brings you up and down the strip for $2 one way (regardless of how far you travel) or $5 for 24 hours use. The Deuce departs outside most hotels on the strip and is a great way to get around when your feet start getting tired! I had to ask the concierge exactly where the Deuce went from and he then gave me a leaflet on it. I just think this should be placed in every room to inform all guests. I also had to ask the concierge for a map of the strip showing the location of all the hotels and I think that this also should be placed in each room. Overall, I would definitely recommend the Paris Hotel as I throughly enjoyed my trip and will definitely return to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vegas Vacation”
Reviews.Author: YoungGun
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Paris Las Vegas during a 'lads' 4 night stay from 27/09/07 - 01/10/07. Had previously stayed here before when we came to Las Vegas in 2004 and we're swayed by its location on the 'strip' and the fact that we had such a great time. So let the holiday commence, which it did unfortunately with lengthy delays to our flights both from Manchester and our connecting flights from Philadelphia to Las Vegas. This meant that we were nearly 6 hours delayed getting into Vegas and not arriving to the Paris Las Vegas until just before midnight. It then seemed to take an eternity to get checked-in as they appeared to not have many rooms left, at least not many non-smoking rooms available. After legthy conversations and attempts to try and get my party an upgrade if no suitable rooms could be found, I finally got the party booked into the three double rooms that we had booked. A bit of a bad start to the holiday, but we were determined to not let the delays and problems with the allocation of rooms deter us from having a great time in Vegas. Of the three rooms provided, one of them had a part view of the strip and the Bellagio on the 7th floor, the other rooms were facing the back of the hotel - not a problem as we weren't planning on having much sleep on this holiday. All the rooms were nicely decorated and furnished with large Queen sized beds to help get over the jet lag. The bathroom was nice, albeit no bath, but a walk in shower which was nice and powerful to wake you up in the morning. All rooms had a safe and the TV showed all the necessary stations to catch up on the final weekend of Baseball action - go Red Sox!! With sleep deprevation setting in following our marathon journey, and the fact that we probably hadn't had any sleep in over 24 hours we all met at 'Le Central Lobby Lounge', which is one of the Bars located in the casino. Bearing in mind it was now gone 1am, we all settled down in the comfort of the Bar and surrounding Casino and drank our first 'US' drinks - I think most opted for either Bud Light's or Corrs Light - refreshing and hopefully the start of a great vacation. Without boring you all too much about 'My Diary of Las Vegas' - we ended up having a fantastic time in both Paris and Las Vegas. We made full use of 'Le Village Buffet' every morning for I think $16, it was worth the visit as we normally ate enough food to last us through until the evening. There is so much selection and a you just end up eating so much!! Within the Hotel, we made full use of the pool in the afternoon after what was normally a tiring morining walking up and down the strip visiting the other casinos or going to the shopping outlet villages. The pool was of a good size, although busy, you could always find yourself somewhere to lie down and soak up the sun, which considering it was approaching October the temperature was in the 90's. Beware if you ever buy drinks buy the pool - they are expensive, $4 for a bottle of coke!! Once inside the hotel, we liked the Paris as the gaming floor is a nice size and one that if some of your party wander off, you always find them within a few minutes. Our group enjoyed playing the Roulette, Black Jack and Poker - all with their own success and failure stories. All the gaming tables were fun and you never felt intimidated and this made for a good atmosphere and helped while away the hours and dollars!! Overall, another fantastic and enjoyable stay in Paris Las Vegas and I wouldn't hesitate in coming back to this hotel again on my next visit, which for me is next February, but I'll be on a budget as I'm doing a West Coast tour and I'll probably have to opt for a cheaper hotel next year.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Paris”
Reviews.Author: tiffanyg54
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris from October 10 to October 14. We booked through the website because the room was comped based on our players club play. We requested a king room and received it. We did not have a view but requested the highest room possible and were put on the 24th floor. The room was very spacious and the furnishings were very nice. I did wish that there was a place to put your luggage. We ended up using the ottoman and the small lounger for our suitcases. We have stayed many places in Vegas-Tropicana, Mirage, Flamingo but I enjoyed the Paris most. It was nice to hop in the elevator and you were instantly close to food and the casino. No treking from one end of the hotel to the other. We ate at the Creperie, le Notre, Cafe ile St. Louis, and the Burger Brasserie and enjoyed the food at all. We gambled at the casino at Paris and Bally's. We did not hit any huge wins but we got to play for awhile. We did gamble a lot at Bill's Gambling Hall next to Bally's and did quite well. The waitresses there also come around quite often if you like to enjoy a cocktail while gambling like we do. The only low point of our trip was that we ate at Raffles in the Mandalay Bay one evening after a concert at the HOB. The next day, I wasn't feeling well and it turns out I had food poisoning. It was the only place that I ate that day. For those of you who complain about the beds at the Paris, I say that you are wrong. I spent 20 hours in bed and while I can't say I was comfortable, I definitely rested well. I will never eat at any restaurant at Mandalay again. I lost nearly 2 days of vacation not feeling well. Overall the Paris was fantastic. We loved the decor, the location, the room, and the fact that we didn't pay for it helps too. We are going again in January and will likely stay at the Paris again-especially because the rooms are comped!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!!”
Reviews.Author: disco_c
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 day whilrwind vacation in Vegas. My BF and I stayed at Paris and loved it. We arrived earlier then checkin which was expected and the doormen were more then happy to hold our luggage until our room was available. We found the rooms to be a good size and the bathrooms were amazing with a seperate stand up shower and bath. We decided not to pay the extra $$ for a room with a view b/c we didn't anticipate spending a lot of time in the room (c'mon peeps this is VEGAS). The location on the strip was very central which made it convienient to take the bus or a taxi to pretty much anywhere. We only spent a little time at the pool and the grounds were nice. The water was a little cold and the pool area only got sun until about 6ish but by that time we were usually ready for a nap before our wild nights on the town. We booked a show with help from the Conceiarge (sp??) and he was amazing. He made great suggestions about what to see when and where to sit -- he couldn't have been better!! Overall I highly recomend this location and there really isn't anything to worry about when booking a trip here.....BUT if I were to be picky and honest there were a few things that did bother me a little.....We never ate in the hotel restaurants so I can't say much -- but we did have a hard time finding something to eat for late night snack -- nothing seemed to be open and we had to walk to Bally's to find a sandwich (a little inconvenient); also the first night I thought the bed was a little hard....but I guess I got over that pretty fast b/c it didn't bother me for the rest of the trip - these are just little things that shouldn't stop you from considering this place -- just wanted to throw it out there!! Have fun!! P.S. Make sure you make it to Fremont Street in old vegas -- amazing (Take the bus -- $5 for a day pass!!)

Reviews.Title: “Spend your money elsewhere!!!”
Reviews.Author: don3561
Reviews.Content: After hearing some good things about this hotel, my wife and I decided to book this hotel for our honeymoon. We had reservations that clearly stated a king bed in a non smoking room with a view. Upon check-in, we were given a double queen room, no king. When I inquired about our reservations for a king, we were informed that our reservation does not guarantee what we are asking for and unfortunately, they did not have any other rooms. I informed them that this was our honeymoon and we really did not want separate queen beds, we were told by the rather lackadaisical counter worker, "sorry, but if you call down tomorrow we will see if we can move you". It was late and we decided to take the room for the night with the hope the room will get changed the next day. Needless to say they did change our room the next day, but I do have to say these were some of the most uncomfortable beds we have ever slept on! We even had a hole in the sheet! I had expected much more from a supposedly four star hotel. These were very average hotel rooms. We have stayed at better hotels for a fraction of the price. And the fact that they did not care it was our honeymoon? Who does that? As for the rest of the property, the gambling was horrible. Slots did not pay out, good luck finding room at a decent limit craps table, and the only blackjack was a brutal 6-5 single deck. Before leaving, we asked for a late checkout, we were told "no". We asked for two extra hours and were again told "no". Our checkout time was 11 a.m. and for the guests arriving, the check-in was 3 p.m. and they could not have given us 2 hours? How long does it take to clean a room? To sum up, I will have to say that if the service at Paris is terrible, the workers not accommodating at all, and the gambling is not good, why spend your money on this property? There are plenty of other hotels to spend your money at.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: mundus-eo-ire-itum
Reviews.Content: Second time to Vegas. Last year stayed at MGM Grand and what a bad experience - too big. This year we chose Paris Hotel because of its central location to all the action. The rooms were very French and very clean (pillows a little hard...but did not get much sleep anyway!). Liked the fact that we did not have to treck our way through the Casino to get to the pool since it is on the second floor. One night we ate at Mon Ami Gaby restaurant and it was great. The Eifel Tower is the coolest thing and we were right across from the Bellaggio Hotel's water show...would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: pontypool1
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Paris whilst staying in Las Vegas. On arrival we found the check-in desks easily and only had to queue for about five minutes. The check-in girl was really lovely - she offered us a great price on one of the suites (which we had considered before booking but decided it was just too expensive: the price she offered was way below what we had seen on the website!). We had just got engaged before coming to Las Vegas so decided to take the upgrade and spoil ourselves. We were so glad we did! We got a suite on the 16th floor overlooking the Eiffel Tower and Bellagio. The suite was huge, with its own living area complete with dining table, king size bedroom, and his and her bathrooms! It was well worth the upgrade price and about five times bigger than the normal hotel rooms. We didn't have to queue for the elevators at all and once called they arrived in just a few seconds. Paris itself is small enough to know your way around without getting too lost! It has a good range of places to eat, both fine and casual dining, as well as 24/7 eateries.
