Breakfast wasn't included when we booked but this was no problem as there is a Boulangerie and a Creperie on site which did great breakfast items; muffins, crepes, coffees etc. The hotel is in the middle of the Strip and provides a fantasic base for exploring all Vegas has to offer. If you do get too tired (and when we arrived it was 100f, so we did!) the monorail stop is just next door, at Bally's casino (which is a kind of sister hotel to Paris). Check-out was quick and easy. The taxi service made sure that we got a cab very quickly and the hotel looked after our luggage for a few hours after we had checked out free of charge. Overall, highly recommend this hotel. It's big enough to have everything you need but somehow small enough that you don't notice it has thousands upon thousands of bedrooms!! The staff were helpful and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding! Don't settle for less!”
Reviews.Author: eschuber
Reviews.Content: This hotel is outstanding and is worth the extra money. Along with the Venetian and the Bellagio, it is one of our favorites. Beautiful casino, bars, restaurants, and very relaxing. Excellent location in the middle of the strip for walking to the Bellagio, Caesar's Palace, Margaritaville, and the Venetian. A reasonable taxi ride to hotels further out. Free shuttle to the Rio. Clean and nicely decored rooms with firm bed. Relaxing pool area for sunbathing. Don't settle for a blah hotel. Stay a day less and enjoy one of the best!

Reviews.Title: “Okay - nothing exceptional”
Reviews.Author: LilyNewZealand
Reviews.Content: Booked at my request through a travel agent after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. I was travelling with my son (20) and initially they had given us just one bed. That was sorted out quickly however. I had also requested coffee and tea making facilities but as another reviewer says 'we weren't on a casino floor' so that wasn't available. Seems strange as these facilities seem standard everywhere else. A mini bar that charged to your account if anything was removed from it (even if you were just taking something out to see what it was) and nowhere to store your own water/juice containers to keep them cool. Good location - near the centre of everything and within easy walking distance to all the hotels on the strip. Incredible shopping area as most of the casino's and hotels - in fact we got lost in Paris more than once!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: MartinHolmslykke
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Really clean and with good space in the room. Nice staff, but remember to tip everybody.... Great and cheap food.

Reviews.Title: “Big, Noisy, But Great Value”
Reviews.Author: patsandsox
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nites in late August with my wife and two other couples; had stayed here on business 3 or 4 years ago when hotel was much newer. Our room was not renovated (since opening) but quite pleasant. While the glitiz and scale doesn't measure up to Bellagio or Venetian, hard to beat the sub-$99 rates, much lower than the others. We were prepared for the crowds and noise; hotel seemed to be overrun with European tourists (including a lot of French --- I wondered many times, how they must have thought of this honor to their capital); in any case, we enjoyed the stay, and the convenience. Comfortable large (but not ostentatious pool area); excellent buffet. Convenient location on strip. The pastry and coffee shops downstairs offered decent value, although lengthy lines sometimes. All in all, a very pleasant base.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the location and price”
Reviews.Author: dyanaST
Reviews.Content: 3 friends and I stayed at Paris - Las Vegas in September for a girls' weekend. I was really impressed with the staff and condition of the rooms. Check-in was a breeze and they were even nice enough to let 2 of my friends who arrived earlier than I did to leave their bags with the bellmen even though they weren't on the reservation. The rooms were very nice, well decorated and the beds were your decent, standard hotel beds. The bathrooms are nice and we found that even with 4 of us getting ready, we had plenty of room to maneuver around. Overall I was really impressed with the Paris. Having also stayed at Bally's, Bellagio and Mirage, I would say that this is the best bet for the location and price. It's not as cheap as Bally's but not as expensive as Bellagio and the rooms were definitely nicer than I expected. However, if you don't mind being a bit further down on the strip, my absolute 100% favorite hotel in Vegas is THE Hotel at Mandalay Bay. I'd definitely recommend THE Hotel over all others, but as it is farther down on the strip and can be a little inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect at Paris”
Reviews.Author: VegasgirlPghPA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 night at Paris for our 5th wedding anniversary from 9/25 to 9/28. We truly had a wonderful time. The hotel is beautiful and very clean. The room was beautiful, the bed was very comfy and the bathroom was very nice with a seperate tub and shower. I would highly recommend this hotel to all of my friends and family. It was a wonderful getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Paris Hotel and casino was great”
Reviews.Author: ared0723
Reviews.Content: Love all of the Harrah's properties have stayed at the Rio, Harrah's and now the Paris. Paris was just like being in France. Casino hosts were more than attentitive and called me by name each time I played table games. One bad thing was no coffee pot in the room. Just hate to get dressed without my coffee.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay -- would return”
Reviews.Author: giulietta429
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris hotel for one night over Labor Day week-end (we booked well in advance through AAA website and got a good rate). We arrived just after 11 am on a Saturday. The line to check-out/check-in was not long, but moved slowly. Once we got to a clerk, we asked for a room above 25th floor. He said that one was available. We were in Room 2604. It was one of the renovated rooms, with pleasant decor and a very comfortable king-size bed. There was an ipod dock, a mini-bar, and a large flat screen TV. The bathroom was good size and had a separate tub and a glass shower. We ate dinner at Mon Ami Gabi, which we would highly recommend (I will leave a separate review for it) and had brunch at the Paris buffet. The following morning, we tried out the Creperie for breakfast. The crepes were excellent and not too expensive for Las Vegas (around $9 each). The spa at Paris was absolutely amazing. If you book a spa treatment (they take SpaFinder certificates), you get to use the gym for free, which is what I did. My therapist (a young woman whose name I cannot remember) gave me one of the best massages I have ever had. I would highly recommend the lime ginger Elemis treatment -- it includes a full body scrub (30 min) followed by a 50 min massage ($185, an 18% gratuity is automatically added to the bill). After the massage, I was able to relax and enjoy tea, juice, and fruit at the spa. I would highly recommend it. We went to the pool in the morning, before it got too hot. Contrary to some other reviewers, we enjoyed the pool. It was not crowded, and there was enough room to swim for about 1 hour. (Of course, this is not comparable to the pools at the Bellagio, but not bad at all.) We had a great stay and would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “so-so”
Reviews.Author: Snotts
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, but don't expect any favours from the staff, even if you're a decent tipper. We paid for four rooms for our wedding party, but no effort was made to allocate the rooms close to each other - every one else had a room with a coffee maker, but when we asked for one as well we were told we weren't on a 'casino floor' and they wouldn't give use one - despite the fact that we were paying for all four rooms! We booked our Wedding Dinner for the Mon Ami Gabi, several months in advance, and repeatedly checked if they would give us a table with a view of the fountains - we were disappointed that the table had no view whatsoever, although the food and service was excellent. A nice looking hotel, with a good location, but I'm not sure I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good compromise between price and location”
Reviews.Author: MichaelArchangel
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, right opposite the amazing Bellagio fountains and right in the centre of the strip. Room was very decent for price and we had no problems during our stay. It just compares to any other major hotel of the strip with lots of shops and restaurants/bars nearby and a casino. Would go again... It's nice to go up the tower as well, including in the restaurant (but oh boy is it expensive!)...

Reviews.Title: “Nice strip hotel with a good atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: hdblue
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 1 night at the paris hotel for business. I checked into the Paris at the last night of my conference in Las Vegas to escape the Planet Hollywood Hotel I had the misfortune of staying in the past three nights. The room is very comfortable, nicely decorated and comfortable. Everything is quality in the room with the exception of the bathtub which looks like they ran out of room and threw the smallest tub they could find into it. The shower is wonderful. The bed is very comfortable and the room actually has a coffee maker which is missing from most hotels on the strip. Also the room is very modern with a plasma tv, updated furniture, high speed internet and a real coffee maker. The decor in the hotel and the casino is very pretty. I love they paris theme and it is truly nice inside and out. It is also very relaxed atmosphere which is nice. For strip hotels this one is very nice and worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good!”
Reviews.Author: ponomo
Reviews.Content: I visited the Paris Hotel in September, I had a great time there. the rooms were clean, the staff was ok. However the Casino was slow and boring. the food selection in the cafe's were thin compared to other hotels ex. Mirage,Venetian,MGM etc.. The Pool area was nice, a little crowded but what do you expect with 102 degree weather. I ordered chicken fingers by the pool. They were awful! ( well I'am from Atlanta, and I expect more from my chicken :) the poolside waitresses worked hard serving cold beverages and were very beautiful. They also had a fabulous DJ that was playing a variety of hits making the visit to the pool more of an experience. The hotel is in a great location decent walk to Fatburgers (3 blocks). I paid a rate of $375n for a deluxe room. I would most likley stay again but only if I can book for $250n or less.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tagretchen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Paris for 5 nights in mid-September. The hotel is located in the middle of the strip and close to all attractions. Although the rooms are a bit old (floors 25+ have been renovated) they are large and comfortable. The pool area is nice, but lacks any real atmosphere. We did most of our gambling elsewhere as the table limits were a bit high.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Paris Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Traveler-Hawaii
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paris for one night in early September. Hotel was extra busy due to MTV Awards and UNLV game with Wisconsin that weekend. Although lines to check in and check out were terribly long, the front desk handled all efficiently. Upon check in, we were informed of a special rate for a Junior Suite and took it. Well worth the extra $$. The suite was great -- spacious, renovated, beaucoup ambiance. Partook of food on the run - delicious crepes, salads, breakfast pastries. We ate at off hours and avoided the long food lines. Upon checkout, left baggage with bell desk so we could explore the strip - again courteous, professional service.

Reviews.Title: “loved the paris!!!!”
Reviews.Author: luandlee
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the paris for 4 days last week. Nothing but pleased with the whole experience. I don't know what the other travelers are talking about in their recent reviews??? The rooms were beautiful, and clean, and we were in a room that wasn't renovated and that was by choice because I saw the renovated rooms and found them to be to mod and contemporary, wanted a more "Parisian" feel and thats what we got! Beds were sooo comfortable and clean, clean, clean! Staff was always courteous and helpful, and smiling. Perhaps the other travelers were high rollers and not "regular" people?? don't know what they were expecting or what they got, but we had a wonderful experience and will definitely stay here again. Especially after visiting the other huge hotels like the Bellagio and the Venetian which were way to big and impersonal and impossible to navigate. In the Venetian they had a food court! I felt like I was in the local mall. Though the rest of the hotel was nice and we ate in a great restaruant there, I didn't care for the hotel on the whole. Paris is the place, I assure you!! and go to the buffet!!! we waited no more than 10 minutes the most, the people who said they waited hours are full of it!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Artemus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, in our early 50's, stayed at Paris August 18-25. Overall a great stay. Very nice, beautiful hotel with oustanding restaurants. Great vibe and energy in the casino. Paris is a very good location on the Strip. Here are a few particulars about our stay At check-in, the lady at the desk was a little rude, but we did not let that bother us. We got over that very quickly and started enjoying our trip. Our room was a standard room with two queen beds and was very nice with a large marbled bathroom. First stop was at Gustav's Bar, but found the bartenders to be rude and unattentive. Moved on quickly from there. Ate at St. Louis Cafe twice for breakfast and thought it was very good. Had lunch at Le Village Buffet one day and thought it was very good. Had dinner at Mon Ami Gabi one evening. I thought my steak and frites was rather bland and my wife said her salmon was very good. However, overall we really liked the restaurant with the excellent service and great outside terrace seating with a nice view of the Bellagio fountains. Went to the pool, which was very nice and quiet, one day, but it was too hot to go back. I would say the pool area need more shade. Really enjoyed the shops at Paris and the overall feeling of the hotel. Most of the Paris employees were very nice and accomodating. Overall we really enjoyed Paris and hope to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: mclacal
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 4 day/3night trip to Las Vegas, and stayed in Paris. The ambiance in Paris was very cute...I definitely like the casino there for it. Although, after being there a few days, it became to feel a little cramped in comparison to some of the other casino's. Also, the service wasn't near what I expected. In years past we've stayed at Cesar's Palace, and their hotel service was outstanding. In Paris, no one was over friendly or went that extra mile as we had been accustomed to over at Cesar's, which I found was disappointing. The beds were so-so; we had a king room, and the mattress pads they used were smaller than the bed and constantly bunched up underneath us. The pool was nothing special, and the service out there was terrible (Cesar's pool ROCKS!!! We actually snuck in over there one afternoon to show our friends). We went to the pool one day around 5 PM. They close the pool at 7, but they were already putting up the chairs and there were towels and all sorts of trash all over the place. We stayed less than 30 minutes because it was just so blah. We never were once asked for cocktails either, which was irritating. Where else should you enjoy a yummy mixed drink than out by the pool on a hot afternoon? Overall, the hotel was okay. It was clean, no worries there. it just wasn't what I expected and we'll definitely go back to Cesar's or perhaps the Vegetarian if we can catch a good deal over there.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Paris”
Reviews.Author: boatonwylie
Reviews.Content: We just returned last week from a great trip to Las Vegas. The Paris is charming and lovely. We had a room overlooking the pool and Bellagio fountains. While the linens do need replacement, that is the only complaint I can make. The bars downstairs have live music, we were comped on drinks several times, the tables are reasonable, and the staff helpful. The bellhops are great at getting the taxis-you feel pretty important. The Crepierie is wonderful and open late; the bakery is the same. Great, less expensive way to grab breakfast. We had a wonderful trip and hope to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected, but less than I hoped”
Reviews.Author: LadyMercy
Reviews.Content: For our 10th anniversary we decided to stay at Paris Las Vegas. We had booked our room on Expedia and got a really good deal for both airfare and hotel room. We knew that all the rooms above the 26th floor had been remodled. When we booked we asked for one of those rooms with a king size bed.. We arrived at the airport and decided to try the airport check in. We did and were sad to find out though we had requested the room weeks in advance the only room that they had above the 26th floor with the view we wanted had two queen beds. Not terribly romantic for a special anniversary. But once we got over that little snag the rest of the stay was lovely. The view from our room of the Bellagio fountains and the Eiffel tower was amazing. We were close to the pool and the spa. Not to mention the beds were REALLY comfortable. Though my husband and I were not used to squeezing ourselves into a queen bed we slept like logs. Also the nigh of our anniversary we had dinner at the resturant in the Eiffel tower. It was wonderful. Not the best meal I ever had but it was specail and our waiter was very good. He was attentive and kind and funny...all the things we look for. Not to mention the view from the resturant was great. All in all we had a lovely time. The hotel was relatively peaceful in spite of it being in vegas. The pool was quiet and calm. Really just what we were looking for. My only complaints were the room screw up and the long slow line at the buffet. We only ate there once because of it. I would go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great views from a P room!”
Reviews.Author: jmp14
Reviews.Content: I was lucky to discover the offer of 3 free nights and entry into Bally's VP tournament pretty early on, so I was able to book a 'premium' room at Paris. Now, this didn't necessarily guarantee me the room, but I did get one upon checkin at the airport (1198P). I travelled solo, so I had more room than I knew what to do with! Great views too! I had Le Village buffet for breakfast one morning and it was 'okay'. I didn't see what all the fuss was about. The food was tasty, although my OJ was warm. The next morning I got a muffin and a soda from their little bakery (JJ's something-something). I got a soda cuz they wanted $5 for juice! I didn't mind the inside of the property trying to mimic the outside of france when it came to where the shops/dining was, but I thought this made for a very strange feeling casino. Who wants to gamble 'outside'? I'm a blackjack player and the table mins were too high, so I spent much of my time next door at the Planet Hollywood. I definitely appreciated the central location of Paris, as I was able to walk north to the Wynn and then walk south to the MGM. THere's also a monorail stop at Bally's.

Reviews.Title: “Paris is Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Danny F
Reviews.Content: My partner an I stayed at Paris Las Vegas for 5 nights (comped) starting on September 9th. We flew on AirTran from Atlanta, which is nice because it was non-stop. We were both excited about staying here since it was our first stay at Paris, we usually stay at Bally's, which I still like. Our room was 2907, which was an upgraded rooms since we are diamond members. These new rooms are very nice and ours had a wonderful view of the Bellagio and Ceasers. I used the pool 4 out of the 5 days and it wasn't the best of pools but it was just fine. The water was cool and that felt really good since it was about 105 degrees everyday. There is a nice spot located by the two hot tubs that I recommend if you want seclusion and peace. There is a shop located right before you get to the pool and I usually bought a soda or water and brought it in with me. The drink I got by the pool the first day cost me $18, and I learned my lesson and brought my own from that point. The casino is really large and has plenty to choose from. If you like table games or slots, there is alot to choose from. We spent most of our time between Paris, Bally's and Bill's which is across from Bally's. Not to diss Paris, but our best experience gambling was the Gold Coast on Flamingo next to Rio. I just can't say enough about Paris. I loved every minute of our stay. The staff treated us great every minute and when we checked in, they didn't even blink when we requested a king bed for two men. It is the best place to stay on the strip if you are a same sex couple. They even perform ceremonies in their chaple if you would like to have a commitment with your life partner while you are there. It was the perfect vacation and we will definently stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: EricSD
Reviews.Content: Three weeks ago I stayed at the Las Vegas Tropicana and hated it (see that review). I had to return to Vegas for business and the company put me up at the Paris Hotel. Wow, what a difference! The room was clean and the furnishings were relatively new. The AC in the casino area worked well...there was no smoke smell at all. Plus the dealers for the most part were talkative and helpful (they even taught me how to play craps). The casino is kind of small...I'd say fun but far from wild. The restaurants are not very exciting but the food was reasonably priced and tasted good. There are nicer restaurants at the MGM, Venetian & Mandalay Bay. Its not really a "party" place to stay, but if you want a clean, mellow home-base...this is the place. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Solid Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: sirtoasty
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a 3 night stay in Vegas at Paris. Paris is nice, but not over-the-top nice like some of the more expensive places. Briefly: PROS: -unbeatable location is easily accessible to everything -very nice bathrooms -not a huge "destination casino," so the casino itself doesn't get overly busy or unreasonably priced -great value for the money -great view from the Eiffel Tower -awesome interior and exterior decor CONS: -rooms are a bit run-down -although it has some good dining options, you'll want to go elsewhere for serious dining and bar scene -underwhelming pool -sports book is barely there Truth is, the pros outweighed the cons for us -- we don't spend a lot of time in our hotel anyway no matter where we stay, so having nice, reasonably priced accommodations in the mid-strip area was awesome. Would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Some Good....Some not so good!”
Reviews.Author: mikec
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Paris Vegas September 02 -06, 2007. I was here a month earlier and enjoyed it emmensely.......that was then. This time this is what we experienced. Check In- Check in went flawlessly at the airport. It was nice to have a comped premier room. I paid for it at black jack though!! The room is nothing special. It is nice and does have a view but in Vegas you don't spend much time in the room. Room- 1411 Had a nice view of the pool and Bellagio. The room safe did not work properly. There were also a couple of times that we had to get the room keys reset as they did not work consistently. This became an inconvenience. The air condition did not work well. Staff- I was taken back with some of the pool waitresses and their attitudes. When I came here in August, some waitresses did not seem to be happy and could care less on taking drink/food orders. This time, (I wish I got her name), my wife and I asked politely for a menu. we were given a menu. In the process of us ordering a drink, the young lady walked away and said "someone else will take care of you". Needless to say, I had to search for someone to assist us. Unbeleivable The food at the pool is VERY GOOD. My wife are food critics and both enjoyed everything we ordered throughout the trip. Some miscellaneous problems we seemed to encounter consistently: Morning breakfast at that pastry shop- Over charged for (2) pastries- $12.00 when it was suppose to be 6$. Money was refunded but no apology. Spa- Overcharged for a massage. I brought it to the managers attention. He rebilled me. When I got to the room to check the account folio, it showed a double charge from the spa. I had to make another call to get things straightened out. Some positives: The casino and hotel are still easy to navigate. Compared to other hotels such as Caesars and Venetian, Paris is comparable. My Host (Mr. Sierra) took care of everything. To conclude: As with anywhere you stay, you may have some problems. It just seems that it is becoming more consistent that Paris is consistently having more problems. I may give it another chance but will consider somewhere else next time. We had the opportunity to see the Blue Man Group- If you have to pay full price, you may be dissapointed. It is entertaining but there isn't much talent. My parents, wife and I were all expecting a little more. You'll see what I'm saying if you go.

Reviews.Title: “Bring lots of money”
Reviews.Author: Harleyscal
Reviews.Content: This is a top-notch Hotel without a doubt and highly recommend it but bring lots of cash. I guess I long for the old Vegas. A place where you could get a buffet for $3.95 and a room for $50.00 and have a decent chance to hit a jackpot from time to time. I have stayed everywhere over the years in Las Vegas. Strip, Downtown, off-strip you name it. I wanted my Son to experience Vegas from mid-strip and that is where the Paris is. Right in the middle of a lot of action and can easily walk to a lot of Casinos like Caesars, Bellagio, Flamingo, NY NY, MGM, Tropicana, Excalibur and the Luxor. And the monorail is right there in Bally's, which is actually connected to the Paris. We were there 8 days and booked the room for $1,400.00. I probably and foolishly let them talk me into an upgrade on the room for $50.00 more per night but after watching my Wife and our Son stare out the window of the 27th floor most of the times that we were in the room, I figured it was worth it. A perfect view of the Paris swimming pool and the Bellagio Fountain but how many times can one watch that noisy fountain. So now the room costs us $2200.00 for 8 days. 3 massages at $135.00 a pop. Buffets at $25.00 a piece. I suggest going to Ballys for the Buffet because there is never a wait and the food is just as good versus Paris where you might wait an hour to be seated. I played a lot of Blackjack and do so by the book but had terrible luck but thats on me. The Slots were the tightest I have ever seen anywhere. NOTHING! I suggest if you want to play Blackjack, cross the street to Wild Bill's Gambling Hall and play there. At least they still let you hold your cards in your hands while playing. Paris really pushes you to play $25 a hand and there are few, if any $10 tables. I like to play $15 a hand. And whats with a BJ only paying 6-5 now! Rented a Pool Villa at The Paris for $250 for the day. That was a ton of private fun but Pricey!! To me it seemed they were jamming you up for service charges everywhere and still wanted tips added onto that too. Room service for 3 hamburgers (albeit very tasty) was $70 smackers! Be sure and check the goodies refrigerator when walking into the room as they were gonna jam us up for stuff other people ate and not had restocked before we checked in. Bottom line is I love The Paris but next time I think I can have just as much class and fun somewhere else for a lot less.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be”
Reviews.Author: garypcsc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris Las Vegas from 9/3 through 9/7. It was not our first time, but it will be our last. Harrah's has destroyed any ambience this hotel had. We have stayed here previously on at least 4 occasions. Upon its opening, many years ago, we were honored to stay in one of their suites. The experience was almost as good as visiting Paris itself, They really made an effort to capture the charm of Paris, with street performers and even security and all their personnel dressed in Parisian costumes. Ha Ha. No More. No security, no performers. No nothing. The corportate bottom line now has top priority. This review will not dissuade people who want to go there from going. All I can say is good luck. I've seen how good it was. You will see how bad it can be and maybe that's good enough. Expect a room that has seen its better days. Expect a mattress pad that tries to slide you of the bed. Expect sheets with holes in them. Our room was made up properly each of the days we were there, so no complaints on that end. But unless you get yourself a good rate, (ie. $100. bucks or less per night) try somewhere else. Preferably a non Harrah's property. Oh did I mention they screwed us out of our "Total Rewards", but that's another story.

Reviews.Title: “No thanks...”
Reviews.Author: sherindave
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at the Paris 8/27/07-8/31/07. This was our 4th trip to Vegas and the first time to stay at the Paris. For me, part of the lure of Vegas is the supposed "hospitality" you're suppose to receive from the hotels, etc. The Paris must have forgot to train their employees in this aspect because we got zero! Especially at the "Total Rewards" counter. There was a misunderstanding the day I signed up for my total rewards card and the gal behind the counter was suppose to give me a free ticket to go up in the Eiffel Tower - when I realized the next day that she did not do her job and went back to the counter to get my free entrance pass, the next girl behind the counter would not give me my pass. I've just spent nearly a $1,000 to stay in this place and she wouldn't give me a $9 pass - and proceeded to argue with me. When I asked to speak to a manager, she refused to get one. The food there is terribly expensive - even for simple meals. Breakfast cost us $45.00 for just basic pancakes and eggs and a 2 glasses of milk. The buffet did not have any gravy and I've had better buffets. I'm in a french hotel and went one morning to get a bagel and cream cheese - I was sent to 3 different places within the hotel and after standing in each line for 10 minutes making my way to the counter, no one had them and I never did get one. The hotel room was just average. The bed was uncomfortable (lumpy) and there were "fuzz balls" coming out of my pillow. The pool was not impressive. Needless to say, I will go back to Vegas but I will not stay at the Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Paris okay”
Reviews.Author: Gatorgal7
Reviews.Content: Will start by saying that in 2006 I was a Platinum Total Rewards member, but my "credits" expired this year so I was downgraded to Gold status. Booked a two comp night with Paris with an additional night at $100. Well, ended up having to cut the trip short by one day. When we checked in, they would not honor the two night comp and instead charged us the $100 for the second night. We asked to have a renovated room and were told that we could only have that if we paid an addtional $85/night. We went ahead and did that because we still wanted a nicer room. We were given one of the "P" suites with a view of the top of buildings. The room was nice with a very comfortable bed and nice decor, but I was dissappointed after reading the other reviews here about the free upgrades other had received. A year earlier we had earned free airfare and free rooms we never used... so much for loyalty. Anyway, the hotel and casino are very nice and plush. Unfortunately, never witnessed anyone winning on any game (slots, craps, blackjack, etc). The poker room was descent and was the only place any money was won. Other than that, we did well at Harrah's and Casino Royale. For the price and loyalty service, I recommend that you stay there if you want a nice place to stay, and aren't worried about the gambling a whole lot.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but.....”
Reviews.Author: squirrel20
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Vegas Aug. 13 - 17/07 and stayed at Paris. We took a cab from the airport instead of the shuttle and after talking to our friends who showed up a day later, turned out to be the PREFERRED way to get to the hotel. It took us only 10 min. to get to our hotel from the airport using a cab, whereas it took our friends an hour and a half (because they had to wait for the shuttle first and then stop at all the other hotels before getting to their own). Check in was quick and painless. After reading other reviews we tried to do what they did by asking for a room "on the 26th floor or above" not realizing that NOT ALL of those rooms are renovated, but even though our room wasn't renovated it was very large and clean. We weren't facing the strip either but it was no big deal cause we were barely in the room anyways. We didn't sit by the pool at all because for us it was WAY TOO HOT and wanted to stay indoors as much as possible (being from Canada, the +44 weather was pretty unbearable) but we went to check it out and it looked awesome. We were a little disappointed with the restaurant selection after visiting alot of the other hotels on the strip. A lot of times we were interested in just "snacking" foods and Paris doesn't have alot of that to offer. Actually, they pretty much only have their buffet (that always had a huge line up) and a few other places (where the menu showed $25 or higher entrees). Most of the other hotels had "food court" settings with way more variety. I have no complaints about Paris whatsoever but will probably not stay there again.....just because there's so many other places to explore. Our friends stayed at the Wyn and ended up getting a phenomenal deal through Expedia paying less then us and that hotel is breathtaking!! We were able to check out their room and WOW!! If we don't stay at the Wyn, we'll probably do the Bellagio or Venetian. On another note, we went to a show every night we were there. First we went to Penn and Teller (at Rio) and were disappointed. The second night we went to Jubilee (at Ballys) and LOVED IT!! It's a classic vegas show and well worth it. The third night we went to Wayne Brady (at Venetian) and laughed our heads off. He was sooooo funny, it was definately the best show we've seen there! If you'd like further details, please feel free to email me :o)

Reviews.Title: “Just not right...”
Reviews.Author: dianaw
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at the Paris from Aug 27-31, 2007. This was our fifth time to Vegas so we felt we had something to compare our trip to. I was very excited to stay at the Paris and we got an excellent package deal thru Northwest Airlines. Of course, the location of the hotel was wonderful... but sadly it goes down hill from there. The stereotype that French people are rude, must have been taught to the staff during orientation--just to make it seem more realistic. On several different occasions various staff members seemed bothered or irritated at your mere presence, let alone if you actually needed something. At check in we nicely asked if there was any way to get a view of the Bellagio---the unfriendly staff person curtly replied, "Yes, for an up charge of $60 a night."---then nothing else--after we declined she just kept pushing buttons and then told us our room number and handed us the keys. If I were training the staff, I would have said something like, "OK, so if you don't want to upgrade, let me see what I can do to give you a higher floor room to help you out." We ended up getting a room on the 18th floor anyway, but if she had actually spoken to us in a pleasant manner we would have felt better about it and we would have thought she was on our side. Instead, she made us feel like cheap skates that she didn't want to waste her time on. Other problems included: 1. Rooms Rooms were a nice size, but the details of luxury were overlooked. The mattress of our king bed looked and felt like it was broken down and cheap. The sheets were a low thread count and had holes in them. The way they made the bed the sheets kept coming undone and exposing the bare mattress. The towels were fairly small and a quality I would expect at a travel lodge. 2. The Pool I had seen pictures of the pool and was very excited to go. I guess fantasy is better than reality. Granted it had been a windy day in the morning, but the pool was still full of leaves and I even stepped on a plastic cup at the bottom of the pool in the afternoon. There was no one even trying to clean it out the whole time I was there. There was trash, (left over drinking glasses, paper, cigarette butts, leaves, debris) every where on the ground around the pool. Even though I saw plenty of young people on staff, no one was cleaning only talking and giggling with each other. In fact, I actually witnessed an employee ignore the trash. It appears it was his job to pick up left over towels on the lounge chairs, so he stepped over a turned over empty bottle just to get the towel---he seemed to be a "it's not my job" type of employee. Besides, the pool itself is only one depth-3 1/2" and it hit around my stomach so I thought I was in a kiddie pool the entire time---either that or a country pond with all the debris that was in it. 3. The Buffet We ate at the breakfast buffet and waited for over 20mins in a stuffy, hot line of other hungry diners. Not so bad in Vegas until we realized it was not because they were so overly busy---just completely mismanaged. There were plenty of empty tables and servers---just not enough common sense to get us seated efficiently. On a personal note: No biscuits and gravy in this buffet--how sad for my American stomach. Went to Caesar's Buffet for breakfast the next day--same price, no wait, excellent service and great food (with biscuits and gravy). Overall, I'm just glad I got a good deal on the room-it helped ease the pain somewhat--would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LVfun
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Paris for 2 nights(Aug.15-17) and loved almost everything that this hotel offers. First of all, it's a great location. The room is big enough to relax and clean, and the bathroom has a separate bath and a huge shower. The buffet is great, and I certainly enjoyed breakfast! The bakery, JJ's Boulangerie is awsome and reasonable. I liked to dine at Le Café Île St. Louis. I went there around 7:30p.m and there was no wait, but be aware of a long line to get in at late night. I got the airport at 10:30a.m and coluld check in and got a room(15th floor) right at the airpot. I paid $49/night more to get a room with view so I enjyoed the view of Eiffel tower, pool and the fountain of Bellagio. I just wish I could've got a renovated room though. I would recommend everyone to stay here and would definetely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Paris was just ok”
Reviews.Author: spookyfudge
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paris hotel Aug-28 through Sept 1. Stayed in a new conditioned room on the 28th floor. Room was nice but wife got rash from the decorative pillow located from bed. Some stains on the furnature which I hate to think where that came from. Casino was ok, but found the Balley's and more friendly. Would not stay here again. Had to call the maid for soap and toilet paper. Why would you not put a new bar of soap in the room every night like a Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “The good and the bad and the ugly”
Reviews.Author: Travelman0708
Reviews.Content: Check in was close to drop off point, got in at 9 am and was told to come back for check in at 11:30 am. Went back at 11 and the line was long and I asked for a room without an adjoining door. got to the room and their was an adjoining door. View was terrible, parking structure and that was it. Bedspread looked like it was taken from a garage sale. Shower stall had mold in the tile cracks. TV was old model. These rooms need updating, more on that to come. Since I was staying on rewards comps for free actually, I decided to stick it out since I wouldnt be in the room much anyhow. Lobby bar needs upgrading badly. A look at the furniture will tell you that. Discussions with some employees even said that harrahs needed to spend some money. Almost all employees were helpful and friendly. Some did have a grim look on their face and no smiles for whatever reasons. The Eiffle tower experience is pretty neat for some good pics of the strip. The buffet in the shop area is pretty good for the price, under 20.00. Drink prices were expensive and I understand they just raised them, like from 8/9 dollars for a long island iced tea to 13.00. Bartenders were all friendly and quick, good service. Cocktail waitresses all had a dead look on their face. The 3 girl dance troupe that puts on impromtu dance routines were kinda neat out of the blue. All smiling and provacatively dressed...yeah!!! Slot machines were tight it seemed(the dollar ones) nickels and quarters were alot better. The pool was spacious and nice. Very cool to hang out at. The cocktail(pool) waitresses hustled and all were friendly and smiled.; Check out had me billed for a drink out of the room fridge, 7.00 and I didnt take it. The clerk wasnt pleasent about this and said they will do an inventory. I replied, go ahead, you will see that it wasnt taken. Waiting for a credit. There are alot of beautiful guests and people that were at the Paris, especially the women. Of course I think all of vegas is like that. The hookers that pass thru at times late in the evening need a beauty salon and for 500.00 an hour, geez, keep walking. The Paris has a great old world charm to it and the casino is layed out pretty cool.

Reviews.Title: “Just what you need on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: jonny-loves-travel
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the Paris Las Vegas after a 10 hour flight was just the tonic to really get our holiday off to a great start. Checking in was quick and efficient and we were soon in our room, which was extremely comfortable and spacious with a great bathroom with separate bath and huge shower. Keen to see what was on offer around the hotel we quickly found a fantastic pool with unbelievable views of the Eiffel Tower and across to the Bellagio. Having worked up an appetite we went to find food, and with 2 teenagers in tow were not disappointed with Le Burger Brasserie. Reasonably priced typical American food with huge portions we would come to get used to over the next 3 weeks. The public areas of the hotel with their French theme were typically Vegas but for a first time visitor, still awe inspiring. The best meal of the holiday was at Mon Ami Gabi in the hotel, where the food, service and view of the Bellagio fountains was difficult to fault and very good value when you get 2 dollars to the pound. I think the Paris Las Vegas is ideally located on the strip, being very central and within reasonable walking distance of most attractions, or for the monorail for further attractions. We stayed for 4 nights and thoroughly enjoyed our time there with no compaints at all and would unreservedly recommend it to anyone visiting Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyJetLag
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the night before last. It has a fantastic location on the strip, being directly opposite the Bellagio and Ceasers Palace. The room we had was on the 30th floor overlooking Ballys, and had a fantastic layout, including a massive LCD TV. Didn't get a chance to try any of the things on offer in the hotel, like the Casino, or The Producers or even the Restaurants. But we had a great time! On a unrelated note, whilst we we there, Las Vegas suffered from a massive thunderstorm which caused flash flooding. Right behind the hotel, cars got washed away! Crikey!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel-great honeymoon.”
Reviews.Author: usababe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the paris hotel from the 6th august for four nights as part of our honeymoon.When we arrived it was quite late and we asked because it was our honeymoon if we could get an upgrade-after trying to sell us reduced rates for suites- the lady finally said she couldnt offer anything for us that night but if we wanted to move the next day we could have a renovated corner room.Our original room we were given was two double beds and it was nice -it had a partial view of the bellagio across the road and would have been more than acceptable but when we got our new room it was lovely-just more modern with a plasma tv and because we got a corner room we had two windows-one with a strip view of the bellagio again and it was slightly bigger! The hotel has a fantastic location and after prveiously staying at NYNY we felt more in the center of things and it was lovely to have the view of the bellagio fountains.The hotel and its casino are smaller than most on the strip was was nice as it didnt take us ages to get around the hotel and it felt more friendlier.Some reviews have mentioned lots of smoke and loud noise but I dont think they were staying at the same hotel I didnt find that at all. We didnt do much gambling so I cannot comment on the casino and we only ate in the new 'burger brasserie' which is located between paris and ballys and it was great-a sports type bar witha french theme and about 4 different types of fries.We also went to the pool expecting all the loungers to be taken but this was never the case and there was always plenty of room in the pool although the water was a little chilly in the 104 degree heat. We signed up for a reward card and got free trips up the eiffel tower which was great-a great tip you get loads of coupons and things even if your not a big gambler like us. We had a fantastic start to our honeymoon at the paris and although there is lots of choice on the strip and it would be nice to try somewhere different we would have no hesitation staying at the paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Paris”
Reviews.Author: sremington
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Paris, we arrived 9:30am on 8/22 and stayed for 3 nights. We checked in at the airport after getting our bags it was 9:45 so we decided to wait and check-in at the airport check-in which opened at 10AM. After reading several of the reviews here I tried to get one of the newly renovated rooms but none were available instead we were given room 1998 which had a great view of the Bellagio fountains and a nice view of the pool and hot tubs below the tower. Our beds were comfortable, the room was clean, and the staff were very friendly. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: MRP01
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at The Paris and found it to be everything we expected. The location at the center of the strip was excellent with respect to other Las Vegas attractions, and our room was very spacious and comfortable. The desk clerk told us that this room had been recently renovated and it showed. I especially liked how well the ac worked in the bathroom; a hot shower to a cool room, very nice indeed! The casino and public spaces in the Paris have a pseudo Parisienne street motif, but overall it was tastefully done. One complaint is that they charge a whopping $9.00 per person to go to the top of the Eiffel Tower, even for paying guests. We passed on that one. The pool was quite large and there was always plenty of room in and around it even on 110 degree+ days. Meals at Le Cafe were good and not overpriced with decent burgers and sandwich options. Breakfast at JJ's Boulangerie was not worth the wait. We wanted to try the buffet for dinner one night, but the line was very long, so we walked over to Bally's which is connected, and their buffet was $19.99 and fabulous. I would definitely stay at The Paris again, but the strip is loaded with bargains in this price range (we paid $130 per night).

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: NancyNona
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed at the Paris the weekend of Aug. 18th through the 20th. I knew how nice the casino floor was so, I was very eager to see the rooms and to actually stay in the hotel. Unfortunatly, most of the reviews on this website are accurate. The room was nothing to write home about. In fact, our toilet ran if you did not jiggle the handle. No big deal but, you'd expect more from Paris considering its popularity. While playing the penny slots, we waited almost an hour for the "free drinks". When I moved to the $1 slots, my waitess showed up right away and she made sure I was playing those slots before she took my drink order. Who goes through all that? Just give me the drink lady. Then, when we were at the pool, a waitress by the name of Kharen took our order and she was so dispondant, I had to tell her that I thought her attitude was not pleasant. I probably would not have said anything to her if the waitess that I originally flagged down had not snubbed me so badly by informing me as she walked, that she did not "serve my area of the pool". She said it in passing so I had to ask someone else "what'd she say"? So, rude. So, it just gives credit to some of the others who posted on this website that Paris only caters to the high rollers and not your average person who pays $200 a night for a room instead of it being comped. I wish customer service was still a thing of the present instead of a thing of the past. Vacations are expensive enough, more so in this tough economy, I would expect more from a destination so dependant upon your money to survive given all the competition in the area. Finally, their food choices could be more abundant, another thing I've heard repeated on this review site. Sadly, Paris hotel won't be my first choice ever again, and all of the other adults I traveled with said the same thing. Their management really needs to check themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Best location on the strip - loved it!”
Reviews.Author: davcat
Reviews.Content: We arrived at about 1 pm, walked straight up to check in, no line and met with a really pleasant lady (so sorry I didn't get her name). Anyway, she checked us in very promptly and gave us a renovated room after I asked nicely - she said she shouldn't as they were for diamond members but I am soooo glad she did. The room was fab, on 30th floor. It was so elegantly decorated, 46" flat screen tv and the bathroom was really plush. Pity it was Vegas really, as you don't spend too much time in the room to really appreciate it, but we were very grateful nonetheless. Loved the casino, easy enough to navigate yourself around it and really enjoyed the little shops etc. en route to Ballys - thought they did the french theme so well. We ate at the buffet one night and thoroughly enjoyed it (however I do think they should get new uniforms for the female staff - way too much!!!). Ate at Mon Ami Gabi (didn't like - separate review under the restaurant itself), wouldn't recommend. Ate at Burger Brasserie (on way to Ballys), nice place, cheap food and good atmosphere, very pleasant staff. Overall we loved the Paris for the ambience, cleanliness and not least the location - its bang on the middle of the strip, you walk out of the casino right onto the street and you have the fabulous Bellagio fountains exactly opposite you. It was pleasant walk in either direction to see the rest of the big name hotels. We would highly recommend for a first visit to Vegas. Make sure you register with Harrahs.com so you can get email updates on cheaper rates for your dates of travel you can ring and get the reduced rates applied to your booking. Well worth it as we saved $60 per night on our original booking this way.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice on the Strip; Just Not for Me”
Reviews.Author: PigInSpace
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Paris Las Vegas for one night in June while on business. The firm I was visiting chose the hotel, and upon reflection I think it was a good choice. The location on the Strip was very convenient for strolling and a short cab ride to many excellent restaurants. I had a hard time deciding how to rate this hotel, because I think one's reaction to it will be very closely related to one's reaction to Las Vegas in general. Many of the things that put me off won't bother others at all. That said, here are my impressions: PLUS -Room was large and recently renovated, with a small separate sitting area. -Comfortable king bed. -Large bathroom with separate bath and shower. -Room was clean, though carpet was already stained. -My advance request for a quiet room was largely fulfilled, as the hotel assigned me a room at the end of a hallway on a high floor. This, incidentally, gave me a great view over the "Arc de Triomphe" as well. I really appreciated that. (I say largely fulfilled on the noise front, though, because it was quite close to the housekeeping equipment room, so I did hear semi-constant comings and goings of the cart...not terrible, though). MINUS -Whatever industrial-strength cleaning solvent they use in the rooms gave me a heck of a headache. It was a very strong odor. -The hotel has something like 4,000 rooms. This felt creepy to me, though it may not bother most people. -Similarly, the plastic-cobbled "streets" and casino downstairs with its clouds of smoke and desperation gathering under the low ceilings painted to look like sky...well, it freaked me out. But that's Vegas, right? -$4 for a pretty crummy pain au chocolat. I can't say that I loved my stay, but for fans of the whole Las Vegas experience, Paris Las Vegas is probably a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Engaged at the Paris Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: SoxFan777
Reviews.Content: We got engaged at Paris Las Vegas, so I might be biased toward the wonderfulness (yes, I know that's not a word) of the hotel. They helped make our stay wonderful while we were there. We're mostly just tourists (not huge gamblers--only spent a couple hundred) but we loved it! We searched and searched for which hotel to stay in, and it came down to Paris, Luxor, or Monte Carlo. My boyfriend had already been to the Monte Carlo, and we picked Paris because the price was running the same as the Luxor and we thought it was a good deal. The casino is awesome with lots of character and atmosphere. We had fun, were treated politely, and we had no real complaints. Dinner up in the Eiffel towar was very good, and my boyfriend called ahead and told them he was proposing. They gave us the best seat in the house. The meal was good, but I've had better. The DESSERT was awesome... banana something or other. The view was incredible. The rooms were very nice but standard... it's Vegas, you don't spend that much time in your room! All in all, we'd stay at Paris Las Vegas again, but we'd also love to try another resort, too. There's so much to see in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Great Ambience”
Reviews.Author: foodie192
Reviews.Content: Wonderful ambience. Incredible food and great service. Best location right in the midst of the action on the strip. Comfortable clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “paris is the best”
Reviews.Author: scoobie21
Reviews.Content: My brother and I go to Vegas every year about twice. We have stayed in the Trop, Luxor, Excalbur,Mirage, Flamingo, Bally's, Stratopshere, MGM, Planet Hollywood and the Westin. The Paris is our favorite. Everyone of these other hotels are ok. We even could say we like the Trop (because of the pool) but the Paris has everything. Pool, Food, Rooms, and Casino are all 10's. Maybe the pool is a 9. PARIS ---- SURE IS GREAT!!!! Going there 2 more times before 2008. Can't wait. The count down begins

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected, but it was Comp'd”
Reviews.Author: Urban_Tourista
Reviews.Content: We recently celebrated our anniversary with a free night stay at the Paris, curtesy of our Total Rewards club. That was about the only really good thing. We got to our room and we were impressed by it's overall appearance, but taking a closer look at the bedding changed that. The decorative throw had stains on it and blonde hairs strewn about, yeah. The view was non existent. But hey it was free! The hotel overall has great little restaurants,and the recreated village inside is just the best! The bakery, yum! Definetly high end everywhere you look. Had the bedding been a little cleaner, it would have been too perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Lisamorris
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paris from 04/07/2007 to 11/07/2007 for my honemoon. I read a lot of the reviews and took on board asking for a room above the 25th Floor. We stayed on the 27th floor and looked onto Planet Hollywood. The room was fantastic and very spacious. The bathroom was amazing and the beds were sooooo comfy. Read some of the reviews about the check in service being very lenghly, it took us around 20 mins which in my opinion wasnt very long and when going into hotel like the Luxor etc the queues were horrendious. When we first arrived to the Paris it was lunch time and we decided to start our honeymoon with lunch at the Eiffel Tower restaurant looking over the Belagio, which was fantastic. We ate at the buffet which was lovely however after day 3 were sick of all that food for breakfast. We ate out at several places along with a beautiful cafe in the Venetian which was superb. However to top the holiday off we booked the French Steakhouse in the Paris sitting outside again looking over the Belagio fountains, this was the perfect end to a perfect holiday it actually brought tears to my eyes. Over all Las Vegas was an amazing place with lots to do and see, oh and I thought the pool was lovely at the Paris. Very hot so a great place to cool down. I would go back in a heartbeat and definately stay at the Paris again. Lisa & Stephen, Scotland

Reviews.Title: “Saturated with cigarette smoke”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoOasis
Reviews.Content: Horrible. Hotel is saturated with cigarette smoke. There are hordes of people and waiting. Noise in the casino is deafening. Their expresso coffee is really bad.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Pippy437
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a comped stay at the Paris (and no, I'm not a "high-roller", just a lucky college student). Such a beautiful hotel! But beware, if the thought of hearing and seeing Paris-themed stuff 24/7 freaks you out, stay somewhere else. For me, I loved it! If you're going along with your significant other, you should stay here, it's so romantic! I must warn that this review will be extremely lengthy so please bear with me. The room: After a couple room changes, I was upgraded to a renovated strip-view room with a view of the Eiffel Tower and the Bellagio fountains. All the rooms above the 25th floor are renovated. If you want a room that has a perfect view, get a room thats towards the end of the hall in the 90's and make sure it is an even number(i.e. if you are on the 26th floor, make sure your room is 2692, 2694, etc) . These rooms are towards the right side of the hotel and the Eiffel Tower won't block your view of the Bellagio fountain show which is sooooo awesome at night but yet you can still see the Eiffel Tower on your left. I'm the kind of person that needs the perfect room, so I hope this info helps some of you out there. Oh yeah, and I did see how the old rooms looked and trust me, you HAVE to ask for a renovated room. The old rooms were really old, torn, and dingy. In the new room, the beds were heavenly, the down comforters were nice and the feathered pillows were fluffy. The plasma tv, on the other hand, had a life of it's own and it took forever to turn the tv on/off or switch channels. All in all, the room was great! The pool: The pool is pretty boring but it really is sufficient. I went there twice early (9ish in the morning) and there weren't many people there even though it was warm enough to get into the pool. If you like to do laps in the morning, this pool is great. The casino: The atmosphere of the casino was extremely beautiful. The slots on the other hand, sucked, but hey it's Vegas. I never once got offered a drink (like I said, I played the slots). I also liked how the hotel was not a massive monster, and you could easily walk to the slots or to the parking lot without getting out of breath. Make sure you sign up for Total Rewards if you haven't yet. You can get coupons for $5 off the buffet and 2-for-1 rides for the Eiffel Tower. I highly suggest using the buffet coupon for breakfast, especially on a weekday when the line isn't so long or earlier in the morning. I got to use the buffet coupon on a Friday morning around 10:45ish and I got to eat both breakfast and lunch for 10 bucks which I paid through comps. I also found a trick for the Eiffel Tower coupons. It says that you can only use the 2-for-1 coupon before 5 pm but here's what you do: buy the tickets before 5 pm but use the actual tickets at night when it's really pretty; the tickets they print out are regular tickets that are valid for a year or so. Oh yeah, you also get 10% off in the stores with Total Rewards. Bally's is also connected to the Paris so sometimes I went there to gamble. If you're not a big spender when it comes to food, the Paris very much lacking in that department (sometimes, you just want some chicken nuggets, you know?). On that note, my bf and I went across the street to Ellis Island where they have 4.99 steak dinners and 2.95 breakfasts. Planet Hollywood, next door, also had some cheap eats in the Miracle Mile Shops. Shows: I'm too lazy to write separate reviews for the shows I watched, so I'll just give some short opinions: 1) V Variety Show: (Planet Hollywood) You must watch this show! It's a great deal! You can find coupons online (2-for-1, etc). You basically see magicians, a juggler, comedians, impersonators, acrobats, everything! I laughed my pants off, seriously! 2) Mesmerized Hypnosis Show (Planet Hollywood): This show had the potential to be great but maybe since I went on a Thursday night, the crowd was dead. It was hilarious though. Again, look for good deals online. 3) Riviera Comedy Club: DO NOT WATCH THIS CRAP IF DOM IRRERA IS PERFORMING BECAUSE HE SUCKS! His jokes just weren't funny and it seemed like he did not want to be there. The two ladies before him were so much more funnier than him. That casino is just so icky, don't go here. In fact, I suggest watching Second City, a comedy show I watched in May, which is SUPER funny. Again, look for discounts online. 4) Cirque du Soleil Mystere (TI): As always, this show was magnificent. As a tip, for those of you who are active military, you get 50% off all of the Cirque du Soleil shows in Vegas. I don't know how long this deal with last but shoot, I had awesome seats! I highly suggest not sitting right at the front but sitting towards the middle since a lot of the tricks are in the air. 5) Price is Right (Bally's): Make sure you show your hotel key card when purchasing tickets at Bally's for a 25% discount. The Price is Right was really fun, but I wish my name was chose to play Plinko hahaha. Getting around (no, not like that): If you're using a car during your trip, I know a "secret" place to park. When you go up the ramp into the garage, turn left at the first entry where it has a sign for Hertz. Here, you'll turn left and go all the way around and all the way down to the other end where there'll be so many parking spots and it'll be a couple steps to the door to the casino. You won't have to use any elevators or struggle to find parking. I think most people don't try parking at this level because of the Hertz sign that throws you off but hey, I discovered it by accident. Also, AVOID using Las Vegas Blvd. When accessing the hotel, exit Tropicana, turn left on Koval, right on Harmon, and right on Audrie. Use, Koval and Paradise Rd (accessed from Harmon) to access all other casinos on the strip. Trust me, I'll save you like an hour of commuting time. Oh yeah, Fremont Street is disgusting. The end. In conclusion, I highly recommend this hotel. The only reason I did not give it a perfect rating was the fact that the whole hotel has not been renovated. Once the whole hotel is renovated it'll be perfect! One more note: visit the vegas4locals website for inside tips, coupons, tickets, and great bargains!!! I sure did, and I saved a crapload!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: bigblindbob
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the newly renovated rooms (26th floor) and had a wonderful view of the Bellagio fountains. We are not big time gamblers but recieved an offer after our stay last year at Bally's for two free nights and two additional nights at $75 per nt. Check in was fast and staff was extremely friendly. While the room was moderate in size, it had a nice new flat screen tv, marble bathroom, & coffee maker (rare for the strip). The only restaurant we ate at in the hotel was the buffet one morning. As far as buffets go, it's very good. The pool is ok but nothing to write home about . For what it's worth, we will most likely stay here when we return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Most employees were rude”
Reviews.Author: fleaflea821
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3 day vacation at the Paris in Las Vegas. The hotel itself was nice but the employees were rude. It seemed unless you were a high roller you would not be receiving the service you hoped for. On one occasion i was getting ready to sit down to play at one of the slot machines and as I was getting ready to sit down I stopped one of the waitresses to get me a drink and her exact words to me were "Oh no honey, unless you are playing I can't take your drink order" and she just walked off. I encountered other problems with other staff but this one just really seemed to be the most upsetting. I also wanted to mention that I don't know when the last time they changed their comforters out but they sure were dingy.

Reviews.Title: “Gaudy and over-the-top... What more can you ask of a Vegas hotel?”
Reviews.Author: UESyorkie
Reviews.Content: I knew before I arrived at the Paris that it would be over-the-top, but it's Vegas so I rolled with it! The location of the property right on the strip, and basically across the street from the Bellagio, is good, and the room, pool, and spa were well-worth the price. The hotel concierge suggested a fantastic italian restaurant at the Venetian (Valentino) and made all the necessary last minute arrangements. All-in-all a nice expericence which I would be more than willing to repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Paris is the best”
Reviews.Author: verno24
Reviews.Content: This experience was better than expected. The staff was great, the hotel was outstanding, food great, casino top notch. We ate at the Eiffel Restaurant which the food was okay but the ambiance and view of the skyline was incrediable. Will stay there again no question.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Devas
Reviews.Content: About the casino... Even if you skip the rest of this review, please note the following: If you're gambling at the Paris casino and you like roulette, you MUST find a table where either Brian or Jose is the dealer. (And someone said there's more than one Jose. He's the one who knows every baseball statistic since the beginning of time.) They were the two most friendly, most entertaining, and most informative of all the dealers there. And the rest weren't bad either. The drink servers were pleasant, but service was slow, especially at the slots. And I once waited over an hour at the tables before a server came by. About the hotel... Pros: The wide-screen TV was enjoyable, although it wasn't working right. The safe in the room is an appreciated amenity, especially in Las Vegas. The room decor in general was very modern and attractive, especially the bathroom with its marble tile throughout. Thoroughly enjoyed the availability of the computer/printer kiosk by the lobby elevators for printing out our boarding passes. Maid service was thorough and unobtrusive. Cons: The room was quite small. The air conditioning didn't work very well. We had it set at 67 degrees at all times, and eventually we would be comfortable, but it probably never went below 72 degrees, so if you're looking for a quick cool down after coming in from the desert heat, you're out of luck. Additionally, the bathroom didn't have an air duct for the A/C, nor did it have a vent fan. So be prepared to primp in a sauna-like environment. The TV was very uncooperative. It kept locking up, and so we had to keep powering it off and on, although we did get prompt service from engineering to try to fix it, which they did, but then the problem just started all over again. It was the fourth day before we figured out how to reach the regular TV channels with ease. BEWARE: Make sure you read the note in the mini-bar fridge, especially the part about the $50 cleaning fee if you store your own items in there!!! About the restaurants... Every single restaurant had a French theme, and so it was all a bit too French for me, which meant it was difficult to find a sandwich on just regular sliced bread. All the sandwiches in all the restaurants were served on hard, crusty French bread. But you MUST try the restaurant Le Burger. I had the lamb burger and it was the best burger I ever ate! Overall, I would stay at Paris hotel and gamble at Paris casino again in the future. But with the exception of Le Burger, I would plan to eat my meals elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: handecan
Reviews.Content: Perfect two days in this incredible hotel. You feel like you are just under Eiffel Tower when you are swimming in the hotel pool. It a must to go there :)

Reviews.Title: “Didn't know what to expect, but had a good time and $20 trick worked!”
Reviews.Author: mella2007
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Paris on my own from 17th till 19th July. I arrived at the airport at 7am and after catching a shuttle, arrived at Paris at 9am. First impression of the hotel was just ok....we were taken in a side entrance so didn't get a chance to see the front until later on. Check in: A lot of people checking in and out when I arrived, apparantly Monday mornings are very busy for the hotel. Spoke to a nice lady about getting me into my room early after an overnight flight. I said I would give her a tip if she could get me into my room early etc...told me to come back in around an hour. I did just that and she got me into my room at 10am, on the 28th floor, fantastic room overlooking Pool and Eiffel tower as well as the full view of the Bellagio fountains! I gave her $20 and she was happy with that! Room: It was room 2803 and i would highly recommend it. It was obviously a newer room with big plasma TV, otttoman in front of window, desk with coffee maker, a great big King bed and fluffy pillows. All in all very happy! Room service: I ate in a couple of times and found the food to be warm on both occassions, though the delivery time and hotel staff service was good. Price looked good until they add around $5 room service charge to it! Pool area: Fresh towels were always available and 5 lifeguards on duty which i thought was great for just a hotel pool. Waiters were hard to get when I was there and I paid $17 for a large Margerita!! I liked the pool area though, weather was hot but not so crowded. Saw Ballys pool on the monorail and it was tiny compared to Paris. Food on site: Ate at the buffet once....heaps of choice, but i thought the desserts were horrible...basically just some cheese cakes and creme brulee which i ate. No fresh fruit at all which was disaapointing. I didnt go to any of the other eateries at all. Most of the other places were always busy and the food looked fresh. Casino: I found the casino to be less crowded than Ballys and the drinks were forthcoming as well as friendly attendants. I won a little on the slots as well as on roulette which was good. I signed up for Total rewards and got $28 off my hotel bill at the end. There was little smoke around and i found it got much quitier after midnight which i liked. There are plenty of gift shops and also the walkway to the Ballys casino and shops which is a very short stroll away. Elevators were always quick on my side, not sure about the opposite ones for the lower floors. The heat was unbearable outside, took a cab to the factory outlets which was fun, didnt do much else as my trip was short and I enjoyed just being around the hotel. Also took the monorail to the Forum shops at Caesars which was ok...had to walk through Imperial Palace and Harrahs to get there. Much preferred the walkways of Paris to these hotels which simply were claustraphobic and very busy. I agree with previous reviews about the fake french accents getting on your nerves, they should do away with it. I also found it amusing that a lot of the TV channels were in Spanish, but coming from Australia I guess there are so many Spanish speaking people in the USA. Checkout can be done via your room or in reception. They overcharged me on the mini bar which i had to get fixed. I also dont like the fact that they put a hold on your credit card for an extra amount even though they got all their money. Would i stay again?? No. I would like to stay in other hotels, and go when it isnt so hot. Truly the heat is so bad you dont want to do anything half the time!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: paramatex
Reviews.Content: just finished small vacation @ the paris hotel. A long line to check-in (42 mintues) mentioned wait to check-in clerk and was offered discounted upgrade that was to a suite which was recently redone...beautiful room..... great breakfest buffet ... used a coupon to try the spa and was very pleased with staff and facilities....pool was small compared to others in vegas but never over crowded and was clean and well maintained. Jubilee show at Ballys (connects to paris) was good show A/C on high and was darn right COLD so bring cover shirt or jacket. Gotta add this , saw carrot top @ luxor, funniest show ever you got to check him out.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful upgrade to Penthouse Suite!”
Reviews.Author: Starz331
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a promotional free offer to stay comped at a Harrah's property of our choice in Las Vegas. We had already planned to stay at the Bellagio but decided to take advantage of the free night stay at the Paris due to a late evening flight. We checked in at the lobby around midnight, and were told that the free standard rooms were all booked and were given a free upgrade to a penthouse suite! The room was amazing; a huge dining area and sitting area, bar with fridge, microwave and coffee maker. 2 separate bathrooms; one with a jacuzzi and even a bidet! We were on the 33rd floor with a view of the strip overlooking the Flamingo. We were sad to leave and move into our smaller standard room at the Bellagio; although here we had an incredible view of the dancing fountains. I would definitely return to the Paris hotel. We love the Village Breakfast Buffet (go early, it opens at 7 and there is usually not a long line until after about 8:30 a.m. Excellent crepes, made to order omelettes, eggs, carved ham, fresh fruits, etc!) We also enjoyed a late night meal at the 24 hour cafe at Paris; the french onion soup was incredible with a ton of mozzarella cheese on top. Feel free to ask any questions you might have!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at paris, Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: GBMelb
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at Paris Las Vegas at the end of a vacation in the southwest. Our room on the 17th floor was absolutely great with two large windows with different views, a king size bed, several comfortable chairs, and a very large bathroom that included both a shower and a tub. Also, likely because Paris is a smaller hotel, the elevators are very convenient to the registration desk, casino and shops/restaurants. At $139/night (Wednesday and Thursday) the room seemed well worth it. We had a rental car and parked in the garage and found it was not as long a walk to the hotel as we might have expected. We also valeted the car once which is likely a better option if you don't need to be getting stuff out of car and such (valet and garage parking are both free, although you need to tip the valet). Our booking came with several coupons for various free and 2-for-1 offers, although we wound up only using the one to go to the top of the Eiffel tower. It has a great view of the strip and all the surrounding areas. Only thing we did wrong was not realize that the Bellagio water show (across the street) would not go off when we went up (the shows started at 3 pm). We did eat in Mon Ami Gabi for dinner and the cafe for breakfast and found the food and service good in both, although the prices were a bit high--although that was somewhat expected. We were disappointed that the Napoleon bar no longer served hors d'oeuvres as it used to due to a new Nevada law (they allow smoking, so cannot serve food is what we heard), but we still enjoyed the champagne. The only other negative thing to report was again the price of some things--like $3 for a bottle of soda--but you do expect that type of thing is a tourist area. Overall, our stay in Paris was quite enjoyable and we'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Paris Treatment for Visitors”
Reviews.Author: FinickyMama
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Paris hotel during our last trip to Vegas. Unfortunately, we'd been spoiled the year before at the Bellagio. The Paris is rundown and in need of renovation! The service in all aspects was pretty poor--very disappointing! Do yourself a huge favor and spend just a little more for a nicer hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay there Again!”
Reviews.Author: sheribo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Paris from July 8-12, 2007. We had a fabulous time! This was our 2nd trip to Vegas together (last July we stayed at the Aladin - now Planet Hollywood). There really isnt much more you could ask for from a hotel that is priced in the "moderate" price range for Vegas. We loved this hotel! The them is obviously of Paris and you can really feel that everywhere you go in the hotel. It is a smaller casino than others but we really enjoyed that. Everyone seemed very friendly. We played the blackjack tables and met some wonderful people. We arent huge gamblers and Paris still offered Blackjack tables with a $10 minimum which can be hard to find! Some hotels the minimum for blackjack tables is $25/bet!! I didnt find this casino snobby at all like some of the higher end hotels. The lobby is easy to get to as are the elevators to the hotel rooms. Some other hotels are soo large that you can get lost in them and just finding your room can be a challenge! Our room was very clean and quiet. Paris is an awesome location on the strip. Bellagio and Ceasars are just across the street with Bally's on one side and Planet Hollywood on the other. The only restaurant we ate at in the Paris Hotel was the buffet. I actually dont recommend it.
