Out of all the buffets I have had in Vegas this one was probably the worst (with same prices as the others). I just found there wasnt as much selection for the price you pay. Another note... upon checking in we were offered to "upgrade" our room to a "VIP" package. This included a view of the strip, with access to the VIP room which included continental breakfast every morning and drinks/appetizers every night from 5-8pm. This was all for a cost of $60US. But be aware! This is $60US/per night which we never realized until afterwards. Our view from our room was amazing though. We could watch the Bellagio fountains from the comfort of our room! We could also see the swimming pool as well as a good portion of the strip! The continental breakfast included all types of pastries, cold smoked samon, yogurt, cereal fresh fruit and drinks. The appetizers at night could be an entire supper! Peel and eat shrimp, pasta, sandwiches, skewers with steak and non-alcoholic drinks (drinks with alcohol had a charge). So if you dont mind paying the extra $60/night - this really wasnt that bad of a deal if you make use of both meals! So overall Paris was a wonderful experience for us. I wouldnt be suprised if we stay there again next year when we return to Vegas. Couple extra Vegas notes: Ride the Double Deus bus. There are a bunch of buses that run up and down the strip. $2/trip or $5 for a 24 hour pass. We didnt wait more than 5 minutes for a bus and it runs all the way to Freemont Street. Also we had an awesome meal at Cheesecake Factory! (in Ceasars Forum shops). If you like pasta and seafood I highly recommend the Shrimp Bistro and if you like steak - the Hibachi steak was awesome! 2 Great meals with a bottle of wine was $65! Not bad for Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Paris”
Reviews.Author: MernieNY
Reviews.Content: First of all this was our 8th year visiting Vegas and our first stay at Paris. This review will be lengthy, but hopefully it will help. We stayed at Paris July 7 thru July 13. We didn't have any problems at all. We checked in at 11:00 a.m. and it was very quick and they had a room available at that time. I inquired about an upgrade to a renovated room but everything was sold out due to 7/7/07. They said they would have one available the next day and they would hold for me if I would like. I wanted to check the standard room first as I didn't want to pay an additional $60 nightly if not necessary (even though we only paid $350 for the six nights including tax thru casino marketing). Well, the standard room was fine. It was a little dated, but very clean and well kept. The only bad part of the room were the linens. They were worn, a little torn and one had a little stain on it. We were going to keep the room and just request new linens. However, the next morning I decided to go back and check on the renovated room (as it would have had a view of the pool, Bellagio fountains, etc.). Well, I was pleasantly surprised to be offered an upgrade to a renovated room on the 26th floor (room 2641) at no additional cost (it just didn't offer the front view, it was a view towards Planet Hollywood and the south end of the strip). Yes, there was some construction in view, but there is construction all over the strip so that was not an issue at all. The room was in the corridor where the employee elevators (for room service etc.) are and the housekeeping rooms and I was concerened about the noise from these areas. Absolutely nothing to worry about, it was never a problem. The renovated room was wonderful. The beds (and bedding) are amazing and it was very quiet. I slept better than I have in years any where. The casino is fine and if you really pay attention on your first walk through, you will be able to navigate very easily. It is a little confusing at first. The pool area, is standard in comparison to the Mirage and MGM, but it was very clean, quiet (they played nice music) it wasn't all parisian as it seemed to be inside and there was always ample seating (and not on top of each either, as you find at the Mirage and Treasure Island. We were concerned about the pool area as we like the more tropical feeling in a pool area, but we really ended up enjoying this pool area. The only thing was the sun is blocked by the building until about 9:30. The first sun hits around the bottom of the tower, so you will want to sit over there (between the cafe and the tower leg. However, it was so hot when we were there, it was very comfortable being shaded. So I guess it depends on what you are looking for. The staff was all very friendly. We are not in the Diamond Club and didn't get great comps at the end, but we were never looked down upon as some of the reviews have stated. The restaurants were pricey and we weren't overly impressed with them. They did not have any cheap dining (every once in awhile you want to grab a quick inexpensive bite to eat and this resort did not offer that). We ate at the Buffet for breakfast which was very good and we highly recommend it and we ate there for dinner but did not feel we would eat there for dinner again. If you sign up for the players club you get a coupon book with a $5 off coupon for the buffet...use it for breakfast. We did have room service one evening and the french onion soup was wonderful and the french dip sandwich and fries were very good, the bread was amazing and the service was very good and the table was removed from the hallway by the next morning. We found this resort to be extremely busy and loud with through traffic to Bally's. As it is a themed resort it gets alot of walk through traffic and being connected to Bally's makes it that much worse. We did struggle with that sometimes. It wasn't bad later at night and it was nice to have the inside connection to Bally's at that point. The pro's and con's of the inside connection. We did have our 17 year old son with us this year and I would have to say, if you are bringing any children in their late teens, I would recommend the MGM. I think he would have enjoyed walking around there much more than Paris. As for adult couples, I would recommend Paris. All in all we enjoyed Paris and would definetly stay there again if the price is right. I have to say, we stay at the most decent place that gives us the best offer. Just a little added info on dining. The Top of the World revolving restaurant at the Stratosphere was wonderful. We ate lunch there as they have a dress code for dinner and we didn't want to dress up, plus lunch is obviously less expensive and you have the daytime view of the entire area, instead of just the lights at night (which would be very pretty, too). It was $111 for three of us, but my son and I had the three course chef's choice which included prime rib and an amazing desert and my husband had the four course chef's choice and he had steak and shrimp and a different wondeful desert. It was very good and really not pricey when you deduct $33 from that (as that is what it would cost for three to go up to the observation deck without lunch/dinner). We enjoyed the observation deck inside and out after lunch and feel it is well worth the price of lunch there at least once. Ellis Island is on Koval Street behind Bally's to the right. It is a little local's casino/restaurant and we had steak dinner's for $4.95 and it was very, very good. A tip that was given to us by one of the customers (and she was right) is order your steak a step down from the way you usually eat it, if you like medium, order medium rare and it is done as medium, etc. We heard about Ellis Island on the travel channel and also read reviews online. It truly is good! We will be eating there again when we return in October. Also, when we go to Vegas we generally stay a week and rent a car. We go to Walmart and buy a 12 cup coffee pot for $9 - $10, coffee, filters and dixie to go cups...we spend about $17 and have coffee for the week (we drink multiple cups a day) and it is a huge savings of $ and time from purchasing it in the hotels. We then just dispose of the coffee pot there and don't travel with it. Also, Dollar is the best car rental we have used out there. We now use only Dollar and you can rent it from several locations (no matter where you are staying) and drop off at a different location if you choose at no additional cost. we have never encoutered any type of problem with Dollar.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: falkirklimos
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paris hotel for our honeymoon was advised to take a room 25th floor and up as these have recently been renovated and ended up on floor 27, two queen beds 42in plasma screen tv and a very clean, big bathroom with seperate shower area. Hotel itself situated bang in the middle of the strip, probably a bit smaller than somee of its conterparts but at least you do not get lost in this hotel!! Obviously a big french theme throughout. Great resturants from the buffett to tower restuarant catering for all ranges and tastes. Recommend you to try this hotel we loved it and are already planning a quick trip back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, a bit loud early mornings!”
Reviews.Author: justmewichita
Reviews.Content: We always stay at a Harrah's property and decided to give the Paris a try this trip. The staff was very accomodating and helpful. Always eager and available when we had a need for anything. The airport check in was quick & easy as always. The rooms at the Paris are very comfortable with ample space and a large size bathroom. The pillows are a bit lacking and even with extras it is still not comfy. The room service was fast each time being under 30 minutes, which was impressive. Our only complaint is that the cleaning staff seems to be in the hallways very early (630am) and are most usually yelling outside the doorways while people are still sleeping. If you are a night owl who stays up gambling & checking out the night life of vegas this is perhaps not the place for you as you are unable to sleep in past usually 7am without being awaken. The casino as far as gambling goes, wasnt very loose, but we did hit a few things off and on. For actual gamblers , the Flamingo is far better for better pays!

Reviews.Title: “Paris Las Vegas old or new room, still a good deal”
Reviews.Author: kenandrob
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the 5-8th July 2007 (for my niece's wedding). We did NOT get one of the remodelled rooms as they were extra but I must say, the older rooms are fine! Our check in was QUICK and smooth (Emelda I believe was her name was very friendly on check in desk). The room was a good size, room was clean as was the bathroom. the bathrooms in the older rooms have the marble floors and separate bath / shower. the only problem we did encounter is we had a room that had a connection door with another room therefore making the noise from their room into ours a bit louder. SO be sure if you're not travelling with friends to ask for a room without connection doors. the only time we had a problem was on our last night with this but they did hush it a bit after i knocked on the connecting door. overall i would recommend the Paris whether you get a remodelled room or an older room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Resort, Excellent Service, but . . .”
Reviews.Author: bricomp
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paris from June 19th thru 21st. Overall it was a good stay. The staff was helpful, friendly and professional. The desk staff and bellmen were quick, so getting settled in was a breeze. The only draw back was the room, it needed remodeling, but it was clean and quiet. I enjoyed several breakfasts at Le Village buffet, and a dinner at Le Burger Brasserie. I would recommend both places. Le Burger Brasserie is a great place to watch the game or unwind at the end of the day, their appetizers were huge and the burgers were top quality with tons of topping choices. One note: if you are an early riser you will have to get your coffee at the Java Coast next door at Bally's, Lenotre (their bakery) does not open til 7AM. Alot of the convention, business and early travelers need their coffee, I think the Paris is missing out.

Reviews.Title: “Well pleased”
Reviews.Author: skitahoe46
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Paris July 1st thru July July 6th. Found the Hotel staff to be very friendly, we arrived early for check-in but the gentleman at the check-in found us a room that we could have if we did not want to wait. Rooms were very adequate, A/C worked well. The pool and hot tubs were excellent. The bath had a shower that was enclosed seperate from the bathtub. The room had a safe located inside the closet. The gaming area is laid out very nice and was considerably more "quite" than some other casinos. We would recommend Paris to friends. It is a Harrah's property so all "Rewards Credits" can be used at Paris

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteLauchi
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel, one of the best thematic hotels in Strip. Rooms are confortable and clean. The only problem is that there were a lot of room service trays at the corridors and for days nobody pick them up. The bedroom is clean, but the hotel should upgrade the bed linen.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel at a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Slix
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris from July 3-9, 2007, check in at the airport made things easy and we were able to go straight to our room on arrival. My husband, 2 adult daughters and I stayed in room 1882, which had a great view of the pool, the Eiffel Tower, the Bellagio & its fountains, along with the Arch de Triomphe, and the Miracle Mile shops at Planet Hollywood. The room wasn't huge, but it was nicely appointed and clean. The housekeeping staff was very good, and the one night when it appeared that a group of kids were left unattended and reaking havoc in the next room, the front desk was quick about sending up security to quiet them. My husband rented a cabana for my birthday and we spent the day by the pool. The cabana was wonderful. Not only did it provide shade, but it gave us a little privacy as well. Inside there was a table and chairs, a fridge stocked with water, soda, & juices, a phone, a tv, a sofa lounge & a ceiling fan. Outside there were 5 lounge chairs and misters to cool you. The cabana rental also included a lovely fruit basket and 2 free raft rentals. The cocktail waitress was very efficient and we had breakfast and lunch served in the cabana. Paris's pool may not be as fancy as some, but it's large and does a great job of cooling you off on a hot day. There seemed to be plenty of lounge chairs free too. It's definitely worth the cost of the rental, imo. Paris has some excellent food options. The 24 hour cafe and the buffet are excellent. Le Burger Brasserie is their new sports bar where you can get decent food at reasonable prices. Napoleon's is a beautiful lounge where you can listen to dueling pianos and try one of the many champagnes they have to offer. Sadly, Mon Ami Gabi was a disappointment on this latest visit, but maybe they were just having an off day, since we've eaten there several times before and always enjoyed it. It's a beautiful hotel and the location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location--stay there once”
Reviews.Author: madhattertx
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Paris Las Vegas July 2-6, 2007. We checked in at the airport when we arrived. I know it has been commented on before here, but it was at check-in that it was made clear how much the hotel values its "Diamond rewards club" members over the rest of us riff-raff. I asked to stay above the 25th floor in one of the renovated rooms and was told by the clerk flat out that those rooms were reserved for the Diamond members of the rewards program and she would do "the best she could". We were lucky enough to get 2 rooms on the same floor, but not connecting like we asked nor facing the strip as we asked. We weren't even offered an upgrade by the clerk. It seemed pretty obvious she wanted to get rid of us quickly. One of the rooms did turn out to be a room at the end of a corridor and had a partial view of Bellagio's fountains, but the other overlooked the back of the hotel property. Here is a tip...if you get the hotel transfer to and from the airport by bus, make sure you call to arrange your pickup right after you get to your room. We didn't and we ended up paying for a transfer back to the airport that we never got (we ended up taking 2 taxis). You are probably better off doing the taxis anyway because the cost to and from the hotel isn't that more expensive if you have a group of 4 or more like we did. Also, be prepared to wait in line for the buses, which was mighty fun considering it was 110+ outside when we arrived. We had rooms on the 20th floor. The hotel is showing its age...we saw many ceiling and crown molding cracks in the rooms and hallways. Our room had 2 queen beds with torn covers and stained sheets. The room was clean and smelled ok, but the linens definitely need to be updated. The bathrooms were the best part with nice soap, shampoo, etc and beautiful tile. The shower was separate and very roomy. The water is hard, so don't expect to get that desert sand feeling off you with foamy suds in the shower. The room service came daily and cleaned up nicely, but were lax about leaving new supplies especially even one extra roll of toilet paper. We had to go get paper from the carts on more than one occasion. The hotel charges $12.99/day for hi-speed internet access. They also charge up to $12.99 for hollywood movies. The tv channels are sparse and there were several outages and pixelated pictures on some channels. There are 1-2 spanish channels and something like 5-6 asian channels. No HBO or other movie channels. late night TV watching after a hard day of heat and gambling is definitely not enjoyable. Skip the honor bar too and go to one of the local convenience stores to stock up on snacks. $10 for a jar of freaking gummy bears???? The pool area is way small for such a large hotel. I do not recommend it at all. The elevators are quick. The shops are few, but convenient along the side of the hotel near the elevators and along the way to Bally's. We ate at the Village Buffet twice and it was pretty good and varied. To get in the restaurant, we had to go early because the lines get really long later in the morning through the rest of the day. Register for the rewards program at the desk and they will give you coupons for $5 off the buffet. We ate at Provence (spelling?) which was an Italian restaurant and the service was slow and the food average. We ate at Mon Ami Gabi and cannot recommend it. The food was extremely slow to arrive (1 hr) and undercooked. The medium steaks arrived rare and my pork porterhouse was raw in the center. The slots didn't seem at all loose. I won about $125 on the quarter machines and did much better over at Bally's. The wait for the Eiffel Tower view was hours long on the evening we tried to go up and we skipped it entirely. **Be wary of the kiosk halfway down to Bally's from the elevators...there are 2 elderly ladies there and we thought they worked for the hotel. They offered us maps and free comps, but we finally figured them out when they wanted to take us in a bus to another property to look at rooms there. Turns out it was an attempted timeshare kidnapping. I was smart enough to turn it down or we could have wasted hours just to get a coupon for free food. I cannot say enough how much I hate the diamond rewards holders who can skip in front of you at restaurants and all lines (check-in/check-out, etc). Hopefully, they have diamond reward lines in hell so they can go in ahead of me there too. In spite of all I have knocked the hotel for, the hotel is in a perfect position at the center of the strip and is really lovely to look at on the outside and downstairs in the casino/shop area. I would recommend to stay there at least once just to do it, but I would go elsewhere for later visits.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: JKobr
Reviews.Content: Last minute boys weekend in Vegas, at the mercy of the charter's availability. At first, reluctant about staying at the Paris afraid it might be too "romantic" for our home base, but not the case. Spent so little time in the room, where we stayed hardly mattered as long as it is clean and central, which Paris is. Check in was quick and easy. Room clean, big enough, by no means elegant or spectacular. No coffee maker, odd. Bathroom small, but does the job. Could have easily stayed next door at Bally's and saved more than a few bucks as the Paris room and hotel didn't offer anything that was exclusive. Morning coffee by the pool was relaxing. Pool large and nice but by no means spectacular or themed in any way. Breakfast buffet was amazing -- great food, great price, albeit a big lineup if you get down after 10am. Those in our party who gambled at Paris found tables more expensive then elsewhere. Staff out front was great at quickly getting us a taxi. Golfed TPC (beautiful, but pricey, at least you can say you played where the pros did) and Sienna (cheaper than TPC and found surrounding scenerary nicer, despite some homes close to the fairways in spots). Took in Monty Python's Spamalot at the Wynne. If a fan of Python, which we were, great show. J Peterman from Seinfeld fame played lead. All in all, great time, good location, will take my wife either there or Bellagio when we visit together.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: VacaDreamer
Reviews.Content: A convention brought me to Vegas June 23-28 and I booked my stay (through the convention) at Paris. Check-In: Arrived at the airport Sunday before noon. Line at the baggage claim for Harrah properties was 15 deep, so I skipped check-in and headed straight for the golf course. Ended up not checking in until 9pm and by then a non-smoking king was unavailable. No lines that time of night. Not a smoker, so they offered a night in the jr suite 815P instead (offered rest of the nights at $85 upgrade, but declined). I did request a rennovated room, if available, after the first night since I would have to repack and move. No problem - she even told me which room I would be moving to (26th floor). Apparently all the rooms above 25 have been rennovated. Rooms: Jr suites are very large (more square) with wet bar, couch, two chairs, coffee table, desk, armoire. Small hall/entry off the bedroom takes you to the large bathroom with separate jacuzzi tub, shower and double sinks and full-length mirror. Another door takes you into the toilet and bidet. Very large but decor was dated with blue carpet and floral bedspread. Bathroom looked rennovated and very clean. Rennovated room was naturally smaller, but loved the decor. White bedding, red throw, feather pillows, large red leather headboards, granite bathrooms and separate showers and tubs. Plasma TV and upholstered bench/couch at the end of the bed are nice touches. Cool item: ipod radios! Could listen/charge my ipod and even wake to my music on the alarm. Spa: Terrific deep tissue massage from Brian, but the facilities aren't that great. Small and not as luxurious as other spas. Robes were not that comfy and the waiting area/relaxation space was located right in with the front desk - too high traffic to really relax with a bottle of water. Again though, Brian was fab and worked out the knots. Restaurants: St. Louis cafe for breakfast was good, meal was hot and overpriced (as expected). Sports Bar, on the way to Bally's, was yummy and casual. Very good service too. Napolean's had nice dueling piano entertainment and comfy chairs. It's a cigar bar, so the air can get a bit thick, but nice to unwind after a day at the convention. Got in early for a quiet seat and enjoyed a cocktail. Gustav's casino bar was a good place to people watch, but the cocktails were not that great. Just not made right - maybe less experienced bartender? Best bet for casual eat/drink? The Tequila Bar at Bally's tucked in the back behind Indigo. Just awesome - strongest margarita of my life. Burrito as big as your head, super staff. Ended up eating dinner and spending some meet and greet at the bar (needed the extra time to finish the drink). Margarita was as much as the meal, but well worth it. The only downfall was the music. It would have been a real cantina if a little Mexican beat was heard, but all you could hear was the music from the four tops at Indigo. Just took away some ambiance. The gambling: getting pretty hard for a $5 blackjack player to find a table - even in the middle of the day. Had lots of luck on the $5 craps table. I don't play the slots. What's up with some of the scents in the casinos? Are they pumping in air frangrances? May sure seemed that way. This was a solo trip to Vegas, but as a regular to town, I knew how to get around and what would keep me busy. In town for a convention, so limited to the strip as I didn't get a car (which I normally always do). Overall good trip, good convention, comfortable and always felt safe (solo trip for gal in 30's). Let me know if anyone has specific ?'s. Happy to help.

Reviews.Title: “Great upgrade”
Reviews.Author: violet3violet
Reviews.Content: Because we had pre paid for our room for 3 nights but only managed to arrive for the last night (flight problems) the girl at check in took pity on us (thank you Jayna!) and put us in a suite which was great. Not sure it was worth the $1200 a night she said it was, but the bed was comfy and we had a view of the air balloon and the corner of the Bellagio fountains. Didn’t get a chance to check out the pool here as we had to leave first thing, but for location I think Paris is probably one of the best on the strip. Have to say when we checked out there was a mix up and I was inadvertently charged an extra $117 but realised quickly so they put everything right very promptly. 9/10

Reviews.Title: “Great value at Paris Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler786
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a Vegas hotel that's in a great location for a great value, then look no further. Paris Las Vegas is the hotel for you. I booked the hotel through the hotel's web site via an online promotion and got a great deal with coupons and 2 for 1 tickets at some of the hotel's attractions. Pros: 1) The overall value. For the price (under $100), the rooms are spacious with marble bathrooms and great amenities. The housekeeping staff was also very friendly and accomodating during my stay (I'm the type that always asks for extra towels, soaps, etc...). 2) Location, location, location. Paris is right across from the Bellagio and centrally located on the strip, so if you don't have a car or don't want to worry about parking, Paris is the right hotel for you. Also, to visit casinos that are a little farther out, the taxi system in Vegas is a good bet. 3) Le Village Buffet is hands down my favorite breakfast buffet in Las Vegas. The made-to-order crepes and French pastries alone are worth the price. I try to stay away from buffets in general, but Le Village Buffet is one that I cannot pass up. The only buffet that's significantly better in my opinion is the Wynn buffet. Cons: 1) Paris is one of the smaller mega-hotels on the strip, so the lobby/casino area can get a little crowded. Also, the front entrance/casino area can get really smoky. 2) Check-in can take a while depending on when you arrive at the hotel. We waited about 20-30 minutes to check-in during a summer weekday, which I thought was a little excessive. Nevertheless, the registration staff were friendly. Overall, if you're on a budget but still looking for a top-notch hotel in a great location, Paris Las Vegas is definitely the place to go!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - A vegas gem”
Reviews.Author: alphababyjames
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Paris having visited the casino on a previous visit to Las Vegas. The location is great - right in the centre of the Strip action and opposite the Bellagio. The theming is well carried out if a little 'Disney' but then that's vegas. Like all these super casino resorts the experience is a little impersonal - checking in is like checking in at an airport and all the housekeeping staff look at you blankly if you ask them anything. The standard rooms are, well, standard but very comfy and the bathrooms are very roomy with seperate shower and bath. The only let down were really thin and mean little pillows on the otherwise very sleep inducing beds. The faux parisian cafes are little more than cafeterias and the man behind the counter was VERY bossy about standing inline but the prices are resonable. The Village buffet is brilliant (one of the best in vegas and I should know!) and well worth more than one visit as you cannot possibly sample everything in one visit. I recommend the Paris if you want the Vegas themed experience. On my last visit it seemed as if Vegas was tiring of pastiche so you may need to hurry before they implode this one too!

Reviews.Title: “would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: dolly07
Reviews.Content: Spent June25-30th there. Booked through Harrah's.com. Asked for a room with view at check in, was given 1584 on 15th floor. Overlooks pool, tour Eiffel, and Bellagio fountain. Paris is next to Bally's, Planet Hollywood, Mall, facing Bellagio, and Caesar's Palace. And in the middle of the strip. Very nice room. We had to take most of our meals in the hotel due to time and kids waking up not waiting for restaurant options. Open buffet is a must try for $13 for breakfast, and $25 for dinner. Took the deuce for $5 /day, don't suggest it, we had to wait in a 104 degree heat, then decided to walk. Stayed last day at the Grand Canyon Best Western, what a difference after Paris. BW felt like a motel, yet was good for one night, and kids got to play bowling. Took helicopter ride over the GCanyon from the GCanyon airport. Used Pappillion company and dicount for AAA members that can only be used there. Flights available every 30mins. If you plan to go to GC, try booking El-Tovar at the south rim of the Canyon. If no availability try before you go by 4 days as people cancel 3 days before arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Hotel; Fabulous Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: jshw
Reviews.Content: We were in Las Vegas from June 28 - July 1, 2007. We travel to Las Vegas about 2 times a year and this was our first time at Paris Las Vegas. We booked a "king room" and since we arrived very late on Thursday night, were told they only had "2 queens". We took that room for the night and requested that we be moved to a king room the next day. They did move us but both rooms were drab and needed updating. The bedding was very worn and tired looking. We were not particularly impressed with Paris Las Vegas and will not stay there again. They do, however, have a fabulous restaurant - Eiffel Tower Restaurant. We had dinner there on Saturday night and it was wonderful! The staff, service, atmosphere, and especially the food, were exceptional. We will definitely dine there again.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymooning in Vegasat Paris”
Reviews.Author: Forchdog
Reviews.Content: I'll keep it short and simple. This hotel is all about appearance. Great from the outside but when you stay there you won't be too impressed unless you have never travelled. Restaurants are way over priced and the buffet was aweful. Mon Ami Gabi was decent and room service isn't cheap but was decent. I was not impressed by the pool and incredible expensive drinks. You would think with the people at your pool who are all paid guests you wouldn't try to rape them. The workers in the hotel are very nice but the management and registration (check-in/out) are a tad snotty. Room was ok but the biggest knock I had on this hotel was the lack of ambition to please its guests. I'm sorry but they need to make their guests feel important. P.S. the casino was little to be desired. They need to hand out maps so guests can be more interactive. Had more fun at the older casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: Atlanta_Travelers_dp
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at The Paris for 3 nights, as a surprise to my mother for her 75th birthday. Check in was very quick, which we appreciated. I tried to convince them to upgrade my parents' room since it was my mom's birthday, but all they offered us was an upgrade for an additional $60 per night (which we declined, since we weren't going to spend much time in the room to begin with). The mattress, pillows and overall bedding need to be upgraded, but overall it was a very comfortable hotel and I would definitely stay there again. Compared to the rates of everything else on the strip, this was a good value for the money, in a great location. Take note if you decide to have any packages shipped to the hotel for yourself. My office sent me a fed ex envelope, and upon check out I was billed $5.00 for "handling and storage" of the envelope. Total rip off, but after gambling for 4 days, it wasn't worth fighting a $5 charge.

Reviews.Title: “Snootier than it has a right to be”
Reviews.Author: williejoeshaver
Reviews.Content: Visited Las Vegas for the first time in my 33 years on a business trip and stayed at Paris based on a co-worker's recommendation. I have no idea how other nearby properties compare but my overall reaction is "blah." The interior and casino floor is a fake outdoors indoors complete with sky for ceiling and the "always dusk" lighting is fine for the casino but a little low for the shops, restaurants, etc. Downright laughable was the "Frenchification" of everything with signs such as "Le Car Rental" making the entire theme seem like a joke. With the exception of one waiter, all staff - from the reception desk to the concierge to the dealers and so on - were cold and standoffish at best to boorish at worst. I am no high roller by any means but this joint flunks when it comes to customer service. With the exception of Lettuce Entertain You chain Mon Ami Gabi, the restaurants on the property were mediocre at best in terms of food quality. Prices were typically high, from $10 for a stack of pancakes to $3 for a 20 oz bottle of soda to $5 fees on any ATM transactions. The room itself was well-kept but no more remarkable in its furnishings than any mid-grade Marriott property.

Reviews.Title: “Only Great Floors 25 and Up”
Reviews.Author: Paramourfa
Reviews.Content: This was my third visit to the Paris. My first two produced good memories so I felt confident that it would continue along the same lines. Here was my experience. I was greeted by standing in a long line waiting for a room. There were very few reservation agents open at 4:00 PM in the afternoon on a Sunday. My wife and I were finally assigned a room on the 10th floor. When we arrived at the room there were dirty dishes outside the door. We were hesitant to go in (thinking the room was still occupied),however we entered to find it presumably ready for occupancy. Here 's what we found inside the room: Little pieces of paper all over the floor. A credit card receipt on the floor A large dust ball on the wall over the bed A huge stain on the carpet (about 18" in diameter) Assorted little pieces of "litter" on the bathroom floor. Whoever was responsible for cleaning the room apparently did it with a blindfold. The room was really tired looking. I called housekeeping and was told a supervisor would be up to examine the room. After 15 minutes no one had arrived so I called management and spoke to a young ( by her voice) woman who after hearing our story immediately said she was moving us to a renovated room on the 25th floor. In a few minutes a bellman brought up the new room keys (cards) and we went up to a new room. It was really magnificent. New furniture, clean, a fabulous bed, and in fact the whole floor had a wonderful fresh feeling to it. (These rooms are meant for diamond club members) The moral of the story is basically don't expect much if you can't get a room on levels 25 and above. This hotel is badly in need of an entire renovation. (Look at the carpet on the way from the parking garage.) By the way--- after four nights I left Las Vegas for a side trip and returned to the Paris for one night. I was again assigned to the 25th floor and the room was perfect. A lovely room agent at the Paris from Birmingham, MIchigan helped secure a renovated room for our return visit. Forgive me for not remembering her name. If Paris management reads this review, please do something about the rest of your rooms.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: BonnieOntario
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris June 18-22. After reading some negative reviews we were a bit worried, but you know what ? it was a great hotel. We stayed in a corner room thanks to Jeremy (I think that was his name). We were given a room on the 6th floor originally (even had a coffee maker) over looked the pool, really no complaints but we had inquired about a corner room with a view or a renovated room and he gave us this room the next day, wow what a great room. (room 2398, awesome view, no coffee maker). We didn't eat at any of the restaruants at Paris, we were with a group and we all stayed at different hotels. Pool area was great, casino was good, drink service was very good and best of all casino was not smokey. Great location, we had breakfast at Balleys a couple of times, good price and good food. Had the buffet at Wynns a couple of times, very good (a bit pricey). Out of all the casino's we like Wynn's the best for variety of slots and drinks and service. We would stay at Paris again even if it wasn't a corner room with the awesome view. You really aren't in your room that much, and yes the decor is a bit tired but we've never been to Paris so maybe that is the real thing LOL. Oh yes we did visit Ellis Island and the food was really good, not your dress up restaurant and you did have to wait (40 minutes for us) I had the 4.99 steak and my husband had the 8.99 prime rib, it was scary for the prices but it was really good. (you do have to ask for the 4.99 steak dinner its not on the menu). Ellis Island is only a 5 to 7 minute walk from Balleys. Bonnie

Reviews.Title: “Good Mid Range Hotel for Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Wattamolla
Reviews.Content: Paris Hotel is in a great location and ask for an upgrade at the desk for a view over the pool and the Bellagio Fountains. The rooms are fine but the bed cover inen is very warn out and they could do with a revamp and they were in the process of doing it up last year but have sold it now and wont do anymore up for now. The pool was really dissapointing. Really loud music playing all the time and if you are enjoying the nightlife of vegas you kind of want to lay out and sleep by the pool but with the latest dance tracks playing that does prove a tad difficult. The Gambling area though was the highlight. It had a great atmosphere and a space for mnot so serious gamblers. the pit bosses to the dealers to the people playing were friendly and there was alot of high fiving and high energy. Other hotels that we had a flutter at really lacked the atmosphere that Paris had. Would recommend this hotel for location and resturants and space. Also doesnt take you half an hour to walk back from the pool like some of the massive megaresorts like MGM does. Dont go to cafe ile st louis - was the worst food I have ever had in the States and service to match.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: daboo2
Reviews.Content: I was in Las Vegas with a friend June 1 - 5/07 and we chose the hotel based on previous reviews. I just finished reading some negative reviews and they couldn't be more wrong. The staff were friendly upon checkin, elevators were very prompt and I loved the way there were many elevators and in different sections for different floors, therefore no long waits at all. Our room was extremely quite,very nice size, and a good size bathroom with nice toiletries as well. Wonderful restaurants, especially The Creperie, it was excellent and great prices too, one is definately enough for two to share, and at 6.95 each you can't go wrong. Excellent sandwich and bakery place as well as Mon Ami Gabi, very good. I am an extremely fussy traveller and was very pleased with everything at this hotel. If I did have any complaints it would be that the bedspreads seem like they have been overwashed one too many times therefore new ones would make things look much nicer. Stay at this hotel and you won't be disappointed, we weren't. Oh and another thing regarding the smoke in the Casinos, well it wasn't bad at all and I am a non smoker. I would advise that you not sit beside someone who smokes while at a machine gambling as then it would be unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific convention at the Paris”
Reviews.Author: flowy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paris Hotel as part of a convention. GREAT hotel --the convention area was very close to the rooms and breaks for lunch. The reception desk was wonderful. I had told them I was a woman traveling alone and wanted a room near the elevators on the conceirge level. I paid the extra $60 per night. It was absolutely worth it. Coffee and breakfast in the morning and a snack between 5-8 during the evening with a room overlooking the tower. Wonderful staff. Would absolutely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “saitified but can be more”
Reviews.Author: superbugs
Reviews.Content: stayed @ Paris for 3 nights. checked in late with a young blonde guy and got a nice strip view on the 20th Floor ($20 trick). it was my 2nd trip in LV and my friends' first. The room itself without counting the strip view was distressed. i only got the old room, it did really need a renovation. it was clean but dated. the bathroom was still nice. needed to change the carpet, the matress, pillows, and updated the furniture, old tv set. with the view (Bellagio fountain, strip, pool), it just broke even. I chose this hotel because of the very reasonable price with 3 people split it (only $400 each person with air and 3 nights from NY) I stayed @ MGM before and would not be able to stay at Pairs on my own due to its higher price compared to MGM. so i wanted a try. I liked its location, its food choice inside the premises. MGM was good but my problem was the overpriced restaurants. MGM has about 30 restaurants which will charge $50 for an entree or a food court but don't have anything in the mid range with good quaility (buffet and the 24 hrs cafe were all not for food enusiatics). with Paris, i knew the food quality would be better. The Le Village buffet was good, i had it twice for lunch ( with $5 off from coupon book when signed up the TR card). then it has a burger place or others. Drinks on gaming floor were excellence. it well worth the tips ( gave $2 each, well worth it). The only disappointment was not enough fun slots there compared to MGM or others. The slots choice was kind of boring. I hope Harrah's can improve it so i can have a "second home" in the future. Lastly, I will consider it for the next time but will also try others to fit my eat, play, comfort requirement.

Reviews.Title: “A bit tired, but ok”
Reviews.Author: nrsjulie
Reviews.Content: Stayed June 13-15. Check in was ok. Room was not ready until afternoon. Asked for adjoining rooms, and request was honored. When entering both rooms, housekeeping supervisor (a man) was "cleaning up" one of our rooms. I asked what/why he was there, as I was told that both rooms were "ready" and he said that he was just "cleaning up" whatever that meant. He did run the vacuum cleaner as I was leaving one room to go into our other room (next door). As I now check every bed for "uncleanliness" aka bedbugs and such, I found a fair amount of hair on the mattress pad of the room I was staying in, so I went next door, told the "supervisor" and asked for a clean mattress pad on the bed I was going to be sleeping in. The fitted sheet on one of my queen beds also had a noticable hole in it. He seemed ok with this request, came into my room after finishing with our other room, and proceeded to tear both beds (2 queen bed room) apart, completely removing all sheets. I knew that this would take awhile, and it did. A maid came into the room at one point, asked what was going on, and I told her that the sheets were being replaced. She said "I just cleaned this room" and the supervisor gave her a look, and he and another maid kept replacing the bed linen, top to bottom. As I was planning on unpacking and heading out to the strip, I was a bit put off, as I wanted to get in and out of the room quickly, but it took about 20 min. before my room was finally "done" being stripped and linens replaced. The room decor is tired looking, carpet did not look that clean. Bathroom is fine, clean enough for aged property. My brother's room key became demagnetized that night, as he had a magnetic money clip in his pocket next to his room key, so he had to have security come up at 4:00a.m to let him into his room. He did not want to wake me up to let him into his room, but the conversation outside my room woke me anyway. This hotel should either advise the customer that this is a possibility, or make up different type room keys. I heard other people comment on their room keys not working as I was walking thru the hotel at various times. I like this casino hotel for it's compactness--you don't have to hike far to the elevators, and it's easy access to the pool as well. I'm not into extreme cigarette smoke, so this hotel rated decently on that point as well. What I'd like to see is a completely NON SMOKING HOTEL CASINO. Wouldn't that be charming? With all the ongoing construction Vegas always seems to have going on, you'd think that one of these casino owners would come up with this novel approach for those of us that hate smelling like the bottom of a dirty ashtray everytime we walk thru a casino. . .

Reviews.Title: “PARIS HOTEL OF THE PAST?”
Reviews.Author: travelinformation
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Paris Hotel in Las Vegas for my husband and my wedding anniversary (annual trip) over Memorial Day weekend 2007. We have stayed at Paris numerous times as we travel to Las Vegas at a minimum of twice a year. We liked Paris Hotel for many reasons such as their central location on the strip and the ambiance of the hotel. With the recent takeover from Harrahs Entertainment, I feel that this wasn't a positive move but rather a big negative for the hotel. The management has now discontinued the mimes from walking the streets and casino and the bicycle riders entertaining the guests of the casino and hotel. Now onto the customer service--that is little to be desired. From the time you check into the hotel to the players club to the restaurants, all around the workers at this hotel and casino need to take classes in customer service 101. If you belong to their players club "connection card" and you are not a "diamond member" well you may as well stay at a different hotel because without being a "diamond member" you won't receive customer service, you'll wait in long lines for everything, will not receive a decent room, and will be treated as if you are a second class citizen. If you decide on eating their buffet you'll be asked if you're a "diamond member" and if you aren't you'll be asked to wait in the peasant line where you can wait like ourselves between 1 and 1 1/2 hours to be seated with countless people in the "diamond line" being seated before us. We were done with waiting in line for their mediocre buffet so we decided on eating at their Italian restaurant and of course the first thing out of the hosts mouth was "are you a diamond member". We responded "no" and he then asked if we had a "connection card" because if we didn't we can not dine their, that the restaurant is exclusively for "connection cardholders" only. C'mon who in the world does this hotel think they are? The Wynn, Bellagio, Venetian--I don't think so not even close. I have stayed at Wynn several times, Bellagio, Venetian and I can definitely say you get what you pay for. The rooms haven't seen much change in several years, aleast we haven't seen much upgrades in the rooms or amenities. Food quality has decreased from previous dining experiences with prices only rising. Paris is going downhill and rapidly. I can see Paris being an upscale Imperial Palace at best in a few years. Speaking to several Paris employees in various areas of the hotel and casino have agreed that the service is plummiting at this hotel since the Harrahs change. I really enjoyed staying at Paris years ago and since the recent managerial/ownership change am so disappointed in all aspects of this hotel. It's sad to see what once was such a lovely hotel crumble so quickly. My review on Paris isn't on the room quality alone, but rather the whole experience from customer service at check-in, players club, restaurants, shops, etc. For the money there are many better choices in Las Vegas without spending a fortune. For one, the Planet Hollywood Hotel next door to Paris is worth a try!

Reviews.Title: “Paris is a good value”
Reviews.Author: babs6987
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at Paris and it is one of the better places I've stayed at (and I've stayed at about 15 different hotels in LV.) You cannot beat the location being just across the street from Bellagio and Caesar's. The pool is unremarkable so if a great pool scene is what you want, look elsewhere. There is little shade around the pool so you need to keep moving to different spots to get the shade. Drinks at the pool are expensive. Supersize margarita's are $16 and service is spotty so you may need to just go to the bar to get your drinks. Paris is one of the less smoky casino's which is nice. Recommend Mon Ami Gabi for dinner - try to get one of the outside patio tables right on the strip. It's not as hot as you think since they have cold air blowing on you and misters. You also have a nice view of the Bellagio fountain while you eat. I also recommend Olives at Bellagio for dinner although it was very l loud on a friday night and you must make a reservation to get a table. Paris is a pretty compact hotel and casino so it's pretty easy to get from one end to the other fairly quickly. The boulevard has lots of shops and the bakery has great breakfast items - I wasn't that impressed with the creperie. Highly recommend if you aren't already, to join the total rewards program. My husband is a diamond card holder and we got 3 of our 5 nights comped and also free tickets to Jubilee.

Reviews.Title: “Nice low key Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Family
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at several different Vegas Hotels while meeting friends for brief trips. Paris seems to have come out as one of our favorite ones for combination of nice rooms, reasonable size, central location and reasonable price. You also can't beat the breakfast buffet there! When we stayed at other places in Vegas we walked all the way across the strip to get to the Paris and waited in line not to miss it. Go hungry and then plan on not eating again until dinner. Don't miss the crepe line. Other food places within the casino and shopping areas seemed fine too. I'm not a big gambler so I don't care about the casino area. I actually like that it is not overwhelming. The staff at the Paris have also been friendly and pretty easy to deal with on our two stays there. One morning I was wanting a quick cup of coffee before working out and did not want to get in the long Starbucks line or the pastry place line. The nice bartender near the elevator got me a cup even though I don't think she was technically open for business. Then she made sure I knew the quickest way to find my way over to the gym. All staff just seemed happy and helpful in little ways like that. By the way the gym is not bad. I have stayed at the Bellagio and their gym is nice too but they really get you on the price to work out each day. Paris charges something for several days, but it is much more reasonable for similar facilities. It was never too crowded to use the weights and find some sort of aerobic machine to get on. My friend and I had pedicures at the spa. It was my first and I can't compare, but she had a bad experience in getting badly cut by the rough filing tool they used on callouses. She was limping all over Vegas the next two days and it was getting infected. She went back to show them the problem and they did comp the service off of her hotel bill. It seemed an honest slip of the file, but it was painful for my friend and she went on antibiotics when she got home. We are meeting other friends in Vegas again and decided to stay at the Paris again instead of Caesars where some of them will be...less overwhelming and I think nicer staff and more consistent service and rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Stay”
Reviews.Author: PK6
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3-night stay at Paris Hotel on business. I had been through the hotel several times previously but had never stayed overnight. Have previously stayed at New York/New York, Mandalay Bay, The Venetian, Treasure Island, and MGM. While Mandalay Bay is still my favorite, Paris is a close 2nd now. Our conference was at Bally's, and it was a 3-minute INDOOR walk from our room to Bally's hotel as you wind through the restaurants and shops. Paris reminded me of NY/NY, except it's smaller and more intimate. It was so much easier to get around and less smokey. Upon arrival, there was just a 10-minute line to check in. They asked if we wanted to upgrade, but we just took the standard room for $125/night. The shops were fun to browse through, and all the restaurants we tried were great...service was much better than anything you'd find in the real Paris! We especially enjoyed the sports bar/burger shop just next to Bally's in the walkway. Our standard room on the 12th floor was very nice..spacious for 2 of us with a beautiful bathroom. Pool looked nice, but it was 100 degrees outside and I only ventured outside at night. Amazing that people actually live in that hot, dry climate! Had a good time seeing the hypnotist at Empire Theatre (behind Walgreens)...good value at $35 and an entertaining show. Listened to music at Caesar's and at Paris. Great all-girl rock and roll band at Paris...superb talent! Alcoholic drinks are very expensive...over $10 each. This is another Pepsi place...very hard to find a Diet Coke in Vegas for us Diet Coke fiends! Would highly recommend this hotel--great location, wonderful service, tasty food, good entertainment, and very nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marycheryl
Reviews.Content: There are several new hotels that have sprung up in the last five years and certainly, they are more attractive, more elaborate, and has more amenities than their older counterparts. Paris Hotel & Casino is a newer hotel compared to Mirage, Treasure Island and the likes. Almost or at the heart of the Vegas Strip, Paris Hotel & Casino is definitely a hotel to stay at. We were able to snag a prime room, thanks to my sister's friend's sister who works there (we did not know, it was so coincedental when we were checking in). First, when we got in she had to give us the room that we had reserved. She tried getting us a better room beforehand but they were fully booked. Within minutes of getting into our room, she called and said that she got us a prime room. Obviously the latter was bigger and had better amenities; however, I would say that for the price of the regular room, the regular room was more than ample. Clean rooms and public/common areas, large clean pool, excellent view and great location. I don't recall much about the restaurant there, but the only thing I can remember was we totally pigged out. We would definitely stay at Paris Hotel again in the future because of our good experience; however, we do feel we should also try out other hotels (for experience's sake).

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at the Paris”
Reviews.Author: seejanerun
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 6 nights at the Paris and was pleased overall with the experience. The rooms, while not large, were clean and comfortable. They have renovated recently so everything was in great repair. One very pleasant surprise was the appearance of an in-room coffee maker! For those who are Vegas veterans, you know that's almost impossible to find! The coffee makers only make one cup at a time, but it still beat having to go downstairs first thing in the morning. I also found the rooms to be quiet - no overhead thumping or TV sounds coming from the room beside me. A great spot for breakfast is the outdoor cafe by the pool. We never had a problem getting a table here - it really only got busy closer to lunch time. Downstairs, inside, was a different story. If you plan to bake in the sun, try to get your lounge chair to the side or in front of one of the arbours, or alternatively, along the half-wall in front of the cafe. These spots have misters that will help keep you cool! Room service was inconsistent - painfully slow the first time, exceptionally quick the next. I guess it depends on what's going on. We experienced decent drink service in the casino, and not being a big gambler, I was happy to find lots of penny slots. I even hit the jackpot on one - too bad I was only playing minimum bets. For the price ($139 a night), the Paris was a good deal - you can't beat the location and they have lots of offerings in terms of restaurants. The only thing that drove me nuts were the fake French accents!

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy We Stayed Here”
Reviews.Author: JeantheBean3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris from, June 6-June10, to celebrate our 10th Wedding Anniversary. We had originally considered staying at one of the cheaper hotels near by, but were very happy that we chose to stay here. We actually stayed in two rooms, because for our last night there we decided to upgrade to a small suite. Both of the rooms were newly renovated (red/black/grey decor). The bathrooms were huge with both shower and tub (our suite had a Jacuzzi tub). The beds were extremely comfortable and both of our rooms had large plasma TVs. We really enjoyed having the quaint street of shops and cafes downstairs. On several mornings we went downstairs to get tea and pastries and brougth it up to our room. We also really enjoyed the St. Louis cafe (the French Onion Soup and Le Parisenne sandwich was perfect). We also enjoyed the pool, the pool cafe, the casino, the nightly music in the casino bar - - everything. And, if you are celebrating a special occasion we highly recommend the The Eiffel Tower Restaurant. And, to top it all off, Paris is in a great location on the Strip. You can go either way and find lots of alternatives for shopping, food, etc. We had a great time and will definitely stay here our next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Paris / Ballys The Best In Town”
Reviews.Author: pattycakes212
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Paris Las Vegas for two nights comp and it was great. The room was not to big , but it was very comfortable. We check in at the airport and arrange for shuttle transportation there too. The room had views of the mountain, the sunset at night was so amazing, the pool area is small so go there early. The eatery are so good the village buffet was the best, a little high price but food was good. Next two nights was at Ballys at a rate of 59.00 per night and sunday we comp. I was a little nervous about Ballys because of the reviews it was getting ( bad reviews) but our room was the best!!!!! It was much bigger than the rooms at Paris and we had a view of the pool, which was very nice. Go to the Indigo lounge at Bally had a wondeful time, free entetainment, the clubs are great. The big kitcken Buffet was nice, had champamge brunch there. Overall our trip was Better Than WE Hope For. Harrah Rewards Program really does work. Vegas is the Best place to vacation or relax.The Anthony Cools show was good and it was comp, and Jubilee is wonderful. My husband and I had a better time at ballys. p.s. the Eiffel Tower experience was nice also.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely pink marble bath”
Reviews.Author: a9zn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris on Memorial Day wknd. The first thing we noticed is that the bathroom has got wall to wall pink marble. Additionally, it has got both shower & tub. The bathroom was very large, in my opinion. Location of the hotel is great. Walk to everything. The walk from hotel check in/out & the garage was a trip, had to walk through all the people waiting on the line for restaurants. Not sure what the architects/designers were thinking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice!”
Reviews.Author: pug13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris Las Vegas for 2 nights in early May. This was our second trip to Las Vegas. Since our first trip we knew we wanted to try out Paris. We loved the casino and atmosphere there. We are so glad we followed through. It was a wonderful stay. It took us a while to check in, as it appears they aren’t too welcoming of early check-ins so we had them store our luggage and went site seeing for a couple hours. We returned about 3pm and checked in, but had to wait another ½ hour or so for our room to be ready. No big deal, we were in vacation mode – no rush. We were offered an upgrade to a strip room view for an extra $45 per night but turned it down. We ended up with a corner room, 1049P, which we were incredibly happy with. We were glad we saved the money. It was a huge room with a large bath including a separate tub and shower. We could see some of the strip from where we were, but it was limited. We were very pleased. The room was clean and comfortable and the staff was friendly. We took advantage of the pool on Saturday and Sunday. It is a fairly small pool area compared to other hotels on the strip which have several small pools in different places. Paris just has one large pool. The area was nice though and the benches weren’t as packed in as other hotels. It was nice and relaxing and they played good music. We loved the atmosphere of Paris casino. We enjoyed a wonderful dinner on the patio at Mon Ami Gabi. It was worth every minute of the 2 hour wait. We had wonderful crepes also. Definitely save room for dessert there. Overall, we had a wonderful time at Paris and would return there again in a heartbeat. The location on the strip, the rooms and atmosphere are all well worth the price for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: TCP-GDI
Reviews.Content: We got a good rate by booking on their website, and found the rooms nice and clean. We requested an upgrade and got a room with a view of the pool and the Eiffel Tower. The room had 2 full-sze beds and was like any typical hotel room, the bathroom was nice, however, with a large shower and nice granite sinks. We didn't spend much time in the room so it was perfect for us. Great location on the Strip as well.

Reviews.Title: “Got what we expected. Good place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: Jennt
Reviews.Content: We had booked 2 rooms for 1nt here in mid-May, for our family of 5 (parents, 3kids 15,14,12yrs). Thanks to reading the reviews on here, I knew what to expect, and we got what we expected. Check-in was pretty quick - no big lines. I mentioned our request for either adjoining rooms, or rooms next to or opposite each other. This was greeted with a look of consternation from our check-in staff member. She looked in her system for a while and then asked if we were interested in upgrading to a suite for an extra $150.00. We said "no" so she kept looking for rooms for us. She finally found us 2rooms right next to each other on the 10th floor - a view of the carpark, but then that's what we'd paid for... The rooms were nicely decorated and quite spacious. The bathrooms were very large and had separate shower and bath. On the whole, we were quite happy. The one problem we had was that one room had very definitely had someone smoking in there - the room smelt very strongly of cleaning spray, and then when you'd been in the room for a few minutes you started noticing the smoke smell. It was pretty gross, but since we were only staying one night we decided not to complain - and our noses stopped noticing it so much after about 10mins in the room. We only ate breakfast here - at the bakery the next morning - and it was reasonable and tasty. We did pay for a trip up the Eiffel Tower for us all - definitely a "must"if you're staying there. We managed to be up there at about 11pm when the fountains started across the road - good view! All in all, as I said in the title of this review - we got what we expected from our stay and would choose to stay there again for the position and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: jdisney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris Las Vegas hotel from May 3rd-May 16th whilst we were in Vegas to get married. On arrival, all staff from the bellboys to reception were very friendly & helpful. We got to our room which was pleasant with a reasonably good view of the new Planet Hollywood hotel next door, and a corner view of the Bellagio fountains. Some family joined us 2 days later for the wedding, and were also staying in Paris. They checked into their rooms, and what a difference!! They had been given rooms on a newly renovated floor, and their rooms had plasma TV's, modern designs & were generally just very modern & much more comfy then our room. My husband & I decided it might be worth asking at reception if there were anymore of these rooms available, and I'm so glad we did! We explained to the reception clerk (Joseph) that we were in Vegas for 2 weeks (a very long time by Vegas standards!), and that were in Vegas to get married & have part of our honeymoon there and that we would really appreciate one of the newer rooms. We expected to be told that we could 'upgrade' for a fee, but no! After speaking with his manager, Joseph returned to advise that not only were we to get one of the newer rooms, he was also going to upgrade us to a premium room. This meant that we would have a dual aspect room - one window directly looking at the Bellagio fountains, with Caesars Palace to the right, and the other window looking out onto Ballys, The Flamingo, Mirage etc. We were given a superking bed, and the room was just superb - a hall area, seperate dressing room, HUGE bathroom, chaise lounge, plasma TV - it was fantastic. We asked how much this would cost us, and the response - it was all courtesy of the hotel with their compliments & best wishes for our wedding. Now, we hadnt gambled a single penny in Paris at this point, so they certainly didnt do us any favours because we were high rollers - quite the opposite! The rest of our trip was just perfect - the pool area is beautiful, and a complete suntrap. It gets quite busy at weekends, but we never had a problem getting a sunbed at any time of day. The pool bar is quite expensive, but this is what we expected anyway - most hotel pool bars anywhere we've been have been overpriced. They allowed you to take your own food & drink anyway, so you have the choice whether to pay their prices or not. We ate breakfast in the buffet restaurant a few times - GORGEOUS food, although you have to get there early to avoid the queues. We did go to Ballys a couple of mornings though when the queues in Paris were too big, and that was also good - we liked being able to walk into Ballys from Paris without having to go outside. The bakery & patisserie are also good. We only gambled once in Paris on the slots, and lost. We did find the casino a bit smoky & packed in compared to other hotels, but it didnt bother us as we didnt want to spend our trip in 1 hotel anyway, and spent most evenings going round to all of the different properties. We went up the Eiffel Tower which gives fantastic views of the Strip, and the whole property in general was very pretty. We found everything to be well organised & everyone very very friendly, from the cleaners to the concierge to the valet. It was always easy to get a Taxi if we needed as well which was good, especially in the 105 degree heat! We ordered room service one night as well and the food was lovely & very reasonable. We loved Vegas in general, and this was a repeat visit for me - last time I stayed in the Monte Carlo, and we also stayed there on this trip for 2 nights (we got married in the Monte Carlo), and Paris is in a different league. The Monte Carlo rooms are basic, tired & dated compared to Paris. There is also SO much construction work around the Monte Carlo that it made it impossible to get a good nights sleep, and we were on a high floor facing towards New York New York (away from the construction), and we could still hear it. The pool area has also been reduced in size due to the building works, and sitting out there was no different to sitting on a construction site in your bikini. But this is a review about Paris, and I cant recommend it highly enough. We would stay there again in a shot, and be more then confident that our stay would be fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Paris!”
Reviews.Author: nbkcoe4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Paris from May 17th through May 21st and could not have had a better time. On our first trip to Las Vegas two years ago our friends talked into staying at the Imperial Palace..what a dump...never again. Paris is an absolutely beautiful hotel. We had one of the largest rooms we have ever had the pleasure to stay in. We had a lovely view from one of our windows; partial view of the Bellagio, the balloon and the street. Really nice. The view from the other window was not so great; storage for pool furniture...oh well, you can't have everything. We had the same housekeeper everyday, she was very friendly, always had a smile on her face, spoke to us and made sure we had plenty of towels once she noticed we seemed to need extra. The casino was very pleasant and not smoky as some others seem to be. We had lunch our first day at Mon Ami Gabi which was absolutely fabulous. We dined outside overlooking the fountains of the Bellagio, what a great start to our vacation after being on an airplane all day. Also had dinner at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant..what a view!! The food was great but Mon Ami Gabi was better...and cheaper. Went to Napoleon's two evenings and really enjoyed the "dueling pianos"..lots of fun. Also highly recommend Emerl's New Orleans Fish House at MGM Grand and Olive's at the Bellagio. Took a helicopter tour of the Grand Canyon with Maverick Tours which we booked through the hotel. This was a fantastic experience! Paris had a very roomy, laid back feel. We really enjoyed this hotel and will certainly stay there again on our next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Paris was great as always”
Reviews.Author: wwhitehead30
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Paris on two other visits. It is as nice as we remembered it. We go to Las Vegas at least twice a year since my husband has conventions he attends, and we have stayed at lots of hotels -- Luxor, Wynn, Bellagio, Flamingo, Bally's, Paris, and the MIrage. The Wynn and Bellagio are our favorites, but sometimes, the price is more than we want to pay. We got a great rate at Paris, and the location is fantastic. We checked in and were given a corner room with a view of the Bellagio fountain. This may have been because our 5 month-old son was with us. You can check in at the airport while you wait for your luggage which I thought was much easier than waiting in line once you arrive at the hotel. The rooms at Paris are a bit worn, but they are well maintained. The pool is nice, but I like the pools at other hotels better. Maybe I just prefer a connection of smaller pools and landscaping rather than one giant pool. We try to eat at the Village Buffet every time we stay there or if we stay nearby. The food is excellent, especially breakfast. We also try to eat at Mon Ami Gabi which is one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas. This visit, we ate at Ah Sin which I found bland and unimpressive. We did have a fantastic view of the Bellagio fountains though. The spa is also nice, and I had a swedish massage. You have full use of the workout facilities, spa, hot tub, and sauna included with your service. I did want to add that we used a fantastic sitting service while we were there. We used Grandma Dotti's, and she sent the same nice lady every evening to care for our son. They were reasonably priced, dependable, and I thought our sitter provided excellent, experienced care for our son. We don't normally take our children with us, but we needed to this time. The concierge at Paris gave us the name of a sitting service, but they charged $45 an hour with a 4 hour minimum. $180 for babysitting? I thought that was crazy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Buzz”
Reviews.Author: tribesman_76
Reviews.Content: Came here on a January and loved it. First off, got the desk and they upgraded us to a suite. What more can you say. You could do cartwheels across the floor for 2 minutes and still not touch anything in the room. The jacuzzi was so relaxing after a long flight. If we had stayed in the room for the entire period, it would have been glorious. The brasserie was great- the food tastefully prepared. The staff were attentive and not overbearing. Very nice balance. Liked very much the creperie in the morning. Staff were chilled out and helpful. Casino was relaxing and the bar du sport had a great vibe to it. Location is great. You can walk nicely to the other big hotels, the Ballagio is across the street. And they had a lovely bistro...Mon Ami Gabi. Hats off to this place. Real French cooking and lovely attention to detail. A really good dining experience. Best hotel I stayed in in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Paris”
Reviews.Author: Gigglegrl01
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. When you walked in, the elevators to the hotel were on the left, easy to get to. And there are many elevators, so you're not stuck waiting for one. The room was great. There was 4 girls (including me).. 2 queen beds, and the bathroom was very roomy for all 4 girls to do makeup. We were provided with lots of towels. The view was great too. The pool was great as well. They had towels but you have to trade in your room key for it and id (if I remember), and the towels were not soft.. Jaccuzzi was nice, it was a walk from the pool but being private to the side was nice. Casino was nice. And the stores/restaurants were very very good. I especially enjoyed the buffet, so many foods to choose from. And don't forget the Eiffel Tower. You have to pay, but it is soo worth it. Great view of the strip, especially at night. Overall Paris was a great place to stay. I would definitely stay there again, but I would like to explore the other hotels too. This year I'm staying at MGM... :)

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay at Paris Las Vegas again!”
Reviews.Author: KathrynViau
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris Las Vegas from 5/10 to 5/15/07. When they lost the reservation 3 times before we got there, that should have warned us, but we stayed anyway. On Saturday, 5/13/07, my friend and I had spent the day sightseeing. We ate breakfast at the hotel - splitting a croissant and a danish. We then split a salad for lunch at Mandaley Bay. By 9pm, we were hungry and laughingly said, we were not splitting dinner. But, we ended up at Le Cafe at Paris both getting the turkey wrap. She got fries and I got the POTATO SALAD. I woke up at 4am Sunday with horrible food poisoning. It would not stop so we called the medical line. I ended up at the hospital with 3 bags of saline to try and rehydrate me. I called the hotel from the hospital as the security person said that they would send a cab to pick us up. From my hospital bed, Paris Las Vegas switched me to a number of people (most of them worked at Ballys as they do not have the switchboard down yet). Finally, the Front Desk Manager, who I think is named John, but I was seriously ill in the hospital, so I cannot be sure, and told me that (1) they would NOT send a cab, that it was not their problem and I had to deal with it; (2) if I wanted to stay an extra night (I was so depleted by then that I could barely move) they would charge me $79. I would say they were rude, but when you are lying in a hospital bed AND THEY PUT YOU THERE, I would call that CRUEL. Then, when I got back to the hotel barely able to walk through the lobby, they said we had to change rooms. HAD TO CHANGE ROOMS? I could barely walk! They called, they came to the door, and each time I told them I was too sick to move, I was out of there the next morning, and to please LEAVE ME ALONE. When we checked out the next morning, they raised the $79 rate for the last night to $103. The last knife in my side. I will be contacting the legal department of their corporation. DO NOT STAY THERE. You are not a "guest" to Paris Las Vegas. You are only $$$ coming in and they do not care at all about you.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: lefty0418
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel Friday to Saturday. The hotel allows for early check in. The downside of this is that there are fewer desk clerks, so you might have to wait in line. The hotel is in the middle of everything, so it is great if it's the first time you've stayed on the strip. The room was nice/average. We had a king sized bed with only two pillows. I called down to housekeeping to request more pillows and they were very quick in bringing them up. The view of the Bellagio fountains was very nice. My biggest complaint about this hotel (and they can't do anything about it) is that to get from the main desk to the hotel elevators, you need to wheel your luggage through a cobblestone area filled with people going to the casino, restaurants and shops. It is very awkward and I found it very unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Paris”
Reviews.Author: EdmontonMarc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paris for one week in March for a conference in Vegas. The location is great, a central part of the strip with the Bellagio across the street, and Bally’s and Planet Hollywood both next door. Also, the monorail line has a station at Bally’s which connects easily with the Paris. This made it really easy to get to the Convention Centre. The room I had was actually quite nice. The décor was nice, but understated. It felt kind of comfortable & calming. I had a room facing west, looking out over the Pool, the Eiffel Tower and the Bellagio. We could actually see the Bellagio Fountain Show from the window. The bathroom is very large, with a separate bathtub and shower -- lots of room for two people. The dining here was above average. Le Village buffet is kind of neat. Le Burger Brasserie wasn’t bad, but the bartenders there were hired more for their looks than for their service. For a quick breakfast or decent pastry, JJ’s fit the bill nicely. Mon Ami Gabi was my favorite restaurant by far, as I had several excellent meals here and they have a good selection of wine by the glass. The pool area was wonderful. It was really easy to get a couple of deck chairs close to the water on a Saturday afternoon, with a heated pool, beautiful people and large, slushy drinks. I’m a bit of a sucker for the fake-French décor, from the cobble-stone streets and store-fronts to the replica Opera Garnier, Arc de Triomphe and Hotel de Ville. They just got a lot of little things right. This is the 6th hotel I’ve stayed at on the Strip, and I’d have to rank my stay here as one of the top two.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Can't wait to stay again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hammy68
