Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel last week. Regular room was extremely clean, and well cleaned every day. The room was large, w/a couch, chair, king bed and plenty of room and bright airy decor. Bellagio and fountains could be seen from the room even without paying for an upgrade. Casino was lots of fun, bright and plenty large enough. It did seem to be smokier than other casinos though. Housekeeping staff, and all waitstaff, checkin/out staff were very friendly. All restaurants are SUPER! Crepes in the morning, or buffet...whatever you are craving. The Mon Ami Gabi was superb for lunch...sitting outside watching the fountains and people. Location, location, location...you cannot beat it. Central with easy access to anywhere you want to head off to. Overall great, quality place and highly recommended for anyone that wants to get away and have their own little fantasy!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: WesCat75
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Paris on our first trip to Las Vegas this April. The resort exceeded our expectations in several areas. 1. Check In & The Room. Check in and check out moved very swiftly. We were upgraded to a corner suite for free, although it did not have a view of the Bellagio. Still, the room was large and had two seating areas. The bathroom was coated in marble and very nice. The elevators were fast and the walk to the room (ours was at the end of the hall) was not bad at all. The furnishings were average for a hotel in this price range, bathroom excepted. 2. Food. The food at the hotel was excellent. We ate at the buffet for breakfast on several occasions and the food was phenomenal. The wait wasn't band, although we were eating early (8am) because it took a while to adjust to the time change. The "outdoor" cafe also had excellent food, as did the room service. Expensive though. 3. Pool. The pool area was very upscale. We were able to easily find a place to sit every time we went. The wait for drinks at the bar was very long however. Also, it's not a meat market, so it's better for couples. 4. Location. You can't beat the location: center of the strip, near Bally's, Ceasar's Palace, and the Bellagio. We walked almost everywhere. While the hotel was excellent, we will go elsewhere when we visit again. We didn't have much luck at the casino; the table games were OK but slots and video poker didn't seem to pay out very well. We gambled alot at Bill's across the street and had good luck there. The casino is pretty however. Also, as mentioned by other reviewers, we did come home with a rash from the beds. I think it was a mixture of the dry air (we're from the East Coast) and the heavily washed sheets. It didn't ruin our trip or anything but was kind of annoying. I think this would have happened at any hotel. Next time, we will probably stay at somewhere a little less upscale and focus more on gambling, drinking, and shows. We do recommend the Paris however to couples, romatics, etc. Also, check out Hugo's Steakhouse in the Four Queens on Fremont Street...excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, centrally located on the strip...but nothing spectacular.”
Reviews.Author: ParkSlopeBoy
Reviews.Content: I was attending TravelCom conference in Vegas (in April) and found a great deal at Paris. I have stayed at Paris before and I think they deliver a consistent service. I’m never disappointed by them, nor am I ever really blown away. It’s a really nice hotel located in the middle of the strip and they always have great deals. The rooms are nice and the bed are comfortable. They are not really themed in any way but hey, all rooms look the same when you turn off the lights right?! Check-in and Check-out was a breeze. The casino is small but a lot more fun than some of the neighboring hotels (I can’t stand the casino at Aladdin which always seems dead). If you stay at the Paris, you have to do the breakfast buffet there, which in my opinion is the best breakfast buffet in town. Overall, Paris is a good hotel and will turn out to be what you expect. It’s nothing spectacular and if you want some over the top Vegas experience, then you might want to try a different themed hotel. It’s centrally located and I have stayed at this hotel more than five times in the last year and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Hotel - nicest hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sunbum22
Reviews.Content: VIVA LAS VEGAS!!! Had a wonderful time in Vegas. Stayed at the Paris. Wonderful hotel - upgraded free of charge to a view of the Strip and of the Bellagio fountains....highly recommend it!!! The Paris is situated in the middle of the Strip which gave us great access to great restaurants and bars. As for a buffet, highly recommend the Rio Seafood Buffet - it was truly delicious. We never had the buffet in the Paris but if the line ups were an indication it must have been fabulous as well.

Reviews.Title: “Typical”
Reviews.Author: Rori74
Reviews.Content: Paris is okay, I’ve stayed here before and it is typical for Las Vegas. The rooms are clean and inviting. The staff could use a little customer service training.

Reviews.Title: “It's okay”
Reviews.Author: T.B.Patriot
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a convention. The hotel is very large with a lot of sparkles like other mega-hotels on the strip. The only reason I gave this rating is that for a this type of a hotel, lines and pillow were sub-standard. Maybe I wasn't happy that I got a smoking room when I requested a non-smoking room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our 30th! Cocktails, Poker, Nascar, and Reservoir Dogs”
Reviews.Author: bean8800
Reviews.Content: So, I'll try to cover a little of everything here: My husband and I were turning 30 and decided to invite a bunch of friends and family members to Vegas to celebrate with us. Considering that we had a wide range of people coming-ranging in ages from 22 to 72, with some people being downright crazy to some whose this would be their first time there- we thought Paris would be great. First of all, the location can't get any better- you are right across the street from the Bellagio Fountains. Next store you have Bally's, Alladin (soon to be Planet Hollywood), Ceasers, Bellagio, and also Bills Gambling Hall and Saloon (who can leave that out???). Second- Paris has a smaller, more intimate feel to it. Most of the people who were with us told us that they were so happy that we had picked Paris, since the MGM, Ceasers, and some of the other hotels were way too intimidating since they were so so big. Also, Paris has great little places to eat up and down the cobblestone walkway. You can get a crepe, a latte, or a beer. Perfect. Contrary to what I've read about this hotel, the staff were fantastic-from the concierge to the dealers. Maid service, front desk, & room Service was fantastic and I also got a fantastic massage in the spa. I am very very picky with my massages-especially the deep tissue massages- but this was the most deepest, most in-tune massage I ever had. I can honestly tell you that it kicked my ass. Ask for Victor if you enjoy very very deep tissue massages. It is worth every penny. Rooms- everyone who stayed at this hotel loved the rooms. I kinda thought I might have got upgraded since we had about 20 people come with us for our party and even had our big bash at Mon Ami Gabi their french bistro (more later) but apparently they don't upgrade anyone from what I am told. You can upgrade to the fountain view for $60 more per day, but no one in our group did that. Everyone loved the rooms, though--especially the large bathrooms which include a shower and a tub. Gambling- we didn't do too well our first 5 days but we did win over a $1000 on our last night. We were pleased to see that they started a new poker room recently so we did play a bit there, however, we really enjoyed playing at Bally's which is connected to Paris if you walk down the cobblestone street. They have a bunch of tables that were very friendly. We played 3/6 limit and no-limit while listening to live music playing the oldies all night. It was awesome. Big ol black band from the 60's rockin out--loved it. Would not stay at Bally's, but loved how our hotel was connected to it. Didn't do too well at Bellagio or Bills Gambling Hall, however, we enjoyed the old school decor of the Gambling Hall, and who can beat the 300 pound Elvis belting out Viva Las Vegas? Restaurants-We ate all over Las Vegas-from Mandalay Bay, Bellagio, Ceasers, and Paris- and have to say that our birthday dinner at Mon Ami Gabi (Paris) was the best. Although our dinner wasn't cheap- it was the best service and filet mignon I have ever had. They really really outdid themselves. I work in hospitality myself and was very pleased and impressed with the 5 waiters that simultaneously brought out our food. Lunch at Mon Ami Gabi wasn't as great, but the view outside the fountain show made it worth every cent. We also sat next to one of the crazy guys from Reservoir Dogs-kinda cool. Also, try to have a drink at the restaurant at the Eiffel Tower at night. The view alone is worth it. Also, one thing we didn't do until our last day was go to Le Burger. I thought it was just a sports bar, but this place rocks! Our bartender was so entertaining that I called everyone by the pool and told them to get down to Le Burger as this guy was throwing cherries about 10 feet in the air and catching them on plastic picks before throwing them into a mai tai. Apparently he is the 9th best bartender in the U.S. or something like that. He made me get up on the bar and pour 4 kamikazies at once for me and the family. He was very entertaining, humble, funny, and is not to be missed for a great lunch. Hubby did Richard Petty's Driving Experience (my gift for his bday) and he had the time of his life. You have to do this if you have a true Nascar fan on your hands. I booked this 3 months in advance and it was worth it ($400). I thought it might be cheesy, but no. My husband had the biggest grin on his face for days. He rode his own race car for 8 laps and it was awesome watching him. Beware-leave early-not a lot of cab drivers know how to get there and we barely made it. Did the rumjungle thing at Mandalay and it's fun, but I guess just not our scene. Good food though. Ghost bar is pretty fantastic. We went early (like 8pm) and there was no wait at all. There is hardly anyone there at this time, which was great for us. We had the bartender, tables, and view all to ourselves. Girls were free and guys were $25 to get in at that time. For those that like to shop, I heard that Ceasers and Alladin have the best stores. If you need a sudden Ferrari, they have a dealership in the lobby at the Wynn. Maybe next time. Anyhow, if this trip sounds like your cup o tea, then here are my recommendations: Day one Stay at Paris hotel Lunch at Le Burger Cocktails around 8pm at Eiffel Tower Restaurant Dinner at Mon Ami Gabi (try to eat outside-it's worth the wait) Dinner at Fix (Bellagio) is fun too. Day two Richard Petty's Driving Experience Poker at Bally's See baby Tigers at MGM (you can play with them for a fee) Cocktail at Ghost Bar 8pm Dinner at Golden Steer (off the strip) for a great steak and to sit in the oldest steakhouse in Vegas. Rat Pack used to hang out there and I'm sure the Mob still does. You'll see. Great fun, and there's a strip club next store for those of you who are interested. Anyhow, have fun. We sure as hell did.

Reviews.Title: “Paris is THE best”
Reviews.Author: Chelsee
Reviews.Content: My daughter and just returned from our second stay at Paris in the past year. We loved it the first time and loved it even more this second stay. Our room was on the 27th floor.....huge plasma tv and color scheme of the room was beautiful. View was great.. Casino is a perfect size and layed out very nicely. Had dinner at Mon Ami Gabi. Wonderful restaurant and service was terrific. Video poker machines were tight, but the same was also true for other casinos. Am counting the days til I can go back. Paris will definitely be our choice for the third time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Gilroygarlic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris for a two-day getaway in early April, 2007. The rooms were furnished with 2 queen size beds even though we prefer, and asked at the time of reservation, for a king size. The hotel wesite was clear, however, that room selection could not be guaranteed. On arrival, we could have upgraded for the king size rooms with a better view, for additional cost which we declined. There is so much to do that room location and bed selection is pretty low on our list of expectations sice you're not in the rooms much. The room was very clean but remember this is one of the mega-hotels and the walks to the rooms once on the floor can be a slight distance from the elevators. The self-parking area is a long, long ways from the hotel, check-in and the rooms. Drop you luggage at the front and valet the car if you don't like a long walk. The restaurants were very good but there were a lot of people in town, even in early April, and the wait can be a little long for some. The central location of the Paris on the Strip is excellent and you will have an easy walk to Bally's, the Bellagio, Ceasars and others. We would stay at the Paris again. If you are a Harrah's Total Rewards member, the rate is sometimes even reduced more or "comped" depending on your gambling play.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Liffey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris for three nights. The location is right in the heart of the 'mega resort' area and handy for visiting other hotels and walking the strip. On arrival, we were offered a choice of upgrades at a very good price. (Suites with jacuzzi etc) but we decided not to take it as our trip so short and although it was affordable for us, there are other things we'd rather spend our money on. After all, in Vegas how much time do you spend in your room? However, for others it might be something you'd want to do. The room we had was super. It was clean with excellent views of the strip, the city vista, the "Eiffel Tower" and Bellagio's dancing fountains, which we watched every evening. The view from above was far more spectacular than on the ground and to see it from one's own room was a real treat. I have to be critical of Room Service. That's not to say that when food arrived it wasn't good. It was. And the service was polite and very pleasant. However, when we dialled room service we often found that we were put on hold for a lengthy time and when we did order, there was a wait of about an hour before the food arrived. This was especially a problem in the mornings when all we wanted was tea or coffee first thing. There were no tea or coffee facilities in the room and like most normal people, we like to have a cup of tea or coffee in the mornings when we awake. To have to wait for an hour for a hot drink in the morning is a pain. We ended up having to get showered and dressed and go to the Casino to find somewhere to get a hot drink, which sort of distracts from the idea of being in a hotel and having easy mornings. The Paris should provide facilities in the room for hot drinks. It's also hard to get a simple hot drink in the hotel as the restaurants are set up for huge breakfasts. Sometimes guys, all we want is tea and toast!!!! The housekeeping service was hit and miss. Some days we had a bed turn-down and chocolates and on others they forget to replenish the toiletries. They also spilled rubbish from the bin on the floor and left it. I also stupidly left some chips on the bedside table which disappeared. I suppose that they assumed it was a tip, even though we'd left a tip in the envelope provided. Never mind! Checking in and out was smooth and easy and the Concierge service was excellent. Self parking is convenient. Like all big hotels it's is a long walk to get from one place to another but all in all, it's one of the most attractive hotels on the strip and a nice place to stay. They just need more staff on Room Service and some training for Housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris !!!”
Reviews.Author: MunchyMoo1
Reviews.Content: Just home from a trip to Vegas from the 6th April to the 13th April and all I can say is Go stay at the Paris Hotel it is great.!!! Paris is not as large as some of the other hotels but it makes up for it in style and location. Check in queues at some times of the day are quiet long but the staff are really helpful and try to deal with everyone as quickly as possible. Pool - nice size and gets lots of sun from about ten in the morning. Choose either left or right hand side of the tower leg for all day sun. Good points ; central location on the strip, decent size swiming pool, great views of the Bellagio fountains. Lovely and quiet rooms and the newly refurbished rooms have beds which are so soft you might have trouble getting out of them!!!. Could improve on pool services, getting a waitress so you can order a drink can be a little difficult on some days because the pool area can get really busy. But there are always plenty of clean towels and sunbeds as a plus point. The hotel is close to lots of shops as the Cesears Palace forum shops are diagonally opposite the hotel. The Bellagio shops and restaurants are across the road. Don't be put off by the Aladin/Planet Hollywood hotel next door which is being revamped you won't hear any noise from the building works in Paris. The shops inside theAladdin are still open until about eleven in the evenings and there are lots of good places to eat in the Miracle mile/passage way too. Go to a Cirque de Soliel show if you get a chance , I found if you go to the actual hotel hosting the show you get a really good deal. The discount ticket places are excellent for the slightly smaller shows rather than the big named ones I found. The new Cirque de Soliel "Love" production at the Mirage is based on the Beatles music and it was amazing. "Love" and the "KA" show at the MGM I found easier to get tickets for than Zumanity and O which were sold out for the whole week. Both Love and KA were totally different but as the Americans would say "Awesome" !! The Las Vegas Premium outlets north of the strip is a really nice outside shopping experience and there are great savings to be had. The $12 cab ride to get there was well worth it. Dualling pianos at New York New York were I think the best in Vegas but another fun one was at Harrahs. Go on the New York New York roller coaster at night - I'm a real whuss but went with some people I met from Washington and I'm so peased they talked me into going. Paris Hotel is ideal walking distance to all of the other casinos/hotels on the strip. Just remember to bring comortable shoes with you and carry water with you . All of the hotels are so big they look closer than they are when you start your walk to them - no need to go to the gym you'll get lots of exercise walking the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: travelcrazy5
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Paris from April 3rd until April 9th with my two teenaged daughters. I've stayed in 13 different hotels in Vegas in the past. (This was the 1st time with kids) Check in / check out was fine. They couldn't meet our requests for the first night due to late check in but fixed that the next day. Rooms are immaculate but smallish. Casino is smallish but fine. Restaurants are good. The Creperie and the pastry shop were great. The location is excellent. Pool has been renovated, is now open and was great- a bit barren compared to lush tropical pool areas like the Monte Carlo and the Tropicana etc. Customer service seems to be better at these Harrah's properties than at others. If you ask a staff member where something is (i.e. sports book, restaurant), they will generally take you there instead of pointing off into oblivion. 2 things only that I didn't care for: Total Rewards points that you earn at Harrah's casinos must be used within 6 months. If you live a long way from Vegas, that can be unrealistic. At the Race book, they made me buy my racing forms and then get the money back later and get drink vouchers from the betting cage. It used to be that in these hotels, if you were visibly gambling, drinks etc were promo. Things have sure changed. I think it may be the same situation in many other hotels now. All in all, I enjoyed this hotel and would recommend it in particular for special occasions.

Reviews.Title: “The right balance”
Reviews.Author: lucidboy
Reviews.Content: As we arrived from the airport by taxi, my girlfriend was silently hesitant about Las Vegas. Whilst she loved to gamble, she was a little put off by the initial view of the Strip. However, when we arrived at Paris, she was immediately at ease with the place, and so the rest followed. Despite horror stories about queuing at check in, we have no difficulties and the staff were helpful. We got a room facing the rear of the hotel as opposed to the Strip but this was not a problem for us. Room Service and breakfast at all hours was very handy and relatively quick considering when we chose to use it. Loved the casino area so when we were staying elsewhere, all roads led to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Paris, Las Vegas - great choice!”
Reviews.Author: lmturt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for a wedding the first weekend in April. After deliberating on which hotel to stay at we decided upon Paris. It was the perfect choice for us. We did not choose to upgrade our room for a view for $45 extra per night. Therefore, our room faced the parking lots, but it was a corner room so there was plenty of space and clean. The hotel has a great atmosphere. Not too big, but not too small. The casino and pool were nice. We ate in the cafe for breakfast and the food was good. We also picked up sandwiches and tasty salads at La Notre which was really good. The staff was pleasant and the concierge helped us to find a great restaurant and secure a reservation for 6 at prime time on a Saturday night at a great steakhouse called BOA over at the Caesar's forum shop area. The location is fantastic! Just across from the Bellagio and well within walking distance of many others. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice getaway to Paris Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: traveler75tx
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 3 nights at Paris. This was our 4th time to stay here. We love the location and the fact that the casino is a little smaller, so tends to be less crowded. We have also stayed at Bellagio a few times, but for us it's too big and too many people. When we stay at Paris, we always book directly through the hotel and we book a regular, non-view room. Then when we are checking in, we upgrade to a suite. We've actually never stayed in one of their regular rooms. The suite we had this time was 3125P and it was wonderful. It was right on the corner so we had 4 huge windows with lovely views of the fountains, pool area and strip. The upgrade was an extra $185 a night and well worth it. 2 bathrooms, huge living area, fridge, coffeemaker and turndown serice. We're not big gamblers, we mainly go to Vegas to lay by the pool and enjoy some good meals. The pool at Paris is nice. Not too big either. The wait staff at the pool is always very pleasant and happy to bring you a cocktail or lunch to your chair. We had dinner at Mon Ami Gabi one night. This was our second time to eat there, and it was very good again. I recommend waiting for a table on the patio. It's nice to enjoy the fountains across the street while enjoying your meal. We both had the filets and they were perfect. The staff here is also very nice and helpful. I hope this review helps in making your choice. We are going back in July and will stay at Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at Paris”
Reviews.Author: ronadebra
Reviews.Content: Arrived 4/1- checked in at airport. They did not have a P room or K bed with good view. Took a room w/2Q and clerk said good view/ When we got to room the 2q made the room crowded and the view was of rooftops. I went to the front desk and they changed it to a K bed with view of mts. Bed was just OK. Small pillows and toiletries so so. Room was clean. Had turn down service ea. nite with choc on pillow. Bathroom had separate shower. Size of room and BR were fine for us Loved ambiance of hotel lobby and pool was very nice. Garden type setting. Buffet for breakfast was nice too. (only had it first day) would definately return to hotel-especially we got a great rate

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: jfd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights for $109 rate. Was able to check in at 11am. The pool is open now but pretty ordinary for a Vegas pool. The room I had was in very good condition. Check in at the airport was not good as there were 20 people on line and just one person doing check ins, so I went to the hotel site to check in. Parking was pretty easy. I ate at the buffet at the breakfast price at 11am they switched to lunch menu. Food was good as always. They are still doing construction next door at Aladdin, the place is a mess. The sidewalk is closed and there is construction opposite Aladdin as well. There is also a new rental car facility just off Warm Springs road for all car rentals--you take a shuttle bus to get there. It takes a bit longer but it is very organized once you get there. The traffic around Vegas was hopeless during the day as well as the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay at Paris”
Reviews.Author: sueinmaryland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I met some friends for a long weekend stay at Paris. Due to early arrival, airport checkin was not yet available so we went directly to the hotel. They quickly stored our bags for us and gave us directions on finding out when our room was ready. We had booked a regular room, but I asked for a renovated one and we were given one happily. When we called for our bags they were brought within minutes. Our room was lovely, though the large new tv seemed to have a mind of it's own which was really more amusing than irritating. We found the facilities to be lovely, the staff to be very accomodating. We did not do much gambling, so really can't comment on that. All in all a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice but wish had known about pool”
Reviews.Author: nhplanner
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went a couple of weeks ago for 5 days. It happened that we hit town in the first days of a very warm spell. Paris is a nice enough hotel, but when we got to the room, there was a letter on the bed saying that the pool was closed for renovation and we could use Bally's pool. So, the Bally's pool area was wall-to-wall bodies. Not exactly what we thought we were getting when we made our reservations. I think we should have been notified in advance. We would not have stayed there if we had known.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed Paris”
Reviews.Author: uilaw91
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris in late March. This was the first trip to Vegas for my wife and I. Several people told us that we should try to stay in the middle of the strip for our first visit, and the Paris really is in the middle of everything. It was also just a short walk thru the attached Bally's casino to the monorail. We arrived at the hotel at about noon, and our room was ready. We decided against the upgrade charge for a room with a view of the Bellagio, which was good because the fountains were closed due to high winds anyway. As it turned out, our room did have a decent view of strip, and we could see the Bellagio, just not the fountain. The room was spacious and very clean, and all of the staff we spoke to were pleasant and courteous. The only down side to our stay was the lines for the restaurants, especially at prime meal times. I do have to say, however, that the buffet was well worth the wait. The food was excellent, and the desserts were out of this world. The crepe station at dinner was a nice, unexpected touch. We ate at the buffets at several other properties, and this was the best around. We ate breakfast at the cafe one morning, and found the food to be good, but overpriced. It would have been worth the extra wait for the buffet. Walking down the strip, we realized that there are LOTS of great choices of places to stay in Vegas, but we were very pleased with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at best”
Reviews.Author: chickity
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Paris 3/22/07 through 3/25/07 with a friend. We arrived later in the evening and because of this we were unable to get one of the newer, remodeled rooms as suggested by another reviewer. The room we stayed in was very plain (not especially Parisian in theme)...equal to the Riviera which isn't awful, but we paid nearly 500.00 for the two days. It was quiet, centrally located which was a plus, food was decent, restaurant lines reasonable but not much in the way of entertainment and the casino was pretty small compared to other casinos. There wasn't much to do inside of Paris itself. Overall, it lacked atmosphere. It was very themey as far as the lobby, restaurants and shops but the room itself left no indicator that you were staying at a Parisian themed hotel. The one off putting thing aside from the room was that there was a roach on the coffee table. Neither of panicked over this but it just kind of made me think I would probably choose to stay elsewhere next time. In fact, we went next door to the currently renovating Planet Hollywood/Aladdin where we ate and used the bar vs the one lounge in Paris. And as a note, when you go on the website and you attempt to view the room, you won't get much of an idea.....beware.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Las Vegas Review - March 21-26”
Reviews.Author: marleyJ
Reviews.Content: Feel Free to Ask Questions! I will try to cut the commentary and provide some answers that I was looking for before my trip. a little about me and my husband. i am 36, he is 50, we are professionals that travel to vegas 1-2 times per year and gamble on the gulf coast in between. in vegas we have stayed at Mirage, Caesar's, Flamingo and the Hilton and now Paris. AIRPORT ARRIVAL AND CHECK-IN: We checked in at the Paris airport check-in around 10:45pm, Wed. March 21. we booked a king smoking luxury room using comps. We walked out of hotel registration with a 2 queen bed, non-smoking luxury room, and a promise to switch tomorrow. The Premium upgrade quote was $45 a night. We ditched it, we would rather play that $250 at the tables, we moved on to get our baggage. Unfortunately, Not one of our checked bags made the trip with us. We headed for the Delta ‘we lost all your stuff’ office. Our bags were on a later flight arriving soon so we waited. We got our bags at 12:10am then headed for the taxi line. There were around 75 fares ahead of us in line. The line moved like lightning though, they have really gotten the ’herd em out of here’ thing down pat, we were pulling up to Paris at 12:45am. SO, two hours on the money after landing in Vegas, we arrived at Paris, not a great start, but at least we did HAVE our luggage, we headed to our ’not what we ordered room’ 14th floor, probably a grood view of the fountains but it was too late at night, and staring dead on at the hot air balloon. Not a newly renovated room but clean, not impressive, not so great mattress. SPECIFICS: Cab from airport to Paris - $12 plus tip. However, I met someone at Paris who came was charged $24 for a trip from the airport and only one person was riding… hmm. Not sure what happened there, but I did tell my cab driver to take us the quickest way, I don’t know if that made a difference or not. Premium room upgrade - $45 per night. The rooms: I read a lot of posts before going to Paris, and everybody sees the quality of Paris differently, here is my take. You get what you pay for, this is a good mid-range hotel. It is a Hilton (or a bit nicer than a Hilton) not a Ritz. For our purposes, it was lovely. It is a clean nice room to sleep in with an adequate bathroom that has a separate shower. I wasn’t that impressed with the view, I have been to Vegas enough to know what the strip looks like and so, for us, we were happy on day 2 to move to the 4th floor and get a room that had the king bed in it. Actually we like lower floors in Vegas, it is so much easier to run up to your room and back down, you don’t have to stop on other floors very often to let others on and off. We always ask for low floors and rooms close to the elevators. We had a view overlooking the pool, which I preferred to the strip view, they are building a new resort next door to Bellagio and if you are on the ’Aladdin’ side of the building your view will be of the construction site. Our second room was not renovated, however, I did see a renovated room. They are considerably nicer. Housekeeping and maintenance were wonderful. The room service was speedy and wonderful. We were very pleased with the service in the hotel. Room complaints: There was no coffee maker. Each morning I went downstairs and sat at the bar most convenient to the elevator and paid $2.50 times 2 for coffee, that was a hassle. I bought one cup at Le Notre for $5, and then decided to just buy it at the bar, the lines at Le Notre are long in the morning, and the bar coffee was actually very good. The casino: A great staff. We enjoyed Gustav’s bar for video poker, and did pretty well there. The machines paid off enough to keep us playing as long as we wanted to, the bloody marys were good and the bottled beer was cold. The sports book is decent, but the sports book at Bally’s is better. The walk to Bally’s really added to our trip, it is short and pleasant and provides you with a whole different casino and more browsing. DINING: Le Village Buffet breakfast is $13.99 per person, go around 10:30 in the morning, and it crosses over with lunch so you basically get lunch at a discount. But be ready to wait. We waited around 35 minutes. The food is very good for a buffet. Le Creperie - SO GOOD. You must try it. It really is just wonderful! J.J. Boulangerie - we bought a sandwich here, it was great! We also bought pastries, SO GOOD, don’t miss the cheese danish, and definitely don’t miss the gelato. Room Service - Pizza to die for! And Hubby liked the steak but did not care for the shrimp scampi, of course we are from the gulf coast, so shrimp scampi is a common dish for us and we have had some great ones, so I am not sure if his judgment that it wasn’t great is fair. There is a brand new restaurant called Le Burger Brasserie, it is styled like a sports bar and has a really nice ambiance. My hubby got a burger, it was ok. I got a salmon burger and it was fabulous! They offered lamb and veggie burgers as well, and the best part was we charged two burgers, an order of fries and numerous beers to our room, the tab that I signed was around $60 or so, and it came up as an $8 charge on our bill! I always charge everything to my hotel room. It is always good to test the system! Apparently they charged us for our first round of drinks, I did sign the final bill but for whatever reason it wasn’t put in, I saw the error on the long plane ride back and am figuring it is because the place is so new (only one week old) and still working the bugs out. In short, the food at Paris does NOT disappoint. Eating at off times is recommended. The lines at most of the restaurants were very long at typical meal times. For the most amazing cheap meal you have ever had, Go through Bally’s and exit at the door by the sports book, take a right and walk down Flamingo to the light, cross the street and take a right, two doors down is Ellis Island! Ellis Island: WOW! OH MY GOSH! We have found our new favorite Vegas restaurant. We ate lunch at around 2:30 on Friday at Ellis island, there was a short 10 minute wait, the food was unbelievable for the price, total tab was $14.00. We came back to our room and cancelled our steakhouse reservations. The $4.95 steak special is better than Outback, and the salad and green beans served with the steak are home-grown and fabulous. I have no clue how they do it, but we are hooked. The ambiance is what I would imagine Vegas may have been like a few decades ago, and the place was packed with locals. It is a blue-collar café with seriously good food and has to be one of Vegas’ best kept secrets! We ate there a second time on Saturday, 11am and waited about 30 minutes, the food was still fabulous! Ambiance at Paris Las Vegas: I loved this place! Vegas cheesy. It made it fun. The details are meticulous and the ceilings make it light and airy. A few tips: we walked about 10 minutes toward MGM and bought beer and a Styrofoam cooler for our room. We were headed for Walgreens but came upon a tourist trap souvenir shop that carried beer first. We paid $23 and change for an 18-pack of Miller Lite and a Styrofoam cooler. The store also offers all the standard tourist stuff if you want to load up on gifts on the cheap. An even better option: Go through Bally’s and exit at the door by the sports book, there is a grocery right across the street - 12-pack domestic cans - $11.99. Monorail: We didn’t even ride the monorail and here is why… we took a walk and ended up at MGM Grand. We grabbed a cab back and the cost was only $5.70. We realized that the monorail, based on a 10 trip pass would have run us around $8.50. It is overpriced. In my opinion, the only value is if you intend to move about the strip a lot, then the 3-day unlimited pass sold at $40 per person might be worth it, for us, no way.. We will cab it. In short, we were very impressed with Paris. we have stayed at casinos from the top down and for the money it is just great! We are not high rollers (we run $2K-$3K through the casino each day) and so places like Caesars or Wynn are out of the question for us as we just dont get the great treatment there that we get at places on the level of Paris. For us, Paris is perfect, it offers fair room prices and reasonable food prices and has an ambiance of luxury that you do not find at Harrahs or flamingo or bally's or others in that price category. we also love the location, you are just steps from so many other options if you desire. we are already planning to stay at paris when we go next time in the fall.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: jln315
Reviews.Content: We booked two nights at the Paris over St. Patrick's Day weekend. One of the more affordable hotels at the time - when we checked in they offered us an upgrade for $60/day which included a better room and use of the executive suite. Get the upgrade! We originally booked a "luxury" room and ended up one class better with a view of the Bellagio fountains and Eiffel Tower. The executive suite had breakfast every day until 12pm and was plentiful. It also had appetizers every day from 5pm - 8pm with liquor for only $4 per glass. For anyone who has been to Vegas before, you know that meals can cost you so this is a great deal. A couple of family members stayed across the street at the Bellagio and spent at least $100/day with the room and what they paid for breakfast. Would definitely stay at the Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected!”
Reviews.Author: TechWriterCor
Reviews.Content: I travel to Las Vegas often and have stayed at most of the hotels there, but this was my first stay at Paris. Check in and check out were a breeze. The first night I stayed with family in a room with two doubles and the second night I stayed in a king by myself. The rooms were much nicer than I expected. Since this is now a Harrah's property, I wasn't expecting anything special. The rooms are nicer than say, Bally's or the Las Vegas Hilton, but not quite as nice as Caesar's or the Wynn. I liked the room with two doubles better. It was a nice, cozy room. The room with the king bed was too generic hotel room feeling. We ate at the cafe for dinner and breakfast and the food was pretty good - the portions are huge! There were only a couple of things I didn't like about my stay. First, I really wanted to spend most of my time at the pool. When I booked the rooms, no one told me that the pool would be closed. No one said anything at check in either. We tried to go down to the pool and the elevator button wouldn't work for the pool level, so we stopped at the spa level to find out why we couldn't get to the pool. Come to find out, the pool was closed for renovation. It would have been nice if they would have told us that prior to our stay like any other decent hotel would. I had to walk like five miles to the pool at Bally's. The pool area there was ok, but it must have looked odd to people in both hotels/casinos to have people walking around with wet bathing suits. Also, Paris does not have good ventilation to get the smoke out of the casino. I am a non-smoker and can put up with smoking casinos, but this was awful. Not a good time if you don't smoke. I was surprised for being a newer casino that the ventilation was so bad. Overall, I think I would stay at Paris again if the rate was good. It's not one of my favorites, but it's not awful either. I just hope next time that the pool is open!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: VizziOne
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on their web site under HOT DEALS. I avg about 130.00 a night. I made different reservations for consecutive nights, for a room overlooking the strip.Great location stay here and eat breakfast at the Venetian. There is a steakhouse at Circus-Circus( I know Circus Circus is not that great of a place, but the steak house there is outstanding and a great deal not al a carte. Call for reservations, believe me, they turn away more people than they seat!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Paris”
Reviews.Author: yamashitala
Reviews.Content: The Paris hotel was great, I stayed there St. Patricks Day saturday and sunday. I got a great deal from a flyer they mailed me from my gaming there in June. The room was nice, a little small but still really nice. The huge flat screen tv in the room was really sweet though! Location was great right in the middle of everything and the gambling was really good. The club Risque was bumpin' when we got there Saturday, it was about 25 bucks to get in. The bar was okay, but nothing special. I would definitely stay here again for location and room quality.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but the rooms are nothing special”
Reviews.Author: ziggylu
Reviews.Content: Recently spent three nights at the Paris. We visit Las Vegas about once a year and this was our first time staying at this property. The location is great and public areas are very nice. The theme is carried out well without being overly kitchy. On past visits we've eaten here frequently which is why we decided to stay here this time. We don't care for buffet normally but at $12.99 the breakfast buffet is a good value...it's hard to sit down for breakfast anywhere in Las Vegas for that cost so one trip through the line to get a regular breakfast and it's still a good deal without gorging oneself. The crepe stand makes a good sweet crepe. We enjoy Mon Ami Gabi quite a bit and eat there every visit. Napoeon's is a nice place for a drink in the evening. The rooms themselves are average for this price range on the strip. NOthing spectacular. Our bed was uncomfortable but we were on the 8th floor so maybe it hadn' tbeen renovated yet. View of the parkling lot was nothing to get excited about. Didn't find out until we checked in that the pool was closed until the end of March. Bally's pool was avaiable to guests but we didn't feel like trekking over there and entertained ourselves in other ways. I'd stay here again if there were a good special. For a little less money Bally's offers a nice room adjacent to all the amenities at the Paris so I'd probably opt that otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Paris as always was Great!”
Reviews.Author: luvparislv
Reviews.Content: We checked in at the airport on March 9th and it took all of 3 minutes. The room we got was just as requested with a great view of Eiffel Tower and the Bellagio Fountain. This was our 3rd stay at Paris and with a comped room on Nascar weekend it was a great base of operation. We traveled with 2 children ages 16 and 12 and they both loved the hotel. Our room was on the 19th floor and had not yet been rennovated but it was clean and comfortable. Location for the strip is great. Food is good especially Mon Ami Gabi and the crepes located at the stand at the base of the elevator. Beds were comfortable and bathroom was nice with plenty of room. Separate tub and shower. Walls arer a little thin as we heard neighbors late night wen they came in. Overall I would rate this hotel as excellent. Casino has a light and airy feel to it and not smokey. Coctail service in the casino was excellent and best that I have observed on the strip.If you can get a reasonable rate don't hesitate to stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Pure luxury”
Reviews.Author: bostonwest
Reviews.Content: The rooms are pure luxury bed is fantastic – I have never slept in such comfort. The bathroom is HUGE and ALL marble - oh so rich even the hairdryer rocks. This place is all about treating you like royalty. The casino is small but the location could not be better. We asked for a room with a strip view, and we looked down at the fountain show at the Bellagio it was the best possible way to watch the show. Ladies if you love luxury this is your place and oh so romantic

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Paris Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: I_LOVE_VACATIONS58
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our son for a getaway in September 2007. Our son is in a w/c and the Paris Hotel was a great central place for him on the strip. We upgraded to a room with a view of the Strip, and the pool on the 3rd floor below.......it was gorgeous! Especially when it started to get dark and the lights came on and the fountains started their dance!! The room was very spacious, clean and the beds were comfortable! Since we upgraded to a strip view room it was $60/night, but we had access to the Rendevouz Lounge, which we could get in with our pass key. There was continental breakfast which, if you left hungry, that was your fault. Everything from bagels, croissants, yogurt, fresh fruit, smoked salmon, coffee, tea, juice. You could take bottles of water and pop back to your room. Again at 5pm there were appetizers (I guess if you eat late at night, this would hold you off). There was two "hot" entrees, shrimp, cheese, crackers, desserts, and alcoholic beverage as well. It would have cost us alot more to go out to eat. This was more than enough, and we didn't need to stand in line at the buffet to spend money to eat! We were very impressed with this. They always greeted us with "Bonjour". It was a nice little treat to our stay. Our son really needed a vacation. He had just finished his cancer treatments and found out the good news that it was all gone just before we came. We were celebrating. As for the hotel itself, it was very easy for him to get around. The cobblestone was a little bumpy for him, but he could manage. I love walking through the corridor adjoining Paris and Bally's. It is like a street in Paris. All in all, we certainly will be back to Paris. Just the right size hotel for me. Didn't win anything big, but that would have been a bonus if it happened. We will certainly return!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Times in Vegas and at Paris”
Reviews.Author: MB123
Reviews.Content: Spent a few days at Paris with my sister. Overall, I really enjoyed the hotel and would recommend it to others. We stayed in a remodeled room on the 26th floor which was a little small but still nicely decorated and clean (except for an unopened beer bottle under the nightstand). The area was quiet in the evening with no late night noise. The staff was very nice and we had no problems with anyone being rude. The hotel is centrally located and convenient. That is important when you start walking around! Paris is nice and the theme is not really overdone. However, it is not as luxurious as Bellagio or Wynn (I have stayed at both). But there is a price difference along with that. The shops are more reasonable at Paris so you can grab some coffee or a snack within a few minutes and be on your way. If you are looking for something more upscale - stay at Bellagio or Wynn. I also recommend those resorts for different reasons. We spent some time in the casino at Paris and I felt more comfortable in that one than the Wynn, Bellagio or Caesars. Might have something to do with the lower limits on the tables - I am not a big gambler. The dealers were pleasant and professional and it was easy to walk from table to table or the slot machines. The servers are also very good about getting you water or anything else you might want to drink. I never had to look too far for service. The buffet was just "okay" for the money. However, the cafe was excellent and we played Keno during lunch. Lots of fun. One disappointment was the champagne bar. It was my understanding that it provided "jazz" entertainment but I only saw people singing along with the dueling piano players. I had hoped for a sophisticated spot for drinks but it didn't work out. We liked that the hotel was connected to Bally's and we ate dinner one night at the Bally's Steakhouse. Excellent dinner but a little "old school" which was fine with us. The Tequila Bar is also a nice spot for happy hour and some light music by Rick Chavez. Also, we always have dinner at Smith & Wollensky Steakhouse when in Las Vegas. Yes, I realize that they are in other cities but it is good with a nice wine selection. We saw "O" and it was spectacular. Worth the money and you are completely entertained for two hours. I normally do not like shows but this one is good. We had dinner at "Olives" at Bellagio on the patio overlooking fountain. Excellent food and service. I wouldn't want to sit inside as the tables are very close together. House of Blues is good for a drink and entertainment. It helps that it is in Mandalay Bay which is a very large and open casino. You can take the monorail from Bally's down to MGM ($5) - walk across the street to the tram (free) that takes you to Mandalay Bay. Taxi ride is around $10. We also spent time at the Titanic Exhibition at Tropicana. It was fascinating. We then played craps at the Tropicana casino. It was the first time I had played and the dealers were very helpful and patient with us. We actually won! I think that casino gives you a taste of the old Vegas so enjoy it for what it is. Bottom line is that I think Paris is great for a group or friends. However, I would recommend Wynn or Bellagio for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: heywoodjablme
Reviews.Content: We arrived during NBA All Star Weekend. Airport Check In was great. However, the shuttle service the hotel uses was not very timely. We waited at the airport for 45 minutes waiting on the shuttle that takes you to numerous hotels before dropping you off at Paris and on the return trip we almost missed our flight because they were late. The hotel was not properly staffed for the amount of guests. We waited 30 minutes to get into a restaurant. The restaurant was only ¼ full, again not properly staffed. However the outdoor grill was outstanding. Our room had ripped sheets and towels during the entire stay. The maid made an attempt to clean the room but seldom vacuumed or wiped anything down. Do NOT waste your money on Club Risqué. They charged us $100.00 to enter the club (after waiting in line for 45 minutes). The club was completely empty and everything was roped off. You were ushered into the bar area and were relegated to that area. The restrooms were filthy. I would rather eat off a NY subway floor then use there restrooms. I tried contacting Rocky the club manager, but he never returned any calls. I contacted the front desk about the quality of the room, their reply was what would you like us to do? I will never waste my money there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent room, nice casino”
Reviews.Author: bb5555
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at the Paris for one night just to check it out, as I usually stay at Caesars. As soon as I got off the plane I checked in at the Airport, which was super fast and easy. You can check into any Harrah's property there - its in the baggage claim area. I do recommend that you double check your room type as I didn't, as I requested King smoking and received 2 doubles and non-smoking. The room was nice, but not what I reserved (a month ahead of time nonetheless) and I called the front desk and since it was Saturday they were sold out and didn't have any smoking rooms available. Not that big a deal, so I kept the room. The room was a decent size, a nice armoire with TV, desk, and a nice view overlooking the Eiffel tower and part of the strip. Bathroom was also OK, average size with a decent shower. I would say on par with a Sheraton or Hilton regular room. Room service was good and fast (under 30 mins). Staff was friendly. The casino is nice, however not that big compared to say Caesars or Harrah's. It has a nice Parisian feel and layout. I might be a bit biased as I hit a royal flush in the first hour I was at the casino for $2000. This made my trip and I ended up coming back home up, which is great. Paris has a central location on the strip, so its within walking distance to all the major central strip casinos. So the bottom line, the Paris rooms are decent, much better than say the Flamingo but not nearly as nice as Caesars.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: l3abboud
Reviews.Content: This is Great hotel!!!! Great Location! Great Rooms! Great Casino! Great Food!!!!! This is an excellent hotel!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Paris, would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Kosmo114
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Paris for one night in March. Wife and I always wanted to stay here. We are members of the hotels slot club so we frequently get free or discounted offers for hotel. We checked in early evening on weeknight. We must have timed it right, since their was hardly any line at counter. Hotel staff were very friendly. We mentioned this was our first stay at Paris and asked if any complimentary upgrades were available, or if we could have one of the newely remodeled rooms. We were given a great room on 29th floor facing the Paris Balloon, Bellagio fountains, and Eiffel tower. Room was very clean, belldesk had luggage up to room in a few minutes. Baths were nice all marble with seperate glass enclosed shower and tub. We ate at the Paris buffet for dinner (skip it) not worth the $53.00 we paid. Gambling was pretty good at property. Found lots of $10 dollar tables, and even won a little on the slots. Common areas of hotel were kept clean, and we never encountered any rude staff. Hotel Bakery / Sandwich shop was excellent we at Breakfast and lunch here. Wife loved the Chocolate Gelato, and I enjoyed the vanilla eclairs. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: DelawareBeachgirl
Reviews.Content: The accomodations at this hotel were very nice. With the lobby and shops decorated so nicely, we were hoping the rooms would be a little nicer...but they were clean. We were told by the hotel employee that booked the rooms to request an upgrade, and if it was available...they would do it at no extra charge. In researching travel to Las Vegas, most people tipped the desk clerk...which helped to get the upgrade. Upon check in, I stood with two $20 bills in my hand (just in case!), and when I requested an upgrade...she said it would be approximately $100 per room. I explained that the employee who booked the rooms (whom we personally know) said as long as the rooms were available, they could do it for no additional charge. ...still holding my cash on the counter. She said "we haven't done that in a coon's age" ....which I guess means in a very long time! The food was good, the gambling was ok...not as large a gambling area as we expected, and the hotel was very nice. If you are staying here, take time to get a sandwhich from the deli...they are fresh and wonderful! I would skip the restaurant with outdoor seating. The negative: We were awakened at 6 a.m. (after going to bed @ 2:30 a.m.) to banging. Continuous banging. I called the front desk and they sent someone to investigate. It sopped for about ten minutes, then started again. I kept calling until 7:30 a.m....and they finally told us they were doing construction in the hotel. I asked why they would allow them to start @ 6 a.m. and they said they were under contract to start at that time!!!! I explained we had only gone to bed a few hours before, so they asked if we would like a late checkout at no additional charge. I explained that we had late checkout as part of our reservation. They apologized and offered us $20 off of our room. Whoopee. Everything considered, we had a wonderful trip. ...and if the construction was not permitted to start @ 6 a.m., we would've had a wonderful last day in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: ndfan01
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Paris twice and under certain conditions (great deal, traveling with an infrequent LV visitor, none of my favorite haunts available) I'd return. PROS: Great Strip location for venturing out to other mega resort properties. It is very convenient to Bellagio, Caesars and Alladin, and other places are walking distance if you don't mind walking a ways. (I've hoofed it from Paris to MGM, Mirage/TI, and Venetian for example and I'm not in the greatest shape...) It is connected by the shopping area to Bally's which is kind of a depressing casino, but at least provides the gambler some variety as the Paris casino itself is pretty small. Another superlative for this resort is the food. Every place I've eaten there was good. Mon Ami Gabi, the Cafe, the Buffet, even room service and the fast food (crepe) place had tasty food. The Parisian theme is well-executed. It doesn't feel as cheesy as some of the other theme based hotels. There are some employees at Paris who are very nice, efficient and helpful. Particularly in the casino positions. The slot club people are very nice. Checking out through the casino guest desk was very pleasant. CONS: I had unpleasant experiences checking in on both occasions that I stayed. On the first occasion I had to wait almost 4 hours for my room to be available. 2 of the hours were after official check in. When I insisted upon speaking to a supervisor and getting in my room, I was downgraded from the superior room I reserved to a lesser room and they absolutely would not acknowledge the change or adjust the rate. On the second occasion I stayed there, I had reserved a 2Q bed room and a rollaway bed as two friends were joining me. We were not told until after we checked in that we couldn't have a rollaway in the room due to "fire ordinances." This was inconvenient and uncomfortable, and frankly we would have chosen a different hotel had we been told of this policy when I specifically requested the rollaway during the reservation process. The guy at the desk was really rude about it. He never smiled, made no conversation, and pretty much just treated us like we were checking into a women's prison. Then he failed to activate two of the three keys to top it off. Not a nice way to start the trip. Room Service was incompetent and unapologetic. A friend had ordered us a bottle of champagne for the room. We received a message to call room service to have it brought up. ( I learned later that we didn't receive the message until almost a day after the order had been called in) When I did call for it, they said they'd bring it but we had to stay in the room and wait. After waiting almost 2 hours, and calling 2 times for status still no show. When I called the third time the lady said, "we are really busy." This isn't a souffle here. Put our champagne and some glasses on a tray and bring it up. Our evening was wasted. We also visited the Champagne bar on the trip. The waitress there was nice but slow, clumsy, and frankly not very bright. She couldn't get our drink order right on 3 tries. We gave up on waiting for the appetizers we ordered after an hour. The valet yelled "Hey You" at my friend as she was leaving the area because he needed some information he forgot to ask for when he gave her the claimcheck for her car and luggage. The rooms are kind of small and unimpressive when compared to the competition on the strip, but there are some great views of the Bellagio fountains and the strip if you get lucky. Pool wasn't that great. The spa was pretty, and my massage was good, but I hated that they kept trying to push you to buy the overpriced products. They also somehow cancelled my massage reservation AFTER I checked in at the spa when one of my friends came in later and they needed to know the name on the room (mine) rather than hers. Then they asked her if she was having a massage, and when she said "no" they cancelled mine while I was sitting right there waiting for the therapist to call me. Just experienced a lot of dumb stuff like that throughout this stay. In short the hotel and wait staff is inexperienced and untrained to respond to common custumer service needs. This isn't a real impressive resort from the standpoint of an expensive hotel. On the other hand, for the occasional visitor who doesn't want to pay Bellagio or Wynn prices, the Pros make it a reasonable choice for a vacation destination. If you stay somewhere else in the vicinity, Paris is a great place to visit and eat.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhhhh Paris Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: giosomerdale
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our first trip to The Strip 2/17 thru 2/21. We fell in love with The Paris. Our room was awesome. We stayed in a corner room on the 29th floor with one window overlooking the mountains and the other the Bellagio and it's beautiful fountain show. Our room was spacious, very clean and the bed was very comfortable. The staff were most helpful and courteous. The Eiffel Tower Restaurant was a once in a lifetime experience for us -- it was quite expensive but well worth the $$$$ great view, food and ambiance. Must try the Le Crepere' located near the elevators great crepes very different than we ever had. The bands were great especially if your into dancing and just watching other people dancing. We did have some luck at the Casino but enjoyed gambling the most at Fremont Street (downtown old part of Las Vegas). I read many reviews of The Paris before we left and was a little skeptical but I can tell you we are going back to Vegas and will stay at the Paris again. I guess you can say to each their own but if you are like us and love to have a great time and stay in a 5 star hotel this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good location; reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: funsandiego
Reviews.Content: Great location. Good service and reasonably priced. We upgraded to a suite and it was very nice with 2 bathrooms, living room, dining room and sitting area off the master bedroom. Loved the brick walkways and sidewalk cafes. The lines at the eateries were long; food was below average. Staff was very nice and accommodating. Our room overlooked the Eiffel Tower and the Bellagio Fountains. Nice amenities in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Made my 21st even more special!”
Reviews.Author: Charley18
Reviews.Content: As Paris is one of my favourite cities I didn't have high expectations with this hotel. I was wrong not to. The rooms were spacious and clean with lovely views over the strip and the location was perfect for lazy days and shopping. The entertainment was good and the all the staff were pleasant and courteous. However, I was gobsmacked to see the patisseries and they were a blessing for those early morning hangovers. Overall, I cannot recommend this hotel enough, it was fantastic and I woudn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Paris was great.”
Reviews.Author: rush66
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paris over 2006-07 New Years Eve celebration. I wasn't sure if I would like staying there. In the past I had gone into the casino but never stayed there. The room was nice - nothing great about it but nothing to complain about either. The casino was fun (probably because I won $600 on the 1st night). The buffet was really good - a lot of choices. Location was perfect. I wouldn't have a problem staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Mid Range Hotel In Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PKM10
Reviews.Content: Having read reviews on this site, I was a bit leery about staying at Paris. However, our stay was fine. We used the airport check-in and found the staff to be very friendly and accommodating. Because we were checking out on a Saturday, we were given a room on a higher floor at no extra charge. Had a view of the Eiffel Tower and Bellagio fountains. The staff we encountered during our stay were friendly and helpful. We had none of the rude experiences some others have mentioned. Our room was nicely decorated - bed was firm (which we like) - pillows not so great but housekeeping brought us some extras very quickly upon our request. The only "black mark" was the shuttle from the airport. When we checked in at the airport, the hotel agent told us the hotel offers a special rate for guests with one of the shuttle services. They add the round trip charge to your hotel room - $14 per person for round trip. When we found the shuttle and boarded, I noticed the cost for anyone just walking up and boarding was $10.50 each. Apparently, the hotel adds a "little something" to the fare. I would recommend to just get your own transportation and avoid the hotel's "special deal."

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay in good location”
Reviews.Author: iloveolives
Reviews.Content: One night stop to see a show. As others have observed the entrance is completely dominated by the casino hall, check in is way in the corner so you have to navigate carefully. Room was huge. We didn't bother with upgrade so our view was of the car park but it was quiet. Two very comfy queen beds, huge luxurious bathroom.The location is excellent as it is half way along where all the action is. The Village buffet ( one of their many restaurants) is very popular and regarded as one of the best value places to eat. We had breakfast there and it was excellent. You have to line up but don't be put off as the line moves reasonably quickly and the food is worth it. ( We went one night to Monte Carlo buffet thinking the wait at Village wasn't worth and regretted it). There was a bit of noise coming fromt he service room used by housekeeping . We called and it stopped immediately! Very impressive facade amongst all the odd sights in Las Vegas. Overall an enjoyable stay and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised by Paris”
Reviews.Author: jbmWyoming
Reviews.Content: I was in Vegas with a group of friends on a girls trip. We got a great deal from a relative of one of the girls and that is why we chose Paris. I love the Bellagio so I was a little worried after reading some reviews, I can be picky about my room; bed comfort, pillows, etc. Check-in was fine. The lady was professional, not friendly or unfriendly. I took the $60 upgrade for the room which gave me a great view of the strip; Paris tower and Bellagio fountains across the street. My friend staying in my room lives in Asia so it was nice to sit in front of the window at the little table and have a cocktail and watch the fountain while we were getting ready. The upgrade also included access to their lounge that had breakfast and evening heavy hors d'oeuvres and wine (for a fee.) I would not do that again. Breakfast was OK, but only one night did we make it and they didn't let you take any food or drink out of the room. Wanted to munch on some wine and cheese and crackers in the room while we got ready and we literally had to sneak it out. Room was much nicer than expected. Beutiful bathroom with both stall shower and jacuzzi tub. Plenty of vanity space for two girls. Beds were very comfortable with duvets and fine pillows. Nicely decorated. No complaints. The casino itself is very loud (not just because of the slots) but because the floors are made out of "cobblestone" to represent to streets of Paris and sound just echos over them. Not a cozy place, but again fine in this price range. As everywhere, I think, some really nice dealers and some not. Played poker and the poker room management were very nice as were the dealers. Had never played poker in a casino and they were nice explaining their buy-in rules. Can be hard to find something to eat late night besides room service. Check-out a breeze. Cabs easy to get out front. Very good location on the strip and nice rooms. Like other actual casinos areas better. Would go again at a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Rashes From Paris”
Reviews.Author: heavyduty
Reviews.Content: Hello all. This is the first review i have ever written and it is not good my friends... I recently stayed at Paris las vegas from jan 14 thru jan 17. I was suppost to stay thru the 19th. Just some background on me, My wife and I have stayed in Vegas 8 times... Luxor, Stratosphere, horsshoe, venetian, golden nugget, bellagio, and this past august a parlor suite at Wynn. This is the first time i have ever complained to the hotel management. We checked in on the 14th at about 9 am. We decided to go cheap this time and just pay for a regular room. At the front desk, I asked if they had any upgrades available for a fountain view. The woman informed me it would be 60 per night for that. I already know the drill with vegas... If you want something you have to grease the wheels if you know what i mean. I asked for a high floor and slipped her a 20.. Low and behold, we got a "P" corner room on the 24th floor with a great view of the fountains. No extra cost... So back to the hotel.. It was nice enough, not like wynn or bellagio, but we already knew that and werent expecting that much... As the days passed, my wife and i started getting progressively more itchy and i started breaking out on my chest... my wife on her legs.... As the 3rd night came we got back to the hotel at about midnight... As my wife lay in bed, she was complaining of an itchy feeling. She got up, and both her hips were red, she had bumps on her legs,chest, and back. My chest also wasn't looking good. Before this I thought it was just the dry weather, because we're from hawaii, we weren't used to it. I knew now it was from the bedding/furniture. I called to the front desk manager, who sent an EMS guy up. They switched us rooms to a calais suite at 1am... When we got there, we were initially excited... HEY, ITS A SUITE... We took a shower, and were getting ready to go to bed. My wife undid the covers and noticed there were hairs and yellow stains on the pillows. I couldn't believe it. My wife wanted to stay and tough it out, But I had enough... I went back down to the front desk and tolde them we wanted to check out immediately... The manager couldn't even believe his hotel was like that. I called the venetian, they had a room ready and waiting for us when we got there. The Rooms are NIGHT AND DAY... The regular room at the venetian was better than the calais suite at paris... The only thing i was really interested in was a clean bed. I never slept so well that night.... Overall, the Customer service was nice enough, but the paris seems older than hotels twice its age... Harrahs has got to take care of there properties. I wrote a complaint today to harrahs because we go to vegas so often, i couldn't believe the experience i had... I stayed at the horseshoe about 3 years back, and AT LEAST THEY HAD CLEAN SHEETS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - but beds are like rocks”
Reviews.Author: sewaterman
Reviews.Content: Big Vegas Hotel with great decor, attractive rooms and friendly staff - but beds that desperately need replacing. Reception were wonderful - had no Strip view rooms free when we arrived at 6.00 pm, but offered us one by 7.30pm, told us how to check our bags till then & waived the upgrade charge. Really nice non smoking room which looked out on the Eiffel Tower & big blue Montgolfier balloon - nicely furnished, very clean - but a bed that resembled a slab of concrete.... Nice French bakery downstairs for fresh rolls & coffee at breakfast if you're not buffet people, attractive "cobbled streets" and Parisian decor - very pleasant place to stay. Casino - like all the others in Vegas - stil allows smoking. Amazing today and really gross near some of the slot machines -surprising the unions aren't doing something to protect their workers health. Would we go back - sure - hopefully after they replace the beds with new & comfotable ones....

Reviews.Title: “FUn in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: johnbj
Reviews.Content: Wonderful check in and out through Diamond Rewards Membership. Staff was courteous and helpful in all venues through out the hotel. Restaurants on site were delightful. Rooms need an upgrade. Carpets are worn and need replacing. Bedspreads have lost luster and color. Pillows were flat and uncomfortable. The room was clean and neat, but looks tired out .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Paris Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: lobots75
Reviews.Content: A few friends and I recently stayed at the Paris during the beginning of January. Check-in was prompt and the lady at the front desk was very nice and informative about shows going on in the area. We proceeded to our newly renovated room and were delightfully surprised to find a Huge flat screen T.V. to watch the morning playoff football game. The rooms were also very nicely decorated and offered some very nice views. The casino is huge with towering ceilings that are painted like the sky and it also has shops and restaurants that make you feel like you are really in France. The casino offers many games and tables and is also connected to Bally's if you want to wander around. The Paris is also centrally located and within close walking distance of many other popular strip hotels. Check out was more than easy. All we had to do is fill out a little card and drop it in a box with the keys and they faxed us the bill. Absolutely no lines!! We had a great time in Vegas and would highly recommend staying at the Paris hotel!

Reviews.Title: “It was a great stay”
Reviews.Author: markvon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Paris Jan 2-6, 2007. When we checked in we requested a King smoking room and none were ready yet. They held our bags and we checked back an hour later. We were given 472P. It was a large parlor room. Smoking rooms always make me nervous but this room was very clean with no bad smells. We didn't request a view but we could see part of the fountains from our room. The breakfast buffet was excellent and one day it was comped which was nice. The only negative thing I have to say is that sometimes the hallway was littered with room service trays that didn't seem to get picked up in a timely manner. We usually went down the hall to Bally's to gamble where the atmosphere was more lively. Every dealer and bartender there were great. The free entertainment was a Motown band and we enjoyed them very much. I really enjoyed the buffet at Bally's. The food was very good for the price. I would not recommend Bally's steakhouse. Our steaks weren't prepared correctly. I ordered medium rare and it came out medium well and tasted like charcoal. For half the cost go to the buffet. They serve steak, lamb, prime rib and crablegs.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time, and will be back soon!”
Reviews.Author: gillforgan
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed at The Paris for a quick 2- night stop on our way to the BCS Championship Game January 6-8. We only wished we had more time to stay longer!! I have visited Las Vegas multiple times in the last 10 years and this visit to the Paris may have been the best yet. Everything was great, the friendly and prompt check in, the newly refurbished room with HUGE TV, helpful staff at every turn, and of course the fun atmosphere to gamble. The dealers were very helpful and friendly to those that were not regular gamblers and with everyone dressed in either Ohio State or Florida colors, the staff as a whole were always willing to feed into the atmosphere of the weekend leading up to the game. Possibly the most important thing of all, the Paris's location made for a perfect "home base" to work from when we wanted to explore the rest of the strip. We did not need to go too far to see all that you want to see because of its central location. With all the places to see and explore, we still found ourselves back at the Paris to do our relaxing and high rolling. Finally, the food was also top notch. I have been to the actual Paris France and I must say that I was happy to discover that the baguettes and croissants specifically were as tasty and fresh as the ones I experienced when I was there for real. It really tied everything in and made for a realistic Paris experience. I highly recommend the Paris as the place to stay while in Las Vegas and I will definitely be back soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Casino and Location”
Reviews.Author: MonthlyTraveler
Reviews.Content: Many rooms (including ours) were newly renovated in late 2006, including new flatscreen TVs, new beds, new decor, etc. Very comfy and the staff was extremely friendly. We were in the elevator with a hotel employee who was asking us about our thoughts about the room; we chatted for the elevator ride and later returned to the room to find a fresh fruit basket. The casino was spacious and had a nice atmosphere with it's Paris landscape and sky-ceiling. The coffee shop had great atmosphere and food; same for the nicer restaurant, and the crepe stand was great for savory lunch and dessert crepes. And the location is mid-strip, with plenty a variety of hotels within a block's walk.

Reviews.Title: “great time, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: islandboyBermuda
Reviews.Content: 4 guys stayed at the Paris in early Janaury and we had a great time. The hotel is in the best location on the strip and the staff was very friendly and helpful. We liked the new 42" tv sets in our room and the casino was large and offered many tables. We only stayed 2 nights but would certainly return to Vegas and the Paris Hotel. Other reviews had mentioned construction noise but we didn't hear a thing or see any construction going on. The rooms looked wonderful and "fresh". Highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: sydneytraveller63
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location on the strip...right in the middle. Once you start to walk around Vegas and find how long it actually takes to walk anywhere, over all the walkways etc, Paris is in a great location. We werent into the slot machines but found the hotel to be very tastefully decorated. Our room was by far the nicest on our trip. Big, big marble bathroom with a separate shower!! We found the restuarants crowded on the weekend and as there was no breakfast included in the price, it was the most expensive meal of the day!! The staff were all very helpful and at $89 for four and $129 on the weekend nights it really was hard to beat!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Kolly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple stayed at Paris for 4 nights from Jan 1st to Jan 5th 2007.
