From the minute we arrived, the service was outstanding and the atmosphere was beautiful. Check in was a breeze...no long waits like many of the other hotels. Because we read the reviews we knew to ask for a renovated room and a view of the mountains. We were told be that they didn't have anything like that available for the first night but that they could move us the next day, so we agreed and went to our room. Even though this was not a renovated room, it was perfectly fine and not worn out at all (this was in some of the reviews we read), and we didn't even notice any construction at all. Believe me, I am VERY picky when it comes to hotel rooms and I thought it was great. The next day we called about our new room and we were told that all we had to do was wait until the light on our phone in the room lit up and our room would be ready. Later that afternoon we came back to our room to find the message light on the phone lit and we called the front desk. We then called the bell desk and they picked up the keys, came to our room (less than 5 min) and took our bags to the new room! It was so easy! We were pleasantly surprised to find that we had been upgraded to a suite with a spectacular view on the 20th floor at no charge! We could even watch the fountain show at Bellagio! Overall we absolutely loved Paris hotel and would definitely stay there again....and you can't beat the location! We stayed and Luxor and Excalibur before and we found those hotels to be too far away from all the good restaurants and entertainment. As for other recommendations....it is worth every penny to see Cirque de Sole's 'O'...the most amazing show we've ever seen. If you decide to go to Paris, you will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Attitude Adjustments Needed”
Reviews.Author: churchmouse
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay at Paris. Overall, it was a nice experience, but the staff could use attitude adjustments. They make you feel as though you are more of a bother rather than a guest. Our room was nice enough, but the housekeeping staff woke us up before 9:00am every morning by yelling to/at each other in the halls, our beverage glasses were never changed and I had to hunt them down for a plastic bag for the ice bucket. I don't mean to sound uppity, but when you're paying that kind of money, you expect a little more. We found the food at the Village buffet to be above average, but we did wait for 40min in line for lunch (10:50 am to 11:30am). I've come to the conclusion , after traveling to Vegas twice a year for the last five years that they are always crowded and really don't need your business, the staff's attitude at Paris reflects that.

Reviews.Title: “Major Allergies”
Reviews.Author: imazz
Reviews.Content: My family and I had major allergies from the rooms. Lots of dust. I would say it's a relatively small room. Not so good of service and the hotel doesn't really have brand name stores. Most of the stores are made my Paris and they just stock some no name items. I would suggest going to Bellagio for a little bit more money. Oh, on the bright side with Paris, you can watch the Fountains of Bellagio every night and I would consider it a pretty good location!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Rooms, Great Location, Cute & Quaint Casion/Shops”
Reviews.Author: PaBlue
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paris Hotel on Dec. 28, 2006. I did not enjoy my overnight visit. The location is GREAT! The casino/shop atmosphere captures the essence of Paris. However, I did not like the fact that the hotel set-up was not separate from casino. We had to walk through the casino to get to the registration lobby, etc. In addition, the rooms were extremely in poor condition. My room and the hallway leading to the room was a mere upgrade from the Courtyard Marriot. The bed was extremely hard, the linen was dingy, the bathroom had one sink and the cabinets were chipped. Prior to staying at the Paris hotel, I stayed at the Venetian for a few days. Paris DOES NOT in any way shape or form compare to the Venetian. For the same price that I book the Paris hotel [standard room with two double beds], I received a suite at the Venetian with great décor and a fabulous bathroom with double sinks, a separate room for the toilet, and a vanity. If you can get a cheap room at the Paris or if Location is your #1 priority, stay at the Paris. Otherwise, I simply would not stay at the Paris again. I suggest going to another hotel…. Simply put, if you have high standards Paris will not make you happy. I'm norally stay at Courtyard Marriot or comparable hotels during business travel, etc. However, I expect much more from a trip to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Paris not so fab”
Reviews.Author: TTVancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris over the holidays. We enjoyed the whole "Paris" concept - the lobby is beautiful - the shopping area is quaint and charming. Found the rooms to be nice but nothing amazing. Unfortunately we arrived late in the evening and were told they had nothing but "no view" rooms and a handicapped washroom left. The woman said there would just be extra bars in the shower. No offer made by the hotel to move us after the first night and in hindsight I should have insisted. At first it seemed like not a big deal until using the shower which had one of those long snaky pseudo shower heads with a real lack of water pressurethat you had to precariously balance to have a normal shower. We made do. The other disappointment was that the pool was unavailable due to resurfacing which was one of the reasons we booked here ( year round pool supposedly unavailable until spring?) the other being the excellent "on the strip location". Also, in spite of the mediocre reviews this hotel receives it is busy!!!! By the time we arrived there were no rooms with two beds or regular washrooms left. We never went to the buffet because the wait was 2-3 hours long 24-7. Same for the cafe. You can barely make your way through the walkway to the exit due to the crowds milling about and waiting for the buffet. There is a real lack of quick cheap food here and we spent most of our time foraging for food in other hotels. We did have fun in the casino - managed to score a free drink. This place is fine if you're not a picky person and you want to be close to all the action on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great views; pricey spa”
Reviews.Author: Eblana
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in April 2006, with a friend (shared a twin room) for three nights. The decor was fairly bland but perfectly nice. The bathroom was wonderfully OTT with marble, and had a power shower plus ample basins for two girls! We paid to upgrade to a room with a view of the dancing waters and Eifel Tower, and this was well worth it. Also, we were glad we made the decision on arrival at the check-in to pay for access to the all-you-can eat breakfast/snack room guests' buffet (the check-in 'hall' is well worth a photo - it's quite astonishingly rococo/Versailles kitsch). This guests' buffet room was not a zany or excitingly themed space, but allowed us to consume big breakfasts (though things were a little too sugary for my tastes) and big late afternoon feed-ups, and this was all included. So we had plenty of time to spend our money more entertainingly in the casinos and shops (the Desert Passage shops at the Aladin were my favourite for actual purchasing; the Caesar's shops were most fun for browsing). The casino floor at Paris is cute because it's a mock up of the city (with fake 'bridge' and struts of the Eifel Tower). We thought the spa prices were a bit too much for what didn't sound terribly exciting (as treatments go...). The Arch de Triomphe (outside) is amusingly scaled, and overall, the fact that I can mentally revisit the hotel and relive the holiday every time I watch 'Paris' glittering in the credits for 'CSI' is a big bonus! The food in the restaurants surrounding the casino floor was of the big portions/bland variety, but in general, anything involving chips was good. The room service burgers and chips we ordered one evening were very good quality and actually arrived hot. Beds were very comfortable, and there was a good number of well-sized towels. We didn't spend a lot of time in the room, but the picture window that formed one wall (the front) made it feel very special.

Reviews.Title: “Merci, Paris!”
Reviews.Author: OhioChowhound
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Paris for 2 nights over the Christmas holiday. The hotel was completely packed, but we had great service and I really liked the room. Check-in was very easy, no long lines, and we were given a room on the 32nd floor with a nice view of the mountains. We got there at 9:00 am and were given a room. We were in one of the older rooms, but I thought it was very nice and didn't seem worn out. The bathrooms were very pretty, with pink marble tile and a shower and tub. The bed was very comfortable. We didn't hear any noise, but I'm not sure if they were doing construction during the holiday. The gym was not too impressive for the $25 fee to use it, but we got $10 off that fee from the hotel website. It had all the amenities a gym needs, but it was not like a fancy health club or luxury spa. It served the purpose, though. The casino is small, but I preferred it to the other huge ones. I would recommend the Bellagio buffet over Paris, but Le Notre bakery at Paris had wonderful French pastries for breakfast. Overall, we had a very good experience and I liked the theme, decor, and service at this hotel. Great location and the prices are pretty good if you book from their website.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: glyndab
Reviews.Content: I've read mixed reviews about this hotel and was nervous prior to our going out there because of the notes about construction, but we had no problems at all. We asked for a renovated room and were given one on the 25th floor- the only issue was that with late check in (about 11pm) there were no king beds left, so we had two queens, but they were willing to move us the next day if we wanted. There is construction going on - but I could hear it from outside, sounded like whistles and horns blowing. The walls are no more thin than any other hotel and the hotel respected our do not disturb sign in the morning. We ate at the cafe a couple of times and drank at the round bar with a great bartender Tony. He was awesome with our large group of friends who hung out there for a couple of hours before hitting the nightlife. We also hit the piano bar but it was really really smokey and most of us stood outside to avoid the smoke. The spa was great - I had a massage and pedicure there and although it was expensive it was one of the better masssages I've had. Everything had 18 percent gratiuty tacked on though - a bit annoying. We didn't eat at any of the nicer restauarants in the hotel -some of our group did eat at Tao which had fabulous sushi and also Red Square which was good - but had really snooty wait staff. All in all a great trip,I had not stayed there before and was comparing it to the Bellagio and The Hotel at Mandalay Bay which are amazing hotels. But Paris is a nice hotel for the price and we had no problems with rude staff - everyone from check-in to the tables was great to us. I'd recommend staying - just ask for a renovated room and you'll avoid the construction.

Reviews.Title: “50th in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: lovevegasvancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris for my 50th birthday. Just like one of the other reviews says, I was rather alarmed at the bad reviews it had been recieving over the last months. I actually arrived with printouts of the costs of other hotels figuring we would change if it turned out as bad as it was sounding. Boy were we surprised. It was wonderful. We did end up paying the extra $60.00 per night to get a view room and use of the concierge room on the 31st floor. Our room was on the 19th floor over looking the tower, pool and the Bellagio water show. The bed turned out to be one of the most comfortable that we have ever had at a hotel. This surprised me because uncomfortable beds were one of the major complaints in other reviews. I asked for extra pillows and they were delivered to us in less than ten minutes. We didn't hear one sound from the renovations although we had a very loud cowboy yahooing in the room next to us! All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful especial in the concierge room. Unfortunately the pool was closed due to some maintenance. We would have liked to have been able to sit at poolside to enjoy some of the suns rays. It was a fabulous week weather wise although a bit chilly to have taken an actual dip in the pool. The casino was only really smokey on our last night (a Thursday). But I have to admit it was just as bad when we strolled through the Bellagio's casino the same night. The Mirage's casino was smokey too so it has to go with the territory. We don't smoke so we really notice it. The casino was nice if a tad small. The one note I must make is that the week of Dec 10 -16th is not a slow week anymore in Vegas. This was our fourth visit in four years and I swear there were more crowds than ever! Even the buses were filled to the brim with people. The only thing I might suggest to ask for a room without a connecting door to another room. The sound of the people in the next room only seemed to come from this door area. We didn't hear a thing from anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “A true Paris nightmare”
Reviews.Author: ScottCRNA
Reviews.Content: If you are planning on staying at Paris, you may want to think twice. During my 3 night 4 day stay, I encountered paper thin walls, construction that was not to begin until 1000 am which began at 0615 am, & maintenance workers who knocked on my door early in the morning all 4 days even though the "do not disturb" sign was displayed to ask me if my drain was clogged even though I never reported the latter. I checked in at the airport & was told to go to the "key card" only line when I arrived at Paris only to find that the line was seven people deep & witnessing the check-in personnel not offer their assistance when their lines were nearly empty. After placing my order for dinner at one of the Paris restaurants, the waiter informed me that "one of the cooks had not shown up for work" & the meal would be significantly delayed. Don't waste your money on the Paris buffet, it was horrific!

Reviews.Title: “Love Paris!”
Reviews.Author: georgia4
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at Paris last week and loved it! Had originally booked online at Harrahs site for $99/night, several weeks later the rate was $89/night and was given this rate after calling Paris. Requested a Strip view on a higher floor when booking, our room was 19th floor, queen beds, overlooked the pool, great view of South Strip and Bellagio fountains. Room was very clean, bedspreads a little dated but clean, didn't hear banging doors or people in the hall. Entire hotel was spotless, good customer service, did airport check-in so can't comment on that hotel staff. Breakfast twice at the buffet,($13.99/person), great choice of food, good service. Dinner at Mon Ami Gabi, again great service, good steaks. Overall, had a great time and would stay at Paris again. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the negative reviews fool you”
Reviews.Author: travelingoften
Reviews.Content: I had to write this review. Before going to the Paris Hotel in Vegas I of course came to this website to look at the reviews. At first I thought that I had made a mistake by picking this hotel to stay. After reading the negative reviews I was very fearful and leary. I must say from the moment we arrived which was at 10:30 in the morning they were ready to please. Since we had requested a King size bed it wasn't ready but they did offer us a double then we could switch the next day. We decided to wait and check in at 3 or 4 as they stated. We went to check in our bags and was greated with "Thank you for staying at Paris". We hung out in the hotel and gambled a while and contrary to the reviews did quite well on the slots. We hit the streets and came back to find that our room was ready but then they offered an upgrade for 60.00 per day. We decided not to do so yet I did ask for a view not of the roof top of the garage as the past reviews had stated that was thier findings. She looked at the room list and then stated if we wait 5 mins I could get a room on the 6th floor with a nice view, room 611, but the maid was in there now. We took our keys and ventured up. Again the service was given with smiles. Yes the maid was just fininshing up and the view was good. We had the Tower, pool, part of the strip hotels and mountains. It was great and not at an extra cost. The rooms aren't as plush but you must remember they are duplicating Paris, France. If you have ever been over there you would find it to be the same. There was construction but we never heard or saw it. Now upon check in I did ask about it and stated that we didn't want to be near those floors. She stated that it was, I believe, on the 25 thru the 30 floor. We were there 12-10-07 to 12-14-07. We ate, gambled, drank in the hotel with no problems. The ladies were on the gambling floor with our drinks quickly and often with always something kind to say. When we requested our luggage and to replace a broken hair dryer all were done within literally 10 minutes. The bathrooms are nice not as large as the other hotels but hey did you go to Vegas to stand in a large shower? If so don't come here and go to the Venetian or Ceasars. The shower was nice, clean and hot. There was a regular bath tub next to it and the shower was all glass. I just hope that your stay will be enjoyed as ours was.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a group”
Reviews.Author: LessWorkMoreTravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned our wedding at Paris Las Vegas in May 2006. We booked a suite and also 3 luxury rooms for family members. This was our third trip to Vegas but first stay at Paris. The Chapel there and its staff are wonderful--if you're thinking of getting married in Vegas, I highly recommend Paris. The standard rooms were very nice, nothing exceptional about them, but for the price they are a very good deal. We booked a Le Mans Suite, which was great. They are quite large and have a very large bathroom with a separate shower and large soaking tub. If you want to upgrade, this is a great choice. Paris is great for a group of people because it has nice rooms that are affordable and a very good location on the strip. The pool area is OK--though if you want to stay at the pool all day, definitely rent a villa, it's worth it. The casino is on the small side, and they do not have a great selection of restaurants compared to the other casinos. We ate at Mon Ami Gabi while there and found both the food and service lacking. But it is a great jumping off point for the rest of Strip and provides a quieter and smaller meeting location than some of the other places on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Just a few more comments on construction”
Reviews.Author: AZTravelJunkie
Reviews.Content: Just returned yesterday from a week-long trip to the Paris Las Vegas and wanted to add a few more notes on the construction. They're apparently working on floors 25-29 right now, so if you are offered a room on the floor directly above or below the construction zone, you may want to ask for something else immediately. They have water outages at certain times that you'll need to be aware of, and even though the construction isn't supposed to start until 10:00 in the morning, a lot of the people I traveled with had construction noise starting at 6:30 every morning. I originally had a room on the 30th floor and woke up to no hot water (others on the floor had it), but the hotel staff was very helpful in moving me to another room. I've stayed at the Paris on other occasions in the past and have always enjoyed it - just be aware of a few hiccups right now if you're headed there.

Reviews.Title: “Smoky, drab and under construction”
Reviews.Author: jmmj99
Reviews.Content: Smoky, smoky, smoky...beware of fake non-smoking rooms! I booked a room at Paris Las Vegas for Nov. 26-28 2006. I paid extra and booked a "premium" room and requested a view of the Bellagio fountains. I called the hotel and confirmed my reservation. The agent put a request in for a NS king room with a view of the fountains. The agent was very nice and helpful over the phone. She said that the higher floors had a nice view of the fountains and their "eiffel tower." When we checked in the agent was very grumpy and unhelpful. I reminded her that we paid for a premium view, I asked for a view of the fountains. She told me she had no idea what the different views were. She also informed me that construction is taking place on the higher floors and that floor 12 was the highest we could go without hearing the noise. When we went up to our room we were completly underwhelmed. The "view" was of the hotel's very blah pool and a little bit of the middle of the eiffel tower. The room was very dark, drab and worn. This non-smoking room smelt like an ashtray. I started sneezing immediately. (the casino is also one of the smokiest smelling) The room would have been fine if it was $69 a night but not $179! Luckily a supervisor gave us a refund without any trouble. We called the Bellagio and got a rate only slightly more expensive than what we were going to pay at Paris. We headed across the street and WOW, there is no comparison. The staff was friendly and helpful, the room was beautiful, spacious, and we had quite the view of the fountains!

Reviews.Title: “Construction warning”
Reviews.Author: Scootoir
Reviews.Content: Our Thanksgiving stay at Paris Las Vegas was cut short due to illness but the hotel and Dollar car rental did all we asked to accommodate changes. That said please be advised that the hotel was undergoing construction this week (11/20/06) to refurbish some rooms. Perhaps that accounts for the very low rate we were offered. We started with a room on the 30th floor overlooking the Bellagio but when we walked in were welcomed by the industrial sound of window cleaning which would start again the next day at 7:00 a.m. Construction on rooms on floors 25-30 would start at 10am and if needed they would move you to a new room while you were out. We had no notification when booking or checking in (at the airport) and only found this out when we saw the letters on the desk in the room. Called the desk and were given a room on 14th floor overlooking the Eiffel Tower and pool with no construction or window cleaning planned but the water would be off for a couple hours on Wednesday. Do ask about construction if you are booking soon. Our room looked like it needed the bedspreads replaced and the armoire repaired. Two of three drawers were broken. Bathroom was very nice, lots of storage but the Luxor towers offer soaking tubs while the Paris had a pretty standard bathtub. They need to add more Parisian style tubs to maintain the theme and really be a luxury resort. Separate marble shower was nice. Room service was prompt. The pool looked wonderful for lap swimming but not much shade around it. Place was clean, food good, valet parking efficient. Airport check-in is handy.

Reviews.Title: “The Real Deal”
Reviews.Author: WildBoys
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris Hotel from the 16th of November to the 20th. Here is my account: Location - Cannot beat the location. In the middle of the strip. You can walk to any hotel or get a cab quickly. Check in - We booked a standard room and asked to overlook the Bellagio Water Show. As they did not have a Premier room available they gave us a large suite one night and then a Premier room the next night. All at no extra charge. You cannot complain about that. Casino - Very smokey compared to other casinos. Bring enough clothes to avoid smelling of smoke all day. Now, to my only real issue with the Paris. The dealers. Without a doubt if you play a card game, especially blackjack they will do everything they can to put you off when you are winning. From incesent talking to the pit boss sitting next to you talking. It is not a relaxed place to gamble. Sports Book - If you are a soccer fan the Harrahs properties do not have Fox Sports World. With the amount of European people in Vegas, this is a mistake not to have this. Buffett - By far and away the best buffett on the strip!!! Maid Service - Very Good Rooms - Standard rooms are the usual size and of nice quality. Clean and comfortable. Room Service - Quick and an OK choice of foods. Spa - Typical Vegas. Expensive!!! Overall. Good hotel, great location, great food. Avoid the smoey casino and walk accross the street to Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “High end, poor service”
Reviews.Author: BACJS
Reviews.Content: We found check in was incredibly slow, staff were impatient and unfriendly. Our room overlooked a roof-top, however; it was okay as it was very quiet at night. Not that we slept much! The room was adequate, bathroom nice, toilet paper like sandpaper . This was our first time to Vegas and we were concerned enough to book a high end hotel. We will not do this again. The gambling tables were espensive, not a $5.00 blackjack table to be found. Free drinks were slow to come around. I would pick a hotel that is cheaper. We took the Deuce bus down to Freemont Street and gambled at the Queens hotel, we had a lot of fun down there and felt quite safe. I wouldn't stay on Freemont Street, but certainly would spend the day there. The hotel is vast and has some shops, nice restaurants. The line-up for the buffet breakfast was so long that we never did eat there. We saw the Legends show at the Imperial Palace and it was great! Buy your tickets on the strip, same day and get a great deal. There are a couple of them just past the Aladdin hotel and outside the MGM Grand (a big coke bottle). We had a great buffet dinner at the Monte Carlo Hotel and would of gone back if we had time. Next time we will spend less on the hotel, I saw lots of interesting hotels that were a lot less expensive than ours and we will do that next time.,

Reviews.Title: “Loved Paris!”
Reviews.Author: meyerinc
Reviews.Content: We were at Paris for four nights and absolutley loved it! This was the start of our honeymoon, and we couldn't have asked for a better experience. I was a little worried after reading about so many travellers' bad encounters with the staff, but I have to say that every single Paris employee was friendly and helpful. And we used their services like room service, package delivery, messages, restaurants, car rental (Dollar), and of course the front desk. Everyone was attentive and efficient. Our room overlooked the Bellagio fountains and the Eiffel Tower. It was magical! The room was clean and large. The bathroom was enormous with a separate bath and shower. Each morning, I ran down an picked up a couple of coffees and a pastry or two. We were very pleased. This was a wonderful way to start our married life together!

Reviews.Title: “Ticked off Canadian”
Reviews.Author: ralice
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to be staying at the Paris until we arrived at reception. There where five of us ladies and we had reseved Joining rooms which we did not get, when we went back to the desk to see why we did not have these rooms we where told because our room's where side by side they where joining, if we wanted a door between the rooms we should have asked for connecting rooms. After returning to the desk two more times we where moved to different rooms. There are no coffee pots in the rooms on the lower floors either, you can not use the frig because you may contaminate it, if you need refrigeration they will supply one for a fee. The rooms are very small and not as clean as other places I have stayed in Vegas. Overall view I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Faemuzzy
Reviews.Content: Second time in Vegas and decided on Paris. Check-in very good; Tricia upgraded us for $60.00 a day (watch the tax) and we had a very nice room with a view of the Eiffel Tower & Bellagio water show, plus continental breakfast and hors d'oevres each day. Fine! Checked into our room, changed and went directly to pool. Expecting the authenticity of Paris to continue out into the pool area, we were blasted with rap music on speakers everywhere in pool area. The music was loud and awful. Ate on Mon Ami Gabi with 3 other couples and was fine, except for making our reservation a month ahead and having to stand on line behind those not having a reservation. Compared to Bellagio where we stayed last time, I would go back to Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare in Paris”
Reviews.Author: tee-em
Reviews.Content: We arrived to find a very unsympathetic front desk staff member tell us our no-smoking room was not available. According to her, a non-smoking room is simply a request made of the hotel which may or may not be available and that had we read the small print we would have known that. We requested to speak to the manager and after waiting 15 minutes without explanation we had no choice but to take the room. The alternative, as clearly implied by the staff person was we could go somewhere else (at 3:00 am on the Veteran's Day long weekend). Upon arriving in the room we found a letter advising there would be no hot water that day between either 10 am and 1pm or 1pm and 4pm. That morning we were awakened at 6:30 am by an unidentified electronic bell sound from outside the room and discovered another letter advising there would be no hot water between 10am and 4pm. The following morning we got the same letter. The day before we were scheduled to leave we were reminded by multiple signs that our floor was being redecorated commencing promptly at 11 am checkout time and we would have to be out before then. Prior to 11 am there was a knock at the door from hotel staff wanting access to our room, apparently having assumed that we had checked out. We spent our very short holiday working around the hotel's construction schedule and constantly feeling harassed. At the prices they charge, we expected much more in customer service

Reviews.Title: “cramped, smoky”
Reviews.Author: theobata
Reviews.Content: small corridors in casino and common areas make getting around a headache. also seemed more smoky than other large hotels we visited. there was no water for one day as there was some plumbing work. though it took some carefully selected words with management we were given 50 dollars per night off the room rate. For its location and reputation the room was very low quality. the shower was plastic and broken when we got to the room

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, Perfect, Perfect”
Reviews.Author: kwhizz
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at Paris......Checked in at the Airport at 9 a.m. and upgraded to a Suite overlooking the Bellagio Water show and the Strip.......... Got our Keys at the Airport and the room was ready and waiting.....Bedroom, Sitting Room, two Baths,just perfect...........Very Smooth........Again, the Buffet was awsum.....The whole place was "Squeeky" clean and very well run...........We have found our home away from home in Vegas......

Reviews.Title: “Great First Stay at Paris”
Reviews.Author: Juju11
Reviews.Content: We have been to Las Vegas around 25 times and we finally decided this time around to give Paris a try. We took advantage of the airport check-in. It was quick and convenient and the staff was pleasant. Unfortunately, we were long-hauled from the airport ($19 and no traffic) so that put me in a sour mood for a few precious LV moments. We were pleasantly surprised, however, when we arrived at Paris and discovered that we had received a corner room on the 25th floor. The room was very comfortable and very well appointed. Nice layout with two seating areas, two windows and a full closet (with safe) in addition to the armoire. As others have reported, the comforters and furnishings are definitely showing some wear and tear but not to the extent that it seemed dirty or rundown. The bathrooms are spacious with separate shower and oddly smallish bathtub. The only fridge in the room is one of those dangerous auto charge minibars. We requested an empty fridge on our 2nd day. Supposedly "a charge" applies, however, we were never charged so that was a nice bonus. During our stay, we ate at the Creperie which is a good option if you want to grab a quick (and very rich) bite. We also had dinner at Mon Ami Gabi. This was our third time dining here, first on the patio, and it was excellent as always. I love the feel of the casino at Paris, however, this casino is not the best for video poker so not much time spent actually playing onsite during our stay. We threw a little dough into VP at Gustav's bar while we had a cocktail and waited for friends but, that was about the extent of it. Spent a better part of the time playing at Caesar's near the sportsbook. Much better VP offerings and good drink service. Overall, we had a great stay at Paris. The center strip location is convenient, the rooms are nice and the staff is friendly. We'll be back again, hopefully sooner than later!

Reviews.Title: “Paris fine, check in a problem”
Reviews.Author: GlennR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris from October 20 - 23. The hotel was beautiful with a great location. The rooms were clean but nothing out of the ordinary for a large chain. The concierge staff was very helpful and always pleasant to deal with. The only problem we had was check-in. We reserved a room with a view only to find out, when we arrived in the room, the view was of a roof top and parking lot. A call to the front desk offered us a change of rooms, the next day, due to the hotel being sold out. This prompted us to return to the check in facility and request to talk with a manager. We had to make this request a number of times before a manager finally appeared. After much discussion we were finally given a room with a view as we had reserved months in advance. The hotel made no attempt to apologize or compensate us in any way for this inconvenience. This was somewhat disappointing given there claim of exceptional service. I would think twice about returning to the Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Love the employees!”
Reviews.Author: pookieface
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a GREAT 4 day getaway, first vacation in a while and I must say that the Paris Hotel in Las Vegas, has the best employees, they are very accommodating and very well trained. I feel that they should be all congratulated, yes the room was very nice and the casino is very nice, but the employees ran the show, we even were able to check in at 9am, instead of 4pm, and our room was ready!! WOW great service..and I will be back Thanks for letting us have a great vacation

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Crookie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me by my travel agent. I had looked at the Bellagio and wish that I had gone there. The Paris was average but considering the price nothing really special. The room was clean and comfortable but again average. I found some of the staff indifferent and not really helpful. As this was the last stop of a 3 week holiday I had run out of shampoo. I asked for some shampoo from housekeeping (the small travel size) - I am still waiting. The Casino part of the hotel was dark ,smokey and noisy. If I return to Las Vegas I would not choose the Paris

Reviews.Title: “Paris Is Great...But A Few Exceptions!”
Reviews.Author: MelindaJ
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful 3 night stay at Paris Las Vegas. Upon arrival we were offered a suite upgrade at a reasonable cost that we went for. The suite we got was just beautiful and worth every extra penny. The view, decor and ambiance were fabulous. A few exceptions: We arrived early (noon-ish) and I just ran in to see if we were too early to check in. Because it was check-out time the line at the front desk was extremely long. So, I ran into the "Diamond" check-in lounge, which was totally empty of guests, just to ask that question. When I was asked and replied that I was not a Diamond member I was told to leave. SO- I went to the front desk area again. Line was even longer so I walked up a "Platinum" line - which was empty - just to ask my question. Again, told to leave as I was not Platinum. So we just left the hotel and came back a couple of hours later and the line was reasonable. It seems like the Platinum and Diamond check-in agents should take overflow one-by-one if they're empty and the regular line is quite long. Second: We ate at their restaurant Au Sin one night. Appetizers were very good but my entree was a nightmare. I ordered the whole dungeness crab - DON'T order that!!! The crab was portioned but the pieces were not cracked. I tried to crack the pieces with the crab cracker but the sauce was thick and slippery and made that very difficult and messy. I told the waiter and he took my dish back to the kitchen to have it cracked. It took so long that my husband's dish was getting cold so I told him to go ahead and eat. He finished his dish by the time mine returned. Still hard to eat; I managed to get a few flakes - but definitely not worth ordering! The waiter was great and "made it right" by deducting 1/2 the cost of the dish. Still, I left there hungry and disappointed. All in all we were very happy with our stay. Most staff was very good and the amenities were great. We'll stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel in prime location”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynRider
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris for one night at the end of a vacation that began with Death Valley National Park and took us to Manzanar National Historic Site, Sequoia National Park, Kings Canyon National Park, and Mojave National Preserve. Since we booked this hotel for a single night, we were charged a steep rate of $269~ for the night. This was my second visit to Las Vegas, but my first overnight stay. The Paris was located in a prime location on the strip - center stage - so to speak. We arrived to a very busy registration area. The driveway was a bit of a mess with car lanes for registration, valet drop off service and drop-off, which then combined with valet pick-up. It was a grand entry, but for all the "glamour" it could have been more organized. After visits to other hotels, I found that the Paris actually had a pretty good system as we viewed the absolute chaos at the Venetian. Considering that our $269 book us a standard room, we were very pleased to find that we had been upgraded to a suite. (This could be because our travel agent was my the mother of the owner of my place of business. Somehow, we went from a standard king bed room to the Calais Suite (Room 501P). This suite opened into a grand foyer with powder room/bath and a wet bar to the right and a beautiful crystal chandelier suspended above a four seat round table. Behind this was an entertainment area with two chairs, sofa, coffee table armoire and TV. Off from the living room was a bed fit for a king with sweeping drapes on either side of the bed pulled up to a crown at the ceiling above the headboard. There was ample closet and drawer space. A small hallway off of the bedroom led to to the two baths: one a classic bath with beautiful glass enclosed shower stall, the other a large podwer room area with jacuzzi tub with a separate toilet/bidet room. The room was gran and looked out over the pool and the Eiffel Tower. After visitingother hotels and casinos on the strip, I came to appreciate the casino, shopping and restaurat options atthe Paris. The Casino was large, but not designed to disorientate. It had every gaming option, was nicely themed, but didn't overwhlem the senses in a way that I had found at other hotels (like Caesar's or the Venetion, where I just wanted to escape the noise and maze). The shopping areas were themed as French villages and offered the usual items, albeit in a more human scaled setting. Restaurants were aplenty. I forget the names, but we chose the buffet for diner - Superb! And, another fine cafe for breakfast. The registration area was a mini-Hall of Mirrors of Versailles and the theming was so precise. The only drawback I found was the smoking of guests. It seems even with permission to smoke on smoking floors and in smoking areas, they ignored these delineations and smoked everywhere. It was to absolute annoyance. Our suite floor was a non-smoking floor and we always found smokers lounging about in the central lobby by the elevator on our floor. I would highly recommend the Paris to anyone looking for an excellent hotel, with high quality service, in thye middle of it all. This having been my second trip to Vegas, I can say with confidence that the city airport might be a convenient start or end point to excursions to the many natural wonders and national parks of the area, but in the future I will drive the extra hour or so to avoid the city as a place of lodging. Traffic was a nighmare. The urban sprawl of cookie cutter homes depressing. And, if you don't fancy smoking, drinking, or gambling, there is no "there" there. It is just a strip of hotels calling itself a city. A "must" on anyone's lifetime travel list - check it off and be done with it. This country offers much greater and more impressive sights, sounds and backdrops.

Reviews.Title: “Dream vacation on the Vegas strip”
Reviews.Author: Kathy&Harry
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our trip to the "Paris" hotel. We've been to Vegas many times but this hotel was by far the best. We had a room on the 7th floor facing the Arc and the Paris balloon. We asked for a room facing the strip & were told that it would be an extra $60.00 a day. We decided not to do that & were pleasantly surprised with our gorgeous view. We could even see the Bellagio fountains at an angle. The rooms are beautiful. The staff very pleasant. Enjoyed the pool. It was not overly crowded & the jacuzzi's were off in a cove by themselves. Ate at LeCafe for breakfast daily because it was so good. The Asian restaurant, "Ah Sin" was delicious. We shared a meal & it was plenty. Try the tea. Very good. Gambled at Paris, Bally's & the Flamingo. They all give you reward points. We actually won some money this time. Also ate at Mon Ami Gabi. We sat indoors since it was a little cool in the evening but you can sit outdoors under heaters and face the Bellagio fountains. We had an indoor window seat. Make reservations for a seating no later than 6:30pm. It gets busy after that. They serve this steak with different variations of sauces with Frite(french french fries). Very delicious and since it was our last night we had banana foster crepes for desert. One is enough. Went up the Eiffel Tower. Too many people up there to really enjoy it. The hotel is so romantic. You really feel like your outside walking down the cobblestone streets, visiting the shops and restaurants of Paris. It's in the perfect location. Didn't want to leave. Only spent three nights this time since we also visited the Grand Canyon by car. Will stay longer next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: mmeeccee
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with a great Strip location. We stayed there for our honeymoon and enjoyed the room. The casino was loud and smokey. We really enjoyed the buffet and the room itself. My two complaints are about housekeeping and customer service. Since we arrived late we checked in at the airport. They gave us two queen beds. I called about a week before to confirm one king bed. The clerk at the airport was rude and made NO effort to find us a King bed. I mentioned that we were on our honeymoon and she offered to put us in a smoking room. Needless to say, this was not acceptable. When we actually got to the hotel all it took was a request of the front desk. They quickly found a king bed and moved us without question. My husband noticed his pill box (the kind with a compartment for each day of the week) completely opened. He then realized he was missing two pills. Luckily, their loss was not critical. He simply planned which day to miss them and it simply caused him a headache. The housekeeper also kept forgetting items in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Paris is very romantic!”
Reviews.Author: bucknuts
Reviews.Content: Paris Casino is a wonderful place to stay. The food at all of the restaurants was wonderful, especially the Breakfast Buffet. Don't let the long line scare you away, it moves very fast. If you have a choice, get a room with a King bed rather than 2 queens - it is much more spacious. All of the staff was very friendly EXCEPT at the check-in/out, where they are rude and snobbish. My only complaint is that they were very quick to change the $5 craps tables to $10 as soon as they filled up. We stayed there 5 days along with 8 of our friends and had a great time. The atmosphere is really fantastic. Will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Disapointing trip..........”
Reviews.Author: BIG,BAD&BEAUTIFUL
Reviews.Content: Our room was not bad in fact we had a beautiful view of the water show across the street. But we could not gamble as much as we would have liked, because of the 'new check system' so that was no fun.......... I cannot understand how anyone can make that desision as to when a person can cash a perfecially good check or not we have never had problems before,So this ruined our fun.... Then there was the SPA, I went to get my hair done, that was a nightmare, I got a perm I made an appointment I still had to wait. once she got started and got my hair rolled and the solution on She took another lady in to shampoo and comb out , my timer went off but I sat [ my hair was getting over processed] finally the beautian got another person to wash my hair out and apply the next solution on... then my beautian came to take out my rods and apply a conditioner, because she knew I was over processed... She of course charged me. She then brushed and blow dried my hair...It looked like dried hay. But she told me the conditioner would calm it down for 3 months....BUT it did not, my hair is awful it is falling out at the roots, it feels like someone shaved my head you can put your fingers on my scalp and feel nubs of hair........... This is the worst perm I have ever had,AND were leaving on a month vacation to the Caymen Islands in less than 2 weeks... I have called the salon but no one has returned my call and since I live in Arizona, it is quite q trip to LasVegas.... I am very upset...This is the most expensive perm and the worst perm I have ever had.......... $ 241.90 ----PLUS I GAVE THE LADY A $30.00 TIP For a terrible perm and my hatr is so messed up and falling out, and were going on vacation, Iam just sick over this mess.... I WILL NEVER USE THE HAIR SALON AT PARIS AGAIN............

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful imaginary Paris in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Dreams_of_Travel
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel located perfectly at mid-strip in Vegas. You will not go wrong booking this one (we did thru AAA). Book it months in advance to get best rates. The registration desk staff were efficient and we went through the process easily. We rented a car from the airport thru Dollar and got excellent rate via nwa.com--$98/5 days (book it months in adv). Parking is free at all of the casinos--so car rental is good if you want to get out of town one day (go to Valley of Fire SP). Our room (request a high level when you book and non-smoking) on 12th floor didn't have much of a view, but was very luxurious--marble tiled bathroom with tub separate from all glass shower. Plenty of space overall. Internet is on a 24 hour basis so you can decide to plug in just for one day if you like and not be charged for other days. Bell hop sevice is quick and pleasant. Didn't use valet. We had the breakfast buffet--highly recommend although it is expensive--$14. But so much choice and tastefully prepared. Go early to avoid the lines. Sign up for Total Rewards immediately. Then go to Bally's (partner with Paris) to do the slots. We won $145 after 20 minutes! Make sure you do the fitness center. Pool is free. Coupons on the internet for discount--via spa's site. Even if you just do fitness center, you get access to steam room and gender separated jacuzzi (yes, nude it is). They give you a robe and juices, etc. So wonderful!!

Reviews.Title: “Will Be Back”
Reviews.Author: Johnsoen
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vegas for my husband and I. We stayed at the Paris from 15 - 19 Oct. 06, and enjoyed the shows and our stay very much. This was our anniversary trip, and even though this was on our reservations, we were not given or offered anything special. Our room was on the 5th floor with a view of a portion of the buildings roof. Since we had tickets for several shows, we wouldn't be in the room that much anyway. There was only one day that our trash was not emptied in the room, but the bed was made and towels changed. Besides this, the room was larger than expected, very clean, and the bed was just right. We ate at the Mon Ami Gabi in a corner toward the back. The food and wine was very good. We also ate several late night meals at the St. Louis, which was also very good. The room service was off the top with a great food selection. We played the slots at Bally's instead of the Paris, because they seemed to pay off more. To sum our stay up, this is a great hotel and we will try one of the suites next time, because of the reviews we have read on the rooms. Oh, you will need to place your "do not disturb" sign on your door to keep the maids from opening it up early. We will recommend this hotel to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Blissfully romantic four days at Paris”
Reviews.Author: Gourmand
Reviews.Content: Paris Las Vegas This hotel casino was a lovely experience. I had waited quite a few years to afford it, and now that the Wynn and Venetian are in Vegas, Paris had to lower their rates to compete. So, it’s a perfect time to experience an upgraded hotel. First of all, we stayed on a Sunday – Tuesday, always the best time to visit Vegas. Less traffic, fewer crowds and better rates on lodging. We actually got the Paris room for only $116 for Mon – Tuesday. (It was still a high rate for Sunday.) The Paris hotel and casino is beautifully appointed with the Eiffel Tower replica growing out of the casino itself. The replicated cobblestone streets serve as pathways throughout the lobby and casino. Above, the sky is painted a pale blue with clouds so you almost feel like you are outdoors in Paris. The stores are full of things like lavender soap actually made in Provence, but also full of things that say “Paris” but are made in China. So just beware when shopping. When we arrived we asked the receptionist how much it would be to upgrade since we were celebrating both our anniversary and my husbands birthday. The first two rates she proposed were just too high for our budget. Sensing our ability to pay a bit more, she continued working and found a special package which included breakfast and hors d’oeuvres nightly on the Concierge floor plus a larger corner room with a corner view. The additional price was $60 per night and we took it. Not only did the hotel make more money, but also we were thrilled to have the deluxe room. We were on the 25th floor with a perfect romantic view of the strip in both directions, plus the Eiffel Tower was centered in one window for us. We could also watch the Bellagio dancing waters nightly directly across the street. The bigger excitement was the view of all the red and lavender desert and mountains surrounding Las Vegas, something you rarely see from the ground. We also overlooked the attractive Paris pool. Well worth the additional price. The room had a long entry way with French blue carpeting and beige striped wallpaper covered in blue French fleur de lys. The king bed bedspread matched the wallpaper and there was a giant armoire with not one but two closets for hanging clothes. In between the closets sat the TV with several cable channels. There was a bench seat in front of the pool/Eiffel tower view so we turned it around to face out and sat to watch Las Vegas every time we were in the room for a rest. There were also two stuffed comfy chairs that swiveled for the view or reading. The entry to the bathroom started with a separate room for another closet with a safe and a desk with Internet connection. The expansive bathroom had pink marble on the floor and shower. It included both a shower and a bathtub. There was a great deal of counter space for our bath products, and there were plenty of towels. Our only complaint was the king bed was very mushy and thin and moved every time my husband or I did. I also really dislike an expensive hotel not providing fitted sheets on their beds. Fortunately we always bring our own fitted King sheet, but I really believe this caliber hotel should have fitted sheets. I can’t stand to lie down and have the flat sheets untuck and displace themselves all night and end up sleeping directly on the mattress. These are minor complaints. The view was well worth the price. The room was exceptionally clean. The staff was enormously helpful and quick. The valet and bellmen were terrific. We ordered a refrigerator to keep things cold until we checked out. It was only $10.00 per day. That is a bargain. Other minor hotels in town charge $15-$35 a day. We had room service for breakfast twice and it was excellent, however the second time it was not as hot. But the food is very good. We used both the Spa (only $25.00 a day for guests) and spa services (massages, pedicure and hair style) and they were excellent. One staff doing the pedicure was a bit annoying due to her immaturity, but all in all the experience was great. We lay by the pool one day and discovered the pool is shallow all over, perfect for dipping and back to your beach chair. Waitresses came by occasionally to take orders for very expensive drinks and lemonade. One night I was sick from the food at the Eiffel Tower (you can see my review there) and at 3:00 AM three housekeeping staff came in immediately to take care of our bathroom. They were just wonderful. I can’t say enough good things about housekeeping, valet, bellmen and front desk staff. Food at Mon Ami Gabi and Les Artistes Steakhouse and Le Café Ile St. Louis was excellent to superb and is far better than the Eiffel Tower. Paris Casino Las Vegas owns and controls their restaurants EXCEPT the Eiffel Tower. The difference in quality and service is unbelievable. The Paris hotel restaurants are truly fine dining. I am writing my reviews on each of them also. Gambling was fun here, especially the new giant “Wheel of Fortune” game that seats 9 couples at a time. They are one of the few casinos that have this brand new gambling game. I would definitely stay at the Paris Las Vegas again. We left feeling very happy about our stay as it fulfilled our need for quality, service and romance for four days.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Heard
Reviews.Content: Staff was rude. Seemed as if they were "put out" by a simple check in/out. Bellmen never gave us a second look....basically ignored us and were never offered help with bags. Hotel was ok.......but there are better places to stay. Theme was neat. Even if you don't stay here, it is a must see. Bathroom was nice and spacious. Wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: GLORIIAE
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location of this hotel but....the hotel is just average and for the price definately not worth it. I spoke to 3 people before I got there to make sure everything was set for a view of the strip and even paid extra and when I checked in my view was awful. It took 2 room changes before we got a view. And then if you looked to the left you had a construction site. I paid extra off their site for a preimum room and the room was just an average room nothing special so don't pay for the preimum room. Also, there is a convention center in the hotel and every where you went there were hundreds of people so getting into resturants was difficult and the casino was crowded. I would not go back and can't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Paris is no longer a hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: deacon1
Reviews.Content: I am a Vegas veteran of over 20 years. I've stayed at a lot of different hotels from 5 star to #$@%@. I have to say that Paris ranks up there among the top hotels without the outrageous price tag. The rooms are clean, comfortable and well appointed. The casino active, manageable and properly decorated. The staff very accommodating. The location- couldn't be more accessable to most of Vegas hot spots. The food is excellent, even down to the sandwich/pastry shop which I highly reccomend for a soup ( clam chowder and sandwich) for a very reasonable price. I've stayed at Paris 5 years straight . Except for a deisre to experience another hotel in SIn City I cannot reccomend it highly enough. Other reviewers are right on with their positive comments. Well done Paris LV!!

Reviews.Title: “A Really Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: my_red_dress
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel and casino. We stayed here for three nights and I didn't want to go home! The room was spacious with a king bed and a sitting area with a sofa (this was a standard room) The bathroom was really spacious with a seperate tub and shower: the shower was marble. The toiletries were quality. I did not hear any noise coming from the hall which can be the case in Vegas. We had dinner at two of the restaurants in the hotel and the food was good! I love the look of the casino area with the beautiful sky above you! Great location on the strip too!

Reviews.Title: “Paris Las Vegas, EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: Rocknel
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Paris Las Vegas. I felt as if I had been taken back to the streets of Paris, even down to the tiny little details. We make many trips to Vegas and usually stay at the same hotel, not the Paris. This time we wanted a change. The hotel was beautiful and we have never experienced such incredible service. It was so hot and busy in Vegas, but the hotel was cool, peaceful and traquil. We had a few problems with the room and the manager took care of them quickly. We ate at most of the hotels restaurants and were very pleased with the food, although it was a little high priced. We found that to be common all over Vegas on this trip. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone making a trip to Vegas. I also liked that I was able to use my Harrahs card in this hotel and several others that were all close together. What a great place!!! SMP from Houston, Tx

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: resipsa
Reviews.Content: Excellent time. Very friendly staff (hotel and casino), quick check in & out, no surprises. Loved the decor and the ambience. room was clean, and cleaned well throughout my stay. Ate at Mon Ami Gabi and it was very good. We sat out on the patio and had a nice view of the Bellagio water show. I would highly recommend Paris. The only criticism I can think of is the annoying rap music which they played poolside, but the water was warm and the drinks girl was friendly and prompt.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sparkster
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, friendly and helpful staff and a great location on the strip. Room service was also speedy, hot and value for money(good for the hangover breakfast!) Will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Not my favorite in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: SDParadiseJewelry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris hotel Sept 24 to the 26th. It has some good points and bad points. Good points: 1) Our room on the 26th floor was nicely decorated and it had a huge bathroom. With nice marble flooring and tile. And it had a great view. The bathroom had a full length mirror at the back of the door. That was nice for getting dressed. 2) The elevators are very fast in this hotel, so you don't have to wait long for one. 3) We upgraded our room, for what we thought was $60 a day to be able to use the concierge room on the 31st floor. It turned out to be $60 for our entire stay. In the concierge room, you do not pay for breakfast, but rather you go up for your coffee and breakfast there, and it's open from 7 to Noon. Side note: Our friends who arrived much later in the day, couldn't get the concierge room, as the availability had sold out. The food is mostly high carb in nature for breakfast, but they do offer croissants, bagels, cereal, yogurt, granola, and salmon, cream cheese and fruits. Also, cafe latte etc, for no extra charge. The upgrade to the concierge room also includes happy hour from 5 to 7pm, which basically could be dinner, as we had steak skewers, pasta, some salads and lots of delicious pastries. There is also wine and beer, but you do have to pay $4.00 extra for the drinks. If you are traveling with friends, it's a great place to meet and have a snack before heading out for the evening to a show and gambling. 4) The hotel is a 5 minute walk to the Aladdin Shopping mall, and a 15 minute walk to the Cesars's shopping mall. Great food and great shopping at both. The Paris is also right in the middle of the strip, so it's great to be able to walk to everything. 5) If you check out (-)Parislasvegas.com, you can print off a $25.00 off coupon for the spa. 6) For some free and fun entertainment at The Paris, check out their piano bar. These guys are called dueling pianos, and they are really good and funny, and you can tell they love their job. They entertain from 10:30 pm to 1:00pm I think. 7) The Paris, does have some fun shops and restaurants. Bad points: 1) The lighting is not that great in the bathroom, and not great for women putting on make up. Also, other hotels on the strip provide lighted make-up mirrors, and this hotel doesn't. 2) The bathroom also doesn't have a fan of any sort. So after a shower it remains foggy. 3) The spa is very nice, but for women if you want to stay in the spa dressing area, and put on your make-up in the spa, and fix your hair, there once again are no lighted mirrors. They do provide hand-held mirrors, which I thought was a big joke. Also, the hair dryers are not that great. Mandalay bay does a much more superior job in the spa department, and you are paying the same price for the service. 4) There is no coffee maker in the room. This is something that I get picky about. I just want to have my first morning coffee in my room, without having to get dressed for it. This was also true of the Bellagio. Not sure why these pricey hotels can't offer a coffee maker in the room. 5) This Hotel was very smokey. But other hotels we visited were not. 6) Can't use the refrigerator in the room, because otherwise you will be charged for the items that were moved around, even if you didn't eat or drink them. But heck, it would have been nice to have been able to keep our water and snacks cold. But this service isn't offerred here. All and all I did enjoy my stay here. Loved the location. Our room was clean, comfortable. But if I were coming to see a show and spend time in a spa, this wouldn't be the hotel I would pick. For room design and quality and just plan big, The Rio is very nice, and they provide a coffee make and a refrigerator you can use. The spa's are much nicer at the Mandalay bay, and the Bellagio, and also MGM. Any questions, just email me at Julie@SDParadiseJewelry.com

Reviews.Title: “Best view in Vegas, Baby!”
Reviews.Author: Zricky47
Reviews.Content: Wife & I stayed here Sept 17-20 in room 3096...well worth the $30 upcharge for a premium view! We had a full-length view of the Eiffel Tower and the Bellagio's fountain show...it was something to see from our 30th floor vantage point. When the room service waiter delivered our breakfasts (excellent croissants and pastries, BTW), he said the rooms across the hall looked out at a wall or something (Bally's?). Ask for this room (or one near it), and thank me later! We ate at Mon Ami Gabi, inside in the A/C, and had great pomeganite Mojitos, good oysters, Roquefort steak frites and salmon, along with a shared dessert and coffees, for $150 w/tip...this is a well run restaurant... We have been to Vegas numerous times in the past twenty five years, and, somehow it keeps getting better...especially the restaurants...we had a good time (even tho we lost a few hundred at blackjack!).

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel and great location on strip.”
Reviews.Author: fanatic-reviewer
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my partners birthday and we went Sept 3rd-7th. I was a little worried due to some of the previous reviews. I needn't have worried. From the minute we arrived we were treated nicely. Our room was on the 10th floor and had a side view so I could see the bellagio fountains but they were quite a distance away. This was not a particular tragedy!!!! We were hardy in our room and spent most of our time sightseeing. The room was lovely and clean and had two queen size beds, although we only ever used the one. There was no bath but a walk in marble shower instead which was good. The best bit about this hotel (apart from it being very clean, cause my partner is very fussy about cleanliness) was the strip location, as it was central. Unfrotunately I can't comment on the buffets etc, but we did have crepes or coffee and breakfast at the patisserie most mornings. All in all I would most definately recommend this hotel to anyone of any age as it was lovely (I'm mid 30's and my partners early 40's), and particularly because my partner loved it, and he's the type who will complain immensley if he's not satisfied, honest!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The BEST!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Len3
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Paris was a 5 night comp - Sept. 14 to 19 - they gave us a corner room which was simply beautiful. The staff was more than gracious and couldn't have been more helpful. I only play slots and came home with $2,160 in winnings. What a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: thecatsmother
Reviews.Content: My husband ,daughter and I stayed here recently for a three day vacation. It was wonderful. We had standard rooms which were spacious, comfortable and clean. The bathroom had a separate tub and beautiful marble shower. We asked for Strip facing rooms but as it was Labour day weekend this wasn't possible but they gave us rooms next to each other and we all had a great time. The beds were comfortable, there were plenty of complimentary toiletries and towels. The hotel is smaller than others but this makes it feels more personal. The Buffet breakfast was excellent, good service and an authentic feel to the settting. The staff in the hotel and casino were friendly and attentive and made great efforts to accomodate any requests. I've stayed in other Las Vegas Hotels and so far this was the best. A couple of suggestions- Check in at the airport. We got the shuttle but this did take sometime and with three of us it might have been faster and not more expensive to get a cab. The airport check in, however was efficient and fast. Eat at 'Mon Ami Gabi'. We were going to eat at the Eiffel Tower Restuarant but after comparing the prices ( they were HUGE in the Tower restaurant!) we decided to eat at Mon Ami Gabi. It was wonderful. Again authentic ambience, great service and fabulous food. Try Napoleon's Piano Bar. It was more sedate than the one in Harrahs or NY NY but it wasn't as crowded, was still lots of fun and a nice place to spend a couple of hours. Vegas was as much fun as ever!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price for location”
Reviews.Author: nlappa
Reviews.Content: we stayed in just the regular room, requested a "P" room, but none were available... the price was great, and the location was fantastic, you can't go wrong request a "strip view", high floor - we did and got it, and it was excellent! clean, quite, and the Paris buffet was the best on the strip (even compared to the Bellagio)...it is close to all the hotels... the pool was nice too, we spent one day lounging and it was very enjoyable did the airport check in - i would reccomend that option... Nadia (Ottawa, Canada)

Reviews.Title: “My 2nd Visit, Paris is a solid choice for LV”
Reviews.Author: DavidofB
Reviews.Content: 8/29-9/2 I arrived at the hotel at 12:30pm and was given immediate service (no line) and my room was ready. I was on the 6th floor overlooking the pool. The room was clean and the maid service was very good. The pool was great and the drinks strong. The food in the buffet is OK, but not stellar. Tip: If you want breakfast and the buffet and diner are crowded, walk to Bally's (connected) and you will probably find that their restaurants aren't as crowded. I also like the fact that you can walk through Bally's to catch the monorail to other casinos with dealing with walking and traffic in a taxi. The only negative was that I had the concierge arrange for a car to pick my mom up from the airport (a service I paid for) and the company they contracted with failed to show up. This may not be their problem directly, but this was the company that the contracted with to take care of their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Quality slipping!”
Reviews.Author: Indyjaybird
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Paris in the last few years. We checked in at the airport with the $20 'trick' and we were upgraded to a "P" room on the fifth floor. We also checked in my brother-in-law (BIL) and his family at the same time and they were also given a "P" room on the seventh floor. Room was like we remembered from first visit - just not very good views - ours looked out over a roof that had old lounge chairs and junk on it. We didn't have any shampoo so we called housekeeping who sent some up. The toilet was loose on its setting and the shower had lime build up around the bottom and the door. Otherwise, it was perfectly acceptable. BIL's room wasn't ready until late in the day and they had requested a roll-away bed when they checked in at 3 p.m. which did not get delivered until 10 p.m. after repeated requests. Their room also smelled like smoke (on a non-smoking floor) but that cleared up after the first day. We rented a car from Dollar at the hotel which we picked up in the attached garage. Very convenient. I would recommend valet parking the car - it is quite a hike to run back and forth to the garage to get it all of the time. The only drawback is that you have to pull out of the hotel onto the strip which can mean delays if it is crowded. Returning the car took about half an hour because the clerk was late opening up the rental desk and there were several people in line. We only ate at the Paris buffet one time for breakfast. It was not as good as we remembered with much less variety and choices. Every station had bacon and some form of plain potatoes. Very bland. On a side note, I would recommend Peppermill restaurant for a change of pace - it was across from the Stardust. Excellent food and atmosphere - neon diner-ish. I would stay away from Batista's Hole in the Wall. Bad Italian food and service. The buffets at the Aladdin and Orleans have gone downhill but the buffets at the Bellagio, Rio, and Wynn are absolutely spectacular! We saw Lance Burton's magic show which was fine. My husband, BIL, and niece really seemed to enjoy it. My husband and I saw Popovich's Pet Comedy Theater at the Aladdin. I loved the cat and dog portions of the show (about 15 minutes of an hour and fifteen minute show), but could have lived without the quasi circus/clown acts and too much juggling show. The 'theater' itself was just regular restaurant type chairs on a flat floor. Carrot Top or Mamma Mia are much better values. My niece and I used the pool at Paris one day which was fine. Crowded but clean. Did notice that they allowed people to have glass bottles in the pool which did not seem very safe. Our maid did a less than acceptable cleaning job every day. On our last day, she never came in to clean at all. We returned to our room at 1 p.m. to take a nap and called housekeeping to let them know the room had not yet been cleaned. We told them we would be leaving at 3 p.m. and they could clean it anytime after that. They indicated that would be fine. We left at 3 p.m. and returned at 10 p.m. to a still uncleaned room. We had a message from housekeeping at 3:18 p.m. asking when they could clean the room! We called and told them told them it still needed to be cleaned which they finally sent someone up to do after some argument. They were less than accommodating. We asked to talk to a manager who begrudgingly comped us two breakfasts the following day. I would recommend staying at Ballys on the strip for a better value and access. Wynn or Bellagio for tremendously better quality and atmosphere. Off strip, the Orleans, Silverton, or South Coast for value and Red Rock Casino for a little more luxury. It was our first time to see the new Red Rock and Silverton casinos and they were really quite impressive!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel That Needs Some Help!”
Reviews.Author: rrflood
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 2:30pm and line was short for check in. This, unfortunately, was the best part of the Paris. Room wouldn't be ready for at least another two hours. We didn't get the view room that we were promised.(unless you like to have a view of the back of Ballys and the shorter rooftops) The room was okay until we started looking closer. Shower in bathroom wasn't clean. Fingernail clippings from previous guests were on the carpet. The carpet looked very worn, as well as the bedspread. The TV cable signal was distorted. The bed was like sleeping on cement.! Our room was comped because of previous stays with Harrah's. I hope this isn't Harrah's policy to give comped rooms that are in desperate need of attention. (BTW....we got the comped room because my wife and I played many hours and lost lots of money....so we really did pay for it!) Now for the positive. The food is outstanding and most service is better than average. The dealers are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: DarkKnight
Reviews.Content: From the breath taking entrance to spectacular views, this hotel offers an excellent place to stay while in Vegas. With an almost perfect location ( middle of the strip) the hotel is an ideal place to explore everything Vegas has to offer. The room we stayed in was excellent with a view overlooking the Bellagio fountains ( ask for a corner room to see these). The variety of different restaurants inside is impressive and Napleons bar is perfect for both a quick drink or a whole night. The duelling piano show 9 till 1 every night is superb entertainment and well worth a look. A perfect place for first time visitors to Vegas as it's locality offers a perfect platform to view Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: system
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled to Vegas from Toronto for a stay at Paris during the first week of July 2006. For both of us, this was our first trip to Vegas. We arrived at the hotel around 11:00 p.m. To make small talk with the check-in customer service representative, I mentioned that this was our first trip to Vegas and it was our 4th Wedding Anniversary. The young lady immediately put us in their best sweet for the first night (highest floor---I think it was 33) and an upgraded room for the remainder of the week. We were extremely delighted and thankful for her kindness and thoughfulness. The sweet was amazing. It had a huge foyer, 3 washrooms, make-up desk, 10 person shower, 10 seat dining table, separate living room and separate bedroom. We ordered room service and the bill was taken care of by the hotel (we didn't realize this until check-out). We really enjoyed the fact that the hotel was in the middle of the strip and right across from Belligio.The decor of Paris was great as well as the resturants. We watched "O" at Belligio. I would definitely recommend this show to every vacationer to Vegas. Worth the money. Even when you convert to Canadian Dollars. Also saw David Copperfield, who was great although his age is showing. We also went to the Fashion Outlets in Prim, Nevada for 2-3 hours via a bus from Alladin ($15.00 return cost). Trip to the outlets was worth it. My experience with Paris was great and I would reommend this hotel. The decor of Paris was great as well as the resturants. We watched "O" at Belligio. I would definitely recommend this show to every vacationer to Vegas. Worth the money. Even when you convert to Canadian Dollars. Also saw David Copperfield, who was great although his age is showing. We also went to the Fashion Outlets in Prim, Nevada for 2-3 hours via a bus from Alladin ($15.00 return cost). We had a great time at Paris and would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Shadow46
Reviews.Content: My wife and I checked in at the airport late evening. The hotel clerk there said she did not have a king bed room. We took a double, but upon arriving at the hotel there was no line at check in so I asked again about a king bed. The Rep checked with housekeeping and an upgraded "p" room, with king.was available, which she gave us without additional charge, Then upon our departure, after a 5 day stay, she recognized us at checkout and asked how the room was during our stay. She then gave us her direct line and told us on our next trip to call the day of our arrival and assured us a similar room would be set aside for us, if available. I was quite impressed---First that she recalled us from 5 days before and Second for the personal service. We have stayed at Paris before this trip and will surely continue to do so. Like the room our stay was great. The central strip location of Paris is a big plus. There is always room at the pool and the food options are all above average. For the cost it can't really be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with the hotel”
Reviews.Author: PrestonTraveller
Reviews.Content: On our second trip to Vegas we chose to stay at the Paris. We wanted a more central location on the strip and this one seemed suitable. We previously stayed at the MGM Grand some years ago. At check-in we were told that none of the rooms were yet ready. This is not something you want to hear after a 10 hour flight, nor do they offer you some complimentary drinks whist you wait for your room to get ready. Its a case of park your luggage and come back later. At check-in I tried to get an upgrade as it was an anniversary trip but alas I was out of luck. I tried to get a strip view but again no luck. I had to pay extra for a view of the strip but I did also get access to the club lounge for my money which included a light buffet breakfast and light evening appetisers. You were also allowed to take soft drinks out with you which made it worthwhile but does not make up for the disappointment of not even getting a decent view for the price you have already paid for your room. However just as i was about to leave the check-in area a room became available, so no waiting around then. The hotel is more compact, the rooms were of a good size, well furnished. The bath room had a separate tub and shower and I did not notice any problems with the water pressure. I agree the hotel rooms are due a refurbishment even though its a relatively new hotel.
