The room decorations just need to be jazzed up and the bedding needs to be refreshed. The gimmick of the Paris works well. Although the Eiffel Tower and Arc De triomphe looks tacky its also well done. It does not beat the real thing at the real Paris but is a more tasteful hotel than most. The pool area is good, very large and was very popular with families. I would had preferred a pool where the water had more depth at at one end and a separate pool for young kids. The concierge were very good and very friendly. If you have the club access room you also get personal concierge services. Like most Vegas hotels it does lack the personal touch but we had an enjoyable trip to Vegas and did like the hotel a lot. It also looks spectacular at night. If only next time I get a decent view without stumping up extra.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: oldtwo
Reviews.Content: We checked in on 8-23-6 for one night after we stayed at Ceaser Palace for two nights. Soon as we waked in to the room, we were totally disappointed. The room is dirty,furniture is old, the wall the thin that we can tell every word from next room. I rated this rotel two star but they charged for the four star hotel price. After we had dinner at the buffet inside the hotel, I had food posion. I threw up all night, get up and go bathroom every twenty minutes. Finally at 4:30am, I called the front desk to get an ambulance. The front desk transferred me to the security desk, the security guy said he will come to our room soon. He never shown up. Luckily, I was so sick and fell in sleep. I won't recommended this hotel to anyone. Don't let the outside of the hotel fools you. This is the first time and wll be my last time stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: Gerty1223
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay Aug 19th -22nd. Check in was fast for a Saturday, but when I asked for a strip view room the lady told us an additional $65.00. I had a tewnty in my had but she did not budge. Looked like a manager. So I asked for a room close to elevator. She put us in oom 433. Terrible view of a 1/2 brick wall and MGM. Was a little dissapointed but who's in their room anyways. So stay off the 4th floor if not facing strip you will have a view of a wall! Did quite a bit of gambling there, slots are tight .They have a neat computerized roulette where you wager on a video screen instead of reaching over everyone. They have 2 attendents there to spin a real roulette wheel, and if you win all money is put on your screen until you decide to cash out. Nice sportsbook, people were ok behind the counter.Nothing special they kind of acted like they were doing you a favor. Also while checking in my wife lost her neck pillow with bell hop and we called down to the luggage hold area and the girl who answered the phone was very rude and said we would have to call the "Paris Police", we asked her to just look for us and she replied its not here! All in all a nice place to rest your head but if your looking for that little special hospitality you may want to try else where.I visit Vegas once a year and this was by far the worst we have been treated. And 2 of my nights were comped!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful !!!”
Reviews.Author: Jacynth1980
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Las Vegas from Aug 1-4/06. Paris was actually not our first choice. We were supposed to stay at Bally's but because they were almost at full capacity, they offered us a room at Paris. We agreed, and were very satisfied with the room that they gave us. ROOM: We had a large spacious room with a king size bed. Because we had a corner room, we had two windows that gave us a view of the stip and a view of the MGM. Our room was clean and spacious. The bathroom was large with good water pressure and temperature. FOOD: We never ate at Paris cause we found it a very expensive. We ate breakfast at the Salsa Cantina 3 times for $2.99. It's located in Aladin's mall. It was tasty and quick. Ellis Island, found behind Bally's, is also very good, we had dinner there once. Very affordable and very good. The deli at Bally's is very good, with fresh bread and deli meats made right in front of you. Good pickles!!! GAMBLING: We played mostly the machines and I found the cocktails waitresses to be very courteous and came around often. No complains there! SHOWS: We attended two shows: Jubillee!! which was wonderful. My husband and I really enjoyed the music and the dancers. A must see. The only negative aspect was that it was terribly cold in the theatre. We also attended the Price is Right Live, very exciting and very fun. It was almost like the real thing. Unfortunately we didn't win anything :( All in all it was a wonderful trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: RDCollins
Reviews.Content: I travel to Las Vegas on business several times per year, and I've stayed in several of the better hotels, although I try to find a good deal for the sake of my clients, who end up paying. I had business in the area in late August 2006. After checking the room rates on the Internet, I chose Paris Las Vegas for $119 per night, plus taxes for a total of $129.71. I had never stayed at that hotel before, so I decided to check the reviews on TripAdvisor, and I was a bit dismayed at some of the less-than-glowing reviews. I figured it was only one night, and I wanted to see the place, so I decided to keep the reservation. I'm glad I did! My experience was apparently different from that of some of the other TripAdvisor reviewers. The room was in excellent shape, very clean, nicely decorated, and very quiet. Everything worked properly. The bed was firm, but comfortable -- and I slept through the night, which is unusual for me. The bathroom was immaculate and very nicely appointed -- although the tub was small and there was no light in the separate shower stall. Nonetheless, it was very, very nice, especially for the price. The large casino floor is interesting and well run. It's noisy, of course, but no more than other large casinos on the Strip. The shops are all quite nice, if nothing out of the ordinary (what is these days?), and there are lots of restaurants and other food outlets to choose from. The hotel's shopping mall is connected directly to that of Bally's, which is nice. The Parisian theme is well done, although like other themes hotels, it gets to be a little tiring after a while -- sort of like Disneyland, too sterile, too cute. But that's what theme hotels are all about, and it's fun if you're not overly critical about it not being "real." Since I was alone, I decided to forgo the expensive restaurant in the mock Eiffel Tower and instead opted for Mon Ami Gabi, a Parisian-style bistro. Wow! It was GREAT! Several very nice, large dining rooms, including one facing the Strip and Bellagio's lake, and also an outdoor dining area. The French bistro theme and décor is well done and comfortable. I chose the Steak Roquefort Frites, a very thin steak quickly cooked to medium rare, topped with Roquefort cheese, and accompanied by the best pommes frites (French fries) I've ever had. That was $23. I ordered some asparagus to accompany it for $7, and they gave me enough for two. Wines by the glass were reasonably priced, $6 to $14 or so, and there were several good choices. The dessert choices all looked interesting, and the Bananas Foster Crepe I ordered was great, again enough for two. I think it was $8. Service was attentive and very professional without being annoying, although I had a bit of trouble with my French waiter's accent. All in all, I thought the hotel was a super deal. The room was excellent, the staff was top-notch (Vegas has the best hotel workers in the world, IMHO, largely because the hotels and the unions work well together, the employees are well paid, and most have many years of experience in the industry). Paris Las Vegas is as nice or nicer than the other four-star hotels I've tried in Las Vegas. If you want more, I think you'll need to go to Bellagio or Wynn's, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MeiFan01
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Paris for 3 nights in August 2006. The hotel was very nice - very tacky and very Vegas, but the rooms were very spacious, stylishly decorated and the hotel is very conveniently placed. It's opposite the Bellagio (where you must go and see O by Cirque du Soleil), a short walk to the Forum in Ceaser's Palace (shopping heaven) and of all the other casinos dotted around the Strip. We managed to get an upgrade to a suite with views of the Bellagio fountains!! That was pretty amazing and we didn't even ask for it! The staff were always helpful and courteous, but as would be expected in such a large place it lacks the personal touch. The pool on the 3rd floor is large with lots of loungers, a bar/cafe (try out the fresh smoothies - they're delicious) with waitress service and misters to keep everyone cool in the dessert sun. The Boulevard has numerous eateries and the breakfast buffet (as expected) is very good, with more food on offer than you could ever imagine eating. The ultimate dinner buffet though is at the Bellagio. It can not be beaten!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cubsfan_1974
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Imperial Palace on my first trip to Vegas, we were looking for a nicer hotel that was still centrally located. We couldn't have asked for a better option than the Paris. Although a little more expensive than some strip hotels (Flamingo, Bally's), we thought that this hotel was reasonably priced for the amenities and location offered... and wasn't as expensive as many others (Bellagio, Mirage, Caesar's). The rooms were large and clean. We had a nice view of the South strip. However, the pool isn't very large and it becomes difficult to find a pool chair during the afternoon hours on the weekend. My friends loved the casino, but since I didn't gamble I don't have much to add to that. I'd also recommend sitting on the terrace at Mon Ami Gabi for dinner. I've done this during two trips to Vegas now and the view of the Bellagio water show while having a great dinner is unparalleled.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel! Worth Every Penny!”
Reviews.Author: ElvDvd
Reviews.Content: Just came back from our vacation to Las Vegas where we stayed at the Paris Hotel. What a great place to stay and eat at, not to mention one of the best locations on the strip! The the breakfast buffet was awesome! So much variety and everything was fresh. The casino itself didn't give that casino feeling, but felt more like you were walking the streets Paris. I would definitely recommend this hotel and everything that it has to offer! Should you be staying here, please have a latte at Le Notre coffee shop, you won't regret it! The check in went really fast, no hold ups at all and they have an easy check out where you fill out a form and attach to it your keys and then drop everything in a box. Really convenient when your checking out at 3 in the morning! The concierge was always very helpful and gave us many VIP passes to the hottest clubs on the strip. We are planning on coming back to Vegas and will definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: missgabs
Reviews.Content: Our family booked 3 rooms at the Paris as we passed through Las Vegas on our way back home from California and wanted to experience Vegas on the strip. At first, the terrible traffic on the strip made us regret our decision. However, once we checked in we were much happier. The man who checked us in was not very friendly, but got us in and out of the line fairly quickly. Once we made it up to our room we were a bit dismayed that our non-smoking floor smelled pretty smoky. Our room was better, but the halls smelled. Our room was a good size, clean and the bathroom was nice. But, for some reason our carpet was wet, as if they had just cleaned it or something. I wondered why they put us in a room that wasn't actually ready, but oh well. We didn't plan on spending all that much time there anyway. We took our toddler down to the pool for some serious downtime after 6 hours in the car. It was crowded and dirty, with cigarette butts all-over the ground and all sorts of who-know's-what in the pool. The pool didn't seem to be heated, which in Las Vegas probably isn't necessary, but at 6 pm in the shade it was almost too chilly in the water so we headed in. I felt like I needed a shower after I left because everything was so filthy. Room service was pricy, but our club sandwich and ceasar salad were fresh and arrived within 20 minutes. The shrimp cocktail was skimpy for the price. The breakfast buffet the next morning was wonderful. Tons of food to choose from: everything from traditional hot entrees to fresh fruit and cheese. It was definatly worth the wait and the cost was reasonable for the spread of food to choose from. I guess that what we liked most was the location and the ambiance of a themed casino. Having been in Paris, I never felt like I was back in France at this hotel. But, it was fun to have an eiffel tower and arc de triumphe. The location is great because it is centrally located on the strip and within walking distance to some of the other great casinos. We would probably stay here again, but I wouldn't have as high expectations as I used to have.

Reviews.Title: “Door Would Not Lock !!!”
Reviews.Author: TripKid
Reviews.Content: We had one night left to stay in Las Vegas, so we decided to stay at the Paris Hotel on a Sunday night. The walk from the parking garage to the hotel front desk was very long. It made it even less enjoyable when there was a lot of luggage to get to the hotel room. The check in was fast and our room was very nice. After leaving all of our luggage in the room, we decided to check out the swimming pool. The pool area was large and very clean. When we went back to our room, I took out my key card to open the door, but first I tried to turn the door handle, and to our surprise, the door opened without using the key card!!! We checked again. We made sure the door was completely closed and then we tried to open the door again without using the key card. We tried turning the door knob once, twice and on the third time, the door opened. We rushed into the room to see if any of our items were stolen. We were relieved nothing had been taken from the room. So, we had a very expensive hotel room with a front door that would not lock. We were short on time and we had reservations for a show in a few hours. We had to haul most of our luggage back to the parking garage, so we could lock it in the trunk of the car. Then it was back to the room to get ready for the show. After the show, we went back to the parking garage to get our luggage and we hauled the luggage back to the room. We opened the door to our room without the key card again, and then we tried to enjoy staying in the room without a locking front door. When you pay this kind of money for a room it should have a working lock on the front door. We give the Paris Hotel one circle, because of an extreme security issue with our room...

Reviews.Title: “OK, but things are heading south”
Reviews.Author: Wynner7
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at Paris Hotel and Casino in 2 years. We have stayed at several vegas casinos over the past 12 years. Our most recent stay was business related. The rooms are in need of some upgrades. The shower leaked onto the floor and there was some mildew growth in some areas of the shower. The beds were not very comfortable and the air conditioning didn't work well with temps. in the 100's. The price and hotel location is very good. The bartenders will tell you that you must MAX BET to get your drinks free at the bar. Walk across the street to the Barbary Coast Hotel and Casino and get your drinks free by gambling whatever you want, or just pay $2 a drink if you're not gambling. And the bartenders are far more fun and friendly at the Barbary Coast. 2nd time was not a charm at Paris so there will not be a 3rd stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: PatrickG1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris Hotel for free via receiving an offer for 2 free nights. The hotel itself is a sight to see. I've never been to Venetian, Bellagio, or any of the other "higher class" resorts as that's not really my scene. I'm in my early 20's, so needless to say all those 'snooty' people, I can go without :) Anyway, I will say the Paris is amazing! The check-in was a breeze. We were in and out to our room within 10 minutes.. ON A WEEKEND. The hike to the rooms from the hotel check-in is another plus. Nothing like any of the other major resorts (MGM Grand, i'm lookin' at you). Just take a couple steps, and you're there. I can't speak for the Buffet as we went to Flamingo for their buffet (Which was GREAT. $13 for a seafood buffet which included Crab, Shrimp, Salmon, and others with amazing scenery. Can't beat that. The room itself, was good. Not too big. Not too small. We weren't in the room much anyway, so it didn't really make a difference. We were on the 22nd floor, however we got a partial view of the strip as you can see in our pics. The beds were comfortable. The pillows were a bit blah, but whatever. Water pressure was great. Not much to complain about! The slots couldn't have been any tighter.. won absolutely nothing there. But hey, ya win some, and lose some. The location is great! Right next door, you have Ballys and Aladdin. Other nearby hotels are Harrahs, Flamingo, The Mirage and Treasure Island.

Reviews.Title: “Showing wear, didn't get requested room, staff friendly, food great!”
Reviews.Author: MissDaisy
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Paris Las Vegas in late afternoon. Hubby took care of the reservations, clearly stated we requested a King size bed, instead clerk gave us Queen. Arrived to room and discovered two queen beds. Oh well...we were hot and tired and the queen beds would do. The room was clean overall except for a pink stain in the carpet near the bathroom entry way. Carefully stepped around the stain. The bedspreads looked a bit tired. The bedding was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was spotless. Housekeeping tended to enter the room, even if you were in the room. They did not wait for you to answer the door. Happened twice but that was enough. Overall the staff was friendly and the hotel felt quite comfortable The hotel's strongest suit was the food. Excellent food for reasonable prices. We ate at the St. Louis cafe, crepery and the bakery. All were excellent. A nice touch was the connections between Bally's and Paris. We spent most our time gambling at Bally's. Hubby said Bally's reminded him of old Las Vegas. And the ride on the bus from Ballys to Rio was great! Friendly bus driver and speedy service. Overall a friendly, comfortable experience. We had fun!

Reviews.Title: “ok for the money”
Reviews.Author: socal4me
Reviews.Content: we stayed at Paris, Las Vegas for one night July 19, 2006. we had been at the Venetian for 3 nights. We were parked at Paris, and while walking around in Bellagio decided to stay an extra night. note the Venetian is an all suite hotel that cost $149/night. Paris was a basic room/bathroom at $99 night. We liked that the walk to the room did not feel like the 'mile or so trek' at the Venetian to our room in the Venezia tower. I thought the bathroom was ok, I enjoyed the deep soaking tub in the Venetian, Paris had a typical bathtub that feels like half a tub after being in a deep tub. both had separate shower areas. One sink in the bathroom (Venetian has two) and a magnifyer that was a little too high on the wall for me. I thought the room was ok. Bed was comfy, I compare everything to the Westin 'Heavenly Bed" and this was good, but not heavenly. though when sleeping I could detect a faint tobacco/cigarette aroma, probably someone stayed or visited this room and lit up, (though the room is on a non-smoking level). Upon checking out Thursday morning, I found out there were no batteries in the remote and decided just to do express checkout over the phone. all in all I liked Paris but am ready to try other hotels on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: lovenewengland
Reviews.Content: Late review, but then again, it was a late honeymoon! :) Stayed at the Paris for 4 days in January. Loved Vegas and staying at the Paris made our stay even better. Great room, though lacking in storage space. Services on ALL levels were great- concierge, staff, everything. My favorite part was the bathroom- huge and lovely soft lighting. It was really comfortable. The buffet rocks- but we loved the Creperie and the other restaurant (forgot the name, not the Eiffel Tower one) even more. We'll absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris”
Reviews.Author: Nidus
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed from July 8th to 13th at the Paris and we loved it. Booked at the Paris website - got great rate of $99 per night. Checked in near Baggage Carousel no 1 at the airport - very easy , no wait , used the $20 trick and the nice clerk upgraded us to view room at no extra cost per night. Lovely view of the strip, swimming pool , Eiffel Tower and Bellagio fountains. Great for keeping an eye on the kids when they were swimming. Pool a little cool, but good for doing laps once we were warmed up. Spas nicely secluded - rather warm. Pool nice and shady in the mornings. Wanted to try Le Village Buffet but lines too long. Instead had a couple of great buffets next door at the Aladdin spice market buffet -no lines and good food -lots of variety - you must try their creme brulee!!! Great crepes at le creperie- must try if you go- can take away and eat in your room - excellent chocolate crepe and seafood/savoury ones good too. Hope this reveiw will help. Found staff helpful and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: sunnnychick
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Paris July 16th & 17th. We've stayed at many strip hotels but never Paris so we decided to give it a try. We got a really great rate booking early. We checked in early on Sunday (The front desk staff were excellent) and upgraded to a LeMans suite. The room and the bathroom were both huge. The view wasn't great as we faced the parking garage but we were on the 22nd floor so that helped as we could see the mountains and the planes coming in. The room was huge and very clean. We found the bed to be very comfortable. The bellman, houskeeping staff and every other employee we came in contact with were all cheeful and helpful. The pool area was great. Plenty of lounge chairs and plenty of room in the pool. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants this trip but have eaten at Mon Ami Gabi and the Eiffel Tower Restaurant in the past and both are excellent. The views from the Eiffel Tower Restaurant at night are amazing, so romantic!

Reviews.Title: “intimate,convenient and cordial”
Reviews.Author: amishboy
Reviews.Content: stayed at the paris july 3rd - july 6th 2006. must say that this resort is very convenient to most attractions on the las vegas strip. the hotel itself is a smaller property than most of the other upscale resorts and i liked that feature very much. the paris has a reception counter at mccarren airport so you can check in there and receive your keys to your room if its ready. the agent at the paris check in was extremley nice and upgraded us to a P room which is called a premium room that is really like a mini suite that overlooks the bellagio hotel and fountains <what a view> we did not dine at the restaurants in paris but i must say they all looked so inviting. the pool area at this hotel was nice except that at 5pm when the crowds were winding down the area was left very messy. the hotel resembles old world paris especially in the shopping areas with the streets of cobblestone. the casino was small and convenient with very tight slot machines.!!!. all in all i do recommend this resort as a intimate, convenient, and pleasant mini vacation

Reviews.Title: “Just Average Not Worth the Extra Money”
Reviews.Author: princessdru76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from celebrating my 30th birthday. Being that it was a special occasion we decided to book a "nicer" hotel. This was our 4th time in Vegas and we previously stayed at Bally's,Treasure Island, and Luxor. Paris was not what we thought it would be. Just as stated in earlier reviews you had ridiculous lines for the buffet and cafe's. We ate at the breakfast buffet once because we decided to beat the crowd and went down at 6:45am. It was a bit pricey for breakfast and was decent but not worth the price. The cafe we finally got to eat at 3:00am since this was the only time there was not a line, it was okay but didn't have a great selection like some of the other hotels. The rooms were average and small. I've stayed at nicer Hampton Inns. The beds were not that comfortable. I have thick curly hair and had the most miserable time with their showers and lack of water pressure. I had read this was a problem in previous reviews and wish I would of listened. Not many $5 table games in the casino. For the amount of money it costs to stay at Paris save your money and stay at Luxor or Treasure Island. They have a better food selection, nicer rooms for less money.

Reviews.Title: “probably overpaid”
Reviews.Author: shot2pieces
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas from June 25 thru June 27. Our first two days were spent at Paris Las Vegas. We have stayed many times before and each time the experience gets just a little worse. I suspect this has to do with the Harrahs ownership. I had a "comped" room but was asked at checkin if I wanted to upgrade to a suite for only $65.00 a night extra. I did do it. Not worth the extra money. We had a view of bally's that i did not appreciate. Yes it was a big room but for the money it was not worth the extra money. Did not win any money the slots seemed really tight. I do like the propery and will probably stay again but it will never be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I both agreed that we like the ambiance of the casino the best of those that we had walked through. The casino was actually in the atmosphere versus just walking into this boring place with bright lights and no decorations. The hotel room was average - nothing super special but this isn't the Bellagio people so stop being so picky. I don't find that there was really anything to complain about the whole time we stayed there - people have noted the uncomfortable beds. I am a light sleeper and I thought that the beds were decent. I did, however, hate the comforter (scratchy and uncomfortable). Rooms were always cleaned and restocked and the hotel/casino staff was the friendliest I found out of the other casino/hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Save your money, go to the real Paris”
Reviews.Author: rachelbsn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to stay at the Paris after moving back from Europe. We knew it wasn't the real deal, but we wanted some of that ambience. Well, I can say this hotel is nothing like Paris. To begin, the room decor was very tired. Nothing appealing about it. My bathroom was dirty upon check-in, with some hair in the tub. On the second day I realized that there was a dirty glass in our bathroom. It was turned upside down with coke dripping from the bottom. I asked my husband if he got a coke out of the mini-bar and he said no. Apparently the housekeeper put a dirty glass in our room. I went to report it but the ceck-out lines were loooong. So I figured it would be picked up the next day. Nope! It sat there in all it's sticky glory the entire four day weekend. The food is horrible and over-priced. Nothing like France, although they try to make it sound like you're eating French cuisine. Sorry, but French toast isn't served in France. And they will seat you in the worst section if you don't ask for a particular spot. Twice we sat next to the kitchen and listened to plates dropping, employees yelling back and forth, and so on. On our last day at breakfast an employee came around spraying the tables and seats with chemicals and wiping them down right while we ate! He even did the same to a woman who was eating in her booth. He just went right on and started mopping down the seat opposite her in her booth. He didn't even bother to say "excuse me" or "sorry". We would have eaten at Denny's had we not had an early flight to catch. And speaking of, there are two Denny's on either side of the hotel about ten minutes each way. Better prices and food, sad to say. As you can see we were very disappointed with our stay and will not be back. Obviously this hotel is going downhill and the management doesn't seem to care.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but Vegas offers better”
Reviews.Author: kbendalin
Reviews.Content: Short review - The hotel and staff are fine. The beds, however, are very uncomfortable and the linens are cheap (like a Courtyard or budget hotel). There are too many other choices on the strip with better beds.

Reviews.Title: “All in all, a fine place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the posted reviews about Paris Las Vegas, I almost switched hotels. I'm glad I didn't! My room overlooking the lovely pool area (from the 25th floor) had a clear view of the Bellagio fountains across the Strip. We had some lucky breaks that could probably apply to almost any mega-hotel (remember, the Paris has almost 3,000 rooms so individualized service is not the name of the game here!). We arrived early afternoon - had no check-in lines and were able to get exactly the room we'd requested - high floor, non-smoking and king size bed. (I still can't believe a hotel in 2006 would not guarantee a non-smoking room, but Paris won't...they get big points off from me because of that!) Room was fine, bed was nice and firm (I can't stand a saggy mattress), bathroom very nice and clean....tv worked, wake-up call was on time...bellmen were most helpful as was the rest of the staff. Lost money in the casino, though (it was the only one I lost in - won at Venetian, Bally's and Bellagio...) Food was generally good to quite good in the brasserie, Mon ami Gabi. Look, Paris is a good value for the money. Are there nicer places? Sure...but you certainly pay the price. I'll stay there again next time unless I decide to shell out more for Bellagio or the Venetian.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Las Vegas- One of the Strip's Best Themed Property”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked two nights at using a discount that I received from a previous visit, I wasn't too excited as I had read some not so kind reviews from previous guests. I decided to try this for 2 nights and then move to New York New York. What a fool! The Paris Las Vegas is lovely. We were celebrating my daughter's 21st birthday and she kept walking around in awe of the ceiling art, the beautiful chandelier's ($32,000 each according to the reservation clerk) in the reservation area and the street artists. Although some of the French wording used throughout the resort might have been a little shaky grammatically, who cares! This is Vegas. Pros: *The pool was quite nice, contrary to popular opinion. Plenty of deck chairs and towels and quite a large area in which to spread out * Numerous choice of restaurants for all budgets. The buffet was quite good, although the line was very long (but did move fast), and much better than buffet at the Rio which was more expensive. Go about 11:00 am so you can have brunch. The Creperie was lovely for a quick snack or meal and the Bon Ami was delicious. *Room service was prompt and delicious. I advise calling and ordering via the telephone however as you will have a better choice than ordering via the television *The room itself was lovely. It was very clean and fresh and contained everything that we needed to enjoy our trip, including a coffee pot. *The location is perfect in the middle of the strip directly across from the Bellagio and next to the Aladdin Desert Passages for some fun, less expensive shopping. Cons: *We checked out after 2 days and moved to the New York New York Enjoy your Trip!

Reviews.Title: “Dining in Eiffel restaurant”
Reviews.Author: aussiewanderers
Reviews.Content: Just a warning that if you book a table at this hyper expensive restaurant (half way up the Eiffel Tower with a potentially great view of the Strip) during the afternoon, you will not see much of the view of the Strip if it is a sunny day. The reason is that the afternoon sun streams in the restaurant so they pull down window shades across the whole front of the restaurant to avoid the heat, and no one table can vary this as they are not individual window shades but massive things across multiple windows operated electrically. So even if you want to endure the heat for the sake of the view, you do not have that choice. They don't raise the shades until the sun sets behind the Bellagio across the street at, I would estimate, about an hour before sunset. Everything else about the restaurant is excellent however, including of course exquisite food. However, the pricing is only worth it for the view, and if you book at night, you have less chance of getting a window table. The views are not so great from other tables.So go for the hour before sunset! If you want the best view of the Bellagio fountains (every 15 mins), ask for a window table in the north west corner. Bon appetite.

Reviews.Title: “loved the paris”
Reviews.Author: skoala
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Sunday June 18th at 9AM. We checked in and I really figured we would have to store our bags with them but they had a room available. I didn't ask for anything special since I was just happy to get a room this early. The room was very nice. A big bathroom with a separate tub and shower-very nice. It was a great room. We had stayed at Bally's last year and it was fine, but this was much nicer. I really liked the feel of the Paris. We left the room to just walk around. I keep wanting to eat at their buffet but there is always a line. It would be nice if they would let hotel guests make reservations for the buffet. We changed our connection card to the Total Rewards card. I must say every employee of the hotel that we came in contact with was extremely pleasant to us and we are not high rollers. We ate at Mon Ami for supper that night and it was good but not super. We saw the Price is Right on Tuesday and since we were hotel guests our tickets were only $33 instead of $44. It was a fun show. We were checking out on Tuesday and we called for late check out and they said no problem for 1:00PM. I also like that Paris and Bally's are connected. We liked the Paris casino. We also went to Alladin and it was a very short walk. You can not beat the location of Paris. Everything was so close and you could walk everywhere. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It was great”
Reviews.Author: iflewjetz
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Paris from June 20 thru the 23. We came from Honolulu on the red eye and arrived too early to check in at the airport. We arrived at the hotel at about 8:30 am and the staff was great. It is about a $12 cab ride. The girl at check- in was very helpful. I asked if I could get a Bellagio view up on a high floor. And could I please get a "P" room I have heard about so much. She looked and said the only P room was on the 8th floor overlooking the Bellagio, but she could get me a regular room on the 24th floor. I opted for the 24th floor. She was very appologetic that it wasnt ready. I told her I wasnt even expecting it to be open before 3:00PM but we were very tired. She took my number and called when it was ready, at 10:30 am. I was more than excited. I am not sure of the service the other people received, but mine was incredible. We went to have breakfast before our rooms were ready and went to the pool area and camped out on a deck chair and relaxed before we got in the room. It was not crowded at all. It was about 100 degrees though. We watched the fountain show alot from our room. You can only open these little vents and could sometimes hear the music. The view from the room was incredible. Great view of the Eiffle tower, Bellagio, Caesars, and the West Mountains. We did the Eiffle Tower ride to the top, sounds cheesy but was very worth it. We did it at night and it was great. We showed our room key and got up there for $4.50 each. 2 adults and one child. We ate at one restaurant at night on the front of the hotel on the strip. I think it was Mon Ami Gambi, it was great. Not too pricey, great service. If you can get an outside seat, you get a great view of the Bellagio. The room was nothing spectacular and the beds were hard, which is the only reason I gave it a 4. Staff was great. They didnt charge me for an upgrade. We had room 2403. I would reccomend it to anyone going, but expect hard beds.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was Magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: mrandmrsnyc
Reviews.Content: FIrst off, I'd like to say that we have stayed at the Venetian, Aladdin and Bellagio but this was by far the best experience of all. Our stay was from Mon June 19 to Fri June 23. Check-in was smooth ... We were able to upgrade to a Calais suite on the second to highest floor (32) overlooking the Bellagio fountains and Eiffel Tower and pool ... absolutely marvelous view and beautiful room. We were so happy we did that. It was so comfortable. We had a living room with dining table, wet bar and mini fridge, coffee maker and coffee (delicious), his and her bathrooms which my wife loved and jacuzzi tub. Cleaning service was great. The pool was great - it was cool to be hanging out and swimming at the foot of the Eiffel Tower. I used the fitness center each day and was very satisfied. After that it was straight to the pool from about 9am to only 12 noon each day since it was super hot (100 to 110 degrees each day). As far as dining goes, the Mon Ami Gabi steak restaurant was awesome. The Creperie was great and the Boulangerie also. One time we ordered room service and we were very impressed with the quality of the food. I felt The replica of the Paris streets was very impressive, the storefronts and cafes felt authentic. As far as the casino goes, I loved the atmosphere and the mini cabaret shows they have going around. They also had a great live band playing. The Eiffel Tower ride to the top was fun, got to the top, saw the strip, the lights ... beautiful. The other hotels we stayed at on other occasions did not compare to the Paris. Our next stay will be at the Paris ... I think we found our home in LV. Vive la France !

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful view & location for the money!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at the Paris Hotel in Las Vegas. My husband and I stayed here on June 18 through June 21, 2006. We arrived a couple hours early for check-in so we checked in our luggage at the curb and went to lunch. By the time we were finished with lunch we went to the key pick up window and picked up our room key. The room was extremely clean and we had a great view of the pool, Eiffel Tower, strip, and Bellagio water show. The non-smoking premier view room was worth the money and the hotel location is excellent!!! We received great service from everyone at the hotel and restaurants. We'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Oui....oui....we loved Paris!”
Reviews.Author: compassquest
Reviews.Content: Oui...we really loved the ambience of Paris. Have stayed in many other strip hotels, but I think this is the first time that the experience could make you forget for abit that you were in Vegas. We stayed in a premier view room on the 28th floor. Excellent views of the Eiffel Tower and Bellagio fountains. I would have like bigger windows so we could have seen more of the view. First impression was that the tapestry type bed covers seemed at bit worn, but they were sparkling clean, there was triple sheeting and the beds were extremely comfortable. The bath was large with a separate tub and glassed in shower. Large vanity and everything was again sparkling. Lunch at Mon Ami Gabi was fabulous! Do not miss the Lemon Drop martini. I don't drink much and loved it! The breakfast buffet is superb ! Lots of French kitsch, but you will like it.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I always check tripadvisor before I go on vacation and was a little concerned about some of the reviews of the hotel. I had a nursing conference to attend @ the Hilton and didn't want to be so far off the strip. While at the Paris I took the Monorail that is located at back entrance to Bally's to go between the hotels. I highly recommend the monorail for getting around, it was relatively inexpensive and quite fast. The people working the front desk were very helpful, didn't encounter any attitude that you hear about.The room was located at end of long hall but I didn't mind the walk, it was so quiet(which was really nice) The only noise I had to worry about was myy 22 yo son and husband coming in at thw wee hours of the morning. I'd certainly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Paris and the Ambience of the Hotel/Casion”
Reviews.Author: Sheryll
Reviews.Content: We had two nights staying at The Paris Hotel before moving over to the Wynn Hotel. I was really pleased with the hotel, whilst check in and check out queues were long, the ambience of the Hotel and the restuarants and shops was almost like being in Paris (if you have not been to Paris you will love it). The cobblestone walkways, the resaurants were very good value and the buffett breakfast was wonderful (it was much better than the more expensive one we had a few days later at The Wynn Hotel). The rooms were well appointed and the bathroom quite large, bath and shower. Our room overlooked the strip and we were able to see and hear The Belligio Fountains each night. I would certainly stay here again as it was good value for money and whilst The Wynn was superior in presentation of rooms etc, this hotel was equal in service and in fact better with the buffett and other standard meals at a more realistic price. Would recommend to singles, couples and also families as very good value, also nice and close to monorail and bus stops in case you dont want to walk. Highly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “tired”
Reviews.Author: Lemon1
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Paris Las Vegas in June. It was a basic room, but we expected a lot more from Paris LV. The bedspread and curtains were tired looking and the bed swayed in the middle. The bathroom tile was cracked in several places, but it was kept clean and the towels were thick. The water pressure wasn't enough to get my short hair rinsed and I don't know how anyone with long hair would manage it. With the cash the casinos are making, we expected a more luxurious experience from this hotel. Definitely will not go back to this one!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there June 5-6. It was our second visit. If you want to be away from the big hotels but still have the Vegas feel. this is the place. Nice room and bathroom ( poor view ). Only real complaint was the poor choice of cable tv channels. Great staff and good friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel check-in at airport”
Reviews.Author: hapf
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Las Vegas on May 26 , & after getting our bagaage, went to the the Harrah's desk to check-in to Paris. There was 3 people behind the desk handling check-in for all the Harrah hotels. After standing on a long line for 10 minutes, we realized that the line had not moved at all. Gave up & took a taxi to Paris where there was no line whatsoever. We have gone to Vegas every year for the past 12 years. & stay in either Paris, Caesar, Bally's, or Aladdin. Rooms in all of them are satisfactory, as are the hotels, though I prefer Caesar. After playing the slots in Paris, it became obvious that Harrah's has tightened the slots. I don't expect to win, but I don't expect $20 in quarters to last 5 minutes.This happened too many times to be bad luck. I mentioned this to a Paris employee who replied " Welcome to Harrahs" We gambled in several other casinos & experienced normal results, some wins & some losses. Paris buffet was great as always. The one in Bellagio has slipped both in service & in quality. Saw Hairspray & Mama Mia & loved them both.

Reviews.Title: “the worst towels”
Reviews.Author: That'sMyOpinion
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the worst towels I have ever experienced. Thin, grey and very, very, scratchy. Downey is not that expensive, people! Holiday Inn Express has nicer towels. Shameful to call this a top notch hotel. It is not. It's nice, but make sure you get a good rate because if you are paying top dollar, you are being ripped off. The housekeeping staff did a very fine job, I applaud them. They deserve a good tip, our room was done up promptly, with not a crumb in sight. The pool is quite nice if you love earsplitting music with sometimes vulgar lyrics, and not an umbrella in sight. It was 105 degress in the shade and no umbrellas at the pool. Yikes!! The spa reception staff seems young and inexperienced. A few more people skills seminars are in order. They were not rude, just inexperienced, in my opinion. We did not dine here, nothing seemed especially appealing. This hotel seems to attract large groups of young people from Southern California (there was no doubt where they were from, they let it be known loud and clear) who also need some people skills. This is not the Venetian or The Bellagio, so make sure you get a cheap room to make up for it's shortcomings.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: ThatBlondeChick
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas a few times (Aladdin and Mirage). I stayed at Paris for a conference and because of that we got a great rate. Paris has check-in available at the airport which was so handy. Paris has the shortest trek through the casino to the hotel elevators. Our room (with a view of the Bellagio water cannons and the Strip) was quite comfortable. The pool is huge but the pool deck gets kind of crowded during the day. The music they pipe in at the pool gets louder and more heavy rock as the day goes on. By 5pm it's intolerable. Perhaps it's meant to drive people away and into the casino? I thought this hotel was great value and great location. We really enjoyed the coffee and pastry shop near the elevators. We also enjoyed our dinner at Mon Ami Gabi - it's the only streetside restaurant on the strip. The misters were lovely and people watching was fun. Good food and service throughout the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Middle of the road”
Reviews.Author: SDLane
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews on Trip Advisor, I felt a mixture of apprehension and excitement about staying at the Paris LV for five days and five nights. This is definitely a mixed review. We reserved a room with a king bed, but upon checking in, the clerk said they had none; only two doubles. A king bed was in a suite and an extra $85 per night, and facing the Bellagio fountain was another $135 a night for a better suite. I found this unbelievable - since we checked in on a Monday night and there weren't THAT many people milling around, compared to Friday and Saturday when the place was teeming with guests. Since my husband was there for business, his company allowed us the upgrade to the suite for $85 extra. It faced the parking garage, but the mountians in the distance were beautiful, and at night there were still thousands of lights to look at. The bathroom was beautiful, with a bidet and his/her sinks and a jacuzzi tub for two with a separate shower. There was a separate dressing area with vanity table; a sitting area which was nice and the chairs were comfortable, the bed was comfy and there was a wetbar. But it was still just okay - one curtain was ripped, vanity table was scratched and watermarked, bathroom doors had black smudges on them, one towelholder by the sink was broken, the toilet wobbled, and the faucet at the wetbar dripped consistently until I made a tourniquet out of a hand towel and shut it good - for $500, you must be joking. The first day of housekeeping, all that was done was the bed was made and we had new towels. No straightening up, vacuuming, nothing. Next day housekeeping forgot our room altogether. I called and it was cleaned while we went to dinner. I was able to use the jacuzzi tub, which was wonderful, but then it was never cleaned out so I could use it again and I just didn't care enough to call. The water pressure was okay, but not if you have thick hair. BUT... the staff was friendly and helpful, the croissants, gelato, pain aux chocolat and sandwiches (even the coffee) was delicious in the two pastry shops, and the buffet was excellent (it was almost 11 but everything was still fresh at that time). The pool was wonderful, ample towels and space and the waitresses were quick with the drinks and poolside menu. We rented a cabana on our last day which was nice, because a VERY rowdy crowd was having a bachelor/bachelorette party and we had a very nice, smoke-free quiet spot to relax away from it all. I was there most days and it was very enjoyable. In my opinion, the shops left a bit to be desired compared to other hotels (Caesars, Bellagio, etc.). Small, with not much selection. The children's shop was very cute. Also, the Paris is connected to Bally's which is right by the outside escalators to bring you across the street to Bellagio or Caesars, so if it is too hot for you, you can walk through Bally's and keep out of the heat a bit longer. It is a very pretty hotel and the Eiffel Tower is magnificent. I went to the salon one day to get my hair blown out and deep conditioned and it was a whopping $128 (including tax and included gratuity). Since my hair was long, they charged $80 to blow it out. It looked wonderful, but I didn't want to spend my money on getting it done again. So all in all it was just middle of the road. Truth be told, the best meals and the best times we had were at Caesar's Palace, so next time, we'll stay there.

Reviews.Title: “RUDE staff, will never return. Too many other better choices!”
Reviews.Author: beachmomri
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris May 5 - 9, 2006. This was our 4th trip - we have previously stayed at TI, Bellagio and Mandalay. The front desk staff were civil, but far from welcoming. There were 3 couples and we asked for rooms near each other. We ended up on the same floor, but in 3 different wings. Not a big deal, since the one thing I did like about this hotel is that it's never a really loooong walk to the elevator from your room like it can be at the Bellagio. The elevators are in the middle and the 4 wings radiate out. The one thing we were really anticipating was the rooftop pool. Being Sex and the City fans, we imagined ourselves sunning at the pool overlooking the Strip. Well, rooftop means on top of the first floor casino, and you aren't seeing anything of the Strip. Should have done more research on that one, but to bill that boring pool as rooftop is a complete misnomer. Also, don't expect to get a drink anytime soon from the pool waitresses. The quickest way we found was to go to the bar ourselves, bring our drinks back, only to have one magically appear and yell at us for getting our own. The casino and restaurant area is dark and closed in - seemed like very low ceilings that made the whole area feel claustrophobic. Paris is connected to Bally's through the shops area. The casino staff practiced disinterest and rudeness continuously. The food was acceptable - the buffet was one of the best we have tried, especially the breakfast. The quality and variety were hard to beat. The staff, again, with a few exceptions, was never welcoming and just plain rude. The health club/spa was nicely appointed, but they charge $25 per day for access, which I thought was a bit much. We all got massages and my masseuse was the first friendly person I encountered there, as well as giving a fabulous massage. With so many choices on the Strip, I wish we had picked a friendlier place to stay. The rooms were of an acceptable size, some of the views are indeed incredible, but there is nothing to separate this place from many others save for the extreme rudeness of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Au revoir Paris! Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Paris Hotel over Memorial Day Weekend. The only reason being that we would stay on a busy weekend is because it was our 10th Anniversary. I was excited about staying at the Paris Hotel. I had even read some of the negative reviews before booking, but I had my heart set on staying there. We arrived early at the hotel and tried to check in early. We also were informed that the hotel was overbooked and would we like to stay at the Bally's for a discounted fee. The discount wasn't anything worthwhile. I said, "It's our 10th anniversary and I really wanted to stay at the hotel." We declined and the clerk (rude) dismissed us and said check in is at 3:00. In the meantime we checked our baggage and hung around the hotel. We ended up making our nightime show plans since we had time to kill. We booked three shows thru the hotel. The show clerk for The Price is Right ended up booking our seats not next to each other but one on each side of the aisle. We found that out at showtime. Ridiculous!! Since it was 2:15ish I saw all these people lining up to check in and the hotel was indeed checking people in. We dealt with someone in the platinum member line. He was actually much friendlier and talked us into an upgrade to a suite. It's twice the size of the regular rooms and has a whirlpool tub. The suite was small and I wondered what a regular room would have been like. And the suite overlooked the parking garage. Save your money and don't upgrade. I think someone else said that too! Upon getting to our suite and getting settled. I need an iron. The one in the room was broken and dripping water everywhere on my clothes. So I called housekeeping and asked for a new one and some extra pillows. The guy came up promptly and sat the pillows on the bed and was starting to walk off with the iron. I said, " I asked for the iron too." He said, "No this is for another room." I said, " I have a broken iron." He left it rudely. 5 minutes later, same guy at the door to deliver pillows. Geez! Overall the encounter with people working here made it disappointing, cuz nobody wants to deal with rude people on their vacation. We will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible View”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris for two nights earlier this week. We did not upgrade, but had an incredible corner room (Room 2598p). One window had a perfect view of the Bellagio fountain & the other south down the strip & the Eiffel Tower. Breakfast at Cafe St Louis was fair. Roberto at check in was great. He did not pressure us to upgrade & gave us this fabulous view (celebrating our 12th anniversary). Housekeeping seems to be the only problem. We were out from 9:00 to 4:00 & our room still was not cleaned. They ended up cleaning after we went out again for the night Shaving cream in the bath tub from the morning was not cleaned. AND in the drawer of the nightstand was Prep H, KY Jelly and food wrappers from a previous guest. Other than that... a great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Paris Las Vegas - Worst Hotel experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: acetopper
Reviews.Content: Having been to Las Vegas before, I was very excited to be staying at the Paris Las Vegas on this trip. The hotel is absolutely beautiful and gives you the feel of being in Paris. However this excitement quickly faded upon check in. Keep in mind I booked my trip for Memorial Day weekend 2006 in December 2005 which included paying for a full night as a deposit when I made the reservation. However when I went to check in, the extremely rude desk clerk (probably the rudest person I have ever encountered at a hotel) told me that the Paris Las Vegas was overbooked and my reservation had been moved to the much lower quality Bally's Las Vegas hotel next door. When I asked the desk clerk how they could possibly do this since I had booked the room 6 months ago and already paid for one night to hold the room, she told me that they can do what they want and it does not matter what deposit I paid or when I reserved the room. She also told me that the airlines overbook flights all the time and bump people off flights and the Paris Las Vegas does the same. So as a result of the fact that I am not a high roller and don't lose thousands of dollars at their hotel I was moved to the much older and much less nice Bally's Las Vegas. I could not have been more disappointed as I was really looking forward to staying at the Paris Las Vegas. In addition to the problems with the room, I found the staff at the Paris Las Vegas to be extremely rude. We ate at the restaurant Mon Ami Gabi (inside the Paris Las Vegas) and stood at the hostess stand for approximately 5 minutes while the 3 hostesses talked amongst themselves before they even acknowledged us, even though I tried to interrupt them. Additionally, the staff at the check in desk was some of the rudest I have ever encountered. Never once did they apologize for situation and were completely unsympathetic. Based on this experience I will definitely never stay at the Paris Las Vegas or any of the related properties owned by Caesar's Entertainment, including Bally's Las Vegas, Rio, Caesars Palace, the Flamingo, and Harrah's. Never have I been treated so rudely by hotel staff. If you are looking for a hotel where the staff ignores you and treats you rudly and you are a risk taker and want to take a chance that you won't have a room once you arrive at the hotel, then the Paris Las Vegas is definitely for you!

Reviews.Title: “Rudest staff I have ever encountered (even in the real Paris !)”
Reviews.Author: Huftycat
Reviews.Content: I spent a weekend at the Paris with friends, the culmination of schoolgirl promises that we would one day 'do Vegas', some 20 years after leaving school ! The hotel public areas were lovely, and really well done and the room itself was comfortable and clean. The buffet was at best mediocre, and I'd recommend the Spice Buffet at the Aladdin next door, which was cheaper and better. This probably doesn't sound too bad. However, I've left the worst until last. The staff were just apalling, from the check in clerk who tried to pressure us into a $60 per night upgrade and was incredibly abrupt when we turned this down to the room service people with no understanding of the 'service' concept whatsoever. All staff, with the honorable exception of the porter, claimed to have difficulty understanding my English accent. They were just as rude to my American friend, though. This is not what I would expect from a cheap B&B, let alone a 4* hotel. They clearly don't depend on any repeat business. And they certainly won't be getting any from me.

Reviews.Title: “Paris - loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mlf
Reviews.Content: Arrived and did airport check in. One couple in front of us – waited less than 3 minutes. Girl at counter was super nice and friendly. We received an incredible rate by using Paris’ website best rate guarantee. She looked at us quizzically and said that there was a note saying we requested two beds and a smoking room. I said with a smile that would not work because it was an anniversary trip. She said congratulations and then said she would upgrade us to a nice view. We ended up in 2745 (?) and the room was sufficient but we did look out on the Bellagio Fountains – which was a really nice treat. As other posters have mentioned – the bathrooms are big and spacious. You do have a tub separate from a shower. Great to toss wet towels and bathing suits into. Other posters have said how rude and unfriendly the staff is. My husband lost his wallet the first night there – what a disaster! But the Paris staff was so kind and helpful! Concierge, front desk and security were all wonderful. And no, he never found it. Plus, the women who cleaned our room kept it super clean. I was in the room one day when she was cleaning the bathroom and I was amazed – I don’t think I spend that much time when I clean my own bathroom Had dinner at Ah Sin in Paris. Super delicious and not ridiculously expensive. Got sandwiches to go at the little sandwich shop. They were good. Only got them out of convenience – wouldn’t make a trip to go there- but would return. The pool was fine although as a sun worshipper, I did have to move around quite a bit to keep in the sun. The Eiffel Tower does get in the way. The misters to keep you cool are a nice touch. We met up with friends at Rio’s pool later in the week and it was a complete change! Multiple pools, big bar scene, DJ spinning tunes, young lovelies dancing about in bikinis. It was a fun change but glad I had my boring and shade spotty Paris pool to return to After visiting pretty much every hotel/casino on the strip I was very pleased in our choice of Paris. It was a little smaller and more personal/intimate than many of the other locations. Yes – I would love to stay at Bellagio, but for the money we paid we got an incredible deal! We will definitely stay here on our return!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't agree more...this Paris isn't enchanting.”
Reviews.Author: Eclipse827
Reviews.Content: I am extremely disappointed in the rude and inempt staff. Beware of strange practices at check-in to get you to upgrade. What are they doing? Having an employee contest? There were $50 in charges on my bill for copies from the printer in my room. No prices were posted. At $450 a night, doesn't that alone qualify for the consideration of an upgrade and isn't the printer an amenity of the room? After checking out to await my flight home with no where to sit inside, I took respite on a bench outside. Security told me to move along as if I was a vagrant. When I asked them where people wait, they told me most go directly to the airport. If you aren't spending money, you can't stay. Welcome to Paris. Truly a sad and ungratifying experience.

Reviews.Title: “Paris--Okay for Mid-Strip”
Reviews.Author: Aloha_29
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris Hotel 5/14-5/18. If you can get a decent rate like we did via their website (AAA rate of $98.00 per night) and want to stay someplace mid-strip, then this hotel is fine. The rooms are clean, quiet, and have a nice bathroom with a separate shower. The hotel is smaller than others, in which we liked the convenience of a short walk from the elevator to the taxi in front of the lobby. However, compared to other hotels we have stayed at in Las Vegas (Venetian, Mirage, MGM Grand, Luxor), Paris was our least favorite. Not many restaurant choices at the Paris. JJ's Boulangerie had reasonably priced breakfast specials, as well as pastries, soups, salads, and sandwiches, but prepared to fight for tables--not many available. The Paris buffet was the worst buffet we've eaten at, not many food choices for our tastes, especially at $25 pp for dinner. During our visit we saw the 'O' at Bellagio, an excellent show that I highly recommend; La Cage was very good (female impersonator show); 'KA' at MGM Grand was boring--not worth the money; and the Ron Lucas show at Rio was okay (would have liked it better if not family-friendly). We also toured the Shark Reef at Mandalay Bay and enjoyed it very much. A gonola boat ride inside the Venetian was fun. If you like lounge bands, go to Madalay Bay to see "Groove Kitty." They used to be the house band at MGM. They're an excellent 'all female' band. After visiting Vegas 5 times in the last 6 years, I'm pretty well Vegased Out. If we ever go back, we'd like to stay at Madalay Bay next time.

Reviews.Title: “good but I've seen better”
Reviews.Author: ScttLee
Reviews.Content: Great location, very good staff, clean rooms. Overall, the place is very noisy with a lot of background roar. Restaurants, except Eiffel Tower and Mon Ami gabi, were also very noisy. The two restaurants mentions are quiet, have good food, but expensive. The bed was getting soft and uncofortable. Pillows fluff nice, but ar flat with no support. I like to lay around a pool during the day, but their pool was very basic and not that good. It was accessable by the elevator, and you do not have to walk through a casino to get to it. Overall I do not recommend this hotel because of value for price.

Reviews.Title: “This Paris isn't enchanting”
Reviews.Author: KathiHBCali
Reviews.Content: I just attended a conference at the Paris Hotel and Casino. The room was very nice, however the facility appears to be understaffed. Coffee and water service at the conference were inadequate -- serving pieces seemed to always be empty. The food services at the hotel grossly understaffed and everything, (the cafes, bakery, buffet) had long lines day and night. Just buying a cup of coffee was a minimum wait of 10-15 minutes. The convenience store in the hotel is so cramped that only 2 people can stand near the counter and the line was always 6+ people deep. The facility has plenty of shops, without many shoppers, but each staffed with a sales person. Maybe they could redirect some of the staffing out of the retail stores and into guest services. Conference price for the room was $150 per night, but I got a $119 rate via the Paris website -- so if you are going there for a function, take the time to check alternative booking options.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive hotel/casino”
Reviews.Author: Teramo48
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights during a professional conference. Overall I enjoyed my stay, but there were a few things I disliked. The room was great--spacious with comfortable bedding and large marble bath with shower and tub! I didn't like the $1.25 charge to access an 800 number. The hotel was so busy it was hard to get served a meal during normal meal times. The vegetarian crepe from the Creperie was awful--the filling was cold and the crepe was covered in some beige goo. The pool was wonderful--large with abundant chaises. The hotel/casino was much more interesting than many of the other Vegas establishments. I used the same path to and from the conference sessions, so it was enjoyable to pretend I was walking along a Parisian street. Much better than Bally's where the only sights were a casino and hotel desk. The Sidewalk Cafe at Bally's had a slighter cheaper breakfast than the restaurant at Paris--especially the great Boulevard Sampler. (Bally's and Paris are interconnected so I avoided the 100 degree temperature outside.)

Reviews.Title: “Highly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ksongaddict
Reviews.Content: If you want to truly experience rude staff and desk clerks, then by all means, I recommend the Paris Hotel for your vacation. We normally stay at the MGM everytime we go to Vegas (because we normally get lucky at their casino) but this year, we said "let's try somewhere different!". Boy, did we make a mistake. We choose Paris because of the location and the reasonable deal offered by Expedia. Upon checking in, we were told that the non-smoking rooms we requested are not available and the only rooms they have left are all smoking rooms! My aunt has health issues and being in an enclosed room with cigarette smoke is a big problem. We had booked all four rooms as non-smoking but our main concern was our aunt so we asked the desk clerk to find at least just one room for her and were told there's nothing they can do. We then asked if a non-smoking suite is available and we would just pay for the upgrade and again was told no without even checking. We then asked the clerk what other options are available and she said go to another hotel! It was already around 9 o'clock at night and the last thing we want to do is go look for another hotel after a long day. We asked to speak to a manager because I know that hotels always keep some rooms available for their VIPs who might drop in unexpectly (my friend is a hotel manager in San Francisco). The desk clerk refused and instead said she will talk to the manager for us and see if there's anything. She came back about 15 minutes later and said the best they can do is to comp us for a free breakfast buffet and offered to switch our rooms to non-smoking the next day. At that point we were all tired and without any options so we took it and hope that our aunt would be okay for the night. That leads me to the buffet the following morning. We had to get up early because we technically have to check out of our smoking rooms and check back in to our non-smoking ones. Another big disappointment. There was not a whole of selections and the service was horrible. Rude is the only word to describe them. In fact, that's the one word that keeps repeating throughout the entire Paris Hotel experience. Needless to say, we would not go back to that hotel again due to the rudeness of the staffs . The only saving grace is that the hotel itself is very nice and the hotel rooms and bathrooms are decent.

Reviews.Title: “Look out Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jmace57
Reviews.Content: This is really an indictment of ALL of the Vegas strip, rather than just the Paris Hotel. The hotel was nice. The rooms were adequate - nice bathrooms. However, the room was expensive...but consistent with the rest of the strip hotels. Las Vegas is going to price itself out of existence if they don't watch it. This will be my last trip there. From $9.50 hamburgers to an $11 elevator ride (to the top of the fake "Eiffel Tower", it just doesn't make sense. It was crowded and noisy and trashy (literally and figuratively). The trafffic is unbelievable. We gave up on taking cabs to any location, no matter how far the walk was. We met three other couples there, all of whom have been to Vegas numerous times. All of us agreed that it will be our last trip there. One exception! The Danny Gans show at the Mirage is worth every penny - excellent. Jim

Reviews.Title: “Loved Paris”
Reviews.Author: Lederhosen Larry
Reviews.Content: I've been coming to Las Vegas for conventions since 1990, so I've stayed at just about every major Strip hotel. I convinced my wife (her last visit was in '89, she hated it) to give Vegas another try for my 49th birthday (it helped I got Celine tickets). We stayed at Paris and got the upgrade to get the view of the Strip, which included the Eifel Tower, the pool and the Bellagio fountains. We were up on the 20th floor, had a great room, fabulous view. We used the Ambassador check-in feature, which means you call in 2 hours before check-in, get to the head of the line and into your room with no fuss, Great concept. As we headed down the hall to the elevators, we stopped at the pastry shop for some killer French pastries to take the edge off our hunger before dinner. We took a box of them home the next day, they were so good!. We walked to Caesar's for dinner and the show, came back over to the Bellagio for gelato and a couple of the fountain shows, back over to the Paris casino for some table fun and then off to dreamland. A very romantic evening and a very nice stay. The service all arouind was efficient, courteous, and prompt. We asked for extra pillows and got them in 5 minutes. Nicely appointed room with overstuffed chairs and a table by the window, great for enjoying the view. Great selection of toiletiries in the bathroom, huge shower separate from the tub, which most Vegas rooms don't have. My wife says to plan on her coming next year! BTW- I thought Celine's show was fantastic, this coming from a guy who wouldn't be caight dead listening to her in the car. What a performance. It helped we have 2nd row, center seats. Hint... pay the extra $25 to join her club, you get preferential seating...

Reviews.Title: “Paris- great place!”
Reviews.Author: seeceil
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paris from May 1st - May 5th, with my husband and father. The location was perfect, right in the center of the strip, which made it possible for us to walk in either direction to see the sights. It's also very close to a handful of older casinos which are more our preference as far as gambling (friendlier slots!). There were mostly business people staying there, which for us was fine (we're in our early 50's). It wasn't a rowdy party crowd that you might encounter elsewhere. We spent most of the day exploring the strip, and by the end of the day would end up at Bally's casino, which is very conveniently located through the cobblestone walkway connected to Paris. The lounges and restaurants at both Paris and Bally's were great. The room was great, #1890, beautiful view, great bathroom, good water pressure. The beds are pretty flat, but clean and comfortable enough. There weren't any problems with noise from the strip or the elevators. Room service was fast and friendly. The size of the hotel is just right, it's easy to navigate. I would definitely stay there again- if I ever get back there! The flight from Florida's a long one!

Reviews.Title: “I Love Paris in the Springtime”
Reviews.Author: karebear1981
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just spent 4 days at Paris Las Vegas, and loved it. We ended up getting a GREAT rate using their Best Rate Guarantee. We checked in at the airport, and got a strip view (I thought we'd get stuck looking at homeless people or something). The room was nice - a good size, good climate and the bathroom was very spacious. Also, the elevators are really fast and you don't have to wait long to catch one! The maid was cute and friendly and she double stocked all the shampoo and stuff, because there were two of us. We had a really nice stay and I recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “As good as the Venetian !”
Reviews.Author: jopinky
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paris for 6 nights from 17-23rd April. Checked in at the airport and upgraded to a premier view room. We were not disappointed.!! We had a room on 22nd floor and it was fantastic. My husband and I both rated this hotel to be on par with the Venetian where we stayed for a week last March. Although the Venetian rooms are slightly bigger and fancier, the Paris would win me over every time now and I loved the Venetian ! The room was very clean and spacious and we had daily maid service and replenishment of towels and toiletries. We ordered room service breakfast on two days and the food was lovely and hot and the service was excellent. I used the Mandara Spa whilst we we're there and it was wonderful. Its pricey but you get what you pay for. I had a back massage, back cleanse, facial and pedicure and used the facilities and it was $450. We also used the pool as we had excellent weather and it was great. Lots of space and sunbeds and lovely surroundings coupled with excellent waitress service while you sunbathed. The casino was also a winner for us, very light and airy. Great slots and excellent drinks service both on the slots and on the tables. The tables had quite high limits sometimes so we ventured to Barbary Coast some days and even down to the Sahara which was excellent. We ate at the Cafe De Paris which was good on both occassions, at the buffet for dinner once which was excellent and also in the Steakhouse which was FANTASTIC. We had steak and lobster and the evening was very memorable. The snack bars/coffee shops in the Paris are also excellent. No complaints whatsoever on the food front. I could only make 3 complaints about our stay and they really are very minor and silly: 1. The windows really needed cleaning. it didnt spoil the view but when you pay extra for a view the windows ought to be clean 2. The shower isnt very powerful 3. We got charged for a couple of things on the room which were not ours but this was resolved very quickly with no problems by the hotel The Paris overall was absolutely wonderful. It seems smaller than both the Luxor and Venetian where we have stayed before and we liked that. Its just got it right. The atmosphere and location for me can only be beaten by Caesars but the Paris is just better value for money. I wouldnt spend lots on a lake view room in the Bellagio as you can get this at the Paris. I would stay there again without a doubt !

Reviews.Title: “Not Improving With Age”
Reviews.Author: GRGADA
Reviews.Content: My wife stayed here in the past and after staying at other hotels during the NAB Convention, we thought we would try Paris. Our mistake. Like others, when we checked in we found "our room" was not available but another room was offered. We took it. We were told we could get an upgrade to a mini-suite for something like $85 more a night. We declined. After signing reservation card, we were told that if we didn't like our room, we could come back and get a better room (view, size, location) for an additional $60 per night. Room was so-so on 11th foor. Room seemd smaller than the room stayed in before... carpet was stained... windows dirty (outside)... old cigarette boxes and matches were found in room although it was a non-smoking floor. Bathroom was large and the nicest part of the stay. Although, as mentioned, this was a non-smoking floor, we found a woman sitting by elevator using cell phone,,, while smoking. We had to pass by her. Crowds are expected and waits too. We ate at Ballys Buffet one morning ($12.95) and this was very good. We love J’s Boulangerie and always have dessert there. This time, we also had breakfast there one morning. Would I go back? Not likely.... too bad there are not more Hilton properties on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Was Okay!!”
Reviews.Author: MilitaryMom65
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris Hotel April 12th - 17th. The check in went very smoothly. They do ask if you would like a view and if so you need to pay extra. You could also upgrade to a suite for more money. We took our room on the 12th floor, it was a very nice room. I loved the bathroom, the tub and shower were separate. I used the Spa for a swedish massage. It was a very nice 50 minutes. I had a crepe for the very first time. It was delicious, they also had dessert crepes that looked wonderful. There is a little cafe shop with cafe mocha's and wonderful pastry..The Paris was a very busy place. The carosel bar in the middle of Paris is great. They have some very nice bartenders(Lilli). I have to say I liked the Paris but would go back to the Mirage to stay. The comps at the Mirage are much better. We gambled alot and got hardly anything comped to us. It was a very pricey Hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and beautiful lobby.”
Reviews.Author: Melanie3979
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here for two nights (April 21st and 22nd) and we were impressed with the hotel. The location is fantastic - smack in the middle of the Strip. The staff was helpful and check in was not difficult. The lobby is gorgeous - cobblestone flooring (attempting to mimic the streets of Paris) and faux storefronts with lit windows. Lots of interesting gift shops and random places to eat and drink... including a creperie vendor, mmmm. Our room was fine - nice and large, not a great view but not horrible either.
