Bathroom was fine too - although one friend complained of the lack of a coffee maker in the room. Hairdryer was fantastic though! On Saturday morning at 11am, the buffet line was ridiculous. We waited for ten minutes and moved about three spots and eventually decided to eat a la carte at a cafeteria-style restaraunt instead. We ate our second breakfast at Le Cafe restaurant and had a nice time. Reasonable prices and the food was delicious. The servers were excellent although the cooks were slow - it took us quite a while to get our food, but the meal was excellent. There's a prior review complaining about the smoke in the lobby. YES, the lobby is smoky. But that's not the hotel's fault - many gamblers smoke and you won't find a hotel (as far as I know) that bans smoking inside. We're from Boston and this was a tough change for us... we're used to clean air inside. But we realized that this is not the hotel's fault and the ventilation system is adequate. Didn't do any gambling here, but one friend did and had fun. She said the dealers were patient and nice, and she enjoyed herself. :)

Reviews.Title: “First Time in Vegas - Loved the Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Kelcole
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vegas and after reading several reviews I picked the Paris and we were not disappointed. We stayed there from April 19 - April 22. For a first timer, this was a great location. We were there at 10:30 am before our check in time and had no problem getting a room. We did pay for an upgrade which included a better view, which was worth it being our first time (probably won't pay next time we come). We found the staff extremely friendly and helpful. For first timers, if you can't tolerate smoking, Vegas is not the town for you as it seemed everyone was smoking and drinking, and although not a smoker or drinker, it didn't particually bother me while in the casino. I liked the fact that the Paris casino was smaller as I was very overwhelmed at first. Vegas is an experience for anyone 21 and older. I would not recommend bringing children and could not understand why so many people had their small children there with them with all the partying and smoking, not a place for kids. It's an adult playground! We only had 2 bad experiences while there, one of the gentleman dealers at Bally's was extremely rude and had the same experience at the Monte Carlo with a lady dealer, so we didn't go back to either place. The people at the Paris were great and you can't beat the location. We will be back next year and this is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ruusiantravel
Reviews.Content: .we have stayed here last september this time -most disappointing vacation.the staff were rude,everything here is going down..food in restorant-average,but i dont recommend the lunch and dinner buffet.no longer our favorite plase.

Reviews.Title: “There are much better places to stay at in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I booked a place at the Paris hotel for a one week stay in April, 2006. I've traveled all over the world and stayed at many hotels, including several in vegas alone. The only thing good that I can say about this hotel is that it is very beautiful and the housekeeping is made up of some really sweet ladies. Other than that, its not worth the money. Besides being quoted one price over the phone but ended up paying a much higher price at check out, every single thing that you wanted to do had a price on it. You would think that if you are a guest in the hotel that things such as Internet or checking out the Eiffel tower restaurant would all be free....however that was not the case. The Internet was $5 for 5mins, and the Eiffel tower was $11/person. Give me a break. Not to mention the double charges on room service we ended up with at check out. Also, the front desk had the worst customer service I've ever seen. Honestly, if you are going to spend the money, make reservations at another hotel that appreciates it's guest.

Reviews.Title: “the only hotel in vegas I will stay at”
Reviews.Author: TIALAURA
Reviews.Content: I arrived 4/12 at 5pm after checking out of the Flamingo due to a dirty room and a nice rep reserved me a room on the 18th floor at no extra cost and was told to come back at 10 am when I did was told the room wasnt ready but Nadia the checkin reservation rep at Paris actually called housekeeping at 10am and asked them to rush our room and it was clean before 12 noon, she apoligized that the room wasnt done at 10am, even though someone was still in room LOL. She didnt make us wait in line again to get room key just walked up to her without waiting in line again. Room 1888 had a perfect view of the Bellagio fountain show. I like the big Bathrooms with the seperate shower and tub in the Paris bathroom. Everybody who helped me from the maids to the servers to the checkin reps were very friendly. The 2 times I have stayed here in the last year I have had very clean rooms, bathrooms, nice beds, good drink service, great servers.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant experience at paris”
Reviews.Author: zz44
Reviews.Content: i chose the paris because of the location but the hotel delivered a pleasant strip experience. the room was decent with a good bathroom and if you can arrange a high floor facing the strip you can enjoy a lighted eiffel tower backed by the bellagio light and water show. the themed food was decent especially the pastries at "le notre". the pool is decent but check out the shoadow of the eiffel tower before you pick your spot. all in all a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - excellent value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from Las Vegas and would highly recommend this hotel. We paid $99 per night (after calling the hotel directly) and were allocated a room on the 20th floor with a fantastic view (see photo). We were able to watch the fountain displays from our window. The room was comfortable with a good size bathroom and a lovely shower (although a bit dark). We checked in whilst waiting to collect our suitcases at the airport which was great because we didn't have to wait very long. The lifts were amazingly fast. We ate at Mon Ami Gabi for lunch. It was lovely because we sat outside just across the road from the Bellagio fountains. My husband recommends the steak sandwich - it was delicious! The only minor complaint is that the casino was very smokey compared to other hotels. Also, I wouldn't suggest that you use the monorail as I found it expensive and by the time that you get to the station you may as well have walked to the hotel you wanted to go to. (Las Vegas is not a place to visit if you hate walking)

Reviews.Title: “Loved Paris !!!”
Reviews.Author: Shannon Markham
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a very nice 4-night stay at Paris LV. We arrived Monday night around midnight and were greeted at the desk by Kristina - very pleasant and warm. Our flight had been delayed by 2 hours and this was my husband's first time in Vegas. Kristina gave us a 2-night upgrade to a P-suite, which was very nice, bath and a half, fabulous view. Since I saw both rooms, I can confidently say the suite was much, much nicer than the regular room. The bathroom was much bigger (and the half bath was a nice addition), the jetted tub was very deep (and nice after a long day of walking), there was a fridge (not stocked, which I prefer so it can be used for what you want - water, take-out, etc.) in the suite and a nice, beautifully furnished living space. My husband was most impressed with the tv in the bedroom, as it would automatically rise out of the chest at the foot of the bed. The regular room was what you might find in any Hampton Inn, though the mini-bar was fully stocked with liquor, beer, snacks, lotion, etc and automatically charges if items are moved - clearly displays instructions, so there's no confusion. There is no space for storing any of your own things in the fridge and they request that you don't. We left the tv on a music station too long and were automatically charged $9.95, but when we realized what happened, we called the front desk. Alfonzo was very pleasant, accomodating and immediately credited our account. We found the location to be perfect, just across from the Bellagio, easy access to the monorail (once we realized we didn't have to walk outside to Bally's - just past the restaurants and shops), the deuce, and walking distance to many other hotels. It's also a nice size hotel - not so large that you can't get out to the street or to the monorail fairly quickly. Every staff member was gracious, polite and asked if there was anything we needed. All the restaurants we tried were excellent, La Creperie, JJ's Boulangerie, Le Provencal (parmesan crusted chicken is absolutely fabulous!), the buffet and Mon Ami Gabi (we sat outside and watched the fountains across the street at Bellagio). All the shops were expensive, which is expected, but a short walk next door to the Aladdin shops, there are some regular stores, like the GAP, if you forget or need more basics. The only negative we found is that the air didn't seem to work well in either room at night (we are both warm-natured, and it's only April, so I can only imagine that it's also a problem in the summertime.) We are not complainers but are not easily impressed either. I've stayed at MGM Grand before and much prefer Paris. We had a wonderful time and will stay at Paris again when we go back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Paris is Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: almostseniors
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending seven nights at Paris LV, & had a wonderful time. We checked in at the airport at about 8 PM on a Sat. evening, & there was only one person in line. I was able to get an upgrade to a view of the pool, the Eiffel Tower, the strip, & Bellagio fountains. We took the shuttle for which we paid $23 at check-in (it's $19 I found out later by buying directly from Showtime). We had to wait awhile to leave, but there was only one other hotel stopped at. We took a cab back since our plane was leaving at 6 AM, & the first shuttle was at 4:30 & we'd never make it. I got a refund on my bill from the Concierge, all of whom were very helpful. The room was large, very well maintained, plenty of closet space, large bathroom with separate shower. Ate often at Le Boulangerie for quick breakfast & fantastic desserts at Le Notre. Had dinner at Mon Ami Gabi; excellent food, but somewhat noisy when sitting inside. Didn't have much luck in the casino (none of them actually; better luck at Gold Coast & Sam's Town) Paris's location is ideal: Deuce bus stop right in front; shuttle to Rio right outside Bally's next door (go through the tunnel), to Gold Coast shuttle from Barbary Coast, as well as to Sam's Town. While the rooms were by no means cheap (well over $200 per night), I found it more convenient than Bellagio, where we stayed last time. Also, it isn't that far to get back to the elevators from outisde; you only have to walk alongside part of the casino. All in all, we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Used to love this place, no more!”
Reviews.Author: TheLuxeTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Paris at least a dozen times over the past few years. The hotel has always had service problems, but this is Vegas, so not a big surprise. The past two visits however, things have become apparent that everything here is going down, and fast. The bellman at this hotel ar not just rude, but often plain mean to people. I have seen numerous confrontations between guests and bell staff, at christmas, one bellman made two older women cry and STILL did not change his tune. Just ridiculous, almost unreal at times. Anyway, the casino is fine, dealers are top notch and the front desk staff are not always nice, but usually pretty good. The problem is this; There are not enough restaurants so they are all crowded all the time. The buffet has gone down in quality and quantity, the service just plain s--- but more important the food is not good! They charge you a ton of money after you wait in line forever and then serve nothing but very average fair. The rooms are OK at best, honestly the rroms and service are far better next door at Bally's! (I know, but trust me!!) The beds here, both suites and regular rooms, are AWFUL! The shower pressure is not great, and the housekeeping...Oh my god. We walked into a room with dirty socks on floor and a trash with used condoms. Im not kidding. But things happen, we just changed rooms, and have returned since but there is always problems with cleanliness. This time, stains (big time) on the bedspread, carpet, curtains, bathroom door, and let's not get into what we found on the bedskirt. We know this has never been cleaned, ever. I don't want to get complicated but Harrah's has taken this place over from Caesers, and the changes are...well...apparent. I would stay next door at the Ballys (also Harrahs owned but far better service, and great rooms, nice beds too!) or Ceasars over this place. Good Casino, Mon Ami Gabi is great but bad hotel. just not good. CB

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Max013
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at Paris Las Vegas and had no complaints. We pre-booked and got an excellent deal which made the hotel even better. Our check in was completed in minutes and our room on the 26th floor was bright, roomy and the furnishings were of a high standard. The bathroom is superb with a seperate shower cubicle. The rooms are also well sound proofed and we heard no noise whatsoever from the surrounding rooms. The bed was comfortable and we had the best nights rest in Paris than in any of the other 3 hotels we stayed in on our 2 week trip. Other than coffee and croissants we tended to eat out so cannot comment about the food but there were always queues to get into the buffet. This could be good because the food was good or could be bad because the staff were unable to cope, take your pick. We ate a couple of times at the Cheescake Factory in Caesars Palace which we highly recommend. Big portions of good food at reasonable prices. The only down side was the casino which seemed to be permanently darker than other casinos. It gave the appearance of being always night time. Other than that I would highly recommend this hotel, especially if you can get the rates we did ($109 per night)

Reviews.Title: “Good times at the Paris”
Reviews.Author: chinita415
Reviews.Content: Just got back from an extended weekend trip with family. Overall, we had a wonderful stay due to the can't-be-beat center strip location. I went with people who haven't been there in years so this was the perfect location within hoofing distance of all the major resort hotels. Cons: (1)Airport check-in was awful. We waited over 30 minutes. Not sure if it was the clerks or it was just busy. The desk next door at MGM was empty. I am pretty certain we would have waited less if we went straight to the hotel, but since we invested so much time already, we just waited more. (2)I had to pay to use the gym. I guess I am used to business oriented hotels like the Marriot where I can run on the treadmill. I had to pay for a spa/fitness center day pass to work out. I had a coupon from their website so it was only $15. Pros: (1) Comfy rooms. Similar to other places of similar price range (Monte-Carlo, Luxor). Not a fan of the low tub. Like someone else mentioned, it is like sliding into a low sports car! (2) Easy late check-out. Normally checkout is at 11am, but we got 1pm checkout without problems. (3) Of course, the location, location, location. My family loved being so close to the Bellagio pool. Plus, we went to see "O" and after the show, the taxi line was LONG! We just walked across the street. I would definitely stay here again. It is a definte resort hotel with all the amenities you need.

Reviews.Title: “For the money, Paris is the best hotel”
Reviews.Author: Greatgreys
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at the Paris Hotel. This is a mid-range hotel (not as expensive as the Bellagio or Wynn's and not as cheap as Sahara). However, when you're staying at Paris, the feel is luxury hotel. The standard room is large, comfortable and the bathroom has a separate stall shower. The hotel is big enough to have everything you need but not so big that you feel like you have to walk 3 miles just to leave the place (if you've ever stayed at the Luxor, you'll know what I mean). The staff was consistently friendly and helpful. My husband and I have stayed at a lot of places in Vegas and decided that from now on, Paris is "our hotel". I saw a lot of comments on this site that the breakfast buffet was wonderful but the dinner buffet was just so-so. We went to the dinner buffet and thought it was the best buffet we ever had! The quality and assortment of the food was first rate. Each buffet station represents a different region in France. There was some food that we tried that we didn't like, but the boullabaise was the best we ever had (tons if shrimp, mussels, clams and big pieces of a wonderful fish - don't know what kind but it was delicious). The desserts were to die for! One suggestion, if you're staying or eating at Paris, the buffet is cheaper than Le Cafe. We had breakfast at Le Cafe one day and spent almost as much as we did for the dinner buffet. JJ Boulangers (spelling?) offers good specials for breakfast and lunch - it's probably one of the cheapest quality places to eat in Vegas. Try it when you're tired of stuffing yourself and just want a normal meal.

Reviews.Title: “Made me want to go to the real Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Paris for a total of 4 days and have absolutely no complaints. The rooms were immaculate and beautiful, the service was great, and the food was delicious. The pool was a bit crowded but the view was worth it. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “nice.. but not exceptional”
Reviews.Author: jpgNewYork_NY
Reviews.Content: Spent three very enjoyable and comfortable nights at Paris... but would probably try a different hotel next time... if the price was right. Here are the positives: The location cant be beat. Center-strip.. across the street from the Bellagio and Caesars. The atmosphere and decor are very inviting. A faux cobblestone pathway with old- fashioned lightposts snakes around the casino and is lined with pastry shops and little stores. Check-in was simple. Upon arrival, I was placed in a spacious corner room, but immediately asked to be changed because the furnishings were shabby and the faucets in the bathroom leaked. The front desk happily honored the request and we moved into a lovely room on a higher floor. Negatives: Food is very expensive and you cant even brew a cup of coffee in your room. You have to go downstairs to a restaurant and buy one. I also wasnt all that impressed with the food. I dont recommend the dinner buffet. Having said that, Im happy to have stayed at Paris. It's definitely family-friendly. Some of the other casinos seem more edgy and geared toward a younger, wilder crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Paris!”
Reviews.Author: SJG5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris for 3 nights and we were thoroughly satisfied with our stay. Although the rooms were somewhat pricey, it was a busy time of year(spring break/Nascar weekend)and rooms everywhere on the strip were higher than we recalled from previous visits. Check-in was a breeze at the airport, and upon our request, the agent selected a nice room for us--high up, with a terrific view of the Bellagio fountains.Even though we checked in early (9 am) and the room wasn't guaranteed to be ready until 3:00 pm, we got in our room about 11:30 am so we were quite pleased. We found the beds to be comfortable, the view spectacular, and the bathrooms clean and moderately upscale with marble counters, separate marble shower, and tub. Staff was courteous and helpful. We did have one problem with a toilet that overflowed one night (no fault of ours!), but the maintenance crew was prompt and the maid service followed up to clean the bathroom right away. The food at the buffet was much better with a nicer atmosphere than at the Mirage. The location is perfect--middle of the strip. We would stay there again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Minnesota couplel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Paris Hotel on March 5 & 6 with our daughter and son-in-law. Room was very quiet-no street or hall noise. Beds were older, but comfortable. Asked for extra pillows and they brought fluffy ones warm from the dryer. Everything was clean and well supplied. Went to the breakfast buffet and the pastries and crepes were wonderful. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, good eats”
Reviews.Author: MustTravel
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here 3 times in the last year and a half. It's centrally located in the middle of the strip, has clean rooms and I've never had a problem with the staff. I've only stayed in the standard rooms and they are an ok size with the regular tv/armoire, desk, chair, mini bar, chair/ottoman set up. We had a room on a non-smoking floor that faced the front of the hotel with a view of the Bellagio water show. IF you are not a late night person I suggest getting a room facing the other way...you can hear the fountain show and it goes on till about midnight. Also ask about upgrades when you check in...they aren't all that expensive but we reasoned that we would not be hanging out in the hotel room all that much so we passed on it. One thing that absolutely [--], which I hadn't noticed on previous trips for some reason, is that the shower has very weak water pressure. I have long hair and I ended up rinsing my hair in the tub and then getting back into the shower! The guys that I traveled with agreed that the shower sucked...and they have very short hair. Just because of this I probably will not stay there again. It's a roomy bathroom, however and has separate tub and shower. Le Village Buffet for dinner..not all that bad...small shrimp though. Bigger shrimp at Bellagio buffet. The crepes at La Creperie were pretty good...my only complaint is that they make the crepe itself too thick. JJ's Boulangerie is good for sandwiches and fresh bread. We bought coffee and a whole baguette one morning and split it between the 4 of us for a simple breakfast. I LOVE LeNotre! I think it's the only one in the states. It's a little different from the ones in France that I've been to but still has great croissants, cakes, pastries, etc! I always make it a point to stop there even if I'm not staying at Paris. Good alternative for breakfast as well. Stopped in Le Cafe Ile St. Louis late one night for their steak special. Skip it. Undercooked potato, tough, thin steak. Have been to Mon Ami Gabi on a different visit and I always like their food and service.

Reviews.Title: “Food Only”
Reviews.Author: mersimbo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at another hotel but joined my brother and sister-in-law for dinner at Au Sin asian restaurant. This was about the fourth meal we've had there and the service and food was excellent. Some people have made negative comments but we have always found all of the restaurant staffs to be friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a short visit.”
Reviews.Author: Dr.GB
Reviews.Content: Visit to Vegas in mid/late Feb. for a conference. My wife and I stayed at Paris. Excellent locale-mid Strip. We arrived early on a Sunday morning. Airport check-in was a snap. Dropped our bags at the front door and went looking for lunch (we were ready at 10 am). Called front desk at noon, room ready, bypassed long check out/check in line to pick up my key since we were already checked in. Bags were delivered to room in less than 5 minutes. Room larger than expected, clean and quiet; bathroom was much larger and nicer than expected. Really the only bad part of the room was the very firm (read "hard") bed. We had a mediocre meal at Ah Sin at the Paris. Breakfast buffet was just above average for the price. The pastry shop next to the elevators was better for breakfast. Never made it up to the Eifel Tower. My wife did have a good time watching the taping of ABC's The View @ Cesear's and shopping there too. Overall, we would probably stay here again if we got a good deal, but would really like to try the Venetian or Wynn.

Reviews.Title: “Rought start at airport check-in but finished strong at Paris”
Reviews.Author: tomvegas
Reviews.Content: This was our 7th stay at the Paris/Bally's properties and once again we had a really great experience with one downside.. Upon arrival on Friday 2/24/06 at 8:15pm, I proceeded to go check us in at the airport. Upon arriving I was informed the computers were down so we couldn't be checked in there and we would have to go to the hotel. This is the 3rd time since Novemeber I have been to Las Vegas and this has happened all 3 times with them. A real downer...But here is the real kicker. I am a Diamond Member with Harrah's and I called ahead the day before because we wanted to upgrade to a suite. I went ahead and booked a Calais suite at a reduced rate but upon arrival at the hotel to check in, it turns out the person who helped us at the airport was a supervisor and thought we were only gold members and unblocked the suite and proceeded to place notes all over the account not to upgrade us. It wasn't until I spoke with the front desk manager at Paris and gave them my Harrah's Diamond card that they fixed things. They apologized and chalked it up to conversion from the connection card (Was also a VIP, but they lost all of that with conversion apparently) to Total Rewards program with Harrah's inc. After that, we were given a Calais suite, I spoke with my Casino Host and by the end of the trip, we had been taken well care of, enjoyed wonderful food and a fantastic suite. I also won a good chunk of money and the casino and all of the staff I encountered were all very kind and helpful to us. So I am giving them the benefit of the doubt as I know conversion has been tough, but at least most of the folks there are trying hard...We'll be back again in March/April and I hope by then they will have worked these glitches out or it will be time to switch to the Mirage...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jlmaryon
Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay from start to finish. Stayed a week in the Paris in September 05 and as it was my fifth trip to Vegas expectations where high; have to say was not disappointed. Service at check in was excellent, very friendly and quick. The room although the view was limited was clean and well equiped and generous in size. The whole atmosphere of the hotel was relaxed and ambient. The only downside was the pool was mainly in shade until early afternoon, but nevertheless still a wonderfull surrounding looking up at the Eiffel Tower. It is a must to sit and eat on the terrace at Mon Ami Garbi and watch the world go by, and the service is great. The Paris is a hotel I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Paris with some exceptions”
Reviews.Author: ashah7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris Las Vegas for 5 nights from Feb 23-28. Our reason for staying there was because my wife had a conference in that hotel. Overall, the hotel was nice. The good things about it is that it is in a very nice location on the strip, is not an overwhelmingly huge hotels as others are and the room rates are generally good. The bad parts of the hotel are that there is very little variety of restaurants in the hotel...there are pastry shops and things like that but not anywhere to grab a quick bite to eat. Also the prices are high for food. The rooms are nice and the bathrooms are large and well kept. The housekeeping services are not so good. When we returned to our room one evening (after requesting turn down service) we noticed some debris in our toilet. I flushed the toilet and up came garbage from our bathroom garbage can. The entire bathroom flooded with toilet water soaking the area. It ended up that the turn down maid dumped our bathroom garbage into the toilet flooding it. Ultimately our bathroom was disinfected that evening and we got $100 off our hotel bill. Beyond that, the rooms offer a free safe, good tv reception, but the beds are very hard and not comfortable. Also the water pressure in the shower is very weak and takes getting used to. I have been to Las vegas 3 other times and if you can get a good rate, I would highly recommend Mandalay Bay (they have an amazing wave pool and lazy river), Venetian or MGM. I have stayed also at Luxor and think you can do better than this. Keep in mind that Mandalay bay is at the very end of the strip and not in the best location. I would highly recommend renting a car for a few days and driving out to Hoover dam and red rock canyon. Also driving out into the city of las vegas is nice to see how they live and there are beautiful views of the surrounding mountains.

Reviews.Title: “The Paris was a Delight after a Rocky Start”
Reviews.Author: Redcc55
Reviews.Content: We visited Las Vegas over President's Weekend. We arrived at the Paris at 2am after a long, late flight out of Newark. We found that the hotel was completely sold out and would have to go to Caesar's Palace for the 1st night of our 4 night stay. (Even though we had paid for the the whole trip though a Travelocity deal 2 months earlier). We were offered $100 in food & beverage comp, the cost of the 1st night hotel room comped and cab fare to Caesars... until they found out that we had paid Travelocity, whereupon they told us they couldn't comp us the 1st night...so they increased the F&B comp to $200 and upgraded us to a "P" room suite for the remaining three nights. The Paris Hotel was wonderful...the room was enormous and had a great view...the casino was beautiful...the themeing (Eiffel Tower, Arc de Triomph, and Hot Air Balloon) was spectacular. No problems with any staff rudeness. Restaurants: The Eiffel Tower Restaurant... spectacular view of the Bellagio Fountains..very pricey menu, although very tasty...we had filet mignon, crusted salmon, two orders of mashed potatoes, two cocktails $127. Ah Sin...spectacular pan-Asian cuisine...sake, asparagus salad, soup, vegetable/tofu salad...4 large sushi rolls..two cocktails...$60. Did not have the patience to stand in the Le Village buffet line (the one everyone raves about)..instead waited in the much shorter line (5 minutes a most) for Le Cafe ile St Louis...good service..good omelets...really good coffee...about $35 each morning. The F&B comp was not applicable at the Eiffel Tower Restuarant nor could it have been used at Mon Ami Gabi..but we used it up regardless. We saw Barry Manilow (Hilton) and Elton John (Caesars) and both were spectacular. Went to the Jubilee show at Bally's because we wanted to see a "Vegas" show....we were unimpressed...overwhelming stage sets and costumes do not make up for campy skits and boring story lines...asked many times: is this over yet????...the jugglers and acrobats were the best part...BY FAR. Don't waste your money ($130 for 2 cheap seats)...we moved up 15 rows, the place was half full. Also, I have worked in NYC and go there often socially and use taxi's a great deal, but Vegas taxi's are unbelievably expensive...it will cost you $5 to cross the street...the $10 cab fare the hotel gave us to get to Caesar's was not enough for the round trip (literally across the street)...watch out and walk! Taxi's to ($12) and from ($16) the airport were painless. Tip..have someone go stand in the taxi line at the airport while you get your checked luggage. Went to the South Rim of the Grand Canyon via small plane on a last minute whim..took a bus tour of the area and had a buffet lunch. Nice change from the hustle/bustle...$400...8 hour day trip. Hope this helps. We sure learned a lot researching this site...wanted to repay the service.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: HipHotel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel over Xmas 2005 and had a ball. We had a lovely suite which was huge, no view but great comfy bed and huge bathroom etc. It was quiet and easy to get in and out of,via the central lifts. The location of the hotel is perfect, right in the middle of the Strip. The restaurants were always crowded and had lines to get into, but in general they were pretty good, especially the french bakery. The staff at check-in and around the place were really helpful. We had a fabulous stay and were surprised how much we enjoyed Las Vegas - it wasn't nearly as tacky as we expected!

Reviews.Title: “Paris Resort - Adaquate”
Reviews.Author: 4ManFam
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Paris, Las Vegas Resort from February 16 - February 20, 2006. Our experience started off very well, as we were able to check into the hotel from the airport. Paris has a check-in desk located next to the baggage claim area. I would highly recommend checking in at the airport. While my husband was waiting on the luggage, I checked in and received my hotel room key. Therefore, upon arrival at the hotel, we went directly to our room with no waiting in the LONG check-in line at the hotel's front desk. Nice Perk! The Resort was well themed and very nice to look at. The room we were assigned was on the 25th floor and had a decent view given the fact that we didn't pay for an upgraded room. We were able to see an obstructed view of the strip but couldn't see the Eiffel Tower. The room was bright and clean. The bathroom large and well decorated with lots of marble and a glass enclosed shower. The one complaint I had with the room was the lack of a closet. The room contained a wardrobe that housed the TV as well as 2 small areas to hang your clothing. With a family of four, I found the wardrobe provisions a bit small. Additionally, I like to hide my luggage inside the closet during the trip making for a less cluttered vacation room. Unfortunately, our luggage (and we had a bunch of bags) was piled in a corner of the room against the window for the entire vacation. While in Paris, we ate at the Cafe de St. Louis for breakfast twice and thoroughly enjoyed both days. Although the line to get a table seemed long, it moved very quickly. The wait staff was attentive enough and the food came out very fast, which was a plus for us because we are always in a hurry. We also had Sunday Brunch at Le Village and found it to be very enjoyable as well. The wide variety of dishes were all very tasty. One thing we found odd about one of the restaurants open late night (can't remember the name), is that they didn't have take out containers so there was no way to bring food back to the room to others who were too tired to go down for dinner. I guess this encourages more costly Room Services meals. The Mandara Spa on the 2nd Level was very enjoyable as well. The Deep Tissue Massage and Frangiapani Wrap were to die for! Casino was small and we had terrible luck there. My husband gambled in several casinos and won in most of the others but NEVER won anything in Paris. Maybe it was just bad luck on his part but he is convinced it was the odds. Overall, we enjoyed our trip. However, traveling with kids, I wouldn't stay at Paris again. There was not enough "fun" stuff to do. My kids really liked the Luxor, NYNY and Circus Circus when we visited because they had more activities. Good hotel for a couple.

Reviews.Title: “First Time in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I went to Las Vegas for the first time and stayed at the Paris Las Vegas. I have absolutely no complaints with the service in the hotel. Room-We had booked a king sized bed but upon check in were told there were none available. As compensation we were given a strip view with two queens. Our room overlooked the replica Eiffel Tower and the fountains at the Bellagio. The room was clean and well appointed. The bathroom has a separate shower stall and everything is marble. Watch the floor, it gets slippery when wet! Casino-Sure the Casino is loud but what do you expect! Also, we were there from Thurs through Sun and found the table games to be a little on the expensive side. You could always find a slot machine to play however. Service was sometimes slow while you were playing but for free drinks I'm not going to get uptight. The Casino was also a lot less smoky than all of the others we visited. Food - Excellent, we had dinner in the Eiffel Tower Restaurant and the Rack of Lamb is by far the best I have ever eaten. Le Provencal has singing waitstaff. Trust me, go and listen.. it's well worth it! Pastries were exceptional! Service - As mentioned above, no complaints. Cost -Bring your credit card... nothing is cheap in the Paris. Helpful Tip- Bring your most comfortable shoes, you'll do more walking than you can imagine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hlmhrt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Paris hotel in Las Vegas for a long weekend stay. The room itself was average size and the bathroom was large. I also found the room to be clean and furnishings were fairly new. We asked for a view and found the hotel charged us $60 more per night for a view, but it also included continental breakfast and evening hor'dovrs. The view was not spectular so I would avoid this upgrade for a price. The casino is large and never really felt crowded. We did eat at the buffet and was not impressed at all. The food was average at best. We did eat at their signature restaurant, Les Aristes, and found the meal to be wonderful. I also frequented the spa twice. Once for a massage which was excellent The second time was for a facial which was average. When the facial was over my face was bright red and burning. When I asked the therapist what to do she didn't know. It didn't last but my skin was dry for a few days. I would recommend this hotel to others. Since this hotel is centrally located, it made it convenient to reach anything on the strip. The effifel tower was fun and had an excellent view of the strip at nite.

Reviews.Title: “Detailed report on recent stay”
Reviews.Author: tg7614
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Paris several times over the past few years and, overall, it is in line with what to expect from the hotels on the strip: Very large, theme oriented, and all inclusive of activities within the hotel such as casinos, fine dining, shows, and shopping. Here are some brief points to know before going; There are no bellmen or other greeting staff when you arrive. Either take your bags to check-in or there is a person to tag them outside. When you settle into your room, call to have your bags delivered. they will not be automatically brought up. Your room choice and bedding preferences (king , queen, 2 queens) can only be made at checkin and not prior to. what you get is ultimately based on availability. Rooms are very clean and bathrooms are well equipped and relatively spacious. You may read some reviews about the pillows being a little hard, which they are, and walls are not completely soundproof. You will here partying in adjacent rooms (and vice versa). Casino area is fantastic. Very spacious and covers all gaming. Texas holdem area can get crowded and works on a reservation system.Be very attentive also as some of the tables for $1/$2 are actually NO-LIMIT and betting gets in the $100's after the flop. Before getting on the waiting list, walk next door to the Aladdin and sit right down in a very good poker room. Also try the $10 slots. I know, it sounds pricey but the payouts are better and a lot more frequent. Dining is kind of dicey but also very subjective. Le village buffet, like all buffets, is strictly for those in search of mass quantity. Seriously, buffets in Vegas are fairly expensive and overrated because of the sheer size of choices. Every restaurant in the Paris offers very good fare and at Mon Ami Gabi, the outside seating view is the best. You get the atmosphere of a true Paris bistro at night and a free show of the Bellagio fountains every hour. Service is no different than anywhere else. The larger the crowd the slower the service. It's too be expected but, hey, you are on vacation so what's the rush anyway? Shopping? Interesting selection of boutique stores. Most of them fall under "things I wish I needed" category and the pricing is typical Vegas. There is also a cigar bar on the way to the elevators that some reviewers have complained about. However, the air quality is constantly monitored and I did not experience a problem, not was it ever "smoky".

Reviews.Title: “I loved the Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved the Hotel, My daugther and me we stayed at the Paris Hotel, The hotel was beautiful, and thepeople were beautiful also, I enjoyed myself and would stay there again. the maid serves was excellent also. just lloved it.

Reviews.Title: “Paris and Las Vegas Trip Report”
Reviews.Author: jimboc
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Las Vegas in nearly two years, and the first with both my children (3 & 1 year old). Paris is centrally located on the Strip, so we could take either the monorail, walk, or go on a short cab ride to every hotel on our itinerary. This was convenient, since we did not rent a car. Check-in was smooth and fast. We are AAA members, and this allowed us to jump ahead onto a VIP line. Our room was on the 30th floor, and had a partial strip view. It was breath-taking to view at night. The kids had never been so high up, so they enjoyed the view. I liked the atmosphere at Paris and the adjacent Bally's Hotel--they're connected by a short walkway that's also a faux French village. Great smells from the restautants at Paris, although we only ate from room service and La Creperie. It was Chinese New Year, so the casinos were packed with Asian gamblers testing their luck in the new year, the Year of the Dog. Every casino we visited had decorated with a Chinese theme, in particular the high-limit salon areas. The casinos in Paris and Bally's were crowded, but manageable. The smoke in Bally's is worse than Paris, because the latter has a very high ceiling that resembles a sky view. Everything on the strip is overpriced, and Paris is no exception. Our room averaged $175 per night on the weekend. The room service, while good, set us back $12 per person for breakfast. However, we knew what we were getting ourselves into, since my wife and mother-in-law were going to see a concert at the MGM Grand on Saturday night. We chose Paris because of its convenence to MGM as well as sights like the Bellagio and Caesar's Palace. Nevertheless, the rooms were clean and spacious and the bathroom was quite large and sparkling. Room and maid service service was prompt and courteous. My only complaint is that the tap water in all Las Vegas casinos tastes terrible. You'll probably want to drink only bottled water. We saw most of the major hotels on the strip and they each have their advantages. For Paris, its main selling point is the convenience, a "fair" price on the strip (compared to others), and a tasteful and well-executed theme. However, if I were to come here again, I would make sure that the kids were a bit older.

Reviews.Title: “paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: linlin60
Reviews.Content: hey i went to LasVegas and stayed at the paris hotel, it was great. we had room service which was very good, we had the works eggs, bacon, ham, coffee, toast, for two people it came to 52.00 w/tip. the casino at the paris is to die for. the ceiling is just like the sky. this place is fabulous. you will enjoy this hotel. clean, nice and friendly. i had locked my suitcase key in my suitcase called to the front desk and they sent someone up to help within minutes my suitcase was open. i had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Dark and Crowded”
Reviews.Author: srook
Reviews.Content: I was very disapointed with the Paris. We were a group of three girlfriends, in our forties, staying 3 nights in Las Vegas. We chose the Paris due to the great location on the strip and also the favorable reviews on this site. Having stayed at the Wynn last June, I realized this would not be like the Wynn, but I didn't expect it to be on par with the Holiday Inn, which is exactly what the room reminded me of. The bed was the hardest mattress I had ever slept on and the pillows were smaller than standard pillows with no stuffing at all. It was hard to not think about the heavenly beds at the Wynn with the fabulous pillows. Also, the casino is small, dark, and very unorganized. I hate to keep comparing, but the casinos at the Wynn and Belagio are so much roomier and well lit, with large aisles in between sections. During the day these casinos have a lot of natural light that the Paris never has, making the Paris feel very gloomy inside even during the day. Our next trip to Vegas will definitely be at the Wynn. It is worth paying a little more for such a huge difference in quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Front Desk Could have gone an extra mile...”
Reviews.Author: Ridgesas
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paris from January 25 to January 29, 2006. We arrived at 11pm with a group of 7. We requested 3 non-smoking rooms and king beds. We only received a king bed in one of the rooms after having to wait 45 minutes for the room to be made up. This was after having prepaid for the rooms through Expedia. I would have expected the rooms to be ready given they were paid for. We asked for a “P-room” but were told it would be an extra $60 including breakfast. We declined. When we got to the room it was nice but nothing special. It was clean, airy and what was expected after reading the reviews on trip advisor. Did not blow us away but also did not disappoint. The hotel is in a great location and the Casino is well laid out and friendly. The various restaurants and “streets of Paris” are great. I would recommend having free drinks at the Casino. We gambled at other hotels and the cocktail waitresses arrived once an hour. At the Paris the service was frequent and great. We tipped the waitresses an average of $1 per drink and they kept coming back with more drinks all the time. We would recommend the chocolate martinis!!! The village buffet and creperie are wonderful. The quality of food at the buffet was surprisingly good. We entered at 10:30am and stayed after the lunch changeover at 11am. The breakfast and lunch selections are great (exceeded our expectations of buffet food). The desserts were even better! We rented a van and drove to see Hoover Dam and the Grand Canyon west rim. This trip was worth the 3 hour drive as we got to see one of the wonders of the world. Try and arrive before 2pm as the sun sets over the canyon at 4pm in January. Considering we paid $50 + gas for a van we saved a lot of money vs. paying $100+ per person for a tour. The day of checkout we asked for a late checkout given that our flight left at 11pm. We were told to pay a half day rate and when we advised that we checked in at 11pm (having paid for a full day) they backed down and said the hotel did not have any rooms available. Sounded fishy to us but we checked out at 1pm and left our bags with the bellman. This is what we had expected anyway so no surprise. Overall had a great time in Vegas. Will definitely be back to Paris (if the price remains reasonable).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, unexciting casino”
Reviews.Author: Thornaldo
Reviews.Content: Paris Las Vegas is a really nice hotel, but a quite boring casino. Thankfully it is connected to its sister-hotel, Ballys, where I found the gambling much more attractive. The rooms are easy to get comfortable in though. Not very big (I had a twin bed standard room), but with everything you need: In room-bar, lots of tv channels and a separate bath and shower in the very luxurious bath room. Paris is nicely situated between Aladdin and Ballys, with Bellagio and Ceasars Palace across the strip. I'm a regular visitor to Las Vegas, and have previously stayed at Aladdin, MGM Grand, Excalibur, Luxor, San Remo and Plaza Hotel (Downtown). I rate Paris as the best hotel I've stayed in alongside Aladdin. But you'll probably find yourself taking your gambling elsewere. And you don't have to go far to find great alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lvtotravel82
Reviews.Content: We planned a last minute get-away and we were very happy with our choice of the Paris Hotel. We have been traveling here for the past 12 years so we wanted to try another new hotel. I was concerned on reviews from readers regarding the staff. However, our check-in was a breeze. We received our room right away at 11:30 am and they allowed a late check-out of 1 pm since we were taking a red-eye flight home that evening. There is a cute bistro on the right when you exit from the elevators. They offer breakfast and lunch specials. We returned from a late outing and noticed their lunch special is from 11 am to 11 pm. My husband chose the turkey wrap, with potato salad and drink I believe for $6.50. We even had breakfast another day including your beverage. We will definitely return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, boring room”
Reviews.Author: chloeco
Reviews.Content: I can't agree with the posts complaining about the service at the Paris Las Vegas. Aside from check-in (either terse or efficient, depending on your point of view), the staff was quite pleasant and accommodating. We had a very late evening our very last night; when we woke up at 10:00 AM (after just 4 hours of sleep) for an 11:00 check-out, I called the front desk and groggily asked for a 2-hour extension to our check-out time, which they granted right away, free of charge. The rooms are the problem at this hotel. They are small and charmless and lacking in character. You can find a better room, in a hotel that's just as well-located, for the same money or less (the Mirage and the Luxor come to mind, as does the Venetian when they have a good sale going).

Reviews.Title: “Was not impressed”
Reviews.Author: MoxTea
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Vegas and we stayed there for three nights from Jan 10-13. Upon arrival, we were sent to a room on the 6th floor, but as soon as we got there, I wanted to switch rooms because we had an awful view. When we asked if the had any available rooms with a better view and we were told that it would be $60 to upgrade per night! Besides that, the rooms were in okay condition, although a little worn down considering it is a fairly new hotel. I probably won't plan on staying here again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: omnitravel
Reviews.Content: This was our second time in Las Vegas and loved the Paris hotel ... the location is great (we previously stayed closer to the end of the strip and it is nice to be more "central"). The hotel itself has a fabulous atmosphere - our room was very large, the beds comfortable and the pool area was a great place to relax. I think the theming of the hotel really does give you a sense of the "real" Paris (as close as you can in Vegas, of course). It was fun to visit the other hotels, but so glad to come home at the end of the night to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: ztdonna
Reviews.Content: stayed here over xmas and new year and thought it was brilliant. been to vegas many times before but first time to stay here and would definitely stay again. staff were friendly and really helpful. very well located on the strip aswell. will be going back there soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: asteroid
Reviews.Content: Unlike many of the people posting here, I don't go to Las Vegas primarily for my vacation. However, I've been going to conferences and business meetings in Las Vegas since the late 80s, and based on my three-day stay at Paris in November 2005, I think I've found a new favorite. Most of the hotels in Las Vegas require you to walk through the casino for EVERYthing; you simply can't escape it. Paris is an exception. If you come in the front door, you can slide around the edge of the casino to get to the elevator. When it's time to grab breakfast before you run off to the convention hall, you can do so without getting your hair full of cigarette smoke. You could *almost* forget that there's a casino around the corner. For the business traveller, Paris is a solid good choice. While Internet access is not free, the extra cost won't take your breath away. The rooms are a decent size, the desk is big enough for your laptop plus papers, and mine, at least, was quiet enough for me to get some work done late at night. It felt like a hotel-with-casino, rather than a casino with some rooms glued on. The location on the strip is good, too, but it won't help you avoid cabs. My conference was at the Mandalay Bay, so I assumed I could take the train from Bally's. All the service personnel at Paris said that I'd be better off taking a cab, because the hike to the train (and then to the conference area at the MB, at the other end) would make the trip about a half hour. So you may still want to budget for taxi fare or rent a car. I'm headed back to Las Vegas in March (for a NON business trip, for a change) and I'm definitely considering staying at Paris -- even though it's quite a hike from the event hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Understated Elegance......”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travel40
Reviews.Content: We frequent Las Vegas at least 3 to 4 times per year and have stayed at a wide variety of four and five star Strip hotels. Paris is my hands-down favorite. Great location, not too big, nice casual dining, wonderful ambiance and nicely appointed rooms and bathrooms. We recently paid double the typical Paris rate to stay at Bellagio and got stuck in their new tower which is a 5 mile hike from the street and casino. I was quite surprised that the Bellagio rooms were no nicer than the standard Paris room although the bathroom was larger. I could certainly live without the outragously priced Bellagio mini bar in each room. They actually warn you at check-in that the items are weight sensored and that if you pick one up or move one accidently, even if you put it right back, you will be charged. That has to be a joke, right? We'll be staying at Paris from now on and enjoying their yummy crepes late at night that you can take up to your room and eat in bed. YUMMMMMM!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: elmac40
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paris Las Vegas Hotel a couple of days ago. Great hotel, friendly staff, spotlessly clean and a great location. Contrary to other reviewers, we had no problems with checking in at the hotel. I would definately recommend this hotel if you go to Las Vegas. GENERAL INFO ON LAS VEGAS If you've never been to Vegas before, here are a couple of things to note: 1 - In many of the casinos, you will be offered "free" tickets to shows. Basically this is a sales ploy to get you to go to new resorts that are being built/have been built. If you're happy to do this, then fine, but if not a polite "no thanks" is sufficient. 2 - A couple of good view points are the Stratosphere Tower and in particular the Eiffel Tower at the Paris Las Vegas hotel. If you go to the latter, its good to go just before sunset, that way you can see the area in daylight and then when the sun sets, you see the strip light up. 3 - No matter what you do in Vegas, you have to see the Bellagio fountains - fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Stay out of Parking garage”
Reviews.Author: HotSlotMama
Reviews.Content: Our son was robbed and mugged in the Parking lot. Where are the security cameras and security guards?

Reviews.Title: “From the Center of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Paris Las Vegas was a great stay. Upon arriving, we informed them it was our first trip to Las Vegas, and our room was upgraded with a great view of the strip directly across from the Bellagio. The best part of the hotel was location, location, location! It is right in the middle of the strip so leave at least two days - one to go to the right to the south of the strip, and one to go to the north. We couldn't get enough of watching the Bellagio fountains from our room! Definitely try the Creperie for the Banana Peanut-butted Crepes and the Buffett for a good French breakfast. Otherwise, we didn't really eat here. The room was great with no problems whatsoever and a comfortable bed to sleep in. We didn't spend too much time in the room, though.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Paris”
Reviews.Author: romana
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from Paris Las Vegas after a 4 night stay with my Husband and 2 Teenagers. Over the past year I have read numerous reports about the Paris and was concerned as many were not good but I am extremely well travelled and have stayed in many hotels all over the world and I have to say we all enjoyed our stay. This was a first visit for us all to Las vegas and I chose the Paris as it was in a good central position on the Strip and from a location point of view it did not disappoint. If I returned to Las Vegas I would stay either at Paris, Bellagio or Casears as in my opinion they are in the best location. The reception area is extremely nice as is the shopping area and Cafe/restaurants. We had a room on the 15th floor overlooking the dancing fountains at the Bellagio. The room had 2 queen beds and although not overly large was really clean and perfectly adequate for the time we spent in it. The Bathroom was lovely with the separate Bath and Shower which was lovely and powerful and really woke you in in the morning. Now to the staff - very mixed there but I suppose they deal with so many guests and like everywhere you are bound to get good and bad. On the whole the staff were courteous and I only experienced one lady on reception who was offhand so I would again put this as a positive. The hotel in my opinion is well worth a visit and with all the touches is very parisian ie the Eiffel tower etc and I could honestly say I would stay again and my fussy teenagers were very enthusiastic so again a major plus there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room Only.......”
Reviews.Author: Teach1977
Reviews.Content: Our room was lovely, the bathroom big and had a big mirror. The negative about this hotel is there werent places to get a quick coffee or grab a snack or just sit and read for a while. The pool was open and is big and had many places to sit. The view there is great. As a frequent guest to Las Vegas, I would not recommend this hotel. As I did enjoy the room, I had to go to other hotels for every thing else.

Reviews.Title: “Discrimination at Cafe Ile St. Louis”
Reviews.Author: paris_1204
Reviews.Content: The review from the poster who felt discriminated against seemed laughable to me at first. But my husband and I had a very terrible experience which we felt was due to the fact that we are Asians. It didn't matter that we are Asian Americans, just the fact that we were not Caucasian that this one particular server singled us out to abuse us. Please read about our experience at the Cafe Ile St. Louis: Tonight, December 29, 2005, my husband and I had a very upsetting and unpleasant experience at Paris's Ile St. Louis cafe. We were seated on the patio and waited for almost 15 minutes with menus in hand waiting for our server. In the meantime, another table was seated and waited on by a server. A Filipino busboy came by and asked us if we were helped yet and when we said 'No' he went to get our server. Our server asked what we wanted to drink and after our request for a particular mineral water was not available, we opted to order two Pepsi's. The busboy came by about five minutes later and told my husband in confidence that the Pepsi was flat and so we were preparing to inform our server of another drink when he came back to us. Another 15 minutes went by and our server produced no drink order nor came by to check on us. In the meantime, we noticed that another table was seated and said server had gotten their drink orders and was proceeding to take their meal orders. I was livid at this point and my husband urged me to calm down and wait thinking our server would bring our drinks at any minute. I told my husband I did not believe that was so as he got the drinks for the other table whose patrons were seated long after we were. In fact, we felt very self-conscious as we were seated on the side but still in full view of other diners and we were the only patrons who were being ignored! In any event, after the server didn't acknowledge my signal he came over after I called out. I asked why he did not come over as he saw me signal to him. He proceeded to argue with me and insisted he did not see me. Clearly he did and my husband noticed that he turned his face after I signaled to him. I was more upset at this point due to his bad attitude. We questioned him about our drinks order. He was haughty and presumptious by telling us that he saw us speaking to the busboy and assumed he told us that the Pepsi machine was broken. In my husband and my opinion it is the server's duty to inform the patrons of any problems regardless of the fact that the busboy brings out the drinks. By now my husband and I were very very upset and decided that the server was singling us out for whatever reason. The bottom line was that he refused to serve us. We decided that we would not sit there and take that type of abuse and pay for it. Therefore, we got up and proceeded to walk out. The server followed us and shouted to us that if we wanted to speak to his manager he would get him. My husband felt that he was challenging us so we decided to speak to the manager and told him our story. Mark, the manager, apologized for the rudeness of his server and made an excuse for him saying that the server was just coming on shift as if that's a good excuse for his behavior towards us. We said that's not right. The manager said he would be sure we were treated well, but we declined as we were so upset that we did not feel like eating again. We mentioned to the manager that perhaps the server was discriminating us due to our race. We are Asian. It was very presumptious of him to think that the busboy, an Asian, would tell us of any problems. That is a server's job, not a busboy's but the intonation is that Asian to Asian we were speaking to each other. My husband and I feel that the server is prejudiced although the manager claims racial discrimination was not the cause. Whatever the reason-racial discrimination or a bad day-gives no server to treat patrons in the shabby way that this server treated us. As I told the manager, we have travelled to Europe and to other countries and we have never been treated so shabbily before. Ironically I've been to France many times and know that the French are thought of to be stereotypically rude. But we have never been treated rudely there, but we come home to the States and on a visit to Vegas we get treated the same way as how Americans claim the French treat them: rude! Is racial discrimination a criteria for hiring staff at Vegas hotels?

Reviews.Title: “rude americans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: a nice place, rude to people from other countries and not very friendly. period. if they know you are not from america they treat you liek dirt. but what else can you expect from americans right diep . AUS

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: sirronah
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, very comfortable and very busy. The Deluxe room (queen beds) was very good - with an excellent bathroom - although it lacked a fridge and complimentary tea/coffee making facilities: nothing is free in Las Vegas but we thought this was cheap; room service is just plain extortionate so forget it and drink water. Don't open the mini bar which clocks up what you move after 45 seconds at ludicrous prices. In general, don't go to Las Vegas if you want value for money because you have to pay through the nose for everything; the Paris is no exception. (The hotels don't compete on price, they have formed a cartel and prices are artificially high. That is a given!) As for the Paris, the breakfast buffet at the The Village was very good indeed at $12.50 per person such that we ate there regularly. However, the dinner buffet in the same location was poor - don't bother, there are many alternatives elsewhere. The Provençal, with opera singing waiters, was good and very enjoyable unlike Mon Ami Gabi, the bistro at the front of the hotel, which had staff ranging from a typical American over-zealous fawning, to plain arrogance: it appears that we were privileged to be allowed to pay to eat in their establishment. It is also essential during your meal there to work out which member of staff you are allowed to ask for the check, because if you ask the wrong one, wait for the sarcastic reposte - you will not get the check until you you find 'your' waiter, notwithstanding that he disappears for long periods. For an excellent meal, with superb service, try the Cafe Ballagio across the street. Would we stay there again? Definitely yes, at the right price, as a good room is a good room! Would we eat there again? Only breakfast! Of course, if the competion can provide a good room and good dining competitively, then maybe a change would be on the cards.

Reviews.Title: “Dinner Buffet>> No way!”
Reviews.Author: RICHB351
Reviews.Content: As, somewhat of Las Vegas, 'Buffet' connoisseur,I definatlely don't like this one,for dinner.I forgot that a couple of years ago,a friend and I ate dinner here,and regreteted it.This passed Nov., as I already had a seat and beverage,I went to view the food and immediately,realised I 'goofed'! The same looking 'mush', was served,years later! It's hard to find anything that's appetizing,the beef,shrimps are good,the other food,I couldn't look at or eat! I arrived at about 4:30 p.m.,and did find a sausage 'kabob',I thought I'd like.But, the 'chef' said they were ALREADY out of sausages,as dinner just got started! Go somewhere, else! Try 'Wynn's' buffet on Fri.,eve,$37,but excellent!

Reviews.Title: “NOT kid friendly, and disappointing food”
Reviews.Author: petalutha
Reviews.Content: At first glance, the Paris hotel is quite beautiful. The rooms are elegant and tastefully decorated, and the casino and shops are ok. However, the food was a disappointment. There are very few choices, especially for breakfast. Everything was very expensive, there were no value alternatives. So if you stay there, expect to spend at least $10-20 per person extra each day for breakfast. (unless you go to another hotel for breakfast, but that requires a lot of walking time!) All the food is also French, generally speaking. Other hotel/casinos offer many varied selections. The Aladdin next door to us had Tex-mex, PF Changs, Italian food, etc. We would've liked more variety in the dining establishments. My biggest disappointment was some of the employees' attitudes towards children. I would NOT recommend staying here with kids. We went to meet up with my brother-in-law and his family - it was our family reunion for this year. We had 2 two year olds with us on the trip. Some of the staff were friendly and smiling at the kids (who were very well behaved), but unfortunately there were many employees at the Paris who were down right rude to us and the children. One employee (at a cafe) nearly knocked me and my child over trying to get by (even though I was trying to get out of her way), and at the casual restaurant we went to for lunch, they were rude to the kids. They also offered NO kids menu whatsoever. That is a clear indication to me that they do not really want children there in the first place. I cannot excuse rudeness from an employee at any level, regardless of whether it is directed toward a child or an adult. If you choose to stay at this hotel, leave your kids at home, and be prepared to trek to another casino for food variety.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Moe_Ipak
Reviews.Content: I had an amazing time at the hotel. The service was amazing. The food wasn't great at the place, but the rooms were perfect. As read, I requested to be upgraded to a P room, with a view fo the strip and they did so. I guess a P room would be a corner room, because it was a lot larger than some of the open rooms that we saw. The cleaning people did a great job. The environment was great inside.

Reviews.Title: “Tres bien!”
Reviews.Author: lawahoo2001
Reviews.Content: We stayed during the week of Thanksgiving. This was our second stay, and once again, we were very pleased. The hotel truly has the best location on the Strip. Also, the quality of the hotel, casino, and restaurants far exceed most hotels on the Strip, with the exception of the Bellagio, Venetian, and Wynn, which are far more expensive than Paris. This hotel is the best value on the Strip. We paid less than $500 for 4 nights through the AAA website, and this includes tax. (If we weren't AAA members, then it would have cost $50 more to book direct through the hotel's website.) We did the airport check-in, which was great. I requested a king size bed, non-smoking room, on a high floor, with a quiet location and a view of the Strip. They accomodated me in every way except for the view of the Strip, which would have costed $60/night extra. A tip on the airport shuttle - don't book it through the airport check-in - instead do it directly through the shuttle service (Showtime was a good company). Otherwise, the hotel will charge you more (some kind of convenience fee?). I found the mattress of the bed in our room to be highly comfortable. The bathroom is the best feature of the room - marble throughout with a separate tub and glass shower. A word of warning about the mini bar - don't even move anything in there unless you plan on paying for it. There are sensors that will cause your room to be charged within 45 seconds of you moving something, so don't try to store bottled H2O in there. I did, and had to call the front desk to have the charges removed (I checked my hotel bill on a daily basis through the TV). We love Paris and will stay there again next time we go!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights Nov 20-23 at a rate of $ 99 per night. Was able to check in early at 10:30am with a nice comfortable king bed room on the 14th floor. I asked for a complimentary upgrade but with no avail. The front desk asked if I wanted to pay $ 60 extra per night for an upgrade to a Strip view, breakfast, hordorves, etc. which I turned down. Paris is a great location to the other hotels. We had some questions on playing the slot machines and the hostess was very helpful. I lost a cell phone somewhere at Paris or Ballys. Even though I never found the cell phone, the Paris lost and found dept was very helpful in contacting Ballys' security to look for the phone. One complaint, our room was near the maids quarters and each morning around 9am, there was a lot of noisy conversation among the maids. They should be aware of their early morning conversations.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Paris!”
Reviews.Author: SommerinTexas
Reviews.Content: We took my mom to Vegas the week of Thanksgiving 2005 for her birthday, and we stayed at the Paris. We were 100% satisfied with the hotel. We loved how it really looked like the cobblestone streets of Paris. The room was nice - maybe a little small - but the bathroom was very spacious. We tried the Village Buffet for breakfast and dinner, and it was fabulous. We also ate at JJ's Boulangerie for a quick breakfast one day, and it was good. (We also went to Rosemary's Restaurant off the strip for a special final dinner, and it was completely amazing. I highly recommend it!) If you like poker, you can go next door to Bally's (connected to the Paris), and they have a larger poker area. I also prefer their variety of slot machines. The location of the Paris is perfect - right in the middle of the strip. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a really good time at the Paris Hotel. We ate at several of the restaurants and everything was fantastic! We requested an upgrade and received a P room for no additional charge. The P-rooms are wonderful. They're larger than the regular rooms and the views are amazing! The location on the strip can't be beat. I will recommend this hotel to friends and family. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “So much smoke in room, I can't breathe!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed at the Paris Hotel and ended up taking allergy pills every night. Our smoke-filled room on the 15th floor was a nightmare. I literally had to sleep with a sheet over my head to breathe clean air. Very disappointed with our stay. Previously stayed at the MGM Grand and had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Watch the concierge floor rip-off!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When I called the Paris to make my reservation, I was told that for $45 extra per day my room would be on the 31st floor with a Strip view and access to a "concierge buffet breakfast" and afternoon drinks and hors dourves and some other benefits. That sounded good and I said I'd take it. When I arrived, they put me in a 7th floor room with a view of the roof and an overturned trash can. The "concierge breakfast" was in a very small 31st floor room, crammed with people and no place to sit, with tiny danishes and machine coffee in styrofoam cups. Don't fall for this "concerige floor" ploy, save your $45 and go to breakfast/drinks on your own. Although I reserved for three nites, I checked out after the first night and went to another major Strip hotel. The Paris employees gave the impression that they just didn't care.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Saswa
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights Paris was fantastic in our opinion best on the strip for location and Casino. We had a standard room and it was superb could not fault anything room size and ameneties excellent. It was also great being linked to Bally's this gave easy access to the monorail which was good for getting up and down the strip. The Mandara Spa was great had full body massage and it was probably the best I have ever had. The buffet breakfasts at the village buffet were amazing we ate one breakfast at Aladdin next door, they advertise as being the best on the strip Paris was much better! The staff at Paris were always polite and helpful. It was our first time to Vegas and WOW it was amazing can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!”
Reviews.Author: mcurt9
Reviews.Content: this is my fav hotel in the world-i love that its in the center of the strip and the service is great---try and get a view facing the strip its worth it--their casino doesn't have that smoke feeling when u walk though it..and the casino staff couldn't have been better- I also like how they have a safty channel in the room for safty concerns and what to do in case of an emergency. this is the place i will only stay when i come to vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: SKgolf
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the Paris. The location is great, it is connected to Bally's both physically and organizationally. the food is great, staff is friendly, rooms are nice size and the bathrooms is very nice as well. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Classy”
Reviews.Author: Macemack
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from an extended weekend at the Paris Hotel. Overall our stay was above average. Here are the pluses: Clean Room, Excellent Cleaning Staff Clean Casino (Rugs and pathways are well maintained) Excellent Food Options (Mon Ami Gabi!) Interesting Interior (faux-Paris Streets) Very good ventilation system Lots of Elevators Quick Check-in/Check-out service Great Location on the strip Friendly Concierge and Baggage Attendants Delecious Buffet Here are the minuses: Charmless Pool Area (shaped like an octagon; boring) Ridiculously Expensive Eiffle Tower Bar ($40 for two glasses of champagne) Bad Poker Room (Does not attract players and is poorly situated) Here are the things that score Just-Average: Room Size (Treasure Island rooms were bigger) Room Decor (nothing special) Casino Layout (confusing mess, but I liked the tall ceilings) French Theme (Bellagio theme, whatever that is, is more appealing) Summary: This is a very nice hotel and not too pricey. The location is absolutely perfect, being right across the street from the Bellagio, and overlooking the fountain show. The food is very good. The cleaniless is almost a perfect 10. I would say this is a great option for those who want a nice stay on the stip without breaking the bank. The French theme is not overdone, and it does seem a little half-hearted, which isn't necessarily a bad thing either. Score: 8.5 out of 10

Reviews.Title: “We loved Paris!!!”
Reviews.Author: robynrollins
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful experience at the Paris Las Vegas Resort. We were there for 4 nights from Oct. 24-28 and couldn't have asked for more. We were given an upgraded room at check-in since we mentioned it was our anniversary and it was a very special trip. The Queen show was awesome. We received a discount on tickets for staying in the hotel. We enjoyed the gambling there (much less slots, but also much less noise). We had a corner room on the 16th floor and it had a view of the pool, tower, and fountains. Our housekeeper was fantastic and we received the extra pillows and towels requested immediately. Our ammenities were restocked daily. We did leave a tip each day ($5) but felt this was very worth the results. The breakfast buffet was excellent, wonderful pastries and a wide variety for a reasonable price, the line went fairly quickly, although we were there mid-week, might have been worse on the weekend as it seemed to be more crowded on Friday morning. The customer service was beyond our expectations. We used the monorail, loved the fountain show at night from the Eiffel tower. Couldn't have asked for more!

Reviews.Title: “Had a fabulous time at the Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary at the Paris Las Vegas and had a fabulous time. We called the ambassador check-in line the night before we arrived and requested a room with a view of the strip but were told it would be $45.00 extra per night. We did get a free upgrade to a P-Room. The P-Rooms are larger than a standard room and have 2 windows and a larger bathroom. We liked having the extra room more than viewing the strip anyway. We were on the 30th floor but never had to wait for an elevator. We ate most of our meals at the Paris restaurants but our favorite was the breakfast buffet. We really enjoyed going up the Eiffel Tower at night to see the Billagio fountains lit up. The pool was nice and always had seats available with free towels. My wife had 2 massages at the Spa and really enjoyed them. The housekeeper we had was very nice and cheerful and always left us plenty of towels & soaps. We tipped her $4.00 per day as she did an excellent job. The ceilings in the casino and shop walkways were very high and painted like the sky.
