We never noticed any smoke and the casino seemed quieter than other casino's. If we go back to Vegas we would definatly stay at the Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Paris”
Reviews.Author: TravelfromNYC
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Paris in late October as first time guests there and really enjoyed it. The hotel itself is very large without being intimidating, nicely decorated and boasts a very helpful staff. We had a Player's Club room on the 15th floor with views of the Eiffel Tower and the Bellagio fountains. The rooms themselves are very nicely appointed with extra large bathrooms featuring a tub and marble and glass enclosed shower. My one complaint is that the beds at the Paris are hard and not very comfortable. Despite being such a big hotel the elevators come and go in a flash - a big plus in a 30+ floor building. The staff was helpful and courteous - we were offered an upgrade upon arrival but the upgraded room was without the view so we chose to keep our original room. We ate at several restaurants at the Paris. Monami Gabi was very good, as was the Cafe and the Crepe stand. Excellent location too - central to everything on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jacana
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at The Paris before and found it very nice....last time we had an upgraded room which was a suite so we weren't sure what we would get this time. We just had a regular room but found it spacious, clean, and well maintained. We liked the fact that you can get to the elevators without spending much time going through the casino. We also liked the great restaurants and the accessability to the monorail through adjacent Bally's. It was raining when we were there and we noticed that several of the other hotels had leaky ceilings---we didn't see any leaks at the Paris. The checkin procedure was fine---we were offered an upgraded room for $89/night. We thought we'd look at the room before making a decision and decided that the regular room was fine....although if you want to splurge, the suite was really awesome with a large jacuzzi tub and nice sitting area. We also enjoyed the very nice pool area and found the poolside service personable and efficient. We have stayed in several different hotels in Las Vegas and this is our favorite!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: velvetcrush
Reviews.Content: We managed to get an exceptionally good rate of US$102nett on a Thursday night at the Paris. The airport check-in was quick and efficient, with a shuttle service of US$5.50/person offered at the counter(but be warned as the hotel seemed to be the last stop). We were allocated a corner room on the 21st floor, which was very spacious and well-kept, with a Strip view including half a view of the Bellagio fountain. A pleasant surprise indeed, given that an additional US$45 was required to get a full fountain view. The bathroom was immaculately clean and large with a separate shower and bathtub. Given the central location of the hotel (the monorail is a 7 minute walk towards Bally's, a shopping arcade at the Aladdin and a walk in the Bellagio gardens just minutes away), it has definitely been a great experience at the Paris, especially for couples on a romantic getaway. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Not even a single star!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When I checked in I found a dirty cup on the floor and room seemed unclean. I asked room maintenance to clean up the room, and then I sent out for dinner. I came back around mid night and found the cup still on the floor. I called manager but he just said sorry and did nothing. I paid $320 a night!! I WILL NOT STAY HERE AGAIN. NEVER!

Reviews.Title: “First Class Place”
Reviews.Author: paradise56
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night in July 2005. A really great standard motel room for $100.00 per night. Very comfortable room which was extra clean and very nicely furnished. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Make sure you use the Ambassador Express Check In, it can save you a one half hour wait. Bellagio water show across the street was nice. Only complaint was the huge crowds on a Monday night. I miss the days of silver coins in the slot machines. Now, it is all paper money.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back”
Reviews.Author: jsk
Reviews.Content: I guess the tone for the vacation was set by the RUDE attitude at the check in counter. We tried to check into our 3 rooms which had been booked for months by going to the airport check in. We were given the keys to the one Queen room and were told that another room was being cleaned but they weren't sure about the third. SO, we still had to go through check in at the hotel ( after 45 minutes at the airport). The woman at the hotel told us that the room they had arranged for us was not going to be available because the people who were there did not check out and had decided to stay. We had a choice of giving up the upgraded room or the king bed. I guess there are problems like that everywhere, but the attitude was unbelievably rude. We spent the first 3 hours in Vegas trying to get our room that we had arranged for and paid for one night in advance. This is supposed to be a top hotel and for the money you would think there would be more amenities. The HUGE hotels in Vegas are just too big for me. On the plus side, the location is good, the rooms are clean and there are good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: 96ers
Reviews.Content: Arrived after 6 days in Anaheim with 4 adults and 2 teens (16 and 14). Upgraded to rooms with a view of the fountains and eifel tower. WOW, worth every penny. Our rooms on the 22nd floor were very clean with a good sized bathroom and separte shower. Have read some not so good reviews regarding the pool area but we thought it was wonderful, certainly large enough and plenty of chairs and space available in the sun for most of the day. The cleaning service was fabulous, left a tip every day and at the end of our stay our cleaning lady left us a thankyou note which was lovely (haven't come across this before). Found the Paris slots very tight, although hubby did have a win for awhile but put it all back and then some!!!! All in all a great place to stay, central to everything and a lovely atmosphere. Would stay again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Dear God, the food!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paris 22 Sep through 25 Sep, attending festivities and wedding ala the chapelle du paradis for my little brother Joey and his new bride Risa. I stayed in a room on the 28th floor, a standard room with nice enough decor - nothing spectacular - the bathroom was lovely, however. I could have stayed forever, just to eat. The $12 Village Buffet breakfast (with 99cent Bloody Mary's before 10AM) was like a dream. Crepe, Omelette chefs on standby - puffed pastry filled with crab, breakfast meats of all kinds, quiche, eggs, fruits. Ate at the Les Artistes Steakhouse Friday - Prawns, filet mignon, and the most beautiful dark chocolate shelled chocolate and white chocolate mousse demi-mound, with dark chocolate ribbons decorating the top and edible gold confetti. Mon Ami Gabi on Saturday night with a poached Salmon in a citrus broth, crabcake appetizer in creamy pepper sauce, and the most exquisite creme brulee. And I noticed that each and every waiter was absolutely top notch, personable, and, in some cases, down right delightful. Even our Buffet wait person was pure 'full service,' for a serve yourself restaurant. She was so very personable and made us feel very special. The Wait Staff at the Les Artiste worked seamlessly waiting on our large pre-wedding dinner party. It was hectic, but they were cool - right there when you needed them and a GQ model of a waiter was particularly kind and attentive to my tired, weepy young neice who just wanted French Fries. He checked on her several times. At the Mon Ami Gabi, my female waiter hooked me up with a delicious Pina Colada with a silver server filled with extra whipped cream. Our primary waiter, a handsome dark-eyed, dark-haired man, was super. When I commented that he was "wonderful," he said: "when you love your job, you're wonderful. I love my job." I wish I had hugged each and every wait staff employee at the Paris. They made every delicious meal even more spectacular and special. The creperie was excellent as I fulfilled an Ohioan's unfulfilled memories of spongey, melt in your mouth French crepes, loaded with blueberries, blackberries, raspberries, strawberry, topped with chantilly cream. My cocktail of choice on the slots floor - (aside: boy I miss the machines that would jangle out coin winnings - the ticket system takes thrill out of it.) I lost pitifully, but was content feeling I evened out with Pina Coladas gratis - heaven help me - topped with real whipped cream. At the Paris, a granola bar, cereal, and Lean Cuisine girl died and went to milkfat heaven. The Paris is worth the trip for the amazing cuisine and the excellent, excellent service. And it is a beautiful casino capturing the charm of ala Francais with faux cobblestone and charming French building fronts. The domed 'sky' is always blue with some clouds - it's always a feel of France right before sunset. Amazing. Wasn't knocked out by the registry workers - a few were sourfaced and one woman directed my family to the hard to find end of the line with no joie de vivre whatsoever. The Paris may want to have wait staff train the desk staff on personality and gentile customer service. The average rooms, the uncheerful checker-inners (mostly applied to the unsmiling, impatient seeming female), take one star away from review. Due to the sights, ambiance, and glorious food and food service, I vow to go back to Vegas' Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Pascale
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a surprise, nice place, very good location and good restaurant (Mon ami Gaby)! We do not except so much. The room are nice, it's very good quality price. Ask for room with a view on Bellagio's fountain, it's worth it and if they have availability the will give you one without charge. We had really good time and we were very lucky at the casino

Reviews.Title: “great stay at Paris”
Reviews.Author: keylime
Reviews.Content: Booked the room for a five-night stay through the hotel website. The price dropped twice before our stay and the hotel readjusted the rate when I called; saved us $120.00! (So be sure to check back on rates after you book.) Checked in at the airport on a Sunday morning, and I had the room before my husband retrieved the luggage. I was very friendly to the desk attendant and told her it was our anniversary and could we have a room with a high floor number and a nice view. She said fountain views were extra, but she could give me a P room on the 29th floor, which is a corner room and larger than regular room. We picked up the key at the key desk as soon as we arrived at the hotel, and we were very pleased with the room. Had a sunrise view of the mountains, which was very pretty. The housekeeper did an outstanding job on our room. We tipped her 3.00 a day, and she loved us. The room was large, with 2 corner windows, sitting areas, and the bed was quite comfortable. There was ample closet and armoire room. The shower was good. The room wasn't smoky at all, in fact, the whole casino wasn't smoky, compared to some you'd walk through. Really appreciated the central location of the hotel. The pool was nice and relaxing. Service at La Provencal restaurant was a bit lacking, and the slots were tight, but those were about the only minor negatives. Bally slots were better, and it's connected to Paris. Paris casino in general did not have many people playing. We would have liked more casual food choices, such as lunch to take out to the pool or a late night snack. We used the monorail system (from the Bally's station)a few times to go north, and that's convenient. We got our airline boarding passes online the night before we left and had them faxed for no charge to the front desk. That was very convenient, as was the express checkout that we did on the tv screen right before we left. When we picked up the fax we asked for late checkout and she readily told us 1:00PM, which was what we wanted. We had a wonderful stay at Paris and would definitely stay there again. The Parisian theme in the casino and shopping areas is lovely.

Reviews.Title: “loved the location!”
Reviews.Author: wendic430
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Paris was great. We really enjoyed the Village buffet, only $12 on weekdays. Large bathrooms with a seperate shower. Room was a little small, but adequate. The central location on the strip is really nice. Pool area was ok, could use some new lounge chairs. Staff was friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Had a very nice stay at Paris”
Reviews.Author: Karen256
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend stay at Paris Las Vegas and loved it! This was my first visit to Vegas. This hotel is in a fantastic location, right in the center of the strip. The Parisian theming is beautiful. The whole hotel and casino had a great ambiance. The staff was helpful and very friendly. There is a great choice of several nice restaurants. The breakfast buffet had a large variety of delicious foods. The crepe station could use more choices. The room was well appointed, clean and spacious. We never heard any noise at all coming from the hallway or other rooms. We had a great corner room with views of the south end of the strip from one window and a view of the Arc de Triomph and partial view of the Bellagio fountains from the other window, and we didn't pay any extra for the view. The bed was a little on the firm side, which we prefer so it was great for us. There were plenty of elevators so we never had to wait more than a few seconds. If I had to find a negative it'd be that there wasn't a coffee maker in the room. Overall, we had a great stay at this hotel and can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: phl5110
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Paris in Dec of 2004 w/ two girlfriends. We asked for a room with a view of the strip and got an AWESOME view of the Eiffel tower and the Bellagio fountain show. Room was great, the bathroom was huge and gorgeous. Only complaint was room service was very slow, but we only ordered it once so no big deal....location is super convenient to walk to any of the casinos, I wouldn't want to stay all the way at the end of the strip because it is so far to walk. Great value for what we paid, can't believe it didn't cost more per night!! I would definitely stay there again and recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and overall good choice”
Reviews.Author: MIZZOU1986
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at the Paris and overall had a pleasant time. Staff was helpful and location of the hotel on the strip is great. After checking out other hotels we found the casino at the Paris a bit small with a smaller selection of poker tables. Room was a suite and we agree with previous reviewer that even though we were on non smoking level parts of the floor did smell of smoke. Had dinner at Mon Ami Gabi and highly recommend restaurant as both service and food were excellent. Massage at spa was also enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We read the many reviews and used what we learned. Asked for an upgrade from our deluxe room at the airport check-in with a $20 bill visible under my hand. It was either that or the fact that we were staying at the Paris to celebrate our 48th wedding anniversary, but we were upgraded to a wonderful corner view room on the 25th floor. The clerk refused it, but we left the tip anyway and when we saw the room it was well worth it. Everything about the room was spotless. We left $2 every day for the cleaning lady and even though we sometimes didn't leave the room until noon the "Do not disturb" on the door was respected. We ordered the $12.95 continental breakfast from room service and it was convenient and worth the cost, including the additional $2.50 room service charge per person. The sheets were fine and we did not request that they be changed every day as the bathroom counter card notified us could be done. The towels were rough as one person complained, but soft towels make it difficult to dry yourself. The Village Buffet and the Eiffel Tower were very good as was Mon Ami Gabi where we tried the onion soup recommended by LA Times Paris writer Susan Spano. Right on Susan! The best restaurant was Le Provencal which we didn't try until our last day. If we have any complaint it is the confusion over the connection card which we arranged over the hotel web site as recommended. We fed those slot machines quite generously and before we left we checked to see if we had received any credits on the card. We had earned a Paris Hotel T-shirt which we now call the most expensive T-shirt we have ever purchased!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!!!! We booked with fabutravel”
Reviews.Author: budget101
Reviews.Content: We really liked the paris, good location and nice rooms. If you're looking for a hotel that is upper class, but a good cost, the paris is good. We booked through a little travel company in canada, they were amazing and we were able to do everything through email, their company is fabutravel.

Reviews.Title: “first trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed at the paris had a great time the staff were the nicest and politest in vegas the food in the buffett and the cafe were the best out of most the other hotels yes the rooms could use refreshing but it one i stayed in was great the staff on the casino floor were always around and helpful cant say that for the other casinos we want to return again soon was a great stay after checking out all other casinos we always hung out at the paris we wish to thank the staff for a wonderful time bought time share but my husband wants to go back to the paris

Reviews.Title: “Paris was good experience But”
Reviews.Author: jake2771
Reviews.Content: Overall it was a neat experience. BUT-I would have expected more given the room rates. A nice robe would have been a small improvement. Even though we were on a non-smoking floor-everything smelled of smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Paris 8/18-8/22”
Reviews.Author: SusanS
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Paris for four nights. Our room was nice and very clean. It was done in blue and beige. The furniture was french looking or course, and the bathroom was a decent size. The housekeeping group did a wonderful job. No sooner did we leave our room, they were there cleaning it, and it was spotless. The restaurants were good, and the buffet was surprisingly good. I would definately go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms Need a Makeover Soon!!!”
Reviews.Author: amfmoore
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 9 days from May 29th - June 6th. Overall we love this hotel as it is very easy to get around such as getting your car at the valet, or your morning coffee as it's just a few steps from the elevator. All of the food at this hotel is wonderful also and our favorite is Mon Ami Gabi. Wonderful food and atmosphere!!! But we do have complaints about the room as they are in very much need of a makeover as the carpet and bedspreads are worn and the bathroom faucet was leaking. What I am saying here is for the money that they charge for a night here they need to seriously do some upgrading as a lot of the other hotels have upgraded their rooms with very comfortable beds and new carpeting and bedspreads and your not paying as much as you do for the Paris. We will not be going back here until we hear they have upgraded the rooms as we can do much better for less money elsewhere. Please Paris, start some makeovers soon so we will come back as love your hotel and the location!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Room problems”
Reviews.Author: AnnieMichelle
Reviews.Content: Well, everyone has glowing reviews but we had some problems during our stay August 5. I booked two rooms on their website for $169.00 night. I asked for a view and was willing to pay for one. We checked in to a view of the parking lot. Apparently nothing else was available but were upgraded to two suites. Very large suites. Problem was, we asked for two queen beds. Again not avaialbe. Our 6' 2" son ended up sleeping on the couch. I thought this was a bit riduculous. One of the rooms wet bar smelled so bad of sewer we had to request a room change. The whole rooms stunk. One chair was so filthy no one would sit on it. The wall paper was peeling off in the bathroom. The have a great location here, but need to update the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “excellent place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the paris hotel with 4 of my girlfriends, we left the husbands at home, it was so beautiful the eiffel tower was at the pool, no other hotel could even compare a view like that. all of us girls went to the spa at the hotel, we all had massages and sat around in terrie cloth robes and drank flavored juice and tea. It was the best fun in a long time. It was the perfect thing to do with your girlfriends to take a break for a couple days away from the kids and feel free again. had alot of fun just chit chatting in the little quant coffee shops and playing the slots the staff was friendly and the hotel was clean and gorgeous.jill

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: canadabound
Reviews.Content: we stayed 2 nights and got a special deal mid week via the hotel website for $79 + tax-best of all as we had 2 teenagers with us there were no extra person charges.We were given a 2 bedded room on the non smoking 22nd floor with a good view The location is excellent-we were originally going to stay off strip but the special deal we got meant it was cheaper to stay here than at our original choice. Getting around:The monorail station is actually at Bally's next door-we found by the time we'd found our way through 2 large hotels it was just as easy to walk along the strip! We have no interest at all in gambling-we just wanted to experience the spectacle that is Las Vegas-the hotel was ideal for that. We did find it pretty peculiar that despite notices everywhere that minors are not allowed to loiter near the gambling you had to pass through the casino area in nearly every hotel to be able to get outside! The hotel pool was very good -under the Eiffel tower and landscaped to resemble a parisian Park-mists of cooling spray very welcome in the middle of the Vegas heatwave! Las Vegas is definitely a Disneyland for adults but our teenage children also enjoyed the holiday-we felt safe at all times and it was a highlight of our fly drive holiday to Vegas, LA and San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “Paris in Las Vegas - Worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found a good rate on this hotel using the Paris Hotel's own website. The several nights I spent there were great, and I didn't even have a "premiere view" room! Comfortable bede, spacious standard room and pleasant, quiet surroundings. Quite a difference from the horrible MGM Grand I endured later in the week. In fact my friends and I kept referring back to the Paris as the de facto standard for a good Las Vegas Hotel. Though we stayed at three different hotels during our ten days there, this was the best. We enjoyed meals at several of the eateries at the Paris. Mon Ami Gabi was delightful - but avoid the patio if the heat is ruling. I adored their famous buffet which lived up to its reputation as one of the best in Las Vegas. Not every item was perfect, but most were exceptional. And the price for the dinner buffet became another benchmark as we visited overpriced restuarants throught the city. We wished we were back at the Paris Buffet, and we did indeed return there several times. It was a pleasure to walk a few steps to the elevators to our rooms, too! I am a frequent visitor to LV, and while the Paris is not the Ritz or Four Seasons, it will keep me returning until I hit the jackpot and can afford such rarified establishments!

Reviews.Title: “Good Price for one of the Better Hotels”
Reviews.Author: rockchick
Reviews.Content: Excellent price for a nice hotel. My rate by day varied, but I probably paid about $100/ nite. It is a beautiful hotel, tho rather small casino. And I hate the smoke. Pool area with the Tower is a lovely site. Food prices throughout are reasonable. My room was a bit smaller than I'd like, but very nice. Would have loved a fridge in the room.Service good, tho the fake frence is cheesy. Convenient to check in at the airport. Excellent steak house, The show, WE WILL ROCK YOU is a MUST SEE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Napolean's lounge in Paris”
Reviews.Author: foofoome
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Vegas and found a wonderful place to smoke cigars in Paris. The lounge is called Napolean's, and used to be a cigar lounge. It's decorated in dark wood and red velvet, is very laid back, uncrowded, and has happy hour from 4-7, where you get free gourmet sandwiches brought to you with your cocktails. There is a cigar shop in the back, so this seems like it would fit your requests. We had an absolutely wonderful, and relaxing time. They have dueling pianos late in the evening, but go during happy hour. There were maybe 10 people in the entire place every time we walked by, and the service was EXCELLENT. We were treated extremely well. Had some wonderful black martini's and top shelf margaritas. See pics.............

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with Paris”
Reviews.Author: ArkansasOrchid
Reviews.Content: Paris was perfect for us. We were traveling with two teenage daughters who loved the ambiance. The hotel is beautifully themed and attractive and we had no problems of any kind during our stay. We found the room to be perfectly adequate with a large bathroom that includes both a glass shower and a separate bathtub. We checked in at the airport (explained on their web site) and found this to be extremely easy and fast. We asked advice at the concierge desk several times and also booked a Grand Canyon tour at their excursions desk and were pleased with the service in all cases. We requested extra hangers and pillows from Housekeeping just before leaving for dinner and found exactly what we requested in our room when we returned. No problems or negative experiences of any kind during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Paris hotel (Outstanding)”
Reviews.Author: ladynewyorker
Reviews.Content: Outstanding is all I can say about the Paris Hotel, from check-in, room, maid service, & food. We were very pleased and would highly recommend to all. Even the the slot machines paid off. Been a while since I ever left with their money in my pocket. (PS cocktail waitress's were pleasant and you could always get a drink if you were playing the slots.)

Reviews.Title: “Loved Paris !”
Reviews.Author: AdamZach
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this hotel and our trip. Even though the temp was 118 outside (highest in Las Vegas EVER), we had a grand time because of the hotel. Terrific employees everywhere in the place! Everyone wanted to make sure we enjoyed ourselves. We would go back in a minute (but probably in October, not July)!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: dixiediva
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is absolutely breathtaking. No problems with our room, however at checkout "maryanne" was having a bad day. (no exceptional customer service there) The ceilings were painted as to give you the illusion of sky. At one point I actually thought of staying inside the whole time! My first trip to Vegas & probably my last. I have to say it is a place you absolutely love or could live without. Enjoyed the Hotel & Casino & would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Paris, A Wonderful Spot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Makes you think you really are in Paris! The location is great right in the middle so you really can walk down the strip by going in and out of near hotels, there is a monorail also. The room was very nice. We did have a room which had the view of the top of what must have been the kitchen because we woke up smelling food. So one call with the complaint of the smell and we were moved to a room on a higher floor with a side view of the strip. I really like the beds, very comfortable and the bathroom was spacious. There was not a table so we had to eat room service with one sitting on the bed and the other in a chair-it was fine after a night of gambling. The buffet was wonderful! Great variety and wonderful desserts. The main resturant was very good also lots of choices. The service was prompt and very polite - everyone smiles and is happy to do their job! Not the best place for comps. The view from the "Tower" is a nice touch, but I could do without. It is a price-y place but in this case - you do get what you pay for. It was a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Worth it”
Reviews.Author: MDinDenver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris June 30 - July 1st. We loved the room and the atmosphere of the casino. The food at Le Cafe and at the Buffet were both above average and the bread from La Boulangerie was excellent. We had no trouble with anything and very much enjoyed our stay. We enjoyed sitting around and watching a house band with drinks on Friday night. We would come back here as long as the room rate was below $150, and we were coming to Vegas anyway. As far as gambling goes, when I came here a few years ago, the slots were fun to play - their payback was pretty good, so it took a long time for you to lose your money. This time, I lost my $200 really fast - I think I won maybe three times. I would not recommend playing the slots here. Also, how do people get comps here? I lost $200 and that's it, got nothing for it, and wasn't even sort of kind of anywhere near close to the lowest $10 comp when using their Card. No e-mails or letters from them after two weeks asking me to come back either - oh well. Positives: everything about the room was excellent; food; "eiffel" tower views; atmosphere; middle of strip. Negatives: crowded on holiday weekend - very busy starting on Friday and I am glad we were not there for the entire weekend (don't know if that's normal or if it was just because of the 4th of July); slots must have a very low payback - you'll lose your money FAST; don't expect comps.

Reviews.Title: “21st Birthday Gift Trip with Boyfriend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My first time in Las Vegas and my 21st Birthday all rolled into one! My boyfriend surprised me with a suite on the 15th floor overlooking the Watershow at the Bellagio on one side and the pool on the other. We stayed at Paris for 13 days. The service, atmosphere and overall experience was absolutely wonderful. The bathrooms are gorgeous, the room was immaculant, and the great room service came in handy on those hard to get out of bed days. It was the most memorable experience in my life, and I can't wait to come back. It's hard to leave Vegas, but even harder to leave after spending almost two weeks at the Paris Hotel. Oh, I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a romantic, yet youthful atmosphere. Not stuffy and old! Thanks Paris!

Reviews.Title: “you can get better with these rates....”
Reviews.Author: rchung07
Reviews.Content: My stay at Paris was a little above average at best. at check in, we upgraded to a "P" room which are the rooms at the end of each hallway. these rooms are a bit larger and have 2 windows instead of 1. the only negative is that these rooms are the furthest from the elevators...rooms are just average...you can find a WAY better room for the same price or cheaper (try mandalay bay, mirage, aladdin). other than the room, Paris is one of my favorite hotels at las vegas. the eiffel tower has wonderful views of the fountains at bellagio and the casino is one of the nicest around (i won the most money there out of all the casinos the past 2 yrs). the BUFFET IS THE BEST BUFFET IN VEGAS (along with the bellagio buffet) but is a bit pricey at around $25 for dinner. try MON AMI GABI for lunch...THE BEST, NOT SO EXPENSIVE RESTAURANT IN VEGAS with a wonderful area to sit right along the strip. overall, great resort, so-so rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: konarm
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our anniversary at Paris on July 3-5th. Extraordinarily crowded due to the holiday weekend. Navigating the mall was very difficult especially with suitcases. You have to pass through the entire length of the mall from the self-parking garage to get to the registration desk. Check-in was efficient and relatively quick. I asked for an upgrade to a room with a view of the Bellagio fountains and was told it would be an additional $60/night. With the fireworks display this probably would have been money well spent but I passed thinking it should have been free after reading other reviews. No one else mentioned being charged for an upgrade. The room was nice and clean and comfortable. I thought housekeeping was excellent. The elevators were fast. I like that the pool has it's own floor so you don't have to parade through the casino in your swimwear. We ate breakfast at the Buffet and waited about an hour in line. We thought it was worth the wait. We enjoyed both breakfast and lunch since we were seated at 11:00 am and they brought out the lunch food at 11:30. At $13.95 it was a great value. I played the horses in the Sportsbook. It was probably the only non-crowded spot in the hotel. I was always able to get a table with a private TV. Not enough cocktail waitresses but the drinks were strong and you don't have to ask for those pesky drink tickets. Plenty of screens and helpful cashiers. They explained all the parlay payouts to me for the baseball cards. They didn't jump your case if you accidently answer your cell phone. I stayed at Ceasars last trip and they have cell phone nazi's. We like the ceiling in the casino which depicts a blue sky with scattered clouds. We saw Celine Dion at Ceasars for $127.50 a ticket and would gladly fork it out again. Fantastic show. We also saw Clint Holmes at Harrahs and used the 2 for 1 coupon in the magazine they put in your room. He was also fantastic and we loved the cozy theater. He comes out in the audience and mingles with the crowd. We would stay at the Paris again just not during a holiday weekend.

Reviews.Title: “what a wonderful hotel/casino”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my husband and I just returned from a wonderful 4 night stay at the paris. I have to give them high ratings because we were treated very well from the time that we checked in at the airport and upgraded to a P room at no extra charge till the time we left. The food everywhere from monami gambi to the breakfast and supper buffet and in between was excellent. What a fantastic variety of food and very good. service was also great everywhere we ate . The front desk was more than willing to help us with directions to get to hoover dam and back by giving us a card with printed directions that were exact and easy. I couldnt believe how fast the valet service was! our room was very clean and nice and the maid kept everything very tidy and clean. If we asked for anything we were always answered with "ofcourse", or "how can we help you?". This was our first trip to vegas and on an airplane! Its taken me 30 years of marriage to fly, but we are so glad we took this trip! we definately will return to the paris hotel. Also, they removed our room charges and 2 meals off of our bill,leaving us with a 0 balance from our play there, and we also had good luck! please give paris a try--WE lOVED IT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ooooh La La Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the beautiful Paris hotel for two nights (July 3rd and July 4th) and overall I have to say it's a great hotel. We booked through their website and got a room with two beds. It looks exactly as advertised (I've stayed at places that don't look anything like what's posted so I appreciate it when it's near or exactly the same as photographed). The AC wasn't very strong but it got the job done. The pillows are very small and lumpy but it didn't bother us so much since we were bone tired when we went to bed. The water pressure at the Paris hotel is fabulous! After staying at one too many hotels with the dinky water saver shower heads we really appreciated the powerful stream of water (especially great after a LONG drive). We got to the hotel very early (3AM!) and we couldn't check in until 11AM so we walked around the strip area. Since it was the holiday weekend there were quite a few crazy people outside (Las Vegas really doesn't sleep!). I won't go into what we saw but let's just say that it doesn't hurt to be aware of your surroundings. After our long car ride it did feel very nice to stretch our legs and Vegas was still very warm so early in the morning so it was an interesting walk. We heard the buffet at Paris was very good so we tried the breakfast buffet and I'd rate it just slightly above average. Service was good, they cleared our plates quickly and got us our drinks/refills promptly. I guess I'm just spoiled as I've been to Paris, France and the food just wasn't the same/up to par. I'm a big fan of crepes and found these to be just "OK." The breads were ok, nothing to write home about. The eggs were nasty and the eggs benedict was just blah. The english muffin was very hard so it made chewing a chore. I did enjoy the waffles, they tasted like cakes and topped with fresh fruit and whipping cream it was devine-I'm just sad I didn't try it first and was too full to get seconds! Overall, it was an enjoyable buffet, just not the BEST as I've read here and other places. Check-in went smoothly. I called their Ambassador hot-line at 8AM and was able to jump the line (after finding the manager) during check-in at 11AM. I highly recommend you call the Ambassador hot-line 2 hours before you arrive to expediate check-in as the line is a bear! On the second night, we tried the Mon Ami Gabi restaurant and found it very good. I like the carrot thing (I think that's what it is) they give you with the bread! Their Cosmo is actually very delicious (although I love the one from Morton's more.) We ordered the shrimp appetizer on the recommendation of our server (forgot the name of the dish) and it was actually just OK, we don't really recommend it. For entrees: I had the steak with peppercorns and my sister had the lamb both were very good. We didn't try their dessert as we were too full. I'd give this restaurant a B+. The casino: I don't usually gamble as I go to Vegas for the shows and shopping but I did donate $100 to the bank of Paris. Didn't win anything here but I did win at the Wynn and Bellagio. Overall I would rate our stay at the Paris an A-.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had been to Las Vegas last year and went to the Eiffel Restaurant for dinner, and simply fell in love with this hotel! Everyone at the hotel, from the bellhops to the Concierge were very friendly and eager to help in any way. We checked in early and were told that a king size bed wasn't ready, but that we could upgrade to a suite for an additional $85 a night. We thought about it and decided to give it a try. Unfortunately the suite was nothing fabulous and we decided to wait for a standard king instead. We did not have to wait long when we went back down to reception...we were given a corner king with a wonderful view immediately! This room was larger than a standard room and we had windows all around! It was just magnificent! We opted for room service for most of our mornings and we were glad that we did. As you know - you can't go anywhere in Vegas without it costing a fortune for food, so we were very happy that their $12 European Pastry Basket included 6 croissants and a whole pot of coffee and a large orange juice! It was all we needed to start the day, and at $6 a person - you can't go wrong. Since we were on East Coast time and we were up at 5 am, we opted to take morning swims when the pool opened at 8am and the pool was hardly occupied at that time. Dry cleaning was picked up and dropped off in a timely manner and was pretty reasonable. The casino is not as sprawling as the Bellagio across the street, but we still managed to win! Valet service is lightning fast and the hotel has put in wonderful misters so that you stay nice and cool while you wait. In the end, the Paris is a beautifully themed casino that really makes you feel miles away in Paris, but we probably will opt for the Bellagio next time.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place just looks good from the outside, that's it. No one is helpful at the hotel, housekeeping sucks they knock on your door at 8am! the rooms are so small! just save your $$ and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “I love Paris every moment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I made reservations at Paris for ourselves and our friends directly with the hotel web site. We were all extremely happy with the hotel, staff, and emenities. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a suite at no request, it was fab. Our friends stayed in a regular room which they were happy with also. The maid service was very good (tip daily$3.00), I don't know if that is why we got such good service or not. We split the cost of a Cabana one day, it was GREAT! we were given a fruit basket, soft drinks, water, and the servers came around a number of times to see if we required anything - coctails were also served as well as lunch/snacks, and it was service with a smile. The meals (2) were also quite good. Shopping was great, the hotel is centrally located so we ventured north and south. I highly recommend this hotel the rates were very good, plenty to see in and around the hotel itself, and the staff friendly. We are going back and will stay again. This was our 2nd trip to Vegas, the Luxor was the 1st place we stayed, we found it to be quite all right, but Paris is far and away much better for the same price. It was a very good trip.

Reviews.Title: “not privite”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice, and so was the casino. But the frist day we were there the maid came in are room when we were napping...to ask if we needed anything. Then the morning we were leving the maid came in our room again!!!!! and asked us what time we were checking out!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay at Paris Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a reservation through Travelocity to stay at the Rio. Had booked a trip 2 month in advance as a birthday/engagement trip from my fiance. He paid for the 3 day trip in advance, cash, $488 pp. Upon arriving at the Rio, we were told that they oversold hotel, and they would gladly put us up in the Paris hotel. They told us it was a "newer" hotel and beautiful. It was not to say the least. It was below average standards. It was in need of repair. The carpeting was dirty and soiled and it was not very clean. The staff sucked big time. No help with bags to your room. The lobbies were overcrowded and the machines were the worst I've ever played at. I would never again stay at the Paris or the Rio again. The view sucked as well. All we could see was the outdoor poor which had massive amounts of people in the pools.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - In the Middle of EVERYTHING!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I spent Halloween weekend in Vegas, and the Paris was a perfectly romantic hotel. It is connected to Bally's and has a lot of great shopping on the main floors. We ate a restaruant right off of the elevator for breakfast, and stood in line for 45 minutes. Only when we were seated did we find that we had not been waiting for the breakfast buffet, like everyone in line thought, but a sit down (rather expensive and not so good) breakfast. We could walk across the skyline to Cesar's and the Bellagio for shopping and dining. They had everything - I would reccomend these two hotels for a weekend of fun. All of the high-end shops, great restaruants, fun bars. Eat at Bertollini's for Italian or Cheesecake Factory for dessert. Fat Tuesday is right next to these restaruants with great big mixed drinks to walk with. Paris has a lot of great deals, especially during the week, and it's so close to everything (and cheaper than Bellagio and Cesar's). The atmosphere is definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Hotel doesn't deserve 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: Annieannie14
Reviews.Content: Our daughter was married at the Paris Hotel on April 30, 2005. I will say that the wedding chapel and the staff have their act together. They know what they are doing and are good at it. We did not have any problems with them. However, the hotel itself has really gone down. The customer service is extremely poor & the hotel rooms are in desperate need of renovations. We and several other couples checked in on April 28th. A few months before I had made arrangements, through Paris's consigner, for the wedding couple, some guests and ouselves to be picked up at the airport by a stretch limo with flowers for all the ladies and champagne for all. I re- confirmed the reservations and instructions a few days before leaving with the consigner and the limo company. When we arrived at the baggage pick up the chauffeur was waiting and pulled me aside to tell me that she had just gotten the call and had just arrived herself, she didn't have time to pick up the requested items. She wanted to stop at the flower machine in the airport and the at a liquor store with all of us in the limo I said no. The limo looked like it needed a good cleaning and the radio and windows didn't work. When we told the Paris consigner about this we were told that they would get back to us, we stopped back down 3 days later because no one had gotten back to us. We were told that we would be receiving a refund, we are still waiting for this to happen. We did, just the parents of the bride, get a free ride back to the airport. The room we had was old, shabby and in need of a good cleaning. The maid of honors room had a wet carpet and I mean the entire carpet was drenched, actually the whole room should have been hosed down it was so bad. The parents of the groom had a room where the air conditioning didn't work. When a repariman finally came he told them that the hotel had changed some of the cooling systems and they weren't working properly. He told them to open their windows because he couldn't fix the air. It was moth season and the hotel had signs on the desks warning guests not to open their windows. It got so hot in their room they didn't have a choice so at 3:00 in the morning they were chasing moths around their room. They had complained, they even went down to the front desk and they were told Oh Well there is nothing we can do for you. They didn't even offer to comp some of there stay. They were told no other rooms were available. I will say the Bride and Groom had a lovely suite but that was all part of their wedding package. There is more but this is long enough and I think anyone who reads this will get the idea. No one in the pary will ever stay at the Paris again this includeds the Bride and Groom. It really is ashame because they are letting a once lovely property go down hill fast.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Stay in Paris!!”
Reviews.Author: Leighy
Reviews.Content: I took my mother to Las Vegas for her birthday at the end of May 2005. We stayed at Paris for four nights and had a wonderful experience. Upon arrival at 10:30pm, we waited only a short time in line to check. After reading many other reviews on this site, I decided to try to get a room upgrade since we had only booked to stay in a standard room originally. First, I politely told the clerk that it was my mother's birthday (78 years young!) and asked if it was possible to be upgraded to a room with a view of the Bellagio fountains. She quickly said that it was not possible... that they did not do that. I told her that this was our first time in Vegas and that I was not really sure how things "worked "there. I then offered her a $20.00 tip adding that I read if one tips, one can often times get upgraded to a nicer room. She said she would check with her manager. She left and returned after a few minutes and said that she could indeed upgrade us to a room with a fountain view. I offered her the $20.00 but she graciously refused to accept it saying, "It is your mother's birthday". So... we got our upgrade for free. We did not gamble at the Paris. We opted for only playing the slot machines at places like Slots of Fun & The Flamingo and had pretty good luck in both places. We had dinner at the Steak House in Paris... can not remember the name but it was pretty expensive.... $38.00 for a steak, $8.00 for a side of asparagus and $7.00 for a side of french fries. The steak was very large and delicious but I would have been just as pleased eating at the Outback Steakhouse right up the street. We also ate dinner one evening at the Buffet which was wonderful for $24.95. It was worth every penny. A wonderful variety and very yummy! The sheets on the beds were a little rough but I did not find them as horrible as other reviews I have read on the site. The hotel itself was really beautiful and it was nice not to have to walk too far from the check-in desk to the elevators. By the way, we rented a little scooter for my mother and this really added to her enjoyment. She could aget round so easily without tiring out. We went up and down the strip numerous times over our four days there and she had a blast... I got lots of exercise, needless to say. The only other thing I will mention is that we saw the Anthony Cool hypnotist show at Paris. Now, the adverse for his show did say "raw and uncensored". I guess I should have realized what that really meant in Vegas. The show started out pretty funny but turned quite vulgar toward the middle and end. This guy actually had people on stage acting like they were --- a chair including my mother. She went on stage and I never, ever would have let her do that had I know what the Anthony guy would have these volunteers doing!!! I felt so humiliated for her. I wanted to complain but they did warn us that the show would be racey. I blamed myself and fortunately my mother did not really remember too much. She asked what she did with the chair and I told her that she had been dancing with it. It was pretty embarressing. Next time, we go to Vegas, I will have the good sense not to book any show that claims to be "raw & uncensored". I hope this review is helpful to others. I would definitely resommend staying at Paris. Other than Anthony Cools, it was a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Je ta'ime Paris!”
Reviews.Author: mastertraveler73
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked into the Paris after attending a business convention. We were wary since having such a poor experience at Cesars Palace. Our fears turned out to be unfounded. From the moment we arrived at the Paris, we fell in love with the place! Warm and inviting with just enough "theming" to keep things interesting, we had the time of our lives! We asked about upgrades upon check-in and were given one of the coveted "P" rooms (LeMans Suite). The room was clean, spacious with a bathroom larger than most of our own home! Nice two person shower and oversized tub. We didn't have the best view, but the room more than made up for it. We dined at several of the properties restaurants (thanks to nice discount coupons at check-in). Ah Sin was a nice experience, romantic with a view of the Bellagio fountains. We also enjoyed Le Providence, the St. Louis Cafe and especially the Village Market buffet. (So much to choose from!) We got a kick out of the daily "Bonjours!" from the accomodating and friendly staff. The resort shares amenities with Bally's and we very much enjoyed the classic "Jubilee" show. I highly recommend the Paris for those looking for a more "romantic" Vegas experience.

Reviews.Title: “My Stay”
Reviews.Author: mamamia61
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paris from May 24 thru May 27th, my 9th visit to the Paris since its opening. I have stayed in nine different rooms, the last being a suite for the first time. Every room that I have stayed in has been nothing but spotless and housekeeping has been excellent each time. Checking in at the airport is great! Have to admit the slots were the worst this trip. Pretty disappointed with them.

Reviews.Title: “My Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Paris lobby and casino are very nice. The rooms are a different story, I requested a non-smoking room, the room reeked of smoked and counted at least 17 cigarette burns in carpet. I complained, we were upgraded to a room with torned bed linens, the furniture covered with unknown stains and the bathroom shower nozzle crusted over with mineral residue. Also housekeeping informed us, that they change the bedspread and matress pad every 7th day.

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculous Tight Slots - Come On!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I urge people to stop playing at the Paris Hotel and Casino. Ridiculous tight rip off slot machines. Terrible management in 2005! They take the money but don't pay it out. Just ask their own floor supervisors! They should be ashamed, ashamed and ashamed! I am a "regular invited tourist from California and I don't think they get it, it is boring to Never Win???

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sage67
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable stay at the Paris Hotel. Checked in at the airport, no line-ups and very friendly customer service representatives. We were prepared for long line-ups at the restaurants, and thanks to all the tips on this forum we avoided the long line-ups by arriving early for breakfast, 8:30 ish, skipped lunch and went for an early dinner (4:00pm). The hotel rooms were clean and the maid service was great, they vacuumed our room every day and always left extra soap, lotions and towels, tipped them $3-5 per day. Our bathroom had a separate shower and tub, which came in handy. We were lucky enough to have been upgraded at no extra charge to a premier view room, situated directly across from the Bellagio fountains (20th floor) amazing view! Note: booked our hotel by internet (Paris Hotel website) 3 months in advance and got a cheaper rate. We kept watching the rates up until our departure date and never saw any cheaper rates. The food was incredible at all the restaurants, would definitely recommend the Buffet, Lenotre and La Criepere. The pool area is beautiful, however gets very crowded, so arrive early to get a seat. The location of this hotel was perfect, just a short walk to the hotels: Bellagio, Aladdin, Caesars and there is an underground walk way to Bally’s.

Reviews.Title: “paris is our favorite in vegas”
Reviews.Author: diana-al
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at most of the vegas hotels-they are all great because you are in vegas-our very special one is the paris-we love the size of it-not too large-we love how friendly everyone is-we love the location-we love the buffets-we love the overall feel of the hotel-we love the 'p' rooms if you can get one overlooking the strip-you are very lucky indeed if you get to stay here-

Reviews.Title: “Not top on our list”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: During our 7 night 4 hotel (Plaza-Downtown, Flamingo, Mirage and the Paris) the nights at the Paris rated last in our book of the places we stayed. We will not stay here again unless it's free. While the shower was great, the rest was only so so. And those silly put on accents of the hotel staff, please. The place felt cold and didn't have any charm. For the price it's way over rated.

Reviews.Title: “To Paris on business”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I only stayed for two days for business but enjoyed the hotel. The atmosphere was nice near the shops and restaurants. I had a room on the 20th floor that looked out at the "Eiffel Tower" and also the water fountains of the Bellagio. The room was decent and clean. The bathroom is a bir nicer than average with a separate shower and tub. Easy hook-up for high-speed internet + very helpful employees in the business center (although it's pretty small when a big convention is ongoing). Didn't go into the casino area. I'm not much for gambling, especially when the tables are $10 or $15 per hand. Did see some penny and nickel slots, however. I can definitely recommend the check-in at the airport (by the baggage claim area). The gal there was very nice and spent extra time finding me a nicer room higher up. No line, although I got in around 10:30pm. Took the shuttle for $5, instead of about $12-$14 for a taxi. Had to wait about 15 minutes, but then got to the hotel pretty quick. Easy checkout. No problems with the bill. I would definitely go back and will recommend to others, as it is within walking distance to other hotels and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Stay and The Strip Review”
Reviews.Author: videokenomom
Reviews.Content: Day 5 and 6 landed us (finally) on the Strip itself and a 2 night free stay at Paris was enjoyed by all 3 of us. Again, we were accommodated nicely with an early check-in and decided to just take whatever room we were given. Unfortunately we didn't get the Bellagio water view this time and while views aren't important to me, I have to admit to feeling somewhat miffed when the only view was a concrete barrier in front of our window. But again, I got over it quickly as I was once again flying out the door for more gambling and shopping. Paris is simply beautiful....from the moment you walk onto the cobblestone walkways, to the nice furnishings in the room. Having said this, I quickly remembered the negatives from last year's visit.....the extremely bad acoustics that allows you to hear everything around you - other rooms and hallways. The other negative is not being allowed to empty the mini-refrig. They have built in sensors that if you even move one item, it is instantly changed to your room via computer. But the bathroom is to die for with separate tub and shower....wonderful for 3 women traveling together. We could have spent every morning between the bakery and crepe places, but forced ourselves to partake in other meals such as the steak special after 11 pm. The dualing piano guys along the path towards Bally's are not to be missed....a great way to pull up a seat and enjoy a drink. Once again, video keno was tight and in the case of Paris, they are hard to find many. I much prefer to spend my gambling time at the hotels that I stay in, so this is a concern over the long term as I'm sure free visits aren't in the future if I don't gamble much there. Side trips to casinos were Aladdin which was a new discovery for me and one that I hope to return to over and over (read: they had hundreds of video keno). Tried roulette for the first time on this trip and enjoyed the friendly tables where we got to joke around with people. Shopping was enjoyed at Wynn, Aladdin, Venetian and an incredible cigar shop across from The Stardust in a little strip mall. 4 older cuban men sit there and hand roll them in front of you. Much better prices then what we were finding in shops like at the Venetian (although it was kind of cool to look at what a $300 cigar was). Took in a meal at Harley Davidson which was very nice as well. Loved watching the motorcycles moving above us while eating. We also visited Wynn which is reviewed separately.

Reviews.Title: “It's like really being there, sort of”
Reviews.Author: MontanaGo
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Las Vegas in May 2005. This was my second trip and my second visit to Paris. I have yet to stay there - but plan to do so next time. If you're coming to Vegas, you really should visit Paris. The food is fabulous (especially the breakfast buffet), the shopping is unique and fun, the casino is huge, the sky and faux buildings add so much to the atmosphere and the lobby-and bathrooms-are absolutely stunning!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay - fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: TLIII
Reviews.Content: Five of us stayed at the Paris Las Vegas hotel from May 3rd-8th and had a wonderful time! From the moment we arrived, we felt as though we were actually in Paris, France! The hotel's main entrance takes you through their beautiful casino and gives you the feeling of strolling through the streets of Paris. The hotel was sparkling clean, with very impressive interior decor. The staff couldn't have been friendlier - from their front desk and concierge staff to their chambermaids and casino personnel! Our rooms were located on the concierge floor and had wonderful views of the Las Vegas strip and Bellagio fountains. The Bellagio fountains are certainly spectacular to observe. However, just make sure you're not someone who likes to go to sleep before midnight, because if you are in a room that faces the strip, the Bellagio fountains' sound show will keep you awake until midnight. But hey, who goes to bed in Las Vegas before midnight, anyway?? I never left the casinos before 1:00am and always felt like I was leaving early! It amazed me to see how busy the casinos were all night long! We ate meals in two of Paris Las Vegas' restaurants, Mon Ami Gabi and Ortanique - and enjoyed our experiences in both. We also ate delicious crepes from their creperie located off the lobby and shops area. We found the hotel to be ideally situated in the middle of the strip - making it very easy to go back and forth between hotels. Even though Las Vegas has a lot of spectacular hotels, we felt as though we'd made a great choice by picking Paris! Their pool and pool deck are nice and spacious, however, we never took the time to take a swim. We were a bit disappointed that it cost $25 per day to use the hotel's fitness center (even if you only wanted to use a treadmill for 20 minutes!!). However, this must be the case at all of the Vegas hotels because the Mirage charged a similar daily fee for use of their fitness center when I stayed there a year and a half ago. If you want to jog, you're probably better off following the hotel's suggested Las Vegas strip jogging routes (which are listed in the room guest directories). We highly recommend the Paris hotel based on their high level of service, variety of excellent restaurants, spacious/comfortable accommodations (our rooms had beautifully tiled bathrooms and lots of amenities) and their sparkling clean casino & shops. We'll definitely stay at Paris Las Vegas again. We saw a number of evening shows during our stay (the Danny Gans show at the Mirage, Celine Dion's show and the Rita Rudner comedy show at New York New York). All of us agreed that the Danny Gans show was the most entertaining! (the guy is just incredible with the variety of voices and impersonations he displays). Celine Dion is obviously an unbelievable singer, however, her background characters/dancers were a little bizarre (what's up with the yellow uniformed bellboy and white ghost like characters that seemed to appear in every scene??). Rita Rudner was funny and did a great job in talking about relationships between men & women (although she was squeaky clean with her language and subject matter - I would have preferred her comedy routine be a little more risque, however, the others in my group really liked her show). We were amazed at how well the city of Las Vegas (especially the airport and Southwest Airlines in particular) handle such a large number of visitors day in and day out! Everything seems to run like clockwork! There were people everywhere...if you don't like crowds, Vegas may not be for you - however, its definitely a fun place to spend a few days (and dollars!!!). Stay at the Paris Hotel - you won't be disappointed!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Loved it! Paris was Fabulous, we barely left our hotel! The helicopter ride through the Grand Canyon at Sunset was breath taking. Take comfortable shoes and sunscreen.

Reviews.Title: “Going back again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed there in aug. 2004. We both had not one complaint. The room was clean and the bathroom very impressive. Breakfast buffett was enough to get you threw untill dinner. Food at breakfast time was of excellent quality. We always book a package deal going to vegas, so we have the option of any hotel. We enjoyed the paris soo much the first time we are doing it again. Give it a try you will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “It's just "okay"”
Reviews.Author: gatrgrl0015
Reviews.Content: Just so everyone know. It's $25 a day to use the gym. We were very disappointed. The hotel did offered a route for running, but the route were horrible because all the construction that was going on. The hotel itself was just okay. They really need to update the carpet, TV (so small), wall paper, and the pillow. We found this nasty stain on the chair that no one bother to clean. The pillows on the bed were very hard and small. The pool was nothing to brag about. But we you are just planing on not being in the room that much than I guess it's okay. We think we will spend the extra money and stay at the Ballagio next time. Needless to say we weren't all that impress. It's just old and need some updating. The good things are: The hotel was in the middle of the strip. Good location. Easy to get to everything. IF you rent a car the garge is easy to get to. The restroom was large. Stay at the Wynn. Just opened 04/28/05 right on the strip. Great location. We heard that its going to be the best hotel on the strip. Waterfall, Farrari showroom, Gucci, Channel, Tiffany & Co. store in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we expected but comp was disappointing”
Reviews.Author: crickerpicker
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 2 nights in Paris after having spent 5 nights at Bally's. At first they gave us a terrible room facing the back, a rooftop and Bally's even though we asked for a room with a view. My husband was so disappointed in the room he finally asked for a P room on the 30th floor. ($60 more per night which included the Rendez-Vous lounge) It was super. Rooms are smaller than Bally's but sufficient. The pool was great BUT.... WHEN are parents going to stop bringing babies in diapers in pools???? Paris ought to post a rule about it and have it enforced by the lifeguards. It's just common sense. The food at the buffet was excellent, the crepes were great at the Creperie and my husband loved the pastries at JJ Boulangerie. The slots , however, were very tight and we didn't win a thing. We didn't even get enough play for our money. One thing that really frosted me was that last year we got 3 free nights comp and casino rate the other nights. This year we only got casino rate and NO free nights. To top things off, upon check-out, the clerk said the computers were down (yeah, sure) and she couldn't apply comp to our bill. All in all, we enjoyed out stay and would go back if we could get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with Paris.”
Reviews.Author: winterhart534
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris Las Vegas during the recent FEI World Cup, April 20-24. Overall we were very pleased with our stay. I checked in at the airport and just walked right up to the counter. When you make it down to baggage claim, turn right and walk all the way back. I cannot say enough good things about this service. Fast, efficient, friendly, accommodating, and NO LINE! I wasn't sure that I was actually in the right place for a moment, the lack of a line through me off! We were in room 2197, which was all the way down at the end of the hall. This might be an issue for some, but didn't bother us. The young lady upgraded us to a better view, though not a "P" room. Oh well, it was a busy weekend. We were still able to see most of the Bellagio fountains at night. Very neat. Our room was really lovely - spotlessly clean, comfy beds, HUGE bathroom. I did notice a few dings and scratches but overall nothing that really bothered me. Housekeeping did an excellent job keeping us in clean towels etc. With one exception, all the hotel staff we encountered was pleasant and helpful. I did notice a reduction in the silly use of "Bonjour" etc. IMO, this is a GOOD thing :-) We ate at several restaurants at the Paris during our stay: JJ's Boulangerie, Le Cafe il Ste. Louie and Mon Ami Gabi. JJ's and Le Cafe were decent, if nothing to write home about but we just loved Mon Ami Gabi. One of the most enjoyable meals I've had in quite some time. Charming waiter, great food, and lovely ambiance. We gave Le Buffet a pass, mostly due to the lines. The Spice Market Buffet at the Aladdin was quite good though. My one and only issue with the Paris (and pretty much every strip hotel in Las Vegas) are the truly ridiculous prices they expect for things like bottled water and soda. I should have known better! Next time, I'm bringing my own. We loved the Paris and really enjoyed our time there. I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: hedgren
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris for 4 nights and had an excellent time. Just make sure that if you asked for a non-smoking room you get a non-smoking room. We arrived late and were given a "nasty" smoking room due to lack of availability. I called down to the desk and they were very obliging by offering to send up housekeeping and ensured that we had a clean non-smoking room by 9 am the next day. We had an excellent view both times of the pool and the strip. The bathroom was roomy and we loved the shower. Overall, the room was very nice, the front desk was friendly and efficient, the concierge was helpful and anticipated what we needed - brochures etc. and for the most part the wait staff were nice - you can't let one person ruin your entire time! We tried other buffets in the area and we felt the Paris offered more interestng variety, loved the coffee pot on the table at breakfast, and of course the creperie The only thing that they could have improved was to put more staff on at creperie and the pastisserie shop - 3 people trying to wait on 20 people on a sunday morning ordering a variety of coffee drinks -mon dieu! The only thing is we couldn't understand why the pool closed so early - why not keep it open a little later to maybe 8 or so. I guess they want you gambling in the casino? Ensure that if you are gambling that you get a connection card to use there, at Ceasar and Bally's. We walked the strip comparing our hotel to the others and felt we had made the best choice - well the Bellagio was pretty impressive but compared to some of the others we were pretty happy with our choice. We would definately return!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: uscshannon
Reviews.Content: My sister and I were staying for one night and had a great experience. The computer system was down when we were trying to check in but once we got to the front desk they were very nice to us. They gave us a late checkout as well as an upgrade to a Petite Suite. There was nothing petite about the suite! Two large bathrooms, one with a huge jetted tub, one with a huge stand up shower. The view of the strip was awesome! The decorations, and linen were top notch and very Paris like. Loved the decor in the entire hotel. Highly recommend the crepe restaurant for breakfast as well as the brunch buffet. The line does move faster than you may think. The location of the Paris is great! It's in the middle of the strip close to lots of great shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Great Location - Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my fiance for 4 nights in March and we both loved it. We checked out a lot of the other hotels while we were there and we were really happy with our choice. Our room was perfect - very clean, nice view, spacious and I loved the large bathroom with the separate shower. We would definitly stay there again! Great breakfast buffett too, don't let the long line scare you - it moves fast!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Paris”
Reviews.Author: profpat
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Paris for 3 days (April 15-17) I was very impressed. I love the layout of the cobblestone streets and thought the crystal chandeliers in the lobby were exquisite. I like it better than the Venetian, which has a similar "look." To me Paris is more cozy/quaint because it's smaller. FOOD: The bakery was excellent for breakfast. I had a great rasberry or apricot puff and coffee every day. Dinner (at the restaurant with a "B" like Boulanger or something) was very tastey and well-presented. The fish was melt-in-your-mouth good...And the bread with the meal was terrific. I ate at Spago (in Ceasers) on the next night, but I found the food and atmosphere much better (and more relaxing) at the Paris hotel restaurant. I'd give Spago a 6.5 out of 10 and Boulanger a 9 out of 10. Spago is so rushed, the waiters are practically running. And, the male bartender at Spago ignored me (a single woman) while I waited for my table. At Boulanger, several waitstaff serve you and all are very nice. I observed everyone (couples, groups, singles...) ALL getting the same pleasant service. I didn't feel awkward being by myself at Paris. POOL: I went to the pool on the day I arrived, but the pool closes at 5pm. So I really wasn't there very long and it was time to leave. But, it was fine. The water is heated so it wasn't a shock to your system. (I stayed at the Mirage before and the water there was freezing...) The view of the Iffel tower in the pool area was pleasant. They had run out of chairs, but the towel both had someone run and get me one. Points for service, here... ROOM: The room was attractive and had a nice marble bathroom with a separate shower and bath. The bathroom never got steamy after a shower because of the unique design. When you close the shower door, the steam is trapped in the shower stall so the mirror stays clear and you can put on make-up or whatever. LOCATION: As everyone has said, the location is great. My room faced the Bellagio and I could see the water show. Plus, it's just a quick walk to other hotels like Ceaser's etc. I enjoyed staying at Paris and had many instances of excellent service from restaurant staff, to bellboys to front desk. I would go back for sure...

Reviews.Title: “Some things good, Some things ok”
Reviews.Author: GTechMom
Reviews.Content: First of all I rated the Paris hotel as average because I expected a much nicer room. The rooms are small and nothing very special. I paid top dollar for a room with a view. The first room I received I saw a parking lot. The second room I received was higher up but because of the layout of the Paris it was not the kind of view I have had at other hotels in Vegas. Paris is not the hotel to stay at in Las Vegas if you care about the view. The dinner buffet was just ok and there are much better in Vegas. Those were the negatives. Now here is the positives: They had the best breakfast buffet. The layout of the hotel is the easiest to navigate and parking is better than every major hotel on the strip. We had someone in a wheelchair and it was the best hotel for her needs. The rooms were a reasonable distance from parking and front desk. We did not win in the casino but it was the nicest for non-smokers of any on the strip. Therefore, all in all I personally would not stay there again. But I would stay there with a person with limited mobility. I highly recommend the breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Must be one of the best”
Reviews.Author: Camberley0
Reviews.Content: Just had a four day stay at the Paris and was impressed by the scale of the place. Check in only took 5 minutes and the room was large, clean and facing the Eiffel tower with a partly obsured view of the fountains at the Bellagio. Paris must be the best located on the strip as it is slap bang in the middle. Minor moans are the long walk (with baggage) from the car park to the reception and then to your room, top tip - check in then go and get your bags. There were quite a few long queues for the various restaurants and Buffets so be prepared to remain flexible regarding mealtimes. The general cleanliness of the public areas including the shops was very good and they have got a genuine european ambience about the place. Did originally go to get married in the chapel but on discovering the prices opted for a cheaper - but just as nice version outside the Hotel. We made a point of visiting nearly all of the other Hotels on the strip and the Paris compares favourably with most of them and is definetley better than some. Wish I had stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Cleanest hotel in America”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Paris Las Vegas rates the cleanest, best hotel I've ever stayed in - coast to coast! The room was lavish for a standard room. The huge shower was made of marble from top to bottom. The food was amazing. We ate eight of our nine meals at the hotel during our stay. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your own pillow!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lycos
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at the Paris. As always, first impressions really count. I'm waiting in line and the unsmiling lady at the check-in motions me over (without the expected "Welcome to the Paris"). She asks us if we would like a view of the strip and we of course say yes thinking we'd get to see the nice fountain show across the street. "With the strip view comes a continental breakfast and appetizers in the evening for $60" she adds. "A night!" I reply. "Yes", she solemnly replies. No thanks (Why didn't she add that part in the first place I wonder!!!) Anyways, off we head to the 17th floor to the very end room with the parking lot view. The room was ok. The bedding was a little old and worn as was the carpet but all in all it was a decent room. The pillows, however, were horrible. Take two airplane pillows and stuff them in a pillow case and that's what they felt like. The bathrooms were quite decent with the separate shower and tub and sparkling clean. The housecleaning staff did a wonderful job and were always friendly. The self-parking was convenient and easily accessible. AVOID THE STAIRWELLS AT ALL COSTS. I was going for a jog and since we were right beside the stair exits, I decided to chance it and take the stairs to see where they went. As I was descending, the stairs became increasingly dirty and disgusting. By the time I'd reached the bottom, the number of cigarette butts and unknown fluids had increased to obnoxious proportions. I then aborted by plan and was trying to get back into one of the hotel floors and thought I was about to be stuck in cigarette hell when I finally reached the 4th floor and was able to get back in (albeit with a heartbeat reaching 200!). Le Cafe was okay. One waitress we had was excellent. A couple others were okay and one was terrible.
