It is rather a rushed atmosphere which is okay if you're at a McDonalds but I don't think that's quite the aura they're trying to convey. We had an excellent meal and excellent service at Mon Ami Gabi. The coffee at Lenotre was decent but at Parisian prices. Concluding, the stay at the Paris was okay. As with all hotels in Vegas, it was rather dark and gloomy. The staff weren't particularly friendly. Even with my high school french, I could tell that biere was missing an accent. (I wonder if true Parisians stay here?)

Reviews.Title: “Paris was ok”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently went to Vegas, stayed 2 nights and Bellagio and 2 nights at Paris. We arranged late check-out at Bellagio (2:30) and contacted Paris at 10:00 am by phone to arrange check-in as suggested here. They informed us that they did not yet have rooms available but would not let us reserve anything either, they told us to just come around 3:00pm to check-in. Upon arriving at 3:15, we were told that there were no rooms available and to go do something and call in 2 hours or so to see if anything was available yet. The person on the phone in the morning and then at the front desk tried very hard to sell us a suite for an additional $80 night. People in lines next to use were checking in without incident so I decided to just pay the extra $80/night after being told to call before waiting in line again in 2 hours as something still may not be ready. We were going to dinner at 7:00 and I really wanted to make sure we had a room to get ready as we had tickets at 8:30 to We Will Rock You. The hotel was nice. The suite (2151P) was huge but the carpet was ripped, bedskirt ragged, and comforter old and stained but honestly, except for the wear, the room was clean. Mon Ami Gabi - good (not great) food and great view out on the patio of the Ballagio fountains in the evening. Le Village Buffet - good breakfast Les Artistes Steakhouse - great dinner Gambling was fun and the dealers friendly - except CHARLES who was very inconvenienced by the presence of anyone at his table so we just moved to another table. Overall Paris was average.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: mikepowie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Paris a while ago with my girlfriend (mid-late 20s), and hadn't gotten around to writing a review until now. All in all, it was an enjoyable experience with only one major problem which I'll mention at the end. First, the room: we stayed for two nights and their rooms are excellent. We had no complaints about the maid service--everything was clean. Our room didn't have much of a view (facing the back and the other part of the hotel), but the room was very nicely appointed, and the bathroom was great. Elevators were fine (and we were on a high floor). In terms of amenities, I can only think of two hotels that were more luxurious in which I've stayed, and they were both more than the $165/night I spent at Paris. Dining: We ate one night at Les Artistes Steakhouse, and it was excellent. This was our Valentine's Day dinner, and it certainly fit the billing with a tasty meal in an elegant surrounding. The waitstaff was completely professional. Don't expect a bargain here, but it certain was a nice experience. We also ate at the more casual and affordable Le Provencal. The ambiance is country French. The food is pretty much Northern Italian, which I prefer to French anyway. Good prices and the service was very friendly, though perhaps a little too kitschy with the singing waiters (it wasn't as obnoxious or silly as you might think, though). Also, Le Creperie had excellent crepes, however there could be quite a wait at times. Atmosphere and Casino: overall, we were pleased. The mood with the cobblestone streets and false sky are pleasant, and while obviously not France, not as tacky as one might imagine. As others have said, at certain times of the day, the casino area can get very crowded and feel a little too rushed (especially in the part of the casino between the lobby and the elevators). I did an hour or two of $10, single deck blackjack one night and found the dealers cool--they dealt with the spirited, largely younger, male (myself included) table in which I sat with appropriate machismo. Cocktail waitresses...some were prompt, others not. All were polite, though, and their French bellhop outfits are a nice touch. I know this is probably obvious, but if you actually prefer alcohol in your drinks, stick with beer or other unwaterable drinks. I think my Tom Collinses were lemonade with a cherry. Now for the complaint: it took--no exaggeration--an hour and a half to check-in. FYI, we checked in around 2-3pm on a Sunday. The woman we dealt with when we finally got to the check-in was efficient and polite, but the line was an unbelievable 90 minutes long. My girlfriend didn't wait in the line with me, but because we had nowhere to put the bags, she still had to sit with them on the floor (can't take a chair in the casino and the three in the lobby were obviously already taken). The shock in most people's faces upon seeing the hundreds of people waiting in line was a downer. I hope this problem will be remedied. Other than that, I highly recommend Paris.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: sharyur_123
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from a long weekend in Las Vegas. After much research we decided to stay at The Paris. I have nothing but good things to say about it: the rooms were nice, staff was all very friendly from the dealers to the maids, great restaurants, and certainly the size of the hotel and casino make getting around so much easier than some of the other mammouth structures so popular in the city. The French bakeries within The Paris had some of the best pastries and breads I have ever tasted. We saw Elton John's show and it was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Parisian Views”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a memorable, three-night stay at the Paris Las Vegas Hotel. We based our fairly high expectations of the property on the insightful commentary of other TripAdvisors, and are pleased to say that we were not disappointed. This hotel really does have it all. Location means a very great deal in Las Vegas, and it would be difficult to do much better than the Paris Hotel. Everything on "the Strip" is within walking distance, but the Bally's/Paris monorail station is also very convenient if your feet are tired, or you need to get somewhere in a hurry. It's also a definite plus that the property fronts on the Bellagio fountains; with a little bit of planning, you can get some spectacular views. We managed to avoid almost all of the "problems" that some reviewers have noted; forewarned is forearmed. Definitely ask about Paris's "Ambassador Checkin" program when you make your reservations. In our case, calling ahead not only helped us avoid the lines at checkin, but also let us "block" one of the hotel's better rooms long before other guests arrived. We asked for, and received, a Premier View room on the northwest corner of the 26th floor. (We didn't try the $20 tip idea; asking nicely seemed to be enough. We also can't speak to criticisms of the porters, since all we had with us was hand luggage.) All of the staff members we ran into were extremely helpful and friendly. The room itself was huge, quiet and lavishly-appointed. We had two windows, each with its own spectacular view of the south "strip" and Bellagio fountains. (It would be impossible to put a price on those views. Unbelievable.) Housekeeping, as some reviewers have noted, was uneven - odd in what is otherwise a four-star hotel. We mentioned the fact to the front desk on the first day, and had terrific service (new sheets, evening turndowns) for the remainder of our stay. Paris is a busy place, its intimate surroundings a bit cramped in the middle of the day. To truly appreciate the atmosphere, try sauntering through the Boulevard shops early in the morning, or in the evening, when crowds are at a minimum. We never had to wait in line, though, even for the popular "Champagne Brunch" on Sunday. (We asked for a buffet pass from one of the casino hosts, before we'd even set foot in the casino, and breezed right through.) We signed up for Paris's "Connection Card" slot club, even though we don't gamble, because they rebate a percentage of your hotel expenses as a "comp". (Check the program details.) My wife thoroughly enjoyed the Mandara Spa: pampering at a price. We had a similar impression of our farewell dinner at Paris's Mon Ami Gabi restaurant, where the service was impeccable and the food delicious. (We decided not to try the Eiffel Tower restaurant, again based on previous reviews. We had a better view from our room, anyway.) The regional variety of foods at le Village Buffet was impressive, though, at least for breakfast, we liked the buffet at the Bellagio better. (Again, there's a real advantage in being so centrally located; you can easily shop around.) The pastries at Lenotre were terrific. As with a good many things in Las Vegas, there's a certain artificiality to the hotel's theme; if you're interested in a truly Parisian experience, then France is the place to go. Still, if you're looking for comfortable accommodations in the heart of the Vegas strip, you could certainly do worse than the Paris Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Our Time at Paris”
Reviews.Author: zbeth
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to the Paris Hotel for the Slot Tournament and boy did we have fun. Check-In at the airport went very smooth and there was no lines at all, just walked right up to registration. Our room wasn't ready so we had to go Invited Guest check-in to get our keys around 3:00. We went to the spa and had a fantastic salt scrub and massage. The spa is somewhat small but very comfortable and the massage room are spacious. We also decided to do "Concierge Lounge" (extra cost $45 for two people) which includes a expanded continental breakfast, beverages (non-alcoholic) through out the day, hot appetizers for early evening, and limited business services. We had our boarding passes printed up for our return trip which was extremely convenient. Our room was nice, clean, bed was comfortable, and bathroom was adequate for 2 people. Ours was a standard room without a view but we spent very little time in there anyways. All the staff was courteous and helpful. We had the nicest massage therapist and concierge at the lounge. Tim the "bellman" was the greatest, he's on the side for the airport transportation bus drop off. We joined the slot tournament and met some great people in line waiting to pick our times. We had lots of fun and I would encourage you to do this at least once. We actually won and who knows we maybe asked back for the Million Dollar one in December. Check-out was efficient and no lines. I know that sometimes it can be long but we didn't experience that this time. My only concern was they did not have security at the elevator after 9:00 like other hotels we have stayed at in Vegas. Overall, I would rate Paris a 9 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip to Paris 4/2-4/4”
Reviews.Author: sclark30
Reviews.Content: My husband and I moved to the Paris from MGM Grand, where the service was terrible. We were extremely pleased by the service at Paris, which was friendly, efficient, and accommodating from the bell captains to the cocktail waitresses in the casino. We upgraded to a LeMans suite, which was huge, with great bathroom (separate toilet/bidet with phone, double sinks, marble fixtures, jacuzzi tub, separate shower). We could hear plumbing noise but only when in the bathroom, so who cares? We loved the casino, found it easy to get around and not too big, and the buffet, where we had the Sunday champagne brunch. Only played slots, and my first time to Vegas, so I can't say if they were tight--we left our money behind, anyway, and only saw a few people winning on slots. Pool is not too large, by Vegas standards, but very pretty and relaxing, and service there was also great. Location is perfect, across from Bellagio, between Bally's and Aladdin, so we will definitely stay here again. Only drawback is that our room, while perfectly comfortable and well-maintained, was decorated in horrendous shades of gold and bilious green. I would hope that Paris is updating the decor.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: mrsbobs
Reviews.Content: Visited from 27 March 05 to 3 April 05 & loved the place! Stayed at Caesars last year & while the overall splendour of Caesars is awesome, we prefered the room at Paris. Every member of staff we came into contact with was helpful & very friendly (yes even the blackjack dealers! My husband had never played before & after 30 minutes had doubled his stake!) Food in the 4 restaurants we tried was excellent, especially Ortanique. Had a free room upgrade, We Will Rock You was brilliant, everywhere spotless, cannot find fault with anything. Will definately go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Substandard Service”
Reviews.Author: NYCityGirl13
Reviews.Content: Paris is touted as a luxury hotel and while it has a unique atmosphere, the service is generally lacking. Starting from the lack of adequate numbers of people at check-in, to the missing concierge, to the too-busy bell captain... Once they got you to sit down and shell out more money, the service at restaurants and the bars was adequate. Paris needs better service in order to deserve its reputation!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for business, served its purpose”
Reviews.Author: sbndogg
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paris Hotel when I attended a convention at the Bellagio from 3/30 to 4/1. I didn't book in time to get a room at the Bellagio, but picked Paris for its close location. It was an easy walk across the street to the Bellagio. Upon arrival, checked in without a problem, and found my room. I thought I requested a non-smoking room, but when i got to my room, there were ash trays in there. The room didn't smell any smokier than a non-smoking room, so I decided just to stay. The room was actually very clean. Both days, maid service was excellent. I came back to the room at lunch and it was already cleaned. I really have no complaints about the room at all. The hotel itself is in a very good location. You have the Alladin right next door, and Paris is a short walk to Bellagio, Ballys and Caesars. The elevators were fast and I never had to wait for one. The one drawback to me was the lack of a food court for those wanting to pick up a quick bite or those that do not feel like dining alone in a restaurant. There is a french bakery, which has sandwiches, but that's about it. At least I didn't see anything else. The pool, to me was a bit small for a hotel of this size. I can see it getting quite full in the summer time. The one neat thing is that the pool is right there kinda at the base fo the Eiffel tower. All in all, it was a great stay. It was a clean place for me to sleep, but the dining options, in my opinion was a tad lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Vegas? Mais Oui!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned after 5 brilliant days at Las Vegas - our first trip there. We decided on the Paris after reading reviews on this site and we were not disappointed.....absolutely wonderful value. After having visited most of resort hotels during our stay, we're convinced that the Paris is the best all round value. A great building and less tacky than many, and the facilities are easy to find and use, which isn't always the case in Vegas where many of the Hotels lead you into the casino and leave you there. Well situated in the best part of the strip, and close to the Bally's monorail stop, so easy to get around. Our room was on the 19th floor - quick elevators are a bonus - and was large, clean and well appointed. staff were without exception friendly and courteous. The Ah Sin Restaurant was - well, sinful...check out the desserts!! and the Jazz bar was great. Verdict; Very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Not disappointed in Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paris for 5 nights from March 21st. Helpful and courteous staff and very convenient public parking ( enter/exit from Audrie Ln to avoid the strip traffic ). No problems checking in or out. We cleared our bill the day before leaving and used the express checkout since we didn't have any incidental charges. Our room didn't have a good view but was clean and quiet. The bathroom and fixtures were especially nice. Had to periodically adjust the AC since the hotel probably had it on some energy saver setting, but no biggie. The hotel layout was easy to get around and a plus was that it connected to Bally's. Hardly had a long wait for the elevators, even during spring break. We especially enjoyed quick breakfasts or late night pastry and coffee from JJs Boulangerie. We actually preferred the atmosphere of Bally's casino over Paris, but we will stay at the Paris again ( already planning our 2006 trip ).

Reviews.Title: “A WONDERFUL Place”
Reviews.Author: Rubydooo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Paris for 3 nights (Marsh 28-31) and had a WONDERFUL time. We didn't have any complaints. We knew this was a busy week since it was still considered spring break, so we expected the crowds. We just made sure we made plans and got to places early. That's the key!! (Hey, think of it this way, if it wasn't busy, that would mean that it wasn't good, right???????) The P room was beautiful, even though it didn't have a view of the strip. To get that view, it cost another 45 dollars per night. Our room was clean and was perfect. No complaints. The people were friendly. I thought the casino was tight...we didn't make hardly any money...but hey...it's Vegas. We loved walking around the shops because it was just so pretty. One night, we sat at a bar, listened to live music and just had a relaxing time. We were pretty self-sufficient and didn't ask much of the employees, so we didn't run into any problems there. We just went there to get away and to have a good time together. We will go there again....no question about it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were originally booked into the Flamingo but when we arrived they had overbooked and told us we had been moved to the Paris. I have to say this was a very pleasant suprize. As it was my husband's birthday we upgraded to a premier room overlooking the strip. The upgrade also included use of the concierge room, where they served a complimentary continental breakfast and hor'dourves in the evening. Our room was lovely, very clean and smelt nice. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Give this place a try!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BlueEyedJerseyGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris one nite ( 3/23) before leaving for the Grand Canyon....This was an easy check-in for us since I had called ahead to arrange Ambassador Check-In ( anyone can do this). You can avoid long check-in lines. When we arrived at the hotel, the other check in lines were at least 100 people deep. There was only one person in front of us at the Ambassador Check-In counter, so be sure to ask about it when you make your reservations. They don't charge extra for kids or teens ( many other hotels DO!!!) We were given a room at 12 pm....21st floor with a great view of the pool, Eiffel Tower, and the Bellagio Fountains ( awesome). The room itself was clean..nothing special....probably due for some updating in the near future, but it suited our needs. The casino and lobby are two separate areas....the hotel is very easy to navigate. We didnt win anything, but we got a great deal ($115 per nite with a $50 match play, 20% off Les Artistes Steakhouse, 20% off Ah Sin, and 20% off Mandara Spa...also, 2 for 1 passes to the Eiffel Tower) Our teens enjoyed the crepes immensely, and the hotel is situated very close to the actual strip, so that is a convenient plus! Valet was quick and efficient for a hotel that was almost at full capacity the day we were there. So, in summary, I would stay here again and would recommend it to anyone. There seems to be a lot of bellyaching from other reviewers about this hotel and others, but we all have to realize that these hotels have 3000+ rooms, and they cannot always satisfy our every whim if they are at full capacity. My advice is to let loose and have a good time..life is too short and this is VEGAS......get out of that hotel room and have some fun!!!!

Reviews.Title: “most good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: collegemom998
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two-night stay and wanted to share some thoughts since some of our experiences were dead-on with past reviews and some were not. Check in and check out went fast and smooth, and we did receive a comp. upgrade to a view room. In the room, the carpet was stained, the bedspread worn and the sheets ill-fitted. But, the bed was comfortable and the room, overall, was clean. The hotel was extremely busy at all times, but we didn't eat in any of the restaurants except for the steakhouse. Our steaks were delicious, but there were many missteps for the premium price. The servers, though friendly, weren't trained properly. Wine glasses were never removed from the table and when my companion needed his steak cooked longer, he had to wait for the busser to finish setting a nearby table before he came over to return it to the kitchen. My caesar salad was absolutely from a bag. I've made enough of them to know it when I see it. For $9, I was appalled. Two sodas were absent from the bill, maybe to make up for the undergrilled steak. When paying $38 for a steak, consider visiting other well-known steakhouses in the city. Overall, for less than $100 a night, the stay was worth the price. But, I doubt we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves the criticism.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After 4 nights recently at the Paris, I think I can see why it has slipped in the Trip Advisor Popularity Index. From the moment myself and a friend set foot in the place we encountered problems. I gave a bell girl $20 to bring my bags up asap – as I had to get changed and get ready to head out to a dinner. 2 and a half hours later I was on the phone to the Bell Captain asking him where they were. Nearly every bar was crowded. Service in them was pathetic - bar tenders with attitude and an inability to determine who had been waiting longer than others. At one point I got one bar tender who rolled his eyes at me when I simply asked for a couple of beers ! As well, waitresses in the bars and lounges took anywhere up to 20 minutes before they’d come and take an order. To top it all off, half the time the bar tenders or waitresses would get the order wrong anyway. All the restaurants had long waits. Trying to get breakfast was a nightmare. The buffet had waits of up to 30 minutes – even though the restaurant was only half full. The ability for staff in the buffet to clean tables quickly and re-sit new customers at an empty table was mind blowingly inept. To top off the buffet experience, I had to tell one of the staff in there about a massive cockroach (or “bug” as Americans refer to them) that was crawling around the serving hood for the bacon ! Comments on Trip advisor about the cleanliness of the rooms are also well founded. Our shower had mould everywhere in the grouting of the tiles. Forget about ordering a drink from roving waitresses whilst gambling. Obviously the Paris sees this as an expensive exercise because they hardly ever operate, and if they do, there’s so few of them you can’t get an order in with them anyway. And finally, what is the story with guests of the hotel having to pay to get into the “Eiffel Tower Experience” ??? What a bunch of cheapskates !! For a supposed 4 star hotel, the trip to the observatory tower should be thrown in with the price of the accommodation. To show I’m fair, the Paris does have some good aspects. The buffet (if you can get in) is quite good with a lot of variety. The restaurants are also very good – the Steakhouse is excellent. It was about the only place where we received decent service. Also, the location of the Paris is excellent – right in the heart of the Strip. But otherwise, as an experienced world traveler that’s stayed in many 4 and 5 star hotels, there’s absolutely no way the Paris is a 4 star hotel. No way.

Reviews.Title: “Paris - THE place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Dragon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Paris the second week of March and just loved it. It has the feel of a smaller hotel, but is plenty big with everything you need. The biggest thing it has going for it is the location. Not only is it mid-Strip with a prime view of the Bellagio fountain show, the hotel entrance sits close to the street so it is not a hike just to get from the door to the street. I never felt like I had to walk a great distance anywhere within The Paris - not true of the other large Strip hotels I visited. The rooms were all clean, spacious, and very comfortable. The staff was amazing - everyone we interacted with interacted with was polite, caring, and couldn't do enough for us. I especially loved our bellman from NY who said "I love my job, but I ain't speakin no ---- French!". Ha! He was a character. TIP! When you check in, ask for a complimentary room upgrade. If they have one, they'll give it to you! It's nice to then tip the clerk, but not required. We asked for an upgrade to a Premier View room (facing the Bellagio fountains) and got it! Then they APOLOGIZED (I love it) that the upgrade room wouldn't be available until our second night. No problem! The room they put us in the first night was a smoking 2-Queens instead of a non-smoking King (we arrived late and it is what they had left). When I said I couldn't stay in the room because of the smell, the moved us to a SUITE ROOM! I had to laugh when they said we could have the room, but only for one night - like I would complain! The suite room was huge with a jacuzzi tub and wonderful, but I liked our Premier View room even better! Not a suite, but large and spacious with an awesome view. The windows had a little vent thingy you could open for fresh air and to hear the music from the fountain show. The pool is very nice. Kind of plain compared to places like the Mandalay Bay maybe, but large with a nice deck. Plus a good view of the Eiffel Tower and the Strip. The buffet is AMAZING! Delicious food and so much variety! They even had crepes for which you'd have to buy at the creperie. YUM. TIP! When you check in, ask for a "golden ticket". This a gold key card that allows you to go to the front of the line. Sweet! And, and try the pastry shop. The prices might seem high, but we got 3 delicious pastries for a total of $15 and it made a fine breakfast for the two of us. As for the casino - we didn't have much luck. We lost at the tables and machines. Well, you can't blame the hotel for that! I've heard that the machines are tight compared to other casinos, but that's up to you to play or not. The casino definitely isn't large, but I liked that. Again, not a football field to walk across to get through it to the hotel or the street. Also, you aren't forced to walk through it to work your way through the hotel. Hey - stay at The Paris and play somewhere else if you need a large casino. The Connection Card you get at the Paris is good at a number of places. If you have any questions - post in the Vegas forum and you'll get answered!

Reviews.Title: “WHICH HOTEL WILL ALLOW YOU TO CHECK IN AT 7 AM?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had arrived in Las Vegas around 11PM. We had no plans of reserving a room on Saturday 3/12/2005 because most of the rooms had prices of $200+ (La Quinta for $200= NO WAY!). After a long night, and some car problems, at 7AM, my boyfriend had asked if we could check in. At first, it wasn't allow, however, after my boyfriend had explained that we went into car problems, the man said the only room that is available was a smoking room. We had a room on the 20th floor, unfortunately I wanted a room that was facing on the Strip. However, getting a room at 7AM is better than nothing. There were some problems with the faucet, it makes noise when you turn on the faucet. We had to turned on the A/C in order to let the smoke flow out. Lots of smokers in the casino area. Most of the food in the casino were quite expensive. The location of this wasn't bad either, center of everything. There were 5 Chinese channels on TV. Paid $99+ taxes and fees for the stay. NOT BAD AT ALL! Much better than NYNY I would say! A lot of the theme really reminds me of Paris, from the cobblestone on the floor to the shops. The Eiffel Tower looks like the one in Paris, as well. (However, it was $9 a person + tax).

Reviews.Title: “Believe the critics”
Reviews.Author: Neil S
Reviews.Content: The grounds are already in need of capital improvement. The rooms are fair but lag behind similar properties in size and finish. Our very loud neighbors were reported to management two nights running, and it wasn't until I asked to speak to a manager I got results. The hospitality staff and restaurant workers were none too motivated a as group. The Venetian is a far better choice. The pool is shallow and uninspired in design.

Reviews.Title: “Save the French!”
Reviews.Author: FarmerBilly
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was clean and tidy. Had a view of the back parkinglot so the rooms might not have been "used" as much as the ones facing the fountain. The shower was nice becuase it is seperate from the tub. The bathroom could use some repainting. The service at the front desk was excellent. The first day the lobby wreaked of cigar stench. The second day it was cleaner. The dinner buffet was overpriced and not worth the $26 a person. The view from the top of the Eifel tower was great. Overall it was a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhhh .... "Pari"”
Reviews.Author: zmn4500
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at the Paris Hotel was simply grand. The experience (lose the slot machine noise) easily reminds us of trips to France. The cobblestones, cafes, pastries, breads and wines ......... they have done well here. Rooms nice and large, clean with bathrooms to die for! Not much of a view from any side of hotel (hey, in Vegas who wastes their time looking out windows anyway?) Would surely recommend and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Among the best”
Reviews.Author: LikeARollingStone53
Reviews.Content: The lobby of the Paris Hotel is one of the most beautiful I saw in Las Vegas. The selection of shops, restaurants and, of course, gaming tables were above par compared to other casinos and hotels I visited while there. I would definitely stay there again. Service was terrific and the hotel staff couldn't have tried harder to make my stay a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Good luck getting checked in”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Made our reservations through Travelocity and asked to upgrade our room at the reservation desk. We agreed to the additional $$ for the upgraded room and was told that it needed to be checked before we could go to our room. We were told to check back with the desk in a 1/2 hour and we should be able to get keys to our room. After about 45 minutes we returned with our bags and told that the room is still not ready and that they would take my cell # and call me once the room has been checked. We sat in the Lobby late at night with little to no customers around. after an hour and 1/2 goes by....the reservationist finally calls someone to find out that the room still hasn't been checked and sends her manager up to the room. The manager brings us a key and says we have a $25.00 restaurant credit for the long wait. We finally go to our room and the maid is outside and tells us we shouldn't have been allowed up because they are not finished with our room. It took 3 hours to get into a room. will not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have traveled to Las Vegas over 10 times and stayed at many different hotels...we have never lost more money and inhaled more smoke than there! It was a good thing we had two beds to choose from for clean linens because they were disgusting. Love the location w/a view of the fountains but it did not erase the other negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Paris. Loved everything about it, wouldn't hesitate to stay there again. I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Panoch1s
Reviews.Content: The Paris Hotel has large room and great French restaurants. The maid service was great. I would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 night stay there. The room was an excellent size, was smartly decorated and very clean. Mini Bar a bit strange in that removing an item from the pressure sensor automatically creates a charge whether you drink the item or not - so dont go lifting everything out! We found the restaurants within the hotel quite busy and the service seemed hurried with a lack of attention to detail. The casino was what you would expect but is one of the smaller ones and we found others with a better ambience. The hotel booked us onto a Grand Canyon Helicopter Tour with a very reputable company and although expensive was worth the peace of mind! All the staff were really helpful and courteous. Our mid week check in was quick but our Sunday morning checkout was a long wait - wished we had gone the express option! The convenience was fantastic - we were right in the middle of everything and it took about 10 minutes max to walk to some of the other casino's down the strip although of course you could take the monorail. It was a pleasure to come back to after a long night out!

Reviews.Title: “I'd go to Paris in the Springtime”
Reviews.Author: Valleygirl
Reviews.Content: It seems to me from reading these reviews that all members of one party of nine have written more or less the same thing about a stay involving a problem between Paris and Travelocity to try to push the ratings down. That seems a bit unfair to me. I stayed at the Paris in January. It was my first visit to Vegas and my husband and I loved both the hotel and the resort. The Paris is centrally placed and within easy walking distance of much of the Strip. The hotel itself is huge, so it is fair to expect that personal service is going to be a bit lacking, but I must say that I found all members of staff that I spoke to polite and helpful, from desk to buffet to room service. We booked in at the airport, and caught a shuttle bus to the Paris - only about a ten minute trip - and went straight to our room on arrival. There were some lines at the reception desk so we saved some time there. The room itself was large and clean, our beds were changed every three days and the bathroom was spotless, with loads of clean towels and new toiletries each day. The bathroom was spacious, with a seperate shower and bath. The casino is large but divided by different elements, eg the legs of the Eiffel Tower, fountains, a bridge, so it doesn't seem overwhelming. The cheapest black-jack table we found was $10 so we went two doors down to the Barbary Coast and listened to Big Elvis while we played which was fun. The buffet at the Paris is good value, especially breakfast and lunch, and so is the buffet at the Bellagio across the road. It is worth taking the trip up the Eiffel Tower - you can see and hear the fountains at the Bellagio and have a really good view of the Strip - in my opinion better than from the Stratosphere which is just too high up and far away to see anything. There are only a few shops in the Paris but there is a really good shopping mall next door at the Aladdin which is worth a visit. To visit the hotels and attractions further away we caught a bus - you can get the 301 or 302, they both travel the length of the strip, southbound from outside the Bellagio southern entrance, and northbound from outside Aladdin or Flamingo. The only difference is that the 302 is an express bus so only makes a few stops - quicker but make sure it's stopping near where you need to be. It costs $5 for a 24hour pass which is really good value as a single trip is $3. I would definitely recommend the Paris, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Paris is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JMB54_11
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to Las Vegas that I took alone. I booked my room through SWVacation which I highly recommend. I checked in at the airport which was so quick and easy. I asked the clerk for a high room with a view of the Bellagio and the Eiffel Tower. I was given a room on the 22nd floor with a view of the Bellagio, the Eiffel Tower and the pool of the Paris. Enjoyed the view and watching the water of the Bellagio. Would use the shampoo and conditioner each night and the maid would replace everything I used. The room was clean. The staff were all helpful. I asked a gentleman how to get somewhere and he took me right to where I wanted to go. He could have just told me how to get there. The food was good at the buffet which is the only place I ate at in the Paris. Check out just took a few moments. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Roomless in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: chefgirl
Reviews.Content: I am a seasoned traveler and have stayed in some of the best hotels around the world. I must say that the Paris Hotel in Las VEgas was one of the worst. Upon arrival I was greeted with the news that my reservation had been cancelled by Travelocity. I was traveling with 8 other people and all of their reservations were fine. Rather that demonstrate their "committment" to customer service, the Hotel staff chose to but their collective heads in the sand and totally disregard my problem. They insisted that I try to clear this up with the travel agent on my own. After 3 hours of "please hold, your call is important to us" , I was finally able to secure a room. The Hotel staff did nothing to help me in any way whatsoever.They were rude and uncooperative. I wouldn't have minded so much had I been on my own, but, there were 8 other customers that were inconvenienced by having to wait for me. I would never recommend this hotel to ANYONE and I will certainly NEVER return.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: stayathomemom
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Las Vegas. We were very pleased with selecting Paris. We asked for a complimentary upgrade and received a "P" room. The view wasn't great, but the room was huge. The room wasn't quite as nice as I had hoped, but it was nice. The bed was comfy. The tub was smaller than I hoped, but the rest of the bathroom was huge. The separate shower is a plus. The location of the hotel was great. We ate at the breakfast buffet and it was wonderful. The restaurants are on the pricey side, but Paris is connected to Bally's and they have a better selection of restaurants with more reasonable prices. I would definetly stay a Paris again!

Reviews.Title: “Customer service is not a priority!”
Reviews.Author: barooney
Reviews.Content: This was about as close to the real Paris as you can get, considering the attitude we encountered with the staff at Paris Las Vegas! On a recent trip with eight friends, we decided to stay at Paris - what a mistake. We booked the trip though Travelocity and one reservation was mistakenly cancelled - imagine our surprise when checking in and being confronted with this problem. Instead of the hotel staff taking charge and trying to please us as customers, we were told we needed to clear the problem up ourselves and played a three hour game of "Whose Fault is it Anyway" between Travelocity and the hotel. This was definitely not the way to start what was supposed to be a fun vacation. I would not stay at Paris again or recommend it to anyone. Besides the customer service issues I felt it was overpriced AND overated.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Suprised”
Reviews.Author: G102000
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 2/10-2/12 and we were pleasantly surprised with the hotel. We were upgraded to a room with a view of the strip and it was definitely worth it. To be able to watch the fountains at the Bellagio from the comfort of your room was priceless. The room was a nice size with a very large marble bathroom. Check-in went very smoothly and the staff at both the restaurants and check-in were more than eager to please. One thing I did not like was having had to go through the Casino to check-in. It should have been separate along with the elevators

Reviews.Title: “Unhappy in Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My stay at Paris Hotel was not a pleasant one from the moment we entered. My friends and I had booked five rooms. Upon arrival we were told that one of the rooms had been cancelled by Travelocity. I understand mistakes can be made, but the hotel was assuming no responsibility. That's okay except one would expect a hotel to assist the people who are there to stay at their establishment, even if the mistake wasn't theirs. We had to make all the phone calls to straighten out the mistake. This took three hours for us to do. Paris Hotel employees explained that since we did not have a reservation, we technically were not guests at their hotel. I guess that meant they didn't have to treat us well. I found the staff in general at this hotel to be just short of rude. No one will go out of their way to assist a guest. It's not what I epected and generally not what you experience in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Reservation nightmare”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I got my reservation through a third party and put in a deposit. The hotel messed the dates up and when we showed up we didn't have a room. After 3 hours we finally got a room but when we checked out my deposit was not applied. The front desk said we would have to apply for a refund. It has taken me over 4 months to finally get the deposit back, and the people I have dealt with have been very rude and condescending. In fact at one point they were overcharging 2 nights and I had to produce a handfull of documents (which they had a hard time believing until I sent them a copy of my boarding pass) to prove I wasn't even in Nevada during those dates. The room and facilities were OK, but with that kind of service there is no way I would go back, and I would certainly not recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Staff rude but room great”
Reviews.Author: traveler4k
Reviews.Content: Yes, I would stay here again possibly because they offer a decent rate, only for that reason but there were a few hiccups in this stay. First, they promised an upgrade to a suite which they never did. We had to beg for a room with a king bed and received a handicapped room. The room was nicely furnished,, great amenities and absolutely beautiful. The hotel was just OK, it was mainly casinos and extremely impersonal service. The staff acted snotty and not there to please the customer in any way at all. I have traveled a lot and will say that the staff is among the worst in the hotel industry! This hotel is hanging on their 4 star rating by a thread but I think it is mostly because of their nice guestrooms. It is also in a great location on the strip, directly across from the Bellagio. I would recommend a different hotel but if you are on a tight budget, this is the place to stay (only stay here if you can get it for about $100/night plus tax).

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but some problems”
Reviews.Author: raveman2001
Reviews.Content: Long lines, bad choices for food and a crowded hotel make the dirty rooms the last straw. Nice to look at, good pool, great to visit, the Paris just dosen't come through with the class it portrays...

Reviews.Title: “Unhappy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nine of us booked a trip through the internet. Upon arrival we were informed one of the reservations had been cancelled by the internet serivce (Travelocity) and it was our responsibility to deal with them. The hotel would not help us. Travelocity said the trip was NOT cancelled and would speak with the person at the hotel desk. The hotel employee would not get on the phone. The hotel was completely unsympathetic and after 3 hours, a fax from Travelocity to honor the reservation and quite alot of very bad attitude (he told us the person in our party was not a guest of the hotel and he was not obligated to help us). I mentioned that it would have been alot easier to just give us a room and then sort it out, In the meantime the hotel was losing alot of money on us as we would have been gambling. He informed me that the casino was not his concern as it was a separate entity. Customer service does NOT seem to be a priority there.

Reviews.Title: “ok, but don't spend lots to book the place”
Reviews.Author: SFBay
Reviews.Content: Booked a 2 night trip at the Paris hotel. Immediately upon check in the clerk told us that our reserved room was ok, but an upgrade was available that had a view of the strip... "usually they charge $60.00 more per night, but I'll let you in on a secret" the woman says," just like anything else in Vegas, you can get what you want if you tip" So, I ask what is the usual tip for such a thing. The woman looks at my wallet and replies"$20.00 outta do it." I ended up doing it but i traded my reserved king bed for 2 doubles and a non smoking room... I'm a smoker. I told the woman that and she replied "oh, you can smoke in the room as long as it's not alot". As other reviews say, the rooms are a bit dirty. The windows needed cleaning and there was an open safety pin on the shower floor. Other than that the room was like Treasure Island, a Comfort Inn type. Nothing special. Book it if it's cheap. Service other than the Front Desk was very good, and it's a fun place. P.S. If u like Star Trek at all, check out the Star Trek Experience at the Vegas Hilton... was more fun than I thought it would be!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy Paris without the Jet Lag”
Reviews.Author: RosanneF
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for realistic ambiance, Paris is a good choice. Even though the "centuries-old" cobblestone is freshly painted and the waiters' accents are fake, it's still really fun. The entire casino, hallways, and restaurants always make you feel like you're in Paris, unlike other hotels with only a replica registration hallway. The fact that my last name is "French" snagged us a room on the 21st floor looking out at the Bellagio fountains. The hotel rooms are quiet and the bathrooms are luxuriously fun. I agree with other posts that the sheets and towels are like sandpaper. Our windows could have used a good cleaning but everything else was in top shape. Be sure to get yourself a comp card. We walked away with 2 tees and a few $$ off our room, and we played penny slots. The food in all the Paris restaurants is good, and the $13 breakfast buffet is a steal. Grab a 99 cent mimosa at the window to enjoy during the buffet line wait.

Reviews.Title: “It was the best...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Paris Hotel for our honeymoon (December 26-30, 2004) and we had a great time. The hotel is beautiful and the food was great. We enjoyed the show "We Will Rock You" that was shown at the hotel. We also enjoyed spending time at the beautiful lobby. Next time we visit Vegas, we will definitely stay at Paris Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty decent...”
Reviews.Author: BeckyTX
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Paris 1/15-1/17 for a bachelorette party with 13 girls. The rooms were very nice, although the sensored mini-bar is annoying as we never took anything out but still got charged $5 somehow. I just didn't have the energy to argue over it. The lobby & casino area are confusing, and I found it very hard to get anything to eat around there as the lines were out of control. We got a good internet special, so based on location and room quality, I feel it was good value. Next time, I'd like to stay somewhere with a younger, hipper vibe...the nightclub was awful! Try the restaurant Mon Ami Gabi whether staying at Paris or not....the crepes are to die for. I will return there on my next trip to Vegas for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Australia07
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights just after Christmas. The location is excellent, the best thing about the hotel. The rooms are fine, although not as large as I would have thought reading the hotel blurb. This is mainly because the bathrooms are large, taking up floor space that would be more useful in the room itself. Like most hotels in Vegas there is no fridge in the room, you have to pay extra for that. The worst thing about the hotel is the crowded lobby and walkway areas. It's a battle to get through the crowds, as the walkways are too narrow for the size of the hotel. Even walking to the lift area to get to your room you have to push through crowds. We purchased a package which included a $50 gaming voucher. What we weren't told when we booked it was you had to add $50 of your own on the bet to be able to use it. Luckily for us we won, but I wouldn't pay extra for that package again because we may not win next time ! The hotel certainly looks impressive from the outside, but I would not stay here again despite the location. We walked around the Aladdin which is right next door. It has a MUCH better shopping arcade, and you can walk around comfortable without being constantly pushed by crowds. I didn't see a room there, but the location is equally good. Overall I wouldn't stay there again despite the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel ! Would love to return”
Reviews.Author: SydneyWalkerb
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 10th Jan 2005 to 15th. We had a great corner room (Premier) on the 20th overlooking the Bellagio & Paris tower. We also got the the latest cheaper rates rather then the price we booked at 3 mths ago. Can't comment on the service as we didn't need much attention. We only had a few drinks there and one or 2 meals. That was all OK. Anyway, we'll be back as its a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stevenhellmann
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paris Hotel on January 14 and loved it so much that I am considering staying there for my entire next trip. The price, location, rooms (seperate shower and soaker tub), amenities, service, and fanstastic buffet (arguably the best buffet in Vegas) make the Paris a hit. The only reason that I do not give the Paris a 5 star rating is that the sheets are a bit scratchy (I believe it is the cleaning detergent they use) and that you can hear the water running from the adjacent room (annoying when your neighbour wakes up at 7 AM). Otherwise, Paris is one of the best values on the strip and should be given serious consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and rude. --”
Reviews.Author: recran
Reviews.Content: Stayed here about a year ago, and I'm still mad about my stay. My husband and I dropped our bags in the room at check in and didn't go back until about 2 am. He fell into bed, but I wanted to take a shower to get the smoke smell off of me. I was SHOCKED when I went into the bathroom that we hadn't yet used and found a great gob of black curly hair in the tub and more hair around the sink. I went back out of the bathroom, realized my husband was asleep already, and cleaned it myself. When we went to the front desk the next morning to complain, the staff was quite rude to us. They said we should've changed rooms and they wouldn't give us a discount since they had rooms available for us to switch to. I wrote them an email about it, again requesting at least a partial refund, but they refused. They sent us a discount coupon for a future stay! Like I would ever stay there again! We checked out and stayed at MGM - less character than Paris but much cleaner and more polite.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Christmas and found the hotel to be well appointed, in a great location, but the beds are uncomfortable and the service was poor. Also my wife may have contracted food poisoning from the La Cafe, we ate dinner there Christmas Eve and she was violently ill six hours after dinning. Six to eight hours is the average gestation time for food poisoning. When we told the manager, he asked why she ate the food. But this was the typical attitude for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST OF VEGAS!”
Reviews.Author: LAGIRL74
Reviews.Content: My hotel of choice! Really great location, new rooms, service is excellent, food is good. It's the type of hotel you can stay at and never leave the property. GOOD LUCK!

Reviews.Title: “Sheets are scratchy”
Reviews.Author: bbrj887
Reviews.Content: If you would like to file your nails on the sheets, this is a great place to do it. We stayed there for Christmas and the sheets were terrible. The food at the buffets were not that good either. I would eat somewhere else. Great location but that is about it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: Angela000
Reviews.Content: We've been to Vegas twice in 2004, in March and in October, both times stayed at the Paris and loved it. As stated in the review below, there are many positives. A nice sized hotel (not too big) and the location is perfect - within walking distance to much on the Strip. The restaurants at the Paris are very good plus you don't have to walk a mile to get to them (many of them are a short walk from the elevators - big plus there). We never received poor service from anyone working there. Unlike the review below we never had an uncomfortable room in anyway. We would definitely recommend the Paris.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL, RUDE SERVICE!”
Reviews.Author: LondonVegasLover
Reviews.Content: I only visited this place for a few minutes as I refused to stay and spend money in a casino with such rude staff! Went in for a drink after a long walk down the Strip. I was with my friend sitting at a table waiting for service. We did have to wait some time for a waitress to serve us although this was NOT due to the bar being busy. When she finally arrived she asked my friend what he would like to drink and took his order. She then walked away from our table and started to take an order from another couple. I tapped her and asked her to take my order as it appeared she had not seen me. (although I was sitting right next to her!) She turned to me, raised her hand and said, "could you just wait I am taking these peoples orders". With that, I picked up my bag and walked out never to go back to Paris again! You would at least think she would have taken the whole tables order before moving to her next customer? Very rude so didn't go back again to rate the rest of the hotel / casino. Things like this really put me off!

Reviews.Title: “Paris Hotel needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: jer9223
Reviews.Content: Its time for the Paris Las Vegas to renovate. I stayed there 2 years ago and all was fine. This year the room was not clean, the chair had holes in the seat pad, the carpet was badly worn and there were black marks on the wall. Le Cafe' Ile St. Louis ran out of milk by 10am and adjoining ice cream shop was out of 3 flavors of ice cream by 10pm (they ony carry 6 flavors to start with). Very disappointed with our stay this time (we had 2 premium rooms on the 18th floor with views of the strip).

Reviews.Title: “Pass”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Lovely suite, but they've recently installed fake room thermostats so you cannot lower the temp below 70 degrees. Beware in the warmer months. Also another corporate bright idea: they've removed all of the vending machines so you'll be forced to buy from the in-room service bars or purchase snacks from the price-gouging shops in the lobby. Pretty cheesy for a 4-star hotel. We finally got a refrigerator that worked after the third try. Limo the hotel was supposed to provide never showed up. Eiffel Tower Restaurant was very expensive and the $69 seafood platter was loaded with frozen seafood (fake crab meat?) although it was supposed to be fresh. We were the biggest bettors by far at the craps and blackjack tables so if WE were treated like this, the average tourist doesn't have a chance. Note to managment: there are too many options out there to treat your preferred guest/gamblers like this.

Reviews.Title: “A solid choice!”
Reviews.Author: cHIRON
Reviews.Content: This hotel grew on us. The hotel has a superb location for exploring the Strip. The room was decorated in a French style using modern furnishing which were well maintained. The rooms were spotless and the seperate shower excellent. For a modern hotel room it was well thought out and a little different from many corporate America rooms we often end up in.....a little less bland....not outstanding but well above average. Food at the Restaurant half way up the Eiffel Tower was a real find. Everyone in our group commented this was the best meal of the trip and it has an amazing view. Worth reserving as surprise surprise it is often fully booked. We will be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not a Four Diamond Propery”
Reviews.Author: Cruisedave
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week at the Paris and spent the New Years holiday there. I am in the travel business so maybe I'm a little pickier than most. The Paris is a nice hotel but it does not deserve the 4 diamond rating they rave about. Our troubles started right in the begining. I reserved a room with two double beds and even checked in from home. Upon my arrival, I was told there weren't any rooms left with two double beds. I held this at least four months in advance so I was not happy. They said the next day they could get me that type of room and for the time being, I would have a room with a roll away. I was fine with that and I was told a roll away would be sent right up. I flew in from the east cost and arrived at the hotel 1:30 a.m. which was 4:30 a.m. to my body. To make a long story short, it took an hour to get that roll away. When I called down to see what was going on, I told them I flew all night and it was almost 6 a.m. my time. The girl I spoke to said to me "I'm up all night all the time". It was not the answer I was looking for. I did get my new room and they did give a room with a very nice view of the strip. TAll was not good, the shower was never cleaned and there was a clump of someone's hair in the drain. It was disgusting and not something I would expect at a "4 diamond" property. I was embarassed to compain again becuase it's not my nature but it was one bad thing after another. The maid service was terrible. The 2nd room we were given had an old Cheeto on the floor from another guest. I left it there to see if it would ever be picked up. Two days, still there....I decided to move it out to make it very easy to see. Still it was not thrown out. I went to the maid to ask if she vacumed, she said she did. I asked her if she was sure, and she started to heistate and say I'm not sure, and that she had 10 checkout that day. That rug was NEVER vacumed. She was worried I would get her in trouble but I never said anything or complained about it. The pulbic areas are nice with a great location. I enjoyed the restaurants and the mall they have. Would I stay there again, probably not. It did not meet my expectations overall but it's not terrible either. Too many things went wrong for me and with all the hotels in Vegas, there are plenty more for me to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “12/28-12/30 Had a nice time except for the rain”
Reviews.Author: jaymazda
Reviews.Content: First off, we love the Bellagio, but can't afford to stay. Next option, stay nearby. Our two choices were Bally's or Paris. Through my wife's influence, we decided to stay at Paris. Unfortunatley, the Bellagio fountain shows were cancelled this time due to high winds and rain so I won't hold that against Paris. Valet: Excellent. No problem with our car and getting all our luggage up to our room. When we checked out, one of our paper bags broke. They packed everything in new bags and still got all our stuff to us just in time for our car to arrive. This was during the peak checkout time around 11:30pm! Check In/Check Out: Good. About a 8-10 minute wait. Everything went smoothly. Room: OK - but all they had was either single bed rooms facing the rear. The only double bed room they had was a handicapped room. I just assumed this would mean there would be bars on the toilet, but what I didn't realize was that it also meant NO BATH. Fine with me, not good with my wife. Nice marble bathroom just like the pictures. Noise was not a problem. Ice plentiful. Good cleaning staff. Our cleaning lady left her phone number on a note. That was a first and I didn't know what to make of it. Was it a mistake? Did she want a date? or was it great service to have a direct line to someone in case we forget or lose something in our room. Gambling and Connections Card: This was the first time for me to use any casino's card and I just can't believe I never took advantage of these before. For several hours of 5 cent multislot, 25cent poker/slot gambling, I could get $28 off my dinner + 2 Paris shirts (comps), $14 dollars off my hotel bill (cashback). I got a coupon printed out at the Connections Card stand before using the $28 comps at the buffet. I don't think cashier at the restaurants/bars/shows, etc. can deal with comps with just your card only. I liked gambling at Bally's better because their slot and poker machines seemed to be more interesting and the Casino was easier to navigate than Paris. Crowd: The hotel was VERY crowded. I don't know if this was because it was raining outside or the popularity of the hotel, but it was pretty bad. There were major lines at all the restaurants and after waiting in line at the buffet around 5:30pm, they just gave us a ticket for a 9:00pm reservation!! For me, the casino was too crowded and smokey to gamble during the day. Food: Paris Buffet - Ok and well priced, but I prefer the Bellagio and Rio buffets instead. We ate a few sandwiches & pastas at some cafe's, but they were just so-so. The desserts were great, but too many people so we couldn't find a table for about 10 minutes and was just stuck walking around with our latte and dessert dish! INTERNET: Broadband Internet for just $10 a day. We brought our laptop and there was a cable on the desk to connect to. Easypeasy Japaneasy. The room also had its own keyboard but we didn't use it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: NLoveUK
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by some of the poor reviews. If you want a room on the strip in a great location this is ideal and a premium view room gives a great view of the strip. If you don't use valet parking be prepared for a bit of a trek with the luggage through walkways that can be busy. All the staff were friendly and helpful and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and accommodating”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaPhotog
Reviews.Content: The location is convenient, the rooms comfortable. The staff was not remarkable, though no one was exceptional - typically French. We enjoyed the buffet, though better deals can certainly be found. It's not the most family friendly hotel on the strip. Overall, we enjoyed our stay, but we've booked our next stay in Vegas elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Liked Paris, would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in early Dec '04. We booked a Premier View room. Checked-In and received a Premier View Corner room. Was very quite at the end of the hall with double door entry, very private. Room was nice, only complaint from my husband and I is the couch needs to be more relaxing friendly. Its like a sitting couch you'd see in a hall entry way, small and wood armrest, too small to lay on. View from two windows, was part of the Bellagio's fountain show and the mountains that were snow covered and of the Eiffel Tower and pool area. Very nice views at night with all of the lights, especially the Effel Tower. Bath Room EXCELLANT by any woman's standards. All staff was nice and helpful. Casino was good to us. Only had breakfast at the huge buffet, excellant! Lunch and dinner menu seemed a little out there for our tastes. The other restraunt had very slow wait staff, we just think they were under staffed. Shops and real statue people were very nice!! Location was great for walking around outside, we love staying in this area. We'd stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Aseret
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in Vegas, and 2 were at the Paris which we loved. We had a corner room. Not a good view of the Fountains at Bellagio due to the Eiffel Tower, but great views of the strip. Room was nicely appointed and very quiet compared to our other 2 day stay at the Mirage. Traffic flow is good through casino and shopping area. Buffet is great. You check in and they give you an appointment time. We waited about 20 minutes during the lunch rush. Did the Eiffel Tower since we got 1 1/2 price. Don't think that I would do it again. Had coffee and pastries in the morning at the place next to crepes, very good as was the sandwich stop. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service at the Paris”
Reviews.Author: smunderdog
Reviews.Content: The overall experience was good here in our room that faced the Strip, but I wanted to especially make note of the service I received when I left my cell phone charger in the room after checkout. I called less than an hour after I had left the room and was transferred to the security office. Spoke with a representative who took my info, checked for the item in my room and called me back to let me know they had it. They shipped it to my home on their dime and I received it within 3 days after I returned from the trip!

Reviews.Title: “Paris: Service is really bad, but really nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Visited Paris hotel 12/19-12/21: Positives: -Really nice hotel, the outside is beautiful, effiel tower is cool. -Great location, across the Belligio; centrally located to everything on the strip. -Great breakfast buffet, great bacon and sausage, made to order omellettes, made to order waffles, huge selection of fruit. A must at Paris. -Rooms are nice, decent size bathroom that has separate tub and shower. The room has a love seat and table that was nice. Negatives: -The customer service was really disappointing. We did not get our room cleaned until 5:00pm on our second night. We called down several times, did not get an apology for it. -Small pool. -We ate in the cafe on night, and our waitress was really rude. -Our check-in guy was a jerk. It seem to be an inconvence for us to ckeck-in. Zero personality, I don't know how he could work here. All in all, nice hotel but the customer service completely ruins everything. I recommend the Mirage before I would this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: swatts1
Reviews.Content: We made reservations for 3 rooms at Paris last April for a big pre-Christmas shopping trip to Vegas. I had confirmed the reservations the week before and called the day that we traveled to do advanced checkin. Each time I stressed that this was a family gathering. When we arrived there was no line and we were checked in right away. Unfortunately instead of getting 2 king rooms and 1 queen, we got 1 king and 2 queens. In order for one of the family to have a king room they had to go to the 6th floor when all the rest of us were on the 30th. I wish I had made a bigger fuss about it. The rooms were very spacious and well maintained. The bathroom was lovely with tub, toilet and separate shower stall. We didn't gamble but did eat at several restaurants which were all fine. The service was fair - not great, not terrible. 2 of our rooms adjoined and they were cleaned by different members of housekeeping which was interesting. One would be cleaned before noon while the other would still be unmade at 3:30 PM. We also found that the housekeepers left different amenities. I never saw a shower cap and got a different type of shampoo from the other room. I would stay at Paris again with a good rate. Since I like to try different hotels I would probably try another hotel next time. This should not be taken as a negative. The hotel was lovely but watch the checkin.

Reviews.Title: “Very very Nice...However”
Reviews.Author: Seattlesun
Reviews.Content: 1, Check in at the airport...easy and uncrowded. 2, Upgrade to a premier room...better view and great room 3, Casino small enough to get around 4, Good restaurants and choices. 5, Drinks were plentiful in the casino area Downside. 1, Nightclub attracts young and unsophisticated crowd who spill over into the casino...later at night though. 2, Slots were tight....were everywhere though. 3, Hard to leave and go home.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Las Vegas -- our new favorite”
Reviews.Author: LeMasseHammer
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I just returned from a 3 night say at the Paris. Paid $99/night. We usually stay at the Monte Carlo or New York, New York, but since the tram between Monte Carlo and Bellagio is indefinitely out of service, we chose Paris for its central location on the strip. Staff was friendly and professional -- they made us feel like they appreciate our business, and genuinely want us to enjoy our stay. The ornate pastries from the sweets shop are amazing, affordable and addictive. So are the crepes from La Creperie. All the food/dining at Paris seemed high quality. We rode to the top of the Eiffel Tower at night, which was a unique experience and worth the money (especially since we were given a 2-for-1 pass upon check-in). We also checked out the Eiffel Tower lounge/restaurant, although we didn't actually eat there. It was cozy and elegant, with good service at the bar -- maybe we'll make reservations to eat there next trip. The slots club worked out well for us. We're not heavy gamblers (typical session is betting $20-40 in 30-45 minutes at the 5-cent poker slots), but we earned enough points to get 3 souvenir t-shirts and a $15 credit toward our room bill. The rooms were slightly larger and more upscale than those at the Monte Carlo. I never thought I'd be willing to pay extra for a "premium view" room, and in this case we got lucky because they gave it to us for free, but our view across to the Bellagio fountains was breathtaking. I really would be willing to pay extra for it during future stays. We never heard much noise coming from other adjacent rooms, so either our floor was deserted, or they've got some pretty good insulation in the walls. I read mixed reviews about the self-parking, but it seemed fine to us. You don't have to walk through the casino to get to the rooms. My only nitpicky complaints about our stay: the shower head was a little clogged, so it made a really loud hissing noise; the cups in the room were the cheap disposable kind like you'd find in a Motel 6 (in the Monte Carlo, I believe they are real glass); room service trays and other misc. items seem to linger in the hallways for nearly an entire day before being picked up; only suites get conditioner -- regular rooms just get a shampoo/conditioner 2-in-1 shampoo (my fiancee requested conditioner from housekeeping and they gave her some). Again, I listed these nitpicky complaints just for the sake of making a balanced review. The Paris is now our favorite place to stay in Vegas, and we look forward to going back ASAP.

Reviews.Title: “First rate”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Vegas. Our initial recation to drawing up to the hotel was one of awe. It was outstanding. Check-in was flawless. It only took about 1 minute waiting in line. We were offered an upgrade to a suite which we gratefully accepted. This was with a convention in the hotel as well. The room was enormous, as was the TV. The room was cleaned each morning. We used the laundry service and was assured it would be returned by 08:00 pm. On our return to our room at 05:00 pm the laundry was already hung up in the wardrobe. Recption cleared up a query re the laundry bill in seconds - I saw it disappear from the onscreen account whilst I was looking at it!!! food was excellent with plenty of choice. What was ideal were sugar free deserts for my wife, who is diabetic. These looked better than the ordinary ones. The tour desk staff were extremely helpful when choosing a show and a helicopter flight to Grand Canyon - both turned out to be excellent value. We liked the casino because it was not as "full on" as some in other hotels. A bit more discreet. we can't wait to return

Reviews.Title: “Do not miss!!!”
Reviews.Author: hollydeed
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel, beautiful room, amazing foods. I thought I was actually in Paris! DO NOT MISS the show We Will Rock You at the Paris. We can't wait to see it again.

Reviews.Title: “SATISFIED”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all this was the 3rd hotel I stayed at in my 6 days in Vegas from Nov 23 to the 29 and if you have allergies this hotel seems to have the best filtering system. My husband and I noticed right away. I had been bothered with allergies since I left Va. and I noticed quite an improvement when I stayed in this room. The room was very clean,and adequate,we had a p-room on the 17th floor, overall for the price it was a good deal. The Village Buffet was great for breakfast, the atmosphere walking thru the mall and the downstairs was very beautiful and busy. The model was great to watch, the experience was quite pleasurable. This was my 2nd time at the Paris, I was there 4 years ago and most definetely I will be back. Why? because I was satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Lesson in Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the week of Thanksgiving and it was ok, but nothing to brag about. I think it was over stated and the prices were high in the places you had to eat at. Waiting line to eat at times were from 1-1 1/2 hours long. There were no coffee pots in our rooms and we wonder why and after we went down stairs we found out why? The coffee was 2.25 . D/Oklahoma

Reviews.Title: “Loved Paris Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris Las Vegas from 11-18-04 to 11-24-04. We did the check-in confirmation on the morning of our trip and when we arrived at the hotel, they had put us on the 23rd floor overlooking the Eiffel Tower and the Dancing Waters of the Bellagio. It was fantastic. The beds were terrific and the room was very, very clean. Don't miss the Jubilee Walking Tour and the show "Jubilee" at Bally's. The Backstage Walking Tour is is not well advertised but it is very interesting and makes the show even more outstanding. Not enough time to see everything but Celine Dion's concert was well worth the money. If you get the chance, see Viva Las Vegas at the Stratosphere in the afternoon--very good show with lots of comedy, dancing, singing, and magicians. It is a great show. Have seen Legend's in Concert before at the Imperial Palace, but went to see it again and it is good entertainment. Also, be sure to eat at the LeVillage Buffet at Paris Las Vegas--the morning buffet is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Picture-pretty Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We took a short weekend trip and stayed at the Paris. Our flight was scheduled to get in early, and in fact got in even earlier - we were at the hotel by 9:30 AM. With the official check-in being 3PM, we were pleasantly suprised that they found a room for us right away, exactly what we requested (high floor, away from the elevator) with a bonus view of the Bellagio fountains. We were at the very end of the hallway, but because the hotel itself has three "arms" the walk wasn't very long at all. I liked the fact that there were separate banks of elevators that served different floors - we never had to wait long for an elevator and the rides were very quick. The hotel itself was laid out very well and the sidewalk effect was charming. Be sure to sign up for their players club if you stay - you get a discount at the Paris shops if you show your card! We found out about the discount accidentally on the last night when we got a discount at the Bally's buffet (not so good but by then we were spoiled - felt a little better about the choice given the discount!). I'm not sure if you get a similar discount at the Paris buffet, but even without it's a bargain at any price. The breakfast was wonderful (even compared to the Bellagio gourmet buffet we'd had the night before) and the seating areas were beautiful. Last but not least, the drink service in the Paris casino is generous, even if you're playing the penny and nickel slots. We were in and out of most of the hotels on the strip and I have to say, we'll probably stay at the Paris again!

Reviews.Title: “Arrogant Customer Service ....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The front desk clerk at the Ambassador Check-In window was ARROGANT and less than satisfactory. First, she told me that I would have to wait in the check-in line (thus defeating the whole purpose of Ambassador check-in). I told her that I had already pre-registered and was instructed to go to the Ambassador check-in window upon arrival. At that point she began to process my check-in with an attitude like she was doing me a great favor. I asked for a quiet room but was given one closest to the elevator. On top of that, both keys didn't work and I had to go back down to the lobby. Fortunately, I received far better customer service from a different lady which made up for the first one. I've stayed at many upscale hotels in the world and expected much more from the Paris Hotel (I've received better service at the Holiday Inn Express)!

Reviews.Title: “right in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We attend a convention here every year.The rooms are neat,clean and spacious.The price is reasonable.The staff are very helpful and polite.I love the eateries and bars.The self park is large and close to the hotel.A great place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While I didn't get a chance to explore much of the hotel, our room was clean and nicely appointed. Also, the maid/bell service was very nice and prompt and the concierge was very helpful. I would definitely stay there again. I also recommend that you do the express check out whereby you just call on the phone from your room and leave your address on an answering machine and they send you a bill. The lines were long when everyone was leaving on Sunday- but this appears true for all the hotels.

Reviews.Title: “We can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Las Vegas for our honeymoon, and having enjoyed our last trip to France we decided to stay at the francophone friendly Paris hotel.
