I have to say that I am surprised at these negative reviews! Maybe these people expected too much! We didn't expect anything but a good time and we were thrilled with our stay. The staff was very friendly and even upgraded our room! The food is delicious and we never ran out of choices of what to eat. The pool is beautiful and a pleasure to spend time at. And the Paris is in the middle of everything! It is so easy to get everywhere, especially with the monorail. I would highly recommend the Paris to anyone who is going to Las Vegas. We are even planning on going back for our first anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Another money hungry Vegas hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Earlier this month I had reserved a room at the Paris. Unfortunately I needed to change my reservations to one day earlier. Paris claimed they had no rooms available that night (I later learned that was untrue). I then informed them I would have to cancel my original reservation. They said that was fine but the penalty would be a charge for one nights stay. This was even though I sought this change three days before my arrival date. Three days notice is not enough for the Paris. Do I even need to say that I will never again consider staying at this hotel?

Reviews.Title: “wonderful rooms and a georgous buffet”
Reviews.Author: sweetmarie
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th time, we have been to Las Vegas. And I prefer Paris to the other hotels. It is beautiful and cosy. The large rooms are decorated very nicely and the buffet is ...mmmhh! (the best belgian waffels and lots of other items). The hotel is situated on the other side of the Bellagio, near Cesars Palace, so you are in the middle of everything. And the show "We will rock you" is very worth seeing it. (but don't miss the cirque de soleil!!).

Reviews.Title: “This Place Was Great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris from Oct 21-25. I had called the hotel directly to make my room reservations in August for a deluxe king smoking room. Since our flight was due to arrive much earlier than the 3 pm check-in time, I was instructed to do embassitor checkin over the phone before we left Atlanta Thursday morning. The helpful attendant said that our room would be ready whenever we arrived if we did that. There was no extra charge for using this service. Once we arrived in Las Vegas, we were able to walk right up to Paris' embassitor checkin area and get right into our room by 11:15 am. There was no wait. The room was above average in space and the furnature provided, specifically the combination armour and entertainment unit, was an added bonus. Very large and spacious bathroom with large vanity area and choice of free-standing tub or shower. Accessing the highspeed internet service from your own personal laptop computer was a breeze as well and far easier than other hotels where we have used internet service in the past. I also feel the $10 per 24-hr fee was quite reasonable for high speed access. Maid service for Paris was well above average. And the pm turndown service and spot clean, complete with chocolate left pillowside, was an additional added plus not seen in my typical hotel stay experience. The only negatives were first the bed pillows. I found them very uncomfortable. And also the keycards getting corrupted and not working (the cause is a magnetic clip on a woman's purse or key being stored near a cell phone. So make note not to have your room keycard near either during your stay). Otherwise, I absolutely loved this hotel, it's staff and the service we experienced during our stay. I will definitely want to stay here again when I return to Las Vegas in the Spring.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: maggiemay7
Reviews.Content: The Paris is centrally located on the strip - connected to Bally's & right across from the Bellagio. The hotel's lobby is lovely with a sky lit ceiling & small french shops throughout. The replicas of the Eifel Tower & Arc de Trimophe were amazing. The service in the hotel was good and the rooms were very nice. We were on the 30th floor w/2 double beds and were very comfortable. The room was actually nicer than the one pictued on the website. Bathroom is decent sized w/a separate tub and shower area (all marble) - plenty of towels were provided and room was very clean. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed Oct 13-17”
Reviews.Author: bonnieboot
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paris for 4 nights. Wonderful experience. Checked in at the airport and got our key cards there so we could go straight to our room when we got to the hotel. That was a terrific plus. We were told to be sure and pick up our connection cards that we would insert into the slot machines at the Paris, Flamingo, Ceasars Palace, Hilton and Bally's to earn comp points and discounts at the various food places and stores. Every employee we met was just wonderful, very friendly and very helpful from the front desk on the last night when we applied our winning comp points to our bill to the concierge that helped arrange the helicopter flight over the grand canyon to the waiters and waitresses to all of the casino cashiers, attendants and bartenders and of course those very sweet ladies that kept the drinks headed our way while we were playing the slots. Many of the staff had been there from the opening of the Paris and some we met had worked for Ceasars (who owns the Paris) for 25 years. Room 2074P was a very nice suite, not a great view of the strip but in all fairness we did not request the room for the view. The king bed was comfortable and the jacuzzi tub was a pleasure also. Nice sofa and chairs made for a very spacious feeling. The casino paid off very well for us and it was really easy to stay up late and have lots of fun playing the slots and watch the other people have fun also. The overhead ceiling painted like the sky right down to the fluffy clouds helped with an open air feeling, was not smoky or stuffy at all. We also felt very safe in the casino, the hallways and all other areas of this beautiful hotel. My husband would not have had a problem with me playing the slots late at night by myself either, as there was no fear that I would have been bothered or harassed by anyone as there was security around as well also. BUT he did not let me play slots by myself because he did not want to miss out on any fun and he was winning too,haha. We dined at the breakfast buffet and it was very good, very filling (our fault) but it was worth all those extra calories. Dined at the sports bar for a quick sandwich also at the Steakhouse for lamb chops and halibut that were tasty, we would have liked more seasonings but we are big on lots of seasoning. Ordered room service and the breakfast was served very fresh, hot and right on time before we had to check out and head to the airport. Would we go back to the Paris? YOU BET WE WILL and we are already talking about who all we want to come with us next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Buffet”
Reviews.Author: HWJOE
Reviews.Content: I didnt stay here but ate Sunday Brunch buffet. Came at 2:30pm and walked right in. For $26, what a wonderful selection. Everything still fresh, hot, and being replaced with a courteous and quick staff. I always get the crepes because they are great but so was everything else. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Traveller65
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Paris from October 8 to 11, 2004. Initially I made my reservations on-line for a regular room about five months ago, then called a few weeks after that to upgrade to a "Premier View" room. Because we were arriving at midnight, I called the week prior to our arrival to confirm our reservations for a non-smoking room with "Premier View." I called the 800 number and they confirmed my reservation. When I was checking in, Jessica tried to give me a regular room saying that my reservation only indicated that I requested a premier view. When I told her that I called last week to confirm this reservation, she asked if I called reservations or the front desk. I told her I didn't know, I just called the 800 number. Jessica then said that talking to the front desk doesn't mean anything, that I had to talk to reservations. She said that she had to go check something and left. 20 minutes later she returned and somehow found a non-smoking premier view room. It was a terrible way to start my vacation! The windows in the "Premier View" room were so dirty that during the day, it wasn't pleasant to look out the window and see dirt spots. The housekeeping staff was great. The Cafe and Le Notre staff were wonderful. I'd go to the restaurants but I will never stay at Paris again. This experience made me realize why during my three previous vacations I stayed at the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service!!”
Reviews.Author: Lynne_Richard
Reviews.Content: Primary Complaint Classification: Service Issues Secondary Complaint Classification: Refund Practices Complaint: Greetings, this is the short version of our trip to Las Vegas, my wife and I stayed at the Paris hotel in Las Vegas and had the worst service. We stayed from Thursday thru Sunday morning, and got nothing but headaches every time in tried to talk to the employees. It started right at check in when the reservation person named Luzia reply s to me asking to check in with " we have no non-smoking rooms " I answered with then cancel my stay and we would go else where, Only after fooling around for a few minutes a room was found for an extra 75.00$ a night. We said no to that then Luzia suddenly found a non-smoking room in our price range. Thinking it would matter I filled a comment card thinking I would hear from someone, to date I still have not. There is a lot more to say but I'm running out of room too write. Thanks for your time, Richard

Reviews.Title: “30th Anniversary - Great Hotel, I'll be Back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our 30th wedding Anniversary at the Paris and we were impressed. This was our first trip to Las Vegas and I think we picked one of the best hotels on the strip. We recommend spending the extra $ and reserve a premier view room overlooking the Bellagio Fountains accross the street. The Casino was comfortable and all of the staff very friendly. Try it, I am sure you will like it as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Pool Area, Average Rooms, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris over Memorial Day weekend. I hope that is the reason this place was in such disarray. I booked my reservation online. Tried to check in at the airport, and like others have mentioned, was unable to. Upon arrival, they tried a room switcheroo on us as well...we ended up with a terrible view of...nothing. The pool area however was the most disappointing - it was FILTHY. Garbage blowing around, no staff whatsoever, chairs covered in crumbs and spilled cocktails. It was shockingly dirty - big piles of wet towels stacked up everywhere and literally chunks of food under nearly every chair. Yuck. Otherwise, the rooms was clean, the restaurants average, and the location really convenient. It's proximity to the Bellagio allowed us to spend a lot of time over there and helped us determine that the next time around, we'll be staying across the street from Paris instead!!

Reviews.Title: “My new FAVORITE place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at several other hotels during past trips to Vegas and this has just become my favorite. We will definitely return! We took advantage of being able to call and pre-check-in by phone before we left Michigan and were able to walk right up to the front of the line to pick up our room keys. The lines were long at 12:30 so this saved a lot of time. I had mentioned to the person I spoke with on the phone that we were celebrating a birthday and they were wonderful enough to upgrade both of our rooms to a premium view rooms and one was even a mini suite! We looked out over the pools and the Eiffel Tower and the mini suite had a spectacular 25th floor view of the Bellagio fountains. I didn't hear french music in the elevators so I don't know what that complaint is about, but the great part of the elevators is how fast they arrive when you push the buttons compared to other hotels. The staff was all wonderful - every employee we encountered was helpful and friendly. We ate at the French Bistro the first night and food was wonderful. Our travel companions didn't want to sit outside because it was hot, so we had a table next to the window but found out later they blow cold air on the outdoor tables so we really missed a great chance to dine out doors and do some great people watching while waiting for the fountains to go off. Had one breakfast at the Buffet, which was also very good. The other couple really liked the Bally's Buffet and sort of insisted that we eat there for two breakfast meals and a dinner. We like to eat at different places when we travel so this was a bummer, but the food and service at the Bally's buffet was also very good. Be sure to get a comp slip or a line pass from the club card area - you can use them at Paris and Bally's and you don't have to wait in long lines which is nice when conventions have them snaking through the streets of Paris! Slots were o.k. Nobody won tons of money in our group, but I did sit next to a woman who had won two $10K jackpots and one $2K jackpot in an hour. We were used to Bally's slots being looser and were disappointed at our experience the one night we gambled there so returned to Paris and managed to get back what we had lost. We walked most of the strip and our travel companions had never been to Vegas so we tried to see everything we could in a short amount of time. They thought we had picked the best hotel of all after a day of walking......we agreed. Make sure to show your casino slot card in the shops affiliated with the card - there is a 10% discount. We bought several breakable items and they were kind enough to wrap them securely with bubble wrap so they'd make the trip home safely. We did not go to the pool, but viewed things from our windows above. It gets very crowded and people begin staking out premium chairs early it seems. Health club is an extra charge, but other guests commented that it was good. We didn't try it - I think that when I pay that much for a hotel, I should be able to work out for free so it's just my attitude about it. My only complaint about the hotel was the lack of coffee makers in the room. The lines for coffee at the shops were VERY LONG. I did take a one cup coffee maker for my husband to use that got us by but it took up a lot of room in my suitcase. If they won't put coffee makers in the room to get you to come down to the casino and gamble, it would be nice if they had more options for buying coffee so the lines weren't so long. If that's the only complaint though, I think the Paris is doing quite well. If you're thinking of staying at Paris and aren't sure, I'd highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “loved the view from the pool”
Reviews.Author: silkwoodband
Reviews.Content: We were on a hotel hunting spree staying two nights in each hotel.we stayed in the Paris hotel from the 17 th to the 19 th of September 2004.We were upgraded on arrival to a suite on the 19 th floor which was fantastic and i checked in at 08.10 am in the morning with no problems what so ever which was great as you are not allowed to check in before 2.00 or 3.00 in the afternoon in most hotels. The staff were super friendly we had a fantastic time .it was definately the best of all of the hotels that we have been to so far and we go to vegas 2 times a year. ......Brian .

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: eleang
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a week stay in Las Vegas at the Paris, this was my second visit to this great city and after speending a whole week at Paris can say is my favorite hotel, first time we stayed at Mirage. The hotel ambience is really cozy (as much as a hotel in Las Vegas can be !) the casino area is not as big as in other mayor hotels and makes you feel like being in an old street in Paris, gives you a romantic feeling, the floor in the main boulvebard resembles a coblestone street of Paris, not to forget the roof wich is a Parisian sky of an early evening (lovely!!! ) gives you the feeling of being around 6 or 7 pm all the time, sourronded by cozy 18th century Paris building replica (Mansard roofs inclusive). The dining options are very good and because of the roof resembling the sky you feel like if you were dining in an street bistro outside most of the time. Rooms are ok, nothing impresive, marble bathrooms and some have a nice view of the Bellagio fountains. Service is excellent and location is the best right in the middle of the strip!!!.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is superb”
Reviews.Author: ellarr
Reviews.Content: I'm at something of a loss to understand how anyone can post criticism of this hotel. Before my trip I had read reports on this website written by trip advisors who made negative comments about staff and about such things as the music in the elevators and the general French theme. The truth is that this is intended to be a French themed hotel and achieves that aim successfully. The atmosphere is lovely, the food is incredibly good in all areas and the staff are trained very well in their use of French responses. It may seem a bit bizarre that guests are addressed as 'Madame' or 'Monsieur' and you are greeted with 'Bonjour' and 'Merci' when you are in the middle of the Nevada desert but the whole theme is carried off extremely well and is all done with warmth and good humour. The breakfast buffet and cafe are fantastic - I've never in my life seen such a good selection of high quality food - and that includes many trips to France! I had a large room overlooking the Bellagio fountains which was worth every penny I paid and also had the good fortune to have the special deal which includes access to the 31st floor and the special 'Concierge' snack facilities. This meant, effectively, that I did not need to purchase either breakfast or dinner during my stay ( I sampled the restaurants whilst staying at another hotel later on my trip) The bedroom had a lovely bathroom which was so clean that it sparkled and had a separate shower and bath and a professional type hairdryer. The slot machines in the casino were incredibly generous - interesting that they paid out most to me before breakfast each day! Front desk and 'Concierge Floor' staff were amongst the best I have encountered anywhere in the world and treated me with courtesy and an ever ready smile. I just loved staying here and will not hesitate to return. This hotel is superb. Thank you Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but GREAT place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paris with a group of friends for four nights in 2003. We couldn't have asked for a better location in the center of the strip. To me, location is almost everything in Vegas so this hotel is ideal. The rooms are large, clean, and nicely decorated. The view out the window is nice. The pool was kind of crowded and a little dirty/cloudy because of the number of people, but chairs for laying out were easy enough to find (except on Saturday morning). We ate at Mon Ami Gabi one night and thought the food was reasonably priced and very good... and I'd recommend a seat on the terrace across from the Bellagio fountains if you can get it (which we were able to after only a short wait). And the French pastry shop inside the hotel is wonderful! I don't gamble (yet love Vegas!) so I can't really comment on the casino. The friends I was with seemed to like the availability of black jack tables and thought the dealers were friendly enough. The only drawback is the cost. It was cheaper for us because we had four to a room, but it's still more expensive than some other hotels on the strip that are nicely located too.

Reviews.Title: “A great time on the strip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a very hot day and our room was over looking a car park so we asked for an up grade we were told another 50.00 per night, but what a bargin a move to a top floor over looking the fountains of Beliagio breakfeast on a very top floor with great food and happy hour and nibbles hot and cold in the evening. The pool area was great except for people smoking in the pool but it wasn't the end of the world. and if you get the chance to see 0 at the Belligio it's breath taking. loads of places to eat and at all different price ranges my favorite was the cafe with hugh fresh cream cakes that taste as good as they look just like in Paris! and just as expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, better ones around”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Paris in Sept 2004. This is a fairly average hotel billed as near-luxury. We would not stay here again. Room: Adequate. The view towards the Bellagio and Eiffel Tower were the best parts. There were many little things: tape over a small hole in the bathroom wall, missing plate where bathrobe hooks should've been. It was just very...average, and not at all worth the $200+ per night we were paying. Staff/general: Average at best. Good experiences included the concierges being very helpful and friendly, the bellmen were efficient. We upgraded from Deluxe to Premium (best parts of that were the view and the breakfast lounge on 31). The check-in staff forgot to give me our coupons for discounts for the "Passport to Paris". I ended up getting them the last day, and so missed out on about $30 in coupons. The maids were pushy and couldn't take a hint when knocking and the door was locked (proper response is to call to ask about room servicing). The pool staff was mixed, good service from waiters; scruffy slouching, bored teens for everything else. Restaurants: Depends. The crepes at the creperie were FANTASTIC, though service on plastic plates and a seat-yourself area was a little low rent. Provencal and Ah Sin were fairly average, and definitely not fine dining (we were overdressed for Ah Sin), and the food was hit and miss (great almond crab claw at Ah Sin, bad veal special at Provencal -- Veal plus lettuce is a dish?). The 24 hour diner was solid; steak and eggs is always good. Pool: Disappointing. We visited Caesar's and Mirage, and they had incredible pools, esp the Mirage (a grotto w/falls into the pool, shaded areas near the pool). Paris had a plain octagon with no shade and no character...lame. Plus it's shared with Bally's, so it get's crowded. General comments: The casino and shops were nice looking, but very crowded and difficult to walk through. I did win a few hundred from a sweet Blackjack dealer. The tower tour was nice at night (though again--crowded), but less fun than the dolphin and big cat area at Mirage. Nothing special here folks, unless you can get it at a cut rate. Try a different hotel.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Park Ridge and Elmwood Park, Il.
Reviews.Title: “4 youthful grandmas had a well deserved holiday!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We all fell in love with "Paris". Not too big so we did not get lost finding one another. All our dining experiences were top notch at this fabulous Casino and Hotel. Walking distance to view all Casino sights...great shopping at the indoor mall! Took a group picture of ourselves as "Well endowed Show Girls". Our husbands loved it! Cannot wait for same time next year with ever growing group of " We deserve it Grandmas of 30 Grandchildren"! See you next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Time at the Paris”
Reviews.Author: gnomehome
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights the last week of August. The check in was fast at the hotel, checked in very late (thanks to the airline we were flying on) we were upgraded to a room with a view of the pool and tower but because of the late check in had to settle for 2 queen beds instead of a King. The room was a slight bit above ordinary hotel fare but the bathroom was really nice and quite large. Everything in hotel room was very clean. We did encounter a problem the first morning with the shower not draining properly, informed the front desk and it was fixed very promptly. The hotel is beautiful and the buffet was great we ate there twice once for a breakfast once for a lunch, and then opted to go to the 'Ballys' buffet for one of our dinners, bad mistake should have stayed with the Paris. Be sure to use the new monorail system we were able to cover a lot of ground, saved many steps, its very fast, reasonably priced and its air conditioned. When it came time to check-out we were confronted with a very long line, after all it was a Friday, thought 'oh no' this is going to be one of those long waits I had read about in previous reviews, but to my amazement it took only 10 min to get to the front desk. We left our luggage with the Paris for the rest of the day, absolutely no problem upon pick up of luggage, ( I wish I could say the same for the airline) Any way we would definitely recommend this hotel and we were not bothered by the ‘Paris theme’ elevator music.

Reviews.Title: “Le Paris Buffet puts "Extra Ingrediants" in their food...YUK!”
Reviews.Author: latinflower76
Reviews.Content: Heard so many good things about this buffet so we decided to check it out on Aug. 28th for lunch time. Nice place... a little noisy because of the Casino..but it was a nice atmosphere. My husband and I were enjoying our food when my hubby brings it to my attention that their was a "creepy crawly" thing in his clams! YUk..it was a cockroach looking black thing w/ little legs and hairy! About the size of fake long acrylic nail tip! So nasty! Didnt expect this here.. at the Paris! We got the attention of our server and she freaked out and immediatly got the manager. The manager took the "creepy crawly" away and appologized and comped our $42.00 for the meal. It was so nasty...we couldnt enjoy the buffet and finished our soda and left very dissapointed in the experince here...we will not return to the Le Paris Buffet! We are thinking of never going to another buffet again after this incident..people beware..check out the food first before digging in!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm only gonna talk about the hotel, not the casino. Paris was even better than I imagined. People sure do have a lot of picky (bad) things to say, but it was a great hotel. We booked through Continental's vacations packages and got free flights basically, so I did not mind paying full price for our room. We did the advance check in (called from the airport before our plane took off, four hours in advance) which let us waltz right up the front of the ambassadors line and get our keys in two minutes. The crystal chandeliers in the lobby are unreal. So pretty and bright! I hate dark lobbies. Our room was on the 19th floor with views of the balloon, Aladdin roof top, MGM, Mandalay Bay, and partial strip and Bellagio. If you want a better view, ask, or go somewhere and look at the view. We did not care where we slept. The room was huge, immaculaltely clean (of course we were on a nonsmoking floor), and had nice decor (though half of the fixtures in the bathroom were gold, half were silver). The TV cabinet/armoir was huge enough to put away all of our clothes and there was a couch, chair and ottoman, desk and another chair, safe, and everything. I stayed at the Fairmont in San Francisco last year and this room at Paris was nicer, newer, bigger, and cost 1/2 as much, if that gives you perspective. We did not hear any noise whatsoever. And, we called the housekeping dept. a few times to request linen changes and they did whatever we asked without bothering us. The cleaning staff on our floor was very nice and professional too. The pool was nice and big and had plenty of space and chairs (I heard lots of complaints about this at other hotels, too bad). The cleanliness of the pool water left a little bit to be desired, but I guess that's what happens when you allow people to drink and eat right in the water if they want and you've got kids as lifeguards who never say a peep or get off their butts. The topiary garden could use a little work (TI and the Mirage has much better flowers), but the spray jets keep things cool if you park yourself right by a planter. As far as food and drink service goes, the hotel has a lot of choices. We ate at JJ's twice since it was so convenient, not too expensive, and had a variety. I got a crepe once at the creperie, it was good even at midnight. We made reservations for Mon Ami Gabi one night (don't be one of the fools who shows up at 8pm and has to wait with 100 people to get in) and it was fabulous. The best filet I've ever had. Knowledgeable staff. Did everything we asked for. If you want cheap food on the go, go downstairs to Bally's at pick up breakfast or lunch at Johnny's deli (they were so nice to us there) or pizza at Sbarro. Sure it's mall fare, but that's why it's fast and cheap. If you don't want to pay five bucks for a coke at the pool (let alone about $10 for a cocktail that would be free if you played in the casino), stop at the soda machine and get a cup of ice on your way down to the pool (there's one on each floor). It's only $2. They give out nice plastic cups everywhere (the Mirage gave us two cups for everything, they must want their name out there), so reuse them the next day. If you want a free sandwhich with your booze, go to Napoleon's for happy hour 4-7pm everyday. Also, carry your connection card everywhere. I went shopping in the Paris and Bally's shops the last day we were there and didn't have my card, and would have gotten an extra 10% off. All in all, go to Paris- it's worth it. Even my impatient husband liked it. The cobblestone brick walkway did not bother me, no one was grumpy and Parisian, and the elevator music is FINE. So beautiful and classy but not stuffy.

Reviews.Title: “Great people, Bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On the dates of Aug. 20-22, I stayed at the paris hotel. It was my first time booking online so I called a few days before to make sure that the things I had requested were taken care of. Things like 2 queen beds and a non-smoking room. When I arrived, I was informed that since they were out of rooms they had upgraded me to a better room. The "upgrade" was 2 queen beds and non-smoking. It did however, come with one of the worst views I have ever seen. In the casino, they wouldn't open new tables when the other ones were full. On the plus side, the casino employees were some of the best I have ever encountered in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay and would visit again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, exceeded our expectations: Pros 1. Valet staff was terrific 2. Staff in general was very courteous & Friendly, better than the other hotels we visited while on the strip 3. Le Village Buffet, go for a late lunch $17.95 before 5:30pm M - Sa, and have dinner including the crab legs at the lunch price. Caution on busy days like Saturday get in line by 5pm or you may not get the lunch price. The buffet was awesome and the choices were varied including awesome desserts. Make sure you tour the buffet before you dig in. Also, the made to order crepes were delicious. 4. Le Cafe, dinner special wa superb a large cut of prime rib, crab legs, veggies and a baked spud all for $13.95. Also, try the french onion soup $5.95, it was very good. 5. The Casino, the staff was very good, helpful and if you were gaming FREE drinks were avilable from the servers making the rounds (Although at times to few). The slots weren't overly crowded like some other hotels 6. The pool is nice and spacious for a quick dip. 7. The spa is great, but pricey 8. The room which was a standard was in great shape and very nicely decorated. 9. The bathroom was beautifully decorated and super clean Cons: 1. No discount for hotel guests for spa use, discount too small for multi day use, basic use is worth about $15/day. 2. Too few servers in the casino giving out the complimentary beverages 3. The in room TV was the typical cheap model, not worthy of watching anything besides checking the news or weather 4. Fitness equipment in spa is old and one of 2 stair machines was broken, they should invest in new equipment and more cardio machines We would definitely visit this property again. What its worth in our opinion $150/night max, a deal would be anything less than $129/night We give it 4.3 out of 5 stars

Reviews.Title: “Paris Delight”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have gone to Las Vegas almost every year for the last 10 years. We have stayed at the Flamingo, Mirage, and the Venetian. This was our first time at the Paris and the first time I have enjoyed staying somewhere so much that I felt compelled to write about it. My husband and I stayed at the Paris August 22-27, 2004. We enjoyed gambling in the Paris casino during our trip to Vegas last year so we thought we'd stay there this year. It also helped that we received an offer in the mail for $79 a night! The offer was only good for 3 nights, so we spent $129 for the additional 2 nights. Our experience with the Paris started out well. We arrived at the Las Vegas airport at 10:30 in the morning and went to the hotel check-in desk at the baggage claim area. We were happily surprised that we not only got a room, but also keys immediately so we could go to our room as soon as we arrived at the hotel. We had hoped for a room with a view of the strip, but instead got one on the 23rd floor facing east. We inquired if we could get a strip or pool view, but the woman at the desk said there were only two rooms available and the one we got was the better of the two. Not wanting to delay checking in, we took it and were not disappointed. Besides a view of the mountains to the east, we also had a view of the airport which made for an interesting backdrop (for the few times we were actually in the room to take in the view). We also received some coupons for match play, free drinks at the pool bar, and a discount at the hotel cafe. Upon entering our room we were happily surprised at how roomy it was. We had a king bed, small couch with coffee table, upholstered side chair, desk with chair, and large ottoman which could also be used for seating if necessary. There is no closet - the tv is in a large armoire with doors on either side - behind these 36" doors are your closets, safe, iron, and ironing board. There are three rather small drawers below the tv for clothes. If you need more clothes storage there are two nightstands, one on either side of the bed, which each have 3 drawers. The bathroom was beautiful and spacious. The floor, countertop, backsplash for the tub, and the entire shower are marble. The shower has clear glass shower doors. There are three shelves under the countertop on either side of the sink for storing your bathroom articles, a large, powerful blow dryer, and a two-sided make-up mirror that pulls out from the wall. The only thing this bathroom needs to make it perfect is two sinks! The towels are thick and we always seemed to have extras. The only complaint we had about the bathroom was the bath soap - they give you some kind of French milled soap which looks like an oatmeal soap. It had all kinds of hard things in it which really scratch your skin when you use it. And since the Vegas water is so hard, you can't get any lather so the pebbles in the soap really hurt! The hand soap is normal - no pebbles - so we just requested extra hand soap and used that in the shower. They also provide shampoo with conditioner (which was ok) and lotion (which smelled awful - bring your own). After unpacking our next stop was the pool. One of our favorite things to do in Vegas is lay out in the HOT sun, so a hotel with a nice pool area is very important. We usually stay at the Flamingo because we like their lively pool area and were a little afraid we wouldn't be too happy with the Paris pool. Well, again, we were happily surprised! The pool isn't that big by Vegas standards - it's kind of an octagon and all one depth. There is a VERY large deck area around the pool, along with two hot tubs (one hot, one cold), a pool cafe and bar. The pool isn't in the sun until about 11:00 so there's no rush to get up early and hurry to the pool for chairs. In fact, we never had a problem getting chairs or finding a place for them, and we were with a group of 5 people so we needed a rather big area. At some hotels we've stayed (Flamingo and Mirage) you have to get down to the pool before 9:00 to reserve chairs or you're out of luck. We liked the fact that we could have a relaxed breakfast then go out to the pool and not have to worry about where we were going to sit. There's nothing going on at this pool, so if you like having a party while you're poolside (like they have at the Flamingo) or you want some water aerobics (like they have at the Mirage) you might be bored. We were in Vegas with a bunch of friends and we were using our pool time to catch up with everyone, so the quiet pool area was just what we wanted. The service at the pool isn't that great - you sometimes have to wait quite a while for a waiter or waitress to take your drink order - but the bar is close by which makes it convenient to get your own. My daughter was staying at Bally's and since I had read on other postings here that Bally's patrons can use the Paris pool I inquired of the pool staff if this was correct. I was told they are not allowed to use the pool, but when I told them my daughter was staying at Bally's they said that wouldn't be a problem since she would be my guest. While she was with us at the pool she ordered drinks and charged them to her room at Bally's with no questions asked. The breakfast buffet at the Paris is outstanding. They have all the usual breakfast fare - omelets, bacon, sausage, bagels, toast, waffles, pancakes - along with a crepe station where you can get made to order crepes, French cheeses, a ham slicing station, and all kinds of fresh fruit including my favorite, a neverending bowl of berries - strawberries, blackberries, raspberries, and blueberries. The setting is the prettiest of all the buffets we have been to in Vegas - including Bellagio and Mandalay Bay. If you are staying at the Paris and have a slot club card, go to the Connection Desk in the casino your first day and check in. They will give you a line pass which entitles you to bypass the line at the buffet and go right in. Unfortunately we didn't go to the Connection Desk until the day before we were leaving so we didn't get a chance to use our line pass. Both days we went to the buffet there was a 30 minute wait to get in, so that pass would have saved us a lot of time. We also ate a couple times in the Le Saint Louis Cafe. Breakfast was good but costs almost as much as the buffet, so you might as well go to the buffet for the price. For dinner they had a prime rib and crab legs special for $16.99 that several people in our party ordered and enjoyed very much. The best deal in the hotel is in the Boulangere. You can get a sandwich (or wrap), soup (or salad) and a drink for $6.99-8.99. And these sandwiches are piled with meat! All in all, we had a great time during our stay at Paris. In fact, we have decided it's our new favorite place to stay when we're in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at the Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris August 9-13. We attempted to check in at the airport as there was no one in line and they would not let us. They really could not give us a reason, I think they just didn't want to be bothered. When we checked in at the hotel we had to take a queen room instead of a king b/c they claimed they didn't have any kings left but would move us tomorrow. Our queen room was on floor 4 and it was very noisy. You could hear a band playing and could hear casino noise all night long. Although we had a nice view of the pool, eiffel tower and balloon it wasn't worth the noise. So the next morning we moved to the 24 floor with a view of the parking garage. It was fine. All in all our stay was ok. Don't think I would be jumping to stay there again though.

Reviews.Title: “Paris was GREAT”
Reviews.Author: triptaker56
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the Paris, Aug. 16-20. Our stay there was wonderful and we plan to stay there on our next trip. We arrived early and checked in at the airport. Our room number was assigned and we were told to pick up our key at the hotel. On arrival at the hotel, we were told our room was not ready and they would put a rush on it and to return and go to the front of the line in an hour. Upon returning, 2 hours later, the receptionist (the same one that told us our room would be ready) said the room was still not ready and afterall, we were there early. He acted like it was our fault and offered no apologies. Our room was spacious and clean once we finally got it. Fortunately the receptionist, Jody was the only rude employee we came in contact with. Considering the number of employees we came in contact with, 1 rude one isn't bad. We ate at several restaurants in the Paris and had wonderful food and service. The pool was very crowded but there were still many available chairs. We took the ride to the Eiffel tour and it was overcrowded and difficult to find a spot where you could get a good view. We also missed the in room coffee maker as well as many of the other reviewers. And by the way, what's with all the Time Share Pushers? it felt like Mexico. Don't these hotels realize how bothersome these people are? We ran into them at NYNY, by Bally's and the Venetian.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Staff is pleasant and courteous. Room was excellent, nicely appointed and with a good view of the strip. Fantastic large pool, even when it is busy at pool side there still is plenty of room in the pool for a dip. The only down side, on 2 of the 4 days we stayed the patrons breakfast room service dishes that were put in the hall in the morning for pick up were not picked up until the evening. You would not expect this from a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value, but slow check-in”
Reviews.Author: BobHarvey
Reviews.Content: had a great stay at the Paris. much cheaper than Bellagio or Venetian but smart new and good rooms. excellent central strip location too. only complaint - arrived 6pm and despite advance payment had to accept two rooms long way apart and one was available til 8pm. changed rooms next day [carried our own luggage] to adjacent ones. and had to queue to check out too. good restaurants and food, found the indoor french street far too dim and gloomy - eat inside the restaurant its brighter! shop at the new premium outlet mall not the older one at south end of strip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Paris!”
Reviews.Author: LOVE2TRAVEL64
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 4 night stay at the Paris and it was more than what we expected. The rooms are more than ordinary standard rooms, with big washrooms and separate showers and it is spotless!! The beds were extremely comfortable and the location of the hotel is First Class! You are literally in the middle of the action....directly across from the Bellagio and next to the Alladin and Bally's! The Pool area was never crowded and it was always easy finding a chair to lie on. The Risque club located right in the Hotel is o.k, but if you really want to PARTY, check out Ghostbar located in The Palms! It is on the 55th floor of the hotel overlooking Las Vegas. The sight is absolutely beautiful. The buffet at the hotel is cheap and very, very good. We also ate at Mon Ami Gabi and it very good as well. Ask for a patio seat and you can watch the water show across the street at the Bellagio all night. Some other good restaurants are the Seafood Buffet restaurant at the Rio and Galaghers steakhouse at NYNY. You definately have to have the warm crepes at the creperie or at the breakfast buffet....they are soooooo good!!!!! We gambled mostly at the Paris and actually came home with money. The blackjack tables at the Paris were a lot of fun and the dealers were always so pleasant. It's also worth the 10US taxi ride to downtown Las Vegas, where they have a light show at night and you really get to experience the difference in atmosphere. We went to 2 shows: Blue Man Group (which was o.k...not what I expected) and Jubilee (which is a traditional Vegas Show). Unfortunately Cirque du Soleil was off for the week, but I would of really loved to see "O" or "Zumanity". Oh well...guess i'll just have to do it next time! All in all, Vegas is a must do, the sights, the sounds the entertainment is unlike anything I've ever experienced. I highly recommend the Paris Las Vegas Hotel, but most of the hotels along the strip are equally beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paris 4th August to 11th August. Had a very pleasant stay. The Paris is in an ideal location in the centre of the strip the room rate was excellent stayed on the 30th floor the room was large enough for 2 adults and 2 teenagers huge bathroom nice and quiet despite being in the centre of the strip. Liked the pool it has plenty of shaded areas. After visiting most of the other hotels on the strip we thought we had made the right choice considering the price

Reviews.Title: “Everyone needs to get a life!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paris is August. Enjoyed everything about it. The food was good, the room was fine, the staff was great and I even made a little money in the casino. I really dont understand why people feel it necessary to ---- about everything. Before going I read many of the comments on all the hotels, to try and get an impartial opinion on where to stay. After reading them, and then going, I am convinced that many people go with the idea of finding something wrong with their stay. Well, guess what, if you stay at the Paris, expect to hear french music in the elevators!!! I guess what I am saying is that people need to get a life. I almost feel like I have to apologize first before saying, we had a wonderful time. But I won't.

Reviews.Title: “Skip Paris for weddings”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sister in law had her wedding ceremony at the Paris Hotel around 5pm. It was horrible! The staff was rude to everyone in the party and worse they started early (10 min early) and didn't let anyone who arrived on time into the chapel until after the bride was down the aisle! So, we never got to see her walk down the aisle! The photographer just snapped pictures without posing people or getting the important family members involved (grandparents..sponsors...brothers and sisters) after the ceremony the staff ushered everyone out of the room to start another ceremony...They must have over booked or something! We did got to the buffet for the reception an hour or 2 later and that was a great experience! Great Crab!!!!! and the wait staff was outstanding! Having gone to several buffets around Vegas I can say they have the nicest people working here! they went beyond their duties to make sure that the day was beautiful! Too bad the ceremony staff wasn't as considerate!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Snedders
Reviews.Content: We are just back from 5 nights in the Paris. The hotel is really spectacular and service was excellent both in the restaurants and at the reception desk. The pool area is very well laid out and easily accessible. Not as many restaurants or shops as some of the other hotels but the restaurant Mon Ami Gabi is great especially if sitting outside as you get a great view of the Musical Fountain display at the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “A really great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Paris is a wonderful hotel! Our stay was for three nights starting July 29. We had none of the problems described in some of the earlier reviews. The location is perfect, right across from the Bellagio and Caesars, and next door to the Aladdin and Bally's. The themeing is very good, with most of the shops and several of the restaurants located on a very pretty and nicely detailed faux boulevard, complete with cobble stones! There are several "living" statues (actors in full make-up poising as statues along the street, moving every so often to the delight of passers-by). The french elevator music WAS annoying, but then, so is most elevator music! The staff was always pleasant and helpful, though a few seemed a bit rushed, none were rude or abrupt in anyway. The wait staff in all the restaurants were especially good. The room is large and nicely decorated, it feels elegant without being stuffy (the whole hotel feels this way), and the king bed was comfortable. We had a very partial view of the fountains at the Bellagio across the street, even though this wasn't a "P" room. The marble bath is huge, with a shower separate from the tub (the tub is a little shallow though, but we didn't care as we didn't use it). The sink area has plenty of counter space, and the mirrors are fog-free. The maid service was good, the room was always clean. One day the maid even laid out my hair brushes on a towel on the sink in the bathroom. We always left a few dollars as a tip, and upon check out left a tip and a few candies from the stash I had brought with me for the trip. These ladies work hard at a job most of us would never do, and I always like to show my appreciation. We ate at 3 restaurants during our stay, the Village Buffett, the Le Cafe, and the Artistes Steakhouse. The Buffett was by far the best. We had breakfast there each morning, and though a little pricey compared to other Vegas buffets ($14 per person for breakfast), the extra cost was worth it as they have very good quality food that you'd actually want to eat. They had made to order eggs, omelettes and crepes, and plenty of fruit, pastry, danish, cheese, yogurt, sausage, bacon, and anything else you can think of for breakfast. The cheese is especially good! Le Cafe was also good overall, especially the service. The only down side was the prime rib, it was a bit tough. The Steakhouse was also excellent, but for the price paid, my filet minogn was again a little dry (very tender though). The Paris seems to have a problem with either getting good quality beef, or they don't know how to prepare it. My companion had the lemon pepper chicken, and said it was excellent, and we both loved the chocolate mouse desert. We saw Jubilee at Bally's. Jubilee is a typical Vegas showgirl review, with plenty of beautiful feathered costumes (mostly topless). The dancing and singing were very good, and the smaller acts like the Chinese acrobats and the jugglers were also very good. We paid $69 per person, and even though we were all the way over to one side (we booked the same day as the performance) our seats were excellent and we could see everything just fine. Don't get the table seats up front, it's too close to the stage and the drink service (and higher ticket price) isn't worth having to crane your neck up at the stage for 1 and ½ hours. Overall, we had a great trip. The only down note was not hitting the jackpot and being able to quit our jobs upon returning home. Oh well, maybe next time!

Reviews.Title: “We loved Paris Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Sofia
Reviews.Content: We stayed three wonderful nights at the Paris Las Vegas, July 19, 20 and 21 in room 2924. As instructed, we called the Paris Las Vegas two hours prior to arrival for pre-check in, which turned out to be a very good system of checking in. A phone clerk takes all the information and assigns you an available room. Upon arrival, one goes to the Ambassador line. All arrangements have been made while on the phone, and all the guest has to do is show the credit card. We were checked in in less than two minutes. Our room was elegant. Our view was of the Aladdin, the MGM, the Monte Carlo, NY - NY, etc. We did have a partial view of the Bellagio fountains and a full view of the Paris balloon. I very much appreciated the presence of security guards who walk the beat in the hotel halls. Their presence was very obvious and they also were attentive to say hello. I had never seen this in other hotels. I especially enjoyed the Paris television station that instructed the viewer as to how to play in the casino. The impersonator did a very funny Fran Fein, Joan Rivers, Judge Judy, Cher and Katharine Hepburn. The comps were very good! The customer service by Ed at the Connection booth was superior. He explained the point system, the comp dollars and then took the time to merge our numerous Caesar's entertainment accounts onto one account. Even our East Coast / Atlantic City accounts merged. We feel that the comp dollars that we used towards our rooms were very generous. Our summer package included a buy one - get one for the show "Jubilee". We took advantage and really enjoyed the show. The coupon saved us $65. Our package included a drink poolside. The bartender Alan made us feel very welcomed at the bar. The frozen drink was delicious. How can anyone not love this pool set beside the Eiffel Tower? The large urns around the pool reminded me of the Estanque pool in El Retiro park in Madrid. The package also included buy one - get one Eiffel Tower Tour. I always wanted to go up that tower! The view was breathtaking. There were many other coupons... something for everyone. We were in Las Vegas for two weeks for our wedding anniversary vacation. I had played a lot of slots prior to arriving at the Paris. I felt that the Paris slots were the most fun. I won, lost, won, lost... but I seemed to win some nice ones at the Paris, which allowed me to play for many hours. On Tuesday, July 20th, we awoke to the news on TV that there had been a fire in the Paris hotel on the 10th floor. We never heard more about it and failed to inquire. I have only good to say about the Paris. It was a great vacation spot. Everything was perfect. We were very comfortable. We felt welcomed on every level. It was a fun stay in a very beautiful resort. The other hotel guests were very friendly and very happy with their stay too. Thank you, Paris Las Vegas, for making our stay such a good one. Thank you for the special package deal that brought us to Paris, Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Good but not Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked the Paris as a treat and it was a nice experience. BUT no coffee maker in the room which is a pain in the ----! However the view over Bellagio was terrific. The king sized bed was very comfortable and room temp was easy to cool and warm tho it did blow over the bed annoyingly. Glassed in shower was fantastic but tub a bit small, tho bathroom was a nice size. At a rate of $129 per nite not bad value. Concierge was very helpful and gave us some good advice. Multiple restaurants down stairs and tried a few tho lineups could be a problem in the morning. Really enjoyed the "Au Sin" (spelling?) was a terrific chinese meal. Check in and out was quick and efficient and got an upgrade to a view room after a bit of persuasion for no added charge. Stayed at the Rio previously and was a better room experience, but location was a bit tuff. Don't know how Paris compares to some of the other better hotels, i.e. Venetian, Bellagio etc. If you want cheap and clean do consider Terrible Herbst, tho off the strip their restarant is quite good and rooms are fine, clean and bit smelly but fine. Pool and deck is outstanding. I have stayed at Herb's twice and paid $29 & $10 depending on the deal of the day and wud stay again. Tried Samba's for dinner and was very expensive and lousy food, tho lots of it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Oregon Shelly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris back in March while my husband attended a conference. I was immediately impressed when the front desk clerk upgraded our room to a junior suite free of charge! Our room was absolutely gorgeous -- very spacious, luxurious bathroom with a separate marble shower, comfy bed and great view of the strip! The shopping area had lovely shops as well as a working French Bakery and Pastry Shop. The onsite restaurants were very good and definitely worth trying. My one complaint is that the pool area was very crowded and in need of some reorganization. Overall, Paris was a very pleasant Vegas experience.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Fantasy”
Reviews.Author: Chita44
Reviews.Content: I attended a convention here in early July. Check in at the airport was a breeze. You can't beat the convenient location of the Paris on mid-strip. I also found the Paris more comfortable and not as overwhelming as other larger Las Vegas hotels. My room had a comfortable king size bed and marble bath with a separate stall shower. The toiletries provided were 5&10 quality, not commensurate with the quality of the rest of the hotel. It didn't really matter however for me since I always travel with my own. I speak French and have lived in Paris, France. Paris, Las Vegas is a charming fantasy of a Paris that no longer exists, perhaps never existed, with strains of Piaf and Aznavour wafting through the cobble stone street, Le Notre Patisserie, la Boulangerie and various boutiques and restaurants. The public rest rooms were so beautiful that some women were taking photos of them. I had a fabulous lunch buffet at Le Village with representative dishes from different regions of France with an array of fabulous pastries and desserts, one of which would cost $8 or $9 in a NYC restaurant, all for $17! I never had a bad meal at any of the restaurants in the Paris and the cocktail lounge, the gorgeous Napoleon had a happy hour special of free high quality sandwiches with the purchase of even a $4 beer. I was fortunate to pay a convention rate for my hotel of $80 per day. My only complaints are that evrything was a la carte - fitness center an extra $25 a day, Business Center $15 per hour etc. and that some people smoked in public areas of my supposedly non-smoking floor.

Reviews.Title: “Captures the Essence of France”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Paris and it really did capture the essence of Paris. By that I mean, the staff from top to bottom, hotel and casino (with the exception for the bell staff and valets) seemed totally disinterested in providing an enjoyable experience. Not a smile to be seen and they all seemed like they wanted to be somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful relaxing hotel with great food.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the room was quaint comfortable and very quiet and relaxing. food is great. the staff wonderful. looking forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good but it's not Paris France”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our group had annual gathering over July 4th. Checked in and got room keys at the airport so went straight to room without having to go to reception at hotel; office of group including Paris located behind baggage claim #1. We were on 19th floor. Room was fine but nothing exceptional, like most hotel/motel rooms. Comfortable king bed. Easy chair plus loveseat with coffee table. Internet connection available. Iron/board. Excellent elevators, fast and quiet, unlike some conventions where eveybody complains about slow ones. Atmosphere tries to emulate a Paris street with some success. Changing "sky" overhead according to time of day, cobblestone sidewalks. Gorgeous outdoor pool and good cafe on 3rd floor at base of "Eiffel Tower". This is a huge place, lots of walking. Several restaurants and they were all crowded. We ate at Ile St Louis and Provencal (French and Italian), good but somewhat expensive. and of course there is the gaming area . Had live music on a stage. Very impressive and we would stay here again if forced to go to Las Vegas (but actually we prefer the real thing.)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris in May of this year. Check in was very long - there was quite a line and it took us over 30 minutes to check in. We ended up having to change our dinner reservations because of it. Additionally, the king we had booked was not available so we had two doubles. When we got to our room we were concerned as it was next to the maid's closet. However, noise was never a problem and we ended up staying in that room despite the hotel's offer to move us the second night. The rooms were comfortable, bathrooms were a nice size, and housekeeping seemed to do a great job. We did eat at the Eiffel Tower restaurant our first night as we got in quite late. I would skip it. The service was rushed, the restaurant is quite noisy and the tables are packed too close together for comfort. The food was good but not the quality I expected. There are several restaurants which are simply much better experiences. The casino was fun - staff was friendly, drink service was consistent if a little slow. The breakfast buffet is nicely arranged and many options for even healthy eaters. However, the lines can get a bit long at popular times. Go early for no wait. The spa was nice - my actual treatment room and treatment was incredible. However, the hot tub, showers, etc leave a bit to be desired. The hot tub is quite boring and does not welcome one to linger. Also, you feel as though you are cattle being moved through lines when waiting for your appt. The lockers were nice and there was a lot of cold water and fruit out to enjoy. The workout area looked quite small as well. I wouldn't pay the price just to get into the spa for an afternoon. Simply not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “It was a good, clean room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Paris Hotel and it was good. The room was clean and simple. Our friends paid to upgrade and they were not happy. It was not worth the extra $75, so I was glad we kept our simple room. My favorite part was the atmosphere. I haven't stayed at any of the other hotels, but I thought the Paris was the prettiest.

Reviews.Title: “A Number One Spot for Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paris Las Vegas Hotel the week of Memorial Day. Eight days is a long time to spend in Vegas, but I had a wonderful time. Paris hotel is a terrific place to stay. The service was great! Check-in was quick and very responsive. Luggage delivery and pickup was excellent. No waiting!!! And best of all ........I got to choose my time for room cleanup. This hotel really caters to their customers. I will stay there every time I go to Vegas. The Taxi lines move very quickly. The restaurants are great and so are the shops. I especially loved the Business Center......they were wonderful help in sending home all my shopping packages. The Spa is beautiful and so is the pool. I had a great view of the fountains and the Effiel Tower. Paris Las Vegas, I plan to see you again in the fall.

Reviews.Title: “Very deceptive!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have read some up and down reviews of the Paris before but took a chance booking a jacuzzi suite for a 4 day stay just recently with my boyfriend. We accessed the site through the Ballys-Paris website with full descriptions and prices. We very clearly booked this type of room with a view of the strip for a specified upgrade in price over the basic room. Upon arrival, we were presented with a xeroxed sheet of price upgrades for suites. When we expressed confusion, we were told that the Paris never guaranteed a specific type of room to an online booking only a basic room that you could upgrade. We asked why there were pics and different price categories then online. She kept assuring us we were wrong about our info and that we only paid for a view of the strip and we got a discount for that online. Well according to her sheet of prices we got a discount, but upon later accessing the web again (surprise the website had changed its info, is it possible they were losing money on the deal?), we indeed found the room with the strip view was quoted at almost 20 dollars lower online. Now remember we were supposedly getting a deal already. Needless to say we were not going to pay another $125 for the same room we thought we booked but were forced to stay since it was after 10 pm. The desk attendant kept quoting rack rates of $800 a night to prove what a deal we were being offered. Upon arrival in the room small and basic at best, I booked a suite at NYNY for about 20 more than our basic room price. I was not disappointed either, only kicked myself that I had not followed my instincts in booking the room in the first place at the NYNY. Back to the Paris review, yes the halls and the check in area were beautiful, but the room was small for the money. The air conditioner barely worked, bed was not comfortable, and the shower handle fell off when touched. Inadequate soap supply. And the one upgrade they explained we payed for, the view of the Strip, was through a very dirty window. All in all, I would not stay here again, I work in Vegas often and have stayed at various resorts, this was by far my most disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Educate”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I think the biggest mistake anybody can make when going to Las Vegas is thinking that everything is free and that the casinos just give things away. First of all if people did research on hotels and Las Vegas they would understand. The casinos give away "comps" based on how much you gamble in the casino and how long you gamble, just like any business every comp given out must be justified, we all have superiors to report to. Secondly, when you book a room at a hotel in Las Vegas you should probably read the fine print. What you pay for is a room not the type of room. 100% of the time you will see that PREFERENCES ARE NOTED BUT CANNOT BE GUARANTEED. So if you are planning to visit Las Vegas and you think that because we have 3000 room hotels and we will give you whatever you want for free (i.e upgrades, food, amenities or anything else) you're wrong. Do some research and educate yourself before coming to Las Vegas. NOTHING IS EVER FREE

Reviews.Title: “What is French for "Muy bien?"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had thought I would never stay anywhere but the Rio forevermore, but my company treated my wife and me to a 48-hr. whirlwind, mid-week trip, booking us into The Paris. When we arrived, an extremely courteous young lady checked us in, and upgraded us to a Suite (one without the view) at no extra charge (the beauty of checking in on a Tuesday). We ate at the buffet, which we thought was exceptional, and had a great steak dinner at Les Artistes. We didn't see a show at the Paris, but the lounge band was excellent. The casino was comfortable and friendly. It is spacious and easy to move around. The atmosphere caused us to do something we rarely do......spend most of our trip in one casino. Some of the reviewers complain about the use of French greetings and terms, but I thought it was a nice touch. Kind of makes you think that the employees are proud of their Hotel. And they well should be. The place is incredible! We will stay at the Paris again, even when we're travelling on our own nickel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel twice now and have had no problems. The hotel is on the centre of the strip...great location. The hotel is clean and the Paris theme is really cute. The only downside to this hotel is that they share the pool with Bally's next door so sometimes it gets crowded. The restaurants are great and the staff is friendly. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ceecee100
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 20th anniversary at Paris. We normally stay at MGM, but didn't want to with the boxing going on. Paris was FANTASTIC. Unlike some of the notes on this board, we found everyone to be nice and helpful. Our room was great, incredible view over the Eiffel Tower and Bellagio fountains. We never had a bad meal, all the food was terrific from the pool bar all the way to the nicest restaurants. We liked the small intimacy of the place. Overall terrific experience. We'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Time Was Had”
Reviews.Author: cosmic
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 days 24/28th May 2004. Liked this hotel better than Aladdin which we have stayed previously. Casino not as brash/brightly lit and somehow seemed more relaxed to me. Pool area very nice - have to watch where you sunbathe in afternoon as 'Eiffel Tower' gets in way! Nice cafe to eat at near pool aswell as various to choose from in hotel complex. Must say though did not think that Paris' buffet is anywhere near as good as Spice market buffet in Aladdin. Nice touch being able to walk right through into Ballys from Paris. Found the Bellhops to be very friendly/helpful. Don't forget to tip the waitress in the casino a couple of dollars and you will be well looked after with drinks while you gamble.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best in town, but still very good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: You had better like French music and the overall French theme if you stay here because you will be inundated with it. Even the elevators play Edith Pilaf non-stop. Our room had a nice view of the Strip and we never had to wait too long for an elevator. Check-in was a breeze plus the room was ready at 10:00am which is almost unheard of in Vegas. Pool is standard, nothing special like Mandalay Bay. Nickel slots near Mon Ami Gabi give you plenty of play. We could usually play for an hour on $4 and even hit some nice jackpots. Casino is open and spacious. The French bakery serves good breakfast, but we had terrible service at Mon Ami Gabi. The hotel connects to Bally's where you can catch a monorail without having to go out into the heat. I'd stay here again if I found another good deal on the room.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Theme overdone”
Reviews.Author: ginatexas
Reviews.Content: Nice size king room. Buffet was very good with a good selection of foods. Location on strip good. Check your receipt when checking in. We booked on Orbitz and the rate we paid online was not the rate they charged us. Luckily we had printed a copy. Take a tour of the Tower at night. Its a spectacular view of the Bellagio waters. By the time you leave this place you'll wish the staff would realize you are not really in France. Overkill with the Paris theme.

Reviews.Title: “had a good time...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I pretty much agreed with everyone else's review on the Paris hotel. Great location, friendly staff, nice hotel...etc.. One thing i didnt see on here was any comments on the noise from McCarran airport. When I checked in at the airport (which is another great thing) I was told that a "P" room (suite facing the strip) is an extra $50 per night, even on a tues, wed and thurs night. I thought no thanks, no big deal i'll take my regular reserved room. The only problem i had with the room was the noise from the airplane engine's. It was loud and could be heard clearly all the time. Our room was on the south side of the hotel facing the airport (obviously). Also, I would have to agree with other comments about the stlouie resturaunt, which is their 24-hour cafe. We ate there twice, once in the middle of the day and once at 3 am. The food at 3am was horrible, cold, stale and down right gross. You might as well spring and extra $20 and get room service. Overall, great hotel except for those few little problems and i'd stay there again. Oh yeah, there is an ice cream shop (dont remember the name) that has the best banana split on the strip, i think it is across the walkway from the stlouie.

Reviews.Title: “Different than I expected but nice!”
Reviews.Author: curioustravel
Reviews.Content: There are so many great reviews of this hotel and I would like to add another. We stayed at Paris in late September of last year. It was a great time to go weather wise. Paris was a little crowded, probably because we were all taking advantage of an internet special. (If you are getting dropped off at the hotel, make sure to tell the driver to go to the East entrance of the hotel so you don't have to walk through the casino with your luggage to get to check in.) Our room had a wonderful view of the Bellaggio and the fountains, the pool and the eiffel tower. The bathroom was luxurious and the maids attentive. Starting off right, my husband won at blackjack on the match play coupon provided with our package. For lunch, we ate at the french buffet. We skipped the buffet at breakfast the next day and ate at the St Louis cafe, which I thought was outdoors by the sidewalk cafe description, but is actually on the casino. We also ate at La Provencal. Napoleans lounge looked interesting but we never stopped. (I actually thought that the bar would be upstairs by it's description but it's actually mixed in with the shops in the quaint french village.) We loved the pool. It wasn't very warm but it wasn't crowded, and the waiters can bring you a large drink in a souvenire eiffel tower. I wasn't impressed with the slots but my husband continued his winning streak at craps and my Amstel light never tasted so good! This was my husband's first time in Vegas and my 4th. We did a bus tour to Hoover Dam that picked us up at the hotel. We did a lot of walking and saw Blue Man at the Luxor, Copperfield at MGM and the comedy show at Harrah's. Each show was unbelievable. Paris is a nice place to stay in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhh, Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a terrific time we had at the Paris! It is just beautiful. We enjoyed looking up at the "sky" in the casino. The food, the shops, the rooms--all were perfect. The staff was so polite and friendly and we loved that the theme was carried throughout the facility. French soap in the rooms, a "bonjour" from the staff and the French bakery. We are ready to go back. Merci

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Change”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here after spending 2 days at the Tropicana for New Years. Check in was a little slow, but they had available rooms despite us going there with ut a reservation. The room was nice and clean. We had the pool/strip view. The hott ub closed at 4pm, which was a let down. Les Artistes Steakhouse was not very good. Overpriced, overcooked food (they way overcooked my ahi tuna) and slow service. The bistro place was good, but way overpriced for breakfast. The French music in the elevator was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel..rude staff”
Reviews.Author: ThisMom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paris in 2002 for our anniversary. While the property was beautiful...we were disappointed in the staff. EVERYBODY was rude, stuffy and slow...despite one gentlemen we spoke to regarding getting a prescription filled. He was very helpful and polite. Getting drinks in the VERY tight casino was a challenge....hardly ever saw a waitress. The maid accidently took our remote to the tv..never saw it again, nor another one upon complaining to the desk. Reservations were made months in advance for four rooms....rooms were scattered throughout the hotel. Pool was very small. Despite staying at the Paris, you still had to pay to visit the Eiffel tower..thought that was stupid and a rip off. Better view atop the Stratosphere. Buffets were okay..found the Aladdin, believe it or not, had better food. Would stay here again, as it is beautiful, and in and of itself, the stay was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Tres Bien!”
Reviews.Author: GaerielSky
Reviews.Content: Another beautiful hotel. Stayed here in October 2001 (Vegas was empty after 9/11) but the hotel was beautiful, rooms were very nice, buffet good. Definitely spend some time by the pool, and going to the top of the mini Eiffel Tower was spectacular. If you time it right, get there by 9pm and you'll have a fantastic show of the light/water show from the Bellagio while up there. It goes off every 15 min. Fantastic view from there, no need to go to Stratosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Paris: Ideal for the well-heeled and well-traveled”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: How can anyone with good taste and any upscale travel experience dislike Paris? Except for the annoying "merci" and "bonjour" your receive from many employees, this is a delightful, creative, different casino environment and dining experience. The decor is inventive, complete witih pavers on the corridor leading to Bally's. Restaurants are diverse and delicious: Ortanique with its "cuisine of the sun," the Cafe, Des Artistes, Mon Ami Gabi, Ah Sin, etc.People who expect to find their home town, and small town prices, in Las Vegas, who mistrust anything "new," should save their money and stay home. Las Vegas is an enlightening, mind- and taste-expanding adventure. If you want to save money, go downtown to Fremont Street or the north end of the Strip...but don't expect musical fountains, a grand flower conservatory, art museums, the Eiffel Tower, gondolas, pirate ships and the like. Four- and five-star hotels charge four- and five-star prices...you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Time Was Had By All”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The atmosphere of the hotel impressed my husband and I. The food was terrific and varied. The building is very clean. One doesn't have to leave the hotel if one doesn't desire to. Everything is there. Our room was very comfortable. I found the staff (from casino to housekeeping and everyone in between) extremely forthcoming with directions or suggestions. My husband and I tried other buffets and no other could offer the variety and presentation of the Paris Hotel buffet. Our hats are off to you all and thank you for making our stay so very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Mtns.
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at Paris from March 14-18. Took my parents for my mom's 82nd birthday and wanted everything to be "just right". We were not disappointed. The first thing we did right was pick up our hotel key at the airport. The line was short and fast. Saved us loads of time at the hotel. The Premium rooms (the room number ends in P) were exceptional. Had great views of the Bellagio fountains and the Eiffel Tower. The bathrooms remind us of the ones at the Bellagio - very spacious and even had a separate shower. Eveyone from the bellman to the maids were cordial and helpful. I requested an additional pillow and was asked my preference of feather or foam. There was no problem with getting an elevator and the music in them is almost non-existent. We had the best time at the Le Cafe Ile St. Louis. Our waitperson Nicole was great.
