She had a great sense of humor and upon finding out about my mom's birthday she surprised her with the biggest banana split I have ever seen. Napoleon's is nice for a drink and some live music. Sometimes they even add a couple of nice little sandwiches. We were so pleased with the whole "Paris experience" that we have made arrangments to stay there again in October. The location is great and the service we experienced was magnifique!

Reviews.Title: “Paris Las Vegas - Overall Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights last month and overall thought it was a nice hotel and worth what we paid. We had a nice corner room, which was quiet and had a view of the Strip and the pool. The "P" rooms with a view are worth the extra $20 if a view is important to you. The room was kept clean and housecleaning was very prompt and organized. We ordered room service breakfast one morning and it arrived on time and was very good. The hotel's location in the middle of the strip is convenient and provides great access to the Bellagio, Bally's, Caeser's Palace, Aladdin and the Flamingo. The casino was open and well-lit (unlike Bellagio which I found quite dark and oppressive) but it is much smaller than other casinos on the strip so if you're a big gambler you might prefer a larger casino with more options. We ate at the cafe on the "boulevard" and it was reasonable and the food was above average. I felt that the biggest cons to this hotel were the following: (1) no matter what door you enter from the exterior of the hotel you must go through the casino to get to the check-in, the rooms, the shops, or anything else and I found that a bit irritating especially when carrying bags, (2) there did not appear to be enough lounge areas and the bars were small and always packed no matter what time of day or night we stopped by, (3) the shops and "french boulevard" while cute were a bit too fake for me (I have been to Paris and never once saw a mime) - I appreciate the effort but it seemed a bit forced (I know, everyone's a critic). I would stay at this hotel again but will probably try Mandalay Bay the next time I visit Vegas to compare. Mandalay had a nice lobby area when you entered and the casino was not so "in your face" when you walked in the door. Plus, Mandalay (in my opinion only) had more interesting and diverse lounge areas and restaurants. Overall, the Paris was a very good hotel and the staff and service we received were excellent and friendly. While I would stay at the Paris again I didn't love it so much to say that I would never try any other place in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Reservation Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sweetheart's fiancee made arrangements to get married in Las Vegas. They wanted us to stay at the hotel where they are having the ceremony. But this is the first time my sweetie will be in Las Vegas. I searched the web and came across the "Passport to Paris" package. It sounded very enticing. So after discussing it with her, we decided that we would call and find out what we could first hand. The internet was very informative but talking with a "live" representative always gives a better insight and impression of the establishments character. The Paris representative was very gracious and informative. She was very easy to talk with and seemed genuinely friendly. We were easily persuaded that this where we wanted to stay. We're very excited about the upcoming wedding and really look forward to our stay at the Paris, Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “March Madness in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris during the first weekend of March Madness in 2002 and 2003, and plan on returning again for 2004. This is the ultimate place to watch the NCAA Basketball Tournament, as the hotel uses their theater to show the games on four huge screens that hang above the stage. Awesome! If you have ever been to a sports book during a big event and had trouble finding a seat, you know why this is so sweet. In 2002 the seating was plentiful, but last year a lot more people showed up and the theater was actually filled to capacity at times. The one drawback to having this many people at one place to watch the games is that the lines at the betting windows were HUGE! I recommend walking down the hall to Bally's to put your bet in, and then go back to Paris to root on your picks. There is a snack bar in the lobby of the theater that serves beer, soft drinks, and "stadium" style food. I preferred to get my drinks from the cocktail waitresses out in the casino rather than paying for drinks at the snack bar. As for the hotel, the room was on par with the other fine hotels in Vegas. The bathroom is the coolest part with marble tile and separate glass shower and bath. Makes you feel like a king! The buffet is excellent for breakfast and dinner (crab legs and prime rib!). It is the most impressive buffet that I have seen in my 20+ trips to Vegas. If you stay at Paris and plan on playing table games, be cautious about their comps. I played for several hours each day at an average bet of $50. I was told to charge my meals to the room and that a casino host "would take care of it" when I checked out. No dice! I don't know if this guy woke up on the wrong side of the bed or what. I vowed that I would not return, but I have since compromised since they are now offering me two nights free for my next trip. Just insist that the pit bosses comp your meals as you go so that you don't get screwed as you leave. As far as meals recommended away from the Paris property, don't miss Del Frisco's (best steak ever) and In-N-Out Burger (get the Double Double).

Reviews.Title: “First Time - Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from stay at the Paris (Feb 6-9). This is only my second time back to Vegas having previously stayed at the Aladdin last year. We primarily chose the Paris because we were able to get better Celine Dion tickets through their Colesseum Package (including upgraded view room). Our stay was excellent and uneventful. We checked-in at the airport check-in and we went straight to our room with keys in less than 45 mins. Awesome way to start. Went to concierge to pick up Celine tickets (we were notified 24-hrs. after booking the room that the tickets were waiting for us!). We were guranteed main floor seats with the package and got excellent seats, better than expected. Also asked concierge to get us on the guest list for the club Risque (no waiting in line) and they said no problem, even when a special event was on that evening. We ate a few different times (brunch, lunch and dinner) at Cafe St. Louis and found the food very good at all times and service quick. We spent a fair amount of time at the blackjack and craps tables and found dealers to be friendly and fun for the most part. You always run into one or two that just go through the motions. Made sure we signed up for the comp card and ended up earning enough for free last lunch! All-in-all, we had an great time and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After admiring the atmosphere for awhile, we finally decided to stay at Paris, LV...but Never Again!! We went with a group of 10 and had 4 rooms. Not one of us liked the hotel or had a pleasant stay. Every staff person we encountered from the hotel was extremely rude and, in their opinon, never wrong. Our trip started with us being unable to get any of the accommodations that we'd requested and paid for. One room didn't receive maid service. Upon calling down there, they were told that they must have left their sign up (which they hadn't) and that maid service had gone home for the night. At 7:00pm, someone started to clean all the rooms in their hallway - turns out the maid service hadn't gone home and had made the mistake. On another occassion, we called to the buffet to make sure a 2-for-1 promotion was still going. After being told it was, we went down there and were told that the promotion was not going on and no one would have told us it was. There are many more stories, but it boils down to this. Though the atmosphere might be nice, the horrible service and rude staff more than ruin what the hotel had going for itself.

Reviews.Title: “My Very Short Stay at The Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from our honeymoon. Here is the typical rundown on our stay at the Paris Hotel in Las Vegas: We arrived at the Las Vegas Airport at 6:30pm and had the hotel arrange for us to have a limosine waiting to pick us up. The limo never showed. We called the hotel.. they said he was at the airport and we needed to call him and let him know where we were and He would meet us. We obtained the number, called it.. and was greeted with a wrong number. Finally we give up on the limo. Upon arriving at the hotel two hours later, we went to check in and they told us the room we had booked three months in advanced (not to mention payed in full at the time of booking) was doubled booked. We had to wait for 4 hours and 47 minutes before a room was finally ready. Being it was our honeymoon, we had previously booked a suite.. but we ended up in a standard room, with double beds.. we wanted a king. After they told us the room was ready, we went up to it.. discovered it was a standard room, went back down to the desk, explained we already paid for a suite, so we either wanted compensation for our overpayment, or a suite. We werent even asking for money back, we just wanted show tickets or maybe dinner passes, or something.. we knew we'd spend the difference either in casino play or on food or shows, so we were willing to take compensation that way. However, the person at the desk arrgued that we couldnt have paid for the room otherwise they wouldnt have been able to book it.. so we called the credit card company, and they were extremely helpful and explained to the desk clerk that the charge was in fact on our card, for the date that we made the booking, and even gave the clerk the total amount charged, which clearly showed we had paid for a suite for four nights. She continues to say that there was no possible way they could reimburse us the over charged amount, and we had to accept it. After about twenty minutes of arguing, we called the credit card company.. explained the situation to them, and they removed the charge from the card .. sent a refuse to pay to the hotel, and my new hubby and I left the hotel and found another.. the Luxor, which was much better. As for the hospitality of the Paris Hotel, well.. lets just say, I was called some pretty rotten things.. including a scam artist trying to get a free room.. and that was after the credit card company told the desk clerk that I had already paid in full for the room. Never will I reserve a room there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at the Paris and were very pleased. The hotel has unique decor not seen at other hotels on the strip. The staff was friendly, rooms comfortable, and the Village Buffet is to die for, especially at breakfast. We had as good a luck at the casino as at any other places along the strip. The central location is a definate plus. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Stormygirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris Hotel Jan. 23-24. Airport hotel check-in is great, room was nice, quiet, clean. I found out after arrival they charge $40.00 more/ night for a view! It was a good value for $159.00/night weekend rate. We have stayed at Treasure Island before and Paris is a step above. I would recommend Paris (We never saw a Mime!) but it is not Caesars Palace!

Reviews.Title: “Like it...but not love it”
Reviews.Author: Cristina444
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Paris for New Year´s Eve, the hotel room was OK (clean, big bathroom, neat). However, they gave us a room in the 4th floor, so we didnt have a view at all!!! We stayed there for 7 nights, and after a few days we got sick of all the Frech decor, moreover, some parts of the hotel were dirty (maybe due to the huge crowd for the holydays). Anyway, we have to make HUGE lines for everything, it was not fun for me to stand in line for over 25 min for my morning coffee.!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful surroundings and gracious hosts”
Reviews.Author: DavidHanna
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Paris Las Vegas in early September 2003 for a short vacation and will be staying there again in early April 2004 for another brief getaway trip. I found the rooms very tastefully decorated with what I would describe as an "understated elegance"--appealing decor without making the guest feel uncomfortable and ideal for singles and couples in early middle age or older. I find the casino quite appealing and, to be honest, Paris' casino and the casino in NYNY are the only two that stand out to me, and that is because of their decor. Most of the other casinos, though grand and elegant, all tend to look the same to me. In my experience casino services have been very generous. For example, although I enjoy some table games, particularly craps, I am hardly a "high-roller" and, for that matter, I hardly play the slots a all. Nevertheless, Paris' casino services were willing to give me an offer for rooms at US$69/night with some dining coupons and other perks thown in for a Sunday through Thursday stay this coming April even though I had only some 37 minutes of slot play on my Connection Card from my visit last September. I thought that that was very considerate of them. I don't understand some of the snide remarks about the French music in the elevators or the Art Nouveau decor in the hotel that some reviewers have made here. Since the name of the hotel is "Paris" and the theme is French culture, I would expect to hear Edith Piaf in the elevators rather than Pearl Jam. I wonder if this is indicative of the general French bashing (athough Paris is owned, of course, by Park Place Entertainment which also owns Caesar's Palace, the Flamingo, the Hiltion, and Bally's in Las Vegas) that is occurring as a result of France's stance on the Iraq war (if so, that's another reason to stay at Paris, although I won't get into politics here). My overall impression of the hotel is that it is an upscale property that caters to vacationers, typically low-rollers like myself, that are planning to gamble a bit, to be sure, but want to do a bit of sightseeing, see a show or two, enjoy an elegant dinner, and generally relax and people-watch as well. For those who prefer an attractive pool setting, the Mandalay Bay, Flamingo, Mirage, or Hard Rock may be better choices. High-rollers might prefer Caesar's Palace, a sister property of Paris Las Vegas. But with the exception of a stand-out pool, Paris offers a stunning ambiance in a beautiful setting and is located in an ideal location to enjoy all the things that Las Vegas has to offer. Hope that your visit will be as smashing as mine has been been!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic trip staying at the Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We travelled from UK to LV for Christmas and my 40th birthday day after boxing day, we stayed at the Paris hotel, I can only say WOW. The service was excellent, the room was ab fab, overlooking the bellagio, we were upgraded to a larger room on registering at the airport - a must if you want that better room and no queing at the hotel. The Paris hotel is an all over romantic experience. The Spa is definitely a must for ladies who want to be pampered and the Eifel tower restaraunt - exceptional for special occasions - bit pricey - but then you get the service and food out of this world. Village buffet a must for breakfast - not so brilliant for evening meal - but not too bad. I would recommend this hotel anyone looking for that special time. This is our second visit to LV we stayed at the Luxor and I have to say out of the two Paris won me over - I'm sure we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “love paris hotel minor problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the paris between jan 11-15 and had a good time. this is the second time we have stayed there, the previous being last august. we got a room facing the strip on the 29 floor because we were repeat customers. they tried to offer us a p suite at $150 per nite. this was up a lot from $50 in august when we took the suite. makes one wonder?. anyways the service from the hotel staff was great and plenty of drinks at the slots. the food and service at their restaurants was excellent except for one restaurant MON AMI GABI. the waiters were arrogant,no explanation of the menu and we ordered a bottle of wine and insted were given a glass of wine. i questioned the waiter about this and he said this is the way they do it. that would be okay except that the price by glass was $2 more per glass than it would have been by the bottle. will not go there again. beware! last words love vegas and lots of great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed Jan2- Jan9. The hotel is incredible. The airport check-in was superb. We walked in and was checked in within three minutes. $60 slipped to the girl got us a "P" room overlooking the Bellagio. The room was going to be ready in one hour. Arriving at the hotel fifteen minutes later another $20 had our room ready and seven floors higher. The food was wonderfull in the bakery and Patisserie. Breakfast in the cafe was great. The only thing lacking was a food court that most of the other hotels have. The center bar had $1.50 drafts all week and we had the cutest redhead waitress. We did see "O", well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “overwhelmed,but terrific”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Las Vegas. We had no idea what to expect. We stayed at the Paris Las Vegas. What a good choice! We didn't stay in our room or even our hotel's casino a lot, but the Paris is right in the middle of the strip, it's across from the Belliagio and caddy-corner to Caesar's Palace. Great location! The hotel was very nice. Crowded, but all the other hotels were crowded too. We went through all the other hotels and their casinos on a two-day walking round. There are lots of people in Las Vegas and a lot of hustle and bustle. Las Vegas is not a relaxing vacation. It was very exciting to stand on the strip and look up and there was the hotel you've always heard about or seen in the movies! We didn't do any buffets in Vegas. My son was concerned with "trashy food" and there were very long buffet lines. We opted for our hotel's restaurants which were very, very good! The steakhouse at the Paris Las Vegas is equal if not better than Morton's of Chicago (where we live)! The other restaurants in the Paris were great! We had a terrific lunch at "Nine Fine Irishmen's bar in the hotel New York, New York-great meal! We set a "to lose budget" we set up just for gambling. We lost all our budget, but that is what we expected. It was lots of fun anyway. The food in Las Vegas is very expensive-for our 3 1/2 day stay we spent over $600.00 for 3 of us to eat. The sights are never forgotten. Yes, we were overwhelmed by everything in Vegas, but I believe we will go again!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: LvVegas
Reviews.Content: We've spent Christmas in Las Vegas every year for the past 5 years, and have stayed at the Paris Las Vegas every time. Also we go there at least 2 more times per year, we take mini vacations during the year, and Vegas is just 4 to 4:30 hours driving time from home. We always tried to stay at The Paris with a few exceptions when trying a new hotel, but always going back to Paris Las Vegas. I can't complain about the hotel at all, very clean rooms, excellent room service, the hotel is great for families, has good shops, a great bakery for that morning coffee and baguette in case you are not that hungry for the buffet, a very nice spa, also is walking distance to the best of Vegas, including the best shows, and the best restaurants. Great shopping across the street at the Bellagio, and The Forum Shops at Caesar's Palace. For every year I can say something good, and maybe a small complaint, but nothing that will make us not go back to Paris Las Vegas. I should not forget to mention the great view of the Bellagio Fountains!! ************** This past Christmas 2003, we stayed for 4 nights, 12/24 to 12/28, and again we had a very good time, starting at registration even that we arrived late, the service that we received from ANTONIO at the registration desk couldn't have been better, a great smile, a nice greeting, and the way he tried his best to help us. After waiting in line to register for almost an hour, the way we were treated made us forget the waiting in line,Thanks so much ANTONIO, we really enjoyed the accommodations, and we had a great Christmas once again in Paris Las Vegas. I have to say that we don t gamble more than the usually 20 to 50 dollars total when passing by the slot machines, we go to Vegas for the shows, the good restaurants and the shopping, and also the great accommodations at the Paris. I do recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away from the Paris Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at all of the top hotels in Las Vegas. I will tell you flat out, Paris was the worst experience I have had in over 10 years. This place does not have a clue on customer service nor is the price worth it. I will never go back to this rip off hotel. Food is lousy and overpriced, management is incompitent and arrogant, staff is rude in general and the hotel ethos are very cheap and stingy for the amount customers pay there. I do not expect much from hotel workers I just don't want to be disrespected. STAY AWAY FROM PARIS!

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorites in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In Vegas there are so many choices but if you can manage to score a deal on so many weekends, Paris is the place to stay. From the moment you drive up, it's beautiful, impeccable, warm, inviting. The lobby and reception where the journey begins is grand and opulent. The casino with it's Art Nouveau detailing and blue skies is breathtaking. The lovely shops further gives you a feel of Paris while in Vegas. It's a love. The rooms are starting to show a bit but I love the detailings. The bathroom is ample and has good amenities. The pool area needs work. It's missing that WOW factor. If poolside experience is key, you should try the Bellagio or Mandalay Bay. For the pirce and location, I love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Ah Sin restaurant: The only thing authentic are the Parisian prices”
Reviews.Author: Yipyap
Reviews.Content: My family and I just dined at Ah Sin Asian restaurant as we wished to have Chinese food and the other restaurants were not yet open at lunchtime. Mistake! We were seated on the covered "sidewalk" made to resemble the Champs Elysees. The place settings look so stupid: a square lacquered plate with an asymetrical bowl that's so huge that the tiny soup portion inside looks ridiculous. And their menu is so limited in its offerings. While you can close your eyes and try to make believe you are in Paris take a look at the Ah Sin menu and you will swear that you are in the city of light-in France that is. Everything is served a la carte and they sure take advantage of this situation: 1/4 roast duck for $13, one tiny serving of bok choy for $7, a bowl of steamed rice for one person for $2, one serving of hot and sour soup for $6, one serving of roast duck noodle soup for $9, etc. The best part of our dining experience was the fact that our server to whom I gave my Bally's comp. card (5 Park Place properties here in LV allow the guests at one property to charge to their room at any of the oter properties' restos and also entitle the guests to get 10% discount) totally ignored giving me a discount. I did not discover this fact until I walked the 1/4 mile back to my Bally's room. So be warned: do not eat at Ah Sin unless you want to be royally ripped off all ways. The name of this place should be called "A Sin".

Reviews.Title: “A pleasing taste of Paris(?) in the heart of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: chriswin
Reviews.Content: My friends and I had been looking forward to this trip for some time but were concerned with some of the negative reviews on this site. While we would rate our experience as pleasant, there were some customer service issues: check in lines were slow (we arrived before 11:00 a.m. and so there may have been people checking out as well) and when we did finally check in, we asked for rooms with a view of the strip and/or Bellagio fountains - were told there were none even though this was the slowest week of the year. The clerk did not offer to check for us later or that we should ourselves inquire later so we just took the rooms assigned - view of the back of Bally's. The clerk at the Connections Card counter seemed bothered and did not offer all the amenities he should have to new enrollees (my friends thought to ask their clerk and did get them). We received conflicting info from different staff on whether we could charge Eiffel Tower food or drinks to our room so we didn't bother at all - need to make sure all staff provides correct information. Except for those minor issues, staff was efficient and friendly. We didn't mind the accents, the elevator music, mimes or cocktail waitress outfits - we were in a hotel called Paris! The food at the buffet was excellent and a reasonable deal compared to some of the other buffets and restaurants in the area. I liked the idea of the separate bath and shower - the water pressure in the shower was perfect - and the housekeeping staff always made sure we had enough towels and toiletries. While we would stay here again, I think my friends and I would try a different hotel next visit just because there are so many we thought we'd like to try. If this is your first visit to Las Vegas, you would enjoy the Paris and its excellent strip location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i just stayed at the paris Dec. 12 and 13. i totally loved it. the bathrooms are great! the shower was all tiled it was so pretty. the room was fantastic we had a premier view room with a view of the eiffel tower and the water show at the Bellagio. it was gret. the service was extrodinary! great room service and front desk staff, but the box office employees can use some work in friendliness. completely recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT EXPERIENCE this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kneel7474
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Thanksgiving night at midnight and asked if we could get ajoining rooms or at least both rooms on the same floor. They told us right away that they could not do this but would check for better rooms. Only after a few minutes she came up with one big room(apprx 750sq ft) on the 33rd floor(atop of the hotel) looking towards the north strip and a one room suite (14th floor) viewing the tower and fountains. FANTASTIC ROOMS. We had rooms that ended with a letter "P'. We ate at the cafe, buffet and the street crepes station; all were great. Middle of the strip. Shopping was great next door at Aladdin(not expensive). Slots were tight; had a few good runs on blackjack and pai gow poker. While waiting for our car at valet, I left a couple of bags of Christmas present on a bench. We didn't relized until two days later. We called the hotel, and they had found the packages and they sent it to us. Best of all, THEY paided for the shipping. Customer service. My family has no problem staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice ending to our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: delta210
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the last stop of our 9 day honeymoon, and it was pretty good. The location is the best, right in the middle of the Strip. We got a great corner room which gave us two views of Vegas. Bathrooms are nice and spacious. The Casino is nice too, the ceiling is really high and is not very smokey, a good assortment of table games, and dealers and pit bosses are really nice. The only annoying thing is the hotel staff trying to speak with a French accent, even when you know they are from Paris, Texas and not Paris, France.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Paris Las Vegas but bartenders rated poor.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Paris Las Vegas for the 1st time 11/24 - 28/03. Loved the hotel, restaurants, servers, but the bartenders at any of the bars/lounges had very bad attitudes. We gamble big, sat at the bar watching NFL football on T Day, played $100's in video poker machines at bar. Husband stopped to light a cigar, asked for a coke, the bartender was rude and said he had to keep playing in order to get a lousy coke comped. Needless to say, we cashed out and left. We know the rules of Las Vegas, and of course we would have kept playing max coins. He was the bartender at Le Sports Bar at 11 am on 11/27/03. Do yourself a favor and stay out of that place. I hope his mgr. sees this.

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY EXCELLENT!!!! Merci!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've been in Vegas about a dozen of times and I have to admit that Paris Hotel in Las vegas as it all. Location is great, in front of Bellagio, between the Aladdin and the Bally's and walkable distance to all the others big hotels complex. Service is excellent as I used the bell man, the maid service and almost all restaurants. Food is excellent, specially at Cafe St-Louis. Buffet is Excellent. Try the 'Creperie' at lunch time. For 6.50$, you get a real nice seafood crepes. Pool is large with a real nice view of the Towel. Rooms are extremely cleans. Check-In was quick and the lounges are full of a real nice people. Try visiting the Effel tower to see the Bellagio fountains just in front. Amazing....Will come back whitout hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Las Vegas has it all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect. It's just the right size, feels like a village. Rooms are elegant w/ large marble bathrooms. The lines move quickly at the restaraunts, which are worth waiting for. The staff was friendly and helpful, everything was really organized.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Paris and would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone! From the moment we arrived to the moment we left the service could not have been better. Offered bottled water at check-in and were upgraded (or should I say treated!) to a gorgeous suite as an upgrade to a standard room when I explained we were here for important birthdays - how gracious and generous! Had dead-on view of Bellagio fountains, Eiffel tower and pool - couldn't ask for more! Ate at Provencal (singing waiters and great Italian food at reasonable prices), sipped Champagne at Napolean (beautiful room with couches, etc. - had a $7 Champagne sampler that contained 3 glasses of very good Champagne - (free sandwiches between 4 and 7), enjoyed an excellent onion soup and the best fries on the terrace of Mon Ami Gabbi, had nice breakfast at Le Cafe - all in all food was excellent, great service everywhere. Enjoyed great band in the lounge - lots of beautiful stores in cobblestone streets. Not very big gamblers, played slots a little - casino was ok. Loved atmosphere, beautiful chandeliers everywhere, marble floors, very Parisian. For those who complain that this hotel is too French - this is a Parisian hotel - this is the concept - if you don't like this sort of thing, stay somewhere else! They do it well here, its not tacky, it's just right. Also enjoyed pool area. Self-Parking is not really a hike at all - elevators to shopping area between Bally's and Paris - not far to rooms - quite convenient actually. Incredible location in center of strip - surrounded by Alladin, Bally's, Bellagio, and Caesar's - best location on strip and very classy! Paid $79/night for this incredible experience - loved it, loved it, loved it! Try it - you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We love the Paris, they give out great deals to come out to stay at there hotel.We were out in Vegas three times this year and stayed at the Mandalay Bay, which is nice but over priced,then stayed at the Paris which was great,then the Venetian,which like the Mandalay Bay is nice but over priced,when you are paying airfare and dumping 5000.00 in to a machine you should get a few small perks to get you to come back. The food is great, the service is great, the pool was great why would you want to stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Beware Switch and Bait, and Overpriced for the service”
Reviews.Author: Paddy02L
Reviews.Content: After 3 phone calls and several emails, have yet to get a reply other than "its this other departments responsibility" Service is sub-par, the many of the staff try to be the aloof snooty french, the cost is overpriced compared to other stip hotels of equal quality, walls are paper thin(beware noisey neighbors, unless you like to eavesdrop, and you really don't have a reservations, even if you pay in advance. In the words of the Desk Staff, it is a " request" not a reservation, so if what you thought you reserved is not available, and they have charged you a deposit in advance for it, they will give you something else that is availablefor the same price, even if it was avaialbe when you made the reservations at a lower price(and forget any offer of an upgrade unless you have alot of money on the table). Also we spent over a week and a few thousand $ there, and when our flight was delayed for 18 hours, they refused to allow us to use the hotel shuttle to come back unless we checked in for another night. Beware the Mon Ami Gabbi Resturaunt, $$$$, average food and very poor service(again they are trying to be french) . We have been to Las Vegas many times, and we have stayed at better places, for less money, on the strip. good place to go if you don't care. however our first time will be the last.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Anyone who has ever been to Paris knows that this has got to be the cheesiest, most maudlin attempt at faux French in the world. The room was not the cleanest (a thick rim of accumulated dust ringed the room along where the wall moulding met the carpet).The fake French accents on the help grated on me immensely.The place radiates what I call "trailer park roccoco."YUCK.I'l never return.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the Mirage”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have always stayed at the Mirage but since it was sold it has gone way way down hill, so we thought we would try something else. The Paris was great, we had a wonderful room on the 27th floor and what a view. Check in wasn,t that great but all hotel have little problems. My husband and I play video poker and went home winners. (This was the first time in 10 years that it has happened that way) Food was okay at the buffet not great to me I am not a fan of french cooking. If you are going just know that the machines are not set up to take the new 20 dollar bills so cash them in before you go. I would stay again had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Most fun casino”
Reviews.Author: kandc
Reviews.Content: We loved the Paris Las Vegas hotel. Although not as large as some of the other strip hotels, but we loved the casino inside. There was a lot going on, and the cocktail waitress were everywhere and dressed in the coolest outfits. The restaurants were located in a wonderfully themed area, and the bakery there was adorable. The staff at the Paris Las Vegas were fun and the casino tables were always full of action. Overall, a great place to hang out.

Reviews.Title: “Too French!”
Reviews.Author: laslototh
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paris on a business trip in September. The property is nice but it is definitely too French. PROS: room was nice CONS: hope you like mimes and guys walking around sticking feather sticks between your legs; also crappy French songs in the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “No response to customer enquiries”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I will be taking a US trip via Las Vegas in Nov. I read from Paris Las Vegas website that they offer a Passport Package which looks quite attractive. So I just made my reservation online a month ago and submitted my credit card information. However I did not receive any confirmation, so I sent an email to the hotel reservations to enquire. But no matter how many times I emailed or faxed them, I never received any response. Since I'm in Hong Kong, I wouldn't be able to call any toll-free number to check. I eventually faxed a complaint letter to the General Manager of the hotel, but it's now another 10 days passed and I still received no response. I am very frustrated and disappointed at this hotel. As a matter of courtesy, I think at least the hotel should acknowledge and respond promptly to customer enquiries. By posting up this complaint online, I'm going to wait and see whether the hotel will respond to my enquiry or not. Since I have already submitted my credit card information, I just want to know whether my reservation is confirmed or not. Isn't that difficult for the hotel to reply??

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Paris for 3 nights in October. It was in an excellent location. Our room was on the 30th floor. We had a beautiful view of Vegas. Just outside our window was the eiffel tower and the fountains of the Bellagio Hotel. The room was very nice. The casino was beautiful. We had a wonderful time. Can't wait to come back!!

HotelInfo.Name: Paris Las Vegas
HotelInfo.Address: 3655 Las Vegas Blvd S, Las Vegas, NV 89109
